hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אוֹר לְאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר בּוֹדְקִין אֶת הֶחָמֵץ לְאוֹר הַנֵּר. כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַכְנִיסִין בּוֹ חָמֵץ, אֵין צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה. וּבַמָּה אָמְרוּ ״שְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת בַּמַּרְתֵּף״ — מָקוֹם שֶׁמַּכְנִיסִין בּוֹ חָמֵץ. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת עַל פְּנֵי כׇּל הַמַּרְתֵּף, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: שְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת הַחִיצוֹנוֹת שֶׁהֵן הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: On the evening [ or ] of the fourteenth one searches for leavened bread by candlelight. Any place into which one does not take leavened bread does not require a search, And with regard to what said two rows in a cellar, a place into which one takes leavened bread, Beit Shammai say two rows across the entire cellar, and Beit Hillel say: the two external rows, which are the upper ones.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One must check for leaven in fourteen places by the light of a candle. Any place where leaven is not brought in does not require inspection. And in what case did they say, "Two rows in the cellar"? A place where leaven is brought in. Beit Shammai says: Two rows in front of the entire cellar, and Beit Hillel says: Two rows of the outermost ones, which are the upper ones.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״אוֹר״? רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: נַגְהֵי, וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: לֵילֵי. קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר נַגְהֵי — נַגְהֵי מַמָּשׁ, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר לֵילֵי — לֵילֵי מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: What is or , Rav Huna said: light, and Rav Yehuda said: evening. it enter your mind the one who said light actual light and the one who said evening actual evening
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "light"? Rav Huna said: brightness, and Rav Yehuda said: night. The conclusion of your opinion is: whoever says brightness - it is actual brightness, and whoever says night - it is actual night.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״הַבֹּקֶר אוֹר וְהָאֲנָשִׁים שֻׁלְּחוּ״ — אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ יְמָמָא הוּא! מִי כְּתִיב ״הָאוֹר בֹּקֶר״? ״הַבֹּקֶר אוֹר״ כְּתִיב, כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר: צַפְרָא נְהַר, וְכִדְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם יִכָּנֵס אָדָם בְּכִי טוֹב, וְיֵצֵא בְּכִי טוֹב.
human_translation: raises an objection “As soon as the morning was or , the men were sent away, Apparently, or is day. Is it written: The light was morning? “The morning was light” is written. as the one who said: morning lightened. And in accordance with Rav Yehuda said Rav said, as Rav Yehuda said Rav said: A person always enter with “it is good” And he leave with “it is good,”
llm_translation: Challenger: "In the morning light and the people were sent out" - this implies that "light" refers to daytime! Where is it written "the light is morning"? "Morning light" is written, as stated by the one who said: "Dawn is like a river," and like Rav Yehudah said Rav. For Rav Yehudah said Rav: A person should always enter with a good cry and leave with a good cry.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וּכְאוֹר בֹּקֶר יִזְרַח שָׁמֶשׁ״ — אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ יְמָמָא הוּא! מִי כְּתִיב ״אוֹר בֹּקֶר״? ״וּכְאוֹר בֹּקֶר״ כְּתִיב, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: וּכְאוֹר בֹּקֶר בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, כְּעֵין זְרִיחַת שֶׁמֶשׁ לַצַּדִּיקִים לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: raises an objection “And as the light [ or ] of the morning, when the sun rises, Apparently, or is day. Is it written the light was morning? “As the light of the morning” is written, and this is is saying: And as the morning light of this world so will be the rising of the sun for the righteous in the World-to-Come,
llm_translation: Challenger: "And like the light of morning, the sun will rise" - this implies that "light" refers to daytime! Where is it written "light of morning"? "And like the light of morning" is written, and thus it is saying: "And like the light of morning in this world, like the shining of the sun for the righteous in the world to come."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וַיִּקְרָא אֱלֹהִים לָאוֹר יוֹם״ — אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ יְמָמָא הוּא! הָכִי קָאָמַר: לַמֵּאִיר וּבָא קְרָאוֹ יוֹם. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״וְלַחֹשֶׁךְ קָרָא לָיְלָה״ — לַמַּחְשִׁיךְ וּבָא קָרָא לַיְלָה?! וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּעַד צֵאת הַכּוֹכָבִים יְמָמָא הוּא!
human_translation: raises an objection: “And God called the or Day, Apparently, or is day. This is is saying: called the advancing light Day. However, if is so, “and the darkness He called Night,” He called the advancing darkness Night, as we maintain it is day until the emergence of the stars.
llm_translation: The question was raised: "And God called the light 'day'" - this means that "light" is daytime! This is what it means to say: He called it 'day' to illuminate it. Rather, from now on, "and to the darkness He called 'night'" - to darken it and He called it 'night'?! But we establish that until the appearance of the stars it is daytime!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: קַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לִנְהוֹרָא וּפַקְּדֵיהּ אַמִּצְוְתָא דִימָמָא, וְקַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לַחֲשׁוֹכָא וּפַקְּדֵיהּ אַמִּצְוְתָא דְלֵילָה.
human_translation: Rather, this is what is saying: God called the light and commanded it the mitzva of the day, and God called the darkness and commanded it the mitzva of the night.
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said: The Merciful One calls to the light and commands the mitzvah of daytime, and the Merciful One calls to the darkness and commands the mitzvah of nighttime.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״הַלְלוּהוּ כׇּל כּוֹכְבֵי אוֹר״ — אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ אוּרְתָּא הוּא. הָכִי קָאָמַר: הַלְלוּהוּ כׇּל כּוֹכָבִים הַמְּאִירִים. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, כּוֹכָבִים הַמְּאִירִים הוּא דְּבָעוּ שַׁבּוֹחֵי, שֶׁאֵינָן מְאִירִין לָא בָּעוּ שַׁבּוֹחֵי?! וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״הַלְלוּהוּ כָּל צְבָאָיו״!
human_translation: raises an objection: praise Him, all the stars of or ” Apparently, or is evening, This is is saying: Praise Him, all the stars that radiate, However, if is so, it is stars that radiate that are required to praise that do not radiate are not required to praise But isn’t it written “Praise Him, all His legions,”
llm_translation: The question was raised: "Praise Him, all His shining stars" — this implies that "light" is a lamp. This is what it means to say: "Praise Him, all the stars that shine." But from now on, are only the stars that shine required to praise Him, while those that do not shine are not required to praise Him?! But isn't it written: "Praise Him, all His hosts"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — דְּאוֹר דְּכוֹכָבִים נָמֵי אוֹר הוּא. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְנוֹדֵר מִן הָאוֹר. (דִּתְנַן:) הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הָאוֹר — אָסוּר בְּאוֹרָן שֶׁל כּוֹכָבִים.
human_translation: Rather, this teach us that the light of stars is also light. What practical difference to one who vows from light. As we learned one who vows from light, it is prohibited to the light of stars.
llm_translation: Rather, this is what it implies to us - that the light of the stars is light. For what purpose does this matter arise? For one who vows from the light. As it was taught: One who vows from the light - he is prohibited from the light of the stars.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״לָאוֹר יָקוּם רוֹצֵחַ יִקְטׇל עָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן וּבַלַּיְלָה יְהִי כַגַּנָּב״,
human_translation: raises an objection: “A murderer rises with the or to kill the poor and needy; and in the night he is as a thief”
llm_translation: Challenger: "For the light of day the murderer shall be put to death, the poor and destitute, and at night he shall be as a thief."

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּקָאָמַר ״וּבַלַּיְלָה יְהִי כַגַּנָּב״ — אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ יְמָמָא הוּא! הָתָם הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי פְּשִׁיטָא לָךְ מִילְּתָא כִּנְהוֹרָא דְּאַנְּפָשׁוֹת קָאָתֵי — רוֹצֵחַ הוּא, וְנִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ. וְאִי מְסַפְּקָא לָךְ מִילְּתָא כְּלֵילְיָא — יְהִי בְּעֵינֶיךָ כְּגַנָּב, וְלֹא נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ.
human_translation: From that states: “And in the night he is as a thief,” apparently or is day, There, this is is saying: If matter is as clear to you as light, that come a life, is a murderer; and may save himself by life And if the matter is as unclear to you as the night, he should be than a thief in your eyes one may not save himself by life
llm_translation: The matter of which it says, "And at night he shall be as a thief" - this means that "light" refers to daytime! There it is thus stated: If the matter is clear to you as the shining of the sun - he is a murderer, and it is permitted to save him at the cost of his own life. But if the matter is doubtful to you entirely - let him be in your eyes as a thief, and it is not permitted to save him at the cost of his own life.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״יֶחְשְׁכוּ כּוֹכְבֵי נִשְׁפּוֹ יְקַו לְאוֹר וָאַיִן וְאַל יִרְאֶה בְּעַפְעַפֵּי שָׁחַר״, מִדְּקָאָמַר ״יְקַו לְאוֹר וָאַיִן״ אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ יְמָמָא הוּא! הָתָם מֵילָט הוּא דְּקָא לָיֵיט לֵיהּ אִיּוֹב לְמַזָּלֵיהּ, אָמַר: יְהֵא רַעֲוָא דְּלִיצְפֵּיהּ הָךְ גַּבְרָא לִנְהוֹרָא, וְלָא לַישְׁכְּחֵיהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection “Let the stars of the twilight be dark; let it look for or but have none; neither let it see the eyelids of the morning” From that states: “Let it look for or but have none,” apparently or is day. There, Job is cursing his fortune. He said: Let it be will that this man, will seek light and not find it.
llm_translation: Challenger: "Let the stars of its twilight be dark; let it hope for light, but have none; and let it not see the eyelids of the morning." From where is it derived that "hope for light, but have none" – this implies that "light" refers to daytime! There, it is a kind of curse that Job cursed his fate, saying: Let the evil one who seeks to darken the light not find it.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וָאוֹמַר אַךְ חֹשֶׁךְ יְשׁוּפֵנִי וְלַיְלָה אוֹר בַּעֲדֵנִי״, אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ יְמָמָא הוּא! הָתָם, הָכִי קָאָמַר דָּוִד: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי אַךְ חֹשֶׁךְ יְשׁוּפֵנִי לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁהוּא דּוֹמֶה לְיוֹם, עַכְשָׁיו, הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה שֶׁהוּא דּוֹמֶה לְלַיְלָה — אוֹר בַּעֲדֵנִי.
human_translation: raises an objection: “And I say, yet the darkness shall envelop me, and the or about me shall be night” Apparently, or is day. This is David is saying there: I said darkness shall envelop me in the World-to-Come, which is like day. Now this world, which is like darkness, light for me.
llm_translation: Challenger: "And He said, 'Surely darkness shall cover me, and night shall be light about me.'" Therefore, "light" refers to daytime! There, this is what David meant: "I said, 'Surely darkness shall cover me for the world to come, which is like day; now, this world, which is like night - light shall be about me."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בּוֹדְקִין אוֹר (לְאַרְבָּעָה) עָשָׂר וּבְאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שַׁחֲרִית וּבִשְׁעַת הַבִּיעוּר. מִדְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בּוֹדְקִין אוֹר אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר וּבְאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שַׁחֲרִית, אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ אוּרְתָּא הוּא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yehuda says: One searches or of the fourteenth on the fourteenth morning, and at the time of removal From that Rabbi Yehuda says one searches or of the fourteenth and on the fourteenth morning, apparently or is evening. learn from it
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: Rabbi Yehuda says: We inspect the barley (for Pesach) on the 14th and on the 16th of Nisan, in the morning and at the time of Bi'ur. From what Rabbi Yehuda says: We inspect the barley on the 14th and on the 16th of Nisan in the morning, it is evident that "light" refers to the evening. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מֵאֵימָתַי אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: מִשְּׁעַת הָאוֹר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִשְּׁעַת הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה.
human_translation: raises an objection From when the fourteenth is prohibited to perform labor, Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: From the time of or . Rabbi Yehuda says: From sunrise.
llm_translation: Challenger: From when are fourteen prohibited in the performance of labor? Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: From the time of the light. Rabbi Yehuda says: From the time of the rising of the sun.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וְכִי הֵיכָן מָצִינוּ יוֹם שֶׁמִּקְצָתוֹ אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה וּמִקְצָתוֹ מוּתָּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוּא עַצְמוֹ יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁמִּקְצָתוֹ מוּתָּר בַּאֲכִילַת חָמֵץ וּמִקְצָתוֹ אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילַת חָמֵץ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov said to Rabbi Yehuda: And where have we found a day, part of which the performance of labor prohibited, and part of which the performance of labor permitted? He said to him: itself prove as part of it, the eating of leavened bread permitted, and part of it the eating of leavened bread prohibited.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said to Rabbi Yehuda: And where do we find a day that part of it is prohibited for work and part of it is permitted for work? He said to him: Let the day itself prove it, that part of it is permitted for eating leavened bread and part of it is prohibited for eating leavened bread.

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִשְּׁעַת הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה, אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב — אוּרְתָּא הוּא! לָא, מַאי ״אוֹר״ — עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר.
human_translation: From that Rabbi Yehuda says from sunrise, apparently or that Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov is saying, is evening. No, What is or ? dawn.
llm_translation: From when Rabbi Yehudah said from the time of sunrise, the sun, as Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said - it is light! No, what is "light" - the pillar of dawn.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ: הֵיכָן מָצִינוּ יוֹם שֶׁמִּקְצָתוֹ מוּתָּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה וּמִקְצָתוֹ אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה, נֵימָא אִיהוּ לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ: הָא אִיכָּא לַיְלָה, דְּקָא שָׁרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב!
human_translation: If so, which said to Where have we found a day, part of which the performance of labor prohibited, and part of which the performance of labor permitted? Let him say to himself: Isn’t there night, which Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov permits
llm_translation: So it is, for he said to him: Where do we find a day that part of it is permitted for work and part of it is forbidden for work? Let him say for himself: There is the night, for Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov permits it!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי, אַשְׁכַּחְנָא דְּקָא פָּלְגִי רַבָּנַן בֵּין יְמָמָא לְלֵילְיָא. (דִּתְנַן) גַּבֵּי תַּעֲנִית צִבּוּר: עַד מָתַי אוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה — עַד שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עַד קְרוֹת הַגֶּבֶר. אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ, הֵיכָא אַשְׁכַּחְנָא יְמָמָא גּוּפֵיהּ דְּפָלְגִי בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן!
human_translation: This is is saying: Granted, to my I find which the Sages distinguished between day and night, as we learned with regard to communal fast: Until when one eat and drink until dawn; the statement of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov. Rabbi Shimon says: until the call of the rooster, However, according to your where do we find the Sages divided the day itself?
llm_translation: So it is stated: According to my opinion, I found that the sages used to divide between day and night. As it was taught: Regarding a public fast, until when may one eat and drink? Until the break of dawn, the words of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. Rabbi Shimon says: Until the rooster crows. But according to your opinion, where did you find that the sages divided the day itself between them!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוּא עַצְמוֹ יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁמִּקְצָתוֹ מוּתָּר בַּאֲכִילַת חָמֵץ וּמִקְצָתוֹ אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילַת חָמֵץ. שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אָמֵינָא לָךְ אֲנָא מְלָאכָה דְּרַבָּנַן וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לִי חָמֵץ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא?! דְּעַד הָכָא אֲסַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְעַד הָכָא שְׁרָא רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: said to itself can prove as part of it, the eating of leavened bread permitted, and part of it the eating of leavened bread prohibited. Rabbi Yehuda has spoken well to Rabbi Eliezer; this is Rabbi Eliezer is saying to him I said to you labor, by rabbinic law, and you said to me leavened bread, which is by Torah law. that until this God prohibited and until that God permitted
llm_translation: He said to him: The bone itself proves, that part of it is permitted for eating leavened bread and part of it is forbidden for eating leavened bread. Is Rabbi Yehuda speaking well to Rabbi Eliezer? This is what Rabbi Eliezer is saying to him: I, a Rabbinic precept, believe you, and you say to me leavened bread of Torah law?! Until here, the Merciful One forbade, and until here, the Merciful One permitted.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? שָׁעוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And the other hours by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: And the other opinion? The hours of the Sages.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? הַרְחָקָה הוּא דַּעֲבוּד רַבָּנַן לִדְאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: And the other the Sages established a preventive measure for a Torah law,
llm_translation: And the other? It is a distance that the Sages established for Torah study.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵין מַשִּׂיאִין מַשּׂוּאוֹת אֶלָּא עַל הַחֹדֶשׁ שֶׁנִּרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ, לְקַדְּשׁוֹ. וְאֵימָתַי מַשִּׂיאִין מַשּׂוּאוֹת — לְאוֹר עִבּוּרוֹ. אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ אוּרְתָּא הוּא! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection: kindle torches only for a month that appeared at its time, to sanctify it And when do kindle torches? or of its additional Apparently, or is evening, learn from it
llm_translation: Challenger: We only proclaim the new month based on its proper sighting, in order to sanctify it. And when do we proclaim the new month? - At the time of its passing. This implies that "passing" refers to its crossing over! Learn from this.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָיָה עוֹמֵד כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה וּמַקְרִיב עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, לָאוֹרָה טָעוּן קִידּוּשׁ יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. ״אוֹרָה״ שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: raises an objection: was standing all night and sacrificing on the altar, in the ora required sanctify his hands and feet the statement of Rabbi ora is different,
llm_translation: Challenger: He was standing all night and offering on the altar, for the lighting requires sanctification of hands and feet, the words of Rabbi. "Lighting" is different.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי מָר זוּטְרָא:
human_translation: Mar Zutra raises an objection
llm_translation: A question was raised by Mar Zutra:

hebrew_text: הַמַּפֶּלֶת אוֹר לִשְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹטְרִין מִקׇּרְבָּן, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מְחַיְּיבִים.
human_translation: a woman who miscarries or of the eighty-first Beit Shammai exempt from offering, And Beit Hillel obligate
llm_translation: The one who miscarries, light for eight and one, Beit Shammai exempt from offering, and Beit Hillel obligate.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ (לָהֶן) בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: מַאי שְׁנָא אוֹר שְׁמֹנִים וְאֶחָד מִיּוֹם שְׁמֹנִים וְאֶחָד? אִם שִׁיוָּה לוֹ לְטוּמְאָה — לֹא יִשְׁוֶה לוֹ לְקׇרְבָּן? מִדְּקָאָמַר בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: מַאי שְׁנָא אוֹר שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד מִיּוֹם שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ ״אוֹר״ אוּרְתָּא הוּא! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: What is different or of the eighty-first and the day of the eighty-first? If they are equal to ritual impurity, will not be equal to the offering from that Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: What is different or of the eighty-first and the day of the eighty-first, learn from it that or is night. learn from it
llm_translation: They said to the House of Hillel to the House of Shammai: What is the difference between oil that is eighty-one days old and oil that is eighty-one days old? If it is fit for impurity, should it not be fit for the offering? Since the House of Hillel said to the House of Shammai: What is the difference between oil that is eighty-one days old and oil that is eighty-one days old, infer from it that "or" means light! Infer from it.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: יָכוֹל יְהֵא נֶאֱכָל אוֹר לַשְּׁלִישִׁי, וְדִין הוּא: זְבָחִים נֶאֱכָלִים לְיוֹם אֶחָד, וּשְׁלָמִים נֶאֱכָלִים לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים. מָה לְהַלָּן — לַיְלָה אַחַר הַיּוֹם, אַף כָּאן — לַיְלָה אַחַר הַיּוֹם!
human_translation: raises an objection might may be eaten or of the third And a logical derivation offerings, are eaten for one day, and peace-offerings are eaten for two days. Just as there, night follows the day, so too here, night follows the day,
llm_translation: Challenger: Can the light be eaten on the third day? And it is a judgment: sacrifices are eaten in one day, and peace offerings are eaten for two days. Just as there — the night after the day, so too here — the night after the day!

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּיוֹם זִבְחֲכֶם יֵאָכֵל וּמִמׇּחֳרָת וְהַנּוֹתָר עַד יוֹם״ — בְּעוֹד יוֹם הוּא נֶאֱכָל, וְאֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל לְאוֹר שְׁלִישִׁי.
human_translation: the verse states: It shall be eaten the same day you sacrifice it, and on the next day; and if any remains until the day, it be eaten while it is still day, and it not be eaten or of the third
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "On the day of your sacrifice it shall be eaten, and on the next day, and what remains until the third day" - on that day it may be eaten, but not on the light of the third day.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יִשָּׂרֵף מִיָּד, וְדִין הוּא: זְבָחִים נֶאֱכָלִין לְיוֹם וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד, וּשְׁלָמִים נֶאֱכָלִין לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד, מָה לְהַלָּן — תֵּיכֶף לַאֲכִילָה שְׂרֵיפָה, אַף כָּאן — תֵּיכֶף לַאֲכִילָה שְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: might be burned immediately and this a logical derivation: offerings are eaten for one day and night, and peace-offerings are eaten for two days and one night. Just as there, burned immediately for eating so too here, burned immediately after eating
llm_translation: One might have thought that it should be burned immediately, but it is a judgment: sacrifices are eaten for one day and one night, and peace offerings are eaten for two days and one night. Just as there — immediately after eating, it is burned, so too here — immediately after eating, it is burned.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהַנּוֹתָר מִבְּשַׂר הַזֶּבַח בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי בָּאֵשׁ יִשָּׂרֵף״ — בַּיּוֹם אַתָּה (שׂוֹרֵף), וְאִי אַתָּה שׂוֹרְפוֹ בַּלַּיְלָה. מִדְּקָאָמַר ״יְהֵא נֶאֱכָל אוֹר לַשְּׁלִישִׁי״ — אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ אוּרְתָּא הוּא! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: the verse states: “And if any remains of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day, it shall be burnt with fire” You burn it during the day, and you do not burn it at night. from that states: it may be eaten or of the third apparently or is evening. learn from it
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And the remainder of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burned with fire" — on the day you (burn), and if you do not burn it by night. From what is stated "it shall be eaten on the third day" — it means that "it shall be burned" is a light. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אוֹר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה. שַׁחֲרִית, מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה. בְּמוּסָף, מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה. בְּמִנְחָה, מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה. בְּעַרְבִית, מִתְפַּלֵּל מֵעֵין שְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם אֲבוֹתָיו: מִתְפַּלֵּל שְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר שְׁלֵימוֹת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לוֹמַר הַבְדָּלָה בְּחוֹנֵן הַדָּעַת. אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ אוּרְתָּא הוּא! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear or of Yom Kippur, one recites seven and confesses the morning prayer, one recites seven and confesses; in the additional prayer, one recites seven and confesses; in the afternoon prayer, one recites seven and confesses; in the evening one recites abridged eighteen Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel says in the name of his forefathers: One recites the eighteen complete due to he is required to recite havdala in Apparently, or is evening. learn from it
llm_translation: Come and hear: On the eve of Yom Kippur, one prays seven and confesses. In the morning, one prays seven and confesses. During the additional service, one prays seven and confesses. During the afternoon service, one prays seven and confesses. During the evening service, one prays a form of eighteen. Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel says in the name of his ancestors: One prays the complete eighteen, because one needs to say the blessing of insight. It is evident that "Or" is Aramaic! Learn from this.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי דְּבֵי שְׁמוּאֵל: לֵילֵי אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר בּוֹדְקִין אֶת הֶחָמֵץ לְאוֹר הַנֵּר. אַלְמָא ״אוֹר״ אוּרְתָּא הוּא.
human_translation: Come hear as it was taught the school of Shmuel: On the evening of the fourteenth one searches for leavened bread by candlelight. Apparently, or is evening,
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught in the school of Shmuel: On the nights of the fourteenth, they search for the leaven by the light of the lamp. This implies that "light" refers to a lamp.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בֵּין רַב הוּנָא וּבֵין רַב יְהוּדָה דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא ״אוֹר״ אוּרְתָּא הוּא, וְלָא פְּלִיגִי, מָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ וּמָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ. בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא קָרוּ ״נַגְהֵי״, וּבְאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה קָרוּ ״לֵילֵי״.
human_translation: Rather, as everyone, both Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda, agrees or is evening, and they do not disagree Master in accordance with his place, and Master in accordance with his place. In Rav Huna’s place, they call light, and in Rav Yehuda’s place they call it night,
llm_translation: Rather: between Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda, the entirety of the world, "light" is a lamp, and they do not disagree, one master in his place and the other master in his place. In the place of Rav Huna they called it "naghei," and in the place of Rav Yehuda they called it "leilei."

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִּידַן מַאי טַעְמָא לָא קָתָנֵי ״לֵילֵי״? לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא הוּא דְּנָקֵט. וְכִדְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: לְעוֹלָם אַל יוֹצִיא אָדָם דָּבָר מְגוּנֶּה מִפִּיו, שֶׁהֲרֵי עִקֵּם הַכָּתוּב שְׁמוֹנֶה אוֹתִיּוֹת, וְלֹא הוֹצִיא דָּבָר מְגוּנֶּה מִפִּיו. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִן הַבְּהֵמָה הַטְּהוֹרָה וּמִן הַבְּהֵמָה אֲשֶׁר אֵינֶנָּה טְהֹרָה״.
human_translation: And the tanna our what is the reason didn’t teach: The night He employed a euphemism. And in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A person should never express a crude matter, as the a verse distorted eight letters rather than express a crude matter, as it is stated: “From the pure animals and from the animals that are not pure [ asher einena tehora ]”
llm_translation: Our Mishna: What is the reason that we do not teach "leilei"? Because it is a higher level of sleep. And like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A person should never utter a disgraceful word, for the Scripture twisted eight letters and did not utter a disgraceful word. As it is stated: "From the clean animal and from the animal that is not clean."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: תֵּשַׁע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי יִהְיֶה בְךָ אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִהְיֶה טָהוֹר מִקְּרֵה לָיְלָה״. רָבִינָא אָמַר: עֶשֶׂר, וָיו דְּ״טָהוֹר״. רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי אָמַר מִקְרֶה הוּא בִּלְתִּי טָהוֹר הוּא כִּי לֹא טָהוֹר״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: nine as it is stated: “If there be among you any man who is not ritually pure [ asher lo yihye tahor ] by reason of that which happened to him by night” Ravina said: ten vav of tahor , Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: sixteen as it is stated: “For he said, something has happened to him, he is not ritually pure; surely he is not ritually pure [ bilti tahor hu ki lo tahor ]”
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: nine, as it is stated: "If there is among you any man who is not clean by reason of that which chanceth him by night." Ravina said: ten, and waw of "tahor." Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: sixteen, as it is stated: "For he has said it is an impure thing; he is unclean."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לְעוֹלָם יְסַפֵּר אָדָם בְּלָשׁוֹן נְקִיָּה, שֶׁהֲרֵי בַּזָּב קְרָאוֹ ״מֶרְכָּב״, וּבָאִשָּׁה קְרָאוֹ ״מוֹשָׁב״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״וְתִבְחַר לְשׁוֹן עֲרוּמִים״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״וְדַעַת שְׂפָתַי בָּרוּר מִלֵּלוּ״.
human_translation: was taught the school of Rabbi Yishmael: A person should always converse euphemistically, as a zav calls riding. And of a woman, calls sitting. And it says “And you choose the language of the crafty” And it says and that which my lips know they shall speak sincerely”
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: A person should always speak in a clean language, for regarding a male discharge, it is called "merkav" (a chariot), and regarding a woman, it is called "moshav" (a dwelling place). And it says: "And choose the language of the crafty." And it says: "And knowledge is clear from his lips."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֲבָל בִּדְרַבָּנַן לָא — תָּא שְׁמַע: וְאוֹמֵר ״וְתִבְחַר לְשׁוֹן עֲרוּמִים״. וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּדְרַבָּנַן, אֲבָל בְּמִילֵּי דְעָלְמָא לָא — וְאוֹמֵר ״וְדַעַת שְׂפָתַי בָּרוּר מִלֵּלוּ״.
human_translation: What is And it says? lest you say: This applies only in the Torah, but in rabbinic no, come hear: And it says: “And you choose the language of the crafty,” And lest you say that this applies only to rabbinic but to ordinary speech, no, And it says: “And that which my lips know they shall speak sincerely,”
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and he shall say"? And if you say: These matters are in regards to matters of the Torah, but not in regards to matters of the Rabbis — come and hear: "and he shall say, 'Choose the language of the cunning.'" And if you say: These matters are in regards to matters of the Rabbis, but not in regards to matters of the world — and he shall say, "and the knowledge of the lips is clear."

hebrew_text: וּבְאִשָּׁה לָא כְּתִיב בָּהּ ״מֶרְכָּב״?! וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַתָּקׇם רִבְקָה וְנַעֲרֹתֶיהָ וַתִּרְכַּבְנָה עַל הַגְּמַלִּים״! הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם בִּיעֲתוּתָא דִגְמַלִּים — אוֹרְחָא הִיא. וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְאֶת בָּנָיו וַיַּרְכִּיבֵם עַל הַחֲמֹר״! הָתָם,
human_translation: And with regard to a woman, is riding not written But isn’t it written: “And Rebecca and her damsels arose and they rode upon camels” There, due to fear of camels, that is standard conduct. But isn’t it written: “And Moses took his wife and his children and rode them upon his donkey” There,
llm_translation: And in a woman it is not written in her "chariot"?! And it is written: "And Rebekah arose, and her maidens, and they rode upon the camels"! There, because of the fatigue of the camels - it is the way. And it is written: "And Moses took his wife and his sons, and he mounted them upon the donkey"! There,

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם בָּנָיו — אוֹרְחָא הוּא.
human_translation: due to his children, it is standard practice
llm_translation: Because of his sons - it is a way.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְהִיא רֹכֶבֶת עַל הַחֲמוֹר״! הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם בִּיעֲתוּתָא דְלֵילְיָא — אוֹרְחָא הוּא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִשּׁוּם בִּיעֲתוּתָא דְלֵילְיָא — לֵיכָּא, מִשּׁוּם בִּיעֲתוּתָא דְּדָוִד — אִיכָּא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בִּיעֲתוּתָא דְּדָוִד — נָמֵי לֵיכָּא, מִשּׁוּם בִּיעֲתוּתָא דְהַר — אִיכָּא.
human_translation: But isn’t it written as she rode on her donkey There, due to the fear of the night, it is standard practice And if you wish, say There is no due to the fear of the night there is due to fear of David. And if you wish, say There is no due to fear of David either; there is due to the fear of the mountain.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And she is riding on the donkey"! There, due to the fear of the night - it is a path. And if you wish, say: due to the fear of the night - it is not, due to the fear of David - it is. And if you wish, say: due to the fear of David - it is also not, due to the fear of the mountain - it is.

hebrew_text: וּבְאוֹרָיְיתָא מִי לָא כְּתִיב ״טָמֵא״? אֶלָּא: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּכִי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ — מִשְׁתַּעֵי בְּלָשׁוֹן נְקִיָּה, כֹּל הֵיכָא דִּנְפִישִׁין מִילֵּי — מִשְׁתַּעֵי בְּלָשׁוֹן קְצָרָה. כִּדְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: לְעוֹלָם יִשְׁנֶה אָדָם לְתַלְמִידוֹ דֶּרֶךְ קְצָרָה.
human_translation: But isn’t impure written in the Torah? Rather, anywhere that are equal speaks a euphemism. Anywhere that the words are numerous, speaks concise language, in accordance with which Rav Huna said Rav said, and some say it Rav Huna said Rav said in the name of Rabbi Meir: A person should always teach his student in a concise manner.
llm_translation: In the light of the Torah, where is it not written "unclean"? Rather, wherever they are like Hadadei - they use clean language, wherever there are many words - they use concise language. As Rav Huna said in the name of Rav, and some say it was Rav Huna who said in the name of Rabbi Meir: A person should always teach his student in a concise manner.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּכִי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ מִשְׁתַּעֵי בִּלְשׁוֹן כָּבוֹד? וְהָא ״רוֹכֶבֶת״ וְ״יוֹשֶׁבֶת״ דְּכִי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, וְקָאָמַר ״רוֹכֶבֶת״! ״רֹכֶבֶת״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And anywhere that are equal in speak dignified language? Aren’t rides [ rokhevet ], and sits [ yoshevet ], of equal states: Rides rides is written
llm_translation: And all places where Hadadei they are found speaking in the language of honor? And the "rider" and "sitter" when Hadadei they are, and it says "rider"! "Rider" is written.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי תַלְמִידֵי דַּהֲווֹ יָתְבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב. חַד אָמַר: שַׁוִּיתִינַּן הַאי שְׁמַעְתָּא כְּדָבָר אַחֵר מְסַנְּקָן, וְחַד אָמַר: שַׁוִּיתִינַּן הַאי שְׁמַעְתָּא כִּגְדִי מְסַנְּקָן, וְלָא אִישְׁתַּעִי רַב בַּהֲדֵי דְּהַאיְךְ.
human_translation: these two students who were sitting before Rav One said: This halakha is rendering us as a tired [ mesankan ] something else, And one said: This halakha is rendering us as a tired kid. Rav not speak with that
llm_translation: Behold, two disciples who were sitting before Rav. One said: "We have compared this teaching to a different matter, like a snail." And the other said: "We have compared this teaching to a young goat, like a snail." And Rav did not pay attention to them regarding this matter.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי תַלְמִידֵי דַּהֲווֹ יָתְבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּהִלֵּל, וְחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי, וְחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. חַד אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי מָה בּוֹצְרִין בְּטָהֳרָה וְאֵין מוֹסְקִין בְּטָהֳרָה? וְחַד אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי מָה בּוֹצְרִין בְּטָהֳרָה וּמוֹסְקִין בְּטוּמְאָה? אָמַר: מוּבְטָח אֲנִי בָּזֶה שֶׁמּוֹרֶה הוֹרָאָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. וְלֹא הָיָה יָמִים מוּעָטִים עַד שֶׁהוֹרָה הוֹרָאָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: these two students who were sitting before Hillel, and one of them Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai. And some say before Rabbi and one of them was Rabbi Yoḥanan. One said: Due to what one harvest grapes in ritual purity, and one need not harvest olives in ritual purity? And one said Due to what one harvest grapes in ritual purity, but one harvest olives in ritual impurity? said: I am certain that this issue rulings in Israel. And not a few days later that he issued rulings in Israel.
llm_translation: Behold, there were two disciples who were sitting before Hillel, and one of them was Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai. And they said to him, before Rabbi, and one of them was Rabbi Yochanan. One said: Why do we prune in purity and not in impurity? And one said: Why do we prune in purity and we handle in impurity? He said: I am confident in this one who teaches Torah in Israel. And it was not many days before he began teaching Torah in Israel.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ תְּלָתָא כָהֲנֵי. חַד אֲמַר לְהוּ: הִגִּיעַנִי כְּפוֹל, וְחַד אָמַר: הִגִּיעַנִי כְּזַיִת, וְחַד אָמַר: הִגִּיעַנִי כִּזְנַב הַלְּטָאָה. בָּדְקוּ אַחֲרָיו, וּמָצְאוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֶץ פְּסוּל.
human_translation: these three priests One said to them: I received a bean-sized And one said: I received an olive-bulk. And one said: I received of a lizard’s tail. They investigated the background and they found a trace [ shemetz ] of disqualification in his
llm_translation: Behold, three priests. One of them said to them: "It reached me like a half a log," and one said: "It reached me like an olive," and one said: "It reached me like the tail of a lizard." They examined it and found in it leaven, invalid.

hebrew_text: וְהָא (תַּנְיָא): אֵין בּוֹדְקִין מִן הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וּלְמַעְלָה!
human_translation: But wasn’t taught one does not investigate beyond the altar?
llm_translation: And the Tanna taught: One does not inspect from the altar and above!

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא ״שֶׁמֶץ פְּסוּל״, אֶלָּא אֵימָא ״שַׁחַץ פְּסוּל״. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִיהוּ דְּאַרַּע נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Do not say a trace [ shemetz ] of disqualification, Rather, say arrogance [ shaḥatz ] of disqualification, And if you wish, say There it is different, as he cast aspersions upon himself.
llm_translation: Do not say "leaven is invalid," rather say "a tear is invalid." And if you wish, say: it is different there, for he himself caused harm to his soul.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא אַרְמָאָה דַּהֲוָה סָלֵיק וְאָכֵיל פְּסָחִים בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. אֲמַר: כְּתִיב ״כׇּל בֶּן נֵכָר לֹא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״, ״כׇּל עָרֵל לֹא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״, וַאֲנָא הָא קָאָכֵילְנָא מִשׁוּפְרֵי שׁוּפְרֵי.
human_translation: A certain gentile would ascend and eat Paschal in Jerusalem. He said: It is written: no foreigner may eat of it” “Any uncircumcised man shall not eat of it” And I ate from the finest of the fine
llm_translation: That Aramean who used to go up and eat Paschal lambs in Jerusalem. He said: It is written, "No foreigner shall eat of it," "No uncircumcised person shall eat of it," and I am eating of the choicest of the choicest.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא: מִי קָא סָפוּ לָךְ מֵאַלְיָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. כִּי סָלְקַתְּ לְהָתָם אֵימָא לְהוּ: סְפוֹ לִי מֵאַלְיָה. כִּי סְלֵיק, אֲמַר לְהוּ: מֵאַלְיָה סְפוֹ לִי! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַלְיָה לְגָבוֹהַּ סָלְקָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira said to him, Did they feed you from the fat tail said to him: No. when you ascend there say to them: Feed me the fat tail. when he ascended, he said to Feed me from the fat tail. They said to him: The fat tail is up to God.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera: Who has counted for you from Elijah? He said to him: No. When he went there, he said to them: Count for me from Elijah. When he went up, he said to them: Count for me from Elijah! They said to him: Elijah has ascended on high.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאן אֲמַר לָךְ הָכִי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא. אֲמַרוּ: מַאי הַאי דְּקַמַּן? בְּדַקוּ בָּתְרֵיהּ, וְאַשְׁכְּחוּהוּ דְּאַרְמָאָה הוּא וְקַטְלוּהוּ. שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא: שְׁלָם לָךְ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא! דְּאַתְּ בִּנְצִיבִין וּמְצוּדָתְךָ פְּרוּסָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: They said to him: Who said that to you, He said to them Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira. They said: What is this before us? They investigated his background and found that he was a gentile, and killed him. They sent to Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira: Peace unto you, Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, as you in Netzivin and your net is spread in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: They said to him: Who told you this? He said to them: Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera. They said: What is this that he said? They checked his background, and found that he was an Aramean, so they excommunicated him. They sent to Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera: Peace unto you, Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera! For you are established and your net is spread over Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא חֲלַשׁ. שַׁדְּרוּהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זִיל בְּדוֹק מַאי דִּינֵיהּ. אֲתָא, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ דְּנָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ. קַרְעֵיהּ לִלְבוּשֵׁיהּ, וְאַהְדְּרֵיהּ לְקִרְעֵיהּ לַאֲחוֹרֵיהּ, וּבָכֵי וְאָתֵי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא לָא קָאָמֵינָא. ״וּמוֹצִיא דִבָּה הוּא כְסִיל״.
human_translation: Rav Kahana fell ill, and the Sages sent Rabbi Yehoshua, son of Rav Idi, They said to him: Go assess what is condition of went and found that had passed away. He rent his garment and turned the tear behind him and he was crying was coming. They said to him: Did pass away? He said to them: I did not say “And he who utters slander is a fool”
llm_translation: Rav Kahana weakened. The Rabbis sent to Rabbi Yehoshua, son of Rav Idi, saying to him: Go check what his judgment is. He came, found that he was weak. He tore his garments, turned them backward, and cried and came. They said to him: Is he weak? He said to them: I am not saying. "And the whisperer separates close friends."

hebrew_text: יוֹחָנָן חָקוֹקָאָה נְפַק לְקִרְיָיתָא. כִּי אֲתָא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: חִיטִּין נַעֲשׂוּ יָפוֹת? אָמַר לָהֶם: שְׂעוֹרִים נַעֲשׂוּ יָפוֹת. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: צֵא וּבַשֵּׂר לַסּוּסִים וְלַחֲמוֹרִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַשְּׂעֹרִים וְהַתֶּבֶן לַסּוּסִים וְלָרָכֶשׁ״. מַאי הֲוֵי לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר? אֶשְׁתָּקַד נַעֲשׂוּ חִיטִּין יָפוֹת. אִי נָמֵי: עֲדָשִׁים נַעֲשׂוּ יָפוֹת.
human_translation: Yoḥanan from Ḥakuk went to the villages. When he came, they said to him: wheat develop nicely? he said to them: barley developed nicely, They said to him, Go out and inform the horses and donkeys as it is written: “Barley and hay for the horses and swift steeds” What could he have said Last year’s wheat developed nicely. Alternatively, lentils, has developed nicely.
llm_translation: Yochanan the scribe went out to the village. When he came, they said to him: "Have the wheat grains become beautiful?" He said to them: "Barley grains have become beautiful." They said to him: "Go and feed the horses and donkeys, as it is written: 'The barley and the straw for the horses and for the pack animals.'" What could he say in response? "The wheat grains have indeed become beautiful." Alternatively: "Lentils have become beautiful."

hebrew_text: רַב, בַּר אֲחוּהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא וּבַר אֲחָתֵיהּ. כִּי סְלֵיק לְהָתָם, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַיְיבוּ קַיָּים? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִימָּא קַיֶּימֶת?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִימָּא קַיֶּימֶת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַיְיבוּ קַיָּים?!
human_translation: Rav the son of Rabbi Ḥiyya’s brother and the son of sister, When ascended there, said to Is Ayevu, alive? He said to him, Is Imma, alive? He said to him: is Imma alive? He said to him: Is Ayevu alive?
llm_translation: Rav, son of his brother of Rabbi Chiya and son of his sister. When he went there, he said to him: "Is it established?" He said to him: "Perhaps it is established?!" He said to him: "Perhaps it is established?" He said to him: "Is it established?!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: חֲלוֹץ לִי מִנְעָלַי וְהוֹלֵיךְ כֵּלַי אַחֲרֵי לְבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אָבֵל אָסוּר בִּנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שְׁמוּעָה רְחוֹקָה אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: said to his attendant: Remove my shoes and carry my garments after me to the bathhouse. Learn from three Learn from it wearing shoes prohibited a mourner, And learn from it distant tidings is practiced only one day. And learn from it part of the day is like of an entire
llm_translation: He said to him to his attendant: "Remove my shoes and bring my utensils after me to the bathhouse." Learn from it three things. Learn from it: A mourner is forbidden to wear sandals. And learn from it: A rumor from afar is only effective for one day. And learn from it: Part of the day is like the whole.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דְּאָמַר: דּוּנוּ דִּינִי. אָמְרִי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִדָּן קָאָתֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״דָּן יָדִין עַמּוֹ כְּאַחַד שִׁבְטֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: A certain would say Adjudicate my case [ dunu dini ]. said: Learn from it he descends from Dan, as it is written: “Dan will judge [ yadin ] his people like one of the tribes of Israel”
llm_translation: That one who said: "Let us judge the laws." They said: Understand from it that he is coming from Dan, as it is written: "Dan shall judge his people as one of the tribes of Israel."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל וְאָמַר: אַכֵּיף יַמָּא אָסֵיסְנִי בִּירָאתָא. בְּדַקוּ וְאַשְׁכְּחוּהוּ דְּמִזְּבוּלוּן קָאָתֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״זְבוּלֻן לְחוֹף יַמִּים יִשְׁכֹּן״.
human_translation: A certain would walk and say: The bushes on the seashore are cypresses They examined and found that he descends from Zebulun, as it is written: “Zebulun shall dwell by the seashore”
llm_translation: That one who was going and said: "How pleasant is the sea, it strengthens me in fear." They investigated and found him standing in Zebulun, as it is written: "Zebulun shall dwell at the shore of the sea."

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּקַיְימָא לַן דִּלְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא ״אוֹר״ אוּרְתָּא הוּא, מִכְּדֵי בֵּין לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וּבֵין לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר — חָמֵץ אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַעְלָה, וְנִבְדּוֹק בְּשֵׁית.
human_translation: And now that we maintain that everyone agrees or is evening, After all, both according to Rabbi Yehuda and according to Rabbi Meir, it is prohibited leavened bread only from the sixth hour and onward. And let us search six
llm_translation: At this time that it is established for us that according to the opinion of the entire world, "or" is a light, as it is stated, between Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Meir - chametz is not prohibited except from six hours and onwards, and it is examined meticulously at six.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא זְרִיזִין מַקְדִּימִין לְמִצְוֹת, נִבְדּוֹק מִצַּפְרָא. דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי יִמּוֹל בְּשַׂר עָרְלָתוֹ״, וְתַנְיָא: כָּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ כָּשֵׁר לְמִילָה, אֶלָּא שֶׁזְּרִיזִין מַקְדִּימִים לְמִצְוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּשְׁכֵּם אַבְרָהָם בַּבֹּקֶר״.
human_translation: And lest you say the vigilant are early of mitzvot, let us search in the morning. as it is written: “And on the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised” And it was taught The entire day is suitable for circumcision; however, the vigilant are early of mitzvot, As it is stated “And Abraham arose early in the morning”
llm_translation: And if you will say, the diligent ones precede in performing mitzvot, we examine from the morning. As it is written: "And on the eighth day, the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised." And it was taught: The entire day is fit for circumcision, but the diligent ones precede in performing mitzvot, as it is said: "And Abraham arose early in the morning."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁבְּנֵי אָדָם מְצוּיִין בְּבָתֵּיהֶם, וְאוֹר הַנֵּר יָפֶה לִבְדִיקָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: in a time when people are found in their homes, And the light of the lamp is favorable for search
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: At the time when people are found in their homes, the light of the lamp is beautiful for inspection.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִילְכָּךְ, הַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן לָא לִפְתַּח בְּעִידָּנֵיהּ בְּאוּרְתָּא דִתְלֵיסַר דְּנַגְהֵי אַרְבֵּסַר — דִּלְמָא מָשְׁכָא לֵיהּ שְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ, וְאָתֵי לְאִימְּנוֹעֵי מִמִּצְוָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: Therefore, a Torah scholar should not begin his period in the evening of the thirteenth that the evening of the fourteenth, perhaps he will become engrossed in the halakha and will come to be prevented from mitzva
llm_translation: Abaye said: Therefore, this elder student should not begin his testimony during the thirteenth hour, perhaps his attention will be diverted, and he will come to neglect the fulfillment of the commandment.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, עַל מִי לִבְדּוֹק? עַל הַמַּשְׂכִּיר לִבְדּוֹק — דַּחֲמִירָא דִּידֵיהּ הוּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא עַל הַשּׂוֹכֵר לִבְדּוֹק — דְּאִיסּוּרָא בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ קָאֵי? תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ — עַל הַשּׂוֹכֵר לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ מְזוּזָה!
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak: one who lets a house to another on the fourteenth upon whom to search upon the lessor to search as the leavened bread is his; or perhaps upon the lessee to search, as the prohibition is in his domain Come hear one who lets a house to another, upon the lessee to affix a mezuza for it.
llm_translation: Inquired of him Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: One who rents a house to his fellow for fourteen, upon whom is the obligation to affix a mezuzah? Upon the renter to affix — perhaps it is his stringency, or perhaps upon the landlord to affix — for the prohibition is in his domain? Come and hear: One who rents a house to his fellow — it is upon the renter to affix a mezuzah!

hebrew_text: הָתָם, הָא אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: מְזוּזָה חוֹבַת הַדָּר הִיא. הָכָא, מַאי? אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, תְּנֵינָא: הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא מָסַר לוֹ מַפְתְּחוֹת חָל אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר — עַל הַמַּשְׂכִּיר לִבְדּוֹק, וְאִם מִשֶּׁמָּסַר לוֹ מַפְתְּחוֹת חָל אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר — עַל הַשּׂוֹכֵר לִבְדּוֹק.
human_translation: There, didn’t Rav Mesharshiya say: a mezuza is the obligation of the resident? what is here? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to them we learned One who rents a house to another, if before he delivered the keys to the fourteenth began, upon the lessor to search And if after he delivered the keys to him the fourteenth began, upon the lessee to search
llm_translation: There, this, said Rav Mesharshya: A mezuzah is an obligation of the dweller. Here, what? Said to them Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak, we learned: One who rents a house to his friend, if before he handed over to him the keys fourteen days — the responsibility is on the renter to check, and if after he handed over to him the keys fourteen days — the responsibility is on the landlord to check.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, חֶזְקָתוֹ בָּדוּק אוֹ אֵין חֶזְקָתוֹ בָּדוּק? לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לִישַׁיְּילֵיהּ! דְּלֵיתֵיהּ לְהַאי דִּלְשַׁיּוֹלֵיהּ. לְאַטְרוֹחֵי לְהַאי, מַאי?
human_translation: They raised dilemma before Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak: one who lets a house to another on the fourteenth its presumptive status searched or it not its presumptive status that it has been searched? What is the practical difference Let him ask where not to ask him. to impose upon What is
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Inquired of him Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: One who rents a house to his friend for fourteen, is his presumption established or is his presumption not established? What is the practical difference? For his benefit! Because he does not have it for his own benefit. To what extent is it beneficial for him, what is it?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: הַכֹּל נֶאֱמָנִים עַל בִּיעוּר חָמֵץ, אֲפִילּוּ נָשִׁים אֲפִילּוּ עֲבָדִים אֲפִילּוּ קְטַנִּים. מַאי טַעְמָא מְהֵימְנֵי,
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to them we learned Everyone is believed about the elimination of leavened bread; even women, even slaves, even minors. What is the reason they are believed?
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak, his teaching: All are trusted regarding the removal of leaven, even women, even slaves, even minors. What is the reason they are trusted?

hebrew_text: לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּחֶזְקָתוֹ בָּדוּק, דְּקָסָבַר: הַכֹּל חֲבֵרִים הֵם אֵצֶל בְּדִיקַת חָמֵץ. דְּתַנְיָא: חָבֵר שֶׁמֵּת וְהִנִּיחַ מְגוּרָה מְלֵיאָה פֵּירוֹת, אֲפִילּוּ הֵן בְּנֵי יוֹמָן — הֲרֵי הֵן בְּחֶזְקַת מְתוּקָּנִים.
human_translation: Isn’t due to that the presumptive status has been searched, as maintains: All are ḥaverim with regard to the search for leavened bread? As it was taught a ḥaver who died and left a storehouse filled with produce, even that day, presumptive status prepared,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Not because his presumption is firmly established, for he holds: all are considered partners in the examination of leaven. As it was taught: If a partner died and left a storage full of fruits, even if they are still within their designated time period — they are considered properly arranged."

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָאָמְרִי הָנֵי. אַטּוּ אֲמִירָה דְּהָנֵי מִידֵּי מְשָׁשָׁא אִית בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: And from where perhaps it is different here, due to these stated Is that to say there is any substance in the statement of these
llm_translation: And from where? Perhaps it is different here, because they are saying those. Come and see, is there a statement of those that has in it a doubt?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי — דְּחָזְקָתוֹ בָּדוּק? הַאי ״הַכֹּל נֶאֱמָנִים״, ״כָּל הַבָּתִּים בְּחֶזְקַת בְּדוּקִין בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, what is that its presumptive status has been searched? this Everyone is believed, It should have all houses on the fourteenth, presumptive status is they have been searched,
llm_translation: Rather what — his presumption is firmly established? This verse "All are trustworthy," "All houses are presumed to be firmly established in fourteen cases" requires it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי — מִשּׁוּם אֲמִירָה דְּהָנֵי, הָא לָא אָמְרִי הָנֵי — לָא? תִּפְשׁוֹט מִינֵּיהּ דְּאֵין חֶזְקָתוֹ בָּדוּק.
human_translation: Rather, what due to statement of these if these do not say no, resolve from here, that presumptive status not has been searched,
llm_translation: Rather, what is it? Because of the statement of those, but did those not say? Remove from it that his presumption is not firmly established.

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ חֶזְקָתוֹ בָּדוּק, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — דְּמוּחְזָק לַן דְּלָא בְּדַק, וְקָאָמְרִי הָנֵי: בַּדְקִינֵּיהּ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לָא לְהֵימְנִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: כֵּיוָן דִּבְדִיקַת חָמֵץ מִדְּרַבָּנַן הוּא, דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בְּבִיטּוּל בְּעָלְמָא סַגִּי לֵיהּ — הֵימְנוּהוּ רַבָּנַן בִּדְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: No, actually say to you that its presumptive status has been searched, and with what are we dealing here? where our presumption is did not search and these say: We searched it. Lest you say the Sages do not believe them, teaches us since the search for leavened bread is by rabbinic law, as by Torah law mere nullification is sufficient, the Sages believe them with regard to by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Not, forever say to you his strength is established, and here with what we are dealing — for it is established for us that he did not check, and they say: in his checks. What might you say: not to believe the Rabbis, it is heard for us: since the checking of leaven is Rabbinic, for from the Torah in nullification alone is sufficient for it — the Rabbis believed him with Rabbinic authority.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ בְּחֶזְקַת בָּדוּק, וּמְצָאוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּדוּק, מַהוּ? מִי הָוֵי כְּמִקָּח טָעוּת, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before one who lets a house to another with the presumptive status it was searched, and discovered that it was not searched, what is Is it considered a mistaken transaction, Or no,
llm_translation: He asked them: One who rents a house to his friend with the presumption that it is well-built, and then they find that it is not well-built, what is the ruling? Is it considered a mistaken transaction or not?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא בְּאַתְרָא דְּלָא יָהֲבִי אַגְרָא וּבְדַקוּ — דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ לְקַיּוֹמֵי מִצְוָה בְּגוּפֵיהּ. אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַתְרָא דְּיָהֲבִי אַגְרָא וּבְדַקוּ — דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ לְקַיּוֹמֵי מִצְוָה בְּמָמוֹנֵיהּ.
human_translation: Come hear as Abaye said: Needless to say, in a place where do not pay a wage and searches a person prefers to fulfill mitzva himself. However, even in a place where pay a wage and search that a person prefers to perform mitzva with his money.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Abaye said: It is not necessary in a case where one does not give a reward and they check - that it is preferable for a person to fulfill a commandment with his body. Rather, even in a case where one gives a reward and they check - that it is preferable for a person to fulfill a commandment with his money.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אוֹכְלִין כָּל חָמֵשׁ, וְשׂוֹרְפִין בִּתְחִלַּת שֵׁשׁ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אוֹכְלִין כָּל אַרְבַּע, וְתוֹלִין כָּל חָמֵשׁ, וְשׂוֹרְפִין בִּתְחִלַּת שֵׁשׁ. דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהָא חָמֵץ מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַעְלָה אָסוּר, מְנָלַן?
human_translation: We learned there, Rabbi Meir says: One eat the entire five and burns at the beginning of the sixth Rabbi Yehuda says: One eat the entire four and one leaves in abeyance during the fifth and one burns at the beginning of the sixth Everyone agrees, in any case, leavened bread is prohibited from the sixth hour and onward. From where do we
llm_translation: We learned there, Rabbi Meir says: One may eat until the fifth hour and burn at the beginning of the sixth. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may eat until the fourth hour, remove until the fifth, and burn at the beginning of the sixth. Since the entire world prohibits chametz from the sixth hour and onwards, from where do we derive this?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי, כְּתִיב: ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים שְׂאוֹר לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְּבָתֵּיכֶם״, וּכְתִיב: ״אַךְ בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן תַּשְׁבִּיתוּ שְּׂאוֹר מִבָּתֵּיכֶם״. הָא כֵּיצַד? לְרַבּוֹת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר לְבִיעוּר.
human_translation: Abaye said: Two verses are written, It is written “Seven days, leaven shall not be found in your houses” And it is written “Yet on the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses” How this to include the fourteenth to the elimination
llm_translation: Abaye said: Two verses are written, it is written: "Seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses," and it is written: "But on the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses." How so? To include the fourteenth for removal.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא לְרַבּוֹת לֵילֵי חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר לְבִיעוּר, דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: ״יָמִים״ כְּתִיב, יָמִים — אִין, לֵילוֹת — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן אֲפִילּוּ לֵילוֹת! הָהוּא לָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ,
human_translation: And say to include the night of the fifteenth, to the elimination As, it could enter your mind to say: days is written, days, yes, nights, no, teaches us: even nights. That not necessary to
llm_translation: And why not to include the nights of the fifteenth for Bi'ur, since your mind has come to say: "days" is written, days - no, nights - yes, it implies to us even nights! That case is not necessary for him.

hebrew_text: דְּהָא אִיתַּקַּשׁ הַשְׁבָּתַת שְׂאוֹר לַאֲכִילַת חָמֵץ, וַאֲכִילַת חָמֵץ לַאֲכִילַת מַצָּה.
human_translation: the removal of leaven is juxtaposed to the eating of leavened bread And the eating of leavened bread to the eating of matza ,
llm_translation: The Sabbath is connected to the eating of leavened bread, and the eating of leavened bread is connected to the eating of matzah.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁבָּתַת שְׂאוֹר לַאֲכִילַת חָמֵץ, דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים שְׂאֹר לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְּבָתֵּיכֶם כִּי כָּל אֹכֵל מַחְמֶצֶת וְנִכְרְתָה״.
human_translation: The removal of leaven to the eating of leavened bread, as it is written: “Seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses, as anyone who eats that which is leavened, shall be cut off
llm_translation: The cessation of leaven for the consumption of chametz, as it is written: "Seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses, for whoever eats leavened bread, that soul shall be cut off."

hebrew_text: וַאֲכִילַת חָמֵץ לַאֲכִילַת מַצָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כָּל מַחְמֶצֶת לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ בְּכֹל מוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶם תֹּאכְלוּ מַצּוֹת (וְגוֹ׳)״, וּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ בְּמַצָּה: ״בָּעֶרֶב תֹּאכְלוּ מַצּוֹת״.
human_translation: And the eating of leavened bread to the eating of matza , as it is written: “You shall not eat anything that is leavened; in all of your dwellings you shall eat matzot , etc.” and it is written with regard to matza : in the evening you shall eat matzot ”
llm_translation: Eating leaven for eating matzah, as it is written: "You shall not eat any leavened bread with it; for seven days you shall eat unleavened bread (etc.)" and it is written in it regarding matzah: "You shall eat unleavened bread with it; in the evening you shall eat unleavened bread."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא לְרַבּוֹת לֵיל אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר לְבִיעוּר? ״בַּיּוֹם״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And say to include the night of the fourteenth to remove “on the day” is written.
llm_translation: And why not include the night of the fourteenth for Bi'ur? "On the day" is written.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא מִצַּפְרָא! ״אַךְ״ חִלֵּק.
human_translation: And say from the morning yet divides.
llm_translation: And why not from Tzafra! "However" he disputed.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: מָצִינוּ אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שֶׁנִּקְרָא רִאשׁוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּרִאשׁוֹן בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹם לַחֹדֶשׁ״. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: רִאשׁוֹן — דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא מַשְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״הָרִאשׁוֹן אָדָם תִּוָּלֵד״.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: We found fourteenth is called: First, as it is stated: “On harishon , on the fourteenth day of the month” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: as rishon means previous. as the verse stated: “Are you first [ rishon ] man born?
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Yishmael it was taught: We found fourteen days that are called "first," as it is stated: "In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "First" - this implies from the beginning, as the verse states: "The first man shall be born."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״וּלְקַחְתֶּם לָכֶם בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן״, הָכִי נָמֵי רִאשׁוֹן דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא מַשְׁמַע?
human_translation: But so, “And you shall take for yourselves on the first [ harishon ] day So too, harishon mean previous
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from now, "and you shall take for yourselves on the first day," is it so that the term "first" from the outset implies?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּשְׂמַחְתֶּם לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״, מָה ״שְׁבִיעִי״ — שְׁבִיעִי לֶחָג, אַף ״רִאשׁוֹן״ — רִאשׁוֹן לֶחָג.
human_translation: There it is different, as it is written “And you shall rejoice before the Lord your God seven days” Just as the seventh the seventh day of the Festival, too, first first of the Festival
llm_translation: The matter is different there, for it is written: "And you shall rejoice before the Lord your God seven days." Just as "seventh" refers to the seventh day of the festival, so too "first" refers to the first day of the festival.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי כְּתִיב: ״אַךְ בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן תַּשְׁבִּיתוּ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים מַצּוֹת תֹּאכֵלוּ״! אִם כֵּן, נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״רִאשׁוֹן״, ״הָרִאשׁוֹן״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לִכְדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Here too, it is written “Yet on the first [ harishon ] day you shall remove “for seven days you shall eat matza ” If so, let write rishon ; why do I harishon ? Learn from it, as we said:
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Here it is written: "But on the first day you shall cease leavened bread from your houses; for whoever eats leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel." If so, the verse should have written "רִאשׁוֹן" (first), why "הָרִאשׁוֹן" (the first)? Learn from this as we have said.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי הָתָם נָמֵי, ״הָרִאשׁוֹן״ לְמָה לִי? וְתוּ, הָתָם דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן שַׁבָּתוֹן וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי שַׁבָּתוֹן״, אֵימַר ״רִאשׁוֹן״ דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא מַשְׁמַע? שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי שַׁבָּתוֹן״, מָה ״שְׁמִינִי״ — שְׁמִינִי דְּחַג, אַף ״רִאשׁוֹן״ — רִאשׁוֹן דְּחַג.
human_translation: If so, there too, why do I harishon ? And furthermore, there it is written: “On the first [ harishon ] day a solemn rest and on the eighth day a solemn rest” say first means previous, It is different there, as the verse said: “And on the eighth day a solemn rest,” just as eighth eighth of the Festival, too, rishon first of the Festival.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, there, "the first," why do I need it? And if so, there, as it is written: "On the first day is a Sabbath rest, and on the eighth day is a Sabbath rest," should we say that "first" implies from the outset? It is different there, as the verse says: "And on the eighth day is a Sabbath rest," just as "eighth" refers to the eighth day of the festival, so too "first" refers to the first day of the festival.

hebrew_text: ״הָרִאשׁוֹן״ לְמָה לִי? לְמַעוֹטֵי חוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. חוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד מֵ״רִאשׁוֹן״ וּ״שְׁמִינִי״ נָפְקָא!
human_translation: Why do I harishon ? to exclude the intermediate days the intermediate days is derived from first and eighth.
llm_translation: "The first" why do I need it? To exclude the weekday of the festival. The weekday of the festival is derived from "the first" and "the eighth" comes out!

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הוֹאִיל דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי״, וָיו מוֹסִיף עַל עִנְיָן רִאשׁוֹן, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: necessary it could enter your mind to say since the Merciful One writes: “And on the eighth day,” vav adds to the previous matter, that even the intermediate days teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary: since your mind is in doubt, I say, since the Merciful One wrote: "And on the eighth day," and the vav adds to the first matter, that even on a weekday of the festival, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: וְלָא לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא לָא וָיו וְלָא הֵא?! וְתוּ, הָתָם דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן מִקְרָא קֹדֶשׁ יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״ — רִאשׁוֹן דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא מַשְׁמַע?!
human_translation: And let the Merciful One write neither vav nor heh . And furthermore, there, it is written: “On the first [ harishon ] day you shall have a sacred convocation; first mean previous,
llm_translation: And not to write "Rachmana" with a Vav and not with a Yud?! And come, there, as it is written: "On the first day there shall be a holy convocation for you" — the first from the outset implies what?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה ״רִאשׁוֹן״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתָנֵי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בִּשְׂכַר שְׁלֹשָׁה ״רִאשׁוֹן״, זָכוּ לִשְׁלֹשָׁה ״רִאשׁוֹן״: לְהַכְרִית זַרְעוֹ שֶׁל עֵשָׂו, לְבִנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְלִשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל מָשִׁיחַ.
human_translation: Rather, those three rishon necessary for that which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught. As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: In reward for the three rishon they were entitled to three rishon : To eradicate the descendants of Esau, to the construction of the Temple, and to the name of Messiah.
llm_translation: Rather, those three "firsts" are required according to the teaching of the school of Rabbi Ishmael. For it was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: In reward for three "firsts," they merited three "firsts": to uproot the seed of Esau, to build the Temple, and for the name of the Messiah.

hebrew_text: לְהַכְרִית זַרְעוֹ שֶׁל עֵשָׂו, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּצֵא הָרִאשׁוֹן אַדְמוֹנִי כֻּלּוֹ כְּאַדֶּרֶת שֵׂעָר״. וּלְבִנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּסֵּא כָבוֹד מָרוֹם מֵרִאשׁוֹן מְקוֹם מִקְדָּשֵׁנוּ״. וְלִשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל מָשִׁיחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״רִאשׁוֹן לְצִיּוֹן הִנֵּה הִנָּם״.
human_translation: To eradicate the descendants of Esau, as it is written: “And the first [ harishon ] came forth red, all over like a hairy mantle; And to the construction of the Temple, as it is written: Throne of Glory, on High from the beginning [ merishon ], the place of our Temple” And to the name of Messiah, as it is written: “A harbinger [ rishon ] to Zion Behold, behold them;
llm_translation: To cut off the seed of Esau, as it is written: "And the first came out red, all over like a hairy garment." And for the construction of the Temple, as it is written: "The throne of glory on high from the beginning is the place of our sanctuary." And for the name of the Messiah, as it is written: "The first to Zion, behold, behold them."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״לֹא תִשְׁחַט עַל חָמֵץ דַּם זִבְחִי״ — לֹא תִּשְׁחַט הַפֶּסַח וַעֲדַיִן חָמֵץ קַיָּים.
human_translation: Rava said: from here: “You shall not slaughter the blood of My offering over leavened bread; you shall not slaughter the Paschal lamb while leavened bread is still intact.
llm_translation: Rava said, from here: "Do not slaughter on leaven the blood of my sacrifice" - do not slaughter the Passover sacrifice while leaven is still in existence.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: כָּל חַד וְחַד כִּי שָׁחֵיט! זְמַן שְׁחִיטָה אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: And say each and every person when he slaughters The Merciful One states the time of slaughter
llm_translation: And why? Each and every one, when slaughtered! The time of slaughter, the Merciful One said.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״אַךְ בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן תַּשְׁבִּיתוּ שְּׂאֹר מִבָּתֵּיכֶם״ — מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב. אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּיוֹם טוֹב עַצְמוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תִשְׁחַט עַל חָמֵץ דַּם זִבְחִי״ — לֹא תִּשְׁחַט אֶת הַפֶּסַח וַעֲדַיִין חָמֵץ קַיָּים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: were also taught “Yet on the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses” from the eve of the Festival. Or perhaps not it only to the Festival itself. The verse states: “You shall not slaughter the blood of My offering over leavened bread” you shall not slaughter the Paschal lamb while leavened bread is still intact. the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "But on the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses" — from the evening of the fifteenth day. Or is it only on the fifteenth day itself? The Torah teaches: "You shall not slaughter upon leaven the blood of My sacrifice" — you shall not slaughter the Passover sacrifice while leaven is still in existence, according to the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אַךְ בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן תַּשְׁבִּיתוּ שְּׂאֹר מִבָּתֵּיכֶם״, וּכְתִיב: ״כָּל מְלָאכָה לֹא (תַעֲשׂוּ)״, וּמָצִינוּ לַהַבְעָרָה שֶׁהִיא אַב מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: There is no need as it says: “Yet on the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses,” and it is written: you shall perform no manner of work And we found that kindling is a primary category of labor.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary, as it says: "But on the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses," and it is written: "No (work) shall be done," and we found that burning is a primary labor.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אַךְ בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן תַּשְׁבִּיתוּ שְּׂאֹר מִבָּתֵּיכֶם״ — מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב. אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּיוֹם טוֹב — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אַךְ״, חִלֵּק. וְאִי בְּיוֹם טוֹב עַצְמוֹ, מִי שְׁרֵי? הָא אִיתַּקַּשׁ הַשְׁבָּתַת שְׂאוֹר לַאֲכִילַת חָמֵץ, וַאֲכִילַת חָמֵץ לַאֲכִילַת מַצָּה! אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: There is no need as it says: “Yet on the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses.” from the eve of the Festival. Or perhaps not it to the Festival itself. The verse states: Yet, to divide And if to the Festival itself, is permitted the removal of leaven is juxtaposed to the eating of leavened bread, and the eating of leavened bread to the eating of matza . Rava said:
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: It is not necessary. For he says: "But on the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses" — from the eve of the festival. Or is it only on the festival day itself — the Torah says "But," to differentiate. And if on the festival day itself, who permits? The Sabbath is connected to removing leaven for eating chametz, and eating chametz is connected to eating matzah! Rava said:

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִדְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אֵין בִּיעוּר חָמֵץ אֶלָּא שְׂרֵיפָה, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַבְעָרָה לְחַלֵּק יָצָאת, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לָא אָמְרִינַן הוֹאִיל וְהוּתְּרָה הַבְעָרָה לְצוֹרֶךְ — הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ.
human_translation: Learn from of Rabbi Akiva three Learn from it the removal of leavened bread only by burning. And learn from it was out to divide And learn from it we do not say: Since permitted kindle for purpose also permitted not for purpose
llm_translation: Listen, derive from it three things from Rabbi Akiva. Listen from it: there is no removal of leaven except by burning, and listen from it: burning is permitted to divide the leaven, and listen from it: we do not say since burning is permitted for a necessary purpose, it is also permitted for a non-necessary purpose.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים שְׂאֹר לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְּבָתֵּיכֶם״. מַה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״לֹא יֵרָאֶה לְךָ שְׂאֹר [וְלֹא יֵרָאֶה לְךָ חָמֵץ] בְּכׇל גְּבֻלֶךָ״!
human_translation: The Sages taught “Seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses” what the verse state Wasn’t it already stated: no leaven shall be seen with you, neither shall there be leavened bread seen with you, in all your borders”
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses." What is the Talmud to say? Has it not already been stated: "Leaven shall not be seen with you and no leaven shall be seen with you within all your borders!"

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יֵרָאֶה לְךָ שְׂאֹר״ — שֶׁלְּךָ אִי אַתָּה רוֹאֶה, אֲבָל אַתָּה רוֹאֶה שֶׁל אֲחֵרִים וְשֶׁל גָּבוֹהַּ. יָכוֹל יַטְמִין וִיקַבֵּל פִּקְדוֹנוֹת מִן הַגּוֹי — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא״.
human_translation: Because it is stated: “And no leaven shall be seen with you,” your you not see, but you may see to others, and to God. might one conceal accept deposits from a gentile. the verse states: “Shall not be found,”
llm_translation: According to what is stated: "No leaven shall be seen with you" - what is yours you do not see, but you see that which belongs to others and that which is high. One might have thought that one could hide and receive his deposits from a non-Jew - therefore the Scripture states: "It shall not be found."

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּגוֹי שֶׁלֹּא כִּיבַּשְׁתּוֹ, וְאֵין שָׁרוּי עִמְּךָ בֶּחָצֵר. גּוֹי שֶׁכִּיבַּשְׁתּוֹ, וְשָׁרוּי עִמְּךָ בֶּחָצֵר מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְּבָתֵּיכֶם״.
human_translation: I have nothing other with regard to a gentile whom you did not overcome and who does not dwell with you in the courtyard. a gentile whom you overcame and who dwells with you in the courtyard, from where The verse states: “It shall not be found in your houses”
llm_translation: I have only in a non-Jew that you have not dried, and not permitted with you in the courtyard. A non-Jew that you have dried, and permitted with you in the courtyard, from where? The Torah teaches: "There shall not be found in your houses."

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁבְּבָתֵּיכֶם. בְּבוֹרוֹת בְּשִׁיחִין וּבִמְעָרוֹת מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בְּכׇל גְּבֻלֶךָ״.
human_translation: I have nothing other that is in your houses. From where in pits, ditches, and caves? The verse states: In all your borders,
llm_translation: I have only in your dwellings. In pits, in ditches, and in caves, from where? The Torah teaches, "In all your borders."

hebrew_text: וַעֲדַיִין אֲנִי אוֹמֵר: בַּבָּתִּים עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם בַּל יֵרָאֶה וּבַל יִמָּצֵא וּבַל יַטְמִין וּבַל יְקַבֵּל פִּקְדוֹנוֹת מִן הַגּוֹי. בַּגְּבוּלִין — שֶׁלְּךָ אִי אַתָּה רוֹאֶה, אֲבָל אַתָּה רוֹאֶה שֶׁל אֲחֵרִים וְשֶׁל גָּבוֹהַּ. מִנַּיִין לִיתֵּן אֶת הָאָמוּר שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה וְשֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה?
human_translation: And still I say: in your houses, one violates shall not be seen and it shall not be found, as well as you shall not conceal and you shall not receive deposits from a gentile. in your borders, your you may not see, but you may see to others, and to God. From where to apply that was said about this to that and that was said about that to this
llm_translation: I still say: In houses, one may pass items due to the prohibition of "do not see" and "do not find" and "do not hide" and "do not accept deposits from a non-Jew." In borders - yours you may not see, but you may see those of others and those of a higher place. From where do we know to give the statement of this one to that one and that one to this one?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שְׂאוֹר״ ״שְׂאוֹר״ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה. נֶאֱמַר שְׂאוֹר בַּבָּתִּים: ״שְׂאֹר לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְּבָתֵּיכֶם״, וְנֶאֱמַר שְׂאֹר בַּגְּבוּלִין: ״לֹא יֵרָאֶה לְךָ שְׂאֹר״. מָה שְׂאוֹר הָאָמוּר בַּבָּתִּים — עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם בַּל יֵרָאֶה וּבַל יִמָּצֵא וּבַל יַטְמִין וּבַל יְקַבֵּל פִּקְדוֹנוֹת מִן הַגּוֹיִם, אַף שְׂאוֹר הָאָמוּר בַּגְּבוּלִין — עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם בַּל יֵרָאֶה וּבַל יִמָּצֵא וּבַל יַטְמִין וּבַל יְקַבֵּל פִּקְדוֹנוֹת מִן הַגּוֹיִם.
human_translation: the verse states leaven leaven as a verbal analogy. It states leaven with regard to houses: leaven shall not be found in your houses,” and it states leaven with regard to borders: “Neither shall there be leaven seen with you.” Just as leaven stated with regard to houses one transgresses shall not be seen and it shall not be found, and one shall not conceal and one shall not receive deposits from a gentile, too, leaven stated with regard to borders, one transgresses shall not be seen and it shall not be found, and one shall not conceal and one shall not receive deposits from a gentile.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Sour" "sour" for a decree is similar. It is stated sour in the houses: "No sour shall be found in your houses," and it is stated sour in the borders: "No sour shall be seen by you." Just as the sour mentioned in the houses - it passes from the prohibition of seeing, finding, hiding, and accepting deposits from the nations, so too the sour mentioned in the borders - it passes from the prohibition of seeing, finding, hiding, and accepting deposits from the nations.

hebrew_text: וּמָה שְׂאוֹר הָאָמוּר בַּגְּבוּלִין — שֶׁלְּךָ אִי אַתָּה רוֹאֶה, אֲבָל אַתָּה רוֹאֶה שֶׁל אֲחֵרִים וְשֶׁל גָּבוֹהַּ, אַף שְׂאוֹר הָאָמוּר בַּבָּתִּים — שֶׁלְּךָ אִי אַתָּה רוֹאֶה, אֲבָל אַתָּה רוֹאֶה שֶׁל אֲחֵרִים וְשֶׁל גָּבוֹהַּ.
human_translation: Just as leaven stated with regard to borders, your you may not see, but you may see to others, and to God, too, leaven stated with regard to houses: Your you may not see, but you may see to others and to God.
llm_translation: "And what is the leaven mentioned in the borders - it is yours if you do not see it, but you see that of others and of a high place, so too the leaven mentioned in the houses - it is yours if you do not see it, but you see that of others and of a high place."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּגוֹי שֶׁלֹּא כִּיבַּשְׁתּוֹ, וְאֵין שָׁרוּי עִמְּךָ בֶּחָצֵר. גּוֹי שֶׁכִּיבַּשְׁתּוֹ, וְשָׁרוּי עִמְּךָ בֶּחָצֵר מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא״.
human_translation: The Master said: I have nothing other with regard to a gentile whom you did not overcome and who does not dwell with you in the courtyard. a gentile whom you overcame and who dwells with you in the courtyard, from where The verse states: “It shall not be found
llm_translation: Master said: I have only in a non-dried fig, and it is not permitted with you in the courtyard. A non-dried fig, and it is permitted with you in the courtyard, from where? Scripture teaches "it shall not be found."

hebrew_text: כְּלַפֵּי לְיָיא! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: On the contrary; Abaye said: Reverse
llm_translation: According to the will of the Lord! Abaye said: Turn it over.
