hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, וְאַרֵישָׁא קָאֵי: שֶׁלְּךָ אִי אַתָּה רוֹאֶה, אֲבָל אַתָּה רוֹאֶה שֶׁל אֲחֵרִים וְשֶׁל גָּבוֹהַּ. אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּגוֹי שֶׁלֹּא כִּיבַּשְׁתּוֹ, וְאֵין שָׁרוּי עִמְּךָ בֶּחָצֵר. גּוֹי שֶׁכִּיבַּשְׁתּוֹ, וְשָׁרוּי עִמְּךָ בֶּחָצֵר, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא״.
human_translation: Rava said: Actually, do not reverse and it applies to the first clause Your you not see, but you may see to others, and to God, I have nothing other with regard to a gentile whom you did not overcome and who does not dwell with you in the courtyard, a gentile whom you overcame and who dwells with you in the courtyard, from where The verse states: “It shall not be found.”
llm_translation: Rava said: Always do not turn over, and the first one is standing: yours if you see, but you see others and the high one. I have only in a nation that you did not dry, and it is not tied with you in the courtyard. A nation that you dried, and it is tied with you in the courtyard, from where? The Talmud says, "It shall not be found."

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא מְיהַדַּר אַהֶיתֵּירָא, וְנָסֵיב לֵהּ קְרָא לְאִיסּוּרָא?! מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לְךָ״ ״לְךָ״ תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי.
human_translation: This tanna seeks permission he cites a verse to a prohibition. Due to that it is stated: with you with you twice,
llm_translation: And this Tanna reconciles the contradiction, and he brings a verse to prohibit it?! Because it is stated, "to you," "to you," two times.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָכוֹל יַטְמִין וִיקַבֵּל פִּקְדוֹנוֹת מִן הַגּוֹיִם, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא״. הָא אָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא: שֶׁלְּךָ אִי אַתָּה רוֹאֶה, אֲבָל אַתָּה רוֹאֶה שֶׁל אֲחֵרִים וְשֶׁל גָּבוֹהַּ!
human_translation: The Master said: might one conceal accept deposits from the gentiles. the verse states: It shall not be found. But didn’t you say in the first clause Your you may not see, but you may see to others and to God,
llm_translation: Master said: Can one hide and accept deposits from the nations? Scripture states: "It shall not be found." But didn't you say initially: What is yours you do not see, but what belongs to others and is high you do see!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּקַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אַחְרָיוּת, הָא — דְּלָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אַחְרָיוּת.
human_translation: not difficult; this as he accepted upon himself responsibility that as he did not accept upon himself responsibility,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - that he accepted responsibility, this - that he did not accept responsibility.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר לְהוּ רָבָא לִבְנֵי מָחוֹזָא: בַּעִירוּ חֲמִירָא דִבְנֵי חֵילָא מִבָּתַּיְיכוּ. כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ מִיגְּנֵב וְאִילּוּ מִיתְּבִיד בִּרְשׁוּתַיְיכוּ קָאֵי וּבָעִיתוּ לְשַׁלּוֹמֵי — כְּדִילְכוֹן דָּמֵי, וְאָסוּר.
human_translation: is like that which Rava said to the residents of Meḥoza: Remove the leavened bread that belongs to the members of the army from your houses. Since if were stolen or if it were lost, it stands in your possession and you required to pay is as yours, and it is prohibited
llm_translation: This is what Rava said to the people of Mahoza: "Be careful with the wine of the people of Cheila, from your homes." Since whether it is stolen or whether it is acquired legally in your possession, it stands and you will have to pay for it - as the law of blood, and it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּבָר הַגּוֹרֵם לְמָמוֹן — כְּמָמוֹן דָּמֵי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לָאו כְּמָמוֹן דָּמֵי, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This well according to the one who said: an object that effects monetary is like money. However, according to the one who said: is not like money, what can be said?
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says that a matter that causes monetary loss is like actual money. But for the one who says it is not like actual money, what can be said?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּאָמַר ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא״.
human_translation: different here, as said: “It shall not be found,”
llm_translation: The matter here is different, as it says, "it shall not be found."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּבָר הַגּוֹרֵם לְמָמוֹן — לָאו כְּמָמוֹן דָּמֵי,
human_translation: Some state This well according to the one who said: an object that effects monetary is not like money.
llm_translation: There are those who say: Let it be left for the one who says that a matter causing monetary loss is not like actual money.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כְּמָמוֹן דָּמֵי — ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא״ לְמָה לִי? אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְכִי אִיתֵיהּ הָדַר בְּעֵינֵיהּ — לָאו בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ קָאֵי, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: That is that necessary It shall not be found, However, according to the one who said: is like money, why do I It shall not be found? necessary, it could enter your mind to say: Since when is intact it returns in its pure, not stand in possession teaches us
llm_translation: That is to say, that it is necessary "it shall not be found." But according to the one who says "like the value of the money" — "it shall not be found," why do I need it? It is necessary, for your mind to say: Since when it is in her possession, it is not in her domain, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרָבָא: בֶּהֱמַת אַרְנוֹנָא חַיֶּיבֶת בִּבְכוֹרָה, אוֹ אֵין חַיֶּיבֶת בִּבְכוֹרָה? כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּמָצֵי מְסַלֵּק לֵיהּ בְּזוּזֵי — לָא קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לַן דְּחַיָּיב.
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rava: an animal the royal tax [ arnona ] obligated in the firstborn Or not obligated the firstborn any where could dismiss with money we do not raise the dilemma, as obligated
llm_translation: Inquired from Ravah: Regarding a pregnant animal, is it obligated in the firstborn or not? Wherever it is found to remove it with a coin - it is not inquired for us that it is obligated.

hebrew_text: כִּי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לַן — הֵיכָא דְּלָא מָצֵי מְסַלֵּק לֵיהּ בְּזוּזֵי, מַאי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: פְּטוּרָה. וְהָתַנְיָא: חַיֶּיבֶת! הָתָם דְּמָצֵי מְסַלֵּק לֵיהּ.
human_translation: when we raise the dilemma where cannot dismiss with money. What He said to them: exempt But wasn’t it taught obligated There where could dismiss
llm_translation: When he asks us - where it cannot be removed for him with coins, what? He said to them: exemption. And it was taught: obligated! There, where it can be removed for him.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: בֶּהֱמַת אַרְנוֹנָא פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמָצֵי מְסַלֵּק לֵיהּ. עִיסַּת אַרְנוֹנָא חַיֶּיבֶת בְּחַלָּה, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא מָצֵי מְסַלֵּק לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Some say Rava said: an animal the royal tax is exempt from a firstborn, even though could dismiss dough the royal tax is obligated in ḥalla , even though cannot dismiss
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rava said: A cow of Arnuna is exempt from the firstborn, even though it is found, it is removed from it. The dough of Arnuna is obligated in challah, even though it is not found, it is removed from it.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא: בְּהֵמָה אִית לַהּ קָלָא, עִיסָּה לֵית לַהּ קָלָא.
human_translation: What is the reason An animal publicity; dough not publicity.
llm_translation: What is the reason? An animal has a voice, but dough does not have a voice.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גּוֹי שֶׁנִּכְנַס לַחֲצֵירוֹ שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל וּבְצֵיקוֹ בְּיָדוֹ — אֵין זָקוּק לְבַעֵר. הִפְקִידוֹ אֶצְלוֹ — זָקוּק לְבַעֵר. יִחֵד לוֹ בַּיִת — אֵין זָקוּק לְבַעֵר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא״.
human_translation: The Sages taught a gentile who enters the courtyard of a Jew with his dough in his hand, need not remove deposited with him, he must remove he designated house for he need not remove as it is stated: “It shall not be found”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A gentile who enters the courtyard of a Jew with a torch in his hand - he is not suspected of intending to set it on fire. If he left it with him - he is suspected of intending to set it on fire. If he rented a house with him - he is not suspected of intending to set it on fire, as it is stated, "He shall not find."

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אַרֵישָׁא קָאֵי, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: הִפְקִידוֹ אֶצְלוֹ — זָקוּק לְבַעֵר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא״.
human_translation: What is saying? Rav Pappa said: is referring to the first clause and this is is saying: deposited with he, must remove as it is stated: It shall not be found.
llm_translation: What is he saying? Rav Papa said: He is standing at the head, and thus he is saying: If he entrusted it to him - he is obligated to clarify, as it is stated "it shall not be found."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם אַסֵּיפָא קָאֵי, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: יִחֵד לוֹ בַּיִת — אֵין זָקוּק לְבַעֵר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְּבָתֵּיכֶם״, וְהָא לָאו דִּידֵיהּ הוּא, דְּגוֹי כִּי קָא מְעַיֵּיל — לְבֵיתָא דְנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָא מְעַיֵּיל.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually is referring to the last clause and this is is saying: he designated house for he need not remove it, as it is stated: It shall not be found in your houses, and that is not his; since when the gentile brings into he brings into his house,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Always the end is standing, and thus he said: "He shall have a house of his own" - he is not required to light, as it is stated "shall not be found in your houses," and this is not his house, for when he brings in - he brings into his own house.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דִּשְׂכִירוּת קָנְיָא?! וְהָתְנַן: אַף בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁאָמְרוּ לְהַשְׂכִּיר — לֹא לְבֵית דִּירָה אָמְרוּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּכְנִיסִין לְתוֹכוֹ עֲבוֹדַת גִּלּוּלִים. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ דִּשְׂכִירוּת קָנְיָא, כִּי קָא מְעַיֵּיל — לְבֵיתֵיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָא מְעַיֵּיל?
human_translation: Is that to say that rental acquires But didn’t we learn Even in a place which they said to rent they did not say for a residence, because bring idolatry into it. And if it enters your mind that rental acquires when brings into he brings them into his own house.
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of renting, did he acquire it?! And we learned in a Mishnah: Even in a place where they said to rent — they did not say to rent a house, because they bring idol worship into it. And if it enters your mind that he acquired it through renting, when he is bringing in — is he bringing it into his own house?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא בִּלְשׁוֹן ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא״ — מִי שֶׁמָּצוּי בְּיָדְךָ, יָצָא זֶה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מָצוּי בְּיָדְךָ.
human_translation: different here as the Merciful One expresses it the language: It shall not be found, that which is found in your possession excluding this which is not found in your possession.
llm_translation: The matter is different here, for the Merciful One expressed it in the language of "will not be found" - whoever is found in your possession, this one has left who is not found in your possession.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הַמּוֹצֵא חָמֵץ בְּבֵיתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב — כּוֹפֶה עָלָיו אֶת הַכְּלִי. אָמַר רָבָא: אִם שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ הוּא — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. מַאי טַעְמָא — מִיבְדָּל בְּדִילִי מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: One who finds leavened bread in his house on the Festival, covers it with a vessel Rava said: If is consecrated, he need not What is the reason distance from
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One who finds leaven in his house on a festival - he should cover it with a vessel. Rava said: If it belongs to the Temple, it is not necessary. What is the reason? - Because it is distinct from its kind.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: חֲמֵצוֹ שֶׁל גּוֹי, עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ מְחִיצָה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים מִשּׁוּם הֶיכֵּר. וְאִם שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ הוּא — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִיבְדָּל בְּדִילִי אִינָשֵׁי מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Rav said: leavened bread belonging to a gentile erect a barrier ten handbreadths it as a conspicuous marker, And if is consecrated, he need not What is the reason people distance from
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The vinegar of a non-Jew, one must make for it a partition of ten handbreadths because of recognition. But if it is vinegar of the Temple, it is not necessary. What is the reason? People distinguish between it and its kind.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הַמְפָרֵשׁ, וְהַיּוֹצֵא בִּשְׁיָירָא, קוֹדֶם שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — אֵין זָקוּק לְבַעֵר, תּוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — זָקוּק לְבַעֵר. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ תּוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — זָקוּק לְבַעֵר, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁדַּעְתּוֹ לַחֲזוֹר, אֲבָל אֵין דַּעְתּוֹ לַחֲזוֹר — אֵין זָקוּק לְבַעֵר.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Rav said: one who sets sail, or one who departs in a caravan before thirty days need not remove within thirty days he must remove Abaye said: That you said, within thirty days one must remove we only said where his intention is to return However, where it is not his intention to return he need not remove
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One who separates and goes out with a caravan, before thirty days - he is not required to clarify. Within thirty days - he is required to clarify. Abaye said: This that you said, within thirty days - he is required to clarify, we only said this when he intends to return, but if he does not intend to return - he is not required to clarify.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְאִי דַּעְתּוֹ לַחֲזוֹר, אֲפִילּוּ מֵרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה נָמֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ קוֹדֶם שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם אֵין זָקוּק לְבַעֵר, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין דַּעְתּוֹ לַחֲזוֹר, אֲבָל דַּעְתּוֹ לַחֲזוֹר — אֲפִילּוּ מֵרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה זָקוּק לְבַעֵר.
human_translation: Rava said to him: But if he intends to return even from Rosh HaShana, Rather, Rava said: that you said, before thirty days he need not remove we said only if he does not intend to return However, he intends to return, even from Rosh HaShana, he must remove
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: And if his intention is not to return, even from the beginning of the year also! Rather, Rava said: This that you said, "Before thirty days one is not required to clarify," we only said it when his intention is not to return, but if his intention is to return — even from the beginning of the year he is required to clarify.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה בֵּיתוֹ אוֹצָר, קוֹדֶם שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — אֵין זָקוּק לְבַעֵר. תּוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — זָקוּק לְבַעֵר.
human_translation: And Rava followed his reasoning As Rava said: one who turns his house into a storehouse, before thirty days he need not remove within thirty days, he must remove
llm_translation: And Rava's reasoning is established. For Rava said: One who builds his house a storehouse, before thirty days - not obligated to demolish. Within thirty days - obligated to demolish.

hebrew_text: וְקוֹדֶם שְׁלֹשִׁים נָמֵי, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין דַּעְתּוֹ לְפַנּוֹתוֹ, אֲבָל דַּעְתּוֹ לְפַנּוֹתוֹ — אֲפִילּוּ קוֹדֶם שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם נָמֵי זָקוּק לְבַעֵר.
human_translation: And before thirty days we only said it is not his intention to clear away However, his intention is to clear away he must remove even before thirty days
llm_translation: Before thirty days, we only said that his intention is not to turn away, but if his intention is to turn away - even before thirty days, he is required to clarify.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ? כִּדְתַנְיָא: שׁוֹאֲלִין וְדוֹרְשִׁין בְּהִלְכוֹת הַפֶּסַח קוֹדֶם הַפֶּסַח שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא —
human_translation: What is the purpose of this thirty days As it was taught One asks and teaches the halakhot of Passover thirty days before Passover. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: two weeks What is the reason for the first tanna ,
llm_translation: These thirty days, what do they do? As it was taught: One may ask and inquire about the laws of Passover thirty days before Passover. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Two Sabbaths. What is the reason for the first teaching?

hebrew_text: שֶׁהֲרֵי מֹשֶׁה עוֹמֵד בְּפֶסַח רִאשׁוֹן, וּמַזְהִיר עַל הַפֶּסַח שֵׁנִי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיַעֲשׂוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַפָּסַח בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי אֲנָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר הָיוּ טְמֵאִים לְנֶפֶשׁ אָדָם״.
human_translation: that Moses was standing at first Pesaḥ , and warning about the second Pesaḥ , As it is stated “Let the children of Israel perform the Pesaḥ at its appointed time” And it is written “And there were people who were impure due to a dead body
llm_translation: Moses stands in the first Passover, and warns about the second Passover, as it is stated: "And the children of Israel shall make the Passover in its appointed season," and it is written: "And there were men who were unclean by the dead body of a man."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אָמַר לָךְ: אַיְּידֵי דְּאַיְירִי בְּמִילֵּי דְפִסְחָא, מַסִּיק לְהוּ לְכׇל מִילֵּי דְפִסְחָא.
human_translation: And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to you Since was speaking with regard to the laws of Passover, he completed all the matters of Passover,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to you: Through the fact that they bring in matters of Pesach, he concludes for them all matters of Pesach.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? שֶׁהֲרֵי מֹשֶׁה עוֹמֵד בְּרֹאשׁ הַחֹדֶשׁ, וּמַזְהִיר עַל הַפֶּסַח, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה לָכֶם רֹאשׁ חֳדָשִׁים״, וּכְתִיב: ״דַּבְּרוּ אֶל כׇּל עֲדַת יִשְׂרָאֵל לֵאמֹר בֶּעָשֹׂר לַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה וְיִקְחוּ לָהֶם אִישׁ שֶׂה לְבֵית אָבוֹת וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: What is the reason for Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel’s that Moses was standing on the first day and warning about the Pesaḥ , as it is stated: “This month shall be for you the beginning of the months, And it is written “Speak to the entire congregation of Israel, saying: On the tenth day of this month they shall take for them every man a lamb, according to their fathers’ houses,
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? For behold, Moses stands at the beginning of the month and warns about the Passover, as it is stated: "This month shall be for you the beginning of months," and it is also written: "Speak to the entire congregation of Israel, saying: On the tenth of this month they shall take for themselves each man a lamb for a father's house, etc."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי דִּבְרֵישׁ יַרְחָא קָאֵי? דִּילְמָא בְּאַרְבְּעָה בְּיַרְחָא אוֹ בְּחַמְשָׁה בְּיַרְחָא קָאֵי?
human_translation: from where that he was standing on the of the New Moon? Perhaps he was standing on the fourth of the month or on the fifth of the month
llm_translation: From what matter does the month of Yarcha stand? Perhaps it stands on the fourteenth of the month or on the fifteenth of the month?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שִׁימִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא, מֵהָכָא: ״וַיְדַבֵּר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה בְמִדְבַּר סִינַי בַּשָּׁנָה הַשֵּׁנִית בַּחֹדֶשׁ הָרִאשׁוֹן״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְיַעֲשׂוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַפָּסַח בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״. הָכָא נָמֵי, מִמַּאי דִּבְרֵישׁ יַרְחָא קָאֵי? דִּילְמָא בְּאַרְבְּעָה בְּיַרְחָא אוֹ בְּחַמְשָׁה בְּיַרְחָא קָאֵי?
human_translation: Rather, Rabba bar Shimi said in the name of Ravina: from here: “And God spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year and it is written: “And let the children of Israel perform the Pesaḥ at its appointed time” Here too, from where that he was standing on the of the New Moon? Perhaps he was standing on the fourth of the month or on the fifth of the month?
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbah bar Shimi, in the name of Ravina, said from here: "And Hashem spoke to Moses in the Sinai Desert in the second year, in the first month." And it is written: "And the children of Israel shall make the Passover offering in its appointed time." Here, the question arises: From when does the first month begin? Perhaps it begins on the fourth day of the month or on the fifth day of the month?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אַתְיָא ״מִדְבָּר״ מִ״מִּדְבָּר״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״בְּמִדְבַּר סִינַי״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַיְדַבֵּר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה בְּמִדְבַּר סִינַי בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד בְּאֶחָד לַחֹדֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִי״. מָה לְהַלָּן בְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ — אַף כָּאן בְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: derived wilderness and wilderness It is written here: “In the wilderness of Sinai,” and it is written there: “And God spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai in the Tent of Meeting on the first of the second month” Just as there on the New Moon, too here, it was on the New Moon.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It comes from "midbar" from "midbar." It is written here: "in the wilderness of Sinai," and it is written there: "And Hashem spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the Tent of Meeting, on the first day of the second month." Just as there, it is on the first of the month - so too here, it is on the first of the month.

hebrew_text: וְנִיכְתּוֹב בְּרֵישָׁא דְּחֹדֶשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, וַהֲדַר נִיכְתּוֹב דְּחֹדֶשׁ שֵׁנִי. אָמַר רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת אֵין מוּקְדָּם וּמְאוּחָר בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: let write first in the first month and then let it write in the second month, Rav Menashiya bar Taḥlifa said in the name of Rav: That is to say there is no earlier and later, in the Torah,
llm_translation: And it is written at the beginning of the first month, and then it is written at the beginning of the second month. Rav Menashya bar Tahalifa said in the name of Rav: This means there is no early or late in the Torah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בִּתְרֵי עִנְיָינֵי, אֲבָל בְּחַד עִנְיָינָא, מַאי דְּמוּקְדָּם — מוּקְדָּם, וּמַאי דִּמְאוּחָר — מְאוּחָר. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, ״כְּלָל וּפְרָט — אֵין בַּכְּלָל אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁבַּפְּרָט״, דִּילְמָא פְּרָט וּכְלָל הוּא!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: applies only with two matters, but within one matter, that which earlier earlier, and that which later later; as, if you do not say so generalization detail the generalization only that which the detail, perhaps detail generalization,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: We only said this regarding two matters, but in one matter, what is earlier is earlier, and what is later is later. For if you do not say this, "General and specific - the general includes only what is in the specific," perhaps it is specific and general!

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, ״פְּרָט וּכְלָל נַעֲשֶׂה כְּלָל מוּסָף עַל הַפְּרָט״, דִּילְמָא כְּלָל וּפְרָט הוּא!
human_translation: And furthermore, a detail generalization, the generalization becomes an addition to the detail, perhaps it is a generalization a detail,
llm_translation: "And come, 'specific and general, the general is made as an addition upon the specific,' perhaps it is a general and specific!"

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ בִּתְרֵי עִנְיָינֵי נָמֵי! הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״כְּלָל וּפְרָט הַמְרוּחָקִין זֶה מִזֶּה — אֵין דָּנִין אוֹתוֹ בִּכְלָל וּפְרָט״, שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״דָּנִין״, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: If so, even to two matters. This well according to the one who said: a generalization and a detail that removed from one another, one cannot derive with a generalization and a detail. However, according to the one who said: One derives what is there to say?
llm_translation: If so, even in two separate matters indeed! It is preferable according to the one who said, "General and specific that are distant from each other - do not include it in general and specific," it is fine. But according to the one who said, "Include," what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״דָּנִין״, הָנֵי מִילֵּי — בְּחַד עִנְיָינָא. אֲבָל בִּתְרֵי עִנְיָינֵי — אֵין דָּנִין.
human_translation: Even according to the one who said that one derives this applies only to one matter, However, two matters, one cannot derive
llm_translation: Even according to the one who says "we judge," those matters - in one matter. But in two matters - we do not judge.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הַבּוֹדֵק צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּבַטֵּל. מַאי טַעְמָא, אִי נֵימָא מִשּׁוּם פֵּירוּרִין — הָא לָא חֲשִׁיבִי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: One who searches must render null and void, What is the reason If you say it is due to crumbs they are insignificant,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The one who inspects (produce) needs to nullify (any forbidden items found). What is the reason? If it is said (it is because of) concern for mixtures - this is not considered.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: כֵּיוָן דִּמְינַטַּר לְהוּ אַגַּב בֵּיתֵיהּ — חֲשִׁיבִי, וְהָתַנְיָא: סוֹפֵי תְאֵנִים, וּמְשַׁמֵּר שָׂדֵהוּ מִפְּנֵי עֲנָבִים. סוֹפֵי עֲנָבִים, וּמְשַׁמֵּר שָׂדֵהוּ מִפְּנֵי מִקְשָׁאוֹת וּמִפְּנֵי מִדְלָעוֹת,
human_translation: And lest you say: Since they are protected on account of his house, are significant wasn’t it taught remaining figs guard his field due to the grapes, remaining grapes guards his field due to the cucumbers and due to the gourds,
llm_translation: And if you will say: Since he is meticulous about his house - he is considered important. And it was taught: The ends of figs, and he guards his field from grapes. The ends of grapes, and he guards his field from thorns and thistles.

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁבַּעַל הַבַּיִת מַקְפִּיד עֲלֵיהֶן — אֲסוּרִין מִשּׁוּם גֵּזֶל, וְחַיָּיבִין בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מַקְפִּיד עֲלֵיהֶן — מוּתָּרִין מִשּׁוּם גֵּזֶל, וּפְטוּרִין מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: When the owner is particular about it is prohibited due to robbery, and obligated due to tithe When the owner is not particular about them, permitted due to robbery and exempt due to tithe
llm_translation: In a time when the homeowner is particular about them - forbidden due to theft, and obligated in tithing. In a time when the homeowner is not particular about them - permitted due to theft, and exempt from tithing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִמְצָא גְּלוּסְקָא יָפָה וְדַעְתֵּיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ. וְכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לֵיהּ לְבַטְּלֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rava said: a decree lest he find a fine cake [ geluska ] and his thoughts are upon it. And let him nullify it when he finds it.
llm_translation: Rava said: A decree lest he find a beautiful glass vessel and his mind be diverted. And do you think he will nullify it!

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לֵיהּ לְבָתַר אִיסּוּרָא, וְלָאו בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ קָיְימָא, וְלָא מָצֵי מְבַטֵּיל. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁנֵי דְבָרִים אֵינָן בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, וַעֲשָׂאָן הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: בּוֹר בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְחָמֵץ מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: Perhaps he will find it after it is forbidden, and it is no in his possession and he is unable to nullify as Rabbi Elazar said: Two items are not in a person’s possession and the Torah rendered them as though in his property. And these are they: An pit in the public domain, and leaven from the sixth hour and onward.
llm_translation: Perhaps she will find it afterwards, and the prohibition will not be in her possession, and she will not annul it. For Rabbi Elazar said: There are two things that are not in a person's possession, yet the Torah considers them as if they were in his possession, and these are: a pit in a public domain, and leaven after six hours.

hebrew_text: וְנִיבַטְּלֵיהּ בְּאַרְבַּע, וְנִיבַטְּלֵיהּ בְּחָמֵשׁ? כֵּיוָן דְּלָאו זְמַן אִיסּוּרָא הוּא וְלָאו זְמַן בִּיעוּרָא הוּא, דִּילְמָא פָּשַׁע וְלָא מְבַטֵּל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: let him render null and void during the fourth hour or let him render it null and void during the fifth hour Since is neither the time prohibition nor the time removal, perhaps he will be negligent and will not render it null and void,
llm_translation: And we nullify it on the fourth, and we nullify it on the fifth? Since it is not a time of prohibition and it is not a time of separation, perhaps he transgressed and did not nullify it.

hebrew_text: וְנִיבַטְּלֵיהּ בְּשֵׁית! כֵּיוָן דְּאִיסּוּרָא דְרַבָּנַן עִילָּוֵיהּ — כִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא דָּמְיָא, וְלָאו בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ קָיְימָא, וְלָא מָצֵי מְבַטֵּיל.
human_translation: But let him render null and void during the sixth Since a rabbinic prohibition on is like by Torah law, and it is not in his possession and he unable to nullify
llm_translation: And one should nullify it with sixty! Since the prohibition of the Rabbis is superior - it is like a Biblical prohibition, and it is not standing in his domain, and he cannot annul it.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַעְלָה, אֲפִילּוּ בְּחִיטֵּי קוּרְדִּנְיָתָא — אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְקִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: as Rav Giddel said Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef said Rav said: a man who betroths from the sixth hour and onward, even with wheat from the mountains [ kurdanaita ], one not concerned that a betrothal.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rav Giddel said, Rabbi Hiyya bar Yosef said, Rav said: One who sanctifies from six hours and onwards, even with wheat of Kurdistan - we are not concerned for the sanctification."

hebrew_text: וּלְבָתַר אִיסּוּרָא לָא מָצֵי מְבַטֵּיל לֵיהּ? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: הָיָה יוֹשֵׁב בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁיֵּשׁ חָמֵץ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ — מְבַטְּלוֹ בְּלִבּוֹ, אֶחָד שַׁבָּת וְאֶחָד יוֹם טוֹב. בִּשְׁלָמָא שַׁבָּת, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, כְּגוֹן שֶׁחָל אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת. אֶלָּא יוֹם טוֹב — בָּתַר אִיסּוּרָא הוּא!
human_translation: And after the prohibited unable to render it null and void? But wasn’t it taught was sitting in the study hall and he remembered that there is leavened bread in his house, render it null and void in his heart, both on Shabbat and on the Festival? Granted, Shabbat you find where the fourteenth occurs on Shabbat However, Festival it is after the prohibition
llm_translation: And after the prohibition, is it not possible to annul it? But it was taught: If one was sitting in the study hall and remembered that there is leaven in his house - he annuls it in his heart, whether it is Shabbat or a festival day. It makes sense for Shabbat, as you forget about it, for example, if the fourteenth of Nisan fell on Shabbat. But for a festival day - after the prohibition, it is too late!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: הָכָא בְּתַלְמִיד יוֹשֵׁב לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹ עָסְקִינַן, וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִיסָּה מְגוּלְגֶּלֶת בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, וּמִתְיָירֵא שֶׁמָּא תַּחֲמִיץ. קָדֵים וּמְבַטֵּיל לַיהּ מִיקַּמֵּי דְּתַחְמִיץ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: Here we are dealing with a student sitting before his teacher, and he remembers that there is kneaded dough in his house, and he is afraid lest it leaven earlier and render it null and void before it becomes leavened.
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Here, with a student sitting before his teacher, we are dealing with a case where it was remembered that there is dough kneaded in a bowl inside his house, and he is afraid that perhaps it will become leavened. He should act preemptively and nullify it before it becomes leavened.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: הָיָה יוֹשֵׁב בְּתוֹךְ בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is also precise as teaches: was sitting in the study hall. learn from this
llm_translation: Precisely it was stated, as it was taught: He was sitting in the study hall. He heard from her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: הַפַּת שֶׁעִיפְּשָׁה. כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָבְתָה מַצָּה — מוּתֶּרֶת. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּיָדַע בַּהּ דְּחָמֵץ הִיא — כִּי רָבְתָה מַצָּה מַאי הָוֵי?
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said Rav said: bread that became moldy, once there was more matza permitted. What are the circumstances? If you say that he knows that is leavened bread, there were more matza , what of
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: The bread that became leavened. Once it has become matzah — it is permitted. How so? If you say because it is known to contain leaven — when it has become matzah, what is the issue?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּלָא יָדְעִינַן בָּהּ אִי חָמֵץ הוּא אִי מַצָּה הוּא — מַאי אִירְיָא כִּי רָבְתָה מַצָּה? אֲפִילּוּ כִּי לֹא רָבְתָה מַצָּה נָמֵי, נֵיזִיל בָּתַר בָּתְרָא.
human_translation: Rather, where we do not know whether it is leavened bread whether it is matza . why specifically where there was more matza Even where there was not more matza as well, let us follow the last
llm_translation: Rather, that we do not know in it if it is chametz or if it is matzah — what is the ruling when matzah has increased? Even if matzah has not increased, we go after the latter.

hebrew_text: מִי לָא תְּנַן: מָעוֹת שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ לִפְנֵי סוֹחֲרֵי בְהֵמָה — לְעוֹלָם מַעֲשֵׂר. בְּהַר הַבַּיִת — חוּלִּין.
human_translation: Didn’t we learn coins that were found before animal merchants they are always tithe, on the Temple Mount non-sacred
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Coins that were found in front of livestock merchants - always considered Ma'aser. On the threshold of the house - considered ordinary.

hebrew_text: בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, בִּשְׁעַת הָרֶגֶל — מַעֲשֵׂר, בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה — חוּלִּין.
human_translation: in Jerusalem during the Festival, tithe during the rest of the year, non-sacred
llm_translation: In Jerusalem, during the pilgrimage festival - tithe, on the rest of the days of the year - ordinary.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שְׁמַעְיָה בַּר זֵירָא: מַאי טַעְמָא — הוֹאִיל וְשׁוּקֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם עֲשׂוּיִין לְהִתְכַּבֵּד בְּכׇל יוֹם. אַלְמָא אָמְרִינַן: קַמָּאֵי קַמָּאֵי אָזְלִי לֵיהּ, וְהָנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ. הָכָא נָמֵי, נֵימָא: קַמָּא קַמָּא אָזֵיל, וְהַאי דְּהָאִידָּנָא הוּא.
human_translation: And Rav Shemaya bar Zeira said: What is the reason Since the markets of Jerusalem tend to be cleaned every day, Apparently, we say the first ones are gone and these are later ones. Here too, let us say: The first ones are gone, and this is from now
llm_translation: And Rav Shemaya son of Zeira said: What is the reason? - Because the markets of Jerusalem are prepared to be honored every day. This implies that we say: "They went first, and those others are after." Here too, it should be said: "They went first, and this one is now."

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּעִיפּוּשָׁהּ מוֹכִיחַ עִילָּוָיהּ. אִי עִיפּוּשָׁהּ מוֹכִיחַ עִילָּוָיהּ, כִּי רָבְתָה מַצָּה מַאי הָוֵי? אָמַר רַבָּה: לָא תֵּימָא שֶׁרָבְתָה מַצָּה, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: שֶׁרַבּוּ יְמֵי מַצָּה עִילָּוָיהּ.
human_translation: different here, as the mold proves about If its mold proves about if there was more matza what of Rabba said: Do not say there was more matza rather, say that several days of matza have passed over
llm_translation: The case is different here with regard to its proof. If its proof is established, what is the ruling when there is an abundance of matzah? Rabba said: Do not say that there is an abundance of matzah, rather say: The days of matzah have increased its proof.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּעִיפּוּשָׁהּ מְרוּבֶּה. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דְּעִיפּוּשָׁהּ מְרוּבֶּה — אִיגַּלְּיָא מִילְּתָא דְּוַדַּאי חָמֵץ מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן:
human_translation: If so, obvious No, it is necessary its mold is extensive. Lest you say: Since its mold is extensive the matter is revealed that it is certainly leavened bread, teaches us
llm_translation: If so, it is obvious! It is not necessary, for its explanation is abundant. What might you say: since its explanation is abundant — the matter is certainly clarified, it is like vinegar on top, it is clear to us.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁרַבּוּ יְמֵי מַצָּה עִילָּוָיהּ, אָמְרִינַן: כׇּל יוֹמָא וְיוֹמָא נַהֲמָא חַמִּימָא אֲפָה, וּשְׁדָא עִילָּוָיהּ וְעָפְשָׁא טְפֵי.
human_translation: Since several days of matza have passed over we say: Each and every day he baked warm loaves, which he placed upon it to grow moldier.
llm_translation: Since they increased the days of Matzah, they said: Every day and day hot water bake, and spread on it and sprinkle ashes.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָזְלִינַן בָּתַר בָּתְרָא? וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: תֵּיבָה שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּמְּשׁוּ בָּהּ מְעוֹת חוּלִּין וּמְעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר, אִם רוֹב חוּלִּין — חוּלִּין, אִם רוֹב מַעֲשֵׂר — מַעֲשֵׂר. וְאַמַּאי? לֵיזִיל בָּתַר בָּתְרָא!
human_translation: And do we, follow the last But wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: a box used for non-sacred coins and tithe coins, if the majority non-sacred non-sacred. If the majority tithe tithe But why Let us follow last
llm_translation: We go after the majority. And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: A chest that was used for both common money and tithes, if the majority is common money - it is common money, if the majority is tithes - it is tithes. And why? We go after the majority!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּמְּשׁוּ בָּהּ מְעוֹת חוּלִּין וּמְעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר, וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן בַּסּוֹף. רַב זְבִיד אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּמְּשׁוּ בָּהּ צִיבּוּרִין צִיבּוּרִין. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דְּאִישְׁתְּכַח בְּגוּמָּא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: With what are we dealing here? where used for non-sacred coins and tithe coins, and he does not know which last. Rav Zevid said: where he used piles piles Rav Pappa said: where was found in a hole
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, when they used it for both ordinary money and tithe money, and one does not know which is which in the end. Rav Zebid said: For example, when they used it for communal purposes. Rav Papa said: For example, when it was mixed with a date-palm branch.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַבּוֹדֵק צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּבָרֵךְ. מַאי מְבָרֵךְ? רַב פַּפֵּי אָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: (אוֹמֵר) ״לְבַעֵר חָמֵץ״. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: ״עַל בִּיעוּר חָמֵץ״. בִּ״לְבַעֵר״ — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּוַדַּאי לְהַבָּא מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: One who searches must recite a blessing. What blessing does he recite, Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava recites: to remove leavened bread. Rav Pappa said in the name of Rava: Concerning the removal of leavened bread. With regard to To remove, everyone agrees that certainly refers to the future.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: The one who checks (for chametz) must recite a blessing. What blessing does he recite? Rav Pappa said in the name of Rava: "To destroy chametz." Rav Papa said in the name of Rava: "On the destruction of chametz." Regarding "to destroy" - everyone agrees that it is certainly for the future.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּ״עַל בִּיעוּר״. מָר סָבַר: מֵעִיקָּרָא מַשְׁמַע, וּמָר סָבַר: לְהַבָּא מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: Where they disagree is with regard to Concerning the elimination Sage, maintains it is referring to previously. And Sage, maintains refers to the future.
llm_translation: When they disputed regarding "ba'al b'iyur," Master holds: from the outset it is implied, and Master holds: for the future it is implied.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״בָּרוּךְ ... אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ עַל הַמִּילָה״!
human_translation: raises an objection Blessed Who has made us holy through His mitzvot and has commanded us concerning circumcision.
llm_translation: Challenger: "Blessed... Who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us regarding circumcision!"

hebrew_text: הָתָם, הֵיכִי נֵימָא? נֵימָא ״לָמוּל״ — לָא סַגִּיא דְּלָאו אִיהוּ מָהֵיל? אֲבִי הַבֵּן מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אִין הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: what can we recite there? we say: to circumcise, is there no alternative to he circumcising the child’s father what can be said? Yes, it is indeed so.
llm_translation: There, how should it be said? It should be said "lamul" - it is not sufficient that he is not skilled? What can Abaye say? Thus it is stated.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״בָּרוּךְ ... אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ עַל הַשְּׁחִיטָה״! הָתָם נָמֵי, הֵיכִי נֵימָא? נֵימָא ״לִשְׁחוֹט״ — לָא סַגִּיא דְּלָאו אִיהוּ שָׁחֵט?
human_translation: raises an objection Blessed Who has made us holy through His mitzvot and has commanded us concerning slaughtering. There too, what can we recite? we say: to slaughter, is there no alternative to his slaughtering
llm_translation: Challenger: "Blessed ... Who sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us regarding the slaughtering!" There, it is fitting to say, how should it be said? It should be said, "to slaughter" - is it not sufficient that he did not slaughter?

hebrew_text: פֶּסַח וְקׇדָשִׁים מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אִין הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: Paschal lamb and consecrated what can be said? Yes, it is indeed so.
llm_translation: Passover and holy things, what is there to say? It is not so.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָעוֹשֶׂה לוּלָב לְעַצְמוֹ, מְבָרֵךְ: ״שֶׁהֶחֱיָינוּ וְקִיְּמָנוּ וְהִגִּיעָנוּ לַזְּמַן הַזֶּה״. נְטָלוֹ לָצֵאת בּוֹ, אוֹמֵר: ״אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ עַל נְטִילַת לוּלָב״! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּאַגְבְּהֵהּ נְפַק בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection One who prepares a lulav for himself recites the blessing: Who has given us life, sustained us, and brought us to this time. he takes it to fulfill with it he says: Who has made us holy through His mitzvot and has commanded us concerning the taking of the lulav . It is different there, as at the time when he lifts fulfilled
llm_translation: The question was raised: One who makes a lulav for himself, he recites: "Who has granted us life, sustained us, and enabled us to reach this occasion." When he takes it to fulfill his obligation, he says: "Who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us concerning the taking of the lulav." It is different there, for at the time when he binds it, he takes it out.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי: ״לָצֵאת בּוֹ״? ״יָצָא בּוֹ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וּמִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנָא סֵיפָא: ״לֵישֵׁב בַּסּוּכָּה״, תְּנָא רֵישָׁא נָמֵי ״לָצֵאת בּוֹ״.
human_translation: If so, to fulfill with it should have with which fulfilled Yes, it is indeed so; But due to that he wants to teach the latter clause to sit in the sukka , he likewise taught the first clause: To fulfill with it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so: "to go out in it"? "He went out in it" what does he need it for! So too here, and because it wants to teach the latter clause: "to dwell in the sukkah," the first clause is also needed "to go out in it."

hebrew_text: דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּה לְעַצְמוֹ, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ ... שֶׁהֶחֱיָינוּ וְקִיְּמָנוּ וְהִגִּיעָנוּ לַזְּמַן הַזֶּה״. נִכְנַס לֵישֵׁב בָּהּ, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ ... אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ לֵישֵׁב בַּסּוּכָּה״. וְהִלְכְתָא: ״עַל בִּיעוּר חָמֵץ״.
human_translation: As it teaches in the latter clause One who erects a sukka for himself recites: Blessed are You, God, Who has given us life, sustained us, and brought us to this time. he enters to sit in he says: Blessed Who has made us holy through His mitzvot and has commanded us to sit in the sukka . And the halakha is Concerning the removal of leaven,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Mishnah teaches in the latter part: One who makes a sukkah for himself, he says: "Blessed are You, Hashem ... Who has kept us alive, sustained us, and brought us to this time." If one enters to sit in it, he says: "Blessed ... Who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us to dwell in the sukkah." And the Halacha is: "Regarding the removal of leaven."

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהָא, מֵעִיקָּרָא בָּעִינַן לְבָרוֹכֵי, מְנָלַן? דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת מְבָרֵךְ עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹבֵר לַעֲשִׂיָּיתָן.
human_translation: In any event, everyone agrees one is required to recite a blessing prior to From where do we as Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: all the mitzvot, one recites a blessing over them prior to [ over ] their performance.
llm_translation: The all of world from her, from beginning in we require to bless, from where? For Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: All the commandments bless upon them passes to their fulfillment.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״עוֹבֵר״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאַקְדּוֹמֵי הוּא? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיָּרׇץ אֲחִימַעַץ דֶּרֶךְ הַכִּכָּר וַיַּעֲבֹר אֶת הַכּוּשִׁי״. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״וְהוּא עָבַר לִפְנֵיהֶם״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״וַיַּעֲבֹר מַלְכָּם לִפְנֵיהֶם וַה׳ בְּרֹאשָׁם״.
human_translation: From where may it be inferred that over is the language of priority? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said that the verse said: “And Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and overran [ vaya’avor ] the Cushite” Abaye said: from here: “And he passed [ avar ] before them” And if you wish, say from here: “And their king passed [ vaya’avor ] before them and God at their head”
llm_translation: What is the implication that this "transgressor" is in front of them? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, as the verse states: "And Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and overran the Cushite." Abbaye said, from here: "And he passed before them." And if you wish, say from here: "And their king passed before them, and the Lord at their head."

hebrew_text: בֵּי רַב אָמְרִי: חוּץ מִן הַטְּבִילָה וְשׁוֹפָר. בִּשְׁלָמָא טְבִילָה — דְּאַכַּתִּי גַּבְרָא לָא חֲזֵי. אֶלָּא שׁוֹפָר מַאי טַעְמָא? וְכִי תֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּילְמָא מִיקַּלְקְלָא תְּקִיעָה. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ שְׁחִיטָה וּמִילָה נָמֵי!
human_translation: In the school of Rav they say: except for immersion and shofar . Granted immersion, as man is still unfit However, a shofar , what is the reason And lest you say due to lest the sounding flawed, if so, even slaughter and circumcision,
llm_translation: The scholars of the school of Rav said: Except for immersion and the shofar. Immersion we understand, for a man does not see. But the shofar, what is the reason? And if you say it is because it may lead to confusion of the blasts, if so, even ritual slaughter and circumcision as well!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: חוּץ מִן הַטְּבִילָה בִּלְבַד אִיתְּמַר. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: טָבַל וְעָלָה, בַּעֲלִיָּיתוֹ אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ ... אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ עַל הַטְּבִילָה״.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisda said: Except for immersion alone was stated, That was also taught immersed and emerged, as he emerges he recites: Blessed Who has made us holy through His mitzvot and commanded us concerning immersion.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisdah said: Except for immersion alone it was stated. It was taught similarly: He immerses and ascends, upon his coming up he says: "Blessed... Who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us concerning immersion."

hebrew_text: לְאוֹר הַנֵּר וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לָמַדְנוּ מְצִיאָה מִמְּצִיאָה, וּמְצִיאָה מֵחִיפּוּשׂ, וְחִיפּוּשׂ מֵחִיפּוּשׂ, וְחִיפּוּשׂ מִנֵּרוֹת, וְנֵרוֹת מִנֵּר.
human_translation: by the light of the lamp, etc. From where are these matters, Rav Ḥisda said: We derive finding from finding and finding from searching, and searching from searching and searching from lamps, and lamps from lamp.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "To the light of the candle, etc." From where do we derive these matters? Rav Ḥisda said: We learned discovery from discovery, and discovery from investigation, and investigation from investigation, and investigation from candles, and candles from a candle.

hebrew_text: מְצִיאָה מִמְּצִיאָה — כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים שְׂאֹר לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְּבָתֵּיכֶם״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַיְחַפֵּשׂ בַּגָּדוֹל הֵחֵל וּבַקָּטֹן כִּלָּה וַיִּמָּצֵא״. וּמְצִיאָה מֵחִיפּוּשׂ דִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Finding from finding it is written here: “Seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses” and it is written there: “And he searched, starting with the eldest, and ending with the youngest; and was found And finding to searching in that same
llm_translation: Discovery from discovery - it is written here: "Seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses," and it is written there: "And he searched, beginning with the eldest and finishing with the youngest, and he found." And discovery is greater than search.

hebrew_text: וְחִיפּוּשׂ מִנֵּרוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״בָּעֵת הַהִיא אֲחַפֵּשׂ אֶת יְרוּשָׁלִַים בַּנֵּרוֹת״, וְנֵרוֹת מִנֵּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״נֵר (אֱלֹהִים) [ה׳] נִשְׁמַת אָדָם חֹפֵשׂ כׇּל חַדְרֵי בָטֶן״.
human_translation: And searching from lamps as it is written: at that time I will search Jerusalem with lamps” And lamps from lamp as it is written: “The spirit of man is the lamp of God, searching all the inward parts”
llm_translation: And they searched from his lampstands, as it is written: "At that time I will search Jerusalem with lamps," and lamps from a lampstand, as it is written: "The lamp of God is the soul of man, searching all the inner chambers."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לֵילֵי אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר בּוֹדְקִים אֶת הֶחָמֵץ לְאוֹר הַנֵּר. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לְדָבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים שְׂאֹר לֹא יִמָּצֵא״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיְחַפֵּשׂ בַּגָּדוֹל הֵחֵל וּבַקָּטֹן כִּלָּה״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״בָּעֵת הַהִיא אֲחַפֵּשׂ אֶת יְרוּשָׁלִַים בַּנֵּרוֹת״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״נֵר (אֱלֹהִים) [ה׳] נִשְׁמַת אָדָם חֹפֵשׂ״.
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: the night of the fourteenth one searches for leavened bread by the light of the lamp. Although there is no proof for matter, there is an allusion to matter, as it is stated: “Seven days leaven shall not be found and it says: “And he searched, starting with the eldest, and ending with the youngest; And it says: “At that time I will search Jerusalem with lamps,” and it says: “The spirit of man is the lamp of God, searching
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: On the nights of the fourteenth, they search for the leaven by the light of a lamp. Even though there is no sight to the matter, it is a remembrance of the matter, as it is stated: "For seven days leaven shall not be found." And it says: "He searched carefully, beginning with the great and ending with the small." And it says: "At that time I searched Jerusalem with lamps." And it says: "The lamp of God is the soul of man, searching."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״?
human_translation: What is And says?
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and he says"?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הַאי ״בָּעֵת הָהִיא״ — קוּלָּא הוּא דְּקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: לָא בָּדֵיקְנָא לַהּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם בִּנְהוֹרָא דַאֲבוּקָה — דִּנְפִישׁ נְהוֹרָא טוּבָא, אֶלָּא בִּנְהוֹרָא דִשְׁרָגָא — דְּזוּטַר נְהוֹרָא טְפֵי, דְּעָוֹן רַבָּה מִשְׁתְּכַח וְעָוֹן זוּטַר לָא מִשְׁתְּכַח, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״נֵר ה׳ נִשְׁמַת אָדָם״.
human_translation: And lest you say this “At that time, is a leniency, as God is saying: I will not search Jerusalem by the light of a torch, whose light is great, Rather, by the light of lamp, whose light is smaller, that great sins will be discovered and small sins will not be discovered. Come hear, “The spirit of man is the lamp of God,
llm_translation: And if you will say: This "at that time" — it is a voice that the Merciful One is saying: Not in it Jerusalem did I investigate with her in the brightness of the torch — for a bright torch is very bright, but rather in the brightness of the flame — for the light of a flame is more delicate, for a great sin is forgotten and a small sin is not forgotten, come and hear: "The lamp of the Lord is the soul of man."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין בּוֹדְקִין לֹא לְאוֹר הַחַמָּה, וְלֹא לְאוֹר הַלְּבָנָה, וְלֹא לְאוֹר הָאֲבוּקָה, אֶלָּא לְאוֹר הַנֵּר,
human_translation: The Sages taught: One does not search neither by the light of the sun, nor by the light of the moon, nor by the light of a torch. Rather, by the light of a lamp,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may not inspect a blemish by the light of the sun, nor by the light of the moon, nor by the light of a torch, but rather by the light of a lamp.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאוֹר הַנֵּר יָפֶה לַבְּדִיקָה. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר — זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים שְׂאֹר לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְּבָתֵּיכֶם״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיְחַפֵּשׂ בַּגָּדוֹל הֵחֵל״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״בָּעֵת הַהִיא אֲחַפֵּשׂ אֶת יְרוּשָׁלִַים בַּנֵּרוֹת״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״נֵר ה׳ נִשְׁמַת אָדָם חֹפֵשׂ כׇּל חַדְרֵי בָטֶן״.
human_translation: because the light of a lamp is effective for searching. And even though there is no proof for matter, there is an allusion to matter, as it is stated: “Seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses” and it says: “And he searched, starting with the eldest, And it says: “At that time I will search Jerusalem with lamps” and it says: “The spirit of man is the lamp of God, searching all the inward parts”
llm_translation: Because the light of the candle is good for inspection. And even though there is no visible evidence for the matter - it is a remembrance of the matter, as it is said: "For seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses," and it says: "He searched carefully, beginning with the eldest," and it says: "At that time I searched Jerusalem with candles," and it says: "The lamp of the Lord is the soul of man, searching all the innermost parts."

hebrew_text: הַאי אוֹר הַחַמָּה הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי נֵימָא בְּחָצֵר, הָאָמַר רָבָא: חָצֵר אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה בְּדִיקָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָעוֹרְבִין מְצוּיִין שָׁם. אֶלָּא בְּאַכְסַדְרָה, הָאָמַר רָבָא: אַכְסַדְרָה לְאוֹרָהּ נִבְדֶּקֶת!
human_translation: This light of the sun, what are the circumstances If we say in the courtyard, didn’t Rava say a courtyard does not require searching, due to the ravens that are found there, Rather, to a portico, didn’t Rava say a portico may be searched by its light,
llm_translation: This light of the sun, how is it comparable? If you say in a courtyard, but Rava said: A courtyard does not require inspection, because the ravens are commonly found there. Rather, in a colonnade, but Rava said: A colonnade is examined for its light!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, לַאֲרוּבָּה דִּבְחֶדֶר. וּדְהֵיכָא? אִי לְבַהֲדֵי אֲרוּבָּה — הַיְינוּ אַכְסַדְרָה. אֶלָּא לִצְדָדִין.
human_translation: No, is necessary with regard to the skylight that is in a room. And which where If opposite the skylight, that a portico, Rather, to the sides
llm_translation: Not needed, for the courtyard of one room. And where is this? If for a courtyard of one room - that is a balcony. Rather, for side rooms.

hebrew_text: וַאֲבוּקָה לָא? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנֹגַהּ כָּאוֹר תִּהְיֶה קַרְנַיִם מִיָּדוֹ לוֹ וְשָׁם חֶבְיוֹן עֻזּוֹ״, לְמָה צַדִּיקִים דּוֹמִין בִּפְנֵי שְׁכִינָה — כַּנֵּר בִּפְנֵי הָאֲבוּקָה. וְאָמַר רָבָא: אֲבוּקָה לְהַבְדָּלָה מִצְוָה מִן הַמּוּבְחָר!
human_translation: And a torch not But didn’t Rava say: What is which is written, “And a brightness appears as the light; He has rays at His side; and there is the hiding of His power” To what are the righteous comparable before the Divine Presence? to a lamp in the face of a torch. And Rava said: a torch for havdala the mitzva the optimal manner.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And Avuka not? And Rava said, what is the meaning of what is written: 'And his horns are like the horns of a wild ox; with them he shall push the peoples together to the ends of the earth' (Deuteronomy 33:17)? Why do the righteous resemble a lamp before the candle? And Rava said: Avuka for the separation is a mitzvah from the finest!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: זֶה — יָכוֹל לְהַכְנִיסוֹ לְחוֹרִין וְלִסְדָקִין, וְזֶה — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַכְנִיסוֹ לְחוֹרִין וְלִסְדָקִין. רַב זְבִיד אָמַר: זֶה — אוֹרוֹ לְפָנָיו, וָזֶה — אוֹרוֹ לְאַחֲרָיו. רַב פָּפָּא אֲמַר: הַאי — בְּעִית, וְהַאי — לָא בְּעִית. רָבִינָא אֲמַר: הַאי — מְשִׁךְ נְהוֹרָא, וְהַאי — מִיקַּטַּף אִיקַּטּוֹפֵי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: can put this into holes and crevices, and cannot put that into holes and crevices, Rav Zevid said: This its light before it, and that its light behind it, Rav Pappa said: this fears and that not fear Ravina said: This draws light, and that fluctuates.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: This one — can be inserted into holes and cracks, and this one — cannot be inserted into holes and cracks. Rav Zevid said: This one — his light is in front of him, and this one — his light is behind him. Rav Papa said: This one — is a large vessel, and this one — is not a large vessel. Ravina said: This one — draws light, and this one — scatters light.

hebrew_text: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַכְנִיסִין כּוּ׳. ״כׇּל מָקוֹם״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי הָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: חוֹרֵי בַּיִת הָעֶלְיוֹנִים וְהַתַּחְתּוֹנִים, וְגַג הַיָּצִיעַ, וְגַג הַמִּגְדָּל, וְרֶפֶת בָּקָר, וְלוּלִין, וּמַתְבֵּן, וְאוֹצְרוֹת יַיִן וְאוֹצְרוֹת שֶׁמֶן — אֵין צְרִיכִין בְּדִיקָה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִטָּה הַחוֹלֶקֶת בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת וּמַפְסֶקֶת — צְרִיכָה בְּדִיקָה.
human_translation: Any place into which one does not take What Any place, to include? to include that which the Sages taught The upper and lower holes a veranda roof, a closet roof, a cowshed, coops, a storehouse for straw, a wine cellar, and a storeroom for oil; do not require search Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A bed that divides inside a house and separates requires a search,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Every place where they do not bring in..." "Every place" - to include what? To include what the Rabbis taught: The holes of the upper and lower story, the roof of the balcony, the roof of the tower, the cattle pen, the lofts, the straw, the wine cellars, and the oil cellars - do not require inspection. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A sand pit that is inside the house and separates - requires inspection.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: חוֹר שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ — זֶה בּוֹדֵק עַד מָקוֹם שֶׁיָּדוֹ מַגַּעַת, וְזֶה בּוֹדֵק עַד מָקוֹם שֶׁיָּדוֹ מַגַּעַת, וְהַשְּׁאָר מְבַטְּלוֹ בְּלִבּוֹ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִטָּה הַחוֹלֶקֶת בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, וְעֵצִים וַאֲבָנִים סְדוּרִים תַּחְתֶּיהָ, וּמַפְסֶקֶת — אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה בְּדִיקָה.
human_translation: raises a contradiction a hole that is between person to another, this searches to the point that his hand reaches, and that searches to the point that his hand reaches. And the rest renders it null and void in his heart. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A bed that divides inside a house, with wood and stones placed under it, and separates does not require searching.
llm_translation: And they asked: A hole between a person and his fellow - this one examines until the place his hand touches, and this one examines until the place his hand touches, and the rest he nullifies in his heart. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A bed that divides within the house, with wood and stones arranged beneath it, and it is detached - it does not require examination.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא מִטָּה אַמִּטָּה, קַשְׁיָא חוֹרִין אַחוֹרִין!
human_translation: difficult a bed a bed difficult holes holes
llm_translation: A difficulty from below, a difficulty from above, difficulties pierce through difficulties!

hebrew_text: חוֹרִין אַחוֹרִין לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּעִילָּאֵי וּבְתַתָּאֵי, וְהָא — בְּמִיצְעֵי. מִטָּה אַמִּטָּה לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּמִידַּלְּיָא, הָא — דְּמִיתַּתַּאי.
human_translation: holes holes not difficult. This to upper and lower And that to intermediate a bed a bed is not difficult. This to a raised that to a low
llm_translation: Carvings behind are not difficult: this — in the upper ones and in the lower ones, and this — in the middle ones. Below, below is not difficult: this — because it is elevated, this — because it is lowered.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹצְרוֹת יַיִן אֵין צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה?! וְהָתַנְיָא: אוֹצְרוֹת יַיִן — צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה, אוֹצְרוֹת שֶׁמֶן — אֵין צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּמִסְתַּפֵּק. אִי הָכִי, שֶׁמֶן נָמֵי!
human_translation: And do wine storages not require searching? But wasn’t it taught Wine storages require searching; oil storages do not require searching. With what are we dealing here? where one supplies If so, oil as well.
llm_translation: "And wine cellars do not require inspection?! But it was taught: Wine cellars - require inspection, oil cellars - do not require inspection! What are we dealing with here - with doubt. If so, oil is clear!"

hebrew_text: שֶׁמֶן — יֵשׁ קֶבַע לַאֲכִילָה. יַיִן — אֵין קֶבַע לִשְׁתִיָּה.
human_translation: oil, there is a fixed for eating wine, there is no fixed for drinking,
llm_translation: Oil - there is a fixed measure for consumption. Wine - there is no fixed measure for drinking.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: עָשׂוּ אוֹצְרוֹת שֵׁכָר בְּבָבֶל כְּאוֹצְרוֹת יַיִן בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, בְּמִסְתַּפֵּק.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: rendered beer storages in Babylonia like wine storages in Eretz Yisrael, to one who supplies
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya: They made storehouses of beer in Babylonia like storehouses of wine in the land of Israel, in doubt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בֵּי דָגִים אֵין צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה. וְהָתַנְיָא צְרִיכִין בְּדִיקָה! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּרַבְרְבֵי, הָא — בְּזוּטְרֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A fish storage does not require searching. But wasn’t it taught requires searching? not difficult; this to large that with small
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: In the case of fish, there is no need for inspection. But it was taught: They require inspection! There is no contradiction: here - in large fish, there - in small fish.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: בֵּי מִילְחֵי וּבֵי קִירֵי צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בֵּי צִיבֵי וּבֵי תַמְרֵי צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: A salt storage and a storage for candles require searching Rav Pappa said: A wood storage and a storage for dates require searching
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: In the houses of salt and in the houses of plaster, one must inspect. Rav Papa said: In the houses of brick and in the houses of dates, one must inspect.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: אֵין מְחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ לְהַכְנִיס יָדוֹ לְחוֹרִין וְלִסְדָקִין לִבְדּוֹק — מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה. מַאי סַכָּנָה? אִי נֵימָא מִפְּנֵי סַכָּנַת עַקְרָב — כִּי מִשְׁתַּמַּשׁ, הֵיכִי אִישְׁתַּמַּשׁ? לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּנְפַל.
human_translation: It was taught do not require one to place his hand into holes and crevices to search due to the danger what danger? If we say due to the danger of a scorpion when he made use of how did he make use No, it is necessary where fell
llm_translation: Mishna: They do not obligate him to insert his hand into holes and crevices to check - due to danger. What is the danger? If you say it is due to the danger of a scorpion - when it is being used, how can it be used? It is not necessary, as it fell.

hebrew_text: אִי נְפַל, לְמָה לִי בְּדִיקָה? וְהָתְנַן: חָמֵץ שֶׁנָּפְלָה עָלָיו מַפּוֹלֶת — הֲרֵי הוּא כִּמְבוֹעָר! הָתָם שֶׁאֵין הַכֶּלֶב יָכוֹל לְחַפֵּשׂ אַחֲרָיו, הָכָא כְּשֶׁהַכֶּלֶב יָכוֹל לְחַפֵּשׂ אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: If fell why do I search? But didn’t we learn leaven upon which a rockslide fell, it is considered removed There, where a dog cannot search for it. Here, a dog can search for it
llm_translation: If it fell, why do I need to check? And we learned in a Mishnah: If leaven that fell on it is covered — behold, it is as if it is burned! There, where the dog cannot search for it, here, when the dog can search for it.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁלוּחֵי מִצְוָה אֵינָן נִיזּוֹקִין? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שֶׁמָּא תֹּאבַד לוֹ מַחַט, וְאָתֵי לְעַיּוֹנֵי בָּתְרַהּ.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: Those on the path to perform a mitzva are not harm Rav Ashi said: lest he will have lost a needle and he will look for it
llm_translation: The Gemara: And did not Rabbi Elazar say: Messengers of a mitzvah are not harmed? Rav Ashi said: Perhaps he will lose his needle, and he will come to inspect the stitches afterwards.

hebrew_text: וּכְהַאי גַּוְונָא לָאו מִצְוָה הוּא?! וְהָתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר ״סֶלַע זוֹ לִצְדָקָה בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁיִּחְיֶה בְּנִי״ אוֹ ״שֶׁאֶהְיֶה בֶּן הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא״ —
human_translation: And in a case like that, it not a mitzva? But wasn’t it taught one who says: this sela to charity so that my son will live, or I will be one the World-to-Come,
llm_translation: And like this case is not a commandment?! And it was taught: One who says, "This rock is for charity so that my son may live," or "so that he will be a son of the World to Come" —

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי זֶה צַדִּיק גָּמוּר! דִּילְמָא בָּתַר דְּבָדֵק אָתֵי לְעַיּוֹנֵי בָּתְרַהּ.
human_translation: this is a full-fledged righteous person lest he look for after he searched
llm_translation: Behold, this one is a completely righteous individual! Perhaps after he examines, he will come to scrutinize the Torah.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם סַכָּנַת הַגּוֹיִם, וּפְלֵימוֹ הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: חוֹר שֶׁבֵּין יְהוּדִי לְאַרְמַאי — בּוֹדֵק עַד מְקוֹם שֶׁיָּדוֹ מַגַּעַת, וְהַשְּׁאָר מְבַטְּלוֹ בְּלִבּוֹ. פְּלֵימוֹ אָמַר: כׇּל עַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ בּוֹדֵק מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: danger by gentiles. is Pelimu. As it was taught a hole between a Jew and a gentile, one searches as far as his hand reaches, and the rest he renders null and void in his heart. Pelimu said: not search the entire due to the danger
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Due to the danger from the gentiles, and it is a decree. As it was taught: A hole between a Jew and an Aramean - one inspects until his hand touches, and the rest he nullifies in his heart. Peleimo said: He does not inspect any bone due to the danger.

hebrew_text: מַאי סַכָּנָה, אִי נֵימָא סַכָּנַת כְּשָׁפִים, כִּי אִישְׁתַּמַּישׁ הֵיכִי אִישְׁתַּמַּישׁ? הָתָם כִּי אִישְׁתַּמַּישׁ — יְמָמָא וּנְהוֹרָא, וְלָא מַסִּיק אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ. הָכָא — לֵילְיָא וּשְׁרָגָא הוּא, וּמַסֵּיק אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: what danger? If we say the danger of sorcery, when he made use of how did he make use There, when he made use of day and light, and not raise in his mind. Here, night and is a lamp, and raise in his mind.
llm_translation: What is the danger? If you say it is the danger of sorcery, how does one engage in sorcery? There, when one engages in sorcery, it is during the day and with light, and he does not fully concentrate. Here, it is night and it is dark, and he fully concentrates.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁלוּחֵי מִצְוָה אֵינָן נִיזּוֹקִין! הֵיכָא דִּשְׁכִיחַ הֶיזֵּיקָא שָׁאנֵי. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֵיךְ אֵלֵךְ וְשָׁמַע שָׁאוּל וַהֲרָגָנִי וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ עֶגְלַת בָּקָר תִּקַּח בְּיָדֶךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say those on the path to perform a mitzva are not harm where danger is commonplace it is different, as it is stated “And Samuel said: How will I go, and Saul will hear and kill me; and God said: Take in your hand a calf
llm_translation: And he said, Rabbi Elazar: messengers of commandments are not harmed! Wherever it is common that harm occurs, it is different. As it is said: "And Samuel said, 'How can I go? If Saul hears, he will kill me.' And the Lord said, 'Take a heifer with you...'"

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב: הָנֵי בְּנֵי בֵּי רַב דְּדָיְירִי בְּבָאגָא, מַהוּ לְמֵיתֵי קַדְמָא וַחֲשׁוֹכָא לְבֵי רַב? אֲמַר לְהוּ: נֵיתוֹ עֲלַי וְעַל צַוָּארִי. נֵיזִיל מַאי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא יָדַעְנָא.
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rav: those members of the school of Rav who live in the fields [ baga ] what is come early and dark to Rav’s school, He said to them: Let them come, upon me and my neck. What is returning He said to them: I do not know
llm_translation: Ask from him Rav: Those sons of the household of the sons of Rav who reside in Bagga, what is their practice regarding going in front and behind the household of Rav? He said to them: "Place it on me and on my neck." What should we do? He said to them: "We do not know."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁלוּחֵי מִצְוָה אֵינָן נִיזּוֹקִין לֹא בַּהֲלִיכָתָן וְלֹא בַּחֲזִירָתָן. כְּמַאן?
human_translation: it was stated Rabbi Elazar said: Those on the path to perform a mitzva are not harm; neither when they go nor when they return. In accordance with whose
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Elazar said: Messengers of a commandment are not harmed neither in their going nor in their returning. According to whom?

hebrew_text: כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא דְּתַנְיָא, אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּלַפֵּי שֶׁאָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״וְלֹא יַחְמֹד אִישׁ אֶת אַרְצְךָ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁתְּהֵא פָּרָתְךָ רוֹעָה בָּאֲפָר וְאֵין חַיָּה מַזִּיקָתָהּ, תַּרְנְגוֹלְתְּךָ מְנַקֶּרֶת בָּאַשְׁפָּה וְאֵין חוּלְדָּה מַזִּיקָתָהּ.
human_translation: in accordance with of this tanna , as it was taught Isi ben Yehuda says: With regard to which the Torah said: “And no man shall covet your land, teaches that your cow shall graze in the meadow and no beast will harm it, your rooster shall peck in the garbage and no marten ḥulda shall harm it.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught: Issi ben Yehuda says: In accordance with the Torah's statement, "And no man shall covet your land," this teaches that your cow should graze in the dust and no wild animal will harm it, your hen should scratch in the ash and no weasel will harm it.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אֵלּוּ שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לִזּוֹק — אֵינָן נִיזּוֹקִין, בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכָּן לִזּוֹק — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בַּהֲלִיכָה, בַּחֲזָרָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּפָנִיתָ בַבֹּקֶר וְהָלַכְתָּ לְאֹהָלֶיךָ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁתֵּלֵךְ וְתִמְצָא אָהָלְךָ בְּשָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: And are matters not a fortiori ? And if those that typically are harmed are not harmed, people who typically are not harmed, all the more so, I have only when going from where when returning The verse states: and you shall turn in the morning and go to your tents” teaches that you shall go and find your tent in peace,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And are these not logical arguments: and what are these that their way is to be injured - they are not injured, people whose way is not to be injured - how much more so. I only have a source for walking, from where do we know for returning? The Talmud teaches: 'And you shall turn in the morning and go to your tents,' Deuteronomy 23:15 teaching that you should go and find your tent in peace."

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דַּאֲפִילּוּ בַּחֲזִירָה, בַּהֲלִיכָה לְמָה לִי? לְכִדְרַבִּי אַמֵּי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קַרְקַע — עוֹלֶה לָרֶגֶל, וְשֶׁאֵין לוֹ קַרְקַע — אֵין עוֹלֶה לָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: And once that even when returning, why do I when goes? in accordance with Rabbi Ami, as Rabbi Ami said: Any person who has land ascend for the Festivals. And who does not have land is not ascend for the Festivals,
llm_translation: And when since even in the pig, in walking, what do I need it for? According to Rabbi Ammi. For Rabbi Ammi said: Any person who has ground — goes up by foot, and one who does not have ground — does not go up by foot.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין פֵּרוֹת גִּינּוֹסַר בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם? כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ עוֹלֵי רְגָלִים אוֹמְרִים: אִלְמָלֵא לֹא עָלִינוּ אֶלָּא לֶאֱכוֹל פֵּרוֹת גִּינּוֹסַר בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם — דַּיֵּינוּ. נִמְצֵאת עֲלִיָּיה שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin bar Rav Adda said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Due to what are there no fruits of Ginnosar, in Jerusalem? so that pilgrims would not say: If we had ascended only to eat the fruit of Ginnosar, it would have been sufficient for us. ascent then be not for its own sake.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avin bar Rav Adda said, Rabbi Yitzchak said: Why are the fruits of Ginosar not transported to Jerusalem? In order that the pilgrims should not say: If not for ascending solely to eat the fruits of Ginosar in Jerusalem — it would have sufficed for us. It is found regarding it that it is not for its own sake.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ, אָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי: מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין חַמֵּי טְבֶרְיָא בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם? כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ עוֹלֵי רְגָלִים אוֹמְרִים: אִלְמָלֵא לֹא עָלִינוּ אֶלָּא לִרְחֹץ בְּחַמֵּי טְבֶרְיָא — דַּיֵּינוּ, וְנִמְצֵאת עֲלִיָּיה שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: On a similar Rabbi Dostai, son of Rabbi Yannai, said: Due to what are the hot springs of Tiberias not in Jerusalem? so that pilgrims would not say: If we had only ascended to bathe in the hot springs of Tiberias, it would have been sufficient for us. ascent then be not for its own sake.
llm_translation: As it is stated, Rabbi Dostai son of Rabbi Yannai said: For what reason are the hot springs of Tiberias not in Jerusalem? So that those who ascend for the pilgrimage will not say: If only we had come up solely to bathe in the hot springs of Tiberias - it would have sufficed for us, and it is found to be a pretext.

hebrew_text: וּבַמָּה אָמְרוּ שְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת וְכוּ׳. מַרְתֵּף מַאן דְּכַר שְׁמֵיהּ?
human_translation: And with regard to what say two rows etc. A cellar, who mentioned
llm_translation: And in what context did they say "two lines," etc.? Who is the one who mentioned his name?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַכְנִיסִין בּוֹ חָמֵץ — אֵין צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה, וְאוֹצְרוֹת יַיִן וְאוֹצְרוֹת שֶׁמֶן נָמֵי אֵין צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה, וּבַמָּה אָמְרוּ שְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת בַּמַּרְתֵּף — מָקוֹם שֶׁמַּכְנִיסִין בּוֹ חָמֵץ, וּבְמִסְתַּפֵּק.
human_translation: this is is saying: Any place into which one does not take leaven does not require searching, and wine storages and oil storages also do not require searching. And with regard to what say two rows in a cellar? a place into which one brings leavened bread, and where one supplies
llm_translation: So it is stated: Any place where leaven is not brought in - does not require inspection, and wine cellars and oil cellars that are sealed do not require inspection, and where did they say two rows in the cellar - a place where leaven is brought in, and there is doubt.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים שְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת שֶׁאָמְרוּ, מִן הָאָרֶץ וְעַד שְׁמֵי קוֹרָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: שׁוּרָה אַחַת כְּמִין גַּאם.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say two rows Rav Yehuda said: two rows that they stated from the ground up to the ceiling. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one row like the shape of gamma [gam],
llm_translation: House of Shammai says, "Two lines, etc." Rav Yehudah said: The two lines they spoke of, from the earth to the sky. And Rabbi Yochanan said: One line like a plumb line.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת עַל פְּנֵי כׇּל הַמַּרְתֵּף, וּשְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת שֶׁאָמְרוּ — מִן הָאָרֶץ וְעַד שְׁמֵי קוֹרָה. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת עַל פְּנֵי כׇּל הַמַּרְתֵּף — חִיצוֹנָה רוֹאָה אֶת הַפֶּתַח, וְעֶלְיוֹנָה רוֹאָה אֶת הַקּוֹרָה. שֶׁלִּפְנִים הֵימֶנָּה, וְשֶׁלְּמַטָּה הֵימֶנָּה — אֵין צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rav Yehuda, was taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan. was taught in accordance with Rav Yehuda: Beit Shammai say two rows across the entire front of the cellar, and the two rows that were stated from the ground up to the ceiling. was taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan: two rows across the entire cellar, outer faces the door, and upper row faces the ceiling. inward and lower than do not require searching.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Yehudah, it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan. It was taught in the school of Rav Yehudah, Beit Shammai say: "Two rows in every balcony, and two rows that they said - from the earth to the sky." It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan: "Two rows in every balcony - the outer one sees the entrance, and the upper one sees the beam. The one inside it, and the one below it - do not need inspection."

hebrew_text: בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים שְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת הַחִיצוֹנוֹת שֶׁהֵן הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת. אָמַר רַב: עֶלְיוֹנָה וְשֶׁלְּמַטָּה הֵימֶנָּה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: עֶלְיוֹנָה וְשֶׁלִּפְנִים הֵימֶנָּה. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב — דָּיֵיק ״חִיצוֹנוֹת״. וְהָא עֶלְיוֹנוֹת קָתָנֵי! לְמַעוֹטֵי תַּתָּאֵי דְתַתָּיָיתָא.
human_translation: Beit Hillel say: the two external rows, which are the upper ones. Rav said uppermost and that is beneath it. And Shmuel said the uppermost and the that is inward What is the reason Rav? He infers Outer But doesn’t teach: Upper to exclude the lowest of the lower
llm_translation: House of Hillel says: Two outer rows that are the upper ones. Rav said: The upper one and the lower one from it, and Shmuel said: The upper one and the inner one from it. What is the reason of Rav? Because it specifies "outer." But the upper ones are smaller! To exclude the lower ones of the lower ones.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: עֶלְיוֹנָה וְשֶׁלִּפְנִים הֵימֶנָּה. מַאי טַעְמָא — דָּיֵיק ״עֶלְיוֹנוֹת״. וְהָא חִיצוֹנָה קָתָנֵי! לְמַעוֹטֵי גַּוָיָיאתָא דְגַוָיָיאתָא. רַבִּי חִיָּיא תָּנֵי כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, וְכוּלְּהוּ תַּנָּאֵי תָּנוּ כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: And Shmuel said the uppermost and the that is inward What is the reason Shmuel? He infers Upper But doesn’t teach: Outer to exclude the innermost of the inner Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches in accordance with Rav, and all tanna’im , teach in accordance with of Shmuel. And the halakha is in accordance with Shmuel.
llm_translation: Samuel said: "Its upper part and its inside are to the right." What is the reason? Because it specifically says "upper parts." But isn't its outer part smaller? To exclude the outermost chamber from the other chambers. Rabbi Chiya taught in the name of Rav, and all the teachings were taught in the name of Samuel, and the halakha follows the teachings of Samuel.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא גֵּירְרָה חוּלְדָּה מִבַּיִת לְבַיִת וּמִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם, דְּאִם כֵּן מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר וּמֵעִיר לָעִיר — אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף.
human_translation: one not concerned that perhaps a marten dragged from house to house, or from place to place, As if so, from courtyard to courtyard and from city to city. there is no end to the matter,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One does not need to be concerned that perhaps a weasel dragged a fetus from one house to another, or from one place to another, for if so, then from one courtyard to another and from one city to another - there is no end to the matter.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּלָא חֲזֵינָא דִּשְׁקַל, הָא חֲזֵינָא דִּשְׁקַל — חָיְישִׁינַן, וּבָעֵי בְּדִיקָה.
human_translation: The reason is that we did not see drag however, if we saw drag we concerned requires searching
llm_translation: Gemara: The reason that we do not see that he took, is because we see that he took - we are concerned and require investigation.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא אֲכַלְתֵּיהּ! מִי לָא תְּנַן: מְדוֹרוֹת הַגּוֹיִם טְמֵאִים. וְכַמָּה יִשְׁהֶה בְּמָדוֹר וִיהֵא הַמָּדוֹר צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה — אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם.
human_translation: But why Let us say ate Didn’t we learn The residences of gentiles are ritually impure, And how long stayed in a residence the residence to require searching? forty days.
