llm_translation: And why? Say, you ate it! Who did not we learn: the dwellings of the nations are unclean. And how long should one stay in a dwelling so that the dwelling requires inspection - forty days.

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אִשָּׁה. וְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁחוּלְדָּה וַחֲזִיר יְכוֹלִין לַהֲלוֹךְ — אֵין צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה!
human_translation: And even though has no wife. And any place where a marten or a pig can enter need not be searched,
llm_translation: "And even though he does not have a wife. And in any place where a weasel and a pig can walk - no need for inspection!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּבָשָׂר, וְהָא בְּלֶחֶם. בְּבָשָׂר — לָא מְשַׁיְּירָא. בְּלֶחֶם — מְשַׁיְּירָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: not difficult, this to flesh, that to bread. With regard to flesh, does not leave With regard to bread, leaves
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, it is not difficult: here with meat, and here with bread. With meat - it does not remain. With bread - it remains.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאי? בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם — אֵימוֹר הֲוָה, אֵימוֹר לָא הֲוָה. וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר הֲוָה — אֵימוֹר אֲכַלְתֵּיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּוַדַּאי דַּחֲזֵינָא דִּשְׁקַל — מִי יֵימַר דַּאֲכַלְתֵּיהּ? הָוֵי סָפֵק וּוַדַּאי, וְאֵין סָפֵק מוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי.
human_translation: Rava said: What is this Granted, there, say was and say was not And if you say was say ate it. However, here, where one definitely saw take who will say that ate it? It is an uncertainty and a certainty an uncertainty does not override a certainty.
llm_translation: Rava said: What is this? Granted there — if it was said, it was said; if it was not said, it was not said. And if you find to say it was said — it was eaten. But here, where we definitely see that he took it — who can say that he ate it? It is a case of doubt and certainty, and doubt does not remove from certainty.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין סָפֵק מוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי?! וְהָא תַּנְיָא: חָבֵר שֶׁמֵּת וְהִנִּיחַ מְגוּרָה מְלֵיאָה פֵּירוֹת, וַאֲפִילּוּ הֵן בְּנֵי יוֹמָן — הֲרֵי הֵן בְּחֶזְקַת מְתוּקָּנִין. וְהָא הָכָא, דְּוַדַּאי טְבִילִי הָנֵי פֵּירֵי, וְסָפֵק מְעוּשָּׂרִין וְסָפֵק לֹא מְעוּשָּׂרִין, וְקָאָתֵי סָפֵק וּמוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי!
human_translation: And an uncertainty does not override a certainty? But wasn’t taught a ḥaver who died and left a storehouse filled with produce, even that day, presumptive status prepared, However, here, this produce certainly untithed and uncertainty they tithed or whether they are not tithed. the uncertainty comes and overrides the certainty
llm_translation: And is there a doubt that one who definitely removes terumah and tithes?! But it was taught: If a fellow dies and leaves a storage full of fruits, even if they are fit for consumption — they are considered properly prepared. And here, indeed, immerse those fruits, and there is a doubt whether they are tithed or untithed, and the doubt arises and definitely removes terumah and tithes!

hebrew_text: הָתָם וַדַּאי וּוַדַּאי הוּא, דְּוַדַּאי מְעַשְּׂרִי, כִּדְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא חוֹזָאָה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא חוֹזָאָה: חֲזָקָה עַל חָבֵר שֶׁאֵין מוֹצִיא מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְתוּקָּן.
human_translation: There, is certainty and certainty, as certainly tithed, in accordance with Rabbi Ḥanina Ḥoza’a. As Rabbi Ḥanina Ḥoza’a said: a presumption with regard to a ḥaver that he does not that is not prepared, leave his possession.
llm_translation: There, and certainly it is certain, that certainly tithes, as Rabbi Chanina Chozai said. For Rabbi Chanina Chozai said: Establish a presumption against one's fellow that he does not remove from his possession an item that is not prepared.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: סָפֵק וְסָפֵק הוּא, דִּילְמָא מֵעִקָּרָא אֵימוֹר דְּלָא טְבִילִי, כְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say is uncertainty and uncertainty, perhaps one could say never initially untithed. in accordance with Rabbi Oshaya.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: It is a doubt and it is a doubt, perhaps from the outset the statement was said that it should not be immersed, like Rabbi Oshaya.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מַעֲרִים אָדָם עַל תְּבוּאָתוֹ, וּמַכְנִיסָהּ בַּמּוֹץ שֶׁלָּהּ, כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא בְּהֶמְתּוֹ אוֹכֶלֶת וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: As Rabbi Oshaya said: A person may employ artifice with his grain, and bring it into in its chaff so that his animal may eat And is exempt tithes.
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: A person may tithe his produce, and bring it into its pile, so that his animal may eat from it, and he is exempt from tithing.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין סָפֵק מוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי?! וְהָתַנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּשִׁפְחָתוֹ שֶׁל מֵצִיק אֶחָד בְּרִימּוֹן שֶׁהֵטִילָה נֵפֶל לְבוֹר,
human_translation: And an uncertainty does not override a certainty? But wasn’t taught Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident involving the maidservant of a certain violent person in Rimon, who threw a stillborn into a pit,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is there no doubt that one who produces an item is exempt from liability for surety?! And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident with the maidservant of a certain Mezic who threw a fetus into a pit."

hebrew_text: וּבָא כֹּהֵן וְהֵצִיץ בּוֹ לֵידַע אִם זָכָר הוּא אִם נְקֵבָה הִיא. וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים, וְטִיהֲרוּהוּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁחוּלְדָּה וּבַרְדְּלָס מְצוּיִין שָׁם.
human_translation: and a priest came and glanced at to ascertain whether it is male whether it is female, And incident came before the Sages, and they deemed him ritually pure. due to a marten and a polecat [ bardelas ] are found there,
llm_translation: And a kohen shall come and examine him to know whether he is male or female. And a case came before the sages, and they declared him pure, because a weasel and a lizard were found there.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא — דְּוַדַּאי הֵטִילָה, וְסָפֵק גֵּרְרוּהוּ וְסָפֵק לֹא גֵּרְרוּהוּ הָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא, וְקָאָתֵי סָפֵק וּמוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי! לָא תֵּימָא ״שֶׁהֵטִילָה נֵפֶל לְבוֹר״, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: ״שֶׁהִפִּילָה כְּמִין נֵפֶל לְבוֹר״, וְהָוֵי סָפֵק וְסָפֵק.
human_translation: And here, where it is certain that she threw and it is uncertain dragged it and it is uncertain it did not drag it at that time, an uncertainty comes and overrides a certainty. Do not say that she threw a stillborn into a pit; rather, say that she threw similar to a stillborn into a pit. And this is uncertainty and uncertainty.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And here, for sure, if she threw it, and there is doubt whether they dragged it or not, that case, and it is a case of doubt and he is liable! Do not say, "since she threw it, it fell into the pit," but rather say: "since she caused it to fall like a miscarriage into the pit," and it is a case of doubt and doubt.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״לֵידַע אִם זָכָר הוּא אִם נְקֵבָה הִיא״ קָתָנֵי! הָכִי קָאָמַר: לֵידַע אִם רוּחַ הִפִּילָה, אִם נֵפֶל הִפִּילָה. וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר נֵפֶל הִפִּילָה: לֵידַע אִם זָכָר הוּא וְאִם נְקֵבָה הִיא.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught To ascertain whether it is male whether it is female, this is is saying: to ascertain whether she miscarried wind, if she miscarried a stillborn And if you say she miscarried a stillborn, to ascertain whether it is male whether it is female.
llm_translation: The text states: "And this, 'to know if it is a male or a female,' it teaches! This is what it is saying: to know if it caused a miscarriage by a spirit, or if it caused a miscarriage by falling. And if you can say it caused a miscarriage by falling: to know if it is a male or if it is a female."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָתָם וַדַּאי וּוַדַּאי הוּא, כֵּיוָן דְּחוּלְדָּה וּבַרְדְּלָס מְצוּיִין שָׁם — וַדַּאי גֵּרְרוּהוּ בְּהָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא. נְהִי דְּשַׁיּוֹרֵי מְשַׁיְּירָא — מִיגְרָר מִיהַת וַדַּאי גֵּרְרוּם בְּהָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא. (לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: נְהִי דְּוַדַּאי אֲכָלוּם לָא אָמְרִינַן, וַדַּאי גֵּרְרוּהוּ לְחוֹרַיְיהוּ — אָמְרִינַן.)
human_translation: And if you wish, say There it is certainty and certainty. Since a marten and a polecat are found there, they certainly dragged it at that time, Although leave in any case they certainly dragged at that time. Another version Although we do not say that they certainly ate we do say that they certainly dragged it to their holes.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: There, certainly, it is indeed so, since Chuldah and Bardelas are present there - they certainly dragged it at that moment. Even though the oxen are bellowing, they certainly dragged them at that moment. (In another version: Even though they did not say that they certainly ate it, they certainly dragged it to their holes - we say.)

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמְרִינַן אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא גֵּרְרָה חוּלְדָּה? וְהָא קָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: מַה שֶּׁמְּשַׁיֵּיר יַנִּיחֶנּוּ בְּצִנְעָה, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: And do we say one not be concerned perhaps a marten dragged But isn’t it taught in the last clause, that leaves place it in concealed that will not require searching after it?
llm_translation: And who said we do not worry lest a weasel dragged it? And it teaches in the latter clause: Whatever one leaves, he should leave in a hidden place, so that he will not need to check after it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא קַשְׁיָא הָא — בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, הָא — בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר. בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר דִּשְׁכִיחַ רִיפְתָּא בְּכוּלְּהוּ בָּתֵּי — לָא מַצְנְעָא. בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא רִיפְתָּא בְּכוּלְּהוּ בָּתֵּי — מַצְנְעָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult; this to the fourteenth that to the thirteenth. On the thirteenth when bread is found in every house, does not conceal on the fourteenth when bread is not found in any houses, hides
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is not difficult - here (in a group of) fourteen, here (in a group of) thirteen. In a group of thirteen, since the loaf is commonly found in all the houses - it is not concealed. In a group of fourteen, since the loaf is not commonly found in all the houses - it is concealed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְכִי חוּלְדָּה נְבִיאָה הִיא! דְּיָדְעָא דְּהָאִידָּנָא אַרְבֵּיסַר, וְלָא אָפֵי עַד לְאוּרְתָּא, וּמְשַׁיְּירָא וּמְטַמְּרָא?! אֶלָּא, אָמַר רָבָא: מַה שֶּׁמְּשַׁיֵּיר — יַנִּיחֶנּוּ בְּצִנְעָה, שֶׁמָּא תִּטּוֹל חוּלְדָּה בְּפָנֵינוּ, וִיהֵא צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: Rava said And is the marten a prophetess that knows that now the fourteenth and no bake until the evening, and it leaves and conceals Rather, Rava said: that leaves place it in concealed lest a marten take it before us and will require searching after it.
llm_translation: Rava said: Is Huldah the prophetess? For she knew that the storehouses were open, yet she did not turn to the light, and she remained hidden and concealed?! Rather, Rava said: Whatever remains, let him leave it in modesty, lest Huldah take it before us, and then one would need to investigate it afterwards.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הָרוֹצֶה לֶאֱכוֹל חָמֵץ אַחַר בְּדִיקָה, כֵּיצַד יַעֲשֶׂה? מַה שֶּׁמְּשַׁיֵּיר יַנִּיחֶנּוּ בְּצִנְעָה, שֶׁלֹּא תָּבוֹא חוּלְדָּה וְתִיטּוֹל בְּפָנֵינוּ, וִיהֵא צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: It was taught in accordance with of Rava: One who wishes to eat leavened bread after search, what should he do? that leaves place it in concealed so that a marten will not come and take it before us, and he will need to search after it.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rava: One who wishes to eat leaven after the examination, how should he do it? Whatever remains, he should place it in a hidden place, so that a weasel does not come and take it in our presence, and he should require examination after it.

hebrew_text: רַב מָרִי אָמַר: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יַנִּיחַ עֶשֶׂר וְיִמְצָא תֵּשַׁע.
human_translation: Rav Mari said a decree lest he place ten and find nine.
llm_translation: Rav Mari said: A decree lest one leave ten and find nine.

hebrew_text: תֵּשַׁע צִיבּוּרִין שֶׁל מַצָּה וְאֶחָד שֶׁל חָמֵץ, וַאֲתָא עַכְבָּר וּשְׁקַל. וְלָא יָדְעִינַן אִי מַצָּה שְׁקַל אִי חָמֵץ שְׁקַל — הַיְינוּ תֵּשַׁע חֲנוּיוֹת. פֵּירֵשׁ, וַאֲתָא עַכְבָּר וּשְׁקַל — הַיְינוּ סֵיפָא.
human_translation: nine piles of matza and one pile of leavened bread, and a mouse come and take and we do not know if it took matza if it took leavened bread, this is nine stores separated and a mouse come and take it, that is the latter clause
llm_translation: Nine communities of matzah and one of chametz, and a mouse came and took. And we do not know whether it took matzah or chametz — that is nine precautions. It explained, and a mouse came and took — that is the conclusion.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: תֵּשַׁע חֲנוּיוֹת, כּוּלָּן מוֹכְרִין בְּשַׂר שְׁחוּטָה, וְאַחַת מוֹכֶרֶת בְּשַׂר נְבֵלָה, וְלָקַח מֵאַחַת מֵהֶן, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ מֵאֵיזֶה מֵהֶן לָקַח — סְפֵיקוֹ אָסוּר.
human_translation: As we learned nine stores all of which sell meat a slaughtered and one sells meat animal carcasses, and took from one of them and he does not know from which one he took uncertainty, is prohibited.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: There are nine storehouses, all of them sell kosher meat, and one of them sells non-kosher meat. If one buys from one of them and does not know from which one he bought - his purchase is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וּבַנִּמְצָא — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הָרוֹב.
human_translation: And in found follow the majority.
llm_translation: And in the case of "benimtza" - one follows the majority.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי צִיבּוּרִין, אֶחָד שֶׁל מַצָּה וְאֶחָד שֶׁל חָמֵץ. וְלִפְנֵיהֶם שְׁנֵי בָתִּים, אֶחָד בָּדוּק וְאֶחָד שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּדוּק. וַאֲתוֹ שְׁנֵי עַכְבָּרִים, אֶחָד שְׁקַל מַצָּה, וְאֶחָד שְׁקַל חָמֵץ. וְלָא יָדְעִינַן הֵי לְהַאי עָיֵיל וְהֵי לְהַאי עָיֵיל, הַיְינוּ שְׁתֵּי קוּפּוֹת.
human_translation: two piles, one of matza and one of leavened bread, and before them two houses, one searched and one not searched, and two mice came, one took matza and one took leavened bread. and we do not know which entered this and which entered that This is two baskets.
llm_translation: Two congregations, one of matzah and one of leaven. And before them, two houses, one plastered and one not plastered. And there came two mice, one took matzah, and one took leaven. And we do not know which one to suspect and which one to suspect, that is, two baskets.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: שְׁתֵּי קוּפּוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין וְאַחַת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה. וְלִפְנֵיהֶם שְׁנֵי סְאִין, אֶחָד שֶׁל חוּלִּין וְאֶחָד שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה. וְנָפְלוּ אֵלּוּ לְתוֹךְ אֵלּוּ — מוּתָּרִין. שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר, חוּלִּין לְתוֹךְ חוּלִּין נָפְלוּ, וּתְרוּמָה לְתוֹךְ תְּרוּמָה נָפְלָה.
human_translation: As we learned two baskets, one non-sacred and one teruma , and before them two se’a one non-sacred and one teruma . And these, fell into those, is permitted, as I say the non-sacred produce fell into the non-sacred produce and the teruma fell into the teruma .
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Two baskets, one containing common produce and one containing terumah. And in front of them are two measures, one of common produce and one of terumah. If these fell into those, they are permitted. For I say, common produce fell into common produce, and terumah fell into terumah.

hebrew_text: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמְרִינַן ״שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר״
human_translation: Say that we state As I say,
llm_translation: Saying that we say "Sh'e'ani omer"

hebrew_text: בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן. בְּחָמֵץ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מִי אָמְרִינַן?! אַטּוּ בְּדִיקַת חָמֵץ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא? דְּרַבָּנַן הִיא! דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בְּבִיטּוּל בְּעָלְמָא סַגִּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: to teruma by rabbinic law, to leavened bread, by Torah law, do we say Is that to say the search for leavened bread by Torah law? It is rabbinic as by Torah law, mere nullification is sufficient.
llm_translation: Tractate of the Rabbis' Contribution. In leaven of the Torah, do we say?! Rather, in the examination of leaven of the Torah? It is of the Rabbis! For from the Torah, mere nullification suffices for it.

hebrew_text: צִבּוּר אֶחָד שֶׁל חָמֵץ וּלְפָנָיו שְׁנֵי בָתִּים בְּדוּקִין, וַאֲתָא עַכְבָּר וּשְׁקַל, וְלָא יָדְעִינַן אִי לְהַאי עָל אִי לְהַאי עָל — הַיְינוּ שְׁנֵי שְׁבִילִין. דִּתְנַן: שְׁנֵי שְׁבִילִין, אֶחָד טָמֵא וְאֶחָד טָהוֹר, וְהָלַךְ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן וְעָשָׂה טְהָרוֹת, וּבָא חֲבֵירוֹ וְהָלַךְ בַּשֵּׁנִי וְעָשָׂה טְהָרוֹת.
human_translation: one pile of leavened bread and before it two houses searched, and a mouse came and took and we do not know if it entered this or if it entered that this is two paths, as we learned two paths, one ritually impure and one ritually pure. And walked on one of them, and he engaged in ritual purity, and another came and walked on the second and he engaged in ritual purity.
llm_translation: A community of leaven and before it two houses are close, and a mouse came and took, and we do not know if for this one or for that one — that is, two paths. As we learned: two paths, one impure and one pure, and one walked on one of them and performed purifications, and his fellow came and walked on the other and performed purifications.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם נִשְׁאֲלוּ זֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְזֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ — טְהוֹרִין. שְׁנֵיהֶן בְּבַת אַחַת — טְמֵאִין. רַבִּי יוֹסִי אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ טְמֵאִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If this asked by himself, and that asked by himself, they are pure. both at the same time, they are ritually impure. Rabbi Yosei says: One way or another they are ritually impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If this one was asked by itself and that one was asked by itself - they are pure. If both were asked together - they are impure. Rabbi Yosi says: Whether this way or that way, they are impure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּבַת אַחַת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל טְמֵאִין. בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל טְהוֹרִין. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּבָא לְהִשָּׁאֵל עָלָיו וְעַל חֲבֵירוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לְבַת אַחַת, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לְזֶה אַחַר זֶה.
human_translation: Rava said, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan at the same time, everyone agrees they are ritually impure, one after the other, everyone agrees they are ritually pure. They disagree only with regard to comes to ask about himself and about the other. Rabbi Yosei likens this to at the same time, and Rabbi Yehuda likens it to one after the other.
llm_translation: Rava said, and some say it was Rabbi Yochanan: In one case — all agree it is impure. In this case after that case — all agree it is pure. They only disputed in the case of coming to inquire about it and about his fellow. Rabbi Yosei compares it to "in one case," and Rabbi Yehuda compares it to "in this case after that case."

hebrew_text: סָפֵק עָל, סָפֵק לָא עָל — הַיְינוּ בִּקְעָה, וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: uncertainty entered uncertainty did not enter that is a valley, and to the dispute between Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Doubt upon, doubt not upon — that is in the case of a valley, and in the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַנִּכְנָס לְבִקְעָה בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, וְטוּמְאָה בְּשָׂדֶה פְּלוֹנִית, וְאָמַר אֶחָד: הָלַכְתִּי בַּמָּקוֹם הַלָּז, וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אִם נִכְנַסְתִּי בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׂדֶה וְאִם לֹא נִכְנַסְתִּי. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְטַהֵר, וַחֲכָמִים מְטַמְּאִין.
human_translation: As we learned one who enters a valley during the rainy season, And if ritual impurity in a certain field, and one said: I walked in that place, and I do not know whether I entered that field or whether I did not enter, Rabbi Eliezer deems him pure, and the Rabbis deem him impure.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If one entered a valley during the rainy season, and she became impure in a certain field, and one said: "I walked in that place, and I do not know if I entered that field or not." Rabbi Eliezer declares her pure, but the Sages declare her impure.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: סְפֵק בִּיאָה — טָהוֹר, סְפֵק מַגַּע טוּמְאָה — טָמֵא.
human_translation: as Rabbi Eliezer would say: uncertainty entry, ritually pure; uncertainty contact ritual impurity, ritually impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer used to say: A doubtful case of intercourse - pure, a doubtful case of contact with impurity - impure.

hebrew_text: עָל, וּבְדַק וְלָא אַשְׁכַּח — פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבָּנַן, דִּתְנַן: הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּחֶזְקַת טוּמְאָה, לְעוֹלָם הוּא בְּטוּמְאָתוֹ עַד שֶׁיִּוָּדַע לָךְ הַטּוּמְאָה הֵיכָן הִיא.
human_translation: enter and searched and did not find the dispute between Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis. As we learned Rabbi Meir would say: Any object that has presumptive status of ritual impurity, forever in its ritual impurity, until it becomes known to you where the ritual impurity is.
llm_translation: On, and he checked and did not find - the dispute of Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis, as we learned: Rabbi Meir would say: Anything that is in a state of impurity, it will always remain in its impurity until you know where the impurity is.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בּוֹדֵק עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְסֶלַע אוֹ לְקַרְקַע בְּתוּלָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say searching until he reaches bedrock or virgin soil,
llm_translation: The sages say: One examines until reaching the rock or the ground in a state of virginity.

hebrew_text: עָל, וּבְדַק וְאַשְׁכַּח — פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: enter and searched and found the dispute between Rabbi and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: Upon, and he checked and found - a dispute of Rabbi and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: שָׂדֶה שֶׁנֶּאֱבַד בָּהּ קֶבֶר — הַנִּכְנָס לְתוֹכָהּ טָמֵא. נִמְצָא בָּהּ קֶבֶר — הַנִּכְנָס לְתוֹכָהּ טָהוֹר, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: קֶבֶר שֶׁאָבַד הוּא קֶבֶר שֶׁנִּמְצָא — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: תִּיבָּדֵק כׇּל הַשָּׂדֶה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: As it was taught a field in which a grave was lost, one who enters is ritually impure, If a grave was found in one who enters is ritually pure, as I say: grave that was lost is grave that was found. the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The entire field must be searched,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A field in which a grave was lost - one who enters it becomes impure. If a grave is found in it - one who enters it remains pure. For I say: A grave that was lost is different from a grave that is found - these are the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The entire field should be thoroughly examined.

hebrew_text: הִנִּיחַ תֵּשַׁע וּמָצָא עֶשֶׂר — פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי וְרַבָּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא: הִנִּיחַ מָנֶה וּמָצָא מָאתַיִם, חוּלִּין וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי.
human_translation: placed nine and found ten, the dispute between Rabbi and the Rabbis. As it was taught placed a maneh , and found two hundred non-sacred and second-tithe intermingled with each other. the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: He placed nine and found ten - a dispute between Rabbi and the Rabbis. For it was taught: If one placed a hundred and found two hundred, ordinary coins and second tithe coins mixed together - these are the words of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַכֹּל חוּלִּין.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: all non-sacred
llm_translation: And the sages say: "All are susceptible to ritual impurity."

hebrew_text: הִנִּיחַ עֶשֶׂר וּמָצָא תֵּשַׁע הַיְינוּ סֵיפָא, דְּתַנְיָא: הִנִּיחַ מָאתַיִם וּמָצָא מָנֶה — מָנֶה מוּנָּח וּמָנֶה מוּטָל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי.
human_translation: placed ten and found nine, this is the latter clause as it was taught left two hundred and found a maneh , maneh placed, and maneh taken the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: He placed ten and found nine - this is the conclusion, as it was taught: If one placed two hundred and found a hundred - the hundred is considered deposited and the hundred is considered lost, the words of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַכֹּל חוּלִּין.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say, all non-sacred
llm_translation: And the sages say: Everything is permissible.

hebrew_text: הִנִּיחַ בְּזָוִית זוֹ וּמָצָא בְּזָוִית אַחֶרֶת — פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבָּנַן, דְּתַנְיָא: קַרְדּוֹם שֶׁאָבַד בְּבַיִת — הַבַּיִת טָמֵא. שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: אָדָם טָמֵא נִכְנַס לְשָׁם וּנְטָלוֹ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הַבַּיִת טָהוֹר, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: הִשְׁאִילוֹ לְאַחֵר וְשָׁכַח, אוֹ שֶׁנְּטָלוֹ מִזָּוִית זוֹ וְהִנִּיחַ בְּזָוִית הָאַחֶרֶת וְשָׁכַח.
human_translation: placed in this corner and found in another corner, the dispute between Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and the Rabbis, as it was taught an axe that was lost in a house, the house is impure, as I say a ritually impure person entered and took Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The house is ritually pure, as I say he lent to another and forgot, or that he took it from this corner and placed it in the other corner and forgot.
llm_translation: He placed it in this corner and found it in another corner - a dispute between Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and the Rabbis, as it was taught: If a mouse that was lost in a house - the house is impure. But I say: A person who is impure entered there and took it. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The house is pure, but I say: If he lent it to another and forgot, or if it was taken from this corner and placed in another corner and forgotten.

hebrew_text: זָוִית מַאן דְּכַר שְׁמֵיהּ?
human_translation: A corner, who mentioned anything about it?
llm_translation: Corner, who remembers his name?

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: קַרְדּוֹם שֶׁאָבַד בְּבַיִת — הַבַּיִת טָמֵא, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: אָדָם טָמֵא נִכְנַס לְשָׁם וּנְטָלוֹ. אוֹ שֶׁהִנִּיחוֹ בְּזָוִית זוֹ וּמְצָאוֹ בְּזָוִית אַחֶרֶת — הַבַּיִת טָמֵא, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: אָדָם טָמֵא נִכְנַס לְשָׁם וּנְטָלוֹ מִזָּוִית זוֹ וְהִנִּיחוֹ בְּזָוִית אַחֶרֶת. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הַבַּיִת טָהוֹר, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר הִשְׁאִילוֹ לְאַחֵר וְשָׁכַח, אוֹ שֶׁנְּטָלוֹ מִזָּוִית זוֹ וְהִנִּיחַ בְּזָוִית זוֹ וְשָׁכַח.
human_translation: is incomplete, and is teaching the following: an axe that was lost in a house, the house is ritually impure, as I say an impure person entered and took or, if placed it in this corner and found it in another corner, the house is ritually impure, as I say an impure person entered and took from this corner and placed in another corner. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The house is ritually pure, as I say he lent it to another and forgot, or that he took it from this corner and placed it in that corner and forgot
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Chasorei mechassera, vehachi katanei: Kardom she'avad bebayit — habayit tamei, she'ani omer: Adam tamei nichnas lesham unetalo. O shehinicho bezavit zo umetzao bezavit acheret — habayit tamei, she'ani omer: Adam tamei nichnas lesham unetalo mizavit zo vehinicho bezavit acheret. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel omer: Habayit tahor, she'ani omer hishilo le'acher veshachach, o shenetalomizavit zo vehinicho bezavit zo veshachach." Translation: "The missing piece is missing, and thus it is taught: If a piece of a mortar that was lost in a house — the house is impure, for I say: An impure person enters there and takes it. Or if it was placed in one corner and found in another corner — the house is impure, for I say: An impure person enters there and takes it from one corner and places it in another corner. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The house is pure, for I say if it was lent to another and forgotten, or if it was taken from one corner and placed in another corner and forgotten."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: עַכְבָּר נִכְנָס וְכִכָּר בְּפִיו, וְנִכְנַס אַחֲרָיו וּמָצָא פֵּירוּרִין — צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל עַכְבָּר לְפָרֵר. וְאָמַר רָבָא: תִּינוֹק נִכְנָס וְכִכָּר בְּיָדוֹ, וְנִכְנַס אַחֲרָיו וּמָצָא פֵּירוּרִין — אֵין צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל תִּינוֹק לְפָרֵר.
human_translation: Rava said: a mouse enter loaf in its mouth, and he entered after and found crumbs, requires searching, due to a mouse does not typically generate crumbs. And Rava said: a child enter with a loaf in his hand, and he entered after and found crumbs, does not require searching, because a child typically generates crumbs,
llm_translation: Rava said: If a mouse enters with a loaf of bread in its mouth, and another mouse enters after it and finds crumbs, one must inspect the crumbs, because it is not the way of a mouse to break bread. And Rava said: If a child enters with a loaf of bread in his hand, and another child enters after him and finds crumbs, there is no need to inspect the crumbs, because it is the way of a child to break bread.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: עַכְבָּר נִכְנָס וְכִכָּר בְּפִיו, וְעַכְבָּר יוֹצֵא וְכִכָּר בְּפִיו, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן: הַיְינוּ הַאי דְּעָל, וְהַיְינוּ הַאי דִּנְפַק. אוֹ דִילְמָא, אַחֲרִינָא הוּא.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma a mouse enter with a loaf in its mouth, and a mouse leave with a loaf in its mouth, what is Do we say this that entered is that that left Or perhaps it is a different
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rava: akhbar nikhnas ve'kikar befiv, ve'akhbar yotze ve'kikar befiv, mahhu? mi amrinan: hainu hadi'al, ve'hainu hadi'nafak. o dilma, akharina hu.

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר הַיְינוּ הַאי דְּעָל וְהַיְינוּ הַאי דִּנְפַק: עַכְבָּר לָבָן נִכְנָס וְכִכָּר בְּפִיו, וְעַכְבָּר שָׁחוֹר יוֹצֵא וְכִכָּר בְּפִיו, מַהוּ? הַאי וַדַּאי אַחֲרִינָא הוּא. אוֹ דִילְמָא, אַרְמוֹיֵי אַרְמְיֵהּ מִינֵּיהּ?
human_translation: If you say this that entered was this that left, a white mouse enter with a loaf in its mouth and a black mouse leave with a loaf in its mouth, what is this is certainly a different or perhaps took from
llm_translation: If you find to say this: "This is the same as that" and "This is different from that": a white mouse enters and a loaf of bread is in its mouth, and a black mouse exits and a loaf of bread is in its mouth, what is the ruling? This is certainly a different one. Or perhaps, it is a deception within a deception?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר עַכְבָּרִים לָא שָׁקְלִי מֵהֲדָדֵי: עַכְבָּר נִכְנָס וְכִכָּר בְּפִיו, וְחוּלְדָּה יוֹצְאָה וְכִכָּר בְּפִיהָ, מַהוּ? חוּלְדָּה וַדַּאי מֵעַכְבָּר שְׁקַלְתֵּיהּ. אוֹ דִילְמָא, אַחֲרִינָא הוּא. דְּאִם אִיתָא דְּמֵעַכְבָּר שְׁקַלְתֵּיהּ — עַכְבָּר בְּפִיהָ הֲוָה מִשְׁתְּכַח.
human_translation: And if you say mice do not take from each other, a mouse enter with a loaf in its mouth and a marten leave with a loaf in its mouth, what is the marten certainly took it Or perhaps it is a different for if it is so, that took from the mouse, the mouse would be found in its mouth,
llm_translation: And if you find to say, "Rats do not take from Hadadei," a rat enters with a loaf in its mouth, and a weasel comes out with a loaf in its mouth, what is the ruling? The weasel surely took it from the rat. Or perhaps, it is another one. For if it is found that the weasel took it from the rat, the rat in its mouth would have been forgotten.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר אִם אִיתָא דְּמֵעַכְבָּר שְׁקַלְתֵּיהּ, עַכְבָּר בְּפִיהָ הֲוָה מִשְׁתְּכַח: עַכְבָּר נִכְנָס וְכִכָּר בְּפִיו, וְחוּלְדָּה יוֹצְאָה וְכִכָּר וְעַכְבָּר בְּפִי חוּלְדָּה, מַהוּ? הָכָא וַדַּאי אִיהוּ הוּא, אוֹ דִילְמָא: אִם אִיתָא דְּאִיהוּ נִיהוּ — כִּכָּר בְּפִי עַכְבָּר מִשְׁתְּכַח הֲוָה בָּעֵי אִישְׁתְּכוֹחֵי. אוֹ דִילְמָא: מִשּׁוּם בִּיעֲתוּתָא הוּא נְפַל, וּשְׁקַלְתֵּיהּ. תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: And if you say if it is so, that took it from the mouse the mouse would be in its mouth, a mouse enter with a loaf in its mouth and a marten leave with a loaf and a mouse in its mouth, what is this is certainly the same or perhaps If it is so, that this is the same loaf would have been found in the mouse’s mouth Or perhaps fell due to fear took it Let stand
llm_translation: And if you find to say if it is found that a mouse took it, the mouse was forgotten in its mouth: the mouse entered and the coin in its mouth, and the weasel came out with the coin and the mouse in the mouth of the weasel, what is the ruling? Here, certainly it is he, or perhaps: if it is found that it is he, the coin was forgotten in the mouth of the mouse, he requires to be forgotten. Or perhaps: due to its slipperiness it fell, and it took it. This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: כִּכָּר בִּשְׁמֵי קוֹרָה — צָרִיךְ סוּלָּם לְהוֹרִידָהּ, אוֹ אֵין צָרִיךְ? מִי אָמְרִינַן: כּוּלֵּי הַאי לָא אַטְרְחוּהוּ רַבָּנַן, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא נָחֵית מִנַּפְשֵׁיהּ — לָא אָתֵי לְמֵיכְלַהּ. אוֹ דִילְמָא: זִימְנִין דְּנָפֵל וְאָתֵי לְמֵיכְלַהּ.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma: a loaf on a high beam need a ladder take it down or not necessary? Do we say: The Sages did not exert since will not fall on its own he will not come to eat it? Or perhaps sometimes fall and he will come to eat it,
llm_translation: Rava asked: If a loaf of bread is in the rafters, does one need a ladder to bring it down, or not? Did we not say: The Rabbis were not concerned about such a case, since if it does not come down by itself, it will not come down at all. Or perhaps: Sometimes it falls and then one can eat it.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר זִימְנִין דְּנָפֵל וְאָתֵי לְמֵיכְלַהּ: כִּכָּר בְּבוֹר — צָרִיךְ סוּלָּם לְהַעֲלוֹתָהּ, אוֹ אֵין צָרִיךְ? הָכָא וַדַּאי דְּלָא עֲבִידָא דְּסָלְקָה מִנַּפְשַׁהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא: זִימְנִין דְּנָחֵית לְמֶעְבַּד צוּרְכֵּיהּ, וְאָתֵי לְמֵיכְלַיהּ.
human_translation: And if you say sometimes fall and he will come to eat it, loaf was in a pit, need a ladder to bring it up, or not necessary? Here will certainly not come up on its own, or perhaps sometimes he go down to perform requirement of his, and he will come to eat it.
llm_translation: And if you might say, sometimes it falls and comes to be eaten: A talent in a pit - does it require a ladder to bring it up, or does it not require? Here, it is certain that it is not a case of it coming up by itself, or perhaps: sometimes it falls to be used for its needs, and comes to be eaten.

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר זִימְנִין דְּנָחֵית לְצוּרְכֵּיהּ וְאָתֵי לְמֵיכְלַהּ: כִּכָּר בְּפִי נָחָשׁ — צָרִיךְ חַבָּר לְהוֹצִיא, אוֹ אֵין צָרִיךְ?
human_translation: if you say sometimes one goes down for requirement of his, and he will come to eat it, a loaf in the mouth of a snake, necessary a snake charmer to take out or not necessary?
llm_translation: If you find to say times that he placed for his needs and comes to eat: a loaf in the mouth of a snake - does he need a companion to take it out, or does he not need one?

hebrew_text: בְּגוּפֵיהּ אַטְרְחוּהוּ רַבָּנַן, בְּמָמוֹנֵיהּ לָא אַטְרְחוּהוּ רַבָּנַן. אוֹ דִילְמָא לָא שְׁנָא. תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: with regard to his body the Sages exert with regard to his money the Sages do not exert Or perhaps, no different Let stand
llm_translation: In its body, the Rabbis exempted him, but in its monetary value, the Rabbis did not exempt him. Or perhaps it is not different. The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בּוֹדְקִין אוֹר אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, וּבְאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שַׁחֲרִית, וּבִשְׁעַת הַבִּיעוּר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא בָּדַק אוֹר אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר — יִבְדּוֹק בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One searches on the evening of the fourteenth and on the fourteenth the morning, and at the time of removal And the Rabbis say: one did not search on the evening of the fourteenth he search on the fourteenth
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says: One examines the leaven on the fourteenth of Nisan, and on the fourteenth of Nisan in the morning, and at the time of Bi'ur. And the Sages say: If one did not examine the leaven on the fourteenth of Nisan, he should examine it on the fourteenth of Nisan.

hebrew_text: לֹא בָּדַק בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר — יִבְדּוֹק בְּתוֹךְ הַמּוֹעֵד. לֹא בָּדַק בְּתוֹךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — יִבְדּוֹק לְאַחַר הַמּוֹעֵד. וּמַה שֶּׁמְּשַׁיֵּיר יַנִּיחֶנּוּ בְּצִינְעָא, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: he did not search on the fourteenth, he should search during the festival he did not search during the Festival, he should search after the Festival, And that leaves place it in concealed so that it will not require searching after it
llm_translation: He did not check on the fourteenth — he shall check during the festival. He did not check during the festival — he shall check after the festival. And whatever he leaves over, he shall place it in a hidden place, so that he will not need to check it afterwards.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: כְּנֶגֶד שָׁלֹשׁ הַשְׁבָּתוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה — ״לֹא יֵרָאֶה לְךָ חָמֵץ וְלֹא יֵרָאֶה לְךָ שְׂאֹר״, ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים שְׂאֹר לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְּבָתֵּיכֶם״, ״אַךְ בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן תַּשְׁבִּיתוּ שְּׂאֹר מִבָּתֵּיכֶם״.
human_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna who both say: corresponds to three the removal is in the Torah. no leavened bread shall be seen with you, neither shall there be leaven seen with you, “Seven days shall there be no leaven found in your houses” yet on the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses”
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda? Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna both said: In accordance with the three Shabbats mentioned in the Torah - "No leaven shall be seen with you, and no leaven shall be seen with you," "For seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses," "But on the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁלֹּא בָּדַק בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים הַלָּלוּ — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ בּוֹדֵק. אַלְמָא בְּמִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ הוּא דִּפְלִיגִי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection Rabbi Yehuda says: Anyone who did not search at these three times no longer search. Apparently, from this forward that they disagree.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Yosef raised an objection: Rabbi Yehuda says: Anyone who did not examine these three chapters - he should not examine it again. This implies that here and there is where they disagree.

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא מַתְנֵי הָכִי: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁלֹּא בָּדַק בְּאֶחָד מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים הַלָּלוּ — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ בּוֹדֵק. אַלְמָא בְּשׁוּב אֵינוֹ בּוֹדֵק הוּא דִּפְלִיגִי.
human_translation: Mar Zutra taught this Rav Yosef raised an objection Rabbi Yehuda says: Anyone who did not search at one of these three times no longer search. Apparently, one no longer search that they disagree.
llm_translation: Master Zutra taught thus: It was raised: Rav Yosef objects, Rabbi Yehuda says: Anyone who did not examine in one of these three chapters - he should reexamine. It implies that if he reexamines, it is what they disagree about.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נָמֵי, אִם לֹא בָּדַק קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehuda also said: If one did not search
llm_translation: Rather Rabbi Yehuda said, "If he did not examine, that is what he meant."

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר: מִקַּמֵּי אִיסּוּרָא — אִין, בָּתַר אִיסּוּרָא — לָא, גְּזֵירָה דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְמֵיכַל מִינֵּיהּ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: And here, about this that they disagree: Sage, maintains before the prohibition yes, after the prohibition no, decree lest one come to eat from And the Rabbis maintain: We do not issue a decree
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here in this case they disagree: Master holds: before the prohibition - no, after the prohibition - yes, lest one come to eat from it. And the Rabbis hold: we do not decree."

hebrew_text: וּמִי גָּזַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְמֵיכַל מִינֵּיהּ? וְהָא תְּנַן: מִשֶּׁקָּרַב הָעוֹמֶר יוֹצְאִין וּמוֹצְאִין שׁוּקֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁהֵם מְלֵאִים קֶמַח וְקָלִי.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yehuda issue a decree lest one come to eat But didn’t we learn Once the omer was sacrificed, go out and find the markets of Jerusalem filled with flour and toasted grain,
llm_translation: And who decreed Rabbi Yehuda lest perhaps she will come to eat from its species? And we learned: From when the Omer offering is brought close, the markets of Jerusalem are filled with flour and parched grain.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים (הֵן עוֹשִׂין), דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין. וְלָא קָא גָזַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְמֵיכַל מִינֵּיהּ? אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי חָדָשׁ, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא הִתַּרְתָּ לוֹ אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי קִטּוּף, הוּא זָכוּר.
human_translation: they act contrary to the will of the Sages. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: They act in accordance with the will of the Sages. And Rabbi Yehuda did not issue a decree lest one eat from it. Rava said new is different: Since you permitted one only by picking he will remember
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When it is not with the consent of the sages (they do), the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: They were done with the consent of the sages. And Rabbi Yehuda did not decree lest perhaps one might come to eat from it? Rava said: It is different with a new one, since you only permitted it through plucking, it is remembered.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: תִּינַח בִּשְׁעַת קְטִיפָה, טְחִינָה וְהַרְקָדָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: טְחִינָה בְּרִחְיָא דְיָד, הַרְקָדָה עַל גַּבֵּי נָפָה.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: well to the time picking grinding and sifting, what can be said? This is not difficult, grinding with a hand mill, sifting on top of sifter.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: "It is fitting at the time of a meal, what is there to say about tahini and dancing?" This is not difficult: tahini on the back of the hand, dancing on a table.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן: קוֹצְרִין בֵּית הַשְּׁלָחִים וְשֶׁבַּעֲמָקִים, אֲבָל לֹא גּוֹדְשִׁין. וְאוֹקִימְנָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר!
human_translation: However, which we learned One harvest a field that requires irrigation and in the valleys, but one not pile And we established in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda; what can be said?
llm_translation: Rather, this that we learned: One may harvest the produce of the fields and vineyards in the Sabbatical year, but one may not gather the produce into sheaves. And we establish it in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. What is there to say!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: חָדָשׁ — בָּדֵיל מִינֵּיהּ, חָמֵץ — לָא בָּדֵיל מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: from new distances himself, from leavened bread does not distance himself,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: "Chadash" - he separates it, "Chametz" - he does not separate it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה קַשְׁיָא, דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן לָא קַשְׁיָא?
human_translation: Rava said: of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda difficult, of the Rabbis of the Rabbis not difficult?
llm_translation: Rava said: Regarding Rabbi Yehuda, is Rabbi Yehuda stringent, but regarding the Rabbis, are the Rabbis not stringent?

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא קַשְׁיָא — כִּדְשַׁנִּינַן. דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא — הוּא עַצְמוֹ מְחַזֵּר עָלָיו לְשׂוֹרְפוֹ, מֵיכַל קָאָכֵיל מִינֵּיהּ?!
human_translation: of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda not difficult, as we resolved of the Rabbis of the Rabbis also not difficult: himself is seeking out to burn it, he eat from
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: It is not difficult - as we learn. The Rabbis said in the name of the Rabbis: It is not difficult - he himself is returning to burn it, and Michal is eating from it?!

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא קַשְׁיָא: ״קֶמַח וְקָלִי״ תְּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda not difficult, as we learned flour and toasted grain.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: In the name of Rabbi Yehuda, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, it is not difficult: "flour and parched grain" we learned.

hebrew_text: הָא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי בְּדוּתָא הִיא: הָתִינַח מִקָּלִי וְאֵילָךְ, מֵעִיקָּרָא עַד קָלִי מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: That of Rav Ashi is a mistake, That well from toasted grain and forward, initially until toasted grain, what can be said?
llm_translation: This is the case of Rav Ashe in Duta: If one was traveling from Kalai and onwards, from the beginning until Kalai, what can be said?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא עַל יְדֵי קִיטּוּף כִּדְרָבָא, אֶלָּא ״קוֹצְרִין בֵּית הַשְּׁלָחִין וְשֶׁבָּעֲמָקִים״, וְאוֹקִימְנָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אֶלָּא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי בְּדוּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: And lest you say by harvested, in accordance with Rava, but one may harvest a field that requires irrigation and that is in the valleys and we established in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, what can be said? Rather, Rav Ashi’s is a mistake.
llm_translation: And if you say it is due to the act of uprooting, like Ravah, rather "they harvest the courtyard and the valleys," and we establish it like Rabbi Yehuda, what can be said? Rather, it is a matter of dispute between Rav Ashi and Duta.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּלָא בָּדֵיל מִינֵּיהּ, מִי גָּזַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: And anywhere that does not distance does Rabbi Yehuda issue a decree
llm_translation: And all places where he did not separate from it, who decreed Rabbi Yehuda?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: לֹא יִקּוֹב אָדָם שְׁפוֹפֶרֶת שֶׁל בֵּיצָה וִימַלְּאֶנָּה שֶׁמֶן וְיִתְּנֶנָּה בְּצַד הַנֵּר בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁתְּהֵא מְנַטֶּפֶת, וַאֲפִילּוּ הִיא שֶׁל חֶרֶס.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn A person may not pierce in an eggshell, and fill it with oil, and place it beside a lamp so that will drip And even it is an earthenware
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: A person may not puncture the shell of an egg, fill it with oil, and place it next to the lamp so that it drips, even if it is made of earthenware.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר! הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם חוּמְרָא דְּשַׁבָּת מִבְדָּל בְּדִילִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda permits There, due to the stringency of Shabbat, one distances
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda permits! There, because of the severity of Shabbat, one may separate the dill.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי דְּשַׁבָּת אַשַּׁבָּת, דְּתַנְיָא: חֶבֶל דְּלִי שֶׁנִּפְסַק, לֹא יְהֵא קוֹשְׁרוֹ אֶלָּא עוֹנְבוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כּוֹרֵךְ עָלָיו פּוּנְדָּא אוֹ פָּסִקְיָא, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַעַנְבֶנּוּ.
human_translation: And raised a contradiction of Shabbat Shabbat, as it was taught the rope of a bucket that was severed he may not tie it Rather, tie it a bow. Rabbi Yehuda says: One wrap a money belt [ punda ] around it or a sash [ pesikya ], provided that he does not tie it a bow,
llm_translation: And a rope of Shabbat, of Shabbat, as it was taught: a rope that was cut, one should only tie it with its own rope. Rabbi Yehuda says: one may tie it with a strap or a piece of cloth, as long as it is not knotted.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: a difficulty, of Rabbi Yehuda, of Rabbi Yehuda, a difficulty of the Rabbis, of the Rabbis,
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rabbi Yehuda is like the difficulty of Rabbi Yehuda, the difficulty of the Rabbis is like the difficulty of the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן לָא קַשְׁיָא: שֶׁמֶן בְּשֶׁמֶן — מִיחַלַּף, עֲנִיבָה בִּקְשִׁירָה — לָא מִיחַלַּף.
human_translation: of the Rabbis of the Rabbis not difficult, oil be confused with oil. a bow will not be confused with a knot.
llm_translation: The sages of the sages do not have a difficulty: oil with oil - can be interchanged, but a mixture with a binding agent - cannot be interchanged.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא קַשְׁיָא: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּגָזַר עֲנִיבָה אַטּוּ קְשִׁירָה, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר עֲנִיבָה גּוּפַהּ קְשִׁירָה הִיא.
human_translation: of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda not difficult, the reason for of Rabbi Yehuda not because he issues a decree a bow due to a knot. Rather, because Rabbi Yehuda maintains a bow itself is knot.
llm_translation: Regarding Rabbi Yehuda, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, it is not difficult. The reason of Rabbi Yehuda is not because he decreed the twisting, then the tying, but because he holds that the twisting itself is considered tying.

hebrew_text: וְרָמֵי רַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן, דִּתְנַן: קוֹשְׁרִין דְּלִי בְּפָסִקְיָא אֲבָל לֹא בְּחֶבֶל, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר. חֶבֶל דְּמַאי? אִילֵּימָא חֶבֶל דְּעָלְמָא, ״וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר״? קֶשֶׁר שֶׁל קַיָּימָא הוּא, דְּוַדַּאי אָתֵי לְבַטּוֹלֵי!
human_translation: And raised a contradiction between the Rabbis of the Rabbis, as we learned One may tie a bucket with a sash, but not with a rope, and Rabbi Yehuda permits a rope of what If you say a standard rope, Rabbi Yehuda permit It is a permanent knot, as he certainly comes to negate
llm_translation: The sages raised a contradiction: for we learned: one may tie a knot that is temporary, but not one that is permanent, and Rabbi Yehuda permits it. What is a permanent knot? If you say a permanent knot of the world, "and Rabbi Yehuda permits it"? It is a knot of a professional, for surely it will come to be untied!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּגַרְדִּי.
human_translation: Rather, obvious of a weaver [ gardi ].
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious that it is a "gardei."

hebrew_text: וּגְזַרוּ רַבָּנַן חֶבֶל דְּגַרְדִּי אַטּוּ חֶבֶל דְּעָלְמָא? אִין, חֶבֶל בְּחֶבֶל — מִיחַלַּף, עֲנִיבָה בִּקְשִׁירָה — לָא מִיחַלְּפָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis issue a decree of a weaver due to a standard rope Yes, rope may be interchanged with rope, a bow is not interchanged with a knot.
llm_translation: The sages decreed: a rope of a garden, is it like a rope of the world? No, a rope within a rope - it can be exchanged, a loop within a knot - it cannot be exchanged.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּבָדֵיל מִינֵּיהּ לָא גָּזַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: בְּכוֹר שֶׁאֲחָזוֹ דָּם, אֲפִילּוּ הוּא מֵת — אֵין מַקִּיזִין לוֹ דָּם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And anywhere that distances himself Rabbi Yehuda not issue a decree? But wasn’t it taught firstborn animal blood constricted, Even if it dies one not let its blood the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And all where separated from it not decreed Rabbi Yehuda? And it was taught: A firstborn that held blood, even if he is dead — we do not sprinkle blood for him, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יַקִּיז, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יָטִיל בּוֹ מוּם. הָתָם, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאָדָם בָּהוּל
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: One let provided that he does not inflict a blemish on There, since a person is agitated
llm_translation: The sages say: One should inspect, but only if he does not impose a blemish upon it. There, because a person is in a state of confusion.

hebrew_text: עַל מָמוֹנוֹ, אָמְרִינַן: אִי שָׁרֵית לֵיהּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין בּוֹ מוּם — אָתֵי לְמֶעְבַּד בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁעוֹשִׂין בּוֹ מוּם.
human_translation: about his property, we say: If you permit him in a place that does not cause a blemish in he will come to do in a place that causes a blemish in it,
llm_translation: On his property, we say: If you lent it to him in a place where they do not cause a blemish - he may come to cause a blemish.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּאִי לָא שָׁרֵית לֵיהּ כְּלָל אָתֵי לְמֶעְבַּד.
human_translation: And the Rabbis all the more so for if you do not permit him at all, he will come to act
llm_translation: And the Rabbis - all the more so, for if he did not permit it to him in general, he comes to do it.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמְרִינַן לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָדָם בָּהוּל עַל מָמוֹנוֹ? וְהָתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין (מְקַדְּרִין) הַבְּהֵמָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה חַבּוּרָה, אֲבָל מְקַרְצְפִין. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מְקַדְּרִין, אַף אֵין מְקַרְצְפִין.
human_translation: And do we say according to Rabbi Yehuda a person is agitated about his property? But didn’t we learn Rabbi Yehuda says: One not scrape an animal on a Festival because he inflicts a wound, However, one scratch And the Rabbis say: One neither scrape nor even scratch,
llm_translation: And who said to Rabbi Yehuda, "Is a person allowed to be negligent with his money?" And we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says, "One does not tie up an animal on a festival day, because it forms a bond, but one may muzzle it." And the Sages say: "One does not tie up, nor muzzle."

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: אֵיזֶהוּ קִידּוּר וְאֵיזֶהוּ קִרְצוּף? קִידּוּר — קְטַנִּים, וְעוֹשִׂין חַבּוּרָה. קִרְצוּף — גְּדוֹלִים, וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין חַבּוּרָה.
human_translation: And it was taught What is scraping and what is scratching? Scraping small and one inflicts a wound. Scratching large and one does not inflict a wound.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: What is a "kidur" and what is a "kirtzuf"? "Kidur" - small logs, and they make a stack. "Kirtzuf" - large logs, and they do not make a stack.

hebrew_text: הָתָם, דְּאִי שָׁבֵיק לֵיהּ — מָיֵית, אָמְרִינַן אָדָם בָּהוּל עַל מָמוֹנוֹ. הָכָא, אִי שָׁבֵיק לֵיהּ — צַעֲרָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, לָא אָמְרִינַן אָדָם בָּהוּל עַל מָמוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: There, for if he leaves it will die, we say a person is agitated over his property. Here, if he leaves it will merely pain we do not say a person is agitated about his property.
llm_translation: There, for if he leaves it - he dies, we say: a person is in turmoil about his money. Here, if he leaves it - it is just regular pain, we do not say: a person is in turmoil about his money.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, מַאי שְׁנָא גַּבֵּי חָמֵץ דְּגָזַר, וּמַאי שְׁנָא גַּבֵּי קִרְצוּף דְּלָא גָּזַר? לֶחֶם בְּלֶחֶם — מִיחַלַּף. קִידּוּר בְּקִרְצוּף — לָא מִיחַלַּף.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, what is different with regard to leavened bread that he issued a decree and what is different with regard to scraping that he did not issue decree? bread interchanged with bread, scraping not be interchanged with scratching.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, what is the difference regarding chametz that he decreed, and what is the difference regarding kirtzuf that he did not decree? Bread with bread - it can be exchanged. Pot with kirtzuf - it cannot be exchanged.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אוֹכְלִים כׇּל חָמֵשׁ, וְשׂוֹרְפִין בִּתְחִלַּת שֵׁשׁ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אוֹכְלִין כׇּל אַרְבַּע, וְתוֹלִין כׇּל חָמֵשׁ, וְשׂוֹרְפִין בִּתְחִלַּת שֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: One eat the entire fifth and one burn at the beginning of the sixth Rabbi Yehuda says: One eat the entire fourth and places it in abeyance the entire fifth and one burns at the beginning of the sixth
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Rabbi Meir says: One may eat until the fifth hour, and one must burn chametz at the beginning of the sixth hour. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may eat until the fourth hour, and one must remove chametz until the fifth hour, and one must burn chametz at the beginning of the sixth hour.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: שְׁתֵּי חַלּוֹת שֶׁל תּוֹדָה פְּסוּלוֹת מוּנָּחוֹת עַל גַּב הָאִיצְטְבָא, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמּוּנָּחוֹת — כׇּל הָעָם אוֹכְלִין. נִיטְּלָה אַחַת — תּוֹלִין; לֹא אוֹכְלִין וְלֹא שׂוֹרְפִין. נִיטְּלוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן — הִתְחִילוּ כׇּל הָעָם שׂוֹרְפִין.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: Two disqualified loaves of a thanks-offering are placed on the bench As long as are placed the entire nation eat one was taken to place in abeyance, neither eat nor burn they were both taken the entire nation began burning
llm_translation: And furthermore said Rabbi Yehuda: Two loaves of thanksgiving offering that are disqualified, placed on top of the ledge, as long as they are placed - all the people may eat. If one is removed - they are suspended; neither eaten nor burned. If both are removed - all the people may begin burning.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: חוּלִּין נֶאֱכָלִין כׇּל אַרְבַּע, וּתְרוּמָה כׇּל חָמֵשׁ, וְשׂוֹרְפִין בִּתְחִלַּת שֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says Non-sacred are eaten the entire fourth and teruma the entire fifth And one burns at the beginning of the sixth
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: Regular food is eaten every four days, and Terumah every five days, and one may burn chametz at the beginning of the sixth hour.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר בִּשְׁנַיִם בַּחֹדֶשׁ, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה — עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת,
human_translation: We learned there: one says on the second of the month and one says the third their testimony is valid.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanan hatam: echad omer bishnayim bachodesh, ve'echad omer bishloshah - eidutam kayemet." English translation: "We learned in a Mishnah there: one says two in the month, and one says three - their testimony stands."

hebrew_text: שֶׁזֶּה יוֹדֵעַ בְּעִבּוּרוֹ שֶׁל חֹדֶשׁ, וְזֶה אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּעִבּוּרוֹ שֶׁל חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: that this knows about the addition to month. And that does not know about the addition to month,
llm_translation: This one knows the intercalation of the month, and this one does not know the intercalation of the month.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר בַּחֲמִשָּׁה — עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵלָה. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר בִּשְׁתֵּי שָׁעוֹת, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר בְּשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁעוֹת — עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר בְּשָׁלֹשׁ, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר בְּחָמֵשׁ — עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵלָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: one says the third and one says on the fifth, their testimony is void, one says at two hours and one says at three hours, their testimony is valid, one says at three and one says at five their testimony is void. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: One says with three, and one says with five - their testimony is nullified. One says within two hours, and one says within three hours - their testimony stands. One says within three, and one says within five - their testimony is nullified, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר בְּחָמֵשׁ, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר בְּשֶׁבַע — עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵלָה. שֶׁבְּחָמֵשׁ חַמָּה בְּמִזְרַח, וּבְשֶׁבַע חַמָּה בְּמַעֲרָב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: their testimony is valid, one says at five and one says at seven their testimony is void. as at five the sun in the east, and at seven the sun in the west.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Their testimony is valid. One says at five, and one says at seven - their testimony is nullified. When one says at five, the sun is in the east, and when one says at seven, the sun is in the west.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּשֶׁתִּמְצָא לוֹמַר, לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר — אֵין אָדָם טוֹעֶה וְלֹא כְּלוּם; לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — אָדָם טוֹעֶה חֲצִי שָׁעָה. לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר — אֵין אָדָם טוֹעֶה וְלֹא כְּלוּם: מַעֲשֶׂה כִּי הֲוָה, בְּמִיפַּק תַּרְתֵּי וּמְעַיֵּיל תְּלָת. וְהָא דְּקָאָמַר שְׁתַּיִם — בְּסוֹף שְׁתַּיִם, וְהָא דְּקָאָמַר שָׁלֹשׁ — בִּתְחִלַּת שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: Abaye said: When you will find say according to the statement of Rabbi Meir a person does not err at all, According to the statement of Rabbi Yehuda a person errs half an hour. According to the statement of Rabbi Meir, a person does not err at all, the incident occurred as the second ended and the third began. And this said the second the end of the second that said the third the beginning of the third
llm_translation: Abaye said: When you find a ruling to say according to the words of Rabbi Meir — a person does not err and is not at fault; according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda — a person errs for half an hour. According to the words of Rabbi Meir — a person does not err and is not at fault: There was an incident when he Rabbi Meir would bring out two and establish three. And that which he said two — at the end it is two, and that which he said three — at the beginning it is three.

hebrew_text: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — אָדָם טוֹעֶה חֲצִי שָׁעָה: מַעֲשֶׂה כִּי הֲוָה, בְּפַלְגָא דְאַרְבַּע הֲוָה, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר שָׁלֹשׁ — בְּסוֹף שָׁלֹשׁ, וְקָטָעֵי פַּלְגָא דְשַׁעְתָּא לְקַמֵּיהּ. וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר חָמֵשׁ — בִּתְחִלַּת חָמֵשׁ, וְקָטָעֵי פַּלְגָא דְשַׁעְתָּא לַאֲחוֹרֵיהּ.
human_translation: According to the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, a person errs half an hour, when incident occurred, it occurred at the midpoint of the fourth And this who says three the end of the third hour, and errs half an hour before And that who says five the beginning of the fifth and he errs half an hour after
llm_translation: According to the words of Rabbi Yehuda - a person errs half an hour: There was a case, in the middle of four, and what he says three - at the end of three, and he cuts off half an hour before it. And what he says five - at the beginning of five, and he cuts off half an hour behind it.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּשֶׁתִּמְצָא לוֹמַר, לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר — אָדָם טוֹעֶה מַשֶּׁהוּ; לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — אָדָם טוֹעֶה שָׁעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ. לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר — אָדָם טוֹעֶה מַשֶּׁהוּ: מַעֲשֶׂה כִּי הֲוָה, אוֹ בְּסוֹף שְׁתַּיִם הֲוָה אוֹ בִּתְחִלַּת שָׁלֹשׁ, וְחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ טוֹעֶה מַשֶּׁהוּ. לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — אָדָם טוֹעֶה שָׁעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ: מַעֲשֶׂה כִּי הֲוָה — אוֹ בְּסוֹף שָׁלֹשׁ אוֹ בִּתְחִלַּת חָמֵשׁ,
human_translation: Some say Abaye said: When you will find say according to Rabbi Meir a person errs a bit, according to Rabbi Yehuda a person errs an hour and a bit. According to Rabbi Meir, a person errs a bit, when incident occurred, it occurred either at the end of the second or at the beginning of the third and one of errs a bit. According to Rabbi Yehuda, a person errs an hour and a bit, when incident occurred, it occurred either at the end of the third or at the beginning of the fifth
llm_translation: There are those who say, Abaye said: When one finds himself saying according to the words of Rabbi Meir — a person makes an error momentarily; according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda — a person makes an error for a longer period and momentarily. According to the words of Rabbi Meir — a person makes an error momentarily: if the incident occurred at the end of two or at the beginning of three, and one of them is in error momentarily. According to the words of Rabbi Yehuda — a person makes an error for a longer period and momentarily: if the incident occurred at the end of three or at the beginning of five.

hebrew_text: וְחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ קָטָעֵי שָׁעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: and one of them errs an hour and a bit.
llm_translation: And one of them cut the time and prolonged it.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתְּתָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אָמַר: וּמָה אִילּוּ דָּיְיקִינַן בְּהָנֵי סָהֲדֵי, דְּהַאי דְּקָאָמַר שָׁלֹשׁ — בִּתְחִלַּת שָׁלֹשׁ, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר חָמֵשׁ — בְּסוֹף חָמֵשׁ, וְהָוְיָא עֵדוּת מוּכְחֶשֶׁת, וְלָא קָטְלִינַן, וַאֲנַן נֵיקוּם וְנִקְּטֹיל מִסְּפֵקָא?! וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְשָׁפְטוּ הָעֵדָה״ ״וְהִצִּילוּ הָעֵדָה״!
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehuda, went and said the halakha before Rava. said And were we closely examine of these witnesses that the one who says at three at the beginning of the third and the one who says at five at the end of the fifth be contradictory testimony and we would not kill and will we arise and kill on uncertainty? And the Merciful One says “And the congregation shall judge…and the congregation shall deliver”
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehuda, went to hear a lecture from Rava. He said: If we were meticulous with these witnesses, for this one who says three - at the beginning of three, and for this one who says five - at the end of five, it would be a clear testimony, and we would not kill, and we would take care of it from doubt?! And the Merciful One said: "And the congregation shall judge" "And the congregation shall save"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר — אָדָם טוֹעֶה שְׁתֵּי שָׁעוֹת חָסֵר מַשֶּׁהוּ; לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — אָדָם טוֹעֶה שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁעוֹת חָסֵר מַשֶּׁהוּ. לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר — אָדָם טוֹעֶה שְׁתֵּי שָׁעוֹת חָסֵר מַשֶּׁהוּ, מַעֲשֶׂה כִּי הֲוָה, אוֹ בִּתְחִלַּת שְׁתַּיִם אוֹ בְּסוֹף שָׁלֹשׁ, וְחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ קָטָעֵי שְׁתֵּי שָׁעוֹת חָסֵר מַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: according to the statement of Rabbi Meir, a person errs two hours less a bit; according to the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, a person errs three hours less a bit. According to the statement of Rabbi Meir, a person errs two hours less a bit. When incident occurred, either at the beginning of the second or at the end of the third and one of erred by two hours less a bit,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: According to the words of Rabbi Meir - a person errs by two hours lacking something; according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda - a person errs by three hours lacking something. According to the words of Rabbi Meir - a person errs by two hours lacking something, whether it was a case of "it happened" or at the beginning of two hours or at the end of three hours, and one of them is missing two hours.

hebrew_text: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — אָדָם טוֹעֶה שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁעוֹת חָסֵר מַשֶּׁהוּ, מַעֲשֶׂה כִּי הֲוָה אוֹ בִּתְחִלַּת שָׁלֹשׁ אוֹ בְּסוֹף חָמֵשׁ, וְחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ קָטָעֵי שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁעוֹת חָסֵר מַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: According to the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, a person errs three hours less a bit. When incident occurred, either in the beginning of the third or at the end of the fifth and one of them errs three hours less a bit.
llm_translation: According to the words of Rabbi Yehuda - a person errs three hours lacking something, whether it was at the beginning of three or at the end of five, and one of them cuts off three hours lacking something.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הָיוּ בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ בְּשֶׁבַע חֲקִירוֹת: בְּאֵיזוֹ שָׁבוּעַ, בְּאֵיזוֹ שָׁנָה, בְּאֵיזֶה חֹדֶשׁ, בְּכַמָּה בַּחֹדֶשׁ, בְּאֵיזֶה יוֹם, בְּאֵיזוֹ שָׁעָה, בְּאֵיזֶה מָקוֹם. (וְתַנְיָא:) מָה בֵּין חֲקִירוֹת לִבְדִיקוֹת? חֲקִירוֹת, אָמַר אֶחָד מֵהֶן ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ — עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה. בְּדִיקוֹת, אֲפִילּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם אוֹמְרִים ״אֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִים״ — עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת.
human_translation: We learned would examine with seven interrogation: In which seven-year in which year in which month on which of that month, on which day at which hour at which place And it was taught What is between interrogations and examinations? interrogation, one of said: I do not know, their testimony is void. examinations, even if both say: We do not know, their testimony is valid.
llm_translation: We learned: They would examine it with seven examinations: In which week, in which year, in which month, on what day of the month, at what time, in what place. (And it was taught:) What is the difference between examinations and inspections? Examinations, if one of them says, "I do not know," their testimony is nullified. Inspections, even if both of them say, "We do not know," their testimony stands.

hebrew_text: וְהָוִינַן בַּהּ: מַאי שְׁנָא חֲקִירוֹת וּמַאי שְׁנָא בְּדִיקוֹת?
human_translation: And we discussed what interrogations different and what examinations different?
llm_translation: And we were in it: What is the difference between inquiries and examinations?

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן: חֲקִירוֹת, אָמַר אֶחָד מֵהֶן ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ — עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ עֵדוּת שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲזִימָּהּ.
human_translation: And we said interrogations, one of them says: I do not know, their testimony is void, as is testimony that you cannot render as false, conspiring
llm_translation: And we say: Regarding inquiries, if one of them says, "I do not know" - their testimony is nullified, for it becomes a testimony that you cannot challenge.

hebrew_text: בְּדִיקוֹת, עֵדוּת שֶׁאַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲזִימָּהּ הִיא.
human_translation: examinations, it testimony that you can render as false, conspiring
llm_translation: In examinations, testimony that you are able to impeach it is.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ טָעֵי אִינִישׁ כּוּלֵּי הַאי, חֲקִירוֹת דְּ״אֵיזוֹ שָׁעָה״ נָמֵי עֵדוּת שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲזִימָּהּ הִיא, דְּאָמְרִי: מִטְעֵי קָטָעִינַן!
human_translation: And if you say a person errs that much, interrogations of what time is also testimony that you cannot render as false, conspiring for say: We are mistaken,
llm_translation: And if you say, "A person errs in all of this," the investigations of "at what time" are indeed a valid testimony that you cannot contradict, for they say: "We cut off the errors!"

hebrew_text: דְּיָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ כּוּלֵּי טָעוּתַיְיהוּ. לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר — יָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ מִתְּחִילַּת שָׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה עַד סוֹף חָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: that we give the entire their error. According to Rabbi Meir, we give from the beginning of the first hour until the end of the fifth
llm_translation: We gave to them all of their errors. To Rabbi Meir - we gave to him from the beginning of the first hour until the end of the fifth.

hebrew_text: וּבְדִין הוּא דְּנִיתֵּיב לְהוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא טְפֵי, אֶלָּא בֵּין יְמָמָא לְלֵילְיָא לָא טָעוּ אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: And by right we should give them even more at the beginning. However, between day and night people do not err,
llm_translation: And in judgment it is that he argued with them from the outset, but between day and night people did not err.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — יָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ מִתְּחִילַּת שָׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וְעַד סוֹף שִׁשִּׁית. וּבְדִין הוּא דְּנִיתֵּיב לְהוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא טְפֵי,
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yehuda, we give from the beginning of the first hour until the end of the sixth And by right we should give them even more at the beginning,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yehuda - we gave to him from the beginning of the first hour until the end of the sixth. And in judgment, he would argue with them from the outset more.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בֵּין יְמָמָא לְלֵילְיָא לָא טָעוּ אִינָשֵׁי. וּבְדִין הוּא דְּנִיתֵּיב לְקַמֵּיהּ טְפֵי, אֶלָּא שֶׁבְּחָמֵשׁ חַמָּה בַּמִּזְרָח, וּבְשֶׁבַע חַמָּה בַּמַּעֲרָב.
human_translation: However, between day and night people do not err, And by right we should give them even more at the end However, as at five the sun in the east and at seven the sun in the west.
llm_translation: Rather, between day and night people do not err. And in the judgment that was presented before Him, it was a surplus, but that the sun is in the east with five hours, and in the west with seven hours.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אוֹכְלִין כׇּל חָמֵשׁ, וְשׂוֹרְפִין בִּתְחִילַּת שֵׁשׁ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אוֹכְלִין כׇּל אַרְבַּע, וְתוֹלִין כׇּל חָמֵשׁ, וְשׂוֹרְפִין בִּתְחִילַּת שֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: We learned Rabbi Meir says: One eat the entire fifth and one burn at the beginning of the sixth Rabbi Yehuda says: One eat the entire fourth and places it in abeyance the entire fifth and one burns at the beginning of the sixth
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Meir says: One may eat until the fifth hour and burn at the beginning of the sixth hour. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may eat until the fourth hour, tie up until the fifth hour, and burn at the beginning of the sixth hour.

hebrew_text: לְאַבָּיֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: אֵין אָדָם טוֹעֶה וְלֹא כְּלוּם — נֵיכוֹל כּוּלַּהּ שֵׁית. וּלְהַךְ לִישָּׁנָא נָמֵי דְּאָמַר: אָדָם טוֹעֶה מַשֶּׁהוּ — נֵיכוֹל עַד סוֹף שֵׁית.
human_translation: According to Abaye’s in accordance with of Rabbi Meir, that he said a person does not err at all, let him eat the entire sixth And according to that version that said a person errs a bit, let eat until the end of the sixth
llm_translation: To Abbaye in the school of Rabbi Meir, who said: A person does not err and it is not for nothing - let him consume the entire six. And to counter this, the other sages said: If a person errs even a little - let him consume until the end of six.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: אָדָם טוֹעֶה חֲצִי שָׁעָה — נֵיכוֹל עַד פַּלְגָא דְשֵׁית. וּלְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא נָמֵי דְּאָמְרַתְּ: אָדָם טוֹעֶה שָׁעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ — נֵיכוֹל עַד סוֹף חָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: And Abaye’s in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, that he said: A person errs half an hour; let eat until the midpoint of the sixth And even according to the version that said: A person errs an hour plus a bit; let him eat until the end of the fifth
llm_translation: And Abbaye in the school of Rabbi Yehuda said: If a person errs for half an hour - he can be influenced up to half of six. And to support this, we have the following saying: If a person errs for an hour and delays - he can be influenced until the end of five.

hebrew_text: (אֶלָּא) אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: עֵדוּת מְסוּרָה לִזְרִיזִים, חָמֵץ לַכֹּל מָסוּר.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: testimony is entrusted to the vigilant. leavened bread is entrusted to all,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Testimony is entrusted to the diligent, leaven is entrusted to everyone.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: אָדָם טוֹעֶה שְׁתֵּי שָׁעוֹת חָסֵר מַשֶּׁהוּ — מִתְּחִילַּת חָמֵשׁ לָא נֵיכוֹל! חָמֵשׁ חַמָּה בַּמִּזְרָח, וְשֶׁבַע חַמָּה בַּמַּעֲרָב.
human_translation: And Rava’s in accordance with of Rabbi Meir, that he said: A person errs two hours less a bit; from the beginning of the fifth let one no eat five the sun in the east and seven the sun in the west,
llm_translation: And Rava, the son of Rabbi Meir, said: A person who makes a mistake of two hours is lacking something - from the beginning of five, we cannot! Five is the sun in the east, and seven is the sun in the west.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בְּשֵׁית נָמֵי נֵיכוֹל?! אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: שֵׁית, יוֹמָא בְּקַרְנָתָא קָאֵי.
human_translation: If so, during the sixth let him eat as well, Rav Adda bar Ahava said: sixth the day, stands at the meridian,
llm_translation: So, in this case, can we eat fat?! Rav Adda bar Ahava said: "Fat, it stands at the edge of the horn."

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: אָדָם טוֹעֶה שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁעוֹת חָסֵר מַשֶּׁהוּ — מִתְּחִילַּת אַרְבַּע לָא נֵיכוֹל! חָמֵשׁ חַמָּה בַּמִּזְרָח, וְשֶׁבַע חַמָּה בַּמַּעֲרָב. וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן אַרְבַּע. אִי הָכִי, בְּחָמֵשׁ נָמֵי נֵיכוֹל!
human_translation: And Rava’s in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, that he said: A person errs three hours less a bit; from the beginning of the fourth let one no eat five the sun in the east and at seven the sun in the west, and all the more so four If so, during the fifth let him eat as well.
llm_translation: Rava said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: A person errs three hours lacking something — from the beginning of the fourth, we cannot eat! Five hours the sun is in the east, and seven hours the sun is in the west. And certainly four. If so, with five, we can eat!

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ אַבָּיֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרָבָא: עֵדוּת מְסוּרָה לִזְרִיזִים, חָמֵץ לַכֹּל מָסוּר.
human_translation: Abaye interpreted it in accordance with of Rava: Testimony is entrusted to the vigilant, leavened bread is entrusted to all.
llm_translation: Translate the following text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Talmudic text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ אַבָּיֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרָבָא: עֵדוּת מְסוּרָה לִזְרִיזִים, חָמֵץ לַכֹּל מָסוּר. English translation: Abaye translated it in the house of Rava: Testimony is given for the diligent, leaven is given to all.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: לָאו הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אֶלָּא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: אֵין בִּיעוּר חָמֵץ אֶלָּא שְׂרֵיפָה, וִיהַבוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן שָׁעָה אַחַת לִלְקוֹט בָּהּ עֵצִים.
human_translation: And Rava said: That is not the reason of Rabbi Yehuda, Rather, Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he said: The removal of leaven only burning and the Sages provided him one hour during which to gather wood
llm_translation: Rava said: This is not the reason of Rabbi Yehuda. Rather, Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning, as he said: The removal of leaven is only by burning, and the Sages gave him one hour to gather wood.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי — שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת בִּיעוּרוֹ. אֲבָל בִּשְׁעַת בִּיעוּרוֹ — הַשְׁבָּתָתוֹ בְּכׇל דָּבָר!
human_translation: Ravina raised an objection to Rava Rabbi Yehuda said: When not at the time for its removal. However, at the time for its removal, the removal of in any manner,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rava from the following teaching of Ravina: Rabbi Yehuda said: When? - Not at the time of its selection. But at the time of its selection - its cessation in every matter!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם יוֹם הַמְעוּנָּן. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת נָמֵי לָא נֵיכוֹל! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אַרְבַּע זְמַן סְעוּדָה לַכֹּל הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: It is a decree due to a cloudy day, If so, even at fourth let one no eat Rav Pappa said: fourth is mealtime for everyone,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: It is a decree due to a cloudy day. If so, even within four hours it is not possible! Rav Papa said: Four times for a meal is for everyone.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שָׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — מַאֲכַל לוּדִים. שְׁנִיָּה — מַאֲכַל לִיסְטִין. שְׁלִישִׁית — מַאֲכַל יוֹרְשִׁין. רְבִיעִית — מַאֲכַל פּוֹעֲלִין. חֲמִישִׁית — מַאֲכַל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים. שִׁשִּׁית — מַאֲכַל כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: The Sages taught the first hour eating for Ludim , The second eating for robbers [ listin ]. The third eating for heirs, The fourth eating for workers. The fifth eating for Torah scholars. The sixth eating for all people.
llm_translation: The sages taught: The first hour - food for Ludim. The second hour - food for Lystin. The third hour - food for Yorshin. The fourth hour - food for Poalin. The fifth hour - food for disciples of sages. The sixth hour - food for all people.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: רְבִיעִית — זְמַן סְעוּדָה לְכׇל הִיא! אֶלָּא אֵיפוֹךְ: רְבִיעִית — מַאֲכַל כׇּל אָדָם, חֲמִישִׁית — מַאֲכַל פּוֹעֲלִים, שִׁשִּׁית — מַאֲכַל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: didn’t Rav Pappa say fourth is time of eating for all? Rather, reverse fourth mealtime for all people, fifth eating for workers, the sixth eating for Torah scholars.
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Papa: A quarter — a time for a meal for everyone! Rather, the opposite: A quarter — food for all people, a fifth — food for laborers, a sixth — food for Torah scholars.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, כְּזוֹרֵק אֶבֶן לַחֵמֶת. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא טָעֵים מִידֵּי בְּצַפְרָא. אֲבָל טָעֵים מִידֵּי בְּצַפְרָא — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: from forward like one who throws a stone into a bottle, Abaye said: We only said that when he did not taste anything in the morning; however, if he tasted something in the morning we have no with it.
llm_translation: From here and onwards, like one who throws a stone to a heap of grain. Abaye said: We only said this when it is not tasty from the bird's hand. But if it is tasty from the bird's hand - we do not have it.
