hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כְּמַחְלוֹקֶת בְּעֵדוּת, כָּךְ מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּחָמֵץ. פְּשִׁיטָא, הַיְינוּ הָךְ דְּאָמְרִינַן! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: שִׁינּוּיֵי דְּשַׁנִּינַן — שִׁינּוּיָא הוּא, וְלָא תֵּימָא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Like dispute with regard to testimony, so too dispute with regard to leavened bread. obvious, this is that which we said. teach us the answers that we answered, are answers. And do not say tanna’im
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Just as there is a dispute in testimony, so too there is a dispute in chametz. It is obvious, this is what we say! This is teaching us: the changes we make in what we say - that is a change, and do not say it is a teaching.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּשָׁעוֹת, אֲבָל אֶחָד אוֹמֵר קוֹדֶם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר אַחַר הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה — עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה. פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: They taught only with regard to hours However, one says before sunrise and one says after sunrise, their testimony is void. obvious
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashe said: They only disagreed regarding the hours, but one says before the rising of the sun and one says after the rising of the sun - their testimony is nullified. It is obvious!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר קוֹדֶם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר בְּתוֹךְ הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה — עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה. הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: תַּרְוַיְיהוּ חֲדָא מִילְּתָא קָאָמְרִי, וְהָא דְּקָאָמַר
human_translation: Rather, one says before sunrise and one says during sunrise, their testimony is void. That too is obvious, lest you say both of are saying one matter, and that says
llm_translation: Rather: one says before the rising of the sun, and one says at the time of the rising of the sun - their testimony is nullified. Is it not obvious? What might you have thought? They are saying the same thing, and this is what he is saying:

hebrew_text: בְּתוֹךְ הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה — בְּגִילּוּיָיא הֲוָה קָאֵי, וְזַהֲרוּרֵי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דַּחֲזָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: during sunrise he was standing in the open and mere rays of light that he saw teaches us
llm_translation: Within the rising of the sun - in its full strength it was standing, and the brightness of the world it was seeing. It is teaching us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וְנֵימָא מָר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דִּסְתַם לַן תְּנָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Rava said to Rav Naḥman: And let the Master say the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, as the tanna taught unattributed in accordance with his opinion,
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said in the name of Rav: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah. Rava said to Rav Nahman: And let the Master say the halakha is according to Rabbi Meir, for a Tanna taught it to us anonymously in accordance with his opinion.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: כׇּל שָׁעָה שֶׁמּוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל — מַאֲכִיל!
human_translation: As we learned entire time that one is permitted to eat he feeds
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: "Any time that it is permissible to eat - one may feed."

hebrew_text: הָהִיא לָאו סְתָמָא הוּא, מִשּׁוּם דְּקַשְׁיָא ״מוּתָּר״.
human_translation: That is not unattributed, due to that Permitted, difficult.
llm_translation: That case is not a simple case, because it is difficult "permitted."

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא מָר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ מַכְרִיעַ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לָאו מַכְרִיעַ הוּא, טַעַם דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And let the Master say the halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel, as he is decisor He said to him: Rabban Gamliel is not a decisor; he is stating a reason of his
llm_translation: And it was said: Master Neima rules in accordance with Rabban Gamliel, for he was decisive. He said to him: Rabban Gamliel is not decisive, the reason being that he is speaking for himself.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַב דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — מְבַעֲרִין אֶת הַכֹּל מִלִּפְנֵי הַשַּׁבָּת. וְשׂוֹרְפִין תְּרוּמוֹת טְמֵאוֹת, תְּלוּיוֹת, וּטְהוֹרוֹת. וּמְשַׁיְּירִין מִן הַטְּהוֹרוֹת מְזוֹן שְׁתֵּי סְעוּדוֹת, כְּדֵי לֶאֱכוֹל עַד אַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן יְהוּדָה אִישׁ בַּרְתּוֹתָא, שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rav said in accordance with this tanna , as it was taught the fourteenth that occurs on Shabbat, one removes everything before Shabbat, and one burns ritually impure teruma : in abeyance, and pure And one leaves from the pure food for two meals, in order to eat until four hours the statement of Rabbi Elazar ben Yehuda of Bartota, who said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rav said, as this Tanna taught, as it was taught: If fourteen meals are due to be on Shabbat - one should clear away everything before Shabbat. And one may burn impure terumot, suspended terumot, and pure terumot. And one should leave from the pure terumot food for two meals, in order to eat for up to four hours, the words of Rabbi Elazar ben Yehuda of Bartota, who said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: טְהוֹרוֹת לֹא יִשָּׂרְפוּ, שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצְאוּ לָהֶן אוֹכְלִין. אָמַר לָהֶן: כְּבָר בִּקְּשׁוּ וְלֹא מָצְאוּ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: שֶׁמָּא חוּץ לַחוֹמָה לָנוּ?
human_translation: said to him: One not burn pure perhaps those eat it will be found He said to them: They already sought and they did not find They said to him: Perhaps slept outside the wall
llm_translation: They said to him: Pure ones should not be burned, lest they find for them food. He said to them: They have already searched and not found. They said to him: Perhaps outside the wall for us?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: לְדִבְרֵיכֶם, אַף תְּלוּיוֹת לֹא יִשָּׂרְפוּ — שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וִיטַהֲרֵם. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: כְּבָר מוּבְטָח לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאֵין אֵלִיָּהוּ בָּא לֹא בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וְלֹא בְּעַרְבֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים, מִפְּנֵי הַטּוֹרַח.
human_translation: He said to According to your statement, one not even burn teruma in abeyance, perhaps Elijah will come and render it ritually pure. They said to him: the Jewish people have already been assured that Elijah will come neither on a Friday nor on the eve of a Festival, due to the exertion
llm_translation: He said to them: According to your words, even dependent offerings should not be burned - lest Elijah come and purify them. They said to him: It is already assured to the Israelites that Elijah does not come neither on the eve of Sabbaths nor on the eve of Festivals, due to the inconvenience.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ: לֹא זָזוּ מִשָּׁם עַד שֶׁקָּבְעוּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן יְהוּדָה אִישׁ בַּרְתּוֹתָא שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: They said: They did not move from there until they established the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Yehuda of Bartota, who said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: They said: They did not move from there until they established the halakha according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Judah of Bartota, who said in the name of Rabbi Joshua.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, אֲפִילּוּ לֶאֱכוֹל? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: לֹא, לְבַעֵר.
human_translation: what, is it not even to eating? Rav Pappa said in the name of Rava: No, to remove
llm_translation: What is the reason why not, even to eat? Rav Papa said in the name of Rava: No, to clarify.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבִּי סָבַר לְהָא דְּרַב נַחְמָן. דְּאָמַר רָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁהִפְקִיד דִּיסַקַּיָּא מְלֵאָה חָמֵץ אֵצֶל יוֹחָנָן חָקוֹקָאָה, וּנְקָבוּהָ עַכְבָּרִים, וְהָיָה חָמֵץ מְבַצְבֵּץ וְיוֹצֵא. וּבָא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי, שָׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה אָמַר לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן. שְׁנִיָּה, אָמַר לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן. שְׁלִישִׁית, אָמַר לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן. רְבִיעִית, אָמַר לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן. חֲמִישִׁית, אָמַר לוֹ: צֵא וּמוֹכְרֶהָ בַּשּׁוּק.
human_translation: And even Rabbi holds in accordance with this of Rav Naḥman, As Ravin bar Rav Adda said: an incident a certain person who deposited a saddlebag [ disakkayya ] filled with leavened bread with Yoḥanan Ḥakuka’a, and mice bore in and leavened bread was spilling out And he came before Rabbi the first hour said to him: Wait, the second he said to him: Wait. the third he said to him: Wait. the fourth he said to him: Wait. In the fifth he said to him: Go and sell it in the market.
llm_translation: And even Rabbi holds like that of Rav Nachman. For Ravin son of Rav Adda said: There was an incident with a certain man who entrusted a barrel full of vinegar to Yochanan the carver, and mice perforated it, and the vinegar would ooze out. And he came before Rabbi, the first hour he said to him: Wait. The second, he said to him: Wait. The third, he said to him: Wait. The fourth, he said to him: Wait. The fifth, he said to him: Go and sell it in the market.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, לְגוֹיִם — כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא, לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִי לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — נִישְׁקְלֵיהּ לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ?
human_translation: What, did not to gentiles, in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, Rav Yosef said: No, to a Jew, in accordance with Rabbi Meir Abaye said to him: If for a Jew let him take it for himself
llm_translation: What is the reason that it is not permissible for non-Jews — like Rabbi Yehuda? Rav Yosef said: No, it is not permissible for Israelites — like Rabbi Meir. Abaye said to him: If it is not permissible for Israelites — is it weighed for themselves?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם חֲשָׁדָא, דְּתַנְיָא: גַּבָּאֵי צְדָקָה שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם עֲנִיִּים לְחַלֵּק — פּוֹרְטִין לַאֲחֵרִים, וְאֵין פּוֹרְטִין לְעַצְמָן.
human_translation: due to suspicion. As it was taught Collectors of charity who have no poor people to distribute change with other and do not change it themselves,
llm_translation: Due to suspicion, as it was taught: "Rich people who have no poor to give to - they distribute to others, but do not distribute to themselves."

hebrew_text: גַּבָּאֵי תַמְחוּי, שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם עֲנִיִּים לְחַלֵּק — מוֹכְרִין לַאֲחֵרִים וְאֵין מוֹכְרִין לְעַצְמָן, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וִהְיִיתֶם נְקִיִּים מֵה׳ וּמִיִּשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: collectors of the charity plate, who do not have poor people to distribute sell to others and do not sell it to themselves, as it is stated: “And you shall be clear before God and before Israel”
llm_translation: The elders of Tamhui, who have no poor to distribute to — they sell to others and do not sell to themselves, because it is stated: "And you shall be clean from the Lord and from Israel."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה לְרַב יוֹסֵף: בְּפֵירוּשׁ אֲמַרְתְּ לַן, צֵא וּמוֹכְרֵן לַגּוֹיִם, כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana said to Rav Yosef: You told us explicitly Go and sell it to gentiles, in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Matna said to Rav Yosef: "In explanation you said to us, 'Go and sell them to the Gentiles,' like Rabbi Yehuda."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא דְּרַבִּי — כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דִּתְנַן: הַמַּפְקִיד פֵּירוֹת אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ הֵן אֲבוּדִין — לֹא יִגַּע בָּהֶן. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מוֹכְרָן בְּבֵית דִּין מִפְּנֵי הֲשָׁבַת אֲבֵידָה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: In accordance with whose is that halakha which was taught by Rabbi in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as we learned one who deposits produce with another, even if ruined he not touch them. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: sell them in court, due to restore lost property.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: To whom does this teaching of Rabbi go according to? It goes according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as we learned: One who entrusts his fruits to his fellow, even if they are lost, he should not touch them. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: They should be sold by the court due to the concern of loss on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְלָאו אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַב יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Wasn’t it stated with regard to that Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: taught only
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And it was not said about it, Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rav Yoḥanan: They only taught except

hebrew_text: בִּכְדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן, אֲבָל יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן — מוֹכְרָן בְּבֵית דִּין. וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן הָכָא, דְּהָא פְּסִידִי לִגְמָרֵי.
human_translation: their decrease at the standard However, their decrease beyond the standard one sells them in court; and all the more so here, as entirely lost.
llm_translation: In the amount of their loss, but more than the amount of their loss - they sell them in court. And all the more so here, for it is a complete loss.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שְׁתֵּי חַלּוֹת כּוּ׳. תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה ״עַל גַּב הָאִיצְטְבָא״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי לְהַצְנִיעָן הוּא צָרִיךְ?! תְּנִי ״עַל גַּג הָאִיצְטְבָא״.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: Two loaves tanna taught before Rav Yehuda: on [ al gav ] the bench He said to him: And does he need to conceal them? teach On the roof of [ al gag ] the colonnade,
llm_translation: And furthermore said Rabbi Yehuda two loaves like. Taught a Tanna before Rabbi Yehuda "on the top of the Istaba." He said to him: Is it necessary to hide them?! Teach "on the roof of the Istaba."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַחֲבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הַר הַבַּיִת סְטָיו כָּפוּל הָיָה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַר הַבַּיִת סְטָיו כָּפוּל הָיָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִיסְטְווֹנִית הָיְתָה נִקְרֵאת — סְטָיו לְפָנִים מִסְּטָיו.
human_translation: Raḥava said Rabbi Yehuda said: The Temple Mount was a double colonnade, That was also taught Rabbi Yehuda says was called an istevanit a colonnade within a colonnade.
llm_translation: Rahava said, Rabbi Yehuda said: The Temple Mount was doubled. It was taught in a baraita likewise: The Temple Mount was doubled. Rabbi Yehuda says: It was called "Istavonit" - its foundation was from its foundation.

hebrew_text: פְּסוּלוֹת וְכוּ׳. אַמַּאי פְּסוּלוֹת? אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהָיוּ מְרוּבּוֹת — נִפְסָלוֹת בְּלִינָה. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מְבִיאִין תּוֹדָה בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת, מִפְּנֵי חָמֵץ שֶׁבָּהּ.
human_translation: disqualified. Why they disqualified? Rabbi Ḥanina said: Since are numerous, are disqualified by left overnight. as it was taught One not bring a thanks-offering on the festival of Passover due to the leavened bread with it,
llm_translation: Invalidating and so forth. Why are they invalid? Rabbi Chanina said: Because they were mostly mixed — they are invalidated by the minority. As it was taught: One does not bring a thanksgiving offering on the Festival of Matzot, because of the leaven it contains.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: הָכָא בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר עָסְקִינַן, וְקָסָבַר: אֵין מְבִיאִין קָדָשִׁים לְבֵית הַפְּסוּל.
human_translation: obvious Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Here we are dealing with the fourteenth and maintains: One not bring consecrated to situation the disqualification.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Peshita? Amar Rav Adda Bar Ahava: Haka be'arba'ah asar oskinan, ve'kasavar: Ein mevi'in kodashim le'veit hap'sul. English translation: Obvious? Rav Adda Bar Ahava said: Here we are dealing with fourteen cases, and he holds: One does not bring holy items to an invalid house.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר מַיְיתֵי לְהוּ, וּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהֵן מְרוּבּוֹת — נִפְסָלוֹת בְּלִינָה.
human_translation: And everyone brought them on the thirteenth And since are numerous, they are disqualified by left overnight,
llm_translation: And all the people of the world in thirteen bring to him, and from among them the majority - disqualified in the night.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמְרוּ: כְּשֵׁירוֹת הָיוּ, וְאֶלָּא אַמַּאי קָרֵי לְהוּ פְּסוּלוֹת — שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁחַט עֲלֵיהֶן הַזֶּבַח. וְנִשְׁחוֹט! שֶׁאָבַד הַזֶּבַח.
human_translation: They said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: were not disqualified Rather, why did call them disqualified? that no offering was slaughtered together them And let us slaughter where the offering was lost.
llm_translation: From the statement of Rabbi Yannai they said: When they were singing, and if not, why are they called "invalid"? Because the sacrifice was not slaughtered on them. And if they were slaughtered! The sacrifice is lost.

hebrew_text: וְנַיְיתֵי זֶבַח אַחֵר וְנִשְׁחוֹט! דְּאָמַר: ״זוֹ תּוֹדָה וְזוֹ לַחְמָהּ״, וְכִדְרַבָּה. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: אָבַד הַלֶּחֶם — מֵבִיא לֶחֶם אַחֵר, אָבְדָה תּוֹדָה — אֵין מֵבִיא תּוֹדָה אַחֶרֶת. מַאי טַעְמָא — לֶחֶם גְּלַל תּוֹדָה, וְאֵין תּוֹדָה גְּלַל לֶחֶם.
human_translation: And let us bring another sacrifice and let them slaughter where said: This is a thanks-offering and these are its loaves. and in accordance with Rabba, as Rabba said: the loaf lost, brings another loaf the thanks-offering was lost not bring another thanks-offering. What is the reason The loaves due to the thanks-offering but the thanks-offering is not brought on account of the loaves.
llm_translation: And he will bring another sacrifice and it will be slaughtered! As it was said: "This is the thanksgiving offering and this is its bread," in accordance with Rabba. For Rabba said: If the bread is lost - one brings other bread, if the thanksgiving offering is lost - one does not bring another thanksgiving offering. What is the reason? - The bread is for the sake of the thanksgiving offering, and the thanksgiving offering is not for the sake of the bread.

hebrew_text: וְנִיפְרְקִינְהוּ וְנַפְּקִינְהוּ לְחוּלִּין! אֶלָּא: לְעוֹלָם שֶׁנִּשְׁחַט עֲלֵיהֶן הַזֶּבַח וְנִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם.
human_translation: And let us redeem and render them non-sacred, Rather, actually where the offering was slaughtered over them, but blood spilled
llm_translation: And we will separate them and take them out for common use! Rather: Indeed, the sacrifice was slaughtered upon them, and the blood was poured out.

hebrew_text: וּכְמַאן — כְּרַבִּי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי: שְׁנֵי דְבָרִים הַמַּתִּירִין — מַעֲלִין זֶה בְּלֹא זֶה. דְּתַנְיָא: כִּבְשֵׂי עֲצֶרֶת אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶת הַלֶּחֶם אֶלָּא בִּשְׁחִיטָה. כֵּיצַד? שְׁחָטָן לִשְׁמָן וְזָרַק דָּמָן לִשְׁמָן — קִידֵּשׁ הַלֶּחֶם.
human_translation: And in accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi as Rabbi said: Each two factors permitting elevates without the other. as it was taught The lambs sacrificed Assembly, consecrate the loaves only by slaughter. How so? one slaughtered for their sake, and sprinkled their blood for their sake, the loaves are consecrated.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And according to whom? According to Rabbi. For Rabbi said: Two things that permit, one may elevate this without that. As it was taught: The lambs of the festival may only be sanctified through slaughter. How so? One slaughters them for their own sake and throws their blood for their own sake - he sanctified the bread.

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטָן שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָן וְזָרַק דָּמָן שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָן — לֹא קִידֵּשׁ הַלֶּחֶם. שְׁחָטָן לִשְׁמָן וְזָרַק דָּמָן שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָן — לֶחֶם קָדוֹשׁ וְאֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי.
human_translation: one slaughtered them not for their sake, and sprinkled their blood not for their sake, the loaves are not consecrated, one slaughtered them for their sake, and he sprinkled their blood not for their sake, the loaves are consecrated but they are not consecrated the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: The slaughterer who slaughters not for its sake and throws its blood not for its sake - he did not sanctify the bread. The slaughterer who slaughters for its sake and throws its blood not for its sake - it is holy bread and it is not holy, the words of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ הַלֶּחֶם, עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁחוֹט לִשְׁמָן וְיִזְרוֹק דָּמָן לִשְׁמָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Actually, the loaves are consecrated only when one slaughters for their sake and sprinkles their blood for their sake,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says: Always not holy the bread, until he slaughters for its fat and he throws their blood for its fat.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּתְקַבֵּל הַדָּם בְּכוֹס וְנִשְׁפַּךְ,
human_translation: Even you say Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, with what are we dealing here? where the blood was received in the cup and it spilled
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, here we are dealing with what? For example, when the blood was received in a cup and spilled.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר לֵיהּ כַּאֲבוּהּ, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הָעוֹמֵד לִזְרוֹק כְּזָרוּק דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, holds in accordance with his father, who stated any that is about to be sprinkled is like had been sprinkled.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon holds like his father-in-law, for he said: "Anyone who stands to cast a stone is considered as if he cast it already."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא, מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמְרוּ: כְּשֵׁירוֹת הָיוּ. כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמּוּנָּחוֹת — כׇּל הָעָם אוֹכְלִין. נִיטְּלָה אַחַת מֵהֶן — תּוֹלִין; לֹא אוֹכְלִין וְלֹא שׂוֹרְפִין. נִיטְּלוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן — הִתְחִילוּ כּוּלָּן שׂוֹרְפִין.
human_translation: It was taught they said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: were fit. As long as were placed the entire nation eat one of was taken to place in abeyance, neither eat nor burn both of were taken they all began burning
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Elazar: They were fit. As long as they were resting - all the people would eat. If one of them was removed - they are suspended; they do not eat and do not burn. If both of them were removed - they all began to burn.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: It was taught Abba Shaul says:
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Abba Sha'ul says:

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי פָרוֹת הָיוּ חוֹרְשׁוֹת בְּהַר הַמִּשְׁחָה. כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁשְּׁתֵּיהֶן חוֹרְשׁוֹת — כׇּל הָעָם אוֹכְלִין. נִיטֶּלֶת אַחַת מֵהֶן — תּוֹלִין; לֹא אוֹכְלִין וְלֹא שׂוֹרְפִין. נִיטְּלוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן — הִתְחִילוּ כׇּל הָעָם שׂוֹרְפִין.
human_translation: Two cows would plow on the Mount of Olives As long as both of them are plowing, the entire nation eat one of is taken to place in abeyance, neither eat nor burn both of them were taken the entire nation began burning
llm_translation: Two cows were plowing on Mount Mishcha. As long as both of them were plowing - all the people may eat. If one of them was removed - they are suspended; neither eating nor burning. If both of them were removed - all the people began burning.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים אוֹמֵר: מִימֵיהֶם שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים לֹא נִמְנְעוּ מִלִּשְׂרוֹף אֶת הַבָּשָׂר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בִּוְולַד הַטּוּמְאָה עִם הַבָּשָׂר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמּוֹסִיפִין טוּמְאָה עַל טוּמְאָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina the deputy High Priest says: In the days of the priests, they did not refrain from burning meat that became ritually impure by a secondary source of ritual impurity, with meat that became ritually impure by a primary source of impurity. even though they add impurity to impurity
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Chanina, deputy of the priests, says: From the days of the priests, they were not prevented from burning the flesh that became impure through contact with the impurity of a corpse together with the flesh that became impure through contact with the father of the impurity, even though impurity is added to its impurity.

hebrew_text: הוֹסִיף רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְאָמַר: מִימֵיהֶם שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים לֹא נִמְנְעוּ מִלְּהַדְלִיק אֶת הַשֶּׁמֶן שֶׁנִּפְסַל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם בְּנֵר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בִּטְמֵא מֵת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמּוֹסִיפִין טוּמְאָה עַל טוּמְאָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva added and said: In the days of the priests, they did not refrain from lighting oil that was disqualified by one who immersed himself during that day in a lamp that became ritually impure through ritually impure a corpse. even though they add impurity to impurity
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva added and said: From the days of the Kohanim, they were not prevented from kindling the oil that became disqualified through immersion on a day-old lamp that became impure through contact with a corpse, even though they are adding impurity upon its impurity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם לָמַדְנוּ שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפִין תְּרוּמָה טְהוֹרָה עִם הַטְּמֵאָה בַּפֶּסַח. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֵינָהּ הִיא הַמִּדָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said: From their statements we learned that one burn ritually pure teruma with impure on Passover Rabbi Yosei said: That is not the inference
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: From their words we learned that we burn pure terumah with impure terumah on Passover. Rabbi Yosei said: This is not the measure.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדִים רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפִין זוֹ לְעַצְמָהּ וְזוֹ לְעַצְמָהּ. עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל הַתְּלוּיָה וְעַל הַטְּמֵאָה. שֶׁרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: תִּשָּׂרֵף זוֹ לְעַצְמָהּ וְזוֹ לְעַצְמָהּ, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּיהֶן כְּאַחַת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua, concede that one burns this by itself and that by itself. With regard to what did they disagree? with regard to in abeyance, and impure as Rabbi Eliezer says: This should be burned by itself, and that should be burned by itself; and Rabbi Yehoshua says: both of them as one.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua agree that they burn this one separately and this one separately. What do they disagree about? They disagree about the hanging of the animal and about the impurity. For Rabbi Eliezer says: This one should be burned separately and this one should be burned separately, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: Both of them together.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִכְּדֵי בָּשָׂר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בִּוְולַד הַטּוּמְאָה מַאי הָוֵי — שֵׁנִי, כִּי שָׂרֵיף לֵיהּ בַּהֲדֵי בָּשָׂר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה מַאי הָוֵי — שֵׁנִי,
human_translation: Now what is meat that became ritually impure by a secondary source of impurity? second- When one burns with meat that became ritually impure by a primary source of ritual impurity, what is second-
llm_translation: Gemar, from the time of the flesh that became impure in the womb of impurity, what is it? - Repeat, for he burns it with the flesh that became impure in the father of impurity, what is it? - Repeat.

hebrew_text: שֵׁנִי וְשֵׁנִי הוּא. מַאי מוֹסִיף לוֹ טוּמְאָה עַל טוּמְאָתוֹ אִיכָּא?
human_translation: is second- and second- what is there adding impurity to its impurity
llm_translation: Two and two it is. What does he add to it, impurity upon his impurity, is there?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכָא בִּוְולַד וְולַד עָסְקִינַן, דְּהָוֵי לֵיהּ שְׁלִישִׁי, וְקָסָבַר שְׁלִישִׁי מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: here we are dealing with secondary source of a secondary source of ritual impurity, as is third- And maintains it is permitted to render second- third-
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Here we are dealing with a case of "bivlad v'vlad," for it would be considered a third generation, and he holds that a third generation is permitted to be made into a second.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֵין אוֹכֶל מְטַמֵּא אוֹכֶל! דְּתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל יְהֵא אוֹכֶל מְטַמֵּא אוֹכֶל, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִי יֻתַּן מַיִם עַל זֶרַע וְנָפַל מִנִּבְלָתָם עָלָיו טָמֵא הוּא״ — הוּא טָמֵא, וְאֵין עוֹשֶׂה כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ טָמֵא.
human_translation: Isn’t food does not transmit ritual impurity to food, as it was taught might food transmits impurity to food; the verse states: “And if water is placed upon the seed, and any of a carcass falls upon it, it is impure” It, is impure, but it does not render similar impure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And this one does not eat that which makes impure, eat! As it was taught: Could it be that one may eat that which makes impure, eat? The Scripture states: 'And if water be put upon seed, and part of their carcass fall upon it, it is impure.' — It is impure, and one does not make a similar inference regarding it being impure."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְאַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּחוּלִּין, אֲבָל בִּתְרוּמָה וְקׇדָשִׁים — עוֹשֶׂה כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ.
human_translation: This well according to Abaye, who said: They taught only with regard to non-sacred however, with regard to teruma and consecrated transmits it renders similar to it
llm_translation: He left it to Abbaye, for he said: They only taught this regarding common things, but with regard to terumah and holy items - one may do as one pleases.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא נָמֵי דְּאָמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא חוּלִּין וּתְרוּמָה, אֲבָל בְּקָדָשִׁים — עוֹשֶׂה כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן, שַׁפִּיר.
human_translation: And also according to Rav Adda bar Ahava in the name of Rava, who said: They taught only with regard to non-sacred and teruma ; however, with regard to consecrated transmits it renders similar to it well.
llm_translation: And for Rav Adda bar Ahava from the name of Rava also said: They only taught regarding ordinary items and terumah, but with regards to holy items - one may do as one pleases with them, it is fine.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרָבִינָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא דְּאָמַר: מִקְרָא מָלֵא דִּיבֵּר הַכָּתוּב, לָא שְׁנָא חוּלִּין, לָא שְׁנָא תְּרוּמָה, לָא שְׁנָא קָדָשִׁים — אֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ. מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: However, according to Ravina in the name of Rava, who said: The Torah stated a categorical verse, no different non-sacred no different teruma , and no different consecrated does not render similar to it what can be said
llm_translation: Instead, for Ravina in the name of Rava who said: When the verse speaks explicitly, it is no different whether it is regarding ordinary matters, terumah, or holy items — it does not make a difference. What can be said about this?

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן? דְּאִיכָּא מַשְׁקִין בַּהֲדֵי בָּשָׂר, דְּקָא מִיטַּמֵּא מֵחֲמַת מַשְׁקִין.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where there are liquids with the meat it becomes impure due to the liquid.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? That there is a mixture of liquids with meat, which causes the meat to become impure due to the liquids.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַאי ״עִם הַבָּשָׂר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה״ — ״עִם הַבָּשָׂר וּמַשְׁקִין״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא: נְהִי דְּאֵין אוֹכֶל מְטַמֵּא אוֹכֶל מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מִדְּרַבָּנַן מִיהוּ מְטַמֵּא.
human_translation: If so, this With meat that became ritually impure by a primary source of impurity, should have With meat and liquids, Rather, Although food does not transmit impurity to food by Torah law, in any event, by rabbinic law, transmits impurity
llm_translation: If so, this, "With the flesh that became impure through the father of impurity" - "With the flesh and liquids" it requires! Rather, since one who does not eat can render impure from a Rabbinic standpoint.

hebrew_text: הוֹסִיף רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִימֵיהֶן שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים לֹא נִמְנְעוּ מִלְּהַדְלִיק כּוּ׳. מִכְּדֵי שֶׁמֶן שֶׁנִּפְסַל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם מַאי הָוֵי — שְׁלִישִׁי. וְכִי מַדְלֵיק לֵיהּ בְּנֵר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בִּטְמֵא מֵת מַאי הָוֵי — שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva added: In the days of the priests, they did not refrain from lighting Now what is oil that was disqualified by one who immersed himself during that day? third- And when he lights it in a lamp that was rendered ritually impure through ritually impure a corpse, what is second-
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva added: From the days of the Kohanim, they were not prevented from lighting the Menorah. Since oil that became disqualified through immersion on the day before, what is it considered - the third day. And if one lights it with a candle that became impure through contact with a corpse, what is it considered - the second day.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — שְׁלִישִׁי מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ שֵׁנִי, הַיְינוּ הָךְ?! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכָא בְּנֵר שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת עָסְקִינַן, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר:
human_translation: what is teaching us third- it is permitted to render it second- this is that Rav Yehuda said: Here, we are dealing with a metal lamp, As the Merciful One states:
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? — The third day it is permitted to do the second, is that so?! Rav Yehudah said: Here we are dealing with a metal lamp, as the Merciful One said:

hebrew_text: ״בַּחֲלַל חֶרֶב״. חֶרֶב הֲרֵי הוּא כֶּחָלָל. וְהָוְיָא לַיהּ אַב הַטּוּמְאָה, וְקָסָבַר שְׁלִישִׁי מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: one who is slain with a sword sword is like one who is slain. and this is a primary source of impurity. And maintains it is permitted to render third- first-
llm_translation: "In the space of a sword." A sword is like a void. And it is analogous to the father of impurity, and he holds that the third generation is permitted to be like the first.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי דּוּחְקֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה לְאוֹקְמֵיהּ בְּנֵר שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת, נוֹקְמֵיהּ בְּנֵר שֶׁל חֶרֶס,
human_translation: And what impelled Rav Yehuda to establish of a metal lamp? Let him establish it of an earthenware lamp.
llm_translation: And what is the reason that Rav Yehudah was insistent to establish it with a lamp of metal, he established it with a lamp of earthenware.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״הוֹסִיף״ — דְּאִילּוּ הָתָם טָמֵא וְטָמֵא, וְאִילּוּ הָכָא פָּסוּל וְטָמֵא!
human_translation: And what does add? Whereas there, ritually impure impure here, disqualified impure.
llm_translation: And what is "added" - for if there, impure and impure, and if here, disqualified and impure!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, מַתְנִיתִין קְשִׁיתֵיהּ: מַאי אִירְיָא דְּתָנֵי נֵר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בִּטְמֵא מֵת? נִיתְנֵי שֶׁנִּטְמָא בְּשֶׁרֶץ!
human_translation: Rava said: The mishna was difficult for Why specifically teach a lamp that became ritually impure through ritually impure a corpse? Let it teach that became impure by a creeping animal,
llm_translation: Rava said, the Mishnah is difficult: What is the case of teaching "a lamp that became impure through impurity of a corpse"? It should have taught "that became impure through a creeping thing"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁחֲלוּקָה טוּמְאָתוֹ בֵּין טוּמְאַת מֵת לְשֶׁרֶץ — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה מַתֶּכֶת.
human_translation: Rather, what is the substance which a distinction between its impurity impurity a corpse creeping animal? You must say is metal.
llm_translation: Rather: What is a matter that its impurity is divided between the impurity of a corpse and the impurity of a creeping thing? One should say this is metal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ קָסָבַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין לְטַמֵּא אֲחֵרִים דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּרַבָּנַן, מִכְּדִי הַאי נֵר מַאי קָא מַהְנְיָא לְהַאי שֶׁמֶן, אִי לְאִיפְּסוֹלֵי גּוּפֵיהּ — הָא פְּסִיל וְקָאֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: Learn from Rabbi Akiva holds: The ritual impurity of liquids to transmitting impurity to other by Torah law, As, if it enters your mind by rabbinic law, now, this lamp, what effect does have on that oil? If disqualify itself, it is disqualified from the outset.
llm_translation: Rava said, hear from it, it is the opinion of Rabbi Akiva: The impurity of liquids is to render others impure by Torah law. For if according to your opinion, it is the lamp that benefits from this oil, if not to disqualify its own body — this is a graven image and it stands.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא לְטַמֵּא אֲחֵרִים מִדְּרַבָּנַן. אִי מִדְּרַבָּנַן, מַאי אִירְיָא בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה? אֲפִילּוּ בְּרִאשׁוֹן וְשֵׁנִי נָמֵי תְּחִלָּה הָוֵי!
human_translation: From where Perhaps to transmit ritual impurity to other by rabbinic law. If by rabbinic law, why particularly by a primary source of impurity? even with first- or second- too, is first-
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps to make others impure according to the Rabbis. If according to the Rabbis, what is the matter with the father of impurity? Even in the first and second instances, it is considered primary!

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: כׇּל הַפּוֹסֵל אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה — מְטַמֵּא מַשְׁקִין לִהְיוֹת תְּחִלָּה, חוּץ מִטְּבוּל יוֹם.
human_translation: As we learned Any disqualifies teruma , transmits impurity to liquids, first- except who immersed himself during that day
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: Anyone who disqualifies the terumah - renders liquids impure to begin with, except for one who has immersed that day.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, learn from is by Torah law.
llm_translation: Rather, hear from it, that it is from the Torah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם לָמַדְנוּ וְכוּ׳. מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם דְּמַאן? אִילֵימָא מִדִּבְרֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים, מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם טָמֵא וְטָמֵא, הָכָא טָהוֹר וְטָמֵא!
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said: From their statements we learned From whose statements If you say from the statement of Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy High Priest, is comparable There, ritually impure and ritually impure here, pure and impure
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said, "From their words we have learned, etc." Whose words are considered "theirs"? If you say the words of Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests, who is comparable? There, in the case of the priests, whether impure or impure, but here in our case, whether pure or impure!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מִדִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם פָּסוּל וְטָמֵא, הָכָא טָהוֹר וְטָמֵא!
human_translation: But rather, from the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Is it comparable There, disqualified impure here, pure impure
llm_translation: And rather it is from the words of Rabbi Akiva. Who is similar? There it was invalid and impure, here it is pure and impure!

hebrew_text: נֵימָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר מַתְנִיתִין בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא וְולַד הַטּוּמְאָה דְּרַבָּנַן, דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא טָהוֹר מְעַלְּיָא.
human_translation: Let us say Rabbi Meir maintains the mishna to a primary source of impurity by Torah law and a secondary source of impurity by rabbinic law, which by Torah law is entirely pure.
llm_translation: Nayma, Rabbi Meir holds: Mishnaic teaching regarding the primary source of impurity from the Torah and the derivative source of impurity from the Rabbis, for from the Torah it is pure above.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם״ — מִדִּבְרֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים.
human_translation: And what From their statements? From the statement of Rabbi Ḥanina the deputy High Priest.
llm_translation: "And what is 'from their words' - from the words of Rabbi Chanina, deputy of the priests."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא: מַתְנִיתִין בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא וְולַד הַטּוּמְאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמַאי ״מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם״, מִדִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of bar Kappara: The mishna a primary source of ritual impurity by Torah law and a secondary source of impurity by Torah law. And what From their statements? From the statements of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of Bar Kappara: Mishnaic teachings regarding the primary source of ritual impurity by Torah law and the offspring of ritual impurity by Torah law. And what is meant by "from their words"? From the words of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: הֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ? אִילֵּימָא הָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דִּתְנַן: חָבִית שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנּוֹלַד לָהּ סְפֵק טוּמְאָה, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה מוּנַּחַת בִּמְקוֹם הַתּוּרְפָּה, יַנִּיחֶנָּה בְּמָקוֹם הַמּוּצְנָע, וְאִם הָיְתָה מְגוּלָּה — יְכַסֶּנָּה.
human_translation: which Rabbi Yehoshua If you say this Rabbi Yehoshua, as we learned a barrel of teruma with regard to which uncertainty developed impurity, Rabbi Eliezer says If was resting in a vulnerable place, one place it in a concealed place, and if it was exposed, he cover it.
llm_translation: Be it that Rabbi Yehoshua? Perhaps this is Rabbi Yehoshua as we learned: A barrel of terumah that a doubt of impurity arose regarding it, Rabbi Eliezer says: If it was placed in a prominent location, it should be placed in a hidden location, and if it was uncovered - it should be covered.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה מוּנַּחַת בְּמָקוֹם הַמּוּצְנָע — יַנִּיחֶנָּה בִּמְקוֹם הַתּוּרְפָּה, וְאִם הָיְתָה מְכוּסָּה — יְגַלֶּנָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: if it was placed in a concealed place, place it in a vulnerable place And if it was covered, he expose it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: If it was placed in a hidden place - let it be placed in an exposed place, and if it was covered - uncover it.

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם — גְּרָמָא בְּעָלְמָא. הָכָא — בְּיָדַיִם!
human_translation: Is comparable There, mere causation Here, impure with hands.
llm_translation: Who is similar? There — cause in general. Here — by hands!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דִּתְנַן: חָבִית שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה בַּגַּת הָעֶלְיוֹנָה, וְתַחְתּוֹנָה חוּלִּין טְמֵאִין,
human_translation: Rather, this Rabbi Yehoshua. As we learned a barrel of teruma that broke in the upper winepress, and impure, non-sacred lower
llm_translation: Rather, this is what Rabbi Yehoshua taught: A barrel of terumah that broke in the upper winepress, and its lower part is hullin, it is ritually impure.

hebrew_text: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שֶׁאִם יָכוֹל לְהַצִּיל מִמֶּנָּה רְבִיעִית בְּטׇהֳרָה — יַצִּיל. וְאִם לָאו, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: תֵּרֵד וְתִטָּמֵא, וְאַל יְטַמְּאֶנָּה בַּיָּד. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אַף יְטַמְּאֶנָּה בַּיָּד.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua concede that if one is able to rescue a quarter- from in ritual purity, he rescue And one cannot Rabbi Eliezer says: descend and become impure but one not render it impure with hand. Rabbi Yehoshua says: One even render it impure with hand.
llm_translation: Rebbe Eliezer concedes, and Rebbe Yehoshua, that if one can save a fourth of a log from it in purity, he should save it. But if not, Rebbe Eliezer says: Let it descend and become impure, but do not make it impure with your hand. Rebbe Yehoshua says: Even make it impure with your hand.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַאי ״מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם״, ״מִדְּבָרָיו״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: If so, this From their statements, should have From his statement,
llm_translation: If so, this "from their words," "from His words" is required of it!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: מִמַּחְלוֹקְתָּן שֶׁל רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לָמַדְנוּ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי: דְּקָתָנֵי ״מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: this is is saying: We learned from the dispute between Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua. is also precise, as teaches: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua concede. learn from it
llm_translation: So it is stated: From their dispute, between Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Joshua, we have learned. Specifically, it is taught: "Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Joshua agree." This is the conclusion.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ, מַתְנִיתִין בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא וְולַד הַטּוּמְאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. וּמַאי ״מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם״ — מִדִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: And likewise, Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: The mishna a primary source of ritual impurity by Torah law and a secondary source of impurity by Torah law. And what From their statements? from the statements Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua
llm_translation: And so said Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuh, Mishna in the father of impurity of the Torah and offspring of impurity of the Torah. And what is "from their words" - from the words of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Joshua.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֵין הַנָּדוֹן דּוֹמֶה לִרְאָיָה, שֶׁכְּשֶׁהֵעִידוּ רַבּוֹתֵינוּ, עַל מָה הֵעִידוּ — אִם עַל הַבָּשָׂר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בִּוְולַד הַטּוּמְאָה שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפִין אוֹתוֹ עִם הַבָּשָׂר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה, זֶה טָמֵא וְזֶה טָמֵא.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman Rabbi Yosei said The conclusion is not similar to the proof. When the Sages testified, about what did they testify? If about the meat that became ritually impure through a secondary source of impurity, that one burn it with the meat that became impure through a primary source of impurity. this is impure and that is impure.
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman. Rabbi Yosei said: The testimony is not like the observation, for when our Rabbis testified, what did they testify about? If it was about the flesh that became impure in the womb of impurity that is burned together with the flesh that became impure in the father of impurity, this one is impure and that one is impure.

hebrew_text: אִם עַל הַשֶּׁמֶן שֶׁנִּפְסַל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם שֶׁמַּדְלִיקִין אוֹתוֹ בְּנֵר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בִּטְמֵא מֵת, זֶה פָּסוּל וְזֶה טָמֵא. אַף אָנוּ מוֹדִים בִּתְרוּמָה שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת בִּוְולַד הַטּוּמְאָה, שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפִין אוֹתָהּ עִם הַתְּרוּמָה שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: If about oil that was disqualified by one who immersed himself during that day, that one may kindle it in a lamp that became ritually impure through ritually impure a corpse. this is disqualified and that is impure. We also concede with regard to teruma that became impure through a secondary source of impurity that one burn it with teruma that became impure through a primary source of impurity.
llm_translation: If on the oil that became disqualified in immersion on the day that they kindle it, or on the lamp that became impure in impurity of a corpse, this one is disqualified and this one is impure. We also agree regarding terumah that became impure through the offspring of impurity, that we burn it together with the terumah that became impure through the father of impurity.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הֵיאַךְ נִשְׂרֹף הַתְּלוּיָה עִם הַטְּמֵאָה? שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וִיטַהֲרֶנָּה!
human_translation: However, how will we burn in abeyance, with ritually impure Perhaps Elijah will come and he will render it ritually pure.
llm_translation: But how is the hanging sacrifice burned with the impure sacrifice? Perhaps Elijah will come and purify it!

hebrew_text: הַפִּיגּוּל וְהַנּוֹתָר וְהַטָּמֵא — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין נִשְׂרָפִין כְּאַחַת. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נִשְׂרָפִין כְּאַחַת.
human_translation: Piggul and notar ritually impure Beit Shammai say: They not be burned together, And Beit Hillel say: They be burned together.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "The piggul, the notar, and the tamei — Beit Shammai say: they are not burned together. And Beit Hillel say: they are burned together."

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ רַבִּי מֵאִיר מִדִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ קָאָמַר, אַמַּאי מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִדְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לָאו אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ, דְּהוּא סָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר מִדְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים קָאָמַר לֵיהּ, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ קָאָמֵינָא,
human_translation: And if it enters your mind Rabbi Meir is saying from the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua, why does Rabbi Yosei respond to him from the statement of Rabbi Ḥanina the deputy High Priest? Rav Naḥman said to him: Rabbi Yosei not in mind, As maintains Rabbi Meir is saying to him from Rabbi Ḥanina the deputy High Priest, and said to him: I am stating from Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind, Rabbi Meir from the words of Rabbi Yehoshua is saying, why does Rabbi Yosei honor Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests? Rav Nachman said to him: Rabbi Yosei does not hold that way, that Rabbi Meir from Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests, is saying to him, and he said to him: I am speaking from the words of Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ נָמֵי אֵינָהּ הִיא הַמִּדָּה, דְּהָא מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שֶׁשּׂוֹרֵף זוֹ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ וְזוֹ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: And said to And even according to Rabbi Yehoshua, that is not the inference as Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua concede that one burn this by itself and that by itself,
llm_translation: He said to him: Even according to Rabbi Yehoshua, indeed it is not the measure, for Rabbi Eliezer concedes, and Rabbi Yehoshua, that if one burns this one separately and that one separately.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי אֵינָהּ הִיא הַמִּדָּה? מִדָּה וּמִדָּה הִיא!
human_translation: But why That is not the inference is legitimate inference.
llm_translation: And why is it not the measure? It is the measure and the measure it is!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִיכָּא הֶפְסֵד חוּלִּין.
human_translation: there, is different, as there is loss of non-sacred
llm_translation: The difference there is that there is a loss of secular property.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יִרְמְיָה: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי אִיכָּא הֶפְסֵד דְּעֵצִים! אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא סָבָא: לְהֶפְסֵד מְרוּבֶּה — חָשְׁשׁוּ, לְהֶפְסֵד מוּעָט — לֹא חָשְׁשׁוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya strongly objects to this the mishna, too, there is loss of wood, A certain Elder said to him: were concerned about a great loss; they were not concerned about minimal loss
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Yirmiyah: Mishnaic text, is there a loss of trees! Said to him that elder: For a significant loss - they were concerned, for a minor loss - they were not concerned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּשֵׁשׁ, אֲבָל בְּשֶׁבַע — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל שׂוֹרְפִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: dispute to sixth However, in seventh everyone agrees one burn
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan: Dispute in six, but in seven - all agree they burn.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי אַסִּי: נֵימָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַתְנִיתִין בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא וְולַד הַטּוּמְאָה דְּרַבָּנַן, וּמַאי ״מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם״ — מִדִּבְרֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Asi: Let us say Rabbi Yoḥanan maintains the mishna to a primary source of impurity by Torah law and a secondary source of impurity by rabbinic law. And what From their statements? from the statement of Rabbi Ḥanina the deputy High Priest,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Assi: Let us say that Rabbi Yochanan holds that the Mishnah regarding the father of impurity is from the Torah, and the offspring of impurity is from the Rabbis. And what is "from their words" - the words of Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַתְנִיתִין בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא וְולַד הַטּוּמְאָה דְּרַבָּנַן, וּמַאי ״מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם״ — מִדִּבְרֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים. וּמַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֵׁשׁ, אֲבָל בְּשֶׁבַע — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל שׂוֹרְפִין.
human_translation: said to him: Yes, It was also stated Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The mishna to a primary source of impurity by Torah law and a secondary source of impurity by rabbinic law. And what From their statements? from the statement of Rabbi Ḥanina the deputy High Priest. And the dispute to sixth However, everyone agrees in seventh one burn
llm_translation: He said to him: No. It was also stated, Rabbi Yochanan said: The Mishnah regarding the primary source of impurity is from the Torah, and the Mishnah regarding the derivative source of impurity is from the Rabbis. And what is meant by "from their words" - the words of Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests. And the dispute is in six, but in seven - everyone agrees that they are burned.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הַפִּיגּוּל וְהַנּוֹתָר וְהַטָּמֵא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין נִשְׂרָפִין כְּאַחַת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נִשְׂרָפִין כְּאַחַת.
human_translation: Let us say supports piggul , notar , and ritually impure Beit Shammai say: They not be burned together, and Beit Hillel say: They be burned together.
llm_translation: Let us say it supports him: the forbidden fat, the leftover offering, and the impure, Beit Shammai say: they are not burned together, and Beit Hillel say: they are burned together.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם: דְּאִית לְהוּ טוּמְאָה מִדְּרַבָּנַן. דִּתְנַן: הַפִּיגּוּל וְהַנּוֹתָר מְטַמְּאִין אֶת הַיָּדַיִם.
human_translation: It is different there, are ritually impure by rabbinic law, As we learned Piggul and notar , render hands impure
llm_translation: The difference there is that there is a Rabbinic impurity. For it was taught: Pigul and Notar render the hands impure.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הַפַּת שֶׁעִיפְּשָׁה וְנִפְסְלָה מִלֶּאֱכוֹל לְאָדָם, וְהַכֶּלֶב יָכוֹל לְאׇכְלָהּ — מְטַמְּאָה טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין בִּכְבֵיצָה, וְנִשְׂרֶפֶת עִם הַטְּמֵאָה בַּפֶּסַח.
human_translation: Let us say supports bread that became moldy and is no longer fit for a person to eat, but a dog can eat it, become impure the ritual impurity of food of an egg-bulk, it is burned with impure on Passover
llm_translation: Let us say it supports him: The bread that was crumbled and disqualified from being eaten by a person, and a dog is able to eat it - it imparts impurity of food in a kevaitz vessel, and it is burned with the impure one on Passover.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּעַפְרָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: It is different there, as it is mere dust,
llm_translation: The matter there is that it is mere dust.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי מוֹדֶה? הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דְּמֵיקֵל, כִּי מֵיקֵל — בִּתְלוּיָה וּטְמֵאָה, אֲבָל בִּטְהוֹרָה וּטְמֵאָה — לָא.
human_translation: If so, why concedes this is Rabbi Yosei is saying to Rabbi Meir: Even according to Rabbi Yehoshua, rules leniently when he rules leniently with regard to in abeyance with impure however, to pure and impure no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, what does he concede? Thus said Rabbi Yosei to Rabbi Meir: Even according to Rabbi Yehoshua who is lenient, when he is lenient - it is dependent and impure, but with pure and impure - no.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי אֵינָהּ הִיא הַמִּדָּה? מִדָּה וּמִדָּה הִיא!
human_translation: If so, why That is not the inference is legitimate inference.
llm_translation: If so, why is it not the measure? It is the measure and the measure it is!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: הָכָא בְּבָשָׂר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בְּמַשְׁקִין שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ מֵחֲמַת שֶׁרֶץ, וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְטַעְמֵיהּ וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְטַעְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: Here, to meat that became ritually impure by means of liquids that became impure due to a creeping animal And Rabbi Meir conforms to his reasoning, and Rabbi Yosei to his reasoning.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: Here in flesh that became impure through liquids that became impure due to a creeping thing, and Rabbi Meir agrees with his reasoning and Rabbi Yosei agrees with his reasoning.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין לְטַמֵּא אֲחֵרִים דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir to his reasoning as he said: The ritual impurity of liquids to transmitting impurity to other by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir according to his reasoning, as he said: The impurity of liquids to render others impure is Rabbinic.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין לְטַמֵּא אֲחֵרִים דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei to his reasoning, as he said: The ritual impurity of liquids to transmitting impurity to other by Torah law. As it was taught
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei according to his reasoning, as he said: The impurity of liquids is to render others impure by Torah law. As it was taught:

hebrew_text: סְפֵק מַשְׁקִין לִיטָּמֵא — טָמֵא. לְטַמֵּא אֲחֵרִים — טָהוֹר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר כִּדְבָרָיו. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לַכֹּל טָמֵא.
human_translation: uncertainty liquid has become ritually impure, impure. to rendering other impure, pure, the statements of Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi Elazar would say likewise in accordance with his statements. Rabbi Yehuda says: impure in all
llm_translation: Doubtful liquids to become impure — impure. To make others impure — pure, the words of Rabbi Meir. And so too Rabbi Elazar would say in accordance with his words. Rabbi Yehuda says: For all cases impure.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: לָאוֹכָלִין טְמֵאִין, לְכֵלִים טְהוֹרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: to foods, impure, to vessels, pure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: "Regarding food, impure; regarding utensils, pure."

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַשְׁקִין אִית לְהוּ טוּמְאָה בָּעוֹלָם? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֵין טוּמְאָה לְמַשְׁקִין כׇּל עִיקָּר. תֵּדַע, שֶׁהֲרֵי הֵעִיד (יוֹסֵף) בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר אִישׁ צְרֵידָה עַל אֵיל קַמְצָא דְּכַן, וְעַל מַשְׁקִין בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא דְּכַן!
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar maintain liquids have ritual impurity at all? Wasn’t taught Rabbi Elazar says: There is no impurity for liquids at all Know as Yosei ben Yo’ezer of Tzereida testified about eil kamtza kosher and about liquids the slaughterhouse ritually pure,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar thought: Do liquids have impurity in the world? And it was taught, Rabbi Elazar says: There is no impurity for liquids at all. You should know, for Joseph ben Yo'ezer of Zeredah testified concerning the ramp of the altar and concerning the liquids of the Temple kitchen!

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר דְּכַן מִלְּטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אֲחֵרִים, אֲבָל טוּמְאַת עַצְמָן יֵשׁ לָהֶן — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְרַב, דְּאָמַר דְּכַן מַמָּשׁ — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This well according to Shmuel, who said ritually pure transmit impurity to other however, they themselves become impure. However, according to Rav, who said that actually ritually pure what can be said?
llm_translation: He left it for Shmuel, for he said that it is indeed effective to transmit the impurity of others, but as for their own impurity, they have it — it is fine. Rather, according to Rav, who said that it is truly so — what can be said?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אַחֲדָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: with regard to one
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Aḥada.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״כִּדְבָרָיו״ קָאָמַר, דִּנְפִישִׁי. וְעוֹד, וְהָא ״וְכֵן״ קָתָנֵי! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: But isn’t saying: in accordance with statements, that many? And furthermore, is teaching: Likewise. difficult
llm_translation: And this, "as his words," he said, is difficult. And furthermore, and this, "and so," it teaches! It is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, רַב אָמַר: דְּכַן מַמָּשׁ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: דְּכַן מִלְּטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אֲחֵרִים, אֲבָל טוּמְאַת עַצְמָן יֵשׁ לָהֶן. רַב אָמַר דְּכַן מַמָּשׁ, קָסָבַר טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין דְּרַבָּנַן, וְכִי גְּזַרוּ רַבָּנַן — בְּמַשְׁקִין דְּעָלְמָא, וּבְמַשְׁקִין בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא — לָא גְּזוּר.
human_translation: the itself. Rav said: actually ritually pure And Shmuel said ritually pure transmit impurity to other however, they themselves become impure. Rav said actually pure, he maintains the ritual impurity of liquids by rabbinic law, and when the Sages issued decree to ordinary liquids. to the liquids of the slaughterhouse they did not issue decree.
llm_translation: The body, Rav said: really so. And Shmuel said: really to prevent the impurity of others, but they have their own impurity. Rav said: really so, he holds the impurity of liquids is Rabbinic, and when did the Rabbis decree? In regular liquids, and in liquids of the slaughterhouse — they did not decree.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: דְּכַן מִלְּטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אֲחֵרִים, אֲבָל טוּמְאַת עַצְמָן יֵשׁ לָהֶן. קָסָבַר טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין עַצְמָן דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, לְטַמֵּא אֲחֵרִים — דְּרַבָּנַן, וְכִי גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן — בְּמַשְׁקִין דְּעָלְמָא, בְּמַשְׁקִין בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא — לָא גְּזוּר. וְכִי לָא גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן — לְטַמּוֹיֵי אֲחֵרִים, אֲבָל טוּמְאַת עַצְמָן יֵשׁ לָהֶן.
human_translation: And Shmuel said ritually pure transmit impurity to other however, they themselves become impure, maintains ritual impurity of liquids by Torah law, to transmit impurity to other by rabbinic law. And when the Sages issued decree, to ordinary liquids. to the liquids of the slaughterhouse they did not issue decree. And when the Sages did not issue decree to transmit impurity to other however, their own impurity they become
llm_translation: Samuel said: Indeed, to purify the impurity of others, but they have their own impurity. He holds that the impurity of liquids is from the Torah, to render others impure — this is Rabbinic, and is it a Rabbinic decree — with regular liquids, with liquids of a slaughterhouse — it is not a decree. And if it is not a Rabbinic decree — it is for the purification of others, but they have their own impurity.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא לִבְרֵיהּ: כִּי עָיְילַתְּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, רְמִי לֵיהּ: מִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל דְּכַן מִלְּטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אֲחֵרִים, אֲבָל טוּמְאַת עַצְמָן יֵשׁ לָהֶן? קְרִי כָּאן: ״וְהַבָּשָׂר אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בְּכׇל טָמֵא לֹא יֵאָכֵל״.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana said to his son: When you enter before Rav Pappa, raise contradiction before him: Did Shmuel say ritually pure transmit impurity to other but they themselves are impurity? Read here “And the flesh that touches anything impure shall not be eaten;
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna the son of Chinena said to his son: "When you go before Rav Papa, cite to him: Who said that Shmuel agrees that one can become impure through contact with others' impurity, but their own impurity they do not have? It is written here: 'And the flesh that touches any impure thing shall not be eaten.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַרְבִיעִי בַּקֹּדֶשׁ. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: רְבִיעִי בַּקֹּדֶשׁ לָא אִיקְּרִי טָמֵא, הַאי אִיקְּרִי טָמֵא! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: just as it is of fourth- in a consecrated Rav Ashi strongly objects to this Fourth- in consecrated is not called impure; this is called impure. difficult.
llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: Since he was a fourth in the Holy. Rav Ashe objected to him: A fourth in the Holy is not called impure, but this one is called impure! It is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְכׇל מַשְׁקֶה אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁתֶה בְּכׇל כְּלִי יִטְמָא״! מַאי ״יִטְמָא״ — הֶכְשֵׁיר.
human_translation: Come hear: “And all drink that may be drunk in any vessel shall be impure” What is Shall be impure, renders susceptible
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And any liquid that shall be drunk in any vessel shall become unclean'! What is 'shall become unclean' — it is fit."

hebrew_text: הֶכְשֵׁיר — מֵרֵישָׁא דִקְרָא שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ, ״מִכׇּל הָאֹכֶל אֲשֶׁר יֵאָכֵל וְגוֹ׳״! חַד בִּתְלוּשִׁין, וְחַד בִּמְחוּבָּרִין.
human_translation: renders susceptible you learned from the beginning of verse: “From all food that may be eaten, One to detached and one to attached
llm_translation: הֶכְשֵׁיר — "fit" — from the beginning of the verse you heard, "Of all the food that may be eaten, etc." One in a state of separation, and one in a state of connection.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בִּתְלוּשִׁין — מִשּׁוּם דְּאַחְשְׁבִינְהוּ, אֲבָל מְחוּבָּרִין — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And are necessary, As, had taught us of detached due to that he ascribed significance to However, attached not
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear a case regarding detached items — it is considered as if we calculate them, but if they are attached items — I would say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא מְחוּבָּרִין — מִשּׁוּם דְּקָיְימִי בְּדוּכְתַּיְיהוּ חֲשִׁיבִי, אֲבָל תְּלוּשִׁין — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכִי.
human_translation: And had taught of attached due to that it stands in its place is significant; however, detached say no, not necessary
llm_translation: "And if you will say they are connected - because they are established in their place, it is considered. But if they are separate - I might say no, it is necessary."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״אַךְ מַעְיָן וּבוֹר מִקְוֵה מַיִם יִהְיֶה טָהוֹר״. מַאי ״יִהְיֶה טָהוֹר״ — מִטּוּמְאָתוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear: “However, a spring or a cistern, a gathering of water shall be pure, What is “Shall be pure”? from his ritual impurity,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: 'Ach mayan u'vor mikveh mayim yihyeh tahor.' Mai 'yihyeh tahor' — mitumato." English translation: Come and hear: "Only a spring or a cistern, a gathering of water, shall be pure." What is meant by "shall be pure" — from its impurity.

hebrew_text: וּתְלוּשִׁין מִי מַכְשִׁירִין? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַשְׁקִין בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא לֹא דַּיָּין שֶׁהֵן דְּכַן, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: attached And does detached render susceptible Didn’t Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, say: liquids of the slaughterhouse not only are they pure, neither do they render susceptible
llm_translation: And hanging utensils, who makes them fit? And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: The liquids of the kitchen do not render utensils like wine does, but they do not make utensils fit.

hebrew_text: תַּירְגְּמָא עַל דָּם, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִנַּיִן לְדַם קָדָשִׁים שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַכְשִׁיר — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל הָאָרֶץ תִּשְׁפְּכֶנּוּ כַּמָּיִם״, דָּם שֶׁנִּשְׁפָּךְ כַּמַּיִם — מַכְשִׁיר,
human_translation: Explain this to blood. As Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: From where with regard to blood of consecrated that it does not render susceptible As it is stated: you shall pour it upon the earth like water” Blood that is poured like water, renders susceptible
llm_translation: Interpretation of blood, as Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: From where do we derive that the blood of holy offerings that does not render them unfit? It is stated: "You shall pour it out on the ground like water" (Deuteronomy 12:16). Blood that is poured out like water renders them fit.

hebrew_text: דָּם שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִשְׁפָּךְ כַּמַּיִם — אֵינוֹ מַכְשִׁיר. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי: הֲרֵי דַּם הַתַּמְצִית — דְּנִשְׁפָּךְ כַּמַּיִם, וְאֵינוֹ מַכְשִׁיר!
human_translation: blood that is not poured out like water does not render susceptible Rav Shmuel bar Ami strongly objects to this: There is blood squeezed which is poured like water, And does not render susceptible
llm_translation: Blood that does not spill like water - is not valid. Rav Shmuel bar Ammi objects to her: Behold, the blood of the essence - that spills like water, and is not valid!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: הַנַּח לְדַם הַתַּמְצִית, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּחוּלִּין נָמֵי לָא מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to him: Leave the blood squeezed as even from non-sacred does not render susceptible either.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Zeira: Leave for the blood of the essence, for even in non-sacred items it does not render unfit.

hebrew_text: קַבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי, דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״רַק חֲזַק לְבִלְתִּי אֲכֹל הַדָּם כִּי הַדָּם הוּא הַנָּפֶשׁ״, דָּם שֶׁהַנֶּפֶשׁ יוֹצְאָה בּוֹ — קָרוּי דָּם, דָּם שֶׁאֵין הַנֶּפֶשׁ יוֹצְאָה בּוֹ — אֵינוֹ קָרוּי דָּם.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Ami accepted this from As the Merciful One states: “Only be strong not to eat the blood; for the blood is the soul” Blood the soul leaves is called blood; blood the soul leave is not called blood.
llm_translation: Acceptance from him Rav Shmuel son of Ammi, as he said: The Merciful One said: "Only be strong not to eat the blood, for the blood is the soul," blood from which the soul departs - is called blood, blood from which the soul does not depart - is not called blood.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דָּם שֶׁנִּטְמָא וּזְרָקוֹ, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — הוּרְצָה, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא הוּרְצָה. מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר אִישׁ צְרֵידָה.
human_translation: Come hear: blood that became ritually impure, and sprinkled it unwittingly, is accepted. intentionally, is not accepted. by rabbinic law, and not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben Yo’ezer of Tzereida,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Blood that became impure and was sprinkled, if it was done unintentionally — it is accepted; if it was done intentionally — it is not accepted. This is the opinion of the Rabbis, and not like Rabbi Yosei ben Yo'ezer of Tzreidah.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: עַל מָה הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה — עַל הַדָּם וְעַל הַבָּשָׂר וְעַל הַחֵלֶב שֶׁנִּטְמָא, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, בֵּין בְּאוֹנֶס בֵּין בְּרָצוֹן, בֵּין בְּיָחִיד בֵּין בְּצִבּוּר.
human_translation: Come hear: For what does the frontplate atone for the blood, and for the meat, and for the fat that became impure, whether unwittingly or intentionally, whether due to beyond control or willfully, whether of an individual or of a community.
llm_translation: Come and hear: For what is the he-goat atoning? — For the blood, and for the flesh, and for the fat that became impure, whether unintentionally or intentionally, whether by force or willingly, whether by an individual or by the congregation.

hebrew_text: מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּדְלָא (כְּיוֹסֵף) בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר אִישׁ צְרֵידָה.
human_translation: by rabbinic law, and is not in accordance with Yosei ben Yo’ezer of Tzereida,
llm_translation: From the sages, and not like Yosef ben Yo'ezer Ish Tzreida.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְנָשָׂא אַהֲרֹן אֶת עֲוֹן הַקֳּדָשִׁים״.
human_translation: Come hear and Aaron shall bear the sin committed with the consecrated
llm_translation: תָּא שְׁמַע: "And Aharon shall bear the iniquity of the holy things."

hebrew_text: וְכִי אֵיזֶה עָוֹן הוּא נוֹשֵׂא? אִם עֲוֹן פִּיגּוּל — הֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא יֵרָצֶה״. אִם עֲוֹן נוֹתָר — הֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא יֵחָשֵׁב״.
human_translation: And Which sin does it bear? If the sin of piggul , it is already stated: it shall not be accepted” If notar , it is already stated: neither shall it be credited
llm_translation: "And what sin does he bear? If it is the sin of Pigul - behold, it is already stated 'it shall not be accepted.' If it is the sin of Nosar - behold, it is already stated 'it shall not be accounted.'"

hebrew_text: הָא אֵינוֹ נוֹשֵׂא אֶלָּא עֲוֹן טוּמְאָה שֶׁהוּתְּרָה מִכְּלָלָהּ בְּצִיבּוּר. מַאי לָאו, טוּמְאַת דָּם? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא, טוּמְאַת קְמָצִים.
human_translation: bears only the sin of impurity as was exempted from its general of the community. What, does not impure blood Rav Pappa said: No, the impurity of handfuls
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the provided Talmudic text: Talmudic text: "Ha einu nosei ela avon tum'ah shehutrah mikelalaha betzibbur. Mai lav, tum'at dam? Amar Rav Papa: La, tum'at kematzim." English translation: "This one only carries the sin of impurity that was permitted from its general category in the community. What is the reason? Is it not the impurity of blood? Rav Papa said: No, it is the impurity of dough offerings."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״הֵן יִשָּׂא אִישׁ בְּשַׂר קֹדֶשׁ בִּכְנַף בִּגְדוֹ וְנָגַע בִּכְנָפוֹ אֶל הַלֶּחֶם וְאֶל הַנָּזִיד וְאֶל הַיַּיִן וְאֶל שֶׁמֶן וְאֶל כׇּל מַאֲכָל הֲיִקְדָּשׁ וַיַּעֲנוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים וַיֹּאמְרוּ לֹא (יִקְדָּשׁ)״.
human_translation: Come hear If a person bears hallowed flesh in the corner of his garment, and with his garment he touches bread, or stew, or wine, or oil, or any food, shall it be sacred? And the priests answered and said: No”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: 'hen yisa ish besar kodesh b'kinaf bigdo v'naga b'knafu el ha'lechem v'el ha'nazid v'el ha'yayin v'el shemen v'el kol ma'achal ha'yikdash vaya'anu hakohanim vayomru lo (yikdash).'" English translation: "Come and hear: 'If a man carries holy flesh in the corner of his garment and his garment touches bread, stew, wine, oil, or any food, will it become holy?' The priests answered and said, 'No, it will not become holy.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב: אִישְׁתַּבֻּשׁ כָּהֲנֵי. מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא אֶלָּא לְרַב? רַב ״מַשְׁקֵי בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא״ תָּנֵי, אֲבָל מַשְׁקֵי בֵּי מַדְבְּחַיָּא — מְטַמֵּא.
human_translation: And Rav said: The priests erred This is reasonable only to Rav, Rav teaches the liquids of the slaughterhouse, However, the liquids of the chamber of the altar, become impure.
llm_translation: And Rav said: The priests became confused. Is it not from him the reason, but for Rav? Rav taught: "Those who drink in the house of slaughter" he taught, but those who drink in the house of tanning - they are impure.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, רַב אָמַר: אִישְׁתַּבֻּשׁ כָּהֲנֵי, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לָא אִישְׁתַּבֻּשׁ כָּהֲנֵי.
human_translation: the itself. Rav said: The priests erred, And Shmuel said: The priests did not err.
llm_translation: The body, Rav said: "The Kohanim should sit," and Shmuel said: "The Kohanim should not sit."

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: אִישְׁתַּבֻּשׁ כָּהֲנֵי — רְבִיעִי בַּקֹּדֶשׁ בְּעָא מִינַּיְיהוּ, וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ טָהוֹר.
human_translation: Rav said the priests erred, raised the dilemma before them consecrated fourth- And the priests said to him pure,
llm_translation: Rav said: If the Kohanim became mixed up - the fourth in holiness inquired about them, and they said to him, "Pure."

hebrew_text: ושְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לָא אִישְׁתַּבֻּשׁ כָּהֲנֵי — חֲמִישִׁי בַּקֹּדֶשׁ בְּעָא מִינַּיְיהוּ, וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: טָהוֹר.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: The priests did not err, raised the dilemma before them consecrated fifth- And said to him pure.
llm_translation: Samuel said: "If the priests did not dress in the proper priestly garments, he is the fifth in holiness. When he inquired about them, they said to him: 'He is pure.'"

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב אַרְבְּעָה: לֶחֶם וְנָזִיד וְיַיִן וָשֶׁמֶן. אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל, חַמְשָׁה מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Granted, to Rav, that is four that are written Bread, stew, wine, and oil, However, to Shmuel, from where does he five
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rav, this is what is written: four - bread, cooked dish, wine, and oil. But according to Shmuel, does he not count five?

hebrew_text: מִי כְּתִיב ״וְנָגַע כְּנָפוֹ״? ״וְנָגַע בִּכְנָפוֹ״ כְּתִיב — בְּמַה שֶּׁנָּגַע בִּכְנָפוֹ.
human_translation: Is it written And its corner touched It is written “And it touched the corner of his garment,” with that touched the corner of his garment.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is it written "and he shall touch his wing"? "And he shall touch in his wing" is written - with that which he touched in his wing.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וַיֹּאמֶר חַגַּי אִם יִגַּע טְמֵא נֶפֶשׁ בְּכׇל אֵלֶּה הֲיִטְמָא וַיַּעֲנוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים וַיֹּאמְרוּ יִטְמָא״. בִּשְׁלָמָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל, מִדְּהָכָא לָא אִישְׁתַּבֻּשׁ — הָתָם נָמֵי לָא אִישְׁתַּבֻּשׁ. אֶלָּא לְרַב, מַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּאִישְׁתַּבֻּשׁ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם דְּלָא אִישְׁתַּבֻּשׁ?
human_translation: Come hear: “And Haggai said: If one who is impure with a corpse touches any of these, shall he be impure? And the priests answered and said: He shall be impure” Granted, to Shmuel, from here, did not err, there too they did not err. However, to Rav, what is different here, that erred, and what is different there, that they did not err?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And Haggai said, If one who is unclean by a dead body touch any of these, shall it be unclean? And the priests answered and said, It shall be unclean.'" Granted, according to Shmuel, from here it is not inferred - there, indeed, it is not inferred. But according to Rav, what is the difference here that it is not inferred, and what is the difference there that it is not inferred?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: בְּקִיאִין הֵן בְּטוּמְאַת מֵת, וְאֵין בְּקִיאִין הֵן בְּטוּמְאַת שֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: were experts with regard to ritual impurity a corpse, they were not experts with regard to the impurity of a creeping animal.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: They are knowledgeable in the impurity of a corpse, but they are not knowledgeable in the impurity of a creeping thing.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: הָתָם רְבִיעִי, הָכָא שְׁלִישִׁי.
human_translation: Ravina said There, fourth- here, third-
llm_translation: Ravina said: There it is the fourth day, here it is the third day.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וַיַּעַן חַגַּי וַיֹּאמֶר כֵּן הָעָם הַזֶּה וְכֵן הַגּוֹי הַזֶּה לְפָנַי נְאֻם ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״טָמֵא״. אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל, אַמַּאי טָמֵא?
human_translation: Come hear “And Haggai answered and said: So is this people, and so is this nation before me, said God; Granted, to Rav that is that it is written: impure,” However, to Shmuel, why ritually impure?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And Haggai answered and said, "So is this people, and so is this nation before Me," says the Lord, etc.'" Granted according to Rav, that is why it is written 'unclean.' But according to Shmuel, why 'unclean'? English translation:

hebrew_text: אַיתְמוֹהֵי קָא מַתְמַהּ. וְהָא ״וְכֵן כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה יְדֵיהֶם״ כְּתִיב! אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אָשֵׁי: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁקִּלְקְלוּ אֶת מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם — מַעֲלֶה עֲלֵיהֶם הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ הִקְרִיבוּ בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: is bewilderment: But isn’t it written “And so is all the work of their hands,” Mar Zutra, and some say Rav Ashi, said: Since they corrupted their deeds the verse ascribes to them as if they sacrificed offerings in impurity.
llm_translation: The students were perplexed. But isn't it written, "And so all the work of their hands"? Said Mar Zutra and some say Rav Ashi: Because they messed up their deeds, the Scripture considers it as if they offered sacrifices in a state of impurity.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. רַב תָּנֵי ״מַשְׁקֵי בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא״, וְלֵוִי תָּנֵא ״מַשְׁקֵי בֵּי מַדְבְּחַיָּא״.
human_translation: the itself. Rav teaches the liquids of the slaughterhouse, and Levi taught the liquids of the altar,
llm_translation: Body. Rav teaches "mashkei beit matbechayya," and Levi teaches "mashkei bei madbechayya."

hebrew_text: לְלֵוִי, הָנִיחָא אִי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ כִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר: ״דְּכַן״ מִלְּטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אֲחֵרִים אֲבָל טוּמְאַת עַצְמָן יֵשׁ לָהֶן — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דְּנָגְעִי כּוּלְּהוּ בְּרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: According to Levi, this well if he holds in accordance with Shmuel, who said ritually pure transmit impurity to other but they themselves become impure. you find all made contact
llm_translation: Levi, he left it if it seems to him like Shmuel, for he said: "Thus" to become impure the impurity of others but their own impurity they have — he forgets to him that touches all of them at first.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי סָבַר לֵיהּ כְּרַב, דְּאָמַר: ״דְּכַן״ מַמָּשׁ — הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לָהּ? עַל כׇּרְחָךְ כִּשְׁמוּאֵל סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
