human_translation: However, holds in accordance with Rav actually ritually pure, under what circumstances can be found? perforce he holds in accordance with Shmuel
llm_translation: Rather, if he holds like Rav, who said: "literally" - how does he find support for it? Surely, Shmuel must be of the opinion.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל, הָנִיחָא אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב, דְּתָנֵי: ״מַשְׁקֵי בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא״ אֲבָל מַשְׁקֵי בֵּי מַדְבְּחַיָּא — אַחֲרִינֵי נָמֵי מְיטַמְּאוּ, רְבִיעִי הוּא דְּלָא עָבֵיד חֲמִישִׁי, הָא שְׁלִישִׁי — עָבֵיד רְבִיעִי.
human_translation: And to Shmuel, this well if he holds in accordance with Rav, who taught the liquids of the slaughterhouse, but the other liquids of the altar transmit impurity as well. it is fourth- that does not render fifth- renders fourth-
llm_translation: To Samuel, he left it. If he thought like Rav, for it teaches: "The drinks of the kitchen" but the drinks of the slaughterhouse - others are defiled after them, it is the fourth that does not make the fifth, this is the third - it makes the fourth.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי סָבַר לֵיהּ כְּלֵוִי, דְּתָנֵי: ״מַשְׁקֵי בֵּי מַדְבְּחַיָּא״, מַאי אִירְיָא רְבִיעִי דְּלָא עָבֵיד חֲמִישִׁי? אֲפִילּוּ שֵׁנִי וּשְׁלִישִׁי נָמֵי לָא עָבְדִי! עַל כׇּרְחָיךְ כְּרַב סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: However, if he holds in accordance with Levi, who taught the liquids of the altar, why specifically fourth- does not render fifth- do not render second- and third- perforce he holds in accordance with Rav
llm_translation: Rather, if he thinks it is absorbed, as it teaches: "The drinks of the butchers' house," what is the difference of the fourth that the fifth does not do? Even the second and third also do not do! Certainly, according to the majority, he thinks so.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּלֵוִי. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּלֵוִי: הַדָּם וְהַיַּיִן וְהַשֶּׁמֶן וְהַמַּיִם, מַשְׁקֵי בֵּי מַדְבְּחַיָּא שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ בִּפְנִים וְהוֹצִיאָן לַחוּץ — טְהוֹרִין. נִטְמְאוּ בַּחוּץ וְהִכְנִיסָן בִּפְנִים — טְמֵאִין.
human_translation: it was taught in accordance with Rav, it was taught in accordance with Levi. It was taught in accordance with Levi: the blood, the wine, the oil, and the water, liquids of the altar that became ritually impure inside and took them outside, they are pure if they became impure outside and took them inside they are impure
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav, it was taught in accordance with the opinion of Levi. It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Levi: blood, wine, oil, and water, the beverages of the butchers' households that became impure inside and were taken outside - they are pure. If they became impure outside and were brought inside - they are impure.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַשְׁקֵי בֵּי מַדְבְּחַיָּא לֹא אָמְרוּ דְּכַן אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹמָן. מַאי לָאו — לְמַעוֹטֵי נִטְמְאוּ בִּפְנִים וְהוֹצִיאָן לַחוּץ! לָא, לְמַעוֹטֵי נִטְמְאוּ בַּחוּץ וְהִכְנִיסָן בִּפְנִים.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: the liquids of the altar, said they are ritually pure only in their place. What, does not to exclude liquids that became impure inside and took them outside, No, to exclude that became impure outside and brought them inside.
llm_translation: I?! And didn't Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: The members of the slaughterhouse did not say so except in their place. What is the reason? — To exclude cases where they became impure inside and took them outside! No, to exclude cases where they became impure outside and brought them inside.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״בִּמְקוֹמָן״ קָאָמַר! הָכִי קָאָמַר: לֹא אָמְרוּ דְּכַן — אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ בִּמְקוֹמָן.
human_translation: Didn’t say: In their place, this is is saying: said they are pure only to those that became impure in their place,
llm_translation: "And here 'bimkomam' he said! This is what he said: They did not say so - rather that they became impure in their place."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב: הַדָּם וְהַמַּיִם מַשְׁקֵי בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ בֵּין בְּכֵלִים בֵּין בְּקַרְקַע — טְהוֹרִין.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rav: The blood and the water, the liquids of the slaughterhouse, that became ritually impure, whether in vessels or on the ground, are pure.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav: Blood and water that were drawn from the slaughterhouse, whether they became impure in vessels or on the ground - are pure.

hebrew_text: (רַבָּן) שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בְּכֵלִים טְמֵאִין, בְּקַרְקַע טְהוֹרִין.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon says: in vessels, ritually impure; in the ground, ritually pure,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon says: In vessels impure, in the ground pure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — מַשְׁקֵי בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא הִלְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן לְרַב פָּפָּא: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אֵין טוּמְאָה לְמַשְׁקִין כׇּל עִיקָּר, תֵּדַע, שֶׁהֲרֵי הֵעִיד (יוֹסֵף) בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר אִישׁ צְרֵידָה עַל מַשְׁקֵי בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא דְּכַן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Even according to the one who says the ritual impurity of liquids by Torah law, the liquids of the slaughterhouse is a halakha learned through tradition. Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said to Rav Pappa: But that which Rabbi Eliezer said: There is no impurity for liquids at all know as Yosei ben Yo’ezer of Tzereida testified about liquids the slaughterhouse ritually pure.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even according to the one who says that the impurity of liquids is from the Torah - the impurity of the kitchen utensils is a tradition. Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said to Rav Papa: But didn't Rabbi Eliezer say: There is no impurity of liquids at all? Know that Yosef ben Yo'ezer, the man of Zeredah, testified regarding the kitchen utensils of the kitchen in this manner.

hebrew_text: וְאִי הִלְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ — מִי גָּמְרִינַן מִינַּהּ?
human_translation: And if they learned a halakha through tradition, do we derive from it?
llm_translation: And if the halakha is learned from her - who learned from her?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְהָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: לְכֵלִים טְהוֹרִין, לָאוֹכָלִין טְמֵאִין.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi, Isn’t it Rabbi Shimon, who said the ritual impurity of liquids by Torah law? As it was taught Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: to vessels are pure, to foods impure,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: But didn't Rabbi Shimon say that the impurity of liquids is from the Torah, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: For vessels, they are pure; for foods, they are impure.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא קָאָמַר (רַבָּן) שִׁמְעוֹן: בְּכֵלִים טְמֵאִין, בְּקַרְקַע טְהוֹרִין. וְאִי הִלְכְתָא הִיא, מָה לִי בְּכֵלִים מָה לִי בְּקַרְקַע? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: And here, Rabban Shimon said: in vessels are ritually impure, in the ground are pure. And if is a halakha what is to me in vessels what is to me in the ground? difficult
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here Rabban Shimon is saying: With vessels that have become impure, they remain impure; with the ground itself, it remains pure. And if it is a halacha, what do I need with vessels, what do I need with the ground? It is difficult."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ בְּקַרְקַע טְהוֹרִין — לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מַיִם, אֲבָל דָּם — לֹא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: That you said, are ritually pure in the ground, taught only water, but blood, no,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: This that you said regarding pure ground - they only taught about water, but blood - no.

hebrew_text: וּמַיִם נָמֵי לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּהָוֵי רְבִיעִית, דְּחָזֵי לְהַטְבִּיל בֵּיהּ מְחָטִין וְצִינּוֹרוֹת. אֲבָל לָא הָוֵי רְבִיעִית — טְמֵאִין.
human_translation: And even water, we said only when it is a quarter- which is a suitable in which to immerse needles and hooks. However, is less than a quarter- ritually impure
llm_translation: And water that is stagnant, did we not say except that it is a fourth of a log, for it is fit for dipping needles and tubes in it. But if it is not a fourth of a log — it is impure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לַכֹּל טָמֵא. לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת כֵּלִים דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא?
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi Yehuda says: impure in all Is that to say that Rabbi Yehuda maintains the impurity liquids to transmit impurity to vessels by Torah law?
llm_translation: Master said, Rabbi Yehuda says: For all impure. To say that Rabbi Yehuda holds impurity of liquids to impurify the impurity of vessels from the Torah?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אֲחוֹרַיִם וָתוֹךְ, כְּגוֹן הַכָּרִים וְהַכְּסָתוֹת וְהַשַּׂקִּין וְהַמַּרְצוּפִין, נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ, נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ — לֹא נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn all vessels that have an exterior and an interior such as cushions, blankets, sacks, and leather sacks, interior of became ritually impure, its exterior is impure its exterior became impure, its interior is not impure,
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: All vessels that have an interior and an exterior, such as bowls, covers, sacks, and mats, if their interior becomes impure, their exterior becomes impure; if their exterior becomes impure, their interior does not become impure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ מֵחֲמַת מַשְׁקִין, אֲבָל נִטְמְאוּ מֵחֲמַת שֶׁרֶץ, נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ, נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ — נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: In what is this statement said? where became impure due to liquids. However, they became impure due to a creeping animal, the interior became impure the exterior is impure, the exterior became impure the interior is impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: In what case are these words spoken? — When they became impure due to liquids, but if they became impure due to a creeping thing, its interior becomes impure — if its interior became impure, its exterior becomes impure.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין לְטַמֵּא כֵּלִים דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מָה לִי נִטְמָא מֵחֲמַת מַשְׁקִין, מָה לִי נִטְמָא מֵחֲמַת שֶׁרֶץ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חָזַר בּוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind the ritual impurity of liquids to transmit impurity to vessels by Torah law, what is to me is rendered impure due to liquids, what is to me is rendered impure due to a creeping animal? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Rabbi Yehuda retracted
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind that the impurity of liquids is to render impure vessels by Torah law, why should I become impure due to liquids, why should I become impure due to a creeping thing? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Rabbi Yehudah retracted from this position.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא הָדַר, הָא — בְּמַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת יָדַיִם. הָא — בְּמַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת שֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: Ravina said: Actually, did not retract this to liquids that come to due to hands that to liquids that come to due to a creeping animal.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Always not return, this — in liquids that come because of hands. This — in liquids that come because of a creeping thing.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַדְּתָנֵי ״בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ מֵחֲמַת מַשְׁקִין״, לִיפְלוֹג וְלִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּמַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת יָדַיִם. אֲבָל בְּמַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת שֶׁרֶץ, נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ, נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ — נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא: חָזַר בּוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: If so, instead of teaching: In what is this statement said? were rendered impure due to liquids, let him distinguish and teach within itself: In what is this statement said? became impure by liquids that come to due to hands. However, became impure by liquids that come to due to a creeping animal, the interior became impure, the exterior is impure, the exterior became impure, the interior is impure. Rather, it is clear as we initially answered, Rabbi Yehuda retracted
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, it was taught: "In what case are these things said that they become impure due to liquids?" Let him distinguish and teach it separately: "In what case are these things said?" — regarding liquids that come because of hands. But regarding liquids that come because of a creeping thing, if its interior became impure — its exterior becomes impure, if its exterior became impure — its interior becomes impure! Rather, it is like a hole in a pitcher: Rabbi Yehuda retracted from this.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מִכֵּלִים הוּא דַּהֲדַר בֵּיהּ, אֲבָל בָּאוֹכָלִין כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ. אוֹ דִילְמָא: לִגְמָרֵי הֲדַר בֵּיהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before it from vessels that retracted but with regard to foods he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon, Or perhaps he completely retracted in accordance with Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: He asked them: Is it with vessels that he adorned it, but with foodstuffs like Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon he agrees? Or perhaps, to complete it entirely, did he adorn it like Rabbi Meir?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, תָּא שְׁמַע: פָּרָה שֶׁשָּׁתְתָה מֵי חַטָּאת — בְּשָׂרָהּ טָמֵא. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Come hear a cow that drank purification waters its flesh is impure Rabbi Yehuda says:
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said, come and hear: A cow that drank the waters of purification - its flesh is impure. Rabbi Yehuda says:

hebrew_text: בָּטְלוּ בְּמֵעֶיהָ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מִכֵּלִים הוּא דַּהֲדַר בֵּיהּ, אֲבָל בָּאוֹכָלִין כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, אַמַּאי בָּטְלוּ בְּמֵעֶיהָ לִגְמָרֵי?
human_translation: are nullified in its innards And if it enters your mind from vessels that retracted but with regard to foods he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon why are nullified in its innards entirely
llm_translation: They were nullified in her womb. And if it enters your mind that it is because it will return, but in the case of food, like Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon hold, why were they nullified in her womb completely?

hebrew_text: נְהִי דְּטוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה לָא מְטַמְּאוּ, טוּמְאָה קַלָּה מִיהָא נִיטַמְּאוּ!
human_translation: Although do not transmit a severe ritual impurity in any event let them transmit a lesser impurity
llm_translation: Let it be that impurity severe not they become impure, impurity light from it they became impure!

hebrew_text: מַאי ״בָּטְלוּ בְּמֵעֶיהָ״ נָמֵי? בָּטְלוּ מִטּוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה, אֲבָל טוּמְאָה קַלָּה מְטַמְּאוּ. מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה נָמֵי מְטַמְּאוּ, הָא ״בְּשָׂרָהּ טָמֵא״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: What, too, is They are nullified in its innards? It they are nullified from a severe impurity. However, transmit a lesser form of impurity. by inference that the first tanna maintains also transmit a severe impurity teaches: Its flesh is impure,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "it became nullified in her womb"? It became nullified from a severe impurity, but a light impurity does not nullify it. From the general principle that the first Tanna holds: a severe impurity nullifies it, as it is stated, "her flesh is impure."

hebrew_text: כּוּלֵּהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: פָּרָה שֶׁשָּׁתְתָה מֵי חַטָּאת — בְּשָׂרָהּ טָמֵא. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — טוּמְאָה קַלָּה, אֲבָל טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה — לֹא, שֶׁרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בָּטְלוּ בְּמֵעֶיהָ.
human_translation: entire is Rabbi Yehuda, and is incomplete and is teaching the following: a cow that drank the purification waters, its flesh is impure. In what is this statement said? a lesser impurity, but a severe purity, no, as Rabbi Yehuda says: are nullified in its innards
llm_translation: The entirety is Rabbi Yehuda, and lacking from the lacking, and thus it was taught: If a cow drank the waters of the sin offering - its flesh is impure. In what case are these words said - a light impurity, but a severe impurity - no, for Rabbi Yehuda says: they were nullified in its innards.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם בָּטְלוּ בְּמֵעֶיהָ לִגְמָרֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ מַשְׁקֶה סָרוּחַ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, are nullified in its innards entirely due to become a foul liquid
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Always they nullified in her womb completely, because it becomes a flowing drink.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: לָאוֹכָלִין — טְמֵאִין, לְכֵלִים — טְהוֹרִים. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבּוֹ אֲמָרָהּ, דְּדָרֵישׁ ״יִטְמָא״ — יְטַמֵּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: to foods are impure. to vessels are pure. Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Reish Lakish said: Rabbi Yosei said in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, his teacher, who interpreted yitma , It shall be impure, yetamme , It shall render impure,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: For food - impure, for vessels - pure. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Reish Lakish: In the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, according to the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, his teacher said it, that he interprets "it shall become impure" - it shall become impure.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן, בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: ״וְכׇל כְּלִי חֶרֶשׂ אֲשֶׁר יִפֹּל מֵהֶם וְגוֹ׳״, אֵינוֹ אוֹמֵר ״טָמֵא״ אֶלָּא ״יִטְמָא״ — יְטַמֵּא אֲחֵרִים, לִימֵּד עַל כִּכָּר שֵׁנִי שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין.
human_translation: As we learned On that day, Rabbi Akiva taught: “And every earthenware vessel any of them does not say: It is impure [ tameh ]; rather, It shall be impure [ yitma ], transmits impurity to other This teaches about a loaf second- that renders third- non-sacred
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: On that day, Rabbi Akiva expounded: "And any earthenware vessel into which any of them falls, etc." It does not say "it shall be unclean," but rather "it shall become unclean" - it renders others unclean. This teaches about a second loaf that makes a third one on weekdays.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא הֵיכִי דָּרֵישׁ? ״וְכׇל מַשְׁקֶה אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁתֶה בְּכׇל כְּלִי יִטְמָא״ — יְטַמֵּא, לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין? אָמַרְתָּ: לֹא כָּךְ הָיָה.
human_translation: And here, how does interpret and all drink that may be drunk in every vessel, shall be impure [ yitma ]” Shall render impure [ yetamme ], transmits impurity to foods. you say transmits ritual impurity to foods, or perhaps is only it transmits impurity to liquids, You said That was not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And here how does he expound? "And any drink that shall be drunk in any vessel shall become unclean" — it shall become unclean, to render unclean the uncleanness of foods. Do you say to render unclean the uncleanness of foods, or is it only to render unclean the uncleanness of drinks? You said: Not so was it.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לֹא כָּךְ הָיָה״? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא מָצִינוּ טוּמְאָה שֶׁעוֹשָׂה כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ.
human_translation: What is That was not Rav Pappa said: we did not find ritual impurity that renders a similar
llm_translation: What is "it was not so"? Rav Papa said: We did not find impurity like its equivalent.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: מִגּוּפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא נָמֵי לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ ״יִטְמָא״ — לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ ״יִטְמָא״ דְּסֵיפָא לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין, ״יִטְמָא״ דְּרֵישָׁא, נָמֵי לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין. נִיעָרְבִינְהוּ וְנִיכְתְּבִינְהוּ: ״מִכׇּל הָאֹכֶל אֲשֶׁר יֵאָכֵל אֲשֶׁר יָבוֹא עָלָיו מַיִם וְכׇל מַשְׁקֶה אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁתֶה בְּכׇל כְּלִי יִטְמָא״.
human_translation: Ravina said: From the verse itself you also cannot say Shall be impure, transmits ritual impurity liquids. As, if it enters your mind Shall be impure, in the latter it transmits ritual impurity liquids, Shall be impure, in the first also it transmits ritual impurity liquids. let combine and write them From all food which may be eaten, upon which water has come, and all drink that may be drunk in every vessel, shall be impure.
llm_translation: Ravina said: From the language of the verse itself, you cannot find that it says "shall become impure" - to render impure the impurity of liquids. For if you were to suggest that "shall become impure" in the latter part refers to rendering impure the impurity of liquids, "shall become impure" in the former part also, you cannot find that it says "shall become impure" - to render impure the impurity of liquids. They debated it and wrote it down: "Of all the food that may be eaten, that on which water comes and any liquid that may be drunk in any vessel shall become impure."

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי ״יִטְמָא״ לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא: ״יִטְמָא״ דְּרֵישָׁא לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין, ״יִטְמָא״ דְּסֵיפָא לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין.
human_translation: Why do I Shall be impure, twice? Rather, Shall be impure, in the first transmits ritual impurity liquids, Shall be impure, in the latter transmits ritual impurity food.
llm_translation: Two "it should become impure" - why do I need it? Rather: "it should become impure" of the beginning to render impure the impurity of liquids, "it should become impure" of the end to render impure the impurity of foods.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא לְטַמֵּא אֶת הַכֵּלִים! וְלָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא, וּמָה כְּלִי שֶׁמְּטַמֵּא מַשְׁקֶה — אֵין מְטַמֵּא כְּלִי, מַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת כְּלִי — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יְטַמְּאוּ אֶת הַכֵּלִים?
human_translation: And say transmits ritual impurity to vessels. And isn’t it an a fortiori Just as vessel, which transmits impurity to liquid does not transmit impurity to vessel, liquids that come to due to a vessel, is it not right that they not transmit impurity to vessels?
llm_translation: And why not to render impure the vessels! And is it not a fortiori reasoning, and just as a vessel that renders liquid impure does not render another vessel impure, liquids that come due to a vessel do not render vessels impure — is it not logical that they should not render the vessels impure?

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: כִּי לָא מְטַמְּאוּ, מַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת כְּלִי. אֲבָל מַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת שֶׁרֶץ, הָכִי נָמֵי דִּמְטַמְּאוּ! מַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת שֶׁרֶץ מִי כְּתִיבִי?
human_translation: And say that when do not transmit ritual impurity liquids that come to due to vessel, However, liquids that come to due to a creeping animal, indeed, they transmit impurity Are liquids that come to due to a creeping animal stated
llm_translation: And why? Because they do not become impure, liquids that come from a vessel. But liquids that come from a creeping thing, do they not also become impure! Liquids that come from a creeping thing, where is it written?

hebrew_text: וְלָאו מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר קָאָתֵי: וּמָה מַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת כְּלִי — מְטַמְּאִין, מַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת שֶׁרֶץ — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: And doesn’t come from an a fortiori Just as liquids that come to due to a vessel, transmit impurity, liquids that come to due to a creeping animal, all the more so not
llm_translation: And not from a fortiori argument is it derived: And just as liquids that come from a vessel — they are impure, liquids that come from a creeping thing — all the more so!

hebrew_text: דַּיּוֹ לַבָּא מִן הַדִּין לִהְיוֹת כַּנִּדּוֹן.
human_translation: It is sufficient [ dayyo ] emerged from the inference be like the source of the inference.
llm_translation: It is sufficient for the father to be like the son.

hebrew_text: ״יִטְמָא״ דְּרֵישָׁא הֵיכִי דָּרֵישׁ? ״מִכׇּל הָאֹכֶל אֲשֶׁר יֵאָכֵל אֲשֶׁר יָבוֹא עָלָיו מַיִם יִטְמָא״, יִטְמָא — לְטַמֵּא אֶת הַמַּשְׁקִין. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר לְטַמֵּא אֶת הַמַּשְׁקִין, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְטַמֵּא אֶת הַכְּלִי?
human_translation: How does interpret Shall be impure, in the first “From all food which may be eaten, upon which water has come, shall be impure” Shall be impure, transmits ritual impurity to liquids. you say transmits impurity to liquids, or perhaps only transmits impurity to a vessel?
llm_translation: "Tuma" in the beginning, how does he interpret? "Of all the food that may be eaten, that on which water comes shall be unclean," shall be unclean - to render unclean the liquids. Do you say to render unclean the liquids, or is it only to render unclean the vessel?

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה מַשְׁקֶה שֶׁמְּטַמֵּא אוֹכֶל — אֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא כְּלִי, אוֹכֶל שֶׁאֵין מְטַמֵּא אוֹכֶל — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יְטַמֵּא כְּלִי?! הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״יִטְמָא״ — לְטַמֵּא אֶת הַמַּשְׁקִין שֶׁהֵן עֲלוּלִין לְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: You say an a fortiori Just as liquid, which transmits impurity to food, does not transmit impurity to a vessel, food, which does not transmit impurity to food, is it not right that it not transmit impurity to a vessel? how do I establish Shall be impure, transmits impurity to liquids, which are susceptible to contracting impurity.
llm_translation: You said a fortiori: And what about a liquid that can render food impure - it does not render a utensil impure, but food that cannot render food impure - is it not logical that it should not render a utensil impure?! How do I fulfill the command "it shall become impure" - to render impure the liquids that are susceptible to impurity.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִירְיָא מַשְׁקִין מִשּׁוּם דַּעֲלוּלִין לְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה, תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיכָּא מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא!
human_translation: Why did specifically liquids due to they are susceptible to contracting impurity? Let him derive that there is no other item
llm_translation: What is the reason that they give drinks in the name of alulim to receive impurity, let him go out because there is no other way!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכִי תֵּימָא אוֹכֶל חָמוּר, דִּמְטַמֵּא מַשְׁקִין, נִיטַמְּיֵיהּ לִכְלִי. הַהוּא חוּמְרָא דְמַשְׁקִין הוּא, מִשּׁוּם דְּמַשְׁקִין עֲלוּלִין לְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: this is is saying: And lest you say food is severe, that transmits ritual impurity to liquids let transmit impurity to a vessel, that is a stringency liquids, due to that liquids susceptible to contracting impurity.
llm_translation: So it is saying: And if you will say, a person who eats vinegar, which imparts impurity to liquids, his vessel becomes impure. That vinegar itself is a liquid, because liquids are susceptible to impurity.

hebrew_text: וּמָה הִיא עֲלִילָתָן — שֶׁמְּקַבְּלִין טוּמְאָה שֶׁלֹּא בְּהֶכְשֵׁר.
human_translation: And what is their susceptibility that they become ritually impure without susceptible
llm_translation: And what is their practice - that they accept impurity not in a permissible manner.

hebrew_text: ״יִטְמָא״ — דְּאֵין עוֹשָׂה כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ, מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא? מֵהָתָם נָפְקָא: ״וְכִי יֻתַּן מַיִם עַל זֶרַע וְנָפַל מִנִּבְלָתָם עָלָיו טָמֵא הוּא״ — הוּא טָמֵא, וְאֵין עוֹשֶׂה טוּמְאָה כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ! חַד בְּמַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת שֶׁרֶץ, וְחַד בְּמַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת כְּלִי.
human_translation: Is Shall be impure that does not render a similar derived from here? derived from there: “But if water is put upon the seed, and any of their carcass falls upon it, it is impure for you” It is impure; it does not transmit impurity similar one to liquids that come to due to a creeping animal, one to liquids that come to due to vessel.
llm_translation: "Yitma" - for does it not make like its equivalent, from where is it derived? It is derived from there: "If water is placed upon seed and their carcass falls upon it, it is impure" - it is impure, yet it does not make impurity like its equivalent! One case is with liquids that come due to a creeping thing, and one case is with liquids that come due to a vessel.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִי? דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן בְּמַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת כְּלִי — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא חֲמִירִי. אֲבָל בְּמַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת שֶׁרֶץ — דַּחֲמִירִי, אֵימָא עוֹשֶׂה טוּמְאָה כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ.
human_translation: And are necessary, As, had taught us with regard to liquids that come due to a vessel, due to their not severe, however, with regard to liquids that come due to a creeping animal, which are severe say that transmit impurity similar
llm_translation: And is it necessary? For if we were to hear regarding liquids that come due to a vessel - it is because they are not stringent. But regarding liquids that come due to a creeping thing - since they are stringent, one might say it renders impurity as the like of it.

hebrew_text: וְלַשְׁמְעִינַן מַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת שֶׁרֶץ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן מַשְׁקִין הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת כְּלִי! מִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר טָרַח וְכָתֵב לַהּ קְרָא.
human_translation: And let teach us liquids that come due to a creeping animal, and all the more so liquids that come due to a vessel. a matter that derived by an a fortiori inference, the verse unnecessarily wrote it
llm_translation: And to hear we learn, liquids that come from a creeping thing, and all the more so liquids that come from a vessel! The matter that comes with a fortiori reasoning, one should exert and write for it a verse.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְהָא אָמַר רָבָא: לָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא,
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: But didn’t Rava say Rabbi Yosei does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Akiva
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: But didn't Rava say: Rabbi Yosei does not hold like Rabbi Akiva,

hebrew_text: וְלָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei
llm_translation: And not Rabbi Akiva holds like Rabbi Yosei!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבּוֹ אֲמָרָהּ, וְלֵיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: Rabbi Yosei said in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, his teacher; he himself does not hold
llm_translation: He said to him: Rabbi Yosei according to the opinion of Rabbi Akiva his teacher said it, but according to him he does not agree.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִנַּיִין לָרְבִיעִי בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ שֶׁהוּא פָּסוּל?
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana Granted, Rabbi Yosei does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, as it was taught Rabbi Yosei said: From where to a consecrated fourth- that it is disqualified
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi to Rav Kahana: Granted, Rabbi Yosei does not agree with Rabbi Akiva, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei said: From where do we derive that the fourth generation in the Holy Temple service is disqualified?

hebrew_text: וְדִין הוּא: וּמָה מְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים שֶׁמּוּתָּר בִּתְרוּמָה, פָּסוּל בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ. שְׁלִישִׁי שֶׁפָּסוּל בִּתְרוּמָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה רְבִיעִי בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ?
human_translation: And is a logical inference: Just as one who lacks atonement, who is permitted teruma , disqualifies consecrated third- which disqualifies teruma , is it not right that it confer fourth- upon a consecrated
llm_translation: And the judgment is: And what deficiency of atonements that is permitted for terumah, is disqualified for kodosh. The third that is disqualified for terumah - is it not the law that the fourth should be done in kodosh?

hebrew_text: וְלָמַדְנוּ שְׁלִישִׁי בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ מִן הַתּוֹרָה, וּרְבִיעִי מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: And we derived third- with regard to consecrated from the Torah, and fourth- by a fortiori inference.
llm_translation: And we have learned that the third derivation in the holy Scriptures is from the Torah, and the fourth derivation is from an a fortiori argument.

hebrew_text: שְׁלִישִׁי מִן הַתּוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב ״וְהַבָּשָׂר אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע
human_translation: from the Torah, as it is written: “And the flesh that touches
llm_translation: Third from the Torah, as it is written, "and the flesh that touches"

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל טָמֵא לֹא יֵאָכֵל״, מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּנָגַע בְּשֵׁנִי. רְבִיעִי מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר, כִּדְאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: any impure thing shall not be eaten” Are we not dealing where touched second- fourth- by a fortiori as we stated
llm_translation: "In all impure not shall eat," who not we are dealing with that touches in second. Fourth from leniency and stringency, as we say.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ סָבַר כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, נִיתְנֵי נָמֵי: רְבִיעִי בַּתְּרוּמָה וַחֲמִישִׁי בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva let him also teach fourth with regard to teruma , and fifth with regard to consecrated
llm_translation: If your opinion is in accordance with that of Rabbi Akiva, it is stated: The fourth animal is designated for the heave-offering, and the fifth for the holy sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לָא סָבַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מְנָלַן?
human_translation: However, Rabbi Akiva does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, from where do we
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Akiva does not hold like Rabbi Yosei. From where do we know this?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּלָא לִישְׁתְּמִיט תַּנָּא וְלִיתְנֵי רְבִיעִי בַּתְּרוּמָה וַחֲמִישִׁי בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ, וְנֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא. וַאֲנַן אַהָכִי נֵיקוּם וְנִסְמוֹךְ?!
human_translation: said to As it is not to avoid tanna who teaches fourth- teruma consecrated and says this is Rabbi Akiva, And will we stand and rely on that
llm_translation: He said to him: that not to be relied upon, a Tanna taught, and to give a fourth in terumah and a fifth in holy things, and it is said: this is the opinion of Rabbi Akiva. And we should thus act and rely upon it?!

hebrew_text: נְפַק רַב אָשֵׁי, וְאִי תֵּימָא רַב כָּהֲנָא, דַּק וְאַשְׁכַּח הָא דִּתְנַן: הַכְּלִי מְצָרֵף אֶת מַה שֶּׁבְּתוֹכוֹ לַקּוֹדֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לַתְּרוּמָה. וְהָרְבִיעִי בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ פָּסוּל, וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁי בַּתְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi, and some say Rav Kahana, left He analyzed and found that which we learned A vessel joins that which is in it with regard to consecrated property, but not with regard to teruma . And the fourth disqualifies consecrated while third- teruma .
llm_translation: Rav Ashi went out, and if you wish, say it was Rav Kahana, he checked and found what we learned: The vessel purifies what is inside it for the Holy, but not for the Terumah. And the fourth is disqualified for the Holy, and the third for the Terumah.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מֵעֵדוּתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נִשְׁנֵית מִשְׁנָה זוֹ. (דְּתַנְיָא:) הוֹסִיף רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הַסּוֹלֶת וְהַקְּטוֹרֶת וְהַלְּבוֹנָה וְהַגֶּחָלִים, שֶׁאִם נָגַע טְבוּל יוֹם בְּמִקְצָתָן פָּסַל אֶת כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: from the testimony of Rabbi Akiva this mishna is taught, as it was taught Rabbi Akiva added the flour, the incense, the frankincense, and the coals that if who immersed during that day, touches some of them, he disqualifies all of them,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The testimony of Rabbi Akiva was repeated from this Mishnah. (As it was taught:) Rabbi Akiva added the fine flour, the incense, the frankincense, and the coals, for if one who is a tevul yom touched some of them, he invalidates all of them.

hebrew_text: רְבִיעִי אִין, חֲמִישִׁי לָא. שְׁלִישִׁי אִין, רְבִיעִי לָא.
human_translation: fourth- yes, fifth- no, third- yes, fourth- no,
llm_translation: Fourth, no; fifth, yes. Third, no; fourth, no.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: צֵירוּף דְּרַבָּנַן. וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי חָנִין, דְּאָמַר: צֵירוּף דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כַּף אַחַת עֲשָׂרָה זָהָב מְלֵאָה קְטֹרֶת״, הַכָּתוּב עָשָׂה כׇּל מַה שֶּׁבַּכַּף אַחַת.
human_translation: Apparently, holds joining by rabbinic law, And disputes that Rabbi Ḥanin, who said: Joining by Torah law, as it is stated: “One golden spoon of ten shekels, filled with incense” The verse rendered everything in the spoon, one
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Perhaps he holds: the combination of the Rabbis. And the dispute of Rabbi Hanin, who says: the combination of the Torah, as it is said: "a single handbreadth full of incense," the Scripture made everything that is in the handbreadth.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: עַל מַחַט שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת בַּבָּשָׂר, שֶׁהַסַּכִּין וְהַיָּדַיִם — טְהוֹרוֹת, וְהַבָּשָׂר טָמֵא. נִמְצֵאת בַּפֶּרֶשׁ — הַכֹּל טָהוֹר. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: זָכִינוּ שֶׁאֵין טוּמְאַת יָדַיִם בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: we learned there: about a needle that was found in the meat that the knife and the hands are ritually pure but the meat is impure, was found in the secretions everything is pure, Rabbi Akiva said: We were privileged that there is no impurity of hands in the Temple
llm_translation: We learned there: Regarding a needle found in the flesh, whether the knife and the hands are pure, and the flesh is impure. If it is found in the hide, everything is pure. Rabbi Akiva said: We have merited that there is no impurity of the hands in the Temple.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא: שֶׁאֵין טוּמְאַת יָדַיִם וְכֵלִים בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: יָדַיִם קוֹדֶם גְּזֵירַת כֵּלִים נִשְׁנוּ.
human_translation: And let us say that there is no ritual impurity of hands and vessels in the Temple, Rav Yehuda said Rav said, and some say Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina: hands was taught prior to the decree for vessels
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was stated: The impurity of hands and vessels in the Temple! Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and it was stated: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: Hands precede the decree of vessels.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְהָא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם גָּזְרוּ, דִּתְנַן: הַסֵּפֶר וְהַיָּדַיִם וְהַטְּבוּל יוֹם וְהָאוֹכָלִין וְהַכֵּלִים שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ בְּמַשְׁקִין!
human_translation: Rava said: But weren’t both decrees issued on the same day? As we learned scroll and hands and one who immersed himself during that day, and foods and vessels that became impure by liquids,
llm_translation: Rava said: And both of them with it on the day they decreed, as we learned in a Mishnah: The book, the hands, and the immersion vessel one day, and the food and the vessels that became impure with liquids!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הַנַּח לְטוּמְאַת סַכִּין, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּחוּלִּין נָמֵי לָא מְטַמֵּא. הַאי סַכִּין דִּנְגַע בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא דִּנְגַע בְּבָשָׂר — הָא אֵין אוֹכֶל מְטַמֵּא כְּלִי, וְאֶלָּא דִּנְגַע בְּמַחַט — וְהָא אֵין כְּלִי מְטַמֵּא כְּלִי!
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: Leave the impurity of knife, as even in non-sacred it does not become impure. this knife, what did it touch If you say that it touched the meat, food does not transmit impurity to a vessel. rather, that it touched the needle, a vessel does not transmit impurity to vessel.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Leave it for the impurity of a knife, for even in ordinary cases it does not render things impure. What is this knife that comes into contact with? If you say it comes into contact with flesh - well, food does not render a utensil impure. Rather, if it comes into contact with a needle - well, a utensil does not render a utensil impure!

hebrew_text: הַאי מַחַט מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ? אִי נֵימָא סְפֵק מַחַט, וְהָא אִיתְּמַר: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, חַד אָמַר: לֹא גָּזְרוּ עַל סְפֵק הָרוּקִּין שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְחַד אָמַר: לֹא גָּזְרוּ עַל סְפֵק הַכֵּלִים שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: this needle, What is its status? If we say uncertainty needle, wasn’t it stated Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina? One said: did not issue a decree uncertainty spittle that is in Jerusalem. And one said: did not issue a decree uncertainty vessels in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: This needle, what does it do? If you say it is a doubtful needle, but it was stated: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei the son of Rabbi Chanina, one said: They did not decree regarding a doubtful needle in Jerusalem, and one said: They did not decree regarding doubtful vessels in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָבְדָה לוֹ מַחַט טְמֵא מֵת, וְהִכִּירָהּ בַּבָּשָׂר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה פָּרָה חֲסוּמָה, וּבָאָה מִחוּץ לִירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: where one lost a needle ritual impurity by a corpse. And he recognized in the meat Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Avin, said: where the cow was muzzled as it came from outside of Jerusalem.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: For example, if a ritually impure needle was lost to him, and he recognized it by the flesh. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Avin, said: For example, if it was a sealed cow, and it came from outside Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, חַד אָמַר: לֹא גָּזְרוּ עַל סְפֵק הָרוּקִּין שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְחַד אָמַר: לֹא גָּזְרוּ עַל סְפֵק הַכֵּלִים שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. רוּקִּין תְּנֵינָא, כֵּלִים תְּנֵינָא!
human_translation: the itself. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, One said: did not issue a decree uncertainty spittle that is in Jerusalem. And one said: did not issue a decree uncertainty vessels in Jerusalem. We learned spittle, we learned vessels.
llm_translation: Body. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina, one said: They did not decree regarding the doubtful spittle in Jerusalem, and one said: They did not decree regarding the doubtful vessels in Jerusalem. Spittle we learned, vessels we learned!

hebrew_text: רוּקִּין תְּנֵינָא, דִּתְנַן: כׇּל הָרוּקִּין הַנִּמְצָאִין בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם טְהוֹרִין, חוּץ מִשֶּׁל שׁוּק הָעֶלְיוֹן! לָא צְרִיכָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיתַּחְזַק זָב.
human_translation: We learned spittle, as we learned Any spittle found in Jerusalem is pure, except for that is upper market, No, necessary even where a presumption a zav
llm_translation: We have learned: All saliva found in Jerusalem is pure, except for that of the Upper Market! This is not necessary, even though it is considered a discharge.

hebrew_text: כֵּלִים תְּנֵינָא, דִּתְנַן: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים הַנִּמְצָאִים בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה לְבֵית הַטְּבִילָה — טְמֵאִין. הָא דְּעָלְמָא — טְהוֹרִין!
human_translation: we learned vessels, as we learned all the vessels found in Jerusalem, on the path down to the ritual bath are ritually impure. all other are pure.
llm_translation: Vessels we learned, as we learned: All the vessels found in Jerusalem, on the way down to the ritual bath - impure. But those of the world - pure!

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: דֶּרֶךְ עֲלִיָּה — טְהוֹרִין. הָא דְּעָלְמָא — טְמֵאִין!
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, say the latter clause on the path up they are ritually pure. All other are ritually impure.
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, let us say the conclusion: the way of ascending - pure. But the world - impure!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: רֵישָׁא דַּוְקָא, וְסֵיפָא לָאו דַּוְקָא. וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי גָּזְיָיתָא.
human_translation: Rather, the first clause is precise And the latter clause is not precise and to exclude the passageways
llm_translation: Rather: the beginning specifically, and the end is not specifically. And to go out to the treasury.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב דְּאָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָבְדָה לוֹ מַחַט טְמֵא מֵת וְהִכִּירָהּ בַּבָּשָׂר, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: ״בַּחֲלַל חֶרֶב״, חֶרֶב הֲרֵי הוּא כֶּחָלָל — אָדָם וְכֵלִים נָמֵי לִיטַמֵּא!
human_translation: And to Rav, who said where one lost a needle ritual impurity by a corpse, and he recognized in the meat the conclusion should be different. Since the Master said “One who is slain with a sword” sword is like one who is slain a person and vessels as well become ritually impure
llm_translation: To Rabbi who says: For example, if a needle that is impure from a corpse was lost and he recognized it in the flesh, since the Master said, "In the place where there is a slain person," a sword is like a slain person - a person and vessels near it become impure!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת עֲזָרָה רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים הִיא, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ סְפֵק טוּמְאָה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים. וְכׇל סְפֵק טוּמְאָה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — סְפֵיקוֹ טָהוֹר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: That is to say courtyard is a public domain And is uncertainty impurity in a public domain, And any uncertainty impurity in a public domain its uncertainty ritually pure.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: This means it is a public domain enclosure, and there is a doubt of impurity in a public domain. And any doubt of impurity in a public domain - its doubt is pure.

hebrew_text: הָא בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד — סְפֵיקוֹ טָמֵא הוּא. מִכְּדֵי הַאי מַחַט דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ דַּעַת לִישָּׁאֵל הוּא. וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ דַּעַת לִישָּׁאֵל, בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד — סְפֵיקוֹ טָהוֹר!
human_translation: in the private domain, its uncertainty ritually impure. Since this needle an item that does not have knowledge to be asked, any item that does not have knowledge to be asked, whether in the public domain or whether in the private domain, its uncertainty ritually pure.
llm_translation: In a private domain - its doubt is impure. Because this matter is something that does not have knowledge for the Jewish people. And any matter that does not have knowledge for the Jewish people, whether in a public domain or in a private domain - its doubt is pure!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי סְפֵק טוּמְאָה הַבָּאָה בִּידֵי אָדָם, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סְפֵק טוּמְאָה הַבָּאָה בִּידֵי אָדָם
human_translation: due to that is uncertainty impurity that comes by means of a person. And Rabbi Yoḥanan stated uncertainty impurity that comes by means of a person,
llm_translation: From the fact that there is doubt regarding impurity that comes into the hands of a person, and Rabbi Yochanan said: Doubtful impurity that comes into the hands of a person.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁאָלִין עָלֶיהָ, אֲפִילּוּ בִּכְלִי הַמּוּנָּח עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע — כְּדָבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ דַּעַת לִישָּׁאֵל.
human_translation: consult about it even with regard to a vessel that is placed upon the ground, like an item that has knowledge to be asked.
llm_translation: Inquired about it, even in a vessel placed on the ground - as something that has the capacity to be inquired about.

hebrew_text: ״וְהַבָּשָׂר טָמֵא״. הַאי בָּשָׂר דְּאִיתַּכְשַׁר בְּמַאי?
human_translation: the meat is ritually impure. With what was this meat rendered susceptible
llm_translation: "And the flesh is impure." This flesh that becomes permissible with what?

hebrew_text: אִי נֵימָא דְּאִיתַּכְשַׁר בְּדָם, וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִנַּיִן לְדַם קָדָשִׁים שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַכְשִׁיר — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תֹּאכְלֶנּוּ עַל הָאָרֶץ תִּשְׁפְּכֶנּוּ כַּמָּיִם״, דָּם שֶׁנִּשְׁפָּךְ כַּמַּיִם — מַכְשִׁיר, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ נִשְׁפָּךְ כַּמַּיִם — אֵינוֹ מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: If we say that it was rendered susceptible by blood didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: From where with regard to blood of consecrated that it does not render susceptible As it is stated: “You shall surely not eat the blood; you shall pour it upon the earth like water” Blood that is poured like water, renders susceptible Blood that is not poured out like water, does not render susceptible
llm_translation: If you want to say that it is valid with blood, but didn't Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba say in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: From where do we derive that the blood of holy things that does not make it valid? As it is stated: "You shall not eat it on the ground; you shall pour it out like water." Blood that is poured out like water makes it valid, and blood that is not poured out like water does not make it valid.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא דְּאִיתַּכְשַׁר בְּמַשְׁקֵי בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא. וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַשְׁקֵי בֵּית מַטְבְּחַיָּא לֹא דַּיָּין שֶׁהֵן דְּכַן, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין מַכְשִׁירִין!
human_translation: Rather, that was rendered susceptible by the liquids of the slaughterhouse, But didn’t Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, say the liquids of the slaughterhouse: Not only are they ritually pure, but they do not render susceptible
llm_translation: And rather that it is valid in the drinks of the kitchen. But didn't Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, say: The drinks of the kitchen are not wine that they are thus, but they do not render ritually impure!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא דְּאִיתַּכְשַׁר בְּחִיבַּת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ. אֵימוֹר דְּמַהְנְיָא לֵיהּ חִיבַּת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ לְאִיפְּסוֹלֵי גּוּפֵיהּ, לְמִימְנֵא בֵּיהּ רִאשׁוֹן וְשֵׁנִי נָמֵי?!
human_translation: Rather, is rendered susceptible by the esteem for sacred Say that the esteem for sacred is effective to disqualify itself does it also counts first- and second-
llm_translation: And rather, that it is valid in the obligation of the holy. Say, what is the relevance of the obligation of the holy to its own invalidations, to count it as first and second?!

hebrew_text: תִּיפְשׁוֹט דְּבָעֵי רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: צָרִיד שֶׁל מְנָחוֹת מוֹנִין בּוֹ רִאשׁוֹן וְשֵׁנִי אוֹ לֹא!
human_translation: resolve that which Reish Lakish raised as a dilemma: a mass from meal-offerings, count first- and second- or not?
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Reish Lakish says: Do we count the required amount of meal-offerings for the first and second Temple or not!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה פָּרָה שֶׁל זִבְחֵי שְׁלָמִים, וְהֶעֱבִירָהּ בְּנָהָר וּשְׁחָטָהּ, וַעֲדַיִין מַשְׁקֶה טוֹפֵחַ עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: where was a cow a peace-offering sacrifice, and led it through the river while liquid was still moist upon it.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: For example, if there was a cow designated for peace offerings, and it crossed a river and was slaughtered, it is still considered as having been watered by handbreadth.

hebrew_text: נִמְצֵאת בַּפֶּרֶשׁ — הַכֹּל טָהוֹר. וְנִיהְדַּר פֶּרֶשׁ וְנִיטַמְּיֵהּ לְבָשָׂר! אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: בְּפֶרֶשׁ עָבָה. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּפֶרֶשׁ רַכָּה, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי מַשְׁקֶה סָרוּחַ.
human_translation: was found in the secretions everything, is pure. And let these secretions, return and transmit impurity to the meat Rav Adda bar Ahava said: to thick, secretions, Rav Ashi said: Even you say to soft secretions, because it is an offensive liquid,
llm_translation: Found in the placenta — everything is pure. And if the placenta is detached and it becomes attached to the flesh! Rav Adda bar Ahava said: In a thick placenta. Rav Ashi said: Even if you say in a soft placenta, because it becomes a moistening agent.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שֶׁרֶץ מְטַמֵּא אֶת הַמַּשְׁקִין, וּמַשְׁקִין מְטַמְּאִין אֶת הַכְּלִי, וּכְלִי מְטַמֵּא אֶת הָאוֹכָלִין, וְהָאוֹכָלִין מְטַמְּאִין אֶת הַמַּשְׁקִין. וְלָמַדְנוּ שָׁלֹשׁ טוּמְאוֹת בְּשֶׁרֶץ. הָנֵי אַרְבָּעָה הֵן! גּוֹז מַשְׁקִין דְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: The tanna taught before Rav Sheshet. a creeping animal transmits impurity to liquids, liquids transmit impurity to a vessel, vessel transmits impurity to foods, and foods transmit impurity to liquids. And we have learned three of impurity with regard to a creeping animal. These are four Cut liquids of the first clause,
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: A creeping thing renders liquids impure, and liquids render vessels impure, and vessels render food impure, and food renders liquids impure. And we have learned three impurities in a creeping thing. Those are four! The Mishna cuts off the first liquids.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, גּוֹז מַשְׁקִין דְּסֵיפָא! לָא אַשְׁכְּחַן תַּנָּא דְּאָמַר ״מַשְׁקִין מְטַמְּאִין כְּלִי״ אֶלָּא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וַהֲדַר בֵּיהּ. וְסִימָנָיךְ: נַזְיְיתָא.
human_translation: On the contrary, cut liquids of the latter clause, The only tanna that we find who said liquids transmit impurity to a vessel is Rabbi Yehuda. he retracted And your mnemonic a brewing vat,
llm_translation: The Great One said, "Cut the drinks of the latter part! I did not find a Mishnah that says, 'Drinks render a vessel impure,' except for Rabbi Yehuda, and he retracted. And your mnemonic: 'Nazyeita.'"

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: שֶׁרֶץ שֶׁנִּמְצָא בְּתַנּוּר — הַפַּת שֶׁבְּתוֹכוֹ שְׁנִיָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַתַּנּוּר תְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: We learned there: a creeping animal that was found in an oven, the bread inside it second- due to the oven first-
llm_translation: We learned there: A creeping thing that was found in an oven - the bread inside it is secondary, because the oven is primary.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה לְרָבָא: וְנִיחְזֵי לְהַאי תַּנּוּר כְּמַאן דִּמְלֵי טוּמְאָה דָּמֵי, וְתִיהְוֵי הַאי פַּת רִאשׁוֹנָה!
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said to Rava: And let us view that oven as one filled with impurity, And this bread be first-
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Ahava to Rava: "And let this oven be considered like one who is full of impurity, and this loaf will be the first one!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל יְהוּ כׇּל הַכֵּלִים מִטַּמְּאִין מֵאֲוִיר כְּלִי חֶרֶס —
human_translation: He said to him: This cannot enter your mind, as it was taught might all the vessels become impure from the airspace of earthenware vessel.
llm_translation: He said to him: Your opinion did not arise, as it is taught: One might have thought that all vessels can become ritually impure from the air of an earthenware vessel —

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כֹּל אֲשֶׁר בְּתוֹכוֹ יִטְמָא״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״מִכׇּל הָאֹכֶל״. אוֹכֶל מִטַּמֵּא מֵאֲוִיר כְּלִי חֶרֶס, וְאֵין כׇּל הַכֵּלִים מִטַּמְּאִין מֵאֲוִיר כְּלִי חֶרֶס.
human_translation: the verse states whatever is in it shall be impure, And juxtaposed to it “From all food food is rendered impure by the airspace of an earthenware vessel, but not all vessels are rendered impure by the airspace of an earthenware vessel.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Everything that is inside it shall become impure," and it is juxtaposed with: "From all that is eaten." Food can become impure from the air of an earthenware vessel, but not all vessels become impure from the air of an earthenware vessel.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא רָמֵי פִּיסְחָא אַפִּיסְחָא וּמְשַׁנֵּי: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שְׁתֵּיהֶן כְּאַחַת?
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised a contradiction Passover and Passover, and he resolved Did Rabbi Yehoshua say both of them as one,
llm_translation: Rav Chisda raised a contradiction: "Pischa" and "Apischa," and he answered: Who said that Rabbi Yehoshua considers both of them as one?

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֵין הַנִּדּוֹן דּוֹמֶה לִרְאָיָה, כְּשֶׁהֵעִידוּ רַבּוֹתֵינוּ — עַל מָה הֵעִידוּ? אִם עַל הַבָּשָׂר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בִּוְלַד הַטּוּמְאָה שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפִין אוֹתוֹ עִם הַבָּשָׂר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה — זֶה טָמֵא וְזֶה טָמֵא.
human_translation: And raised a contradiction Rabbi Yosei said: The conclusion is not similar to the proof. When the Sages, testified, about what did they testify? If to meat that became ritually impure through a secondary source of impurity, that one burn it with meat that became impure through a primary source of impurity, this is impure and that is impure,
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: Rabbi Yosei said, "Dispute is not like observation, when our Rabbis testified - what did they testify about? If it is about the flesh that became impure in the fetus of impurity that is burned together with the flesh that became impure in the father of impurity - this one is impure and that one is impure."

hebrew_text: אִם עַל הַשֶּׁמֶן שֶׁנִּפְסַל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם, שֶׁמַּדְלִיקִין אוֹתוֹ בְּנֵר שֶׁנִּטְמָא בִּטְמֵא מֵת — זֶה פָּסוּל וְזֶה טָמֵא. אַף אָנוּ מוֹדִים בִּתְרוּמָה שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת בִּוְלַד הַטּוּמְאָה שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפִין אוֹתָהּ עִם הַתְּרוּמָה שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה, אֲבָל הֵיאַךְ נִשְׂרוֹף אֲפִילּוּ תְּלוּיָה עִם הַטְּמֵאָה, שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וִיטַהֲרֵם.
human_translation: If to to oil that was disqualified by one who immersed himself during that day, that one kindle it in a lamp that became ritually impure through ritually impure a corpse, this is disqualified and that is impure. We also concede with regard to teruma that became impure from a secondary source of impurity, that one burn it with teruma that became ritually impure from a primary source of impurity, However, how will we burn in abeyance, with ritually impure Perhaps Elijah will come and render it ritually pure.
llm_translation: If on the oil that became disqualified in the immersion of the day, that one kindles it in a lamp that became impure through contact with a corpse - this one is disqualified and that one is impure. We also agree regarding terumah that became impure through the offspring of impurity that we burn it together with the terumah that became impure through the father of impurity. But how is it burned even if it is dependent on the impure one, lest Elijah come and purify them.

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁנֵּי: הָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. הָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: And resolved This Rabbi Shimon and in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua, that Rabbi Yosei and in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And they repeated: This is Rabbi Shimon, and the son of Rabbi Yehoshua. This is Rabbi Yosei, and the son of Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, מְבַעֲרִין אֶת הַכֹּל מִלִּפְנֵי הַשַּׁבָּת, וְשׂוֹרְפִין תְּרוּמוֹת טְמֵאוֹת תְּלוּיוֹת וּטְהוֹרוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: טְהוֹרָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, וּתְלוּיָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, וּטְמֵאָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: As it was taught fourteenth occurs on Shabbat, one removes everything before Shabbat, and he burns teruma impure in abeyance, and pure the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: pure by itself, in abeyance by itself, and impure by itself.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Fourteen pieces of dough that one forgot about on Shabbat, one must burn them all before Shabbat, and one may burn impure terumot that are dependent on them and pure terumot, these are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: If the dough is pure by itself, and if it is dependent by itself, and if it is impure by itself.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עַל הַטְּהוֹרָה וְעַל הַטְּמֵאָה שֶׁאֵין שׂוֹרְפִין, עַל הַתְּלוּיָה וְעַל הַטְּהוֹרָה שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפִין. עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל הַתְּלוּיָה וְעַל הַטְּמֵאָה, שֶׁרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: תִּישָּׂרֵף זוֹ בְּעַצְמָהּ וְזוֹ בְּעַצְמָהּ. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּיהֶן כְּאַחַת.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua did not disagree about ritually pure and about impure that one not burn about in abeyance and about pure that one burn With regard to what did they disagree? with regard to in abeyance and impure as Rabbi Eliezer says: This be burned by itself and that by itself. And Rabbi Yehoshua says: both of them as one.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua did not disagree regarding purity and impurity that do not require burning, regarding hanging and regarding purity that does require burning. What did they disagree about? They disagreed about hanging and impurity, as Rabbi Eliezer says: "Let this one burn by itself and that one burn by itself." And Rabbi Yehoshua says: "Both should be burned together."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא! הָכִי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּמֵיקֵל, כִּי מֵיקֵל בִּתְלוּיָה וּטְמֵאָה, אֲבָל בִּטְהוֹרָה וּטְמֵאָה — לָא.
human_translation: Isn’t the mishna Rabbi Yosei? This is Rabbi Yosei is saying to Rabbi Meir: Even Rabbi Shimon in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, who is lenient, where he leniently with regard to in abeyance and impure However, with regard to ritually pure and impure no,
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Yosei it is! This is what Rabbi Yosei is saying to Rabbi Meir: Even Rabbi Shimon and the school of Rabbi Yehoshua, who are lenient, are lenient in a case of doubt and impurity, but in a case of purity and impurity - no.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא רָמֵי תְּרוּמָה אַפִּיסְחָא, וּמְשַׁנֵּי: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שְׁתֵּיהֶן כְּאַחַת?
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, raised a contradiction teruma of Passover, and he resolved it Did Rabbi Yehoshua say both together?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina raises a question regarding Terumah in Apischa, and he asks: Who said that Rabbi Yehoshua considers both of them as one?

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: חָבִית שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנּוֹלַד בָּהּ סְפֵק טוּמְאָה, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה מוּנַּחַת בִּמְקוֹם הַתּוּרְפָּה — יַנִּיחֶנָּה בְּמָקוֹם הַמּוּצְנָע, וְאִם הָיְתָה מְגוּלָּה יְכַסֶּנָּה. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה מוּנַּחַת בְּמָקוֹם הַמּוּצְנָע — יַנִּיחֶנָּה בִּמְקוֹם הַתּוּרְפָּה, וְאִם הָיְתָה מְכוּסֶּה יְגַלֶּנָּה.
human_translation: And raised a contradiction a barrel of teruma with regard to which uncertainty developed impurity, Rabbi Eliezer says: If was resting in a vulnerable place, one place it in a concealed place, and if it was exposed he cover it. Rabbi Yehoshua says: If it was placed in a concealed place place it in a vulnerable place. And if it was covered he expose it.
llm_translation: And they asked: A barrel of terumah in which there is doubt of impurity, Rabbi Eliezer says: If it was placed in an exposed place - leave it in a hidden place, and if it was uncovered, cover it. Rabbi Yehoshua says: If it was placed in a hidden place - leave it in an exposed place, and if it was covered, uncover it.

hebrew_text: גְּרָמָא — אִין, בְּיָדַיִם — לָא! וּמְשַׁנֵּי: הָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, הָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: causation yes, with hands, no, And resolved This Rabbi Shimon in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua, that Rabbi Yosei in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: "Garma - no, with hands - no! And they taught: This is Rabbi Shimon the son of Rabbi Yehoshua's view, this is Rabbi Yosei the son of Rabbi Yehoshua's view."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר רָמֵי תְּרוּמָה אַתְּרוּמָה, וּמְשַׁנֵּי: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ גְּרָמָא אִין, בְּיָדַיִם לָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raised a contradiction teruma teruma , and resolved Did Rabbi Yehoshua say causation yes, with hands, no,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises a contradiction: "Terumah you shall lift up" - is it lifted up, or not? And he asks: Who said, Rabbi Yehoshua, the cause is not in my hands?

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: חָבִית שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה בַּגַּת הָעֶלְיוֹנָה וְתַחְתֶּיהָ חוּלִּין טְמֵאִין —
human_translation: And raised a contradiction a barrel of teruma that broke in the upper in a winepress, and impure, non-sacred lower
llm_translation: And they asked: A barrel of terumah that broke in the upper winepress, and underneath it are hullin, they are impure —

hebrew_text: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר (לְרַבִּי) יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שֶׁאִם יָכוֹל לְהַצִּיל מִמֶּנָּה רְבִיעִית בְּטׇהֳרָה — יַצִּיל, וְאִם לָאו — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: תֵּרֵד וְתִטַּמֵּא, וְאַל יְטַמְּאֶנָּה בַּיָּד.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer concedes to Rabbi Yehoshua that if one is able to rescue a quarter- from in ritual purity, he rescue And one cannot Rabbi Eliezer says: descend and become impure but one not render it impure with hand.
llm_translation: Rebbe Eliezer concedes to Rebbe Yehoshua that if he can save a quarter-log of liquid in purity, he should save it. But if not, Rebbe Eliezer says: "Descend and become impure, but do not let it become impure in your hand."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: יְטַמְּאֶנָּה בַּיָּד!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: One render it impure with hand,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: "She shall be defiled by hand!"

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁנֵּי: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאִיכָּא הֶפְסֵד חוּלִּין.
human_translation: And resolved There, it is different, as, there is loss of non-sacred
llm_translation: And from the Mishnah: "Sha'anei." There, it is different because there is a loss of secular property.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי אִיכָּא הֶפְסֵד עֵצִים! אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לְהֶפְסֵד מְרוּבֶּה — חָשְׁשׁוּ, לְהֶפְסֵד מוּעָט — לֹא חָשְׁשׁוּ.
human_translation: Rava strongly objects to this the mishna too there is loss of wood, Abaye said to him: were concerned about a great loss. they were not concerned about minimal loss
llm_translation: Rava objects to him: There is a teaching in the Mishnah where there is a loss of wood! Abaye said to him: When there is a significant loss - they were concerned, when there is a minor loss - they were not concerned.

hebrew_text: ומְנָא תֵּימְרָא דִּלְהֶפְסֵד מְרוּבֶּה חָשְׁשׁוּ, וּלְהֶפְסֵד מוּעָט לֹא חָשְׁשׁוּ, דְּתַנְיָא: חָבִית שֶׁל שֶׁמֶן תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה בַּגַּת הָעֶלְיוֹנָה, וּבַתַּחְתּוֹנָה חוּלִּין טְמֵאִין — מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שֶׁאִם יָכוֹל לְהַצִּיל מִמֶּנָּה רְבִיעִית בְּטׇהֳרָה — יַצִּיל, וְאִם לָאו — תֵּרֵד וְתִטַּמֵּא וְאַל יְטַמְּאֶנָּה בַּיָּד.
human_translation: And from where do you say were concerned about a great loss and they were not concerned about a minimal loss? As it was taught a barrel of teruma oil that broke in the upper press, and in the lower impure, non-sacred Rabbi Eliezer concedes to Rabbi Yehoshua that if one can rescue a quarter- in purity from he rescue And one cannot descend and become impure but one not render it impure with hand.
llm_translation: And count the reason for concern of loss from the majority, they were concerned, and for concern of loss from the minority, they were not concerned, as it was taught: A barrel of trumah oil that broke in the upper vat, and in the lower vat there are impure common oil — Rabbi Eliezer concedes to Rabbi Yehoshua that if he can save a quarter of it in purity, he should save it, but if not — it should be poured down and become impure, and one should not render it impure by hand.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא שֶׁמֶן, דְּרָאוּי לְהַדְלִיק? יַיִן נָמֵי רָאוּי לְזִילּוּף!
human_translation: What is different oil that it is suitable for lighting wine is also fit for sprinkling
llm_translation: What is different about oil, that it is suitable for lighting? Wine is suitable for pouring!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵימָא זִילּוּף לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא, וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חִיָּיא: שׁוֹתִין מִלּוֹג בְּסֶלַע, וּמְזַלְּפִין מִלּוֹג בִּשְׁתַּיִם! בְּחָדָשׁ.
human_translation: And lest you say sprinkling is not matter, didn’t Shmuel say in the name of Rabbi Ḥiyya: One drinks from a log for a sela , and one sprinkles from a log for two to new
llm_translation: And if you will say, "Mixing is not a matter," but Samuel said in the name of Rabbi Chiya: "They drink from a log in a rock, and they mix from a log in two!" In the month.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רָאוּי לְיַשְּׁנוֹ! אָתֵי בֵּיהּ לִידֵי תַּקָּלָה. שֶׁמֶן נָמֵי, אָתֵי בֵּיהּ לִידֵי תַּקָּלָה!
human_translation: But isn’t fit to be aged, thereby come to encounter a stumbling block, oil too, one thereby come to encounter a stumbling block,
llm_translation: And is it fitting to repeat it! It leads to a stumbling block. Oil of the righteous, it leads to a stumbling block!

hebrew_text: דְּרָמֵי לֵיהּ בִּכְלִי מָאוּס. יַיִן נָמֵי, רָמֵי לֵיהּ בִּכְלִי מָאוּס! לְזִילּוּף קָא בָעֵי לֵיהּ, בִּכְלִי מָאוּס רָמֵי לֵיהּ?!
human_translation: because he places it in a repulsive vessel, wine, too, place it in a repulsive vessel. one wants for sprinkling will place it in a repulsive vessel?
llm_translation: He threw it into a vessel of disdain. Good wine, he threw it into a vessel of disdain! He wants it for mixing, he threw it into a vessel of disdain?!

hebrew_text: וְתַקָּלָה עַצְמָהּ, תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: תִּשָּׁפֵךְ חֲבָל, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: תֵּעָשֶׂה זִילּוּף.
human_translation: And a stumbling block is itself tanna’im . As it was taught a barrel of teruma wine that became ritually impure, Beit Shammai say: It be poured out all at once, and Beit Hillel say: it be used for spraying.
llm_translation: The text reads: "And the vessel itself, it is a dispute of Tannaim. For it was taught: If a barrel of wine of terumah becomes impure, Beit Shammai say: Pour it out through a hole, and Beit Hillel say: Let it be mixed."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אֲנִי אַכְרִיעַ: בַּשָּׂדֶה — תִּשָּׁפֵךְ חֲבָל, בַּבַּיִת — תֵּעָשֶׂה זִילּוּף. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בְּחָדָשׁ — תִּשָּׁפֵךְ חֲבָל, בְּיָשָׁן — תֵּעָשֶׂה זִילּוּף. אָמְרוּ לוֹ:
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: I will decide in a field, it be poured out all at once, in the house, it be used for sprinkling. Some say In new it be poured out all at once; in old it should be used for spraying. They said to him:
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: I will decide - in the field, a rope should be spread out; in the house, a bundle should be made. Some say: in the new rope, a rope should be spread out; in the old rope, a bundle should be made. They said to him:

hebrew_text: אֵין הַכְרָעַת שְׁלִישִׁית מַכְרַעַת.
human_translation: The decision third not a decision
llm_translation: The decision of the third one is decisive.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַחְלוֹקֶת שֶׁנָּפְלָה לְפָחוֹת מִמֵּאָה סְאָה חוּלִּין טְמֵאִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: dispute where fell into less than one hundred se’a of impure, non-sacred
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina: A dispute that fell less than one hundred se'ah of impure common produce.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל נָפְלָה לְמֵאָה חוּלִּין טְמֵאִין — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל תֵּרֵד וְתִטַּמֵּא, וְאַל יְטַמְּאֶנָּה בַּיָּד.
human_translation: However, fell into one hundred ritually impure, non-sacred everyone agrees descend and become ritually impure and one not render it impure with hand.
llm_translation: But if it fell into one hundred empty vessels, they are impure - this is the opinion of all; they shall descend and become impure, but one should not make them impure by hand.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: חָבִית שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה בַּגַּת הָעֶלְיוֹנָה, וְתַחְתֶּיהָ מֵאָה חוּלִּין טְמֵאִין — מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שֶׁאִם יָכוֹל לְהַצִּיל מִמֶּנָּה רְבִיעִית בְּטׇהֳרָה — יַצִּיל, וְאִם לָאו — תֵּרֵד וְתִטַּמֵּא וְאַל יְטַמְּאֶנָּה בַּיָּד.
human_translation: That was also taught a barrel of teruma that broke in the upper winepress, and in the lower one hundred ritually impure, non-sacred Rabbi Eliezer concedes to Rabbi Yehoshua that if one is able to rescue a quarter- from in ritual purity, he rescue And not, descend and become impure but he not render it impure with hand.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: If a barrel that broke in the upper winepress, and underneath it are one hundred impure hullin — Rabbi Eliezer concedes to Rabbi Yehoshua that if he can save a quarter of it in purity, he should save it, but if not — it should be lowered and become impure, and one should not make it impure intentionally.

hebrew_text: הַאי ״מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ״, מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רָבָא: אֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: This Rabbi Eliezer concedes to Rabbi Yehoshua, should Rabbi Yehoshua concedes to Rabbi Eliezer, Rava said: Reverse
llm_translation: This is the case of "Rabbi Eliezer concedes to Rabbi Yehoshua," Rabbi Yehoshua concedes to Rabbi Eliezer from where does he concede to him! Rava said: Turn it around.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר, לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בִּכְלִי שֶׁתּוֹכוֹ טָהוֹר וְגַבּוֹ טָמֵא. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא נִיגְזוֹר דִּילְמָא נָגַע גַּבּוֹ בִּתְרוּמָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Actually, do not reverse with what are we dealing here? in a vessel whose interior is ritually pure and whose exterior is impure Lest you say we issue a decree lest the exterior touch the teruma teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said, "Always do not reverse: Here, with what are we dealing? With a vessel whose interior is pure and its exterior is impure. Lest you say, perhaps it became scratched, and maybe its exterior touched terumah, it is evident to us."

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ אוֹר לְאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר
llm_translation: We will return to you, light, for fourteen.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל שָׁעָה שֶׁמּוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל, מַאֲכִיל לַבְּהֵמָה לַחַיָּה וְלָעוֹפוֹת, וּמוֹכֵר לַנׇּכְרִי, וּמוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָתוֹ. עָבַר זְמַנּוֹ — אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָתוֹ, וְלֹא יַסִּיק בּוֹ תַּנּוּר וְכִירַיִם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין בִּיעוּר חָמֵץ אֶלָּא שְׂרֵיפָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף מְפָרֵר וְזוֹרֶה לְרוּחַ אוֹ מֵטִיל לַיָּם.
human_translation: entire time that it is permitted to eat one feed to domesticated animals, to non-domesticated animals, and to birds; and one sell to a gentile; and it is permitted to benefit from it. its time passes, it is prohibited to benefit from it, and one may not light an oven or a stove with Rabbi Yehuda says: The removal of leavened bread is only burning. And the Rabbis say: one even crumble and throw into the wind or cast into the sea.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Every moment that it is permitted to eat, one may feed it to domestic animals, wild animals, and birds, and sell it to a non-Jew, and benefit from it. If its time has passed, it is forbidden to benefit from it, and one may not use it to stoke ovens and stoves. Rabbi Yehuda says: The removal of leaven is only by burning. And the Sages say: One may also crumble it and scatter it to the wind or cast it into the sea.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כׇּל שָׁעָה שֶׁמּוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל — מַאֲכִיל, הָא כׇּל שָׁעָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל — אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּאִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא אִיכָּא חָמֵשׁ דְּאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל — וּמַאֲכִיל. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אוֹכְלִין כׇּל חָמֵשׁ, וְשׂוֹרְפִין בִּתְחִלַּת שֵׁשׁ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אוֹכְלִין כׇּל אַרְבַּע, וְתוֹלִין כׇּל חָמֵשׁ, וְשׂוֹרְפִין בִּתְחִלַּת שֵׁשׁ!
human_translation: entire time that it is permitted to eat one feed However, entire time that it is not permitted to eat one not feed Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. As, if Rabbi Yehuda, isn’t there fifth one not eat but one feed As we learned Rabbi Meir says: One eat the entire fifth and he burns at the beginning of the sixth Rabbi Yehuda says: One eat the entire fourth he suspends the entire fifth and he burns it at the beginning of the sixth
llm_translation: Gemara: Every hour that it is permitted to eat - one feeds, but every hour that it is not permitted to eat - one does not feed. Let us say the Mishnah is not like Rabbi Yehuda. For if it were like Rabbi Yehuda, there are five hours that one does not eat - and yet one feeds. As we learned in the Mishnah, Rabbi Meir says: One may eat until the fifth hour, and burn the chametz at the beginning of the sixth hour. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may eat until the fourth hour, search until the fifth hour, and burn the chametz at the beginning of the sixth hour!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי, רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא? הַאי ״כׇּל שָׁעָה שֶׁמּוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל מַאֲכִיל״ — ״כׇּל שָׁעָה שֶׁאוֹכֵל מַאֲכִיל״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, what Rabbi Meir. this entire time that it is permitted to eat one feed, It should have entire time that one eats he feed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And rather what, Rabbi Meir is it? This 'any time that it is permitted to eat, one feeds' — 'any time that one eats, one feeds' it requires." English translation: "But what about Rabbi Meir's opinion? This principle of 'whenever it is permissible to eat, one feeds' — it requires 'whenever one eats, one feeds'."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא: מַתְנִיתִין רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא. דִּתְנַן, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: חוּלִּין נֶאֱכָלִין כׇּל אַרְבַּע, תְּרוּמָה כׇּל חָמֵשׁ, וְשׂוֹרְפִין בִּתְחִלַּת שֵׁשׁ. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל שָׁעָה שֶׁמּוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל כֹּהֵן בִּתְרוּמָה, יִשְׂרָאֵל מַאֲכִיל חוּלִּין לַבְּהֵמָה לַחַיָּה וְלָעוֹפוֹת.
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla said: The mishna is Rabban Gamliel. As we learned Rabban Gamliel says: Non-sacred be eaten the entire fourth teruma the entire fifth and one burns at the beginning of the sixth And this is is saying: entire time that it is permitted a priest to partake of teruma , an Israelite feed non-sacred to domesticated animals, to non-domesticated animals, and to birds.
llm_translation: Rabah bar Ulla said: The Mishnah is that of Rabban Gamliel. For it was taught: Rabban Gamliel says: Regular food may be eaten for four hours, terumah for five hours, and the remains are burned at the beginning of the sixth hour. And this is what he means to say: Every hour that it is permissible for a priest to eat terumah, an Israelite feeds regular food to domestic animals, wild animals, and birds.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנָא בְּהֵמָה, לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנָא חַיָּה? צְרִיכָא. דְּאִי תְּנָא בְּהֵמָה — דְּאִי מְשַׁיְּירָא חָזֵי לַהּ. אֲבָל חַיָּה, דְּאִי מְשַׁיְּירָא קָמַצְנְעָא לַהּ — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: Why do I to teach domesticated animals, and why do I to teach non-domesticated animals necessary as had it taught domesticated animals, because if leaves over one will see However, a non-domesticated animal, if it leaves over it hides it say not
llm_translation: "Why do I need to teach about a domestic animal, why do I need to teach about a wild animal? It is necessary. For if one were to teach about a domestic animal - if it becomes fat, one may look at it. But a wild animal, if it becomes lean - I might say no."

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא חַיָּה — מִשּׁוּם דְּאִי מְשַׁיְּירָא מִיהַת מַצְנְעָא. אֲבָל בְּהֵמָה, זִימְנִין דִּמְשַׁיְּירָא וְלָא מַסֵּיק אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ, וְקָאֵי עֲלֵיהּ בְּ״בַל יֵרָאֶה וּבְבַל יִמָּצֵא״ — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had it taught a non-domesticated animal, because if it leaves over in any case it will hide However, a domesticated animal, sometimes it leaves over and it does not enter his mind And It shall not be seen and it shall not be found, apply to him. say not it was necessary
llm_translation: If one were to say "a wild animal" — because if it remains hidden, it is concealed. But with regard to a domestic animal, sometimes it remains hidden and does not reveal its mind, and it stands over it with "it will not be seen and it will not be found" — say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: עוֹפוֹת לְמָה לִי? אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה, תְּנָא נָמֵי עוֹפוֹת.
