This implies that he holds: liquids are absorbed by absorption. And once the food becomes impure for him, the liquids become impure for him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְאַתְּ לָא תִּיסְבְּרָא דְּמַשְׁקִין מִיפְקָד פְּקִידִי? וְהָתְנַן: טְמֵא מֵת שֶׁסָּחַט זֵיתִים וַעֲנָבִים מְכֻוֶּונֶת כְּבֵיצָה — טְהוֹרִין. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא מִיפְקָד פְּקִידִי — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי טְהוֹרִין, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִיבְלָע בְּלִיעִי — אַמַּאי טְהוֹרִין?
human_translation: said to him: Do you not hold liquids are stored Didn’t we learn one who is ritually impure a corpse who squeezed olives or grapes exact an egg-bulk, pure. Granted, if you say stored due to that is pure. But if you say absorbed why pure?
llm_translation: He said to him: And you do not think that liquids are considered as if they were designated? But we learned: If a person who is impure due to contact with a dead body slaughtered olives and grapes the size of an egg - they are pure. If you say it is because they are considered as if they were designated - that is why they are pure. But if you say it is due to being absorbed through ingestion - why are they pure?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, בַּעֲנָבִים שֶׁלֹּא הוּכְשְׁרוּ. לְאֵימַת מִתַּכְשְׁרִי? לְכִי סָחֵיט לְהוּ. כִּי סָחֵיט לְהוּ — בְּצִיר לְהוּ שִׁיעוּרָא. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, הָא דְּתַנְיָא: הָא לְמָה זֶה דּוֹמֶה — לִתְרוּמַת תּוּתִין (זֵיתִים) וַעֲנָבִים שֶׁנִּטְמְאָה, שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּהּ לֹא הֶיתֵּר אֲכִילָה וְלֹא הֶיתֵּר הַסָּקָה. הָא הֶיתֵּר אֲכִילָה נָמֵי אִית בֵּיהּ, דְּאִי בָּעֵי דָּרֵיךְ לְהוּ פָּחוֹת פָּחוֹת מִכְּבֵיצָה.
human_translation: said to him: With what are we dealing here? the grapes have not been rendered susceptible When do they become susceptible once one presses them when he presses them, and are lacking the measure for if you do not say so, that which was taught To what this be compared? to teruma of berries, olives, and grapes that became impure, which can neither be eaten nor burned. they may even be eaten, as if one wishes he may tread less than an egg-bulk
llm_translation: He said to him: Here, with what are we dealing? With grapes that have not been checked. When will they be checked? Go squeeze them. When you squeeze them - with the measure of a log. For if you do not say so, behold, it was taught: What is this similar to? To the tithe of olives and grapes that became impure, which has neither the permission for eating nor the permission for burning. It also has the permission for eating, for if one wants, he can eat less than the size of an egg at a time.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: גְּזֵירָה דִּילְמָא אָתֵי בְּהוּ לִידֵי תַקָּלָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּמִי חָיְישִׁינַן לְתַקָּלָה? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: מַדְלִיקִין בְּפַת וּבְשֶׁמֶן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פַּת — זָרֵיק לֵיהּ בֵּין הָעֵצִים. שֶׁמֶן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה — רָמֵי לֵיהּ בִּכְלִי מָאוּס.
human_translation: Rava said: a rabbinic decree lest he encounter a stumbling block. Abaye said to him: Are we concerned about stumbling block? Wasn’t taught One light with bread and oil of teruma that became ritually impure? said to him: Bread one throws it among the wood Teruma oil when one puts it into a repulsive vessel
llm_translation: Rava said: A decree lest it lead to a mishap. Abaye said to him: And do we concern ourselves with a mishap? But isn't it taught: One may kindle with bread and with oil of terumah that became impure. He said to him: Bread - throw it among the wood. Oil of terumah - lift it with a repulsive vessel.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: מַדְלִיקִין בְּפַת וּבְשֶׁמֶן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּחִזְקִיָּה, וְרָבָא אָמַר דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר מָרְתָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא פַּת, אֲבָל חִיטֵּי — לֹא, שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא בָּהֶן לִידֵי תַּקָּלָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ חִיטֵּי. וְאַמַּאי? נֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא אָתֵי בָּהֶן לִידֵי תַּקָּלָה! כִּדְאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: the itself, One light with bread and oil of teruma that became ritually impure. Abaye said in the name of Ḥizkiya and Rava said the school of Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Marta Rav Huna said: They taught only bread; however, wheat, no, with it, lest one encounter a stumbling block And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even wheat And why Let us be concerned lest he encounter a stumbling block. Rav Ashi said
llm_translation: Body: We light with bread and with oil of terumah that became impure. Abbaye said in the name of Chizkiyah, and Rava said in the school of Rabbi Yitzchak bar Marta said Rav Huna: They only taught regarding bread, but wheat - no, lest it lead to a stumbling block. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even wheat. And why? Concern that perhaps it will lead to a stumbling block! As Rav Ashe said:

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלִיקָתָא וּמְאִיסָתָא, הָכִי נָמֵי בִּשְׁלִיקָתָא וּמְאִיסָתָא. וְהֵיכָא אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב אָשֵׁי? אַהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין בַּר רַב אַחָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל גַּבָּל שֶׁל בֵּית רַבִּי הָיָה, וְהָיוּ מְחַמִּין לוֹ חַמִּין בְּחִיטִּין שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה טְמֵאָה לָלוּשׁ בָּהֶן עִיסָּה בְּטׇהֳרָה. אַמַּאי? נֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא אָתֵי בְּהוּ לִידֵי תַקָּלָה! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בִּשְׁלִיקָתָא וּמְאִיסָתָא.
human_translation: to boiled and repulsive so too to boiled and repulsive Where was Rav Ashi’s stated? with regard to this: As Rabbi Avin bar Rav Aḥa said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Abba Shaul was the kneader of Rabbi house, and they would heat water for him, with wheat of ritually impure teruma , in order to knead dough in ritual purity. Why Let us be concerned lest they encounter a stumbling block Rav Ashi said boiled and repulsive
llm_translation: In the matter of "Bishlikata" and "Meisata," so it was stated: "In the matter of 'Bishlikata' and 'Meisata.'" And where was it stated that Rav Ashe said? This is what Rabbi Avin bar Rav Acha said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: "Abba Sha'ul, the treasurer of the house of Rabbi, would have them heat for him hot water with impure terumah wheat, in order to knead dough with it in purity." Why? Lest perhaps it might come to a mishap! Rav Ashe said: "In the matter of 'Bishlikata' and 'Meisata.'"

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַב חֲנַנְיָא בַּר אָבִין תָּנוּ תְּרוּמוֹת בֵּי רַבָּה. פְּגַע בְּהוּ רָבָא בַּר מַתְנָה, אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי אָמְרִיתוּ בִּתְרוּמוֹת דְּבֵי מָר? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וּמַאי קַשְׁיָא לָךְ? אֲמַר לְהוּ, תְּנַן: שְׁתִילֵי תְרוּמוֹת שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ וּשְׁתָלָן — טְהוֹרִים מִלְּטַמֵּא, וַאֲסוּרִין מִלֶּאֱכוֹל (בִּתְרוּמָה). וְכִי מֵאַחַר דִּטְהוֹרִין מִלְּטַמֵּא, אַמַּאי אֲסוּרִין מִלֶּאֱכוֹל?
human_translation: Abaye bar Avin and Rav Ḥananya bar Avin taught Terumot in the school of Rabba. Rava bar Mattana met them said to them: What you say Terumot in the school of Master, They said to him: What difficult for you? He said to them: we learned Saplings teruma that became ritually impure and were planted are pure do not impart ritual impurity but they are prohibited to be eaten as teruma . If they do not impart ritual impurity, why is it prohibited to eat them?
llm_translation: Abaye son of Avin and Rav Chananya son of Avin taught the laws of the terumot in the house of Rabba. Rava bar Matna encountered them and said to them: What did you say regarding the terumot of the house of Mar? They said to him: And what is difficult for you? He said to them: We learned: If terumah seedlings became impure and were replanted, they are pure from becoming impure, but forbidden to eat (as terumah). And since they are pure from becoming impure, why are they forbidden to eat?

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבָּה: מַאי אֲסוּרִין — אֲסוּרִין לְזָרִים. וּמַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: גִּידּוּלֵי תְרוּמָה — תְּרוּמָה? תְּנֵינָא: גִּידּוּלֵי תְרוּמָה — תְּרוּמָה!
human_translation: said to This is what Rabba said What they are prohibited they are prohibited by non-priests, what is teaching us growths of teruma teruma ? we learned: Growths of teruma , teruma .
llm_translation: They said to him, thus said Rabba: What are the prohibitions - prohibited to non-priests. And what does he imply to us: the growths of terumah - terumah? We learned: the growths of terumah - terumah!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא גִּידּוּלֵי גִידּוּלִין, וּמַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ כָּלֶה. הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הַטֶּבֶל — גִּידּוּלָיו מוּתָּרִין, בְּדָבָר שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ כָּלֶה. אֲבָל בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ כָּלֶה — אֲפִילּוּ גִּידּוּלֵי גִידּוּלִין אֲסוּרִין בַּאֲכִילָה. אִישְׁתִּיקוּ.
human_translation: And if you say the growths of growths what is it teaching us? an item whose seed does not disintegrate we learned as well. untithed produce [ tevel ], its growths, are permitted in items whose seed disintegrates; however, in items where the seed does not disintegrate, it is prohibited to eat even the growths of growths They were silent
llm_translation: And if you will say, "Gidulei gidulin," what does it teach us? — In a matter where its seed is complete. This is indeed taught: Regarding tevel, its gidulayim are permitted, in a matter where its seed is complete. But in a matter where its seed is not complete — even gidulei gidulin are forbidden for consumption. Let them be silent.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מִידֵּי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ בְּהָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מַאי אֲסוּרִין — אֲסוּרִין לְכֹהֲנִים, הוֹאִיל וְאִיפְּסִילוּ לְהוּ בְּהֶיסַּח הַדַּעַת.
human_translation: They said to Have you heard something in this He said to them: This is what Rav Sheshet said: What prohibited prohibited for priests, since it has been disqualified for them due to the diversion of attention.
llm_translation: They said to him: "Did you hear this from Shemi'a?" He said to them, "Thus said Rav Sheshet: What are the prohibitions? — Prohibitions for the priests, since they have been invalidated in a moment of forgetfulness."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הֶיסַּח הַדַּעַת פְּסוּל הַגּוּף הָוֵי — שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הֶיסַּח הַדַּעַת פְּסוּל טוּמְאָה הָוֵי — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?!
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says diversion of attention constitutes an inherent disqualification, it works out well. But according to the one who says diversion of attention is a disqualification due to ritual impurity, what is there to say?
llm_translation: The one who says "neglect of intent disqualifies the offering but the body is valid" - it is good. Rather, the one who says "neglect of intent disqualifies the offering and renders it impure" - what can be said in response?!

hebrew_text: דְּאִתְּמַר: הֶיסַּח הַדַּעַת, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: פְּסוּל טוּמְאָה הָוֵי, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: פְּסוּל הַגּוּף הָוֵי.
human_translation: as it was stated: diversion of attention? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is a disqualification ritual impurity Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: It is an inherent disqualification.
llm_translation: It was stated: When one's mind is diverted, Rabbi Yochanan said: It is considered an invalid impurity, and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: It is considered an invalid impurity of the body.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר פְּסוּל טוּמְאָה הָוֵי: שֶׁאִם יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וִיטַהֲרֶנָּה — שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר פְּסוּל הַגּוּף הָוֵי: שֶׁאִם יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וִיטַהֲרֶנָּה — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan, said it is a disqualification ritual impurity, if Elijah comes and renders it ritually pure we will listen to him, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, said it is an inherent disqualification, if Elijah comes and renders it pure we will not listen to him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "An impure disqualified person is considered impure. If Elijah were to come and declare her pure, we would listen to him." Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: "An impure body is considered impure. If Elijah were to come and declare her pure, we would not listen to him."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמֵר: לוּל קָטָן הָיָה בֵּין כֶּבֶשׁ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ בְּמַעֲרָבוֹ שֶׁל כֶּבֶשׁ, שֶׁשָּׁם הָיוּ זוֹרְקִין פְּסוּלֵי חַטַּאת הָעוֹף, וּתְעוּבַּר צוּרָתָן, וְיוֹצְאִין לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא פְּסוּל טוּמְאָה הָוֵי, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי בָּעֵי עִיבּוּר צוּרָה, שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וִיטַהֲרֶנָּה. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ פְּסוּל הַגּוּף, לְמָה לִי עִיבּוּר צוּרָה? וְהָתְנַן, זֶה הַכְּלָל:
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: There was a small gap between the ramp and the altar on the western of the ramp, where they would throw disqualified birds sin-offerings. until their form decayed, taken out to the place burning. Granted, if you say is a disqualification ritual impurity, for this reason it requires decay of form and Elijah may come and render it ritually pure. However, if you say it is an inherent disqualification, why do I it has decay of form? But didn’t we learn this is the principle:
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan against Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka, says: If a small rampart was between the sheep and the altar in its western side, where they would pour out the disqualified bird sin-offerings, and their form would be altered, and they would be taken out to the place of burning. If you say that they are disqualified due to impurity, then why do we need to alter their form, perhaps Elijah will come and purify them. But if you say that the body is disqualified, why do I need to alter their form? And we learned in the Mishnah, this is the principle.

hebrew_text: כׇּל שֶׁפְּסוּלוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ — יִשָּׂרֵף מִיָּד. בַּדָּם וּבַבְּעָלִים — תְּעוּבַּר צוּרָתָן וְיוֹצְאִין לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי תַּנָּא, תַּנָּא דְּבֵי רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ הוּא, דְּאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ פִּיגּוּל טָעוּן עִיבּוּר צוּרָה.
human_translation: Any that has a disqualification in the body should be burned immediately. in the blood its owner, its form is decayed and taken out to the place burning. said to him: This tanna , is tanna the school of Rabba bar Avuh, who said: Even piggul , requires decay of form.
llm_translation: All that is disqualified in its body - shall be immediately burned. With regard to the blood and the organs - their form shall be changed and they shall be taken out to the house of burning. He said to him: This Mishna, is the Mishna of the school of Rabba bar Avuh, who said: Even a "Piggul" requires the form of a bird.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: נִטְמָא אוֹ שֶׁנִּפְסַל הַבָּשָׂר, אוֹ שֶׁיָּצָא חוּץ לַקְּלָעִים, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יִזְרוֹק, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִזְרוֹק. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שֶׁאִם זָרַק — הוּרְצָה.
human_translation: raised a objection to If the meat became impure or disqualified, or if it was taken out of the walls Rabbi Eliezer says: He sprinkles Rabbi Yehoshua says: He does not sprinkle And Rabbi Yehoshua concedes that if was sprinkled, is accepted.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: If the flesh became impure or disqualified, or if it went outside the curtains, Rabbi Eliezer says: It should be thrown away, Rabbi Yehoshua says: It should not be thrown away. And Rabbi Yehoshua concedes that if it was thrown away — it is acceptable.

hebrew_text: מַאי נִפְסַל — לָאו בְּהֶיסַּח הַדַּעַת? אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא פְּסוּלֵי טוּמְאָה הָוֵי, הַיְינוּ דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דִּמְרַצֵּי צִיץ. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ פְּסוּל הַגּוּף הָוֵי, אַמַּאי הוּרְצָה (צִיץ)?
human_translation: what disqualification Is it not a diversion of attention? Granted, if you say a disqualification ritual impurity, this is you find because the frontplate atones But if you say that it is an inherent disqualification, why accepted
llm_translation: What is the disqualification — is it not due to a lapse of intent? If you say it is regarding disqualified items of impurity, that is when you forget that it requires the appearance of the Tzitz. But if you say it is regarding a disqualified body, why is it acceptable (Tzitz)?

hebrew_text: מַאי נִפְסַל, נִפְסַל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם. אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ טָמֵא! תְּרֵי גַּוְונֵי טָמֵא.
human_translation: what was disqualified? disqualified due to one who immersed himself during the day. If that is so, this is ritual impurity. two types of ritual impurity
llm_translation: What is disqualified, is disqualified in a state of being immersed for a day. If so, that is the same as being impure! Two types of impurity.

hebrew_text: כִּי סְלֵיק רָבִין, אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, וַאֲמַר: בַּבְלָאֵי טַפְשָׁאֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּיָתְבִי בְּאַרְעָא דַחֲשׁוֹכָא אָמְרִיתוּן שְׁמַעְתָּתָא דִּמְחַשְּׁכוּ. לָא שְׁמִיעַ לְכוּ הָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא:
human_translation: When Ravin ascended he stated halakha of before Rabbi Yirmeya. And said: Foolish Babylonians! Because you dwell in a dark land, you state halakhot that are dim. Have you not heard this Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish in the name of Rabbi Oshaya?
llm_translation: When Ravin ascended, she said in his presence to Rabbi Yirmeya, and he said: "In the foolish Babylonians, because they dwell in a land of darkness, they said that the darkness is light." Do not listen to what Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya.

hebrew_text: מֵי הַחַג שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ, הִשִּׁיקָן וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקְדִּישָׁן — טְהוֹרִין, הִקְדִּישָׁן וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִשִּׁיקָן — טְמֵאִים.
human_translation: the water festival became impure, was contact was then consecrated, it is ritually pure. if it was consecrated and was then contact it is ritually impure.
llm_translation: The waters of the festival that became impure, if one poured them out and then sanctified them - they are pure; if one sanctified them and then poured them out - they are impure.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי זְרִיעָה נִינְהוּ, מָה לִי הִשִּׁיקָן וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקְדִּישָׁן, מָה לִי הִקְדִּישָׁן וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִשִּׁיקָן? אַלְמָא: אֵין זְרִיעָה לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ. הָכָא נָמֵי, אֵין זְרִיעָה לִתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: Since is to planting, what does it matter if it was contact and then consecrated or consecrated and then contact? Apparently planting is not to consecrated items, here too, planting is not to teruma .
llm_translation: From the perspective of planting, they are considered, why do I need to consecrate them and then tithe them, why do I need to tithe them and then consecrate them? This implies: There is no planting for consecration. Here too, there is no planting for terumah.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב דִּימִי וְקָאָמַר לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הִקְדִּישָׁן בִּכְלִי קָאָמַר, אֲבָל בַּפֶּה לָא עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן מַעֲלָה. אוֹ דִילְמָא בַּפֶּה נָמֵי עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן מַעֲלָה?
human_translation: Rav Dimi sat and said this halakha Abaye said to him: Did he consecrated in a vessel, but through speech then the Sages did not impose a higher Or perhaps the Sages imposed a higher where through speech as well?
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Dimi and saying to her this matter. Said to him Abbaye: Sanctified them in vessel saying, but in mouth not Rabbanan act above. Or perhaps in mouth also Rabbanan act above?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זוֹ לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי, כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ שָׁמַעְתִּי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עֲנָבִים שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ, דְּרָכָן וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקְדִּישָׁן — טְהוֹרִים. הִקְדִּישָׁן וְאַחַר כָּךְ דְּרָכָן — טְמֵאִין. וְהָא עֲנָבִים דִּקְדוּשַּׁת פֶּה נִינְהוּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן מַעֲלָה.
human_translation: said to him: I did not hear this I heard a similar case. As Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: grapes that became ritually impure, if one trod on them and afterward consecrated them, they are pure. he consecrated and afterward pressed them, they are impure, And yet grapes which are consecrated through speech, even so, the Sages imposed a higher
llm_translation: He said to him: "This I have not heard, but something similar to it I have heard." For Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Grapes that became ritually impure, if their usual purpose was for consumption and then they were consecrated, they remain pure. If they were consecrated first and then designated for consumption, they are impure. And these grapes are considered sacred by verbal declaration, yet the Sages elevate the status.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: עֲנָבִים קָאָמְרַתְּ? הָכָא בַּעֲנָבִים שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה עָסְקִינַן, דִּקְדוּשַּׁת פֶּה דִּידְהוּ — כִּקְדוּשַּׁת כְּלִי דָּמְיָא. אֲבָל הָנֵי דְּבָעֵי כְּלִי, בַּפֶּה לָא עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן מַעֲלָה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: you spoke of grapes, and here we are dealing with grapes of teruma , whose consecration through speech is comparable to consecration in a vessel, However, those that require a vessel the Sages did not impose a higher through speech.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Are we speaking about grapes? Here we are dealing with grapes of terumah, for the sanctity of their produce is like the sanctity of a vessel. But those that require a vessel, the Sages did not elevate them to the level of the mouth.

hebrew_text: דְּרָכָן — וַאֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא?! וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עֲנָבִים שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ — דּוֹרְכָן פָּחוֹת פָּחוֹת מִכְּבֵיצָה!
human_translation: if one tread upon them even many And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this? Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: grapes that became ritually impure grapes, one tread on them less than an egg-bulk at a time.
llm_translation: Their way - even a good one?! But who said so, Rabbi Yochanan like this, and didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: Grapes that became impure - their way is less than a kevitzah!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָכָא נָמֵי פָּחוֹת פָּחוֹת מִכְּבֵיצָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָתָם דְּנָגְעוּ לְהוּ בְּרִאשׁוֹן, דְּהָווּ לְהוּ אִינְהוּ שֵׁנִי. הָכָא דְּנָגְעוּ בְּשֵׁנִי, דְּהָווּ לְהוּ שְׁלִישִׁי.
human_translation: If you wish, say Here, too, less than an egg-bulk at a time. And if you wish, say There, came into contact first- that they became second- Here, they came into contact second- that they became third-
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Here, they are each less than a kevitzah. And if you wish, say: There, since they touched him first, they were considered the second. Here, since they touched him second, they are considered the third.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: ״וְנָתַן עָלָיו מַיִם חַיִּים אֶל כֶּלִי״ — שֶׁתְּהֵא חִיּוּתָן בִּכְלִי. ״וְנָתַן״, אַלְמָא תְּלוּשִׁין נִינְהוּ. וְהָא מְחוּבָּרִין נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: Rava said: We, too, have learned and he shall put flowing water into a vessel” should flow into the vessel “and he shall put,” Apparently is detached, but it is attached
llm_translation: Rava said, "We also learn: 'And he shall put living water into a vessel' - that their living should be in a vessel. 'And he shall put' - this implies that they are separate. Yet, they are connected!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַעֲלָה. הָכִי נָמֵי — מַעֲלָה.
human_translation: Rather, a higher standard, Here too, a higher standard
llm_translation: Rather, "ma'alah." This is what is meant - "ma'alah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: טָבַל וְעָלָה — אוֹכֵל בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. הֶעֱרִיב שִׁמְשׁוֹ — אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה. בִּתְרוּמָה אִין, בְּקָדָשִׁים לָא. אַמַּאי, טָהוֹר הוּא? אֶלָּא מַעֲלָה. הָכִי נָמֵי — מַעֲלָה.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: We, too, learned immersed and emerged, eat tithes the sun set for him, he eat teruma . With regard to teruma , yes, with regard to consecrated no, Why he is ritually pure. Rather, higher standard Here too, a higher standard
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashei said, we also learned: If one immersed and the sun set - he may eat from the tithe. If he designated his contribution - he may eat from the heave-offering. If from the heave-offering, no; from the consecrated items, no. Why? Is he pure? Rather, he has designated. So we say - he has designated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: ״וְהַבָּשָׂר״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָעֵצִים וּלְבוֹנָה. עֵצִים וּלְבוֹנָה בְּנֵי אִיטַּמּוֹיֵי נִינְהוּ?! אֶלָּא מַעֲלָה. הָכָא נָמֵי — מַעֲלָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: We, too, learned And the flesh to include the wood and the frankincense. Do wood and frankincense capacity to become ritually impure, Rather, a higher standard here too, a higher standard
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said, we also learned: "And the flesh," to include wood and frankincense. Are wood and frankincense offspring of the trees?! Rather, it is an elevation. Here too, it is an elevation.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בַּפֶּסַח: בְּחִטִּים, בִּשְׂעוֹרִים, בְּכוּסְּמִין וּבְשִׁיפוֹן וּבְשִׁיבּוֹלֶת שׁוּעָל. וְיוֹצְאִין בִּדְמַאי וּבְמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁנִּטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ, וּבְמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ. וְהַכֹּהֲנִים בַּחַלָּה וּבַתְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: These are with which a person fulfills his obligation on the Passover: With wheat, with barley, with spelt [ kusmin ], with rye [ shifon ], and with oats [ shibbolet shu’al ]. And one fulfills with doubtfully tithed produce, and with first tithe from which its teruma was taken, second tithe and consecrated food that were redeemed. And priests from ḥalla , or with teruma ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the things that a person fulfills his obligation with on Passover: with wheat, with barley, with spelt, with oats, and with rye. And one fulfills his obligation with produce subject to doubt regarding tithes and with the first tithe that its terumah was separated, and with the second tithe and consecrated items that were redeemed. And the priests fulfill their obligation with challah and with terumah.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא בְּטֶבֶל, וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ, וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדּוּ. חַלּוֹת הַתּוֹדָה וּרְקִיקֵי נָזִיר, עֲשָׂאָן לְעַצְמוֹ — אֵין יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן. עֲשָׂאָן לִמְכּוֹר בַּשּׁוּק — יוֹצְאִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: However, not with untithed produce, nor with first tithe from which its teruma was not separated, nor with second tithe, nor consecrated that was not redeemed. loaves of a thanks-offering, wafers by a nazirite, he prepared them for himself, does not fulfill with them. he prepared them to sell them in the market one fulfills with them.
llm_translation: However, not with tevel, and not with the first tithe that its terumah was not taken, and not with the second tithe and consecrated items that were not redeemed. Thanksgiving loaves and Nazirite wafers, if one made them for oneself — one does not fulfill with them. If one made them to sell in the market — one fulfills with them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: כּוּסְּמִין — מִין חִיטִּין, שִׁיבּוֹלֶת שׁוּעָל וְשִׁיפוֹן — מִין שְׂעוֹרִין. כּוּסְּמִין — גּוּלְבָּא, שִׁיפוֹן — דִּישְׁרָא, שִׁיבּוֹלֶת שׁוּעָל — שֻׁבְילֵי תַעֲלָא. הָנֵי אִין, אוֹרֶז וְדוֹחַן — לָא.
human_translation: taught Spelt a type of wheat, oats [ shibbolet shu’al ] and rye [ shifon ] a type of barley. Spelt gulba ; rye dishra ; oats shevilei ta’ala . These yes, rice [ orez ] and millet [ doḥan ], no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Kusmin - a type of wheat, Shibolet Shual and Shipon - a type of barley. Kusmin - Gulba, Shipon - Dishra, Shibolet Shual - Shevilei Ta'ala. These are not Orez and Dochon.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: אָמַר קְרָא ״לֹא תֹאכַל עָלָיו חָמֵץ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים תֹּאכַל עָלָיו מַצּוֹת״. דְּבָרִים הַבָּאִים לִידֵי חִימּוּץ — אָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּמַצָּה, יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין בָּאִין לִידֵי חִימּוּץ, אֶלָּא לִידֵי סִירְחוֹן.
human_translation: From where are these matters, derived? Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, and likewise of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught, and likewise of the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov taught the verse states: “You shall eat no leavened bread with it; seven days you shall eat with it matza , substances which will come to leavening, a person fulfills his obligation to matza with them, excludes these which, do not come to leavening but to decay [ siraḥon ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are the particulars? Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, and so did the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, and so did the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov: The verse states, "You shall not eat leavened bread with it; for seven days you shall eat with it unleavened bread." Matters that lead to fermentation - a person fulfills his obligation with matzah through them. These are those that do not lead to fermentation, but lead to spoilage.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, דְּאָמַר: אוֹרֶז מִין דָּגָן הוּא, וְחַיָּיבִין עַל חִימּוּצוֹ כָּרֵת. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אוֹסֵר בְּאוֹרֶז וְדוֹחַן מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקָּרוֹב לְהַחְמִיץ.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, who said: Rice is type of grain, and one is liable karet for its leavened As it was taught Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri prohibits rice and millet due to that they are close to being leavened.
llm_translation: Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, who said: rice is a type of grain, and one is liable for its leavening with karet. As it was taught: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri prohibits rice and sifts it because it is close to becoming leavened.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ ״שֶׁקָּרוֹב לְהַחְמִיץ״? דְּקָדֵים וּמַחְמִיץ, אוֹ דִילְמָא: ״קָרוֹב לְהַחְמִיץ״ — הָוֵי, חָמֵץ גָּמוּר — לָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before That it is close to becoming leavened? that it will be leavened quicker Or perhaps it is close to being leavened, it is not full-fledged leavened bread.
llm_translation: He asked them: "Is 'close to becoming leavened' closer to being leavened, or perhaps 'close to becoming leavened' is considered fully leavened and is not considered close?"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: אוֹרֶז מִין דָּגָן הוּא וְחַיָּיבִין עַל חִימּוּצוֹ כָּרֵת, וְאָדָם יוֹצֵא בּוֹ יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בַּפֶּסַח.
human_translation: Come hear as it was taught Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: Rice is type of grain. one is liable karet for its leavened and a person fulfill his obligation with it on Passover.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: Rice is a type of grain, and one is liable for its leavening with karet, and a person fulfills his obligation with it on Passover.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אוֹמֵר: קַרְמִית חַיֶּיבֶת בְּחַלָּה. מַאי קַרְמִית? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שֵׁיצְנִיתָא. מַאי שֵׁיצְנִיתָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שֵׁיצְנִיתָא דְּמִשְׁתַּכְחָא בֵּינֵי כַּלָּנְיָתָא.
human_translation: And so too, Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri would say: keramit , obligated to ḥalla , What is keramit ? Abaye said: shitzanita . What is shitzanita ? Rav Pappa said: This is the wild grain that is found between papyrus reeds.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And so did Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri say: A vineyard is liable for challah. What is a vineyard? Abaye said: A grapevine. What is a grapevine? Rav Papa said: A grapevine that intertwines among the shoots.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: עִיסָּה שֶׁנִּילּוֹשָׁה בְּיַיִן וְשֶׁמֶן וּדְבַשׁ — אֵין חַיָּיבִין עַל חִימּוּצָהּ כָּרֵת. יָתֵיב רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין, וְיָתֵיב רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין וְקָא מְנַמְנֵם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַב פָּפָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ?
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Reish Lakish said: dough that was kneaded with wine, oil, or honey, one is not liable karet for its leavened Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, were sitting before Rav Idi bar Avin, and Rav Idi bar Avin was sitting and dozing Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Pappa: What is the reason of Reish Lakish,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Reish Lakish said: Dough that was kneaded with wine, oil, and honey - one is not liable for its leavening with regard to the punishment of excision. Rav Pappa and Rav Huna the son of Rav Yehoshua were sitting before Rav Idi bar Avin, and Rav Idi bar Avin was dozing. Rav Huna the son of Rav Yehoshua said to Rav Pappa: What is the reason of Reish Lakish?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא תֹאכַל עָלָיו חָמֵץ [וְגוֹ׳]״. דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּמַצָּה — חַיָּיבִין עַל חִימּוּצוֹ כָּרֵת. וְהָא, הוֹאִיל וְאֵין אָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהּ יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ, דְּהָוְיָא לַיהּ מַצָּה עֲשִׁירָה — אֵין חַיָּיבִין עַל חִימּוּצָהּ כָּרֵת.
human_translation: said to him: The verse states: “You shall eat no leavened bread with it; substances which a person fulfills his obligation to matza , one is liable karet for leavened And this since a person does not fulfill his obligation with it, it is rich, matza , one is not liable karet for its leavened
llm_translation: He said to him, as the verse says: "Do not eat upon it etc.." Things that a person fulfills his obligation with unleavened bread - he is liable for its leavening with karet. But since a person does not fulfill his obligation with it, as it would be considered rich matzah - he is not liable for its leavening with karet.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַב פָּפָּא: הִמְחָהוּ וּגְמָעוֹ, אִם חָמֵץ הוּא — עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, וְאִם מַצָּה הוּא — אֵין אָדָם יוֹצֵא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בַּפֶּסַח. וְהָא הָכָא, דְּאֵין אָדָם יוֹצֵא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּמַצָּה, וְחַיָּיבִין עַל חִימּוּצוֹ כָּרֵת?
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, raised an objection to Rav Pappa: dissolved it in water, and swallowed If is leavened bread, punished with karet ; and if it is matza , a person does not fulfill his obligation on Passover But here where a person does not fulfill his obligation to matza and he is liable karet for its leavened
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, raised an objection to Rav Pappa: If one erases and swallows it, if it is leavened — the punishment is excision, and if it is unleavened — a person does not fulfill his obligation on Passover. But here, where a person does not fulfill his obligation with unleavened bread, and is liable for its leavening, is excision imposed?

hebrew_text: אִיתְּעַר בְּהוּ רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין, אָמַר לְהוּ: דַּרְדְּקֵי, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָווּ לְהוּ מֵי פֵירוֹת,
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin woke up, said to them: Children, this is the reasoning of Reish Lakish: because are fruit juices,
llm_translation: There was an incident with Rav Idi bar Avin, he said to them: "Dardakai, that is the reason of Reish Lakish: because they were like fruit juices."

hebrew_text: וּמֵי פֵירוֹת אֵין מַחְמִיצִין.
human_translation: and fruit juice does not leavened.
llm_translation: And from fruits, one does not leaven.

hebrew_text: יוֹצֵא בִּדְמַאי וּבְמַעֲשֵׂר וְכוּ׳. דְּמַאי הָא לָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ! כֵּיוָן דְּאִי בָּעֵי מַפְקַר לְנִכְסֵיהּ הָוֵי עָנִי וְאוֹכֵל דְּמַאי — הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי חֲזֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: fulfill with doubtfully tithed produce and of first tithe, doubtfully tithed produce? not suitable for him Since, if one desires renounce his property, now too it is suitable for him,
llm_translation: One who goes out with Demai and with Ma'aser, etc. Demai - this one does not see it! Since if he wants to declare his property ownerless, he will be poor and eat Demai - now he sees it.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: מַאֲכִילִין אֶת הָעֲנִיִּים דְּמַאי, וְאֶת אַכְסַנְיָא דְּמַאי. וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: תָּנָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מַאֲכִילִין אֶת הָעֲנִיִּים דְּמַאי וְאֶת הָאַכְסַנְיָא דְּמַאי, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מַאֲכִילִין.
human_translation: As we learned One feed the poor doubtfully tithed produce, and soldiers [ akhsanya ] doubtfully tithed produce. And Rav Huna said was taught Beit Shammai say: One neither feed the poor doubtfully tithed produce, nor soldiers doubtfully tithed produce. And Beit Hillel say: One feed
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "One may feed the poor - what is the law regarding this? And the innkeepers - what is the law regarding this?" And Rav Huna said: "It was taught in a Mishnah, Beit Shammai says: 'We do not feed the poor - what is the law regarding this? And the innkeepers - what is the law regarding this?' And Beit Hillel says: 'We feed.'"

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁנִּטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא! דְּכֵיוָן שֶׁנִּטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ חוּלִּין הָוֵי!
human_translation: first tithe from which its teruma , was taken obvious, as, since its teruma has been taken, it is non-sacred
llm_translation: First tithe that its terumah was taken etc. Obviously! Since its terumah was taken, it becomes hullin.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא — שֶׁהִקְדִּימוֹ בְּשִׁיבֳּלִים, וְנִטְּלָה הֵימֶנּוּ תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר וְלֹא נִטְּלָה הֵימֶנּוּ תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה, וְכִדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ.
human_translation: No, necessary preceded on stalks. And the teruma of the tithe was taken the teruma gedola was not taken from And in accordance with Rabbi Abbahu.
llm_translation: Not needed - for he prioritized it with shekels, and he took from it the tithe of produce, but he did not take from it a large tithe, as Rabbi Avahu said.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁהִקְדִּימוֹ בְּשִׁיבֳּלִים — פָּטוּר מִתְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַהֲרֵמֹתֶם מִמֶּנּוּ תְּרוּמַת ה׳ מַעֲשֵׂר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר״. מַעֲשֵׂר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה וּתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: As Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: First tithe preceded on the stalks is exempt from teruma gedola , As it is stated: and you shall set apart from it a gift for the Lord, a tithe from the tithe” a tithe from the tithe, and not teruma gedola and the teruma of the tithe from the tithe.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: The first tithe that was given with shekels - exempt from the great heave offering, as it is stated: "And you shall lift from it the Lord's heave offering, a tithe from the tithe." I said to you a tithe from the tithe, not a great heave offering and a tithe of the tithe.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, אֲפִילּוּ הִקְדִּימוֹ בִּכְרִי נָמֵי לִיפְּטַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עָלֶיךָ אָמַר קְרָא ״מִכֹּל מַתְּנֹתֵיכֶם תָּרִימוּ אֵת כׇּל תְּרוּמַת ה׳״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: However, if is so, even preceded in a pile, said to him: With regard to your the verse states: “From all that is given to you, you shall set apart all of that which is the Lord’s teruma ,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: Rather, from now on, even if they preceded him with a golden throne to exempt him? He said to him: Upon you the verse said, "From all your gifts you shall offer every contribution of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ?! הַאי אִידְּגַן, וְהַאי לָא אִידְּגַן.
human_translation: And what did you see This has become grain; and that did not become grain,
llm_translation: And what did you see?! This one is fertile, and this one is not fertile.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, שֶׁנָּתַן אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְלֹא נָתַן אֶת הַחוֹמֶשׁ. וְקָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאֵין חוֹמֶשׁ מְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: second-tithe and consecrated that was redeemed. obvious With what are we dealing here? where one gave the principal, but he did not give fifth And teaches us the fifth does not invalidate
llm_translation: Second tithe and consecrated items that were redeemed, etc. Obviously! Here we are dealing with what? That he gave the principal but did not give the fifth. And it is implied to us that the fifth does not prevent.

hebrew_text: וְהַכֹּהֲנִים בְּחַלָּה וּבִתְרוּמָה וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מַצָּה שָׁוָה לְכׇל אָדָם בָּעֵינַן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — ״מַצּוֹת״ ״מַצּוֹת״ רִיבָּה.
human_translation: And priests with ḥalla and with teruma . obvious lest you say we require matza equally by anyone, teaches us “ matzot ,” “ matzot ” amplify,
llm_translation: The priests in challah and terumah, etc. Obvious! What might you say: Matzah equal for all people we require, it is heard to us - "matzot" "matzot" multiplied.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא בְּטֶבֶל וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, בְּטֶבֶל טָבוּל מִדְּרַבָּנַן שֶׁזְּרָעוֹ בְּעָצִיץ שֶׁאֵינוֹ נָקוּב.
human_translation: However, not with untithed produce. obvious No, it is necessary where untithed produce by rabbinic that one sowed in an unperforated flowerpot. an unperforated flowerpot
llm_translation: But not in Tevel, etc. It is obvious! It is not necessary, in Tevel, one is immersed according to the Rabbis, if he planted in a pot that is not perforated.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, שֶׁהִקְדִּימוֹ בִּכְרִי.
human_translation: And not with of first tithe, whose teruma , was not taken. obvious No, necessary where preceded in a pile
llm_translation: "And not in the first tithe that its heave-offering was not taken. It is obvious! Not necessary, for he preceded it in his produce."

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא כְּדַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְשַׁנִּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Lest you say, as Rav Pappa said to Abaye, teaches us, as responded
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? As Rav Papa said to Abbaye, he is teaching us as he taught it to him.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדּוּ וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: And not with second-tithe or consecrated that was not redeemed. obvious,
llm_translation: And not with second tithe and consecrated items that have not been redeemed, etc. It is obvious!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּנִפְדּוּ, וּמַאי לֹא נִפְדּוּ — שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדּוּ כְּהִלְכָתָן: מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁפְּדָאוֹ עַל גַּב אֲסִימוֹן, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְצַרְתָּ הַכֶּסֶף״ — דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ צוּרָה.
human_translation: Actually, where they were redeemed, and what They were not redeemed? that they were not redeemed properly, second-tithe was redeemed with an unminted coin [ asimon ]. As the Merciful One says “and bind up [ ve’tzarta ] the money” an object that has a form [ tzura ],
llm_translation: Always they were redeemed, and what not were redeemed - that not were redeemed as their law: tithe second that redeemed on back of silver, for the Merciful One said: "And you shall make it into money" - a thing that has a form.

hebrew_text: וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁחִילְּלוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְנָתַן הַכֶּסֶף וְקָם לוֹ״.
human_translation: And consecrated where he redeemed it for land instead of money, as the Merciful One says: “And he will give the money and it shall be assured to him”
llm_translation: "And the hekdesh that was desecrated on the ground, for the Merciful One said: 'And he shall give the money, and it shall be his.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָכוֹל יוֹצֵא אָדָם יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּטֶבֶל שֶׁלֹּא נִתְקַן. כׇּל טֶבֶל נָמֵי הָא לֹא נִתְקַן!
human_translation: The Sages taught: might a person fulfills his obligation with untithed produce that was not amended untithed produce that was not amended. all untithed produce also not amended,
llm_translation: The sages taught: One might have thought that a person can fulfill his obligation with immersion in a mikveh that is not properly prepared. Any mikveh that is murky, this is not properly prepared!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בְּטֶבֶל שֶׁלֹּא נִתְקַן כׇּל צוֹרְכּוֹ. שֶׁנִּטְּלָה מִמֶּנּוּ תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה וְלֹא נִטְּלָה מִמֶּנּוּ תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר, [מַעֲשֵׂר] רִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, וַאֲפִילּוּ מַעְשַׂר עָנִי, מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: Rather, untithed produce that was incompletely amended. from which teruma gedola was taken, but teruma of the tithe was not taken from first tithe but not second tithe; or, poor man’s tithe. From where
llm_translation: Rather: in a tevel that was not rectified for all its needs. For a large terumah was taken from it, and not a tithe was taken from it, not the first tithe nor the second tithe, and even from the poor tithe, whence?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תֹאכַל עָלָיו חָמֵץ״ — מִי שֶׁאִיסּוּרוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תֹּאכַל עָלָיו חָמֵץ״, יָצָא זֶה שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּרוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תֹּאכַל חָמֵץ״, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תֹּאכַל טֶבֶל״.
human_translation: The verse states: “You shall not eat leavened bread with it; with whose prohibition due to Do not eat leavened bread with it, excludes this which is not prohibited due to Do not eat leavened bread, but due to Do not eat untithed produce.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Do not eat leavened bread with it" - one whose prohibition is derived from "Do not eat leavened bread with it," this one excludes that his prohibition is not derived from "Do not eat leavened bread," but rather from "Do not eat produce."

hebrew_text: וְאִיסּוּרָא דְחָמֵץ לְהֵיכָן אֲזַלָא? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָא מַנִּי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: And the prohibition of leavened bread, where did it go? Rav Sheshet said: whose is this It is Rabbi Shimon, who said: One prohibition does not take effect where another prohibition As it was taught Rabbi Shimon says:
llm_translation: The prohibition of chametz, where does it go? Rav Sheshet said: This is the teaching of Rabbi Shimon, who said: One prohibition does not take effect on another prohibition. As it was taught, Rabbi Shimon says:

hebrew_text: הָאוֹכֵל נְבֵלָה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: One who eats animal on Yom Kippur is exempt
llm_translation: The one who eats nevelah on Yom Kippur - exempt.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר, אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן: מִי שֶׁאִיסּוּרוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תֹּאכַל חָמֵץ״ בִּלְבַד. יָצָא זֶה שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּרוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תֹּאכַל חָמֵץ״ בִּלְבַד, אֶלָּא אַף מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תֹּאכַל טֶבֶל״.
human_translation: Ravina said: Even you say the Rabbis, with whose prohibition solely due to Do not eat leavened bread, excludes this which is forbidden not only due to Do not eat leavened bread, but also due to Do not eat untithed produce.
llm_translation: Ravina said, even according to the opinion of the Rabbis: one whose prohibition is specifically due to "do not eat leavened bread" alone, this one is exempt, whose prohibition is not specifically due to "do not eat leavened bread" alone, but also due to "do not eat tevel."

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי ״בִּלְבַד״ כְּתִיב? אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת.
human_translation: Is Only, written Rather, it is clear in accordance with Rav Sheshet,
llm_translation: From where is it written "bilvad"? Rather, from Mechavvarta as Rav Sheshet.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָכוֹל יוֹצֵא אָדָם יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֶחֶם עוֹנִי״, מָה שֶׁנֶּאֱכָל בָּאֲנִינוּת. יָצָא זֶה שֶׁאֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל בַּאֲנִינוּת, אֶלָּא בְּשִׂמְחָה — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: might a person can fulfill his obligation matza with second tithe in Jerusalem. the verse states: the bread of affliction [ leḥem oni ]” that be eaten acute mourning, excludes this which cannot be eaten during acute mourning but only of joy, the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One might have thought that a person can fulfill his obligation of the second tithe in Jerusalem with bread of affliction. Therefore, the verse states: "bread of affliction," which is something that is eaten in distress. This teaches that one can fulfill his obligation with something that is not eaten in distress, but rather with joy - these are the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״מַצּוֹת״ ״מַצּוֹת״ רִיבָּה. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לֶחֶם עוֹנִי״? פְּרָט לְעִיסָּה שֶׁנִּילּוֹשָׁה בְּיַיִן וְשֶׁמֶן וּדְבַשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: matzot matzot amplify, If so, what the verse states leḥem oni , excludes dough that was kneaded with wine, oil, or honey,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "Matzot, matzot" is a repetition. If so, what is the teaching of "bread of affliction"? To exclude dough that is kneaded with wine, oil, and honey.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִי כְּתִיב ״לֶחֶם עוֹנִי״? ״עָנִי״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Akiva? Is it written leḥem oni it is written leḥem oni
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Akiva's opinion: Who is it written "bread of affliction"? "Affliction" is written.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי: מִי קָרֵינַן ״עָנִי״! ״עוֹנִי״ קָרֵינַן. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הַאי דְּקָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״עוֹנִי״, כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: ״לֶחֶם עוֹנִי״ — לֶחֶם שֶׁעוֹנִין עָלָיו דְּבָרִים הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili Do we vocalize ani , we vocalize oni , And Rabbi Akiva that we vocalize as oni in accordance with Shmuel. As Shmuel said: leḥem oni bread over which many matters are recited [ onin ],
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean: Who reads "ani"! We read "oni." And Rabbi Akiva: This one that we read in it "oni," as Samuel. For Samuel said: "bread of oni" - bread that many words are said about it.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא עִיסָּה שֶׁנִּילּוֹשָׁה בְּיַיִן וְשֶׁמֶן וּדְבַשׁ לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין לָשִׁין עִיסָּה בַּפֶּסַח בְּיַיִן וְשֶׁמֶן וּדְבַשׁ. וְאִם לָשׁ, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: תִּשָּׂרֵף מִיָּד, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יֵאָכֵל. וְאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: שַׁבַּתִּי הָיְתָה אֵצֶל רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְלַשְׁתִּי לָהֶם עִיסָּה בְּיַיִן וְשֶׁמֶן וּדְבַשׁ, וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לִי דָּבָר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva maintain dough that was kneaded with wine, oil, or honey, not But wasn’t it taught One not knead dough on Passover with wine, oil, or honey? And if one kneaded Rabban Gamliel says: be burned immediately, And the Rabbis say be eaten. And Rabbi Akiva said: It was my Shabbat before Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua and I kneaded for them dough with wine, oil, and honey, and they said nothing to me
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Akiva thought that dough that is kneaded with wine and oil and honey, is it not? And it was taught: One may not knead dough on Passover with wine and oil and honey. And if one did knead, Rabban Gamliel says: it shall be burned immediately, and the sages say: it may be eaten. And Rabbi Akiva said: I once stayed with Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua, and they kneaded dough for me with wine and oil and honey, and they did not say anything to me.

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לָשִׁין, מְקַטְּפִין בּוֹ — אֲתָאן לְתַנָּא קַמָּא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵת שֶׁלָּשִׁין בּוֹ — מְקַטְּפִין בּוֹ. וְאֶת שֶׁאֵין לָשִׁין בּוֹ — אֵין מְקַטְּפִין בּוֹ. וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין לָשִׁין אֶת הָעִיסָּה בְּפוֹשְׁרִין!
human_translation: And although one not knead one spread we have come to the first tanna , And the Rabbis say: into which one knead one spread into which one not knead one not spread And everyone agrees that one not knead the dough with warm
llm_translation: And even though there is no tongue, they may cut it - they came before the first Tanna. And the sages say: if there is thirty in it - they may cut it. And if there is not thirty in it - they may not cut it. And if they are equal, not having thirty, they are resolved!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן. הָא — בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: not difficult, this the first day of the Festival, that the second day
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - on the first day of the festival. This - on the second day of the festival.

hebrew_text: כְּדַאֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לִבְנֵיהּ: יוֹמָא קַמָּא לָא תְּלוּשׁוּ לִי בַּחֲלָבָא, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ לוּשׁוּ לִי בַּחֲלָבָא. וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין לָשִׁין אֶת הָעִיסָּה בְּחָלָב, וְאִם לָשׁ — כׇּל הַפַּת אֲסוּרָה, מִפְּנֵי הֶרְגֵּל עֲבֵירָה. אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: יוֹמָא קַמָּא לָא תְּלוּשׁוּ לִי בְּדוּבְשָׁא, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — לוּשׁוּ לִי בְּדוּבְשָׁא.
human_translation: as Rabbi Yehoshua said to his sons: the first night do not knead for me with milk, from onward, knead me with milk. But wasn’t it taught one not knead dough with milk, and if he kneaded the entire bread is prohibited, due to accustomed to sin, Rather, this is what he is saying: the first do not knead me with honey; from then onward, knead me with honey.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yehoshua said to his sons: On the first day, do not soak the dough for me in milk; from here on, soak it for me in milk. And it was taught: One may not knead the dough with milk, and if one did knead it — all the bread is forbidden, due to the habit of transgression. Rather, this is what he meant to say: On the first day, do not soak the dough for me in honey; from here on, soak it for me in honey.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם בַּחֲלָבָא, כְּדַאֲמַר רָבִינָא: כְּעֵין תּוֹרָא — שְׁרֵי. הָכָא נָמֵי כְּעֵין תּוֹרָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say actually With milk, as Ravina said: of an ox’s eye, it is permitted. Here too, of an ox’s eye.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always with milk, as Ravina said: Like the eye of a dove - permitted. Here too, like the eye of a dove.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין לָשִׁין אֶת הָעִיסָּה בְּפוֹשְׁרִין. מַאי שְׁנָא מִמְּנָחוֹת, דִּתְנַן: כׇּל הַמְּנָחוֹת נִילּוֹשׁוֹת בְּפוֹשְׁרִין, (וּמִשְׁתַּמְּרִין) שֶׁלֹּא יֶחְמְצוּ. אִם אָמְרוּ בִּזְרִיזִין, יֹאמְרוּ בְּשֶׁאֵין זְרִיזִין?
human_translation: And everyone agrees that one not knead dough with warm what is different from meal-offerings? As we learned All meal-offerings are kneaded with warm water and are watched so that they will not be leavened. If they say for diligent shall they say to those who are not diligent?
llm_translation: And equal that not tongue the dough in they clarify. What difference from meal-offerings, for we learned: All meal-offerings kneaded with they clarify, (and they are) left over so they do not become leavened. If they said with haste, should they say with that they are not hasty?

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מִילְתָּת נָמֵי לָתֵית! אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר יִרְמְיָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חִיטִּין שֶׁל מְנָחוֹת אֵין לוֹתְתִין אוֹתָהּ! לִישָׁה בִּזְרִיזִין אִיתָא, לְתִיתָה לֵיתָא בִּזְרִיזִין.
human_translation: If so, let them also soak Why did Rabbi Zeira say Rabba bar Yirmeya said Shmuel said: wheat in the meal-offerings, one not soak it? kneading is by diligent soaking is not by diligent
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, the matter is clear! Why did Rabbi Zeira say that Rabba bar Yirmeya said in the name of Shmuel: The wheat of meal-offerings does not require sifting! For sifting is necessary for fine flour, but not for coarse flour.

hebrew_text: וְלִישָׁה מִי אִיתָא בִּזְרִיזִין? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְיָצַק עָלֶיהָ שֶׁמֶן וְגוֹ׳ וֶהֱבִיאָהּ אֶל הַכֹּהֵן״ — מִקְּמִיצָה וְאֵילָךְ מִצְוַת כְּהוּנָּה, לִימֵּד עַל יְצִיקָה וּבְלִילָה שֶׁכְּשֵׁירָה בְּכׇל אָדָם!
human_translation: And kneading, is it by diligent But isn’t it written: and he shall pour oil upon it, And he shall bring it to the priests; from the handful and onward, mitzva by the priesthood. This teaches about the pouring and the stirring that are valid by any person,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And for Yisha, who is mentioned in Zrizin? And it is written: 'And he shall pour oil upon it, etc., and bring it to the priest' — from here and onwards is the commandment of the priesthood, teaching about pouring and mixing, that it is valid for all people!"

hebrew_text: לִישָׁה, נְהִי דְּבִזְרִיזִין לֵיתָא, בִּמְקוֹם זְרִיזִין אִיתָא. דְּאָמַר מָר: בְּלִילָה כְּשֵׁירָה בְּזָר, חוּץ לְחוֹמַת עֲזָרָה — פְּסוּלָה. לְאַפּוֹקֵי לְתִיתָה — דְּאֵינָהּ בִּזְרִיזִין, וְלָא בִּמְקוֹם זְרִיזִין.
human_translation: kneading, although is not by diligent it is in place of diligent. As the Master said: Mixing is valid by a non-priest; outside the walls of the courtyard, it, is disqualified. to exclude soaking, which is neither by diligent nor in place of the diligent.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: For a woman, if there are those who are swift, she is not found in a place of swiftness. For the Master said: "At night, when a song is sung with a zar, outside the wall of the Azarah - it is disqualified." To go and bring her - for she is not among the swift, and not in a place of swiftness.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מִמִּנְחַת הָעוֹמֶר? דְּתַנְיָא: מִנְחַת הָעוֹמֶר לוֹתְתִין אוֹתָהּ וְצוֹבְרִין אוֹתָהּ! צִיבּוּר שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: And what is different from the omer meal-offering, As it was taught omer offering, one soaks it and gathers it, community is different,
llm_translation: And what is the difference from the Omer Mincha offering? For it was taught: The Omer Mincha offering, one burns it and one collects it! The public is different.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָכוֹל יוֹצֵא אָדָם יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּבִכּוּרִים? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּכֹל מוֹשְׁבוֹתֵיכֶם תֹּאכְלוּ מַצּוֹת״ — מַצָּה הַנֶּאֱכֶלֶת בְּכׇל מוֹשְׁבוֹתֵיכֶם, יָצְאוּ בִּכּוּרִים שֶׁאֵין נֶאֱכָלִין בְּכׇל מוֹשְׁבוֹתֵיכֶם אֶלָּא בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: The Sages taught might one fulfill his obligation by first fruits; the verse states: “In all of your habitations you shall eat matzot ” matza that be eaten “in all of your habitations.” excludes first fruits, which not be eaten in all of your habitations, but in Jerusalem. the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Can a person fulfill his obligation of the firstborn with matzot? The Torah says: "In all your settlements you shall eat matzot" - matzah that is eaten in all your settlements, the firstborns that are not eaten in all your settlements except in Jerusalem, these are the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מַצָּה וּמָרוֹר; מָה מָרוֹר שֶׁאֵינוֹ בִּכּוּרִים, אַף מַצָּה שֶׁאֵינָהּ בִּכּוּרִים. אִי: מָה מָרוֹר שֶׁאֵין בְּמִינוֹ בִּכּוּרִים, אַף מַצָּה שֶׁאֵין בְּמִינָהּ בִּכּוּרִים!
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: matza and bitter herbs: Just as bitter herbs are not first fruits, so too matza not be first fruits. If Just as bitter herbs from a species not first fruits, so too matza from a species not first fruits,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Matzah and Maror; just as Maror that is not from the first fruits, so too Matzah that is not from the first fruits. If: just as Maror that is not of its kind from the first fruits, so too Matzah that is not of its kind from the first fruits!

hebrew_text: אוֹצִיא חִיטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּמִינָן בִּיכּוּרִים. תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מַצּוֹת״ ״מַצּוֹת״ רִיבָּה. אִי ״מַצּוֹת״ ״מַצּוֹת״ רִיבָּה, אֲפִילּוּ בִּיכּוּרִים נָמֵי! הֲדַר בֵּיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: I would excludes wheat and barley, which are from a species first fruits the verse states: “ Matzot ,” “ matzot ” amplify If matzot matzot amplify also first-fruit Rabbi Akiva retracted
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "To bring out wheat and barley that are of the same species as ours in the first fruits. The Torah says: 'matzot' 'matzot' - a dispute. If 'matzot' 'matzot' is a dispute, even with first fruits also! Rabbi Akiva reconsidered it."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל יֵצֵא אָדָם יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּבִיכּוּרִים, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּכֹל מוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶם תֹּאכְלוּ מַצּוֹת״ — מַצָּה הַנֶּאֱכֶלֶת בְּכׇל מוֹשָׁבוֹת, יָצְאוּ בִּיכּוּרִים שֶׁאֵינָן נֶאֱכָלִין בְּכׇל מוֹשָׁבוֹת אֶלָּא בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מוֹצִיא אַף מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מַצּוֹת״ ״מַצּוֹת״ רִיבָּה.
human_translation: As it was taught might a person fulfill his obligation with first fruit; the verse states: “In all of your habitations you shall eat matzot ” matza that be eaten in all habitations. excludes first fruits, which not be eaten in all habitations, but only in Jerusalem. might I also exclude second-tithe the verse states: “ Matzot ,” “ matzot .” amplify,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One might have thought that a person fulfills his obligation with first-fruits, therefore the Torah states: "In all your settlements you shall eat matzot" (Exodus 13:7) — matzah that is eaten in all settlements, excludes first-fruits that are not eaten in all settlements except in Jerusalem. One might have thought that one also fulfills his obligation with second tithe, therefore the Torah states: "Matzot, matzot" — this is a ribbah (an amplification).

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וּלְהוֹצִיא בִּיכּוּרִים? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ הֶיתֵּר בְּכׇל מוֹשָׁבוֹת, כִּדְרַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר), וּמוֹצִיא אֲנִי בִּיכּוּרִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן הֶיתֵּר בְּכׇל מוֹשָׁבוֹת.
human_translation: And what did you see to include second-tithe but to exclude first fruits? I include second tithe, which has permitted in all habitations, Rabbi Eliezer, And I exclude first fruits, which do not have, permitted in all habitations.
llm_translation: And what did you see to include a second tithe and to bring out first-fruits? I increase a second tithe that has excess in all its settlements, like Rabbi Eliezer, and I bring out first-fruits that have no excess in all its settlements.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר): מִנְיָן לְמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁנִּטְמָא, שֶׁפּוֹדִין אוֹתוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי לֹא תוּכַל שְׂאֵתוֹ״.
human_translation: As Rabbi Eliezer said: From where with regard to second-tithe that became ritually impure, that one redeem it even in Jerusalem? The verse states: so that you are not able to carry it [ se’eto ],
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Eliezer said: From where do we derive the law regarding the second tithe that became ritually impure, that it may be redeemed even in Jerusalem? The verse teaches: "For you may not carry it."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין ״שְׂאֵת״ אֶלָּא אֲכִילָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּשָּׂא מַשְׂאֹת מֵאֵת פָּנָיו״.
human_translation: And carrying [ se’et ] is nothing other eating, as it is stated: “And portions [ masot ] were taken to them from before him”
llm_translation: "And there is no 'lifting' except for eating - as it is stated: 'And he lifted gifts from before him.'"

hebrew_text: מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר בְּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי נָפֵיק בֵּיהּ? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְקָמְמַעֵיט לְהוּ לְבִיכּוּרִים ״מִבְּכֹל מוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶם״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֲדַר בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Who did you hear that said: fulfill his obligation with second tithe? Rabbi Akiva, and he excludes first fruits to “In all of your habitations.” Learn from this that retracted
llm_translation: One who heard that he said in the second tithe came out with him? Rabbi Akiva, and he minimizes for them for the firstfruits "from all your settlements," hear from it, return with it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִ״לֶּחֶם עוֹנִי״ — מִי שֶׁנֶּאֱכָל בְּאוֹנִי, יָצָא זֶה שֶׁאֵין נֶאֱכָל אֶלָּא בְּשִׂמְחָה?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, Let him derive it from Leḥem oni that be eaten in acute mourning; excludes this which be eaten only in joy.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean said: "One should distance oneself from 'lechem oni' - whoever eats oni has fulfilled the requirement of eating only with joy?"

hebrew_text: סָבַר לֵיהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. דְּתַנְיָא: בִּיכּוּרִים אֲסוּרִין לְאוֹנֵן, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר.
human_translation: maintains in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, As it was taught First fruits are prohibited to an acute mourner, and Rabbi Shimon permits
llm_translation: He holds like Rabbi Shimon. For it was taught: With regard to first fruits, they are forbidden for a mourner, and Rabbi Shimon permits.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תוּכַל לֶאֱכֹל בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״, וְאָמַר מָר: ״תְּרוּמַת יָדֶךָ״ אֵלּוּ בִּיכּוּרִים, דְּאִיתַּקַּשׁ בִּיכּוּרִים לְמַעֲשֵׂר: מָה מַעֲשֵׂר אָסוּר לְאוֹנֵן — אַף בִּיכּוּרִים אָסוּר לְאוֹנֵן.
human_translation: What is the reason for the Rabbis’ As it is written: “You may not eat within your gates And the Master said: “The offering of your hand,” these are first fruits, as compares first fruits to tithe: Just as tithe is prohibited to an acute mourner, so too first fruits prohibited to an acute mourner.
llm_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? — As it is written: "You shall not eat within your gates," and the Master said: "The offering of your hand" refers to first fruits, for first fruits are connected to tithing. Just as tithing is prohibited for a mourner, so too first fruits are prohibited for a mourner.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: ״תְּרוּמָה״ קְרִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא. כִּתְרוּמָה: מָה תְּרוּמָה מוּתֶּרֶת לְאוֹנֵן — אַף בִּיכּוּרִים מוּתָּר לְאוֹנֵן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon are called teruma by the Merciful One like teruma : Just as teruma is permitted to an acute mourner, so too first fruits permitted to an acute mourner.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: "Terumah" it is called by the Merciful One. Like Terumah: Just as Terumah is permitted for a mourner — so too, with firstfruits it is permitted for a mourner.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, נְהִי דְּהֶיקֵּישׁ לֵית לֵיהּ, שִׂמְחָה מִיהָא מִיכְתָּב כְּתִיבָא בְּהוּ. דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשָׂמַחְתָּ בְכׇל הַטּוֹב״?
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, although he does not juxtaposition in any case joy is written with regard to as it is written: “And you shall rejoice in all the good
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said, "If there is no joy, there is no rejoicing from the heart as it is written in the Scripture. As it is written: 'And you shall rejoice in all the good'?"

hebrew_text: הָהוּא לִזְמַן שִׂמְחָה הוּא דַּאֲתָא, דִּתְנַן: מֵעֲצֶרֶת וְעַד הַחַג — מֵבִיא וְקוֹרֵא, מֵהַחַג וְעַד חֲנוּכָּה — מֵבִיא וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא.
human_translation: that it comes that period of rejoicing. As we learned From Shavuot until Sukkot , one brings and recites From Sukkot until Hanukkah one bring but he does not recite
llm_translation: That one to invite joy he is that came, as we learned: from Shavuot until Sukkot - one brings and reads, from Sukkot until Hanukkah - one brings and does not read.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לֶחֶם עֹנִי״ — פְּרָט לְחָלוּט וְלַאֲשִׁישָׁה. יָכוֹל לֹא יֵצֵא אָדָם יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ אֶלָּא בְּפַת הַדְרָאָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מַצּוֹת״ ״מַצּוֹת״ רִיבָּה, וַאֲפִילּוּ כְּמַצּוֹת שֶׁל שְׁלֹמֹה. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לֶחֶם עוֹנִי״ — פְּרָט לְחָלוּט וְלַאֲשִׁישָׁה.
human_translation: The Sages taught poor man’s bread [ leḥem oni ] excludes was boiled [ ḥalut ] and large cake [ ashisha ]. might a person fulfills his obligation only with coarse [ hadra’a ] bread; the verse states: “ Matzot ,” “ matzot ,” amplify And even with matzot like those of Solomon, If so, what the verse states: “Poor man’s bread”? to exclude boiled and large cakes,
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Poor man's bread" - excluding coarse bread and lentil bread. Can a person fulfill his obligation with anything other than fine bread? The Torah teaches: "Matzot" - repeated twice, to include even matzot as fine as those of King Solomon. If so, why does the Torah say "poor man's bread" - excluding coarse bread and lentil bread.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי אֲשִׁישָׁה לִישָּׁנָא דַחֲשִׁיבוּתָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְחַלֵּק לְכׇל הָעָם לְכׇל הֲמוֹן יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵאִישׁ וְעַד אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ חַלַּת לֶחֶם אַחַת וְאֶשְׁפָּר אֶחָד וַאֲשִׁישָׁה אֶחָת וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: From where inferred ashisha is an expression importance? As it is written “And he dealt among all the people, among the whole multitude of Israel, both to men and women, to every one a cake of bread, and an eshpar , and an ashisha ,
llm_translation: And what is implied by this "ashisha" for the importance of sleep, as it is written: "And he distributed to all the people, to the entire multitude of Israel, both to men and women, to each one a loaf of bread, a portion of meat, and an ashisha."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר אַבָּא: ״אֶשְׁפָּר״ — אֶחָד מִשִּׁשָּׁה בַּפָּר, ״אֲשִׁישָׁה״ — אֶחָד מִשִּׁשָּׁה בָּאֵיפָה. ופְלִיגָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: ״אֲשִׁישָׁה״ — גַּרְבָּא דְחַמְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֹהֲבֵי אֲשִׁישֵׁי עֲנָבִים״.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥanan bar Abba said: eshpar one-sixth of an ox, ashisha one-sixth of an eipha And disputes of Shmuel, as Shmuel said: Ashisha a jug of wine, as it is written: “And those who love the jug [ ashishei ] of grapes”
llm_translation: And Rav Hanan bar Abba said: "Eshpar" - one of the six in the bull, "Ashisha" - one of the six in the ephah. And it is in dispute with Shmuel, for Shmuel said: "Ashisha" - a clod of wine, as it is written: "And lovers of clods of grapes."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין אוֹפִין פַּת עָבָה (בְּיוֹם טוֹב) בַּפֶּסַח, דִּבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי,
human_translation: The Sages taught: One not bake thick bread on the Festival, on Passover, the statement of Beit Shammai.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may not bake thick bread (on a festival) on Passover, the words of the House of Shammai,

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין. וְכַמָּה פַּת עָבָה? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: טֶפַח, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּלֶחֶם הַפָּנִים טֶפַח.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel permit And how much thick bread? Rav Huna said: a handbreadth as we found by the shewbread, a handbreadth
llm_translation: House of Hillel permits. And how thick is a thick bread? Rav Huna said: A handbreadth, as we find in the showbread a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: אִם אָמְרוּ בִּזְרִיזִין — יֹאמְרוּ בְּשֶׁאֵינָן זְרִיזִין? אִם אָמְרוּ בְּפַת עֲמִילָה — יֹאמְרוּ בְּפַת שֶׁאֵינָהּ עֲמִילָה?
human_translation: Rav Yosef strongly objects to this If said by diligent they say with regard to who are not diligent? if they said with regard to well-kneaded bread, they say with regard to bread that is not well kneaded?
llm_translation: Challenges to it, Rav Yosef: If they said regarding the diligent ones - should they say regarding those who are not diligent? If they said regarding bread of toil - should they say regarding bread that is not of toil?

hebrew_text: אִם אָמְרוּ בְּעֵצִים יְבֵשִׁין — יֹאמְרוּ בְּעֵצִים לַחִים? אִם אָמְרוּ בְּתַנּוּר חַם — יֹאמְרוּ בְּתַנּוּר צוֹנֵן? אִם אָמְרוּ בְּתַנּוּר שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת — יֹאמְרוּ בְּתַנּוּר שֶׁל חֶרֶס?
human_translation: If they said with dry wood, they say with moist wood? If they said with regard to a hot oven they say with regard to a cool oven? if they said with regard to in a metal oven they say with regard to a clay oven?
llm_translation: If they said regarding dry wood - should they say regarding moist wood? If they said regarding a hot oven - should they say regarding a cold oven? If they said regarding a metal oven - should they say regarding an earthenware oven?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא: שְׁאֵילִית אֶת רַבִּי בְּיִחוּד, וּמַנּוּ: רַב. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: שְׁאֵילִית אֶת רַבִּי בְּיִחוּד, וּמַנּוּ: רַבֵּינוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ. מַאי פַּת עָבָה? פַּת מְרוּבָּה. וְאַמַּאי קָרוּ לֵיהּ פַּת עָבָה? מִשּׁוּם דִּנְפִישָׁא בְּלִישָׁה. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא, בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּהַאי תַּנָּא לְפַת מְרוּבָּה — פַּת עָבָה קָרוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: I asked my special Rabbi, and who is this? Rav. Some say Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav said: I asked my special Rabbi, and who is this? Our holy Rabbi, What is Pat ava ? A large of bread, And why did they call it: Pat ava , due to that a large of kneading. And if you wish, say in the place where this tanna lived, a large quantity of bread was called pat ava ,
llm_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: I asked Rabbi privately, and he answered: Rav. Some say that Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said in the name of Rav: I asked Rabbi privately, and he answered: Our holy Rabbi. What is thick bread? Bread that is abundant. And why is it called thick bread? Because it is thick with fat. And if you wish, I can say, in the place of this Mishna, for abundant bread - it is called thick bread.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִי מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא טָרַח טִירְחָא דְּלָא צְרִיךְ, מַאי אִירְיָא בְּפֶסַח? אֲפִילּוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב נָמֵי!
human_translation: What is the reason If is due to the unnecessary exertion why particularly to Passover? should also to other Festivals.
llm_translation: "What is the reason? If it is because he exerted unnecessary effort, what is the difference with Pesach? Even on a festival day, it is permitted!"

hebrew_text: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהַאי תַּנָּא בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁל פֶּסַח קָאֵי. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין אוֹפִין פַּת עָבָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: Yes, it is indeed so; And this tanna was referring to the festival of Passover, That was also taught Beit Shammai say: One not bake pat ava on a Festival, and Beit Hillel permit
llm_translation: Thus it is stated, and this Mishnah is discussing the eve of the festival of Passover. It was taught similarly: Beit Shammai say, "One may not bake thick bread on a festival," and Beit Hillel permit it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יוֹצְאִין בְּפַת נְקִיָּה, וּבְהַדְרָאָה, וּבִסְרִיקִין הַמְצוּיָּירִין בַּפֶּסַח, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ אֵין עוֹשִׂין סְרִיקִין הַמְצוּיָּירִין בַּפֶּסַח. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: דָּבָר זֶה שָׁאַל בַּיְיתּוֹס בֶּן זוֹנִין לַחֲכָמִים: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ אֵין עוֹשִׂין סְרִיקִין הַמְצוּיָּירִין בַּפֶּסַח? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹהָה עָלֶיהָ וּמְחַמַּצְתָּהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One fulfills on Passover with fine bread, with coarse bread, and with shaped in figures, although they said one should not bake shaped in figures on Passover Rav Yehuda said Baitos ben Zonin asked the Sages this matter: Why did say one not prepare shaped in figures on Passover They said to him: because a woman will tarry over it and she will cause it to become leavened.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may go out on Passover eve with a clean loaf, and with a decorated loaf, and with matzot that are shaped like a Pesach offering, even though they said that one may not make matzot shaped like a Pesach offering. Rav Yehudah said: This matter was asked by Beitus ben Zonin to the sages: Why did they say that one may not make matzot shaped like a Pesach offering? They said to him: Because the woman kneads the dough and it becomes leavened.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: אֶפְשָׁר יַעֲשֶׂנָּה בִּדְפוּס וְיִקְבָּעֶנָּה כֵּיוָן! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: יֹאמְרוּ כׇּל הַסְּרִיקִין — אֲסוּרִין, וּסְרִיקֵי בַּיְיתּוֹס — מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: He said to them: It is possible to prepare with a mold, and set it immediately, They said to him: they would say all shaped is prohibited, and Baitos’ shaped is permitted.
llm_translation: He said to them: It is possible to do it in a mold and establish it permanently! They said to him: Let all the scribes say - forbidden, and the scribes of Beit Hillel - permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק: פַּעַם אַחַת נִכְנַסְתִּי אַחַר אַבָּא לְבֵית רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְהֵבִיאוּ לְפָנָיו סְרִיקִין הַמְצוּיָּירִין בַּפֶּסַח. אָמַרְתִּי: אַבָּא, לֹא כָּךְ אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים, אֵין עוֹשִׂין סְרִיקִין הַמְצוּיָּירִין בַּפֶּסַח? אָמַר לִי: בְּנִי, לֹא שֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁל נַחְתּוֹמִין אָמְרוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok said: Once I followed my father, into Rabban Gamliel’s home, and they brought before him shaped in figures on Passover. I said: Father, didn’t the Sages say one not prepare shaped in figures on Passover? He said to me: My son, they did not say this for all people; rather, they said so of bakers,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Tzadok said: Once I entered after Abba to the house of Rabban Gamliel, and they brought before him decorated serekhin on Passover. I said: Abba, did not the sages say that one should not make decorated serekhin on Passover? He said to me: My son, they did not say this about everyone, but about the punctilious ones they said it.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא שֶׁל נַחְתּוֹמִין אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: עוֹשִׂין סְרִיקִין כְּמִין רְקִיקִין, וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין סְרִיקִין כְּמִין גְּלוּסְקָאוֹת.
human_translation: Some say this is said to did not say of bakers, rather of all people. Rabbi Yosei said: One prepare shaped as thin but one not prepare shaped as thick loaves,
llm_translation: There are some who say, thus he said to him: Not of sealed ones they said, but of all people. Rabbi Yosei said: They make thin ones like pancakes, but they do not make thin ones like wafers.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַסּוּפְגָּנִין וְהַדּוּבְשָׁנִין וְאִיסְקְרִיטִין וְחַלַּת הַמַּסְרֵת וְהַמְדוּמָּע — פְּטוּרִים מִן הַחַלָּה. מַאי חַלַּת הַמַּסְרֵת? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: זֶה חָלוּט שֶׁל בַּעֲלֵי בָתִּים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Sponge-like cakes, honey cakes, spiced cakes [ eskeritin ], pan-fried bread [ ḥallat hamasret ], and a mixture are exempt from ḥalla . What is pan-fried bread? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: This is boiled bread by homeowners
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Sufganin, Dubshanin, Iskritin, Challat HaMasret, and Medumma are exempt from Challah. What is Challat HaMasret? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: This is a loaf of bread made by homeowners.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַלָּלוּ מַעֲשֵׂה אִילְפָּס הֵן. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מַעֲשֵׂה אִילְפָּס חַיָּיבִין. וְהַלָּלוּ שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן בַּחַמָּה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: These are pot-boiled stew [ ilpas ], And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a pot-boiled stew is obligated these as were baked in the sun.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: These are the deeds of Ilfas. And Rabbi Yochanan said: The deeds of Ilfas are obligatory. And these are the ones who did them in the sun.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַסּוּפְגָּנִין וְהַדּוּבְשָׁנִין וְהָאִיסְקְרִיטִין, עֲשָׂאָן בְּאִילְפָּס — חַיָּיבִין, בַּחַמָּה — פְּטוּרִין, תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ! אָמַר עוּלָּא: אָמַר לְךָ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — שֶׁהִרְתִּיחַ וּלְבַסּוֹף הִדְבִּיק.
human_translation: raises an objection sponge-cakes, honey cakes, or spiced cakes, prepared them in a pot, obligated in the sun, exempt a conclusive refutation Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish. Ulla said: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said to you: With what are we dealing here? where one heated and afterward pasted
llm_translation: Challenger: sponges and honeycombs and iskiritin, if made on Shabbat - liable; if made in the sun - exempt. The dispute of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish! Ulla said: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said to you, what are we dealing with here - that he boiled and ultimately stuck.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הִדְבִּיק וּלְבַסּוֹף הִרְתִּיחַ, מַאי? הָכִי נָמֵי דִּפְטוּרִין, אַדְּתָנֵי סֵיפָא: עֲשָׂאָן בַּחַמָּה פְּטוּרִין, לִיפְלוֹג וְלִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִרְתִּיחַ וּלְבַסּוֹף הִדְבִּיק, אֲבָל הִדְבִּיק וּלְבַסּוֹף הִרְתִּיחַ — פְּטוּרִין?
human_translation: However, pasted and afterward heated what So too, that exempt rather than teach the latter clause exempt if it was baked in the sun, let distinguish and teach within itself: In what is this statement, said? For example, when one heated the pot and afterward pasted but if he placed the bread and boiled exempt.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But if he stuck and ultimately boiled, what is the law? It is as it was said, they are exempt. For it was taught in the latter clause: If they were made in the sun, they are exempt.
