human_translation: Ulla said: Even you say Rabbi Meir, Here, it is different, as the verse states: “Nor boiled in any way,” in any case.
llm_translation: Ulla said: Even if you say it is according to Rabbi Meir, it is different here, as the verse says: "and it is well-cooked," in any case.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָכוֹל צְלָאוֹ כׇּל צוֹרְכּוֹ יְהֵא חַיָּיב — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַל תֹּאכְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ נָא וּבָשֵׁל מְבֻשָּׁל בַּמָּיִם״. נָא וּבָשֵׁל מְבֻשָּׁל אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא שֶׁצְּלָאוֹ כׇּל צוֹרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: might that one roasted fully, he be liable. the verse states: “You shall not eat it partially roasted, nor boiled in any way in water” I, said to you partially roasted or boiled in any way, but not it is fully roasted.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One might have thought that his roasting is for all his needs, he should be liable - the Talmud teaches: "Do not eat it raw or boiled in water." Raw or boiled in water I have told you, but not that his roasting is for all his needs.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: דְּשַׁוְּיֵא חֲרוֹכָא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances Rav Ashi said: where one burned it.
llm_translation: "How are the laws of damages assessed?" Rav Ashi said: "According to the market value."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָכוֹל אָכַל כְּזַיִת חַי יְהֵא חַיָּיב — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַל תֹּאכְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ נָא וּבָשֵׁל מְבֻשָּׁל״. נָא וּבָשֵׁל אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא חַי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: might one who ate an olive-bulk raw be liable the verse states: “You shall not eat it partially roasted [ na ], nor boiled in any way in water.” teaches I, said to you partially roasted or boiled, but no it raw.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One might have thought that if one ate an olive's worth of raw meat, he would be liable. The Talmud teaches us: "Do not eat it raw or cooked." I have told you raw and cooked, but not alive.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יְהֵא מוּתָּר — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי אִם צְלִי אֵשׁ״. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי נָא? אָמַר רַב: כִּדְאָמְרִי פָּרְסָאֵי: אֲבַרְנִים.
human_translation: might that it is permitted the verse states: “But roasted with fire” What are the circumstances na , Rav said: As the Persians say: Avarnim ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Yachol yehi mutar — Talmud lomar: 'Ki im tzeli esh.' Heichi damei na? Amar Rav: Kid'amri parsaei: Avarnim." English translation: "It might be permitted — the Talmud states: 'But roasted by fire.' How is it similar? Rav said: Like the Persians say: 'Avarnim.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַמְבַשֵּׁל בְּחַמֵּי טְבֶרְיָא בְּשַׁבָּת — פָּטוּר. פֶּסַח שֶׁבִּשְּׁלוֹ בְּחַמֵּי טְבֶרְיָא — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: One who cooks in the hot springs of Tiberias on Shabbat is exempt. a Paschal that was cooked, in the hot springs of Tiberias, liable
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: One who cooks with the hot springs of Tiberias on Shabbat - is exempt. If one cooked the Passover offering with the hot springs of Tiberias - is liable.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא בְּשַׁבָּת דְּלָא? דְּתוֹלְדוֹת אֵשׁ בָּעֵינַן, וְלֵיכָּא. פֶּסַח נָמֵי, לָאו תּוֹלְדוֹת אֵשׁ הוּא!
human_translation: What is different with regard to Shabbat, that not that a fire derivative, is required but there is no with regard to Paschal as well, it is not a fire derivative,
llm_translation: What is different about Shabbat that it is not permissible? Because we require the offspring of fire, and there is none. Pesach also, it is not the offspring of fire!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי ״חַיָּיב״ דְּקָתָנֵי — דְּקָא עָבַר מִשּׁוּם ״צָלִי אֵשׁ״.
human_translation: Rava said: What is liable that taught? that one violated due to “Roasted with fire.”
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the meaning of "chayav" that it is taught - that he transgressed due to "tzali eish."

hebrew_text: רַב חִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן מַתְנֵי לַהּ לְהָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא בְּהֶדְיָא. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַמְבַשֵּׁל בְּחַמֵּי טְבֶרְיָא בְּשַׁבָּת — פָּטוּר, וּפֶסַח שֶׁבִּשְּׁלוֹ בְּחַמֵּי טְבֶרְיָא — חַיָּיב, שֶׁעָבַר מִשּׁוּם ״צְלִי אֵשׁ״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Natan, teaches this of Rav Ḥisda’s explicitly, Rav Ḥisda said: One who cooks in the hot springs of Tiberias on Shabbat is exempt, and a Paschal that was cooked in the hot springs of Tiberias, is liable he violated due to “Roasted with fire.”
llm_translation: Rav Chiya, son of Rav Natan, taught it to him in the name of Rav Chisda with regard to a pot cooked in the hot springs of Tiberias on Shabbat - he is exempt, but the Paschal lamb that was cooked in the hot springs of Tiberias - he is liable, because he transgressed the prohibition of "roasting with fire."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אֲכָלוֹ נָא —
human_translation: Rava said: ate partially roasted,
llm_translation: Rava said: "He ate it now—"

hebrew_text: לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם. מְבוּשָּׁל — לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם. נָא וּמְבוּשָּׁל — לוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: receives two lashes, boiled receives two lashes, partially roasted and boiled receives three lashes,
llm_translation: If one is liable for two, when cooked - one is liable for two. If raw and cooked - one is liable for three.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֵין לוֹקִין עַל לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye said: One does not receive lashes for a prohibition stated in general terms.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "One does not receive lashes for a negative commandment that is part of a general category."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: תַּרְתֵּי הוּא דְּלָא לָקֵי, חֲדָא מִיהַת לָקֵי.
human_translation: Some say It is two lashes that he does not receive, at any rate one set of lashes he does receive.
llm_translation: There are those who say: there are two cases where one is not liable, one of them is where he is not liable.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: חֲדָא נָמֵי לָא לָקֵי, דְּלָא מְיַיחַד לָאוֵיהּ כְּלָאו דַּחֲסִימָה.
human_translation: Some say one does not receive even one lashes as the prohibition is not specific like the prohibition against muzzling.
llm_translation: There are some who say: One who does not have a wife is not considered a complete man, as he is not joined with his counterpart like the lock and the key.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אָכַל זָג — לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם. חַרְצָן — לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם. זָג וְחַרְצָן — לוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: Rava said: ate skin he receives two lashes, pit he receives two lashes, skin and pit he receives three lashes,
llm_translation: Rava said: One who eats Zog - receives two lashes. Charitzan - receives two lashes. Zog and Charitzan - receives three lashes.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֵין לוֹקִין עַל לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: תַּרְתֵּי הוּא דְּלָא לָקֵי, חֲדָא מִיהַת לָקֵי. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: חֲדָא נָמֵי לָא לָקֵי, דְּלָא מְיַיחַד לָאוֵיהּ כְּלָאו דַּחֲסִימָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: one does not receive lashes for a prohibition stated in general terms. Some say it is two lashes that he does not receive; at any rate one set of lashes he does receive. some say: One does not receive even one lashes for as the prohibition is not specific like the prohibition against muzzling.
llm_translation: Abaye said: One does not receive lashes for a negative commandment that is part of a general prohibition. There are those who say: There are two that one does not receive lashes for, one of them is not receiving lashes. There are those who say: There is also one that one does not receive lashes for, because it does not combine with its prohibition like the prohibition of a seal.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָכַל כְּזַיִת נָא מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — פָּטוּר; כְּזַיִת נָא מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה — חַיָּיב. אָכַל כְּזַיִת צָלִי מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — לֹא פָּסַל עַצְמוֹ מִבְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה; כְּזַיִת צָלִי מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה — פָּסַל עַצְמוֹ מִבְּנֵי הַחֲבוּרָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one ate a partially roasted olive-bulk while it was still day he is exempt. a partially roasted olive-bulk after dark, he is liable he ate a roasted olive-bulk while it was still day he has not disqualified himself from group. a roasted olive-bulk after dark, he disqualifies himself from the group
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If one ate an olive's bulk from midday - he is exempt; if he ate an olive's bulk from dusk - he is liable. If one ate a roasted olive's bulk from midday - he did not disqualify himself from being part of a group; if he ate a roasted olive's bulk from dusk - he disqualified himself from being part of the group.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: יָכוֹל אָכַל כְּזַיִת נָא מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם יְהֵא חַיָּיב, וְדִין הוּא: וּמָה בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל צָלִי — יֶשְׁנוֹ בְּבַל תֹּאכַל נָא. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל צָלִי — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּבַל תֹּאכַל נָא?
human_translation: It was taught another might eats a partially roasted olive-bulk while it was still day is liable And this a logical derivation If at time when one is included in to arise eat roasted he is included in not to eat partially roasted, at a time when one is not included in to arise eat roasted isn’t it right that he included in not to eat partially roasted?
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One might have thought that if one ate an olive's bulk of food from midday onwards, he would be liable, and this is the law: But in a case where he is lying down and eats roasted food — he is lying down, do not eat now. In a case where he is not lying down and eats roasted food — it is not the law that he is lying down, do not eat now.

hebrew_text: אוֹ לֹא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל צָלִי — יֶשְׁנוֹ בְּבַל תֹּאכַל נָא, בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל צָלִי — אֵינוֹ בְּבַל תֹּאכַל נָא.
human_translation: Or not At time when one is not included in to arise eat roasted he is included in not to eat partially roasted. at a time when one is included in to arise eat roasted he is not included in not to eat partially roasted,
llm_translation: Or not: at a time when he is not in a state of rising, eating roasted food — he is asleep, do not eat now, at a time when he is in a state of rising, eating roasted food — he is not asleep, eat now.

hebrew_text: וְאַל תִּתְמַהּ, שֶׁהֲרֵי הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ אֵצֶל צָלִי.
human_translation: And do not be confounded as relaxed with regard to roasted
llm_translation: And do not wonder, for behold he was permitted from its entirety beside roasting.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַל תֹּאכְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ נָא וּבָשֵׁל מְבֻשָּׁל בַּמָּיִם כִּי אִם צְלִי אֵשׁ״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כִּי אִם צְלִי אֵשׁ״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כִּי אִם צְלִי אֵשׁ״? לוֹמַר לָךְ: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל צָלִי — יֶשְׁנוֹ בְּבַל תֹּאכַל נָא, בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל צָלִי — אֵינוֹ בְּבַל תֹּאכַל נָא.
human_translation: the verse states: “You shall not eat it partially roasted, nor boiled in any way [ bashel mevushal ] in water, but roasted with fire” As no the verse to state: “Roasted with fire,” what the verse states: “Roasted with fire”? to tell you at time when one is included in to arise eat roasted he is included in not to eat partially roasted, at a time when one is not included in to arise eat roasted he is not included in not to eat partially roasted
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Do not eat from it raw or boiled in water, but only roasted with fire." For there is no teaching to say "but only roasted with fire." And what is the teaching to say "but only roasted with fire"? To tell you: when one is able to eat roasted, he is able to eat; when one is not able to eat roasted, he is not able to eat.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֶקְרָא אֲנִי ״בָּשֵׁל״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״מְבֻשָּׁל״? שֶׁיָּכוֹל אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁבִּישְּׁלוֹ מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה, בִּשְּׁלוֹ מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם מִנַּיִן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בָּשֵׁל מְבֻשָּׁל״ מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi says: I read “boiled [ bashel ],” What the verse states mevushal , As might I have only when it was boiled after dark, From where if he boils it while it was still day? The verse states bashel mevushal , in any case.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: I will read "cooked," what is the Talmud to say "well-cooked"? That he can, I have only that it was cooked from when it got dark, if it was cooked from before the day, from where - the Talmud to say "cooked, well-cooked" from any place.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי ״בָּשֵׁל מְבֻשָּׁל״ אַפְּקֵיהּ רַבִּי לִצְלִי קֵדָר וְלִשְׁאָר מַשְׁקִין!
human_translation: But Rabbi derived “ bashel mevushal ” against roasting in a pot, and with other liquids.
llm_translation: And this "cooked from being cooked," Rabbi brought it up for discussion regarding a pot of stew and other beverages!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן — לֵימָא קְרָא אוֹ ״בָּשֵׁל בָּשֵׁל״, אוֹ ״מְבֻשָּׁל מְבֻשָּׁל״. מַאי ״בָּשֵׁל מְבֻשָּׁל״? שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: If so, let the verse say either “ bashel bashel ” or “ mevushal mevushal ,” What “ bashel mevushal ”? Learn from this two
llm_translation: If so — let us say the verse says "cooked cooked," or "boiled boiled." What is "cooked cooked"? Learn from it two.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָכַל צָלִי מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — חַיָּיב, וּכְזַיִת נָא מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: The Sages taught: ate a roasted when it was still day, he is liable after dark an olive-bulk that was partially roasted, he is liable
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If one ate roasted meat from midday - liable, and like an olive from when it gets dark - liable.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי צָלִי דּוּמְיָא דְּנָא: מָה נָא בְּלָאו, אַף צָלִי בְּלָאו.
human_translation: taught roasted similar to partially roasted Just as partially roasted of a prohibition, so too, roasted of a prohibition.
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught in the school of Nana: Just as it is now without, so too it is without."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא נָא, כְּתִיב: ״אַל תֹּאכְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ נָא״, אֶלָּא צָלִי מְנָלַן?
human_translation: Granted, partially roasted it is written: “You shall not eat it partially roasted” However, roasted, from where do we
llm_translation: In peace now, as it is written: "Do not eat from it raw," but how is it roasted?

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאָכְלוּ אֶת הַבָּשָׂר בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״. בַּלַּיְלָה — אִין, בַּיּוֹם — לָא.
human_translation: As it is written: “And they shall eat the meat on that night, At night, yes, by day, no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאָכְלוּ אֶת הַבָּשָׂר בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״. בַּלַּיְלָה — אִין, בַּיּוֹם — לָא. English translation: As it is written: "And they shall eat the flesh in this night." In the night - yes, in the day - no.

hebrew_text: הַאי לָאו הַבָּא מִכְּלַל עֲשֵׂה הוּא, וְכׇל לָאו הַבָּא מִכְּלַל עֲשֵׂה — עֲשֵׂה!
human_translation: This is a prohibition that comes by inference from a positive mitzva, every prohibition that comes by inference from a positive mitzva a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: This negative commandment that comes from a positive commandment, and any negative commandment that comes from a positive commandment - it is a positive commandment!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא מַנִּי
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: whose is this
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: "Ha mani."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״שׁוֹר וָשֶׂה שָׂרוּעַ וְקָלוּט נְדָבָה תַּעֲשֶׂה אֹתוֹ״. אוֹתוֹ אַתָּה מַתְפִּיס לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת, וְאִי אַתָּה מַתְפִּיס תְּמִימִים לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: כׇּל הַמַּתְפִּיס תְּמִימִים לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת עוֹבֵר בַּעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught a bull or a lamb that has anything too long or too short, you may offer it as a free-will offering it, you consecrate for maintaining the Temple, but you not consecrate unblemished for maintaining the Temple. From here stated: Whoever consecrates unblemished for maintaining the Temple transgresses a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says, as it was taught: "An ox or a sheep that is found and collected, it shall be made as a freewill offering." You, however, are designating it solely for checking the house, and if you designate innocent animals for checking the house, you transgress the positive commandment. From here they said: Anyone who designates innocent animals for checking the house transgresses the positive commandment.

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בַּעֲשֵׂה, בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וַיְדַבֵּר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה לֵּאמֹר״, לִימֵּד עַל כׇּל הַפָּרָשָׁה כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁיְּהֵא בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: I have only a positive mitzva; from where do I a prohibition? The verse states “And the Lord spoke to Moses saying” teaches with regard to the entire portion that a prohibition applies to it. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: I have only in the positive commandment, from where do I derive the prohibition of the negative commandment? The verse teaches: "And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying," to teach regarding the entire portion that it should be without the negative commandment, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי לְבַר קַפָּרָא: מַאי מַשְׁמַע?
human_translation: Rabbi said to Bar Kappara: From where may it be inferred
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Levar Kapara: What does it imply?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: דִּכְתִיב ״לֵאמֹר״ — לֹא נֶאֱמַר בַּדְּבָרִים.
human_translation: He said to him: As it is written: “Saying [ leimor ].” no, is stated with regard to matters,
llm_translation: He said to him: as it is written "le'mor" - it is not said in words.

hebrew_text: בֵּי רַב אָמְרִי: ״לֵאמֹר״ — לָאו אֱמוֹר.
human_translation: the school Rav they say lav emor , Say a prohibition.
llm_translation: The scholars of the school of Rav said: "Leimor" - not "Emor."

hebrew_text: מֵי תַשְׁמִישׁוֹ שֶׁל נַחְתּוֹם וְכוּ׳. תָּנֵי חֲדָא: שׁוֹפְכִין בִּמְקוֹם מִדְרוֹן, וְאֵין שׁוֹפְכִין בִּמְקוֹם הָאֶישְׁבּוֹרֶן. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: שׁוֹפְכִין בִּמְקוֹם הָאֶישְׁבּוֹרֶן!
human_translation: Water that has been used by a baker It was taught one One pour out in a place with an incline, and he not pour out in a place where collects. And it was taught another One pour out in a place where collects.
llm_translation: The waters of the ritual bath of Nachtom, etc. One taught: One may pour in a place of a drain, but one may not pour in a place of a cistern. And it was taught in another Baraita: One may pour in a place of a cistern!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דִּנְפִישִׁי, דִּקְווּ. הָא — דְּלָא נְפִישִׁי, דְּלָא קְווּ.
human_translation: not difficult. This to a large that will collect that where not a large amount will not collect.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this — that multiplied, they hoped. This — that did not multiply, they did not hope.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אִשָּׁה לֹא תָּלוּשׁ אֶלָּא בְּמַיִם שֶׁלָּנוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: A woman knead only with water that rested,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A woman should only be divorced with our water.

hebrew_text: דַּרְשַׁהּ רַב מַתְנָה בְּפַפּוֹנְיָא. לְמָחָר אַיְיתוֹ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חַצְבַיְיהוּ וַאֲתוֹ לְגַבֵּיהּ, וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הַב לַן מַיָּא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא בְּמַיָּא דְּבִיתוּ אֲמַרִי.
human_translation: Rav Mattana taught in Paphunya. On the next day, everyone brought their jugs to him and said to him: Give us water. He said to them: I say Water that rested [ devitu ]
llm_translation: Rav Matna expounded in Pappunya. The next day, everyone brought their axes and came to him, and they said to him: "Bring us water." He said to them: "I speak about the water of his house."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: אִשָּׁה לֹא תָּלוּשׁ בַּחַמָּה, וְלֹא בְּחַמֵּי חַמָּה, וְלֹא בַּמַּיִם הַגְּרוּפִין מִן הַמּוּלְיָיר, וְלֹא תַּגְבִּיהַּ יָדָהּ מִן הַתַּנּוּר עַד שֶׁתִּגְמוֹר אֶת כׇּל הַפַּת. וְצָרִיךְ שְׁנֵי כֵלִים — אֶחָד שֶׁמְּקַטֶּפֶת בּוֹ, וְאֶחָד שֶׁמְּצַנֶּנֶת בּוֹ אֶת יָדֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rava taught: A woman not knead in the sun, nor with heated by the sun, nor with water collected [ hagerufin ] in an urn heated [ mulyar ] And she not remove her hand from the oven, until she finishes all the loaves And requires two vessels, one in which she mixes and one in which she cools her hands
llm_translation: Rava expounded: A woman should not knead dough in the heat of the sun, nor in the heat of the sun's rays, nor in water that has been warmed by the sun, and she should not remove her hand from the oven until she finishes all the dough. And she requires two utensils—one to knead with, and one to cool her hands with.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עָבְרָה וְלָשָׁה, מַהוּ? מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר: מוּתָּר, רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אָסוּר.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before she transgressed and kneaded what is Mar Zutra said: It is permitted Rav Ashi said: It is forbidden.
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: If it passed through fire and lye, what is the ruling? Mar Zutra said: Permitted, Rav Ashe said: Prohibited.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין לוֹתְתִין הַשְּׂעוֹרִין בַּפֶּסַח. וְאִם לָתַת, נִתְבַּקְּעוּ — אֲסוּרִים, לֹא נִתְבַּקְּעוּ — מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: From where do I say As it was taught One not soak barley on Passover, and if one soaked split, is forbidden. not split, is permitted.
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: From where do I say this? As it was taught: One may not roast the barley for the Passover offering. And if one did roast them, if they split open - they are forbidden; if they did not split open - they are permitted.

hebrew_text: וְרַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אַטּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ חֲדָא מְחִיתָא מְחִיתִינְהוּ?! הֵיכָא דְּאִיתְּמַר — אִיתְּמַר, וְהֵיכָא דְּלָא אִיתְּמַר — לָא אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: And Rav Ashi said Is that to say all of them are woven in the same weaving? Where it was stated it was stated; and where it was not stated it was not stated.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Do they all agree on one point, that we should destroy it completely?! Where it is stated, it is stated, and where it is not stated, it is not stated.

hebrew_text: הָדְרָן עֲלָךְ כׇּל שָׁעָה
llm_translation: We will return to you at every moment.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ עוֹבְרִין בַּפֶּסַח: כּוּתָּח הַבַּבְלִי, וְשֵׁכָר הַמָּדִי, וְחוֹמֶץ הָאֲדוֹמִי, וְזֵיתוֹם הַמִּצְרִי, וְזוֹמָן שֶׁל צַבָּעִים, וַעֲמִילָן שֶׁל טַבָּחִים, וְקוֹלָן שֶׁל סוֹפְרִים.
human_translation: these one transgresses [ overin ] on Passover, Babylonian kutaḥ , Median beer; Edomite vinegar; Egyptian zitom , dyers’ broth [ zoman ]; bakers’ well-worked dough; and kolan of soferim .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the ones that are transgressing on Passover: Kutach the Babylonian, and Shechar the Median, and Chometz the Edomite, and Zeitom the Egyptian, and Zoman of dyers, and Amilan of butchers, and Kolam of scribes.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַף תַּכְשִׁיטֵי נָשִׁים.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: also women’s adornments,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even the adornments of women.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא מִמִּין דָּגָן — הֲרֵי זֶה עוֹבֵר בַּפֶּסַח. הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בָּאַזְהָרָה, וְאֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם כָּרֵת.
human_translation: This is the principle: any that is from a type of grain one transgresses on Passover. These in the warning, but there is no element of karet
llm_translation: This is the principle: Anything that is from the species of grain - behold, this one transgresses in regards to Passover. These are subject to warning, and there is no penalty of excision for them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים נֶאֱמָרִים בְּכוּתָּח הַבַּבְלִי: מְטַמְטֵם אֶת הַלֵּב, וּמְסַמֵּא אֶת הָעֵינַיִם, וּמַכְחִישׁ אֶת הַגּוּף.
human_translation: The Sages taught three things were said with regard to kutaḥ : It blocks the heart, it blinds the eyes, and it weakens the body.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Three things are stated in the Book of Kohelet (Ecclesiastes): dulling the heart, darkening the eyes, and weakening the body.

hebrew_text: מְטַמְטֵם אֶת הַלֵּב — מִשּׁוּם נַסְיוּבֵי דַחֲלָבָא. וּמְסַמֵּא אֶת הָעֵינַיִם — מִשּׁוּם מִילְחָא. וּמַכְחִישׁ אֶת הַגּוּף — מִשּׁוּם קוֹמָנִיתָא דְאוּמָא.
human_translation: It blocks the heart due to whey. It blinds the eyes due to the salt And it weakens the body due to the mold in the bread,
llm_translation: He darkens the heart - because of the fatigues of milk. And he blinds the eyes - because of salt. And he weakens the body - because of the commonality of blood.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מַרְבִּין הַזֶּבֶל, וְכוֹפְפִין אֶת הַקּוֹמָה, וְנוֹטְלִין אֶחָד מֵחֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת מִמְּאוֹר עֵינָיו שֶׁל אָדָם, אֵלּוּ הֵן: פַּת קִיבָּר, וְשֵׁכָר חָדָשׁ, וְיָרָק חַי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Three things increase waste, lower stature, and take one five-hundredth of a person’s vision they are: Bread coarse new beer, and raw vegetables.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three things increase the refuse, bend the spine, and take away one five-hundredth of the brightness of a person's eyes. These are: coarse bread, new beer, and raw vegetables.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מְמַעֲטִין אֶת הַזֶּבֶל, וְזוֹקְפִין אֶת הַקּוֹמָה, וּמְאִירִין אֶת הָעֵינַיִם, אֵלּוּ הֵן: פַּת נְקִיָּיה, בָּשָׂר שָׁמֵן, וְיַיִן יָשָׁן. פַּת נְקִיָּיה —
human_translation: the Sages taught Three things decrease waste, straighten stature, and improve vision, they are: Bread fine fatty meat, and aged wine. Fine bread
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three things diminish the waste, straighten the spine, and brighten the eyes. These are: clean bread, fatty meat, and aged wine. Clean bread—

hebrew_text: דִּסְמִידָא, בָּשָׂר שָׁמֵן — דִּצְפִירְתָּא דְּלָא אִפְּתַח, יַיִן יָשָׁן — עַתִּיק עַתִּיקֵי.
human_translation: from refined flour; fatty meat from a goat that has not given birth; and aged wine aged significantly,
llm_translation: Dismaida, meat oil - the lock that does not open, old wine - very old.

hebrew_text: כׇּל מִילֵּי דִּמְעַלֵּי לְהַאי — קָשֵׁה לְהַאי, וּדְקָשֵׁה לְהַאי — מְעַלֵּי לְהַאי, בַּר מִזַּנְגְּבִילָא רַטִּיבָא, וּפִילְפְּלֵי אֲרִיכְתָּא, וּפַת נְקִיָּיה, וּבָשָׂר שָׁמֵן, וְיַיִן יָשָׁן — דִּמְעַלֵּי לְכוּלֵּי גּוּפֵיהּ.
human_translation: Any that is effective in this is deleterious for that And that is deleterious for this is effective that except for moist ginger, long peppers, and bread refined and fatty meat, and aged wine, which are effective to heal all of the body.
llm_translation: All matters that are difficult for this one - are easy for that one, and all that are difficult for that one - are easy for this one. Bar Mitzngebila is moist, and Filpeli is long, and clean bread, and fatty meat, and old wine - are beneficial for all of his body.

hebrew_text: שֵׁכָר הַמָּדִי. דְּרָמוּ בֵּיהּ מֵי שְׂעָרֵי.
human_translation: Median beer place barley water into it.
llm_translation: The intoxicating drink of Midian, they mixed in it water of barley.

hebrew_text: וְחוֹמֶץ הָאֲדוֹמִי. דְּשָׁדוּ בֵּיהּ שְׂעָרֵי.
human_translation: And Edomite vinegar place barley into it.
llm_translation: "And vinegar of the Edomite. They put in it hairs."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן (בַּר יִצְחָק): בַּתְּחִלָּה כְּשֶׁהָיוּ מְבִיאִין נְסָכִים מִיְּהוּדָה, לֹא הָיָה יֵינָם שֶׁל יְהוּדָה מַחְמִיץ, עַד שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לְתוֹכָן שְׂעוֹרִין. וְהָיוּ קוֹרִין אוֹתוֹ חוֹמֶץ סְתָם.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Initially, and they would bring libations from Judea, The wine of Judea would not turn to vinegar unless they placed barley into it And they would call ordinary vinegar,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman (son of Yitzchak) said: Initially, when they would bring libations from Yehudah, the wine of Yehudah would not ferment until they would place barley into it. And they would call that leaven "plain leaven."

hebrew_text: וְעַכְשָׁיו אֵין יֵינָם שֶׁל אֲדוֹמִיִּים מַחְמִיץ עַד שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לְתוֹכָן שְׂעוֹרִין, וְקוֹרִין אוֹתוֹ חוֹמֶץ הָאֲדוֹמִי, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִמָּלְאָה הָחֳרָבָה״, אִם מְלֵאָה זוֹ — חֲרֵבָה זוֹ, וְאִם מְלֵאָה זוֹ — חֲרֵבָה זוֹ. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״וּלְאֹם מִלְּאֹם יֶאֱמָץ״.
human_translation: And now, Edomite wine does not turn to vinegar unless one places barley into it. This is called Edomite vinegar, to fulfill that which is stated I shall be filled with her that is laid waste” If this one, is full, that one, is laid waste; and if this is full, she, is laid waste. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: from here, “The one people shall be stronger than the other people”
llm_translation: And now their wine, the Edomite wine, does not ferment until they put barley into it, and they call that Edomite vinegar, to fulfill what is said: "If it is full of this, it is a sword; if it is full of that, it is a sword." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, from here: "And a nation will be strengthened by a nation."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בִּיהוּדָה, בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הַלּוֹקֵחַ חוֹמֶץ מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְעַשֵּׂר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁחֲזָקָה אֵינוֹ בָּא אֶלָּא מִן הַתֶּמֶד. וְעַכְשָׁיו, הַלּוֹקֵחַ חוֹמֶץ מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ — צָרִיךְ לְעַשֵּׂר, שֶׁחֶזְקָתוֹ אֵינוֹ בָּא אֶלָּא מִן הַיַּיִן.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yehuda said: In Judea, initially, one who would purchase vinegar from an am ha’aretz , not need to tithe it due to it can be assumed was made only from temed , But now, one who purchases vinegar from an am ha’aretz must tithe it, and the presumption is comes only from wine.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: In Judea, initially, one who buys vinegar from an am ha'aretz does not need to tithe it, because the presumption is that it comes only from vinegar. But now, one who buys vinegar from an am ha'aretz must tithe it, because the presumption is that it comes from wine.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: תֶּמֶד לָאו בַּר עַשּׂוֹרֵי הוּא? וְהָא (תְּנַן): הַמְתַמֵּד וְנָתַן מַיִם בַּמִּדָּה, וּמָצָא כְּדֵי מִדָּתוֹ — פָּטוּר, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְחַיֵּיב?
human_translation: But does Rabbi Yehuda hold that temed is not subject to tithing? Wasn’t it taught one who produces temed and adds a measured of water and finds a corresponding he measured, he is exempt Rabbi Yehuda obligates
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda thought: Is a tamed animal not worth ten coins? But didn't we learn: One who is meticulous and gives water according to the measure, and found it to be sufficient for his measure — he is exempt, and Rabbi Yehuda obligates him?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: לֹא נֶחְשְׁדוּ עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ עַל הַתֶּמֶד. אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: נֶחְשְׁדוּ, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּדִרְווֹקָא, הָא — בִּדְפוּרְצָנֵי.
human_translation: This is is saying: amei ha’aretz are not suspected temed . If you wish, say are suspected and not difficult This with dregs That with grape pits; because
llm_translation: So it is stated: The people of the land were not suspected regarding ritual impurity. If you wish, I can say: they were suspected, but it is not difficult. Here - in a case of a narrow alleyway, here - in a case of a wide open area.

hebrew_text: וְזֵיתוֹם הַמִּצְרִי וְכוּ׳. מַאי זֵיתוֹם הַמִּצְרִי?
human_translation: Egyptian zitom What is Egyptian zitom ?
llm_translation: "And zayitom the Egyptian, etc." What is zayitom the Egyptian?

hebrew_text: תָּנָא רַב יוֹסֵף: תְּלָתָא שְׂעָרֵי, תְּלָתָא קוּרְטְמֵי, וּתְלָתָא מִלְחָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef taught one-third barley, one-third safflower, and one-third salt.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rav Yosef said: Three hairs, three membranes, and three salts.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא מַפֵּיק שְׂעָרֵי וּמְעַיֵּיל חִיטֵּי, וְסִימָנָיךְ סִיסָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa removes barley and includes wheat; Your mnemonic sisanei ,
llm_translation: Rav Papa removes hairs and brings wheat, and your sign is sesame seeds.

hebrew_text: תָּרוּ לְהוּ וְקָלוּ לְהוּ וְטָחֲנִי לְהוּ וְשָׁתוּ לְהוּ מִדִּיבְחָא וְעַד עֲצַרְתָּא. דִּקְמִיט מְרַפֵּי לֵיהּ, וְדִרְפֵי מְקַמֵּיט לֵיהּ, לְחוֹלֶה וּלְאִשָּׁה עוּבָּרָה סַכַּנְתָּא.
human_translation: soak and roast them and grind them They drink from Passover to Shavuot . relaxes constipated, and it constipates loose. it is dangerous for a sick person or a pregnant woman
llm_translation: They roasted for him, and they grilled for him, and they ground for him, and they drank for him from Pesach until Atzeret. For when he is satiated, he is healed, and when he is thirsty, he is satiated, for a sick person and a pregnant woman are in danger.

hebrew_text: וְזוֹמָן שֶׁל צַבָּעִים וְכוּ׳. הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: מַיָּא דְּחִיוָּרֵי דְּצָבְעִי בְּהוּ לִבָּא.
human_translation: dyers’ broth Here, they interpreted bran water [ maya deḥivri ] that use to dye leather.
llm_translation: And the appointed time of the dyers, etc. Here they interpreted: the water of the blackness of the dyers is in it for the heart.

hebrew_text: וַעֲמִילָן שֶׁל טַבָּחִים וְכוּ׳. פַּת תְּבוּאָה שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיאָה שְׁלִישׁ, שֶׁמַּנִּיחָהּ עַל פִּי קְדֵירָה וְשׁוֹאֶבֶת הַזּוּהֲמָא.
human_translation: bakers’ well-worked dough bread made from grain that was one-third on top of a pot to draw out the filth
llm_translation: The toil of butchers, etc. A loaf of produce that did not bring a third, one places it on the edge of the pot and absorbs the moisture.

hebrew_text: וְקוֹלָן שֶׁל סוֹפְרִים וְכוּ׳. הָכָא תַּרְגּוּמָא: פֵּרוּרָא דְאוּשְׁכָּפֵי.
human_translation: kolan of soferim, Here, they interpreted that shoemakers’ glue
llm_translation: Their voice of scribes, etc. Here the translation: The crowns of the letters.

hebrew_text: רַב שִׁימִי מָחוֹזְנָאָה אָמַר: זֶה טִיפּוּלָן שֶׁל בְּנוֹת עֲשִׁירִים, שֶׁמְּשַׁיְּירוֹת אוֹתוֹ לִבְנוֹת עֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: Rav Shimi from Ḥozna’a said: This is the paste of the daughters of the wealthy, of which they would leave a remnant for the daughters of the poor.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi Machozna'ah said: This is the neglect of the daughters of the wealthy, who leave him for the daughters of the poor.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא תָּנֵא רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אַרְבָּעָה מִינֵי מְדִינָה, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה מִינֵי אוּמָּנוּת. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ טִיפּוּלָן שֶׁל בְּנוֹת עֲשִׁירִים, מַאי מִינֵי אוּמָּנוּת אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach four items of the state, and three items of artisans, And if you say the paste of the daughters of the wealthy, what artisanship is there in that?
llm_translation: I am not? But didn't Rabbi Chiya teach: Four types of government officials, and three types of craftsmen. And if you say that the daughters of the wealthy are included in the category of craftsmen, what types of craftsmen are there?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי, פֵּרוּרָא דְאוּשְׁכָּפֵי? אַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ הַאי קוֹלָן שֶׁל סוֹפְרִים? קוֹלָן שֶׁל רַצְעָנִין מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: לְעוֹלָם פֵּרוּרָא דְאוּשְׁכָּפֵי, וּמַאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ קוֹלָן שֶׁל סוֹפְרִים? דְּסוֹפְרִים נָמֵי מְדַבְּקִין בְּהוּ נְיָירוֹתֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rather what, shoemakers’ glue? why did call it bookmakers’ glue [ kolan shel soferim ]? It should shoemakers’ glue [ kolan shel ratzanin ]. Rav Oshaya said: Actually, shoemakers’ glue; and why is it called bookmakers’ glue? bookmakers also use it to attach their pages.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather what, the expiation of the wicked? Why is it called the voice of scribes? The voice of the wicked requires it! Rav Oshaya said: Indeed, the expiation of the wicked, and why is it called the voice of scribes? Because scribes also stick to their papers.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר אַף תַּכְשִׁיטֵי נָשִׁים וְכוּ׳. תַּכְשִׁיטֵי נָשִׁים סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אַף טִיפּוּלֵי נָשִׁים. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says women’s adornments are also Could it enter your mind that adornments Rather, say Even women’s cosmetics As Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: With regard to the Jewish women
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Even women's ornaments, etc." Women's ornaments - is it your intention? Rather say: Even women's cosmetics. As Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav: The daughters of Israel.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לְפִרְקָן, וְלֹא הִגִּיעוּ לְשָׁנִים, בְּנוֹת עֲנִיִּים — טוֹפְלוֹת אוֹתָן בְּסִיד, בְּנוֹת עֲשִׁירִים — טוֹפְלוֹת אוֹתָן בְּסוֹלֶת, בְּנוֹת מְלָכִים — בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמּוֹר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמּוֹר״.
human_translation: who reached maturity, but had not reached the age They would smear daughters of the poor with lime; they would smear daughters of the wealthy with fine flour; they would smear daughters of kings with shemen hamor , as it was stated: six months with shemen hamor ”
llm_translation: When they reach puberty, but have not reached the age of twelve, the daughters of poor people are anointed with oil; the daughters of wealthy people are anointed with fine flour; the daughters of kings are anointed with pure myrrh, as it is stated: "Six months with oil of myrrh" (Esther 2:12).

hebrew_text: מַאי ״שֶׁמֶן הַמּוֹר״? רַב הוּנָא בַּר יִרְמְיָה אוֹמֵר: סְטָכַת. רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: שֶׁמֶן זַיִת שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיא שְׁלִישׁ.
human_translation: What is shemen hamor ? Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya said: Setaket . Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: olive oil that not reached a third
llm_translation: What is "Shemen Hamor"? Rav Huna bar Yirmeya says: Stakhat. Rav Yirmeya bar Abba says: Olive oil that did not bring a third.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַנְפִּיקְנִין — שֶׁמֶן זַיִת שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיא שְׁלִישׁ, וְלָמָּה סָכִין אוֹתוֹ? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּשִּׁיר אֶת הַשֵּׂיעָר וּמְעַדֵּן אֶת הַבָּשָׂר.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yehuda says anpiknin olive oil that has not reached a third And why is it spread due to that it removes [ mashir ] the hair and pampers the skin.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says: Anpiknin - olive oil that did not bring a third of its volume. And why do we smear it? Because it makes the hair smooth and nourishes the skin.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל כׇּל שֶׁהוּא מִמִּין דָּגָן. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ כֹּל שֶׁהוּא מִין דָּגָן הֲרֵי זֶה עוֹבֵר בְּפֶסַח, לָמָּה מָנוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת אֵלּוּ? כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא רָגִיל בָּהֶן וּבִשְׁמוֹתֵיהֶן.
human_translation: This is the principle: anything that is from a type of grain. It was taught Rabbi Yehoshua said: Now that we learned anything that is a type of grain one violates during Passover, why did the Sages list these so that would become familiar with these and with their names,
llm_translation: This is the principle: anything that is from the species of grain. It was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua said: Since we have learned that anything that is from the species of grain, why did the Sages count these? In order that one should be familiar with them and their names.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּהָהוּא בַּר מַעְרְבָא אִיקְּלַע לְבָבֶל, הֲוָה בִּישְׂרָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: קָרִיבוּ לִי מַתְכִּילְתָּא. שְׁמַע דְּקָאָמְרִי: קָרִיבוּ לֵיהּ כּוּתָּח. כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁמַע כּוּתָּח — פֵּירַשׁ.
human_translation: As in this of that from the West, visited Babylonia, had meat with him, he said to Bring me a dip He heard them saying: Bring him kutaḥ . Since he heard kutaḥ , he stopped
llm_translation: The one who came from Ma'arava to Babylon, was sitting in front of the scholars, he said to them: Bring me the matkilta. Listen to what they were saying: Bring him the kutach. Once he heard the kutach - he explained.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בְּאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: These are included in the prohibition
llm_translation: Behold, these are under a warning.

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא דְּחָמֵץ דָּגָן גָּמוּר עַל יְדֵי תַּעֲרוֹבוֹת, וְנוּקְשֶׁה בְּעֵינֵיהּ בְּלָאו?
human_translation: Who is the tanna who full-fledged, leavened grain bread in a mixture, and hardened in its pure, in a prohibition?
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that maintains that leavened grain is completely nullified by mixtures, and it is difficult in his eyes without?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: שִׂיאוּר — יִשָּׂרֵף, וְנוֹתְנוֹ לְכַלְבּוֹ, וְהָאוֹכְלוֹ — בְּאַרְבָּעִים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: It is Rabbi Meir, as it was taught Leavening be burned, or gives it to his dog. And one who eats it with forty
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: It is Rabbi Meir, as it was taught: "A bundle - shall be burned, and give it to his dog, and its eater - is forty."

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ ״שִׂיאוּר יִשָּׂרֵף״, אַלְמָא אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה, וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי: וְנוֹתְנוֹ לִפְנֵי כַּלְבּוֹ, אַלְמָא מוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה!
human_translation: This itself is difficult. You said leavening be burned; apparently it is prohibited to benefit And then it teaches: Or gives it to his dog; apparently, it is permitted to benefit
llm_translation: This is a difficult case, as you said "the hair will be burned," implying that it is prohibited to derive benefit from it. And then it teaches: "and he places it before his dog," implying that it is permitted to derive benefit from it!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: שִׂיאוּר יִשָּׂרֵף — דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְנוֹתְנוֹ לִפְנֵי כַּלְבּוֹ — דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: this is is saying: Leavening be burned, by Rabbi Meir in accordance with Rabbi Meir, by Rabbi Yehuda, in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda that one gives it to his dog, by Rabbi Meir, according to Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: So he said: "The burning of the leaven" - Rabbi Meir to Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Yehuda to Rabbi Yehuda. And he places it before his dog - Rabbi Meir to Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וְהָאוֹכְלוֹ בְּאַרְבָּעִים — אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: one who eats with forty we have arrived at Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And the one who eats in forty — came to Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר נוּקְשֶׁה בְּעֵינֵיהּ — בְּלָאו. וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן חָמֵץ דָּגָן גָּמוּר עַל יְדֵי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת.
human_translation: we learned Rabbi Meir hardened in its pure, in a prohibition, And all the more so, full-fledged, leavened grain bread in a mixture
llm_translation: We have heard regarding Rabbi Meir: "It is difficult in his eyes" - without. And certainly leavened grain is completely annulled through a mixture.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: עַל חָמֵץ דָּגָן גָּמוּר — עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, עַל עֵירוּבוֹ — בְּלָאו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַל חָמֵץ דָּגָן גָּמוּר — עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, עַל עֵירוּבוֹ — בְּלֹא כְּלוּם. וְשָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמַר חָמֵץ דָּגָן גָּמוּר עַל יְדֵי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת — בְּלָאו, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן נוּקְשֶׁה בְּעֵינֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: is Rabbi Eliezer, as it was taught For full-fledged, leavened grain bread punishable karet , for a mixture for a prohibition. the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Rabbis say: For full-fledged, leavened grain bread punishable by karet ; for its mixture not at all. And we learned according to Rabbi Eliezer, who said full-fledged, leavened grain bread in a mixture is in a prohibition, and all the more so hardened leaven in its pure,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Rabbi Eliezer is the one, as it was taught: Regarding fully leavened grain - the punishment is excision, regarding its mixture - it is without punishment, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the sages say: Regarding fully leavened grain - the punishment is excision, regarding its mixture - it is without disgrace. And we heard about Rabbi Eliezer that he said: Fully leavened grain through a mixture - it is without disgrace, and all the more so it is repugnant in his eyes.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: And what is the reason Rav Naḥman did not state in accordance with Rav Yehuda,
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman, what is the reason he did not say like Rav Yehudah?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: דִּילְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָתָם אֶלָּא נוּקְשֶׁה בְּעֵינֵיהּ, אֲבָל חָמֵץ דָּגָן גָּמוּר עַל יְדֵי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת — לָא.
human_translation: said to you Perhaps Rabbi Meir stated only there, hardened in its pure, however, full-fledged, leavened grain bread in a mixture, no,
llm_translation: He said to you: perhaps until here not said Rabbi Meir there rather was difficult in her eyes, but leaven of grain complete by means of mixture — no.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב נַחְמָן?
human_translation: And what is the reason Rav Yehuda did not state in accordance with Rav Naḥman,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah, what is the reason he did not say like Rav Nachman?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָתָם אֶלָּא חָמֵץ דָּגָן גָּמוּר עַל יְדֵי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת. אֲבָל נוּקְשֶׁה בְּעֵינֵיהּ — לָא אָמַר.
human_translation: said to you: Rabbi Eliezer stated only there, full-fledged, leavened grain bread in a mixture However, hardened in its pure, he did not state
llm_translation: He said to you: Until here did not say Rabbi Eliezer there except leaven of grain complete by means of mixture. But if it became moldy in her eyes — he did not say.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: ״כׇּל מַחְמֶצֶת לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״ — לְרַבּוֹת כּוּתָּח הַבַּבְלִי וְשֵׁכָר הַמָּדִי וְחוֹמֶץ הָאֲדוֹמִי וְזֵיתוֹם הַמִּצְרִי. יָכוֹל יְהֵא עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי כׇּל אֹכֵל חָמֵץ וְנִכְרְתָה״, עַל חָמֵץ דָּגָן גָּמוּר — עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, וְעַל עֵירוּבוֹ — בְּלָאו.
human_translation: it was taught in accordance with Rav Yehuda, “You shall eat nothing leavened; to include Babylonian kutaḥ , Median beer, Edomite vinegar, and Egyptian zitom . might will be punishable karet . the verse states: “For whoever eats leavened bread… shall be cut off For full-fledged, leavened grain bread punished karet , but for its mixture of a prohibition.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Yehudah: "You shall not eat any leaven" — to include Babylonian kutach, Median beer, Edomite vinegar, and Egyptian zitom. Could it be that the punishment is karet? The verse teaches: "For whoever eats leavened bread shall be cut off," regarding fully leavened grain — the punishment is karet, but regarding its mixture — it is a negative commandment.

hebrew_text: מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר עַל עֵירוּבוֹ בְּלָאו? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, וְאִילּוּ נוּקְשֶׁה בְּעֵינֵיהּ לָא קָאָמַר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: נוּקְשֶׁה לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לֵית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Whom did you hear that said that for a mixture of a prohibition? It is Rabbi Eliezer. However, is not stating hardened in its pure, Learn from this that Rabbi Eliezer is not of hardened
llm_translation: One who heard him say about his Eruv without a condition? Rabbi Eliezer it is, and if it were problematic in his eyes, he would not have said it. Learn from it: If it were problematic for Rabbi Eliezer, he would not have it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, עֵירוּבוֹ בְּלָאו מְנָא לֵיהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל מַחְמֶצֶת לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, from where does he its mixture in a prohibition? as it is written: “You shall eat nothing leavened.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, his Eruv with a loaf, does he not establish it? As it is written: "You shall not eat any leaven."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, כָּרֵת נָמֵי לְחַיֵּיב, דְּהָא כְּתִיב: ״כִּי כׇּל אֹכֵל מַחְמֶצֶת וְנִכְרְתָה״!
human_translation: If so, let one also be liable to karet As it is written: for whosoever eats anything [ kol ] leavened, shall be cut off
llm_translation: If so, he is liable for karet, for it is written: "For whoever eats leavened bread shall be cut off" (Exodus 12:15)!

hebrew_text: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, (״מַחְמֶצֶת״) אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּתְחַמֵּץ מֵאֵלָיו, מֵחֲמַת דָּבָר אַחֵר מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כׇּל ... מַחְמֶצֶת וְנִכְרְתָה״.
human_translation: needs that for that which was taught leavened, I have only that became leavened on its own from where due to a different factor? The verse states: anything [ kol ] leavened…shall be cut off,”
llm_translation: That one asks according to the teaching, ("leavened bread") I have only that which has leavened from it, from another matter how do I know? The Talmud teaches: "Any ... leavened bread shall be cut off."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, דְּלָאו נָמֵי לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא!
human_translation: If so, to prohibition, comes for that as well.
llm_translation: If so, that it is not only for this reason that he came!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מִ״כׇּל״.
human_translation: Rather, the reason for Rabbi Eliezer from anything [ kol ].
llm_translation: Rather: The reason of Rabbi Eliezer is "from all."

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״כׇּל״? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַנָּשִׁים.
human_translation: There, too, isn’t it written: whosoever [ kol ] requires that to include women
llm_translation: There, it is stated, "all"? That one asks him - to include women.

hebrew_text: נָשִׁים מִדְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב נָפְקָא, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אָמַר קְרָא ״אִישׁ אוֹ אִשָּׁה כִּי יַעֲשׂוּ מִכׇּל חַטֹּאת הָאָדָם״, הִשְׁוָה הַכָּתוּב אִישׁ לְאִשָּׁה לְכׇל עוֹנָשִׁין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: women derived from Rav Yehuda Rav said. As Rav Yehuda said Rav said, and similarly, the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: The verse said: A man or woman, when they commit any of the sins of men, The Torah rendered a man equal to a woman for all punishments of the Torah.
llm_translation: Women according to Rav Yehudah said Rav Nafka, as Rav Yehudah said Rav, and so too it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: The verse states, "If a man or a woman commits any of the sins that people commit," the Scripture equated a man to a woman for all punishments in the Torah.

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ,
human_translation: necessary
llm_translation: It is necessary.

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב ״לֹא תֹאכַל עָלָיו חָמֵץ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים תֹּאכַל עָלָיו מַצּוֹת״, כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל מַצָּה — יֶשְׁנוֹ בְּבַל תֹּאכַל חָמֵץ, וְהָנֵי נְשֵׁי, הוֹאִיל וְלֵיתַנְהוּ בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל מַצָּה, דְּהָוְיָא לַיהּ מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא (הִיא) — אֵימָא בְּבַל תֹּאכַל חָמֵץ נָמֵי לֵיתַנְהוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: it could enter your mind to say since it is written: “You shall eat no leavened bread with it; seven days you shall eat with it matzot ” anyone included to eat matza is included prohibition against eating leavened bread. And these women, since they are excluded to eat matza , as it is a time-bound, positive mitzva say they are also excluded from the prohibition against eating leavened bread. teaches us
llm_translation: I ascend of your opinion: Since it is written, "You shall not eat leavened bread with it; for seven days you shall eat with it unleavened bread," anyone who has the obligation to eat matzah — has the obligation not to eat leavened bread. And these women, since they do not have the obligation to eat matzah, for it is a positive commandment dependent on time — say also they do not have the obligation not to eat leavened bread, and it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאִתְרַבּוּ לְהוּ בְּבַל תֹּאכַל חָמֵץ — אִיתְרַבִּי נָמֵי לַאֲכִילַת מַצָּה, כְּרַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר). דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת בַּאֲכִילַת מַצָּה דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תֹאכַל עָלָיו חָמֵץ וְגוֹ׳״, כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּבַל תֹּאכַל חָמֵץ — יֶשְׁנוֹ בַּאֲכִילַת מַצָּה. וְהָנֵי נְשֵׁי נָמֵי, הוֹאִיל וְיׇשְׁנָן בְּבַל תֹּאכַל חָמֵץ — יֶשְׁנָן בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל מַצָּה.
human_translation: And now have been included in the prohibition against eating leavened bread, they also be included to eat matza , in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. As Rabbi Eliezer said: Women are obligated to eat matza by Torah as it is stated: “You shall eat no leavened bread with it; anyone included the prohibition against eating leavened bread is included in to eat matza . And these women too, since they included the prohibition against eating leavened bread, they are included in to eat matza .
llm_translation: At this time when they were in Babylon not to eat leavened bread - It was taught: They were also obligated to eat matzah, like Rabbi Eliezer. For Rabbi Eliezer said: Women are obligated in the eating of matzah by Torah law, as it is stated: "You shall not eat upon it leavened bread, etc." Anyone who is included in not eating leavened bread - is included in the eating of matzah. And these women, since they are included in not eating leavened bread - they are included in the obligation to eat matzah.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חָזֵית דְּהַאי ״כׇּל״ לְרַבּוֹיֵי נָשִׁים, וּמַפְּקַתְּ עֵירוּבוֹ? אֵימָא: לְרַבּוֹיֵי עֵירוּבוֹ!
human_translation: What did you see that anything [ kol ] include women and to exclude its mixture? say to include its mixture.
llm_translation: And what do you see that this "all" includes the wives of his students, and it invalidates his eruv? Say: It includes the wives of his eruv!

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא, קָאֵי בְּאוֹכְלִין מְרַבֵּה אוֹכְלִין. קָאֵי בְּאוֹכְלִין מְרַבֵּה נֶאֱכָלִין?
human_translation: It is reasonable dealing with those who eat it includes those who eat, is dealing with those who eat include be eaten?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Mistabera, ka'ei be'ochlin merabeh ochlin. Ka'ei be'ochlin merabeh ne'echalin?" Translation: "If it is digested, it increases the food. If it increases the food, are they digested?"

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נָתָן אֲבוּהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא (בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן): וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּקָאֵי בְּאוֹכְלִין לָא מְרַבֵּה נֶאֱכָלִין? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: ״כִּי כׇּל אֹכֵל חֵלֶב מִן הַבְּהֵמָה אֲשֶׁר יַקְרִיב״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא חֵלֶב תְּמִימִין שֶׁרָאוּי לִיקְרַב, חֵלֶב בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִן הַבְּהֵמָה״. חֵלֶב חוּלִּין מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי כׇּל״. וְהָא הָכָא דְּקָאֵי בְּאוֹכְלִין, וְקָא מְרַבֵּה נֶאֱכָלִין!
human_translation: Rav Natan, father of Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, strongly objects to this: And anywhere that is dealing with those who eat, does not include types of food Wasn’t taught “For anyone who eats the fat of the domesticated animal, of which men present I have only fats unblemished that are fit to be sacrificed. From where fats of blemished animals, The verse states: “Of the domesticated animal.” From where fats of non-sacred The verse states: “For anyone Here, isn’t dealing with those who eat include be eaten.
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Natan the father of Rav Huna (son of Rav Natan): And wherever it stands regarding foods, does it not increase in being eaten? But is it not taught: "For any who eats the fat of the animal that one may offer," I have only the fat of unblemished animals that are fit to be offered, from where do we derive the fat of blemished animals? The Scripture states: "From the animal." From where do we derive the fat of non-consecrated animals? The Scripture states: "For any." But here, regarding foods, it increases in being eaten!

hebrew_text: הָתָם דְּלֵיכָּא אוֹכְלִין — מְרַבֵּה נֶאֱכָלִין. הָכָא דְּאִיכָּא אוֹכְלִין — לָא שָׁבֵיק לְהוּ לְאוֹכְלִין וּמְרַבֵּה נֶאֱכָלִין.
human_translation: There, where there are no who eat to include foods. Here, where there are who eat not exclude who eat and include eaten.
llm_translation: There, where there are eaters - the food is increased. Here, where there are eaters - he did not leave it for the eaters and the food is increased.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן דְּלֵית לְהוּ עֵירוּב, ״כׇּל״ לָא דָּרְשִׁי. אֶלָּא נָשִׁים מְנָא לְהוּ?
human_translation: And the Rabbis, who are not of mixture do not interpret Anything [ kol ], However, from where do they women
llm_translation: The Sages who do not have an eruv, "all" they did not inquire. Rather, women, how do they count for them?

human_translation: they do not derive Anything, they derive For anyone [ ki kol ],
llm_translation: "Kol" - did not expound, "ki kol" - expounded.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אֵימָא: ״כׇּל״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַנָּשִׁים, ״כִּי כׇּל״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ!
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, Say Anyone to include the women, For anyone to include its mixture.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "כׇּל" - to include women, "כִּי כׇּל" - to include his mixture!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא ״כִּי כׇּל״ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לָא דָּרֵישׁ, וְהָתַנְיָא: שְׂאֹר בַּל תַּקְטִירוּ — אֵין לִי אֶלָּא כּוּלּוֹ, מִקְצָתוֹ מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כׇּל״. עֵירוּבוֹ מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי כׇּל״. מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּדָרֵישׁ ״כׇּל״ — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְקָא דָּרֵישׁ ״כִּי כׇּל״!
human_translation: And lest you say that Rabbi Eliezer does not derive For anyone [ ki kol ], Wasn’t taught You shall not offer leaven, I would have nothing other an entire From where part of it? The verse states: “No [ kol ] From where a mixture? The verse states: “For no ki kol Whom did you hear who derives Kol ? Rabbi Eliezer, and he derives Ki kol .
llm_translation: And if you will say, "For 'all' Rabbi Eliezer does not expound," yet it was taught: "Do not leave over any leaven" - I have only its entirety, how do I know some of it? The Talmud teaches: "All." How do I know its mixture? The Talmud teaches: "For all." Who heard that he expounds "all"? Rabbi Eliezer, and he expounds "For all"!

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: difficult,
llm_translation: "Kashya."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אִיסּוּרִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה — אֵין הֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר, חוּץ מֵאִיסּוּרֵי נָזִיר, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״מִשְׁרַת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: With regard to all prohibitions of the Torah, a permitted does not join together with a prohibited except for the prohibitions of a nazirite, as the Torah said soaked
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avahu said Rabbi Yochanan: All prohibitions in the Torah - no permission combines with prohibition, except for the prohibitions of a Nazirite, for the Torah said "from wine."

hebrew_text: וּזְעֵירִי אָמַר: אַף שְׂאוֹר בַּל תַּקְטִירוּ.
human_translation: And Ze’eiri said: also the prohibition against offering leaven
llm_translation: And Zeiri said: Also leaven do not burn.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּדָרֵישׁ ״כׇּל״.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who derives kol
llm_translation: As whom? As Rabbi Eliezer, who interprets "all."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי
human_translation: If so,
llm_translation: If so.

hebrew_text: לְעִנְיַן חָמֵץ בַּפֶּסַח נָמֵי.
human_translation: to the matter of leavened bread on Passover also
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of chametz on Passover, let it be said.

hebrew_text: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּאַבַּיֵּי דְּאָמַר: יֵשׁ הַקְטָרָה לְפָחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דְּהַקְטָרָה לָאו לְפָחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת.
human_translation: Yes, indeed it is so, and to exclude of Abaye, who said: There is offering less than an olive-bulk teaches us that an offering less than an olive-bulk not
llm_translation: Thus it is said. And to go out from the words of the father who said: There is incense less than the size of an olive, we learn that incense is not less than the size of an olive.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב דִּימִי וְקָאָמַר לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב דִּימִי: וְכׇל אִיסּוּרִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה אֵין הֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר?
human_translation: Rav Dimi sat and stated this halakha Abaye said to Rav Dimi: And all prohibitions in the Torah, a permitted does not join together with a prohibited
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Dimi and saying to her this report. Said to him Abbaye to Rav Dimi: And all prohibitions in the Torah not permitted joins to prohibition?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: הַמִּקְפָּה שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה וְהַשּׁוּם וְהַשֶּׁמֶן שֶׁל חוּלִּין, וְנָגַע טְבוּל יוֹם בְּמִקְצָתָן — פָּסַל אֶת כּוּלָּן. הַמִּקְפָּה שֶׁל חוּלִּין וְהַשּׁוּם וְהַשֶּׁמֶן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, וְנָגַע טְבוּל יוֹם בְּמִקְצָתָן — לֹא פָּסַל אֶלָּא מְקוֹם מַגָּעוֹ בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn soup with teruma garlic and oil of non-sacred and one who immersed himself during that day touched some of he disqualified all soup with non-sacred and the garlic and the oil were of teruma , and one who immersed himself during that day touched some of them, he disqualifies only place that he touched.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: If the covering of Terumah, and the garlic, and the oil of common produce, and a Tevul Yom touched some of them - he invalidates all of them. If the covering of common produce, and the garlic, and the oil of Terumah, and a Tevul Yom touched some of them - he only invalidates the place of his touch alone.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: מְקוֹם מַגָּעוֹ אַמַּאי פְּסוּלָה? הָא בָּטְלִי לְהוּ תַּבְלִין בְּרוֹב! וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: מַה טַּעַם — הוֹאִיל וְזָר לוֹקֶה עֲלֵיהֶן בִּכְזַיִת. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּהֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר?
human_translation: And we discussed this Why place that he touched disqualified? spices, are nullified by the majority. And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said What is the reason since a non-priest is flogged for an olive-bulk What are the circumstances not due to that the permitted joins together with the prohibited
llm_translation: We were learning in it: the place of its touch, why is it invalid? Because it is nullified by the majority of spices! And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: What is the reason? Since a foreign substance is absorbed into them with a spoon. How so? Is it not because the permitted substance combines with the forbidden substance?

hebrew_text: לָא, מַאי כְּזַיִת — דְּאִיכָּא כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס.
human_translation: No; what is an olive-bulk that there is an olive-bulk in the time it takes to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: Not, what is "like an olive"? - that there is an olive in the amount of a Peras' worth of food.

hebrew_text: וּכְזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: Is an olive-bulk in the time it takes to eat a half-loaf by Torah said to him: Yes.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And like an olive in the size of the eating of a half-Pras of Torah is it? He said to him: No."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּכוּתָּח הַבַּבְלִי?
human_translation: If so, why do the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Eliezer with regard to Babylonian kutaḥ ,
llm_translation: If so, why do the Rabbis dispute with regard to the ruling of Rabbi Eliezer in the case of the Babylonian wheat?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי, מִשּׁוּם דְּהֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר? סוֹף סוֹף אַמַּאי פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּכוּתָּח הַבַּבְלִי? אֶלָּא: הַנַּח לְכוּתָּח הַבַּבְלִי דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס. אִי בְּעֵינֵיהּ דְּקָשָׂרֵיף וְקָאָכֵיל לֵיהּ, בָּטְלָה דַּעְתֵּיהּ אֵצֶל כׇּל אָדָם. וְאִי מִשְׁטָר קָשָׁטַר וְאָכֵיל — לֵית בֵּיהּ כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס.
human_translation: Rather, what due to a permitted joins together with a prohibited ultimately, why do the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Eliezer with regard to Babylonian kutaḥ ? Rather, leave Babylonian kutaḥ , as there is no an olive-bulk in the time it takes to eat a half-loaf If eats in its pure, by swallowing it his intention is irrelevant by all people. And if he dips and eats not an olive-bulk in the time it takes to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason that he who is permitted joins with the prohibition? Ultimately, why do the Rabbis argue with regard to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer in the matter of the Babylonian kutah? Rather, leave the Babylonian kutah that does not contain the size of an olive for the purpose of a meal. If he looks at it and eats it, his mind becomes nullified in the eyes of all people. And if he examines it and eats it — it does not contain the size of an olive for the purpose of a meal.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: שְׁתֵּי קְדֵירוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין וְאַחַת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, וְלִפְנֵיהֶן שְׁתֵּי מְדוֹכוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין וְאַחַת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, וְנָפְלוּ אֵלּוּ לְתוֹךְ אֵלּוּ — מוּתָּרִין. שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: תְּרוּמָה לְתוֹךְ הַתְּרוּמָה נָפְלָה, וְחוּלִּין לְתוֹךְ חוּלִּין נָפְלוּ,
human_translation: raised an objection to two pots, one of non-sacred and one of teruma , before which two mortars, which non-sacred and one which teruma and these fell into these it is permitted. as I say, teruma fell into the teruma and non-sacred produce fell into non-sacred produce.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: Two pots, one of ordinary produce and one of terumah, and before them are two baskets, one of ordinary produce and one of terumah, and these fell into those — they are permitted. For I say: terumah fell into terumah, and ordinary produce fell into ordinary produce.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אַמַּאי אָמְרִינַן ״שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר תְּרוּמָה לְתוֹךְ כּוּ׳״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַנַּח לִתְרוּמַת תַּבְלִין דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And if you say an olive-bulk in the time it takes to eat a half-loaf by Torah why do we say As I say that teruma into etc.? said to him: Leave teruma spices, by rabbinic
llm_translation: "And if you say 'like an olive in the amount for eating half a Persian,' which is from the Torah, why do we say 'I say a contribution into a pit'? He said to him: Leave the contribution of spices of the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: שְׁתֵּי קוּפּוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין וְאַחַת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, וְלִפְנֵיהֶם שְׁנֵי סְאִין, אַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין וְאַחַת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, וְנָפְלוּ אֵלּוּ לְתוֹךְ אֵלּוּ — מוּתָּרִין, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: חוּלִּין לְתוֹךְ חוּלִּין נָפְלוּ, תְּרוּמָה לְתוֹךְ תְּרוּמָה נָפְלָה. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — אַמַּאי אָמְרִינַן ״שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר״?
human_translation: raised objection two baskets, one non-sacred and the other teruma , and before them two se’a one non-sacred and one with teruma , and these, fell into those, permitted, as I say the non-sacred produce fell into the non-sacred produce and the teruma fell into the teruma . and if you say an olive-bulk in the time it takes to eat a half-loaf by Torah why do we say As I say
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: Two baskets, one of common produce and one of terumah, and before them are two se'ahs, one of common produce and one of terumah, and if these fell into those — they are permitted, for I say: common produce fell into common produce, terumah fell into terumah. And if you say, "like an olive in the amount for eating a Persian cucumber" — why do we say "for I say"?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַנַּח לִתְרוּמָה בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: He said to him: Leave teruma in modern times, by rabbinic
llm_translation: He said to him: "Leave it for the offering at this time according to the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: וְהַאי ״מִשְׁרַת״ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא? הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״מִשְׁרַת״ —
human_translation: And this Soaked, come to that is required to that which was taught Soaked,
llm_translation: And this "mishrat" is thus the reason why it came? This one requires it as it was taught: "mishrat" —

hebrew_text: לִיתֵּן טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר. שֶׁאִם שָׁרָה עֲנָבִים בְּמַיִם, וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶן טַעַם יַיִן — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: to establish taste like substance. As, where one soaked grapes in water and has the taste of wine, is liable
llm_translation: To give reason as the essence. For if one soaks grapes in water, and they have the taste of wine - liable.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אַתָּה דָּן לְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ: וּמָה נָזִיר שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם, וְאֵין אִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר הֲנָאָה, וְיֵשׁ הֶיתֵּר לְאִיסּוּרוֹ — עָשָׂה בּוֹ טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר, כִּלְאַיִם, שֶׁאִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם, וְאִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר הֲנָאָה, וְאֵין הֶיתֵּר לְאִיסּוּרוֹ — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר?
human_translation: From here you derive to the entire Torah; Just as a nazirite, whose prohibition is not an eternal prohibition, and his prohibition is not a prohibition benefit and there is dissolution for his prohibition his rendered taste like substance; diverse kinds, whose prohibition is an eternal prohibition [ issuro issur olam ] and whose prohibition is a prohibition benefit, and there is no dissolution for its prohibition, is it not right that should render taste like substance?
llm_translation: From here you judge the entire Torah: And what about a Nazirite whose prohibition is an eternal prohibition, and his prohibition is a prohibition of benefit, and there is permission for his prohibition - if he acted with a reason like the original, it is forbidden, as if it were not forbidden, his prohibition is an eternal prohibition, and his prohibition is a prohibition of benefit, and there is no permission for his prohibition - is it not the law that he should not act with a reason like the original?

hebrew_text: וְהוּא הַדִּין לְעׇרְלָה בִּשְׁתַּיִם!
human_translation: And the same is true of fruit that grows on a tree during the first three years after it was planted [ orla ], on two
llm_translation: And it is the same for Orlah with two!

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי רַבָּנַן הִיא, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: whose opinion It is the Rabbis, Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: This is the statement of the Sages, and Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: הֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּמַתְנִיתִין, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: נָזִיר שֶׁשָּׁרָה פִּתּוֹ בְּיַיִן, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ לְצָרֵף כְּדֵי כְּזַיִת — חַיָּיב, וּמִמַּאי דְּמִפַּת וּמִיַּיִן? דִּילְמָא מִיַּיִן לְחוֹדֵיהּ?
human_translation: which Rabbi Akiva If you say Rabbi Akiva mishna, as we learned: Rabbi Akiva says, a nazirite who soaked his bread in wine, and contain to join together to an olive-bulk, he is liable; from where do we that from the bread and the wine Perhaps from wine alone?
llm_translation: Be Rabbi Akiva? Perhaps Rabbi Akiva of the Mishnah, as we learned: Rabbi Akiva says: A Nazirite who soaks his bread in wine, and it contains enough to season like an olive's bulk - is liable. And from what is he liable? Perhaps from the bread or from the wine? Perhaps from the wine for its own merit?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: מִיַּיִן לְחוֹדֵיהּ מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּתַעֲרוֹבֶת.
human_translation: And lest you say from wine alone, what to state this teach us that even though in a mixture,
llm_translation: And if you will say: From wine to vinegar, what is there to say about water? This teaches us that even though it becomes mixed.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּבָרַיְיתָא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: נָזִיר שֶׁשָּׁרָה פִּתּוֹ בְּיַיִן, וְאָכַל כְּזַיִת מִפַּת וּמִיַּיִן — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Akiva in the baraita , as it was taught Rabbi Akiva says: A nazirite who soaked his bread in wine and ate an olive-bulk from bread and wine is liable.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Akiva of the school of Yavne. As it was taught: Rabbi Akiva says: A Nazirite who soaked his bread in wine, and ate an olive's worth of bread and an olive's worth of wine - is liable.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר מְנָא לֵיהּ? יָלֵיף מִבָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב: לָאו טַעְמָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, וְאָסוּר? הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, from where taste like substance He derives meat in milk. merely taste and is forbidden. Here, too, no different,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva: Does he derive the reasoning from the essence itself? It is derived from "Do not cook a kid in its mother's milk." Is it not a mere reason, and it is prohibited? Here too, it is no different.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? מִבָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב לָא גָּמְרִינַן, דְּחִידּוּשׁ הוּא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, from meat in milk we do not derive as is a novelty.
llm_translation: The Sages? From meat in milk not we conclude, for it is a novelty.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חִידּוּשׁ? אִילֵּימָא דְּהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ וְהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ — שְׁרֵי, וּבַהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי — אָסוּר, כִּלְאַיִם נָמֵי: הַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ וְהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ — שְׁרֵי, וּבַהֲדָדִי — אָסוּר.
human_translation: And what is novelty If you say that this alone and that alone permitted, and together they are forbidden, diverse kinds too, this alone and that alone permitted, and together they are prohibited.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And what is the novelty? If you say that this one is for its own sake and this one is for its own sake - it is permitted, but if they are together - it is prohibited. Rather, it is obvious: if this one is for its own sake and this one is for its own sake - it is permitted, but if they are together - it is prohibited."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דְּאִי תָּרוּ לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּי יוֹמָא בַּחֲלָבָא — שְׁרֵי, בַּשֵּׁיל לֵיהּ בַּשּׁוֹלֵי — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rather, that if one soaks in milk all day, it is permitted one cooked is prohibited
llm_translation: Rather: if you soak it all day in milk - it is permitted, but if you cook it in hot water - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי, בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב וַדַּאי חִידּוּשׁ הוּא?
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva too meat in milk is a novelty.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva said, "Meat in milk, is it certainly a novelty?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא יָלֵיף מִגִּיעוּלֵי גוֹיִם: גִּיעוּלֵי גוֹיִם, לָאו טַעְמָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, וְאָסוּר? הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Rather, he derives from purging gentiles. Isn’t purging gentiles mere taste prohibited Here, too, no different;
llm_translation: Rather, he should derive it from the produce of the nations. The produce of the nations, is it not merely a reason in itself, and prohibited? Here too, it is no different.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, גִּיעוּלֵי גוֹיִם נָמֵי חִידּוּשׁ הוּא. דְּהָא כׇּל נוֹתֵן טַעַם לִפְגָם — מוּתָּר, דְּגָמְרִינַן מִנְּבֵילָה — וְהָכָא אָסוּר.
human_translation: And the Rabbis purging gentiles is a novelty. As anything that contributes taste tainted is permitted. As we derive from an animal carcass However, here, prohibited.
llm_translation: The sages, the disgrace of the nations, it is a novelty. For anyone who gives a reason to degrade - it is permitted, for we learn from a carcass - but here it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא כִּדְרַב חִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר: לֹא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא בִּקְדֵירָה בַּת יוֹמָא, הִלְכָּךְ לָאו נוֹתֵן טַעַם לִפְגָם הוּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, in accordance with Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Huna, who said: The Torah prohibited only in a pot on that day. Therefore, it is not contributes taste tainted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva as the opinion of Rabbi Chiya, son of Rav Huna, who said: The Torah only prohibited cooking in a pot on the day of Shabbat, therefore one does not give a reason for the prohibition to avoid denigration.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? קְדֵירָה בַּת יוֹמָא נָמֵי, לָא אֶפְשָׁר דְּלָא פָּגְמָה פּוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis even a pot on that day, it is impossible that does not slightly taint
llm_translation: The sages? A pot of one day is considered as though it has not spoiled the food.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מִדְּרַבָּנַן נִשְׁמַע לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, מִי לָא אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן ״מִשְׁרַת״ לִיתֵּן טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר, מִכָּאן אַתָּה דָּן לְכׇל אִיסּוּרִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה. לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי — ״מִשְׁרַת״ לְהֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר, מִכָּאן אַתָּה דָּן לְכׇל אִיסּוּרִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Ashi: From the Rabbis, let us learn Rabbi Akiva. Don’t the Rabbis say soaked teaches taste is like substance from here you derive to all prohibitions of the Torah? According to Rabbi Akiva as well, soaked teaches the permitted joins together with the prohibited from here you derive to all prohibitions of the Torah.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rav Avya said to Rav Ashi: From the Rabbis it is heard for Rabbi Akiva, did they not say, the Rabbis, "to give a reason like the principle," from here you judge for all prohibitions in the Torah. Also for Rabbi Akiva, "to permit" joins with a prohibition, from here you judge for all prohibitions in the entire Torah!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: said to him:
llm_translation: He said to him:

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה נָזִיר וְחַטָּאת שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְאֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: due to a nazirite a sin-offering two verses that come as one, do not teach
llm_translation: Because he is a Nazirite and a sin offering, two Scriptures that come as one, and do not teach.

hebrew_text: נָזִיר, הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. חַטָּאת מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״כֹּל אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בִּבְשָׂרָהּ יִקְדָּשׁ וְגוֹ׳״, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ לֹא בָּלְעָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בִּבְשָׂרָהּ (יִקְדָּשׁ)״ — עַד שֶׁיִּבָּלַע בְּבָשָׂר
human_translation: a nazirite that which we stated a sin-offering, what is As it was taught “Anything that touches in its flesh shall become consecrated” might even if it did not absorb the verse states: In its flesh shall become consecrated, until is absorbed within its flesh.
llm_translation: Nazar, the one we said. Sin offering what is it? As it was taught: "Whatever touches its flesh shall become holy, etc." Could it even be without swallowing? The verse teaches: "In its flesh (it shall become holy)" - until it is swallowed in the flesh.

hebrew_text: ״יִקְדָּשׁ״ — לִהְיוֹת כָּמוֹהָ, שֶׁאִם פְּסוּלָה הִיא — תִּיפָּסֵל, וְאִם כְּשֵׁירָה הִיא — תֵּאָכֵל כֶּחָמוּר שֶׁבָּהּ.
human_translation: Shall become consecrated its becomes like that if is disqualified, will be disqualified. And if is valid, be eaten in accordance with the more stringent of
llm_translation: "Yikdash" - to be like it, that if it is invalid - it will be disqualified, and if it is valid - it will be eaten like its most stringent aspect.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי, נִיהְוֵי נָזִיר וְחַטָּאת שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְאֵין מְלַמְּדִין!
human_translation: And the Rabbis as well, let a nazirite and a sin-offering two verses that come as one and they do not teach
llm_translation: The sages also agree, a Nazirite and a sin offering, two Scriptures that come as one, and they do not teach!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָנְהוּ מִיצְרָיךְ צְרִיכִי.
human_translation: say: these are necessary
llm_translation: They said: "Behold, those Egyptians are necessary for you."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, מַאי צְרִיכִי? בִּשְׁלָמָא אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בְּחַטָּאת, לָא גָּמַר נָזִיר מִינַּהּ — דְּחוּלִּין מִקֳּדָשִׁים לָא גָּמְרִינַן. אֶלָּא, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בְּנָזִיר, וְתֵיתֵי חַטָּאת וְתִגְמוֹר מִינֵּיהּ, דְּהָא כׇּל אִיסּוּרִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה קָא גָמַר מִנָּזִיר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, what are necessary? Granted, if the Merciful One had written to a sin-offering, not derive a nazirite from it, we do not derive non-sacred from consecrated However, let the Merciful One write with regard to a nazirite, and you bring sin-offering and derive as all prohibitions in the Torah is derived from a nazirite.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, what is the need? Granted, if the Merciful One wrote in regard to a sin offering, we would not complete the Nazirite vow from it - for we do not complete mundane items from consecrated items. Rather, if the Merciful One wrote in regard to a Nazirite, and one brings a sin offering and completes it, for all prohibitions in the Torah are completed from a Nazirite.
