hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי לָךְ, מִיצְרָךְ צְרִיכִי: חַטָּאת לְהֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר, וְחוּלִּין מִקֳּדָשִׁים לָא גָּמַר, וּ״מִשְׁרַת״ — לִיתֵּן טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר, וּמִכָּאן אַתָּה דָּן לְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, say to you are necessary. sin-offering to that a permitted joins together with a prohibited one cannot derive non-sacred from consecrated And soaked, teaches taste is like substance. And from here you derive to all of the Torah in its entirety.
llm_translation: The sages say to you, "From your distress I am needed: a sin offering to be permitted becomes combined with a prohibition, and mundane items from sanctified items are not fully redeemed, and 'from the service' - to give reason as the primary, and from here you judge the entire Torah."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: תַּרְוַיְיהוּ לְהֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר, וְהָווּ לְהוּ שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְכׇל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva both a permitted joins together with a prohibited and they are two verses that come as one, And any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: Both of them to be permitted join to prohibition, and they will be to him two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one do not teach.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא, אֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: ״מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר יֵעָשֶׂה מִגֶּפֶן הַיַּיִן מֵחַרְצַנִּים וְעַד זָג״ — לִימֵּד עַל אִיסּוּרֵי נָזִיר שֶׁמִּצְטָרְפִים זֶה עִם זֶה. הַשְׁתָּא: לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אִיסּוּר וְהֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרְפִין, אִיסּוּר וְאִיסּוּר מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: But that which is taught nothing that is made of the grapevine, from the grape skins to the grape seed” taught with regard to prohibitions of a nazirite that join together. Now According to Rabbi Akiva, prohibited and permitted join together, is it necessary prohibited joins together with prohibited
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi to Rav Kahana, rather this that it teaches: "From all that the wine grape produces, from the husks to the dregs" — it teaches about the prohibitions of a Nazirite that they combine with each other. Now, according to Rabbi Akiva, prohibitions and permissions combine, do prohibitions require prohibitions?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיסּוּר וְהֶיתֵּר בְּבַת אַחַת, אִיסּוּר וְאִיסּוּר בָּזֶה אַחַר זֶה.
human_translation: said to him prohibited and permitted simultaneously, prohibited and prohibited one after the other.
llm_translation: He said to him: Prohibition and permission in one daughter, prohibition and prohibition in another after it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּצֵק שֶׁבְּסִידְקֵי עֲרֵיבָה, אִם יֵשׁ כְּזַיִת בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד — חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר, וְאִם (לֹא) — בָּטֵל בְּמִיעוּטוֹ.
human_translation: dough that is in the cracks of a bowl, if there is an olive-bulk in one place, is obligated to remove And if not it is nullified due to its insignificance.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Dough in the cracks of a stove, if there is the size of an olive in one place - one is obligated to remove it, and if not - it is nullified in its minimal amount.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן הַטּוּמְאָה, אִם מַקְפִּיד עָלָיו — חוֹצֵץ, וְאִם רוֹצֶה בְּקִיּוּמוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא כַּעֲרֵיבָה.
human_translation: And similarly, with regard to ritual impurity, if one is particular about it interposes And if he wants to remain its is like of the bowl
llm_translation: And so regarding the matter of impurity, if one is meticulous about it - he is a chotetz, and if he desires its fulfillment - behold, he is like an areivah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עֲשׂוּיִין לְחַזֵּק, אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁעֲשׂוּיִין לְחַזֵּק — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: They taught only in a case where the are not serve to reinforce However, in a case where they serve to reinforce he is not obligated to remove
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only stated this where it is not customary to strengthen, but where it is customary to strengthen, one is not obligated to remove.

hebrew_text: מִכְלָל דְּפָחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת — אֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עָשׂוּי לְחַזֵּק אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר.
human_translation: by inference less than an olive-bulk, even in a place where it does not serve to reinforce one is not obligated to remove
llm_translation: From the principle of "less than the size of an olive" - even in a place where it is not customary to establish it, one is not obligated to remove it.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא: ״וְאִם לָאו בָּטֵל בְּמִיעוּטוֹ״. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם הֶעָשׂוּי לְחַזֵּק, אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עָשׂוּי לְחַזֵּק — חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר, מִכְּלָל דִּכְזַיִת — אֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם הֶעָשׂוּי לְחַזֵּק חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר.
human_translation: Some teach to the latter clause And if not it is nullified due to its insignificance. Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: They taught only in a place where it serves to reinforce however, in a place where it does not serve to reinforce one is obligated to remove it. by inference that an olive-bulk even in a place where it serves to reinforce one is obligated to remove it.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches the following in the latter part: "And if not, it is not annulled in its minimal amount." Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only taught this in a place where it is customary to strengthen, but in a place where it is not customary to strengthen - one must burn it. By way of inference - even in a place where it is customary to strengthen, one must burn it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא קַמָּא, תַּנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא בָּתְרָא. תַּנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא קַמָּא: בָּצֵק שֶׁבְּסִידְקֵי עֲרֵיבָה, בִּמְקוֹם הֶעָשׂוּי לְחַזֵּק — אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ וְאֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר. וּבִמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עָשׂוּי לְחַזֵּק — חוֹצֵץ וְעוֹבֵר. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? בִּכְזַיִת, אֲבָל בְּפָחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת — אֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עָשׂוּי לְחַזֵּק, אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ וְאֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with the first version was taught in accordance with the latter version was taught in accordance with the first version dough that is in the cracks of a bowl in a place where it is serves to reinforce does not interpose and one does not violate And in a case where it does not serve to reinforce it interposes, and one violates In what is this statement said? in an olive-bulk however, less than olive-bulk, even in a case where it does not serve to reinforce it does not interpose and does not violate
llm_translation: It was taught: like the first case, it was taught: like the first case, it was taught: like the first case - dough that is in the cracks of a stove, in a place where it is made to strengthen - it does not separate and it does not transgress. And in a place where it is not made to strengthen - it separates and transgresses. In what case are these words said? In a basket, but in less than a basket - even in a place where it is not made to strengthen, it does not separate and it does not transgress.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא בָּתְרָא: בָּצֵק שֶׁבְּסִידְקֵי עֲרֵיבָה, בִּמְקוֹם הֶעָשׂוּי לְחַזֵּק —
human_translation: And was taught in accordance with the latter version dough that is in the cracks of a bowl, in a place where it serves to reinforce
llm_translation: "And it was taught in a Baraita: In the dough that is kneaded for an Eruv, in a place where it is customary to strengthen —"

hebrew_text: אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ וְאֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר. בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עָשׂוּי לְחַזֵּק — חוֹצֵץ וְעוֹבֵר. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּפָחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת, אֲבָל בִּכְזַיִת — אֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם הֶעָשׂוּי לְחַזֵּק חוֹצֵץ וְעוֹבֵר.
human_translation: it does not interpose and one does not violate In a case where does not serve to reinforce it interposes and one violates In what is this statement said? in less than an olive-bulk. However, if it is an olive-bulk, even in a case where it serves to reinforce it interposes and one violates
llm_translation: He does not divide and he does not pass through. In a place where it is not made to strengthen - he divides and passes through. In what circumstances are these matters said? - In less than the size of a dried fig, but in the size of a dried fig - even in a place where it is made to strengthen, he divides and passes through.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: סְמִי קִילְּתָא מִקַּמֵּי חֲמִירְתָּא.
human_translation: contradict each other. Rav Huna said: Delete the lenient from before the stringent one.
llm_translation: Difficult are the questions of Ahadadei. Rav Huna said: "The wool of a black ram is superior to that of a white ram."

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: תַּנָּאֵי שָׁקְלַתְּ מֵעָלְמָא?! תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: הַפַּת שֶׁעִיפְּשָׁה — חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרָאוּי לְשׁוֹחְקָהּ וּלְחַמֵּעַ בָּהּ כַּמָּה עִיסּוֹת אֲחֵרוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Have you removed the tanna’im from the world? It is tanna’im . as it was taught bread that grew moldy one is obligated to remove due to it is suitable to be ground and to leaven other dough.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "Did you learn it from the world?! It is a teaching. As it was taught: If a loaf of bread became moldy - one is obligated to burn it, because it is fitting to mock it and degrade it with how many other doughs."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּמְקוּיֶּימֶת לַאֲכִילָה, אֲבָל כּוֹפֶת שְׂאוֹר שֶׁיִּיחֲדָהּ לִישִׁיבָה — בָּטְלָה. מִדְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר בָּטְלָה, מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר לֹא בָּטְלָה, אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: כׇּל כְּזַיִת, אַף עַל גַּב דִּמְבַטֵּל — לָא בְּטִיל.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: In what is this statement said? where maintained for consumption; however, a mass of leaven that one designated for sitting is nullified. From that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said is nullified, by inference the first tanna maintains is not nullified. Apparently, maintains any olive-bulk even though one renders null and void, is not nullified.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: In what case are these words said? In a case where it is designated for eating, but if one kneads sourdough that was designated for sitting, it is nullified. From the statement of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar that it is nullified, it can be inferred that the first Tanna holds that it is not nullified. This implies that he holds: Any amount, even though it can be nullified, is not nullified.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: תָּרֵצְתְּ בִּכְזַיִת. פָּחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת מִי תָּרֵצְתְּ? אֶלָּא הָא וְהָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בִּמְקוֹם לִישָׁה, הָא — שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם לִישָׁה.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: You resolved with regard to an olive-bulk did you resolve less than an olive-bulk Rather, this and that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, and not difficult. This is in place kneading that is not in place kneading
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: You wanted with a small olive. Less than an olive, who did you want with? Rather, this and that is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, and it is not difficult: this - in a place of anointing, that - not in a place of anointing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לָא תֵּימָא שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם לִישָׁה — אַגַּבַּהּ דְאַגָּנָא, אֶלָּא אַשִּׂיפְתָּא דְאַגָּנָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Do not say not in place kneading on back of, the basin; rather, on the edge of the basin,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Do not say that it is not in a place of foundation - because of the roof of the storage room, rather it is the threshold of the storage room.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא זִמְנָא דְּאָטֵיף וּמָטֵי לְהָתָם, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious; lest you say sometimes drips there teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Peshita? Mahu d'teima zimna d'ateif u'matei l'hatam, ka mashma lan." English translation: "Obvious? What is the reasoning that when one wraps and places it there, it implies to us."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rav said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Rav: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: אִם טָח פָּנֶיהָ בְּטִיט — בָּטְלָה. טָח אִין, לֹא טָח — לָא!
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rav Yitzḥak bar Ashi say Rav said: If one covered the surface with mortar, is nullified? he covered yes, not cover no, not
llm_translation: I am? But didn't Rav Yitzchak bar Ashi say in the name of Rav: If one plastered her face with mud - she is annulled. If he plastered, he did not plaster - no!

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי הָא לָא מַתְנֵי הָא.
human_translation: He who teaches this does not teach that
llm_translation: The one who teaches this does not teach this.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: אִם טָח פָּנֶיהָ בְּטִיט — בָּטְלָה וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Some say Rav Naḥman said Rav said: halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, as Rav Yitzḥak bar Ashi said Rav said: If one covered the surface with mortar, it is nullified.
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rav Nachman said in the name of Rav: The halakha is not like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, for Rav Yitzchak bar Ashi said in the name of Rav: If she plastered her face with mud - she is annulled, and so forth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁנֵי חֲצָאֵי זֵיתִים וְחוּט שֶׁל בָּצֵק בֵּינֵיהֶן, רוֹאִין: כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ יִנָּטֵל הַחוּט וְנִיטָּלִין עִמּוֹ — חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר. וְאִם לָאו — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: two half-olive-bulk with a string of dough between them, one observes: any that were the string taken and taken with it, one is obligated to remove And if not one is not obligated to remove
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: Two olive pits with a dough thread between them, if one could remove the thread and the pits would come with it - he is obligated to remove it. But if not - he is not obligated to remove it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בַּעֲרֵיבָה, אֲבָל בַּבַּיִת — חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר.
human_translation: Ulla said: We stated only in a bowl, However, in a house, one is obligated to remove
llm_translation: Ulla said: We only said this regarding a bonfire, but in a house - one must extinguish.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא, דְּזִימְנִין דְּכָנֵישׁ לְהוּ וְנָפְלִי גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: What is the reason because will sometimes gather them and they will fall to each other.
llm_translation: What is the reason that sometimes when they enter to pray, they fall upon their chests?

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: בָּעוּ בְּמַעְרְבָא, בַּיִת וַעֲלִיָּיה מַהוּ? בַּיִת וְאַכְסַדְרָא מַהוּ? שְׁנֵי בָתִּים זֶה לִפְנִים מִזֶּה מַהוּ?
human_translation: Ulla said: raise a dilemma in the West, house and in the upper what is the house a portico, what is two houses, one inside the other, what is
llm_translation: Ula said: In Ma'arava, what is the law regarding a house and an upper story? What is the law regarding a house and a balcony? If two houses are one in front of the other, what is the law?

hebrew_text: תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Let stand
llm_translation: The case remains undecided.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַפַּת שֶׁעִיפְּשָׁה וְנִפְסְלָה מִלֶּאֱכוֹל לָאָדָם, וְהַכֶּלֶב יָכוֹל לְאוֹכְלָהּ — מְטַמְּאָה טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין בִּכְבֵיצָה, וְנִשְׂרֶפֶת עִם הַטְּמֵאָה בַּפֶּסַח. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי נָתָן אָמְרוּ: אֵינָהּ מְטַמְּאָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: bread that grew moldy and was rendered inedible for consumption by a person, but a dog can eat it, can become impure ritual impurity of foods in of an egg-bulk it be burned with ritually impure on Passover. They said in the name of Rabbi Natan: It cannot become ritually impure.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If a loaf of bread was kneaded and became disqualified from being eaten by a person, but a dog can still eat it - it imparts impurity of food through contact, and it is burned along with impure items on Passover. In the name of Rabbi Nathan they said: It does not impart impurity.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דִּתְנַן, כְּלָל אָמְרוּ בִּטְהָרוֹת: כׇּל הַמְיוּחָד לְאוֹכֶל אָדָם — טָמֵא עַד שֶׁיִּפָּסֵל מִלֶּאֱכוֹל לְכֶלֶב. כְּמַאן — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי נָתָן.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which we learned stated principle with regard to ritual purity: Any that is designated as food for a person ritually impure until it is rendered unfit to be consumed by a dog. In accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabbi Natan,
llm_translation: As to where this goes, this is what we learned: In general, they said regarding purity laws: Anyone designated for human consumption is impure until it is disqualified from being eaten by a dog. As to where? Not like Rabbi Nathan.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֲרֵיבַת הָעַבְּדָנִין שֶׁנָּתַן לְתוֹכָהּ קֶמַח, תּוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים — חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר. קוֹדֶם שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר. אָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן לְתוֹכָהּ עוֹרוֹת, אֲבָל נָתַן לְתוֹכָהּ עוֹרוֹת — אֲפִילּוּ תּוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה אֵין חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר.
human_translation: The Sages taught: tanners’ bowls into which placed flour within three days one is obligated to remove prior to three days one is not obligated to remove Rabbi Natan said: In what is this statement said? where one did not place hides into however, one placed hides into even within three he is not obligated to remove
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If a mixture of animal feed was placed within it, the animal feed being mixed with flour, for three days - one is obligated to burn it. Before three days, one is not obligated to burn it. Rabbi Natan said: In what case are these words said? - When he did not place hides within it, but if he placed hides within it - even within three days one is not obligated to burn it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי נָתָן, אֲפִילּוּ יוֹם אֶחָד וַאֲפִילּוּ שָׁעָה אַחַת.
human_translation: Rava said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Natan even one day or even one hour
llm_translation: Rava said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Natan, even for one day and even for one hour.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה, אִם מַקְפִּיד עָלָיו — חוֹצֵץ, וְאִם רוֹצֶה בְּקִיּוּמוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא כַּעֲרֵיבָה.
human_translation: And similarly, with regard to ritual impurity, if one is particular about it interposes And if he wants to remain its is like of the bowl
llm_translation: And so regarding the matter of impurity, if one is meticulous about it - he is considered a priestly scribe, and if he desires its fulfillment - behold, he is like an offering.

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם — בְּשִׁיעוּרָא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא. הָכָא — בִּקְפִידָא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא!
human_translation: Is it comparable? There, the matter is contingent upon the measure Here, the matter is contingent upon particular
llm_translation: Who is similar? There — in the estimation of the matter. Here — in the precision of the matter!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אֵימָא: וּלְעִנְיַן הַטּוּמְאָה אֵינוֹ כֵּן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: Say And with regard to ritual impurity, it is not so,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, "Say: 'And regarding the matter of impurity, it is not so.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הָא ״וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה״ קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכֵן
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Doesn’t teach: And similarly with regard to ritual impurity. Rather, Abaye said: This is is saying: And similarly
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: This "and similarly regarding impurity" is what it teaches! Rather Abaye said, this is what it means: and so.

hebrew_text: לְעִנְיַן צֵירוּף טוּמְאָה בַּפֶּסַח, וּבִשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה אִיכָּא פְּלוּגְתָּא.
human_translation: with regard to the combination ritual impurity during Passover, during the rest of the year there is a distinction
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of combining impurity with the Passover offering, and on the rest of the days of the year there is a dispute.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי, כְּגוֹן דְּאִיכָּא פָּחוֹת מִכְּבֵיצָה אוֹכָלִין, וְנָגְעוּ בְּהַאי בָּצֵק. בְּפֶסַח, דְּאִיסּוּרוֹ חָשׁוּב — מִצְטָרֵף. בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, דְּבִקְפֵידָא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא, אִם מַקְפִּיד עָלָיו — מִצְטָרֵף, אִם רוֹצֶה בְּקִיּוּמוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא כַּעֲרֵיבָה.
human_translation: What are the circumstances where there is less than an egg-bulk of food, and it touched this dough During Passover, the prohibition significant it combines during the rest of the year, when the matter is dependent on particularity; if he is particular about it, it combines if one prefers its presence it is like the kneading bowl
llm_translation: How are they similar? For example, when there is less than the size of an egg of food, and they touched it with this dough. In regards to Passover, where its prohibition is significant — it combines. On the rest of the days of the year, where it is a matter of stringency, if one is stringent about it — it combines, if one desires its fulfillment — it is like a pledge.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: מִי קָתָנֵי ״מִצְטָרֵף״? וְהָא ״חוֹצֵץ״ קָתָנֵי. אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: וְכֵן לְהַעֲלוֹת טׇהֳרָה לַעֲרֵיבָה.
human_translation: Rava strongly objects to this: Was taught Combines? Didn’t teach it interposes? Rather, Rava said And so too purifying the kneading bowl
llm_translation: Rava objects to it: Who teaches "mitztaref"? But it teaches "chotetz." Rather, Rava said: And so to bring purity to the mixture.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי, כְּגוֹן דְּאִיטַּמִּי הָךְ עֲרֵיבָה, וּבָעֵי לְאַטְבּוֹלֵי. בְּפֶסַח, דְּאִיסּוּרוֹ חָשׁוּב — חוֹצֵץ, וְלָא סָלְקָא לַהּ טְבִילָה. בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה בִּקְפִידָא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא. אִי מַקְפִּיד עָלָיו — חוֹצֵץ, וְאִם רוֹצֶה בְּקִיּוּמוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא כַּעֲרֵיבָה.
human_translation: What are the circumstances where the kneading bowl became ritually impure, and wishes to immerse it. During Passover, when the prohibition significant, it interposes and the immersion is ineffective. during the rest of the year, the matter depends upon particular If he is particular about it interposes if desires it to be present, it is like kneading bowl
llm_translation: How are they similar? For example, if one immersed in a mikveh and wants to immerse again. In Pesach, where its prohibition is considered significant - it is a barrier, and immersion does not suffice for it. On the rest of the days of the year, one should be meticulous about the matter. If one is not meticulous about it - it is a barrier, but if one wants to fulfill it - it is like immersion.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: מִי קָתָנֵי ״וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן טׇהֳרָה״? הָא ״לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה״ קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן לְהוֹרִיד טוּמְאָה לַעֲרֵיבָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa strongly objects to this: Was taught And similarly with regard to ritual purity? Didn’t teach: And similarly with regard to ritual impurity? Rather, Rav Pappa said And similarly with regard to the transfer of ritual impurity to the kneading bowl
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Rav Papa objects to this: Who teaches "and similarly for the matter of purity"? It teaches "for the matter of impurity"! Rather, Rav Papa said: "And similarly for the matter of reducing impurity to the evening."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי, כְּגוֹן דְּנָגַע שֶׁרֶץ בְּהַאי בָּצֵק. בְּפֶסַח דְּאִיסּוּרוֹ חָשׁוּב — חוֹצֵץ, וְלָא נָחֲתָה לַהּ טוּמְאָה. בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה דְּבִקְפִידָא תַּלְיָא, אִם מַקְפִּיד עָלָיו — חוֹצֵץ, אִם רוֹצֶה בְּקִיּוּמוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא כַּעֲרֵיבָה.
human_translation: What are the circumstances where a creeping animal touched this dough. During Passover, when its prohibition significant, it interposes ritual impurity does not descend to the kneading bowl, During the rest of the year, when it depends particular if he is particular about it, it interposes if he desires it to be present, it is like the kneading bowl
llm_translation: How so are the cases similar? For example, if a creeping thing touches this dough. On Passover, where its prohibition is significant - it is nullified, and it does not render it impure. On the rest of the days of the year, where it depends on scrutiny, if one is meticulous about it - it is nullified, if one desires its fulfillment - it is like a mixture.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּצֵק הַחֵרֵשׁ, אִם יֵשׁ כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ שֶׁהֶחְמִיץ — הֲרֵי זֶה אָסוּר.
human_translation: Deaf dough If there is similar to it which became leavened, is prohibited.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: With regard to deaf-mute dough, if there is something equivalent to it that has become leavened, it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִם אֵין שָׁם כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ מַהוּ? אֲמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּלֵךְ אָדָם מִמִּגְדַּל נוּנַיָּא לִטְבֶרְיָא מִיל.
human_translation: If there is no similar to it, what is Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: a person walk from Migdal Nunaya Tiberias, a mil ,
llm_translation: Gemara: If there is no equivalent there, what is the law? Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: In order for a person to walk from Migdal Nunayya to Tiberias, a mil.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא מִיל! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּשִׁיעוּרָא דְּמִיל כְּמִמִּגְדַּל נוּנַיָּא וְעַד טְבֶרְיָא.
human_translation: Let us say mil . This teaches us that the length of a mil from Migdal Nunaya to Tiberias.
llm_translation: And it was said: "Mil!" Behold, this teaches us the measurement of a mil is like from Migdal Nunayya to Tverya.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: לְגַבָּל וְלִתְפִלָּה וְלִנְטִילַת יָדַיִם — אַרְבָּעָה מִילִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: With regard to a kneader, and with regard to prayer and with regard to washing hands four mil ,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avahu said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: for boundary and for prayer and for washing of hands - four cubits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אַיְיבוּ אַמְרַהּ, וְאַרְבְּעָה אֲמַר בַּהּ, וַחֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ עִבּוּד. דִּתְנַן: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁעִיבְּדָן, אוֹ שֶׁהִילֵּךְ בָּהֶן כְּדֵי עֲבוֹדָה — טְהוֹרִין, חוּץ מֵעוֹר הָאָדָם. וְכַמָּה כְּדֵי עֲבוֹדָה? אָמַר רַבִּי (אִינְיָיא) אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: כְּדֵי הִילּוּךְ אַרְבָּעָה מִילִין.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Ayvu said and he said it four And one of them tanning As we learned And all that were tanned or that one trod upon for leatherworking are ritually pure. except for skin of a human How much a hide for the leatherworking Rabbi Ayvu said that Rabbi Yannai said: walk four mil .
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: They brought a contradiction, and he said four things in it, and one of them is about service. As we learned: And all of them that were used, or that he walked with them for the purpose of service - they are pure, except for human skin. And how much is the amount for the purpose of service? Rabbi (Iniya) said Rabbi Yannai: The distance of four mil.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְפָנָיו, אֲבָל לְאַחֲרָיו — אֲפִילּוּ מִיל אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר. אָמַר רַב אַחָא, וּמִינַּהּ: מִיל — הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר, הָא פָּחוֹת מִמִּיל — חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: They taught only is before him, However, behind him, he need not return even a mil . Rav Aḥa said: From this he not return a mil , but he must return less than one mil
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: They only said this regarding before him, but after him—even a word does not return. Rav Acha said, and some say it was Ravina: A word that does not return, less than a word—it returns.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד מַפְרִישִׁין חַלָּה בְּטוּמְאָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב?
human_translation: How does one separate ḥalla in ritual impurity during the Festival
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: How do we separate the challah in a state of impurity on a festival?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: לֹא תִּקְרָא לָהּ שֵׁם עַד שֶׁתֵּאָפֶה. בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: תָּטִיל בְּצוֹנֵן. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ:
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: should not designate it until it is baked. Ben Beteira says: She should place in cold Rabbi Yehoshua said:
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Do not call her by name until she is baked. Ben Beteira says: Place it in the oven. Rabbi Yehoshua said:

hebrew_text: לֹא זֶה הוּא חָמֵץ שֶׁמּוּזְהָרִין עָלָיו בְּבַל יֵרָאֶה וּבְבַל יִמָּצֵא. אֶלָּא: מַפְרִישָׁתָהּ וּמַנִּיחָתָהּ עַד הָעֶרֶב, וְאִם הֶחְמִיצָה — הֶחְמִיצָה.
human_translation: This is not the leavened bread about which we are warned It shall not be seen, and: It shall not be found. Rather, she should separate and leave it until the evening; and if it becomes leavened, it will become leavened,
llm_translation: Not this is the leaven that we are cautious about, that it should not be seen and should not be found. Rather, one should separate it and leave it until the evening, and if it has become leavened - it has become leavened.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא בְּטוֹבַת הֲנָאָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה מָמוֹן. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה אֵינָהּ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: Let us say disagree with regard to benefit discretion, Rabbi Eliezer holds: Benefit discretion is monetary Rabbi Yehoshua holds: Benefit discretion is not monetary
llm_translation: Gemara: Let us say in the case of a benefit, they disagree. For Rabbi Eliezer holds: Benefit is considered wealth. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: Benefit is not considered wealth.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סָבְרִי טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה אֵינָהּ מָמוֹן, וְהָכָא בְּ״הוֹאִיל״ קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״, וְאִי בָּעֵי אִיתְּשִׁיל עֲלַהּ — מָמוֹנֵיהּ הוּא. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״.
human_translation: No, everyone holds benefit discretion is not monetary and here they disagree Since, etc. As Rabbi Eliezer holds: We say since, if he wants, he can ask it is his property. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: We do not say since
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "No, for the entire world holds that pleasure is not considered money, and here it is a case of 'since.' For Rabbi Eliezer holds: we say 'since,' and if he wants, he can acquire it with his money. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: we do not say 'since.'"

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָאוֹפֶה מִיּוֹם טוֹב לְחוֹל, רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: לוֹקֶה, רַבָּה אָמַר: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: It was stated one who bakes a Festival for the week. Rav Ḥisda said: He is flogged Rabba said: He is not flogged.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who bakes from a Festival day to a weekday, Rav Ḥisda said: He is liable, Rabba said: He is not liable.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר לוֹקֶה: לָא אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל וּמִיקַּלְעִי לֵיהּ אוֹרְחִים — חֲזֵי לֵיהּ״. רַבָּה אָמַר אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה: אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said he is flogged we do not say since guests happen him, fit for him Rabba said he is not flogged we say since
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: One who strikes his animal, we do not say, "Since he is accustomed to it, let him see it." Rabba said: He is not liable for damages. We say, "Since."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה לְרַב חִסְדָּא: לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ לָא אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״, הֵיאַךְ אוֹפִין מִיּוֹם טוֹב לְשַׁבָּת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם עֵירוּבֵי תַּבְשִׁילִין.
human_translation: Rabba said to Rav Ḥisda: According to you, who said that we do not say Since, etc., how bake a Festival for Shabbat? He said to him: due to the joining of cooked foods [ eiruv tavshilin ]
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabba to Rav Ḥisda: According to your opinion, since you say we do not say "ho'il," how do we prepare from Yom Tov to Shabbat? He said to him: Because of the mixture of cooked dishes.

hebrew_text: וּמִשּׁוּם עֵירוּבֵי תַּבְשִׁילִין שָׁרֵינַן אִיסּוּרָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא צוֹרְכֵי שַׁבָּת נַעֲשִׂין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דִּגְזַרוּ בֵּיהּ, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ אוֹפִין מִיּוֹם טוֹב אַף לְחוֹל. וְכֵיוָן דְּאַצְרְכוּהּ רַבָּנַן עֵירוּבֵי תַּבְשִׁילִין — אִית לֵיהּ הֶיכֵּירָא.
human_translation: Due to the joining of cooked foods, may one permit a Torah prohibition? said to him: By Torah needs Shabbat be done on a Festival, It was the Sages who decreed a decree lest say one may bake on the Festival even for the week. And since the Sages required a joining of cooked foods, one has a conspicuous marker
llm_translation: And because of the Eiruvei Tavshilin, do we permit a prohibition of Torah?! He said to him: From the Torah, the needs of Shabbat are done on Yom Tov, and it is the Rabbis who decreed upon it, a decree lest people say, "We can bake on Yom Tov even for a weekday." And since the Rabbis required the Eiruvei Tavshilin - it has recognition.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: בְּהֵמָה הַמְסוּכֶּנֶת, לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לֶאֱכוֹל הֵימֶנָּה כְּזַיִת צָלִי מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם. ״יָכוֹל לֶאֱכוֹל״ — אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא בָּעֵי לְמֵיכַל. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי, דְּאָמְרִי ״הוֹאִיל״: ״הוֹאִיל וְאִי בָּעֵי לְמֵיכַל מָצֵי אָכֵיל״ — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי יִשְׁחוֹט. אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ, דְּאָמְרַתְּ לָא אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״, אַמַּאי יִשְׁחוֹט?
human_translation: raised an objection to a dangerously animal he may not slaughter unless he can eat an olive-bulk of it roasted while it is still day. one can eat although he is not required to eat Granted, according to my that I said Since, etc., Since if one wants to eat he may eat, due to that he may slaughter But you, who that we do not say Since, etc., why may he slaughter
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: An animal that is in danger, one may not slaughter it except to be able to eat from it like a roasted olive from the middle of the day. "He may eat" - even though he does not want to eat. According to my opinion, for we say "since he wants": "Since he wants, and if he does not want to eat, he may eat" - therefore he should slaughter. But according to your opinion, for you say we do not say "since he wants," why should he slaughter?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם הֶפְסֵד מָמוֹנוֹ. וּמִשּׁוּם הֶפְסֵד מָמוֹנוֹ שָׁרֵינַן אִיסּוּרָא דְאוֹרָיְיתָא?!
human_translation: said to him: due to monetary loss Will we permit a Torah prohibition due to monetary loss?
llm_translation: He said to him: Because of financial loss. And because of financial loss, are we permitted to transgress a biblical prohibition?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, אִין: מִשּׁוּם הֶפְסֵד מָמוֹנוֹ — גָּמַר בְּלִבּוֹ לֶאֱכוֹל כְּזַיִת, וְאִי אֶפְשָׁר לִכְזַיִת בָּשָׂר בְּלֹא שְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: said to him: Yes, due to monetary loss one decided to eat an olive-bulk And it is impossible an olive-bulk of meat without slaughtering
llm_translation: He said to him, "No: due to the loss of his money - he resolved in his heart to eat like an olive, and it is impossible to eat meat without ritual slaughter."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים
human_translation: raised objection to him: The shewbread
llm_translation: He raised an objection: "Lechem Hapanim."

hebrew_text: נֶאֱכָל לְתִשְׁעָה, לַעֲשָׂרָה, וּלְאַחַד עָשָׂר — לֹא פָּחוֹת וְלֹא יוֹתֵר. כֵּיצַד? כְּדַרְכּוֹ, לְתִשְׁעָה. נֶאֱפֶה בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — נֶאֱכָל בְּשַׁבָּת לְתִשְׁעָה. חָל יוֹם טוֹב לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — נֶאֱכָל לְשַׁבָּת לַעֲשָׂרָה. שְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — נֶאֱכָל לְשַׁבָּת לְאַחַד עָשָׂר, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה לֹא אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא אֶת הַיּוֹם טוֹב. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ צוֹרְכֵי שַׁבָּת נַעֲשִׂין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אַמַּאי לָא דָּחֵי יוֹם טוֹב?
human_translation: eaten on the ninth, tenth, eleventh no less and no more. How so? In its manner on the ninth it is baked on Shabbat eve it is eaten on Shabbat, on the ninth a Festival occurs on Shabbat eve, it is eaten on Shabbat on the tenth two Festival days of Rosh HaShana it is eaten on Shabbat, on the eleventh because does not override Shabbat or a Festival. If you say needs Shabbat may be done on a Festival, why doesn’t override the Festival?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If it was cooked for nine, for ten, and for eleven — not less and not more. How so? According to its usual manner, for nine. If it was baked on Erev Shabbat — it may be eaten on Shabbat for nine. If a festival falls on Erev Shabbat — it may be eaten on Shabbat for ten. If the two good days of Rosh Hashanah fall on Shabbat — it may be eaten on Shabbat for eleven, because it does not override either Shabbat or the festival day. And if you say that the needs of Shabbat can be fulfilled on a festival day, why then does it not override the festival day?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁבוּת קְרוֹבָה — הִתִּירוּ. שְׁבוּת רְחוֹקָה — לֹא הִתִּירוּ.
human_translation: said to him: They permitted the rabbinic decree proximate they did not permit the rabbinic decree a distant
llm_translation: He said to him: A close sitting — they permitted. A distant sitting — they did not permit.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן הַסְּגָן: דּוֹחֶה אֶת יוֹם טוֹב וְאֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה אֶת יוֹם צוֹם, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: And according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, said in the name of Rabbi Shimon, son of the deputy overrides a Festival but does not override the fast day what can be said?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Hasagin: One may postpone a festival day but may not postpone a fast day, what can be said?

hebrew_text: בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי: מָר סָבַר שְׁבוּת קְרוֹבָה הִתִּירוּ, שְׁבוּת רְחוֹקָה לֹא הִתִּירוּ. וּמָר סָבַר: שְׁבוּת רְחוֹקָה נָמֵי הִתִּירוּ.
human_translation: this is they disagree: One Sage, holds they permitted the rabbinic decree proximate they did not permit the rabbinic decree distant And one Sage, holds they also permitted the rabbinic decree a distant
llm_translation: In this they dispute: Master holds, a near rabbinic prohibition they permitted, a distant rabbinic prohibition they did not permit. And Master holds: a distant rabbinic prohibition they indeed permitted.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב מָרִי: שְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם אֵינָן נֶאֱכָלוֹת לֹא פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם, וְלֹא יוֹתֵר עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה. כֵּיצַד? נֶאֱפוֹת עֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — נֶאֱכָלוֹת לְיוֹם טוֹב לִשְׁנַיִם. חָל יוֹם טוֹב לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת — נֶאֱכָלוֹת לְיוֹם טוֹב לִשְׁלֹשָׁה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה לֹא אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא אֶת הַיּוֹם טוֹב. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ צוֹרְכֵי שַׁבָּת נַעֲשִׂין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, הַשְׁתָּא דְּשַׁבָּת בְּיוֹם טוֹב שְׁרֵי, דְּיוֹם טוֹב בְּיוֹם טוֹב מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Rav Mari raised an objection: The two loaves are eaten no sooner than the second and no later than the third How so? They are baked the eve of the Festival and eaten on the Festival, the second the Festival occurs after Shabbat, they are eaten on the third because does not override Shabbat or the Festival. If you say needs Shabbat may be done on a Festival, now that it is permitted Shabbat on a Festival, is it necessary for the Festival on the Festival?
llm_translation: The Master raises an objection: Two loaves are not eaten by fewer than two, nor by more than three. How so? If they were baked on Erev Yom Tov, they are eaten on Yom Tov by two. If Yom Tov falls after Shabbat, they are eaten on Yom Tov by three, because it does not override either Shabbat or Yom Tov. And if you say that the needs of Shabbat can be fulfilled on Yom Tov, then why is it permitted to bake on Yom Tov for Shabbat, for Yom Tov on Yom Tov is required?!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״לָכֶם״ — ״לָכֶם״ וְלֹא לְגָבוֹהַּ.
human_translation: It is different there, as the verse says: for you” “for you,” and not for the above,
llm_translation: The difference there is that the verse says "to you" - "to you" and not to the high ones.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן הַסְּגָן: דּוֹחֶה אֶת יוֹם טוֹב, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? סָבַר לַהּ כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל, דְּאָמַר: ״לָכֶם״ — ״לָכֶם״ וְלֹא לְגוֹיִם.
human_translation: And according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said in the name of Rabbi Shimon, son of the deputy overrides the Festival, what can be said? He holds in accordance with Abba Shaul, who said for you, and not for gentiles;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben HaSagan: One may push off a festival day. What is there to say? He holds like Abba Shaul, who said: "For you" — "For you" and not for the nations.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַבָּה בְּיַד רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא: מִי אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״? וְהָא תְּנַן: יֵשׁ חוֹרֵשׁ תֶּלֶם אֶחָד וְחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם שְׁמוֹנָה לָאוִין: הַחוֹרֵשׁ בְּשׁוֹר וַחֲמוֹר, וְהֵן מוּקְדָּשִׁים, וְכִלְאַיִם בַּכֶּרֶם,
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda sent to Rabba with Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna: Do we say Since, etc.? Didn’t we learn There is plows one furrow and is liable for eight prohibitions one who plows with an ox and a donkey, and they were consecrated, food crops in a vineyard,
llm_translation: Send to him Rav Ḥisda to Rabbah by the hand of Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna. Who said "since"? But didn't we learn: There is one who plows one furrow and is liable for eight negative commandments: He plows with an ox and a donkey, and they are consecrated, and forbidden mixtures in a vineyard.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁבִיעִית, בְּיוֹם טוֹב, כֹּהֵן וְנָזִיר אַבֵּית הַטּוּמְאָה. וְאִי אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״ — אַחֲרִישָׁה לָא לִיחַיַּיב, הוֹאִיל וְחָזֵי לְכִיסּוּי דַּם צִיפּוֹר.
human_translation: And Sabbatical on a Festival. a priest and a nazirite, a place of ritual impurity, And if we say Since, etc., he should not be liable for plowing since is fit for covering the blood of a bird.
llm_translation: Seventh, on a festival, a priest and a nazir are considered members of a household of impurity. And if we say "ho'il" - he is not liable for silence, since he is fit for covering the blood of a bird.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: בַּאֲבָנִים מְקוּרְזָלוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa bar Shmuel said: sharp stones,
llm_translation: Rav Papa son of Shmuel said: "In stones there is magnetism."

hebrew_text: רְאוּיוֹת לְכוֹתְשָׁן! וּכְתִישָׁה בְּיוֹם טוֹב מִי שְׁרֵי?! רְאוּיוֹת לְכוֹתְשָׁן כִּלְאַחַר יָד! בְּצוּנְמָא.
human_translation: fit crushed Is crushing permitted on a Festival? fit to be crushed in an unusual manner, hard, soil,
llm_translation: Fit for pounding! And pounding on a festival, who permits it?! Fit for pounding like after the fact! In Tzunma.

hebrew_text: צוּנְמָא בַּר זְרִיעָה?! צוּנְמָא מִלְּמַעְלָה, וְעָפָר תִּיחוּחַ מִלְּמַטָּה. וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם עָפָר תִּיחוּחַ!
human_translation: Is hard soil fit for planting? there was hard soil above and loose soil underneath, Derive due to loose soil,
llm_translation: Tzunma son of Zeri'ah?! Tzunma from above, and dust will be sprinkled from below. And it shall come out because of dust will be sprinkled!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּטִינָא. וְטִינָא בַּר זְרִיעָה הוּא?! בִּמְתוּנְתָּא.
human_translation: Rather, Mar bar Rav Ashi said: mud, Is mud fit for planting? moist earth,
llm_translation: Instead, Mar son of Rav Ashi said: "In the mortar." But is the mortar a son of planting seed?! Rather, in a measure.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הַמְבַשֵּׁל גִּיד הַנָּשֶׁה בְּחָלָב בְּיוֹם טוֹב וְאוֹכְלוֹ — לוֹקֶה חָמֵשׁ. לוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם מְבַשֵּׁל גִּיד בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְלוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם אוֹכֵל גִּיד, וְלוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם מְבַשֵּׁל בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב, וְלוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם אוֹכֵל בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב, וְלוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם הַבְעָרָה. וְאִי אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״ — אַהַבְעָרָה לָא לִיחַיַּיב, הוֹאִיל דַּחֲזֵי לֵיהּ לְצׇרְכּוֹ!
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to One who cooks the sciatic nerve in milk on a Festival and eats it is flogged five He is flogged due to cooking the nerve on a Festival, and he is flogged due to eating nerve, and he is flogged due to cooking meat in milk; and he is flogged due to eating meat in milk; and he is flogged due to kindling And if we say Since, etc., he should not be liable for kindling since is fit for
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: One who cooks the sciatic nerve in milk on a festival and eats it - he is liable to receive lashes five times. He is liable due to cooking the sciatic nerve on a festival, and he is liable due to eating the sciatic nerve, and he is liable due to cooking meat in milk, and he is liable due to eating meat in milk, and he is liable due to kindling a fire. And if we were to say "since he intended" - kindling a fire should not render him liable, since he sees it as necessary for his use!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַפֵּיק הַבְעָרָה, וְעַיֵּיל גִּיד הַנָּשֶׁה שֶׁל נְבֵילָה.
human_translation: said to him: Remove kindling and add a sciatic nerve from an animal carcass
llm_translation: He said to him: "Take out the ember, and bring the sinew of the thigh of a carcass."

hebrew_text: וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: לוֹקִין שְׁתַּיִם עַל אֲכִילָתוֹ, וְשָׁלֹשׁ עַל בִּישּׁוּלוֹ. וְאִי אִיתָא, שָׁלֹשׁ עַל אֲכִילָתוֹ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach is flogged twice for his eating, and three for his cooking, And if it is should have three for his eating,
llm_translation: And it was taught by Rabbi Chiya: They administer two lashes for his eating, and three for his cooking. And if it comes, three for his eating are required for him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אַפֵּיק הַבְעָרָה, וְעַיֵּיל עֲצֵי מוּקְצֶה.
human_translation: Rather, Remove kindling and add wood set aside
llm_translation: Rather: extinguish the fire, and bring in wood that is designated for burning.

hebrew_text: וּמוּקְצֶה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁי וְהֵכִינוּ אֵת אֲשֶׁר יָבִיאוּ״. וְאַזְהָרָתַהּ מֵהָכָא, מִ״לֹּא תַעֲשֶׂה כׇל מְלָאכָה״.
human_translation: set-aside by Torah He said to him: Yes, as it is written: “And it shall come to pass on the sixth day that they shall prepare that which they bring in” the warning is from here: “You shall not perform any labor”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is it the end of the Torah? He said to him: No, as it is written: 'And it shall be on the sixth day, and they shall prepare what they bring.' And its warning is from here, from 'You shall not do any work.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, וְהָא אַתְּ הוּא דַּאֲמַרְתְּ: בְּעַאי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב חִסְדָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: בְּעַאי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב הוּנָא: הֵבִיא שֶׂה מֵאֲפָר, וּשְׁחָטוֹ תָּמִיד בְּיוֹם טוֹב, מַהוּ?
human_translation: said to him: Wasn’t it you who said: I raised a dilemma before Rav Ḥisda, and some say I raised a dilemma before Rav Huna: one brought a lamb from the meadow, and he slaughtered it daily on a Festival, what is
llm_translation: He said to him, "But you are the one who said: 'I need a sheep from Rav Ḥisda,' and they say to him: 'I need a sheep from Rav Huna.' He brought a sheep from the ashes, and slaughtered it continuously on a festival day, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לַן, (אָמַר לִי) עֲלַהּ: ״שֶׂה״ — וְלֹא הַבְּכוֹר.
human_translation: And you said to us: He said to me about this lamb but not to a firstborn,
llm_translation: And you said to us, (he said to me) "Bring up": "lamb" - and not the firstborn.

hebrew_text: ״אַחַת״ — וְלֹא מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: one not tithe.
llm_translation: "One" — and not tithe.

hebrew_text: ״מִן הַצֹּאן״ — וְלֹא הַפַּלְגָּס.
human_translation: Of the flock not a palges ,
llm_translation: "From the flock" — and not the "palgas."

hebrew_text: ״מִן הַמָּאתַיִם״ — מִמּוֹתַר שְׁתֵּי מֵאוֹת שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּיְּירוּ בַּבּוֹר. מִכָּאן לְעׇרְלָה שֶׁבְּטֵילָה בְּמָאתַיִם.
human_translation: Out of two hundred, From the remaining two hundred that remain in the vat. From here that orla is nullified in two hundred.
llm_translation: "From the two hundred" - from the surplus two hundred that remained in the pit. From here to circumcision which is annulled with two hundred.

hebrew_text: ״מִמַּשְׁקֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — מִן הַמּוּתָּר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: אֵין מְבִיאִין נְסָכִין מִן הַטֶּבֶל.
human_translation: From the well-watered pastures of Israel, from that which is permitted to Israel. From here, stated: One not offer libations from untithed produce [ tevel ],
llm_translation: "From the drink of a Jew" - permissible for a Jew. From here they said: One does not bring libations from untithed produce.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יָבִיא מִן הַמּוּקְצֶה. אָמַרְתָּ: מָה טֶבֶל מְיוּחָד שֶׁאִיסּוּר גּוּפוֹ גָּרַם לוֹ — אַף כֹּל שֶׁאִיסּוּר גּוּפוֹ גָּרַם לוֹ. יָצָא מוּקְצֶה שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּר גּוּפוֹ גָּרַם לוֹ, אֶלָּא אִיסּוּר דָּבָר אַחֵר גָּרַם לוֹ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אִיסּוּר מוּקְצֶה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מָה לִי אִיסּוּר גּוּפוֹ מָה לִי אִיסּוּר דָּבָר אַחֵר?
human_translation: might one not offer set-aside you said: Just as tevel is unique in that its inherent prohibition caused it so too, anything whose inherent prohibition caused it excludes set aside, which an inherent prohibition caused it rather, a different prohibition, caused it And if you say the prohibition of set-aside is by Torah what to me inherently prohibited; and what to me a different prohibition?
llm_translation: He is able not to bring from the edge. You said: Just as tevel that its own prohibition caused it — so too, anything that its own prohibition caused it. He left the edge where its own prohibition did not cause it, rather another prohibition caused it. And if you say that the prohibition of the edge is from the Torah, what do I need its own prohibition for, what do I need another prohibition for?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, הָא אַתְּ הוּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ: חִילּוּק מְלָאכוֹת לְשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין חִילּוּק מְלָאכוֹת לְיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: And furthermore, Wasn’t it you who said, division of labors to Shabbat, no division of labors to a Festival,
llm_translation: And furthermore, here you are saying: "Dividing labor for Shabbat, but not dividing labor for Yom Tov."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַפֵּיק הַבְעָרָה, וְעַיֵּיל עֲצֵי אֲשֵׁירָה. וְאַזְהָרָה מֵהָכָא, ״וְלֹא יִדְבַּק בְּיָדְךָ מְאוּמָה מִן הַחֵרֶם״.
human_translation: Rather, remove kindling and add the wood of a tree designated for idolatry [ asheira ]. And the warning, is from here, “Nothing from the spoil shall cling to your hand”
llm_translation: Instead, he should remove the burning coal and bring wood of the Asherah. And a warning from here, "And nothing of the banned things shall stick to your hand."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְנִלְקֵי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם ״וְלֹא תָבִיא תוֹעֵבָה אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Abaye: one should also be flogged due to “You shall not bring an abominable thing into your home”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha son of Rava to Abbaye: "And we learn from the verse 'You shall not bring an abomination into your house.'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אַפֵּיק הַבְעָרָה, וְעַיֵּיל עֲצֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ. וְאַזְהָרָה מֵהָכָא, ״וַאֲשֵׁרֵיהֶם תִּשְׂרְפוּן בָּאֵשׁ ... לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן כֵּן לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: Rather, remove kindling and add consecrated wood. And the warning, is from here: “And you shall burn their asheira with fire...you shall not do this to the Lord your God”
llm_translation: Rather: take out the fire, and bring in the holy wood. And a warning from here, "And their idols you shall burn in the fire... You shall not do so to the Lord your God."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה — מַחֲלוֹקֶת דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא. דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: This Rav Ḥisda and Rabba is dispute Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua As, Rabbi Eliezer, holds we say Since, etc. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: We do not say Since, etc.
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: This matter of Rav Ḥisda and Rabba is a dispute between Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua. Rabbi Eliezer holds: We say "ho'il." And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: We do not say "ho'il."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וְדִילְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָתָם דְּאָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״, אֶלָּא דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּקָא עָיְילִי לְתַנּוּרָא כׇּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא חַזְיָא לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא, דִּלְאוֹרְחִין הוּא דַּחֲזֵי לְדִידֵיהּ לָא חֲזֵי — אֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Perhaps Rabbi Eliezer only stated that we say Since, etc., there, because at the time that it was placed into the oven, each and every was fit for him, However, here, where is fit for guests is not fit for him, say that so too, we do not say Since, etc.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: And perhaps until here Rabbi Eliezer did not say, there where we say "since," but in the case where they are going to the oven, each and every one sees it for themselves. But here, where it is not the way of the world to see it for themselves, he might say thus, that we do not say "since."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: וְדִילְמָא לָא הִיא, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הָתָם דְּלָא אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״, אֶלָּא דְּאִיכָּא חֲדָא דְּלָא חַזְיָא לָא לְדִידֵיהּ וְלָא לְאוֹרְחִין. אֲבָל הָכָא, דַּחֲזֵי מִיהַת לְאוֹרְחִין — אֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״.
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: Perhaps that is not so. Rabbi Yehoshua only stated that we do not say Since, etc., there, where there is one that is not fit for him or for guests, However, here, when it is at least fit for guests, say that so too, we say Since, etc.
llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: And perhaps it is not so, until here Rabbi Yehoshua did not say "since," but rather that there is one thing that is not seen by us and not by others. But here, since it is seen from one to others, we say "since" in this way.

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ [רַבָּנַן] קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה וְרַבִּי זֵירָא. רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה קַיבְּלַהּ, רַבִּי זֵירָא לָא קַיבְּלַהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי זֵירָא: מִילְּתָא דְּקַשְׁיָא לַן וְאָתְיָא כַּמָּה שְׁנֵי בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, הַשְׁתָּא אַמְרוּהָ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה, וְלָא נִיקַבְּלַהּ?
human_translation: The Sages said before Rabbi Yirmeya and Rabbi Zeira. Rabbi Yirmeya accepted it Rabbi Zeira did not accept it. Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: matter has been difficult for us for several years: With regard to what did Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua disagree? Now has been stated in the name of a great man. Shall we not accept it?
llm_translation: They said it before Rabbi Yirmeya and Rabbi Zeira. Rabbi Yirmeya accepted it, Rabbi Zeira did not accept it. Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: The matter that is difficult for us and comes up in what do Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua disagree? Now they said it in the name of the great man, Rabba, and it was not accepted?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵיכִי אֲקַבְּלַהּ, דִּתְנֵינָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לִדְבָרֶיךָ, הֲרֵי הוּא עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה כׇל מְלָאכָה״, וּשְׁתֵיק לֵיהּ. וְאִי אִיתָא, לֵימָא לֵיהּ: טַעְמָא דִּידִי מִשּׁוּם ״הוֹאִיל״.
human_translation: He said to him: How can I accept it? We learned Rabbi Yehoshua said to According to your statement, one violates “You shall not perform any labor” and was silent. if it is should have said to him: The reason my due to Since, etc.,
llm_translation: He said to him: How should I receive it, as we have learned, Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: According to your words, he is transgressing the prohibition of "You shall not do any work," and he remained silent. And if he comes, let him say to him: The reason for my action is because of "ho'il."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דִּתְנֵינָא בְּבָרַיְיתָא, אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: לִדְבָרֶיךָ, הֲרֵי הוּא עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל יֵרָאֶה וּבַל יִמָּצֵא״, וּשְׁתֵיק לֵיהּ. הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא אַהְדַּר לֵיהּ? הָא קָא מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ בְּמַתְנִיתִין? דִּתְנַן: לֹא זֶהוּ חָמֵץ שֶׁמּוּזְהָרִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל יֵרָאֶה וּבַל יִמָּצֵא״, אֶלָּא: שָׁתֵיק לֵיהּ בְּבָרַיְיתָא, וּמַהְדַּר לֵיהּ בְּמַתְנִיתִין. הָכִי נָמֵי, אֵימוֹר שְׁתֵיק לֵיהּ בְּמַתְנִיתִין, וְאַהְדַּר לֵיהּ בִּמְכִילְתָּא אַחֲרִיתִי.
human_translation: said to him: According to your reasoning, that which we learned in a baraita , Rabbi Eliezer said to him: According to your statement, he transgresses It shall not be seen, and: It shall not be found, and was silent, did he too not respond to He responded to him in the mishna, as we learned This is not the leavened bread about which we are warned It shall not be seen, and: It shall not be found. Rather, He silent in the baraita but he responded in the mishna. So too, say that he silent in the mishna, but he responded in a different tractate.
llm_translation: He said to him: And to your taste, this that we learned in a baraita, Rabbi Eliezer said to him: According to your words, he transgresses the prohibition of "it shall not be seen nor found," and he remained silent. Is this because he did not respond to him? Rather, he responded to him in the baraita, and he responded to him in the Mishnah. As we learned: This is not the leaven that we are warned about due to "it shall not be seen nor found," but he remained silent in the baraita, and he responded to him in the Mishnah. So too, say he remained silent in the Mishnah, and he responded to him in another concluding teaching.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּבֶן בְּתֵירָא.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi says: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: halakha is in accordance with ben Beteira.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, and Rabbi Yitzchak says: The halakha is in accordance with Ben Beteira.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר עִיסָּה? רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: בְּחִיטִּין — קַבִּין. וּבִשְׂעוֹרִין — שְׁלֹשֶׁת קַבִּין. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: חִילּוּף הַדְּבָרִים.
human_translation: How much dough Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: With regard to wheat, two kav and with regard to barley, three kav . Rabbi Natan says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: The matters are reversed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much is the measure of dough? Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, says: In wheat - one kab. And in barley - three kabs. Rabbi Natan says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: The exchange of words."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: בְּחִטִּין — שְׁלֹשֶׁת קַבִּין, וּבִשְׂעוֹרִין — אַרְבָּעָה קַבִּין! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּחַסִּיכָתָא, הָא — בִּמְעַלְּיָיתָא.
human_translation: Wasn’t taught Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: With regard to wheat, three kav and with regard to barley, four kav ? not difficult, this to low-quality that to high-quality
llm_translation: The text states: "And it was taught: Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, says: In wheat - three kav, and in barley - four kav! There is no difficulty: here - in the granary, here - in the loft."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ גְּרִיעִין חִיטֵּי חַסִּיכָתָא מֵחִיטֵּי מְעַלְּיָיתָא טְפֵי מִדִּגְרִיעָן שְׂעָרֵי חַסִּיכָתָא מִשְּׂעָרֵי מְעַלְּיָיתָא. דְּאִילּוּ הָתָם תִּילְתָּא, וְהָכָא רִיבְעָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Learn from this low-quality wheat is worse than high-quality wheat is greater than low-quality barley is worse than high-quality barley, as there, one-third; and here, one-fourth.
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: Hear from it, the inferior wheat of the lower field is better than the superior wheat of the upper field, the hairs of the lower field are finer than the hairs of the upper field. For there, it is a third, and here, it is a quarter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: קַבָּא מְלוֹגְנָאָה לְפִיסְחָא, וְכֵן לְחַלָּה. (וְהָתַנְיָא:)
human_translation: Rav said: A kav Melogna for Passover. And similarly, with regard to ḥalla , Wasn’t taught
llm_translation: Rav said: A kab of fine flour for Pesach, and likewise for challah. (And it was taught:)

hebrew_text: חֲמֵשֶׁת רְבָעִים קֶמַח וְעוֹד — חַיָּיבִין בַּחַלָּה. הָכִי קָאָמַר, קַבָּא מְלוֹגְנָאֵי נָמֵי אַהַאי שִׁיעוּרָא קָאֵי.
human_translation: five-quarters log flour and more obligates ḥalla ? this is is saying: A kav from Melogna is the same measure as this,
llm_translation: Five quarters of flour and more - obligated in challah. This is what he said, a kab of fine flour is equivalent to this measure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָנֵי נְשֵׁי דִידַן נְהוּג לְמֵיפָא קְפִיזָא קְפִיזָא לְפִיסְחָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ, לְחוּמְרָא? חוּמְרָא דְּאָתֵי לִידֵי קוּלָּא הוּא, דְּקָא מַפְקַע לַהּ מֵחַלָּה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: These women of our ordinarily bake kefiza kefiza , on Passover, Abaye said to him: What is your opinion? stringent? That a stringency that leads to a leniency, as one removes from ḥalla .
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: These women of ours are accustomed to baking matzot, matzot for Passover. Abaye said to him: What is your opinion, for stringency? It is a stringency that leads to leniency, as it prevents her from becoming ill.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּעָבְדָן כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, (דְּתַנְיָא,) רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הָרוֹדֶה וְנוֹתֵן לַסַּל — הַסַּל מְצָרְפָן לַחַלָּה. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: said to him: They do in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. As it was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: One who removes and places them in a basket, the basket combines them to ḥalla , And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: He said to him: "We should act like Rabbi Eliezer, as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: One who kneads and gives to the basket - the basket contributes to the dough." And Rav Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is like Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא כִּכָּרוֹת שֶׁל בָּבֶל שֶׁנּוֹשְׁכוֹת זוֹ מִזּוֹ, אֲבָל כְּעָכִין — לָא. הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֲפִילּוּ כְּעָכִין.
human_translation: said to him: But wasn’t it stated with regard to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: They taught only Babylonian loaves that bite from one another. However, not to rod-like loaves ke’akhin Wasn’t it stated with regard to Rabbi Ḥanina said: even with regard to rod-like loaves?
llm_translation: He said to him: But isn't it stated regarding it, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: They only decreed regarding Babylonian loaves that are adjacent to one another, but like cakes - no. But isn't it stated regarding it, Rabbi Chanina said: Even like cakes.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: טַבְלָא שֶׁאֵין לָהּ לְבִזְבְּזִין מַהוּ? תּוֹךְ כְּלִי בָּעֵינַן, וְהָא לֵיכָּא. אוֹ דִילְמָא — אֲוִיר כְּלִי בָּעֵינַן, וְהָא אִיכָּא. תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised a dilemma: a board without a rim [ levizbezin ], what is Do we require the inside of the vessel and that is lacking, Or perhaps we require the airspace of the vessel, and that is Let it stand
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rabbi Yirmeya: A tabl that does not have for sprinkling, what is it? Inside a vessel we require, and here it is not. Or perhaps - the air of a vessel we require, and here it is. The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הַסַּל מְצָרְפָן. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: תַּנּוּר מְצָרְפָן. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר כִּכָּרוֹת שֶׁל בָּבֶל שֶׁנּוֹשְׁכוֹת זוֹ מִזּוֹ מִצְטָרְפוֹת.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: A basket combines Rabbi Yehoshua says: An oven combines them. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Babylonian loaves that bite from one another are combined;
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: the basket binds them. Rabbi Yehoshua says: the oven binds them. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Babylonian loaves that are bitten from one another are considered as one.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים לָשׁוֹת כְּאַחַת וְאוֹפוֹת בְּתַנּוּר אֶחָד, זוֹ אַחַר זוֹ.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: Three women may knead as one, and bake in one oven, one after the other,
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabban Gamliel says: Three women may knead together in one oven, one after the other.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים עוֹסְקוֹת בְּבָצֵק כְּאַחַת, אַחַת לָשָׁה, וְאַחַת עוֹרֶכֶת, וְאַחַת אוֹפָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Three women engaged dough as one, One kneads one arranges one bakes
llm_translation: The Sages say: Three women are involved in making dough together, one kneads, one shapes, and one bakes.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים וְלֹא כׇּל הָעֵצִים וְלֹא כׇּל הַתַּנּוּרִים שָׁוִין. זֶה הַכְּלָל: תָּפַח — תִּלְטוֹשׁ בְּצוֹנֵן.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Not all women, not all wood, and not all ovens are the same, this is the principle: rise, she spread cold
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Not all women, not all trees, and not all ovens are the same. This is the principle: Tafach - it will extinguish with a bellows.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן. לָשָׁה, הִיא מְקַטֶּפֶת, וַחֲבֶירְתָּהּ לָשָׁה תַּחְתֶּיהָ. מְקַטֶּפֶת, הִיא אוֹפָה, וַחֲבֶירְתָּהּ מְקַטֶּפֶת תַּחְתֶּיהָ, וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁית לָשָׁה. אוֹפָה הִיא, לָשָׁה, וַחֲבֶירְתָּהּ אוֹפָה תַּחְתֶּיהָ, וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁית מְקַטֶּפֶת, וְחוֹזְרֹת חֲלִילָה. כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁעוֹסְקוֹת בַּבָּצֵק — אֵינוֹ בָּא לִידֵי חִימּוּץ.
human_translation: The Sages taught kneads she arranges and another kneads in her place. arranging she bakes and another arranges in her place, and the third kneads baking, she kneads and another bakes in her place, and the third arranges and they continue in turn. As long as they are engaged the dough, it will not become leavened.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Regarding dough, it collects impurity, and its fellow dough collects impurity beneath it. It collects impurity, it bakes, and its fellow collects impurity beneath it, and the third dough collects impurity. It bakes, and its fellow dough bakes beneath it, and the third collects impurity, and they return to being permissible. As long as they are engaged in the dough - it does not come to become leavened.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר לֹא כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: דַּנְתִּי לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, יְלַמְּדֵינוּ רַבֵּינוּ בְּנָשִׁים זְרִיזוֹת אוֹ בְּנָשִׁים שֶׁאֵין זְרִיזוֹת? בְּעֵצִים לַחִים אוֹ בְּעֵצִים יְבֵשִׁים? בְּתַנּוּר חַם אוֹ בְּתַנּוּר צוֹנֵן? אָמַר לִי: אֵין לְךָ אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁשָּׁנוּ חֲכָמִים, זֶה הַכְּלָל: תָּפַח — תִּלְטוֹשׁ בְּצוֹנֵן.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says not all women, It was taught Rabbi Akiva said: I deliberated before Rabban Gamliel, May our master teach us with regard to diligent women or women who are not diligent? with regard to moist wood or dry wood? with regard to a hot oven or a cold oven? said to me: You have only what the Sages taught, this is the principle: rise she should spread cold onto
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says, "Not all women, etc." It was taught: Rabbi Akiva said, "I argued before Rabban Gamliel, 'Should our master teach us about diligent women or about women who are not diligent? About moist wood or about dry wood? About a hot oven or about a cold oven?' He said to me, 'You have only what the sages have taught: the principle is: blow - extinguish in cold.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שִׂיאוּר — יִשָּׂרֵף, וְהָאוֹכְלוֹ פָּטוּר. סִידּוּק — יִשָּׂרֵף, וְהָאוֹכְלוֹ חַיָּיב כָּרֵת.
human_translation: siur be burned, but one who eats it is exempt cracking be burned, and one who eats it is liable to karet ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Siyur - it shall be burned, and one who eats it is exempt. Sidduk - it shall be burned, and one who eats it is liable to karet."

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ שִׂיאוּר? כְּקַרְנֵי חֲגָבִים. סִידּוּק — שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ סְדָקִין זֶה בָּזֶה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זֶה וְזֶה — הָאוֹכְלוֹ חַיָּיב כָּרֵת. וְאֵיזֶהוּ שִׂיאוּר? כׇּל שֶׁהִכְסִיפוּ פָּנָיו כְּאָדָם שֶׁעָמְדוּ שַׂעֲרוֹתָיו.
human_translation: What is siur ? like the antennae of locusts. cracking when the cracks intermingle. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Rabbis say: One who eats this or that, is liable karet , And what is siur ? whose surface has becomes pale a person whose hair stands
llm_translation: Which is the removal? Like the horns of locusts. Sidduk - that intertwining cracks with each other, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And the sages say: This and this - one who eats it is liable to karet. And which is the removal? Whenever his face turned pale like a person whose hairs stood on end.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ שִׂיאוּר? כׇּל שֶׁהִכְסִיפוּ פָּנָיו כְּאָדָם שֶׁעָמְדוּ שַׂעֲרוֹתָיו. סִידּוּק — כְּקַרְנֵי חֲגָבִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵיזֶהוּ שִׂיאוּר? כְּקַרְנֵי חֲגָבִים. סִידּוּק — שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ סְדָקִין זֶה בָּזֶה. וְזֶה וָזֶה — הָאוֹכְלוֹ חַיָּיב כָּרֵת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: What is siur ? any whose surface has become pale a person whose hair stands Cracking like the antennae of locusts the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: What is siur ? like the antennae of locusts, cracking when the cracks intermingle. And one who eats this or that is liable karet .
llm_translation: The sages taught: What is the definition of "si'ur"? Any person whose face has turned pale like a person whose hairs have stood on end. Sidduk - like the horns of locusts, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: What is the definition of "si'ur"? Like the horns of locusts. Sidduk - when the cracks intermingle with each other. And both this one and that one - one who eats them is liable to receive karet.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: שִׂיאוּר יִשָּׂרֵף, וְהָאוֹכְלוֹ פָּטוּר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אֵימָא: לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, זֶה וָזֶה הָאוֹכְלוֹ חַיָּיב כָּרֵת.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn siur must be burned but one who eats it is exempt the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Say According to Rabbi Meir, one who eats this or that is liable karet ,
llm_translation: We have learned: The burning of the leaven is obligatory, while its consumption is exempt, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Say: According to Rabbi Meir, both the burning and the consumption incur the penalty of excision.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר — אֵין לָךְ כׇּל סֶדֶק וָסֶדֶק מִלְּמַעְלָה שֶׁאֵין לוֹ כַּמָּה סְדָקִים מִלְּמַטָּה.
human_translation: Rava said: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir? there is no crack above that does not have several cracks below.
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir? - You have no righteousness and righteousness from above that has as many righteousnesses from below.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — מְבַעֲרִין אֶת הַכֹּל מִלִּפְנֵי הַשַּׁבָּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בִּזְמַנּוֹ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בַּר צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: תְּרוּמָה — מִלִּפְנֵי הַשַּׁבָּת, וְחוּלִּין — בִּזְמַנָּן.
human_translation: the fourteenth that occurs on Shabbat, one removes all before Shabbat, the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: at its time Rabbi Eliezer bar Tzadok says: Teruma before Shabbat, non-sacred at their time,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Fourteen loaves that happen to be on Shabbat - one must remove all of them before Shabbat, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Remove them in their proper time. Rabbi Eliezer ben Zadok says: Terumah - remove it before Shabbat, and ordinary non-sacred loaves - in their proper time.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בַּר צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: פַּעַם אַחַת שָׁבַת אַבָּא בְּיַבְנֶה, וְחָל אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת. וּבָא זוּנִין מְמוּנֶּה שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְאָמַר: הִגִּיעַ עֵת לְבַעֵר אֶת הֶחָמֵץ, וְהָלַכְתִּי אַחַר אַבָּא וּבִיעַרְנוּ אֶת הֶחָמֵץ.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Eliezer bar Tzadok says: One time my father, spent Shabbat in Yavne, and the fourteenth occurred on Shabbat. Zonin, the appointee of Rabban Gamliel, came and said: The time has come to remove leavened bread; and I went with my father and we removed the leavened bread.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, Tanya, Rabbi Eliezer bar Tzadok says: Once, Abba went to Yavneh on Shabbat, and the fourteenth day of the month fell on Shabbat. And Zunin, the appointed agent of Rabban Gamliel, came and said: 'The time has come to burn the leaven, and I will follow Abba and we will burn the leaven.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַהוֹלֵךְ לִשְׁחוֹט אֶת פִּסְחוֹ, וְלָמוּל אֶת בְּנוֹ, וְלֶאֱכוֹל סְעוּדַת אֵירוּסִין בְּבֵית חָמִיו, וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ חָמֵץ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ. אִם יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר וּלְבַעֵר וְלַחֲזוֹר לְמִצְוָתוֹ — יַחְזוֹר וִיבַעֵר, וְאִם לָאו — מְבַטְּלוֹ בְּלִבּוֹ.
human_translation: One who is traveling to slaughter his Paschal lamb, to circumcise his son, or to eat a betrothal feast in his father-in-law’s house, and he remembers that he has leavened bread in his house, if he is able to return and remove return to the mitzva he should return and remove But if he should nullify it in his heart,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who goes to slaughter his Passover offering, and to circumcise his son, and to eat the meal of betrothal in his father-in-law's house, and remembers that he has leaven in his house. If he is able to return and burn it and then return to fulfill his obligation - he should return and burn it. But if not - he nullifies it in his heart.

hebrew_text: לְהַצִּיל מִן הַגּוֹיִם, וּמִן הַנָּהָר, וּמִן הַלִּסְטִים, וּמִן הַדְּלֵיקָה, וּמִן הַמַּפּוֹלֶת — יְבַטֵּל בְּלִבּוֹ. וְלִשְׁבּוֹת שְׁבִיתַת הָרְשׁוּת — יַחְזוֹר מִיָּד.
human_translation: to save gentiles, from a river, from bandits, from a fire, or from a collapsed he should nullify in his heart. to establish his Shabbat optional he should return immediately
llm_translation: To save from the nations, and from the river, and from bandits, and from fire, and from a collapsing building — he should annul in his heart. And to sit in a temporary dwelling — he should return immediately.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן מִי שֶׁיָּצָא מִירוּשָׁלַיִם וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּיָדוֹ בְּשַׂר קֹדֶשׁ, אִם עָבַר צוֹפִים — שׂוֹרְפוֹ בִּמְקוֹמוֹ. וְאִם לָאו — חוֹזֵר וְשׂוֹרְפוֹ לִפְנֵי הַבִּירָה מֵעֲצֵי הַמַּעֲרָכָה.
human_translation: And so too, one who left Jerusalem and remembered that there was consecrated meat in his hand. If he passed Scopus Tzofim ], he burns at the site he and if not he must return and burn it before the Temple with wood from the arrangement
llm_translation: And so too, one who left Jerusalem and remembered that he has holy meat in his possession, if he passed Tzofim - he burns it in its place. And if not - he returns and burns it before the Temple from the wood of the arranged pile.

hebrew_text: וְעַד כַּמָּה הֵן חוֹזְרִין? רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: זֶה וְזֶה בִּכְבֵיצָה, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: זֶה וְזֶה בִּכְזַיִת. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּשַׂר קֹדֶשׁ — בִּכְזַיִת, וְחָמֵץ — בִּכְבֵיצָה.
human_translation: how much to return? Rabbi Meir says: this and that an egg-bulk. Rabbi Yehuda says: this and that an olive-bulk. And the Rabbis say consecrated meat, an olive-bulk, but leavened bread, for an egg-bulk.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And until when do they the sages repeat the process of checking for chametz? Rabbi Meir says: This and this are checked with a candle, Rabbi Yehuda says: This and this are checked with a piece of matting. And the Sages say: Holy meat is checked with a piece of matting, and leaven is checked with a candle."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַהוֹלֵךְ לֶאֱכוֹל סְעוּדַת אֵירוּסִין בְּבֵית חָמִיו, וְלִשְׁבּוֹת שְׁבִיתַת הָרְשׁוּת — יַחְזוֹר מִיָּד!
human_translation: raises a contradiction One who is traveling to eat a betrothal feast in his father-in-law’s house or to establish his Shabbat optional must return immediately
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara and it was asked: One who goes to eat a meal of betrothal in the house of his father-in-law, and to sit a sitting of authority - he should immediately return!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: סְעוּדַת אֵירוּסִין רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: not difficult, This Rabbi Yehuda, that Rabbi Yosei. As it was taught A betrothal feast is optional; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: mitzva.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan, not difficult: this - Rabbi Yehuda, this - Rabbi Yosei. As it was taught: A betrothal feast is optional, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: It is a commandment.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בִּסְעוּדָה שְׁנִיָּה, אֲבָל בִּסְעוּדָה רִאשׁוֹנָה דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מִצְוָה. אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא הָא וְהָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בִּסְעוּדָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, הָא — בִּסְעוּדָה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: And now that Rav Ḥisda said: The dispute the second but everyone agrees that the first feast is a mitzva, Even if you say that this that Rabbi Yehuda, not difficult. This the first meal. That the second meal.
llm_translation: At this time, as Rav Ḥisda said: Disagreement in a second meal, but in the first meal, everyone agrees it is a mitzvah. Even if you say this and that, Rabbi Yehuda, and it is not difficult: this - in the first meal, that - in the second meal.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֲנִי לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי אֶלָּא סְעוּדַת אֵירוּסִין, אֲבָל לֹא סִבְלוֹנוֹת. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲנִי שָׁמַעְתִּי סְעוּדַת אֵירוּסִין וְסִבְלוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yehuda said: I heard only betrothal feast but not gifts [ sivlonot ], Rabbi Yosei said to him: I heard a betrothal feast and gifts
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said, "I have only heard of a betrothal feast, but not of burdens." Rabbi Yosei said to him, "I have heard of a betrothal feast and burdens."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל סְעוּדָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁל מִצְוָה — אֵין תַּלְמִיד חָכָם רַשַּׁאי לֵהָנוֹת מִמֶּנָּה.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Shimon says: A Torah scholar may not benefit from any feast that is not a mitzva.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: Any meal that is not for the sake of a mitzvah - a Torah scholar is not permitted to benefit from it.

hebrew_text: כְּגוֹן מַאי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּגוֹן בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וּבַת תַּלְמִיד חָכָם לְעַם הָאָרֶץ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵין זִוּוּגָן עוֹלֶה יָפֶה.
