human_translation: In what case Rabbi Yoḥanan said: In a case the daughter of a priest an Israelite, the daughter of a Torah scholar an ignoramus. as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the daughter of a priest an Israelite their union will not be auspicious,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: For example, what is it? Rabbi Yochanan said: For example, the daughter of a Kohen to an Israelite, and the daughter of a Torah scholar to an am ha'aretz. As Rabbi Yochanan said: The daughter of a Kohen to an Israelite - their pairing is not beautiful.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אוֹ ״אַלְמָנָה״, אוֹ ״גְּרוּשָׁה״, אוֹ ״זֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: קוֹבְרָהּ אוֹ קוֹבַרְתּוֹ, אוֹ מְבִיאָתוֹ לִידֵי עֲנִיּוּת.
human_translation: What is this Rav Ḥisda said: either be a widow, a divorcee, or without children It was taught in a baraita : will bury her or she will bury him, or she will cause him to become poor.
llm_translation: What is it? Rav Ḥisdah said: Either "widow," or "divorcee," or "she has no offspring." In a baraita it was taught: One buries her or buries him, or brings him to poverty.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָרוֹצֶה שֶׁיִּתְעַשֵּׁר יִדְבַּק בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁתּוֹרָה וּכְהוּנָּה מַעֲשַׁרְתָּן. לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּתַלְמִיד חָכָם, הָא — בְּעַם הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: One who wishes to become wealthy should cling to the descendants of Aaron, all the more so Torah priesthood cause them to become wealthy. not difficult, this refers to a Torah scholar That an ignoramus
llm_translation: I?! And this, Rabbi Yochanan said: One who wishes to become wealthy should cleave to the seed of Aaron, all the more so Torah and priesthood enrich them. It is not difficult: this — with a Torah scholar, this — with an am ha'aretz.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ נְסֵיב כָּהֵנְתָּא, חֲלַשׁ. אָמַר: לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְאַהֲרֹן דְּאֶדְבַּק בְּזַרְעֵיהּ, דְּהָוֵי לֵיהּ חַתְנָא כִּי אֲנָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua married a daughter of a priest became ill. He said: it is not satisfactory to Aaron that I cling to his descendants, so that he has a son-in-law like me.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua married a Kohenet and became weak. He said: It is not pleasing to Aharon that he should cling to his seed, for he would then have a son-in-law like me.

hebrew_text: רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין נָסֵיב כָּהֵנְתָּא, נְפַקוּ מִינֵּיהּ תְּרֵי בְּנֵי סְמִיכִי: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אִי לָא נָסֵיבְנָא כָּהֵנְתָּא, לָא אִיעַתַּרִי.
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin married a daughter of a priest. Two sons ordained came from him, Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, and Rabbi Yehoshua, son of Rav Idi. Rav Pappa said: Had I not married a daughter of a priest, I would not have become wealthy.
llm_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin married a Kohenet, two sons of semikha went out from him: Rav Sheshet son of Rav Idi, and Rabbi Yehoshua son of Rav Idi. Rav Papa said: If we had not married a Kohenet, we would not have been permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אִי לָא נָסֵיבְנָא כָּהֵנְתָּא, לָא גְּלַאי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְהָא לִמְקוֹם תּוֹרָה גְּלֵית! לָא גְלַאי כִּדְגָלֵי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Rav Kahana, said: Had I not married a daughter of a priest, I would not have been exiled, They said to him: But you were exiled to a place of Torah, I was not exiled as people are exiled,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: If we had not married Kahentah, it would not have been revealed. They said to him: But you revealed it in a place of Torah! It is not revealed like the flags of people.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִסְּעוּדַת הָרְשׁוּת לְסוֹף גּוֹלֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֹכְלִים כָּרִים מִצֹּאן וַעֲגָלִים מִתּוֹךְ מַרְבֵּק״, וּכְתִיב: ״לָכֵן עַתָּה יִגְלוּ בְּרֹאשׁ גּוֹלִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Anyone who benefits from an optional feast, will ultimately be exiled, as it is stated: “And eat the lambs of the flock and the calves out of the midst of the stall” and it is written: “Therefore now they shall go into exile at the head of the exiles;
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who benefits from a meal of the community is exiled to the end, as it is stated: "And they eat the lambs from the flock and the calves from the midst of the stall," and it is written: "Therefore now they shall go into exile at the head of the exiles."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הַמַּרְבֶּה סְעוּדָּתוֹ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, סוֹף מַחֲרִיב אֶת בֵּיתוֹ, וּמְאַלְמֵן אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וּמְיַיתֵּם אֶת גּוֹזָלָיו, וְתַלְמוּדוֹ מִשְׁתַּכֵּחַ מִמֶּנּוּ, וּמַחְלוֹקוֹת רַבּוֹת בָּאוֹת עָלָיו, וּדְבָרָיו אֵינָם נִשְׁמָעִים, וּמְחַלֵּל שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם וְשֵׁם רַבּוֹ וְשֵׁם אָבִיו, וְגוֹרֵם שֵׁם רַע לוֹ וּלְבָנָיו וְלִבְנֵי בָנָיו עַד סוֹף כׇּל הַדּוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Any Torah scholar who feasts excessively everywhere ultimately destroy his house, widow his wife, orphan his chicks, and his studies will be forgotten. Much dispute will come upon him, his words will not be heeded, and he will desecrate God’s name and the name of his master and the name of his father. And he will cause a bad name for himself, his children, and his descendants throughout future generations.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Every Torah scholar who increases his feasting in every place, ultimately destroys his household, impoverishes his wife, steals from his neighbors, causes his learning to be forgotten, brings upon himself many disputes, his words are not listened to, desecrates the name of Heaven, the name of his teacher, and the name of his father, and brings a bad name upon himself, his children, and his grandchildren until the end of all generations.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: קָרוּ לֵיהּ בַּר מַחֵים תַּנּוּרֵי. רָבָא אָמַר: בַּר מְרַקֵּיד בֵּי כוּבֵּי. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: בַּר מְלַחֵיךְ פִּינְכֵי. רַב שְׁמַעְיָה אָמַר: בַּר מַךְ רָבַע.
human_translation: What is this Abaye said: is called the son bar of the one who heats ovens, Rava said: the son of the one who dances inns [ bei kuvei ], Rav Pappa said: the son of the one who licks bowls [ pinkhei ]. Rav Shemaya said: the son of the one who folds and crouches,
llm_translation: What is it? Abaye said: they called it "son of the womb of the ovens." Rava said: "son of the boiling pots." Rav Papa said: "son of the salters of the corners." Rav Shemaya said: "son of the quarterer."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לְעוֹלָם יִמְכּוֹר אָדָם כׇּל מַה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ וְיִשָּׂא בַּת תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, שֶׁאִם מֵת אוֹ גוֹלֶה — מוּבְטָח לוֹ שֶׁבָּנָיו תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים. וְאַל יִשָּׂא בַּת עַם הָאָרֶץ, שֶׁאִם מֵת אוֹ גוֹלֶה — בָּנָיו עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One should always sell all he has marry the daughter of a Torah scholar, as if he dies or is exiled he can be assured that his sons will be Torah scholars, And one should not marry the daughter of an ignoramus, as if he dies or is exiled, his sons will be ignoramuses.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A person should always sell all that he has and marry the daughter of a Torah scholar, for if he dies or is exiled, it is guaranteed that his sons will be Torah scholars. And one should not marry the daughter of an ignoramus, for if he dies or is exiled, his sons will be ignoramuses.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לְעוֹלָם יִמְכּוֹר אָדָם כׇּל מַה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ וְיִשָּׂא בַּת תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, וְיַשִּׂיא בִּתּוֹ לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם, מָשָׁל לְעִנְבֵי הַגֶּפֶן בְּעִנְבֵי הַגֶּפֶן, דָּבָר נָאֶה וּמִתְקַבֵּל. וְלֹא יִשָּׂא בַּת עַם הָאָרֶץ, מָשָׁל לְעִנְבֵי הַגֶּפֶן בְּעִנְבֵי הַסְּנֶה, דָּבָר כָּעוּר
human_translation: the Sages taught: One should always sell all he has marry the daughter of a Torah scholar and marry off his daughter to a Torah scholar. compared to grapes of a vine with grapes of a vine, something beautiful and acceptable And one should not marry the daughter of an ignoramus. compared to grapes of a vine with berries of a bramble, something unseemly
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A person should always sell all that he has and marry the daughter of a Torah scholar, and marry off his daughter to a Torah scholar. This can be compared to grapes from a vineyard with grapes from a thornbush, a pleasant and accepted matter. But he should not marry off his daughter to an unlearned person, this can be compared to grapes from a vineyard with grapes from a thornbush, a repulsive matter.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינוֹ מִתְקַבֵּל.
human_translation: and unacceptable.
llm_translation: And it is not accepted.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לְעוֹלָם יִמְכּוֹר אָדָם כׇּל מַה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ, וְיִשָּׂא בַּת תַּלְמִיד חָכָם. לֹא מָצָא בַּת תַּלְמִיד חָכָם — יִשָּׂא בַּת גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר. לֹא מָצָא בַּת גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר — יִשָּׂא בַּת רָאשֵׁי כְנֵסִיּוֹת. לֹא מָצָא בַּת רָאשֵׁי כְנֵסִיּוֹת — יִשָּׂא בַּת גַּבָּאֵי צְדָקָה. לֹא מָצָא בַּת גַּבָּאֵי צְדָקָה — יִשָּׂא בַּת מְלַמְּדֵי תִּינוֹקוֹת. וְלֹא יִשָּׂא בַּת עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן שֶׁקֶץ, וּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁרֶץ, וְעַל בְּנוֹתֵיהֶן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אָרוּר שׁוֹכֵב עִם כׇּל בְּהֵמָה״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A person should always sell all he has marry the daughter of a Torah scholar. he cannot find the daughter of a Torah scholar, he should marry the daughter of great of the generation, he cannot find the daughter of great of the generation, he should marry the daughter of the heads of the congregations. he cannot find the daughter of the heads of the congregations, he should marry the daughter of the charity collectors. he cannot find the daughter of the charity collectors, he should marry the daughter of the schoolteachers. he should not marry the daughter of an ignoramus [ am ha’aretz ] because they are vermin and their wives are a creeping animal, And with regard to their daughters states: “Cursed is he who lies with an animal”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A person should always sell all that he has and marry the daughter of a Torah scholar. If he did not find the daughter of a Torah scholar, he should marry the daughter of the leaders of the generation. If he did not find the daughter of the leaders of the generation, he should marry the daughter of the heads of the synagogues. If he did not find the daughter of the heads of the synagogues, he should marry the daughter of the charitable community leaders. If he did not find the daughter of the charitable community leaders, he should marry the daughter of teachers of young children. And he should not marry the daughter of the common people, because they are an abomination, their wives are like vermin, and concerning their daughters it is said: "Cursed be he who lies with any beast."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: עַם הָאָרֶץ אָסוּר לֶאֱכוֹל בְּשַׂר, (בְּהֵמָה) שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַבְּהֵמָה וְהָעוֹף״: כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה מוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל בְּשַׂר בְּהֵמָה וָעוֹף, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה אָסוּר לֶאֱכוֹל בָּשָׂר בְּהֵמָה וָעוֹף.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi says: It is prohibited for an ignoramus to eat meat, as it is stated: “This is the law [ torah ] of the beast and of the fowl” Anyone who engages in Torah is permitted to eat the meat of animals and fowl, and anyone who does not engage in Torah is prohibited to eat the meat of animals or fowl.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says: An am ha'aretz (ignorant person) is forbidden to eat meat, as it is stated: "This is the Torah of the animal and the bird." Anyone who engages in Torah study is permitted to eat the meat of animals and birds, and anyone who does not engage in Torah study is forbidden to eat the meat of animals and birds.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עַם הָאָרֶץ מוּתָּר לְנוֹחֳרוֹ בְּיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: רַבִּי, אֱמוֹר לְשׁוֹחְטוֹ! אָמַר לָהֶן: זֶה טָעוּן בְּרָכָה, וְזֶה אֵינוֹ טָעוּן בְּרָכָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: It is permitted to stab an ignoramus on Yom Kippur that occurs on Shabbat. His students said to him: Master, say to slaughter him. He said to them: this requires a blessing and that does not require a blessing
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: An am ha'aretz (ignorant person) is permitted to slaughter on Yom Kippur that falls on Shabbat. His disciples said to him: Rabbi, say to him to slaughter! He said to them: This one requires a blessing, and this one does not require a blessing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עַם הָאָרֶץ אָסוּר לְהִתְלַוּוֹת עִמּוֹ בַּדֶּרֶךְ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הִיא חַיֶּיךָ וְאוֹרֶךְ יָמֶיךָ״, עַל חַיָּיו לֹא חָס, עַל חַיֵּי חֲבֵירוֹ — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: It is prohibited to accompany an ignoramus on the road as it is stated “For it is your life and the length of your days” he is not concerned about his own life; to another’s life, all the more so.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: A commoner is forbidden to accompany him on the road, as it is stated: "For it is your life and the length of your days," he is not obligated to risk his life for the life of his fellow - all the more so.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַם הָאָרֶץ מוּתָּר לְקוֹרְעוֹ כְּדָג. אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: וּמִגַּבּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is permitted to tear an ignoramus like a fish. Rabbi Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: And from his back
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yochanan: An am ha'aretz is permitted to tear it like a fish. Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Yitzchak: And from its back.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כְּשֶׁהָיִיתִי עַם הָאָרֶץ אָמַרְתִּי: מִי יִתֵּן לִי תַּלְמִיד חָכָם וַאֲנַשְּׁכֶנּוּ כַּחֲמוֹר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: רַבִּי, אֱמוֹר כְּכֶלֶב! אָמַר לָהֶן: זֶה נוֹשֵׁךְ וְשׁוֹבֵר עֶצֶם, וְזֶה נוֹשֵׁךְ וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹבֵר עֶצֶם.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Akiva said: When I was an ignoramus I said: Who will give me a Torah scholar I will bite him like a donkey? His students said to him: Master, say like a dog! He said to them: this one, bites and breaks bones, and that one, bites but does not break bones.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Akiva said, "When I was an 'am ha'aretz, I used to say, 'Who will give me a wise disciple, that I may bite him like a donkey?'" His disciples said to him, "Rabbi, say 'like a dog!'" He said to them, "This one bites and breaks bones, and this one bites and does not break bones."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַמַּשִּׂיא בִּתּוֹ לְעַם הָאָרֶץ, כְּאִילּוּ כּוֹפְתָהּ וּמַנִּיחָהּ לִפְנֵי אֲרִי. מָה אֲרִי דּוֹרֵס וְאוֹכֵל, וְאֵין לוֹ בּוֹשֶׁת פָּנִים — אַף עַם הָאָרֶץ מַכֶּה וּבוֹעֵל, וְאֵין לוֹ בּוֹשֶׁת פָּנִים.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Meir would say: Anyone who marries off his daughter to an ignoramus as though he binds her and places her before a lion. Just as a lion mauls and eats and has no shame, so too, an ignoramus strikes and engages in sexual relations and has no shame.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say, "Anyone who marries off his daughter to an 'am ha'aretz (ignorant person), it is as though he pushes her before a lion. Just as a lion tears and devours, and has no shame — so too an 'am ha'aretz strikes and cohabits, and has no shame."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִילְמָלֵא אָנוּ צְרִיכִין לָהֶם לְמַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן, הָיוּ הוֹרְגִין אוֹתָנוּ.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: If we did not need for business, they would kill us.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: If not for the need for them for buying and selling, they would kill us.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵא רַבִּי חִיָּיא: כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה לִפְנֵי עַם הָאָרֶץ, כְּאִילּוּ בּוֹעֵל אֲרוּסָתוֹ בְּפָנָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תּוֹרָה צִוָּה לָנוּ מֹשֶׁה מוֹרָשָׁה״. אַל תִּקְרֵי: ״מוֹרָשָׁה״, אֶלָּא: מְאוֹרָסָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: Anyone who engages in Torah in the presence of an ignoramus, is considered as though he had sexual relations with betrothed in his presence, as it is stated: “Moses commanded us the Torah, an inheritance morasha Do not read it inheritance [ morasha ]; rather, betrothed [ me’orasa ].
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya: Anyone who engages in Torah study in front of an am ha'aretz, it is as if he is cohabiting with his betrothed in his presence, as it is stated: "Moses commanded us the Torah, an inheritance." Do not read it as "inheritance," rather as "betrothal."

hebrew_text: גְּדוֹלָה שִׂנְאָה שֶׁשּׂוֹנְאִין עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם יוֹתֵר מִשִּׂנְאָה שֶׁשּׂוֹנְאִין אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן יוֹתֵר מֵהֶן. תָּנָא שָׁנָה וּפֵירַשׁ, יוֹתֵר מִכּוּלָּן.
human_translation: The hatred which ignoramuses have for a Torah scholar is greater than the hatred that the nations of the world have for the Jewish people. And wives more than It was taught who studied and left more than all of them.
llm_translation: Great is the hatred that the ignorant masses have for a Torah scholar more than the hatred that the nations of the world have for Israel, and their wives more than them. A Tanna taught and explained, more than all of them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּעַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ: אֵין מוֹסְרִין לָהֶן עֵדוּת. וְאֵין מְקַבְּלִין מִמֶּנּוּ עֵדוּת. וְאֵין מְגַלִּין לָהֶן סוֹד. וְאֵין מְמַנִּין אוֹתָן אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס עַל הַיְּתוֹמִים. וְאֵין מְמַנִּין אוֹתָן אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס עַל קוּפָּה שֶׁל צְדָקָה. וְאֵין מִתְלַוִּין עִמָּהֶן בַּדֶּרֶךְ. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף אֵין מַכְרִיזִין עַל אֲבֵידָתוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Six statements were made with regard to ignoramuses: One may not entrust them with testimony, one may not accept testimony from them, one should not reveal a secret to them, One may not appoint them as steward [ apotropos ] over orphans, one may not appoint them as guardian over a charity fund. one should not accompany them on the road, And there are those who say: One does not even announce their lost
llm_translation: The sages taught: Six things were said regarding the common people: They are not admonished regarding testimony. And testimony is not accepted from them. And secrets are not revealed to them. And they are not appointed as overseers over orphans. And they are not appointed as overseers over the charity box. And one does not associate with them on the road. And some say: One does not even announce his lost object.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא? זִמְנִין דְּנָפֵיק מִינֵּיהּ זַרְעָא מְעַלְּיָא וְאָכֵיל לֵיהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יָכִין וְצַדִּיק יִלְבַּשׁ״.
human_translation: the first tanna , Sometimes upstanding offspring will come from him and will consume as it is stated: “He may prepare it but the just shall put it on”
llm_translation: And did the first tanna teach? At times when the seed emerges from it above and he eats it, as it is stated: "He prepares and the righteous one will wear it."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן מִי שֶׁיָּצָא וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: And so too, one who left
llm_translation: And so too, one who went out, etc.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר כְּבֵיצָה הוּא דַּחֲשִׁיב, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר כְּזַיִת נָמֵי חֲשִׁיב. וּרְמִינְהִי: עַד כַּמָּה הֵן מְזַמְּנִין? עַד כְּזַיִת, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד כְּבֵיצָה!
human_translation: Is that to say that Rabbi Meir holds an egg-bulk is significant, and Rabbi Yehuda holds that an olive-bulk is also significant? raises a contradiction How much to obligate in a zimmun ? An olive-bulk And Rabbi Yehuda says: An egg-bulk
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Meir, he holds that the size of an egg is significant, while Rabbi Yehuda holds that the size of an olive is significant. And they raised a dilemma: Until what size are they considered prepared? Until the size of an olive, and Rabbi Yehuda says: Until the size of an egg!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The opinions are reversed
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Mochlephet hashchitah.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ. הָתָם — בִּקְרָאֵי פְּלִיגִי, הָכָא — בִּסְבָרָא פְּלִיגִי. הָתָם בִּקְרָאֵי פְּלִיגִי, רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ״ — זוֹ אֲכִילָה, ״וְשָׂבָעְתָּ״ — זוֹ שְׁתִיָּה, וַאֲכִילָה בִּכְזַיִת. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ וְשָׂבָעְתָּ״ — אֲכִילָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ שְׂבִיעָה, וְאֵיזוֹ זוֹ? בִּכְבֵיצָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: Actually, do not reverse There, they disagree with regard to verses, here, they disagree with regard to logical reasoning. There, they disagree with regard to verses. Rabbi Meir holds “And you shall eat,” that is eating; “and be satisfied,” that is drinking. eating an olive-bulk. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: “And you shall eat and you shall be satisfied” to eating that includes satisfaction. And what is an egg-bulk.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Always do not reverse. There — in the verses they argue, here — in reasoning they argue. There in the verses they argue, Rabbi Meir holds: "And you shall eat" — this is eating, "and you shall be satisfied" — this is drinking, and eating with a full stomach. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: "And you shall eat and be satisfied" — eating that includes satisfaction, and what is that? Eating a k'beitza.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בִּסְבָרָא פְּלִיגִי, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר חֲזָרָתוֹ כְּטוּמְאָתוֹ: מָה טוּמְאָתוֹ בִּכְבֵיצָה, אַף חֲזָרָתוֹ בִּכְבֵיצָה. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר חֲזָרָתוֹ
human_translation: here, they disagree with regard to logical reasoning, as Rabbi Meir holds: return is analogous to its ritual impurity. Just as its ritual impurity is egg-bulk, so too, return it is egg-bulk. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: return
llm_translation: Here in reasoning they dispute, for Rabbi Meir holds that his return is like his impurity: just as his impurity is in a lump, so too his return is in a lump. And Rabbi Yehuda holds that his return...

hebrew_text: כְּאִיסּוּרוֹ: מָה אִיסּוּרוֹ בִּכְזַיִת, אַף חֲזָרָתוֹ בִּכְזַיִת.
human_translation: is analogous to its prohibition. Just as its prohibition is olive-bulk, so too, return it is olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Like its prohibition: Just as its prohibition is with olive oil, so too its allowance is with olive oil.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: זֶה וְזֶה כִּשְׁתֵּי בֵיצִים, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: was taught Rabbi Natan says: this and that, two egg-bulks but the Rabbis did not agree with him.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Natan says: This and this are like two eggs, and the Sages did not agree with him.

hebrew_text: ״וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא לֹא יִהְיֶה אוֹר יְקָרוֹת וְקִפָּאוֹן״. מַאי ״יְקָרוֹת וְקִפָּאוֹן״?
human_translation: “And it shall come to pass on that day that there shall not be light, heavy clouds [ yekarot ] and thickness [ vekippaon ]” What is “ yekarot vekippaon ”?
llm_translation: "And it shall be on that day, there shall not be light, precious stones, and frost." What is "precious stones and frost"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: זֶה אוֹר שֶׁיָּקָר בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, וְקָפוּי לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: This is light which is significant yakar ] in this world and insignificant kafuy ] in the World-to-Come,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: This is the light that is precious in this world, and folded for the world to come.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵלּוּ נְגָעִים וְאֹהָלוֹת, שֶׁיְּקָרִין הֵן בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, וּקְפוּיִין הֵן לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This Nega’im and Oholot , which are weighty [ yekarim ] in this world, but easy [ kefuyin ] in the World-to-Come,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: These are the afflictions and impurities that are called in this world, and they are atoned for in the world to come.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁיְּקָרִין הֵן בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, וּקְפוּיִין הֵן לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. כִּי הָא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי חֲלַשׁ וְאִיתְנְגִיד, כִּי הֲדַר, אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ: מַאי חֲזֵית? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עוֹלָם הָפוּךְ רָאִיתִי, עֶלְיוֹנִים לְמַטָּה, וְתַחְתּוֹנִים לְמַעְלָה. אָמַר לוֹ: בְּנִי, עוֹלָם בָּרוּר רָאִיתָ. וַאֲנַן הֵיכִי הָתָם? כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאִיתוּ אֲנַן הָכָא, הָכִי אִיתִינַן הָתָם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: These are people who are important [ yekarim ] in this world and unimportant kefuyim ] in the World-to-Come. like Rav Yosef, son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, became ill and expire. When he returned his father said to him: What did you see He said to him: I saw an inverted world. Those above, below, those below, above. He said to him: My son, you have seen a clear world. And where are we, there? Just as we are here, so are we there.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: These are the people who are called in this world, and are accounted for in the world to come. For this that Rav Yosef, son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, became ill and was bedridden, when he recovered, his father said to him: What did you see? He said to him: I saw an upside-down world, the upper ones below, and the lower ones above. He said to him: My son, you saw a clear world. And how are we there? Just as we are here, so are we there.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: אַשְׁרֵי מִי שֶׁבָּא לְכָאן וְתַלְמוּדוֹ בְּיָדוֹ. וְשָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: הֲרוּגֵי מַלְכוּת אֵין אָדָם יָכוֹל לַעֲמוֹד בִּמְחִיצָתָן.
human_translation: And I heard that they were saying Praiseworthy is the one who arrives here with his studies in hand. And I heard that they were saying: Those executed by the government no one can stand in their enclosure.
llm_translation: I have heard that they used to say: "Fortunate is he who comes here with his Talmud in his hand." And I have heard that they used to say: "Those executed by the kingdom, no man can stand in their place."

hebrew_text: (וּמַאן) נִינְהוּ? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וַחֲבֵירָיו — מִשּׁוּם הֲרוּגֵי מַלְכוּת וְתוּ לָא?! אֶלָּא: הֲרוּגֵי לוֹד.
human_translation: And who are these If you say Rabbi Akiva and his colleagues, due to they were martyred by government and nothing more? Rather, the martyrs of Lod,
llm_translation: (And) who are they? If we say Rabbi Akiva and his colleagues — (is it) because of (the) slain of (the) kingdom and not (the) slain of Lod?! Rather: (the) slain of Lod.

hebrew_text: ״בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִהְיֶה עַל מְצִלּוֹת הַסּוּס קֹדֶשׁ לַה׳״. מַאי ״מְצִלּוֹת הַסּוּס״?
human_translation: “On that day there shall be upon the bells of the horses [ metzillot hasus ]: Holy unto the Lord” What is metzillot hasus ?
llm_translation: "On that day there shall be upon the bells of the horse 'Holy to the Lord.'" What are 'the bells of the horse'?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהוֹסִיף עַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם עַד שֶׁהַסּוּס רָץ וּמֵצֵיל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: In the future the Holy One, Blessed be He, will extend Jerusalem as much as a horse can run it casts a shadow [ metzeil ].
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to add to Jerusalem until the horse runs and saves.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: כׇּל מְצִילּוֹת שֶׁתּוֹלִין לַסּוּס בֵּין עֵינָיו — יִהְיֶה קֹדֶשׁ לַה׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: All bells [ metzillot ] that one hangs between the eyes of a horse will be sanctified to God,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: All bandages that are placed on a horse in front of its eyes - shall be holy to the Lord.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כׇּל בִּיזָּה שֶׁבּוֹזְזִין יִשְׂרָאֵל עַד שָׁעָה שֶׁהַסּוּס רָץ וּמֵצֵיל — יִהְיֶה קֹדֶשׁ לַה׳.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: All spoils that the Jewish people take up to the time a horse runs and casts a shadow [ metzeil ], will be sanctified for God.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Every coin that the Jews give until the moment the horse runs and saves - shall be holy to the Lord.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כׇּל בִּיזָּה שֶׁבָּזְזוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה הַסִּירוֹת בְּבֵית ה׳ כַּמִּזְרָקִים לִפְנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּהָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי, מַאי ״וְהָיָה הַסִּירוֹת בְּבֵית ה׳״? מִילְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי קָאָמַר, דְּמִתְעַתְּרִי יִשְׂרָאֵל וּמִתְנַדְּבִי וּמַיְיתִי.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said all spoils that the Jewish people take, this is as it is written “And the pots in the Lord’s house shall be like the basins before the altar.” However, according to the ones who said these two what “And the pots in the Lord’s house”? is saying something else: the Jewish people will become wealthy and bring donations
llm_translation: In peace, according to the one who says all the coins that Israel stole, as it is written: "And the pots in the house of the Lord shall be like the basins before the altar." But according to the one who says with two hin measures, what is "And the pots in the house of the Lord"? He is speaking of a different matter, that Israel should become wealthy, give willingly, and bring forth.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בִּיזָּה, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא יִהְיֶה כְנַעֲנִי עוֹד בְּבֵית ה׳ צְבָאוֹת״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי, מַאי ״וְלֹא יִהְיֶה כְנַעֲנִי״? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: אֵין כָּאן עָנִי.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said spoils, this is as it is written “And there shall no longer be a merchant [ kena’ani ] in the house of the Lord of hosts” However, according to the ones who said these two what “There shall no longer be a merchant”? Rabbi Yirmeya said: There is no poor person here [ ein kan ani ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, according to the one who says "coin," that is as it is written: "And there shall no longer be a Canaanite in the house of the Lord of hosts." But according to the one who says "here are two," what is "And there shall no longer be a Canaanite"? Rabbi Yirmiyah said: There is no poor person here.

hebrew_text: וּכְנַעֲנִי מְנָלַן דְּאִיקְּרִי תַּגָּר? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּרְא שָׁם יְהוּדָה בַּת אִישׁ כְּנַעֲנִי״. מַאי ״כְּנַעֲנִי״? אִילֵּימָא כְּנַעֲנִי מַמָּשׁ, אֶפְשָׁר בָּא אַבְרָהָם וְהִזְהִיר אֶת יִצְחָק, בָּא יִצְחָק וְהִזְהִיר אֶת יַעֲקֹב, וִיהוּדָה אָזֵיל וְנָסֵיב?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: בַּת גַּבְרָא תַּגָּרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״כְּנַעַן בְּיָדוֹ מֹאזְנֵי מִרְמָה״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״אֲשֶׁר סוֹחֲרֶיהָ שָׂרִים כִּנְעָנֶיהָ נִכְבַּדֵּי אָרֶץ״.
human_translation: And from where do we that a merchant can be called a kena’ani ? As it is written: “And Judah saw there the daughter of a certain kena’ani … What is kena’ani If you say an actual Canaanite, is it possible that Abraham warned Isaac Isaac warned Jacob and Judah went and married Rather, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: the daughter of a merchant, as it is written: “As for the merchant [ kena’an ], the balances of deceit are in his hand. He loves And if you wish, say “Whose traders are princes, whose merchants [ kinaneha ] are the honorable of the earth”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And where is it derived that they are called "Tagar"? As it is written: "And Judah saw there a daughter of a Canaanite man." What is meant by "Canaanite"? If you say a Canaanite literally, is it possible that Abraham came and warned Isaac, Isaac came and warned Jacob, and Judah went and married her?! Rather, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: A merchant's daughter is called Tagara, as it is written: "Canaan, his scales of deceit are in his hand." And if you wish, say it is derived from here: "Her traders are princes, her merchants are the honored of the earth."

hebrew_text: ״וְהָיָה ה׳ לְמֶלֶךְ עַל כׇּל הָאָרֶץ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִהְיֶה ה׳ אֶחָד וּשְׁמוֹ אֶחָד״. אַטּוּ הָאִידָּנָא לָאו אֶחָד הוּא?
human_translation: “And the Lord shall be King over all the earth, on that day shall the Lord be one and His name one” Is that to say that now He is not one?
llm_translation: "And the Lord shall be King over all the earth; in that day shall the Lord be One, and His name One." Now, is it not the case that currently He is not One?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: לֹא כָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, עַל בְּשׂוֹרוֹת טוֹבוֹת אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״, וְעַל בְּשׂוֹרוֹת רָעוֹת אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ דַּיַּין הָאֱמֶת״. לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, כּוּלּוֹ ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina said: The World-to-Come is not like this world. this world, upon good tidings one recites: Blessed…Who is good and does good, and over bad tidings one recites: Blessed…the true Judge. In the World-to-Come always Blessed…Who is good and does good.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said: Not like this world is the world to come. In this world, upon hearing good tidings one says, "Blessed is the good and the one who does good," and upon hearing bad tidings one says, "Blessed is the true Judge." In the world to come, it is all "the good and the one who does good."

hebrew_text: ״וּשְׁמוֹ אֶחָד״. מַאי ״אֶחָד״? אַטּוּ הָאִידָּנָא לָאו שְׁמוֹ אֶחָד הוּא?
human_translation: and His name one.” What one Is that to say that now His name is not one?
llm_translation: "And his name is One." What is "One"? Perhaps now, this one is not his name One?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לֹא כָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, נִכְתַּב בְּיוֹד הֵי וְנִקְרָא בְּאָלֶף דָּלֶת. אֲבָל לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא כּוּלּוֹ אֶחָד, נִקְרָא בְּיוֹד הֵי וְנִכְתַּב בְּיוֹד הֵי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: The World-to-Come is not like this world. In this world, is written with yod heh is read alef dalet . However, in the World-to-Come it will all be one, read with yod heh and written with yod heh .
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Not like this world is the world to come. This world, written with a yod hei and read with an alef dalet. But the world to come, entirely one, read with a yod hei and written with a yod hei.

hebrew_text: סְבַר רָבָא לְמִדְרְשַׁהּ בְּפִירְקָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא סָבָא: ״לְעַלֵּם״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rava thought to expound lecture A certain old man said to him: forever is written
llm_translation: Rava thought to go to the study hall in the village, that elder said to him: "לְעַלֵּם" is written.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבִינָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״זֶה שְּׁמִי לְעֹלָם״ — ״וְזֶה זִכְרִי לְדוֹר דּוֹר״. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: לֹא כְּשֶׁאֲנִי נִכְתָּב, אֲנִי נִקְרָא. נִכְתָּב אֲנִי בְּיוֹד הֵא, וְנִקְרָא אֲנִי בְּאָלֶף דָּלֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Avina raised a contradiction: It is written “This is My name forever,” “And this is My memorial unto all generations” the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I, not read as I am written. I am written with yod heh , and I am read with alef dalet .
llm_translation: Rabbi Avina said: It is written, "This is My name forever" — "and this is My memorial to all generations." The Holy One, blessed be He, said: I am not written as I am pronounced. I am written with a yod and a heh, but I am pronounced with an aleph and a dalet.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ אֵלּוּ עוֹבְרִין
llm_translation: We will return to you - These are the transgressors.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת מְלָאכָה בְּעַרְבֵי פְסָחִים עַד חֲצוֹת — עוֹשִׂין. מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲשׂוֹת — אֵין עוֹשִׂין. הַהוֹלֵךְ מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁעוֹשִׂין לְמָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין, אוֹ מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין לְמָקוֹם שֶׁעוֹשִׂין — נוֹתְנִין עָלָיו חוּמְרֵי מָקוֹם שֶׁיָּצָא מִשָּׁם וְחוּמְרֵי מָקוֹם שֶׁהָלַךְ לְשָׁם.
human_translation: a place where accustomed to perform labor on Passover eve until midday, one do a place where accustomed not to perform one not do travels from a place where perform to a place where do not perform or from a place where do not perform to a place where perform impose upon him the stringencies of the place from which he left and the stringencies of the place to which he went.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In a place where it is customary to work on the eve of Passover until midnight, they may do so. In a place where it is customary not to work, they may not work. One who goes from a place where they work to a place where they do not work, or from a place where they do not work to a place where they work, must observe the stricter practices of the place from which he came and the stricter practices of the place to which he is going.

hebrew_text: וְאַל יְשַׁנֶּה אָדָם מִפְּנֵי הַמַּחֲלוֹקֶת. כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ: הַמּוֹלִיךְ פֵּירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁכָּלוּ לִמְקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ, אוֹ מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לְמָקוֹם שֶׁכָּלוּ — חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: צֵא וְהָבֵא לְךָ אַף אַתָּה.
human_translation: And a person not deviate due to dispute. Similarly, who transports Sabbatical from a place has ceased to a place where it has not ceased or from a place where it has not ceased to a place where it has ceased is obligated to remove Rabbi Yehuda says You, too, go out and bring
llm_translation: And one should not sleep because of the dispute. For example: one who brings seventh-year fruits from a place where they have finished to a place where they have not finished, or from a place where they have not finished to a place where they have finished — he is obligated to burn them. Rabbi Yehuda says: Go and bring for yourself as well.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי אִירְיָא עַרְבֵי פְסָחִים? אֲפִילּוּ עַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וְעַרְבֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים נָמֵי! דְּתַנְיָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה סִימַן בְּרָכָה לְעוֹלָם! הָתָם, מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה הוּא דְּאָסוּר, סָמוּךְ לַמִּנְחָה — לָא. הָכָא — מֵחֲצוֹת. אִי נָמֵי: הָתָם, סִימָן בְּרָכָה הוּא דְּלָא חָזֵי, אֲבָל שַׁמּוֹתֵי לָא מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לֵיהּ. הָכָא — שַׁמּוֹתֵי נָמֵי מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Why particularly Passover eves? It even Shabbat eves and Festival eves as well, as it was taught One who performs labor on Shabbat eves and Festival eves from minḥa onward never sees a sign of blessing There, from minḥa onward; not adjacent to minḥa Here, from midday. Alternatively, there, a sign of blessing that he does not see; however, do not excommunicate him Here, also excommunicate him
llm_translation: Gemara: What is meant by "Erev Pesach"? Even Erev Shabbatot and Erev Yomim Tovim as well! As it was taught: One who performs labor on Erev Shabbatot and Yomim Tovim from Mincha onwards will never see a sign of blessing. There, from Mincha onwards it is prohibited, but close to Mincha - no. Here - from midday. If you wish: There, it is a sign of blessing that is not seen, but we do not rely on names. Here - we do rely on names.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וּבְעַרְבֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה, וּבְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת וּבְמוֹצָאֵי יוֹם טוֹב וּבְמוֹצָאֵי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וּבְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁם נִידְנוּד עֲבֵירָה, לְאֵתוֹיֵי תַּעֲנִית צִיבּוּר — אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה סִימַן בְּרָכָה לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: matter itself One who performs labor on Shabbat eves or on Festival eves from minḥa onward, the conclusion of Shabbat, the conclusion of a Festival, the conclusion of Yom Kippur, or on any occasion where there is a trace of sin, to include a communal fast, never sees a sign of blessing
llm_translation: Body: One who performs labor on Friday evenings and on the eves of Festivals from the time of the Minchah offering and onwards, and on the conclusion of Shabbat, and on the conclusion of a Festival, and on the conclusion of Yom Kippur, and in any place where there is a suspicion of sin, for the purpose of declaring a communal fast — he will never see a sign of blessing.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יֵשׁ זָרִיז וְנִשְׂכָּר, וְיֵשׁ זָרִיז וְנִפְסָד. יֵשׁ שָׁפָל וְנִשְׂכָּר, וְיֵשׁ שָׁפָל וְנִפְסָד. זָרִיז וְנִשְׂכָּר — דְּעָבֵיד כּוּלֵּי שַׁבְּתָא, וְלָא עָבֵיד בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא. זָרִיז וְנִפְסָד — דְּעָבֵיד כּוּלֵּי שַׁבְּתָא, וְעָבֵיד בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא. שָׁפָל וְנִשְׂכָּר — דְּלָא עָבֵיד כּוּלֵּי שַׁבְּתָא, וְלָא עָבֵיד בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא. שָׁפָל וְנִפְסָד — דְּלָא עָבֵיד כּוּלֵּי שַׁבְּתָא, וְעָבֵיד בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא. אָמַר רָבָא: הָנֵי נְשֵׁי דְמָחוֹזָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא עָבְדָן עֲבִידְתָּא בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא — מִשּׁוּם מְפַנְּקוּתָא הוּא, דְּהָא כׇּל יוֹמָא נָמֵי לָא קָא עָבְדָן. אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי — שָׁפָל וְנִשְׂכָּר קָרֵינַן לְהוּ.
human_translation: the Sages taught: There is diligent and rewarded and there is diligent and penalized there is lazy and rewarded; and there is lazy and penalized. Diligent and rewarded who works the entire week and does not work on Shabbat eve. Diligent and penalized works all week and works on Shabbat eve. Lazy and rewarded who does not work the entire week and does not work on Shabbat eve. Lazy and penalized not work the entire week and works on Shabbat eve Rava said: those women of Meḥoza, even though they do not perform labor on Shabbat eve, it is due to pampering, as neither do they work on any day. Even so, we call them lazy and rewarded.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There is one who is diligent and profits, and there is one who is diligent and suffers loss. There is one who is lazy and profits, and there is one who is lazy and suffers loss. Diligent and profits - he does all his work during the week and does not work on Shabbat. Diligent and suffers loss - he does all his work during the week and works on Shabbat. Lazy and profits - he does not do all his work during the week and does not work on Shabbat. Lazy and suffers loss - he does not do all his work during the week and works on Shabbat. Rava said: Those women of Machoza, even though they do not do work on Shabbat, work on the eve of Shabbat due to their delicacy, for every day they are not doing work. Even so, we call them lazy and profitable.

hebrew_text: רָבָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״כִּי גָדֹל עַד שָׁמַיִם חַסְדֶּךָ״, וּכְתִיב ״כִּי גָדֹל מֵעַל שָׁמַיִם חַסְדֶּךָ״. הָא כֵּיצַד? כָּאן בְּעוֹשִׂין לִשְׁמָהּ, וְכָאן בְּעוֹשִׂין שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ. וְכִדְרַב יְהוּדָה. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם יַעֲסוֹק אָדָם בְּתוֹרָה וּמִצְוֹת אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ, שֶׁמִּתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ בָּא לִשְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: Rava raised a contradiction: is written: “For Your mercy is great unto the heavens, and it is written “For Your mercy is great above the heavens, How so? Here, one performs for its own sake; and here, one performs not for its own sake. as Rav Yehuda said Rav said: A person should always engage in Torah mitzvot, even if not for their sake, as through not for their sake, comes for their sake.
llm_translation: Rava raises a contradiction: It is written, "For great to the heavens is Your kindness," and it is written, "For great above the heavens is Your kindness." How so? Here it refers to acts done for its own sake, and here it refers to acts not done for its own sake. And like Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person should always engage in Torah and mitzvot even not for their own sake, for through not for their own sake, one comes to do them for their own sake.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְצַפֶּה לִשְׂכַר אִשְׁתּוֹ וְרֵיחַיִם — אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה סִימַן בְּרָכָה לְעוֹלָם. שְׂכַר אִשְׁתּוֹ — מַתְקוּלְתָּא. רִיחְיָיא — אַגְרָתָא. אֲבָל עָבְדָה וּמְזַבְּנָה — אִישְׁתַּבּוֹחֵי מִשְׁתַּבַּח בָּהּ קְרָא דִּכְתִיב: ״סָדִין עָשְׂתָה וַתִּמְכֹּר״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who anticipates the earnings of his wife or a mill never sees a sign of blessing Earnings of his wife a scale mill rent However, if a woman works and sells the verse praises her, as it is written “She made a cloak and sold it,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who anticipates the reward for being intimate with his wife and for fragrances - he will never see a sign of blessing. Reward for his wife - a stumbling block. Fragrances - a loss. But if he serves her and honors her - he will be blessed in her, as it is written: "She made a linen garment and sold it."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמִּשְׂתַּכֵּר בְּקָנִים וּבְקַנְקַנִּים — אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה סִימַן בְּרָכָה לְעוֹלָם. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דִּנְפִישׁ אַפְחָזַיְיהוּ — שָׁלְטָא בְּהוּ עֵינָא. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: תַּגָּרֵי סִימְטָא, וּמְגַדְּלֵי בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה, וְקוֹצְצֵי אִילָנוֹת טוֹבוֹת, וְנוֹתְנִין עֵינֵיהֶן בְּחֵלֶק יָפֶה — אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה סִימַן בְּרָכָה לְעוֹלָם, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּתָהוּ בֵּיהּ אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who earns from rods or jugs will never see a sign of blessing What is the reason Since their volume the eye dominates them. the Sages taught: Merchants in an alleyway [ simta ] and those who raise small livestock, and those who chop down good trees, those who direct their eyes to the fine portion never see a sign of blessing What is the reason that people wonder about him
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who engages in commerce with reeds and with glassware — he never sees a sign of blessing forever. What is the reason? Since people are envious of him, the evil eye has power over him. The Rabbis taught: Those who weave fine linen, raise small cattle, prune good trees, and place their eyes on a beautiful portion — they never see a sign of blessing forever. What is the reason? Because people are envious of them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, אַרְבַּע פְּרוּטוֹת אֵין בָּהֶן סִימָן בְּרָכָה לְעוֹלָם: שְׂכַר כּוֹתְבִין, וּשְׂכַר מְתוּרְגְּמָנִין, וּשְׂכַר יְתוֹמִים, וּמָעוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: the Sages taught: In four perutot , there is never a sign of blessing: Wages of scribes wages of disseminators, payment of orphans, and money that comes from a country overseas.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Four things have no sign of blessing forever: wages of scribes, wages of translators, wages of orphans, and funds that come from overseas.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא שְׂכַר מְתוּרְגְּמָנִין — מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיחֲזֵי כִּשְׂכַר שַׁבָּת. וּמָעוֹת יְתוֹמִים נָמֵי — לָאו בְּנֵי מְחִילָה נִינְהוּ. מָעוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָאו כׇּל יוֹמָא מִתְרְחִישׁ נִיסָּא.
human_translation: Granted, wages of disseminators, as it appears as wages Shabbat, And orphans’ money, are not capable of relinquishing money that comes from a country overseas, a miracle does not transpire every day.
llm_translation: In truth, the wages of translators - because it appears like the wages of Shabbat. And the money of orphans is trustworthy - they are not the sons of Mechilah. The money that comes from the province of the sea - because miracles do not occur every day.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שְׂכַר כּוֹתְבִין מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע תַּעֲנִיּוֹת יָשְׁבוּ אַנְשֵׁי כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה עַל כּוֹתְבֵי סְפָרִים תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת שֶׁלֹּא יִתְעַשְּׁרוּ, שֶׁאִילְמָלֵי מִתְעַשְּׁרִין — אֵין כּוֹתְבִין. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כּוֹתְבֵי סְפָרִים תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת, הֵן, וְתַגָּרֵיהֶן, וְתַגָּרֵי תַגָּרֵיהֶן, וְכׇל הָעוֹסְקִין בִּמְלֶאכֶת שָׁמַיִם, לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מוֹכְרֵי תְכֵלֶת — אֵינָן רוֹאִין סִימָן בְּרָכָה לְעוֹלָם. וְאִם עוֹסְקִין לִשְׁמָהּ — רוֹאִין.
human_translation: what is the reason wages of scribes? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The members of the Great Assembly observed twenty-four fasts, for scribes scrolls, phylacteries, and mezuzot , so that they will not become wealthy as were they become wealthy, they write the Sages taught: Scribes scrolls, phylacteries, and mezuzot ; their merchants, their merchants’ merchants; and all those engaged in the work of Heaven to include those who sell the sky-blue never see a sign of blessing And if they engage for their own sake, they see
llm_translation: Rather, why do they write "reward"? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Twenty-four fasts the men of the Great Assembly imposed on the writers of books, phylacteries, and mezuzot, so that they should not become wealthy. For if they were to become wealthy, they would not write. The Sages taught: Writers of books, phylacteries, and mezuzot, their wives, and the wives of their students, and the wives of the students of their students, and all who are engaged in the work of Heaven, for the purpose of the sellers of techelet — they do not see a sign of blessing forever. But if they engage in it for its own sake — they see.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי בַיְישָׁן נְהוּג דְּלָא הֲווֹ אָזְלִין מִצּוֹר לְצִידוֹן בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא. אֲתוֹ בְּנַיְיהוּ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֲבָהָתִין אֶפְשָׁר לְהוּ, אֲנַן לָא אֶפְשָׁר לַן. אֲמַר לְהוּ: כְּבָר קִיבְּלוּ אֲבוֹתֵיכֶם עֲלֵיהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שְׁמַע בְּנִי מוּסַר אָבִיךָ וְאַל תִּטּוֹשׁ תּוֹרַת אִמֶּךָ״.
human_translation: The residents of Beit She’an were accustomed not to travel from Tyre to Sidon on Shabbat eve. Their children came before Rabbi Yoḥanan They said to him: our fathers however, it is not possible for us He said to them: Your fathers already accepted upon themselves, as it is stated: “My son, hear your father’s rebuke and do not abandon your mother’s teaching”
llm_translation: Sons of Bayshan were accustomed that they would not go from Tzor to Tzidon on Shabbat eve. Their sons came before Rabbi Yochanan, they said to him: Our fathers were able to do so, but we are not able. He said to them: Your fathers already accepted it upon themselves, as it is stated: "Hear, my son, the instruction of your father, and do not forsake the teaching of your mother."

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי חוֹזָאֵי נָהֲגִי דְּמַפְרְשִׁי חַלָּה מֵאָרוֹזָא, אֲתוֹ וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַב יוֹסֵף. אֲמַר לְהוּ: נֵיכְלַהּ זָר בְּאַפַּיְיהוּ. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: דְּבָרִים הַמּוּתָּרִים וַאֲחֵרִים נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן אִיסּוּר —
human_translation: The residents Ḥozai were accustomed to separate ḥalla from rice They came and told Rav Yosef He said to them: Let a non-priest eat in their presence Abaye raised an objection to him: matters permitted, but others were accustomed to them prohibition,
llm_translation: Sons of Ḥozai practiced that they would separate challah from dough in Ẓorza, they came and said to Rav Yosef. He said to them: A stranger consumed it with their fire. Abaye raised an objection: Permissible matters and others they conducted with prohibition —

hebrew_text: אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְהַתִּירָן בִּפְנֵיהֶם. אָמַר לוֹ: וְלָאו מִי אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּכוּתָאֵי! כּוּתָאֵי מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דִּמְסָרְכִי מִילְּתָא, הָנָךְ אִינָשֵׁי נָמֵי סָרְכִי מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: you are not allowed to permit said to And wasn’t it stated Rav Ḥisda said: with regard to Samaritans? What is the reason Samaritans? they will extend matter These people will also extend matter
llm_translation: You are not permitted to permit them in their presence. He said to him: But who has been said about it? Rav Ḥisdah said: In the villages! Why in the villages? What is the reason? Because the matter was handed over, those people also handed over the matter.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חָזֵינַן אִי רוּבָּן אוֹרֶז אָכְלִי — לָא נֵיכְלַהּ זָר בְּאַפַּיְיהוּ, דִּילְמָא מִשְׁתַּכְחָא תּוֹרַת חַלָּה מִינַּיְיהוּ. וְאִי רוּבָּן דָּגָן אָכְלִי — נֵיכְלַהּ זָר בְּאַפַּיְיהוּ, דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפְרוֹשֵׁי מִן הַחִיּוּב עַל הַפְּטוּר, וּמִן הַפְּטוּר עַל הַחִיּוּב.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: We see, if the majority eat rice, not let a non-priest eat in their presence, lest the category ḥalla be forgotten from them. And if most of them eat grain, a non-priest eat in their presence, lest they separate from is a requirement, on behalf of an exemption, or from that which is an exemption on behalf of that which is a requirement,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: We have seen that if they ate mostly rice, a non-Jew did not eat with them, lest the law of challah be forgotten from them. And if they ate mostly wheat, a non-Jew did eat with them, lest it come to be distinguished between what is obligated and what is exempt.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, דְּבָרִים הַמּוּתָּרִין וַאֲחֵרִים נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן אִיסּוּר — אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְהַתִּירָן בִּפְנֵיהֶן. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּכוּתָאֵי עָסְקִינַן. וְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: רוֹחֲצִין שְׁנֵי אַחִין כְּאֶחָד, וְאֵין רוֹחֲצִין שְׁנֵי אַחִין בְּכָבוּל. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בִּיהוּדָה וְהִלֵּל בָּנָיו שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁרָחֲצוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּאֶחָד בְּכָבוּל, וְלָעֲזָה עֲלֵיהֶן כׇּל הַמְּדִינָה, אָמְרוּ: מִיָּמֵינוּ לֹא רָאִינוּ כָּךְ. וְנִשְׁמַט הִלֵּל וְיָצָא לַבַּיִת הַחִיצוֹן, וְלֹא רָצָה לוֹמַר לָהֶן: מוּתָּרִין אַתֶּם.
human_translation: matter itself. matters permitted but others were accustomed to them prohibition, you are not allowed to permit Rav Ḥisda said: We are dealing with Samaritans, And doesn’t to everyone? Wasn’t it taught Two brothers may bathe together, However, two brothers do not bathe together in Kabul And an incident involving Yehuda and Hillel, sons of Rabban Gamliel, who bathed together in Kabul, and the entire city denounced them said: In all our days we have never seen that Hillel stole and went out to the outer chamber and did not want to tell them: You are permitted
llm_translation: The body, things permitted and others they acted with prohibition - if you are not authorized to permit them in their presence. Rav Ḥisdah said: We are dealing with Kutaei. But isn't this the practice of the entire world? And it was taught: Brothers may wash together as one, but brothers may not wash together in a group. And there was an incident with Judah and Hillel, the sons of Rabban Gamliel, who washed together as one in a group, and the entire province criticized them, saying: We have never seen such a thing in our days. Hillel slipped away and went out to the outer room, and he did not want to say to them: You are permitted.

hebrew_text: יוֹצְאִים בְּקוֹרְדָּקֵיסוֹן בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְאֵין יוֹצְאִין בְּקוֹרְדָּקֵיסוֹן בַּשַּׁבָּת בְּבֵירֵי. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בִּיהוּדָה וְהִלֵּל בָּנָיו שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁיָּצְאוּ בְּקוֹרְדָּקֵיסוֹן בַּשַּׁבָּת בְּבֵירֵי, וְלָעֲזָה עֲלֵיהֶן הַמְּדִינָה, וְאָמְרוּ: מִיָּמֵינוּ לֹא רָאִינוּ כָּךְ. וּשְׁמָטוּם וּנְתָנוּם לְעַבְדֵיהֶן, וְלֹא רָצוּ לוֹמַר לָהֶן: מוּתָּרִין אַתֶּם.
human_translation: one go out with wide shoes on Shabbat; however, one does not go out with wide shoes Birei. And an incident involving Yehuda and Hillel, sons of Rabban Gamliel, who went out with wide shoes in Birei, and the city denounced them and said: In all our days we have never seen that And removed and gave them to their servants, and did not want to tell You are permitted
llm_translation: Outgoing in Cordakaison on Shabbat, and not outgoing in Cordakaison on Shabbat in Beirei. And it happened with Judah and Hillel his sons of Rabban Gamliel that they went out in Cordakaison on Shabbat in Beirei, and the government imposed a fine on them, and they said: "In our days we have not seen such." And they released them and gave them to their servants, and they did not want to say to them: "You are permitted."

hebrew_text: וְיוֹשְׁבִין עַל סַפְסַלֵּי גּוֹיִם בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְאֵינָן יוֹשְׁבִין עַל סַפְסַלֵּי גוֹיִם בַּשַּׁבָּת בְּעַכּוֹ. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁיָּשַׁב עַל סַפְסַלֵּי גוֹיִם בַּשַּׁבָּת בְּעַכּוֹ, וְלָעֲזָה עָלָיו כׇּל הַמְּדִינָה, אָמְרוּ: מִיָּמֵינוּ לֹא רָאִינוּ כָּךְ. נִשְׁמַט עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע, וְלֹא רָצָה לוֹמַר לָהֶן: מוּתָּרִין אַתֶּם. בְּנֵי מְדִינַת הַיָּם נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי רַבָּנַן גַּבַּיְיהוּ — כְּכוּתִים דָּמוּ.
human_translation: one may sit on gentiles’ stools on Shabbat, But one may not sit on gentiles' stools on Shabbat in the city of Akko. And an incident involving Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who sat on gentiles’ stools on Shabbat in Akko, and the entire city denounced him. They said: In all our days we have never seen that moved onto the ground and did not want to tell them: You are permitted people in the cities, since Sages are not found among them, is like the Samaritans.
llm_translation: And they sit on the benches of non-Jews on Shabbat, but they do not sit on the benches of non-Jews on Shabbat in Akko. And there was an incident with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who sat on the benches of non-Jews on Shabbat in Akko, and the entire province mocked him, saying: "In our days we have not seen such a thing." He fell to the ground and did not want to say to them: "You are permitted." The people of the coastal region are trustworthy, since the Rabbis are not commonly found among them - their actions are like the Kutim.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא סַפְסַלֵּי גוֹיִם, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִחֲזֵי כְּמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר. בְּקוֹרְדָּקֵיסוֹן נָמֵי, דִּילְמָא מִשְׁתַּלְּפִין וְאָתֵי לְאֵיתוֹיִינְהוּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: Granted, gentiles’ stools because it appears like in buying and selling wide shoes as well, lest they fall off and he come to carry them four cubits in the public domain,
llm_translation: In truth, the benches of the Gentiles, because they appear as merchandise and trade. In Cordakison, it is possible that they may become uprooted and come to a distance of four cubits in a public domain.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רוֹחֲצִין מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? כִּדְתַנְיָא: עִם הַכֹּל אָדָם רוֹחֵץ, חוּץ מֵאָבִיו וְחָמִיו וּבַעַל אִמּוֹ וּבַעַל אֲחוֹתוֹ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר בְּאָבִיו מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד אָבִיו, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְבַעַל אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: However, what is the reason that may not bathe was taught A person bathe with anyone except for his father, and his father-in-law, and his mother’s husband, and his sister’s husband. And Rabbi Yehuda permits with his father, due to the honor his father The same is true for one’s mother’s husband.
llm_translation: Rather, washing, what is the reason for not? As it was taught: With everyone a person washes, except for his father and his father-in-law and his mother's husband and his sister's husband. And Rabbi Yehuda permits with his father because of the honor of his father, and the same applies to his mother's husband.

hebrew_text: וַאֲתוֹ אִינְהוּ וּגְזוּר בִּשְׁנֵי אַחִין מִשּׁוּם בַּעַל אֲחוֹתוֹ. תָּנָא: תַּלְמִיד לֹא יִרְחַץ עִם רַבּוֹ, וְאִם רַבּוֹ צָרִיךְ לוֹ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And came and issued a decree for two brothers, due to one’s sister’s husband. It was taught A student may not bathe with his teacher, But if his teacher requires his it is permitted.
llm_translation: They came and decreed regarding two brothers because of the husband of their sister. It was taught: A student may not bathe with his teacher, but if his teacher needs him, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה, אֲכַל דְּאַיִּיתְרָא. עוּל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַב עַוִּירָא סָבָא וְרַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזִינְהוּ כַּסְּיֵיהּ מִינַּיְיהוּ. אֲתוֹ וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְאַבָּיֵי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: שַׁוִוינְכוּ כְּכוּתָאֵי.
human_translation: When Rabba bar bar Ḥana came he ate over the straight part Rav Avira the Elder and Rabba, son Rav Huna, entered to When he saw them he concealed from them They came and told Abaye he said to them: he rendered you Samaritans,
llm_translation: When Rabba bar bar Ḥana came, he ate more. Rav Avira the Elder, and Rabba son of Rav Huna, sat before him. When they saw that he was satiated from them, they came and said to Abbaye. He said to them: "You have compared yourselves to Kutai."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה לֵית לֵיהּ הָא דִּתְנַן נוֹתְנִין עָלָיו חוּמְרֵי הַמָּקוֹם שֶׁיָּצָא מִשָּׁם וְחוּמְרֵי הַמָּקוֹם שֶׁהָלַךְ לְשָׁם? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָנֵי מִילֵּי מִבָּבֶל לְבָבֶל, וּמֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִי נָמֵי, מִבָּבֶל לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אֲבָל מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְבָבֶל — לָא. כֵּיוָן דַּאֲנַן כַּיְיפִינַן לְהוּ, עָבְדִינַן כְּווֹתַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And is Rabba bar bar Ḥana not that which we learned impose upon him the stringencies of the place from which he left and the stringencies of the place to which he went? Abaye said: That applies from in Babylonia to in Babylonia, or from in Eretz Yisrael to in Eretz Yisrael, or alternatively, from Babylonia to Eretz Yisrael. However, from Eretz Yisrael to Babylonia, no, Since we, are subordinate to them we act in accordance with their
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana has no answer to this question that we learned: "One may place upon it the animal the stringencies of the place from which it came out and the stringencies of the place to which it went." Abbaye said: Those stringencies apply from Babylon to Babylon, and from the Land of Israel to the Land of Israel. If you wish, they apply from Babylon to the Land of Israel. But from the Land of Israel to Babylon — no. Since we are like them, we treat them according to their custom.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְבָבֶל, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאֵין דַּעְתּוֹ לַחֲזוֹר, וְרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה דַּעְתּוֹ לַחֲזוֹר הֲוָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה לִבְנֵיהּ: בְּנִי, לֹא תֹּאכַל לֹא בְּפָנַי וְלֹא שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנַי. אֲנִי שֶׁרָאִיתִי אֶת רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שֶׁאָכַל — כְּדַי הוּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לִסְמוֹךְ עָלָיו בְּפָנָיו וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו. אַתָּה לֹא רָאִיתָ אוֹתוֹ, לֹא תֹּאכַל בֵּין בְּפָנַי בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנַי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say that from Eretz Yisrael to Babylonia, this applies only when his intent is not to return. Rabba bar bar Ḥana’s intent was to return Rabba bar bar Ḥana said to his son: My son, do not eat neither in my presence nor not in my presence. I, who saw Rabbi Yoḥanan eat Rabbi Yoḥanan is worthy to rely upon him in his presence and not in his presence. You did not see him. do not eat in my presence nor not in my presence,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if one says from the land of Israel to Babylon, those words where there is no intention to return, and Rabbah bar bar Ḥana had the intention to return. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said to his sons: My sons, do not eat neither in my presence nor not in my presence. I saw Rabbi Yoḥanan eat — Rabbi Yoḥanan would lean on it in his presence and not in his presence. You did not see him, do not eat whether in my presence or not in my presence.

hebrew_text: ופְלִיגָא דִּידֵיהּ אַדִּידֵיהּ. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה, סָח לִי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: פַּעַם אַחַת נִכְנַסְתִּי אַחַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן לָקוֹנְיָא לַגִּינָּה,
human_translation: And his disagrees with his, as Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Elazar told me: Once I followed Rabbi Shimon ben Rabbi Yosei ben Lakonya into the garden
llm_translation: And a dispute of his, of his. For Rabba bar bar Ḥana said, "Rabbi Yoḥanan ben El'azar told me: Once I entered after Rabbi Shim'on ben Rabbi Yose ben Laqunya into the garden,"

hebrew_text: וְנָטַל סְפִיחֵי כְרוּב וְאָכַל וְנָתַן לִי, וְאָמַר לִי: בְּנִי, בְּפָנַי — אֱכוֹל, שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנַי — לֹא תֹּאכַל. אֲנִי שֶׁרָאִיתִי אֶת רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי שֶׁאָכַל — כְּדַי הוּא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי לִסְמוֹךְ עָלָיו בְּפָנָיו וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו. אַתָּה — בְּפָנַי אֱכוֹל, שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנַי — לֹא תֹּאכַל.
human_translation: and he took cabbage after-growths and ate and gave to me. And he said to me: My son, in my presence, you may eat not in my presence, you may not eat I, who saw Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai eat, Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai is worthy to rely upon him both in his presence and not in his presence. You, in my presence, eat; not in my presence, do not eat.
llm_translation: And he shall take the fine flour of the meal-offering, and he shall eat it, and he shall give it to me, and he said to me: "My son, in my presence - eat, not in my presence - do not eat." I saw Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai eat - as much as Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai relied on him in his presence and not in his presence. You - in my presence eat, not in my presence - do not eat.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַסְּפִיחִים אֲסוּרִין, חוּץ מִסְּפִיחֵי כְּרוּב, שֶׁאֵין כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן בְּיָרָק הַשָּׂדֶה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הַסְּפִיחִין אֲסוּרִים.
human_translation: What Rabbi Shimon? As it was taught Rabbi Shimon says: All after-growths are prohibited except for the after-growths of cabbage, as there is nothing similar to them among the vegetables in the field. And the Rabbis say: All after-growths are prohibited,
llm_translation: What is Rabbi Shimon's opinion? For it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: All types of vegetables are prohibited, except for the vegetables of the beet, as there is nothing similar to them in the field. And the Sages say: All types of vegetables are prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״הֵן לֹא נִזְרָע וְלֹא נֶאֱסֹף אֶת תְּבוּאָתֵנוּ״, אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁאֵין זוֹרְעִין מֵהֵיכָא אוֹסְפִין? מִכָּאן לַסְּפִיחִין שֶׁהֵן אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: The Gemara comments: And both in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. As it was taught Behold, we may not sow, nor gather our crops” Rabbi Akiva said: And since they cannot sow, from where would they gather? from here that after-growths is prohibited.
llm_translation: And their dispute is in the case of Rabbi Akiva. As it was taught: "If we do not sow and do not gather our produce," Rabbi Akiva said: Since when do we gather from where we did not sow? From here we learn about s'fichin that they are prohibited.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: גָּזְרִינַן סְפִיחֵי כְרוּב אַטּוּ שְׁאָר סְפִיחֵי דְעָלְמָא, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: לָא גָּזְרִינַן סְפִיחֵי כְרוּב אַטּוּ סְפִיחֵי דְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? The Rabbis, hold: We issue a decree cabbage after-growths due to other after-growths in general. And Rabbi Shimon holds: We do not issue a decree cabbage after-growths due to other after-growths in general.
llm_translation: With what do they argue? The Rabbis hold: We decree the sifting of carob pods but not the sifting of other pods of the world. And Rabbi Shimon holds: We do not decree the sifting of carob pods but we do decree the sifting of other pods of the world.

hebrew_text: הַהוֹלֵךְ מִמָּקוֹם וְכוּ׳. בִּשְׁלָמָא הַהוֹלֵךְ מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁעוֹשִׂין לְמָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין — נוֹתְנִין עָלָיו חוּמְרֵי מָקוֹם שֶׁהָלַךְ לְשָׁם, וְאַל יְשַׁנֶּה אָדָם מִפְּנֵי הַמַּחְלוֹקֶת וְלָא לֶיעְבֵּיד.
human_translation: one who travels from a place Granted, one who travels from a place where people perform labor to a place where they do not perform labor, impose upon him the stringencies of the place to which he went, and a person should not deviate due to dispute, and not perform
llm_translation: The one who goes from a place, etc. Granted, the one who goes from a place where they do to a place where they do not do - they impose upon him the stringencies of the place to which he went, and a person should not deviate because of an argument and not to cause distress.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין לְמָקוֹם שֶׁעוֹשִׂין, אַל יְשַׁנֶּה אָדָם מִפְּנֵי הַמַּחְלוֹקֶת וְנַעְבֵּיד? הָא אָמְרַתְּ: ״נוֹתְנִין עָלָיו חוּמְרֵי מָקוֹם שֶׁהָלַךְ לְשָׁם וְחוּמְרֵי מָקוֹם שֶׁיָּצָא מִשָּׁם״!
human_translation: However, from a place where do not perform to a place where they perform a person should not deviate due to conflict, and perform Didn’t you say: impose upon him the stringencies of the place to which he went and the stringencies of the place from which he left?
llm_translation: Rather, from a place where they do not do to a place where they do, should a person not change due to the dispute and bring? But didn't you say: "We impose upon him the stringencies of the place where he went and the stringencies of the place from which he departed"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אַרֵישָׁא. רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם אַסֵּיפָא, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין בָּזוֹ מִפְּנֵי שִׁינּוּי הַמַּחְלוֹקֶת. מַאי קָא אָמְרַתְּ — הָרוֹאֶה אוֹמֵר מְלָאכָה אֲסוּרָה? מֵימָר אָמְרִי: כַּמָּה בַּטְלָנֵי הָוֵי בְּשׁוּקָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: to the first Rava said: Actually, to the latter this is what it is saying: does not a deviation dispute. What are you saying; one who sees will say that labor is prohibited, they will say: How many idle people there are in the market
llm_translation: Abaye said: Initially. Rava said: Always the latter. And thus he said: One does not despise the latter due to the change in the dispute. What is he saying? — Is the one who sees and says that work is prohibited? The Gemara said: How many idle people are there in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב סָפְרָא לְרַבִּי אַבָּא: כְּגוֹן אֲנַן דְּיָדְעִינַן בִּקְבִיעָא דְיַרְחָא,
human_translation: Rav Safra said to Rabbi Abba: like us, who, know the determination of the month
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Safra to Rabbi Abba: "Like us who know the fixed time of the month,"

hebrew_text: בַּיִּישּׁוּב לָא עָבֵידְנָא מִפְּנֵי שִׁינּוּי הַמַּחְלוֹקֶת. בַּמִּדְבָּר מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב אַמֵּי: בַּיִּישּׁוּב אָסוּר, בַּמִּדְבָּר מוּתָּר.
human_translation: we do not perform labor in the settled area due to deviation dispute, in the desert what is He said to him this Rav Ami said: In a settled area it is prohibited; in the desert it is permitted.
llm_translation: In returning, we do not act due to the change in the dispute. In the wilderness, what? He said to him: Thus said Rav Ammi: In returning it is prohibited, in the wilderness it is permitted.

hebrew_text: רַב נָתָן בַּר אָסְיָא אֲזַל מִבֵּי רַב לְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי שֶׁל עֲצֶרֶת. שַׁמְתֵּיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּלְנַגְּדֵיהּ מָר נַגֹּידֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֲדִיפָא עֲבַדִי לֵיהּ, דִּבְמַעְרְבָא מִימְּנוּ אַנִּגְידָּא דְּבַר בֵּי רַב, וְלָא מִימְּנוּ אַשַּׁמְתָּא.
human_translation: Rav Natan bar Asya traveled from Rav’s hall to Pumbedita on the second day of Assembly, Rav Yosef excommunicated him Abaye said to Let the Master flog said to him: I him more severely, as in Eretz Yisrael they vote to flog a Torah scholar, but do not vote to excommunication,
llm_translation: Rav Natan bar Asya went from the house of Rav to Pumbedita on the second day of Shemini Atzeret. Rav Yosef placed him there. Abbaye said to him: "And opposite him are the leaders!" He said to him: "My master is preferable, for in the west, we would say a matter of the house of Rav, and not a matter of the academy."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: נַגְּדֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: נְשַׁמְּתֵיהּ מָר, דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מְנַדִּין עַל שְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל גָּלִיּוֹת! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי — אִינִישׁ דְּעָלְמָא. הָכָא, צוּרְבָּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן הוּא — דְּטָבָא לֵיהּ עֲבַדִי. דִּבְמַעְרְבָא מִימְּנוּ אַנִּגְדְּתָא דְּבַר בֵּי רַב, וְלָא מִימְּנוּ אַשַּׁמְתָּא.
human_translation: Some say: Rav Yosef flog him. Abaye said to Let the Master excommunicate him, as Rav and Shmuel who both say one excommunicates for the second day of the Festival in the Diaspora. said to him: That applies to an ordinary person. Here, he is a Torah scholar. I did what was best for him, as in Eretz Yisrael they vote to flog a Torah scholar but do not vote to excommunication.
llm_translation: There are those who say: In front of him, Rav Yosef. Abaye said to him: His soul is bitter, for Rav and Shmuel used to say about him that they would deliberate for two good days of festivals! He said to him: Those matters - are of this world. Here, it is a dispute among the Sages - for it is beneficial for him. For in the west, opposite the house of Rav, and not opposite the house of Shmuel.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ הַמּוֹלִיךְ פֵּירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית וְכוּ׳. וְלֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָא דִּתְנַן: נוֹתְנִין עָלָיו חוּמְרֵי הַמָּקוֹם שֶׁיָּצָא מִשָּׁם וְחוּמְרֵי הַמָּקוֹם שֶׁהָלַךְ לְשָׁם?!
human_translation: Similarly, who transports Sabbatical produce And is Rabbi Yehuda not that which we learned impose upon him the stringencies of the place from which he left and the stringencies of the place to which he went?
llm_translation: As an example of this: one who leads out seventh-year produce, etc. And it is not according to Rabbi Yehuda, as we learned: One places upon it the stringencies of the place from which it came out and the stringencies of the place to which it went?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: מִילְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אוֹ מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לְמָקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ, וְשָׁמַע שֶׁכָּלוּ בִּמְקוֹמוֹ — חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: צֵא וְהָבֵא לְךָ אַף אַתָּה מֵהֵיכָא דְּאַיְיתִינְהוּ, וְהָא לָא כָּלוּ לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son Rav Idi, said: Rabbi Yehuda is stating a different matter, and this is what is saying: Or from a place where has not ceased to a place where it has not ceased and he heard that it ceased in his location, he is required to remove Rabbi Yehuda says: You, too, go out and bring from a place where they remain in the field, as they have not ceased
llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: The final matter Rabbi Yehuda was stating, and thus he said: From a place where they did not finish to a place where they did not finish, and hear that they finished in their place — one is obligated to burn. Rabbi Yehuda says: Go out and bring for yourself also from where I brought them, and behold, they did not finish for him.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְקוּלָּא קָאָמַר? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֶלָּא לְחוּמְרָא! אֶלָּא אֵיפוֹךְ — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: צֵא וְהָבֵא לְךָ אַף אַתָּה מֵהֵיכָא דְּאַיְיתִינְהוּ, וְהָא כָּלוּ לְהוּ.
human_translation: Is that to say Rabbi Yehuda is stating as a leniency Didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: Rabbi Yehuda stated as a stringency? Rather, reverse he is not required to remove Rabbi Yehuda says: You, too, go out and bring from where I brought them, and ceased
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Yehuda, is he expressing a lenient view? But didn't Rabbi Elazar say: Rabbi Yehuda only stated it as a stringency! Rather, the opposite - one is not obligated to burn it. Rabbi Yehuda says: Go and bring for yourself also from where I brought them, and they will be consumed for you.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם כִּדְקָתָנֵי, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אוֹ מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לְמָקוֹם שֶׁכָּלוּ, וְהֶחְזִירָן לִמְקוֹמָן וַעֲדַיִין לֹא כָּלוּ — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְבַעֵר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: צֵא וְהָבֵא לְךָ אַף אַתָּה מֵהֵיכָא דְּאַיְיתִינְהוּ, וְהָא כָּלוּ לְהוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: Actually, as it is taught, and this is what is saying: Or, from a place where it has not ceased to a place where it has ceased and he returned to their place have still not ceased he is not required to remove Rabbi Yehuda says: You, too, go out and bring from where I brought them, and hasn’t ceased
llm_translation: Abaye said: Always as it is taught, and thus he said: Or from a place where they did not finish to a place where they did finish, and they returned them to their place and they still did not finish - one is not obligated to burn. Rabbi Yehuda says: Go and bring for yourself also from where I brought them, and they finished there.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַטּוּ אַגַּבָּא דְחַמְרָא קַלְטִינְהוּ?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְהָנֵי תַנָּאֵי, דִּתְנַן: הַכּוֹבֵשׁ שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּבָשִׁין בְּחָבִית אַחַת, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אוֹכְלִין עַל הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi strongly objects to this: Is that to say Rabbi Yehuda, did the back of the donkey absorb Rather, Rav Ashi said: to the dispute of these tanna’im , as we learned one who preserves three preserves in one barrel Rabbi Eliezer says: One may eat on the first.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Ashi raised an objection to him: According to Rabbi Yehuda, should we really soak them in wine vinegar?! Rather, Rav Ashi said: In the dispute of those Tannaim, as we learned: One who traps three lambs in one trap, Rabbi Eliezer says: One may eat from the first.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הָאַחֲרוֹן. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁכָּלָה מִינוֹ מִן הַשָּׂדֶה — יְבַעֵר מִינוֹ מִן הֶחָבִית, וַהֲלָכָה כִּדְבָרָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: even on the final Rabban Gamliel says: Any whose type has ceased from the field, he remove its type from the barrel and the halakha is in accordance with his statement.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Even on the last day. Rabban Gamliel says: Anything whose species is from the field - its species should be removed from the barrel, and the halakha is according to his words.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְהָנֵי תַנָּאֵי, דִּתְנַן: אוֹכְלִין בִּתְמָרִין עַד שֶׁיִּכְלֶה הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁבְּצוֹעַר. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Ravina said: to the dispute of these tanna’im , as we learned One may eat dates until the last in Tzoar, ceased Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says:
llm_translation: Ravinah said: In the dispute of those Tannaim, as we learned: One may eat dates until the last one in Tzoar is consumed. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says:

hebrew_text: אוֹכְלִין עַל שֶׁל בֵּין הַכִּיפִּין, וְאֵין אוֹכְלִין עַל שֶׁבֵּין הַשִּׁיצִין.
human_translation: One eating on between the palm branches. But one not eating on between the thorn branches,
llm_translation: Eating on that which is between the cups is permitted, but eating on that which is between the shards is not permitted.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם, שָׁלֹשׁ אֲרָצוֹת לְבִיעוּר: יְהוּדָה, וְעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן, וְגָלִיל. וְשָׁלֹשׁ אֲרָצוֹת בְּכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת. וְלָמָה אָמְרוּ שָׁלֹשׁ אֲרָצוֹת לְבִיעוּר? שֶׁיִּהְיוּ אוֹכְלִין בְּכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת עַד שֶׁיִּכְלֶה הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁבָּהּ.
human_translation: We learned there three lands to removal, Judea, Transjordan, and the Galilee. And three lands in each and every one And why did say three lands to removal that will eat in each and every one until ceases in the last it.
llm_translation: We learned there: Three lands for Biur: Yehudah, Ever HaYarden, and Galil. And three lands in each and every one. And why did they say three lands for Biur? So that they may eat in each and every one until the last one in it is finished.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר עוּקְבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְלִבְהֶמְתְּךָ וְלַחַיָּה אֲשֶׁר בְּאַרְצֶךָ״. כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁחַיָּה אוֹכֶלֶת מִן הַשָּׂדֶה — הַאֲכֵל לַבְּהֵמָה שֶׁבַּבַּיִת, כָּלָה לְחַיָּה אֲשֶׁר בַּשָּׂדֶה — כַּלֵּה לִבְהֶמְתְּךָ מִן הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Ḥama bar Ukva said Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: The verse says “And for the cattle and the beasts that are in your land, As long as the undomesticated animals eat from the field, one may feed to the domesticated animal in house, has ceased for the undomesticated animals in the field, cease to your domesticated animal in the house.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena hanei millei? Amar Rav Ḥama bar Ukva amar Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina: Amar kra 've'livhemtekha velachayah asher be'artzekha'. Kol zeman shechayah okhelet min hasadeh - ha'akel labehemah shebabayit, kalah lechayah asher basadeh - kalleh livhemtekha min habayit." English translation: "What are these words? Rav Ḥama bar Ukva said in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina: The verse states, 'And for your livestock and for the animals that are in your land.' As long as the animal eats from the field - the food is for the domestic animal in the house, once it finishes eating from the field - it is finished for your livestock from the house."

hebrew_text: וּגְמִירִי: דְּאֵין חַיָּה שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה גְּדֵילָה עַל פֵּירוֹת שֶׁבַּגָּלִיל, וְאֵין חַיָּה שֶׁבַּגָּלִיל גְּדֵילָה עַל פֵּירוֹת שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה.
