human_translation: And we learned that an undomesticated animal in Judea does not develop on the produce of the Galilee, and an undomesticated animal in the Galilee does not develop on the fruits of Judea.
llm_translation: Gemara: That the animal of Judah does not excel in the fruits of Galilee, and the animal of Galilee does not excel in the fruits of Judah.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פֵּירוֹת שֶׁיָּצְאוּ מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ — מִתְבַּעֲרִין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהֵן. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: יַחְזְרוּ לִמְקוֹמָן וְיִתְבַּעֲרוּ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּאַרְצֶךָ״. הָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ?
human_translation: The Sages taught: fruits that left Eretz Yisrael to the Diaspora must be removed any place that they are Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: should return to their place and be removed because it is stated: “In your land,” Didn’t you derive
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Fruits that have exited from the land of Israel to outside the land - they are burned in every place where they are. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Let them return to their place and be burned, because it is stated: "In your land." Have you understood this?

hebrew_text: קְרִי בֵּיהּ: ״בָּאָרֶץ״ ״בְּאַרְצֶךָ״, אִי נָמֵי: ״מֵאֲשֶׁר בְּאַרְצֶךָ״.
human_translation: Read in the land in your land. Alternatively, from “That are in your land,”
llm_translation: He read in it: "in the land" "in your land," if so: "from what is in your land."

hebrew_text: רַב סָפְרָא נְפַק מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ. הֲוָה בַּהֲדֵיהּ גַּרְבָּא דְחַמְרָא דִּשְׁבִיעִית, לַוּוֹ בַּהֲדֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא וְרַב כָּהֲנָא, אָמַר לְהוּ: אִיכָּא דִּשְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹ לָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: Rav Safra left Eretz Yisrael to the Diaspora, and he had with him a jug of wine. Rav Huna, son Rav Ika, and Rav Kahana accompanied him. He said to them: Is there who heard Rabbi Abbahu the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar or not? Rav Kahana said to him this Rabbi Abbahu said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, Rav Huna, son Rav Ika, said this Rabbi Abbahu said: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar,
llm_translation: Rav Safra went out from the Land of Israel to the Diaspora. There was with him a barrel of seventh-year wine. Rav Huna, the son of Rav Ika, and Rav Kahana were with him. He said to them: Is there anyone who heard from Rabbi Abahu whether the halakha follows Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar or not? Rav Kahana said to him: So said Rabbi Abahu: The halakha follows Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Rav Huna, the son of Rav Ika, said to him: So said Rabbi Abahu: The halakha does not follow Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר רַב סָפְרָא: נְקוֹט הָא כְּלָלָא דְּרַב הוּנָא בִּידָךְ, דְּדָיֵיק וְגָמַר שְׁמַעְתָּתָא מִפּוּמֵּיהּ דְּרַבֵּיהּ כְּרַחֲבָה דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא. דְּאָמַר רַחֲבָה אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַר הַבַּיִת סְטָיו כָּפוּל הָיָה סְטָיו לְפָנִים מִסְּטָיו. קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: ״עַמִּי בְּעֵצוֹ יִשְׁאָל וּמַקְלוֹ יַגִּיד לוֹ״. כׇּל הַמֵּיקֵל לוֹ — מַגִּיד לוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Safra said: Take that principle of Rav Huna in your hand, as he is scrupulous and he learned the halakha well from the mouth of its originator, as Raḥava Pumbedita Raḥava said Rav Yehuda said: The Temple Mount was a double colonnade [ stav ], a colonnade within a colonnade Rav Yosef read the verse: “My nation ask counsel of their stock, and its staff [ maklo ] tells to them” with regard to Anyone who is lenient [ mekel ] tells him
llm_translation: Rav Safra said: Take the general principle of Rav Huna into your hand, for he was precise and concluded the teaching from the mouth of his teacher as the width of the entrance of Pumbedita. For Rav Yehudah said: The Mount of the House was doubled, its doubling was in front of its doubling. Rav Yosef recited regarding it: "My nation, with his wood, will inquire, and his staff will inform him." Whoever takes it lightly - informs him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אִילְעַאי קַץ כַּפְנְיָיתָא דִשְׁבִיעִית. הֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכִי?! ״לְאׇכְלָה״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא לְהֶפְסֵד. וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּנָחֵית לְפֵירָא, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלָא נָחֵית לְפֵירָא — לָא. וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: הָנֵי מְתַחֲלֵי דְעׇרְלָה — אֲסִירִי, הוֹאִיל וְנַעֲשׂוּ שׁוֹמֵר לְפֵירֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elai chopped unripe dates of the Sabbatical Year. How did he do this? The Merciful One says: To eat and not to destroy. And if you say this applies where it has reached of fruit, but where it has not reached fruit, no, didn’t Rav Naḥman say Rabba bar Avuh said: Those orla date coverings are prohibited because they became protection for the fruit?
llm_translation: Rabbi Ilai cut the palm branch of the seventh year. How did he do this?! "For eating," the Merciful One said, and not for destruction. And if you say: These words apply where it is beneficial for the fruit, but where it is not beneficial for the fruit - no. And Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: These are the first buds of uncircumcision - forbidden, since they have become guards for the fruit.

hebrew_text: וְשׁוֹמֵר לְפֵירֵי אִימַּת הָוֵה? בְּכוּפְרֵי וְקָא קָרֵי לְהוּ פֵּירֵי! רַב נַחְמָן דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: סְמָדַר אָסוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא פֵּירֵי, וּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: And when do protection for the fruit? When the fruit is still young and one calls them fruit. Rav Naḥman who stated in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, As we learned Rabbi Yosei says: grape bud, is prohibited because it is a fruit. the Rabbis disagree with him,
llm_translation: And who is considered the guardian of the fruits of a widow? In the villages, and they are called her fruits! Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabbi Yosei: As we learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Yosei says: A samdar is forbidden because it is considered a fruit, and the Rabbis disagree with him on this.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שִׁימִי מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא: וּמִי פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בִּשְׁאָר אִילָנוֹת? וְהָא תְּנַן: מֵאֵימָתַי אֵין קוֹצְצִין אֶת הָאִילָנוֹת בַּשְּׁבִיעִית? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הָאִילָנוֹת מִשֶּׁיּוֹצִיאוּ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: הֶחָרוּבִין מִשֶּׁיְּשַׁרְשְׁרוּ, וְהַגְּפָנִים
human_translation: Rav Shimi of Neharde’a strongly objects to this: Do the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Yosei with regard to of all other trees Didn’t we learn From when may one no chop down trees during the Sabbatical Beit Shammai say: all the trees, from when fruit emerge And Beit Hillel say: The carob trees from when they chains and the vines,
llm_translation: Rav Shimi from Nehardea objects to her: And do the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Yosei regarding other trees? But didn't we learn: From when do we not prune trees in the seventh year? Beit Shammai says: All trees from when they sprout, and Beit Hillel says: Carob trees from when they take root, and vines...

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁיְּגָרֵיעוּ, וְהַזֵּיתִים מִשֶּׁיָּנֵיצוּ, וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הָאִילָנוֹת מִשֶּׁיּוֹצִיאוּ. וְאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: הוּא בּוֹסֶר, הוּא גֵּירוּעַ, הוּא פּוֹל הַלָּבָן. פּוֹל הַלָּבָן סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: שִׁיעוּרוֹ כְּפוֹל הַלָּבָן.
human_translation: from when form kernels and olive from when they blossom; and all other trees from when they produce And Rav Asi said: It is an unripe grape, it is a grape kernel, it is a white bean, Does it enter your mind a white bean? Rather, say: size of a white bean.
llm_translation: When they have shed, and the olives have ripened, and all other trees have produced their fruit. And Rav Assi said: It is the boser, it is the geirua, it is the pol halavan. Pol halavan, is it according to your opinion?! Rather say: Its measure is like pol halavan.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר בּוֹסֶר אִין, סְמָדַר לָא — רַבָּנַן, וְקָתָנֵי: שְׁאָר כׇּל הָאִילָנוֹת מִשֶּׁיּוֹצִיאוּ! אֶלָּא רַבִּי אִילְעַאי בִּדְנִיסְחָנֵי קַץ.
human_translation: whom did you hear that said: An unripe grape, yes, a grape bud, no, the Rabbis, And it is taught all other trees from when they produce Rather, Rabbi Elai chopped with stunted dates,
llm_translation: The one who heard him say "Boser Ein," it is not a valid testimony - the Rabbis, and the Mishna teaches: "All other trees from when they bud!" Rather, Rabbi Ilai in D'Nischanai Katz.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אוֹכְלִין בַּעֲנָבִים עַד שֶׁיִּכְלוּ דָּלִיּוֹת שֶׁל אוֹכֵל. אִם יֵשׁ מְאוּחָרוֹת מֵהֶן — אוֹכְלִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One eat grapes until the branches in Okhel have ceased. And if there are later than those, one may eating on their
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may eat grapes until the pits are finished by the eater. If there are some left over, one may eat them.

hebrew_text: אוֹכְלִים בְּזֵיתִים עַד שֶׁיִּכְלֶה אַחֲרוֹן שֶׁבִּתְקוֹעַ, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּכְלֶה אַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל גּוּשׁ חָלָב, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא עָנִי יוֹצֵא וְאֵינוֹ מוֹצֵא לֹא בְּנוֹפוֹ וְלֹא בְּעִיקָּרוֹ רוֹבַע. אוֹכְלִין בִּגְרוֹגְרוֹת עַד שֶׁיִּכְלוּ פַּגֵּי בֵּית הִינֵי.
human_translation: one may eat olives until the final have ceased in Tekoa. Rabbi Eliezer says: until the final have ceased in Gush Ḥalav. that a poor person will go out find, neither in branches nor in its trunk, a quarter- One may eat dried figs until the unripe figs of Beit Hini have ceased.
llm_translation: Eating olives until the last one is crushed, Rabbi Eliezer says: until the last one of the vat of milk is finished, so that a poor person may leave satisfied and not find olives neither in its stem nor in its pit a quarter of an olive. Eating dried figs until the fig cakes of the innkeepers are finished.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֹא הוּזְכְּרוּ פַּגֵּי בֵּית הִינֵי אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן מַעֲשֵׂר. (דִּתְנַן:) פַּגֵּי בֵּית הִינֵי וַאֲהִינֵי דְטוֹבִינָא — חַיָּיבִין בְּמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: The unripe figs of Beit Hini were mentioned only with regard to tithes, As we learned The unripe figs of Beit Hini and the dates of Tovyana, obligated to tithe .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: Paggei Beit Hinei were only mentioned in relation to the matter of tithing. As it was taught: Paggei Beit Hinei and Ahinei who are wealthy - are obligated in tithing.

hebrew_text: אוֹכְלִין בִּתְמָרִים עַד שֶׁיִּכְלֶה הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁבְּצוֹעַר. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אוֹכְלִין עַל שֶׁל בֵּין הַכִּיפִּין, וְאֵין אוֹכְלִין עַל שֶׁל בֵּין הַשִּׁיצִין.
human_translation: One eat dates until the last in Tzoar ceased Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One eating on between the palm branches; but one not eating on between the thorn branches.
llm_translation: Eating dates until the last one in Tzoar. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One may eat dates from the top of the baskets, but one may not eat dates from the bottom of the baskets.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: אוֹכְלִין בַּעֲנָבִים עַד הַפֶּסַח, בְּזֵיתִים עַד הָעֲצֶרֶת, בִּגְרוֹגְרוֹת עַד הַחֲנוּכָּה, בִּתְמָרִים עַד הַפּוּרִים, וְאָמַר רַב בִּיבִי: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן תַּרְתֵּי בָּתְרָיָיתָא — מַחְלִיף. אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא, הָא קָתָנֵי בְּהֶדְיָא: אִם יֵשׁ מְאוּחָרוֹת מֵהֶן — אוֹכְלִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction One may eat from the grapes until Passover; from the olives, until Assembly, from the dried figs, until Hanukkah; and from the dates, until Purim. And Rav Beivai said: Rabbi Yoḥanan transposes the last two. this and that are one period. And if you wish, say it is taught explicitly: And if there are later than those, one may eating on their
llm_translation: And they asked: One may eat grapes until Passover, olives until Shavuot, unripe figs until Hanukkah, dates until Purim. And Rav Bevai said: Rabbi Yochanan holds that two after the time limit is interchangeable. And both are of the same measure. And if you wish, say: This is what was taught in the language of the Mishnah: If there are late ones among them, one may eat them.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: סִימָן לְהָרִים — מֵילִין. סִימָן לַעֲמָקִים — דְּקָלִים. סִימָן לִנְחָלִים — קָנִים. סִימָן לַשְּׁפֵלָה — שִׁקְמָה. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לְדָבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּתֵּן הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת הַכֶּסֶף בִּירוּשָׁלִַים כָּאֲבָנִים וְאֵת הָאֲרָזִים נָתַן כַּשִּׁקְמִים אֲשֶׁר בַּשְּׁפֵלָה לָרוֹב״.
human_translation: It was taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: sign for mountains is gallnut sign for valleys is palm A sign for streams is reeds. sign for the plain is a sycamore And although there is no proof an allusion to the matter as it is stated: “And the king made silver to be in Jerusalem like stones, and he made cedars to be as the sycamore trees in the plain”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A sign for mountains - meilin. A sign for valleys - dekalim. A sign for rivers - kanim. A sign for lowlands - shikmah. And even though there is no visible proof for this matter, it is a remembrance of the matter, as it is stated: "And the king made silver in Jerusalem like stones, and cedars he made like sycamore trees that are in the lowland."

hebrew_text: סִימָן לְהָרִים מֵילִין, סִימָן לַעֲמָקִים דְּקָלִים — נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְבִכּוּרִים, דִּתְנַן: אֵין מְבִיאִין בִּכּוּרִים אֶלָּא מִשִּׁבְעַת הַמִּינִין, וְלֹא מִדְּקָלִים שֶׁבֶּהָרִים, וְלֹא מִפֵּירוֹת שֶׁבָּעֲמָקִים.
human_translation: sign for mountains is gallnut sign for valleys is palm practical difference first fruits. As we learned One may bring first fruits only from the seven species not from palm trees that in the mountains. not from produce in the valleys,
llm_translation: Sign for raising words, sign for valleys of date palms - it was derived from it for firstborns, as we learned: One may only bring firstborns from the seven species, not from the date palms of the mountains, and not from the fruits of the valleys.

hebrew_text: סִימָן לִנְחָלִים קָנִים — נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְנַחַל אֵיתָן. סִימָן לַשְּׁפֵלָה שִׁקְמָה — נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי לְמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר.
human_translation: sign for streams is reeds. practical difference to rough stream sign for the plain is a sycamore practical difference to buying and selling. Now that you have arrived at this to all to buying and selling as well,
llm_translation: Sign for inheritances reeds — came out from it for the inheritance of Etan. Sign for lowland upland — came out from it for buying and selling. Now that it came for this, all of them are considered for buying and selling.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לִמְכּוֹר בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה לַגּוֹיִם — מוֹכְרִין, מָקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא נָהֲגוּ לִמְכּוֹר — אֵין מוֹכְרִין. וּבְכׇל מָקוֹם אֵין מוֹכְרִין לָהֶם בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה, עֲגָלִים וּסְיָיחִין, שְׁלֵמִין וּשְׁבוּרִין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר בַּשְּׁבוּרָה. בֶּן בְּתִירָא מַתִּיר בַּסּוּס.
human_translation: a place where were accustomed to sell small livestock to gentiles, one sell a place where were not accustomed to sell one not sell in every place, one sell neither large livestock, calves or foals, whole or damaged. Rabbi Yehuda permits a damaged Ben Beteira permits a horse
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In a place where it is customary to sell thin animals to non-Jews, one may sell them; in a place where it is not customary to sell them, one may not sell them. And in any place, one may not sell to them large cattle, calves, or foals, whether whole or broken. Rabbi Yehuda permits selling broken ones. Ben Butira permits selling horses.

hebrew_text: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לֶאֱכוֹל צָלִי בְּלֵילֵי פְסָחִים — אוֹכְלִין, מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לֶאֱכוֹל — אֵין אוֹכְלִין.
human_translation: a place where were accustomed to eat roasted on Passover evenings, one eat a place where were accustomed not to eat one not eat
llm_translation: Place where accustomed to eat roasted on nights of Passover - eat, place where accustomed not to eat - do not eat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָסוּר לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״בָּשָׂר זֶה לְפֶסַח הוּא״ — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאֶה כְּמַקְדִּישׁ בְּהֶמְתּוֹ וְאוֹכֵל קָדָשִׁים בַּחוּץ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דַּוְקָא בָּשָׂר, אֲבָל חִיטֵּי — לָא, דְּמִינְטַר לְפִסְחָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said prohibited for a person to say This meat is for Passover, due to that one appears to be consecrating his animal eats consecrated outside Rav Pappa said: specifically meat, however, wheat, no, is saying that be watched for Passover.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said, Rav Yehudah said, Rav said: It is forbidden for a person to say, "This meat is for the Passover," because it appears as if he is consecrating his animal and eating consecrated items outside the Temple. Rav Papa said: Specifically with regard to meat, but with regard to grains - no, he is speaking about monitoring for Passover.

hebrew_text: וּבָשָׂר לָא? מֵיתִיבִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: תּוֹדוֹס אִישׁ רוֹמִי הִנְהִיג אֶת בְּנֵי רוֹמִי לֶאֱכוֹל גְּדָיִים מְקוּלָּסִין בְּלֵילֵי פְּסָחִים. שָׁלְחוּ לוֹ: אִלְמָלֵא תּוֹדוֹס אַתָּה גָּזַרְנוּ עָלֶיךָ נִדּוּי, שֶׁאַתָּה מַאֲכִיל אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל קָדָשִׁים בַּחוּץ. ״קָדָשִׁים״ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ! אֶלָּא אֵימָא:
human_translation: And meat not raises an objection. Rabbi Yosei said: Theodosius [Todos] of Rome, instituted the custom for the Roman to eat kids roasted [ mekulas ] whole on the evenings of Passover, sent to him: If you were not Theodosius, we would have decreed ostracism upon you, as you are feeding Israel consecrated food, outside Could it enter your mind consecrated Rather, say
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And flesh, no? It was asked: Rabbi Yosei said: Tudos, a Roman man, led the sons of Rome to eat kid goats roasted on the eve of Passover. They sent to him: Were it not for Tudos, we would have decreed excommunication upon you, for you are feeding Israelites holy offerings outside. "Holy offerings" - is that your opinion? Rather say:

hebrew_text: קָרוֹב לְהַאֲכִיל אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל קָדָשִׁים בַּחוּץ. מְקוּלָּס — אִין, שֶׁאֵין מְקוּלָּס — לָא! אָמְרִי, מְקוּלָּס: לָא שְׁנָא אֲמַר, לָא שְׁנָא לָא אֲמַר. שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְקוּלָּס: פֵּירֵשׁ — אִין, לֹא פֵּירֵשׁ — לָא.
human_translation: is akin to feeding Jews consecrated outside roasted whole, yes, not roasted whole, no, say roasted whole, there is no difference one said there is no difference did not say not roasted whole, one specified yes, one did not specify no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Close to feed Israel holy things outside. Mikulas - no, She'en Mikulas - lo! Amri, Mikulas: Lo shna amar, lo shna lo amar. She'eino Mikulas: Peiresh - ein, lo peiresh - lo. English translation: Close to feed Israel holy things outside. Mikulas - no, She'en Mikulas - no! They said, Mikulas: It is not different if he said, it is not different if he did not say. One who is not Mikulas: He explained - no, he did not explain - no.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא מַתְנִי לַהּ לְהָא מַתְנִיתִין כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּתָנֵי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — מִי נִיחָא?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa teaches this baraita in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. Rav Sheshet strongly objected to this: Granted, to the one who learns it in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, well. However, to the one who teaches in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, does well? Didn’t learn
llm_translation: Rav Ahah teaches her: Teach her according to the teaching of Rabbi Shimon. Rav Sheshet objects to her: Granted, according to the one who teaches her like Rabbi Yosei — it is fine, but according to the one who teaches her like Rabbi Shimon — is it fine?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר, שֶׁלֹּא הִתְנַדֵּב כְּדֶרֶךְ הַמִּתְנַדְּבִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon exempts he did not donate in the manner of donors.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon exempts, because he did not volunteer in the manner of those who volunteer.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִי נִיחָא? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֲמָרָהּ, דְּאָמַר: אַף בִּגְמַר דְּבָרָיו אָדָם נִתְפָּס.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: And the one who teaches it in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, does well? Didn’t Rava say: Rabbi Shimon stated in accordance with of Rabbi Yosei, said: A person is also held for the conclusion of his statement.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: And one who teaches like Rabbi Yosei, is it appropriate? And Rava said: According to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon in the view of Rabbi Yosei, she said, as he said: Even in the finalization of his words, a person is apprehended.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו: מִדְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי נָמֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן! לָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: What, is it not from that Rabbi Shimon holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Yosei holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, No, although Rabbi Shimon holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Yosei does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: What is the reason? From Rabbi Shimon who holds like Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Yosei also holds like Rabbi Shimon! No, Rabbi Shimon holds like Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Yosei does not hold like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: תּוֹדוֹס אִישׁ רוֹמִי גַּבְרָא רַבָּה הֲוָה, אוֹ בַּעַל אֶגְרוֹפִין הֲוָה?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Was Theodosius of Rome a great man Or, was he a violent man
llm_translation: He asked them: Todus, a Roman man, was he a great man, or was he a master of the vineyard?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע. עוֹד זוֹ דָּרַשׁ תּוֹדוֹס אִישׁ רוֹמִי: מָה רָאוּ חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה שֶׁמָּסְרוּ [עַצְמָן] עַל קְדוּשַּׁת הַשֵּׁם לְכִבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ?
human_translation: Come hear: This was also taught by Theodosius of Rome: What did Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah see that deliver themselves to the fiery furnace for sanctification of the name
llm_translation: "Come and hear. Furthermore, this is what Todus the Roman expounded: What did Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah see when they delivered themselves up to the sanctification of the Name to the fiery furnace?"

hebrew_text: נָשְׂאוּ קַל וָחוֹמֶר בְּעַצְמָן מִצְּפַרְדְּעִים. וּמָה צְפַרְדְּעִים שֶׁאֵין מְצֻוִּוין עַל קְדוּשַּׁת הַשֵּׁם, כְּתִיב בְּהוּ: ״וּבָאוּ [וְעָלוּ] בְּבֵיתֶךָ [וְגוֹ׳] וּבְתַנּוּרֶיךָ וּבְמִשְׁאֲרוֹתֶיךָ״, אֵימָתַי מִשְׁאָרוֹת מְצוּיוֹת אֵצֶל תַּנּוּר? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַתַּנּוּר חַם. אָנוּ שֶׁמְּצֻוִּוין עַל קְדוּשַּׁת הַשֵּׁם — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: They drew an a fortiori inference on their own from frogs frogs, which are not commanded concerning the sanctification of the name it is written: and come into your house, and into their ovens and kneading bowls” When are kneading bowls found near the oven? You must say that when the oven is hot. all the more so, we, who are commanded concerning the sanctification of the name
llm_translation: They raised a fortiori argument by themselves from frogs. And just as frogs, which are not commanded regarding the sanctity of the Name, it is written about them: "And they shall come and go into your house etc. and into your ovens and into your kneading bowls." When are kneading bowls found near an oven? One would say when the oven is hot. We who are commanded regarding the sanctity of the Name — how much more so.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר: מֵטִיל מְלַאי לְכִיס שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הָיָה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמֵּטִיל מְלַאי לְכִיס תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים זוֹכֶה וְיוֹשֵׁב בִּישִׁיבָה שֶׁל מַעְלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי בְּצֵל הַחׇכְמָה בְּצֵל הַכָּסֶף״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said: was cast merchandise into the purse of Torah scholars. as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who casts merchandise into the purse of Torah scholars is rewarded and sits in the heavenly academy, as it is stated: “For in the shadow of wisdom, is the shadow of money”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said: He used to put money into the purse of the Torah scholars. As Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who puts money into the purse of Torah scholars merits and sits in the yeshiva on high, as it is said: "For in the shadow of wisdom, in the shadow of silver."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְהַדְלִיק אֶת הַנֵּר בְּלֵילֵי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — מַדְלִיקִין. מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְהַדְלִיק — אֵין מַדְלִיקִין. וּמַדְלִיקִין בְּבָתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבְבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת וּבִמְבוֹאוֹת הָאֲפֵלִים וְעַל גַּבֵּי הַחוֹלִים.
human_translation: a place where were accustomed to kindle a lamp on Yom Kippur evenings, one kindles a place where were accustomed not to kindle one does not kindle However, one kindles in synagogues and study halls, in dark alleyways, and next to the sick.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In a place where it is customary to light the candle on the nights of Yom Kippur, they light. In a place where it is customary not to light, they do not light. And they light in synagogues, study halls, dark alleyways, and on the beds of the sick.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: בֵּין שֶׁאָמְרוּ לְהַדְלִיק וּבֵין שֶׁאָמְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְהַדְלִיק — שְׁנֵיהֶן לְדָבָר אֶחָד נִתְכַּוְּונוּ. אָמַר רַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא ״וְעַמֵּךְ כֻּלָּם צַדִּיקִים לְעוֹלָם יִירְשׁוּ אָרֶץ וְגוֹ׳״, בֵּין שֶׁאָמְרוּ לְהַדְלִיק וּבֵין שֶׁאָמְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְהַדְלִיק — שְׁנֵיהֶם לֹא נִתְכַּוְּונוּ אֶלָּא לְדָבָר אֶחָד.
human_translation: It was taught Both where said to kindle and where they said not to kindle, they both intended to same objective, Rav Yehoshua said Rava taught: “Your people are all righteous, they shall inherit the land forever; Both where said to kindle and where they said not to kindle, they intended only to same objective,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A teaching was taught: Whether they said to light or whether they said not to light - both were intended for the same matter. Rav Yehoshua said: Rava expounded, "And your people, all of them righteous, shall inherit the land forever," whether they said to light or whether they said not to light - both were not intended except for one matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין מְבָרְכִין עַל הָאוּר אֶלָּא בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, הוֹאִיל וּתְחִלַּת בְּרִיָּיתוֹ הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא סָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: יִשַׁר, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. עוּלָּא הֲוָה רְכִיב חֲמָרָא וְאָזֵיל, וַהֲוָה שָׁקֵיל וְאָזֵיל רַבִּי אַבָּא מִיַּמִּינֵיהּ וְרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה מִשְּׂמָאלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְעוּלָּא: וַדַּאי דְּאָמְרִיתוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן ״אֵין מְבָרְכִין עַל הָאוּר אֶלָּא בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, הוֹאִיל וּתְחִלַּת בְּרִיָּיתוֹ הוּא״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One should recite the blessing over fire: only at the conclusion of Shabbat, since is its original creation. A certain Elder said to him, and some say Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: correct; and so said Rabbi Yoḥanan. Ulla was riding on a donkey and going along, and Rabbi Abba was going along on his right and Rabba bar bar Ḥana on his left. Rabbi Abba said to Ulla: true that you said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan one recites the blessing over fire only at the conclusion of Shabbat, since its original creation is
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One does not recite a blessing over the light except at the conclusion of Shabbat, since it was created first. That elder said to him, and some say it was Rabba bar bar Ḥana: Straight, and so said Rabbi Yoḥanan. Ulai would ride on a donkey and go, and Rabbi Abba would take from his right, and Rabba bar bar Ḥana from his left. Rabbi Abba said to Ulai: Surely you said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, "One does not recite a blessing over the light except at the conclusion of Shabbat, since it was created first."

hebrew_text: הֲדַר עוּלָּא, חֲזָא בֵּיהּ בְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה בִּישׁוּת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא לָאו אַהָא אֲמַרִי, אֶלָּא אַהָא אָמְרִי — דְּתָנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, אַף בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁאָמְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְהַדְלִיק — מַדְלִיקִין מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת. וְעָנֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בָּתְרֵיהּ: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עָדָא תְּהֵא.
human_translation: Ulla turned around and looked angrily at Rabba bar bar Ḥana said to him: I did not say about that rather, I said about that which reciter taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Yom Kippur that occurs on Shabbat, even in a place where they said not to kindle one kindles in deference to Shabbat. Rabbi Yoḥanan answered after him And the Rabbis prohibit said Let it be
llm_translation: The honor of the eve of Yom Kippur, he saw in it Rabba bar bar Ḥana sitting. He said to him: I did not say this, rather I said this - as a Tanna taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: On Yom Kippur that falls on Shabbat, even in a place where they said not to kindle, we kindle due to the honor of Shabbat. And Rabbi Yoḥanan answered him: And the Sages prohibit it. He said to him: Until here it shall be.

hebrew_text: קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: ״מַיִם עֲמוּקִּים עֵצָה בְלֶב אִישׁ
human_translation: Rav Yosef read about “Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water;
llm_translation: Rav Yosef reads upon it: "Deep waters, counsel in the heart of man."

hebrew_text: וְאִישׁ תְּבוּנָה יִדְלֶנָּה״. ״מַיִם עֲמוּקִּים עֵצָה בְלֶב אִישׁ״ — זֶה עוּלָּא. ״וְאִישׁ תְּבוּנָה יִדְלֶנָּה״ — זֶה רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה. וְאִינְהוּ כְּמַאן סַבְרוּהָ? כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי בִּנְיָמִין בַּר יֶפֶת אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְבָרְכִין עַל הָאוּר בֵּין בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת בֵּין בְּמוֹצָאֵי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. וְכֵן עַמָּא דָּבַר.
human_translation: but a man of understanding will draw it out” Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; that is Ulla, But a man of understanding will draw it out; that is Rabba bar bar Ḥana, And in accordance with whose do hold, in accordance with that Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One recites the blessing over fire both at the conclusion of Shabbat and at the conclusion of Yom Kippur. And that is the people act.
llm_translation: "And a man of understanding will draw it out." "Deep waters, counsel in the heart of man" - this is Ulla. "And a man of understanding will draw it out" - this is Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah. And who are they comparable to? Like this one who said, Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: One recites a blessing over the light, whether at the conclusion of Shabbat or at the conclusion of Yom Kippur. And so is the custom.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵין מְבָרְכִין עַל הָאוּר אֶלָּא בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, הוֹאִיל וּתְחִילַּת בְּרִיָּיתוֹ הוּא. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁרוֹאֶה — מְבָרֵךְ מִיָּד. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, סוֹדְרָן עַל הַכּוֹס. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: raises an objection One recites a blessing over fire only at the conclusion of Shabbat since is its original creation. he sees it, he recites the blessing immediately. Rabbi Yehuda says: arranges over the cup And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Challenger: One does not recite a blessing over the light except at the conclusion of Shabbat, since it is the beginning of its creation. And once one sees it, he recites immediately. Rabbi Yehuda says, he arranges his garments over the cup. And Rabbi Yochanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּאוּר שֶׁשָּׁבַת, כָּאן בְּאוּר הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הָעֵצִים וּמִן הָאֲבָנִים.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, fire that rested There, generated from wood and from stones
llm_translation: No difficulty: here regarding the light that was created on Shabbat, here regarding the light that emanates from the trees and from the stones.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: אוּר הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הָעֵצִים וּמִן הָאֲבָנִים מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו, וְתָנֵי חֲדָא: אֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו. לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, כָּאן בְּמוֹצָאֵי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: taught one fire generated from wood and stones, one recites a blessing over it; and taught one One does not recite a blessing over it. not difficult. Here, to the conclusion of Shabbat. There, to the conclusion of Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: One taught: Regarding the light that comes from wood and from stones, we recite a blessing over it. And one taught: We do not recite a blessing over it. It is not difficult: here it is referring to the conclusion of Shabbat, here it is referring to the conclusion of Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מְפַזְּרָן. רַבִּי חִיָּיא מְכַנְּסָן. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁרַבִּי מְפַזְּרָן — חוֹזֵר וְסוֹדְרָן עַל הַכּוֹס, כְּדֵי לְהוֹצִיא בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi distribute Rabbi Ḥiyya collect them, Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said: Even though Rabbi distributes them he repeats and arranges them over the cup in order to discharge the obligation of his children and the members of his household.
llm_translation: Rabbi Mefazzran. Rabbi Hiyya Mekhanesan. Rabbi Yitzhak bar Avdimi said: Even though Rabbi Mefazzran scatters, he goes back and arranges them on the cup, in order to bring out his sons and the sons of his household.

hebrew_text: וְאוּר בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת אִיבְּרִי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים נִבְרְאוּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, אֵלּוּ הֵן: בְּאֵר, וְהַמָּן, וְקֶשֶׁת, כְּתָב, וּמַכְתֵּב, וְהַלּוּחוֹת, וְקִבְרוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה, וּמְעָרָה שֶׁעָמַד בּוֹ מֹשֶׁה וְאֵלִיָּהוּ, פְּתִיחַת פִּי הָאָתוֹן, וּפְתִיחַת פִּי הָאָרֶץ לִבְלוֹעַ אֶת הָרְשָׁעִים.
human_translation: Was fire created at the conclusion of Shabbat? Wasn’t taught Ten phenomena were created on Shabbat eve during twilight, They were: well, and the manna and the rainbow, writing [ ketav and writing instrument [ mikhtav ], and the tablets and the grave of Moses, and the cave in which Moses and Elijah stood, the opening of the mouth of donkey, and the opening of the earth’s mouth to swallow the wicked
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And a light on the eve of Shabbat, should one kindle? But it was taught: Ten things were created on the eve of Shabbat at twilight, these are they: the well, and the manna, and the rainbow, the script, and the scriptural text, and the tablets, and the grave of Moses, and the cave in which Moses and Elijah stood, the opening of the mouth of the she-donkey, and the opening of the mouth of the earth to swallow the wicked. English translation:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם אָבִיו: אַף הָאוּר וְהַפֶּרֶד. רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם אָבִיו: אַף הָאַיִל, וְהַשָּׁמִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַצְּבָת. הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: צְבָתָא בִּצְבָתָא מִתְעַבְדָא, וּצְבָתָא קַמַּיְיתָא מַאן עֲבַד? הָא לָאיֵ בְּרִיָּה בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם הִיא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶפְשָׁר יַעֲשֶׂנָּה בִּדְפוּס וְיִקְבָּעֶנָּה כֵּיוָן. הָא לָאיֵ בְּרִיָּה בִּידֵי אָדָם הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya said in the name of his father: Even the fire and the mule, Rabbi Yoshiya said in the name of his father: Even the ram and the shamir Rabbi Yehuda says: Even the tongs He would say: Tongs fashioned with tongs, but who fashioned the first tongs? Indeed, was fashioned at the hand of Heaven. said to him: It is possible to fashion with a mold and align it Indeed, were a creation of man.
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah says in the name of his father: Also the light and the mule. Rabbi Yoshiyah says in the name of his father: Also the ram and the goat. Rabbi Yehuda says: Also the turtle-dove. He used to say: A turtle-dove is served with another turtle-dove, and which turtle-dove is standing? This is not in the hands of a creature, it is in the hands of Heaven. He said to him: It is possible to make it in a mold and establish it permanently. This is not in the hands of a creature, it is in the hands of man.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּאוּר דִּידַן, הָא בְּאוּר דְּגֵיהִנָּם. אוּר דִּידַן — בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, אוּר דְּגֵיהִנָּם — בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת. וְאוּר דְּגֵיהִנָּם בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת אִיבְּרִי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: שִׁבְעָה דְּבָרִים נִבְרְאוּ קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּבְרָא הָעוֹלָם, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: תּוֹרָה, וּתְשׁוּבָה, וְגַן עֵדֶן, וְגֵיהִנָּם, וְכִסֵּא הַכָּבוֹד, וּבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וּשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל מָשִׁיחַ.
human_translation: not difficult. This to our fire, and that to the fire Gehenna. Our fire at the conclusion of Shabbat, the fire of Gehenna was created on Shabbat eve. Was the fire of Gehenna created on Shabbat eve? Wasn’t taught Seven phenomena were created before the world was created, and they are: Torah, and repentance, and the Garden of Eden, and Gehenna, and the Throne of Glory, and the Temple, and the name of Messiah.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this in our light, that in their light. Our light - at the conclusion of Shabbat, their light - on Friday evening. And their light on Friday evening, is it evening? But it was taught: Seven things were created before the world was created, and these are they: Torah, repentance, the Garden of Eden, Gehenna, the Throne of Glory, the Temple, and the name of the Messiah.

hebrew_text: תּוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״ה׳ קָנָנִי רֵאשִׁית דַּרְכּוֹ״. תְּשׁוּבָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּטֶרֶם הָרִים יֻלָּדוּ״, וּכְתִיב: ״תָּשֵׁב אֱנוֹשׁ עַד דַּכָּא וַתֹּאמֶר שׁוּבוּ בְנֵי אָדָם״.
human_translation: Torah as it is written: “The Lord made me as the beginning of His way, Repentance as it is written: “Before the mountains were brought forth, and it is written “You return man to contrition; and You say: Repent, children of man”
llm_translation: Torah, as it is written: "The Lord possessed me in the beginning of His way." Repentance, as it is written: "Before the mountains were brought forth," and it is written: "You turn man to destruction and say, 'Return, O children of men.'"

hebrew_text: גַּן עֵדֶן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּטַּע ה׳ אֱלֹהִים גַּן בְּעֵדֶן מִקֶּדֶם״. גֵּיהִנָּם, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי עָרוּךְ מֵאֶתְמוּל תׇּפְתֶּה״.
human_translation: The Garden of Eden as it is written: “And God planted the Garden of Eden in the east [ mikedem ]” Gehenna as it is written: “For its hearth is ordained of old”
llm_translation: Garden of Eden, as it is written: "And the Lord God planted a garden in Eden, in the east." Gehinnom, as it is written: "For it is prepared from yesterday, it is also deep and large."

hebrew_text: כִּסֵּא הַכָּבוֹד וּבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּסֵּא כָבוֹד מָרוֹם מֵרִאשׁוֹן מְקוֹם מִקְדָּשֵׁנוּ״. שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל מָשִׁיחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְהִי שְׁמוֹ לְעוֹלָם לִפְנֵי שֶׁמֶשׁ יִנּוֹן שְׁמוֹ״!
human_translation: The Throne of Glory and the Temple as it is written: “Your Throne of Glory on high from the beginning, in the place of our Sanctuary” The name of Messiah as it is written “May his name endure forever; his name existed before the sun”
llm_translation: The seat of glory and the Temple, as it is written: "The seat of glory, exalted from the beginning, is the place of our sanctuary." His name is that of the Messiah, as it is written: "May his name endure forever; may his name increase as long as the sun shines."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי, חֲלָלָהּ הוּא דְּנִבְרָא קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּבְרָא הָעוֹלָם, וְאוּר דִּידֵיהּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: They say void was created before the world, but its fire was created on Shabbat eve.
llm_translation: They said, "It is a disgrace that he was created before the world was created, and the light of his own in the eve of Shabbat."

hebrew_text: וְאוּר דִּידֵיהּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת אִיבְּרִי? וְהַתַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אוּר שֶׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּשֵׁנִי בַּשַּׁבָּת אֵין לוֹ כְּבִיָּיה לְעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָצְאוּ וְרָאוּ בְּפִגְרֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים הַפּוֹשְׁעִים בִּי כִּי תוֹלַעְתָּם לֹא תָמוּת וְאִשָּׁם לֹא תִכְבֶּה״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי בְּנָאָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי עוּלָּא: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נֶאֱמַר ״כִּי טוֹב״ בְּשֵׁנִי בַּשַּׁבָּת — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּבְרָא בּוֹ אוּר שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ ״כִּי טוֹב״, חָזַר וּכְלָלוֹ בַּשִּׁשִּׁי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּרְא אֱלֹהִים אֶת כׇּל אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה וְהִנֵּה טוֹב מְאֹד״.
human_translation: And was its fire created on Shabbat eve? Wasn’t taught Rabbi Yosei says: The fire that the Holy One, Blessed be He, created on the second day of the week will never be extinguished, as it is stated: “And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcasses of the men who have rebelled against Me; for their worm shall not die, nor will their fire be extinguished; And Rabbi Bana’a, son Rabbi Ulla, said: Why doesn’t the verse state: That it was good, second day of the week because on the fire of Gehenna was created. And Rabbi Elazar said even though: That it was good, was not stated with regard to He later included it sixth day, as it is stated: “And God saw all that He had done and behold, it was very good”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the light of His countenance on Erev Shabbat, did He create? And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: The light that the Holy One, blessed be He, created on the second day of the week, it has no cessation forever, as it is stated: 'And they shall go forth and look upon the carcasses of the men that have transgressed against Me; for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched.' And Rabbi said in the name of the son of Rabbi Ulla: Why was it not said 'that it was good' regarding the second day of the week? Because on it was created the light of Gehenna. And Rabbi Elazar said: Even though 'that it was good' was not said regarding it, He went back and included it on the sixth day, as it is stated: 'And God saw all that He had made, and behold, it was very good.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: חֲלָלָהּ — קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּבְרָא הָעוֹלָם, וְאוּר דִּידֵיהּ — בְּשֵׁנִי בַּשַּׁבָּת. וְאוּר דִּידַן — בְּמַחְשָׁבָה עָלָה לִיבָּרְאוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וְלֹא נִבְרָא עַד מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי דְבָרִים עָלוּ בְּמַחְשָׁבָה לִיבָּרְאוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וְלֹא נִבְרְאוּ עַד מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, וּבְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת נָתַן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא דֵּיעָה בְּאָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן מֵעֵין דּוּגְמָא שֶׁל מַעְלָה, וְהֵבִיא שְׁנֵי אֲבָנִים וּטְחָנָן זוֹ בָּזוֹ, וְיָצָא מֵהֶן אוּר, וְהֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי בְהֵמוֹת וְהִרְכִּיב זוֹ בָּזוֹ וְיָצָא מֵהֶן פֶּרֶד. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: פֶּרֶד בִּימֵי עֲנָה הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הוּא עֲנָה אֲשֶׁר מָצָא אֶת הַיֵּמִם בַּמִּדְבָּר״.
human_translation: Rather, the void before the world was created, and its fire on the second day of the week. And arose mind to create our fire on Shabbat eve; it was not created until the conclusion of Shabbat, as it was taught Rabbi Yosei says: two phenomena arose in mind on Shabbat eve, but were not created until the conclusion of Shabbat. At the conclusion of Shabbat, the Holy One, Blessed be He, granted Adam, the first knowledge similar to divine and he brought two rocks and rubbed them against each other, and fire emerged from them. Adam brought two animals, and mated them with each other, and emerged from them a mule. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says mule was in the days of Anah, as it is stated: this is Anah who found the mules in the wilderness,
llm_translation: Rather, its void — before the world was created, and its light — on the second day of the Sabbath. And our light — arose in thought to be created on the eve of Sabbath, and was not created until after the Sabbath. As it was taught, Rabbi Yosei says: Two things arose in thought to be created on the eve of Sabbath, and were not created until after the Sabbath, and on the conclusion of the Sabbath, the Holy One, blessed be He, placed knowledge in the first man like a pattern from above, and brought two stones and ground them one against the other, and light emerged from them, and brought two animals and yoked one against the other and a mule emerged from them. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The mule was in the days of Anah, as it is said: "He found mules in the wilderness."

hebrew_text: דּוֹרְשֵׁי חֲמוּרוֹת, הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: עֲנָה פָּסוּל הָיָה, לְפִיכָךְ הֵבִיא פְּסוּל לְעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֵלֶּה בְנֵי שֵׂעִיר הַחֹרִי״, וּכְתִיב: ״אֵלֶּה בְנֵי צִבְעוֹן וְאַיָּה וַעֲנָה״! אֶלָּא, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁבָּא צִבְעוֹן עַל אִמּוֹ וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה עֲנָה.
human_translation: The interpreters symbolism [ ḥamurot ] would say: Anah was unfit Therefore, brought unfitness, into the world, as it is stated: “These are the sons of Seir the Horite, And it is stated: “And these are the sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah” Rather, this teaches that Zibeon cohabited with his mother, and fathered Anah from her.
llm_translation: Those who expound on the donkeys would say: An invalid response it was, therefore he brought an invalid offering forever, as it is stated: "These are the sons of Seir the Horite," and it is written: "These are the sons of Zibeon, Aiah, and Anah"! Rather, it teaches that Zibeon came upon his mother and begot Anah from her.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא תְּרֵי עֲנָה הֲווֹ?! אָמַר רָבָא: אָמֵינָא מִילְּתָא דְּשַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא לָא אַמְרַהּ, וּמַנּוּ? שְׁמוּאֵל. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אָמֵינָא מִילְּתָא דְּשַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא לָא אַמְרַהּ, וּמַנּוּ? רָבָא; אָמַר קְרָא: ״הוּא עֲנָה״ — הוּא עֲנָה דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: And perhaps there were two Anah, Rava said: I will state a matter King Shapur did not state. And who is Shmuel, Some say Rav Pappa said: I will state a matter King Shapur did not state. And who is he Rava. The verse said: “This is Anah he is Anah initially
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And perhaps there were two responses?! Rava said: I believe the matter of the breaking of the king was not said, and who? Shmuel. There are those who say: Rav Pappa said: I believe the matter of the breaking of the king was not said, and who? Rava; the verse said: 'He answered' — he answered from the beginning." English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים נִבְרְאוּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: בְּאֵר, וּמָן, וְקֶשֶׁת, הַכְּתָב, וְהַמַּכְתֵּב, וְהַלּוּחוֹת, קִבְרוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה, וּמְעָרָה שֶׁעָמַד בָּהּ מֹשֶׁה וְאֵלִיָּהוּ, פְּתִיחַת פִּי הָאָתוֹן, וּפְתִיחַת פִּי הָאָרֶץ לִבְלוֹעַ אֶת הָרְשָׁעִים. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף מַקְלוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן שְׁקֵדֶיהָ וּפְרָחֶיהָ, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַמַּזִּיקִין, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף
human_translation: The Sages taught: Ten phenomena were created on Shabbat eve during twilight, and they were: well, and manna, and rainbow, writing, and the writing instrument, and the tablets, the grave of Moses, and the cave in which Moses and Elijah stood, the opening of the mouth of donkey, and the opening of the mouth of the earth to swallow the wicked And some say even Aaron’s staff its almonds and its blossoms. Some say even the demons And some say even
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Ten things were created on the eve of Shabbat at twilight, and these are they: the well, the manna, the rainbow, the writing, the writing instrument, the tablets, the burial place of Moses, the cave in which Moses and Elijah stood, the opening of the mouth of the she-donkey, and the opening of the mouth of the earth to swallow the wicked. And some say: also the staff of Aaron, its almonds and blossoms, and some say: also the destructive spirits, and some say: also

hebrew_text: בִּגְדּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: the garment of Adam, the first
llm_translation: His garment, that of Adam the first.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁבְעָה דְּבָרִים מְכוּסִּים מִבְּנֵי אָדָם, אֵלּוּ הֵן: יוֹם הַמִּיתָה, וְיוֹם הַנֶּחָמָה, וְעוֹמֶק הַדִּין, וְאֵין אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ מָה בְּלִבּוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, וְאֵין אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ בַּמֶּה מִשְׂתַּכֵּר, וּמַלְכוּת בֵּית דָּוִד מָתַי תַּחְזוֹר, וּמַלְכוּת חַיֶּיבֶת מָתַי תִּכְלֶה.
human_translation: the Sages taught: Seven matters are concealed from people, they are: day of death; and the day of consolation the profundity of justice, and a person does not know what is in the heart of another; and a person does not know in what will earn a profit; when the monarchy of the house of David will be restored and when the wicked monarchy will cease
llm_translation: The sages taught: Seven things are concealed from the sons of man, and they are: the day of death, and the day of consolation, and the depth of judgment, and no man knows what is in the heart of his fellow, and no man knows with what he will earn, and the kingdom of the house of David when will it return, and the kingdom of the wicked when will it end.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים עָלוּ בְּמַחְשָׁבָה לִיבָּרְאוֹת, וְאִם לֹא עָלוּ — דִּין הוּא שֶׁיַּעֲלוּ: עַל הַמֵּת שֶׁיַּסְרִיחַ. וְעַל הַמֵּת שֶׁיִּשְׁתַּכֵּחַ מִן הַלֵּב. וְעַל הַתְּבוּאָה שֶׁתֵּרָקֵב. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: עַל הַמַּטְבֵּעַ שֶׁיֵּצֵא.
human_translation: The Sages taught three matters arose in mind to be created, and if they did not arise by right arisen a corpse rots, that the deceased are forgotten from the heart, and that grain will rot And some say: that currency will circulate
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three things were considered in thought to be created, and if they were not created — it is proper that they be created: concerning a corpse that will putrefy. And concerning a corpse that will decompose from the heart. And concerning produce that will rot. And some say: concerning the coin that will be minted.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת מְלָאכָה בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב — עוֹשִׂין, מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲשׂוֹת מְלָאכָה — אֵין עוֹשִׂין, וּבְכׇל מָקוֹם תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים בְּטֵלִים. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם יַעֲשֶׂה אָדָם עַצְמוֹ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם.
human_translation: a place where were accustomed to perform labor on the Ninth of Av, one performs a place where were accustomed not to perform labor, not perform And in all places Torah scholars are idle Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: a person should always conduct himself a Torah scholar
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In a place where it is customary to work on the ninth of Av, they work; in a place where it is customary not to work, they do not work. And in every place, the students of the sages are exempt. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A person should always make himself a student of a wise person.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין תַּעֲנִית צִיבּוּר בְּבָבֶל אֶלָּא תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב בִּלְבַד. לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת שֶׁלּוֹ אָסוּר? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת שֶׁלּוֹ מוּתָּר. וְכִי תֵּימָא קָסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל תַּעֲנִית צִיבּוּר בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת שֶׁלּוֹ מוּתָּר, וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: ״אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם״. לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי, לָאו לְמַעוֹטֵי בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת? לָא, לְמַעוֹטֵי מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה.
human_translation: Shmuel said: The only communal fast in Babylonia is the Ninth of Av. Is that to say, that Shmuel holds the Ninth of Av during twilight prohibited? But didn’t Shmuel say: twilight of the Ninth of Av permitted, And if you say that Shmuel holds: every communal fast, during twilight permitted, didn’t we learn One may eat and drink while it is still day? What to exclude? What, isn’t it to exclude twilight No, to exclude after dark,
llm_translation: Gemara: Shmuel said: Public fasts in Babylonia are only on the ninth of Av alone. Is it to be inferred that Shmuel holds that on the ninth of Av, it is prohibited to fast between his suns? But did not Shmuel say: On the ninth of Av, it is permitted to fast between his suns? And if you would say that Shmuel holds that any public fast is permitted between his suns, but we learned: "Eating and drinking until sunset." To exclude what? Is it not to exclude fasting between his suns? No, to exclude fasting from when it becomes dark.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: אֵין בֵּין תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לְיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, אֶלָּא שֶׁזֶּה סְפֵיקוֹ אָסוּר, וְזֶה סְפֵיקוֹ מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Let us say supports The only between the Ninth of Av and Yom Kippur is that this, its uncertainty is prohibited, whereas its uncertainty permitted,
llm_translation: Nayma assists him: There is no difference between the ninth of Av and Yom Kippur, except that this one's doubt is forbidden, and that one's doubt is permitted.

hebrew_text: מַאי סְפֵיקוֹ מוּתָּר — לָאו בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת? לָא, כִּדְאָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: לִקְבִיעָא דְיַרְחָא, הָכָא נָמֵי — לִקְבִיעָא דְיַרְחָא.
human_translation: What its uncertainty permitted? not twilight, No, as Rav Sheisha, son Rav Idi, said determination of the month, Here, too, determination of month.
llm_translation: What is the ruling regarding a doubtful case - is it permitted? Not between the sunsets? No, as Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: For the establishment of the month, here too - for the establishment of the month.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: עוּבָּרוֹת וּמְנִיקוֹת — מִתְעַנּוֹת וּמַשְׁלִימוֹת בּוֹ, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמִּתְעַנּוֹת וּמַשְׁלִימוֹת בְּיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, וּבֵין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת שֶׁלּוֹ אָסוּר. וְכֵן אָמְרוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב אֵינוֹ כְּתַעֲנִית צִיבּוּר. מַאי לָאו, לְבֵין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת? לֹא, לִמְלָאכָה.
human_translation: Rava taught: Pregnant women and nursing women fast and complete on in the manner that they fast and complete on Yom Kippur, and twilight on it is prohibited And they likewise said in the name Rabbi Yoḥanan. And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say that? Rabbi Yoḥanan say: The Ninth of Av is not like a communal fast What, isn’t it twilight? No, labor,
llm_translation: Rava expounded: Pregnant women and nursing women - they fast and complete it, in the same way as they fast and complete it on Yom Kippur, and it is forbidden between their suns. And so they said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan. And who said it is not like Rabbi Yochanan? And Rabbi Yochanan said: The ninth of Av is not like a communal fast. What is the reason? Is it because of between their suns? No, for work.

hebrew_text: מְלָאכָה? תְּנֵינָא: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת מְלָאכָה בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב — עוֹשִׂין, וּבְמָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲשׂוֹת — אֵין עוֹשִׂין. וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לָא אָמַר אֶלָּא דְּכִי יָתֵיב וְלָא עָבֵיד, לָא מִיחְזֵי כְּיוּהֲרָא, אֲבָל מֵיסָר — לָא אָסַר.
human_translation: labor? We learned a place where were accustomed to perform labor on the Ninth of Av, one performs in a place where were accustomed not to perform one does not perform And even Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel only said because when one sits and does not perform it does not appear as presumptuousness However, prohibiting he does not prohibit
llm_translation: Work? We learned: In a place where they are accustomed to work on the ninth of Av - they work, and in a place where they are not accustomed - they do not work. And even Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel did not say except that when he sits and does not work, he does not appear as if he is doing it intentionally, but if he refrains - he did not prohibit.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מַאי אֵינוֹ כְּתַעֲנִית צִיבּוּר — לִתְפִילַּת נְעִילָה. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּלְוַאי שֶׁיִּתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ!
human_translation: Rather, what is not like a communal fast? the closing prayer. But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: If only a person would continue to pray throughout the entire day?
llm_translation: Rather: What is not like the fast of the community - for the closing prayer. And Rabbi Yochanan said: If only a person would pray and walk the entire day!

hebrew_text: הָתָם חוֹבָה, הָכָא רְשׁוּת. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מַאי אֵינוֹ כְּתַעֲנִית צִיבּוּר — לְעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: There, a requirement here, optional And if you wish, say What is not like a communal fast? twenty-four
llm_translation: There, obligation, here, permission. And if you wish, say: What is not like the fast of the congregation - to twenty-four.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מַאי ״אֵינוֹ כְּתַעֲנִית צִיבּוּר״ — אֵינוֹ כָּרִאשׁוֹנוֹת, אֶלָּא כָּאַחֲרוֹנוֹת, וַאֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: What is not like a communal fast? is not first Rather, it is like the final prohibited
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: What is "it is not like the fast of the community"? - It is not like the earlier ones, but like the later ones, and it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵין בֵּין תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לְיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים אֶלָּא שֶׁזֶּה סְפֵיקוֹ אָסוּר וְזֶה סְפֵיקוֹ מוּתָּר, מַאי סְפֵיקוֹ מוּתָּר — לָאו בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת שֶׁלּוֹ! אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: לָא, לִקְבִיעָא דְיַרְחָא, הָא לְכׇל דְּבָרִים — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין.
human_translation: raises an objection: the only between the Ninth of Av and Yom Kippur is that this, its uncertainty prohibited, whereas its uncertainty permitted? What Its uncertainty permitted? not its twilight, Rav Sheisha, son Rav Idi, said No. determination of the month. to all matters this and that are equal.
llm_translation: Challenger: There is no difference between the ninth of Av and Yom Kippur except that this one's doubt is forbidden and that one's doubt is permitted. What is the doubt that is permitted? — Is it not between his sunsets! Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: No, for the establishment of the month, but in all other matters, both this and that are equal.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָסוּר לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיּוֹשִׁיט אֶצְבָּעוֹ בְּמַיִם בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁאָסוּר לְהוֹשִׁיט אֶצְבָּעוֹ בְּיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים.
human_translation: supports Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said: prohibited for a person to extend his finger into water on the Ninth of Av, just as it is prohibited to extend his finger into water on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Assisting Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said: It is forbidden for a person to dip his finger in water on the ninth of Av, in the same way that it is forbidden to dip his finger on Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵין בֵּין תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לְתַעֲנִית צִיבּוּר אֶלָּא שֶׁזֶּה אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה וְזֶה מוּתָּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ. הָא לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶם — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין. וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי תַּעֲנִית צִיבּוּר תַּנְיָא: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ ״אָסוּר בִּרְחִיצָה״, לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא כׇּל גּוּפוֹ, אֲבָל פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו — לֹא!
human_translation: raises an objection: The only between the Ninth of Av and a communal fast is that this performance of labor is prohibited, and on that performance of labor is permitted in a place where are accustomed all matters this and that are equal. However, with regard to a communal fast, it was taught When said bathing is prohibited, they said only one’s entire body, but one’s face, one’s hands, and one’s feet not
llm_translation: Challenger: There is no difference between the ninth of Av and a public fast except that this one is prohibited in the performance of labor, and that one is permitted in the performance of labor in a place where it is customary. This applies to all their matters - this and that are equal. But regarding a public fast, it was taught: When they said, "prohibited in washing," they only said this regarding his entire body, but not his face, hands, and feet!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא:
human_translation: Rav Pappa said:
llm_translation: Rav Papa said:

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קוּלֵּי קוּלֵּי קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: The tanna is teaching leniencies.
llm_translation: We have learned: "Tanna kulai kulai kathanei."

hebrew_text: וּבְכׇל מָקוֹם תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים וְכוּ׳. לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְיוּהֲרָא, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: חָיְישִׁינַן לְיוּהֲרָא? וְהָא אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ, דִּתְנַן: חָתָן, אִם יִרְצֶה לִקְרוֹת קְרִיַּת שְׁמַע לַיְלָה הָרִאשׁוֹן — קוֹרֵא. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֲמַר: לֹא כׇּל הָרוֹצֶה לִיטּוֹל אֶת הַשֵּׁם יִטּוֹל.
human_translation: And in all places Torah scholars are idle Is that to say that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds we are not concerned about presumptuousness And the Rabbis hold we are concerned about presumptuousness? Didn’t we hear them the opposite? As we learned if a groom wishes to recite Shema on the first night Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Not everyone who wishes to assume the reputation may assume
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And in every place, disciples of sages, etc. To say the opinion of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: We are not concerned for arrogance, and the Rabbis say: Are we concerned for arrogance? But the opposite we have heard for them, as we learned: A groom, if he wishes to recite the Shema on the first night — he may recite. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Not everyone who wishes to take the name may take. English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה. רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי אָמַר לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ: דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן לָא קַשְׁיָא; הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עָבְדִי מְלָאכָה וְאִיהוּ לָא עָבֵיד — מִיחְזֵי כְּיוּהֲרָא, אֲבָל הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא קָרֵי וְאִיהוּ נָמֵי קָרֵי — לָא מִיחְזֵי כְּיוּהֲרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The opinions is reversed Rav Sheisha, son Rav Idi, said: Do not reverse the Rabbis and the Rabbis not difficult. Here, since everyone is performing labor and he is not performing labor, appears like presumptuousness. However, there, it does not appear like presumptuousness, as everyone is reciting and he is also reciting
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The row of the sycamore tree. Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: Do not reverse it, for the Rabbis, when they engage in Torah study, are not problematic. Here, since the entire world is engaged in work and he is not engaged — he appears like a demon, but there, since the entire world is reading and he is also reading — he does not appear like a demon.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אַדְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לָא קַשְׁיָא; הָתָם הוּא דְּבָעֵינַן כַּוּוֹנָה, וַאֲנַן סָהֲדֵי דְּלָא מָצֵי כַּוּוֹנֵי דַּעְתֵּיהּ — מִיחְזֵי כְּיוּהֲרָא: אֲבָל הָכָא לָא מִיחְזֵי כְּיוּהֲרָא, אָמְרִי: מְלָאכָה הִיא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ, פּוֹק חֲזִי כַּמָּה בַּטְלָנֵי אִיכָּא בְּשׁוּקָא.
human_translation: between Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel not difficult. There, it is that we require concentration, and it is clear to all he is unable to concentrate it appears like presumptuousness. However, here, it does not appear like presumptuousness, say: It is he has no labor Go out and see how many idle people there are in the marketplace,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is not difficult. There, where we require intention, and we testify that his intention is not found - it appears as if it is intentional. But here, it does not appear as if it is intentional. They said: It is a task that does not have intention, go and see how many idle people there are in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בִּיהוּדָה הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בְּעַרְבֵי פְסָחִים עַד חֲצוֹת, וּבַגָּלִיל לֹא הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין כׇּל עִיקָּר. הַלַּיְלָה, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹסְרִים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין עַד הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: In Judea, would perform labor on Passover eves until midday, and in the Galilee would not perform at all. the night Beit Shammai prohibit and Beit Hillel permit until sunrise.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And the sages say: In Judea, they would work on the eve of Passover until midnight, but in the Galilee, they did not work at all. That night, Beit Shammai prohibit, and Beit Hillel permit until sunrise.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מֵעִיקָּרָא תְּנָא מִנְהָגָא, וּלְבַסּוֹף תְּנָא אִיסּוּרָא!
human_translation: Initially, taught custom and ultimately, he taught that it is prohibited
llm_translation: A Tanna taught initially according to custom, and in the end, he taught prohibition!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — רַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בִּיהוּדָה הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בְּעַרְבֵי פְסָחִים עַד חֲצוֹת, וּבַגָּלִיל אֵינָן עוֹשִׂין כׇּל עִיקָּר. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מָה רְאָיָיה יְהוּדָה וְגָלִיל לְכָאן? אֶלָּא, מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת מְלָאכָה — עוֹשִׂין, מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲשׂוֹת — אֵין עוֹשִׂין. מִדְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר מִנְהָגָא — מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אִיסּוּרָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: not difficult, that Rabbi Meir, this Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught Rabbi Yehuda said: In Judea they would perform labor on Passover eves until midday, and in the Galilee they would not perform at all. Rabbi Meir said to him: What proof from Judea and the Galilee to here? Rather, a place where were accustomed to perform labor, one performs and a place where were accustomed not to perform one does not perform From that Rabbi Meir is speaking custom, by inference, Rabbi Yehuda is speaking prohibition
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan, not difficult: this - Rabbi Meir, this - Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught, said Rabbi Yehuda: In Judea they would work on the eve of Passover until midnight, but in the Galilee they do not do anything significant. Rabbi Meir said to him: What proof is there from Judea and the Galilee to here? Rather, a place where they are accustomed to work - they work, a place where they are accustomed not to work - they do not work. From the fact that Rabbi Meir speaks of custom - it is evident that Rabbi Yehuda is referring to prohibition.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר מוּתָּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַמְנַכֵּשׁ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר וְנֶעְקְרָה בְּיָדוֹ — שׁוֹתְלָהּ בִּמְקוֹם הַטִּיט, וְאֵין שׁוֹתְלָהּ בִּמְקוֹם הַגְּרִיד.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yehuda hold that performance of labor on the fourteenth is permitted Wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: one who is weeding the thirteenth and was uprooted in his hand, he plants it in a muddy place one not plant it in a dry place,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds: fourteen days are permitted for the performance of labor? And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: One who plants on the fourteenth day and it is uprooted in his hand — he should plant it in a place of clay, and he should not plant it in a place of gravel.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר — אִין, בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר — לָא. מִכְּדִי שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הַרְכָּבָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת לִשְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים — שׁוּב אֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר מוּתָּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה, לְמָה לִי שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר? וְהָאִיכָּא אַרְבֵּיסַר וַחֲמֵיסַר וּמִקְצָת שִׁיתְּסַר! אָמַר רָבָא: בַּגָּלִיל שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: on the thirteenth yes, on the fourteenth no, Now, we learned Rabbi Yehuda said: Any graft that does not take hold within three days will no longer take hold. If it could enter your mind performing labor on the fourteenth is permitted, why I thirteenth? Aren’t there the fourteenth the fifteenth and part of the sixteenth Rava said: They taught the Galilee;
llm_translation: In thirteen — no, in fourteen — not. Because we heard it in the name of Rabbi Yehuda who said: Any carriage that does not travel for three days — if it goes back, it does not travel. And if it enters your mind that fourteen is permitted for work, why do I need thirteen? But there are the twelfth, thirteenth, and some of the fourteenth! Rava said: They taught this in the Galilee.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא לֵילְיָא! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם כְּבֵית הִלֵּל — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכָּן שֶׁל בְּנֵי אָדָם לְנַכֵּשׁ בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: Isn’t there the night Rav Sheshet said: in accordance with Beit Shammai, Rav Ashi said: Actually, with Beit Hillel. because it is not the manner of people to weed at night.
llm_translation: And there is a night! Rav Sheshet said: Like Beit Shammai. Rav Ashi said: Rather, like Beit Hillel - because it is not the way of people to grope in the darkness at night.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם בִּיהוּדָה, וּבְהַשְׁרָשָׁה חַד ״מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ״ — אָמְרִינַן, תְּרֵי ״מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ״ — לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: Ravina said: Actually, to Judea. taking root, we state once part of the day is like the entire do not state twice part of the day is like the entire
llm_translation: Ravina said: Always in Judah, and in the root one "part of the day is like the whole day" — we say, two "part of the day is like the whole day" — we do not say.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מְלָאכָה שֶׁהִתְחִיל בָּהּ קוֹדֶם לְאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, גּוֹמְרָהּ בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר. אֲבָל לֹא יַתְחִיל בָּהּ בַּתְּחִלָּה בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְגוֹמְרָהּ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: שָׁלֹשׁ אוּמָּנִיּוֹת עוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בְּעַרְבֵי פְסָחִים עַד חֲצוֹת, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: הַחַיָּיטִין, וְהַסַּפָּרִים, וְהַכּוֹבְסִין. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף רַצְעָנִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: any labor that one began before the fourteenth he may complete it on the fourteenth However, one not begin from the outset on the fourteenth, even if he is able to complete it And the Rabbis say: three crafts perform labor until midday on Passover eve, and they are: Tailors, barbers, and launderers, Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: Even shoemakers
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Meir says: Any work that one began before the fourteenth of Nisan, he may complete it on the fourteenth. But one may not begin it initially on the fourteenth, even though he could complete it. And the Sages say: Three types of craftsmen may work on the eve of Passover until midnight, and they are: tailors, scribes, and launderers. Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: Also dyers.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד תְּנַן, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — אֲפִילּוּ מִיגְמַר נָמֵי לָא, אוֹ דִילְמָא: שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד תְּנַן, אֲבָל לְצוֹרֶךְ — אַתְחוֹלֵי מַתְחֲלִינַן, אוֹ דִילְמָא: בֵּין לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ, מִיגְמַר — אִין, אַתְחוֹלֵי — לָא.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before for the purpose of the Festival we learned but that is not for the purpose of the Festival may not even be completed? Or perhaps that is not for the purpose of the Festival we learned but that is for the purpose we initiate Or perhaps, both that is for the purpose of the Festival and that is not for the purpose completing, yes, initiating, no,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: We learned for the need of the festival, but for not the need of the festival - even if we say "we do not conclude," or perhaps: we learned not for the need of the festival, but for the need of the festival - we permit preparations, or perhaps: whether for the need of the festival or not for the need of the festival - if we conclude, we do not permit preparations; if we permit preparations, we do not conclude.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֲבָל לֹא יַתְחִיל בַּתְּחִילָּה בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר אֲפִילּוּ צִלְצוֹל קָטָן אֲפִילּוּ שְׂבָכָה קְטַנָּה. מַאי ״אֲפִילּוּ״? לָאו אֲפִילּוּ הָנֵי, דִּלְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד, מִיגְמַר — אִין, אַתְחוֹלֵי — לָא?! מִכְּלָל דְּשֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ — מִיגְמַר נָמֵי לָא גָּמְרִינַן!
human_translation: Come hear However, one may not begin from the outset on the fourteenth, even a small belt, or even a small hairnet. What even Isn’t it even those that are for the purpose of the Festival, completing, yes, initiating, no, by inference, that is not for the purpose we may not even complete
llm_translation: Come and hear: But one may not begin initially with fourteen, even a small clatter, even a small pebble. What is meant by "even"? Not these, which are necessary for the festival, if he finishes - no, if he does not finish?! From the inference that if not for the festival - if he finishes, we also do not finish!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם דְּשֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ מִיגְמַר נָמֵי גָּמְרִינַן, וּמַאי ״אֲפִילּוּ״? אֲפִילּוּ הָנֵי נָמֵי, דְּזוּטְרֵי נִינְהוּ, דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא הַתְחָלָתָן זוֹ הִיא גְּמַר מְלַאכְתָּן — נַתְחֵיל בְּהוּ נָמֵי לְכַתְּחִילָּה, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: No; actually that is not for the purpose we also complete, And what even? even these which are small; as it could enter your mind to say: their initiation is their completion, let us even initiate ab initio . it teaches us
llm_translation: Not, forever that not for need from we learn, and what "even"? Even these we learn, that minors they are, that your mind ascends I say their beginning this is their work completed — we begin with them initially, it is heard to us.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מְלָאכָה שֶׁהִיא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד —
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Meir says: any labor that is for the purpose of the Festival,
llm_translation: Come and hear. Rabbi Meir says: Any labor that is for the sake of the festival —

hebrew_text: גּוֹמְרָהּ בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִתְחִיל בָּהּ קוֹדֶם אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, אֲבָל לֹא הִתְחִיל בָּהּ קוֹדֶם אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר — לֹא יַתְחִיל בָּהּ בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, אֲפִילּוּ צִילְצוֹל קָטָן, אֲפִילּוּ שְׂבָכָה קְטַנָּה. לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — אִין, שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — לָא. הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ נָמֵי גָּמְרִינַן, וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד, מִיגְמַר — אִין, אַתְחוֹלֵי — לָא.
human_translation: one completes it on the fourteenth. When when he initiated prior to the fourteenth. However, he did not initiate prior to the fourteenth, he should not initiate it on the fourteenth, even a small belt or even a small hairnet. for the purpose of the Festival, yes, not for the purpose of the Festival, no, the same is true; we also complete even when it is not for the purpose of And this teach us that even for the purpose of the Festival, completing yes, initiating no,
llm_translation: He completes it on the fourteenth. When? If he began it before the fourteenth, but if he did not begin it before the fourteenth, he may not begin it on the fourteenth, even with a small pebble or a small chip. For the purpose of the festival - yes, not for the purpose of the festival - no. The same law applies even if not for the purpose, we complete it. And this teaches us that even for the purpose of the festival, if he completes - yes, if he delays - no.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מְלָאכָה שֶׁהִיא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — גּוֹמְרָהּ בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — אָסוּר, וְעוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בְּעַרְבֵי פְסָחִים עַד חֲצוֹת בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ. מְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ — אִין, לֹא נָהֲגוּ — לָא, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — אִין, שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — לָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Meir says: any labor that is for the purpose of the Festival, one complete it on the fourteenth, and is not for the purpose of the Festival, it is prohibited And one perform labor on Passover eves until midday in a place where were accustomed place where were accustomed yes, where were not accustomed no, And learn from it for the purpose of the Festival, yes, not for the purpose of the Festival, no, learn from it
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Meir says: Any work that is for the need of the festival - one may complete it until the fourteenth day, and if it is not for the need of the festival - it is forbidden. And they perform work on the eve of Passover until midnight in a place where it is customary. Where it is customary - yes, where it is not customary - no. And learn from it: for the need of the festival - yes, not for the need of the festival - no. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים שָׁלֹשׁ אוּמָּנִיּוֹת. תָּנָא: הַחַיָּיטִין, שֶׁכֵּן הֶדְיוֹט תּוֹפֵר כְּדַרְכּוֹ בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. הַסַּפָּרִין וְהַכּוֹבְסִין, שֶׁכֵּן הַבָּא מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם וְהַיּוֹצֵא מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין מְסַפְּרִין וּמְכַבְּסִין בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הָרַצְעָנִין, שֶׁכֵּן עוֹלֵי רְגָלִים מְתַקְּנִין מִנְעָלֵיהֶן בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד.
human_translation: the Rabbis say: three crafts It was taught The tailors as a layperson sew in his manner during the intermediate days Barbers and launderers, as one who arrives from a country overseas or one who leaves prison may cut their hair and wash on the intermediate days Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Shoemakers also because Festival pilgrims repair their shoes during the intermediate days of the Festival.
llm_translation: The Sages say: three skilled trades. It was taught: the weavers, for so the common people weave in their usual manner on the weekday of the festival. The barbers and launderers, for so one who comes from a coastal town and one who comes out from prison cut hair and launder clothes on the weekday of the festival. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: also the shoemakers, for so pilgrims repair their shoes on the weekday of the festival.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: לְמֵידִין תְּחִילַּת מְלָאכָה מִסּוֹף מְלָאכָה, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין לְמֵידִין תְּחִילַּת מְלָאכָה מִסּוֹף מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: With regard to what disagree? Sage, holds: We learn the initiation of labor from the conclusion of labor; And Sage, holds: We cannot learn the initiation of labor from the conclusion of labor;
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Master holds: We learn the beginning of work from the end of work, and Master holds: We do not learn the beginning of work from the end of work.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מוֹשִׁיבִין שׁוֹבָכִין לְתַרְנְגוֹלִים בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר. וְתַרְנְגוֹלֶת שֶׁבָּרְחָה — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתָהּ לִמְקוֹמָהּ, וְאִם מֵתָה — מוֹשִׁיבִין אַחֶרֶת תַּחְתֶּיהָ. גּוֹרְפִין מִתַּחַת רַגְלֵי בְּהֵמָה בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, וּבַמּוֹעֵד מְסַלְּקִין לִצְדָדִין. מוֹלִיכִין כֵּלִים וּמְבִיאִין מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָם לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד.
human_translation: One may place eggs under hens fourteenth And hen fled one restore it to its place. And if died, one place another in its stead. one may sweep from beneath the legs of an animal the fourteenth And during Festival one may clear to the sides. one take vessels to the craftsman’s house and bring even though they are not for the purpose of the Festival.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may set traps for chickens on the fourteenth day of the month. If a hen escapes, one must return it to its place; if it dies, another may be set in its place. One may remove vessels from under an animal's feet on the fourteenth day of the month, but on a festival, they are removed to the side. One may bring utensils and vessels from the artisan's house, even though they are not needed for the festival.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַשְׁתָּא אוֹתוֹבֵי מוֹתְבִינַן, אַהְדּוֹרֵי מִיבַּעְיָא?! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: סֵיפָא אֲתָאן לְחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד.
human_translation: Now, placing is it necessary restoring Abaye said: In the last clause we have arrived at intermediate days
llm_translation: Gemara: "If he drinks that, will we be able to understand it?!" Abaye said: "The conclusion comes to the mundane part of the festival."
