hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא תּוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה לְמִרְדָּהּ — דְּאַכַּתִּי לָא פְּרַח צִימְרָא מִינָּה, וְאַחַר שְׁלֹשָׁה לִישִׁיבָתָהּ — דְּפָסְדָא לַהּ בֵּיעֵי לִגְמָרֵי. אֲבָל לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשָׁה לְמִרְדָּהּ, דִּפְרַח לַהּ צִימְרָא מִינָּה, וְתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה לִישִׁיבָתָהּ, דְּאַכַּתִּי לָא פְּסִידִי בֵּיעֵי לִגְמָרֵי — לָא מַהְדְּרִינַן. רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תּוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה לִישִׁיבָתָהּ מַהְדְּרִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: They taught only three days of its rebellion, as the heat has not yet dissipated three after sitting, when the eggs totally ruined, However, three after its rebellion, when its heat has dissipated, or within three from when it sitting, when not the eggs totally ruined, one not restore Rabbi Ami said: Even within three from when it began sitting, one restore
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: They only taught this law when within three days of her rebellion - for if a sprig of wool was plucked from it, and after three days for her sitting - it would be a complete loss to her. But after three days of her rebellion, when a sprig of wool has sprouted from it, and within three days for her sitting, if it was plucked, it would not be a complete loss - we do not return it. Rabbi Ammi said: Even within three days for her sitting, we return it.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: לְהֶפְסֵד מְרוּבֶּה חָשְׁשׁוּ, לְהֶפְסֵד מוּעָט — לֹא חָשְׁשׁוּ, וּמָר סָבַר: לְהֶפְסֵד מוּעָט נָמֵי חָשְׁשׁוּ.
human_translation: With regard to what disagree? Sage, holds to a major loss, were concerned to a minor loss they were not concerned. And Sage, holds to a minor loss, they were also concerned,
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Master holds: for a loss of the majority they were concerned, for a loss of the minority - they were not concerned. And Master holds: for a loss of the minority they were also concerned.

hebrew_text: גּוֹרְפִין מִתַּחַת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַזֶּבֶל שֶׁבֶּחָצֵר מְסַלְּקִין אוֹתוֹ לִצְדָדִין, שֶׁבָּרֶפֶת וְשֶׁבֶּחָצֵר מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לָאַשְׁפָּה.
human_translation: One may sweep from beneath The Sages taught the dung in a courtyard, one clear it to the sides, that is in the barn and in a courtyard, one may take it out to the garbage
llm_translation: They dig from below. The Rabbis taught: The dung in the courtyard, they remove it to the sides, that in the street and that in the courtyard, they take it out to the garbage dump.

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ: זֶבֶל שֶׁבֶּחָצֵר מְסַלְּקִין אוֹתוֹ לִצְדָדִין, וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי: שֶׁבָּרֶפֶת וְשֶׁבֶּחָצֵר מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לָאַשְׁפָּה! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, כָּאן בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. רָבָא אָמַר: הָא וְהָא בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם נַעֲשָׂה חָצֵר כְּרֶפֶת — מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לָאַשְׁפָּה.
human_translation: This itself is difficult. you said: the dung in a courtyard, one clear it to the sides, And then it was taught that is in the barn and in a courtyard, one may take it out to the garbage Abaye said: not difficult. Here, fourteenth There, to intermediate days of the Festival. Rava said: this and that to intermediate days, and this is it is saying: if the courtyard becomes as a barn, one take out to the garbage
llm_translation: The matter is difficult. You said: The dung in the courtyard, they remove it to the sides. And later you taught: The dung in the rampart and the dung in the courtyard, they take it out to the garbage dump! Abaye said: It is not difficult. Here it is on the fourteenth of Nisan, here it is on a weekday of the festival. Rava said: This one and that one are both referring to cases on a weekday of the festival, and thus he said: If a courtyard becomes like a rampart - they take it out to the garbage dump.

hebrew_text: מוֹלִיכִין כֵּלִים וּמְבִיאִין מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בָּדֵיק לַן רָבָא. תְּנַן: מוֹלִיכִין וּמְבִיאִין כֵּלִים מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָן לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד. וּרְמִינְהוּ: אֵין מְבִיאִין כֵּלִים מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן, וְאִם חוֹשֵׁשׁ לָהֶן שֶׁמָּא יִגָּנְבוּ — מְפַנָּן לְחָצֵר אַחֶרֶת!
human_translation: One take vessels to the craftsman’s house and bring Rav Pappa said: Rava tested us. We learned One take vessels the craftsman’s house and bring from even if they are not for the purpose of the Festival. raised a contradiction One not bring vessels from a craftsman’s house, and if he is concerned lest they be stolen, he may move them to another courtyard
llm_translation: We bring vessels and bring from the craftsman's house. Rav Papa said: Rava examines us. We learned: We bring and bring vessels from the craftsman's house, even though they are not needed for the festival. And they raised a dilemma: We do not bring vessels from the craftsman's house, and if one is concerned that they might be stolen - we move them to another courtyard!

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁנֵּינַן, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, כָּאן — בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, הָא וְהָא בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בְּמַאֲמִינוֹ, כָּאן — בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מַאֲמִינוֹ.
human_translation: And we answered: not difficult. Here, fourteenth There, to the intermediate days And if you wish, say this and that to the intermediate days, and not difficult. Here, he trusts there, he does not trust him.
llm_translation: We learn, it is not difficult: here - on the fourteenth, here - on the eve of the festival. And if you wish, say: here and here on the eve of the festival, and it is not difficult: here - with intent, here - without intent.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מְבִיאִין כֵּלִים מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן, כְּגוֹן הַכַּד מִבֵּית הַכַּדָּר, וְהַכּוֹס מִבֵּית הַזַּגָּג. אֲבָל לֹא צֶמֶר מִבֵּית הַצַּבָּע, וְלֹא כֵּלִים מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן, וְאִם אֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל — נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ וּמַנִּיחוֹ אֶצְלוֹ. וְאִם אֵינוֹ מַאֲמִינוֹ — מַנִּיחָן בְּבַיִת הַסָּמוּךְ לוֹ. וְאִם חוֹשֵׁשׁ שֶׁמָּא יִגָּנְבוּ — מְבִיאָן בְּצִינְעָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: As it taught One bring vessels from the house of a craftsman, such as a jug from the house of a potter, or a cup from the house of a glassmaker, but neither wool from the house of a dyer nor vessels from the house of a craftsman And if has nothing to eat, one gives his payment and leaves with him. And if he does not trust he leaves them in the adjacent house. And if he is concerned lest be stolen, he bring them to his house surreptitiously.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: One may bring utensils from the craftsman's house, such as a pitcher from the potter's house, and a cup from the glassblower's house. However, one may not bring wool from the dyer's house, nor utensils from the craftsman's house. And if one has nothing to eat, he gives him his wages and leaves them with him. And if he does not trust him, he leaves them in a neighboring house. And if he is concerned they may be stolen, he brings them in secretly into his house.

hebrew_text: תָּרֵצְתְּ מְבִיאִין. מוֹלִיכִין קַשְׁיָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: אֵין מְבִיאִין וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן דְּאֵין מוֹלִיכִין! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנִּינַן מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: You have resolved bringing taking difficult, as it was taught: One not bring, and all the more so one may not take Rather, it is clear as we answered initially,
llm_translation: The text reads: "If you wish, bring it. We bring a bundle of straw, as it was taught: 'We do not bring, and all the more so we do not carry!' Rather, it is a demonstration, as we learn from the outset."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים עָשׂוּ אַנְשֵׁי יְרִיחוֹ, עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה מִיחוּ בְּיָדָם וְעַל שְׁלֹשָׁה לֹא מִיחוּ בְּיָדָם. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן שֶׁלֹּא מִיחוּ בְּיָדָם: מַרְכִּיבִין דְּקָלִים כׇּל הַיּוֹם, וְכוֹרְכִין אֶת שְׁמַע, וְקוֹצְרִין וְגוֹדְשִׁין לִפְנֵי הָעוֹמֶר. וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁמִּיחוּ בְּיָדָם: מַתִּירִין גַּמְזִיּוֹת שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ,
human_translation: Six actions were performed by the residents of Jericho, to three, reprimanded them, and to three, did not reprimand them. And these are the ones which they did not reprimand them: graft palm trees the entire day and bundle Shema , and harvest and pile before the omer And these are the ones reprimanded them: permit consecrated branches
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The people of Jericho performed six actions, concerning three they were diligent, and concerning three they were not diligent. And these are the actions they were not diligent about: they would transport bundles of palm branches all day, they would tie the Shema, and they would harvest and thresh before the omer. And these are the actions they were diligent about: they would permit the trimming of shoots of the vineyard.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹכְלִין מִתַּחַת הַנְּשָׁרִים בְּשַׁבָּת, וְנוֹתְנִין פֵּאָה לַיָּרָק. וּמִיחוּ בְּיָדָם חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: and eat from beneath trees that shed fruit on Shabbat; and they designate corner vegetables, And the Sages reprimanded
llm_translation: And eating from under the eagles on Shabbat, and giving tithes to the vegetables. And they argued in their hands, the sages.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁשָּׁה דְבָרִים עָשָׂה חִזְקִיָּה הַמֶּלֶךְ, עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה הוֹדוּ לוֹ, וְעַל שְׁלֹשָׁה לֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ: גֵּירַר עַצְמוֹת אָבִיו עַל מִטָּה שֶׁל חֲבָלִים — וְהוֹדוּ לוֹ. כִּיתַּת נְחַשׁ הַנְּחשֶׁת — וְהוֹדוּ לוֹ. גָּנַז סֵפֶר רְפוּאוֹת — וְהוֹדוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: King Hezekiah performed six actions. With regard to three conceded to him; and with regard to three did not concede to him. he dragged the bones of his father on a bier of ropes and conceded to him. He ground the copper snake and conceded to him. He suppressed the Book of Cures, and they conceded to him.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Six things did King Hezekiah do, for three they praised him, and for three they did not praise him: He dragged the bones of his father on a bed of ropes - and they praised him. He cut up the copper serpent - and they praised him. He hid the Book of Remedies - and they praised him.

hebrew_text: וְעַל שְׁלֹשָׁה לֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ: קִיצֵּץ דְּלָתוֹת שֶׁל הֵיכָל וְשִׁיגְּרָן לְמֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר — וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ. סָתַם מֵי גִיחוֹן הָעֶלְיוֹן — וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ. עִיבֵּר נִיסָן בְּנִיסָן — וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: And with regard to three did not concede to him. He cut off the doors of the Sanctuary and sent them to the King of Assyria, and they did not concede to him He sealed the waters of the upper Gihon and they did not concede to him, He intercalated of Nisan during Nisan, and they did not concede to him.
llm_translation: "And on three they did not praise him: He cut the doors of the Heichal and sent them to the king of Assyria - and they did not praise him. He stopped the upper Gichon waters - and they did not praise him. He passed through Nisan in Nisan - and they did not praise him."

hebrew_text: מַרְכִּיבִין דְּקָלִים כׇּל הַיּוֹם וְכוּ׳. הֵיכִי עָבְדִי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מַיְיתֵי אָסָא דָּרָא וְשִׁיכְרָא דְּדַפְנָא וְקִימְחָא דִשְׂעָרֵי דִּרְמֵי בְּמָנָא דְּלָא חָלְפִי עֲלֵיהּ אַרְבְּעִין יוֹמִין, וּמַרְתְּחִי לְהוּ, וְשָׁדוּ לְהוּ לְדִיקְלָא בְּלִיבֵּיהּ, וְכׇל דְּקָאֵי בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דִּידֵיהּ, אִי לָא עָבְדִי לֵיהּ הָכִי — צָאוֵי לְאַלְתַּר. רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: מַנְּחִי כּוּפְרָא דִּיכְרָא לְנוּקְבְּתָא.
human_translation: They graft palm trees the entire day How did they perform Rabbi Yehuda said: They brought fresh myrtle, strong beer from the laurel tree, and barley flour that was cast into a vessel, and forty days has not passed They boiled them and poured into the core of the palm tree. any standing within four cubits of that if they did not perform this it would immediately wither Rav Aḥa, son Rava, said: They placed a branch of a male palm tree on the female,
llm_translation: We place palm branches all day, etc. How do we do it? Rav Yehudah said: Bring the juice of a male date palm, beer of barley, and flour of sycamore figs, mix them in a vessel that has not been used for forty days, let it ferment, pour it into the heart of the palm tree, and anyone who stands within four cubits of it, if he does not do so, should leave immediately. Rav Acha, son of Rava, said: Place pitch of a palm tree on the tip.

hebrew_text: וְכוֹרְכִין אֶת שְׁמַע. הֵיכִי עָבְדִי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אוֹמְרִים ״שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ ה׳ אֶחָד״, וְלֹא הָיוּ מַפְסִיקִין. רָבָא אָמַר: מַפְסִיקִין הָיוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״הַיּוֹם עַל לְבָבֶךָ״, דְּמַשְׁמַע: הַיּוֹם עַל לְבָבֶךָ, וְלֹא מָחָר עַל לְבָבֶךָ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד הָיוּ כּוֹרְכִין אֶת שְׁמַע? אוֹמְרִים ״שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ ה׳ אֶחָד״, וְלֹא הָיוּ מַפְסִיקִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מַפְסִיקִין הָיוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״בָּרוּךְ שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד״.
human_translation: bundle Shema . How did they do Rabbi Yehuda said they recited: “Hear Israel: The Lord is our God, the Lord is One and they would not pause Rava said: They pause but they would say: Today shall be on your heart, Today it will be on your heart, and tomorrow it will not be on your heart. The Sages taught How would they bundle Shema ? They recited: “Hear Israel, the Lord is our God the Lord is One,” without pausing; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: They paused, but they would not recite: Blessed be the name of His glorious kingdom for ever and ever.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And they wrap themselves with the Shema. How do they do this? Rav Yehudah said: They say "Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is One," and they do not interrupt. Rava said: They would interrupt, but they were saying "today upon your heart," implying: today upon your heart, and not tomorrow upon your heart. The Rabbis taught: How would they wrap themselves with the Shema? They say "Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is One," and they do not interrupt, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehudah says: They would interrupt, but they were not saying "Blessed be the Name of the glory of His kingdom forever and ever."

hebrew_text: וַאֲנַן, מַאי טַעְמָא אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ? כִּדְדָרֵישׁ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: What is the reason that we recite in accordance with which Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish interpreted homiletically.
llm_translation: And we, what is the reason that we say to him? As Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish expounded.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: ״וַיִּקְרָא יַעֲקֹב אֶל בָּנָיו וַיֹּאמֶר הֵאָסְפוּ וְאַגִּידָה לָכֶם״. בִּיקֵּשׁ יַעֲקֹב לְגַלּוֹת לְבָנָיו קֵץ הַיָּמִין, וְנִסְתַּלְּקָה מִמֶּנּוּ שְׁכִינָה. אָמַר: שֶׁמָּא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם יֵשׁ בְּמִטָּתִי פְּסוּל, כְּאַבְרָהָם שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנּוּ יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְאָבִי יִצְחָק שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנּוּ עֵשָׂו? אָמְרוּ לוֹ בָּנָיו: ״שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל, ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ ה׳ אֶחָד״. אָמְרוּ: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין בְּלִבְּךָ אֶלָּא אֶחָד, כָּךְ אֵין בְּלִבֵּנוּ אֶלָּא אֶחָד. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה פָּתַח יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ וְאָמַר: ״בָּרוּךְ שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד״.
human_translation: As Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said “And Jacob called his sons and said, Gather around and I will tell you Jacob wanted to reveal to his sons the end of days but the Divine Presence abandoned him, He said: Perhaps Heaven forfend, one of my descendants is unfit, as Abraham, from whom Ishmael emerged, and my father Isaac, from whom Esau emerged. His sons said to him: Hear Israel, the Lord is our God, the Lord is One. They said: Just as there is only one in your heart, so too, there is only one in our hearts. At that moment Jacob our father said Blessed be the name of His glorious kingdom for ever and ever,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: "And Jacob called to his sons and said, 'Gather together, and I will tell you.'" Jacob sought to reveal to his sons the end of days, but the Divine Presence departed from him. He said: Perhaps there is God forbid a blemish in my bed, like Abraham from whom Ishmael emerged, and my father Isaac from whom Esau emerged? His sons said to him: "Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is One." They said: Just as in your heart there is only One, so too in our hearts there is only One. At that moment, our father Jacob opened and said: "Blessed be the name of the glory of His kingdom forever and ever."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? נֵאמְרֵיהּ, לֹא אֲמָרוֹ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ. לָא נֵאמְרֵיהּ, אֲמָרוֹ יַעֲקֹב. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ אוֹמְרִים אוֹתוֹ בַּחֲשַׁאי. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מָשָׁל לְבַת מֶלֶךְ שֶׁהֵרִיחָה צִיקֵי קְדֵירָה. אִם תֹּאמַר — יֵשׁ לָהּ גְּנַאי. לֹא תֹּאמַר — יֵשׁ לָהּ צַעַר. הִתְחִילוּ עֲבָדֶיהָ לְהָבִיא בַּחֲשַׁאי.
human_translation: The Rabbis said: What should we do? Shall we recite Moses our teacher did not say it Shall we not recite it? Jacob said it. they established that should be recited surreptitiously. Rabbi Yitzḥak said the school of Rabbi Ami said: analogous to the daughter of a king who smelled spices the pot If she tells she will be disgraced, she does not say she will suffering. Her servants began to bring surreptitiously.
llm_translation: The sages said: How should we conduct ourselves? They said, Moses our teacher did not say it. They did not say it, Jacob said it. They established that it should be said in secret. Rabbi Yitzchak said, the sages of the house of Ammi said: A parable to a king's daughter who smelled a pot of spices. If you say - she has disgrace. If you do not say - she has pain. Her servants began to bring it in secret.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ אוֹמְרִים אוֹתוֹ בְּקוֹל רָם, מִפְּנֵי תַּרְעוֹמֶת הַמִּינִין. וּבִנְהַרְדְּעָא, דְּלֵיכָּא מִינִין, עַד הַשְׁתָּא אָמְרִי לַהּ בַּחֲשַׁאי.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: instituted that should recite it aloud due to the grievance of the heretics. In Neharde’a, where there are no heretics, they recite it surreptitiously even now.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: They established that it should be said in a loud voice, because of the arrogance of the heretics. And in Nehardea, where there are no heretics, until now they say it quietly.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים עָשׂוּ אַנְשֵׁי יְרִיחוֹ, שְׁלֹשָׁה בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים. וְאֵלּוּ בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים: מַרְכִּיבִין דְּקָלִים כׇּל הַיּוֹם, וְכוֹרְכִין אֶת שְׁמַע, וְקוֹצְרִין לִפְנֵי הָעוֹמֶר. וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים: גּוֹדְשִׁין לִפְנֵי הָעוֹמֶר, וּפוֹרְצִין פְּרָצוֹת בְּגַנּוֹתֵיהֶן וּבְפַרְדְּסוֹתֵיהֶן לְהַאֲכִיל נֶשֶׁר לַעֲנִיִּים בִּשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים, וּמַתִּירִין גַּמְזִיּוֹת שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁל חָרוּב וְשֶׁל שִׁקְמָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: The Sages taught The people of Jericho performed six actions, three with the will of the Sages and three against the will of the Sages. And these with the will of the Sages: They graft palm trees the entire day and they bundle Shema ; and they harvest before the omer And these against the will of the Sages: They pile before the omer ; and they make breaches in their gardens and their orchards to feed fallen to the poor during drought years, on Shabbat and Festivals; and they permit consecrated branches of carob and of sycamore the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The people of Jericho did six things, three with the consent of the Sages, and three without the consent of the Sages. And these are with the consent of the Sages: they would arrange palm branches all day, and wrap themselves in the tallit for the Shema, and harvest before the Omer. And these are without the consent of the Sages: they would thresh before the Omer, and break open breaches in their gardens and orchards to feed the poor with the produce on Sabbaths and festivals, and permit the pruning of shoots of the carob and sycamore trees, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אִם בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין, יְהוּ כׇּל אָדָם עוֹשִׂין כֵּן. אֶלָּא: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין, עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה מִיחוּ בְּיָדָם, וְעַל שְׁלֹשָׁה לֹא מִיחוּ בְּיָדָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to him: if they acted with the will of the Sages, all people would do so, Rather, these and those were performed against the will of the Sages. With regard to three reprimanded them; and with regard to three did not reprimand them.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehuda: If with the will of the sages they were doing, let all man do so. Rather: these and these that not with the will of the sages they were doing, upon three they have control in their hands, and upon three they do not have control in their hands.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁלֹּא מִיחוּ בְּיָדָם: מַרְכִּיבִין דְּקָלִים כׇּל הַיּוֹם, וְכוֹרְכִין אֶת שְׁמַע, וְקוֹצְרִין וְגוֹדְשִׁין לִפְנֵי הָעוֹמֶר. וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁמִּיחוּ בְּיָדָם: מַתִּירִין גַּמְזִיּוֹת שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁל חָרוּב וְשֶׁל שִׁקְמָה, וּפוֹרְצִין פְּרָצוֹת בְּגַנּוֹתֵיהֶן וּפַרְדְּסֵיהֶן לְהַאֲכִיל נֶשֶׁר לַעֲנִיִּים בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים בִּשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת, נוֹתְנִין פֵּיאָה לַיָּרָק, וּמִיחוּ בְּיָדָם חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: And these did not reprimand them: They graft palm trees the entire day; and they bundle Shema ; and they harvest and pile before the omer And these reprimanded them: They permit consecrated branches of carob and of sycamore they make breaches in their gardens and orchards on Shabbat and Festivals, in order to feed the poor fallen fruit during drought years; and they designate the corner vegetables. And the Sages reprimanded them
llm_translation: And these are cases that are not placed in their hands: they stack bundles of palm branches all day, and they tie the Shema, and they harvest and gather before the omer. And these are cases that are placed in their hands: they permit the pruning of shoots of the carob tree and the sycamore tree, and they break open breaches in their gardens and orchards to feed the poor on Sabbaths and festivals in the two bazors, they give the corner of the field to the vegetable, and the sages place in their hands.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה קְצִירָה שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים הִיא? וְהָתְנַן: אַנְשֵׁי יְרִיחוֹ קוֹצְרִין לִפְנֵי הָעוֹמֶר בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים, וְגוֹדְשִׁין לִפְנֵי הָעוֹמֶר שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים, וְלֹא מִיחוּ בְּיָדָם חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda maintain harvest was against the will of the Sages? Didn’t we learn The people of Jericho harvest before the omer , with the will of the Sages, and they pile before the omer , against the will of the Sages, but the Sages did not reprimand them?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda thought: Is reaping without the consent of the sages considered reaping? But we learned: The people of Jericho reap before the omer with the consent of the sages, and they gather before the omer without the consent of the sages, and the sages do not protest against them.

hebrew_text: מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר ״מִיחוּ״ וְ״לֹא מִיחוּ״ — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְקָתָנֵי: קוֹצְרִין בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים! וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, הָנֵי אַרְבְּעָה הֲוָה! אֶלָּא: סְמִי מִיכָּן קְצִירָה.
human_translation: Whom did you hear that said: Reprimanded and did not reprimand? Rabbi Yehuda, And Rabbi Yehuda is teaching they harvest will of the Sages. And according to your reasoning, these are four: Rather, delete harvest here.
llm_translation: One who heard that he said "to harvest" and "not to harvest" - Rabbi Yehuda. And it teaches: We harvest with the consent of the sages! And to taste, those four were! Rather: from there is the reaping.

hebrew_text: וּמַתִּירִין גַּמְזִיּוֹת שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁל חָרוּב וְשֶׁל שִׁקְמָה. אָמְרוּ: אֲבוֹתֵינוּ לֹא הִקְדִּישׁוּ אֶלָּא קוֹרוֹת, וְאָנוּ נַתִּיר גַּמְזִיּוֹת שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁל חָרוּב וְשֶׁל שִׁקְמָה. וּבְגִידּוּלִין הַבָּאִין לְאַחַר מִכָּאן עָסְקִינַן, וְסָבְרִי לַהּ כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר: אֵין מְעִילָה בְּגִידּוּלִין. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: נְהִי דִּמְעִילָה לֵיכָּא, אִיסּוּרָא מִיהָא אִיכָּא.
human_translation: permit consecrated branches of carob and of sycamore They said: Our fathers consecrated the tree trunks, and we can permit the consecrated branches of carob and of sycamore we are dealing with the growth that came afterward, and they hold in accordance with one who said: There is no misuse with regard to growth. And the Rabbis hold: Although there is no misuse in any case, there is a prohibition.
llm_translation: And permit the dried figs of the hekdesh of carob and of sycamore. They said: Our ancestors only sanctified beams, and we permit the dried figs of the hekdesh of carob and of sycamore. And we are dealing with subsequent growths that come after this, and we hold like the one who said: There is no me'ilah in subsequent growths. And the Rabbis hold: Even though there is no me'ilah, there is still an issur.

hebrew_text: וּפוֹרְצִין פְּרָצוֹת. אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁל מַכְבֵּדוֹת, דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: גָּזְרִינַן שֶׁמָּא יַעֲלֶה וְיִתְלוֹשׁ, וְאַנְשֵׁי יְרִיחוֹ סָבְרִי: לָא גָּזְרִינַן שֶׁמָּא יַעֲלֶה וְיִתְלוֹשׁ. אֲבָל בְּשֶׁל בֵּין הַכִּיפִּין — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר.
human_translation: created breaches Ulla said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: dispute with regard to the upper palm branches [ makhebedot ]. The Sages hold: We issue a decree lest climb and pick And the people of Jericho hold: We do not issue a decree lest one climb and pick However, with regard to lower palm branches [ keifin ], everyone agrees permitted.
llm_translation: And they break through breaches. Ulla said, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: A dispute regarding dignified vessels, for the Rabbis hold: We decree lest it become worn out and be discarded, while the people of Jericho hold: We do not decree lest it become worn out and be discarded. But regarding the vessels between the arches - everyone agrees they are permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְהָא מוּקְצוֹת נִינְהוּ. וְכִי תֵּימָא: הוֹאִיל דַּחֲזֵי לְעוֹרְבִין. הַשְׁתָּא מוּכָן לְאָדָם לָא הָוֵי מוּכָן לִכְלָבִים, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם לֹא הָיְתָה נְבֵילָה מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — אֲסוּרָה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִן הַמּוּכָן, מוּכָן לְעוֹרְבִים הָוֵי מוּכָן לְאָדָם?!
human_translation: Rava said to But aren’t they set-aside, And if you say: since they are fit for ravens, now, prepared for a person is not prepared for dogs, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: If was not a carcass on Shabbat eve, it may not because it was not prepared prepared for ravens prepared for a person?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: But they are muktzot. And if you say: Since he sees crows. Now, something prepared for a person is not prepared for dogs, as we learned: Rabbi Yehuda says: If a carcass was not there from before Shabbat, it is forbidden, because it is not prepared, prepared for crows, is it prepared for a person?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, מוּכָן לְאָדָם — לָא הָוֵי מוּכָן לִכְלָבִים, דְּכׇל מִידֵּי דַּחֲזֵי לְאִינִישׁ, לָא מַקְצֵה לֵיהּ מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ. מוּכָן לְעוֹרְבִים — הָוֵי מוּכָן לְאָדָם, כׇּל מִידֵּי דַּחֲזֵי לְאִינִישׁ, דַּעְתֵּיהּ עִלָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to Yes, prepared for a person is not prepared for dogs, as any item that is fit for a person, one does not remove it from his thoughts; prepared for ravens is prepared for a person. Any item that is fit for a person, his thoughts are upon it.
llm_translation: He said to him: If one is prepared for a person, he is not prepared for dogs, for whenever a person sees him, he does not distance himself from his knowledge. If one is prepared for ravens, he is prepared for a person, for whenever a person sees him, his knowledge is upon him.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁל בֵּין כִּיפִּין, דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: מוּכָן לְעוֹרְבִים — לָא הָוֵי מוּכָן לְאָדָם, וְאַנְשֵׁי יְרִיחוֹ סָבְרִי: מוּכָן לָעוֹרְבִים — הָוֵי מוּכָן לְאָדָם, אֲבָל בְּשֶׁל מַכְבֵּדוֹת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר, גָּזְרִינַן שֶׁמָּא יַעֲלֶה וְיִתְלוֹשׁ.
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: dispute with regard to the lower palm branches, as the Sages hold: is prepared for ravens is not prepared for a person. And the people of Jericho hold: is prepared for ravens is prepared for a person. However, on upper branches, everyone agrees prohibited, we issue a decree lest one climb and pick
llm_translation: When Rabbin came, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: A dispute regarding a kippah, for the Rabbis hold: If it is prepared for ravens, it is not prepared for humans, and the people of Jericho hold: If it is prepared for ravens, it is prepared for humans. But regarding bird traps, everyone agrees it is forbidden, as we decree lest one come and detach it.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹתְנִין פֵּיאָה לַיָּרָק. וְלֵית לְהוּ לְאַנְשֵׁי יְרִיחוֹ הָא דִּתְנַן, כְּלָל אָמְרוּ בַּפֵּיאָה: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא אוֹכֶל, וְנִשְׁמָר, וְגִידּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ, וּלְקִיטָתוֹ כְּאַחַת, וּמַכְנִיסוֹ לְקִיּוּם — חַיָּיב בְּפֵיאָה.
human_translation: And designate the corner [ pe’a ] vegetables. And aren’t the people of Jericho that which we learned A principle was stated with regard to the corner Anything that is food, and is protected, and grows from the ground, and is gathered as one, and brings it in for preservation is obligated in corner
llm_translation: And we give pe'ah to the vegetables. And there is no need for the people of Jericho. As we learned, they said in general regarding pe'ah: anyone who eats, and it is preserved, and its growth is from the land, and its harvesting is at once, and he brings it in for sustenance — he is obligated in pe'ah.

hebrew_text: ״כׇּל שֶׁהוּא אוֹכֶל״ — פְּרָט לִסְפִיחֵי סְטִיס וְקוֹצָה. ״וְנִשְׁמָר״ —פְּרָט לְהֶפְקֵר. ״וְגִידּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ״ — פְּרָט לִכְמֵהִין וּפִטְרִיּוֹת. ״וּלְקִיטָתָן כְּאַחַת״ — פְּרָט לִתְאֵנִים. ״וּמַכְנִיסוֹ לְקִיּוּם״ — פְּרָט לְיָרָק.
human_translation: Anything that is food; to exclude the after-growths of woad and safflower. the corners And is protected; to exclude ownerless And grows from the ground; to exclude truffles and mushrooms, And is gathered as one; to exclude fig And one brings it in for preservation; to exclude vegetables,
llm_translation: "Every that he eats" — excluding sprouts of a stalk and thorn. "And it shall be guarded" — excluding ownerless. "And its growth from the land" — excluding dates and pomegranates. "And their gathering together as one" — excluding figs. "And bringing it in for sustenance" — excluding vegetables.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הָכָא בְּרָאשֵׁי לְפָתוֹת עָסְקִינַן, וּמַכְנִיסוֹ לְקִיּוּם עַל יְדֵי דָּבָר אַחֵר קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: מַכְנִיסוֹ לְקִיּוּם עַל יְדֵי דָּבָר אַחֵר — שְׁמֵיהּ קִיּוּם, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא שְׁמֵיהּ קִיּוּם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Here we are dealing with turnip heads, they disagree with regard to bringing it in for preservation by means of another substance. One Sage, holds: Storage by means of another substance is considered storage. And one Sage, holds: It is not considered storage, corner
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Here we are dealing with the heads of turnips, and if one inserts it for the purpose of something else, he is liable. Mar holds: if one inserts it for the purpose of something else - its name is "purpose," and Mar holds: its name is not "purpose."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ נוֹתְנִין פֵּיאָה לְלֶפֶת וְלִכְרוּב, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אַף לְקַפְלוֹט. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הָיוּ נוֹתְנִין פֵּיאָה לְלֶפֶת וּלְקַפְלוֹט, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף לִכְרוּב.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Initially, they would designate the corner from turnips and cabbages. Rabbi Yosei says: even from leeks [ kaflot ]. And it was taught in another They would designate the corner from turnips and leeks. Rabbi Shimon says: even from cabbages.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Initially, they would give the corner of the field (pe'ah) for the poor to glean from to the doorstep and to the gourd. Rabbi Yosei says: Also to the caper bush. And it was taught in a baraita: They would give the corner of the field for the poor to glean from to the doorstep and to the caper bush. Rabbi Shimon says: Also to the gourd.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא תְּלָתָא תַּנָּאֵי הֲווֹ? לָא, תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי הֲווֹ, וְתַנָּא קַמָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַיְינוּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְתַנָּא קַמָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַיְינוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וּמַאי ״אַף״ — אַקַּמַּיְיתָא.
human_translation: Let us say there are three tanna’im No, there are two tanna’im and the first tanna Rabbi Shimon is Rabbi Yosei. And the first tanna Rabbi Yosei is Rabbi Shimon. And what even the first
llm_translation: The Gemara: "Were there three Tannaim? No, there were two Tannaim, and the first Tanna of Rabbi Shimon is Rabbi Yosei, and the first Tanna of Rabbi Yosei is Rabbi Shimon. And what is 'af' - it is a support."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֶּן בּוּהְיָין נָתַן פֵּיאָה לַיָּרָק, וּבָא אָבִיו וּמְצָאָן לַעֲנִיִּים שֶׁהָיוּ טְעוּנִין יָרָק וְעוֹמְדִין עַל פֶּתַח הַגִּינָּה. אָמַר לָהֶם: בָּנַי, הַשְׁלִיכוּ מֵעֲלֵיכֶם וַאֲנִי נוֹתֵן לָכֶם כִּפְלַיִים בַּמְעוּשָּׂר. לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעֵינִי צָרָה, אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין נוֹתְנִין פֵּיאָה לַיָּרָק.
human_translation: The Sages taught: The son Bohayan designated the corner of vegetables, and his father found the poor laden vegetables and standing at the opening of the garden He said to them: My sons, cast from upon yourselves and I will give you twice tithed Not because I begrudge Rather, it is because the Sages say: One does not designate the corner of vegetables.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Ben Buhyan gave the corner of the field to the vegetable, and his father came and found them loaded with vegetables and standing at the entrance of the garden. He said to them: My sons, remove it from upon you, and I will give you double in the tithe. Not because my eye is evil, but because the sages said: One does not give the corner of the field to the vegetable.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימְרָא לְהוּ ״לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעֵינִי צָרָה״? כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לֵימְרוּ: דַּחוֹיֵי קָא מְדַחֵי לַן.
human_translation: Why for him to say to them: Not because I begrudge so they would not say: He is putting us off,
llm_translation: "Why does he need to say 'not because of the evil eye'?" - In order that they should not say: He is repelling us, he is repelling us.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין עוֹרוֹת קָדָשִׁים בְּלִשְׁכַּת בֵּית הַפַּרְוָה, לָעֶרֶב הָיוּ מְחַלְּקִין אוֹתָן לְאַנְשֵׁי בֵּית אָב. וְהָיוּ בַּעֲלֵי זְרוֹעוֹת נוֹטְלִין אוֹתָן בִּזְרוֹעַ. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיִּהְיוּ מְחַלְּקִין אוֹתָן מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — דְּאָתְיָין כּוּלְּהוּ מִשְׁמָרוֹת, וְשָׁקְלָן בַּהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Initially, would place the hides consecrated in the Parva chamber. In the evening, they would distribute them to the members of the family And the powerful take them by force decreed that they would distribute them each Shabbat eve, all the watches came and took together.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Initially, they would place the hides of the holy animals in the Chamber of the Parwah. Towards evening, they would distribute them to the members of the priestly families. The owners of the arms would take them by the arm. They instituted that they should distribute them from one eve of Shabbat to the next eve of Shabbat, so that all the watches would come and take them together.

hebrew_text: וַעֲדַיִין הָיוּ גְּדוֹלֵי כְהוּנָּה נוֹטְלִין אוֹתָן בִּזְרוֹעַ. עָמְדוּ בְּעָלִים וְהִקְדִּישׁוּם לַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Yet still the prominent priests would take them by force. the owners arose and consecrated to Heaven
llm_translation: And still were the great priests taking them in their arms. The owners stood and sanctified them to heaven.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ: לֹא הָיוּ יָמִים מוּעָטִים עַד שֶׁחִיפּוּ אֶת הַהֵיכָל כּוּלּוֹ בְּטַבְלָאוֹת שֶׁל זָהָב, שֶׁהֵן אַמָּה עַל אַמָּה כְּעוֹבִי דִּינַר זָהָב, וּלְרֶגֶל הָיוּ מְקַפְּלִין אוֹתָן וּמַנִּיחִין אוֹתָן עַל גַּב מַעֲלָה בְּהַר הַבַּיִת, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ עוֹלֵי רְגָלִים רוֹאִין שֶׁמְּלַאכְתָּם נָאָה וְאֵין בָּהּ דֶּלֶם.
human_translation: said: Not a few days passed before they had plated the entire sanctuary with golden tablets were one cubit by one cubit and as thick as a golden dinar. And for the pilgrimage they would remove and place them on a stair of the Temple Mount so that the pilgrims would see that the craftsmanship was beautiful and without flaw [ dalam ].
llm_translation: They said: There were not few days until they plastered the entire Temple with gold planks, which were a cubit by a cubit in thickness of a gold dinar, and for the feet they would fold them and place them on the roof of the Beit HaMikdash, so that the pilgrims would see that their work was beautiful and there was no defect in it.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא, אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: קוֹרוֹת שֶׁל שִׁקְמָה הָיוּ בִּירִיחוֹ, וְהָיוּ בַּעֲלֵי זְרוֹעוֹת נוֹטְלִין אוֹתָן בִּזְרוֹעַ, עָמְדוּ בְּעָלִים וְהִקְדִּישׁוּם לַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: It was taught Abba Shaul says: There were sycamore tree trunks in Jericho, and powerful people would take them by force. The owners stood and consecrated to Heaven.
llm_translation: The text reads: "It was taught: Abba Saul says: There were palm tree boards in Jericho, and the owners of the arms would take them in their arms. The owners stood and sanctified them to Heaven."

hebrew_text: עֲלֵיהֶם וְעַל כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶם אָמַר אַבָּא שָׁאוּל בֶּן בָּטְנִית מִשּׁוּם אַבָּא יוֹסֵף בֶּן חָנִין: אוֹי לִי מִבֵּית בַּיְיתּוֹס — אוֹי לִי מֵאָלָתָן, אוֹי לִי מִבֵּית חָנִין — אוֹי לִי מִלְּחִישָׁתָן, אוֹי לִי מִבֵּית קַתְרוֹס — אוֹי לִי מִקּוּלְמוֹסָן, אוֹי לִי מִבֵּית יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן פִּיאָכִי — אוֹי לִי מֵאֶגְרוֹפָן. שֶׁהֵם כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים, וּבְנֵיהֶן גִּיזְבָּרִין, וְחַתְנֵיהֶם אֲמַרְכָּלִין, וְעַבְדֵיהֶן חוֹבְטִין אֶת הָעָם בְּמַקְלוֹת.
human_translation: With regard to and those like them, Abba Shaul ben Batnit said in the name of Abba Yosef ben Ḥanin: Woe is me due to the house of Baitos, woe is me due to their clubs. Woe is me due to the house of Ḥanin; woe is me due to their whispers Woe is me due to the house of Katros; woe is me due to their pens Woe is me due to the house of Yishmael ben Piakhi; woe is me due to their fists. that were High Priests, and their sons were treasurers, and their sons-in-law were overseers [ amarkalin ]. And their servants strike the people with clubs,
llm_translation: Upon them and upon their like, Abba Saul son of Batnith said in the name of Abba Joseph son of Hanin: Woe is me because of the house of Boethus, woe is me because of their serpent's hiss, woe is me because of the house of Hanin, woe is me because of their witchcraft, woe is me because of the house of Kathros, woe is me because of their whispering, woe is me because of the house of Ishmael son of Piachi, woe is me because of their fists. For they are high priests, and their sons are treasurers, and their sons-in-law are temple overseers, and their servants strike the people with staves.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַרְבַּע צְווֹחוֹת צָוְחָה עֲזָרָה. רִאשׁוֹנָה: צְאוּ מִכָּאן בְּנֵי עֵלִי שֶׁטִּימְּאוּ הֵיכַל ה׳. וְעוֹד צָוְוחָה: צֵא מִיכָּן יִשָּׂשׂכָר אִישׁ כְּפַר בַּרְקַאי שֶׁמְּכַבֵּד אֶת עַצְמוֹ וּמְחַלֵּל קׇדְשֵׁי שָׁמַיִם. דַּהֲוָה כָּרֵיךְ יְדֵיהּ בְּשִׁירָאֵי וְעָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: the Sages taught: the courtyard cried four cries, first Leave here, sons of Eli, who defiled God’s Sanctuary And an additional cry: Leave here, Yissakhar of Kfar Barkai, who honors himself and desecrates consecrated Heaven. wrap in silk [ shirai ] and perform the service.
llm_translation: The sages taught: The Temple made four proclamations. The first: "Leave from here, sons of Eli, who have desecrated the Sanctuary of God." And furthermore, it proclaimed: "Leave from here, Yissachar, a man of Kfar Barkai, who honors himself and desecrates the holy things of heaven." He would tie his hands with scarves and perform the service.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד צָוְוחָה הָעֲזָרָה: שְׂאוּ שְׁעָרִים רָאשֵׁיכֶם וְיִכָּנֵס יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן פִּיאָכִי תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל פִּנְחָס, וִישַׁמֵּשׁ בִּכְהוּנָּה גְּדוֹלָה. וְעוֹד צָוְוחָה הָעֲזָרָה: שְׂאוּ שְׁעָרִים רָאשֵׁיכֶם וְיִכָּנֵס יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נִרְבַּאי תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל פִּנְקַאי וִימַלֵּא כְּרֵיסוֹ מִקׇּדְשֵׁי שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: And the courtyard cried additionally: Lift your heads, O gates, and let Yishmael ben Piakhi, the student of Pinehas enter and serve as High Priest, And the courtyard cried additionally: Lift your heads, O gates, and let Yoḥanan ben Narbbai, the student of Pinkai, enter and fill his belly with of offerings Heaven,
llm_translation: And still the Azarah cries out: "Lift up your heads, O gates, and let Yishmael ben Piakhi, the disciple of Pinchas, enter and serve in the high priesthood." And still the Azarah cries out: "Lift up your heads, O gates, and let Yochanan ben Nurbai, the disciple of Pinqai, enter and fill his hands from the offerings of heaven."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נִרְבַּאי שֶׁהָיָה אוֹכֵל שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת עֲגָלִים, וְשׁוֹתֶה שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת גַּרְבֵי יַיִן, וְאוֹכֵל אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה גּוֹזָלוֹת בְּקִינּוּחַ סְעוּדָה. אָמְרוּ: כׇּל יָמָיו שֶׁל יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נִרְבַּאי לֹא נִמְצָא נוֹתָר בְּמִקְדָּשׁ. מַאי סְלִקָא בֵּיהּ בְּיִשָּׂשׂכָר אִישׁ כְּפַר בַּרְקַאי? אָמְרִי: מַלְכָּא וּמַלְכְּתָא הֲווֹ יָתְבִי. מַלְכָּא אֲמַר: גַּדְיָא יָאֵי, וּמַלְכְּתָא אָמְרָה: אִימְּרָא יָאֵי. אֲמַרוּ: מַאן מוֹכַח? כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, דְּקָא מַסֵּיק קׇרְבָּנוֹת כׇּל יוֹמָא. אֲתָא אִיהוּ,
human_translation: They said about Yoḥanan ben Narbbai that he would eat three hundred calves, and drink three hundred jugs of wine, and eat forty se’a of doves for dessert. They said: all the days of Yoḥanan ben Narbbai there was no leftover in the Temple, What happened to Yissakhar of Kfar Barkai? They said: The king and the queen were sitting The king said goat is better and the queen said lamb better They said: Who can prove The High Priest as he offers sacrifices all day came,
llm_translation: They said about Yochanan ben Nuri, that he would eat three hundred calves, drink three hundred jugs of wine, and consume forty seahs of young pigeons in a single meal. They said: Throughout all the days of Yochanan ben Nuri, no leftover was found in the Temple. What is the reason? Was it because he was a man of Yisaskar, a village in Barkai? They said: Kings and queens would sit at his table. The king said: The kid is good, and the queen said: The meat is good. They said: Who can testify? The High Priest, who would conclude his sacrifices every day. He came...

hebrew_text: אַחְוִי בִּידֵיהּ: אִי גַּדְיָא יָאֵי, יִסַּק לִתְמִידָא. אֲמַר מַלְכָּא: הוֹאִיל וְלָא הֲוֵי לֵיהּ אֵימְתָא דְמַלְכוּתָא, נִיפְסְקוּ לְיַמִּינֵיהּ. יְהַב שׁוֹחַד וּפַסְקֵיהּ לִשְׂמָאלֵיהּ. שְׁמַע מַלְכָּא וּפַסְקֵיהּ לְיַמִּינֵיהּ. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּרִיךְ רַחֲמָנָא דְּאַשְׁקְלֵיהּ לְיִשָּׂשׂכָר אִישׁ כְּפַר בַּרְקַאי לְמִיטְרַפְסֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ בְּהַאי עָלְמָא.
human_translation: signaled with his hand If goat is better, let sacrificed as the daily offering. The king said: Since he has no reverence the monarchy, sever his right He gave a bribe and severed his left hand. The king heard and sever his right hand Rav Yosef said: Blessed is God Who took retribution [ mitarpesei ] from Yissakhar of Kfar Barkai in this world
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Achvi in her hands: if the goat is alive, it should be designated for a continual offering. The king said: since it is not fitting for the time of the kingdom, they should be separated to her right. He gave a bribe and her rulings to her left. The king heard and her rulings to her right. Rav Yosef said: Blessed is the Merciful One who weighed her to Yissachar, a man from Barkai village, to protect her from the people of that world."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: יִשָּׂשׂכָר אִישׁ כְּפַר בַּרְקַאי לָא תְּנָא מַתְנִיתִין. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כְּבָשִׂים קוֹדְמִים לָעִזִּים בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, יָכוֹל מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמּוּבְחָרִין בְּמִינָן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִם כֶּבֶשׂ יָבִיא קׇרְבָּנוֹ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶן שְׁקוּלִין כְּאֶחָד. רָבִינָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מִקְרָא נָמֵי לָא קְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם כֶּבֶשׂ״, ״אִם עֵז״, אִי בָּעֵי כֶּבֶשׂ — לַיְיתֵיהּ, אִי בָּעֵי עֵז — לַיְיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Yissakhar of Kfar Barkai did not study Mishna As we learned Rabbi Shimon says: Lambs take precedence goats in every place might because it is a select species. the verse states: “If he brings a lamb as his offering” teaches that both are equal. Ravina said: even read the Bible as it is written: “If a lamb” “if a goat” If one wishes let him bring a lamb; if one wishes let him bring a goat.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Yissaskar, a man from the village of Barkai, did not teach in the Mishnah. As we learned: Rabbi Shimon says, "Sheep take precedence over goats in all cases, because they are chosen in their species." This is derived from the verse that states, "If his offering is a lamb," teaching that both are considered equal. Ravina said: Even if the verse did not specifically mention, as it is written, "If a lamb," "If a goat," if one wants to bring a lamb - let him bring it, if one wants to bring a goat - let him bring it.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ פֶּסַח רִאשׁוֹן
llm_translation: We will return to you, the place where they were accustomed, and the conclusion is to bring the Passover offering on the first day.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ תָּמִיד נִשְׁחָט בִּשְׁמוֹנָה וּמֶחְצָה, וְקָרֵב בְּתִשְׁעָה וּמֶחְצָה. בְּעַרְבֵי פְסָחִים נִשְׁחָט בְּשֶׁבַע וּמֶחְצָה, וְקָרֵב בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה וּמֶחְצָה — בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בְּשַׁבָּת. חָל עֶרֶב פֶּסַח לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, נִשְׁחָט בְּשֵׁשׁ וּמֶחְצָה, וְקָרֵב בְּשֶׁבַע וּמֶחְצָה, וְהַפֶּסַח אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: The daily offering is slaughtered at eight and a half and is sacrificed, at nine and a half On the eves of Passover, it is slaughtered at seven and a half and sacrificed at eight and a half whether during the week or on Shabbat. Passover eve occurs on Shabbat eve, is slaughtered at six and a half and sacrificed at seven and a half and the Paschal lamb thereafter.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The daily offering is slaughtered at eight and a half hours into the day, and offered at nine and a half hours. On the eve of Passover, it is slaughtered at seven and a half hours, and offered at eight and a half hours - whether on a weekday or on Shabbat. If the eve of Passover falls on Erev Shabbat, it is slaughtered at six and a half hours, and offered at seven and a half hours, and the Passover offering follows it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: From where are these matters
llm_translation: "Gam manah hanei milei?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״אֶת הַכֶּבֶשׂ אֶחָד תַּעֲשֶׂה בַבֹּקֶר וְאֵת הַכֶּבֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִי תַּעֲשֶׂה בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם״, חַלְּקֵהוּ לְבֵין שְׁנֵי עֲרָבִים: שְׁתֵּי שָׁעוֹת וּמֶחְצָה לְכָאן, שְׁתֵּי שָׁעוֹת וּמֶחְצָה לְכָאן, וְשָׁעָה אַחַת לַעֲשִׂיָּיתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: the verse says: “The one lamb you shall offer in the morning and the second lamb you shall offer in the afternoon [ bein ha’arbayim ]” Divide between two evenings. Two and a half hours here and two and a half hours there and one hour to perform
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, as the verse states: "You shall offer the one lamb in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer between the evenings." (Exodus 29:39) Divide it between the two evenings: two and a half hours here, two and a half hours there, and one hour for its preparation.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: בְּעַרְבֵי פְסָחִים נִשְׁחָט בְּשֶׁבַע וּמֶחְצָה, וְקָרֵב בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה וּמֶחְצָה — בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בְּשַׁבָּת! וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה וּמֶחְצָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, הֵיכִי מַקְדְּמִינַן לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rava raised an objection: on the eves of Passover is slaughtered at seven and a half and sacrificed at eight and a half both during the week and on Shabbat. And if it could enter your mind that eight and a half hours by Torah law, how can we do it earlier
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: On the eve of Passover, one may slaughter the Paschal lamb at seven and a half hours into the day, and offer it at eight and a half hours into the day - whether on a weekday or on Shabbat! And if you were to suggest that the time for offering is at eight and a half hours into the day by Torah law, how do we advance it to an earlier time?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מִצְוָתוֹ דְּתָמִיד מִשֶּׁיִּנָּטוּ צִלְלֵי עֶרֶב. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם״, מֵעִידָּנָא דְּמַתְחֵיל שִׁמְשָׁא לְמִעְרַב.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: The mitzva of the daily offering from when the evening shadows slant What is the reason the verse states: In the afternoon [ bein ha’arbayim ], from the time that the sun begins to westward [ ma’arav ].
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: His obligation of the continual offering is from when the shadows of evening spread. What is the reason? As the verse states: "Between the evenings," this testifies that he begins the service towards evening.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ, בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה דְּאִיכָּא נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״עָלֶיהָ חֶלְבֵי הַשְּׁלָמִים״,
human_translation: Therefore, on the rest of the days of the year, when there are vow and free-will As the Merciful One says the fats of the peace-offerings upon it”
llm_translation: Therefore, in the rest of the days of the year when there are vows and voluntary offerings, for the Merciful One said: "Upon it are the fats of the peace offerings."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר מָר (״עָלֶיהָ חֶלְבֵי הַשְּׁלָמִים״): עָלֶיהָ הַשְׁלֵם כׇּל הַקָּרְבָּנוֹת כּוּלָּם — מְאַחֲרִינַן לֵיהּ תַּרְתֵּי שָׁעֵי, וְעָבְדִינַן לֵיהּ בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה וּמֶחְצָה.
human_translation: And the Master said “The fats of the peace-offerings upon it” “Upon it,” complete all the offerings. we postpone for two hours, and sacrifice it at eight and a half
llm_translation: And Mar said ("regarding its fats of the peace offerings"): regarding it, one completes all the sacrifices entirely - we delay it for two hours, and we perform it with eight and a half.

hebrew_text: בְּעַרְבֵי פְסָחִים, דְּאִיכָּא פֶּסַח אַחֲרָיו, קָדְמִינַן לֵיהּ שָׁעָה אַחַת, וְעָבְדִינַן לֵיהּ בְּשֶׁבַע וּמֶחְצָה. חָל עֶרֶב פֶּסַח לִהְיוֹת עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, דְּאִיכָּא נָמֵי צְלִיָּיתוֹ דְּלָא דָּחֵי שַׁבָּת — מוֹקְמִינַן לֵיהּ אַדִּינֵיהּ, בְּשֵׁשׁ וּמֶחְצָה.
human_translation: eves of Passover, when there is the Paschal lamb after we advance one hour and sacrifice it at seven and a half Passover eve occurs on Shabbat eve, when there is also the roasting which does not override Shabbat we establish its halakha at six and a half
llm_translation: In the eve of Passover, when there is another Passover after it, we precede it by one hour, and we roast it at seven and a half hours. If the eve of Passover falls on the eve of Shabbat, where there is concern that its roasting will not be completed before Shabbat — we establish it according to its needs, at six and a half hours.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כְּסִידּוּרוֹ בַּחוֹל כָּךְ סִידּוּרוֹ בַּשַּׁבָּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּסִידּוּרוֹ בְּעֶרֶב פֶּסַח.
human_translation: The Sages taught like its arrangement during the week, so is its arrangement on Shabbat; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: Like its arrangement on Passover eve.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Just as his arrangement on a weekday, so is his arrangement on Shabbat, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: Just as his arrangement on the eve of Passover.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: כְּסִידּוּרוֹ בַּחוֹל בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח כָּךְ סִידּוּרוֹ בַּשַּׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּסִידּוּרוֹ בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת כָּךְ סִידּוּרוֹ בַּשַּׁבָּת. וּמַתְנִיתִין דְּקָתָנֵי בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בַּשַּׁבָּת — רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא.
human_translation: What is saying? Abaye said: This is what it is saying: like its arrangement on Passover eve during the week, so is its arrangement on Passover eve on Shabbat, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: Like its arrangement on Passover eve that occurs on Shabbat eve, so is its arrangement on Shabbat, the mishna that teaches both during the week and on Shabbat, is Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: What is he saying? Abaye said, this is what he is saying: Just as his order on a weekday evening of Passover is like this, so is his order on Shabbat evening of Passover, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: Just as his order on the evening of Passover that falls on a Friday is like this, so is his order on Shabbat. And the Mishnah that teaches whether on a weekday or on Shabbat — it is Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? בְּמוּסָפִין קוֹדְמִין לְבָזִיכִין קָמִיפַּלְגִי. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: מוּסָפִין קוֹדְמִין לְבָזִיכִין. עָבֵד לְהוּ לְמוּסָפִין בְּשֵׁשׁ, וּבָזִיכִין בְּשֶׁבַע, וְעָבֵיד לֵיהּ לְתָמִיד בְּשֶׁבַע וּמֶחְצָה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: בָּזִיכִין קוֹדְמִין לְמוּסָפִין. בָּזִיכִין בְּחָמֵשׁ, וּמוּסָפִין בְּשֵׁשׁ, וְעָבֵיד לֵיהּ לְתָמִיד בְּשֵׁשׁ וּמֶחְצָה.
human_translation: with regard to what do disagree? They disagree about the additional offerings precede the bowls Rabbi Yishmael holds that the additional offerings precede the bowls. sacrificed the additional offerings at six and the bowls at seven he sacrificed the daily offering at seven and a half Rabbi Akiva holds the bowls precede the additional offerings. bowls at five the additional offerings at six and sacrificed the daily offering at six and a half
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? With regards to the additional offerings, they disagree. Rabbi Yishmael holds: the additional offerings precede the regular offerings. He would perform the additional offerings in six hours, and the regular offerings in seven hours, and he would continually perform the service in seven and a half hours. Rabbi Akiva holds: the regular offerings precede the additional offerings. He would perform the regular offerings in five hours, and the additional offerings in six hours, and he would continually perform the service in six and a half hours.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: מִידֵּי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא ״כְּסִידְרוֹ בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת״ קָתָנֵי?! כְּסִידְרוֹ בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח סְתָמָא קָתָנֵי. אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: כְּסִידְרוֹ בְּחוֹל דְּעָלְמָא — כָּךְ סִידְרוֹ בַּשַּׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּסִידְרוֹ בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח. וּמַתְנִיתִין דְּקָתָנֵי בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בַּשַּׁבָּת, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא.
human_translation: Rava strongly objects to this Is Rabbi Akiva teaching: Like its arrangement on Passover eve that occurs on Shabbat eve? He merely teaches: Like its arrangement on Passover eve. Rather, Rava said This is what is saying: Like the arrangement on an ordinary during the week, so is its arrangement on Shabbat on Passover eve. the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: Like its arrangement on Passover eve the mishna that teaches both during the week and on Shabbat is of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Rava objects to him: From the words of Rabbi Akiva, "As he arranged it on the eve of Passover, which falls on Erev Shabbat," is it taught?! As he arranged it on the eve of Passover is what is generally taught. Rather, Rava said, this is what he meant to say: As he arranged it on a weekday — so he arranged it on Shabbat eve of Passover, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: As he arranged it on the eve of Passover. And the Mishnah that is taught, whether on a weekday or on Shabbat, it is Rabbi Akiva's opinion.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? בְּמִכְמַר בִּשְׂרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: חָיְישִׁינַן לְמִכְמַר בִּשְׂרָא. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְמִכְמַר בִּשְׂרָא.
human_translation: with regard to what do they disagree? They disagree with regard to the the meat will become warm Rabbi Yishmael holds that we are concerned lest the meat become warm And Rabbi Akiva holds: We are not concerned lest the meat become warm
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? They disagree regarding the fat of the meat. Rabbi Yishmael holds: We are concerned about the fat of the meat. And Rabbi Akiva holds: We are not concerned about the fat of the meat.

hebrew_text: אִי לָא חָיְישִׁינַן, נִיעְבְּדֵיהּ בְּשֵׁשׁ וּמֶחְצָה? קָא סָבַר: מוּסָפִין קוֹדְמִין לְבָזִיכִין. עָבֵיד לְהוּ לְמוּסָפִין בְּשֵׁשׁ, וּבָזִיכִין בְּשֶׁבַע, וְעָבֵיד לֵיהּ לְתָמִיד בְּשֶׁבַע וּמֶחְצָה.
human_translation: If, we are not concerned let us sacrifice at six and a half holds: The additional offerings precede the bowls sacrifice the additional offerings at six and the bowls at seven and sacrifice the daily offering at seven and a half
llm_translation: We are not concerned, should we perform it in six and a half? He thought: Additional offerings precede the morning offerings. He made for them additional offerings in six, and morning offerings in seven, and he made for it a continual offering in seven and a half.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא: מִידֵּי ״כְּסִידְרוֹ בַּחוֹל כָּךְ סִידְרוֹ בַּשַּׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל״ קָתָנֵי?! ״כָּךְ סִידְרוֹ בַּשַּׁבָּת״ סְתָמָא קָתָנֵי?
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla strongly objects to this Does teach: Like the arrangement during the week, so is its arrangement on Shabbat on Passover eve; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael? simply teaches: So is its arrangement on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabah bar Ulla objects to her: From the words "As he arranged on a weekday, so he shall arrange on Shabbat, on the eve of Passover, the words of Rabbi Yishmael" it teaches?! "So he shall arrange on Shabbat" is it not taught anonymously?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: כְּסִידְרוֹ בְּחוֹל דְּעָלְמָא — כָּךְ סִידְרוֹ בְּשַׁבָּת דְּעָלְמָא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: Rather, Rabba bar Ulla said: this is what it is teaching: Like its arrangement on an ordinary during the week, so is its arrangement on an ordinary Shabbat, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael,
llm_translation: Rabah bar Ulla said, thus it was taught: As its order is on a weekday in the world, so is its order on the Sabbath in the world, the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּסִידְרוֹ בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח דְּעָלְמָא — כָּךְ סִידְרוֹ בְּשַׁבָּת דְּעָלְמָא. וּמַתְנִיתִין דְּקָתָנֵי בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בַּשַּׁבָּת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Like its arrangement on an ordinary Passover eve so is its arrangement on an ordinary Shabbat. And the mishna, which teaches whether during the week or on Shabbat, all opinions,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: As his order on the eve of Passover of the world — so is his order on the Sabbath of the world. And the Mishnah that teaches whether on a weekday or on the Sabbath — these are the words of everyone.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בִּגְזֵרַת נְדָבוֹת וּנְדָרִים קָמִיפַּלְגִי. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: גָּזְרִינַן שַׁבָּת אַטּוּ חוֹל, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: with regard to what do disagree? They disagree concerning whether a decree should be issued on account of vows and free-will offerings. Rabbi Yishmael holds that we issue a decree for Shabbat due to weekdays. And Rabbi Akiva holds that we do not issue such a decree.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? They disagree regarding the decree of voluntary offerings and vows. Rabbi Yishmael holds: We decree Shabbat to include the festival, while Rabbi Akiva holds: We do not decree.

hebrew_text: אִי לָא גָּזְרִינַן, נִיעְבְּדֵיהּ בְּשֵׁשׁ וּמֶחְצָה! קָסָבַר: מוּסָפִין קוֹדְמִין לְבָזִיכִין. מוּסָפִין בְּשֵׁשׁ, וּבָזִיכִין בְּשֶׁבַע, וְעָבֵיד לֵיהּ לְתָמִיד בְּשֶׁבַע וּמֶחְצָה.
human_translation: If we do not issue a decree, Let us sacrifice it at six and a half hours. holds that the additional offerings precede the bowls additional offerings at six and the bowls at seven sacrifices the daily offering at seven and a half
llm_translation: If we do not decree, it will be performed on Friday afternoon! He holds: Additional offerings precede the afternoon offering. Additional offerings on Friday, and the afternoon offering on Shabbat, and he performs it regularly on Shabbat afternoon.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: תָּמִיד, כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ קָרֵב כְּהִלְכָתוֹ: נִשְׁחָט בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה וּמֶחְצָה, וְקָרֵב בְּתֵשַׁע וּמֶחְצָה. וּבָעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, נִשְׁחָט בְּשֶׁבַע וּמֶחְצָה, וְקָרֵב בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה וּמֶחְצָה. חָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת כְּחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשֵׁנִי בַּשַּׁבָּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּסִידְרוֹ בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח.
human_translation: raises an objection The daily offering is sacrificed throughout the entire year in accordance with its law. it is slaughtered at eight and a half and sacrificed at nine and a half And on the eve of Passover it is slaughtered at seven and a half and sacrificed at eight and a half If occurs on Shabbat it is as if it occurred on a Monday, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: like its arrangement on the eve of Passover
llm_translation: Challenger: Tamid, all the year, all of it, he brings near according to his halakha: he slaughters at eight and a half, and brings near at nine and a half. And on the eve of Passover, he slaughters at seven and a half, and brings near at eight and a half. It is as severe to be on Shabbat as to be on Monday, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: According to his arrangement on the eve of Passover.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְאַבָּיֵי נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְרָבָא קַשְׁיָא. אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: לָא תֵּימָא ״כְּחָל בְּשֵׁנִי בַּשַּׁבָּת״, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּשֵׁנִי בַּשַּׁבָּת דְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Granted, according to Abaye, works out well, But according to Rava, difficult. Rava could have said to you: Do not say: It is as if it occurred on a Monday. Rather say: like an ordinary Monday,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Bishlama to Abbaye nicha, ela to Rava kashya. Amar lakh Rava: la teima 'kechal besheni bashabbat,' ela eima: kesheni bashabbat de'alma." English translation: "It is fitting for Abbaye, but difficult for Rava. Rava said to you: Do not say 'like vinegar in teeth on Shabbat,' rather say: like vinegar in teeth of the world."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: חָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת — כְּסִידְרוֹ כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּסִידְרוֹ בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח דְּעָלְמָא. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרָבָא נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְאַבָּיֵי קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: raises an objection occurs on Shabbat, in accordance with its arrangement all year long, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: in accordance with its arrangement on an ordinary Passover eve. Granted, according to Rava, works out well. But according to Abaye, difficult.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Meitivi: Chal lihiyot bashabbat - k'sidro kullashanah kullah, divrei Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva omer: k'sidro be'erev haPesach de'alma. Bishlama l'Rava nicha, ela l'Abaye kashya!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ אַבָּיֵי: לָא תֵּימָא ״כְּסִידְרוֹ כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה״, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּסִידְרוֹ כׇּל הַשָּׁנִים כּוּלָּן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּסִידְרוֹ עֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Abaye can say to you: Do not say In accordance with its arrangement all year long. Rather, say: In accordance with its arrangement every year; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says in accordance with its arrangement on Passover eve that occurs on Shabbat eve.
llm_translation: He said to you, Abaye: Do not say "like his order all year," rather say: "like his order all the years, all of them," the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: "like his order on the eve of Passover that falls on Erev Shabbat."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא דָּבָר קוֹדֶם לְתָמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָרַךְ עָלֶיהָ הָעוֹלָה״. מַאי תַּלְמוּדָא? אָמַר רָבָא: ״הָעוֹלָה״ — עוֹלָה רִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: From where that no shall precede the daily morning offering? The verse states: he shall prepare the burnt-offering upon it What is the derivation? Rava said: “The burnt-offering,” the first burnt-offering,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: From where do we derive that nothing should precede the morning daily offering? The verse states: "And he shall set the burnt offering upon it." What is the derivation? Rava said: "The burnt offering" refers to the first burnt offering.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין דָּבָר קָרֵב אַחַר תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהִקְטִיר עָלֶיהָ חֶלְבֵי הַשְּׁלָמִים״. מַאי תַּלְמוּדָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״עָלֶיהָ״ שְׁלָמִים, וְלֹא עַל חֲבֶירְתָּהּ שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: And from where that nothing is sacrificed after the daily afternoon offering? The verse states: “And shall cause the fats of the peace-offerings to go up in smoke upon it.” What is the derivation? Abaye said: “Upon it.” peace-offerings, But peace-offerings not upon, its counterpart,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that nothing comes after the daily offering of the afternoon? The verse teaches: "And he shall burn upon it the fat of the peace offerings." What is the derivation? Abaye said: "Upon it" refers to its own peace offerings, and not the peace offerings of another.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: אֵימָא שְׁלָמִים הוּא דְּלָא נַקְרֵיב, הָא עוֹלוֹת נַקְרֵיב! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: ״הַשְּׁלָמִים״ — עָלֶיהָ הַשְׁלֵם כׇּל הַקָּרְבָּנוֹת כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: Rava strongly objects to this say it is peace-offerings that we must not sacrifice but burnt-offerings we may sacrifice, Rather, Rava said: “The peace-offerings [ hashelamim ] upon it” completes [ hashlem ] all other sacrifices.
llm_translation: Rava objects to this: Perhaps it is peace offerings that we do not offer, but burnt offerings we do offer! Rather, Rava said: "The peace offerings" - upon it one should complete all the offerings.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: תָּמִיד קוֹדֶם לְפֶסַח, פֶּסַח קוֹדֶם לִקְטֹרֶת, קְטֹרֶת קוֹדֶמֶת לְנֵרוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught The daily offering precedes the Paschal lamb, the Paschal lamb precedes incense, incense precedes lamps
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The daily offering precedes Passover, Passover precedes the incense offering, and the incense offering precedes the lighting of the lamps.

hebrew_text: יְאוּחַר דָּבָר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״בָּעָרֶב״ וּ״בֵין הָעַרְבָּיִם״, לְדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ ״בָּעֶרֶב״, אֶלָּא ״בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם״ בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: An item, about which it is stated: “In the evening” and “in the afternoon,” should be after an item, about which it is not stated “in the evening,” but only “in the afternoon.”
llm_translation: Delayed matter that it says in it "in the evening" and "between the evenings," for a matter that it was not said in it "in the evening," rather "between the evenings" alone.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, קְטֹרֶת וְנֵרוֹת נָמֵי נִקְדְּמוּ לְפֶסַח: יְאוּחַר דָּבָר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״בָּעָרֶב״ וּ״בֵין הָעַרְבָּיִם״, לְדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ אֶלָּא ״בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם״ בִּלְבַד!
human_translation: If that is so, the incense and the lamps should also precede the Paschal lamb. The item, about which it is stated “in the evening” and “in the afternoon” should be after the item about which it is stated only: in the afternoon
llm_translation: So it is, the incense and the lamps preceded the Passover. A matter that is delayed, as it is said about it "in the evening" and "between the evenings," for a matter that is not said about it except "between the evenings" alone!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּמִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא ״אֹתוֹ״. דְּתַנְיָא: ״מֵעֶרֶב וְעַד בֹּקֶר״ — תֵּן לָהּ מִדָּתָהּ שֶׁתְּהֵא דּוֹלֶקֶת מֵעֶרֶב עַד בּוֹקֶר.
human_translation: It is different there, as the Merciful One excludes it [ oto ], As it was taught from evening to morning “from evening to morning” you shall allocate its measure it will burn from evening until morning.
llm_translation: The difference there is that the Merciful One specifies "it." For it was taught: "From evening until morning" - give it its measure that it should burn from evening until morning.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: אֵין לְךָ עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁכְּשֵׁירָה מֵעֶרֶב עַד בּוֹקֶר אֶלָּא זוֹ בִּלְבַד. מַאי טַעְמָא — אָמַר קְרָא: ״יַעֲרֹךְ אֹתוֹ אַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו מֵעֶרֶב עַד בֹּקֶר״. אוֹתוֹ מֵעֶרֶב עַד בּוֹקֶר, וְאֵין דָּבָר אַחֵר מֵעֶרֶב עַד בּוֹקֶר.
human_translation: Alternatively, There is no rite that is valid from evening until morning but this one alone, What is the reason the verse said “Aaron and his sons shall set [ ya’arokh ] it [ oto ] in order, from evening to morning.” it, is from evening until morning, but no other from evening until morning.
llm_translation: Another matter: You have no service that is valid from evening until morning except for this alone. What is the reason? - The verse says: "Aaron and his sons shall set it in order from evening until morning." It is the same from evening until morning, and there is no other matter from evening until morning.

hebrew_text: וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ קְטֹרֶת לְנֵרוֹת.
human_translation: juxtaposes the incense to the lamps,
llm_translation: And it is difficult: the incense for the lamps.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא כִּי קוּשְׁיַין: תָּמִיד קוֹדֶם לִקְטֹרֶת, קְטֹרֶת קוֹדֶמֶת לְנֵרוֹת, וְנֵרוֹת קוֹדְמוֹת לְפֶסַח. יְאוּחַר דָּבָר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״בָּעָרֶב״ וּ״בֵין הָעַרְבָּיִם״, לְדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ אֶלָּא ״בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם״ בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: it was taught in accordance with our difficulty The daily offering precedes the incense, the incense precedes the lamps, and the lamps precedes the Paschal lamb. An item, about which it is stated “in the evening” and “in the afternoon” should be delayed until after an item, about which it is stated only “in the afternoon.”
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: When there are difficulties, the Tamid offering precedes the incense offering, the incense offering precedes the lighting of the lamps, and the lighting of the lamps precedes the Passover offering. Something that is delayed is a matter that is explicitly stated as "in the evening" and "between the evenings," for something that is not explicitly stated as such is only "between the evenings" alone.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כְּתִיב ״אוֹתוֹ״! הַאי ״אוֹתוֹ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמַעוֹטֵי עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁבִּפְנִים, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? קְטֹרֶת. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב ״וּבְהַעֲלוֹת אַהֲרֹן אֶת הַנֵּרוֹת בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם יַקְטִירֶנָּה״, אֵימָא: נַדְלֵיק נֵרוֹת בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר נַקְטֵיר קְטוֹרֶת, מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא ״אוֹתוֹ״.
human_translation: isn’t “it” written This “it” is necessary, to exclude a rite that is inside And what is incense. It could have entered your mind to say that since it is written: “And when Aaron lights the lamps in the afternoon he shall burn it” say we should light the lamps first and then we should burn the incense, the Merciful One excludes it,”
llm_translation: The text reads: "And it is written 'it'! This 'it' is needed to exclude the service inside, and what is it? Incense. If you were to say, since it is written 'and when Aaron kindles the lamps at dusk, he shall burn it,' let us light the lamps first and then burn the incense, the Merciful One excludes 'it'."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, ״בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם יַקְטִירֶנָּה״ לְמָה לִי? הָכִי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: בְּעִידָּן דְּמַדְלְקַתְּ נֵרוֹת תְּהֵא מִקַּטְרָא קְטֹרֶת.
human_translation: However, why do I “in the afternoon he shall burn it,” this is the Merciful One is saying: at the time when you light the lamps, the incense should be burning.
llm_translation: Rather, "Between the evenings he shall burn it" - why do I need it? Thus said the Merciful One: At the time when the lamps are kindled, the incense shall be offered.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁקּוֹדֵם לְתָמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר אֶלָּא קְטֹרֶת בִּלְבַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בָּהּ: ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״. וְיוּקְדַּם קְטֹרֶת — דָּבָר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִקְטִיר עָלָיו אַהֲרֹן קְטֹרֶת סַמִּים בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״, לְדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ אֶלָּא ״בֹּקֶר״ אֶחָד.
human_translation: The Sages taught Nothing may precede the daily morning offering but the incense alone, as it is stated about “In the morning, in the morning.” And the incense, an item about which it is stated: “In the morning, in the morning,” as it is written: “And Aaron shall burn upon it incense of sweet spices; in the morning, in the morning, should precede an item, about which only one morning is stated:
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There is nothing that precedes the daily morning offering except the incense alone, as it is stated regarding it: "In the morning, in the morning." And the incense precedes the daily morning offering - a matter that is stated about it "in the morning, in the morning," as it is written: "And Aaron shall burn on it incense of spices; in the morning, in the morning," for a matter in which only "morning" is not stated once.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁמִּתְעַכֵּב אַחַר תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם אֶלָּא קְטֹרֶת, וְנֵרוֹת, וּפֶסַח, וּמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח — שֶׁטּוֹבֵל שֵׁנִית וְאוֹכֵל אֶת פִּסְחוֹ לָעֶרֶב.
human_translation: And nothing may be delayed after the daily afternoon offering but incense, lamps, the Paschal lamb, and one who lacks atonement on Passover eve, immerses a second time and he eats his Paschal lamb in the evening.
llm_translation: And you have nothing that delays after the daily offering between the evenings except for incense, and the lamps, and the Passover offering, and one who is impure on the eve of Passover - he immerses a second time and eats his Passover offering in the evening.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמֵר: אַף מְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, שֶׁטּוֹבֵל וְאוֹכֵל בַּקֳּדָשִׁים לָעֶרֶב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says even one who lacks atonement on the rest of the days of the year that he immerses and eats sacrificial food in the evening.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka, says: Even one who is in a state of impurity throughout the rest of the year, may immerse and eat from the holy offerings at night.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְתַנָּא קַמָּא, יָבֹא עֲשֵׂה דְפֶסַח שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ כָּרֵת, וְיִדְחֶה עֲשֵׂה דְהַשְׁלָמָה שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ כָּרֵת. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא, מַאי אוּלְמֵיהּ דְּהַאי עֲשֵׂה מֵהַאי עֲשֵׂה?!
human_translation: Granted, according to the first tanna , The positive of the Paschal lamb, which with it karet will come and override the positive of completion. does not karet , However, Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, what is the strength of this positive than that positive
llm_translation: In truth, according to the first Tanna, let the positive commandment of the Passover, which carries with it the penalty of excision, come and override the positive commandment of peace offerings, which does not carry with it the penalty of excision. But according to Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, what is the reason for this positive commandment to override that positive commandment?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָכָא בְּחַטַּאת הָעוֹף עָסְקִינַן, שֶׁאֵין לְמִזְבֵּחַ אֶלָּא דָּמָהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said Rav Ḥisda said: Here we are dealing with a bird a sin-offering. as the altar has only blood.
llm_translation: Ravina said in the name of Rav Ḥisda: Here we are dealing with the sin-offering of a bird, for the altar only requires its blood.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּחַטַּאת בְּהֵמָה, מַעֲלֶהָ וּמְלִינָהּ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Even if you say an animal sin-offering, brings them up and leaves them overnight on the top of the altar.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even if you say regarding a sin offering of an animal, one elevates it and places it on the top of the altar.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא אָשָׁם. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב פָּפָּא הַיְינוּ דְּמֵלִין לַהּ, אֶלָּא לְרַב חִסְדָּא מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אָמְרִי: שֶׁקָּרַב אֲשָׁמוֹ.
human_translation: But isn’t there a guilt-offering Granted, according to Rav Pappa, is leave it overnight However, according to Rav Ḥisda, what can be said, They say: sacrificed his guilt-offering.
llm_translation: And there is a guilt-offering. Granted according to Rav Papa, that is because they speak to him. But according to Rav Ḥisdah, what is there to say? They said: Because his guilt-offering is near.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא עוֹלָה! וְכִי תֵּימָא: עוֹלָה לָא מְעַכְּבָא, וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁחַטָּאתוֹ וַאֲשָׁמוֹ מְעַכְּבִין אוֹתוֹ, כָּךְ עוֹלָתוֹ מְעַכַּבְתּוֹ!
human_translation: But isn’t there a burnt-offering And if you say the burnt-offering does not prevent wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: Just as his sin-offering and his guilt-offering prevents so too does his burnt-offering.
llm_translation: And where is the burnt offering? And if you say: A burnt offering does not delay, but it was taught: Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka, says: Just as his sin and guilt offering delay him, so too his burnt offering delays him!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא בְּשֶׁקָּרְבָה עוֹלָתוֹ, וּמִי קָרְבָה עוֹלָתוֹ קוֹדֶם לְחַטָּאתוֹ רִאשׁוֹן?! וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וְהִקְרִיב אֶת אֲשֶׁר לַחַטָּאת רִאשׁוֹנָה״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? אִם לְלַמֵּד שֶׁתְּהֵא קוֹדֶמֶת לָעוֹלָה — הֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וְאֵת הַשֵּׁנִי יַעֲשֶׂה עוֹלָה כַּמִּשְׁפָּט״.
human_translation: And if you say, that offered his burnt-offering; may his burnt-offering be brought before his sin-offering? Wasn’t it taught and he shall offer that which is for the sin-offering first what does the verse state If it is to teach that should prior to the burnt-offering, it is already stated: “And he shall offer the second as a burnt-offering according to the ordinance”
llm_translation: And if you say, "But his burnt offering is brought first, so how can his burnt offering precede his sin offering?!" And it was taught: "And he shall offer that which is for the sin offering first," what is the Scripture coming to teach? If to teach that it should precede the burnt offering - behold, it is already stated: "And the second he shall make as a burnt offering according to the ordinance."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: זֶה בָּנָה אָב לְכׇל חַטָּאוֹת שֶׁיְּהוּ קוֹדְמוֹת לְכׇל עוֹלוֹת הַבָּאוֹת עִמָּהֶן. וְקַיְימָא לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ חַטַּאת הָעוֹף קוֹדֶמֶת לְעוֹלַת בְּהֵמָה!
human_translation: Rather, this is a paradigm that all sin-offerings should precede all burnt-offerings that come with them. And we maintain even the sin-offering of a bird precedes a burnt-offering animal.
llm_translation: Rather: This is the principle for all sins that precede all burnt offerings that come with them. And we establish that even the sin offering of a bird precedes the burnt offering of an animal!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי עוֹלַת מְצוֹרָע, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר:
human_translation: Rava said: burnt-offering of a leper is different as the Merciful One says
