human_translation: As we learned one who slaughters a thanks-offering inside its bread, is outside the wall, the bread has not become sanctified,
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: One who slaughters a thanksgiving offering inside, and its bread outside the wall— the bread is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: מַאי חוּץ לַחוֹמָה? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חוּץ לְחוֹמַת בֵּית פָּאגֵי, אֲבָל חוּץ לְחוֹמַת הָעֲזָרָה — קָדֵישׁ, וְלָא בָּעֵינַן ״עַל״ בְּסָמוּךְ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ חוּץ לְחוֹמַת עֲזָרָה לָא קָדֵישׁ. אַלְמָא בָּעֵינַן ״עַל״ בְּסָמוּךְ.
human_translation: What outside the wall? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: outside the wall of Beit Pagei, but outside the wall of the Temple courtyard, it has been sanctified, as we do not require “with” next to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Even outside the wall of the Temple courtyard, it has not been sanctified. Apparently, we require “with” next to
llm_translation: What is considered "outside the wall"? Rabbi Yochanan said: Outside the wall of Beit Pagi, but outside the wall of the Azarah is considered holy, and we do not require the word "upon" adjacent to it. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Even outside the wall of the Azarah is not considered holy. This implies that we require the word "upon" adjacent to it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּהַתְרָאַת סָפֵק קָמִיפַּלְגִי. בְּהָא נָמֵי הָא פְּלִיגִי בַהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא!
human_translation: Rather, they disagree about an uncertain warning. they also disagreed about this once
llm_translation: Instead, in the case of a doubt, he disagrees. In this case, they disagree about it one time!

hebrew_text: דְּאִיתְּמַר: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאוֹכַל כִּכָּר זוֹ הַיּוֹם״, וְעָבַר הַיּוֹם וְלֹא אֲכָלָהּ, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ — אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְכׇל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה — אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו. אֲבָל הַתְרָאַת סָפֵק — שְׁמָהּ הַתְרָאָה.
human_translation: it was stated an oath that I will eat this loaf today, and the day passed and he did not eat it, Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish both said he is not flogged Rabbi Yoḥanan said: He is not flogged because it is a prohibition whose does not involve an action, for any prohibition whose does not involve an action one is not flogged; however, an uncertain warning is considered a warning.
llm_translation: It was taught: "A vow to eat this loaf today," and the day passed without eating it, Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish both said: he is not liable. Rabbi Yochanan said: he is not liable, because it is a negative commandment that involves no action, and any negative commandment that involves no action - one is not liable for it. But a warning of doubt - its name is a warning.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ הַתְרָאַת סָפֵק, וְהַתְרָאַת סָפֵק — לֹא שְׁמָהּ הַתְרָאָה. אֲבָל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה — לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: He is not flogged because it is an uncertain warning, and an uncertain warning is not considered a warning. But for a prohibition whose does not involve an action one is flogged.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: He is not liable, because there is a doubt of a doubt, and a doubt of a doubt - its name is not a doubt. But if there is no action involved - one is liable for it.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לְעוֹלָם בְּ״עַל״ בְּסָמוּךְ קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אִיפְּלִיגוּ לְעִנְיַן חָמֵץ, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: בְּהָהוּא הוּא דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּלָא בָּעֵינַן ״עַל״ בְּסָמוּךְ — מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיסּוּר הוּא, וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ — אִיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: They say Actually, they disagree about “with” next to, and it is necessary As, if they disagreed with regard to leaven, I would have said it is with regard to that that Rabbi Yoḥanan said that “with,” we do not require next to because it is a prohibition, and wherever it is, it is.
llm_translation: They said: Always with "al" next to it he argues, and it is necessary, for if they would argue regarding the issue of chametz, I would say: in that case that Rabbi Yochanan said that we do not require "al" next to it - because it is a prohibition, and wherever there is one, there is one.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן מִקְדָּשׁ לֶחֶם — לָא קָדֵישׁ אֶלָּא בִּפְנִים, אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ דְּבָעֵינַן ״עַל״ בְּסָמוּךְ, דְּאִי אִיתֵיהּ גַּוַּאי — קָדֵישׁ, אִי לָא — לָא קָדֵישׁ, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַכְּלֵי שָׁרֵת. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: However, with regard to sanctification of the bread, it becomes sanctified only inside say that concedes to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish that we require “with” next to if it is inside, it is sanctified; and if not, it is not sanctified. just as it is a vessel used in the service, it is necessary
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of the sanctification of the showbread - it is only sanctified internally. I would say that Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish agrees with this, as we require the word "al" to be adjacent, for if it is present, it is sanctified; if not, it is not sanctified, as it is something that is consumed in the service. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן לְעִנְיַן מִקְדָּשׁ לֶחֶם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: בְּהָךְ קָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ דְּבָעֵינַן ״עַל״ בְּסָמוּךְ, דְּאִי אִיתֵיהּ גַּוַּאי — קָדֵישׁ, אִי לָא — לָא קָדֵישׁ, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן חָמֵץ מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּלָא בָּעֵינַן ״עַל״ בְּסָמוּךְ, דְּאִיסּוּרָא הוּא, וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ — אִיתֵיהּ, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had we been taught with regard to sanctification of the bread, I would have said that in this did Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish say that we require “with” next to it, that if it is inside it is sanctified; and if not, it is not sanctified. But with regard to leavened bread, he concedes to Rabbi Yoḥanan that “with,” we do not require next to for it is a prohibition and wherever it is, it is. it is necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear regarding the matter of the sanctity of bread, I would say: In that case, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish is saying that we require the word "al" adjacent to it, for if it has vinegar - it is holy, if not - it is not holy. However, regarding the matter of chametz, Rabbi Yochanan concedes that we do not require the word "al" adjacent to it, for it is a prohibition, and wherever it is present - it is present, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא מֵרַבִּי אַמֵּי: אֵין לוֹ לַשּׁוֹחֵט, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ לְאֶחָד מִבְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי כְּתִיב ״לֹא תִשְׁחַט עַל חֲמֵצְךָ״? ״לֹא תִשְׁחַט עַל חָמֵץ״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rav Oshaya asked Rabbi Ami the slaughterer does not have but one of the members of the group does have, what is said to him: Is it written: You shall not offer with your leavened bread, It is written: “You shall not offer with leavened bread”
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Oshaya from Rabbi Ammi: "He does not have the right to slaughter, but does he have the right for one of the members of the group?" He said to him: "Who is it written, 'Do not slaughter upon your leaven'? 'Do not slaughter upon leaven' is written."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ לְאֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם נָמֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָמַר קְרָא ״לֹא תִשְׁחַט ... וְלֹא יָלִין״ — ״לֹא תִשְׁחַט עַל חָמֵץ״ — הָנָךְ דְּקָיְימִי עֲלֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא יָלִין״.
human_translation: said to If so, even if someone at the end of the world also said to him the verse says: “You shall not offer,” “Neither shall be left “You shall not offer with leavened bread” those who are governed “neither shall be left over,”
llm_translation: He said to him: If so, even for one at the end of the world? He said to him: The verse says "Do not slaughter... and do not leave overnight" - "Do not slaughter on leaven" - where it is established upon it because of "and do not leave overnight."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הִילְכָּךְ כֹּהֵן הַמַּקְטִיר אֶת הַחֵלֶב — עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, הוֹאִיל וְיֶשְׁנוֹ בִּכְלַל הֲלָנַת אֵמוּרִין.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Therefore, the priest who burns the fats transgresses the negative commandment Since he is included in leaving over sacrificial parts
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Therefore, a priest who burns the fat transgresses a negative commandment, since he is included in the prohibition of the words.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הֶחָמֵץ — עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא לַשּׁוֹחֵט אוֹ לַזּוֹרֵק אוֹ לְאֶחָד מִבְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה. הָיָה לְאֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם — אֵין זָקוּק לוֹ. וְאֶחָד הַשּׁוֹחֵט וְאֶחָד הַזּוֹרֵק וְאֶחָד הַמַּקְטִיר — חַיָּיב. אֲבָל הַמּוֹלֵק אֶת הָעוֹף בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר — אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: it was taught in accordance with Rav Pappa: One who slaughters the Paschal lamb with leavened bread transgresses a negative commandment. When? When to the slaughterer, or to the one who sprinkles or to one of the members of the group. to someone at the end of the world, he is not bound to him, And he slaughters or he sprinkles or he burns liable. But one who pinches a bird, on the fourteenth he does not transgress anything.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Papa: One who slaughters the Paschal lamb over leavened bread transgresses a negative commandment. When is this so? When he intends to slaughter or to sprinkle the blood or to have one of the members of the group do so. If it was for one at the end of the world, he is not dependent on him. If one slaughters, one sprinkles, and one offers incense - they are liable. But one who removes the fat from the bird with fourteen - he does not transgress anything.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הֶחָמֵץ — עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַתָּמִיד. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּפֶסַח בִּלְבַד. אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לַשּׁוֹחֵט אוֹ לַזּוֹרֵק אוֹ לְאֶחָד מִבְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה. הָיָה לְאֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם — אֵין זָקוּק לוֹ.
human_translation: raises a contradiction One who slaughters the Paschal lamb with leavened bread transgresses a negative commandment. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even the daily offering They said to him: They stated only with regard to the Paschal lamb. When When the slaughterer, or the one who sprinkles or one of the members of the group has If someone at the end of the world had he is not bound to him.
llm_translation: And they asked: one who slaughters the Passover sacrifice on leavened bread - he transgresses a negative commandment. Rabbi Yehuda says: also the continual offering. They said to him: they only said this regarding the Passover sacrifice alone. When? When there is someone available to slaughter or to sprinkle or one of the members of the group. If there is no one available at the end of the world - he is not required.

hebrew_text: וְאֶחָד הַשּׁוֹחֵט וְאֶחָד הַזּוֹרֵק וְאֶחָד הַמּוֹלֵק וְאֶחָד הַמַּזֶּה — חַיָּיב. אֲבָל הַקּוֹמֵץ אֶת הַמִּנְחָה — אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. הַמַּקְטִיר אֶת הָאֵימוּרִין — אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: And he slaughters or he sprinkles or he pinches or he sprinkles liable. But one who scoops a handful from a meal-offering does not transgress a negative commandment, One who burns the sacrificial parts does not transgress a negative commandment.
llm_translation: One who slaughters, one who sprinkles, one who removes the innards, and one who offers incense - is liable. But one who scoops out the meal offering - does not transgress a negative commandment. One who burns the sacrificial portions - does not transgress a negative commandment.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא מְלִיקָה אַמְּלִיקָה, קַשְׁיָא הַקְטָרָה אַהַקְטָרָה!
human_translation: a contradiction between pinching pinching. a contradiction burning burning.
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "Kashya melikah amelikah, kashya haktrah ahaktrah!"

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, תִּיקְשֵׁי לָךְ הִיא גּוּפָא. דְּקָתָנֵי: לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּפֶסַח בִּלְבַד, וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי: אֶחָד הַשּׁוֹחֵט וְאֶחָד הַזּוֹרֵק וְאֶחָד הַמּוֹלֵק וְאֶחָד הַמַּזֶּה!
human_translation: And according to your reasoning ask about itself, as it teaches: They said only to the Paschal lamb, and then it teaches he slaughters or he sprinkles or he pinches or he sprinkles
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, it is difficult for you, it is the body. As it is taught: They only said this regarding Pesach alone, and then it teaches: One who slaughters, and one who sprinkles, and one who salts, and one who stirs!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הָא וְהָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. מְלִיקָה אַמְּלִיקָה לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, כָּאן — בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. וְאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, this and that Rabbi Shimon. there is no contradiction between pinching pinching: Here, to the fourteenth there, the intermediate days of the festival And this and that Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: Rather: this and this is Rabbi Shimon. Melikah Amlikah is not difficult: here - on the fourteenth, here - on the weekday of the festival. And both are the words of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: הַקְטָרָה אַהַקְטָרָה נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא — תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּאִיכָּא דְּמַקֵּישׁ הַקְטָרָה לִשְׁחִיטָה, וְאִיכָּא מַאן דְּלָא מַקֵּישׁ.
human_translation: no contradiction between burning burning, is tanna’im There is one who compares burning to slaughtering, and there is one who does not compare
llm_translation: Incense, is it like incense? It is a teaching. For there is one who compares incense to ritual slaughter, and there is one who does not compare.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַתָּמִיד וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר לָךְ: ״זִבְחִי״ — זֶבַח הַמְיוּחָד לִי, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? תָּמִיד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: even for the daily offering What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda’s He said to you “My sacrifice” the sacrifice that is designated to Me; and what is it? the daily offering,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even the Tamid, etc. What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda? He said to you: "My sacrifice" - a sacrifice that is designated for Me, and what is it? The Tamid.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הַפֶּסַח בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? דִּכְתִיב ״זִבְחִי״ ״זִבְחִי״ תְּרֵי זִמְנֵי, קְרִי בֵּיהּ: ״זֶבַח, זְבָחַיי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: On the fourteenth the Paschal lamb What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon’s As it is written: “My sacrifice [ zivḥi ],” “My sacrifice [ zivḥi ],” two times, read: A sacrifice [ zevaḥ ], My sacrifices [ zevaḥai ].
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The Passover sacrifice on the fourteenth, etc. What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's statement? As it is written, "My sacrifice, My sacrifice" - two times, read it as: "sacrifice, my sacrifices."

hebrew_text: לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא פַּלְגִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא מֵהֲדָדֵי וְלָא כְּתַב ״זְבָחַיי״? לְמֵימַר: בִּזְמַן דְּאִיכָּא זֶבַח — לָא מִחַיַּיב אַזְּבָחַיי. בִּזְמַן דְּלֵיכָּא זֶבַח — מִחַיַּיב אַזְּבָחַיי.
human_translation: To what halakha does the Merciful One divide them and not write: My sacrifices? to say at the time when there is a sacrifice, one is not liable for My sacrifices. at a time when there is no sacrifice, one is liable My sacrifices
llm_translation: Regarding what halakha? We divide them, the Merciful One from Hadadei, and it did not write "my sacrifices"? To say: When there is a sacrifice - one is not obligated to offer sacrifices. When there is no sacrifice - one is obligated to offer sacrifices.

hebrew_text: וּבַמּוֹעֵד לִשְׁמוֹ פָּטוּר וְכוּ׳. טַעְמָא דְּשֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ, הָא סְתָמָא — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: during the Festival for its purpose one is exempt The reason that for a different purpose; but without intent exempt,
llm_translation: In the appointed time for his name he is exempt, etc. The reason for when it is not for his name, this is a general rule - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? פֶּסַח בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה שְׁלָמִים הָוֵי! שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ פֶּסַח בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה!
human_translation: Why a Paschal lamb during the rest of the days of the year a peace-offering? Learn from this that a Paschal lamb on the rest of the days of the year requires uprooting,
llm_translation: Why? Pesach on other days of the year is considered complete! Learn from it that Pesach on other days of the year requires uprooting!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר גַּמְדָּא: נִזְרְקָה מִפִּי חֲבוּרָה, וְאָמְרוּ: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ בְּעָלִים טְמֵאֵי מֵת, וְנִדְחִין לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי, דִּסְתָמֵיהּ לְשׁוּם פֶּסַח קָאֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda said: it emerged from the group, and they said where the owners were ritually impure by a corpse and they were deferred to the second Passover. presumably stands as a Paschal lamb,
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Gamda said: It was thrown out from the mouth of the group, and they said: For example, if the owners were impure due to contact with a corpse, and they were disqualified for the second Passover, it is assumed that it stands for some Passover.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפֶּסַח נִשְׁחַט בְּשָׁלֹשׁ כִּתּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁחֲטוּ אוֹתוֹ כֹּל קְהַל עֲדַת יִשְׂרָאֵל״, קָהָל, וְעֵדָה, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל. נִכְנְסָה כַּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, נִתְמַלְּאָה הָעֲזָרָה, נָעֲלוּ דַּלְתוֹת הָעֲזָרָה, תָּקְעוּ הֵרִיעוּ וְתָקְעוּ,
human_translation: The Paschal lamb was slaughtered in three groups, as it is stated: “And the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall slaughter it Assembly, congregation, and Israel. The first group entered, the Temple courtyard became filled they closed the doors of the Temple courtyard. They sounded uninterrupted, broken, and uninterrupted blasts,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The Paschal lamb is slaughtered in three groups, as it is stated: "And they shall slaughter it, the entire assembly of the congregation of Israel" (Exodus 12:6) - assembly, congregation, and Israel. When the first group entered, the Temple courtyard became filled, the doors of the courtyard were closed, they sounded the trumpet blast and sounded it again.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּהֲנִים עוֹמְדִים שׁוּרוֹת שׁוּרוֹת, וּבִידֵיהֶם בְּזִיכִי כֶסֶף וּבְזִיכֵי זָהָב. שׁוּרָה שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ כֶּסֶף כֶּסֶף, וְשׁוּרָה שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ זָהָב זָהָב, לֹא הָיוּ מְעוֹרָבִין. וְלֹא הָיוּ לַבָּזִיכִין שׁוּלַיִים, שֶׁמָּא יַנִּיחוּם וְיִקָּרֵשׁ הַדָּם.
human_translation: The priests stood in rows and in their hands bowls [ bezikhin ] of silver and bowls of gold a row entirely silver and a row entirely gold were not mixed The bowls did not have bases perhaps set them down and the blood would congeal
llm_translation: The priests stand in rows, rows, and in their hands are silver basins and golden basins. A row that is entirely silver, silver, and a row that is entirely gold, gold, they were not mixed. And the basins did not have bottoms, lest they place them down and the blood congeal.

hebrew_text: שָׁחַט יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְקִבֵּל הַכֹּהֵן. נוֹתְנוֹ לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וַחֲבֵירוֹ לַחֲבֵירוֹ. וּמְקַבֵּל אֶת הַמָּלֵא, וּמַחֲזִיר אֶת הָרֵיקָן. כֹּהֵן הַקָּרוֹב אֵצֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ זוֹרְקוֹ זְרִיקָה אַחַת כְּנֶגֶד הַיְּסוֹד.
human_translation: An Israelite would slaughter and a priest would receive hand it to another and the other to another. receive a full and return an empty priest who was closest to the altar would sprinkle a single sprinkling against the base
llm_translation: The Israelite slaughtered, and the priest received. He gives it to his fellow, and his fellow to his fellow. And he receives the full vessel, and returns the empty vessel. The priest who is close to the altar pours it with one sprinkle opposite the base.

hebrew_text: יָצְתָה כַּת רִאשׁוֹנָה, וְנִכְנְסָה כַּת שְׁנִיָּה. יָצְתָה שְׁנִיָּה, נִכְנְסָה שְׁלִישִׁית. כְּמַעֲשֵׂה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה כָּךְ מַעֲשֵׂה הַשְּׁנִיָּה וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁית. קָרְאוּ אֶת הַהַלֵּל. אִם גָּמְרוּ — שָׁנוּ, וְאִם שָׁנוּ — שִׁלֵּשׁוּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא שִׁלְּשׁוּ מִימֵיהֶם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִימֵיהֶם שֶׁל כַּת שְׁלִישִׁית לֹא הִגִּיעוּ לְ״אָהַבְתִּי כִּי יִשְׁמַע ה׳״, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעַמָּהּ מוּעָטִין.
human_translation: The first group exited and the second group entered; the second group left and the third group entered. As it was done by the first so was it done by the second and third recite hallel . If they finished they a second time, and if they a second time, they a third time, although they never a third time, Rabbi Yehuda says: The third group never reached “I love that the Lord hears because its people were few
llm_translation: The first one went out, and the second one came in. The second one went out, the third one came in. Just as the first one acted, so did the second and the third. They called it "the Hillel." If they completed it - they repeated it, and if they repeated it - they tripled it, even though they did not triple it in their days. Rabbi Yehuda says: In the days of the third one, they did not reach "I have loved him because the Lord will hear," because they were few in number.

hebrew_text: כְּמַעֲשֵׂהוּ בַּחוֹל כָּךְ מַעֲשֵׂהוּ בַּשַּׁבָּת, אֶלָּא שֶׁהַכֹּהֲנִים מְדִיחִים אֶת הָעֲזָרָה שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כּוֹס הָיָה מְמַלֵּא מִדַּם הַתַּעֲרוֹבֶת, זְרָקוֹ זְרִיקָה אַחַת עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: As it was done during the week, so was it done on Shabbat; only that the priests would rinse the Temple courtyard, contrary to the wishes of the Sages, Rabbi Yehuda says: would fill a cup with the blood that was mixed sprinkle it with a single sprinkling upon the altar. But the Rabbis did not agree with
llm_translation: As its manner on a weekday, so is its manner on Shabbat, except that the priests would rinse the altar against the will of the Sages. Rabbi Yehuda says: There was a cup filled with the blood of the mixture, they would sprinkle it once on the altar. The Sages did not agree with him.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד תּוֹלִין וּמַפְשִׁיטִין? אוּנְקְלָיוֹת שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל הָיוּ קְבוּעִים בַּכְּתָלִים וּבָעַמּוּדִים שֶׁבָּהֶן תּוֹלִין וּמַפְשִׁיטִין. כׇּל מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מָקוֹם לִתְלוֹת וּלְהַפְשִׁיט — מַקְלוֹת דַּקִּים וַחֲלָקִים הָיוּ שָׁם, מַנִּיחַ עַל כְּתֵפוֹ וְעַל כֶּתֶף חֲבֵירוֹ, וְתוֹלֶה וּמַפְשִׁיט. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר
human_translation: How would one suspend and flay Iron hooks [ unkelayot ] were secured into the walls and pillars, and upon them one would suspend and flay anyone lacked a place to suspend and flay there were thin, smooth rods there, he would place on his shoulder and on another’s shoulder, and he would suspend Rabbi Eliezer says: the fourteenth
llm_translation: How do we hang and remove? Iron hooks were fixed in the walls and pillars on which we hang and remove. Anyone who has no place to hang and remove - thin and smooth sticks were there, placing on his shoulder and on the shoulder of his friend, and hanging and removing. Rabbi Eliezer says: fourteen.

hebrew_text: שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת, מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ עַל כֶּתֶף חֲבֵירוֹ, וְיַד חֲבֵירוֹ עַל כְּתֵיפוֹ, וְתוֹלֶה וּמַפְשִׁיט. קְרָעוֹ, וְהוֹצִיא אֶת אֵימוּרָיו. נְתָנוֹ בְּמָגֵיס, וְהִקְטִירָן עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: occurred on Shabbat, he would rest his hand on another’s shoulder and the other’s hand on his shoulder and suspend and flay He would tear and remove its sacrificial parts, He would place in a large basin [ mageis ] and burn them on the altar.
llm_translation: When it comes to Shabbat, he places his hand on the shoulder of his fellow, and the hand of his fellow on his shoulder, and he lifts and removes. If it tore, he takes out its innards. He placed it in a pan and burned them on the top of the altar.

hebrew_text: יָצְתָה כַּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וְיָשְׁבָה לָהּ בְּהַר הַבַּיִת. שְׁנִיָּה בַּחֵיל, וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁית בִּמְקוֹמָהּ עוֹמֶדֶת. חָשֵׁיכָה — יָצְאוּ וְצָלוּ אֶת פִּסְחֵיהֶן.
human_translation: the first group would exit and remain on the Temple Mount; the second the rampart, and the third would stand in its place it became dark, they would go out and roast their Paschal lambs,
llm_translation: The first group of priests went out and sat in the Temple Mount. The second group in the courtyard, and the third group stood in their place. When it became dark - they would go out and roast their Passover sacrifices.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵין הַפֶּסַח נִשְׁחָט אֶלָּא בְּשָׁלֹשׁ כִּתּוֹת שֶׁל שְׁלֹשִׁים שְׁלֹשִׁים בְּנֵי אָדָם. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״קָהָל״ וְ״עֵדָה״ וְ״יִשְׂרָאֵל״. מְסַפְּקָא לַן אִי בְּבַת אַחַת אִי בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה,
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: The Paschal lamb is slaughtered only in three groups of thirty people What is the reason Assembly, congregation, and Israel, We are uncertain at the same time one after another.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rabbi Yitzchak: The Passover sacrifice is not slaughtered except with groups of thirty-three people. What is the reason? "Congregation," "assembly," and "Israel." It is uncertain for us whether it is done all at once or one after the other.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ בָּעֵינַן שָׁלֹשׁ כִּתּוֹת שֶׁל שְׁלֹשִׁים שְׁלֹשִׁים בְּנֵי אָדָם. דְּאִי בְּבַת אַחַת — הָא אִיכָּא, וְאִי בָּזֶה אַחַר זֶה — הָא אִיכָּא, הִלְכָּךְ בְּחַמְשִׁין נָמֵי סַגִּיא, דְּעָיְילִי תְּלָתִין וְעָבְדִי, עָיְילִי עַשְׂרָה וְנָפְקִי עַשְׂרָה, עָיְילִי עַשְׂרָה וְנָפְקִי עַשְׂרָה.
human_translation: Therefore, we require three groups of thirty people As, if at the same time, have and if one after another, have Therefore, even fifty suffice. Thirty enter and perform ten enter and ten leave and ten enter and ten leave
llm_translation: Therefore, we require three groups of thirty-three men. For if they are in one house - there is a group, and if they are in different houses one after the other - there is a group. Therefore, with fifty men it is significant, for they go in groups of thirty and work, then ten come in and ten go out, then ten come in and ten go out.

hebrew_text: נִכְנְסָה כַּת רִאשׁוֹנָה וְכוּ׳. אִיתְּמַר, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: נִנְעֲלוּ תְּנַן. רָבָא אָמַר: נוֹעֲלִין תְּנַן.
human_translation: the first group entered, It was stated Abaye said: We learned closed by themselves. Rava said: We learned that would close
llm_translation: Entered the first chamber, etc. It was stated: Abbaye said: We learn the Mishnah as closed. Rava said: We learn as open.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ לְמִסְמַךְ אַנִּיסָּא. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: נִנְעֲלוּ תְּנַן, כַּמָּה דַּעֲיַילוּ מְעַלּוּ, וְסָמְכִינַן אַנִּיסָּא. רָבָא אָמַר: נוֹעֲלִין תְּנַן, וְלָא סָמְכִינַן אַנִּיסָּא.
human_translation: What is between them? The between them is whether we rely on a miracle. Abaye said: We learned that the doors closed by themselves; as many as entered, entered, and we rely on a miracle Rava said: We learned that close and we do not rely on a miracle
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them for supporting a basket. Abbaye said: They were locked, as much as they brought up, and we support a basket. Rava said: They were locked, but we do not support a basket.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּתְנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: חַס וְשָׁלוֹם שֶׁעֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל נִתְנַדָּה, שֶׁאֵין עֲזָרָה נִנְעֶלֶת עַל כׇּל אָדָם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּחׇכְמָה וּבְיִרְאַת חֵטְא כַּעֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל. אַבָּיֵי מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ, וְרָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ. אַבָּיֵי מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: אֵין בָּעֲזָרָה בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנִּנְעֲלָה עַל כׇּל אָדָם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּחׇכְמָה וּבְיִרְאַת חֵטְא כַּעֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל: רָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: אֵין בָּעֲזָרָה בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנּוֹעֲלִין אוֹתָהּ עַל כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּחׇכְמָה וּבְיִרְאַת חֵטְא כַּעֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל.
human_translation: And that which we learned Rabbi Yehuda said: Heaven forbid that Akavya ben Mahalalel was banned; the Temple courtyard would not close on any man from Israel wisdom and fear of sin as Akavya ben Mahalalel; Abaye explain according to his opinion, and Rava explain according to his opinion. Abaye explain according to his opinion No man from Israel was in the Temple courtyard when it closed by itself wisdom and fear of sin as Akavya ben Mahalalel. Rava, explain according to his opinion No from Israel was in the Temple courtyard when they closed it wisdom and fear of sin as Akavya ben Mahalalel.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this that we learned, Rabbi Yehuda said: Heaven forbid that the family of Mahalalel should be excommunicated, for no help is locked upon any person in Israel in wisdom and fear of sin like Akavya ben Mahalalel. Abbaye interprets his reasons, and Rava interprets his reasons. Abbaye interprets his reasons: There is no help at the time when it is locked upon any person in Israel in wisdom and fear of sin like Akavya ben Mahalalel. Rava interprets his reasons: There is no help at the time when it is locked upon all of Israel in wisdom and fear of sin like Akavya ben Mahalalel.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מֵעוֹלָם לָא נִתְמַעֵךְ אָדָם בָּעֲזָרָה, חוּץ מִפֶּסַח אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה בִּימֵי הִלֵּל, שֶׁנִּתְמַעֵךְ בּוֹ זָקֵן אֶחָד, וְהָיוּ קוֹרְאִין אוֹתוֹ ״פֶּסַח מְעוּכִין״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: No one was ever crushed in the Temple courtyard, except for one Passover in the days of Hillel when an old man was crushed, and they called the Passover of the crushed.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A person should never recline at the table, except for one Passover, which was in the days of Hillel, where an elderly man reclined, and they would call it "a Passover of reclining."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פַּעַם אַחַת בִּיקֵּשׁ אַגְרִיפַּס הַמֶּלֶךְ לִיתֵּן עֵינָיו בְּאוּכְלוּסֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל: תֵּן עֵינֶיךָ בַּפְּסָחִים. נָטַל כּוּלְיָא מִכׇּל אֶחָד, וְנִמְצְאוּ שָׁם שִׁשִּׁים רִיבּוֹא זוּגֵי כְלָיוֹת כִּפְלַיִם כְּיוֹצְאֵי מִצְרַיִם. חוּץ מִטָּמֵא וְשֶׁהָיָה בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה. וְאֵין לָךְ כׇּל פֶּסַח וּפֶסַח שֶׁלֹּא נִמְנוּ עָלָיו יוֹתֵר מֵעֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם. וְהָיוּ קוֹרְאִין אוֹתוֹ ״פֶּסַח מְעוּבִּין״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Once, King Agrippa wished to set his eyes on the multitudes [ ukhlosin ] of Israel said to the High Priest: Set your eyes on the Paschal lambs; took a kidney from each one, and six hundred thousand pairs of kidneys were found there, double those who left Egypt. excluded those who were ritually impure or at a great distance, and there was not a single Paschal lamb that did not have more than ten people registered for it. They called that the Passover of the crowded,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Once, King Agrippas sought to gaze at the entrails of the Israelites' Paschal sacrifices. He said to the High Priest: "Look at the Paschal lambs." He took out the kidneys from each one, and there were found there sixty myriads of pairs of kidneys, double the number of those who left Egypt. Except for one who was impure and one who was on a distant journey. And there is no Paschal offering that did not have more than ten people counted for it. And they would call it "a Paschal offering of abundance."

hebrew_text: נָטַל כּוּלְיָא? הָא בָּעֵי אַקְטוּרַהּ! דַּהֲדַר מַקְטֵיר לְהוּ. וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְהִקְטִירוֹ״, שֶׁלֹּא יְעָרֵב חֲלָבָיו שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה!
human_translation: take a kidney? he have to burn it He subsequently he burned them. Isn’t it written: “And shall burn it he must not mix fats of this with another;
llm_translation: He took the entire incense offering? But he needs to burn it! He will come back and burn it for them. And it is written: "And he shall burn it," so that one's fat should not mix with the other's fat!

hebrew_text: דַּהֲדַר מַקְטֵיר לְהוּ חֲדָא חֲדָא. וְהָתַנְיָא ״וְהִקְטִירָם״, שֶׁיְּהֵא כּוּלּוֹ כְּאֶחָד! אֶלָּא: תְּפִיסָה בְּעָלְמָא, דְּשָׁקֵיל מִינַּיְיהוּ עַד דְּיָהֲבִין לֵיהּ מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא.
human_translation: He subsequently burned them one by one Wasn’t it taught shall burn them that all at the same time? Rather, merely seizure; he took it from them until they brought him something else
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He then offers each one separately. And it was taught: 'And he shall burn them,' that they should all be together! Rather, it is a mere holding, as he takes from them until he gives to another immediately."

hebrew_text: כֹּהֲנִים עוֹמְדִין שׁוּרוֹת וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא דִּילְמָא שָׁקְלִי דְּדַהֲבָא וּמְעַיְּילִי דְּכַסְפָּא — הָכִי נָמֵי, דִּילְמָא שָׁקְלִי בַּר מָאתַן וּמְעַיְּילִי בַּר מְאָה! אֶלָּא, דְּהָכִי שַׁפִּיר טְפֵי.
human_translation: the priests stood in rows What is the reason If you say perhaps would take a gold and return a silver Here, too, perhaps would take a two-hundred- and return a Rather, that this is more attractive.
llm_translation: The priests stand in rows, etc. What is the reason? Perhaps they took gold coins and exchanged them for silver coins - this is the reason, lest they take a hundred and exchange for a hundred! Rather, it is because this is more beautiful.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הָיוּ לַבָּזִיכִין שׁוּלַיִים וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל הַבָּזִיכִין שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ לֹא הָיוּ לָהֶן שׁוּלַיִים, חוּץ מִבְּזִיכֵי לְבוֹנָה שֶׁל לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים — שֶׁמָּא יַנִּיחוּם וְיִפְרוֹס הַלֶּחֶם.
human_translation: the bowls did not have bases. the Sages taught None of the bowls in the Temple had bases with the exception of the bowls of frankincense the showbread, perhaps would rest them on the bread and the bread would break.
llm_translation: And not were to the basikin shulayim etc. The Rabbis taught: All the basikin in the Temple did not have shulayim, except for the basikin of the showbread — lest they place them and break the bread.

hebrew_text: שָׁחַט יִשְׂרָאֵל וְקִבֵּל הַכֹּהֵן וְכוּ׳. לָא סַגִּיא דְּלָאו יִשְׂרָאֵל?! הִיא גּוּפָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דִּשְׁחִיטָה בְּזָר כְּשֵׁירָה. וְקִבֵּל הַכֹּהֵן. הָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן, מִקַּבָּלָה וְאֵילָךְ מִצְוַת כְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: An Israelite would slaughter and a priest would receive Is it not sufficient not an Israelite teaches us this itself, that slaughter by a non-priest is valid. the priest receives comes to teach us that from receiving and onward a commandment upon the priesthood,
llm_translation: The Israelite slaughtered and the priest received, etc. Is it not sufficient that it is an Israelite?! The very act itself informs us that ritual slaughter by a non-priest is valid. And the priest received. This informs us that from the moment of receiving onwards, it is a commandment of priesthood.

hebrew_text: נוֹתְנוֹ לַחֲבֵירוֹ. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ הוֹלָכָה שֶׁלֹּא בָּרֶגֶל — הָוְיָא הוֹלָכָה! דִּילְמָא הוּא נָיֵיד פּוּרְתָּא. וְאֶלָּא מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? הָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן: ״בְּרׇב עָם הַדְרַת מֶלֶךְ״.
human_translation: pass to another Learn from this that carrying without walking, is carrying Perhaps would move a little Rather, what does this teach us? It teaches us “in the multitude of people is the king’s glory”
llm_translation: He gives to his fellow. You heard from it a type that goes not by foot - it is considered as going by foot! Perhaps it is carried by a mule. Rather, what does it teach us? It teaches us: "In the multitude of people is the king's glory."

hebrew_text: קִבֵּל אֶת הַמָּלֵא וּמַחְזִיר אֶת הָרֵיקָן וְכוּ׳. אֲבָל אִיפְּכָא לָא — מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: אֵין מַעֲבִירִין עַל הַמִּצְוֹת.
human_translation: receive a full and return an empty But the opposite not supports Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: One must not postpone mitzvot.
llm_translation: Received the full and returning the empty, and so forth. But the opposite is not allowed — it supports Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, for Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: We do not pass over the commandments.

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן הַקָּרוֹב אֵצֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וְכוּ׳. מַאן תָּנָא פֶּסַח בִּזְרִיקָה? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי הִיא.
human_translation: the priest who was closest to the altar Who is the tanna the Paschal lamb sprinkling Rav Ḥisda said: It is Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: The priest who is near the altar, etc. Who is the Tanna who taught Pesach with regard to sprinkling? Rav Chisda said: It is Rabbi Yosei the Galilean.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: ״אֶת דָּמָם תִּזְרוֹק עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וְאֶת חֶלְבָּם תַּקְטִיר״ — ״דָּמוֹ״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״דָּמָם״. ״חֶלְבּוֹ״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״חֶלְבָּם״. לִמֵּד עַל בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר וּפֶסַח, שֶׁהֵן טְעוּנִין מַתַּן דָּמִים וְאֵימוּרִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: As it was taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: you shall sprinkle their blood upon the altar and you shall burn their fat It is not stated: Its blood, but “their blood.” it is not stated: Its fat, but “their fat.” teaches with regard to the firstborn the tithed animal and the Paschal lamb, that they require placement of their blood and sacrificial parts on the altar,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: "Their blood you shall pour on the altar, and their fat you shall offer up" — "his blood" is not stated, rather "their blood." "His fat" is not stated, rather "their fat." This teaches regarding the firstborn, tithes, and Passover offerings, that they require the giving of blood and verbal declarations at the altar.

hebrew_text: מְנָלַן דִּטְעוּנִין יְסוֹד? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָתְיָא ״זְרִיקָה״ ״זְרִיקָה״ מֵעוֹלָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״אֶת דָּמָם תִּזְרוֹק עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְזָרְקוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֲנִים אֶת דָּמוֹ עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ סָבִיב״, מָה עוֹלָה טְעוּנָה יְסוֹד — אַף פֶּסַח נָמֵי טָעוּן יְסוֹד.
human_translation: From where do we requires base? Rabbi Elazar said: This is derived sprinkling sprinkling with regard to a burnt-offering. Here, it is written: “You shall sprinkle their blood upon the altar;” there, it is written and the sons of Aaron, the priests, shall sprinkle its blood round about upon the altar” Just as burnt-offering must a base, so too, Paschal lamb must a base.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive that the sprinklings are essential? Rabbi Elazar said: It is derived from the word "zrikah" repeated twice in connection with the burnt offering. It is written here: "You shall sprinkle their blood upon the altar," and it is written there: "And the sons of Aaron the priests shall sprinkle his blood upon the altar round about." Just as the burnt offering requires a foundation, so too the Passover offering also requires a foundation.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹלָה גּוּפַהּ מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֶל יְסוֹד מִזְבַּח הָעוֹלָה״, אַלְמָא עוֹלָה טְעוּנָה יְסוֹד.
human_translation: And from where do we the burnt-offering itself the verse said: at the base of the altar of the burnt-offering, Apparently, a burnt-offering requires the base,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And where is its body burnt? The verse says: "To the base of the altar of burnt offering." This teaches us that a burnt offering requires a base.

hebrew_text: יָצְתָה כַּת רִאשׁוֹנָה וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: הִיא נִקְרֵאת כַּת עַצְלָנִית. וְהָא לָא סַגִּי דְּלָאו הָכִי, מַאי הָוֵי לְהוּ לְמִיעְבַּד?
human_translation: the first group exited, It was taught It was called the lazy group But it would not have been sufficient without this What, should have done?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Yatza kat rishonah vekhu. Tana: hi nikret kat atzlanit. Veha la sagi de'la hu, mai havei lehu lemi'abed?" English translation: "She went out first and so on. It was taught: she is called a lazy cat. But isn't it not enough that it is not so, what will be for them to be done?"

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, אִיבְּעִי לְהוּ לְזָרוֹזֵי נַפְשַׁיְיהוּ. כִּדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְעוֹלָם בְּלֹא בַּסָּם וּבְלֹא בּוּרְסִי. אַשְׁרֵי מִי שֶׁאוּמָּנֻתוֹ בַּסָּם, אוֹי לוֹ מִי שֶׁאוּמָּנֻתוֹ בּוּרְסִי. וְאִי אֶפְשָׁר לְעוֹלָם בְּלֹא זְכָרִים וּבְלֹא נְקֵבוֹת. אַשְׁרֵי מִי שֶׁבָּנָיו זְכָרִים, אוֹי לוֹ מִי שֶׁבָּנָיו נְקֵבוֹת.
human_translation: Nonetheless, should have hurried themselves As was taught Rabbi says: The world cannot without a perfume merchant or without a tanner [ bursi ], fortunate is he whose profession is perfume merchant, woe to him whose profession is tanner. the world cannot without males or without females; fortunate is he whose children are males, woe to him whose children are females.
llm_translation: Even so, they should hasten themselves. As it was taught: Rabbi says, it is impossible for the world to exist without balsam and without borith. Fortunate is one whose trust is in balsam, woe to one whose trust is in borith. And it is impossible for the world to exist without males and without females. Fortunate is one whose children are males, woe to one whose children are females.

hebrew_text: כְּמַעֲשֵׂהוּ בַּחוֹל וְכוּ׳. שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן מַאן? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. דְּאִי רַבָּנַן — הָא אָמְרִי שְׁבוּת הוּא, וְאֵין שְׁבוּת בְּמִקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: in the same manner that was performed during the week, Contrary to the wishes of whom? Rav Ḥisda said: It was contrary to the wishes of Rabbi Eliezer, As, if the Rabbis, don’t they say rabbinic decree? And rabbinic decrees not in the Temple.
llm_translation: As his deed on a weekday and so forth. Not willingly who? Said Rav Ḥisdah: Not willingly Rabbi Eliezer. For if the Rabbis — this is what they say, it is a rabbinic prohibition, and there is no rabbinic prohibition in the Temple.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: אֶחָד הַחוֹלֵב וְהַמְחַבֵּץ וְהַמְגַבֵּן — כִּגְרוֹגְרוֹת. הַמְכַבֵּד וְהַמְרַבֵּץ וְהָרוֹדֶה חַלּוֹת דְּבַשׁ בְּשׁוֹגֵג בְּשַׁבָּת — חַיָּיב חַטָּאת, הֵזִיד בְּיוֹם טוֹב — לוֹקֶה אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: What is As it was taught One who milks or sets milk to curdle or makes cheese a dried fig-bulk; one who sweeps or sprinkles or removes honeycombs, unwittingly on Shabbat, he is liable a sin-offering, intentionally on a Festival, he is flogged with forty the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: What is it? As it was taught: One who kneads, and one who smooths, and one who shapes dough - like grog'roth. One who forms, and one who smooths, and one who pierces holes in loaves of honey on Shabbat inadvertently - liable for a sin-offering; intentionally on a festival - receives forty lashes, the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say Both this, and that, are only due to rabbinic decrees.
llm_translation: The sages say, "One this and one this is only due to a Rabbinic decree."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים — וְרַבִּי נָתָן הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: שְׁבוּת צְרִיכָה הִתִּירוּ, שְׁבוּת שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לֹא הִתִּירוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: You can even say contrary to the wishes of the Rabbis, and is Rabbi Natan. As it was taught Rabbi Natan says a rabbinic prohibition necessary they permitted a rabbinic prohibition not necessary they did not permit
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say it is not with the consent of the sages — and it is Rabbi Natan's opinion. As it was taught, Rabbi Natan says: A necessary rest they permitted, a rest that is not necessary they did not permit.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר כּוֹס הָיָה מְמַלֵּא וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כּוֹס הָיָה מְמַלֵּא מִדַּם הַתַּעֲרוֹבוֹת, שֶׁאִם יִשָּׁפֵךְ דָּמוֹ שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן — נִמְצָא זֶה מַכְשִׁירוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says would fill a cup the blood that was mixed It was taught Rabbi Yehuda says: He would fill a cup with the mixed blood, so that if the blood of one was spilled, this would render fit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A cup that was being filled, etc. It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says: A cup that was being filled from the blood of the sacrifices, for if the blood of one of them spills, this one is found to be valid.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וַהֲלֹא לֹא נִתְקַבֵּל בִּכְלִי? מְנָא יָדְעִי?! אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: שֶׁמָּא לֹא נִתְקַבֵּל בִּכְלִי? אָמַר לָהֶן: אַף אֲנִי לֹא אָמַרְתִּי אֶלָּא בְּנִתְקַבֵּל בִּכְלִי.
human_translation: said to Rabbi Yehuda: But had not been received in a vessel How do they know Rather, this is what said to Perhaps had not been received in a vessel said to them: I, too, spoke only about that had been received in a vessel.
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Yehuda: But wasn't it not accepted in a vessel? How do you know?! Rather, this is what they were saying to him: Perhaps it was not accepted in a vessel? He said to them: I too only said it should be accepted in a vessel.

hebrew_text: מְנָא יָדַע? כֹּהֲנִים זְרִיזִין הֵן. אִי זְרִיזִין — אַמַּאי מִשְׁתְּפִיךְ? אַגַּב זְרִיזוּתַיְיהוּ דְּעָבְדִי, מִשְׁתְּפִיךְ.
human_translation: How does know Priests are vigilant, But if they are vigilant, why did spill? Owing to the speed with which they worked, spilled.
llm_translation: He knew how? Priests are diligent. If they are diligent, why does it spill? Because of their diligence in performing, it spills.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דַּם הַתַּמְצִית מְעוֹרָב בּוֹ! רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: דַּם הַתַּמְצִית — דָּם מְעַלְּיָא הוּא. דְּתַנְיָא: דַּם הַתַּמְצִית בְּאַזְהָרָה, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּהִיכָּרֵת.
human_translation: But isn’t blood squeezed mixed with it? Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he says blood squeezed is proper blood As it was taught blood squeezed a warning, Rabbi Yehuda says: karet ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And isn't the blood of the tamtzit mixed in it! Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning, as he said: The blood of the tamtzit - it is blood that ascends. As it was taught: The blood of the tamtzit with a warning, Rabbi Yehuda says: with recognition.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְעִנְיַן כַּפָּרָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הַדָּם הוּא בַּנֶּפֶשׁ יְכַפֵּר״,
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Elazar say Rabbi Yehuda concedes with regard to atonement does not make atonement? As it is stated: for it is the blood that makes atonement by reason of life”
llm_translation: And he said, Rabbi Elazar: Rabbi Yehuda concedes regarding the matter of atonement that does not atone, as it is stated: "For the blood is the atonement for the soul."

hebrew_text: דָּם שֶׁהַנֶּפֶשׁ יוֹצְאָה בּוֹ — מְכַפֵּר. דָּם שֶׁאֵין הַנֶּפֶשׁ יוֹצְאָה בּוֹ — אֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר. אֶלָּא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: אֵין דָּם מְבַטֵּל דָּם.
human_translation: blood with which life leaves makes atonement blood with which life does not leave does not make atonement. Rather, Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he said: Blood does not nullify blood.
llm_translation: Blood that the soul exits in it - atones. Blood that the soul does not exit in it - does not atone. Rather, Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning, as he said: Blood does not nullify blood.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לַחֲכָמִים: לְדִבְרֵיכֶם, לָמָּה פּוֹקְקִין אֶת הָעֲזָרָה? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: שֶׁבַח הוּא לִבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן שֶׁיֵּלְכוּ עַד אַרְכּוּבּוֹתֵיהֶם בְּדָם.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yehuda said to the Rabbis: According to your statement why did they plug the Temple courtyard They said to him: It is praiseworthy of the sons of Aaron, to walk in blood up to their ankles,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said to the sages: According to your words, why do you hollow out the altar? They said to him: It is a praise for the sons of Aaron that they walk up to their ankles in blood.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא חָיֵיץ?! לַח הוּא וְאֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ. כִּדְתַנְיָא: הַדָּם וְהַדְּיוֹ וְהֶחָלָב וְהַדְּבַשׁ, יְבֵשִׁים — חוֹצְצִין, לַחִין — אֵין חוֹצְצִין.
human_translation: Doesn’t interpose is moist and does not interpose. As it was taught blood, ink, milk, and honey, dry, interpose moist, they do not interpose.
llm_translation: And this is considered a solid substance?! It is moist and not solid. As it was taught: Blood, ink, milk, and honey, when dry - they are considered solid substances, when moist - they are not considered solid substances.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָמִתַּוְּוסִי מָאנַיְיהוּ, (וּתְנַן) הָיוּ בְּגָדָיו מְטוּשְׁטָשִׁין וְעָבַד — עֲבוֹדָתוֹ פְּסוּלָה! וְכִי תֵּימָא דִּמְדַלּוּ לְהוּ לְמָאנַיְיהוּ, וְהָתַנְיָא: ״מִדּוֹ בַּד״ — מִדּוֹ כְּמִדָּתוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא יְחַסֵּר וְלֹא יוֹתִיר! בְּהוֹלָכַת אֵיבָרִין לַכֶּבֶשׁ — דְּלָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: But don’t their garments become soiled? And we learned garments were soiled and he performed rite his rite is invalid, And if you say that they raised their garments Wasn’t it taught his linen garment [ middo ]” middo according to his measure [ kemiddato ], not too short and not too long? while carrying the limbs to the ramp which is not a rite,
llm_translation: And this, Kamitavus said to them, (and we learned) if his garments were disheveled and he performed - his service is invalid! And if you will say that they were pleasing to him, and it was taught: "from fine linen" - like its measure, that it should not be lacking or in excess! When walking limbs to the liver - it is not considered service.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָא מִדְּבָעֵי כְּהוּנָּה — עֲבוֹדָה הִיא! דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהִקְרִיב הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הַכֹּל הַמִּזְבֵּחָה״, זוֹ הוֹלָכַת אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ! אֶלָּא: בְּהוֹלָכַת עֵצִים לַמַּעֲרָכָה, דְּלָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: And not But from the fact that requires priesthood, it is a rite. As it was taught “And the priest shall bring it all upon the altar; this the carrying of the limbs to the ramp. Rather, while carrying wood to the wood pile which is not a rite.
llm_translation: And not? But this is from the matters of the priesthood - it is service! As it was taught: "And the priest shall offer all of it on the altar," this refers to the carrying of limbs to the ramp! Rather, it is in the carrying of wood to the arrangement, which is not service.

hebrew_text: בְּהוֹלָכַת אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ וּבְהוֹלָכַת דָּם, מִיהָא הֵיכִי אָזְלִי? דִּמְסַגִּי אַאִיצְטְבֵי.
human_translation: how did they walk while carrying the limbs to the ramp and while carrying the blood They would walk on platforms
llm_translation: In the walking of limbs to the liver and in the walking of blood, how do they go? Because they reach the place.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד תּוֹלִין וּמַפְשִׁיטִין וְכוּ׳. קְרָעוֹ, וְהוֹצִיאוּ אֶת אֵמוּרָיו. נְתָנָם בְּמָגֵיס לְהַקְטִירָם. אַטּוּ הוּא גּוּפֵיהּ הֲוָה מַקְטַר לְהוּ? אֵימָא: לְהַקְטִירָן עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: how one would suspend and flay he would tear it remove its sacrificial parts place them in a large basin in order to burn them. Is that to say that he himself, would burn them? say: In order to burn them on the altar,
llm_translation: How do we hang up and take down, etc.? Tear it, and take out its contents. Place them in a shovel to burn them. But wasn't the body itself already being burned? Say: to burn them on the altar.

hebrew_text: יָצְתָה כַּת רִאשׁוֹנָה וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נוֹתֵן פִּסְחוֹ בְּעוֹרוֹ, וּמַפְשִׁיל לַאֲחוֹרָיו. אָמַר רַב עִילִישׁ: טַיָּיעוּת.
human_translation: The first group exited It was taught Each and every one would place his Paschal lamb in its hide and cast behind him Rav Ilish said: Arab merchants [ tayya’ut ].
llm_translation: The text reads: "Yatza kat rishonah v'chu." Tanah: "Kol echad v'echad noten pisko b'oro, u'mafshil la'achorav." Amar Rav Ilish: "Tayyaut."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ תָּמִיד נִשְׁחָט
llm_translation: We will return to you always slaughtered

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים בַּפֶּסַח דּוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת: שְׁחִיטָתוֹ, וּזְרִיקַת דָּמוֹ, וּמִיחוּי קְרָבָיו, וְהַקְטָרַת חֲלָבָיו. אֲבָל צְלִיָּיתוֹ וַהֲדָחַת קְרָבָיו — אֵינָן דּוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. הַרְכָּבָתוֹ, וַהֲבָאָתוֹ מִחוּץ לַתְּחוּם, וַחֲתִיכַת יַבַּלְתּוֹ — אֵין דּוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: דּוֹחִין.
human_translation: These matters Paschal lamb override Shabbat, Its slaughter, the sprinkling of its blood, the cleaning of its intestines and the burning of its fats However, its roasting and the washing of its intestines, do not override Shabbat; Carrying bringing it from outside the Shabbat limit and cutting off its wart do not override Shabbat, Rabbi Eliezer says: override
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the matters concerning the Passover offering that override the Sabbath: its slaughter, the sprinkling of its blood, the removal of its organs, and the burning of its fats. However, its roasting and the invalidation of its organs do not override the Sabbath. Its transportation, bringing it from outside the boundary, and the cutting of its wool do not override the Sabbath. Rabbi Eliezer says: They do override the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: וַהֲלֹא דִּין הוּא: מָה אִם שְׁחִיטָה שֶׁהִיא מִשּׁוּם מְלָאכָה — דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, אֵלּוּ, שֶׁהֵן מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת — לֹא יִדְחוּ אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: יוֹם טוֹב יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁהִתִּירוּ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם מְלָאכָה, וְאָסוּר בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: not an a fortiori inference? If slaughter, which is as a labor, overrides Shabbat these due to rabbinic decree, should they not override Shabbat? Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: a Festival proves permitted on it as labor, and it is forbidden on it due to rabbinic decree.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: Isn't this a logical argument? If slaughtering, which is considered a labor, overrides the Sabbath, then shouldn't these, which are considered a rabbinic prohibition, not override the Sabbath? Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: A festival will prove it, for on it they permitted labor and prohibited rabbinic prohibitions.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מָה זֶה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ?! מָה רְאָיָה רְשׁוּת לְמִצְוָה? הֵשִׁיב רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְאָמַר: הַזָּאָה תּוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁהִיא מִשּׁוּם מִצְוָה, וְהִיא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת, וְאֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. אַף אַתָּה אַל תִּתְמַהּ עַל אֵלּוּ, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהֵן מִשּׁוּם מִצְוָה, וְהֵן מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת, לֹא יִדְחוּ אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: What is this, Yehoshua? What proof optional to a mitzva? Rabbi Akiva responded and said Sprinkling proves for it is for a mitzva, and it is due to rabbinic decree, and it does not override Shabbat, So, too, you should not be surprised about these that although they are for a mitzva and they are due to rabbinic decree, they do not override Shabbat.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer: What is this, Joshua?! What proof is there for permission for a commandment? Rabbi Akiva replied and said: This dish will prove it, that it is both due to a commandment and due to a prohibition, and it does not override the Sabbath. You too, do not wonder about these, that even though they are due to a commandment and due to a prohibition, they do not override the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְעָלֶיהָ אֲנִי דָּן: וּמָה אִם שְׁחִיטָה שֶׁהִיא מִשּׁוּם מְלָאכָה — דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, הַזָּאָה שֶׁהִיא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁדּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת?
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: With regard to this I infer If slaughter, which is labor, overrides Shabbat, is it not right that sprinkling which is due to rabbinic decree, should override Shabbat?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer, and upon it I judge: And what if slaughter which is from the category of work — overrides the Sabbath, the sprinkling which is from the category of rabbinic prohibition — is it not logical that it overrides the Sabbath?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אוֹ חִלּוּף: מָה אִם הַזָּאָה שֶׁהִיא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת — אֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, שְׁחִיטָה שֶׁהִיא מִשּׁוּם מְלָאכָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תִּדְחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת?! אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: עֲקִיבָא, עָקַרְתָּ מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״, בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to Or reverse If, sprinkling which is due to rabbinic decree, does not override Shabbat, slaughter, which is as a labor, is it not right that it should not override Shabbat? Rabbi Eliezer said to him: Akiva, You have uprooted what is written in the Torah: in its appointed time” whether it is a weekday or Shabbat.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva, or perhaps it was Rabbi Eliezer: What if the blood is due to a discharge — it does not override the Sabbath, and if the slaughtering is considered labor — is it not logical that it should not push aside the Sabbath?! Rabbi Eliezer said to him: Akiva, you have uprooted what is written in the Torah: "At its appointed time," whether on a weekday or on the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, הָבֵא לִי מוֹעֵד לְאֵלּוּ, כְּמוֹעֵד לַשְּׁחִיטָה. כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כׇּל מְלָאכָה שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָהּ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — אֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. שְׁחִיטָה, שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָהּ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: said to My teacher, bring me an appointed time for these like the appointed time with respect to slaughter. Rabbi Akiva stated a principle: Any prohibited labor that can be performed on the eve of Shabbat does not override Shabbat; slaughter, which cannot be performed on the eve of Shabbat, overrides Shabbat.
llm_translation: He said to him: Rabbi, bring me a festival for these, like a festival for slaughtering. Rabbi Akiva said in general: Any work that can be done from Friday eve - it does not override the Sabbath. Slaughtering, which cannot be done from Friday eve - it overrides the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הֲלָכָה זוֹ נִתְעַלְּמָה מִבְּנֵי בְתִירָא. פַּעַם אַחַת חָל אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, שָׁכְחוּ וְלֹא יָדְעוּ אִם פֶּסַח דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת אִם לָאו. אָמְרוּ: כְּלוּם יֵשׁ אָדָם שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ אִם פֶּסַח דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת אִם לָאו? אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: אָדָם אֶחָד יֵשׁ שֶׁעָלָה מִבָּבֶל וְהִלֵּל הַבַּבְלִי שְׁמוֹ, שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ שְׁנֵי גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן, וְיוֹדֵעַ אִם פֶּסַח דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת אִם לָאו. שָׁלְחוּ וְקָרְאוּ לוֹ, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: כְּלוּם אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ אִם הַפֶּסַח דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת אִם לָאו? אָמַר לָהֶם: וְכִי פֶּסַח אֶחָד יֵשׁ לָנוּ בַּשָּׁנָה שֶׁדּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת? וַהֲלֹא הַרְבֵּה יוֹתֵר מִמָּאתַיִם פְּסָחִים יֵשׁ לָנוּ בַּשָּׁנָה שֶׁדּוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: The Sages taught occurs This law was forgotten by the sons of Beteira, The fourteenth once occurred on Shabbat, they forgot and did not know whether the Paschal lamb overrides Shabbat or not. They said: Is there any person who knows whether the Paschal lamb overrides Shabbat or not? They said to them: There is a certain man who came up from Babylonia, and Hillel the Babylonian is his name. he served the two eminent of the generation, Shemaya and Avtalyon, and knows whether the Paschal lamb overrides Shabbat or not. sent and called for him. They said to him: Do you know whether the Paschal lamb overrides Shabbat or not? He said to them: Have we one Paschal lamb during the year that overrides Shabbat? Do we not have many more than two hundred Paschal lambs, during the year that override Shabbat?
llm_translation: The sages taught: This halakha has been hidden from the children of the village. Once, on the fourteenth of Nisan falling on Shabbat, they forgot and did not know whether Passover overrides the Shabbat or not. They said: Is there anyone who knows whether Passover overrides the Shabbat or not? They said to them: There is one man who came up from Babylon, and his name is Hillel the Babylonian, who served under the two great leaders of the generation, Shemaiah and Avtalyon, and he knows whether Passover overrides the Shabbat or not. They sent for him and called him, and said to him: Do you know whether Passover overrides the Shabbat or not? He said to them: Do we have only one Passover in the year that overrides the Shabbat? Do we not have many more than two hundred Passovers in the year that override the Shabbat?

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִנַּיִן לְךָ? אָמַר לָהֶם: נֶאֱמַר ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ בַּפֶּסַח, וְנֶאֱמַר ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ בַּתָּמִיד: מָה ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ הָאָמוּר בַּתָּמִיד דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, אַף ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ הָאָמוּר בַּפֶּסַח דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: They said to him: From where do you He said to them: “Its appointed time” is stated with regard to the Paschal lamb and “its appointed time” is stated with regard to the daily offering, Just as “its appointed time,” which is stated with regard to the daily offering, overrides Shabbat, so too “its appointed time,” which is stated with regard to the Paschal lamb, overrides Shabbat.
llm_translation: They said to him: From where do you derive this? He said to them: It is stated "its appointed time" regarding Passover, and it is stated "its appointed time" regarding the daily offering; just as "its appointed time" that is stated regarding the daily offering overrides the Sabbath, so too "its appointed time" that is stated regarding Passover overrides the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא: וּמָה תָּמִיד שֶׁאֵין עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, פֶּסַח שֶׁעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁדּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: And furthermore, it is an a fortiori If the daily offering, is not punishable by karet , overrides Shabbat, is it not right that the Paschal lamb, is punishable by karet , should override Shabbat?
llm_translation: And furthermore, it is a fortiori argument: Just as the daily offering, for which the punishment of karet overrides the Sabbath, and the Passover offering, for which the punishment of karet applies — it is not a judgment that overrides the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: מִיָּד הוֹשִׁיבוּהוּ בָּרֹאשׁ, וּמִינּוּהוּ נָשִׂיא עֲלֵיהֶם, וְהָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ בְּהִלְכוֹת הַפֶּסַח. הִתְחִיל מְקַנְטְרָן בִּדְבָרִים. אָמַר לָהֶן: מִי גָּרַם לָכֶם שֶׁאֶעְלֶה מִבָּבֶל וְאֶהְיֶה נָשִׂיא עֲלֵיכֶם — עַצְלוּת שֶׁהָיְתָה בָּכֶם, שֶׁלֹּא שִׁמַּשְׁתֶּם שְׁנֵי גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר, שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן.
human_translation: they immediately seated him at the head and appointed him Nasi over them, and he expounded the laws of Passover that entire day. he began rebuking them [ mekanteran ] them with words. He said to them: What caused to you, that I should come up from Babylonia and become Nasi over you? the laziness in you you did not serve the two eminent of the generation Shemaya and Avtalyon.
llm_translation: Immediately they seated him at the head, and they appointed him as their leader, and he would expound the entire day in the laws of Passover. He began to rebuke them with words. He said to them: "What caused you to think that I will ascend from Babylon and become your leader? It is the laziness that was in you, for you did not serve the two great leaders of the generation, Shemaiah and Avtalyon."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: רַבִּי, שָׁכַח וְלֹא הֵבִיא סַכִּין מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, מַהוּ? אָמַר לָהֶן: הֲלָכָה זוֹ שָׁמַעְתִּי וְשָׁכַחְתִּי, אֶלָּא הַנַּח לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, אִם אֵין נְבִיאִים הֵן — בְּנֵי נְבִיאִים הֵן.
human_translation: They said to Our teacher, forgot and did not bring a knife on the eve of Shabbat what is He said to them: I heard this halakha but I have forgotten But leave to the Jewish people; if they are not prophets they are the sons of prophets,
llm_translation: They said to him: Rabbi, he forgot and did not bring a knife from before Shabbat, what is the ruling? He said to them: This halakha I heard and forgot, but leave it to the Israelites, if there are no prophets, they are the sons of prophets.

hebrew_text: לְמָחָר, מִי שֶׁפִּסְחוֹ טָלֶה — תּוֹחֲבוֹ בְּצַמְרוֹ, מִי שֶׁפִּסְחוֹ גְּדִי — תּוֹחֲבוֹ בֵּין קַרְנָיו. רָאָה מַעֲשֶׂה וְנִזְכַּר הֲלָכָה, וְאָמַר: כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מִפִּי שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן.
human_translation: The next day, one whose Paschal offering was a lamb stuck it in its wool; one whose Paschal offering was a goat, stuck it between its horns. saw the incident and remembered the halakha and said: This I received from the mouths of Shemaya and Avtalyon,
llm_translation: Tomorrow, one whose Passover sacrifice is a lamb - he shall roast it with its wool, one whose Passover sacrifice is a goat - he shall roast it with its horns. He saw an incident and remembered a halakha, and said: "This is what has been transmitted to me from the mouths of Shemaiah and Avtalyon."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: נֶאֱמַר ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ בַּפֶּסַח, וְנֶאֱמַר ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ בְּתָמִיד, מָה ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ הָאָמוּר בַּתָּמִיד דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, אַף ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ הָאָמוּר בַּפֶּסַח דּוֹחֶה שַׁבָּת. וְתָמִיד גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָלַן דְּדָחֵי שַׁבָּת? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״ — פֶּסַח נָמֵי הָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״!
human_translation: The Master said “Its appointed time” is stated with regard to the Paschal lamb and “its appointed time” is stated with regard to the daily offering. Just as “its appointed time,” which is stated with regard to the daily offering, overrides Shabbat, so too “its appointed time,” which is stated with regard to the Paschal lamb, overrides Shabbat. And from where do we that the daily offering itself overrides Shabbat? If we say because “in its appointed time” is written in its regard, “in its appointed time” is also written with regard to the Paschal lamb.
llm_translation: Master said: It is stated "its appointed time" regarding Passover, and it is stated "its appointed time" regarding the daily offering. Just as "its appointed time" that is said regarding the daily offering overrides the Sabbath, so too "its appointed time" that is said regarding Passover overrides the Sabbath. But how do we know that the daily offering itself overrides the Sabbath? If you say because it is written in it "at its appointed time" - Passover also, for it is written in it "its appointed time"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ לָא מַשְׁמַע לֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ לָא מַשְׁמַע לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא אָמַר קְרָא: ״עוֹלַת שַׁבָּת בְּשַׁבַּתּוֹ עַל עוֹלַת הַתָּמִיד״ — מִכְּלָל [עוֹלָה] דְּתָמִיד קְרֵבָה בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rather, “its appointed time,” does not indicate to Here too, “its appointed time” does not indicate to him Rather, the verse states: “The burnt-offering of Shabbat on its Shabbat, beside the continual burnt-offering it may be inferred that the daily burnt-offering is brought on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rather, "its appointed time" does not imply it. Here too, "its appointed time" does not imply it. Rather, the verse states: "The burnt offering of the Sabbath on its Sabbath, in addition to the continual burnt offering" — from the inclusion of the continual burnt offering, it is brought on the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: וְעוֹד קַל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמָה תָּמִיד שֶׁאֵין עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, פֶּסַח שֶׁעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁדּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְתָמִיד שֶׁכֵּן תָּדִיר וְכָלִיל. קַל וָחוֹמֶר אֲמַר לְהוּ בְּרֵישָׁא וּפַרְכוּהּ, וַהֲדַר אֲמַר לְהוּ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: The Master said And furthermore, it is an a fortiori inference: If the daily offering, is not punishable by karet , overrides Shabbat, is it not right that the Paschal lamb, is punishable by karet , should override Shabbat? there is room to refute What the daily offering That it is frequent, and consumed first told them the a fortiori inference, but they refuted it and then he told them the verbal analogy,
llm_translation: Master said: And furthermore, an a fortiori argument. And just as the regular offering, for which the punishment of excision overrides the Sabbath, the Passover offering, for which the punishment of excision applies - it is not a law that overrides the Sabbath. There is room to refute this: Just as the regular offering is so frequent and constant. He initially stated the a fortiori argument and then retracted it, and then he stated that it is a similar decree.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּגָמַר גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה, קַל וָחוֹמֶר לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא לְדִידְהוּ קָאָמַר לְהוּ: בִּשְׁלָמָא גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לָא גָּמְרִיתוּ, דְּאֵין אָדָם דָּן גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה מֵעַצְמוֹ. אֶלָּא קַל וָחוֹמֶר, דְּאָדָם דָּן מֵעַצְמוֹ, אִיבְּעִי לְכוּ לְמֵידָן! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: קַל וָחוֹמֶר פְּרִיכָא הוּא.
human_translation: But since learned verbal analogy why do I an a fortiori Rather, he said it for them, Granted, you did not learn the verbal analogy one may not expound a verbal analogy on one’s own. But an a fortiori which one can derive on one’s own, you should have derived They said to him: It is a faulty a fortiori
llm_translation: And when he finished the similar decree, why do I need a fortiori argument? Rather, he is saying to them according to their opinion: If you did not finish a similar decree, because a person does not judge a similar decree by himself. But a fortiori argument, because a person judges by himself, let them come and learn! They said to him: A fortiori argument is a refutation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: לְמָחָר מִי שֶׁפִּסְחוֹ טָלֶה — תּוֹחֵב לוֹ בְּצַמְרוֹ, גְּדִי — תּוֹחֵב לוֹ בֵּין קַרְנָיו.
human_translation: The Master said The next day, one whose Paschal offering was a lamb stuck in its wool, goat stuck it between its horns
llm_translation: Master said: "If one's Paschal lamb is lost for tomorrow - he may redeem it with wool, a kid - he may redeem it between its horns."

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא עָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה בְּקָדָשִׁים! כְּהִלֵּל. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל הִלֵּל: מִיָּמָיו לֹא מָעַל אָדָם בְּעוֹלָתוֹ. אֶלָּא מְבִיאָהּ חוּלִּין לָעֲזָרָה וּמַקְדִּישָׁהּ, וְסוֹמֵךְ יָדוֹ עָלֶיהָ וְשׁוֹחֲטָהּ.
human_translation: But he did work with consecrated in accordance with Hillel, as it was taught They said about Hillel no one ever misused his burnt-offering. rather he would bring it unconsecrated to the Temple courtyard and consecrate it, and place his hand on its and slaughter it.
llm_translation: And this one is performing service with consecrated items! Like Hillel. As it was taught: They said about Hillel: From his days, no one ever transgressed with his offering. Rather, he would bring it as common to the Temple courtyard, sanctify it, lean his hand on it, and slaughter it.

hebrew_text: פֶּסַח בְּשַׁבָּת הֵיכִי מָצֵי מַקְדֵּישׁ לֵיהּ, וְהָתְנַן: אֵין מַקְדִּישִׁין וְאֵין מַעֲרִיכִין וְאֵין מַחְרִימִין וְאֵין מַגְבִּיהִין תְּרוּמָה וּמַעַשְׂרוֹת. כׇּל אֵלּוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב אָמְרוּ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר בַּשַּׁבָּת!
human_translation: how could they consecrate the Paschal offerings on Shabbat? Didn’t we learn One may not consecrate take a valuation vow, consecrate or separate terumot and tithes. They stated all of these a Festival, an a fortiori inference on Shabbat
llm_translation: Passover on Shabbat, how can one sanctify it? And we learned: One may not sanctify, evaluate, place under a ban, or separate terumah and tithes. All of these they said on a festival day, how much more so on Shabbat!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּחוֹבוֹת שֶׁאֵין קָבוּעַ לָהֶן זְמַן. אֲבָל בְּחוֹבוֹת שֶׁקָּבוּעַ לָהֶן זְמַן — מַקְדִּישִׁין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַקְדִּישׁ אָדָם אֶת פִּסְחוֹ בְּשַׁבָּת וַחֲגִיגָתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: This applies only to obligatory that do not have a set time But obligatory that have a set time, one may consecrate For Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A person may consecrate his Paschal lamb on Shabbat and his Festival peace-offering on the Festival.
llm_translation: These are matters of debts that have no fixed time. But in debts that have a fixed time - we sanctify. For Rabbi Yochanan said: A person sanctifies his Passover offering on Shabbat and his festival offering on a festival day.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא מְחַמֵּר! מְחַמֵּר כִּלְאַחַר יָד: מְחַמֵּר כִּלְאַחַר יָד נָמֵי נְהִי דְּאִיסּוּרָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לֵיכָּא אִיסּוּרָא מִדְּרַבָּנַן מִיהָא אִיכָּא.
human_translation: But is he not driving a laden animal? driving a laden animal in an unusual manner, Even driving a laden animal in an unusual manner granted that there is no prohibition by Torah law, there is at least a rabbinic prohibition.
llm_translation: And isn't it more stringent! More stringent after the fact: More stringent after the fact, it is as if the prohibition of the Torah is not there, but rather a prohibition of the Rabbis is there.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דְּקָא בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ: דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ הֶיתֵּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה, וּדְבַר שְׁבוּת עוֹמֵד לְפָנָיו, לְעׇקְרוֹ כִּלְאַחַר יָד בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה מַאי? אָמַר לָהֶן: הֲלָכָה זוֹ שָׁמַעְתִּי וְשָׁכַחְתִּי, אֶלָּא הַנִּיחוּ לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, אִם אֵין נְבִיאִים הֵן — בְּנֵי נְבִיאִים הֵן.
human_translation: This is what asked an act that is permitted by Torah law, and a rabbinic decree stands before it what uprooting in an unusual manner, in a situation a mitzva? said to them: I heard this halakha but I have forgotten But leave to the Jewish people if they are not prophets, they are the sons of prophets.
llm_translation: That is, he was seeking to exclude them: a matter that has a permission from the Torah, and a matter that is standing as a doubt before him, to uproot it like after the fact in a place of a commandment, what is it? He said to them: This halakha I have heard and forgotten, but let the children of Israel leave it to them, if there are no prophets — they are the sons of prophets.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַמִּתְיַהֵר, אִם חָכָם הוּא — חׇכְמָתוֹ מִסְתַּלֶּקֶת מִמֶּנּוּ, אִם נָבִיא הוּא — נְבוּאָתוֹ מִסְתַּלֶּקֶת מִמֶּנּוּ. אִם חָכָם הוּא חׇכְמָתוֹ מִסְתַּלֶּקֶת מִמֶּנּוּ — מֵהִלֵּל, דְּאָמַר מָר הִתְחִיל מְקַנְטְרָן בִּדְבָרִים, וְקָאָמַר לְהוּ: הֲלָכָה זוֹ שָׁמַעְתִּי וְשָׁכַחְתִּי. אִם נָבִיא הוּא נְבוּאָתוֹ מִסְתַּלֶּקֶת מִמֶּנּוּ — מִדְּבוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״חָדְלוּ פְרָזוֹן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל חָדֵלּוּ עַד שַׁקַּמְתִּי דְּבוֹרָה שַׁקַּמְתִּי אֵם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״עוּרִי עוּרִי דְּבוֹרָה עוּרִי עוּרִי דַּבְּרִי שִׁיר וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: Anyone who acts haughtily, if he is a scholar, his wisdom departs from him; if he is a prophet, his prophecy departs from him. if he is a scholar, his wisdom departs from him from Hillel, for the Master said began to rebuke them with words. saying to them: I heard this halakha , but I have forgotten if he is a prophet his prophecy departs from him from Deborah, as it is written: “The villagers ceased, they ceased in Israel, until I, Deborah, arose, I arose a mother in Israel” as it is written “Awake, awake, Deborah; awake, awake, utter a song”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Anyone who is haughty, if he is a sage - his wisdom departs from him, if he is a prophet - his prophecy departs from him. If he is a sage and his wisdom departs from him - it is from Hillel, as the Master said: He who begins to be arrogant in matters, and says to them: I have heard this Halakha but I have forgotten it. If he is a prophet and his prophecy departs from him - it is from Deborah, as it is written: "The leaders ceased in Israel, they ceased until I, Deborah, arose; I arose a mother in Israel" (Judges 5:7), and it is written: "Awake, awake, Deborah; awake, awake, utter a song" (Judges 5:12).

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁכּוֹעֵס, אִם חָכָם הוּא — חׇכְמָתוֹ מִסְתַּלֶּקֶת מִמֶּנּוּ, אִם נָבִיא הוּא — נְבוּאָתוֹ מִסְתַּלֶּקֶת מִמֶּנּוּ. אִם חָכָם הוּא חׇכְמָתוֹ מִסְתַּלֶּקֶת מִמֶּנּוּ — מִמֹּשֶׁה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקְצוֹף מֹשֶׁה עַל פְּקוּדֵי הֶחָיִל וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֶלְעָזָר הַכֹּהֵן אֶל אַנְשֵׁי הַצָּבָא הַבָּאִים לַמִּלְחָמָה זֹאת חֻקַּת הַתּוֹרָה אֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳ אֶת מֹשֶׁה וְגוֹ׳״, מִכְּלָל דְּמֹשֶׁה אִיעֲלַם מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: Any person who becomes angry, if he is a scholar, his wisdom departs from him, if he is a prophet, his prophecy departs from him. if he is a scholar his wisdom departs from him from Moses, as it is written: “And Moses became angry with the officers of the host, And it is written “And Elazar the priest said to the men of war who went to the battle: This is the statute of the law, which the Lord commanded Moses” by inference that had become hidden from Moses due to
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Every person who becomes angry, if he is wise - his wisdom departs from him, if he is a prophet - his prophecy departs from him. If he is wise and his wisdom departs from him - it is from Moses, as it is written: "And Moses became angry with the officers of the army, etc." and it is also written: "And Eleazar the priest said to the men of the army who came from the battle, this is the statute of the Torah that the Lord commanded Moses, etc." From the fact that Moses became angry, it can be inferred that he was separated from them.

hebrew_text: אִם נָבִיא הוּא נְבוּאָתוֹ מִסְתַּלֶּקֶת מִמֶּנּוּ — מֵאֱלִישָׁע, דִּכְתִיב: ״לוּלֵי פְּנֵי יְהוֹשָׁפָט מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה אֲנִי נוֹשֵׂא אִם אַבִּיט אֵלֶיךָ וְאִם אֶרְאֶךָּ וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְעַתָּה קְחוּ לִי מְנַגֵּן וְהָיָה כְּנַגֵּן הַמְנַגֵּן וַתְּהִי עָלָיו יַד ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: if he is a prophet, his prophecy departs from him, from Elisha, as it is written “Were it not that I have regard for the presence of Jehoshaphat the king of Judea, I would not look toward you, nor see you” and it is written: “But now bring me a minstrel; and it came to pass when the minstrel played that the hand of the Lord came upon him”
llm_translation: If a prophet he is, his prophecy departs from him - from Elisha, as it is written: "But now bring me a musician." And when the musician played, the hand of the Lord came upon him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מָנִי בַּר פַּטִּישׁ: כׇּל שֶׁכּוֹעֵס, אֲפִילּוּ פּוֹסְקִין עָלָיו גְּדוּלָּה מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם — מוֹרִידִין אוֹתוֹ. מְנָלַן? מֵאֱלִיאָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּחַר אַף אֱלִיאָב בְּדָוִד וַיֹּאמֶר לָמָּה [זֶּה] יָרַדְתָּ וְעַל מִי נָטַשְׁתָּ מְעַט הַצֹּאן הָהֵנָּה בַּמִּדְבָּר אֲנִי יָדַעְתִּי אֶת זְדֹנְךָ וְאֵת רוֹעַ לְבָבֶךָ כִּי לְמַעַן רְאוֹת הַמִּלְחָמָה יָרָדְתָּ״. וְכִי אֲזַל שְׁמוּאֵל לְמִמְשְׁחִינְהוּ, בְּכֻלְּהוּ כְּתִיב: ״לֹא בָּזֶה בָחַר ה׳״, וּבֶאֱלִיאָב כְּתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל שְׁמוּאֵל אַל תַּבֵּיט אֶל מַרְאֵהוּ וְאֶל גְּבֹהַּ קוֹמָתוֹ כִּי מְאַסְתִּיהוּ״, מִכְּלָל דַּהֲוָה רָחֵים לֵיהּ עַד הָאִידָּנָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Mani bar Patish said: Whoever becomes angry, even if greatness has been apportioned to him from heaven, he is lowered From where do we From Eliab, as it is stated: “And Eliab’s anger burned against David and he said: Why did you come down, and with whom have you left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your insolence and the evil of your heart, for you have come down to see the battle” And when Samuel went to anoint him concerning all of it is written: “The Lord has not chosen this one” whereas with regard to Eliab it is written: “And the Lord said to Samuel: Look not at his appearance, nor at the height of his stature, for I have rejected him” by inference that until now He had loved him,
llm_translation: Rabbi Mani bar Patishe said: Anyone who becomes angry, even if they decree greatness upon him from heaven - they bring him down. From where do we derive this? From Eliab, as it is stated: "And Eliab's anger burned against David, and he said, 'Why have you come down? And with whom have you left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your presumptuousness and the evil of your heart, for you have come down to see the battle.'" And when Samuel went to anoint them, it is written regarding all of them: "The Lord has not chosen this one."
