But regarding Eliab it is written: "And the Lord said to Samuel, 'Do not look at his appearance or at his physical stature, because I have refused him.'" From here it is inferred that He had mercy on him until now.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן תָּמִיד וּפֶסַח דְּדָחוּ שַׁבָּת, דְּדָחוּ טוּמְאָה מְנָא לַן? אָמְרִי: כִּי הֵיכִי דְּיָלֵיף פֶּסַח מִתָּמִיד לְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת, הָכִי נָמֵי יָלֵיף תָּמִיד מִפֶּסַח לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: We have found the daily offering and the Paschal lamb override Shabbat. From where do we that they override ritual impurity? They say: Just as Paschal lamb is derived from the daily offering in regard to Shabbat, so too the daily offering is derived from the Paschal lamb in regard to ritual impurity;
llm_translation: We find the continual offering and the Passover offering that override the Sabbath, how do they override impurity for us? They said: Just as the Passover offering is set aside from the continual offering regarding the matter of the Sabbath, so too the continual offering is set aside from the Passover offering regarding the matter of impurity.

hebrew_text: וּפֶסַח גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָא לַן? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״אִישׁ אִישׁ כִּי יִהְיֶה טָמֵא לָנֶפֶשׁ״. אִישׁ נִדְחֶה לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי, וְאֵין צִיבּוּר נִידְחִין לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי, אֶלָּא עָבְדִי בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: And the Paschal lamb itself, from where do we Rabbi Yoḥanan said: For the verse states: Any man who shall be impure by reason of a corpse, a individual deferred to the second Pesaḥ but the community is not deferred to the second Pesaḥ ; rather, they observe in ritual impurity.
llm_translation: And how do we know the Pesach itself? Rabbi Yochanan said: As the verse says, "A man, a man, if he shall be unclean for a soul." A man who is excluded for the first Pesach, and the community is not excluded for the second Pesach, but they perform it in a state of impurity.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵימָא, אִישׁ נִדְחֶה לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי, צִיבּוּר לֵית לְהוּ תַּקַּנְתָּא לָא בְּפֶסַח רִאשׁוֹן וְלָא בְּפֶסַח שֵׁנִי!
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: say individual deferred to the second Pesaḥ , the community has no remedy, neither on the first Pesaḥ nor on the second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish to Rabbi Yochanan: Say, a man who is disqualified for the second Passover, there is no remedy for him, neither for the first Passover nor for the second Passover!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, מֵהָכָא: ״וִישַׁלְּחוּ מִן הַמַּחֲנֶה כׇּל צָרוּעַ וְכׇל זָב וְכֹל טָמֵא לָנָפֶשׁ״, יֵאָמֵר טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים וְאַל יֵאָמֵר זָבִין וּמְצוֹרָעִין, וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: אִם טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים, מִשְׁתַּלְחִין, זָבִין וּמְצוֹרָעִין — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said from here: that they send out from the camp any leper and any zav and anyone impure by reason of a corpse” Let say those who are ritually impure due to a corpse, and not say zavin and lepers, and I would say If those ritually impure due to a corpse, are sent out zavin and lepers all the more so not
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, from here: "And they shall send out of the camp every leper, and everyone with a discharge, and whoever is unclean by contact with the dead." It should be said, those who are impure due to contact with the dead, and it should not be said those with discharges and lepers. But I say, if those impure due to contact with the dead are sent out, how much more so those with discharges and lepers?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא יֵשׁ לְךָ שָׁעָה שֶׁזָּבִין וּמְצוֹרָעִין מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין וְאֵין טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין, וְאֵיזֶה זֶה — פֶּסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Rather, you have a time when zavin and lepers are sent out but those who are ritually impure due to a corpse are not sent out. And what is this a Paschal lamb is brought in impurity,
llm_translation: Rather, you have a situation where those who are menstruating and those afflicted with tzara'at immerse themselves, and those who are impure due to contact with a dead body do not immerse themselves. And which is this? The Paschal lamb that is brought in a state of impurity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, לֵימָא נָמֵי: יֵאָמֵר זָב וּטְמֵאֵי מֵתִים, וְאַל יֵאָמֵר מְצוֹרָע, וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: זָב מִשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, מְצוֹרָע — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן. אֶלָּא: יֵשׁ לְךָ שָׁעָה שֶׁמְּצוֹרָעִין מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין, וְאֵין זָבִין וּטְמֵאֵי מֵתִים מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין, וְאֵיזֶה זֶה — פֶּסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: If so, let us also say should say zav and those ritually impure due to a corpse and not say leper, and I say zav is sent out, a leper, all the more so not Rather, you have a time when lepers are sent out, but zavin and those ritually impure due to a corpse are not sent out. And what is this a Paschal offering is brought in impurity,
llm_translation: Abaye said: If so, let him say explicitly: "A zav and those defiled by corpses may eat the Paschal lamb, but a metzora may not." And I say: A zav is more stringent, a metzora — all the more so. Rather, you have a time when metzora'im are excluded, and zavim and those defiled by corpses are excluded, and which is that? The Paschal lamb that comes in impurity.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָתְנַן: פֶּסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה לֹא יֹאכְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ זָבִים וְזָבוֹת נִדּוֹת וְיוֹלְדוֹת, וְאִם אָכְלוּ — פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: And if you say that it is so didn’t we learn a Paschal lamb is brought in ritual impurity, zavim and zavot , menstruating women and women after childbirth, may not eat from it; but if they ate, they are exempt
llm_translation: And if you will say so, it is as we learned: The Paschal lamb that is brought in a state of impurity, those who are afflicted with a discharge, menstruating women, and women who have given birth shall not eat from it, and if they did eat, they are exempt.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם מִקְּרָא קַמָּא. אִם כֵּן, נִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ כִּי יִהְיֶה טָמֵא״, ״לָנֶפֶשׁ״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Actually, from the first verse If so, the Merciful One should have written: “Any man who shall be impure.” Why do I “by reason of a corpse”?
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Always begin with the first verse. If so, should it not have been written: "A man, when he is unclean," "for the soul," why do I need it?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הַאי ״לָנֶפֶשׁ״ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא: הַטְּמֵא מֵת הוּא דְּנִדְחֶה לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי, אֲבָל שְׁאָר טְמֵאִין לָא. וְהָתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל לֹא יְהוּ עוֹשִׂין פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי אֶלָּא טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים וְשֶׁהָיָה בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה, זָבִין וּמְצוֹרָעִין וּבוֹעֲלֵי נִדּוֹת מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״, ״לָנֶפֶשׁ״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And if you say these “by reason of a corpse” come for this it is one who is ritually impure due to a corpse that is deferred to the second Pesaḥ but the rest of those who are impure are not For wasn’t it taught might only those ritually impure due to a corpse and those on a distant journey observe the second Pesaḥ . From where zavin , lepers and those who had relations with menstruating women Therefore, the verse states: “Any man,” why do I “by reason of a corpse” that the Merciful One writes,
llm_translation: And if you will say, this "for the soul" is why it came: It is the impure from a corpse who is disqualified for the second Passover, but other impure individuals are not. And it was taught: Can it be that only impure individuals from corpses, those who were on a distant road, those with abnormal discharges, lepers, and those who have had relations with a menstruating woman are not to make the second Passover? The verse teaches: "Each man" - "for the soul" - why do I need it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִישׁ נִדְחֶה לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי, וְאֵין צִיבּוּר נִדְחֶה לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי, אֶלָּא עָבְדִי בְּטוּמְאָה. וְכִי עָבְדִי צִיבּוּר בְּטוּמְאָה — בִּטְמֵא מֵת, אֲבָל שְׁאָר טוּמְאוֹת — לָא עָבְדִי.
human_translation: Rather, this is is saying: individual are deferred to the second Pesaḥ , but the community is not deferred to the second Pesaḥ ; rather, they observe in ritual impurity. And when the community observes in impurity, ritually impure due to a corpse, but other impurity, they do not observe
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said: An individual may be disqualified for the second Passover offering, but the community is not disqualified for the second Passover offering; rather, they perform it in a state of impurity. And when does the community perform it in a state of impurity? In the case of impurity from a corpse, but for other types of impurity, they do not perform it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מְצוֹרָע שֶׁנִּכְנַס לְפָנִים מִמְּחִיצָתוֹ פָּטוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּדָד יֵשֵׁב מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה מוֹשָׁבוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A leper, who went in beyond his boundary, is exempt as it is stated: he shall dwell in isolation, his dwelling shall be outside the camp”
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A metzora who enters inside from his partition is exempt, as it is stated: "He shall dwell alone; outside the camp shall his dwelling be."

hebrew_text: ״בָּדָד יֵשֵׁב״ — לְבַדּוֹ יֵשֵׁב. ״מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה מוֹשָׁבוֹ״, הַכָּתוּב נִתְּקוֹ לַעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: “He shall dwell in isolation” he shall dwell alone, “His dwelling shall be outside the camp” the verse has transmuted into a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: "Alone shall he dwell" — he shall dwell alone. "Outside the camp shall be his dwelling," the verse has detached for the positive commandment.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: מְצוֹרָע שֶׁנִּכְנַס לִפְנִים מִמְּחִיצָתוֹ — בְּאַרְבָּעִים. זָבִין וְזָבוֹת שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לִפְנִים מִמְּחִיצָתָן — בְּאַרְבָּעִים. וּטְמֵא מֵת מוּתָּר לִיכָּנֵס לְמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּה.
human_translation: An objection was raised against A leper, who went in beyond his boundary, with forty zavin and zavot , who went in beyond their boundaries, with forty And one who is ritually impure due to a corpse is permitted to enter the Levite camp.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: A leper who entered inside beyond his partition - forty. Menstruating women who entered inside beyond their partition - forty. And one who is impure due to contact with a dead body is permitted to enter the Levitical camp.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא טְמֵא מֵת בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ מֵת עַצְמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף עִמּוֹ״ — ״עִמּוֹ״ בִּמְחִיצָתוֹ!
human_translation: And not only did they say that one who is ritually impure due to a corpse but even a corpse itself as it is stated: “And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him” “with him” within his boundary,
llm_translation: And not impure from a corpse alone they said, but even from a corpse itself, as it is said: "And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him" — "with him" within his partition!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״בָּדָד יֵשֵׁב״ — לְבַדּוֹ יֵשֵׁב, שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ טְמֵאִין אֲחֵרִים יוֹשְׁבִין עִמּוֹ. יָכוֹל יְהוּ זָבִין וּטְמֵאֵי מֵתִים מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין לְמַחֲנֶה אַחַת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְלֹא יְטַמְּאוּ אֶת מַחֲנֵיהֶם״, לִיתֵּן מַחֲנֶה לָזֶה וּמַחֲנֶה לָזֶה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: This is tanna’im , for it was taught “He shall dwell in isolation” he shall dwell alone, that other ritually impure people, should not dwell with him. might zavin and those who are ritually impure due to a corpse are sent to one camp, Therefore, the verse states: and they shall defile not their camps give a camp for this one and a camp for that one; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: "He shall dwell alone" - he shall dwell alone, so that other impure individuals shall not dwell with him. One might have thought that those with a seminal emission and those defiled by contact with a corpse may join together in one camp - therefore the verse states: "And they shall not defile their camps," to establish one camp for this group and one camp for that group, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וִישַׁלְּחוּ מִן הַמַּחֲנֶה כׇּל צָרוּעַ וְכׇל זָב וְכֹל טָמֵא לָנֶפֶשׁ״, יֵאָמֵר טְמֵאֵי מֵת וְאַל יֵאָמֵר טְמֵאֵי זָב, וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין, זָבִין — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן. לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר זָב — לִיתֵּן לוֹ מַחֲנֶה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: It is not necessary surely says: that they send out from the camp any leper and any zav and anyone impure by reason of a corpse” Let say those who are ritually impure due to a corpse, and not say those impure as a zav , and I say If those ritually impure due to a corpse are sent out all the more so not zavin why is a zav stated? To give him a second camp,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: It is not necessary, as he says: "And they shall send out of the camp every leper, and every one having a discharge, and whoever is unclean by reason of a dead body." Let it be said: Those defiled by contact with a corpse, but not those defiled by a discharge. And I say: Those defiled by contact with a corpse are sent out, but those with a discharge—not to the same extent. Why is it said "a discharge"? To give him a second camp.

hebrew_text: וְיֵאָמֵר זָב וְאַל יֵאָמֵר מְצוֹרָע, וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: זָבִין מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין, מְצוֹרָעִין לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר מְצוֹרָע — לִיתֵּן לוֹ מַחֲנֶה שְׁלִישִׁית, כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״בָּדָד יֵשֵׁב״ — הַכָּתוּב נִתְּקוֹ לַעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: Let say zav , and not say a leper, and I say zavin are sent out, all the more so not lepers Why is a leper stated? To give him a third camp When says “He shall dwell alone,” the verse has transmuted into a positive command.
llm_translation: And it shall be said "zav" and not "metzora," and I say: Zavim are discharged, how much more so metzoraim? Why is it said metzora - to give him a third camp, when it says "he shall dwell alone" - the verse was detached for the positive commandment.

hebrew_text: מַאי חוּמְרֵיהּ דְּזָב מִטְּמֵא מֵת? שֶׁכֵּן טוּמְאָה יוֹצְאָה עָלָיו מִגּוּפוֹ. אַדְּרַבָּה: טְמֵא מֵת חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן טָעוּן הַזָּאָה שְׁלִישִׁי וּשְׁבִיעִי.
human_translation: What is the stringency of a zav over one who is ritually impure due to a corpse? That impurity issues out upon him from his body, on the contrary, one who is ritually impure due to a corpse is more severe, as he requires sprinkling third and seventh
llm_translation: What is the stringency of a zab that it renders one impure from contact with a corpse? Because impurity emanates from his body. On the contrary, impurity from a corpse is stringent, as it requires the sprinkling of the third and seventh days.

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא ״טָמֵא״ ״וְכֹל טָמֵא״, לְרַבּוֹת טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ. וְזָב חָמוּר מִטְּמֵא שֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: the verse states “impure” “and anyone impure.” to include one who is ritually impure due to a creeping animal. and a zav is more severe than one who is ritually impure due to a creeping animal.
llm_translation: The verse said "impure" "and all impure," to include the impurity of a creeping thing. And a seminal emission is more severe than the impurity of a creeping thing.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חוּמְרֵיהּ? כְּדַאֲמַרַן. אַדְּרַבָּה: שֶׁרֶץ חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן מְטַמֵּא בְּאוֹנֶס! אָמְרִי:
human_translation: And what is his stringency? As we have said, on the contrary, a creeping animal is severe, for it imparts ritual impurity through an accident. They say
llm_translation: "And what is the stringency of it? As we said, Adrabah: A creeping thing is stringent, for it also renders impure through inadvertent contact! They said:"

hebrew_text: כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא — זָב נָמֵי טַמּוֹיֵי מְטַמֵּי בְּאוֹנֶס כִּדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: רְאִיָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁל זָב מְטַמְּאָה בְּאוֹנֶס.
human_translation: In a case like this, a zav also becomes impure through an accident, in accordance with Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: The first sighting of a zav establishes ritual impurity through an accident.
llm_translation: This case - a Zav who emits semen due to force, as Rav Huna said: The initial sight of a Zav renders impure due to force.

hebrew_text: מַאי חוּמְרֵיהּ דִּמְצוֹרָע מִזָּב? שֶׁכֵּן טָעוּן פְּרִיעָה וּפְרִימָה, וְאָסוּר בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה. אַדְּרַבָּה זָב חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן מְטַמֵּא מִשְׁכָּב וּמוֹשָׁב, וּמְטַמֵּא כְּלִי חֶרֶס בְּהֶיסֵּט.
human_translation: What is the stringency of a leper over a zav ? That is required to let his hair grow and rend his garments and he is prohibited from marital relations, on the contrary, a zav is severe, for imparts ritual impurity to that upon which he lies or sits and he imparts ritual impurity to an earthenware vessel through movement.
llm_translation: What is the severity of a metzora who is a zav? Because he requires both shaving and immersion, and is prohibited in marital relations. On the contrary, a zav is more stringent, as he imparts impurity to sitting and lying down, and imparts impurity to an earthenware vessel through touching.

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא ״זָב״, ״וְכׇל זָב״, לְרַבּוֹת בַּעַל קֶרִי. וּמְצוֹרָע חָמוּר מִבַּעַל קֶרִי.
human_translation: The verse states “ zav ” “and any zav ,” to include a person who experienced a seminal emission, and a leper is more severe than a person who experienced a seminal emission.
llm_translation: The verse said "zav," "and every zav," to include a baal keri. And a metzora is more severe than a baal keri.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חוּמְרֵיהּ — כְּדַאֲמַרַן. אַדְּרַבָּה: בַּעַל קֶרִי חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן מְטַמֵּא בְּמַשֶּׁהוּ!
human_translation: And what is his stringency? As we said, On the contrary, one who experienced a seminal emission is severe, for he becomes ritually impure with any amount.
llm_translation: And what is the stringency of it? - As we said. AdRabba: A Baal Keri is stringent, for he defiles through his own emission!

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי נָתָן. דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: זָב צָרִיךְ כַּחֲתִימַת פִּי הָאַמָּה, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים. וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ לֵיהּ בַּעַל קֶרִי לְזָב.
human_translation: He holds in accordance Rabbi Natan, as it was taught Rabbi Natan says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: a zav needs a blockage of the tip of the organ. But the Rabbis did not agree with him. And one who experienced a seminal emission is compared to a zav
llm_translation: He thought like Rabbi Natan. As it was taught: Rabbi Natan says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: A Zav requires the size of the mouth of the cubit, and the Sages did not agree with him. And the Baal Keri is connected to him for a Zav.

hebrew_text: ״וְכׇל צָרוּעַ״ לְמָה לִי? אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתִיב ״כׇּל זָב״, כְּתִיב נָמֵי ״כׇּל צָרוּעַ״.
human_translation: why do I “and any leper”? it is written “any zav ,” it is also written “any leper,”
llm_translation: "And 'all tzara'at' why do I need it? Since it is written 'all zav', it is also written 'all tzara'at'."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda Rabbi Shimon spoke well
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, beautiful is what Rabbi Shimon said?

hebrew_text: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל דָּחֲקוּ זָבִין וּמְצוֹרָעִין וְנִכְנְסוּ לָעֲזָרָה בְּפֶסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה, יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וִישַׁלְּחוּ מִן הַמַּחֲנֶה כׇּל צָרוּעַ וְכׇל זָב וְכֹל טָמֵא לָנֶפֶשׁ״. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁטְּמֵאֵי מֵתִים מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין — זָבִין וּמְצוֹרָעִין מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין, אֵין טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין — אֵין זָבִין וּמְצוֹרָעִין מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין.
human_translation: He needs that for that which was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: might if zavin and lepers pushed and entered courtyard during a Paschal lamb that is brought in impurity, perhaps they would be liable Therefore the verse states: “That they send out from the camp any leper and any zav and anyone impure by reason of a corpse” at a time when those impure due to a corpse are sent out, zavin and lepers are sent out those impure due to a corpse are not sent out, zavin and lepers are not sent out,
llm_translation: That one asked according to the teaching, Rabbi Eliezer says: It is possible that they pressed in those with discharges, lepers, and those who had entered the Temple courtyard on Passover while impure, it is possible that they are liable. The verse teaches: "And they shall send out of the camp every leper, and every one that has an issue, and whoever is defiled by the dead." When those defiled by the dead are sent out - those with discharges and lepers are sent out; when those defiled by the dead are not sent out - those with discharges and lepers are not sent out.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״זָב״, ״וְכׇל זָב״ — לְרַבּוֹת בַּעַל קֶרִי. מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְחִילּוֹת לֹא נִתְקַדְּשׁוּ, וּבַעַל קֶרִי מִשְׁתַּלֵּחַ חוּץ לִשְׁתֵּי מַחֲנוֹת.
human_translation: The Master said “ zav ” “and any zav ” to include a person who experienced a seminal emission. supports Rabbi Yoḥanan, for Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The tunnels were not sanctified and a person who experienced a seminal emission is sent outside the two camps
llm_translation: Master said: "Zav," "and every Zav" - to include a Baal Keri. This supports Rabbi Yochanan. For Rabbi Yochanan said: "Machilots were not sanctified, and a Baal Keri is sent outside the two camps."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: בַּעַל קֶרִי כְּמַגַּע שֶׁרֶץ, מַאי לָאו לְמַחֲנוֹתָם? לֹא, לְטוּמְאָתָם.
human_translation: raises an objection a person who experienced a seminal emission is like contact with a creeping animal. What, is not their camps, No, their impurity,
llm_translation: Challenger: A Baal Keri is like one who touches a Sheretz, what is the reason that they are not for their encampments? Not for their impurity.

hebrew_text: לְטוּמְאָתָם?! הַאי טוּמְאַת עֶרֶב כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ, וְהַאי טוּמְאַת עֶרֶב כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו, לְמַחֲנוֹתָם!
human_translation: their impurity? Impurity until evening is written about this one, And impurity until evening is written about that one, Rather, is it not their camps,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Regarding their impurity?! This impurity of the evening is written in it, and this impurity of the evening is written in it! Rather, no, for their camps!"

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם לְטוּמְאָתָם, וְהָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דְּבַעַל קֶרִי כְּמַגַּע שֶׁרֶץ: מָה מַגַּע שֶׁרֶץ מְטַמֵּא בְּאוֹנֶס — אַף בַּעַל קֶרִי מְטַמֵּא בְּאוֹנֶס.
human_translation: No, actually their impurity, and it teaches us that a person who experienced seminal emission is the same as contact with a creeping animal Just as contact with a creeping animal imparts ritual impurity through an accident, so too a person who experienced a seminal emission becomes ritually impure through an accident,
llm_translation: Not, forever, to their impurity, and this is what we heard that with a seminal emission it is like the touch of a creeping thing: just as the touch of a creeping thing renders impure by force — so too, a seminal emission renders impure by force.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי:
human_translation: raises an objection:
llm_translation: Challenged (is) raised:

hebrew_text: בּוֹעֵל נִדָּה כִּטְמֵא מֵת. לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לְטוּמְאָתָם, הַאי טוּמְאַת שִׁבְעָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ, וְהַאי טוּמְאַת שִׁבְעָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: one who had relations with a menstruating woman is like one who is ritually impure due to a corpse. With regard to what If we say their impurity, impurity for seven days is written about this one, and impurity for seven days is written about that one,
llm_translation: One who has intercourse with a menstruating woman is like one who has intercourse with a corpse. For what? If you will say for their impurity, this impurity of seven is written in it, and this impurity of seven is written in it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, לְמַחֲנוֹתָם. וּמִדְּסֵיפָא לְמַחֲנוֹתָם הָוֵי — רֵישָׁא נָמֵי לְמַחֲנוֹתָם! מִידֵּי אִירְיָא?! הָא כִּדְאִיתָא וְהָא כִּדְאִיתָא.
human_translation: Rather, is it not their camps, And from the the latter clause their camps, the earlier clause also their camps, Are comparable? This as it is, and that as it is;
llm_translation: Rather, no, for their camps. And from the end for their camps it is — at the beginning it is for their camps! From the city?! This one as it was said and this one as it was said.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מְצוֹרָע חָמוּר מִזָּב, וְזָב חָמוּר מִטְּמֵא מֵת, יָצָא בַּעַל קֶרִי שֶׁטְּמֵא מֵת חָמוּר מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection a leper is more severe than a zav and a zav is more severe than one who is ritually impure a corpse, to the exclusion of a person who experienced a seminal emission, for one who is ritually impure a corpse is more severe than his
llm_translation: Challenger: A Metzora is more stringent than a Zav, and a Zav is more stringent than one who becomes impure through contact with a dead body. A Baal Keri who is impure due to contact with a dead body is more stringent than him.

hebrew_text: מַאי יָצָא? לָאו: יָצָא מִכְּלַל זָב וּבָא לִכְלַל טְמֵא מֵת, דְּהָא טְמֵא מֵת חָמוּר מִמֶּנּוּ — וּמוּתָּר בְּמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּה!
human_translation: What to the exclusion Is not he is excluded from the category of a zav and enters the category of one who is ritually impure a corpse, for one who is ritually impure by a corpse is more severe than his and he is permitted in the Levite camp.
llm_translation: What did he derive? Not: he derived from the category of a zav and entered the category of impure due to contact with a corpse, for impurity due to contact with a corpse is more severe than it — and is permitted in the camp of the Levites!

hebrew_text: לֹא, יָצָא מִמַּחֲנֵה טְמֵא מֵת וְנִכְנַס לְמַחֲנֵה זָב, וְאַף עַל גַּב דִּטְמֵא מֵת חָמוּר מִמֶּנּוּ (דְּמוּתָּר) בְּמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּה — לְמַאי דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ מְדַמֵּינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: No, excluded from the camp of one who is ritually impure a corpse, and he enters the camp of a zav , And although one who is ritually impure a corpse is more severe than his and is permitted in the Levite camp, we compare him to that to which he is similar.
llm_translation: He did not go out from the camp of the impure due to a corpse and enter the camp of the one with a discharge, and even though in the case of impurity due to a corpse it is more severe than him (it is permitted) in the camp of Leviticus — for what reason do we compare him to it?

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: ״וְיָצָא אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ — זוֹ מַחֲנֵה שְׁכִינָה. ״לֹא יָבֹא אֶל תּוֹךְ הַמַּחֲנֶה״ — זוֹ מַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּה. מִכָּאן לְבַעַל קֶרִי שֶׁיֵּצֵא חוּץ לִשְׁתֵּי מַחֲנוֹת.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi: “He shall go outside the camp,” this is the camp of the Divine Presence. “He shall not come within the camp,” this is the Levite camp. From here a person who experienced a seminal emission must go out from two camps.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi: "And he shall go out to the outside of the camp" — this is the camp of the Divine Presence. "He shall not come into the midst of the camp" — this is the camp of the Levites. From here we learn the law regarding a man with a seminal emission that he should go out to the outside of the two camps.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַכַּתִּי לָא עַיֵּילְתֵּיהּ, אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ. לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: אַכַּתִּי לָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ, עַיֵּילְתֵּיהּ. אֶלָּא אֵימָא: ״מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ — זוֹ מַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּה. ״לָא יָבֹא אֶל תּוֹךְ הַמַּחֲנֶה״ — זוֹ מַחֲנֵה שְׁכִינָה.
human_translation: said to You have not yet brought him in you send him out? Another version, You have not yet sent him out you bring him in? Rather, say “Outside the camp,” this is the Levite camp. “He shall not come within the camp,” this is the camp of the Divine Presence.
llm_translation: He said to him: "You did not bring it in, you took it out." Another one said: "You did not take it out, you brought it in." Rather say: "Outside the camp" - this is the camp of Levi. "He shall not come into the midst of the camp" - this is the camp of the Divine Presence.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: אֵימָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי לְמַחֲנֵה שְׁכִינָה, וְלַעֲבוֹר עָלָיו בַּעֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה! אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא: ״וְיָצָא אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה וְלֹא יָבֹא אֶל תּוֹךְ״, ״הַמַּחֲנֶה״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לִיתֵּן לוֹ מַחֲנֶה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Ravina strongly objects to Say this and that to the camp of the Divine Presence, that he violates a positive and a negative If so, let the verse say “He shall go outside the camp, he shall not come within,” Why do I “the camp”? Conclude from this to give him a different camp;
llm_translation: Ravina objects to this: Perhaps both are necessary for the encampment of the Divine Presence, and to transgress upon it with a positive commandment and a negative commandment! If so, let us say a verse: "And he shall go out to the outside of the camp, and he shall not come into the midst of it," why do I need "the camp"? Learn from it that he should be given another camp.

hebrew_text: וּמִיחוּי קְרָבָיו וְכוּ׳. מַאי מִיחוּי קְרָבָיו? רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: שֶׁמְּנַקְּבָן בְּסַכִּין. (רַב) חִיָּיא בַּר רַב אָמַר: שִׁירְקָא דִמְעִיָּיא דְּנָפְקָא אַגַּב דּוּחְקָא דְסַכִּינָא.
human_translation: cleaning the intestines What is cleaning the intestines? Rav Huna said: that he punctures them with a knife Rav Ḥiyya bar Rav said: the secretions of the intestine, which come out through the pressure of the knife
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the piercing of his innards, etc." What is the piercing of his innards? Rav Huna said: that he is pierced with a knife. (Rav) Chiya bar Rav said: the bile of the liver that comes out due to the pressure of the knife.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר): מַאי טַעְמָא דְּחִיָּיא בַּר רַב? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְחׇרְבוֹת מֵחִים גָּרִים יֹאכֵלוּ״, מַאי מַשְׁמַע? כְּדִמְתַרְגֵּם רַב יוֹסֵף ״וְנִכְסֵיהֹן דְּרַשִּׁיעַיָּא צַדִּיקַיָּא יַחְסְנוּן״.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: What is Ḥiyya bar Rav’s reason As it is written: and the ruins of the fat ones [ meḥim ] shall wanderers eat” From where may it be inferred As Rav Yosef translates “And the righteous shall inherit the possessions of the wicked.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: What is the reason that Chiyah the son of Rav is alive? As it is written: "And swords shall pierce through his liver; it is the terror of the mighty men." What does this imply? As Rav Yosef interpreted: "And their treasures of righteousness shall be plundered."

hebrew_text: ״וְרָעוּ כְבָשִׂים כְּדׇבְרָם״, אָמַר מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַב: כַּמְדוּבָּר בָּם. מַאי כַּמְדוּבָּר בָּם? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״וְחׇרְבוֹת מֵחִים גָּרִים יֹאכֵלוּ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא אִי כְּתִיב ״חׇרְבוֹת״ — כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״וְחׇרְבוֹת״, מִילְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי קָאָמַר.
human_translation: “Then shall the lambs feed as in their pasture kedavram ].” Menashya bar Yirmeya said that Rav said: As was said about them kamedubar bam ], what “as was said about them”? Abaye said: “And the ruins of the fat ones shall wanderers eat.” Rava said to him Granted, were it written “the ruins as you said. Now that it is written “and the ruins,” it states something else,
llm_translation: "And they will graze like sheep, their speech," Menashya son of Yirmeya said in the name of Rav: like the matter in them. What is 'like the matter in them'? Abaye said: "And swords will devour, and their livers will be consumed." Rava said to him: Granted, if it were written 'swords' as you said, now that it is written 'and swords,' it is referring to another matter."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כִּדְרַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב: עֲתִידִין צַדִּיקִים שֶׁיְּחַיּוּ אֶת הַמֵּתִים. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְרָעוּ כְבָשִׂים כְּדׇבְרָם״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״יִרְעוּ בָשָׁן וְגִלְעָד כִּימֵי עוֹלָם״.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: in accordance with Rav Ḥananel said that Rav said. For Rav Ḥananel said that Rav said: In the future, the righteous will resurrect the dead. It is written here: “Then shall the lambs feed [ vera’u ] as in their pasture,” and it is written there: let them feed [ yiru ] in Bashan and Gilad as in the days of old”
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: As Rav Hananel said in the name of Rav. For Rav Hananel said in the name of Rav: The righteous will revive the dead. It is written here: "And the sheep will be scattered, each one according to its kind," and it is written there: "They will graze in Bashan and Gilead as in the days of old."

hebrew_text: בָּשָׁן — זֶה אֱלִישָׁע הַבָּא מִן הַבָּשָׁן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיַעְנַי וְשָׁפָט בַּבָּשָׁן״, וּכְתִיב: ״פֹּה אֱלִישָׁע בֶּן שָׁפָט אֲשֶׁר יָצַק מַיִם עַל יְדֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ״. גִּלְעָד — זֶה אֵלִיָּהוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלִיָּהוּ הַתִּשְׁבִּי מִתּוֹשָׁבֵי גִלְעָד וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: “Bashan” is Elisha, who came from the Bashan. As it is stated: and Yanai and Shafat in the Bashan” and it is written: “Here is Elisha ben Shafat who poured water on the hands of Elijah” “Gilad” is Elijah, as it is stated: “And Elijah the Tishbite, who was of the inhabitants of Gilad, said”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Basan - this is Elisha who came from Basan, as it is stated: 'And he shall answer and judge in Basan,' and it is written: 'Here is Elisha the son of Shapat who poured water on the hands of Eliyahu.' Gilead - this is Eliyahu, as it is stated: 'And Eliyahu the Tishbite of the inhabitants of Gilead said.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: עֲתִידִים צַדִּיקִים שֶׁיְּחַיּוּ מֵתִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עוֹד יֵשְׁבוּ זְקֵנִים וּזְקֵנוֹת בִּרְחֹבוֹת יְרוּשָׁלִָים וְאִישׁ מִשְׁעַנְתּוֹ בְּיָדוֹ מֵרֹב יָמִים״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְשַׂמְתָּ מִשְׁעַנְתִּי עַל פְּנֵי הַנָּעַר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said that Rabbi Yonatan said: In the future the righteous will resurrect the dead, as it is stated: “Old men and old women shall yet again dwell in the streets of Jerusalem, and every man with his staff in his hand for very age” And it is written: “And you shall lay my staff on the face of the child”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: Righteous ones are destined to live from the dead, as it is stated: "Yet shall there sit old men and old women in the broad places of Jerusalem, and every man with his staff in his hand for very age," and it is written: "And you shall set my staff upon the face of the lad."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״בִּלַּע הַמָּוֶת לָנֶצַח״, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי הַנַּעַר בֶּן מֵאָה שָׁנָה יָמוּת״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, כָּאן בַּגּוֹיִם. וְגוֹיִם מַאי בָּעוּ הָתָם? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעָמְדוּ זָרִים וְרָעוּ צֹאנְכֶם וּבְנֵי נֵכָר אִכָּרֵיכֶם וְכֹרְמֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: Ulla raised a contradiction it is written: “He will destroy death forever, And it is written: for the youngest shall die a hundred years old” not difficult: Here, Jews, there, gentiles, What are gentiles doing there As it is written: “And strangers shall stand and feed your flocks, and the sons of the alien shall be your plowmen and your vineyard workers”
llm_translation: Ula raised an objection: It is written, "Death has swallowed up forever," and it is also written, "For the youth shall die at the age of a hundred years!" This is not difficult: here in Israel, and there among the nations. And what do the nations need there? As it is written, "And strangers shall stand and feed your flocks, and the sons of the alien shall be your plowmen and your vinedressers."

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״וְחָפְרָה הַלְּבָנָה וּבוֹשָׁה הַחַמָּה״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה אוֹר הַלְּבָנָה כְּאוֹר הַחַמָּה וְאוֹר הַחַמָּה יִהְיֶה שִׁבְעָתַיִם כְּאוֹר שִׁבְעַת הַיָּמִים״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, כָּאן לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised a contradiction it is written: “Then the moon shall be confounded and the sun ashamed, And it is written: “Moreover the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold, as the light of seven days, not difficult: Here, to the World to Come, there, to the days of the Messiah.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda raises a contradiction: It is written, "And the moon will be ashamed, and the sun will be embarrassed," and it is written, "And the light of the moon will be like the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be sevenfold like the light of the seven days." This is not difficult: here refers to the World to Come, and here refers to the days of the Messiah.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר: אֵין בֵּין הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ אֶלָּא שִׁיעְבּוּד מַלְכִיּוֹת בִּלְבַד, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בְּמַחֲנֵה שְׁכִינָה, כָּאן — בְּמַחֲנֵה צַדִּיקִים.
human_translation: And according to Shmuel, who said there is no difference between this world and the days of the Messiah except for subjugation kingdoms, what is there to say This and that to the World to Come, and not difficult: Here, the camp of the Divine Presence; there, the camp of the righteous.
llm_translation: To Samuel who said: There is no difference between this world and the days of the Messiah except for the subjugation of kingdoms alone. What is there to say? Both here and there, in this world and in the world to come, and it is not difficult: here - in the camp of the Divine Presence, here - in the camp of the righteous.

hebrew_text: רָבָא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״אֲנִי אָמִית וַאֲחַיֶּה״, וּכְתִיב: ״מָחַצְתִּי וַאֲנִי אֶרְפָּא״. הַשְׁתָּא אַחוֹיֵי מַחֲיֵי, מְרַפֵּא לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן! אֶלָּא, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מָה שֶׁאֲנִי מֵמִית — אֲנִי מְחַיֶּה, כְּמוֹ שֶׁמָּחַצְתִּי — וַאֲנִי אֶרְפָּא.
human_translation: Rava raised a contradiction It is written: “I put to death and I make live” and it is written: “I wound and I heal.” Now He gives life all the more so not He heal Rather, The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Those whom I put to death I will bring to life, just as whom I wounded I will heal.
llm_translation: Rava raises a contradiction: It is written, "I kill and I make alive," and it is written, "I have wounded and I will heal." Now, if He brings to life, surely He can heal! Rather, the Holy One, blessed be He, said: Just as I cause death, I also bring life; just as I wound, I also heal.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אֲנִי אָמִית וַאֲחַיֶּה״ יָכוֹל מִיתָה בְּאֶחָד וְחַיִּים בְּאֶחָד, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהָעוֹלָם נוֹהֵג, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מָחַצְתִּי וַאֲנִי אֶרְפָּא״, מָה מַכָּה וּרְפוּאָה בְּאֶחָד, אַף מִיתָה וְחַיִּים בְּאֶחָד. מִכָּאן תְּשׁוּבָה לָאוֹמְרִים אֵין תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה. דָּבָר אַחֵר: בַּתְּחִלָּה מַה שֶּׁאֲנִי מֵמִית אֲנִי מְחַיֶּה, וַהֲדַר מַה שֶּׁמָּחַצְתִּי וַאֲנִי אֶרְפָּא.
human_translation: the Sages taught “I put to death and I make live”; might have thought death for one and life, for another in the customary manner of the world. the verse states: “I wound and I heal”; just as the wounding and the healing same so too death and life same From this a refutation to those who say that there is no Torah source for the resurrection of the dead, Alternatively, At first, those whom I put to death I will bring to life, and subsequently, those whom I wounded I will heal,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "I kill and I bring to life." Could death be in one act and life in one act, as the world normally operates? The Talmud teaches: "I strike and I heal." Just as striking and healing are in one act, so too death and life are in one act. From here we learn a refutation to those who say that the resurrection of the dead is not from the Torah. Another explanation: Initially, what I cause to die, I bring to life, and afterwards, what I strike and heal.

hebrew_text: וְהֶקְטֵר חֲלָבָיו וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה חֲבִיבָה מִצְוָה בִּשְׁעָתָהּ, שֶׁהֲרֵי הֶקְטֵר חֲלָבִים וְאֵבָרִים וּפְדָרִים כְּשֵׁרִים כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה, וְאֵין מַמְתִּינִים לָהֶם עַד שֶׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ.
human_translation: burning the fats it was taught Rabbi Shimon said: Come and see how dear is a mitzva in its time. For burning the fats and limbs and inner fats is valid all night we do not wait with them until nightfall;
llm_translation: "And he shall burn its fat and so forth." It was taught in a baraita, Rabbi Shimon says: Come and see how beloved a mitzvah is at its time, for behold, burning the fats, limbs, and organs is valid all night, and we do not delay for them until it becomes dark.

hebrew_text: הַרְכָּבָתוֹ וַהֲבָאָתוֹ וְכוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: חוֹתְכִין יַבֶּלֶת בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא בַּמְּדִינָה. וְאִם בִּכְלִי — כָּאן וְכָאן אָסוּר.
human_translation: carrying bringing it raises a contradiction One may cut off a wart in the Temple but not in the country And if with an instrument, it is forbidden here, and there,
llm_translation: His wagon and his coming and etc. And they asked: One may cut a branch in the Temple, but not in the province. And if in a vessel — here and here it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא, חַד אָמַר: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בַּיָּד; הָא בְּלַחָה, הָא בִּיבֵשָׁה. וְחַד אָמַר: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּלַחָה, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בַּיָּד, הָא בִּכְלִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina, One said: this and that by hand. This a moist That a dry And one said: this and that a moist and not difficult. This by hand, that with an instrument,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina, one said: "Both in the hand; this one in moist, that one in dry." And one said: "Both in moist, and not difficult: this one in the hand, that one in a vessel."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר: הָא בַּיָּד, הָא בִּכְלִי — מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בַּיָּד, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּלַחָה הָא בִּיבֵשָׁה? אָמַר לָךְ: יְבֵשָׁה — מִפְרָךְ פְּרִיכָא.
human_translation: And according to the one who says this by hand and that with an instrument, what is the reason that he did not state this and that by hand, and not difficult; this a moist that a dry he said to you: A dry breaks apart
llm_translation: And for the one who says: "This one is by hand, this one is in a vessel" — what is the reason he did not say: both by hand, and it is not difficult: this one is moist, this one is dry? He said to you: dry — it is a resolution of the contradiction.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בַּיָּד, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּלַחָה, הָא בִּיבֵשָׁה — מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּלַחָה, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בַּיָּד, הָא בִּכְלִי? אָמַר לָךְ: כְּלִי — הָא קָתָנֵי הָתָם: אִם בִּכְלִי, כָּאן וְכָאן אָסוּר.
human_translation: And according to the one who says this and that by hand, and not difficult; this a moist that a dry What is the reason that he did not state this and that a moist and not difficult; this by hand that with an instrument? he said to you: an instrument is taught there If with an instrument, it is forbidden here, and there,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And according to the one who says: 'Both are by hand,' and it is not difficult: this one is with wetness, this one is with dryness — what is the reason he did not say: 'Both are with wetness,' and it is not difficult: this one is by hand, this one is with a vessel? I say to you: with a vessel — there it is taught: if with a vessel, here and there it is prohibited."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? הָא דְּקָתָנֵי כְּלִי הָכָא, פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן.
human_translation: And the other here teaches an instrument it comes to teach us the dispute Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua;
llm_translation: And the other? This that was taught as a vessel here, it is a dispute of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua that came to teach us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וּמָה אִם שְׁחִיטָה וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר שִׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב נָמֵי מִצְוָה הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said if slaughter, Rabbi Yehoshua follows his reasoning, for he said rejoicing on a Festival is also a mitzva,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said, "And what if shechitah, etc." Rabbi Yehoshua according to his reasoning said, "The joy of a festival is indeed a mitzvah."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֵין לוֹ לְאָדָם בְּיוֹם טוֹב אֶלָּא, אוֹ אוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה, אוֹ יוֹשֵׁב וְשׁוֹנֶה. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: חַלְּקֵהוּ, חֶצְיוֹ לַאֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּה, וְחֶצְיוֹ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ.
human_translation: For it was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: A person has nothing but on a Festival; he either eats and drinks or sits and learns Rabbi Yehoshua, says: Divide half of it for eating and drinking and half of it for the study hall,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: A person should have on a festival, either eat and drink, or sit and engage in Torah study. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Divide it, half for eating and drinking, and half for the study hall.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ, כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״עֲצֶרֶת לַה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״, וְכָתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״עֲצֶרֶת תִּהְיֶה לָכֶם״. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ לַה׳, אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ לָכֶם. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: חַלְּקֵהוּ, חֶצְיוֹ לַה׳ וְחֶצְיוֹ לָכֶם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And both of them derived one verse, one verse says: “It shall be an assembly for the Lord your God; and another verse says: “It shall be an assembly for you; Rabbi Eliezer holds either entirely for God or entirely for you. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds Split half of it for God and half of it for you.
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yochanan: And both of them expounded one verse, it is written one says: "A solemn assembly to the Lord your God," and it is written one says: "A solemn assembly shall be for you." Rabbi Eliezer holds: Either all of it for the Lord, or all of it for you. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: Divide it, half for the Lord and half for you.

hebrew_text: (עב״ם סִימָן) אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בַּעֲצֶרֶת דְּבָעֵינַן נָמֵי לָכֶם. מַאי טַעְמָא? יוֹם שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה בּוֹ תּוֹרָה הוּא. אָמַר רַבָּה: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּשַׁבָּת דְּבָעֵינַן נָמֵי לָכֶם. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״וְקָרָאתָ לַשַּׁבָּת עוֹנֶג״. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּפוּרִים דְּבָעֵינַן נָמֵי לָכֶם. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״יְמֵי מִשְׁתֶּה וְשִׂמְחָה״ כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Ayin , beit , mem a mnemonic Rabbi Elazar said: All agree with regard to Atzeret , that we require also “for you,” What is the reason? It is the day on which the Torah was given, Rabba said: All agree with regard to Shabbat that we require also “for you.” What is the reason? “If you proclaim Shabbat a delight, Rav Yosef said: All agree with regard to Purim that we require also “for you.” What is the reason? it is written: days of feasting and gladness”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Eruvin 62a) Rabbi Elazar said: Everyone agrees regarding Shavuot that we require it to be pleasant for you. What is the reason? It is the day on which the Torah was given. Rabbah said: Everyone agrees regarding Shabbat that we require it to be pleasant for you. What is the reason? "And you shall call the Shabbat a delight." Rav Yosef said: Everyone agrees regarding Purim that we require it to be pleasant for you. What is the reason? "Days of feasting and joy" is written in it.

hebrew_text: מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא כּוּלַּהּ שַׁתָּא הֲוָה יָתֵיב בְּתַעֲנִיתָא, לְבַר מֵעֲצַרְתָּא, וּפוּרְיָא, וּמַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְכִיפּוּרֵי. עֲצֶרֶת — יוֹם שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה בּוֹ תּוֹרָה. פּוּרְיָא — ״יְמֵי מִשְׁתֶּה וְשִׂמְחָה״ כְּתִיב. מַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְכִיפּוּרֵי — דְּתָנֵי חִיָּיא בַּר רַב מִדִּפְתִּי: ״וְעִנִּיתֶם אֶת נַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם בְּתִשְׁעָה לַחֹדֶשׁ״, וְכִי בְּתִשְׁעָה (הֵם) מִתְעַנִּין? וַהֲלֹא בַּעֲשִׂירִי מִתְעַנִּין! אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לְךָ: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה בְּתִשְׁעָה בּוֹ — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ מִתְעַנֶּה תְּשִׁיעִי וַעֲשִׂירִי.
human_translation: Mar, son of Ravina, would spend the entire year fasting except for Shavuot , Purim, and the eve of Yom Kippur. Shavuot it is the day on which the Torah was given Purim “days of feasting and gladness” is written the eve of Yom Kippur, as Ḥiyya bar Rav of Difti taught: “And you shall afflict your souls on the ninth day of the month But does one fast on the ninth Doesn’t one fast on the tenth Rather, to tell you: One who eats and drinks on the ninth, the verse ascribes him as if he fasted on the ninth and the tenth
llm_translation: Mar, son of Ravina, the entire year he would sit in fasting, from the eve of Shavuot, and Purim, and the day before Yom Kippur. Shavuot - the day on which the Torah was given. Purim - "days of feasting and joy" it is written. The day before Yom Kippur - as Chiya, son of Rav from Difti taught: "And you shall afflict your souls on the ninth of the month," and are they fasting on the ninth? Is it not on the tenth that they fast? Rather, to tell you: anyone who eats and drinks on the ninth - the Scripture accounts it for him as if he fasted on the ninth and tenth.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף בְּיוֹמָא דַעֲצַרְתָּא אָמַר: עָבְדִי לִי עִגְלָא תִּלְתָּא. אָמַר, אִי לָא הַאי יוֹמָא דְּקָא גָרֵים — כַּמָּה יוֹסֵף אִיכָּא בְּשׁוּקָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef, on the day of Shavuot , say: Prepare me a third-born calf. He said: If not for this day that caused how many Yosefs would there be in the market?
llm_translation: Rav Yosef on the day of Atzeret said: "My calf served me for three years." He said, "If not for this day when converts are gathered, how many Yosefs like me are there in the market."

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת כׇּל תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין מְהַדַּר לֵיהּ תַּלְמוּדֵיהּ, וְתָלֵי וְקָאֵי בְּעִיבְרָא דְּדַשָּׁא, וַאֲמַר: חֲדַאי נַפְשַׁאי, חֲדַאי נַפְשַׁאי, לָךְ קְרַאי לָךְ תְּנַאי. אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אִילְמָלֵא תּוֹרָה לֹא נִתְקַיְּימוּ שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם לֹא בְרִיתִי יוֹמָם וָלָיְלָה חֻקּוֹת שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ לֹא שָׂמְתִּי״! מֵעִיקָּרָא כִּי עָבֵיד אִינִישׁ — אַדַּעְתָּא דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָא עָבֵיד.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet, every thirty days he would review his studies and he would stand and lean against the bolt of the door and say: Rejoice my soul, rejoice my soul, for you I have read for you I have studied Is that so, But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: If not for the Torah heaven and earth would not be sustained, as it is stated: “If not for My covenant by day and by night, I would not have set up the laws of heaven and earth” at the outset when a person does he does it for himself,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet every thirty days reviewed his studies, and would hang and stand in a plastered room, and said: "One for my soul, one for my soul, for you are my calling, for you are my teacher." Is it not so? But didn't Rabbi Elazar say: If not for the Torah, the heavens and the earth would not have been established, as it is said: "If not for My covenant day and night, the laws of heaven and earth I would not have set!" Initially, when a person engages - the knowledge of his soul he is engaging.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: וּלְמַאי דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נָמֵי יוֹם טוֹב רְשׁוּת, אִית לֵיהּ פִּירְכָא: וּמָה יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁהִתִּיר בּוֹ מְלָאכָה שֶׁל רְשׁוּת, לֹא הִתִּיר שְׁבוּת שֶׁעִמָּהּ. שַׁבָּת שֶׁלֹּא הִתִּיר בָּהּ אֶלָּא מְלָאכָה שֶׁל מִצְוָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תַּתִּיר שְׁבוּת שֶׁעִמָּהּ!
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: And even according to what Rabbi Eliezer said, Festival is optional, there is a refutation: If a Festival, when labor, is permitted for an optional a rabbinic decree that is with it is not permitted, Shabbat, when a labor is only permitted for a mitzva, isn’t it right not to permit a rabbinic decree that is with it?
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: And for what purpose did Rabbi Eliezer say that a festival is a permitted domain? He has an answer: And what is the case of a festival that permits work of a permitted domain, yet does not permit a rabbinic prohibition associated with it? A Sabbath that only permits work of a commandment, it is not proper to permit a rabbinic prohibition associated with it!

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, שְׁבוּת דְּמִצְוָה עֲדִיף לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer a rabbinic decree for a mitzva is preferable.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, the sitting of a mitzvah is preferable to him.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: וּמָה לִי אִם דָּחוּ מַכְשִׁירֵי מִצְוָה שֶׁלְּאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, דְּאִיתְעֲבִיד לֵיהּ מִצְוָה — לֹא יִדְחוּ מַכְשִׁירֵי מִצְוָה שֶׁלִּפְנֵי שְׁחִיטָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת!
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Eliezer said: What I If actions that facilitate the mitzva after the slaughter, override Shabbat the mitzva has been done, actions that facilitate the mitzva before the slaughter do not override Shabbat?
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer said, "And what concern is it to me if they push aside the preparations for a mitzvah after slaughtering an animal on Shabbat, since they are engaged in a mitzvah? They should not push aside the preparations for a mitzvah before slaughtering the animal on Shabbat!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: דְּמָה לִי אִם דָּחוּ מַכְשִׁירֵי מִצְוָה שֶׁלְּאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, שֶׁהֲרֵי דָּחֲתָה שְׁחִיטָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, תֹּאמַר יִדְחוּ מַכְשִׁירֵי מִצְוָה שֶׁלִּפְנֵי שְׁחִיטָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת — שֶׁלֹּא דָּחֲתָה שְׁחִיטָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. דָּבָר אַחֵר: שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצֵא זֶבַח פָּסוּל, וְנִמְצָא מְחַלֵּל אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת לְמַפְרֵעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: What I If actions that facilitate the mitzva after the slaughter override Shabbat, because slaughter has overridden Shabbat can you say that actions that facilitate the mitzva before the slaughter should override Shabbat slaughter has not overridden Shabbat? Alternatively, Perhaps the offering will be found to be disqualified and will be found to have violated Shabbat retroactively
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: "It is of no consequence to me if the facilitators of a commandment are pushed aside after the slaughter on Shabbat, for indeed the slaughter has pushed aside Shabbat. You might say that the facilitators of a commandment are pushed aside before the slaughter on Shabbat - that the slaughter has not pushed aside Shabbat. Another explanation: Lest one find a disqualified sacrifice, and it turns out that he desecrates the Shabbat intentionally."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי — מִשְׁחָט נָמֵי לָא נִשְׁחֹט, שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצֵא זֶבַח פָּסוּל, וְנִמְצָא מְחַלֵּל אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת לְמַפְרֵעַ. אֶלָּא: הָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ בְּרֵישָׁא וּפַרְכֵיהּ, וַהֲדַר אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָךְ דְּמָה לִי אִם דָּחוּ.
human_translation: If so, it should also not be slaughtered; perhaps the offering will be found to be invalid and will be found to have violated Shabbat retroactively. Rather, said this to at the beginning and he refuted it and then said to him this What I If override,
llm_translation: So it is — if one slaughters precisely, we do not slaughter, lest an invalid sacrifice be found, and he is found desecrating the Sabbath intentionally. Rather, he should say to him at first and then retract, and then say to him, "What is it to me if they reject?"

hebrew_text: הֵשִׁיב רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְאָמַר: הַזָּאָה תּוֹכִיחַ וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: עֲקִיבָא, בִּשְׁחִיטָה הֱשַׁבְתַּנִי, בִּשְׁחִיטָה תְּהֵא מִיתָתוֹ. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, אַל תַּכְפִּירֵנִי בִּשְׁעַת הַדִּין, כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מִמְּךָ: הַזָּאָה שְׁבוּת הִיא, וְאֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva responded and said sprinkling proves It was taught Rabbi Eliezer said to him Akiva, you have responded to me slaughter. His death will be with slaughter; said to him: My teacher, do not deny my at the time inference, this I received from you: Sprinkling is rabbinic decree and does not override Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva responded and said: "The zavah will prove and so forth." It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer said to him, "Akiva, you have misled me in regard to ritual slaughter, you have misled me in regard to his death through ritual slaughter." He said to him: "Rabbi, do not belittle me at the time of judgment, this is what I have received from you: The zavah is a temporary cessation, and it does not override the Sabbath."

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּהוּא אַגְמְרֵיהּ, מַאי טַעְמָא קָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ? אָמַר עוּלָּא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר כִּי אַגְמְרֵיהּ, הַזָּאָה דִתְרוּמָה אַגְמְרֵיהּ — דִּתְרוּמָה גּוּפַהּ לָא דָּחֲיָא שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Seeing that taught what is the reason he retracted Ulla said: When Rabbi Eliezer taught him he taught him sprinkling teruma . because teruma itself does not override Shabbat.
llm_translation: And when he completed it, what is the reason that he reviewed it? Ulla said: Rabbi Eliezer, when he completed it, he reviewed the portion of Terumah - for Terumah itself does not override Shabbat.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי כִּי אוֹתְבֵיהּ — הַזָּאָה דִּתְרוּמָה אוֹתְבֵיהּ, שֶׁהִיא מִצְוָה וְהִיא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת! וְהוּא סָבַר: הַזָּאָה דְּפֶסַח קָא מוֹתֵיב לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva as well, when he challenged challenged him sprinkling for teruma , is a mitzva, due to a rabbinic decree; And thought was challenging him sprinkling the Paschal lamb;
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: When he slaughters it - the blood of the Terumah he slaughters it, for it is a commandment and it is also a Rabbinic enactment! And he holds: The blood of the Passover offering he applies to it.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבָּה: הֵשִׁיב רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְאָמַר: הַזָּאַת טְמֵא מֵת תּוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁחָל שְׁבִיעִי שֶׁלּוֹ לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת, וּבְעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח שֶׁהִיא מִצְוָה, וְהִיא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת — וְאֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabba raised an objection Rabbi Akiva responded and said: The sprinkling someone who is ritually impure due to a corpse proves his seventh day occurs on Shabbat and the eve of Passover, for it is for a mitzva, and it is due to a rabbinic decree, and it does not override Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabba raises an objection: Rabbi Akiva responded and said: "This woman, who is impure from contact with a corpse, proves her status because the seventh day of her purification falls on a Sabbath, and on the eve of Passover, which is a commandment, and it is considered a Rabbinic prohibition - and it does not override the Sabbath."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, וַודַּאי הַזָּאָה דְפֶסַח אַגְמְרֵיהּ. וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּאַגְמְרֵיהּ, מַאי טַעְמָא קָא פָּרֵיךְ לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר גְּמָרֵיהּ אִיתְעֲקַר לֵיהּ, וַאֲתָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְאַדְכּוֹרֵי גְּמָרֵיהּ. וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ בְּהֶדְיָה! סָבַר, לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא.
human_translation: Rather, certainly taught sprinkling Paschal lamb. seeing that taught him what is the reason that Rabbi Eliezer refutes it, Rabbi Eliezer forgot his teaching and Rabbi Akiva came to remind him of his teaching let say explicitly He thought that it would not be proper
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, and certainly the brightness of Pesach he concluded. And since he concluded, what reason did Rabbi Eliezer ask him? Rabbi Eliezer concluded and he was uprooted, and Rabbi Akiva came to support his conclusion. And let him say it in its place! He thought, it is not the way of the land.

hebrew_text: וְהַזָּאָה מַאי טַעְמָא לָא דָּחֲיָא שַׁבָּת? מִכְּדֵי טַלְטוֹלֵי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, תִּדְּחֵי שַׁבָּת מִשּׁוּם פֶּסַח! אָמַר רַבָּה: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִטְּלֶנָּה וְיַעֲבִירֶנָּה אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: What is the reason that sprinkling does not override Shabbat? Since it mere moving Let it override Shabbat on account of the Paschal lamb. Rabba said: a decree lest one take and carry it four cubits in the public domain,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the blood - what is the reason it does not override the Sabbath? Because it is considered a mere moving object, it overrides the Sabbath due to the Passover! Rabah said: It is a decree lest one carry it and transfer it four cubits in a public domain."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נַיעְבְּרֵיהּ! דְּהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מַכְשִׁירֵי מִצְוָה דּוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת! אָמְרִי: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּגַבְרָא גּוּפֵיהּ חֲזֵי וּרְמֵי חִיּוּבָא עֲלֵיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּגַבְרָא גּוּפֵיהּ לָא חֲזֵי — לָא רְמֵי חִיּוּבָא עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: according to Rabbi Eliezer, let us carry for Rabbi Eliezer said facilitate a mitzva override Shabbat, They say applies when the person himself is fit and the obligation is incumbent upon him. But here where the person himself is not fit the obligation is not incumbent upon him,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Eliezer his colleagues spoke! For Rabbi Eliezer said: The preparations for a commandment override the Sabbath! They said: Those matters where a person himself sees and actively performs the obligation. But here, where a person himself does not see — the obligation does not actively rest upon him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, קָטָן בָּרִיא — מְחַמִּין לוֹ חַמִּין לְהַבְרוֹתוֹ וּלְמוּלוֹ בְּשַׁבָּת, דְּהָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ. קָטָן חוֹלֶה — אֵין מְחַמִּין לוֹ חַמִּין לְהַבְרוֹתוֹ וּלְמוּלוֹ, דְּהָא לָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabba said: According to the statement of Rabbi Eliezer a healthy baby, one may heat water for him to strengthen him to circumcise him on Shabbat, as he is fit a sickly baby, one may not heat water for him to strengthen him to circumcise him, for he is not fit
llm_translation: Rabba said: According to the words of Rabbi Eliezer, a healthy minor - they heat water for him to bathe him and circumcise him on Shabbat, for he will see it. If a minor is sick - they do not heat water for him to bathe him and circumcise him, for he will not see it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְאִי בָּרִיא הוּא לְמָה לֵיהּ חַמִּין לְהַבְרוֹתוֹ? אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הַכֹּל חוֹלִין הֵן אֵצֶל מִילָּה, אֶחָד קָטָן בָּרִיא וְאֶחָד קָטָן חוֹלֶה אֵין מְחַמִּין לוֹ חַמִּין לְהַבְרוֹתוֹ וּלְמוּלוֹ בְּשַׁבָּת, דְּהָא לָא חֲזֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: But if is healthy, why does he hot water to strengthen him? Rather, Rava said: All are sickly with respect to circumcision, both a healthy baby and a sickly baby, one may not heat water for him to strengthen him to circumcise him on Shabbat, as he is not fit
llm_translation: Rava said: And if he is healthy, why give him hot water to drink? Rather, Rava said: All are considered sick in regards to circumcision, whether a healthy infant or a sick infant, we do not give him hot water to drink to heal him or to circumcise him on Shabbat, because it is not apparent.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: עָרֵל שֶׁלֹּא מָל עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וְהָא הָכָא דְּגַבְרָא גּוּפֵיהּ לָא חֲזֵי, וְקָתָנֵי עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, אַלְמָא: רְמֵי חִיּוּבָא עֲלֵיהּ!
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to An uncircumcised who did not circumcise is liable to the punishment of karet the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. But here the person himself is not fit, is teaching that he is punished with karet . Apparently, the obligation is incumbent upon him
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Abaye raised an objection: An uncircumcised person who did not receive the punishment of karet, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. But here, where the man himself does not see, and it teaches the punishment of karet, it is evident: the obligation is imposed upon him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: קָסָבַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: Rabba said Rabbi Eliezer holds one may not slaughter or sprinkle for someone who is ritually impure due to a creeping animal
llm_translation: Rabba said: Rabbi Eliezer holds, one does not slaughter and sprinkle on a ritually impure creeping animal.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל שֶׁאִילּוּ בְּיָחִיד נִדְחֶה, בְּצִיבּוּר עָבְדִי בְּטוּמְאָה. וְכׇל מִילְּתָא דְּאִיתָא בְּצִיבּוּר, אִיתָא בְּיָחִיד. וְכׇל מִילְּתָא דְּלֵיתָא בְּצִיבּוּר, לֵיתָא בְּיָחִיד.
human_translation: And any an individual is deferred they observe in ritual impurity. Anything that applies to the community applies to an individual, and anything that does not apply to the community does not apply to an individual.
llm_translation: "And any sacrifice that is offered in private is disqualified, but in public it is valid even if the offering is impure. And any matter that is found in public is found in private. And any matter that is not found in public is not found in private."

hebrew_text: עֲרֵילוּת, דְּאִי כּוּלֵּיהּ צִיבּוּר עֲרֵלִים נִינְהוּ, אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ: קוּמוּ מְהוּלוּ נַפְשַׁיְיכוּ וַעֲבִידֵי פִּסְחָא. יָחִיד נָמֵי, אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: קוּם מְהוֹל וַעֲבֵיד פִּסְחָא. וְאִי לָא מָהֵיל וְעָבֵיד — עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת.
human_translation: lack of circumcision, if the entire community is uncircumcised we say to them: Arise, and circumcise yourselves, and offer the Paschal lamb, an individual as well, we say to him: Arise, and circumcise yourself, and offer the Paschal lamb; and if he does not circumcise and offer he is liable to the punishment of karet .
llm_translation: Uncircumcision, for if all the congregation are uncircumcised, we say to them: "Arise, circumcise yourselves and perform the Passover." If an individual also, we say to him: "Arise, circumcise and perform the Passover." And if he does not circumcise and perform — the punishment is excision.

hebrew_text: טוּמְאָה, דְּאִי כּוּלֵּיהּ צִיבּוּרָא טְמֵאִין נִינְהוּ — לָא מַדֵּינַן עֲלַיְיהוּ, אֶלָּא עָבְדִי בְּטוּמְאָה, יָחִיד נָמֵי פָּטוּר.
human_translation: impurity, if the whole community is impure we do not sprinkle on them; rather, they offer in ritual impurity. an individual, as well, is exempt
llm_translation: Impure, for if all of them are impure, they are considered impure as a community - we do not impose upon them, rather, servants in impurity, only an individual is exempt.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרָבָא: וַהֲרֵי פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי, דְּלֵיתֵיהּ בְּצִיבּוּר וְאִיתֵיהּ בְּיָחִיד! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּהָא עֲבַד לֵיהּ צִיבּוּרָא בְּרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rava: But the second Pesaḥ , which does not apply to the community and it applies to an individual. said to It is different there, as the community offered on the first
llm_translation: He said to him Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua to Rava: "But here is a second Pesach, which does not have it in public and has it in private!" He said to him: "It is different there because the community did it initially."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת אֶלָּא שֶׁהָיָה טָהוֹר וְשֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה. עָרֵל וּטְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַטְּמֵאִים מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהָאִישׁ״.
human_translation: raises an objection might that only one who was pure and not on a distant journey is punishable by karet uncircumcised or ritually impure from a creeping animal and all the others who are ritually impure from where The verse states: “but the man”
llm_translation: Challenger: Can it be that the punishment of karet should only apply if one was pure and not on a distant path? Uncircumcised, impure, creeping creature, and all other impure individuals, from where? The Torah teaches: "And the man."

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָא מְהַדַּר אַטְּמֵא שֶׁרֶץ, קָסָבַר: אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ, דְּאִי שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ — לְמָה לֵיהּ לְאַהֲדוֹרֵי עֲלֵיהּ, הַיְינוּ טָהוֹר. אַלְמָא: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא חֲזֵי — חִיּוּבָא עֲלֵיהּ, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵיתֵיהּ בְּצִיבּוּר — אִיתֵיהּ בְּיָחִיד.
human_translation: From he searches for one who is ritually impure from a creeping animal, he holds that one may not slaughter or sprinkle for someone who is ritually impure from a creeping animal. For if one may slaughter and sprinkle for someone impure from a creeping animal, why did he search for it? He is pure Apparently although he was not fit the obligation is incumbent upon him And although this does not apply to the community, it does apply to an individual.
llm_translation: From the fact that he beautifies a creeping thing, he holds: one does not slaughter and sprinkle upon a creeping thing, for if one were to slaughter and sprinkle upon a creeping thing — why would he beautify it, that is, it is pure. This implies: even though he does not see — the obligation is upon him, and even though he does not have it in public — he has it in private.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: קָסָבַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ, וְהוּא הַדִּין לִטְמֵא מֵת בִּשְׁבִיעִי שֶׁלּוֹ. הַזָּאָה לְמַאי? לַאֲכִילָה אֲכִילַת פְּסָחִים לָא מְעַכְּבָא!
human_translation: Rather, Rava said Rabbi Eliezer holds that one may slaughter and sprinkle for someone who is ritually impure from a creeping animal, and the same is true with regard to someone who is ritually impure from a corpse on his seventh for what sprinkling for eating eating of the Paschal lamb is not essential
llm_translation: Rava said: Rather, Rabbi Eliezer holds that one may slaughter and sprinkle on a ritually impure creeping animal, and similarly, one may render impure his seventh-day impurity. What is the purpose of this sprinkling? It is not to delay the eating of the Paschal offering!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַבָּא לְרָבָא: אִם כֵּן, נִמְצָא פֶּסַח נִשְׁחָט שֶׁלֹּא לְאוֹכְלָיו. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֶׁלֹּא לְאוֹכְלָיו — לְחוֹלֶה וּלְזָקֵן, דְּלָא חֲזֵי. אֲבָל הַאי — מִיחְזֵא חֲזֵי, תַּקּוֹנֵי הוּא דְּלָא מְתַקַּן.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Abba said to Rava: If so, it turns out that the Paschal lamb is slaughtered for who cannot eat it, said to him: for who cannot eat for a sick or elderly person who is not fit But this fit has not been made ready
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Abba to Rava: If so, it turns out that a Paschal lamb was slaughtered not for its eaters. He said to him: Not for its eaters - for a sick person and an elderly person, who do not see. But this one - he sees, it is a correction that does not correct.

hebrew_text: כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וּתְנַן נָמֵי גַּבֵּי מִילָה כִּי הַאי גַּוְונָא, כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כׇּל מְלָאכָה שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָהּ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — אֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, מִילָה שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָהּ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva stated a principle Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva we also learned similar to this with regard to circumcision: Rabbi Akiva stated a principle: Any prohibited labor that can be performed on the eve of Shabbat does not override Shabbat; circumcision which cannot be performed on the eve of Shabbat, overrides Shabbat. And Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva
llm_translation: General Rabbi Akiva said and so forth. Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rav: The halacha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. And we also learned in regards to circumcision, for this reason, General Rabbi Akiva said: Any work that one can do from Friday evening does not override the Sabbath; circumcision, which one cannot do from Friday evening, does override the Sabbath. And Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav: The halacha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּי פֶסַח: הָתָם (דְּהוּא מַכְשִׁירֵי) מִצְוָה לָא דָּחוּ שַׁבָּת, מִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא נִכְרְתוּ עָלֶיהָ שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה בְּרִיתוֹת. אֲבָל מִילָה, דְּנִכְרְתוּ עָלֶיהָ שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה בְּרִיתוֹת, אֵימָא לִידְחֵי.
human_translation: And necessary for had taught us with regard to the Paschal lamb, there that the facilitators of a mitzva do not override Shabbat because thirteen covenants were not established upon But circumcision, upon which thirteen covenants were established, I would say override
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear regarding Pesach: there (that which is effective) for the mitzvah does not override Shabbat, because the thirteen covenants were not made upon it. But circumcision, for which the thirteen covenants were made upon it, we might say to push aside.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מִילָה: הָתָם הוּא דְּמַכְשִׁירֵי מִצְוָה לָא דָּחוּ שַׁבָּת, דְּלֵיכָּא כָּרֵת, אֲבָל פֶּסַח דְּאִיכָּא כָּרֵת, אֵימָא לִידְחֵי. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught us with regard to circumcision, It is there that the facilitators of a mitzva do not override Shabbat, as there is no karet But the Paschal lamb, where there is karet I would say that should override It is necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear a word: there, it is regarding those that are facilitating a mitzvah, they did not push off Shabbat, as there is no karet, but regarding Pesach, where there is karet, one might say to push it off. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵימָתַי מֵבִיא חֲגִיגָה עִמּוֹ? בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא בָּא בַּחוֹל, בְּטָהֳרָה וּבְמוּעָט. וּבִזְמַן שֶׁהוּא בָּא בְּשַׁבָּת, בִּמְרוּבֶּה וּבְטוּמְאָה — אֵין מְבִיאִין עִמּוֹ חֲגִיגָה.
human_translation: When does one bring a Festival peace-offering with when comes on a weekday in ritual purity and a small When, comes on Shabbat, when a large in ritual impurity, one does not bring a Festival peace-offering with it.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: When does one bring a festive offering with him? When he comes on a weekday, in a state of purity and with a small amount. But when he comes on Shabbat, in a state of impurity and with a large amount - one does not bring a festive offering with him.

hebrew_text: חֲגִיגָה הָיְתָה בָּאָה מִן הַצֹּאן מִן הַבָּקָר, מִן הַכְּבָשִׂים וּמִן הָעִזִּים, מִן הַזְּכָרִים וּמִן הַנְּקֵבוֹת, וְנֶאֱכֶלֶת לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד.
human_translation: Festival peace-offering would come from the flock, from the herd, from sheep or from goats, from males or from females, And is eaten for two days and one night
llm_translation: Festival-offering was coming from the flock, from the herd, from the sheep, and from the goats, from the males and from the females, and it was eaten for two days and one night.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי תַּנָּא דְּקָתָנֵי חֲגִיגָה? תָּנָא הַרְכָּבָתוֹ וַהֲבָאָתוֹ דְּלָא דָּחֵי שַׁבָּת, וְקָתָנֵי נָמֵי חֲגִיגָה דְּלָא דָּחֲיָא שַׁבָּת. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵימָתַי מְבִיאִין עִמּוֹ חֲגִיגָה — בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא בָּא בְּחוֹל, בְּטׇהֳרָה וּבְמוּעָט.
human_translation: What did teach that teach a Festival peace-offering it taught that carrying and bringing it do not override Shabbat, it also taught a Festival peace-offering, that it does not override Shabbat. And this is what is saying: When does one bring a Festival peace-offering with When it comes on a weekday, in ritual purity, and when small.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the teaching of the Mishnah that mentions the festival offering? It was taught: His animal and his produce that do not cause Shabbat to be desecrated. And it was also taught: The festival offering that does not cause Shabbat to be desecrated. And this is what it means: When does one bring the festival offering with him? When he comes on a weekday, in a state of purity, and with only a small amount.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חֲגִיגַת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Learn from this the Festival peace-offering of the fourteenth
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Hear from it, the festival offering of fourteen.

hebrew_text: לָאו חוֹבָה הִיא. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ חוֹבָה הִיא — תֵּיתֵי בְּשַׁבָּת, וְתֵיתֵי בִּמְרוּבֶּה, וְתֵיתֵי בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: is not an obligation, For if it should enter your mind it is an obligation, it should come on Shabbat, and it should come a large and it should come in ritual impurity.
llm_translation: It is not an obligation. For if it enters your mind that it is an obligation - you may place it on Shabbat, and you may place it in a private domain, and you may place it in impurity.

hebrew_text: וּבְמוּעָט מִיהוּ מַאי טַעְמָא אַתְיָא? כִּדְתַנְיָא: חֲגִיגָה הַבָּאָה עִם הַפֶּסַח נֶאֱכֶלֶת תְּחִילָּה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא פֶּסַח נֶאֱכָל עַל הַשָּׂבָע.
human_translation: what is the reason that it nevertheless comes small? as it was taught The Festival peace-offering that comes with the Paschal lamb is eaten first; so that the Paschal lamb will be eaten when satiated.
llm_translation: And in a small amount, what is the reason it comes? As it was taught: The Chagigah that comes with the Pesach is eaten first, so that the Pesach may be eaten when satisfied.

hebrew_text: וְנֶאֱכֶלֶת לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וְכוּ׳. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּבֶן תֵּימָא. דְּתַנְיָא, בֶּן תֵּימָא אוֹמֵר: חֲגִיגָה הַבָּאָה עִם הַפֶּסַח הֲרֵי הִיא כַּפֶּסַח, וְאֵינָהּ נֶאֱכֶלֶת אֶלָּא לְיוֹם וָלַיְלָה. וַחֲגִיגַת חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר — נֶאֱכֶלֶת לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד.
human_translation: is eaten for two days the mishna is not in accordance with ben Teima, for it was taught ben Teima says: The Festival peace-offering that comes with the Paschal lamb is like the Paschal lamb and is eaten for only a day and a night, the Festival peace-offering of the fifteenth, is eaten for two days and one, night.
llm_translation: "And it shall be eaten for two days, etc." Mishnah: that it is not like the opinion of Ben Teima. For it was taught: Ben Teima says: The festival offering that comes with the Passover is like the Passover, and it is eaten only for a day and a night. And the festival offering of the fifteenth — it is eaten for two days and one night."

hebrew_text: וַחֲגִיגַת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹצֵא בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם שִׂמְחָה, וְאֵין יוֹצֵא בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם חֲגִיגָה.
human_translation: And a Festival peace-offering of the fourteenth, he can fulfill with it rejoicing, he cannot fulfill with it Festival peace-offering
llm_translation: Festival of the fourteenth one fulfills with it from joy, and not fulfills with it from festival.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֶן תֵּימָא? כִּדְמַתְנֵי רַב לְחִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ: ״וְלֹא יָלִין לַבֹּקֶר זֶבַח חַג הַפָּסַח״, ״זֶבַח חַג״ — זֶה חֲגִיגָה, ״הַפָּסַח״ — כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״לֹא יָלִין״.
human_translation: What is the reason for ben Teima’s As Rav taught his son Ḥiyya “Neither shall the offering of the feast of the Passover be left to the morning” “The offering of the feast,” this the Festival peace-offering; “the Passover,” as per its plain meaning, And the Merciful One states “It shall not be left
llm_translation: What is the reason for the opinion of Ben Teima? As Rav taught to Ḥiyya his son: "And he shall not leave any of it until the morning, the Passover sacrifice" - "Passover sacrifice" - this refers to the festive offering, "the Passover" - as it is understood, and the Merciful One said: "It shall not remain."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לְבֶן תֵּימָא נֶאֱכֶלֶת צָלִי אוֹ אֵין נֶאֱכֶלֶת צָלִי? כִּי אַקְּשֵׁיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְפֶסַח — לְלִינָה, אֲבָל לְצָלִי — לָא, אוֹ דִילְמָא לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before According to ben Teima, is eaten roasted or is it not eaten roasted? When the Merciful One compares to the Paschal lamb with regard to leaving over but with regard to roasting, no Or perhaps there is no difference;
llm_translation: He asked them: Is the meat of a young goat eaten roasted or not eaten roasted? For the Merciful One made it difficult for Passover - for eating at night, but for roasting - no, or perhaps it is not different?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה כּוּלּוֹ צָלִי. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי בֶּן תֵּימָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
