human_translation: Come hear on this night it is all roasted. And Rav Ḥisda said: This is the statement of ben Teima, Learn from this
llm_translation: Come and hear: this entire night is clear. And Rav Ḥisdah said: this is the statement of Ben Teima. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ לְבֶן תֵּימָא: בָּאָה מִן הַבָּקָר אוֹ אֵינָהּ בָּאָה מִן הַבָּקָר, בָּאָה מִן הַנְּקֵבוֹת אוֹ אֵינָהּ בָּאָה מִן הַנְּקֵבוֹת, בָּאָה בַּת שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים אוֹ אֵינָהּ בָּאָה בַּת שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים?
human_translation: dilemma was raised before According to ben Teima, does come from the herd or does it not come from the herd, Does it come from females or does it not come from females, Does it come a two-year-old or does it not come a two-year-old
llm_translation: The question was asked to the sons of Tama: If it came from the cattle or did not come from the cattle, if it came from the females or did not come from the females, if it came at the age of two years or did not come at the age of two years?

hebrew_text: כִּי אַקְּשֵׁיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְפֶסַח — לְמִידֵּי דַאֲכִילָה, אֲבָל לְכׇל מִילֵּי — לָא, אוֹ דִילְמָא לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: When the Merciful One compares to the Paschal lamb with regard to matters eating but for everything no Or perhaps there is no difference
llm_translation: When the Merciful One is strict for Pesach - for matters of eating, but for all other things - no, or perhaps not.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: חֲגִיגָה הַבָּאָה עִם הַפֶּסַח הֲרֵי הִיא כְּפֶסַח, בָּאָה מִן הַצֹּאן וְאֵינָהּ בָּאָה מִן הַבָּקָר, בָּאָה מִן הַזְּכָרִים וְאֵינָהּ בָּאָה מִן הַנְּקֵבוֹת, בָּאָה בַּת שְׁנָתָהּ וְאֵינָהּ בָּאָה בַּת שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים, וְאֵינָהּ נֶאֱכֶלֶת אֶלָּא לְיוֹם וָלַיְלָה, וְאֵינָהּ נֶאֱכֶלֶת אֶלָּא צָלִי, וְאֵינָהּ נֶאֱכֶלֶת אֶלָּא לִמְנוּיָו.
human_translation: Come hear The Festival peace-offering that comes with the Paschal offering is like the Paschal offering It comes from the flock and does not come from the herd, it comes from males and does not come from females, it comes a year old and does not come two years old, and it is eaten for only a day and a night, and it is eaten only roasted, and it is eaten only by those who registered for it
llm_translation: Come and hear: A festival offering that comes with the Passover offering, behold it is like the Passover offering. It comes from the flock and does not come from the herd, it comes from males and does not come from females, it comes in its first year and does not come in its second year, and it is only eaten for a day and a night, and it is only eaten roasted, and it is only eaten by its designated individuals.

hebrew_text: מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאִית לֵיהּ הַאי סְבָרָא — בֶּן תֵּימָא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כּוּלְּהוּ מִילְּתָא בָּעֵינַן, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Who have you heard adopts this reasoning, ben Teima. Learn from this we require everything, learn from this
llm_translation: One who heard that there is to him this opinion - Ben Teima, hear from it all the matter we need, hear from it.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ לְבֶן תֵּימָא: יֵשׁ בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת עֶצֶם, אוֹ אֵין בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם? אַף עַל גַּב דְּכִי אַקְּשֵׁיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְפֶסַח, אָמַר קְרָא: ״בּוֹ״. ״בּוֹ״ — וְלֹא בַּחֲגִיגָה. אוֹ דִילְמָא, הַאי ״בּוֹ״ — בְּכָשֵׁר וְלֹא בְּפָסוּל הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: dilemma was raised before According to ben Teima, is subject to breaking a bone, or is it not subject to breaking a bone? even though the Merciful One compares to the Paschal lamb, the verse says “in it,” in it, and not in the Festival peace-offering Or perhaps this “in it,” to a fit but not to a disqualified
llm_translation: The son of Tema asked them: Does it contain bone fracture, or does it not contain bone fracture? Even though the Merciful One made it difficult for Pesach, the verse says, "In it." "In it" — and not in the festival offering. Or perhaps, this "in it" — it is in a state of fitness and not in a state of disqualification that it comes.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: סַכִּין שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר — שׁוֹחֵט בָּהּ מִיָּד. בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר — שׁוֹנֶה וּמַטְבִּיל. קוֹפִיץ בֵּין בָּזֶה וּבֵין בָּזֶה — שׁוֹנֶה וּמַטְבִּיל.
human_translation: Come hear a knife was found on the fourteenth one may slaughter with it immediately on the thirteenth he must immerse again a cleaver [ kofitz ], whether on this or on the other he must immerse again.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A knife that is found on the fourteenth day of the month of Nissan - one may slaughter with it immediately. If found on the thirteenth day of the month of Nissan - one may purchase it and immerse it in a mikveh. If it jumps between this day and that day - one may purchase it and immerse it in a mikveh.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, מַאי שְׁנָא סַכִּין דְּמַטְבִּיל — דְּחַזְיָא לְפֶסַח, קוֹפִיץ נָמֵי — הָא חֲזֵי לַחֲגִיגָה.
human_translation: Whose If you say it is the Rabbis, what is different knife that immersed because it is fit for the Paschal lamb? a cleaver also it is fit for the Festival peace-offering.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Who is the authority? If you say the Rabbis, what is the difference between a knife that is immersed - for it is fit for Passover, it jumps as well - behold, it is fit for the festival."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, דְּבֶן תֵּימָא הִיא, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ יֵשׁ בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם.
human_translation: Rather, is it not ben Teima, and learn from this is subject to breaking a bone,
llm_translation: Rather, it is not so, for it is the opinion of Ben Teima, and we learn from it that it contains an element of bone breakage.

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם רַבָּנַן, וּכְגוֹן שֶׁבָּא בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: No, actually the Rabbis, and where comes on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Not, always sages, and for example that came on the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: חָל אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — שׁוֹחֵט בָּהּ מִיָּד, וּבַחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר — שׁוֹחֵט בָּהּ מִיָּד. נִמְצֵאת קוֹפִיץ קְשׁוּרָה לְסַכִּין — הֲרֵי הִיא כַּסַּכִּין. מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא לָאו בְּשַׁבָּת עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: But from the fact that the latter clause teaches if the fourteenth occurred on Shabbat he may slaughter with immediately, on the fifteenth, he may slaughter with it immediately, if a cleaver was found tied to knife, it is like the knife, by inference that the first clause we are not dealing with Shabbat.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection from the latter clause: If one has fourteen hairs on Shabbat - he may slaughter with it immediately, and with fifteen - he may slaughter with it immediately. If a folded-over membrane is found attached to the knife - it is considered like the knife. From the general principle of the first clause, we are not dealing with Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא שֶׁבָּא
human_translation: Rather, came
llm_translation: And rather that he came.

hebrew_text: בִּמְרוּבֶּה. מְנָא יָדְעִי?
human_translation: large How do know
llm_translation: In the majority. From where do we know?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא שֶׁבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה. סוֹף סוֹף, מְנָא יָדְעִי?
human_translation: Rather, that came in ritual impurity, Ultimately, how do know
llm_translation: And rather that he came with impurity. Ultimately, how do I know?

hebrew_text: דְּמִית נָשִׂיא. דְּמִית נָשִׂיא אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא דְּמִית בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר — סַכִּין לְמָה לִי דְּמַטְבְּלֵיהּ? וְאֶלָּא דְּמִית בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר. מַאי שְׁנָא סַכִּין דְּמַטְבֵּיל, וּמַאי שְׁנָא קוֹפִיץ דְּלָא מַטְבֵּיל לֵהּ?
human_translation: where the Nasi died, When did the Nasi die? If you say that he died on the thirteenth why do I to immerse the knife Rather, he died on the fourteenth what is different the knife he immerses and what is different the cleaver he does not immerse it?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Demit nasi. Demit nasi eimat? Ileima d'mit bishlosha asar - sakin l'mah li d'matbelih? V'ella d'mit b'arba'a asar. Mai sh'na sakin d'matbeil, u'mai sh'na kofitz d'la matbeil leh?" English translation: "He is like a prince. When is he like a prince? If you say when he is thirteen - why do I need a knife to immerse it? Rather, when he is fourteen. What is the difference between a knife that requires immersion, and a spoon that does not require immersion?"

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּנָשִׂיא גּוֹסֵס בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר. סַכִּין, דְּחַד סְפֵיקָא — מַטְבֵּיל לֵהּ. קוֹפִיץ, דִּתְרֵי סְפֵיקֵי — לָא מַטְבֵּיל לֵהּ.
human_translation: It was necessary only the Nasi was in a dying state on the thirteenth. a knife, one doubt, he immerses it, a cleaver, two doubts, he does not immerse it.
llm_translation: Not necessary, for a prince is exempt with thirteen. A knife, with one doubt - one immerses it. A spoon, with two doubts - one does not immerse it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, יְהוּדָה בֶּן דּוֹרְתַאי פֵּירַשׁ הוּא וְדוֹרְתַאי בְּנוֹ, וְהָלַךְ וְיָשַׁב לוֹ בַּדָּרוֹם. אָמַר: אִם יָבוֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וְיֹאמַר לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא חֲגַגְתֶּם חֲגִיגָה בַּשַּׁבָּת, מָה הֵן אוֹמְרִים לוֹ? תְּמֵהַנִי עַל שְׁנֵי גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן שֶׁהֵן חֲכָמִים גְּדוֹלִים וְדַרְשָׁנִין גְּדוֹלִים, וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל חֲגִיגָה דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: It was taught Yehuda ben Dortai separated he and Dortai his son, and went and settled in the south He said: If Elijah will come and say to the Jewish people: For what did you not sacrifice the Festival peace-offering on Shabbat, what they say to him? I am astounded at the two eminent of the generation, Shemaya and Avtalyon, who are great sages and great expositors and they did not tell the Jewish people the Festival peace-offering overrides Shabbat.
llm_translation: It was taught: Yehudah ben Doratai explained, he and his son Doratai, and he went and settled in the south. He said: If Elijah should come and say to the people of Israel, "Why did you not celebrate a festival on Shabbat?" what would they respond to him? They would silence him with the words of the two great sages, Shemaiah and Avtalyon, who were great sages and great expounders, and did not say to the people of Israel that a festival overrides Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֶן דּוֹרְתַאי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְזָבַחְתָּ פֶּסַח לַה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ צֹאן וּבָקָר״, וַהֲלֹא אֵין פֶּסַח אֶלָּא מִן הַכְּבָשִׂים וּמִן הָעִזִּים! אֶלָּא: ״צֹאן״ — זֶה פֶּסַח, ״בָּקָר״ — זוֹ חֲגִיגָה, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״וְזָבַחְתָּ פֶּסַח״!
human_translation: Rav said: What is ben Dortai’s reason? As it is written: “And you shall slaughter the Paschal offering to the Lord your God from the flock and from the herd, Doesn’t the Paschal offering from only the sheep and from the goats, Rather, “Flock”; this the Paschal offering. “Herd”; this the Festival peace-offering And the Merciful One says: “And you shall slaughter the Paschal offering,”
llm_translation: Rav said: What is the reason for the statement of Ben Durtai? As it is written: "And you shall sacrifice the Passover offering to the Lord your God, sheep and cattle." But is not the Passover offering only from lambs and goats! Rather, "sheep" - this is the Passover offering, "cattle" - this is the festival offering. And the Merciful One said: "And you shall sacrifice the Passover offering!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: וַאֲנַן טַעְמָא דִּפְרוּשִׁים נֵיקוּ וְנִפְרוֹשׁ? אֶלָּא קְרָא לְכִדְרַב נַחְמָן הוּא דַּאֲתָא, דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: מִנַּיִין לְמוֹתַר הַפֶּסַח שֶׁקָּרֵב שְׁלָמִים —
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Need we arise and explain the reason of those who separated Rather, the verse comes Rav Naḥman, for Rav Naḥman said that Rabba bar Avuh said: From where a leftover Paschal offering is sacrificed as a peace-offering?
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: And we, what is the reason that we should be meticulous and explain? Rather, it is in accordance with Rav Nachman who came, for Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: From where do we derive that the Paschal lamb that is brought with peace offerings is permitted —

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְזָבַחְתָּ פֶּסַח לַה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ צֹאן וּבָקָר״. וְכִי פֶּסַח מִן הַבָּקָר בָּא? וַהֲלֹא אֵין פֶּסַח בָּא אֶלָּא מִן הַכְּבָשִׂים וּמִן הָעִזִּים! אֶלָּא מוֹתַר הַפֶּסַח יְהֵא לְדָבָר הַבָּא מִן הַצֹּאן וּמִן הַבָּקָר.
human_translation: As it is stated: “And you shall slaughter the Paschal offering to the Lord your God from the flock and from the herd.” Does the Paschal offering come from the herd? Doesn’t it come from only the sheep and from the goats? Rather, a leftover Paschal offering shall be as something that comes from the flock and from the herd,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And you shall sacrifice the Passover offering to the Lord your God, sheep and cattle." And is the Passover offering brought from cattle? But isn't the Passover offering brought only from sheep and goats! Rather, the Passover offering should be permitted for something that comes from sheep and cattle.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא דָּחֵי שַׁבָּת? הָא וַדַּאי קׇרְבַּן צִיבּוּר הוּא!
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what is the reason does not override Shabbat? It is certainly a communal offering,
llm_translation: The Sages, what is the reason that they do not push aside the Sabbath? This is certainly a communal offering!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן סָפְרָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְחַגֹּתֶם אֹתוֹ חַג לַה׳ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים בַּשָּׁנָה״. שִׁבְעָה? שְׁמוֹנָה הֲווֹ! אֶלָּא מִכָּאן לַחֲגִיגָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Safra: The verse said “And you shall celebrate it as a Festival for the Lord, seven days in the year; seven They are eight Rather, from here that the Festival peace-offering ḥagiga does not override Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ilai said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Sappara, a verse states: "And you shall celebrate it as a festival to the Lord for seven days in the year." Seven? They are actually eight! Rather, from here we learn about a festival that does not override the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר: אָמַרְתִּי לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹתַי: פְּעָמִים שֶׁאִי אַתָּה מוֹצֵא אֶלָּא שִׁשָּׁה, כְּגוֹן שֶׁחָל יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג בַּשַּׁבָּת! אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָבִין תַּכָּלָא לֵימָא כִּי הָא מִילְּתָא? שְׁמֹנָה לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּלָל, שִׁבְעָה אִיתָא בְּרוֹב שָׁנִים.
human_translation: When Ravin came he said: I said before my teachers, There are times when you find only six for example, when the first day of the Festival occurs on Shabbat, Abaye said: Would the bereaved Avin, say such a thing Eight you do not find at all; seven are found in most years.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, he said: I said before my teachers: Sometimes you only find six, such as when a festival falls on Shabbat! Abaye said: Understand the conclusion to be when is this matter? Eight are not forgotten altogether, seven are found in most years.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁלָמִים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לֹא מִשּׁוּם שִׂמְחָה וְלֹא מִשּׁוּם חֲגִיגָה. מִשּׁוּם שִׂמְחָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְזָבַחְתָּ ... וְשָׂמַחְתָּ״ — בָּעֵינַן זְבִיחָה
human_translation: Ulla said that Rabbi Elazar said: peace-offerings that one slaughtered on the eve of the Festival, one fulfills with them neither rejoicing nor Festival peace-offering. rejoicing as it is written: “And you shall slaughter and you shall rejoice we require slaughter
llm_translation: Ula said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: Peace offerings that are slaughtered from the eve of a festival, one does not fulfill with them either the obligation of rejoicing or the obligation of a festive meal. Not for the obligation of rejoicing, as it is written: "And you shall sacrifice... and you shall rejoice" — we require the act of sacrifice.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעַת שִׂמְחָה, וְלֵיכָּא. מִשּׁוּם חֲגִיגָה: הָוֵי דָּבָר שֶׁבְּחוֹבָה, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּחוֹבָה אֵינוֹ בָּא אֶלָּא מִן הַחוּלִּין.
human_translation: at the time of rejoicing, and it is not. Festival peace-offering it is something that is an obligation, anything that is an obligation must come only from that which is unconsecrated,
llm_translation: In a time of joy, and there is no obligation. Because of the festival offering: Be something that is obligatory, and everything that is obligatory only comes from the non-sacred items.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: ״וְהָיִיתָ אַךְ שָׂמֵחַ״ — לְרַבּוֹת לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן לְשִׂמְחָה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַךְ (שָׂמֵחַ)״ — חָלַק.
human_translation: Let us say that supports him. “And you shall be but joyous” to include the last night of the Festival. rejoicing Do you say the last night of the Festival? Or it only the first night of the Festival. the verse states: but joyous”; restricts
llm_translation: Let us say it supports him: "And you shall be only joyful" — to include the nights of the last festive day for joy. You say the nights of the last festive day, or is it only the nights of the first festive day? The Scripture teaches to say: "only (joyful)" — it is divided.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין לוֹ בַּמֶּה יִשְׂמַח!
human_translation: What is the reason Is it not because he has nothing with which to rejoice?
llm_translation: What is the reason? Not because he has nothing in which to rejoice!

hebrew_text: לָא, כִּדְתָנֵי טַעְמָא: מָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן וּלְהוֹצִיא לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ שִׂמְחָה לְפָנָיו, וּמוֹצִיא אֲנִי לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁאֵין שִׂמְחָה לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: No, for the reason taught What did you see to include the last night of the Festival and to exclude the first night of the Festival, I include the last night of the Festival for there is rejoicing preceding it, and I exclude the first night of the Festival, for there is no rejoicing preceding it.
llm_translation: Not so, as it was taught in a Baraita: What do you see to include the nights of the second day of a festival and to exclude the nights of the first day of a festival? I include the nights of the second day of a festival because there is joy before it, and I exclude the nights of the first day of a festival because there is no joy before it.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף: חֲגִיגַת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹצֵא בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם שִׂמְחָה, וְאֵין יוֹצֵא בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם חֲגִיגָה. אַמַּאי? הָא בָּעֵינַן זְבִיחָה בִּשְׁעַת שִׂמְחָה, וְלֵיכָּא! אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: שֶׁעִיכֵּב וּשְׁחָטָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection the Festival peace-offering of the fourteenth one fulfills with it rejoicing, but one does not fulfill with it Festival peace-offering. why? we require slaughter at a time of rejoicing, and is not Rav Idi bar Avin said where he delayed and slaughtered it
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Yosef raised a contradiction: The Chagigah of the fourteenth of Nisan, one fulfills the obligation with it due to joy, but one does not fulfill the obligation with it as a Chagigah. Why? Because we require slaughtering at the time of joy, and it is not possible! Rav Idi bar Avin said: Roast it and slaughter it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, הָא מַתְנִיתָא מַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ? בֶּן תֵּימָא — בֶּן תֵּימָא הָא פָּסְלָה לַהּ בְּלִינָה! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: So too, it is reasonable for if you do not say so, who taught this baraita ? ben Teima ben Teima, he has disqualified it by leaving it overnight, Learn from this
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: So it appears fitting, for if you do not say so, then who is the Mishnah teaching? Ben Teima — Ben Teima, she disqualified it at night! Learn from it.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: הַהַלֵּל וְהַשִּׂמְחָה שְׁמֹנָה. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ בָּעֵינַן זְבִיחָה בִּשְׁעַת שִׂמְחָה, הָא זִמְנִין סַגִּיאִין דְּלָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ אֶלָּא שִׁבְעָה, כְּגוֹן שֶׁחָל יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: מְשַׂמְּחוֹ בִּשְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection the hallel and rejoicing eight if you say we require slaughter at a time of rejoicing, many times you find only seven such as when the first day of the Festival occurs on Shabbat, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehuda, said: One rejoices with the male goats of the Festivals.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "Hillel and Simchah are eight." And if you say we require a sacrifice during a time of joy, there are many occasions where one does not forget except for seven, such as when a festival falls on Shabbat! Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehudah, said: "He should rejoice with the festival offerings."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, שְׁתֵּי תְּשׁוּבוֹת בַּדָּבָר: חֲדָא, דִּשְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים חַי נֶאֱכָלִין צָלִי אֵין נֶאֱכָלִין, וְשִׂמְחָה בְּחַי לֵיכָּא. וְעוֹד, כֹּהֲנִים אוֹכְלִין וְיִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמֶּה שְׂמֵחִים? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מְשַׂמְּחוֹ בִּכְסוּת נְקִיָּה וְיַיִן יָשָׁן.
human_translation: Rava said: There are two responses to this. One that the male goats of the Festivals are eaten raw are not eaten roasted. and there is no rejoicing with raw And furthermore, the priests eat With what do Israelites rejoice? Rather, Rav Pappa said: one rejoices with clean clothes and old wine.
llm_translation: Rava said, there are two opinions on the matter: one, that the fats of the festival offerings are eaten when raw but not when roasted, and joy is not applicable to live animals. And furthermore, the priests eat and the Israelites rejoice with what? Rather, Rav Papa said: They rejoice with clean garments and aged wine.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁלָמִים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם שִׂמְחָה וְאֵין יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם חֲגִיגָה. יוֹצֵא מִשּׁוּם שִׂמְחָה — לָא בָּעֵינַן זְבִיחָה בִּשְׁעַת שִׂמְחָה. וְלָא מִשּׁוּם חֲגִיגָה — הָוֵי דָּבָר שֶׁבְּחוֹבָה, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּחוֹבָה אֵינוֹ בָּא אֶלָּא מִן הַחוּלִּין.
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Elazar said: peace-offerings that one slaughtered on the eve of the Festival, one fulfills with them rejoicing, but one does not fulfill with them Festival peace-offering. One fulfills rejoicing, we do not require slaughter at the time of rejoicing But one does not Festival peace-offering, something that is an obligation, and anything that is an obligation must come only from unconsecrated
llm_translation: When Rabbin came, Rabbi Elazar said: "Peace offerings that are slaughtered from the eve of a festival, one fulfills with them the obligation of rejoicing, but one does not fulfill with them the obligation of a festival offering. One fulfills the obligation of rejoicing - we do not require the slaughtering at the time of rejoicing. And not for the obligation of a festival offering - it is a matter of obligation, and anything that is a matter of obligation only comes from unconsecrated funds."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וְהָיִיתָ אַךְ שָׂמֵחַ״ — לְרַבּוֹת לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן לְשִׂמְחָה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר לְרַבּוֹת לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְרַבּוֹת לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אַךְ״ — חָלַק.
human_translation: raises an objection “And you shall be but joyous” to include the last night of the Festival rejoicing. Do you say to include the last night Or it to include only the first night of the Festival? the verse states: but “but” restricts
llm_translation: Challenger: "And you shall be only joyful" - to include the last day of a festival for joy. You say to include the last day of a festival for joy, or is it only to include the first day of a festival for joy? The Torah teaches "only" - it divides.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין לוֹ בַּמֶּה יִשְׂמַח! לֹא, כִּדְתַנְיָא: מָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן וּלְהוֹצִיא לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ שִׂמְחָה לְפָנָיו, וּמוֹצִיא אֲנִי לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁאֵין שִׂמְחָה לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: What is the reason Is it not because he has nothing with which to rejoice, No, as it was taught What did you see to include the last night of the Festival and to exclude the first night of the Festival? I include the last night of the Festival, for there is rejoicing preceding it, and I exclude the first night of the Festival, for there is no rejoicing preceding it.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Not because he has nothing to rejoice with! No, as it was taught: What did you see to include the nights of the last day of a festival and to exclude the nights of the first day of a festival? I include the nights of the last day of a festival because there is joy before him, and I exclude the nights of the first day of a festival because there is no joy before him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מִנַּיִן לְאֵימוּרֵי חֲגִיגַת חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר שֶׁנִּפְסָלִין בְּלִינָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יָלִין חֵלֶב חַגִּי עַד בֹּקֶר״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ ״רֵאשִׁית״ לְמֵימְרָא דְּהַאי בֹּקֶר — בֹּקֶר רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: From where the sacrificial parts of the Festival peace-offering of the fifteenth are disqualified when left overnight As it is stated: neither shall the fat of my Festival offering be left over until morning” and, juxtaposed with it first, to say that the morning first morning
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: From where do we derive the statement regarding the festival offering of the fifteenth of Nisan that become disqualified at night? As it is stated: "And the fat of the festival offering shall not remain until morning," and juxtaposed to it is the word "first" to indicate that the morning referred to is the first morning.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב ״רֵאשִׁית״, הָא לָא כְּתַב ״רֵאשִׁית״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מַאי בֹּקֶר — בֹּקֶר שֵׁנִי. מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּבָשָׂר אִיפְּסִיל לֵיהּ מֵאוּרְתָּא, וְאֵמוּרִין עַד צַפְרָא?
human_translation: Rav Yosef strongly objects to this The reason is that it wrote first. But had it not written first, I would have said: What is morning? The second morning Is there anything where the meat is disqualified from the evening, while the sacrificial parts until the morning?
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to this: The reason it is written "beginning" is to teach that if it had not written "beginning," I would have said, what is "morning"? - the second morning. Is there anything that can disqualify it from the light of day, and it is said until the dawn?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַלְּמָה לָא? וַהֲרֵי פֶּסַח לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, דְּבָשָׂר אִיפְּסִיל לֵיהּ מֵחֲצוֹת, וְאֵמוּרִין עַד צַפְרָא!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Why not? For the Paschal offering according to Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, that the meat is disqualified from midnight while the sacrificial parts until morning.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Why not? But behold, the Passover offering for Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah, for whom if the meat was not roasted by midnight, it is disqualified, and it is said until dawn!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, רַב יוֹסֵף הָכִי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּאִלּוּ תַּנָּא לְבָשָׂר לָא בָּעֵי ״רֵאשִׁית״, וְרַב כָּהֲנָא לְאֵימוּרִין בָּעֵי ״רֵאשִׁית״?
human_translation: Rava said: This is what was difficult to Rav Yosef: Is there anything that the tanna does not need “first” with regard to the meat whereas Rav Kahana requires “first” with regard to the sacrificial portions
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Yosef thus raises a difficulty to him: From where is it derived that if one tithed for produce, he does not require "reshit," and Rav Kahana for statements requires "reshit"?

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״לֹא יָלִין מִן הַבָּשָׂר אֲשֶׁר תִּזְבַּח בָּעֶרֶב בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן לַבֹּקֶר״,
human_translation: What is As it was taught “Nor shall any of the meat that you sacrifice on the first day at evening remain overnight until the morning”
llm_translation: "What is it?" As it was taught: "It shall not remain overnight from the flesh that you sacrifice in the evening on the first day until morning."

hebrew_text: לִימֵּד עַל חֲגִיגַת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שֶׁנֶּאֱכֶלֶת לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד. אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְיוֹם וָלַיְלָה? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״בְּיוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן לַבֹּקֶר״ — הֲרֵי בֹּקֶר שֵׁנִי אָמוּר.
human_translation: teaches that the Festival peace-offering of the fourteenth is eaten for two days and one night; Or it is for only a day and a night; when it says “on the first day until the morning” speaks of the second morning.
llm_translation: He taught regarding the festival offering of the fourteenth of Nisan that it is eaten for two days and one night. Or is it only for a day and a night? When it says, "In the morning of the first day" — behold, the second morning is meant.

hebrew_text: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בֹּקֶר רִאשׁוֹן, וּמָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים חֲגִיגָה הַנֶּאֱכֶלֶת לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וָלַיְלָה אֶחָד — חוּץ מִזּוֹ, כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר בּוֹ: ״אִם נֶדֶר אוֹ נְדָבָה״ — לִימֵּד עַל חֲגִיגַת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שֶׁנֶּאֱכֶלֶת לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וָלַיְלָה אֶחָד.
human_translation: Or it is only the first morning, and how do I establish a Festival peace-offering may be eaten for two days and one night? other than this When it says if is a vow or a free-will offering, it teaches that the Festival peace-offering of the fourteenth, is eaten for two days and one night.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Or he is only the first morning, and what am I fulfilling a festival that is eaten for two days and one night - except for this, when he says about it: "If a vow or a freewill offering" - he taught about the festival of the fourteenth that is eaten for two days and one night.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בֹּקֶר רִאשׁוֹן. הָא אָמַרְתָּ: כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן (לַבֹּקֶר)״ — הֲרֵי בֹּקֶר שֵׁנִי אָמוּר? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲגִיגוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אַחַת חֲגִיגַת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר וְאַחַת חֲגִיגַת חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר, וְזוֹ לְבוֹקְרָהּ וְזוֹ לְבוֹקְרָהּ.
human_translation: The Master said Or it is only the first morning. But you said when it says “on the first day until the morning,” speaks of the second morning. this is is saying: Or it is only the verse is speaking about two Festival peace-offerings, one the Festival peace-offering of the fourteenth and one the Festival peace-offering of the fifteenth, this, its morning, and this, its morning,
llm_translation: Master said: Either it is only the first morning, or you said: when it says "on the first day (in the morning)" - is the second morning also mentioned? This is what he is saying: Either it is only in the two festivals that the Scripture speaks of, one festival on the fourteenth and one festival on the fifteenth, and this one for its morning and this one for its morning.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר: אֶלָּא דְּקַיְימָא לַן חֲגִיגָה הַנֶּאֱכֶלֶת לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וָלַיְלָה אֶחָד. אִם כֵּן: ״אִם נֶדֶר אוֹ נְדָבָה״ בְּמַאי? אִי חֲגִיגַת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, הָא כְּתִיב בַּהּ יוֹם וָלַיְלָה! אִי חֲגִיגַת חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר, הָא כְּתִיב בַּהּ יוֹם וָלַיְלָה!
human_translation: It then says: But that which we maintain, that a Festival peace-offering may be eaten for two days and one night, if so, “But if is a vow or a free-will offering,” with regard to what If the Festival peace-offering of the fourteenth, surely it is written about it, a day and a night. And if the Festival peace-offering of the fifteenth, surely it is written about it a day and a night.
llm_translation: The scholar said: Rather, we establish for ourselves a festive offering that is eaten for two days and one night. If so, "if it is a vow or a freewill offering," with what? If it is a festive offering of the fourteenth, for it is written in it "day and night"! If it is a festive offering of the fifteenth, for it is written in it "day and night"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הַאי לַחֲגִיגַת חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר, וְהַאיְךְ כּוּלֵּיהּ קְרָא לַחֲגִיגַת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, לִימֵּד עַל חֲגִיגַת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שֶׁנֶּאֱכֶלֶת לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וָלַיְלָה אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rather, this the Festival peace-offering of the fifteenth, and the entire other verse: the Festival peace-offering of the fourteenth has taught that the Festival peace-offering of the fourteenth is eaten for two days and one night.
llm_translation: Rather, this refers to the festival offering of fifteen animals, and how is it that the entire festival offering is called the festival offering of fourteen animals? This teaches us regarding the festival offering of fourteen animals that it is eaten for two days and one night.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דִּכְתִיב ״בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן לַבֹּקֶר״, דְּמַאי ״בֹּקֶר״ — בֹּקֶר שֵׁנִי. הָא כׇּל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב בֹּקֶר סְתָמָא — בֹּקֶר רִאשׁוֹן, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא כְּתַב בֵּיהּ ״רֵאשִׁית״.
human_translation: The reason is that it is written “on the first day until the morning,” for what is morning? The second morning. We can infer that wherever morning is written unmodified the first morning even though “first” is not written in relation to
llm_translation: The reason it is written "on the first day in the morning," what is the meaning of "morning" - it is the second morning. Wherever it is written "morning" without specification - it is the first morning, even though it does not contain the word "beginning."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפֶּסַח שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ בְּשַׁבָּת — חַיָּיב עָלָיו חַטָּאת.
human_translation: A Paschal lamb that one slaughtered for a different purpose on Shabbat, he is liable a sin-offering for it
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The Paschal lamb that one slaughtered not for its sake on Shabbat - he is liable for a sin offering.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַזְּבָחִים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן לְשֵׁם פֶּסַח, אִם אֵינָן רְאוּיִין — חַיָּיב, וְאִם רְאוּיִין הֵן — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: all other offerings, that one slaughtered for the purpose of a Paschal offering, if they were not fit he is liable And if they were fit, Rabbi Eliezer deems liable a sin-offering But Rabbi Yehoshua exempts
llm_translation: And the rest of all the sacrifices that they slaughter for the sake of Pesach, if they are not fit - liable, and if they are fit - Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מָה אִם הַפֶּסַח שֶׁהוּא מוּתָּר לִשְׁמוֹ, כְּשֶׁשִּׁינָּה אֶת שְׁמוֹ — חַיָּיב, זְבָחִים שֶׁהֵן אֲסוּרִין לִשְׁמָן, כְּשֶׁשִּׁינָּה אֶת שְׁמָן — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּהֵא חַיָּיב? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לָא, אִם אָמַרְתָּ בַּפֶּסַח שֶׁשִּׁינָּהוּ בְּדָבָר אָסוּר, תֹּאמַר בִּזְבָחִים שֶׁשִּׁינָּן בְּדָבָר הַמּוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to If, the Paschal lamb, which is permitted for its own purpose, when one changed its purpose he is liable, offerings that are forbidden for their own purpose, when one changed their purpose, is it not right that he should be liable? Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, If you say a Paschal lamb because he changed for something forbidden, can you say about offerings that he changed for something permitted
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer: What if the Passover offering, which is permitted for its own sake, when you change its name - is liable, sacrifices that are prohibited for their own sake, when you change their name - is it not right that he should be liable? Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, if you say that regarding the Passover offering, which when you change it is in a matter that is prohibited, you would say the same regarding sacrifices, which when you change them are in a matter that is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אֵימוּרֵי צִיבּוּר יוֹכִיחוּ, שֶׁהֵן מוּתָּרִין לִשְׁמָן, וְהַשּׁוֹחֵט לִשְׁמָן חַיָּיב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לֹא, אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּאֵימוּרֵי צִיבּוּר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן קִצְבָה, תֹּאמַר בַּפֶּסַח שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קִצְבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to Let the communal offerings, prove for they are permitted for their own purpose, and one who slaughters for their purpose is liable. Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, if you say communal offerings, because they have a limit, can you say about the Paschal lamb, which does not have a limit,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Eliezer: The sayings of the congregation prove, for they are permitted for their own sake, and one who slaughters for their own sake is liable. Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, if you say regarding the sayings of the congregation that they have a fixed time, you should say the same regarding the Passover offering which has no fixed time.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף הַשּׁוֹחֵט לְשֵׁם אֵימוּרֵי צִיבּוּר — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: even one who slaughters for the purpose of communal offerings is exempt
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Even one who slaughters for the sake of the pronouncements of the congregation - is exempt.

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לְאוֹכְלָיו וְשֶׁלֹּא לִמְנוּיָו, לַעֲרֵלִין וְלִטְמֵאִין — חַיָּיב. לְאוֹכְלָיו וְשֶׁלֹּא לְאוֹכְלָיו, לִמְנוּיָו וְשֶׁלֹּא לִמְנוּיָו, לְמוּלִין וְלַעֲרֵלִים, לִטְמֵאִין וְלִטְהוֹרִין — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: If one slaughtered for those who cannot eat it, or for those who did not register for it, for the uncircumcised or for those ritually impure, he is liable for those who can eat it and for those who cannot eat it, for those who registered for it and for those who did not register for it, for the circumcised and for those who are uncircumcised, for those who are ritually impure and those who are ritually pure, he is exempt.
llm_translation: The slaughter that is not for its intended consumers and not for its designated purpose, for uncircumcised and impure individuals — is liable. For its intended consumers and not for its intended consumers, for its designated purpose and not for its designated purpose, for circumcised and uncircumcised individuals, for impure and pure individuals — is exempt.

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטוֹ וְנִמְצָא בַּעַל מוּם — חַיָּיב. שְׁחָטוֹ וְנִמְצָא טְרֵיפָה בַּסֵּתֶר — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: he slaughtered it and it was found to have a blemish, he is liable he slaughtered it and it was found to have a hidden condition that would cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ] he is exempt
llm_translation: His slaughtering and found blemished - liable. His slaughtering and found treifah in secret - exempt.

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטוֹ וְנוֹדַע שֶׁמָּשְׁכוּ הַבְּעָלִים אֶת יָדָם, אוֹ שֶׁמֵּתוּ אוֹ שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ — פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשָּׁחַט בִּרְשׁוּת.
human_translation: he slaughtered it and it became known that the owners had withdrawn or they had died or became ritually impure, he is exempt because he slaughtered with permission.
llm_translation: If he slaughtered it and it became known that the owners withdrew their hand, or if they died or became impure - he is exempt, because he slaughtered with permission.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּטוֹעֶה — שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ עֲקִירָה בְּטָעוּת הָוְיָא עֲקִירָה. אֶלָּא בְּעוֹקֵר.
human_translation: with what are we dealing? If you say with one who erred learn from it, the erroneous uprooting constitutes uprooting, Rather, one who uprooted
llm_translation: We are dealing with what? If you say with a mistake - you have heard that uprooting through mistake is considered uprooting. Rather, with one who uproots.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַזְּבָחִים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן לְשׁוּם הַפֶּסַח, אִם אֵינָן רְאוּיִין — חַיָּיב, אִם רְאוּיִין הֵן — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר. וְאִי בְּעוֹקֵר, מָה לִי רְאוּיִין, מָה לִי שֶׁאֵינָן רְאוּיִין?
human_translation: say the latter clause all other offerings that one slaughtered for the purpose of a Paschal offering, if they were not fit he is liable And if they are fit, Rabbi Eliezer deems liable a sin-offering, Rabbi Yehoshua exempts Now if uprooted what does it matter to me whether fit or unfit?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: u'shear kol hazvachim she'shachatun le'shem ha'pesach, im einan reuyin - chayav, im reuyin hen - Rabbi Eliezer mechayev chatat, ve'Rabbi Yehoshua poter. Ve'ei b'okar, mah li reuyin, mah li she'einan reuyin?" English translation: "Say the latter clause: and the rest of all the sacrifices that they slaughter for the sake of the Passover, if they are not fit - liable; if they are fit - Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts. And if it is due to a disqualifying factor, what do I need the fit ones for, what do I need the unfit ones for?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא בְּטוֹעֶה. רֵישָׁא בְּעוֹקֵר וְסֵיפָא בְּטוֹעֶה! אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין: אִין, רֵישָׁא בְּעוֹקֵר וְסֵיפָא בְּטוֹעֶה.
human_translation: Rather, it is obvious one who erred. the first clause one who uprooted whereas the latter clause one who erred Rabbi Avin said: Yes, The first clause one who uprooted whereas the latter clause one who erred
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious in the case of a mistake. The beginning is in uprooting and the end is in a mistake! Rabbi Avin said: No, the beginning is in uprooting and the end is in a mistake.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ דַּהֲוָה קָאֵי בְּאוּכְלוּסָא דְאִינָשֵׁי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַתְנִיתִין מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רֵישָׁא בְּעוֹקֵר וְסֵיפָא בְּטוֹעֶה. תְּנָא מִינֵּיהּ אַרְבְּעִין זִימְנִין וְדָמֵי לֵיהּ כְּמַאן דְּמַנְּחָא בְּכִיסֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef found Rabbi Abbahu standing among a multitude [ okhlosa ] of people, he said to him: What is our mishna? said to him: The first clause one who uprooted whereas the latter clause one who erred learned from him forty times, and it seemed to him as though it were resting in his pouch;
llm_translation: He found Rav Yitzchak the son of Yosef before Rabbi Avahu who was standing in the market of the people, he said to him: What is the Mishnah? He said to him: The beginning is about uprooting and the end is about making a mistake. A Tanna learned from him forty times, and his blood is like one who puts it in his pocket.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מָה אִם פֶּסַח שֶׁמּוּתָּר לִשְׁמוֹ, כְּשֶׁשִּׁינָּה אֶת שְׁמוֹ — חַיָּיב, זְבָחִים שֶׁהֵן אֲסוּרִין לִשְׁמָן, כְּשֶׁשִּׁינָּה אֶת שְׁמָן אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּהֵא חַיָּיב! וְאִם אִיתָא, הָא לָא דָּמֵי, דְּרֵישָׁא בְּעוֹקֵר, וְסֵיפָא בְּטוֹעֶה!
human_translation: We learned Rabbi Eliezer said If the Paschal lamb, which is permitted for its own purpose, when one changed its purpose he is liable, offerings that are forbidden for their own purpose, when he changed their purpose is it not right that he should be liable? And if it is so surely they are not similar as the first clause one who uprooted whereas the latter clause one who erred
llm_translation: We learned: Rabbi Eliezer said: If the Passover sacrifice, whose name is permitted for its name, when you change its name - one is liable. But sacrifices that are forbidden for their name, when you change their name, it is not the law that one should be liable! And if you say, it is not so, for the beginning is invalid, and the end is mistaken!

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לָא שָׁנֵי לֵיהּ. לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דְּשָׁנֵי לֵיהּ, לִישַׁנֵּי לֵיהּ הָכִי!
human_translation: According to Rabbi Eliezer, there is no difference, according to Rabbi Yehoshua, for whom there is a difference let him answer this
llm_translation: To Rabbi Eliezer, it does not change for him. To Rabbi Yehoshua, it changes for him, to change for him thus!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: לְדִידִי לָא דָּמֵי, רֵישָׁא בְּעוֹקֵר וְסֵיפָא בְּטוֹעֶה. לְדִידָךְ: לֹא אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּפֶסַח שֶׁשִּׁינָּה אֶת שְׁמוֹ לְדָבָר הָאָסוּר, תֹּאמַר בִּזְבָחִים שֶׁשִּׁינָּה אֶת שְׁמָן לְדָבָר הַמּוּתָּר.
human_translation: this is what said to According to me, not comparable, the first clause with one who uprooted whereas the latter clause with one who erred according to you, No, if you say a Paschal lamb because he changed its purpose for something prohibited. you say about offerings that he changed their purpose for something permitted?
llm_translation: So he said to him: According to my opinion, it is not similar. The beginning is in uprooting and the end is in making a mistake. According to your opinion: If you said regarding the Passover offering that changing its name to something forbidden, you should say regarding sacrifices that changing their name to something permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אֵימוּרֵי צִיבּוּר יוֹכִיחוּ שֶׁהֵן מוּתָּרִין לִשְׁמָן, וְהַשּׁוֹחֵט לִשְׁמָן — חַיָּיב, אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לֹא אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּאֵימוּרֵי צִיבּוּר שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ לָהֶן קִצְבָה, תֹּאמַר בְּפֶסַח שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קִצְבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to Let the communal offerings prove for they are permitted for their own purpose, and one who slaughters for their purpose is liable. Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, if you said communal offerings, because they have a limit. you say regard to the Paschal lamb, which does not have a limit?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer: The sayings of the congregation prove that they are permitted for their fat, and one who slaughters for their fat is liable, Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: If you say regarding the sayings of the congregation that they have a set time, then say the same regarding the Passover offering which has no set time.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּכֹל הֵיכָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ קִצְבָה מְחַיֵּיב רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ? וַהֲרֵי תִּינוֹקוֹת, דְּיֵשׁ לָהֶן קִצְבָה, וּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנֵי תִינוֹקוֹת, אֶחָד לְמוּלוֹ אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶחָד לְמוּלוֹ בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְשָׁכַח וּמָל אֶת שֶׁל אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת בַּשַּׁבָּת — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Is that to say that wherever there is a limit, Rabbi Yehoshua deems liable But babies which has a limit, we learned one who had two babies one to circumcise after Shabbat and one to circumcise on Shabbat, and he forgot and circumcised after Shabbat on Shabbat, he is liable
llm_translation: In the matter of wherever there is a foreskin, Rabbi Yehoshua obligates? And behold, infants, who have a foreskin, and we learned: If one had two infants, one to circumcise after Shabbat and one to circumcise on Shabbat, and he forgot and circumcised the one meant for after Shabbat on Shabbat - he is liable.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד לְמוּלוֹ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וְאֶחָד לָמוּל בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְשָׁכַח וּמָל אֶת שֶׁל עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת בַּשַּׁבָּת — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר!
human_translation: one to circumcise on Shabbat eve, and one to circumcise on Shabbat, and he forgot and circumcised the one Shabbat eve on Shabbat, Rabbi Eliezer deems liable to a sin-offering. And Rabbi Yehoshua exempts
llm_translation: One for circumcision on Friday, and one for circumcision on the Sabbath, and he forgot and circumcised the one meant for Friday on the Sabbath - Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Joshua exempts him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁקָּדַם וּמָל אֶת שֶׁל עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת בַּשַּׁבָּת, דְּאִיכָּא הָךְ דְּשַׁבָּת דִּטְרִיד בֵּיהּ. הָכָא, כְּגוֹן שֶׁקָּדַם וְשַׁחְטִינְהוּ לְאֵימוּרֵי צִיבּוּר בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: With what are we dealing here? where first circumcised Shabbat eve on Shabbat, there is this Shabbat with whom he is preoccupied. Here, where he first slaughtered the communal offerings at the beginning,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, one who slaughtered and circumcised the eve of Shabbat on Shabbat, as there is a case where Shabbat troubles him. Here, for example, one who slaughtered and they had not yet recited the communal prayers at the outset.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף הַשּׁוֹחֵט לְשֵׁם אֵימוּרֵי צִיבּוּר פָּטוּר, אַף עַל גַּב דִּקְדֵים וְשַׁחְטִינְהוּ לְאֵימוּרֵי צִיבּוּר בְּרֵישָׁא, וְהַתַּנְיָא, רַבִּי חִיָּיא [מֵאָבֵל עֲרָב] אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עַל שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנֵי תִינוֹקוֹת, אֶחָד לָמוּל עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וְאֶחָד לָמוּל בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְשָׁכַח וּמָל אֶת שֶׁל עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת בַּשַּׁבָּת — דְּחַיָּיב.
human_translation: If so, Rabbi Meir says even one who slaughters for the purpose of communal offerings is exempt? even though he first slaughtered the communal offerings at the beginning. But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya from Avel Arav teach Rabbi Meir said: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua did not disagree over one who had two babies one to circumcise Shabbat eve and one to circumcise on Shabbat, and he forgot and circumcised the Shabbat eve on Shabbat; that he is liable
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is this so? Rabbi Meir says: Even one who slaughters for the sake of the utterances of the congregation is exempt, even though he should have slaughtered them for the sake of the utterances of the congregation initially. And it was taught: Rabbi Chiya from the evening of the eve of Shabbat said Rabbi Meir: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua did not disagree when he had two infants, one to be circumcised on the eve of Shabbat and one to be circumcised on Shabbat, and he forgot and circumcised the one meant for the eve of Shabbat on Shabbat - he is liable.

hebrew_text: עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנֵי תִינוֹקוֹת, אֶחָד לָמוּל אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶחָד לָמוּל בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְשָׁכַח וּמָל אֶת שֶׁל אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת בַּשַּׁבָּת, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: With regard to what did they disagree? With regard to one who had two babies one to circumcise after Shabbat and one to circumcise on Shabbat, and he forgot and circumcised the after Shabbat on Shabbat, as Rabbi Eliezer deems him liable a sin-offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts
llm_translation: On what do they argue? - On the case where one had two infants, one for circumcision after the Sabbath and one for circumcision on the Sabbath, and he forgot and circumcised the one meant for after the Sabbath on the Sabbath. Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Joshua exempts.

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא: מָה הָתָם דְּלָא עָבֵיד מִצְוָה — פָּטַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, הֵיכָא דְּקָא עָבֵיד מִצְוָה — מְחַיֵּיב?!
human_translation: And you understand If there, he did not perform a mitzva Rabbi Yehoshua exempted where he did perform a mitzva, deem him liable?
llm_translation: And it was reasoned: What is the difference there that if one does not perform a commandment — Rabbi Yehoshua exempts, but where one does perform a commandment — he obligates?!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: רֵישָׁא — כְּגוֹן שֶׁקָּדַם וּמָל שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת,
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Yannai said: The first clause where first circumcised on Shabbat eve Shabbat.
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yannai said: The beginning — for example, one who lights the Shabbat lamp on Friday evening before Shabbat.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא נִתְּנָה שַׁבָּת לִדָּחוֹת. [וְסֵיפָא — נִתְּנָה שַׁבָּת לִדָּחוֹת אֶצְלוֹ].
human_translation: Shabbat does not stand to be overridden the latter clause, Shabbat stands to be overridden for him,
llm_translation: The Sabbath was not given to be pushed aside. And the latter clause - the Sabbath was given to be pushed aside in his case.

hebrew_text: הָכָא — הֲרֵי נִתְּנָה שַׁבָּת לִדָּחוֹת אֵצֶל קׇרְבַּן צִיבּוּר.
human_translation: here Shabbat stands to be overridden with regard to a communal offering.
llm_translation: Here - behold, Shabbat was given to push aside in the case of the communal offering.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: הָכָא נָמֵי, הֲרֵי נִתְּנָה שַׁבָּת לִדָּחוֹת אֵצֶל תִּינוֹקוֹת דְּעָלְמָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְגַבֵּי דְּהַאי גַּבְרָא מִיהַת לָא אִיתְיְהִיב.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana Here too, Shabbat stands to be overridden with regard to babies in general, said to him: However, with regard to this person, does not stand
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashe to Rav Kahana: Here it is stated, has Shabbat been given to be pushed aside for the sake of children of the world! He said to him: In the case of this man, it was not given.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַזְּבָחִים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן לְשׁוּם פֶּסַח, אִם אֵינָן רְאוּיִין — חַיָּיב, וְאִם רְאוּיִין — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר. מַאן תַּנָּא דְּשָׁנֵי לֵיהּ בֵּין רְאוּיִין לְשֶׁאֵינָן רְאוּיִין?
human_translation: all other offerings that one slaughtered for the purpose of a Paschal offering, if they were not fit he is liable and if they were fit, Rabbi Eliezer deems liable a sin-offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts Who is the tanna that distinguishes between that are fit and those that are not fit?
llm_translation: And the rest of all the sacrifices that they slaughter for the sake of Pesach, if they are not fit - liable, and if they are fit - Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts. Who is the Tanna that teaches him whether they are fit or not fit?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: אֶחָד הַזְּבָחִים הָרְאוּיִין וְאֶחָד זְבָחִים שֶׁאֵינָן רְאוּיִין, וְכֵן הַשּׁוֹחֵט לְשֵׁם אֵימוּרֵי צִיבּוּר — פָּטוּר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עַל שֶׁאֵינָן רְאוּיִין שֶׁחַיָּיב, עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל הָרְאוּיִין, שֶׁרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: It is Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught whether offerings that are fit or offerings that are not fit, and similarly, he slaughters for the purpose of communal offerings he is exempt the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Shimon said: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua did not disagree about that are not fit, that he is liable. With regard to what did they disagree? With regard to that are fit, for Rabbi Eliezer deems liable a sin-offering and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: As it was taught: One of the sacrifices that are fit, and one of the sacrifices that are not fit, and similarly one who slaughters for the sake of the public declaration is exempt, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Shimon said: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua did not disagree regarding those that are not fit which incur liability, what did they disagree about? - about those that are fit, for Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: פּוֹטֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אֲפִילּוּ עֵגֶל שֶׁל זִבְחֵי שְׁלָמִים שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ לְשׁוּם הַפֶּסַח. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַב בִּיבִי: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוֹדֶה הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין לָא טְרִיד בְּהוּ, וְהַאי טְרִיד בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Beivai said that Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Meir would exempt even a calf of a peace-offering that he slaughtered for the purpose of the Paschal offering, Rabbi Zeira said to Rav Beivai: But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say Rabbi Meir conceded blemished He said to him: With regard to blemished he is not preoccupied with them, But as for this he is preoccupied with
llm_translation: Rav Bibi said, Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Meir used to exempt even a calf of peace offerings that was slaughtered for the sake of the Passover. Rabbi Zeira said to Rav Bibi: But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say that Rabbi Meir used to concede in cases of blemished animals? He said to him: In cases of blemished animals he did not concede, but in this case he did.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: חוּלִּין לְשׁוּם פֶּסַח, מַאי לִי אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹטֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אֲפִילּוּ חוּלִּין לְשׁוּם פֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma before unconsecrated for the purpose of a Paschal offering, what would Rabbi Meir say? said to him: Rabbi Meir would exempt even unconsecrated for the purpose of a Paschal offering.
llm_translation: Rava asked a question of Rav Nachman: "Hulin for the sake of Pesach, what is it?" Rabbi Meir said: He used to exempt even Hulin for the sake of Pesach.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוֹדֶה הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין! בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין לָא מִיחַלְּפִי, הָנֵי מִיחַלְּפִי.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say Rabbi Meir concedes blemished Blemished cannot be confused these, can be confused
llm_translation: And he said, Rabbi Yochanan: Rabbi Meir used to concede regarding Ba'alei Mumim! Ba'alei Mumim do not interchange, those interchange.

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר מִשּׁוּם אִיחַלּוֹפֵי וְלָא אִיחַלּוֹפֵי? וְהָאָמַר רַב בִּיבִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: פּוֹטֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אֲפִילּוּ עֵגֶל שֶׁל זִבְחֵי שְׁלָמִים שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ לְשׁוּם הַפֶּסַח! אַלְמָא, טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר מִשּׁוּם דִּטְרִיד!
human_translation: And is Rabbi Meir’s reason that these can be confused and these cannot be confused But didn’t Rav Beivai say that Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Meir would exempt even a calf of a peace-offering that he slaughtered for the purpose of the Paschal offering, it is apparent Rabbi Meir’s reason is that he is preoccupied
llm_translation: The reason of Rabbi Meir is it because of "Ichalofei" or not because of "Ichalofei"? And Rav Bibi said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: Rabbi Meir used to exempt even a calf of peace offerings that was slaughtered for the sake of the Passover! This implies that the reason of Rabbi Meir is because of "Ditrid."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טְרִיד — אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא מִחַלַּף, מִחַלַּף — אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא טְרִיד, לְאַפּוֹקֵי בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין, דְּלָא אִיחַלּוֹפֵי מִחַלַּף וְלָא מִטְרִיד טְרִיד.
human_translation: said to him: preoccupied even though cannot be confused can be confused even though he is not preoccupied to exclude blemished which cannot be confused and is not preoccupied.
llm_translation: He said to him: Trid - even though he did not exchange, he exchanged - even though he did not trid, to exclude those with blemishes, who do not exchange or trid.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַבִּי זֵירָא וְרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק אַקִּילְעָא דְּרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק, וְיָתְבִי וְקָא אָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: נִתְחַלֵּף לוֹ שַׁפּוּד שֶׁל נוֹתָר בְּשַׁפּוּד שֶׁל צָלִי, וַאֲכָלוֹ — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira and Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak were sitting on the porch of Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak, and they sat and said: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: If one confused a spit of leftover with a spit of roasted and he ate it, he is liable
llm_translation: Sitting were Rabbi Zeira and Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak in the palm grove of Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak, and they were sitting and saying, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: If one exchanged his leftover roasted meat for roasted meat, and he ate it - he is liable.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה בָּעַל — חַיָּיב. יְבִמְתּוֹ נִדָּה בָּעַל — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one engaged in sexual intercourse with his wife while she was menstruating, he is liable he engaged in sexual intercourse with his sister-in-law who was waiting levirate marriage while she was menstruating, he is exempt,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: His wife, a menstruant, her husband - liable. His yevamah, a menstruant, her husband - exempt.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן בְּהָהִיא דְּמִחַיַּיב, דְּלֹא עָשָׂה מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Some say all the more so in the deem liable for he did not perform a mitzva
llm_translation: There are those who say: all the more so in that case of one who is obligated, for he did not perform a commandment.

hebrew_text: אִית דְּאָמְרִי, בְּהַהִיא — פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? הָתָם הוּא דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְשַׁיּוֹלֵי. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְשַׁיּוֹלֵי — לָא.
human_translation: Others say in that he is exempt What is the reason? There, for he should have asked But here, where he did not have to ask, not
llm_translation: There are those who say, in that case — exempt. What is the reason? There, because he had a place to ask. But here, where he did not have a place to ask — no.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי שְׁנָא יְבִמְתּוֹ, דְּקָא עָבֵיד מִצְוָה? אִשְׁתּוֹ נָמֵי קָא עָבֵיד מִצְוָה! בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ מְעוּבֶּרֶת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is different his sister-in-law, that he performed a mitzva, also his wife he performed a mitzva, where his wife is pregnant,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, what is different about his yevamah, that he is fulfilling a mitzvah? His wife is also fulfilling a mitzvah! In his wife, she is pregnant.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא שִׂמְחַת עוֹנָה! שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת עוֹנָתָהּ.
human_translation: there is enjoyment of conjugal rights. where it is not the time of her conjugal rights.
llm_translation: And there is the joy of iniquity! Not at the time of its iniquity.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְשַׂמֵּחַ אִשְׁתּוֹ בִּדְבַר מִצְוָה! סָמוּךְ לְוִוסְתָּהּ.
human_translation: didn’t Rava say a man is obligated to please his wife through a mitzva? near her expected date
llm_translation: And Rava said: A person is obligated to make his wife happy with a matter of mitzvah! Close to her.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ יְבִמְתּוֹ נָמֵי! יְבִמְתּוֹ בְּזִיז מִינַּהּ, אִשְׁתּוֹ לָא בְּזִיז מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: If so, even his sister-in-law also his sister-in-law, he is shy [ bazeiz ] of her his wife, he is not shy of her,
llm_translation: If so, even his yevamah also! His yevamah with her ziz minnah, his wife not with her ziz minnah.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כְּמַאן? אִילֵּימָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְשָׁכַח וְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַלּוּלָב לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוֹצִיא בִּרְשׁוּת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, in accordance with whose If you say in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, as we learned Rabbi Yosei says: the first Festival day of the festival occurs on Shabbat, and he forgot and carried lulav out into the public domain he is exempt because he carried it out with permission,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yochanan according to whom? Perhaps according to Rabbi Yosei. As we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yosei says: If on the first day of the festival, which happens to fall on Shabbat, one forgets and takes the lulav out into the public domain - he is exempt, because he took it out unintentionally.

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּזְמַנּוֹ בָּהוּל.
human_translation: Perhaps it is different there, as he is pressed for time.
llm_translation: Perhaps it is different there, for its time is in turmoil.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דִּזְבָחִים. דִּילְמָא הָתָם נָמֵי זְמַנּוֹ בָּהוּל.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehoshua with regard to offerings, Perhaps there also he is pressed for time.
llm_translation: But rather Rabbi Yehoshua concerning sacrifices. Perhaps there, his time was in confusion.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דְּתִינוֹקוֹת. הָתָם נָמֵי זְמַנּוֹ בָּהוּל.
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua with regard to babies, there too, he is pressed for time.
llm_translation: And rather it is like Rabbi Yehoshua of Tinnukot. There, he said his time in confusion.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דִּתְרוּמָה, דִּתְנַן: הָיָה אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה וְנוֹדַע שֶׁהוּא בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua with regard to teruma , as we learned was eating teruma , and it became known that he was the son of a divorced woman or a woman who underwent ḥalitza Rabbi Eliezer deems liable the principal and fifth, Rabbi Yehoshua exempts
llm_translation: And rather according to Rabbi Yehoshua regarding Terumah, as we learned: If one was eating Terumah and it became known that he is a son of a divorced woman or a halutzah - Rabbi Eliezer obligates principal and fifth, Rabbi Yehoshua exempts.

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא כִּדְרַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי, דְּאָמַר רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: בִּתְרוּמָה בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, דִּזְמַנָּהּ בָּהוּל.
human_translation: perhaps in accordance with Rav Beivai bar Abaye. For Rav Beivai bar Abaye said: teruma on the eve of Passover, whose time is pressing,
llm_translation: Perhaps like Rav Bibi bar Abbaye, for Rav Bibi bar Abbaye said: regarding the Terumah on the eve of Passover, its time is in a state of confusion.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: שָׁאנֵי תְּרוּמָה דְּאִיקְּרִי עֲבוֹדָה, וַעֲבוֹדָה רַחֲמָנָא אַכְשַׁר.
human_translation: Alternatively, teruma is different, because it is called service, and the Merciful One validates service
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "אִי נָמֵי: שָׁאנֵי תְּרוּמָה דְּאִיקְּרִי עֲבוֹדָה, וַעֲבוֹדָה רַחֲמָנָא אַכְשַׁר." English translation: "If you say: The offering of Terumah is called 'service,' and 'service' is valid according to the Merciful One."

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הָיָה עוֹמֵד וּמַקְרִיב, וְנוֹדַע שֶׁהוּא בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה — כׇּל הַקָּרְבָּנוֹת כּוּלָּן שֶׁהִקְרִיב עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ פְּסוּלִין, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מַכְשִׁיר. וְאָמְרִינַן, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — דִּכְתִיב: ״בָּרֵךְ ה׳ חֵילוֹ וּפֹעַל יָדָיו תִּרְצֶה״.
human_translation: As we learned was standing and sacrificing offerings and it became known that he was the son of a divorced woman or the son of a woman who underwent ḥalitza , all the offerings that he offered on the altar are disqualified, And Rabbi Yehoshua validates And we said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehoshua? As it is written “Bless, Lord, his substance and accept the work of his hands”
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If one was standing and offering sacrifices, and it became known that he is a son of a divorced woman or a halutzah - all the sacrifices that he offered on the altar are disqualified, but Rabbi Yehoshua deems them valid. And we say, what is the reason for Rabbi Yehoshua's opinion? Because it is written: "Bless, Hashem, his substance, and accept the work of his hands" (Deuteronomy 33:11).

hebrew_text: וּתְרוּמָה הֵיכָא אִיקְּרִי עֲבוֹדָה? דְּתַנְיָא, מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן שֶׁלֹּא בָּא אֶמֶשׁ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. לְשַׁחֲרִית מְצָאוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אָמַר לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא בָּאתָ אֶמֶשׁ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ? אָמַר לוֹ: עֲבוֹדָה עָבַדְתִּי. אָמַר לוֹ: כׇּל דְּבָרֶיךָ אֵינָן אֶלָּא דִּבְרֵי תֵימָה, וְכִי עֲבוֹדָה בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה מִנַּיִן? אָמַר לוֹ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: And where is teruma called service? As it was taught an incident involving Rabbi Tarfon, who did not come in the evening to the study hall. In the morning, Rabban Gamliel found him said to him: For what did you not come in the evening to the study hall? He said to him: I was performing service. He said to him: All your words are astonishing; from where service in this time He said to him: It says
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And where is Terumah called Avodah? For it was taught: There was an incident with Rabbi Tarfon that he did not come last night to the study hall. In the morning, Rabban Gamliel found him and said to him: Why did you not come last night to the study hall? He said to him: I was engaged in work. He said to him: All your words are nothing but nonsense, and is work relevant in this time? He said to him, behold it says: English translation:

hebrew_text: ״עֲבוֹדַת מַתָּנָה אֶתֵּן אֶת כְּהֻנַּתְכֶם וְהַזָּר הַקָּרֵב יוּמָת״, עָשׂוּ אֲכִילַת תְּרוּמָה בִּגְבוּלִין כַּעֲבוֹדַת בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: “I have given you the priesthood as a service of gift; and the stranger that comes near shall be put to death” they made the eating of teruma in the outlying areas, like the service of the Temple.
llm_translation: "The service of a gift I will give your priesthood, and the outsider who approaches shall die." They made the eating of terumah in the borders like the service of the Temple.

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לְאוֹכְלָיו. פְּשִׁיטָא! כֵּיוָן דְּהָתָם — פָּסוּל, הָכָא — חַיָּיב! מִשּׁוּם דְּתַנָּא סֵיפָא פָּטוּר, תְּנָא רֵישָׁא חַיָּיב.
human_translation: one slaughtered for those who cannot eat it It is obvious. Since there, it is invalid, here, he is liable, Since the latter clause taught exempt the first clause taught liable,
llm_translation: Slaughter it not for its intended consumers. It is obvious! Since there it is invalid, here one is liable! Because a Tanna taught: in the latter case one is exempt, in the former case one is liable.

hebrew_text: וְהָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָתָם כָּשֵׁר, הָכָא פָּטוּר! אֶלָּא, אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא שְׁחָטוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ בְּשַׁבָּת, תְּנָא נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְאוֹכְלָיו. וְהִיא גּוּפָא לְמָה לִי? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי לְאִיפְּלוֹגֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: But this also is obvious, since there, valid, here he is exempt, Rather, since taught slaughtered for a different purpose on Shabbat, it also taught for those who cannot eat it. And it itself, why do I Since wished the dispute Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But isn't it obvious? There, in the case of the paschal lamb, it is valid, whereas here, in the case of the burnt offering, one is exempt! Rather, it is because it was taught: If one slaughters it not for its sake on Shabbat, the Mishnah teaches that one is exempt from liability. And why do I need this teaching? Because they established it to serve as a basis for the dispute between Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא לִבְרֵיהּ: כִּי אָזְלַתְּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי זְרִיקָא, בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ: לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר ״מְקַלְקֵל בְּחַבּוּרָה — פָּטוּר״, ״שְׁחָטוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לְאוֹכְלָיו — חַיָּיב״? מָה תִּיקֵּן?!
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana said to his son: When you go before Rabbi Zerika, ask him: According to the opinion that says that one who inflicts a destructive wound is exempt, one who slaughtered for those who cannot eat it is liable? What has he improved
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna the son of Chinena said to his son: When you went to stand before Rabbi Zerika, he asked you: According to the one who says, "One who damages in a group is exempt," and "One who slaughters not for its intended purpose is liable," what did you establish?!

hebrew_text: תִּיקֵּן אִם עָלוּ לֹא יֵרְדוּ.
human_translation: He has improved if ascended they do not descend.
llm_translation: He established, if they ascended, they shall not descend.

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטוֹ וְנִמְצָא בַּעַל מוּם חַיָּיב, מָה תִּיקֵּן? תִּיקֵּן בְּדוּקִּין שֶׁבָּעַיִן, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר אִם עָלוּ לֹא יֵרְדוּ.
human_translation: slaughtered and it was found to have a blemish, he is liable What has he improved He has improved on the eyelid, and in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who said if ascended they do not descend
llm_translation: He slaughtered it and a blemish was found, liable, what did he establish? He established with the eyes of the needle, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Akiva who said, "If they ascended, they shall not descend."

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטוֹ וְנִמְצָא טְרֵיפָה בַּסֵּתֶר — פָּטוּר. הָא בְּגָלוּי — חַיָּיב. מָה תִּיקֵּן? תִּיקֵּן לְהוֹצִיא מִידֵי נְבֵילָה.
human_translation: slaughtered and it was found to have a hidden condition that would cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], he is exempt if is visible, is liable. What has he improved He has improved removed it from an animal carcass [ neveila ],
llm_translation: He slaughtered it and found it to be a treifah in secret - he is exempt. But if it was found to be treifah openly - he is liable. What did he establish? He established to remove it from the status of a neveilah.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: הָא דְּתַנְיָא: הַשּׁוֹחֵט חַטָּאת בַּשַּׁבָּת בַּחוּץ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה — חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ שָׁלֹשׁ חַטָּאוֹת, מָה תִּיקֵּן?
human_translation: Ravina strongly objects to this: that which was taught one who slaughters a sin-offering on Shabbat outside for idolatry is liable to three sin-offerings for it: What has he improved
llm_translation: Ravina objects to it: This that was taught: One who slaughters a sin-offering on Shabbat outside the Temple service - he is liable for three sin-offerings, what is the reason?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עַוִּירָא: שֶׁמּוֹצִיאוֹ מִידֵי אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי.
human_translation: Rav Avira said: he removed it from limbs from a living creature.
llm_translation: Rav Avira said: "One who removes a limb from a living animal."

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטוֹ וְנוֹדַע וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: אָשָׁם שֶׁנִּיתַּק לִרְעִיָּה, וּשְׁחָטוֹ סְתָם — כָּשֵׁר לָעוֹלָה. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: לָא בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה.
human_translation: one slaughtered and it became known Rav Huna said that Rav said: a guilt-offering that was consigned to grazing: And slaughtered it without specifying it is valid as a burnt-offering. apparently holds that it does not require uprooting.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Its slaughter is known, etc." Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: If a guilt-offering was designated for a specific individual and it was slaughtered without specifying, it is valid as a burnt offering. This implies that he holds: It does not require uprooting.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי כִּי לֹא נִיתַּק נָמֵי! גְּזֵירָה לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה אַטּוּ לִפְנֵי כַפָּרָה.
human_translation: If so, when it has not been consigned also decree after atonement due to before atonement
llm_translation: So it is not so, for the verse was not severed! A decree after atonement is different than before atonement.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא, דִּתְנַן: אָשָׁם שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלָיו אוֹ שֶׁנִּתְכַּפְּרוּ בְּעָלָיו — יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב, וְיִמָּכֵר, וְיִפְּלוּ דָּמָיו לִנְדָבָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יָמוּת. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: יִמָּכֵר וְיָבִיא בְּדָמָיו עוֹלָה.
human_translation: From where do you say As we learned A guilt-offering whose owner has died or whose owner has achieved atonement grazes until it becomes unfit, it is sold and its money is used for a free-will burnt-offering. Rabbi Eliezer says: die Rabbi Yehoshua says: it is sold, and he brings a burnt-offering with its money.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And how do you explain the Mishnah that teaches: If a guilt-offering dies while in the possession of its owner, or if its owner has achieved atonement through it, he shall pasture it until it develops a blemish, then sell it, and the proceeds shall be designated as a donation-offering. Rabbi Eliezer says: It shall be left to die. Rabbi Yehoshua says: It shall be sold, and the proceeds used to purchase a burnt-offering.

hebrew_text: בְּדָמָיו אִין, אֲבָל גּוּפוֹ לָא. דְּגָזַר לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה אַטּוּ לִפְנֵי כַּפָּרָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: with its money indeed but itself not a decree after atonement due to before atonement learn from it
llm_translation: In his blood not, but his body yes. For he decreed after atonement before atonement. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב הוּנָא: שְׁחָטוֹ וְנוֹדַע שֶׁמָּשְׁכוּ בְּעָלִים אֶת יָדָם וְכוּ׳,
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised an objection to Rav Huna one slaughtered and it became known that the owners had withdrawn
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Hizda against Rav Huna: "If one slaughtered it and it became known that the owners pulled his hand, etc."

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: בַּחוֹל כִּי הַאי גַוְנָא יִשָּׂרֵף מִיָּד. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה, הַאי פֶּסַח הוּא, וְכֵיוָן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ בְּעָלִים — הָוֵה לֵיהּ פְּסוּלוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ, אַמְּטוּ לְהָכִי יִשָּׂרֵף מִיָּד.
human_translation: And it was taught with regard to this on a weekday, in a case like this, it should be burned immediately. Granted, if you say requires uprooting this is a Paschal offering. And since it has no owners, its disqualification is in itself, therefore it should be burned immediately.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: On a weekday, when this pile is burning, it shall be immediately consumed. If you say it is needed for uprooting, this is a Paschal offering, and since it does not have owners, its disqualification is inherent in it, therefore it shall be immediately consumed.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה — מֵרֵישָׁא הָוֵה לֵיהּ שְׁלָמִים, פְּסוּלוֹ מִשּׁוּם מַאי — מִשּׁוּם דָּבָר אַחֵר, דְּקָא שָׁחֵיט לֵיהּ אַחַר תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם. עִיבּוּר צוּרָה בָּעֵי.
human_translation: But if you say does not require uprooting, it was a peace-offering from the beginning, due to what is its disqualification? Due to something else, that he slaughtered it after the daily afternoon offering, it should require its form decays,
llm_translation: Rather, if you say it does not require uprooting — from the beginning it had peace offerings, its disqualification is due to what? — due to another matter, for he slaughtered it after the afternoon Tamid. It requires the removal of the spinal cord.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁפְּסוּלוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ — יִשָּׂרֵף מִיָּד. בַּדָּם וּבַבְּעָלִים — תְּעוּבַּר צוּרָתוֹ וְיֵצֵא לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה!
human_translation: As it was taught This is the principle: Any whose disqualification is in itself should be burned immediately in the blood in the owners, its form decay, should it be taken out to the place of burning.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: This is the principle: Anything whose disqualification is inherent in its very essence - shall be immediately burned. In the case of blood and internal organs - its form shall be turned over and it shall be taken out to the place of burning!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָא תֵּימָא שְׁחָטוֹ סְתָם — כָּשֵׁר לְשׁוּם עוֹלָה, אֶלָּא אֵימָא שְׁחָטוֹ לְשׁוּם עוֹלָה — כָּשֵׁר. אַלְמָא בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה.
human_translation: Rather, do not say slaughtered without specification is valid as a burnt-offering. Say rather slaughtered it as a burnt-offering, it is valid. apparently requires uprooting.
llm_translation: Rather, do not say that slaughtering it without specifying is valid for an olah offering; rather, say that slaughtering it specifically for an olah offering is valid. This implies that it requires uprooting.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר גַּמָּדָא, דְּאָמַר: נִזְרְקָה מִפִּי חֲבוּרָה וְאָמְרִי, כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ בְּעָלִים טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים וְנִדְחִין לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: according to Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda, who said it was thrown out from the group and they said where the owners were ritually impure by a corpse and they were pushed off to the second Pesaḥ ,
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Chiya bar Gamda, who said: It was thrown from the mouth of the group and they said, for example, if the owners were impure from corpses and were exiled for the second Passover.

hebrew_text: הַאי הוּא דְּבָעֵי עֲקִירָה, הָא בְּעָלְמָא לָא בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה. מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: it is this requires uprooting, but in general it does not require uprooting. what is there to say,
llm_translation: This is the case of "requiring uprooting," whereas in general, it does not require uprooting. What can be said to resolve this?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִפְרִישׁוֹ קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת, וּמֵתוּ בְּעָלִים אַחַר חֲצוֹת, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ נִרְאֶה וְנִדְחֶה. וְכׇל הַנִּרְאֶה וְנִדְחֶה — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וְנִרְאֶה.
