human_translation: Rather, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: With what are we dealing here where they designated before midday, and the owners died after midday, such that was fit and rejected: anything that was fit and rejected does not return to being fit.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, when he separated from his wife before midnight, and the owners died after midnight, it appears and is rejected. And anyone who appears and is rejected - he does not return and appear again.

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא אֶלָּא לְרַב, הָא אָמַר רַב: בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים אֵינָם נִדְחִים.
human_translation: Is this reason for anyone but Rav, But Rav said living creatures cannot be rejected.
llm_translation: From him is the reason, but for Rav, this is what Rav said: living creatures are not rejected.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: וְכֵן הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֲחֵרִים לְשֵׁם פֶּסַח — פָּסוּל, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ פְּסוּלוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: whose is this It is Rabbi Eliezer, who said: And similarly, one slaughtered another for the purpose of a Paschal offering, disqualified. its disqualification is in itself,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: Is this a dispute? It is Rabbi Eliezer, as he said: "And likewise one who slaughters on behalf of others for the sake of the Passover - it is invalid," for his own invalidation is upon him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, חַטָּאת נָמֵי מִחַיַּיב, דְּהָא לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר טוֹעֶה בִּדְבַר מִצְוָה פָּטוּר?
human_translation: But if it is Rabbi Eliezer, he would deem him liable also to bring a sin-offering for Rabbi Eliezer does not accept one who errs in regard to a mitzva is exempt
llm_translation: If Rabbi Eliezer is the one, sin offering also liable, for not has to Rabbi Eliezer mistaken in matter of commandment exempt?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, תַּרְגְּמָא רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב סַלָּא חֲסִידָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: הָא מַנִּי יוֹסֵף בֶּן חוֹנַאי הִיא. דִּתְנַן, יוֹסֵף בֶּן חוֹנַאי אוֹמֵר: הַנִּשְׁחָטִים לְשֵׁם פֶּסַח וּלְשֵׁם חַטָּאת — פְּסוּלִים, אַלְמָא: פְּסוּלוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ הִיא, וּמִשּׁוּם הָכִי יִשָּׂרֵף מִיָּד, וּבִפְטוֹרֵי — סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef, son of Rav Salla the Ḥasid, explained before Rav Pappa whose is this It is Yosef ben Ḥonai. As we learned Yosef ben Ḥonai says: that are slaughtered for the purpose of a Paschal offering or for the purpose of a sin-offering are disqualified, It is apparent its disqualification is in itself and therefore it should be burned immediately. But with regard to exemptions he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef, son of Rav Sala Chasida, translated before Rav Papa: "This is the teaching of Yosef ben Chonai. As we learned: Yosef ben Chonai says, 'Those slaughtered for the sake of Pesach or for the sake of a sin offering are invalid.' This implies that their disqualification is inherent, and therefore they must be immediately burned. And with regard to those exempt from punishment, he holds like Rabbi Yehoshua."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: רַב דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: אִם יֵשׁ שְׁהוּת בְּיוֹם לֵידַע אִם מָשְׁכוּ בְּעָלִים אֶת יְדֵיהֶם אוֹ שֶׁמֵּתוּ אוֹ שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ — חַיָּיב, וּתְעוּבַּר צוּרָתוֹ וְיוֹצֵא לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה!
human_translation: Rav Ashi said Rav said in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka. As it was taught Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: If has time in the day to clarify whether the owners withdrew or died or became ritually impure, he is liable and its form decay, and it should be taken out to the place of burning. What is the reason Is it not because it does not require uprooting?
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Rav said, in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah. As it was taught: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, says: If there is a delay on the day of Yom Kippur to ascertain whether the owners withdrew their hands, or died, or became impure - he is liable, and his form is to be broken and he is taken out to the burning place. What is the reason? Not because it does not require uprooting!

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּסָבַר לַהּ כְּתַנָּא דְּבֵי רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ, דְּאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ פִּיגּוּל נָמֵי בָּעֵי עִיבּוּר צוּרָה. דְּיָלֵיף ״עָוֹן״ ״עָוֹן״ מִנּוֹתָר.
human_translation: From where Perhaps is because he agrees with the tanna of the school of Rabba bar Avuh, who said even piggul , also requires decay of form, for he derived “iniquity” “iniquity” with regard to leftover
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps because he holds like the teaching of the school of Rabba bar Avuh, who said: Even a "Piggul" offering also requires shaping. He deduced "iniquity" from "iniquity" that is left over.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, נִטְמְאוּ בְּעָלִים מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? הָא וַדַּאי בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר גַּמָּדָא: נִזְרְקָה מִפִּי חֲבוּרָה, כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ בְּעָלִים טְמֵאֵי מֵת וְנִדְחוּ לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: For if you do not say so, the owners became ritually impure, what is there to say? it certainly requires uprooting, for Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda said it was thrown out from the group where the owners were ritually impure by a corpse and they were pushed off to the second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: If you don't say so, if the owners became impure, what can be said? This certainly requires uprooting, as Rabbi Chiya bar Gamda said: If it was thrown from a group's mouth, such as when the owners were impure from a corpse and were excluded for the second Passover.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנִּי מֵעִיקָּרָא: יוֹסֵף בֶּן חוֹנַאי הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, it is clear as he answered at the beginning, is Yosef ben Ḥonai.
llm_translation: Rather, Mechavvarta as it was stated from the outset: Yosef ben Choni is it.

hebrew_text: הָדְרָן עֲלָךְ אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים
llm_translation: We will return to you, these are the matters.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד צוֹלִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח? מְבִיאִין שַׁפּוּד שֶׁל רִמּוֹן, וְתוֹחֲבוֹ לְתוֹךְ פִּיו עַד בֵּית נְקוּבָתוֹ, וְנוֹתֵן אֶת כְּרָעָיו וְאֶת בְּנֵי מֵעָיו לְתוֹכוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּמִין בִּישּׁוּל הוּא זֶה, אֶלָּא תּוֹלִין חוּצָה לוֹ. אֵין צוֹלִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח לֹא עַל הַשַּׁפּוּד וְלֹא עַל הָאַסְכָּלָא. אָמַר רַבִּי צָדוֹק: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁאָמַר לְטָבִי עַבְדּוֹ: צֵא וּצְלֵה לָנוּ אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הָאַסְכָּלָא.
human_translation: How does one roast the Paschal lamb? One brings a spit [ shappud ] of pomegranate and thrusts it into the mouth until its anus, and puts its legs and entrails inside it the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. Rabbi Akiva says: this is a type of cooking. Rather, one suspends outside it. One not roast the Paschal lamb on the spit nor on grill [ askela ]. Rabbi Tzadok said: There was an incident with Rabban Gamliel, who said to his slave Tavi: Go and roast the Paschal lamb for us on the grill.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How is the Paschal lamb roasted? One brings a spit of pomegranate wood, inserts it into its mouth until it reaches its womb, and places its legs and innards inside it, according to the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. Rabbi Akiva says: This is like boiling, rather, it should be roasted whole. One does not roast the Paschal lamb on the spit or on a metal grill. Rabbi Tzadok said: It happened with Rabban Gamliel that he said to his servant Tavi: Go out and roast the Paschal lamb for us on the metal grill.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְנַיְתֵי שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת? אַיְּידֵי דְּחַם מִקְצָתוֹ חַם כּוּלּוֹ, וְקָמִטְּוֵי מֵחֲמַת הַשַּׁפּוּד, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״צְלִי אֵשׁ״, וְלֹא צָלִי מֵחֲמַת דָּבָר אַחֵר. וְנַיְתֵי שֶׁל דֶּקֶל? אַיְּידֵי דְּאִית לֵיהּ שִׁיבֵּי, מַפֵּיק מַיָּא וְהָוֵי כִּמְבוּשָּׁל. וְנַיְתֵי שֶׁל תְּאֵנָה? אַיְּידִי דִּמְחַלְחֵל, מַפֵּיק מַיָּא וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ כִּמְבוּשָּׁל.
human_translation: Let them bring a metal once part of it is hot, it is all hot, and roasted due to the spit. And the Merciful One states roasted in fire and not roasted through something else. Let them bring of palm Since has grooves it gives off water is as though it is cooked. Let them bring of fig Since it is hollow it gives off water, and it is as though is cooked.
llm_translation: Gemar and metal vessels? Due to the fact that when a part of it is heated, all of it becomes hot, and it contracts due to the heat of the fire, and the Merciful One said, "Roast with fire," and not roasted due to another reason. And palm branch vessels? Due to the fact that it has knots, it emits water and becomes cooked. And fig branch vessels? Due to the fact that it cracks, it emits water and becomes cooked.

hebrew_text: וְנַיְתֵי שֶׁל אַלּוֹן, שֶׁל חָרוּב, וְשֶׁל שִׁקְמָה? אַיְּידֵי דְּאִית בֵּיהּ קִיטְרֵי, מַפֵּיק מַיָּא.
human_translation: Let them bring from an oak from a carob from a sycamore, since it has knots it gives off water
llm_translation: "And the leaves of which tree? Of the oak, of the carob, and of the sycamore? Because it has knots, it draws water."

hebrew_text: שֶׁל רִמּוֹן נָמֵי אִית בֵּיהּ קִיטְרֵי? שִׁיעִי קִיטְרֵי. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּנַבְגָּא בַּר שַׁתָּא, דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ קִיטְרֵי. וְהָא אִיכָּא בֵּי פִסְקֵיהּ! דְּמַפֵּיק לְבֵי פִסְקֵיהּ לְבַר.
human_translation: from a pomegranate also has knots. Its knots are smooth. And if you wish, say a branch year, which does not have knots. But there is the place it was cut One leaves the place it was cut outside
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Does a pomegranate have seeds? It has seeds. And if you ask: what about a pomegranate of the son of Shata, which does not have seeds? But there is the house of his father! For he brings to the house of his father a son.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁשַּׁפּוּד שֶׁל עֵץ אֵינוֹ נִשְׂרָף, כָּךְ שַׁפּוּד שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת אֵינוֹ מַרְתִּיחַ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: זֶה חַם מִקְצָתוֹ — חַם כּוּלּוֹ, וְזֶה חַם מִקְצָתוֹ — אֵינוֹ חַם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught Rabbi Yehuda says: Just as a spit of wood is not burned, so a spit of metal does not become burning hot. said to him: this, part of it is hot, it is all hot. And that, part of it is hot, not all of it is hot,
llm_translation: Mishnaic teaching that is not like Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: Just as the coal of wood does not burn, so too the coal of metal does not melt. They said to him: If this part is hot — all of it is hot, and if this part is hot — not all of it is hot.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹתֵן אֶת כְּרָעָיו וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל קוֹרֵיהוּ ״תּוֹךְ תּוֹךְ״. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן קוֹרֵיהוּ ״גְּדִי מְקוּלָּס״.
human_translation: one places the legs It was taught Rabbi Yishmael call Tokh , tokh , Rabbi Tarfon call it: Helmeted kid.
llm_translation: And he shall place his legs, etc. It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Yishmael called it "within within." Rabbi Tarfon called it "a goat that is skinned."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ גְּדִי מְקוּלָּס דְּאָסוּר לֶאֱכוֹל בְּלֵילֵי פֶסַח בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה — כׇּל שֶׁצְּלָאוֹ כּוּלּוֹ כְּאֶחָד! נֶחְתַּךְ מִמֶּנּוּ אֵבֶר, נִשְׁלַק מִמֶּנּוּ אֵבֶר — אֵין זֶה גְּדִי מְקוּלָּס.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Which is the kid roasted whole that it is prohibited to eat on the nights of Passover in modern times, any that one roasted all at once one of its limbs is severed one of its limbs is boiled, it is no a kid roasted whole.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: What is a "skewered kid" that is forbidden to be eaten on the nights of Passover in our time? Any animal that is roasted whole, entirely as one! If a limb is cut off from it, or a limb is detached from it - this is not a "skewered kid."

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא יֵשׁ לוֹמַר נֶחְתַּךְ מִמֶּנּוּ אֵבֶר, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּקָא מִטְּוֵי לֵיהּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ, אָמְרַתְּ לָא — נִשְׁלַק מִיבַּעְיָא?! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שֶׁשְּׁלָקוֹ בִּמְחוּבָּר.
human_translation: Now, one can say one of its limbs is severed, although one roasts it together with you said no is boiled, is necessary Rav Sheshet said: where one boiled while it was attached
llm_translation: At that time, it is necessary to say that a limb was cut off from it, even though it is still attached to it, you say it did not detach from the source?! Rav Sheshet said: that it detached in a connected manner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הַאי מוּלַיְיתָא — שַׁרְיָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא קָא בָּלַע דְּמָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּבוֹלְעָהּ כָּךְ פּוֹלְטָהּ.
human_translation: Rabba said: This stuffing is permitted, Abaye said to him: But absorbs blood He said to him: As it absorbs it, so it emits it.
llm_translation: Rabba said: The foreskin - permitted. Abaye said to him: But he is swallowing blood! He said to him: Just as he swallows it, so does he expel it.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: נוֹתֵן אֶת כְּרָעָיו וְאֶת בְּנֵי מֵעָיו לְתוֹכוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא — לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן כְּבוֹלְעוֹ כָּךְ פּוֹלְטוֹ? אָמְרִי: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא בֵּית הַשְּׁחִיטָה דִּמְחַלְחֵל,
human_translation: Let us say that supports him: He places its legs and its entrails inside What is the reason not because we say: As it absorbs it, so it emits it? Say it is different there, Since there is the place of the slaughter, which is hollow
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Nayma assists him: He places his legs and his intestines inside it. What is the reason? — Is it not because we say, 'Just as he swallows, so he expels'? They said: It is different there, since there is a slaughterhouse that is trembling,"

hebrew_text: מֵידָב דָּיְיבִי.
human_translation: flows
llm_translation: From the words of Daibi.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הַלֵּב, קוֹרְעוֹ וּמוֹצִיא אֶת דָּמוֹ. לֹא קְרָעוֹ — קוֹרְעוֹ לְאַחַר בִּישּׁוּלוֹ, וּמוּתָּר. מַאי טַעְמָא — לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן כְּבוֹלְעוֹ כָּךְ פּוֹלְטוֹ?
human_translation: Let us say supports him: the heart tear it and remove its blood he did not tear it he tears it after it is cooked, and it is permitted. What is the reason Is it not because we say as it absorbs it, so it emits it,
llm_translation: Nayma assists him: The heart, tearing it and extracting its blood. If he did not tear it — he tears it after its cooking, and it is permitted. What is the reason? Not because we say, "As he swallows, so he vomits"?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי לֵב, דְּשִׁיעַ.
human_translation: A heart is different it is smooth
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Shanei lev, d'shia." Translation: "Two hearts, that is a demon."

hebrew_text: (אִינִי) וְהָא רָבִין סָבָא טַפְלֵיהּ הָהִיא בַּר גּוֹזָלָא לְרַב, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מְעַלֵּי טִפְלֵיהּ, הַב לִי וְאֵיכוֹל! הָהִיא בִּסְמִידָא דְּמִפְּרִיר.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Ravin the Elder wrap a particular young dove in dough for Rav and said to him: If its dough good, give me and I will eat? That fine flour [ semida ], which is crumbly
llm_translation: (אִינִי) - I וְהָא - And this רָבִין - Rabbin סָבָא - Elder טַפְלֵיהּ - His disciple הָהִיא - That בַּר - Son of גּוֹזָלָא - A robber לְרַב - To the Rabbi וַאֲמַר - And he said לֵיהּ - To him אִי - If מְעַלֵּי - You remove טִפְלֵיהּ - Your hand הַב - Bring לִי - To me וְאֵיכוֹל - And eat הָהִיא - That בִּסְמִידָא - In a place of fasting דְּמִפְּרִיר - That he was breaking fast

hebrew_text: וְהָא רָבָא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא וּטְפַלוּ לֵיהּ בַּר אֲווֹזָא, אָמַר: אִי לָא דַּחֲזִיתֵיהּ דְּזִיג כְּזוּזָא חִיוָּרָא, לָא אֲכַלִי מִינֵּיהּ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ ״כְּבוֹלְעוֹ כָּךְ פּוֹלְטוֹ״ — מַאי אִירְיָא כִּי זִיג? אֲפִילּוּ כִּי לָא זִיג, נָמֵי! הָתָם בְּחִיוָּרְתָּא דְּשָׁרִיר.
human_translation: Didn’t Rava happen to the house of the Exilarch, and they breaded a young goose for him, he said: If I had not seen that is clear as a white, coin, I not eat from it And if it should enter your mind as it absorbs it so it emits it, why particularly because it was clear? Even if it was not clear, also There, white which is firm
llm_translation: And Rava happened to come to the house of the head of the exile, and they served him a dish of gourd. He said: If you did not see that it is as green as leek, do not eat of it. And if you think, "Like swallowing, so it will come out," what is the difference if it is green? Even if it is not green, it is still harmful! There, it is in the sharpness of the taste.

hebrew_text: וְהִילְכְתָא: דִּסְמִידָא, בֵּין אַסְמֵיק בֵּין לָא אַסְמֵיק — שַׁרְיָא. דְּחִיוָּרְתָּא, אִי זִיג כְּזוּזָא חִיוָּרָא — שַׁרְיָא, אִי לָא — אֲסִיר. דִּשְׁאָר קְמָחִים, אַסְמֵיק — אָסוּר, לָא אַסְמֵיק — שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: And the halakha is of fine flour, whether it turned red or did not turn red, it is permitted. of white If it is clear like a white coin, it is permitted; if not, it is prohibited. of other flour, turned red, it is prohibited; it did not turn red, it is permitted.
llm_translation: The Gemara: Regarding dye, whether it is absorbed or not absorbed - permitted. Regarding a wall, if it is similar to a doorpost - permitted, if not - prohibited. Regarding other types of flour, if it is absorbed - forbidden, if not absorbed - allowed.

hebrew_text: הַאי מוּלַיְיתָא, מַאן דְּאָסַר — אֲפִילּוּ פּוּמָּא לְתַחַת, וּמַאן דְּשָׁרֵי — אֲפִילּוּ פּוּמָּא לְעֵיל. וְהִילְכְתָא: מוּלַיְיתָא שְׁרֵי, אֲפִילּוּ פּוּמָּא לְעֵיל.
human_translation: this stuffing The one who prohibits even the opening downward, And the one who permits even the opening upward. And the halakha is that stuffing is permitted even the opening upward,
llm_translation: This circumcision, whoever prohibited - even a mouth below, and whoever permitted - even a mouth above. And the conclusion: circumcision is permitted, even a mouth above.

hebrew_text: אוּמְצָא, בֵּיעֵי, וּמִיזְרְקֵי, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא. בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ רַב אַחָא לְחוּמְרָא וְרָבִינָא לְקוּלָּא, וְהִילְכְתָא כְּרָבִינָא לְקוּלָּא. לְבַר מֵהָנֵי תְּלָת דְּרַב אַחָא לְקוּלָּא וְרָבִינָא לְחוּמְרָא, וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרַב אַחָא לְקוּלָּא.
human_translation: Raw meat [ umtza ] testicles and veins Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagreed about this. In all the Torah, Rav Aḥa is stringent and Ravina is lenient, and the halakha is in accordance with Ravina to be lenient. except for these three, Rav Aḥa is lenient and Ravina is stringent, and the halakha is in accordance with Rav Aḥa to be lenient.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Um'tza, be'eiyei, u'miz'rekei, pligi ba Rav Acha v'Ravina. Be'chol ha'Torah kula Rav Acha l'chumra v'Ravina l'kula, v'hilch'ta k'Ravina l'kula. L'var me'hanei t'lat d'Rav Acha l'kula v'Ravina l'chumra, v'hilch'ta k'Rav Acha l'kula." English translation: "He found, in the islands, and in the rivers, they dispute: Rav Acha and Ravina. In the entire Torah, all of it, Rav Acha leans towards stringency and Ravina towards leniency, and the halacha follows Ravina towards leniency. In three matters, Rav Acha leans towards leniency and Ravina towards stringency, and the halacha follows Rav Acha towards leniency."

hebrew_text: הַאי אוּמְצָא דְּאַסְמֵיק, חַתְכֵיהּ וּמַלְחֵיהּ — אֲפִילּוּ לִקְדֵרָה שְׁרֵי. שַׁפְּדֵיהּ בְּשַׁפּוּדָא — שְׁרֵי, מֵידָב דָּיֵיב. אַחֲתֵיהּ אַגּוּמְרֵי — פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא, חַד אָסַר וְחַד שָׁרֵי. מַאן דְּאָסַר, מִצְמָית צָמֵית. וּמַאן דְּשָׁרֵי, מִישְׁאָב שָׁאֵיב. וְהִילְכְתָא: מִישְׁאָב שָׁאֵיב.
human_translation: this raw meat that became red one cut it and salted it, permitted even to a pot put it on a spit it is permitted flows placed it on coals, Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagreed about this one prohibited and one permitted The one who prohibited to shrivel And the one who permitted draws out And the halakha draws out
llm_translation: This bundle of asmeik, cut it and salt it - even for a pot it is permitted. Roast it on coals - it is permitted, because of the strong heat. The Aggumrei sisters - Rav Acha and Ravina disagreed about it, one forbids and one permits. Whoever forbids, let him be silent. And whoever permits, let him speak. And the conclusion is: let him speak.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בֵּיעֵי, חַתְכִינְהוּ וּמַלְחִינְהוּ — אֲפִילּוּ לִקְדֵרָה שַׁרְיָין. תְּלִינְהוּ בְּשַׁפּוּדָא — שַׁרְיָין, מֵידָב דָּיֵיב. אַחְתִינְהוּ אַגּוּמְרֵי — פְּלִיגִי בֵּיהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא, חַד אָסַר וְחַד שָׁרֵי. מַאן דְּאָסַר, מִצְמָית צָמֵית. וּמַאן דְּשָׁרֵי, מִישְׁאָב שָׁאֵיב.
human_translation: And, so too, testicles: cut them and salted them, they are permitted even to a pot. hung them on a spit they are permitted flows placed them on coals, Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagreed about this; one prohibited and one permitted The one who prohibited it shrivels, and the one who permitted draws out
llm_translation: And so in Be'ei, they cut it and salt it — even for a pot it is permitted. They hang it in the sun — it is permitted, due to the strength of the sun. They grind it into pieces — Rav Acha and Ravina disagree about it, one forbids and one permits. Whoever forbids, he is liable to the death penalty. And whoever permits, he is liable to be lashed.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן מִיזְרְקֵי חַתְכֵיהּ וּמַלְחֵיהּ — אֲפִילּוּ לִקְדֵרָה שְׁרֵי. תַּלְיֵיהּ בְּשַׁפּוּדָא, בֵּית הַשְּׁחִיטָה לְתַתַּאי — שְׁרֵי, מֵידָב דָּאֵיב. אַחֲתֵיהּ אַגּוּמְרֵי — פְּלִיגִי רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא, חַד אָסַר וְחַד שָׁרֵי. מַאן דְּאָסַר, מִצְמָית צָמֵית. וּמַאן דְּשָׁרֵי, מִישְׁאָב שָׁאֵיב. וְהִלְכְתָא: מִישְׁאָב שָׁאֵיב.
human_translation: And, so too, veins: cut them and salted them, it is permitted even to a pot. hung them on a spit the place of the slaughter is downward, it is permitted flows placed it on coals, Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagreed about this one prohibited and one permitted The one who prohibited it shrivels, and the one who permitted draws out And the halakha draws out
llm_translation: And so too, the pouring out of its blood and its salting — even into a pot is permitted. Hang it on a spit, the slaughterhouse below — is permitted, due to the heat. The Gemara concluded — Rav Acha and Ravina disagree, one forbids and one permits. Whoever forbids, his reasoning is that it is boiling hot. And whoever permits, his reasoning is that it is being roasted. And the halakha is: it is being roasted.

hebrew_text: הַאי אוּמְצָא דְּאַסְמֵיק חַלְיֵיהּ — אֲסִיר. לָא אַסְמֵיק חַלְיֵיהּ — שְׁרֵי. רָבִינָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ לָא אַסְמֵיק נָמֵי חַלְיֵיהּ — אֲסִיר, אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלֵית בֵּהּ שׁוּרְיָיקֵי דְּמָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר בַּר אַמֵּימָר לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אַבָּא מְגַמַּע לֵיהּ גַּמּוֹעֵי. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: רַב אָשֵׁי גּוּפֵיהּ מְגַמַּע לֵיהּ גַּמּוֹעֵי.
human_translation: This raw meat, whose vinegar became red is forbidden. its vinegar did not become red, it is permitted. Ravina said: Even its vinegar did not become red, it is forbidden; it is impossible that it does not have streaks of blood. Mar bar Ameimar said to Rav Ashi: Father, would swallow Some say Rav Ashi himself would swallow it.
llm_translation: This found object that he leaned on his illness - forbidden. If he did not lean on his illness - permitted. Ravina said: Even if he did not lean on his illness, it is forbidden, for it is impossible that there are no drops of blood in it. Mar son of Amemar said to Rav Ashi: The father is causing him to be guilty. Some say: Rav Ashi himself is causing him to be guilty.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר בַּר אַמֵּימָר לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אַבָּא, הַאי חַלָּא דְּחָלֵיט בֵּיהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא, תּוּ לָא תָּאנֵי חָלֵיט בֵּיהּ. מַאי שְׁנָא מֵחַלָּא מַתְמְהָא דְּחָלְטִינַן בֵּיהּ? הָתָם — אִיתֵיהּ
human_translation: Mar bar Ameimar said to Rav Ashi: father, vinegar in which he had soaked one time he would not soak in it again. what different from weak vinegar, in which we soak There, the
llm_translation: He said to him, Master Bar Amemar to Rav Ashe: Abba, this vinegar that has vinegarized in it once, if it has not vinegarized in it again. What is the difference between vinegar that we vinegarize in it? There — it is present.

hebrew_text: לְקִיּוּהָא דְפֵירָא בְּעֵינֵיהּ. הָכָא — לֵיתָא לְקִיּוּהָא דְפֵירָא בְּעֵינֵיהּ.
human_translation: sharpness of the fruit in its pure, Here, the sharpness of the fruit does not in its pure,
llm_translation: The piercing of the eye of a wild ox. Here - there is no piercing of the eye of a wild ox.

hebrew_text: אֵין צוֹלִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח וְכוּ׳. מַעֲשֶׂה לִסְתּוֹר?! חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: וְאִם אַסְכָּלָא מְנוּקֶּבֶת — מוּתָּר. וְאָמַר רַבִּי צָדוֹק, מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁאָמַר לְטָבִי עַבְדּוֹ: צֵא וּצְלֵה לָנוּ אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הָאַסְכָּלָא מְנוּקֶּבֶת.
human_translation: one not roast the Paschal lamb an incident to contradict is incomplete and is teaching the following: And if it is a perforated grill, it is permitted. And Rabbi Tzadok said there was an incident with Rabban Gamliel, who said to his slave Tavi: Go and roast the Paschal lamb for us on the perforated grill.
llm_translation: The Passover sacrifice is not roasted, etc. A story to conceal?! Due to lacking in the supply, and thus it was taught: "And if it is perforated — it is permitted." And Rabbi Tzadok said, there was an incident with Rabban Gamliel who said to his servant Tavi: "Go out and roast the Passover sacrifice for us on the perforated skewer."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר אִידִי מֵרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: תַּנּוּר שֶׁהִסִּיקוֹ בִּקְלִיפֵּי עׇרְלָה וּגְרָפוֹ וְאָפָה בּוֹ אֶת הַפַּת, לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹסֵר, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַפַּת מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana bar Idi raised a dilemma before Rav Adda bar Ahava: an oven that one fired with peels of orla , he swept it and he baked bread in it, according to the opinion that prohibits what is He said to him: The bread is permitted.
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Chinana bar Idi from Rav Adda bar Ahava: A stove that they lined with foreskin shells and they scraped it and baked bread in it, according to the one who prohibits, what is the ruling? He said to him: The bread is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָאָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא סָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תַּנּוּר שֶׁהִסִּיקוֹ וּגְרָפוֹ וְצָלָה בּוֹ אֶת הַפֶּסַח — אֵין זֶה צְלִי אֵשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״צְלִי אֵשׁ ... צְלִי אֵשׁ״, שְׁתֵּי פְעָמִים.
human_translation: said to him: But didn’t Rav Ḥinnana the Elder say Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: an oven that one fired and swept and roasted the Paschal lamb in it, this is not roasted in fire, as it is stated roasted in fire, roasted in fire; two times,
llm_translation: He said to him: And didn't Rav Chinana the Elder say in the name of Rabbi Assi in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A stove that they sealed and plastered and roasted the Passover offering in it - this is not roasted by fire, as it is stated "roasted by fire... roasted by fire," twice.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּגַלִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״צְלִי אֵשׁ״ ״צְלִי אֵשׁ״ שְׁתֵּי פְעָמִים. הָא לָא גַּלִּי רַחֲמָנָא, הֲוֵי אָמֵינָא צְלִי אֵשׁ הוּא.
human_translation: The reason the Merciful One reveals Roasted in fire, roasted in fire, twice. But the Merciful One had not revealed I would have said is roasted in fire.
llm_translation: Reason of the Merciful One, "Tzeli Esh" "Tzeli Esh" two times. This is not the reason of the Merciful One, I would say "Tzeli Esh" it is.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּלִּי רַחֲמָנָא הָתָם, וְיָלְפִינַן מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: said to The Merciful One reveals it there, and we learn from it
llm_translation: He said to him: Reveal the Merciful One there, and we will learn from it.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָתָם טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״צְלִי אֵשׁ״ שְׁתֵּי פְעָמִים, הָא לָא כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״צְלִי אֵשׁ״ שְׁתֵּי פְעָמִים, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אַאֵשׁ קָפֵיד רַחֲמָנָא, וַאֲפִילּוּ גְּרָפוֹ נָמֵי — צְלִי אֵשׁ הוּא. אֲבָל הָכָא, אַעֵצִים דְּאִיסּוּרָא קָא קָפֵיד רַחֲמָנָא, וְהָא לֵיתַנְהוּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say There, the reason is that the Merciful One writes “roasted in fire” twice. But the Merciful One had not written “roasted in fire” twice, I would have said that the Merciful One is particular about fire, and even if one swept it, it is roasted in fire. But here, the Merciful One is particular about the prohibited fuel, and it is not here
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: There, the reason that the Merciful One wrote "burning fire" twice, but here He did not write "burning fire" twice, I would say: The Merciful One is particular about fire, and even if it is a coal, it is considered burning fire. But here, the Merciful One is particular about the wood of prohibition, and it does not have them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲתָכוֹ, וּנְתָנוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי גֶּחָלִים. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי שֶׁזֶּה צְלִי אֵשׁ. רָמֵי לֵיהּ רַב אַחָדְבוּי בַּר אַמֵּי לְרַב חִסְדָּא: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי גֶּחָלִים אֵשׁ נִינְהוּ?
human_translation: The Sages taught: one cuts and places it on coals, Rabbi says: I say that this is roasted in fire, Rav Aḥadvoi bar Ami raised a contradiction to Rav Ḥisda: Did Rabbi say that coals are fire?
llm_translation: The sages taught: They cut it and placed it on top of coals. Rabbi says: I say that this is roasted by fire. Rav Achadboi son of Ammi objected to Rav Chisda: Who said that coals are considered fire?

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ ״מִכְוַת אֵשׁ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּכְוָה בְּאֵשׁ, נִכְוָה בְּגַחֶלֶת, בְּרֶמֶץ, בְּסִיד רוֹתֵחַ, בְּגִפְסִיס רוֹתֵחַ, וְכׇל דָּבָר הַבָּא מִן הָאוּר, לְאֵיתוֹיֵי חַמֵּי הָאוּר, מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִכְוָה״ ״מִכְוָה״ רִיבָּה.
human_translation: raised a contradiction a burn from fire” nothing other it is burned by fire is burned by a coal, by burning ash, by burning lime, by burning plaster [ gipsis ], or anything and comes from fire, to include water heated by fire, from where The verse states: A burn, a burn, it includes
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: "From the burning of fire," I have only that which is burned in fire, burned in a coal, in ashes, in boiling lime, in boiling gypsum, and anything that comes from light, to include the heat of the light, from where? The Talmud teaches: "Burned," "burned," it expanded.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״מִכְוָה״ ״מִכְוָה״, הָא לָא רַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״מִכְוָה״ ״מִכְוָה״, גֶּחָלִים לָאו אֵשׁ נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: The reason is that the Merciful One includes A burn, a burn. But the Merciful One had not included a burn, a burn, coals are not fire,
llm_translation: Reason of Rabbi Rachmana "mikvah" "mikvah," this not Rabbi Rachmana "mikvah" "mikvah," coals not fire they are!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּחֶלֶת שֶׁל עֵץ לָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְרַבּוֹיֵי. כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְגַחֶלֶת שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת.
human_translation: He said to him: wood coal, not necessary the verse to include it. Where a verse is necessary to piece of metal
llm_translation: He said to him: A coal of wood does not require a verse for its extinguishing. For a verse is required for a coal of metal.

hebrew_text: וְגֶחָלִים שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת לָאו אֵשׁ הוּא? וְהָא גַּבֵּי בַּת כֹּהֵן, דִּכְתִיב: ״בָּאֵשׁ תִּשָּׂרֵף״. וְאָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: פְּתִילָה שֶׁל אֲבָר הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין לָהּ!
human_translation: And are pieces of metal not fire? But with regard to a daughter of a priest it is written: in fire she shall be burned” and Rav Mattana said: they would prepare for her bar of lead.
llm_translation: And coals of metal not fire it is? But there is regarding the daughter of a priest, as it is written: "She shall be burned with fire." And Rav Matna said: They used to make a wick of a limb for it!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״בָּאֵשׁ תִּשָּׂרֵף״, ״תִּשָּׂרֵף״ — לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל שְׂרֵיפוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מִן הָאֵשׁ.
human_translation: It is different there, as the verse states “in fire she shall be burned.” “she shall be burned” to include all burnings that come from fire.
llm_translation: The matter is different there, for the verse states: "It shall be burned with fire," "it shall be burned" — to include all burnings that come from fire.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן אֵשׁ עַצְמָהּ. וְנַקֵּיף לַהּ חֲבִילֵי זְמוֹרוֹת וְנִקְלַהּ! אָתְיָא ״שְׂרֵיפָה״ ״שְׂרֵיפָה״ מִבְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן. מָה לְהַלָּן — שְׂרֵיפַת נְשָׁמָה וְגוּף קַיָּים, אַף כָּאן — שְׂרֵיפַת נְשָׁמָה וְגוּף קַיָּים.
human_translation: all the more so fire itself Let us surround her bundles of branches and burn her It comes “burning” “burning” the sons of Aaron: Just as below, a burning of the soul and the body remained, so too, here, burning of the soul and the body remains.
llm_translation: And all the more so, fire itself. And it will encompass it with bundles of branches and it will be light! It was taught: "burning" "burning" from the sons of Aaron. Just as there — the burning of the soul and the body endure, so too here — the burning of the soul and the body endure.

hebrew_text: וְנַעְבֵּיד לַהּ חַמֵּי הָאוּר? מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב נַחְמָן, דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמוֹךָ״, בְּרוֹר לוֹ מִיתָה יָפָה.
human_translation: Let us her with water heated by fire. due to Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman said the verse states: “And you shall love your fellow as yourself” select for him a kind death.
llm_translation: And we bring before her hot water? Because Rav Nachman said, as Rav Nachman said: The verse says, "You shall love your neighbor as yourself," implying for him a beautiful death.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּאִיכָּא רַב נַחְמָן, גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לְמָה לִי? אָמְרִי: אִי לָאו גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: שְׂרֵיפַת נְשָׁמָה וְגוּף קַיָּים — לָאו שְׂרֵיפָה הִיא. וְאִי מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב נַחְמָן — נַיפֵּושׁ לַהּ חֲבִילֵי זְמוֹרוֹת טוּבָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דִּתְמוּת בַּעֲגָלָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Once there is Rav Naḥman, why do I the verbal analogy Say If not verbal analogy, I would have said that burning the soul the body remains is not burning. And if due to Rav Naḥman we should add many bundles of branches so that she would die quickly. teaches us
llm_translation: And when there is no Rav Nachman, why do I need a similar decree? They said: If it is not a similar decree, I would have said: Burning of the soul and the body is not considered burning. And if it is because of Rav Nachman, it is preferable for him to be tied with bundles of strong reeds, so that he dies in the wagon, as it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא ״בָּאֵשׁ״ לְמָה לִי? לְאַפּוֹקֵי אֲבָר מֵעִיקָּרוֹ.
human_translation: But for what do I need “in fire”? To exclude lead from its source.
llm_translation: And rather "with fire" why to me? To extract a limb from its source.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי זֵירָא: וְכֹל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב ״בָּאֵשׁ תִּשָּׂרֵף״, לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל שְׂרֵיפוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מֵחֲמַת אֵשׁ הוּא? וְהָא גַּבֵּי פָּרִים הַנִּשְׂרָפִים, דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ: ״וְשָׂרַף אֹתוֹ עַל עֵצִים בָּאֵשׁ״, וְתַנְיָא: ״בָּאֵשׁ״ וְלֹא בְּסִיד רוֹתֵחַ, וְלֹא בְּגִפְסִיס רוֹתֵחַ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: anywhere that it is written: “In fire she shall be burned” to include all burning that come from fire? But bulls that are burned, which it is written: “And he shall burn it on wood in fire, and it was taught In fire, and not in burning lime and not in burning plaster?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: And wherever it is written "shall be burned with fire," to include all burnings that come from fire itself? But what about the bulls that are burned, as it is written about them: "And he shall burn it on wood with fire," and it was taught: "with fire" and not with boiling lime, and not with boiling gypsum?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם כְּתִיב ״בָּאֵשׁ״ וַהֲדַר ״תִּשָּׂרֵף״ — לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל שְׂרֵיפוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מֵחֲמַת הָאֵשׁ. הָכָא כְּתִיב ״וְשָׂרַף אֹתוֹ עַל עֵצִים בָּאֵשׁ״ לְבַסּוֹף ״אֵשׁ״, לְמֵימְרָא דְּאֵשׁ — אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא — לָא.
human_translation: He said to him: How can be compared? There, it is written: “In fire,” and subsequently she shall be burned, to include all burning that come from fire. Here, it is written: “And he shall burn it on wood in fire.” At the end fire, to say that fire, yes, something else, no,
llm_translation: He said to him: Is it so now?! There it is written "with fire" and then "shall be burned" - to include all burnings that come from fire. Here it is written "and he shall burn it on wood with fire" ultimately "fire", to say that with fire - yes, from other things - no.

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי כְּתִיבָא שְׂרֵיפָה לְבַסּוֹף, דִּכְתִיב:
human_translation: There, too, burning is written at the end, as it is written
llm_translation: There, it is written at the end, for it is written:

hebrew_text: ״עַל שֶׁפֶךְ הַדֶּשֶׁן יִשָּׂרֵף״! אָמְרִי: הָהוּא ״יִשָּׂרֵף״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״יִשָּׂרֵף״ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין שָׁם דֶּשֶׁן. ״יִשָּׂרֵף״ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהִצִּית הָאוּר בְּרוּבּוֹ.
human_translation: “Where the ash is poured it shall be burned” Say: That “it shall be burned” is needed for that which was taught It shall be burned even though there is no ash there, “It shall be burned” although the fire has consumed most of it,
llm_translation: "On the ash of the pile he shall be burned!" They said: That 'he shall be burned' is needed for what the Tanna taught: 'He shall be burned' - even though there is no ash there. 'He shall be burned' - even though he ignited the fire with its majority."

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר, כְּרוֹךְ וּתְנִי: ״מִכְוַת אֵשׁ״ — אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּכְוָה בְּאֵשׁ וּבְגַחֶלֶת. נִכְוָה בְּרֶמֶץ, בְּסִיד רוֹתֵחַ, וּבְגִפְסִיס רוֹתֵחַ, וּבְכׇל דָּבָר הַבָּא מֵחֲמַת הָאוּר, לְאֵיתוֹיֵי חַמֵּי הָאוּר, מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִכְוָה״ ״מִכְוָה״ רִיבָּה.
human_translation: Ravina said Combine and teach “a burn from fire,” I have nothing other which one was burned by a fire or by a coal. burned by hot ash, by burning lime, or by burning plaster, or by anything and comes from fire, to include water heated by fire, from where The verse states: A burn, a burn, it includes
llm_translation: Ravina said, tie and teach: "from the burning of fire" - I have only that which is burned in fire and in coal. Burned in ashes, in boiling lime, and in boiling gypsum, and in anything that comes from the heat, to satisfy the heat of the fire, from where? The Talmud says: "burned" "burned" increased.

hebrew_text: רָבָא רָמֵי. מִי אָמַר רַבִּי גֶּחָלִים אִיקְּרוּ אֵשׁ? וּרְמִינְהִי: ״גַּחֲלֵי״ — יָכוֹל עוֹמְמוֹת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֵשׁ״. אִי אֵשׁ — יָכוֹל שַׁלְהֶבֶת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״גַּחֲלֵי״. הָא כֵּיצַד? מֵבִיא מִן הַלּוֹחֲשׁוֹת. (אַלְמָא גֶּחָלִים לָא אִיקְּרִי אֵשׁ!
human_translation: Rava raised a contradiction: Did Rabbi say coals are called fire? And we raise a contradiction coals, might smoldering Therefore, the verse states: Fire. If fire, might a flame. Therefore, the verse states: Coals. How One brings from the flickering, Apparently, coals are not called fire.
llm_translation: Rava raises a contradiction: Who said that Rabbi Gechelim are called "fire"? And we ask: "Gachalei" - could it mean coals? The verse teaches us: "Esh." If not fire - could it mean flames? The verse teaches us: "Gachalei." How so? One brings from the whisperers. This implies that Gechelim are not called fire!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי:) וְהָא גּוּפָא קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ: ״גַּחֲלֵי״ — יָכוֹל עוֹמְמוֹת, אַלְמָא לוֹחֲשׁוֹת אֵשׁ נִינְהוּ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אִי אֵשׁ — יָכוֹל שַׁלְהֶבֶת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״גַּחֲלֵי״, אַלְמָא אֲפִילּוּ לוֹחֲשׁוֹת לָאו אֵשׁ נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Say Isn’t this itself difficult? You said: coals, might smoldering. Apparently, flickering are fire. Say the latter clause If fire, might Therefore, the verse states: Coals. Apparently, even flickering are not fire,
llm_translation: They said: "And this itself is difficult." You said: "Coals" — could it be smoldering? This implies that they are not flames. Say the conclusion: If it is fire — could it be a flame? The Talmud teaches: "Coals." This implies that even if they are not flames.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: ״גַּחֲלֵי״ — יָכוֹל בֵּין עוֹמְמוֹת בֵּין לוֹחֲשׁוֹת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֵשׁ״. אִי אֵשׁ — יָכוֹל שַׁלְהֶבֶת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״גַּחֲלֵי״, הָא כֵּיצַד? מֵבִיא מִן הַלּוֹחֲשׁוֹת. מִכׇּל מָקוֹם גֶּחָלִים לָא אִיקְּרִי אֵשׁ, קַשְׁיָא לְרַבִּי!
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet said, This is what is teaching: coals, might whether smoldering or flickering. Therefore, the Torah states: Fire. If fire, might a flame. Therefore, the verse states: Coals. How He brings from the flickering In any event, coals, are not called fire. a difficulty Rabbi
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said thus: So it was taught: "Coals" — one might think whether they are dim or glowing, the Torah teaches: "fire." If not fire — one might think it refers to a flame, the Torah teaches: "coals." How so? One brings from the glowing. In any case, coals are not called fire, a difficulty for Rabbi!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תָּרֵיץ הָכִי: ״גַּחֲלֵי״ — יָכוֹל עוֹמְמוֹת וְלֹא לוֹחֲשׁוֹת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֵשׁ״. אִי אֵשׁ, יָכוֹל רָצָה שַׁלְהֶבֶת — יָבִיא, רָצָה גַּחֶלֶת — יָבִיא, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״גַּחֲלֵי״. הָא כֵּיצַד? מֵבִיא מִן הַלּוֹחֲשׁוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye said answer as follows: coals, might smoldering and not flickering. Therefore, the verse states: Fire. If fire, might one wanted a flame he bring he wanted a coal he bring Therefore, the Torah states: Coals. How He brings from the flickering
llm_translation: Abaye said thus: "Coals" - one might think it refers to extinguished coals and not burning ones, Scripture teaches: "fire." If not for fire, one might think it refers to a flame - he may bring a flame, if he wants to bring a coal - he may bring a coal, Scripture teaches: "coals." How so? He brings from the burning ones.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: רָצָה גַּחֶלֶת — יָבִיא, רָצָה שַׁלְהֶבֶת — יָבִיא. שַׁלְהֶבֶת בְּלֹא גַּחֶלֶת הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? כְּגוֹן דְּשַׁפְיֵיהּ לְמָנָא מִשְׁחָא וְאַתְלִי בֵּיהּ נוּרָא. הָהוּא לְמָה לִי קְרָא לְמַעוֹטֵי, הַשְׁתָּא לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וְדָם אֵין עוֹשִׂין כֵּן, לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ מַלְכֵי הַמְּלָכִים הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: Rabba said: he wanted a coal he bring if he wanted a flame he bring what circumstances a flame without a coal be found? where one smears a utensil with oil and lights it on fire. this, why do I a verse to exclude it Now, in front of a king of flesh and blood one does not do this, in front of the King of kings, the Holy One, Blessed be He, not all the more so
llm_translation: Rabba said: If one wants a coal - let him bring it, if one wants a flame - let him bring it. How can one find a flame without a coal? For example, if one blows on oil and a fire comes out of it. Why do I need a verse to teach me this, now before a human king of flesh and blood they do not do so, before the King of kings, the Holy One, blessed be He, all the more so!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, תָּרֵיץ הָכִי: ״גַּחֲלֵי״ — יָכוֹל עוֹמְמוֹת וְלֹא לוֹחֲשׁוֹת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֵשׁ״. אִי אֵשׁ — יָכוֹל יָבִיא מֶחֱצָה גַּחֶלֶת וּמֶחֱצָה שַׁלְהֶבֶת, אַדְּעָיֵיל לְגַוַּאי הָוֵי כּוּלֵּיהּ גַּחֶלֶת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְלָקַח מְלֹא הַמַּחְתָּה גַּחֲלֵי אֵשׁ מֵעַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, מִשְּׁעַת לְקִיחָה נִיהְוֵי גֶּחָלִים.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said answer as follows: coals, might smoldering and not flickering; therefore, the verse states: Fire. If fire, might one should bring half coal and half fire, by he enters inside and it will be all coal. Therefore, the verse states: “And he shall take a coal-pan full of burning coals from upon the altar” from the time of taking they should be coals
llm_translation: Rava said thus: "Coals" - one might think this refers to dim coals and not to bright ones. Scripture teaches: "Fire." If it were just fire - one might think one should bring half a coal and half a flame, but in the case of the altar, all of it should be a coal. Scripture teaches: "And he shall take a panful of coals of fire from off the altar," from the moment of taking, they become coals.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אוֹמְמוֹת אוֹ עוֹמְמוֹת? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: ״אֲרָזִים לֹא עֲמָמֻהוּ בְּגַן אֱלֹהִים״.
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before omemot or omemot Rabbi Yitzḥak said: “The cedars in the garden of God could not hide it [ amamuhu ]”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: He asked them: "Ommot or Om'mot?" Rabbi Yitzchak said: "They did not make it dense with cedars in the garden of God."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָגַע בְּחַרְסוֹ שֶׁל תַּנּוּר — יִקְלוֹף אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ. נָטַף מֵרוֹטְבּוֹ עַל הַחֶרֶס וְחָזַר אֵלָיו — יִטּוֹל אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ. נָטַף מֵרוֹטְבּוֹ עַל הַסּוֹלֶת — יִקְמוֹץ אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: touched earthenware of an oven, one peel its place of gravy dripped on the earthenware and returned to it, one remove its place. of gravy dripped onto flour, one remove a handful of its place,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one touched the earthenware of an oven - he should scrape off its place. If some of its moisture dripped onto the earthenware and then returned to it - he should remove its place. If some of its moisture dripped onto the flour - he should scoop out its place.

hebrew_text: סָכוֹ בְּשֶׁמֶן תְּרוּמָה, אִם חֲבוּרַת כֹּהֲנִים — יֹאכֵלוּ. אִם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, אִם חַי הוּא — יְדִיחֶנּוּ. וְאִם צָלִי הוּא — יִקְלוֹף אֶת הַחִיצוֹן. סָכוֹ בְּשֶׁמֶן שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי — לֹא יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ דָּמִים עַל בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה, שֶׁאֵין פּוֹדִין מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: smears with teruma oil, if a group of priests they may eat it, If of Israelites, if raw, one rinse it and if it is roasted, one peel off the outer one smears with oil of second tithe, he may not demand money for it from the members of the group, as one not redeem second tithe in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: Sukkah in oil of terumah, if it is attached to the kohanim — they may eat it. If it belongs to an Israelite, if it is alive — they shall shake it off. And if it is roasted — they shall peel off the outer layer. Sukkah in oil of second tithe — one should not make it impure for the children of the group, for they do not redeem second tithe in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר: חַם לְתוֹךְ חַם — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל
human_translation: It was stated a hot into hot all agree
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Cham letokh cham - divrei hakol." English translation: "Hot within hot - the words of everyone."

hebrew_text: אָסוּר. צוֹנֵן לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר. חַם לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן, וְצוֹנֵן לְתוֹךְ חַם, רַב אָמַר: עִילָּאָה גָּבַר. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: תַּתָּאָה גָּבַר.
human_translation: forbidden, cold into cold all agree it is permitted; hot into a cold a cold into a hot Rav said: The upper one prevails. And Shmuel said: The lower one prevails.
llm_translation: Forbidden. Cold into cold - the words of all are permitted. Hot into cold, and cold into hot, Rav said: the upper one prevails. And Shmuel said: the lower one prevails.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: נָטַף מֵרוֹטְבּוֹ עַל הַחֶרֶס וְחָזַר אֵלָיו — יִטּוֹל אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ. קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ בְּחֶרֶס צוֹנֶנֶת. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב דְּאָמַר ״עִילָּאָה גָּבַר״, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי יִטּוֹל אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ — דְּאָזֵל רוֹטֶב מַרְתַּח לֵיהּ לְחֶרֶס, וְהָדַר חֶרֶס מַרְתַּח לֵיהּ לְרוֹטֶב. וְכִי הָדַר רוֹטֶב אַפֶּסַח — קָא מִטְּוֵי פֶּסַח מֵחֲמַת חַמִּימוּתָא דְחֶרֶס, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״צְלִי אֵשׁ״, וְלֹא צָלִי מֵחֲמַת דָּבָר אַחֵר.
human_translation: We learned of the gravy of dripped onto the earthenware and returned to it, one remove its place. It enter your mind cold earthenware. Granted, according to Rav, who said the upper one prevails, due to this one remove its place. the gravy goes and heats the earthenware, and then the earthenware heats the gravy, and when the gravy returns to the Paschal lamb, the Paschal lamb becomes roasted from the heat of the earthenware, and the Merciful One states “Roasted in fire” and not roasted due to something else.
llm_translation: We learned: If one drips from his wine onto a shard and it returns to him - he should take its place. The reason for your question is a cracked shard. According to Rav who says "the upper one prevails," for this reason he should take its place - because the moisture goes from the wine to the shard, and then the shard's moisture goes to the wine. And if the wine's moisture returns - it is because the Pesach offering is roasting due to the heat of the shard, and the Merciful One said "roast with fire," and not roasted due to something else.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר ״תַּתָּאָה גָּבַר״, חֶרֶס כֵּיוָן דְּצוֹנֵן הוּא — אַקּוֹרֵי מֵיקַר לֵיהּ לְרוֹטֶב, אַמַּאי יִטּוֹל אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ? כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּסוֹלֶת רוֹתַחַת, הָכָא נָמֵי בְּחֶרֶס רוֹתֵחַ.
human_translation: But according to Shmuel, who said the lower one prevails, since the earthenware is cold, it cools down the gravy. why must he remove its place? As Rabbi Yirmeya said Shmuel said hot flour. Here, too, hot earthenware.
llm_translation: Instead, to Shmuel who said, "The lower one prevails," since he is cold — he should dig a hole to make it warm, why should he take its place? As Rabbi Yirmiyah said in the name of Shmuel: In boiling flour, here too in a boiling pot.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: נָטַף מֵרוֹטְבּוֹ עַל הַסּוֹלֶת יִקְמוֹץ אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ. קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ בְּסוֹלֶת צוֹנֶנֶת. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב דְּאָמַר ״עִילָּאָה גָּבַר״, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי יִקְמוֹץ אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ — דְּמַרְתַּח לַהּ לְסוֹלֶת דְּהָדַר הוּדְרָנֵיהּ, וְהָדְרָא סוֹלֶת וּמַרְתְּחָא לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ, וְקָא מִטְּוֵי רוֹטֶב מֵחֲמַת חַמִּימוּתָא דְסוֹלֶת, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״צְלִי אֵשׁ״, וְלֹא צָלִי מֵחֲמַת דָּבָר אַחֵר.
human_translation: We learned of gravy dripped onto flour, one remove a handful of its place. It enter your mind cold flour. Granted, according to Rav, who said the upper one prevails, due to this one remove a handful its place, as heats the flour around it, and the flour then heats and the gravy is roasted from the heat of the flour, and the Merciful One states “Roasted in fire,” and not roasted due to something else.
llm_translation: We learned: If one drips from his stew onto the flour, he should scrape its place. Your mind has come to the conclusion regarding fine flour. According to Rav who says, "A man is superior," for this reason he should scrape its place - because he has mixed it with fine flour, and the fine flour has adorned it, and the adornment of the fine flour and the stew are pleasing to each other, and it causes the stew to drip due to the heat of the fine flour, and the Merciful One said, "Roast with fire," and it did not roast due to any other reason.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר ״תַּתָּאָה גָּבַר״, סוֹלֶת כֵּיוָן דְּצוֹנֶנֶת הִיא — אַקּוֹרֵי קָא מֵיקַר לֵיהּ, לְמָה לִי יִקְמוֹץ אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ? (תִּסְגֵּי לֵיהּ בְּיִטּוֹל אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ!) אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּסוֹלֶת רוֹתַחַת.
human_translation: But according to Shmuel, who said the lower one prevails, since the flour is cold it cools down why do I One remove a handful its place? It should be enough for one to remove its place, Rabbi Yirmeya said Shmuel said: hot flour.
llm_translation: Instead, to Shmuel who said, "The lower part is stronger," since it is well-kneaded flour - the verse is calling out to him, "Why should he take away his place?" (Let him take away his place!) Rabbi Yirmiyah said in the name of Shmuel: With boiling flour.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: סָכוֹ בְּשֶׁמֶן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, אִם חֲבוּרַת כֹּהֲנִים — יֹאכֵלוּ. אִם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, אִם חַי הוּא — יְדִיחֶנּוּ, אִם צָלִי הוּא — יִקְלוֹף אֶת הַחִיצוֹן. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב דְּאָמַר ״עִילָּאָה גָּבַר״, אַמְּטוּ לְהָכִי סַגִּי לֵיהּ בִּקְלִיפָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּעִילָּאָה צוֹנֵן הוּא.
human_translation: We learned one smears with teruma oil, if a group of priests they may eat it, If of Israelites, if raw, one rinse it and if it is roasted, one peel off the outer Granted, according to Rav, who said the upper one prevails, for this it is sufficient peel, because the upper one is cold
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If a Sukkah is made with oil of Terumah, if it is attached to Kohanim - they may eat in it. If it is made with oil of Yisrael, if it is raw - they should smear it, if it is cooked - they should peel off the outer layer. According to Rav who says "the upper part is stronger," they should therefore attach a covering to it, because the upper part is cold.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר ״תַּתָּאָה גָּבַר״, כֵּיוָן דְּחַם הוּא — מִבְלָע בָּלַע, אַמַּאי סַגִּי לֵיהּ בִּקְלִיפָה? נִיתְּסַר לִגְמָרֵי! שָׁאנֵי סִיכָה, דְּמַשֶּׁהוּ בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דַּעֲבִידָא.
human_translation: But to Shmuel, who said: The lower one prevails, since is hot, it absorbs why is it enough for it peel It should be entirely forbidden. Smearing is different because it is done with only a minute amount.
llm_translation: Instead, to Shmuel who said, "The lower one prevails," since he is hot - he swallows it whole. Why does he need to coat it with a peel? It is completely removed! This is different, as it is a covering, for it is something that is done in the world.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: חַם לְתוֹךְ חַם — אָסוּר. וְכֵן צוֹנֵן שֶׁנָּתַן לְתוֹךְ חַם — אָסוּר. חַם לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן וְצוֹנֵן לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן — מֵדִיחַ.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Shmuel: hot into hot it is forbidden. And, so too, cold that one put into hot is forbidden. hot into cold and cold into cold one rinse
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Shmuel: Hot into hot - forbidden. And similarly, cold that was placed into hot - forbidden. Hot into cold, and cold into cold - permissible.

hebrew_text: חַם לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן מֵדִיחַ — כֵּיוָן דְּחָם הוּא, אַדְּמֵיקַר לֵיהּ — אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלָא בָּלַע פּוּרְתָּא, קְלִיפָה מִיהָא נִיבְעֵי! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: חַם לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן — קוֹלֵף, צוֹנֵן לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן — מֵדִיחַ.
human_translation: hot into cold one rinse Since it is hot, until cools it, it is impossible that it will not absorb a little it should at least require peel; Rather, say hot into cold one peel cold into cold one rinse
llm_translation: Hot into cold inside, it causes to spoil — once it is hot, it is recognizable; if it were not to swallow a coal, it would spit out a peel! Rather say: hot into cold — it spoils, cold into cold — it chills.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: בָּשָׂר רוֹתֵחַ שֶׁנָּפַל לְתוֹךְ חָלָב רוֹתֵחַ, וְכֵן צוֹנֵן שֶׁנָּפַל לְתוֹךְ חַם — אָסוּר. חַם לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן וְצוֹנֵן לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן — מֵדִיחַ. חַם לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן מֵדִיחַ — כֵּיוָן דְּחַם הוּא, אַדְּמֵיקַר לֵיהּ — אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלָא בָּלַע פּוּרְתָּא, קְלִיפָה מִיהָא נִיבְעֵי! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: חַם לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן — קוֹלֵף, צוֹנֵן לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן — מֵדִיחַ.
human_translation: It was taught another Hot meat that fell into hot milk, and so too, cold that fell into hot is prohibited. hot into cold and cold into cold one rinse hot into cold one rinse Since it is hot, until cools it, it is impossible that it will not absorb a little it should at least require peel. Rather, say hot into cold one peel cold into cold one rinse
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The flesh of a boiling animal that fell into boiling milk, and likewise, the flesh of a frozen animal that fell into hot milk — is forbidden. If hot flesh fell into frozen milk, and frozen flesh fell into frozen milk — it is rinsed. If hot flesh fell into frozen milk and it is rinsed — since it is hot, it is recognizable, and one may eat it. Otherwise, it is impossible that the skin would not absorb the milk. Rather say: If hot flesh fell into frozen milk — it is peeled off, and if frozen flesh fell into frozen milk — it is rinsed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: צוֹנֵן לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן — מֵדִיחַ. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא מְלָחוֹ, אֲבָל מְלָחוֹ — אָסוּר. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מָלִיחַ הֲרֵי הוּא כְּרוֹתֵחַ. כָּבוּשׁ הֲרֵי הוּא כִּמְבוּשָּׁל.
human_translation: The Master said cold into cold one rinse Rav Huna said: They taught only he did not salt However, if he salted it is forbidden, as Shmuel said: A salted is like a boiling marinated is like a cooked
llm_translation: Master said: One who salts into salt - invalidates. Rav Huna said: They only taught this regarding unsalted meat, but salted meat - prohibited. For Shmuel said: Salting is like boiling, soaking is like cooking.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָא דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מָלִיחַ הֲרֵי הוּא כְּרוֹתֵחַ (וְכוּ׳) — לֹא (אֲמַרַן) [שָׁנוּ] אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱכָל מֵחֲמַת מִלְחוֹ, אֲבָל נֶאֱכָל מֵחֲמַת מִלְחוֹ — לֹא.
human_translation: Rava said: that which Shmuel said, a salted is like a boiling we said only it is not eaten due to its salt. But eaten due to its salt, not
llm_translation: Rava said: This that Shmuel said, "Salting is like cooking" - we do not say except that it is not eaten due to its saltiness, but if it is eaten due to its saltiness - no.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא בַּר גּוֹזָלָא דִּנְפַל לְכַדָּא דְּכַמְכָּא, שַׁרְיֵיא רַב חִינָּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מִפַּשְׁרוּנְיָא.
human_translation: a particular young bird that fell into a jug of kamka , Rav Ḥinnana, son of Rava of Pashronya, permitted
llm_translation: That son of Gozala who fell into a pit of lime, Rav Chinana, son of Rava, released him with a pickaxe.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאן חַכִּים לְמִישְׁרֵא מִילְּתָא כִּי הָא, אִי לָאו רַב חִינָּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מִפַּשְׁרוּנְיָא, דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא. אָמַר לְךָ, כִּי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מָלִיחַ הֲרֵי הוּא כְּרוֹתֵחַ — שֶׁאֵין נֶאֱכָל מֵחֲמַת מִלְחוֹ, הַאי נֶאֱכָל מֵחֲמַת מִלְחוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said Who is wise to permit something as this, if not Rav Ḥinnana, son of Rava of Pashronya, as he is a great man He said to you When Shmuel said a salted is like a boiling it is not eaten due to its salt, this is eaten due to, its salt.
llm_translation: Rava said: Who is wise to straighten out a matter like this? If not Rav Chinana, the son of Rava's brother, from Pashrunya, for he is a great man. He said to you, for Shmuel said, "Salty like brine," which is not eaten because of its saltiness, but this is eaten because of its saltiness.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי חַי, אֲבָל צָלִי — בָּעֵי קְלִיפָה. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ פִּילֵי, אֲבָל אִית בֵּיהּ פִּילֵי — אָסוּר. וְאִי מְתוּבַּל בְּתַבְלֵי — אָסוּר.
human_translation: this applies raw; but roasted, it requires peel. And we said only when it does not have cracks; but it has cracks, it is forbidden And if it has been flavored with spices it is forbidden
llm_translation: These are matters of life, but if roasted - require peeling. And we only said this when it does not have peels, but if it has peels - it is prohibited. And if it is mixed with spices - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: Rav said:
llm_translation: Said Rav:

hebrew_text: בְּשַׂר שְׁחוּטָה שָׁמֵן, שֶׁצְּלָאוֹ עִם בְּשַׂר נְבֵילָה כָּחוּשׁ — אָסוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא — מִפַּטְּמִי מֵהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Fatty kosher meat that one roasted with lean non-kosher meat is forbidden, What is the reason they are flavored from one another.
llm_translation: Meat slaughtered oil, that fried with meat carcass light - forbidden. What reason - from the fat of Hadadezer.

hebrew_text: וְלֵוִי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׂר שְׁחוּטָה כָּחוּשׁ, שֶׁצְּלָאוֹ עִם בְּשַׂר נְבֵילָה שָׁמֵן — מוּתָּר. מַאי טַעְמָא — רֵיחָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, וְרֵיחָא לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא. עָבֵיד לֵוִי עוֹבָדָא בֵּי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא בִּגְדִי וְדָבָר אַחֵר.
human_translation: And Levi said: Even lean kosher meat that one roasted with fatty non-kosher meat is permitted. What is the reason it is merely an aroma, and an aroma is nothing Levi took action, in the house of the Exilarch with a kid and something else,
llm_translation: Levi said: Even with meat that was slaughtered properly, if it was cooked with the fat of a nevelah (an animal that died without proper slaughter), it is permitted. What is the reason? The smell is just a regular smell, and smell is not a substantive matter. Levi did an action in the head of the exile in garments and other things.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵין צוֹלִין שְׁנֵי פְסָחִים כְּאֶחָד מִפְּנֵי הַתַּעֲרוֹבֶת. מַאי לָאו — תַּעֲרוֹבֶת טְעָמִים, וְקַשְׁיָא לְלֵוִי! לָא, מִפְּנֵי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת גּוּפִין.
human_translation: raises an objection: One not roast two Paschal lambs together due to the mixing. What, is it not the mixing of flavors, and it a difficulty to Levi? No, due to the mixing of carcasses.
llm_translation: Challenger: One does not roast two Passover offerings together due to mixture. What is the reason? — Mixture of flavors, and it is difficult for Levi! No, due to mixture of bodies.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אֲפִילּוּ גְּדִי וְטָלֶה. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא מִפְּנֵי גּוּפִין — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי אֲפִילּוּ גְּדִי וְטָלֶה. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִפְּנֵי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת טְעָמִים, מָה לִי גְּדִי וְטָלֶה מָה לִי גְּדִי וּגְדִי.
human_translation: So too, this is reasonable from that it is taught in the latter clause even a kid and a lamb. Granted, if you say due to carcasses, this is was taught even a kid and a lamb. But if you say due to the mixing of flavors, what is a kid and a lamb and a kid and kid?
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: it is inferred from the latter clause: even a kid and a lamb. If you say it is due to their bodies — that is what is inferred: even a kid and a lamb. Rather, if you say it is due to the mixture of flavors, what do I need a kid and a lamb for? What do I need a kid and a kid for?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי, עַל כׇּרְחָיךְ מִפְּנֵי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת גּוּפִין הוּא דְּאָסוּר, אֲבָל תַּעֲרוֹבֶת טְעָמִים — שְׁרֵי, לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב! אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁצְּלָאוֹ בִּשְׁתֵּי קְדֵירוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, what Perforce, due to the mixing of carcasses that it is prohibited, but a mixing of flavors is permitted. Let us say that this will be a refutation of Rav, Rabbi Yirmeya said: With what are we dealing here? where one roasted in two pots.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason? Because of the mixture of bodies it is prohibited, but a mixture of flavors is permitted. Let us say that it should be the preference of Rav! Rabbi Yirmeya said: What are we dealing with here? For example, when one roasted it in two pots.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁתֵּי קְדֵירוֹת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּעֵין שְׁתֵּי קְדֵירוֹת. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין צוֹלִין שְׁנֵי פְסָחִים כְּאֶחָד מִפְּנֵי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת. מַאי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת — תַּעֲרוֹבֶת טְעָמִים. וַאֲפִילּוּ כְּעֵין שְׁתֵּי קְדֵירוֹת, דְּלֵיכָּא תַּעֲרוֹבֶת טְעָמִים — אָסוּר מִשּׁוּם תַּעֲרוֹבֶת גּוּפִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ גְּדִי וְטָלֶה.
human_translation: Could it enter your mind in two pots? Rather, say similar to two pots, And this is saying: One not roast two Paschal offerings together due to mixing. What mixing? the mixing of flavors. And even similar to two pots, where there is no mixing of flavors, is prohibited, due to mixing of carcasses. And even a kid and a lamb.
llm_translation: In two pots, is it your opinion?! Rather say: like two pots. And so it is saying: one does not roast two Passovers together as one because of mixture. What is mixture? Mixture of flavors. And even if like two pots, where there is no mixture of flavors, it is prohibited due to the mixture of bodies, and even a kid and a lamb.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי כְּתַנָּאֵי. הָרוֹדֶה פַּת חַמָּה וּנְתָנָהּ עַל פִּי חָבִית יַיִן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה — רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹסֵר, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר בְּשֶׁל חִיטִּין וְאוֹסֵר בְּשֶׁל שְׂעוֹרִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַשְּׂעוֹרִים שׁוֹאֲבוֹת. מַאי לָאו תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּמָר סָבַר: רֵיחָא — לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא, וּמָר סָבַר: רֵיחָא — מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: Rav Mari said: like tanna’im : one who removes hot bread and places it on top of a barrel of wine teruma , Rabbi Meir prohibits And Rabbi Yehuda permits And Rabbi Yosei permits of wheat, but prohibits of barley, because barley draws out What, is it not tanna’im ? One Sage, holds that an aroma is nothing and one Sage, holds that an aroma is something
llm_translation: Rav Mari said like the Tannaim: One who crushes hot bread and places it on the mouth of a barrel of Terumah wine - Rabbi Meir prohibits, and Rabbi Yehuda permits. And Rabbi Yosei permits with wheat flour and prohibits with barley flour, because barley flour absorbs. What is the reason? Is it not because it is a dispute of Tannaim, for one Sage holds: aroma - it is not a significant matter, and the other Sage holds: aroma - it is a significant matter.

hebrew_text: לְלֵוִי, וַדַּאי תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. לְרַב, נֵימָא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא?
human_translation: According to Levi, it certainly is tanna’im . to Rav, shall we say it is tanna’im ?
llm_translation: To Levi, and surely it is a teaching. To Rav, say it is a teaching?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא רֵיחָא מִילְּתָא הִיא, לָאו אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ דְּהַהִיא, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בְּפַת חַמָּה וְחָבִית פְּתוּחָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר. בְּפַת צוֹנֶנֶת וְחָבִית מְגוּפָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּפַת חַמָּה וְחָבִית חֲתוּמָה, פַּת צוֹנֶנֶת וְחָבִית פְּתוּחָה. וְהָא נָמֵי כְּפַת חַמָּה וְחָבִית פְּתוּחָה דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: Rav said to you: Everyone agrees that aroma is something Was it not stated with regard to that Rabba bar bar Ḥana said that Reish Lakish said: With regard to hot bread and an open barrel, everyone agrees that it is prohibited with regard to cold bread and a closed barrel, everyone agrees it is permitted? They disagreed only with regard to hot bread and a sealed barrel cold bread and an open barrel. And this is also like hot bread and an open barrel.
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav: The smell of the world is a significant matter, it was not stated regarding it. Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Reish Lakish: With a loaf of bread exposed to the sun and a barrel open — everyone agrees it is prohibited. With a loaf of bread shaded and a barrel covered — everyone agrees it is permitted. They only disagreed regarding a loaf of bread exposed to the sun and a sealed barrel, and a loaf of bread shaded and an open barrel. And indeed, a loaf of bread exposed to the sun and a barrel open are similar.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב כָּהֲנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִינָּנָא סָבָא: פַּת שֶׁאֲפָאָהּ עִם צָלִי בַּתַּנּוּר — אָסוּר לְאׇכְלָהּ בְּכוּתָּחָא. הָהִיא בִּינִיתָא דְּאִיטְּווֹא בַּהֲדֵי בִּישְׂרָא, אַסְרַהּ רָבָא מִפַּרְזִיקְיָא לְמֵיכְלַיהּ בְּכוּתָּחָא. מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּמִילְחָא נָמֵי אֲסוּרָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּקַשְׁיָא לְרֵיחָא וּלְדָבָר אַחֵר.
human_translation: Rav Kahana, son of Rav Ḥinnana the Elder, teaches: bread that one baked with roasting in the oven, it is prohibited to eat with kutaḥ , a certain fish that was roasted with meat, Rava of Parzikiyya prohibited it from being eaten with kutaḥ , Mar bar Rav Ashi said: Even with salt is also prohibited because bad for odor, and for something else,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rav Kahana, son of Rav Chinana the Elder, said: Bread that was baked with roasted meat — it is forbidden to eat it with kutach. That specific type of cheese that was made in Beis-She'arim, Rava forbade it to be eaten with kutach. Mar bar Rav Ashi said: Even with salt it is also forbidden, because it is harmful to the smell and to other things.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים בָּאִין בְּטוּמְאָה, וְאֵינָן נֶאֱכָלִין בְּטוּמְאָה: הָעוֹמֶר, וּשְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם, וְלֶחֶם הַפָּנִים, וְזִבְחֵי שַׁלְמֵי צִבּוּר, וּשְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים. הַפֶּסַח שֶׁבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה נֶאֱכָל בְּטוּמְאָה, שֶׁלֹּא בָּא מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ אֶלָּא לַאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: Five items, be brought in impurity, they not be eaten in impurity. The omer , the two loaves the shewbread, the communal peace-offerings, and the goats the New Moons, the Paschal lamb that is sacrificed in impurity is eaten in impurity, as it is brought to begin with only for eating,
llm_translation: It was taught: Five things come in impurity, but are not eaten in impurity: the Omer, and the two loaves, and the showbread, and the communal peace offerings, and the he-goats of the new moons. The Passover sacrifice that comes in impurity is eaten in impurity, for it did not come initially except for eating.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ חֲמִשָּׁה. לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לְמַעוֹטֵי חֲגִיגַת חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר.
human_translation: five. To exclude what to exclude the Festival peace-offering of the fifteenth
llm_translation: Gemara: Five. What is excluded? To exclude what? To exclude the festival offering of fifteen.

hebrew_text: דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כֵּיוָן דְּקׇרְבַּן צִיבּוּר הוּא, וּקְבִיעָא לֵיהּ מוֹעֵד — תִּדְחֵי טוּמְאָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לֵיהּ תַּשְׁלוּמִין כׇּל שִׁבְעָה — לָא דָּחֲיָא שַׁבָּת, וּמִדְּשַׁבָּת לָא דָּחֲיָא — לָא דָּחֲיָא טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: It could enter your mind to say: Since it is a communal offering, and its time is set, it should override ritual impurity teaches us: Since there is redress all seven it does not override Shabbat. And it does not override Shabbat, it does not override ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Your request is beyond my capabilities.

hebrew_text: וְנִיתְנֵי נָמֵי שְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים! הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ זִבְחֵי שַׁלְמֵי צִבּוּר. אִי הָכִי, שְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים נָמֵי לָא נִיתְנֵי, דְּהָא תְּנָא זִבְחֵי שַׁלְמֵי צִבּוּר! אָמְרִי:
human_translation: Let it also teach the goats the Festivals It did teach communal peace-offerings. If so, it should also not teach the goats the New Moons as it taught the communal peace-offerings. Say
llm_translation: "And they shall give the he-goats of the sin-offerings! But didn't a Tanna teach: the communal peace-offerings? If so, the he-goats of the new moons are not given, for a Tanna taught: the communal peace-offerings! They said:"

hebrew_text: שְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא הָא לָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ ״מוֹעֵד״, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אִיקְּרִי מוֹעֵד,
human_translation: necessary for the goats the New Moons. It could enter your mind to say that appointed time is not written with regard to them, it teaches us that the New Moon is called an appointed time.
llm_translation: The goats of the heads of the months require it, as your mind wishes, I say, isn't it written in it "appointed time"? This teaches us that the beginning of the month is called an appointed time.

hebrew_text: כִּדְאַבָּיֵי, דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תַּמּוּז דְּהַאי שַׁתָּא מַלּוֹיֵי מַלְּיוּהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״קָרָא עָלַי מוֹעֵד לִשְׁבֹּר בַּחוּרָי״.
human_translation: in accordance with what Abaye Abaye said: They filled out Tammuz of that year, as it is written: “He proclaimed an appointed time against me to crush my young men”
llm_translation: As Abaye said: The month of Tamuz, in which this year is full, as it is written: "He has set an appointed time upon me to break my young men."

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּכוּלְּהוּ מִ״מּוֹעֵד״ אָתוּ, מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וַיְדַבֵּר מֹשֶׁה אֶת מֹעֲדֵי ה׳״ — מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא לָמַדְנוּ אֶלָּא לְתָמִיד וּפֶסַח שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בְּהוּ ״בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״, ״בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״ וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת, ״בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״ וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Is that to say that all of them come from, appointed time? From where are these matters as the Sages taught “And Moses declared the appointed times of the Lord What the verse states because we learned only that the daily offering and the Paschal lamb as it is stated with regard to them: In its appointed time, in its appointed time and even on Shabbat, in its appointed time and even in ritual impurity.
llm_translation: In the matter of all the "appointed times" they came, are they enjoying words? For the Rabbis taught: "And Moses spoke the appointed times of the Lord" — What is the Talmud to say? Because we have not learned except for the continual offering and Passover, as it says regarding them "at its appointed time," "at its appointed time," even on Shabbat, "at its appointed time," and even in a state of impurity.

hebrew_text: שְׁאָר קׇרְבְּנוֹת צִיבּוּר מִנַּיִין — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֵלֶּה תַּעֲשׂוּ לַה׳ בְּמוֹעֲדֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: the rest of the communal offerings, from where As it is stated “These you shall sacrifice to the Lord in your appointed times”
llm_translation: Remaining communal offerings, from where? - as it is stated: "These you shall offer to the Lord at your appointed feasts."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת עוֹמֶר וְהַקָּרֵב עִמּוֹ, שְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם וְהַקָּרֵב עִמָּם — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וַיְדַבֵּר מֹשֶׁה אֶת מֹעֲדֵי ה׳ אֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, הַכָּתוּב קְבָעוֹ מוֹעֵד אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן.
human_translation: From where to include the omer and sacrificed with it, the two loaves and sacrificed with them? The verse states: “And Moses declared the appointed times of the Lord to the children of Israel” the verse established one time for all of them.
llm_translation: From where do we derive to include the Omer offering and the sacrifice that accompanies it? The verse states: "And Moses spoke the appointed times of the Lord to the children of Israel," indicating that the Scripture established one appointed time for all of them.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הָנֵי לְמָה לִי? צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא תָּמִיד, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא תָּמִיד — שֶׁכֵּן תָּדִיר וְכָלִיל, אֲבָל פֶּסַח — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I all these They are necessary. As, if the Merciful One had written the daily offering I would have said: The daily offering is frequent and it is consumed, but the Paschal lamb, not it teaches us
llm_translation: "And all these, why do I need them? I need them, for if the Merciful One had written 'always,' I would have said 'always' - that it is constant and complete. But regarding Passover - no, it is not so, as it is inferred for us."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא פֶּסַח, פֶּסַח שֶׁהוּא עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, אֲבָל תָּמִיד דְּאֵין עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written Paschal lamb, Paschal lamb, for which one is punished with karet but the daily offering, for which one is not punished with karet say that it does not it comes to teach us
llm_translation: And if the Merciful One wrote "Pesach," Pesach which is a punishment of excision, but the daily offering which is not a punishment of excision - I might say no, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא הָנֵי הוּא יֵשׁ בָּהֶן צַד חָמוּר, תָּמִיד — תָּדִיר וְכָלִיל, פֶּסַח — שֶׁהוּא עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת. אֲבָל שְׁאָר קׇרְבְּנוֹת צִיבּוּר — אֵימָא לָא, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״אֵלֶּה תַּעֲשׂוּ לַה׳ בְּמוֹעֲדֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written these two I would have said it is these they have a stringent aspect. The daily offering is frequent and consumed the Paschal lamb is punished with karet . But the rest of the communal offerings, say not the Merciful One writes: “These you shall sacrifice to the Lord in your appointed times,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If the Merciful One had written those two, I would have said that they have a severe aspect, always - frequent and complete, Passover - for it is a punishment of excision. But for the rest of the communal offerings - I would say no, the Merciful One wrote: "These you shall offer to the Lord at your appointed times."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״אֵלֶּה תַּעֲשׂוּ לַה׳ בְּמוֹעֲדֵיכֶם״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא שְׁאָר קׇרְבְּנוֹת צִיבּוּר הַבָּאִין לְכַפֵּר. אֲבָל עוֹמֶר וּשְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם דְּאֵין בָּאִין לְכַפֵּר, אֶלָּא לְהַתִּיר בְּעָלְמָא נִינְהוּ — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written “These you shall sacrifice to the Lord in your appointed times” I would have said that other communal offerings that come to atone But the omer and the two loaves, which do not come to atone but merely come to permit, not it teaches us
llm_translation: And if the Merciful One had written: "These you shall do to the Lord in your appointed times," I would have said that the rest of the communal offerings that come to atone. But the Omer and the Two Loaves, which do not come to atone, rather they are to permit the new produce of the year in general — no, it is not so, we hear.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא עוֹמֶר וּשְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם לְחוֹדַיְיהוּ, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אַדְּרַבָּה: עוֹמֶר וּשְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם דְּאַלִּימִי דְּבָאִין לְהַתִּיר, אֲבָל הָנָךְ — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written: The omer and the two loaves, by themselves, I would have said: On the contrary, the omer and the two loaves, which are important they come to permit, but these not. it teaches us
llm_translation: And if the Merciful One wrote "omer" and two loaves separately, I would say the opposite: the omer and two loaves that come to permit, but here - no, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: סַבְרוּהָ דִּלְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא טוּמְאָה דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר, וּבָעֲיָא צִיץ לְרַצּוֹת.
human_translation: assumed that everyone agrees that ritual impurity is overridden in the public. the frontplate is required to appease
llm_translation: They thought that in all the world, impurity is pushed aside in a public domain, and the forehead plate is needed to be acceptable.

hebrew_text: דְּלֵיכָּא תַּנָּא דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר טוּמְאָה הוּתְּרָה בְּצִיבּוּר אֶלָּא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא: צִיץ, בֵּין שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ עַל מִצְחוֹ וּבֵין שֶׁאֵינוֹ עַל מִצְחוֹ — מְרַצֶּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עוֹדֵיהוּ עַל מִצְחוֹ — מְרַצֶּה, אֵין עוֹדֵיהוּ עַל מִצְחוֹ — אֵינוֹ מְרַצֶּה.
human_translation: There is no tanna that you have heard who said ritual impurity permitted in the public, except for Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught The frontplate whether it is on his forehead or whether it is not on his forehead, appeases the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: it is still on his forehead it appeases it is no longer on his forehead it does not appease
llm_translation: The Tanna taught in accordance with the opinion of the one who said: Impure food is permitted in a congregation, except for Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: The forehead plate, whether it is placed on his forehead or not on his forehead — it is acceptable, the words of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: If it is still on his forehead — it is acceptable, if it is no longer on his forehead — it is not acceptable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁאֵינוֹ עַל מִצְחוֹ וּמְרַצֶּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said to The High Priest on Yom Kippur shall prove as is not on his forehead, and it appeases
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Shimon: A High Priest on Yom Kippur shall prove, that he is not on his forehead and pleasing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: הַנַּח לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁטּוּמְאָה הוּתְּרָה בְּצִיבּוּר. מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: טוּמְאָה דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: said to him: Set aside Yom Kippur, as ritual impurity permitted in the public. by inference that Rabbi Shimon holds ritual impurity is overridden in the public,
llm_translation: He said to him: Leave for Yom Kippur that which is impure, it is permitted in the congregation. From the principle of Rabbi Shimon, he holds: impurity that is pushed aside is permitted in the congregation.
