hebrew_text: וּדְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל אֲכִילוֹת, דְּלֵיכָּא תַּנָּא דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל אֲכִילוֹת אֶלָּא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל אֲכִילוֹת, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל אֲכִילוֹת.
human_translation: everyone agrees the frontplate does not appease for eaten. As, the only tanna you have heard say the frontplate appeases for eaten is Rabbi Eliezer, as it was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: The frontplate appeases for eaten. Rabbi Yosei says: The frontplate does not appease for eaten.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And the general principle is that the forehead plate does not atone for eating, for there is no Mishnah that you heard that says the forehead plate atones for eating, except Rabbi Eliezer, as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: the forehead plate atones for eating, Rabbi Yosei says: the forehead plate does not atone for eating.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ עֹלֹתֶיךָ הַבָּשָׂר וְהַדָּם״, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אִם אֵין דָּם — אֵין בָּשָׂר, אִם אֵין בָּשָׂר — אֵין דָּם.
human_translation: let us say the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, as it was taught “And you shall sacrifice your burnt-offerings, the flesh and the blood, Rabbi Yehoshua says: If there is no blood there is no meat, if there is no meat there is no blood
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima matnitin d'lo keRabbi Yehoshua, d'tanya: 'Ve'asita olotecha habasar vehadam', Rabbi Yehoshua omer: Im ein dam - ein basar, im ein basar - ein dam." English translation: "It was taught in a Baraita not like Rabbi Yehoshua, as it was taught: 'And you shall make your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood.' Rabbi Yehoshua says: If there is no blood - there is no flesh, if there is no flesh - there is no blood."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: דָּם — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בָּשָׂר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְדַם זְבָחֶיךָ יִשָּׁפֵךְ״, וּמָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְעָשִׂיתָ עֹלֹתֶיךָ הַבָּשָׂר וְהַדָּם״ — לוֹמַר לְךָ: מָה דָּם בִּזְרִיקָה, אַף בָּשָׂר בִּזְרִיקָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Blood although there is no meat, as it is stated: “And the blood of your offerings shall be poured out.” And how do I uphold “And you shall sacrifice your burnt-offerings, the flesh and the blood”? to tell you just as the blood via sprinkling, so too, the meat via throwing.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Blood - even though there is no flesh, as it is stated: "And the blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out," and how do I fulfill "And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood" - to tell you: Just as blood is through sprinkling, so too flesh is through sprinkling.

hebrew_text: הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: לוּל קָטָן יֵשׁ בֵּין כֶּבֶשׁ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: You must say, there is a small gap between the ramp and the altar.
llm_translation: Be said: "If a small basket there is between lamb to the altar."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״וְדַם זְבָחֶיךָ יִשָּׁפֵךְ״! אָמַר לָךְ: הָא כְּתִיב גַּבֵּיהּ ״וְהַבָּשָׂר תֹּאכֵל״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua as well, isn’t it written: “And the blood of your offerings shall be poured out,” He said to you it is written it: “And you shall eat the flesh,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua Nami said, it is written "and the blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out"! He said to you: here it is written next to it "and the flesh you shall eat".

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי לְמָה לִי? חַד בְּעוֹלָה, וְחַד בִּשְׁלָמִים. וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בְּעוֹלָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: עוֹלָה הִיא דַּחֲמִירָא, שֶׁכֵּן כָּלִיל, אֲבָל שְׁלָמִים דְּלָא חֲמִירִי, אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: Why do I these two verse? One to a burnt-offering and one to a peace-offering. necessary, as if the Merciful One had written with regard to a burnt-offering, I would have said a burnt-offering, which is stringent, as it is consumed However, a peace-offering, which is not stringent, say not
llm_translation: These two verses, why do I need them? One for a burnt offering, and one for peace offerings. And the necessity is, if the Merciful One wrote regarding a burnt offering, I would say: It is more stringent, for it is entirely burnt, but peace offerings, which are not as stringent, I might say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא שְׁלָמִים, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אַדְּרַבָּה, דְּאִית בְּהוּ שְׁתֵּי אֲכִילוֹת. אֲבָל עוֹלָה דְּלֵית בָּהּ שְׁתֵּי אֲכִילוֹת, אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written a peace-offering, I would have said: On the contrary, because it has two consumption. But a burnt-offering, which does not have two consumption, say not it teaches us
llm_translation: And if the Merciful One wrote "peace offerings," I would say: On the contrary, that it contains two meals. But an elevation offering that does not contain two meals, I would say no, it does not. This is what he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״וְהַבָּשָׂר תֹּאכֵל״! אָמַר לָךְ: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ אַשֶּׁאֵין הַבָּשָׂר מוּתָּר בַּאֲכִילָה עַד שֶׁיִּזָּרֵק הַדָּם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer as well, isn’t it written: “And you shall eat the flesh”? said to you: That is necessary that the meat is not permitted to be eaten until the blood is sprinkled.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer the Nazir said: It is written, "And the flesh you shall not eat"! He said to you: that one requires it to be like the flesh, that the flesh is not permitted for consumption until the blood is sprinkled.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא כּוּלֵּיהּ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא! דָּם אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין שָׁם בָּשָׂר מְנָלַן?
human_translation: If so, say the entire comes for this from where do we blood even though there is no meat
llm_translation: If so, say that all this is the reason why he came! Blood, even though there is no flesh there, from where do we derive it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: אִם כֵּן, נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״הַבָּשָׂר תֹּאכֵל״ וַהֲדַר ״וְדַם זְבָחֶיךָ יִשָּׁפֵךְ״, כְּדִכְתִיב בְּרֵישָׁא ״וְעָשִׂיתָ עֹלֹתֶיךָ הַבָּשָׂר וְהַדָּם״, מַאי שְׁנָא דְּאַקְדְּמֵיהּ לְ״דַם זְבָחֶיךָ״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: דָּם אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בָּשָׂר, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שֶׁאֵין הַבָּשָׂר מוּתָּר בַּאֲכִילָה עַד שֶׁיִּזָּרֵק הַדָּם.
human_translation: said to you: If so, the Merciful One should have written “and you shall eat the flesh” and then “and the blood of your offerings shall be poured out,” as it is written in the first clause “And you shall sacrifice your burnt-offerings, the flesh, and the blood,” What is different that to precede “the blood of your offerings”? Learn from it blood although there is no meat, and learn from it that the meat is not permitted to be eaten until the blood is sprinkled.
llm_translation: He said to you: If so, it should have been written mercifully, "You shall eat the flesh," and then, "But the blood of your sacrifices you shall pour out," as it is written at the beginning, "And you shall make your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood." What is the difference that "the blood of your sacrifices" is mentioned first? Learn from it: that blood, even without flesh, and learn from it: that the flesh is not permitted for consumption until the blood is sprinkled.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אֵין הַבָּשָׂר מוּתָּר בַּאֲכִילָה עַד שֶׁיִּזָּרֵק הַדָּם — קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא, וּמָה אֵימוּרִין דְּכִי לֵיתַנְהוּ — לָא מְעַכְּבִי, כִּי אִיתַנְהוּ — מְעַכְּבִי, דָּם, דְּכִי לֵיתֵיהּ — מְעַכֵּב, כִּי אִיתֵיהּ — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דִּמְעַכֵּב!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua the meat is not permitted to be eaten until the blood is sprinkled? it is an a fortiori Just as sacrificial portions which do not preclude when they are not present, when they are present they do preclude blood, which precludes when it is not present, when it is present, all the more so not that it precludes
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua: The flesh is not permitted for consumption until the blood is sprinkled - it is a fortiori reasoning. And what are the words that if they are not there - it does not prevent, but if they are there - it prevents, blood, if it is not there - it prevents, but if it is there - not to mention that it prevents!

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? מִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר טָרַח וְכָתֵב לַהּ קְרָא. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ? כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא לְמִדְרַשׁ — דָּרְשִׁינַן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, A matter that derived by an a fortiori inference, the verse exerted wrote it Rabbi Yehoshua Anywhere that there is to expound we expound
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer? matter that comes with a kal vachomer, he exerted effort and wrote for it a verse. And Rabbi Yehoshua? wherever there is a place for Midrash - we expound.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּכֵיוָן דְּאָמַר בָּעֵינַן תַּרְתֵּי, וְצִיץ אַאֲכִילוֹת לֹא מְרַצֶּה, הֵיכִי אָתֵי בְּטוּמְאָה?
human_translation: Now, let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua: Since he said we require two frontplate does not appease for eaten, how can they be brought in ritual impurity?
llm_translation: Let us say a Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Yehoshua, for since he said we require two, and the forehead-plate does not satisfy, how does impurity come into play?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אֶלָּא קָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל הָעוֹלִין.
human_translation: Even you say Rabbi Yehoshua, Rather, Rabbi Yehoshua holds that the frontplate appeases for that which goes up,
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yehoshua, rather Rabbi Yehoshua holds: "The Tzitz atones for those who ascend."

hebrew_text: הָא תִּינַח זְבָחִים דְּאִיכָּא עוֹלִין, אֶלָּא עוֹמֶר וּשְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם דְּלֵיכָּא עוֹלִין, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אָמְרִי: כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ נָמֵי דְּבָעֵינַן תַּרְתֵּי — בִּזְבָחִים, בִּמְנָחוֹת לָא אָמַר.
human_translation: This well offerings, there are go up But the omer and the two loaves, there are no go up What is there to say Say When Rabbi Yehoshua said that we require two with regard to offerings; with regard to meal-offerings he did not say
llm_translation: Here are sacrificial offerings where there are Olot, but there is an Omer and two loaves where there are no Olot, what can be said? They said: For Rabbi Yehoshua said: We require two - for sacrifices, but not for meal offerings.

hebrew_text: וּבִמְנָחוֹת לָא אָמַר? וְהָתְנַן: נִטְמְאוּ שְׁיָרֶיהָ, אָבְדוּ שְׁיָרֶיהָ, כְּמִדַּת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — כְּשֵׁירָה, כְּמִדַּת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: with regard to meal-offerings he did not say Didn’t we learn the remainder became ritually impure, the remainder was lost, according to the principle of Rabbi Eliezer, it is valid, according to the principle of Rabbi Yehoshua it is disqualified?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And in meal-offerings did he not say? And we learned: If its remnants became impure, if its remnants were lost, according to the measure of Rabbi Eliezer — it is fit, according to the measure of Rabbi Yehoshua — it is disqualified."

hebrew_text: כְּמִדַּת וְלֹא כְּמִדַּת: כְּמִדַּת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּבָעֵינַן תַּרְתֵּי. וְלֹא כְּמִדַּת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּאִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּזְבָחִים אָמַר, בִּמְנָחוֹת — לָא אָמַר, וְאִילּוּ הַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּמְנָחוֹת.
human_translation: in accordance with the principle but not in accordance with the principle in accordance with the principle of Rabbi Yehoshua in that we need two And not in accordance with the principle of Rabbi Yehoshua, whereas Rabbi Yehoshua said with regard to offerings with regard to meal-offerings he did not say this tanna holds even to meal-offerings.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Like the measure and not like the measure: Like the measure of Rabbi Yehoshua, for we require two. And not like the measure of Rabbi Yehoshua, for if Rabbi Yehoshua said regarding sacrifices, he did not say regarding meal offerings, and if this Tanna holds: even regarding meal offerings.

hebrew_text: וּמַנּוּ הַאי תַּנָּא דְּקָאֵי כְּווֹתֵיהּ וּמַחְמֵיר טְפֵי מִינֵּיהּ? וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בִּמְנָחוֹת וּבִזְבָחִים, וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּזְבָחִים וּבִמְנָחוֹת.
human_translation: And who is this tanna who holds in accordance with and is more stringent than him? And furthermore, it was taught Rabbi Yosei said: I see the statement of Rabbi Eliezer with regard to meal-offerings and with regard to offerings; and the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua with regard to offerings and with regard to meal-offerings.
llm_translation: The Tanna standing in his place and being stringent more than his colleagues? Furthermore, it was taught: Rabbi Yosei said, "I see the words of Rabbi Eliezer regarding meal offerings and sacrifices, and the words of Rabbi Yehoshua regarding sacrifices and meal offerings."

hebrew_text: דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בִּזְבָחִים, שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: דָּם — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין שָׁם בָּשָׂר. וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּזְבָחִים, שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: אִם אֵין דָּם — אֵין בָּשָׂר, אִם אֵין בָּשָׂר — אֵין דָּם. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בִּמְנָחוֹת, שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: קוֹמֶץ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין שִׁירַיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּמְנָחוֹת, שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: אִם אֵין קוֹמֶץ — אֵין שִׁירַיִם, אִם אֵין שִׁירַיִם — אֵין קוֹמֶץ.
human_translation: The statement of Rabbi Eliezer with regard to offerings, as he would say blood although there is no meat. The statement of Rabbi Yehoshua with regard to offerings, as he would say if there is no blood, there is no meat, if there is no meat, there is no blood. The statement of Rabbi Eliezer with regard to meal-offerings, as he would say the handful although there is no remainder. The statement of Rabbi Yehoshua with regard to meal-offerings, as he would say if there is no handful, there is no remainder, if there is no remainder, there is no handful.
llm_translation: The words of Rabbi Eliezer regarding sacrifices, he used to say: Blood - even though there is no flesh. And the words of Rabbi Yehoshua regarding sacrifices, he used to say: If there is no blood - there is no flesh, if there is no flesh - there is no blood. The words of Rabbi Eliezer regarding meal offerings, he used to say: The handful - even though there are no frankincense. The words of Rabbi Yehoshua regarding meal offerings, he used to say: If there is no handful - there is no frankincense, if there is no frankincense - there is no handful.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, קָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל [הָעוֹלִין וְעַל] הָאֲכִילוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehoshua holds the frontplate appeases for go up for eaten.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehoshua holds: "The Tzitz atones for the offerings and the meals."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי כְּמִדַּת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פְּסוּלָה? אַאָבוּד וְשָׂרוּף.
human_translation: If so, why in accordance with the principle of Rabbi Yehoshua, is disqualified? lost or burned;
llm_translation: So, why is it that according to the measure of Rabbi Yehoshua, it is disqualified? Because it is lost and burnt.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא נִטְמָא, לְמַאן קָתָנֵי? לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — פְּשִׁיטָא, הַשְׁתָּא יֵשׁ לוֹמַר אָבוּד וְשָׂרוּף דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ, מַכְשִׁיר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, נִטְמָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ — מִיבַּעְיָא? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְקָתָנֵי פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: according to whom teaching became impure? According to Rabbi Eliezer, obvious Now lost or burned, when they are not Rabbi Eliezer validates is necessary became impure, when it is Rather, obvious Rabbi Yehoshua, and it is teaching disqualified.
llm_translation: Rather, if it became impure, according to whom is it taught? According to Rabbi Eliezer — it is obvious, now he can say lost and burnt that are not there, Rabbi Eliezer deems it fit, if it became impure with what? Rather, it is obvious according to Rabbi Yehoshua, and it is taught as invalid.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כׇּל זְבָחִים שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, בֵּין שֶׁנִּטְמָא בָּשָׂר וְחֵלֶב קַיָּים, וּבֵין שֶׁנִּטְמָא חֵלֶב וּבָשָׂר קַיָּים — זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם. אֲבָל נִטְמְאוּ תַּרְוַויְיהוּ — לָא. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֵין הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל הָעוֹלִין וְלֹא עַל הָאֲכִילוֹת!
human_translation: And furthermore, it was taught Rabbi Yehoshua says: all offerings in the Torah, whether the meat became ritually impure and the fat remains or the fat became impure and the meat remains one may sprinkle the blood. But if both of them became ritually impure, not Apparently, Rabbi Yehoshua holds the frontplate does not appease for go up or for eaten.
llm_translation: And furthermore, it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua says: All sacrifices in the Torah, whether the flesh and fat became impure, they are valid, and whether the fat and flesh became impure, they are valid - he sprinkles the blood. But if their limbs became mixed up - no. This implies that Rabbi Yehoshua holds that the forehead plate does not atone for the burnt offerings and the food offerings!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא מַתְנִיתִין, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — לְכַתְּחִלָּה, כָּאן — דִּיעֲבַד. כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — לְכַתְּחִלָּה, דִּיעֲבַד לָא.
human_translation: Rather, Actually, the mishna is Rabbi Yehoshua, and it not difficult: There, ab initio ; here, after the fact. When Rabbi Yehoshua said ab initio ; after the fact not
llm_translation: Rather: Always Rabbi Yehoshua it is Mishna, and not difficult: here — initially, here — after the fact. For Rabbi Yehoshua said — initially, after the fact not.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּשָׁנֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֵּין לְכַתְּחִלָּה לְדִיעֲבַד — דְּתַנְיָא: נִטְמָא בָּשָׂר אוֹ שֶׁנִּפְסַל אוֹ שֶׁיָּצָא חוּץ לַקְּלָעִים, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יִזָּרֵק, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִזָּרֵק. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שֶׁאִם זָרַק — הוּרְצָה.
human_translation: And from where do you say that Rabbi Yehoshua differentiates between ab initio and after the fact? As it was taught meat became impure or it was disqualified or went outside the hangings Rabbi Eliezer says may be sprinkled Rabbi Yehoshua says it may not be sprinkled. And Rabbi Yehoshua concedes that if one sprinkled is accepted.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who will say that he taught it to Rabbi Yehoshua, whether for the initial ruling or for a subsequent ruling - for it was taught: If the meat became impure, or if it became disqualified, or if it went outside the curtains, Rabbi Eliezer says: It shall be cast away, Rabbi Yehoshua says: It shall not be cast away. And Rabbi Yehoshua concedes that if it was cast away - it is acceptable.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא, דִּ״פְסוּלָה״ — דִּיעֲבַד מַשְׁמַע. וְעוֹד, ״חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים בָּאִין״ — לְכַתְּחִלָּה מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: One disqualified indicates after the fact And furthermore, five items may be brought in indicates ab initio .
llm_translation: One, that "Pesulah" - it is derived. And furthermore, "Five things come in" - initially it is derived.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בְּיָחִיד, כָּאן — בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: Rather, not difficult: There, an individual. Here, in the public.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult: here — in private, here — in public.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל אֲכִילוֹת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל אֲכִילוֹת.
human_translation: Shall we say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei? As it was taught Rabbi Eliezer says the frontplate appeases for eaten. Rabbi Yosei says the frontplate does not appease for eaten;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima matnitin d'lo k'Rabbi Yosei. D'tanya, Rabbi Eliezer omer: HaTzitz meratze al achilot. Rabbi Yosei omer: Ein haTzitz meratze al achilot." English translation: "It was stated in a Baraita not like Rabbi Yosei. For it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: The Tzitz atones for eating. Rabbi Yosei says: The Tzitz does not atone for eating."

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ מִדְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֵין הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל אֲכִילוֹת — כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר בָּעֵינַן תַּרְתֵּי. נֵימָא הַשְׁתָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי?
human_translation: enter your mind From that Rabbi Yosei said the frontplate does not appease for eaten, he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, who said we require two Let us now say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Your mind has departed from what Rabbi Yosei said: "The forehead-plate does not atone for eating" — like Rabbi Yehoshua holds, for he said we require two. Should we say now the Mishnah does not agree with Rabbi Yosei?

hebrew_text: לָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: דָּם — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בָּשָׂר.
human_translation: No, Rabbi Yosei holds in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said blood although there is no meat.
llm_translation: No, Rabbi Yosei holds like Rabbi Eliezer, for he said: "Blood - even though there is no flesh."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא אֵין הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל אֲכִילוֹת? וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמַר: הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר: דָּם — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בָּשָׂר, הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל אֲכִילוֹת לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא?
human_translation: If so, with regard to what halakha the frontplate does not appease for eaten? And according to your reasoning, Rabbi Eliezer who said the frontplate appeases eaten, since he said blood although there is no meat, with regard to what halakha the frontplate appeases eaten?
llm_translation: So, for what purpose does the forehead-plate find favor in regard to the offerings? And according to your reasoning, Rabbi Eliezer said: The forehead-plate finds favor, since it is said: "the blood" — even though there is no flesh, the forehead-plate finds favor in regard to the offerings. What is the halakha?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְמִיקְבְּעֵיהּ בְּפִיגּוּל וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מִידֵי מְעִילָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: מְרַצֵּה צִיץ עִילָּוֵיהּ וּמְשַׁוֵּי לֵיהּ כְּטָהוֹר, וְקָבַע לֵיהּ בְּפִיגּוּל, וּמַפֵּיק לֵיהּ מִידֵּי מְעִילָה.
human_translation: Rather, they disagree to establish as disqualified due to improper intent [ piggul ] and to exclude from misuse of consecrated property. Rabbi Eliezer holds the frontplate appeases for and it renders it like pure established as piggul . excludes from misuse of consecrated property.
llm_translation: Rather, to establish it in the case of Pigul and to exempt it from the category of invalidation due to a cloak, Rabbi Eliezer holds: He is pleased with its flower and whitens it like pure, and he establishes it in the case of Pigul, and exempts it from the category of invalidation due to a cloak.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: לָא מְרַצֵּה צִיץ עִילָּוֵיהּ, וְלָא מְשַׁוֵּי לֵיהּ כְּטָהוֹר, וְלָא קָבַע לֵיהּ בְּפִיגּוּל, וְלָא מַפֵּיק לֵיהּ מִידֵּי מְעִילָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei holds the frontplate does not appease God for and it does not render it like pure does not establish it as piggul and does not exclude it from misusing consecrated property.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds: not pleased the forehead-plate its beauty, and not equal to it as pure, and not established it in a disqualified manner, and not removed it from the hands of the robe.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב מָרִי: נְהִי נָמֵי דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, בִּשְׁלָמָא זְבָחִים — אִיכָּא דָּם, עוֹמֶר נָמֵי — אִיכָּא קוֹמֶץ, לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים נָמֵי — אִיכָּא בָּזִיכִין.
human_translation: Rav Mari strongly objects to this Even granting that Rabbi Yosei holds in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer Granted, offerings, there is blood, omer , too, there is the handful, the shewbread, too, there are the bowls
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Mari objected to her: "Yes, the student of Rabbi Yosei thought like Rabbi Eliezer. Regarding sacrifices - there is blood, regarding the Omer offering - there is a handful, regarding the showbread - there are frankincense."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: But the two loaves, what is there to say?
llm_translation: Rather, two breads, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא לִקְרַב עִמָּהֶן — הַיְינוּ שַׁלְמֵי צִיבּוּר. אִם כֵּן, הָווּ לְהוּ אַרְבָּעָה, וַאֲנַן — חֲמִשָּׁה תְּנַן!
human_translation: And if you say that are sacrificed with them, this is the communal peace-offerings If so, there are four But we learned five,
llm_translation: And if you say to bring near with them — that is the communal peace offerings. If so, there should have been four, and we learned five!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: טוּמְאָה הוּתְּרָה בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei holds ritual impurity is permitted in the public,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei holds: Impurity is permitted in a public domain.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה — מַזִּין עָלָיו כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִכׇּל חַטָּאוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ שָׁם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַזִּין עָלָיו אֶלָּא שְׁלִישִׁי וּשְׁבִיעִי בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: But wasn’t taught both this and that one sprinkles on him all seven from all the purification offerings, that are there the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: One does not sprinkle upon him except for the third and seventh
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: One and one - one sprinkles upon it all seven days from all the sin-offerings that were there, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: One only sprinkles upon it on the third and seventh days alone.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי טוּמְאָה הוּתְּרָה בְּצִיבּוּר, לְמָה לִי הַזָּאָה כְּלָל? אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind Rabbi Yosei holds ritual impurity is permitted in the public, why do I sprinkling at all? Rather, it is clear the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: "And if it enters your mind that Rabbi Yosei holds that impurity is permitted in a congregation, why do I need the term 'impurity' at all? Rather, the Mishnah is in accordance with the opinion that is not like Rabbi Yosei."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי שְׁטָרָא מְזַכֵּי לְבֵי תְרֵי הוּא?! דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בִּזְבָחִים, וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּזְבָחִים, וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בִּמְנָחוֹת, וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּמְנָחוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: Rabbi Yosei is a document that awards to two as it was taught Rabbi Yosei said: I see the statement of Rabbi Eliezer with regard to offerings, and the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua with regard to offerings, and the statement of Rabbi Eliezer with regard to meal-offerings, and the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua with regard to meal-offerings.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: And Rabbi Yosei, the scribe, is he from the house of two?! As it was taught: Rabbi Yosei said: I see the words of Rabbi Eliezer in regards to sacrifices, and the words of Rabbi Yehoshua in regards to sacrifices, and the words of Rabbi Eliezer in regards to meal offerings, and the words of Rabbi Yehoshua in regards to meal offerings.

hebrew_text: דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בִּזְבָחִים, שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: דָּם אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בָּשָׂר. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּזְבָחִים, שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: אִם אֵין דָּם אֵין בָּשָׂר, אִם אֵין בָּשָׂר אֵין דָּם. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בִּמְנָחוֹת, שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: קוֹמֶץ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין שָׁם שִׁירַיִם. וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּמְנָחוֹת, שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: אִם אֵין שָׁם שִׁירַיִם אֵין קוֹמֶץ, אִם אֵין קוֹמֶץ אֵין שִׁירַיִם!
human_translation: The statement of Rabbi Eliezer with regard to offerings, as he would say blood although there is no meat. The statement of Rabbi Yehoshua with regard to offerings, as he would say if there is no blood there is no meat, if there is no meat there is no blood. The statement of Rabbi Eliezer with regard to meal-offerings, as he would say the handful although there is no remainder. The statement of Rabbi Yehoshua with regard to meal-offerings, as he would say if there is no handful there is no remainder, if there is no remainder there is no handful.
llm_translation: The words of Rabbi Eliezer regarding sacrifices, he used to say: "Blood even though there is no flesh." The words of Rabbi Yehoshua regarding sacrifices, he used to say: "If there is no blood, there is no flesh; if there is no flesh, there is no blood." The words of Rabbi Eliezer regarding meal offerings, he used to say: "The handful, even though there are no frankincense." And the words of Rabbi Yehoshua regarding meal offerings, he used to say: "If there is no frankincense, there is no handful; if there is no handful, there is no frankincense!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִסְתַּבְּרָא קָאָמַר. כִּי קָאֵי בִּזְבָחִים, אָמַר: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כִּי הֵיכִי דִּפְלִיגִי בִּזְבָחִים — פְּלִיגִי נָמֵי בִּמְנָחוֹת. קָאֵי בִּמְנָחוֹת, אָמַר: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כִּי הֵיכִי דִּפְלִיגִי בִּמְנָחוֹת — פְּלִיגִי נָמֵי בִּזְבָחִים.
human_translation: said to him: he said what was reasonable. When involved in offerings, he said: It is reasonable that just as they disagree with regard to offerings, they also disagree with regard to meal-offerings. involved in meal-offerings, he said: It is reasonable that just as they disagree with regard to meal-offerings, they also disagree with regard to offerings.
llm_translation: He said to him: It seems reasonable. When he was discussing sacrifices, he said: It seems reasonable that just as they disagree regarding sacrifices, they also disagree regarding meal offerings. When he was discussing meal offerings, he said: It seems reasonable that just as they disagree regarding meal offerings, they also disagree regarding sacrifices.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָתִינַח: כִּי קָאֵי בִּזְבָחִים אָמַר, מִסְתַּבְּרָא כִּי הֵיכִי דִּפְלִיגִי בִּזְבָחִים פְּלִיגִי נָמֵי בִּמְנָחוֹת, דְּעִיקָּר קְרָאֵי כִּי כְּתִיבִי — בִּזְבָחִים כְּתִיבִי. אֶלָּא, כִּי קָאֵי בִּמְנָחוֹת וְאָמַר, מִסְתַּבְּרָא כִּי הֵיכִי דִּפְלִיגִי בִּמְנָחוֹת פְּלִיגִי נָמֵי בִּזְבָחִים — וְהָא עִיקָּר קְרָאֵי בִּזְבָחִים הוּא דִּכְתִיבִי!
human_translation: said to him: well when he was involved in offerings, he said: It is reasonable that just as they disagree with regard to offerings, they also disagree with regard to meal-offerings, as the essential verses written are written with regard to offerings. But when he was involved in meal-offerings, he said: It is reasonable that just as they disagree with regard to meal-offerings, they disagree with regard to offerings. Aren’t the essential verses written with regard to offerings?
llm_translation: He said to him, "You have answered well: When he was discussing sacrifices, he meant that just as they disagree regarding sacrifices, they also disagree regarding meal offerings, for the primary verses are written about sacrifices — it is written about sacrifices. Rather, when he was discussing meal offerings and said, it makes sense that just as they disagree regarding meal offerings, they also disagree regarding sacrifices — and the primary verses are indeed written about sacrifices!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנִטְמָא, וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּאָבוּד וְשָׂרוּף.
human_translation: Rather, and not difficult I see the statement of Rabbi Eliezer, became impure. the opinion of Rabbi Yehoshua, was lost or burned.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult: I see the words of Rabbi Eliezer regarding impurity, and the words of Rabbi Yehoshua regarding lost and found items and theft.

hebrew_text: בְּנִטְמָא מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דִּמְרַצֵּי צִיץ. הָא שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּאָמַר: אֵין הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל אֲכִילוֹת!
human_translation: In became impure, what is the reason because the frontplate appeases you have heard that Rabbi Yosei said the frontplate does not appease for eaten.
llm_translation: In a state of impurity, what is the reason? — Because it is like the "maratzei tzitz." Have you not heard what Rabbi Yosei said: "The tzitz does not atone for consumption!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּצִיבּוּר, רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּיָחִיד.
human_translation: Rather, not difficult I see the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer, to in the public. I see the opinion of Rabbi Yehoshua, to an individual.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult: I see the words of Rabbi Eliezer in public, I see the words of Rabbi Yehoshua in private.

hebrew_text: בְּצִיבּוּר מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּטוּמְאָה הוּתְּרָה בְּצִיבּוּר? חֲדָא: דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּאָמַר טוּמְאָה דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר, וְעוֹד: אִי בְּצִיבּוּר, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מַכְשִׁיר וְלָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ?
human_translation: With regard to the public, what is the reason because ritual impurity is permitted in the public. One that you have heard that Rabbi Yosei said ritual impurity is overridden in the public; And furthermore, if to the public, Rabbi Eliezer and not Rabbi Yehoshua?
llm_translation: In a congregation, what is the reason? Because impurity is permitted in a congregation? One: because you heard it from Rabbi Yosei who said impurity is nullified in a congregation, and furthermore: if not in a congregation, Rabbi Eliezer permits it but not Rabbi Yehoshua?

hebrew_text: הָא אָמְרַתְּ, בְּצִיבּוּר אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מוֹדֶה.
human_translation: Didn’t you say with regard to the public, even Rabbi Yehoshua concedes
llm_translation: This is what you said, "In a congregation, even Rabbi Yehoshua agrees."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּדִיעֲבַד, וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְכַתְּחִלָּה. דִּיעֲבַד — אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ נָמֵי מוֹדֶה הוּא, דְּקָתָנֵי: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שֶׁאִם זָרַק — הוּרְצָה!
human_translation: Rather, I see the statement of Rabbi Eliezer, after the fact. the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua, ab initio . After the fact Rabbi Yehoshua also concedes, as it teaches: Rabbi Yehoshua concedes that if one sprinkled it was accepted
llm_translation: Rather: I see the words of Rabbi Eliezer as a last resort, and the words of Rabbi Joshua as a first resort. As a last resort - even if Rabbi Joshua himself agrees, as it is taught: Rabbi Joshua agrees that if he threw it - it is acceptable!

hebrew_text: הָא בְּטוּמְאָה, הָא בְּאָבוּד וְשָׂרוּף. כִּי קָתָנֵי: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שֶׁאִם זָרַק הוּרְצָה — בְּנִטְמָא, אֲבָל בְּאָבוּד וְשָׂרוּף לָא. כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּדִיעֲבַד — בְּאָבוּד וְשָׂרוּף.
human_translation: This with regard to ritual impurity, that with regard to lost or burned. When it teaches Rabbi Yehoshua concedes that if one sprinkled it is accepted, with regard to became impure; but with regard to lost or burned, not When Rabbi Yosei said: I see the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer after the fact, with regard to was lost or burned,
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: This one regarding impurity, this one regarding lost property and theft. For it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua concedes that if one threw an object intentionally — it becomes impure, but regarding lost property and theft, no. For this is what Rabbi Yosei said: I see the words of Rabbi Eliezer in retrospect — regarding lost property and theft.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִטְמָא בָּשָׂר וְחֵלֶב קַיָּים — אֵינוֹ זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם. נִטְמָא הַחֵלֶב וְהַבָּשָׂר קַיָּים — זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם. וּבַמּוּקְדָּשִׁים אֵינוֹ כֵּן, אֶלָּא אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּטְמָא הַבָּשָׂר וְהַחֵלֶב קַיָּים — זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם.
human_translation: the meat became ritually impure, and the fat remains one not sprinkle the blood. the fat became impure and the meat remains one sprinkle the blood with regard to offerings it is not so. Rather, although the meat has become impure and the fat remains one sprinkle the blood,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the meat and the fat became impure - one does not sprinkle the blood. If the fat and the meat became impure - one sprinkles the blood. But in the case of the offerings in the Temple, it is not so. Even though the meat and the fat became impure - one sprinkles the blood.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: אִם זָרַק — הוּרְצָה. וְהָא בָּעֵינַן אֲכִילָה! אֲכִילָה לָא מְעַכְּבָא.
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav said: If one sprinkled it was accepted; Don’t we require eaten, eating does not preclude
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: If he threw - it is permitted. But do we require consumption? Consumption does not prevent.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״אִישׁ לְפִי אׇכְלוֹ״?! לְמִצְוָה.
human_translation: Isn’t it written: according to every man’s eating as a mitzva
llm_translation: And the it is written: "Each according to his eating"?! This is for the commandment.

hebrew_text: וּלְעַכֵּב לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״בְּמִכְסַת״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאֵין הַפֶּסַח נִשְׁחָט אֶלָּא לִמְנוּיָו. יָכוֹל שְׁחָטוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לִמְנוּיָו יְהֵא כְּעוֹבֵר עַל הַמִּצְוָה וְכָשֵׁר — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ לְפִי אׇכְלוֹ תָּכֹסּוּ״, הַכָּתוּב שָׁנָה עָלָיו לְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: And not to preclude Wasn’t it taught “According to the number of teaches that the Paschal lamb is slaughtered only for those who have registered for it might one slaughtered it for those who have not registered for it, he is like one who violates a mitzva, valid the verse states: “According to every man’s eating you shall make your count”; the verse repeated to precludes
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And to delay the offering of the Paschal lamb is it not forbidden? And it was taught: "In its appointed time," teaches that the Paschal lamb is not slaughtered except for its designated purpose. One might have thought that if one slaughters it not for its designated purpose, it should be considered as if he transgressed the commandment but it is valid - the Scripture states: "According to the number of souls, each one according to his eating" (Exodus 12:4), the Scripture has changed the law for him to delay.

hebrew_text: וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ אוֹכְלִין לִמְנוּיִין.
human_translation: And those who eat are juxtaposed to those who registered.
llm_translation: And it was asked: "Are we to eat in designated quantities?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַב דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי נָתָן, דְּאָמַר: אֲכִילַת פְּסָחִים לָא מְעַכְּבָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rav said in accordance with Rabbi Natan, who said eating the Paschal lamb does not preclude
llm_translation: Rather, Rav said like Rabbi Natan, who said: the eating of the Paschal lamb does not delay the offering of the afternoon Tamid sacrifice.

hebrew_text: הֵי רַבִּי נָתָן? אִילֵּימָא הָא רַבִּי נָתָן דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹצְאִין בְּפֶסַח אֶחָד — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְשָׁחֲטוּ אֹתוֹ כֹּל קְהַל עֲדַת יִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם״, וְכִי כָּל הַקָּהָל שׁוֹחֲטִין? וַהֲלֹא אֵין שׁוֹחֵט אֶלָּא אֶחָד! אֶלָּא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹצְאִין בְּפֶסַח אֶחָד.
human_translation: Which Rabbi Natan If we say this Rabbi Natan, as it was taught Rabbi Natan says: From where that all Jews fulfill with one Paschal lamb? The verse states: “And the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall slaughter it in the afternoon” And does the entire assembly slaughter Is it not only one slaughters Rather, teaches that all Jews fulfill their obligation with one Paschal lamb.
llm_translation: Be Rabbi Nathan? If you will say, this Rabbi Nathan as it was taught, Rabbi Nathan says: From where do we derive that all Israelites may fulfill their obligation with one Passover offering? Scripture states: "And they shall slaughter it, the entire congregation of the assembly of Israel, between the evenings." Does it mean that all the congregation slaughter? But is it not the case that only one slaughters! Rather, it teaches that all Israelites may fulfill their obligation with one Passover offering.

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִי מִמַּשְׁכִי הָנֵי חֲזֵי לְהָנֵי, וְאִי מִמַּשְׁכִי הָנֵי חֲזֵי לְהָנֵי!
human_translation: Perhaps it is different there, as, if these withdraw it is fit for those, and if those withdraw it is fit for these.
llm_translation: Perhaps it is different there, for if those words are drawn out, they are seen as those words, and if those words are not drawn out, they are seen as those words!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָא רַבִּי נָתָן דְּתַנְיָא: נִמְנוּ עָלָיו חֲבוּרָה אַחַת, וְחָזְרוּ וְנִמְנוּ עָלָיו חֲבוּרָה אַחֶרֶת, רִאשׁוֹנִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן כְּזַיִת, אוֹכְלִין — וּפְטוּרִין מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי, אַחֲרוֹנִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם כַּזַּיִת, אֵין אוֹכְלִין — וְחַיָּיבִין לַעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Rather, this Rabbi Natan, as it was taught one group registered for and then another group registered for it, the first ones, who have an olive-bulk eat and are exempt from performing the second Pesaḥ ; the latter ones, who do not have an olive-bulk do not eat and are obligated to perform the second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: Rather, this, Rabbi Natan taught: They were counted in one group, and then they were counted in another group. The first ones, who have an olive's worth, may eat and are exempt from observing a second Passover. The latter ones, who do not have an olive's worth, may not eat and are obligated to observe a second Passover.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי, שֶׁכְּבָר נִזְרַק הַדָּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Natan says: these and those are exempt from performing the second Pesaḥ , as the blood has already been sprinkled.
llm_translation: Rabbi Natan says: These and these are exempt from performing the second Passover offering, for the blood has already been sprinkled.

hebrew_text: אַכַּתִּי: דִּילְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִי מִמַּשְׁכִי הָנֵי חֲזֵי לְהוּ. אִם כֵּן, לִיתְנֵי: הוֹאִיל וּרְאוּיִים לִימָּשֵׁךְ, מַאי ״שֶׁכְּבָר נִזְרַק הַדָּם״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בְּדָם תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא, אֲבָל אֲכִילָה לָא מְעַכְּבָא.
human_translation: still Perhaps it is different there, as, if these withdraw, it is fit for If so, let it teach since are fit to withdraw. What the blood has already been sprinkled? Learn from this that the matter depends on the blood, but eating does not preclude
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Perhaps it is different there, for if they actually drew the blood, they would see them. If so, let him teach: Since they are fit to be drawn, what is "for the blood has already been thrown"? Learn from it that the matter depends on the blood, but eating does not delay. English translation:

hebrew_text: מַאי דּוּחְקֵיהּ דְּרַב דְּמוֹקֵים לַהּ מַתְנִיתִין לְכַתְּחִלָּה, וְרַבִּי נָתָן? נוֹקְמַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן, וַאֲפִילּוּ דִּיעֲבַד נָמֵי לָא! רַב מַתְנִיתִין קְשִׁיתֵיהּ: אַמַּאי (תָּנֵי) ״אֵין זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם״? לִיתְנֵי ״פָּסוּל״. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: ״אֵין זוֹרֵק״ — לְכַתְּחִלָּה, אֲבָל דִּיעֲבַד שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: What compelled Rav to establish the mishna ab initio , Rabbi Natan? Let us establish the Rabbis and even after the fact, no, Rav had difficulty with the mishna: Why does it teach one not sprinkle the blood? It should teach that is disqualified. Rather, learn from this one not sprinkle ab initio , but after the fact it seems well.
llm_translation: What is the difficulty of Rav that he is struggling with the Mishnah initially, and Rabbi Natan? Avenge it like the Rabbis, and even if it was done unintentionally! Rav found it difficult: Why does it teach "he does not sprinkle the blood"? It should teach "invalid." Rather, learn from it: "he does not sprinkle" - initially, but after the fact, the blood is valid.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי נָתָן, ״אִישׁ לְפִי אׇכְלוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? דְּבָעֵינַן גַּבְרָא דַּחֲזֵי לַאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Natan, why do I “according to every man’s eating,” that we require a person who is fit for eating.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Natan, "A person according to his eating," why do I need it? For we require a man who is fit for eating.

hebrew_text: מַאן תְּנָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: שָׁחֲטוּ לְאוֹכְלָיו וְזָרְקוּ דָּמוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לְאוֹכְלָיו — הַפֶּסַח עַצְמוֹ כָּשֵׁר, וְאָדָם יוֹצֵא בּוֹ יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ. כְּמַאן? נֵימָא רַבִּי נָתָן הִיא, וְלָא רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: Who taught this As the Sages taught: one slaughtered it for able to eat it and sprinkled its blood for who cannot eat it, the Paschal lamb itself is valid, and one fulfills his obligation with it. In accordance with whose Let us say it is in accordance with Rabbi Natan, and not the Rabbis?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna that the Rabbis taught this: "If they slaughtered it for those who will eat it, but they sprinkled its blood not for those who will eat it - the Passover sacrifice itself is valid, and a person fulfills his obligation with it." According to whom? Let us say it is Rabbi Natan, and not the Rabbis?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, אֵין מַחְשְׁבֶת אוֹכְלִין בִּזְרִיקָה.
human_translation: even you say the Rabbis. intent those who will eat sprinkling
llm_translation: Even if you say it is according to the Rabbis, the thought of food is not considered during the act of sprinkling.

hebrew_text: מַאן תְּנָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה חוֹלֶה בִּשְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה וְחָלִים בִּשְׁעַת זְרִיקָה, חָלִים בִּשְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה וְחוֹלֶה בִּשְׁעַת זְרִיקָה. אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עָלָיו, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא חָלִים מִשְּׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה עַד שְׁעַת זְרִיקָה. כְּמַאן? נֵימָא רַבָּנַן הִיא, וְלָא רַבִּי נָתָן? אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי נָתָן, גַּבְרָא דַּחֲזֵי לַאֲכִילָה בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: Who taught this As the Sages taught: one who was sick at the time of slaughter and healthy at the time of sprinkling healthy at the time of slaughter and sick at the time of sprinkling one not slaughter or sprinkle for him until he is healthy from the time of slaughter until time of sprinkling In accordance with whose Let us say it is the Rabbis, and not Rabbi Natan. even you say Rabbi Natan, we require a person who is fit for eating.
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that the Rabbis taught this: If one was sick at the time of slaughter and healthy at the time of sprinkling, or healthy at the time of slaughter and sick at the time of sprinkling, one does not slaughter or sprinkle on his behalf until he is healthy from the time of slaughter until the time of sprinkling. According to whom? Let us say it is the Rabbis, and not Rabbi Nathan? Even if you say it is Rabbi Nathan, we require a person who is fit for eating.

hebrew_text: מַאן תְּנָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁחָטוֹ בְּטׇהֳרָה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִטְמְאוּ הַבְּעָלִים — יִזָּרֵק הַדָּם בְּטׇהֳרָה, וְאַל יֵאָכֵל בָּשָׂר בְּטוּמְאָה. כְּמַאן?
human_translation: Who taught this As the Sages taught: one slaughtered in ritual purity, and after that the owners became ritually impure, the blood be sprinkled in purity and the meat not be eaten in impurity. In accordance with whose
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna who taught this that the Rabbis taught: "If it was slaughtered in a state of purity, and afterwards the owners became impure - the blood should be sprinkled in a state of purity, and the meat should not be eaten in a state of impurity." Whose opinion is this?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר): בְּמַחְלוֹקֶת שְׁנוּיָה, וְרַבִּי נָתָן הִיא. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן הִיא. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּצִיבּוּר, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּטוּמְאָה נָמֵי עָבְדִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: subject to dispute, and it is Rabbi Natan, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: even you say it is the Rabbis. With what are we dealing here? With the public they perform even in impurity.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: In a dispute that is repeated, and it is Rabbi Nathan's. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you say it is the Rabbis'. Here we are dealing with what? With a congregation, for even in impurity they acted.

hebrew_text: אִי בְּצִיבּוּר, אַמַּאי אֵין הַבָּשָׂר נֶאֱכָל בְּטוּמְאָה? גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִטָּמְאוּ הַבְּעָלִים לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה, וְיֹאמְרוּ: אֶשְׁתָּקַד לֹא נִטְמֵאנוּ וְאָכַלְנוּ? הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי נֵיכוֹל. וְלָא יָדְעִי דְּאֶשְׁתָּקַד כִּי אִיזְדְּרִיק דָּם, בְּעָלִים טְמֵאִים הֲווֹ, הַשְׁתָּא בְּעָלִים טְהוֹרִין הָווּ.
human_translation: If it is in the public, why is the meat not eaten in impurity? decree lest the owners become impure after the sprinkling and they will say: Last year, didn’t we become impure, and we ate Now too, we will eat. And they will not know that last year, when the blood was sprinkled the owners were impure, Now, the owners were pure
llm_translation: In a congregation, why is the meat not eaten in a state of impurity? It is a decree lest the owners become impure after the sprinkling, and they will say: Let us be silent, we did not become impure and yet we ate? Now, indeed, we may eat. And I do not know that when the blood is sprinkled, the owners are impure, now the owners are pure.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, רַב דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַזְּבָחִים שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה בֵּין שֶׁנִּטְמָא בָּשָׂר וְחֵלֶב קַיָּים, בֵּין שֶׁנִּטְמָא חֵלֶב וּבָשָׂר קַיָּים — זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rav, who said in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, As it was taught Rabbi Yehoshua says: all offerings in the Torah, whether the meat became ritually impure and the fat remains or the fat became ritually impure and the meat remains one sprinkle the blood.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rav said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua says: All sacrifices in the Torah, whether the flesh and fat became impure, or the fat and flesh became impure, they are valid - one sprinkles the blood.

hebrew_text: נָזִיר וְעוֹשֵׂה פֶסַח, נִטְמָא חֵלֶב וּבָשָׂר קַיָּים — זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם. נִטְמָא בָּשָׂר וְחֵלֶב קַיָּים — אֵין זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם, וְאִם זָרַק — הוּרְצָה.
human_translation: a nazirite and one who performs a Paschal lamb, the fat became impure and the meat remains one sprinkle the blood. the meat became impure and the fat remains one not sprinkle the blood if he sprinkled it was accepted.
llm_translation: Nazarite and performs Passover, became impure fat and meat valid - sprinkles the blood. Became impure meat and fat valid - does not sprinkle the blood, and if he did - it is acceptable.

hebrew_text: נִטְמְאוּ הַבְּעָלִים בְּמֵת — לֹא יִזְרוֹק, וְאִם זָרַק — לֹא הוּרְצָה.
human_translation: the owners became ritually impure from a corpse one not sprinkle and if one sprinkled it was not accepted.
llm_translation: The owners became impure with a corpse - do not sprinkle, and if he sprinkled - it is not acceptable.

hebrew_text: בַּמּוּקְדָּשִׁין אֵינוֹ כֵּן וְכוּ׳. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי?
human_translation: With regard to offerings it is not so; Who is the mishna?
llm_translation: In the sanctuaries, it is not so, etc. The Mishnah asks:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַזְּבָחִים שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּיֵּיר מֵהֶן כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר אוֹ כְּזַיִת חֵלֶב — זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם. כַּחֲצִי זַיִת בָּשָׂר וְכַחֲצִי זַיִת חֵלֶב — אֵין זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם.
human_translation: It is Rabbi Yehoshua. As it was taught Rabbi Yehoshua says: all the offerings in the Torah from which there remains an olive-bulk of meat or an olive-bulk of fat one sprinkle the blood. half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of fat, one not sprinkle the blood.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua it is. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua says: All sacrifices in the Torah, if there remains from them the size of an olive of flesh or the size of an olive of fat - one throws the blood. If there remains half an olive of flesh and half an olive of fat - one does not throw the blood.

hebrew_text: וּבָעוֹלָה, אֲפִילּוּ כַּחֲצִי זַיִת בָּשָׂר וְכַחֲצִי זַיִת חֵלֶב — זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ כָּלִיל. וּבַמִּנְחָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ קַיֶּימֶת — לֹא יִזְרוֹק.
human_translation: And with regard to a burnt-offering, even half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of fat, one sprinkle the blood because it is all consumed And with regard to a meal-offering, although all of it remains one not sprinkle
llm_translation: In the burnt offering, even if it is like half an olive of meat and half an olive of fat - one throws the blood, because its entirety is complete. And in the meal offering, even though its entirety is maintained - it shall not be thrown.

hebrew_text: מִנְחָה מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּהּ? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מִנְחַת נְסָכִים. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, כֵּיוָן דְּקָא אָתְיָא מִכֹּחַ זֶבַח — כְּגוּפֵיהּ דְּזֶבַח דָּמֵי. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What is a meal-offering doing Rav Pappa said: the meal-offering libations It could enter your mind to say: Since it comes due to the offering, it is comparable to the offering itself. it teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the function of the Minchah offering? Rav Papa said: It is a Minchah of libations. Do you think I would say that since it comes from the strength of the sacrifice, it is like the body of the sacrifice itself? It is implied to us.

hebrew_text: חֵלֶב מְנָא לַן? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וּמָטוּ בַּהּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהִקְטִיר הַחֵלֶב לְרֵיחַ נִיחֹחַ לַה׳״, חֵלֶב — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בָּשָׂר.
human_translation: From where do we fat Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, and determined this in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: As the verse states: and he shall make the fat smoke for a satisfying aroma to the Lord” fat although there is no meat.
llm_translation: The fat, what is our opinion? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, and they agreed with him in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah, as the verse states: "And the fat shall he make a sweet savor unto the Lord." Fat - even though there is no meat.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן חֵלֶב. יוֹתֶרֶת הַכָּבֵד וּשְׁתֵּי כְלָיוֹת, מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: We have found fat the diaphragm and two kidneys, from where do we
llm_translation: We found fat. The greater part of the liver and two kidneys, how do we count them?

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא אָמְרִינַן דְּזָרְקִינַן? מִדְּקָתָנֵי: וּבַמִּנְחָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ קַיֶּימֶת — לֹא יִזְרוֹק. מִנְחָה הוּא דְּלָא, אֲבָל יוֹתֶרֶת הַכָּבֵד וּשְׁתֵּי הַכְּלָיוֹת — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי, מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: Where did we say that one sprinkle from that it is taught And with regard to a meal-offering, although all of it remains one not sprinkle it is a meal-offering one not sprinkle but the diaphragm and the two kidneys, it seems well from where do we
llm_translation: Here is where we say that we throw? Since it is taught: "And in the meal-offering, even though it is entirely intact - it should not be thrown." It is a meal-offering that is not, but the greater part of the liver and the two kidneys - their value is good, how do we count them?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לְרֵיחַ נִיחֹחַ״ — כֹּל שֶׁאַתָּה מַעֲלֶה לְרֵיחַ נִיחוֹחַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan himself said, The verse states: For a satisfying aroma, anything you raise as a satisfying aroma,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan did say, his teacher said, the verse says: "for a pleasing aroma" - anything that you bring up for a pleasing aroma.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב חֵלֶב וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״רֵיחַ נִיחוֹחַ״, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא חֵלֶב, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: חֵלֶב — אִין, יוֹתֶרֶת הַכָּבֵד וּשְׁתֵּי הַכְּלָיוֹת — לָא, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״לְרֵיחַ נִיחוֹחַ״. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״לְרֵיחַ נִיחוֹחַ״, הָוֵה אָמֵינָא: כׇּל הָעוֹלִין לְרֵיחַ נִיחוֹחַ, וַאֲפִילּוּ מִנְחָה, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא חֵלֶב.
human_translation: And necessary to write fat and necessary to write: For a satisfying aroma. As, if the Merciful One had written fat, I would have said fat yes, the diaphragm and two kidneys no, the Merciful One writes: For a satisfying aroma. And if the Merciful One had written For a satisfying aroma, I would have said anything that rises as a satisfying aroma, and even a meal-offering the Merciful One writes fat,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And it is necessary to write 'fat,' and it is necessary to write 'a pleasing aroma,' for if the Merciful One had written 'fat,' I would have said: fat - the liver and the two kidneys - no, but the Merciful One wrote 'a pleasing aroma.' And if the Merciful One had written 'a pleasing aroma,' I would have said: all that ascend for a pleasing aroma, even a meal offering, the Merciful One wrote 'fat.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִטְמָא קָהָל אוֹ רוּבּוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים טְמֵאִים וְהַקָּהָל טְהוֹרִים — יַעֲשׂוּ בְּטוּמְאָה. נִטְמָא מִיעוּט הַקָּהָל — הַטְּהוֹרִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן, וְהַטְּמֵאִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: community or most of it became ritually impure, or the priests were impure and the community was pure, they should perform in ritual impurity. a minority of the community became impure, those who are pure perform the first and those who are impure perform the second
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the congregation or the majority of it became impure, or if the priests were impure and the congregation was pure, they should perform the service in a state of impurity. If only a minority of the congregation became impure, the pure individuals perform the first service, and the impure individuals perform the second service.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל טְמֵאִין וְכֹהֲנִים וּכְלֵי שָׁרֵת טְהוֹרִין, אוֹ שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל טְהוֹרִין וְכֹהֲנִים וּכְלֵי שָׁרֵת טְמֵאִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְכֹהֲנִים טְהוֹרִין וּכְלֵי שָׁרֵת טְמֵאִין — יַעֲשׂוּ בְּטוּמְאָה, שֶׁאֵין קׇרְבַּן צִיבּוּר חָלוּק.
human_translation: The Sages taught: the Jewish people were impure and the priests and sacred vessels pure; or, the Jewish people were pure and the priests and sacred vessels impure; and even the Jewish people and the priests were pure and the sacred vessels impure, they perform in ritual impurity. a communal offering, is not divided.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If the Israelites were impure and the priests and the Temple vessels were pure, or if the Israelites were pure and the priests and the Temple vessels were impure, and even if the Israelites and the priests were pure but the Temple vessels were impure — they should perform the service in a state of impurity, for a communal offering does not require distinction.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּטְמָא הַסַּכִּין בִּטְמֵא מֵת, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״בַּחֲלַל חֶרֶב״, חֶרֶב הֲרֵי הוּא כֶּחָלָל,
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: They taught only the knife became impure through one who was ritually impure a corpse, as the Merciful One states: one slain with a sword, A sword is like a corpse.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: They only taught that a knife becomes impure through contact with a corpse, for the Merciful One said: "In the place where the sword" (Ezekiel 21:20), a sword is like a corpse.

hebrew_text: וְקָא מְטַמֵּא לְגַבְרָא, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא כִּי מִיתְעֲבִיד — בְּטוּמְאַת הַגּוּף דְּכָרֵת קָא מִיתְעֲבִיד.
human_translation: it renders impure the person when is initially performed, it is performed in ritual impurity of the body. karet
llm_translation: And he is making impure to a man, for from the outset when he engages — in the impurity of the body, he is engaging in excision.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל נִטְמָא הַסַּכִּין בְּטוּמְאַת שֶׁרֶץ, דְּבָשָׂר הוּא דִּמְטַמְּיָא לֵיהּ, לְגַבְרָא לָא מְטַמְּיָא לֵיהּ. טְהוֹרִין — עָבֵיד, טְמֵאִין — לָא עָבֵיד, מוּטָב יֵאָכֵל בְּטוּמְאַת בָּשָׂר בְּלָאו, וְאַל יֵאָכֵל בָּשָׂר בְּטוּמְאַת הַגּוּף שֶׁהוּא בְּכָרֵת.
human_translation: However, the knife became ritually impure with the impurity of a creeping animal, which renders the meat impure but does not render the person impure, those who are pure perform those who are impure may not perform it is preferable that one eat with impurity of the meat, negative commandment, and one should not eat the meat with impurity of the body, which karet .
llm_translation: But if the knife became impure with the impurity of a creeping thing, it is the flesh that renders it impure, not the man. Pure individuals may handle it, impure individuals may not handle it. It is better to eat meat in a state of impurity without a prohibition, rather than eat meat in a state of impurity of the body, which results in excision.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא קָסָבַר רַב חִסְדָּא: טוּמְאָה דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: טוּמְאָה דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: Apparently, Rav Ḥisda holds impurity is overridden in the public. And, so too, Rabbi Yitzḥak said Impurity is overridden in the public.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Alma kasavra Rav Ḥisda: tum'ah deḥuyah hi be-tzibbur. Ve-ḥen amar Rabbi Yitzḥak: tum'ah deḥuyah hi be-tzibbur." English translation: "The reason Rav Ḥisda holds: impurity that is pushed aside in a public domain. And so said Rabbi Yitzḥak: impurity that is pushed aside in a public domain."

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ טְמֵאִין נָמֵי עָבְדִי. מַאי טַעְמָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַבָּשָׂר אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בְּכׇל טָמֵא לֹא יֵאָכֵל בָּאֵשׁ יִשָּׂרֵף וְהַבָּשָׂר כׇּל טָהוֹר יֹאכַל בָּשָׂר״.
human_translation: And Rava said even those who are ritually impure may also perform What is the reason As it is written: “And the flesh that touches any impure thing shall not be eaten, it shall be burned in fire; and the flesh, every one that is pure may eat the flesh”
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if they are impure, they are considered like servants. What is the reason? As it is written: "But the flesh that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten; it shall be burned with fire. And as for the flesh, all that are clean may eat the flesh."

hebrew_text: כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּלָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְהַבָּשָׂר אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בְּכׇל טָמֵא לֹא יֵאָכֵל״, לָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְהַבָּשָׂר כׇּל טָהוֹר יֹאכַל בָּשָׂר״. כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּקָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְהַבָּשָׂר אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בְּכׇל טָמֵא לֹא יֵאָכֵל״, קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְהַבָּשָׂר כׇּל טָהוֹר יֹאכַל בָּשָׂר״.
human_translation: anywhere that we do not apply “the flesh that touches any impure thing shall not be eaten” we do not apply “and the flesh, every one that is pure may eat the flesh.” anywhere that we apply “the flesh that touches any impure thing shall not be eaten” we apply “And the flesh, every one that is pure may eat the flesh.”
llm_translation: In every place where we do not read in it "And the flesh that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten," we do not read in it "And the flesh of any clean animal shall be eaten." In every place where we read in it "And the flesh that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten," we read in it "And the flesh of any clean animal shall be eaten."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר. הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶחֱצָה טְהוֹרִין וּמֶחֱצָה טְמֵאִין. רַב אָמַר: מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה כְּרוֹב. וְרַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה אֵינוֹ כְּרוֹב.
human_translation: It was stated the Jewish people were half pure and half impure, Rav said half and half is like the majority, and Rav Kahana said half and half is not like the majority.
llm_translation: It was stated: Behold, when the Israelites were half pure and half impure. Rav said: Half and half is like the majority. And Rav Kahana said: Half and half is not like the majority.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה כְּרוֹב: הַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן, וְהַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן. וְרַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה אֵינוֹ כְּרוֹב: טְהוֹרִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן, וּטְמֵאִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: Rav said: Half and half is like the majority, those perform for themselves And those perform for themselves And Rav Kahana said: Half and half is not like the majority. pure perform the first and impure perform the second
llm_translation: Rav said: Half and half is like the majority. These (the pure) act for themselves, and these (the impure) act for themselves. And Rav Kahana said: Half and half is not like the majority. The pure ones act for the first, and the impure ones act for the second.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה אֵינוֹ כְּרוֹב — טְהוֹרִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן,
human_translation: Some say Rav Kahana said: Half and half is not like the majority. those who are pure perform first
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rav Kahana said: Half and half is not like the majority - the pure ones perform the first.

hebrew_text: וּטְמֵאִין אֵין עוֹשִׂין לֹא אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי. בָּרִאשׁוֹן לָא עָבְדִי — דְּלָא הָווּ רוּבָּא. בַּשֵּׁנִי לָא עָבְדִי — דְּלָא הָווּ מִיעוּטָא.
human_translation: and those who are impure do not perform the first or the second. They do not perform on the first because they are not the majority, they may not perform on the second because they are not the minority,
llm_translation: And they become impure, they do not do neither the first nor the second. In the first - they did not serve, for they were not the majority. In the second - they did not serve, for they were not the minority.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: נִטְמָא קָהָל אוֹ רוּבּוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים טְמֵאִין וְהַקָּהָל טְהוֹרִים — יֵעָשֶׂה בְּטוּמְאָה. רוּבּוֹ הוּא דְּעָבְדִי בְּטוּמְאָה, אֲבָל פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא לָא עָבְדִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן. קַשְׁיָא לְרַב!
human_translation: we learned the entire community became ritually impure, or most of it or the priests were impure and the community pure, they perform in impurity. most of that they perform in impurity, but half and half, they do not perform on the first a difficulty to Rav.
llm_translation: We learned: If the majority of the congregation or its entirety became impure, or if the priests were impure and the congregation was pure - the service is performed in a state of impurity. It is the majority that caused the impurity, but half and half did not cause it initially. This is a difficulty for Rav!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַב: רוּבָּא עָבְדִי כּוּלְּהוּ בְּטוּמְאָה, פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא — הַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן וְהַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן.
human_translation: Rav said to you: a majority they all perform in impurity. half and half, these perform for themselves and these perform for themselves
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav: "The majority of my servants are all impure, half and half - these do for themselves, and these do for themselves."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: נִטְמָא מִיעוּט הַקָּהָל, טְהוֹרִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן וּטְמֵאִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי. מִיעוּט הוּא דְּעָבְדִי בַּשֵּׁנִי, אֲבָל פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא — לָא. וְעָבְדִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן, וְהַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן וְהַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as the latter clause teaches: a minority of the community became impure, those who are pure perform the first and those who are impure perform the second the minority that they perform on the second But half and half not these perform for themselves and those perform for themselves
llm_translation: Thus it was explained: for it was taught in the latter clause: If a minority of the congregation became impure, the pure ones perform the first offering and the impure ones perform the second. It is a minority that performs the second, but half and half - no. And if they performed the first, these the pure ones perform for themselves and these the impure ones perform for themselves.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא לְרַב כָּהֲנָא! אָמַר לָךְ רַב כָּהֲנָא: נִטְמְאוּ מִיעוּט הַקָּהָל — טְהוֹרִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן וּטְמֵאִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי. הָא פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא — טְהוֹרִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן, אֲבָל טְמֵאִין אֵינָן עוֹשִׂין לֹא אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: However, it then a difficulty to Rav Kahana. Rav Kahana said to you a minority of the community became ritually impure, those who are pure perform the first and those who are impure perform the second half and half, those who are pure perform the first and those who are impure do not perform the first or the second
llm_translation: The difficulty remains for Rav Kahana! Rav Kahana said to you: If a minority of the congregation became impure - the pure ones perform the first offering, and the impure ones perform the second offering. If it is half and half - the pure ones perform the first offering, but the impure ones do not perform either the first or the second offering.

hebrew_text: הָתִינַח לְלִישָּׁנָא בָּתְרָא דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא. אֶלָּא לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: טְהוֹרִים עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן, וּטְמֵאִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: well according to the latter version But according to that version, which Rav Kahana said those who are pure perform the first and those who are impure perform the second what is there to say?
llm_translation: He prepared for Lishna after Rav Kahana. Rather, to establish Lishna as Rav Kahana said: The pure ones perform the first, and the impure ones perform the second. What is there to say?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב כָּהֲנָא: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא נָמֵי — טְהוֹרִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן, וּטְמֵאִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי. וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי מִיעוּט הַקָּהָל, אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״רוּבּוֹ״ — תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא ״מִיעוּטוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said to you The same is true even half and half as well; those who are pure perform the first and those who are impure perform the second And that which was taught a minority of the community since it taught in the first clause the majority of it also taught in the latter clause the minority of
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav Kahana: The same applies even if half and half are standing - the pure ones perform the first, and the impure ones perform the second. And that which is taught, "the majority of the congregation," is explained by the fact that the first Tanna says "its majority," and the latter Tanna says "its minority."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא כִּתְרֵי לִישָּׁנֵי. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב: הָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶחֱצָה טְהוֹרִין וּמֶחֱצָה טְמֵאִין, הַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן וְהַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן.
human_translation: it was taught in accordance with Rav, it was taught in accordance with Rav Kahana, in accordance with two versions It was taught in accordance with Rav: the Jewish people were half pure and half impure, those perform for themselves and those perform for themselves
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in the name of Rav, it was taught in a Baraita in the name of Rav Kahana: Two groups of Israelites, one half pure and one half impure, these make for themselves and those make for themselves.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּלִישְׁנָא קַמָּא דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶחֱצָה טְהוֹרִין וּמֶחֱצָה טְמֵאִין, טְהוֹרִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן וּטְמֵאִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: It was taught in accordance with the first version of Rav Kahana: the Jewish people were half pure and half impure, those who are pure perform the first and those who are impure perform the second
llm_translation: It was taught in the first chapter of Rav Kahana: If the Israelites were half pure and half impure, the pure ones perform the first task, and the impure ones perform the second task.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא בָּתְרָא דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶחֱצָה טְהוֹרִין וּמֶחֱצָה טְמֵאִין, טְהוֹרִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן, וּטְמֵאִין אֵינָן עוֹשִׂין לֹא אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: And it was taught in accordance with the latter version of Rav Kahana: the Jewish people were half pure and half impure, those who are pure perform the first and those who are impure do not perform the first or the second
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita after Rav Kahana: If the Israelites were half pure and half impure, the pure ones perform the first Pesach offering, and the impure ones do not perform either the first or the second Pesach offering.

hebrew_text: לְרַב וּלְלִישָּׁנָא בָּתְרָא דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא, הָא דְּתָנָא ״טְהוֹרִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן וּטְמֵאִין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי״, הֵיכִי מְתָרְצִי לַהּ? כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶחֱצָה טְהוֹרִין וּמֶחֱצָה טְמֵאִין, וְנָשִׁים מַשְׁלִימוֹת לַטְּמֵאִים.
human_translation: According to Rav and according to the latter version of Rav Kahana, that which was taught those who are pure perform the first and those who are impure the second how do they reconcile it? where the Jewish people half pure and half impure. and the women complete the impure
llm_translation: To Rav and to Lishana, the daughter of Rav Kahana, this that it was taught: "The pure ones perform the first and the impure ones perform the second," how do you reconcile it? For example, when the Israelites were half pure and half impure, and the women completed for the impure ones.

hebrew_text: וְקָסָבַר: נָשִׁים בָּרִאשׁוֹן רְשׁוּת. דַּל נָשִׁים מִטְּמֵאִין, וְהָווּ לְהוּ טְמֵאִין מִיעוּטָא, וּמִיעוּטָא יִדְחוּ לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: And holds women in the first is optional. remove the women from those who are impure, and the impure become the minority. And the minority is deferred to the second Pesaḥ
llm_translation: He wrote: Women in the first Passover are optional. Because women are exempt from the obligation of becoming impure, and they would become impure from a minority of the sacrifices, and from a minority they would be pushed to the second Passover.

hebrew_text: לְרַב וּלְלִישָּׁנָא קַמָּא דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא, הָא דְּתַנְיָא ״טְהוֹרִין עוֹשִׂין אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן וּטְמֵאִין אֵין עוֹשִׂין לֹא אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי״, הֵיכִי מְתָרְצִי לַהּ?
human_translation: According to Rav and according to the first version of Rav Kahana, that which was taught Those who are pure perform first and those who are impure do not perform the first or the second how do they reconcile it
llm_translation: To Rav and to Lishana, before Rav Kahana, as it was taught: "The pure ones perform the first, and the impure ones do not perform neither the first nor the second." How do we resolve this?

hebrew_text: רַב מְתָרֵיץ לַהּ, כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶחֱצָה טְמֵאִין וּמֶחֱצָה טְהוֹרִין, וְנָשִׁים עוֹדְפוֹת עַל הַטְּהוֹרִים, וְקָסָבַר: נָשִׁים בָּרִאשׁוֹן חוֹבָה, וּבַשֵּׁנִי רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: Rav reconciles where the Jewish people were half impure and half pure, and women, added on to pure And holds women in the first is obligatory, and in the second is optional.
llm_translation: Rav resolves it for her, for example, when the Israelites were half impure and half pure, and the women exceeded the number of the pure ones, and he holds: women in the first group are obligated, and in the second group it is optional.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹן לָא עָבְדִי — דְּהָוֵי לֵיהּ מִיעוּט, וּמִיעוּטָא לָא עָבְדִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן. וּבַשֵּׁנִי לָא עָבְדִי — דַּל נָשִׁים מִינַּיְיהוּ וְהָווּ לְהוּ פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא, וּפַלְגָא לָא עָבְדִי בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: on the first do not perform because they are a minority, and a minority may not perform on the first And on the second they do not perform removes the women from them, are half and half does not perform on the second
llm_translation: In the first case, he did not perform - for it would be considered a deficiency for him, and a deficiency is not performed in the first case. And in the second case, he did not perform - because they were poor in women from them, and they would be divided into halves and halves, and a half is not performed in the second case.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב כָּהֲנָא דַּאֲמַר: פַּלְגָא נָמֵי עָבְדִי בַּשֵּׁנִי, הָכִי מְתָרֵיץ לַהּ: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶחֱצָה טְהוֹרִין וּמֶחֱצָה טְמֵאִין, וְנָשִׁים מַשְׁלִימוֹת לַטְּהוֹרִין. וְקָסָבַר: נָשִׁים בָּרִאשׁוֹן חוֹבָה וּבַשֵּׁנִי רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: And according to Rav Kahana, which he said that half also performs on the second this he would reconcile where the Jewish people were half pure and half impure. and the women completed the pure And holds women on the first is obligatory, and on the second is optional.
llm_translation: And for Rav Kahana who said: "I serve a dish on the second day," thus he resolves it: For example, when the Israelites were half pure and half impure, and the women would complete for the pure ones. And he holds: Women in the first instance are obligated, and in the second instance it is optional.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹן לָא עָבְדִי — דְּהָווּ לְהוּ פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא, וּפַלְגָא בָּרִאשׁוֹן לָא עָבְדִי, בַּשֵּׁנִי נָמֵי לָא עָבְדִי — דַּל נָשִׁים מִינַּיְיהוּ מִן הַטְּהוֹרִין הָווּ לְהוּ טְמֵאִין רוּבָּא, וְרוּבָּא לָא עָבְדִי בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: on the first they not perform because they are half and half, and half may not perform on the first On the second as well, they may not perform remove the women from the impure become the majority, and the majority does not perform on the second
llm_translation: In the first case, we do not act - for they were half and half, and half in the first case we do not act; in the second case we also do not act - for the majority of women from them were from the impure group, and the majority we do not act in the second case.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב כָּהֲנָא, הָא דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶחֱצָה טְהוֹרִין וּמֶחֱצָה טְמֵאִין, הַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן וְהַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן, הֵיכִי מְתָרֵיץ לַהּ? אָמַר לָךְ רַב כָּהֲנָא: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה כְּרוֹב, וְאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה אֵינוֹ כְּרוֹב.
human_translation: And according to Rav Kahana, that which was taught the Jewish people were half pure and half impure, those perform for themselves and those perform for themselves how does he reconcile it? Rav Kahana said to you: is the tanna’im . There is one who said half and half, is like the majority, and there is one who said half and half is not like the majority.
llm_translation: To Rav Kahana, this that it was taught: If the Israelites were half pure and half impure, these make for themselves and these make for themselves, how does one resolve it? Rav Kahana said to you: It is a dispute of Tannaim. There is for the one who says: Half against half like the majority, and there is for the one who says: Half against half is not like the majority.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶחֱצָה טְהוֹרִין וּמֶחֱצָה טְמֵאִין, הַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן וְהַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן. הָיוּ טְמֵאִין עוֹדְפִין עַל הַטְּהוֹרִין, אֲפִילּוּ אֶחָד — יַעֲשׂוּ בְּטוּמְאָה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין קׇרְבַּן צִיבּוּר חָלוּק.
human_translation: the itself the Jewish people half pure and half impure, those perform for themselves and those perform for themselves those who were impure outnumbered those who were pure even one they should perform in ritual impurity because a communal offering is not divided.
llm_translation: Body: If Israel were half pure and half impure, these make for themselves and these make for themselves. If the impure outnumber the pure, even one - they should do so in impurity, because a communal offering is not divided.
