hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן מַתְיָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין הַיָּחִיד מַכְרִיעַ אֶת הַצִּיבּוּר לְטוּמְאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Matya says: The individual cannot tip public toward ritual impurity, as it is stated:
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Matya says: The individual does not decide for the community regarding impurity, as it is stated:

hebrew_text: ״לֹא תוּכַל לִזְבֹּחַ אֶת הַפָּסַח בְּאַחַד שְׁעָרֶיךָ״.
human_translation: “You may not sacrifice the Paschal lamb in any one of your cities”
llm_translation: "You are not able to slaughter the Passover sacrifice in one of your gates."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ שֵׁבֶט אֶחָד טָמֵא וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַשְּׁבָטִים טְהוֹרִים — הַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן וְהַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, קָסָבַר: שֵׁבֶט אֶחָד אִיקְּרִי קָהָל.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even one tribe ritually impure and all the rest of the tribes pure, those perform for themselves and those perform for themselves What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? He holds one tribe is called a community,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even if one tribe is impure and the rest of all the tribes are pure - these do for themselves and these do for themselves. What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion? He holds: One tribe is called a congregation.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ שֵׁבֶט אֶחָד טָמֵא וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַשְּׁבָטִים טְהוֹרִין — יַעֲשׂוּ בְּטוּמְאָה, שֶׁאֵין קׇרְבַּן צִיבּוּר חָלוּק. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: שֵׁבֶט אֶחָד אִיקְּרִי קָהָל. וְהָווּ לְהוּ פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא, וְאֵין קׇרְבַּן צִיבּוּר חָלוּק — וְעָבְדִי כּוּלְּהוּ בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one tribe is impure and all the rest of the tribes are pure, perform in ritual impurity, as a communal offering is not divided. Rabbi Yehuda holds one tribe is called a community, and half and half And a communal offering is not divided. all of them may perform in ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if one tribe is impure and all the other tribes are pure, they should perform the Passover offering in a state of impurity, for the communal offering is not divided. Rabbi Yehuda holds that one tribe is called a congregation. And they should be divided into groups, and the communal offering is not divided - and they all perform it in a state of impurity.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶחֱצָה טְהוֹרִין וּמֶחֱצָה טְמֵאִין, אָמַר רַב: מְטַמְּאִין אֶחָד מֵהֶן בְּשֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: It was stated the Jewish people were half pure and half impure, Rav said: They render impure one of with a creeping animal.
llm_translation: It was stated: The Israelites were half pure and half impure. Rav said: They render one of them impure with a creeping thing.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? נִיעְבְּדוּ הָנֵי לְחוֹדַיְיהוּ וְהָנֵי לְחוֹדַיְיהוּ, דְּהָא אָמַר רַב: הַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן, וְהַלָּלוּ עוֹשִׂין לְעַצְמָן! אָמְרִי: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ טְמֵאִין עוֹדְפִין עַל הַטְּהוֹרִין אֶחָד.
human_translation: Why Let those perform on their own and those perform on their own Didn’t Rav say: those perform for themselves and those perform for themselves? Say With what are we dealing here? where the ritually impure outnumbered the ritually pure one
llm_translation: And why? These were mixed, some for themselves and some for themselves, for Rav said: These do for themselves, and these do for themselves! They said: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, they were impure and were left over on one who is pure.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הָווּ לְהוּ רוּבָּא טְמֵאִים? נִיעְבְּדוּ כּוּלְּהוּ בְּטוּמְאָה! סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן מַתְיָא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין הַיָּחִיד מַכְרִיעַ אֶת הַצִּיבּוּר לְטוּמְאָה. אִי הָכִי, הֲדַר קוּשְׁיַין לְדוּכְתֵּיהּ: נִיעְבְּדוּ הָנֵי לְחוֹדַיְיהוּ וְהָנֵי לְחוֹדַיְיהוּ!
human_translation: If so, the majority is impure. let them all perform in impurity. holds in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Matya, who said: An individual cannot tip the community toward ritual impurity. If so, our question has returned to its place. let those perform on their own and those on their own
llm_translation: If so, were they all impure? They were all involved in impurity! He thought like Rabbi Elazar ben Matya, who said: An individual cannot impose impurity on the community. If so, they should have investigated each one separately: these for their own sake and those for their own sake!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי אִיכָּא תַּנָּא דְּסָבַר לַהּ כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא, דְּאָמַר: פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא לָא עָבְדִי כּוּלְּהוּ בְּטוּמְאָה, וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: אֵין קׇרְבַּן צִיבּוּר חָלוּק — מְטַמְּאִין אֶחָד מֵהֶן בְּשֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: Rather, this is said: If there is a tanna who holds in accordance with the first tanna , who said that half and half they do not all perform in impurity, and holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who said a communal offering is not divided, render impure one of with a creeping animal.
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said: If there is a Mishnah that he holds like the first Mishnah, which says: "Neither group did the entire service in a state of impurity," and he holds like Rabbi Yehuda, who says: "A communal offering is not divided," then one of them becomes impure with a creeping thing.

hebrew_text: וְעוּלָּא אָמַר: מְשַׁלְּחִין אֶחָד מֵהֶן לְדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה. וִיטַמְּאֶנּוּ בְּשֶׁרֶץ!
human_translation: And Ulla said: they send one of them to a distant place, Let them render him impure with a creeping animal
llm_translation: And it was said: They send one of them on a distant journey. And he becomes impure with a creeping thing!

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר: שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: holds one slaughter and sprinkle for someone ritually impure from a creeping animal
llm_translation: He holds: slaughtering and sprinkling on impure that swarms.

hebrew_text: וִיטַמְּאֶנּוּ בְּמֵת! מַדְחֵהוּ אַתָּה מֵחֲגִיגָתוֹ.
human_translation: Let them render him impure with a corpse, you defer him from his Festival peace-offering.
llm_translation: And he shall become impure with a corpse! You are removing him from his festival.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי מַדְחֵהוּ אַתָּה מִפִּסְחוֹ! אֶפְשָׁר דְּעָבֵיד בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: Now, too, you disqualify him from his Paschal lamb It is possible that he will perform on the second
llm_translation: The question was asked before him, "Are you exempt from his Passover offering?" It is possible that he is doing it for the second time.

hebrew_text: בְּמֵת נָמֵי, אֶפְשָׁר דְּעָבֵיד בַּשְּׁבִיעִי דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ שְׁמִינִי שֶׁלּוֹ!
human_translation: With regard to a corpse also, it is possible that he will perform on the seventh which is his eighth day
llm_translation: In the case of a deceased person, it is possible that he may have engaged in marital relations on the seventh day, which would be considered his eighth day!

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר עוּלָּא: כּוּלְּהוּ — תַּשְׁלוּמִין דְּרִאשׁוֹן נִינְהוּ. דַּחֲזֵי בָּרִאשׁוֹן — חֲזֵי בְּכוּלְּהוּ, וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּלָא חֲזֵי בָּרִאשׁוֹן — לָא חֲזֵי בְּכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: Ulla holds all are redress for the first one who is fit on the first is fit on all of them, and whenever one is not fit on the first he is not fit on all of them.
llm_translation: Rav Ula holds: All of them - the payments of the first one they are. If he sees in the first one - he sees in all of them, and wherever he does not see in the first one - he does not see in all of them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן: זִילוּ וֶאֱמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְעוּלָּא, מַאן צָיֵית דְּעָקַר סִיכֵּיהּ וּמַשְׁכְּנֵיהּ וְרָהֵיט.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Go and say to Ulla Who will listen to uproot his pegs and tent and run
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Nachman: Go and say to Ulai, who is able to uproot his hedge and his dwelling and plow.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָיוּ רוּבָּן זָבִין, וּמִיעוּטָן טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים, אָמַר רַב: אוֹתָן טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים אֵינָן עוֹשִׂין לֹא בָּרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: It was stated the majority of were zavim and a minority of them were ritually impure from a corpse, Rav said: Those impure from a corpse do not perform on the first or on the second
llm_translation: It was stated: If the majority are zabim and the minority are impure due to contact with the dead, Rav said: Those impure due to contact with the dead do not perform either the first or the second.

hebrew_text: רִאשׁוֹן לָא עָבְדִי, דְּהָווּ מִיעוּטָא, וּמִיעוּטָא לָא עָבְדִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן. בַּשֵּׁנִי נָמֵי לָא עָבְדִי, כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּעָבְדִי צִיבּוּר בָּרִאשׁוֹן — עָבֵיד יָחִיד בַּשֵּׁנִי. כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּלָא עָבְדִי צִיבּוּר בָּרִאשׁוֹן — לָא עָבֵיד יָחִיד בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: first they do not perform because they are the minority, and the minority may not perform on the first On the second they also do not perform whenever the community performs on the first the individual performs on the second. whenever the community does not perform on the first the individual does not perform on the second
llm_translation: First, we did not serve, as it was a minority, and a minority did not serve first. In the second, we also did not serve, wherever the community served first - an individual served in the second. Wherever the community did not serve first - an individual did not serve in the second.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ שְׁמוּאֵל, זִילוּ אֱמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְאַבָּא: ״וְיַעֲשׂוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַפָּסַח בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״ מַאי עָבְדַתְּ לֵיהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ, זִילוּ אֱמַרוּ לֵיהּ: כִּי הֲווֹ כּוּלְּהוּ זָבִין מַאי עָבְדַתְּ לֵיהּ? אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר — לָא אֶפְשָׁר. הָכָא נָמֵי, לָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: Shmuel said to Go and say to Abba: What do you do with “Let the children of Israel offer the Paschal lamb in its appointed time” said to Go and say to him: When they are all zavim , what do you do? Rather, since it is impossible it is impossible. Here, too, it is impossible.
llm_translation: He said to them Samuel, go say to Abba: "And the children of Israel shall make the Passover in its appointed time." What did he do to him? He said to them, go say to him: When all of them are impure, what did he do to him? Rather, since it is not possible - it is not possible. Here too, it is not possible.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָיוּ רוּבָּן טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים וּמִיעוּטָן זָבִין,
human_translation: It was stated The majority of were ritually impure from a corpse and a minority of them were zavim ,
llm_translation: It was stated: If the majority are impure due to contact with a corpse, and the minority are impure due to a seminal emission,

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אֵין תַּשְׁלוּמִין לְפֶסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה, וְרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר: יֵשׁ תַּשְׁלוּמִין לְפֶסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: There is no redress for a Paschal lamb that is brought in ritual impurity. And Rav Adda bar Ahava said: There is redress for a Paschal lamb that is brought in impurity.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: There are no payments for a Passover offering that comes with impurity, and Rav Adda bar Ahava said: There are payments for a Passover offering that comes with impurity.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר: אֵין תַּשְׁלוּמִין לְפֶסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה, קָסָבַר: טוּמְאָה דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about the following: the one who said there is no redress for a Paschal lamb that is brought in impurity, holds ritual impurity is overridden in the public.
llm_translation: Said in that case where they disagree, for whoever says: there is no obligation of payment for the Passover offering brought in a state of impurity, holds: impurity that is pushed aside is valid in a communal context.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָמַר: יֵשׁ תַּשְׁלוּמִין לְפֶסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה, קָסָבַר: טוּמְאָה הוּתְּרָה בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: the one who said there is redress for a Paschal lamb that is brought in ritual impurity, holds ritual impurity is permitted in the public.
llm_translation: The one who says: there are payments for the Passover brought in impurity, holds: impurity is permitted in public.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לָא. דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא טוּמְאָה דְּחוּיָה בְּצִיבּוּר, וּבְהָא פְּלִיגִי: מָר סָבַר —
human_translation: Say: No, everyone agrees ritual impurity is overridden in the public, and they disagree about this Master, holds:
llm_translation: They said: No. For the general principle is that impurity that is nullified in a congregation, and in this they disagree: Master holds —

hebrew_text: טׇהֳרָה מְדַחֲיָא, טוּמְאָה לָא מְדַחֲיָא. וּמָר סָבַר — אֲפִילּוּ טוּמְאָה נָמֵי מְדַחֲיָא.
human_translation: purity defers impurity does not defer And Master, holds even ritual impurity defers
llm_translation: Purity pushes away, impurity does not push away. And Mar thought — even impurity like pushes away.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָיוּ שְׁלִישִׁיתָן זָבִין, וּשְׁלִישִׁיתָן טְהוֹרִין, וּשְׁלִישִׁיתָן טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים — אָמַר רַבִּי מָנִי בַּר פַּטִּישׁ: אוֹתָן טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים אֵינָן עוֹשִׂין לֹא אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא הַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: It was stated one-third of were zavim , and one-third of them were ritually pure, and one-third of them were ritually impure with impurity imparted by a corpse, Rabbi Manni bar Pattish said: Those who were ritually impure with impurity imparted by a corpse do not perform on the first or the second
llm_translation: It was stated: their third (portion) are Zavim, and their third (portion) are pure, and their third (portion) are impure from corpses - Rabbi Mani bar Patis said: Those impure from corpses do not render (the food) neither the first (portion) nor the second.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹן לָא עָבְדִי: הִגְדִּילוּ זָבִין עַל הַטְּהוֹרִים, דְּלָא עָבְדִי בְּטוּמְאָה, הָוֵה לֵיהּ טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים מִיעוּטָא — וּמִיעוּטָא לָא עָבְדִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן. בַּשֵּׁנִי לָא עָבְדִי: נִצָּרְפוּ זָבִין עִם טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים, דְּלָא עָבְדִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן, הָווּ לְהוּ רוּבָּא — וְרוּבָּא לָא מִדְּחוּ לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: On the first they do not perform the zavim increased the ritually pure, as may not perform in impurity. the ritually impure with impurity imparted by a corpse are the minority, and a minority may not perform on the first On the second they may not perform The zavim are joined with those ritually impure with impurity imparted by a corpse, who did not perform on the first they are the majority, and majority is not deferred to the second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: In the first case, they did not perform the Pesach offering: they increased the number of Zavim who were pure, for they did not perform it in impurity, so there were few who were impure due to contact with the dead — and few impure individuals they did not perform it in the first case. In the second case, they did not perform the Pesach offering: Zavim were mixed with those impure due to contact with the dead, for they did not perform it in the first case, they were the majority — and the majority does not push off the obligation to the second Pesach.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפֶּסַח שֶׁנִּזְרַק דָּמוֹ וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹדַע שֶׁהוּא טָמֵא — הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה. נִטְמָא הַגּוּף — אֵין הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָמְרוּ: הַנָּזִיר וְעוֹשֵׂה פֶסַח, הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל טוּמְאַת הַדָּם, וְאֵין הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה עַל טוּמְאַת הַגּוּף.
human_translation: a Paschal lamb whose blood was sprinkled and subsequently it became known that was ritually impure, the frontplate appeases the body had become ritually impure, the frontplate does not appease because said the nazirite and one who performs the Paschal lamb, the frontplate appeases for impurity of the blood the frontplate does not appease for impurity of the body
llm_translation: It was taught: The Passover offering whose blood was sprinkled, and afterwards it became known that it is impure - the forehead plate is acceptable. If the body became impure - the forehead plate is not acceptable, because they said: "The Nazirite who is observing the Passover, the forehead plate is acceptable for the impurity of the blood, but the forehead plate is not acceptable for the impurity of the body."

hebrew_text: נִטְמָא טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם — הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה.
human_translation: become impure ritual impurity of the deep, the frontplate appeases
llm_translation: He became impure with the impurity of the abyss - he gazed and was satisfied.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּנִזְרַק וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹדַע, אֲבָל נוֹדַע וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִזְרַק — לֹא מְרַצֶּה.
human_translation: The reason is that was sprinkled and it subsequently became known However, became known and subsequently sprinkled, does not appease
llm_translation: The taste of the offering, if it was thrown and then became known, but if it became known and then was thrown - it is not acceptable.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: עַל מָה הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה? עַל הַדָּם וְעַל הַבָּשָׂר וְעַל הַחֵלֶב שֶׁנִּטְמָא, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, בֵּין בְּאוֹנֶס בֵּין בְּרָצוֹן, בֵּין בְּיָחִיד בֵּין בְּצִיבּוּר!
human_translation: raises a contradiction For what does the frontplate appease for the blood and the meat and the fat that became impure, whether unwittingly or intentionally, whether by circumstances beyond his control or willfully, whether an individual or the public.
llm_translation: And they asked: On what does the sprinkling make atonement? On the blood, and on the flesh, and on the fat that became impure, whether inadvertently or intentionally, whether by coercion or willingly, whether for an individual or for the community!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: טוּמְאָתוֹ, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד — הוּרְצָה. זְרִיקָתוֹ, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — הוּרְצָה, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא הוּרְצָה.
human_translation: Ravina said its ritual impurity, unwittingly or intentionally, is accepted. sprinkling its unwittingly is accepted, intentionally it is not accepted.
llm_translation: Ravina said: His impurity, whether accidental or intentional — it is accepted. His sprinkling, if accidental — it is accepted, if intentional — it is not accepted.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמַר: זְרִיקָתוֹ, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד — הוּרְצָה. טוּמְאָתוֹ, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — הוּרְצָה, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא הוּרְצָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Sheila said sprinkling whether unwittingly or intentionally, it is accepted. its ritual impurity, unwittingly accepted, intentionally it is not accepted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Sheilah said: Its throwing, whether unintentional or intentional - it is acceptable. Its impurity, if unintentional - it is acceptable, if intentional - it is not acceptable.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּקָתָנֵי: בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, הָכִי קָאָמַר: נִטְמָא בְּשׁוֹגֵג, וּזְרָקוֹ בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד — הוּרְצָה.
human_translation: However, that which was taught whether unwittingly or intentionally, this is it is saying: became impure unwittingly and one sprinkled whether unwittingly or intentionally, it is accepted.
llm_translation: Rather, this that it teaches: whether unintentionally or intentionally, thus it is saying: became impure unintentionally, and he sprinkled it whether unintentionally or intentionally — it is acceptable.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי: דָּם שֶׁנִּזְרַק וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹדַע, טַעְמָא דְּנִזְרַק וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹדַע, אֲבָל נוֹדַע וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִזְרָק — לָא, הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ נוֹדַע וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִזְרַק.
human_translation: And that which was taught blood that was sprinkled and subsequently it became known the reason is that was sprinkled and subsequently it became known but it became known and subsequently was sprinkled, not the same is true, even became known and was subsequently sprinkled.
llm_translation: And this that it teaches: blood that was sprinkled and afterwards it became known, the reason for the sprinkling and afterwards it became known, but if it became known and afterwards it was sprinkled — no, it is the same as if it became known and afterwards it was sprinkled.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי נִזְרַק וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹדַע, מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעֵי לְמִתְנֵי סֵיפָא: נִטְמָא הַגּוּף אֵין הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה, דַּאֲפִילּוּ נִזְרַק וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹדַע — לָא, קָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא נָמֵי: נִזְרַק וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹדַע.
human_translation: And that which was taught that was sprinkled and subsequently it became known because wanted to teach the latter clause the body became impure, the frontplate does not appease even if was sprinkled and subsequently it became known not he also taught the first clause was sprinkled and subsequently it became known
llm_translation: The one who taught: if the body became impure, the forehead plate does not appease, for even if it was thrown and afterwards it became known - no, the beginning teaches similarly: it was thrown and afterwards it became known.

hebrew_text: נִטְמָא טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם וְכוּ׳. בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: כֹּהֵן הַמְרַצֶּה בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹתֵיהֶן, הוּתְּרָה לוֹ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם, אוֹ לָא? מִי אָמְרִינַן כִּי גְּמִירִי טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם — בִּבְעָלִים, בְּכֹהֵן — לָא גְּמִירִי, אוֹ דִילְמָא: בְּזִבְחָא גְּמִירִי, לָא שְׁנָא בְּכֹהֵן וְלָא שְׁנָא בִּבְעָלִים.
human_translation: became ritually impure through impurity of the deep, Rami bar Ḥama raised a dilemma: priest who facilitates acceptance of their offerings, ritual impurity of the deep permitted for him or not? Do we say they learned impurity of the deep with regard to the owners they did not learn to a priest? Or perhaps they learned the sacrifice no different the priest or the owners
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The impurity of the abyss and so forth. Ramei son of Hama asked: If a priest who is involved with their sacrifices, is the impurity of the abyss permitted to him or not? Do we say that when it comes to the impurity of the abyss - with owners, with a priest - we do not say it is certain, or perhaps: when it comes to a sacrifice it is certain, but it is not different with a priest and not different with owners.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: לֹא אָמְרוּ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם אֶלָּא לְמֵת בִּלְבַד. מֵת לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לָאו לְמַעוֹטֵי טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם דְּשֶׁרֶץ?
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear as Rabbi Ḥiyya taught they stated impurity of the deep only with regard to a corpse. a corpse to exclude what? Is it not to exclude impurity of the deep of a creeping animal,
llm_translation: Rava said: Come and hear, as Rabbi Chiya teaches: They only said impurity of the abyss for a dead person alone. What is excluded by "a dead person"? Is it not to exclude the impurity of the abyss of a creeping thing?

hebrew_text: וּבְמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִי נֵימָא בִּבְעָלִים, וּבְמַאן — אִי בְּנָזִיר, מִי מַהֲנֵי בֵּיהּ? ״כִּי יָמוּת מֵת עָלָיו״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: And with what are we dealing? If we say with the owners to whom If to a nazirite, is effective The Merciful One states: “And if any man shall die beside him
llm_translation: And with what are we dealing? If you say with owners, and with whom? If with a Nazirite, who benefits from it? "When a dead person dies upon him," the Merciful One said.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּעוֹשֵׂה פֶסַח. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵאֵי שֶׁרֶץ. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵאֵי שֶׁרֶץ, הַשְׁתָּא טוּמְאָה יְדוּעָה הוּתְּרָה לוֹ, טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: Rather, one performing the Paschal lamb. it works out well according to the one who said one may not slaughter and sprinkle for impure from creeping animals, However, according to the one who said one may slaughter and sprinkle for impure from creeping animals now known impurity is permitted for him, impurity of the deep, is it not all the more so
llm_translation: Rather, concerning one who performs the Passover sacrifice. It is preferable according to the one who says we do not slaughter and sprinkle on those who are impure due to contact with a creeping thing. Rather, according to the one who says we slaughter and sprinkle on those who are impure due to contact with a creeping thing, now, if impurity that is known is permitted for him, how much more so impurity of the abyss?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו — בְּכֹהֵן, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הוּתְּרָה לוֹ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם!
human_translation: Rather, is not a priest Learn from here that impurity of the deep is permitted for
llm_translation: Rather, no — in a kohen, and if he heard from her, impurity of the abyss is permitted to him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לֹא, לְעוֹלָם בִּבְעָלִים, וּבְפֶסַח. וּלְמַעוֹטֵי טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם דְּזִיבָה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: No, Actually, the owners the Paschal lamb. And to exclude impurity of the deep the discharge of a zava .
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: No, always in Baalim, and in Pesach. And to exclude the impurity of the abyss of Zivah.

hebrew_text: וְטוּמְאַת תְּהוֹם דְּזִיבָה לֹא מְרַצֶּה? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם שֶׁשָּׁחֲטוּ וְזָרְקוּ עָלֶיהָ
human_translation: Does not appease ritual impurity of the deep the discharge of a zava ? Wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei says: A woman who keeps watch a day for a day they slaughtered and sprinkled for her
llm_translation: "And the impurity of the abyss of flowing water does not accept? And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: 'The guardian of the day corresponding to the day they slaughtered and sprinkled upon it.'"

hebrew_text: בַּשֵּׁנִי שֶׁלָּהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ רָאֲתָה — אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת, וּפְטוּרָה מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: on her second And after that, she saw she may not eat but she is exempt from performing the second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: In her second husband, and afterwards she saw — she does not eat, and she is exempt from making a second Passover.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דִּמְרַצֶּה צִיץ? אָמְרִי: לָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא הִיא מְטַמְּאָה.
human_translation: What is the reason Is it not because the frontplate appeases Say No, because Rabbi Yosei holds she renders impure from now and onward.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Is it not because it resembles the Tzitz (forehead plate)? They said: No, it is because Rabbi Yosei holds the opinion: From here and onwards it is considered impure.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: זָב בַּעַל שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת שֶׁשָּׁחֲטוּ וְזָרְקוּ עָלָיו בַּשְּׁבִיעִי שֶׁלּוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ רָאָה, וְכֵן שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם שֶׁשָּׁחֲטוּ וְזָרְקוּ עָלֶיהָ בַּשֵּׁנִי שֶׁלָּהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ רָאֲתָה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מְטַמְּאִין מִשְׁכָּב וּמוֹשָׁב לְמַפְרֵעַ,
human_translation: Wasn’t taught Rabbi Yosei says: a zav who has had two sightings for whom they slaughtered and sprinkled on his seventh and subsequently he saw and similarly, a woman who keeps watch a day for a day for whom they slaughtered and sprinkled on her second and subsequently she saw these render lying and sitting impure retroactively.
llm_translation: The text states: "And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: A man with two emissions, whose wives slaughtered and sprinkled upon him on his seventh day, and afterwards he saw, and similarly a woman who keeps a day corresponding to the day her husbands slaughtered and sprinkled upon her on her second day, and afterwards she saw - these render the bed and seat unclean."

hebrew_text: וּפְטוּרִים מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: they are exempt from performing the second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: And exempt from doing the second Pesach.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: מַאי, לְמַפְרֵעַ — מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Say: What retroactively? rabbinic
llm_translation: They said: What is the meaning of "lemafrea" - from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא סָבַר מְטַמֵּא לְמַפְרֵעַ מִדְּרַבָּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אוֹמֵר: אֲבָל זָב שֶׁרָאָה בַּשְּׁבִיעִי שֶׁלּוֹ — סוֹתֵר אֶת שֶׁלְּפָנָיו. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא יִסְתּוֹר אֶלָּא יוֹמוֹ!
human_translation: even Rabbi Oshaya holds renders impure retroactively rabbinic As it was taught Rabbi Oshaya says: But a zav who saw on his seventh it cancels that preceded it. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: It should cancel only its day,
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Oshaya holds that one may render impure due to the ruling of the Sages. As it was taught: Rabbi Oshaya says: But a Zav who saw on his seventh day - he nullifies his previous days. And Rabbi Yochanan said to him: He should only nullify his day!

hebrew_text: מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי קָסָבַר לְמַפְרֵעַ הוּא מְטַמֵּא — אֲפִילּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ נִסְתּוֹר. אִי קָסָבַר מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא הוּא מְטַמֵּא — יוֹמוֹ נָמֵי לָא נִסְתּוֹר! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: לֹא יִסְתּוֹר וְלֹא יוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: Whichever way you If he holds renders impure retroactively, should cancel all if he holds renders impure from now and onward, it should not cancel even its own day. Rather, say instead It should not cancel even its own day.
llm_translation: From what is your soul: If he holds that for one who acts rebelliously, he renders impure — even if all of them are hidden. If he holds that from here and onwards he renders impure — his day is not hidden! Rather say: It will not be hidden and not his day.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי קָאֵי כְּווֹתָךְ. וְהָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מְטַמְּאִין מִשְׁכָּב וּמוֹשָׁב לְמַפְרֵעַ! אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מְטַמֵּא לְמַפְרֵעַ מִדְּרַבָּנַן. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And said to him: Rabbi Yosei, holds in accordance with your But didn’t Rabbi Yosei say they render lying and sitting impure retroactively, Rather, not conclude from this that he renders impure retroactively, due to rabbinic conclude from this.
llm_translation: He said to him: Rabbi Yosei stands by your argument. But doesn't Rabbi Yosei say: One becomes impure from lying and sitting to relieve oneself! Rather, no, understand from it: one becomes impure to relieve oneself according to the Rabbis. Understand from it.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא הוּא מְטַמֵּא [לְמֵת] בִּלְבַד, לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי?
human_translation: According to Rabbi Yosei, now that he said renders impure from now and onward only to a corpse to exclude what
llm_translation: And to Rabbi Yosei, this year, who said from here and onwards he renders a person impure to a corpse alone, what is the exclusion for?

hebrew_text: נִפְשׁוֹט מִינַּהּ, דִּבְכֹהֵן וְהוּתְרָה לוֹ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם.
human_translation: Let us resolve from this a priest, and impurity of the deep is permitted for him.
llm_translation: His soul departed, for a priest and it was permitted to him the impurity of the abyss.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לְעוֹלָם בִּבְעָלִים וּבְפֶסַח, וְקָסָבַר: אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵאֵי שֶׁרֶץ, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמַעוֹטֵי.
human_translation: Say Actually, the owners and to the Paschal lamb, and holds one may not slaughter and sprinkle for impure from a creeping animal. and it was necessary to exclude
llm_translation: They said: Always with owners and with Pesach, and he holds: one does not slaughter and sprinkle on those who are impure with sheretz, and it is necessary to say this to exclude.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, זָבָה גְּמוּרָה הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: But, according to Rabbi Yosei, what circumstances full-fledged zava be found?
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Yosei, a complete zavah, how does one find her?

hebrew_text: בְּשׁוֹפַעַת. אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁרָאֲתָה כׇּל שְׁנֵי בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: in who continuously flows, If you wish, say where she saw for two entire twilights,
llm_translation: In the trumpet. If you wish, say: For example, when she saw all two between the suns.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: כֹּהֵן הַמְרַצֶּה בְּתָמִיד, הוּתְּרָה לוֹ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם אוֹ לָא? אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר כֹּהֵן הַמְרַצֶּה בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹתֵיהֶן (שֶׁל נָזִיר וְעוֹשֵׂה פֶסַח) הוּתְּרָה לוֹ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם, כֹּהֵן הַמְרַצֶּה בְּתָמִיד מַאי? מִי אָמְרִינַן כִּי גְּמִירִי טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם — בְּפֶסַח, בְּתָמִיד לָא גְּמִירִי. אוֹ דִילְמָא יָלֵיף תָּמִיד מִפֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised a dilemma: the priest who facilitates acceptance of the daily offering, is ritual impurity of the deep permitted for him or not? If you say the priest who facilitates acceptance of the offerings of the nazirite and one who performs the Paschal lamb, ritual impurity of the deep is permitted for him, the priest who facilitates acceptance of the daily offering, what Do we say when we learned impurity of the deep with regard to the Paschal lamb, with regard to the daily offering we did not learn Or perhaps derive the daily offering from Paschal lamb?
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rav Yosef: A priest who is involved in the offering of the daily sacrifice, is he permitted the impurity of the abyss or not? If you can say that a priest who is involved in their sacrifices (of a Nazirite or one observing Passover) is permitted the impurity of the abyss, what about a priest who is involved in the daily sacrifice? Do we say that the impurity of the abyss is definitively established in the case of Passover, but not definitively established in the case of the daily sacrifice? Or perhaps we can derive the status of the daily sacrifice from Passover.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה, קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא הוּתְּרָה לוֹ טוּמְאָה יְדוּעָה — הוּתְּרָה לוֹ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם, מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּתְּרָה לוֹ טוּמְאָה יְדוּעָה —
human_translation: Rabba said: a fortiori inference: Just as in a place where known ritual impurity is not permitted for him, impurity of the deep is permitted for him, in a place known ritual impurity is permitted for him,
llm_translation: Rabba said, a fortiori: And what in a place where impurity was not permitted to him known impurity — permitted to him impurity of the abyss, a place where permitted to him known impurity —

hebrew_text: אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁהוּתְּרָה לוֹ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם!
human_translation: is it not right that impurity of the deep is permitted for him
llm_translation: It is not a judgment that permission was granted to him, impurity of the abyss!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: וּמִי דָּיְינִינַן קַל וָחוֹמֶר מֵהֲלָכָה? וְהָתַנְיָא, אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: עֲקִיבָא, עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה הֲלָכָה, רְבִיעִית דָּם קַל וְחוֹמֶר, וְאֵין דָּנִין קַל וָחוֹמֶר מֵהֲלָכָה!
human_translation: Say And do we derive an a fortiori inference from a halakha Wasn’t taught Rabbi Eliezer said to him: Akiva, a bone the size of barley is a halakha a quarter of blood a fortiori inference, and one may not derive an a fortiori inference from a halakha
llm_translation: They said: Who can evaluate a Kal v'Chomer from Halakha? And it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: Akiva, a bone the size of a barleycorn is Halakha, a quarter-log of blood is Kal v'Chomer, and we do not evaluate a Kal v'Chomer from Halakha!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: יָלֵיף ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ ״מוֹעֲדוֹ״ מִפֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: It is derived “its appointed time” “its appointed time” from the Paschal lamb:
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: "Mo'ado" should be derived from "mo'ado" of Pesach.

hebrew_text: וְטוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם גּוּפָא הֵיכָא כְּתִיבָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִי יָמוּת מֵת עָלָיו״ — בִּמְחֻוֶּורֶת עָלָיו.
human_translation: And impurity of the deep itself, where is it written? Rabbi Elazar said the verse states “And if any man shall die beside him” clear to him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And where is the impurity of the abyss itself written? Rabbi Elazar said, the verse says: 'But if a dead person dies upon him' - in a covered pit upon him."

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן נָזִיר. עוֹשֵׂה פֶסַח מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה לָכֶם״ — בִּמְחֻוֶּורֶת לָכֶם.
human_translation: We found a nazirite; from where do we one who performs Paschal lamb? Rabbi Yoḥanan said the verse states: of you [ lakhem ] on a road far away” clear to you [ lakhem ].
llm_translation: I found a Nazirite. Does he make Passover from where? Rabbi Yochanan said, Scripture says: "In a distant place for you" - in your choice.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: כְּדֶרֶךְ. מָה דֶּרֶךְ — בְּגָלוּי, אַף טוּמְאָה נָמֵי — בְּגָלוּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: like a road. Just as a road is in the open, so too, the impurity is in the open.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Like the way. What is the way? Openly. So too impurity is compared to openly.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵי זֶהוּ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם? כׇּל שֶׁלֹּא הִכִּיר בָּהּ אֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם. הִכִּיר בָּהּ אֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם — אֵין זֶה טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם. לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר: בִּמְחֻוֶּורֶת עָלָיו — עַד דְּיָדַע הוּא.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection Which is the impurity of the deep any of which no one is aware, at the end of the earth; one is aware of it, at the end of the earth, this is not impurity of the deep. according to Rabbi Elazar, who said clear to him, until he knew
llm_translation: Challenger: What is the impurity of the abyss? Anyone who did not recognize it at the end of the world. If someone recognized it at the end of the world - this is not the impurity of the abyss. According to Rabbi Elazar, who said: If it is engraved upon him - until he knows it.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: ״לָכֶם״, בִּמְחֻוֶּורֶת לָכֶם — עַד דְּיָדְעִי בַּהּ תְּרֵין.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said lakhem , clear to you, until two know about it,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yochanan, who said: "To you," in your domain - until you know in it two.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר: כְּדֶרֶךְ — עַד דְּיָדְעִי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, who said like a road, until the entire world knows
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, who said: "In the way - until one knows all the worlds."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם הִלְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ, וּקְרָא — אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rather, they learned impurity of the deep as a halakha and the verse a mere support
llm_translation: Rather, the impurity of the abyss is a tradition that we have learned, and the verse is a mere support.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנּוֹדַע לוֹ לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה, דְּכִי אִזְדְּרִיק דָּם — שַׁפִּיר אִיזְדְּרִיק, אֲבָל נוֹדַע לוֹ לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה — לֹא מְרַצֶּה.
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: They taught only when became known to him after sprinkling as when the blood was sprinkled, it was sprinkled well, However, was known to him before the sprinkling does not appease
llm_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: They only taught this when it is known to him after the sprinkling, for when the blood is sprinkled — it is fine that it is sprinkled, but if it is known to him before the sprinkling — it is not acceptable.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַמּוֹצֵא מֵת מוּשְׁכָּב לְרׇחְבּוֹ שֶׁל דֶּרֶךְ, לִתְרוּמָה — טָמֵא. לְנָזִיר וְעוֹשֵׂה פֶסַח — טָהוֹר. וְכׇל טָמֵא וְטָהוֹר — לְהַבָּא הוּא.
human_translation: raises an objection one who finds a corpse lying the width of a road, with regard to teruma , is impure. with regard to a nazirite and one performing the Paschal lamb, is pure And any Impure, and: Pure, it is for the future.
llm_translation: Challenger: One who finds a corpse lying in the expanse of a road, for the purpose of terumah - impure. For a Nazirite and one observing the Passover - pure. And all impure and pure - he is for the future.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר, הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: לָא תֵּימָא נוֹדַע לוֹ לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה הוּא דִּמְרַצֶּה, אֲבָל נוֹדַע לוֹ לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה — לֹא מְרַצֶּה, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ נוֹדַע לוֹ לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה — מְרַצֶּה.
human_translation: Rather, if it was stated, it was stated as follows: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: Do not say when it became known to him after sprinkling that appeases but if it became known to him before sprinkling it does not appease Rather, even if it became known to him before sprinkling,
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated, it was stated thus: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: Do not say that if it is known to him after the sprinkling, he is appeased, but if it is known to him before the sprinkling, he is not appeased; rather, even if it is known to him before the sprinkling, he is appeased.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. הַמּוֹצֵא מֵת מוּשְׁכָּב לְרׇחְבּוֹ שֶׁל דֶּרֶךְ, לִתְרוּמָה — טָמֵא, לְנָזִיר וְעוֹשֵׂה פֶסַח — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: the matter itself. one who finds a corpse lying the width of the road, with regard to teruma he is impure, with regard to a nazirite and one who performs Paschal lamb he is pure.
llm_translation: Body. One who finds a dead body lying in the width of a road, for the purpose of terumah - impure; for a Nazirite and one who is observing the Passover - pure.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מָקוֹם לַעֲבוֹר. אֲבָל יֵשׁ מָקוֹם לַעֲבוֹר — אַף לִתְרוּמָה טָהוֹר.
human_translation: In what is this statement, said? he does not have space to pass by However, there is space to pass by, even for teruma he is pure.
llm_translation: In what matters are these words said? — that it has no place to pass over. But if there is a place to pass over — even for Terumah that is pure.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁמְּצָאוֹ שָׁלֵם. אֲבָל מְשׁוּבָּר וּמְפוֹרָק טָהוֹר, שֶׁמָּא בֵּין הַפְּרָקִים עָבַר. וּבַקֶּבֶר, אֲפִילּוּ מְשׁוּבָּר וּמְפוֹרָק טָמֵא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַקֶּבֶר מְצָרְפוֹ.
human_translation: in what is this statement said? where one finds whole. However, broken dismembered, he is pure. perhaps he passed between the parts in a grave, even broken dismembered, he is impure, because the grave joins
llm_translation: In what matters are these words spoken? — If it was found intact. But if broken and disassembled, it is pure, lest he passed between the pieces. And in a grave, even if broken and disassembled, it is impure, because the grave contaminates it.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּמְהַלֵּךְ בְּרַגְלָיו, אֲבָל טָעוּן אוֹ רָכוּב — טָמֵא, לְפִי שֶׁמְּהַלֵּךְ בְּרַגְלָיו אֶפְשָׁר שֶׁלֹּא יִגַּע וְלֹא יַאֲהִיל, אֲבָל טָעוּן אוֹ רָכוּב אִי אֶפְשָׁר שֶׁלֹּא יִגַּע וְלֹא יַאֲהִיל.
human_translation: In what is this statement, said? with regard to travels by foot, but loaded or riding he is impure. because one who travels by foot, it is possible that he will not touch and will not pass over but one who is loaded or someone riding it is impossible that he will not touch and will not pass over
llm_translation: In what case are these matters said? — When he is walking on his feet, but if he is carrying a burden or riding — he is impure, because when he is walking on his feet it is possible that he will not touch and not convey impurity, but if he is carrying a burden or riding, it is impossible that he will not touch and not convey impurity.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּטוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם, אֲבָל בְּטוּמְאָה יְדוּעָה — טָמֵא:
human_translation: In what is this statement, said? with regard to impurity of the deep. However, impurity known he is impure.
llm_translation: In what matters are these words spoken? In the impurity of the abyss, but in a known impurity - impure.

hebrew_text: וְאֵי זֶה הִיא טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם — כׇּל שֶׁלֹּא הִכִּיר בָּהּ אֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם. אֲבָל הִכִּיר בָּהּ אֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם — אֵין זֶה טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם.
human_translation: And which impurity of the deep? Any of which no one is aware, at the end of the earth; but one is aware of it, at the end of the earth, this is not impurity of the deep.
llm_translation: "And what is the impurity of the abyss? — Anyone who did not recognize it at the end of the world. But if someone recognized it at the end of the world — this is not the impurity of the abyss."

hebrew_text: מְצָאוֹ טָמוּן בְּתֶבֶן, בְּעָפָר, וּבִצְרוֹרוֹת — הֲרֵי זֶה טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם. בְּמַיִם, בַּאֲפֵילָה, בִּנְקִיקֵי הַסְּלָעִים — אֵין זֶה טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם. וְלֹא אָמְרוּ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם אֶלָּא לְמֵת בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: one finds it hidden in hay in dirt in pebbles, this is impurity of the deep. in water, in a dark in the clefts of the rocks, this is not impurity of the deep. And they said impurity of the deep only with regard to a corpse,
llm_translation: He found it hidden in straw, in dust, and in bundles - this is the impurity of the abyss. In water, in darkness, in crevices of rocks - this is not the impurity of the abyss. And they only said impurity of the abyss for a dead person alone.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִטְמָא שָׁלֵם אוֹ רוּבּוֹ — שׂוֹרְפִין אוֹתוֹ לִפְנֵי הַבִּירָה מֵעֲצֵי הַמַּעֲרָכָה. נִטְמָא מִיעוּטוֹ וְהַנּוֹתָר — שׂוֹרְפִין אוֹתוֹ בְּחַצְרוֹתֵיהֶן אוֹ עַל גַּגּוֹתֵיהֶן מֵעֲצֵי עַצְמָן. הַצִּיקָנִין שׂוֹרְפִין אוֹתוֹ לִפְנֵי הַבִּירָה בִּשְׁבִיל לֵיהָנוֹת מֵעֲצֵי הַמַּעֲרָכָה.
human_translation: whole or most of it became ritually impure, one burns it before the Temple [ habira ] with wood from the arrangement a minority of it became impure, and the leftover, burn it in their courtyards or on their roofs, with their own wood. the miserly, burn it before the Temple in order to benefit from the wood of the arrangement.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a complete or majority of a sacrificial offering becomes impure — it is burned in front of the Temple from the wood of the arrangement. If only a minority of it becomes impure and the rest remains — it is burned in their courtyards or on their rooftops from their own wood. The young pigeons are burned in front of the Temple in order to benefit from the wood of the arrangement.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: כְּדֵי לְבַיְּישָׁן.
human_translation: What is the reason Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: In order to embarrass them.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said: In order to be embarrassed.

hebrew_text: נִטְמָא מִיעוּטוֹ וְכוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: וְכֵן מִי שֶׁיָּצָא מִירוּשָׁלַיִם וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּיָדוֹ בְּשַׂר קֹדֶשׁ, אִם עָבַר צוֹפִים — שׂוֹרְפוֹ בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, וְאִם לָאו —
human_translation: a minority of it became ritually impure, raises a contradiction And similarly, one who left Jerusalem and remembers that there is consecrated meat in his hand, if he passed Scopus, he burns at the site he and if not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: He became impure from his minimal amount, etc. And they raised a dilemma: Similarly, one who leaves Jerusalem and remembers that he has holy meat in his possession, if he passed Tzofim - he should burn it in its place, and if not - English translation:

hebrew_text: חוֹזֵר וְשׂוֹרְפוֹ לִפְנֵי הַבִּירָה מֵעֲצֵי הַמַּעֲרָכָה!
human_translation: return and burn it before the Temple with wood from the arrangement.
llm_translation: He returns and burns it in front of the capital from the trees of the array!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר עוּקְבָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן — בְּאַכְסְנַאי. כָּאן — בְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama bar Ukva said: not difficult. Here, is referring to a visitor there, is referring to a resident
llm_translation: Rav Hama son of Ukva said: It is not difficult, here - in a lodging place. Here - in the householder's domain.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: הָא וְהָא בְּאַכְסְנַאי, כָּאן — שֶׁהֶחְזִיק בַּדֶּרֶךְ, כָּאן — שֶׁלֹּא הֶחְזִיק בַּדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: This and that to a visitor. Here, is referring to set out on the road, There, is referring to has not set out on the road,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Here and here in an inn, here - that he held on the road, here - that he did not hold on the road.

hebrew_text: רַב זְבִיד אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם כִּדְאָמַר מֵעִיקָּרָא — כָּאן בְּאַכְסְנַאי כָּאן בְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא הֶחְזִיק בַּדֶּרֶךְ, אַכְסְנַאי כֵּיוָן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ עֲשָׂאוּהוּ כְּצִיקָנִין. דִּתְנַן: הַצִּיקָנִין שׂוֹרְפִין אוֹתוֹ לִפְנֵי הַבִּירָה בִּשְׁבִיל לֵיהָנוֹת מֵעֲצֵי הַמַּעֲרָכָה.
human_translation: Rav Zevid said: Actually, as initially said: Here, is referring to a visitor; there, is referring to a resident. And even though he did not set out on the road, a visitor Since he does not have treated him like the misers, as we learned The misers burn it before the Temple in order to benefit from the wood of the arrangement.
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said: Always as he said from the beginning - here in an inn, here in a homeowner's house. And even though he did not intend to stay overnight, in an inn since he does not have a place to stay, they made it like a temporary dwelling. As we learned: The temporary dwellings burn it in front of the castle in order to benefit from the wood of the siege.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּאוּ לְשׂוֹרְפוֹ בְּחַצְרוֹתֵיהֶן וּמֵעֲצֵי הַמַּעֲרָכָה — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לָהֶן. לִפְנֵי הַבִּירָה וּמֵעֲצֵי עַצְמָן — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לָהֶן.
human_translation: The Sages taught came to burn in their courtyards and wood from the arrangement one does not listen to them. before the Temple with their own wood, one does not listen to them.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If they come to burn in their courtyards and the wood of the pile, we do not heed them. Before the city and their own wood, we do not heed them.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מֵעֲצֵי הַמַּעֲרָכָה בְּחַצְרוֹתֵיהֶן אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לָהֶן — דִּילְמָא פָּיְישָׁן מִינַּיְיהוּ, וְאָתוּ בְּהוּ לִידֵי תַקָּלָה. אֶלָּא לִפְנֵי הַבִּירָה מֵעֲצֵי עַצְמָן, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא?
human_translation: Granted, with wood from the arrangement in their courtyards one does not listen to them. lest they leave over some of the and come to a mishap with it But before the Temple with their own wood, what is the reason not
llm_translation: In truth, from the trees of the woodpile in their courtyards, they do not listen to them - perhaps they are weak, and they will come to a mishap. Rather, in front of the palace, from their own trees, what is the reason that not?

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: שֶׁלֹּא לְבַיֵּישׁ אֶת מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ. רָבָא אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי הַחֲשָׁד.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: in order not to embarrass one who does not have Rava said: due to suspicion.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "Do not embarrass one who has nothing." Rava said: "Due to suspicion."

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּאַיְיתִי קְנֵי וְחַרְיָוָתָא, דְּלָא חֲזֵי לַמַּעֲרָכָה.
human_translation: What is between these between them is brings reeds palm branches that are not fit for the arrangement.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in that one brings reeds and planks, which do not look like a marketplace.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: רֹאשׁ הַמַּעֲמָד הָיָה מַעֲמִיד אֶת הַטְּמֵאִין עַל שַׁעַר הַמִּזְרָח. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כְּדֵי לְבַיְּישָׁן. רָבָא אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי הַחֲשָׁד.
human_translation: We learned there, head of the watch would stand the ritually impure at the eastern gate What is the reason Rav Yosef said: in order to embarrass them Rava said: to suspicion,
llm_translation: We learned there: The head of the standing would stand the impure ones at the gate of the east. What is the reason? Rav Yosef said: In order to embarrass. Rava said: Because of suspicion.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ מְפַנְּקִי, אִי נָמֵי דְּקָא גָדֵיל שִׁישׁוּרָא.
human_translation: What is between these between them is pampered people Alternatively, one who twists ropes
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in that one is delicate, and the other is growing coarse hair.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפֶּסַח שֶׁיָּצָא אוֹ שֶׁנִּטְמָא — יִשָּׂרֵף מִיָּד. נִטְמְאוּ הַבְּעָלִים אוֹ שֶׁמֵּתוּ — תְּעוּבַּר צוּרָתוֹ, וְיִשָּׂרֵף בְּשִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: אַף זֶה יִשָּׂרֵף מִיָּד לְפִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אוֹכְלִין.
human_translation: A Paschal lamb that was taken out or that became ritually impure should be burned immediately the owners became ritually impure or died, its form must decay and it should be burned on the sixteenth Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: This, too, should be burned immediately, because it has no one to eat it,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The Paschal lamb that went out of its designated area or became impure - should be immediately burned. If the owners became impure or died - its form should be broken, and it should be burned on the sixteenth of Nisan. Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: Even this should be immediately burned because it has no permissible use.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא טָמֵא, כְּתִיב: ״וְהַבָּשָׂר אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בְּכׇל טָמֵא לֹא יֵאָכֵל בָּאֵשׁ יִשָּׂרֵף״. אֶלָּא יוֹצֵא מְנָלַן?
human_translation: Granted, ritually impure is written “The flesh that touches any impure item shall not be eaten, it shall be burned in fire” But is taken out from where do we
llm_translation: Gemara: In Shlamah it is impure, as it is written: "And the flesh that touches any impure thing shall not be eaten; it shall be burned with fire." Rather, from where do we derive this?

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״הֵן לֹא הוּבָא אֶת דָּמָהּ אֶל הַקֹּדֶשׁ פְּנִימָה״. אָמַר לוֹ מֹשֶׁה לְאַהֲרֹן: מַדּוּעַ לֹא אֲכַלְתֶּם אֶת הַחַטָּאת? שֶׁמָּא נִכְנַס דָּמָהּ לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים. אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו.
human_translation: as it is written: “Behold, its blood was not brought into the Sanctuary within; Moses said to Aaron: Why didn’t you eat the sin-offering? Perhaps its blood entered the innermost said to him: No.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written: "Behold, its blood was not brought inside the sanctuary." Moses said to Aaron: Why did you not eat the sin offering? Perhaps its blood entered inside and outside. He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: שֶׁמָּא חוּץ לִמְחִיצָתָהּ יָצְתָה? אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו, בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ הָיְתָה. אָמַר לוֹ: אִי בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ הָיְתָה וְ״הֵן לֹא הוּבָא אֶת דָּמָהּ אֶל הַקֹּדֶשׁ פְּנִימָה״, מַדּוּעַ לֹא אֲכַלְתֶּם אוֹתָהּ? מִכְּלָל דְּאִי נָפְקָא, אִי נָמֵי עָיֵיל דָּמָהּ לִפְנִים — בַּת שְׂרֵיפָה הִיא.
human_translation: said to him: Perhaps it was taken outside of its boundary, He said to him: No, it was in the sacred said to him: If it was in the sacred behold, its blood was not brought into the Sanctuary within, why didn’t you eat it? by inference that if it leaves or alternatively, if its blood enters within it must be burned.
llm_translation: He said to him: Perhaps she went out beyond her partition? He said to him: No, she was in the sanctuary. He said to him: If she was in the sanctuary, and "but they did not bring her blood into the sanctuary inside," why did you not eat it? By implication, if her blood had come out, or if her blood had gone inside - she is a daughter of a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא נִטְמָא, גַּלִּי רַחֲמָנָא בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן בְּקׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים. אֶלָּא יוֹצֵא, אַשְׁכְּחַן קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים, קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים מְנָלַן? וְתוּ, הָא דְּתַנְיָא: לָן דָּמָהּ,
human_translation: Granted, became ritually impure, the Merciful One reveals with regard to offerings of lesser sanctity, all the more so with regard to offerings of the most sacred order. However, is taken out we found offerings of the most sacred order. offerings of lesser sanctity, from where do we And furthermore, that which is taught the blood was left overnight
llm_translation: In peace, became impure, revealed mercy in light holy, all the more so in holies of holies. Rather, he goes out, we find holies of holies, from where are light holies? And come, this that it was taught: for us its blood,

hebrew_text: נִשְׁפַּךְ דָּמָהּ, יָצָא דָּמָהּ חוּץ לַקְּלָעִים — דְּקַיְימָא לַן בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, מְנָלַן?
human_translation: its blood was spilled, its blood was taken outside the hangings we maintain burned; from where do we
llm_translation: The blood spilled, its blood went out outside the curtains - where do we establish ourselves regarding burning?

hebrew_text: נָפְקָא לַן מִדְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״בַּקֹּדֶשׁ בָּאֵשׁ תִּשָּׂרֵף״ — לִימֵּד עַל חַטָּאת שֶׁשְּׂרֵיפָתָהּ בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: We derive it from Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught Rabbi Shimon says: in the sacred place, it shall be burned in fire” has taught that the burning of a sin-offering is in the sacred
llm_translation: We learned from Rabbi Shimon. As it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, "With fire in the sanctuary it shall be burned" - this teaches about the sin offering whose burning is in the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא זוֹ בִּלְבַד, שְׁאָר פְּסוּלֵי קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים וְאֵימוּרֵי קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״(וְכׇל) ... בַּקֹּדֶשׁ ... בָּאֵשׁ תִּשָּׂרֵף״.
human_translation: I have only this alone, the rest of the disqualified offerings of the most sacred order and the portions of offerings of lesser sanctity from where do we The verse states: “Any…in the sacred place…shall be burned in fire,”
llm_translation: I have only this alone, how do we know that other disqualified holy items and light holy items are more stringent? The Talmud teaches: "(And all) ... in the holy ... with fire it shall be burned."

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים, קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים מְנָלַן? אֶלָּא: כׇּל פְּסוּלוֹ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, לָא שְׁנָא קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים וְלָא שְׁנָא קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים — גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ, וְחַטָּאת דְּאַהֲרֹן מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה כָּךְ הָיָה.
human_translation: We found offerings of the most sacred order; from where do we derive offerings of lesser sanctity? Rather, Anything disqualified in the sacred burned. no different offerings of lesser sanctity, and no different offerings of the most sacred order; they learned it as a tradition. And the sin-offering of Aaron because the incident that took place, took place in this way.
llm_translation: I found holy of holies, how are light holies derived? Rather: all its disqualifications in holiness are by burning, not differentiating between light holies and holy of holies — it is a tradition, and the sin offering of Aaron was due to an incident that occurred as it occurred.

hebrew_text: וּלְתַנָּא דְּבֵי רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ, דְּאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ פִּיגּוּל טָעוּן עִיבּוּר צוּרָה. מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: And according to the tanna from the school of Rabba bar Avuh, who said even piggul , requires decay of form, from where do we
llm_translation: And it was taught in the school of Rabba bar Avuh, for he said: Even a "Piggul" requires proper formation. How do we know this?

hebrew_text: יָלֵיף ״עָוֹן״ ״עָוֹן״ מִנּוֹתָר.
human_translation: It is derived “iniquity” “iniquity.” leftover
llm_translation: "Will differentiate 'avon' 'avon' from 'notar'."

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף ״עָוֹן״ ״עָוֹן״ מֵחַטָּאת דְּאַהֲרֹן! אָמַר לָךְ: חַטָּאת דְּאַהֲרֹן כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא נָמֵי עִיבּוּר צוּרָה לְדוֹרוֹת בָּעֲיָא, וְהָתָם — הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה.
human_translation: Let us learn through “iniquity” “iniquity” the sin-offering of Aaron, said to you: The sin-offering of Aaron in a case like this would also require decay of form in generations; but there, it was a provisional edict
llm_translation: And it was exchanged, "iniquity" "iniquity" from sin of Aharon! He said to you: sin of Aharon for this type similar formation for generations required, and there — temporary teaching was.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרִינַן כָּל פְּסוּלֵי דְקֹדֶשׁ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, לָא שְׁנָא דְּקׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים וְלָא שְׁנָא קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים, גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ, ״בַּקֹּדֶשׁ ... בָּאֵשׁ תִּשָּׂרֵף״ לְמָה לִי? הָהוּא מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ שֶׁשְּׂרֵיפָתָהּ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ.
human_translation: Now that we say all disqualified sacred burned, no different offerings of the most sacred order offerings of lesser sanctity, they learned it as a tradition, “In the sacred place…shall be burned in fire,” why do I That is required its burning in the sacred
llm_translation: The instance where we say, "All disqualified items of Kodshim are burned," it is no different whether they are Kodshai Kodashim or Kodshim Kalim, the Gemara concludes, "With the Kodshim ... it shall be burned with fire." Why do I need this? That case is needed for when its burning is with Kodshim.

hebrew_text: ״וְהַבָּשָׂר אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בְּכׇל טָמֵא לֹא יֵאָכֵל בָּאֵשׁ יִשָּׂרֵף״, לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: “The flesh that touches any impure item shall not be eaten, it shall be burned in fire” why do I
llm_translation: "And the flesh that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten; it shall be burned with fire." Why do I need this?

hebrew_text: הַהוּא, לְגוּפֵיהּ אִיצְטְרִיךְ. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא כֹּל פְּסוּלֵי דְקֹדֶשׁ, כְּגוֹן: לָן דָּמָהּ, וְנִשְׁפַּךְ דָּמָהּ, וְיָצָא דָּמָהּ, וְנִשְׁחֲטָה בַּלַּיְלָה, דְּבִשְׂרֵיפָה דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ בְּחוּלִּין.
human_translation: That necessary for itself. It could enter your mind to say disqualified sacred where its blood was left overnight its blood was spilled; its blood was taken outside and was slaughtered at night. burned that do not exist with regard to unconsecrated
llm_translation: That one, for himself, required. As your mind thinks, I say, all disqualifications of holy things, such as: its blood is lost, its blood is spilled, its blood goes out, and it was slaughtered at night, due to the burning of which there is no equivalent in mundane matters.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל נִטְמָא, דִּבְחוּלִּין נָמֵי מִפְּסִיל, אֵימָא הוֹאִיל וְאִיתְעֲבִיד בֵּיהּ עוֹבָדִין דְּחוֹל — אֵימָא לָא תִּיבְּעֵי שְׂרֵיפָה, וְתִיסְגֵּי לֵיהּ בִּקְבוּרָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: But became ritually impure, which disqualifies unconsecrated also, say since it was treated in the manner of unconsecrated items, it should not require burning, and burial should be sufficient for it. teaches us
llm_translation: But if it became impure, with mundane items it is disqualified, say perhaps since it was done with mundane items — say it does not require burning, and it is sufficient to bury it, this is implied to us.

hebrew_text: נִטְמְאוּ הַבְּעָלִים אוֹ שֶׁמֵּתוּ תְּעוּבַּר צוּרָתָן וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַחְלוֹקֶת שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ בְּעָלִים אַחַר זְרִיקָה, דְּאִיתְחֲזִי בָּשָׂר לַאֲכִילָה. אֲבָל נִטְמְאוּ בְּעָלִים לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה, דְּלָא אִיתְחֲזִי בָּשָׂר לַאֲכִילָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל יִשָּׂרֵף מִיָּד.
human_translation: the owners became ritually impure or died its form decay, Rav Yosef said: dispute the owners became ritually impure after the sprinkling because the meat was fit for eating But the owners became ritually impure before the sprinkling the meat was not fit for eating all agree it should be burned immediately.
llm_translation: The owners became impure or died, their form will be transferred, etc. Rav Yosef said: The dispute is when the owners became impure after the sprinkling, as the flesh is fit for consumption. But if the owners became impure before the sprinkling, as the flesh is not fit for consumption - everyone agrees it shall be immediately burned.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁפְּסוּלוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ — יִשָּׂרֵף מִיָּד. בַּדָּם וּבַבְּעָלִים — תְּעוּבַּר צוּרָתוֹ וְיֵצֵא לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: raises an objection This is the principle: all its disqualification is in itself, it should be burned immediately. in the blood in the owners, its form decay, and it should be taken out to the place burning.
llm_translation: Challenger: This is the principle: anyone whose disqualification is in his body - he shall be immediately burned. In the blood and in the organs - his form shall be broken and he shall go out to the burning place.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי בְּעָלִים דּוּמְיָא דְּדָם: מָה דָּם לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה, אַף בְּעָלִים לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה.
human_translation: It is teaching owners similar to blood: Just as blood before the sprinkling so too, owners before the sprinkling
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught in a Baraita: The owner is similar to blood. Just as blood before sprinkling, so too the owner before sprinkling."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר, הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: מַחְלוֹקֶת שֶׁנִּטְמְאוּ בְּעָלִים לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה, דְּלָא אִיתְחֲזִי בָּשָׂר לַאֲכִילָה, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ כִּפְסוּלוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ. אֲבָל נִטְמְאוּ בְּעָלִים לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה, דְּאִיתְחֲזִי בָּשָׂר לַאֲכִילָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פְּסוּלוֹ מֵחֲמַת דָּבָר אַחֵר, וּבָעֲיָא עִיבּוּר צוּרָה.
human_translation: Rather, if was stated it was stated as follows: dispute the owners became ritually impure before the sprinkling the meat was never fit for eating, which as though its disqualification is in itself. But the owners became ritually impure after sprinkling the meat was fit for eating, all agree its disqualification is due to a different matter, and it requires decay of form.
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated, it was stated thus: The dispute is when the owners became impure before the sprinkling, as the flesh cannot be seen for consumption, for it would be disqualified in its body. But if the owners became impure after the sprinkling, as the flesh can be seen for consumption — all agree that it is disqualified due to another matter, and it requires the form of a shape.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה נָמֵי מַחְלוֹקֶת. וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אָמְרוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even after sprinkling is the dispute And Rabbi Yoḥanan follows his reasoning, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka and Rabbi Neḥemya said the same thing. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka is that which we said.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even after the throwing of the blood there is still a dispute. And it is clear that Rabbi Yochanan follows his reasoning, as Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka and Rabbi Nechemyah said one thing, Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka, this is what we said.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי אֲנִינוּת נִשְׂרְפָה זוֹ, לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר ״כָּאֵלֶּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya, what is as it was taught Rabbi Neḥemya says: was burned due to acute mourning, For this it is stated as these
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah, what is it? For it was taught, Rabbi Nechemiah says: Because of the poor, this was burned, therefore it is said, "like these."

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֲנִינוּת כִּלְאַחַר זְרִיקָה הָוְיָא, וְכִי אִשְׂתְּרוּף — לְאַלְתַּר (נִשְׂתְּרוּף).
human_translation: Now, acute mourning is similar to after sprinkling And when it was burned, it was burned immediately,
llm_translation: And the matter of the birds is like after the throwing, it is considered, and if it will be burned - immediately (it will be burned).

hebrew_text: רַבָּה מוֹסִיף, אַף רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָעִנְיָן כּוּלּוֹ אֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בְּפָרִים הַנִּשְׂרָפִים וּבִשְׂעִירִין הַנִּשְׂרָפִין, לִשְׂרוֹף פְּסוּלֵיהֶן אַבֵּית הַבִּירָה, וְלִיתֵּן ״לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה״ עַל אֲכִילָתָן.
human_translation: Rabba adds even Rabbi Yosei HaGelili as it was taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: The entire matter speaks only about bulls that are burned and goats that are burned. to burn the disqualified ones in the place of the bira and to establish a prohibition with regard to their consumption.
llm_translation: Rabba adds, also Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. As it was taught, Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: The entire matter he speaks only regarding the burnt calves and the burnt he-goats, to burn their disqualified parts in the Temple courtyard, and to impose the prohibition of "you shall not do" upon their consumption.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: חַטָּאת שֶׁנִּכְנַס דָּמָהּ לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים מִנַּיִן? אָמַר לָהֶן: ״הֵן לֹא הוּבָא אֶת דָּמָהּ אֶל הַקֹּדֶשׁ פְּנִימָה״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִי נָפֵיק אִיהִי, אִי נָמֵי עָיֵיל דָּמָהּ — בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: said to sin-offering whose blood entered inside from where He said to them: “Behold, its blood was not brought into the Sanctuary within” by inference that if is taken out or alternatively, its blood enters burned
llm_translation: They said to him: A sin offering whose blood entered before and inside, from where? He said to them: "Indeed, its blood was not brought into the Holy of Holies inwardly," implying that if its blood came out, or if its blood went in - it is through burning.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סָבַר: דָּם וּבָשָׂר חֲדָא מִילְּתָא הִיא. בְּעָלִים מִלְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי הִיא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan holds blood and meat, is one matter, owners is a different matter.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan holds: blood and flesh are one matter. Owners is another matter.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעֲצָמוֹת וְהַגִּידִין וְהַנּוֹתָר — יִשָּׂרְפוּ בְּשִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר. חָל שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — יִשָּׂרְפוּ בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר. לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָן דּוֹחִין לֹא אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא אֶת יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: The bones and the sinews; and the leftover should be burned on the sixteenth the sixteenth occurs on Shabbat, they should be burned on the seventeenth, because them does not override Shabbat or the Festival.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Bones, sinews, and leftover meat - they should be burned on the sixteenth day of Nisan. If the sixteenth falls on Shabbat, they should be burned on the seventeenth day of Nisan, because they do not override either Shabbat or a festival.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב מָרִי בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: עַצְמוֹת קָדָשִׁים שֶׁשִּׁימְּשׁוּ נוֹתָר — מְטַמְּאִין אֶת הַיָּדַיִם, הוֹאִיל וְנַעֲשָׂה בָּסִיס לְדָבָר הָאָסוּר. נֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הָעֲצָמוֹת וְהַגִּידִים וְהַנּוֹתָר — יִשָּׂרְפוּ לְשִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר.
human_translation: Rav Mari bar Avuh said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Bones of offerings that served leftover, render hands impure, Since have become a base for an prohibited object, Let us say supports him: The bones, and the sinews, and the leftover should be burned on the sixteenth
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Mari bar Avuh said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: Bones of holy items that were used up - they make the hands impure, since they have become a basis for a forbidden matter. It is stated to support him: The bones, sinews, and leftover parts - should be burned on the sixteenth day.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי עֲצָמוֹת הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּלֵית בְּהוּ מוֹחַ, לָמָּה בִּשְׂרֵיפָה? נִשְׁדִּינְהוּ! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא, דְּאִית בְּהוּ מוֹחַ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances these bones If we say there is no marrow in them, why burned? We should discard them, Rather, obvious that have marrow in them.
llm_translation: These bones, how much are they worth? If you say they have no marrow, why burn them? Examine them! Rather, it is obvious that they have marrow.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא שִׁימּוּשׁ נוֹתָר מִילְּתָא הִיא, אַמְּטוּ לְהָכִי בָּעֵי שְׂרֵיפָה. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ שִׁימּוּשׁ נוֹתָר לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא, לְמָה לְהוּ שְׂרֵיפָה? נִתְבְּרִינְהוּ וְנַחְלְצֵהּ לְמוֹחַ דִּידְהוּ וְנִשְׂרְפֵיהּ וְנִשְׁדִּינְהוּ לְדִידְהוּ. אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, שִׁימּוּשׁ נוֹתָר מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: Granted, if you say that serves leftover is something because of this it needs burning But if you say that serving leftover is nothing why do these burned? Let us break them, and remove their marrow, and burn and discard Rather, not conclude from it that serving leftover is something
llm_translation: If you say that the remaining use is a matter, they should burn it thus. But if you say that the remaining use is not a matter, why should they burn it? Let them break it and remove it to its place, and then burn it and judge it according to its own judgment. Rather, do not infer from this, the remaining use is a matter.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ שִׁימּוּשׁ נוֹתָר — לָאו מִילְּתָא, וְקָסָבַר: ״בּוֹ״ בְּכָשֵׁר, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּפָסוּל.
human_translation: Say No. Actually, I could say to you that serving leftover is nothing and holds in it” even to a disqualified
llm_translation: They said: No, I will say to you, the remaining use - it is not a matter, and he holds: "in it" is valid, even with a disqualification.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ בְּפָסוּל סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? וְהָא תְּנַן: אֲבָל הַמּוֹתִיר בַּטָּהוֹר וְהַשּׁוֹבֵר בַּטָּמֵא אֵינוֹ סוֹפֵג אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים! לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן — שֶׁהָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר, כָּאן — שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר.
human_translation: Can enter your mind even to a disqualified Didn’t we learn But one who leaves over a pure one who breaks a ritually impure does not receive forty not difficult. Here, it had a time when it was valid, There, that did not have a time when it was valid.
llm_translation: Even in a disqualified case, has your mind changed? But we learned: However, one who permits the pure and one who prohibits the impure does not absorb the forty! It is not difficult: here - he had a moment of validity, here - he did not have a moment of validity.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן תַּנָּא דְּשָׁנֵי לֵיהּ בֵּין שֶׁהָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר לְלֹא הָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר, רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְעֶצֶם לֹא תִשְׁבְּרוּ בוֹ״, ״בּוֹ״ בְּכָשֵׁר וְלֹא בְּפָסוּל. רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר וְנִפְסַל — יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם, לֹא הָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם.
human_translation: And who is the tanna who differentiates between that had a time when it was valid and did not have a time when it was valid? It is Rabbi Ya’akov, as it was taught “And you shall not break a bone in it,” “in it” to a valid and not to a disqualified Rabbi Ya’akov says: had a time when it was valid and became disqualified, it is subject to breaking a bone; it did not have time when it was valid, it is not subject to breaking a bone. Rabbi Shimon says: both this and that, it is not subject to breaking a bone.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is the Tanna that taught it? Whether it was fit for him at the time of its validity or not fit for him at the time of its validity, it is Rabbi Yaakov. As it was taught: 'And a bone of it you shall not break,' 'of it' in a valid state and not in an invalid state. Rabbi Yaakov says: If it was fit for him at the time of its validity and became disqualified - it contains an issue of breaking the bone; if it was not fit for him at the time of its validity - it does not contain an issue of breaking the bone. Rabbi Shimon says: Whether this one or that one - it does not contain an issue of breaking the bone."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כׇּל עַצְמוֹת הַקֳּדָשִׁים אֵין טְעוּנִין שְׂרֵיפָה, חוּץ מֵעַצְמוֹת הַפֶּסַח מִפְּנֵי הַתַּקָּלָה. הָנֵי עֲצָמוֹת הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּלֵית בְּהוּ מוֹחַ, לְמָה לְהוּ שְׂרֵיפָה? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּאִית בְּהוּ מוֹחַ, וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ שִׁימּוּשׁ נוֹתָר מִילְּתָא הִיא — עַצְמוֹת קָדָשִׁים אַמַּאי אֵין טְעוּנִין שְׂרֵיפָה?
human_translation: raises an objection No bones of offerings require burning except for the bones of the Paschal lamb, due to the a mishap What are the circumstances these bones If we say where there is no marrow why must they be burned? Rather, obvious that there is marrow in them. And if it should enter your mind that serving leftover is something why do bones of offerings not require burning?
llm_translation: Challenger: All the holy bones do not require burning, except for the bones of the Passover offering due to their fragility. How are these bones valued? If you say they have no marrow, why should they require burning? Rather, it is obvious that they have marrow, and if you suggest that the purpose is to prevent any leftover use of them, why then do the bones of holy offerings not require burning?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁמְּצָאָן חֲלוּצִין: עַצְמוֹת קָדָשִׁים, דְּאֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם — קַמֵּי דְּנֶהְווֹ נוֹתָר חַלְצִינְהוּ, וְלָא הָווּ שִׁימּוּשׁ נוֹתָר, וְלָא בָּעוּ שְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: With what are we dealing here? where one finds removed. bones of offerings, to which breaking a bone does not apply, before they became leftover one removed were not serving leftover and they do not require burning
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, when they found consecrated bones: bones of holy items, which do not have the status of bone breakage — since they were left over before they were broken, and were not used after they were left over, and do not require burning.

hebrew_text: עַצְמוֹת הַפֶּסַח, דְּיֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם — לְבָתַר דְּנֶהְווֹ נוֹתָר הוּא דְּחַלְצִינְהוּ, וְהָווּ לְהוּ שִׁימּוּשׁ נוֹתָר, וּבָעוּ שְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: bones of the Paschal lamb, to which breaking a bone does apply, it was after they became leftover that one removed from them, served leftover they require burning.
llm_translation: Bones of the Pesach, that there is in them because of breaking of the bone - after this it remains, it is removed, and it becomes leftover, and they require burning.

hebrew_text: רַב זְבִיד אָמַר: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן
human_translation: Rav Zevid said With what are we dealing here? such as
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said: Here, with what are we dealing? For example,

hebrew_text: שֶׁמְּצָאָן צִבּוּרִין צִבּוּרִין, וּמֵהֶן חֲלוּצִין. עַצְמוֹת קָדָשִׁים דְּאֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם — לְכוּלְּהוּ הֲוָה חָלֵיץ לְהוּ וְאָכֵיל לְהוּ, וְלָא בָּעֵי שְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: when one finds them in piles, and some of them removed. bones of offerings to which breaking a bone does not apply, removed all and ate it, and they do not require burning.
llm_translation: The congregation found them, they are considered congregational, and from them they may be redeemed. The bones of holy items that do not have the status of bone breakage - for all of them one may redeem and eat, and they do not require burning.

hebrew_text: עַצְמוֹת הַפֶּסַח דְּיֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם — דִּילְמָא הָנֵי דְּחַלְצִינְהוּ, וּלְהָנָךְ לָא חַלְצִינְהוּ, וּבָעֵי שְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: the bones of the Paschal lamb, to which breaking a bone does apply, perhaps removed these, and from those he did not remove and they require burning.
llm_translation: Bones of the Paschal lamb that have in them because of breaking of the bone — perhaps these we have removed, and those we have not removed, and require burning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַגִּידִין בָּשָׂר, חוּץ מִגִּידֵי צַוָּאר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: All the sinews like meat. except for the sinews of the neck,
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Rav: All sinews of meat, except for the sinews of the neck.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הָעֲצָמוֹת וְהַגִּידִים וְהַנּוֹתָר יִשָּׂרְפוּ בְּשִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר. הָנֵי גִּידִין הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא גִּידֵי בָשָׂר — נֵיכְלִינְהוּ? וְאִי דְּאִיתּוֹתַר — הַיְינוּ נוֹתָר? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא: גִּידֵי צַוָּאר.
human_translation: We learned The bones, and the sinews, and the leftover shall be burned on the sixteenth. What are the circumstances these sinews If we say sinews of meat, let us eat them. And if that were left over they are leftover, Rather, it is obvious sinews of the neck,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: The bones, sinews, and leftover meat shall be burned on the sixteenth. How much are these sinews worth? If you say they are sinews of meat - shall we eat them? And if they are leftover - is that the same as leftover meat? Rather, it is obvious: sinews of the neck.
