hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בָּשָׂר נִינְהוּ, אַמְּטוּ לְהָכִי בָּעֵי שְׂרֵיפָה. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לָאו בָּשָׂר נִינְהוּ — לְמָה לְהוּ שְׂרֵיפָה? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לְגִיד הַנָּשֶׁה, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Granted, if you say they are meat, due to that they require burning; but if you say they are not meat, why do they burning? Rav Ḥisda said: is necessary only for the sciatic nerve, in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: If you say they are considered meat, they should be liable to burning. But if you say they are not meat, why should they be liable to burning? Rav Ḥisdah said: It is only necessary for the sciatic nerve, and in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג אֶלָּא בְּאַחַת, וְהַדַּעַת מַכְרַעַת שֶׁל יָמִין.
human_translation: As it was taught Rabbi Yehuda said: applies only to one and logic dictates the right
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says: He only engages in one act of intercourse, and the right side determines the child's gender.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא תִּפְשׁוֹט דְּסַפּוֹקֵי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּאִי מִיפְּשִׁיט פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ, הָהִיא דְּהֶיתֵּירָא נֵיכְלֵיהּ, וּדְאִיסּוּרָא נִישְׁדְּיֵיהּ — לְמָה לֵיהּ שְׂרֵיפָה!
human_translation: Shall we then conclude that Rabbi Yehuda was uncertain As, if it were clear to him The one that is permitted we should eat, and that is forbidden we should discard. Why should he burning?
llm_translation: And rather, you should say that the doubtful cases are doubtful to Rabbi Yehuda. For if it would be clear to him, that which was permitted would be eaten, and that which was forbidden would be burned - why would he need burning!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אִיקָא בַּר חִינָּנָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהוּכְּרוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִתְעָרְבוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ika bar Ḥinnana said, where were known, but in the end mixed
llm_translation: Rav Ika bar Hinana said: For example, they recognized each other and in the end they intermingled.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לְשֻׁמָּנוֹ דְּגִיד הַנָּשֶׁה. דְּתַנְיָא: שֻׁמָּנוֹ מוּתָּר, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל קְדוֹשִׁים הֵם וְנוֹהֲגִין בּוֹ אִיסּוּר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: is necessary only the fat of the sciatic nerve, as it was taught The fat is permitted the Jewish people are holy and treat it as forbidden.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: It is only necessary for the fat of the sinew of the thigh-vein. As it was taught: its fat is permitted, and the Israelites are holy and observe its prohibition.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: בַּחִיצוֹן, וְכִדְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁנֵי גִידִין הֵן, פְּנִימִי הַסָּמוּךְ לָעֶצֶם — אָסוּר, וְחַיָּיבִין עָלָיו. חִיצוֹן הַסָּמוּךְ לַבָּשָׂר — אָסוּר, וְאֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: Ravina said: outer and Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said, as Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: There are two sinews inner that is next to the bone is forbidden and one is liable for it. The outer that is next to the meat is forbidden one is not liable for it.
llm_translation: Ravina said: In the outer layer, and like Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: There are two sinews, the inner one adjacent to the bone — it is forbidden, and one is liable for it. The outer one adjacent to the flesh — it is forbidden, but one is not liable for it.

hebrew_text: חָל שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר וְכוּ׳. וְאַמַּאי? נֵיתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְיִדְחֵי לֹא תַּעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: the sixteenth occurs And why The positive mitzva should come and override the prohibition
llm_translation: Text: חָל שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר וְכוּ׳. וְאַמַּאי? נֵיתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְיִדְחֵי לֹא תַּעֲשֶׂה! Translation: It is a positive commandment on the sixteenth and onwards. And why? Because it states "do" and it pushes away "do not do"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה, וְכֵן תָּנֵי דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא תוֹתִירוּ מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר וְהַנּוֹתָר מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר בָּאֵשׁ תִּשְׂרֹפוּ״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עַד בֹּקֶר״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עַד בֹּקֶר״ — לִיתֵּן לוֹ בֹּקֶר שֵׁנִי לִשְׂרֵיפָתוֹ.
human_translation: Ḥizkiya said, and similarly, the school of Ḥizkiya taught: The verse states: “And you shall not leave any of it until morning; and that which remains of it until morning you shall burn with fire” As no the verse to state “until morning,” what the verse states “until morning”? to give it a second morning for its burning.
llm_translation: Hizkiyah said, and so it was taught in the school of Hizkiyah: The verse states, "Do not leave any of it until morning, and what remains of it until morning, you shall burn with fire." The Torah did not need to say "until morning." What is the purpose of saying "until morning"? To give a second morning for its burning.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״עֹלַת שַׁבָּת בְּשַׁבַּתּוֹ״, וְלֹא עוֹלַת חוֹל בְּשַׁבָּת, וְלֹא עוֹלַת חוֹל בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Abaye said: the verse states: “The burnt-offering of each Shabbat on its Shabbat not the burnt-offering of a weekday on Shabbat, and not the burnt-offering of a weekday on a Festival.
llm_translation: Abaye said, the verse says: "The burnt offering of Shabbat on its Shabbat," and not the burnt offering of weekday on Shabbat, and not the burnt offering of weekday on a festival.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״הוּא לְבַדּוֹ יֵעָשֶׂה לָכֶם״ — ״הוּא״ וְלֹא מַכְשִׁירָיו, ״לְבַדּוֹ״,
human_translation: Rava said The verse states only that may be done for you” That, but not facilitate its only
llm_translation: Rava said, the verse says: "He alone shall be done for you" — "He" and not His intermediaries, "alone",

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מִילָה שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ, הַבָּאָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: but not a circumcision not at its time come through an a fortiori
llm_translation: "And not a matter that is not in its proper time, that comes from a fortiori reasoning."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: ״שַׁבָּתוֹן״ דְּיוֹם טוֹב — עֲשֵׂה הוּא, וְאֵין עֲשֵׂה דּוֹחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה וַעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said solemn rest with regard to Festivals is a positive and a positive does not override a prohibition and a positive
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Shabbaton" of a festival day - do it, and doing does not override both a negative commandment and a positive commandment.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הַנֶּאֱכָל בְּשׁוֹר הַגָּדוֹל — יֵאָכֵל בִּגְדִי הָרַךְ, וְרָאשֵׁי כְנָפַיִם וְהַסְּחוּסִים.
human_translation: Anything that is eaten in an adult ox, be eaten in a young kid. And ends of the ribs and the cartilage
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Anyone who eats from the large ox - may eat the tender meat, the tops of the wings, and the hooves.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַבָּה רָמֵי, תְּנַן: כׇּל הַנֶּאֱכָל בְּשׁוֹר הַגָּדוֹל — יֵאָכֵל בִּגְדִי הָרַךְ, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל — לֹא. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: רָאשֵׁי כְנָפַיִם וְהַסְּחוּסִים. וְהָא הָנֵי לָא מִתְאַכְלִי בְּשׁוֹר הַגָּדוֹל!
human_translation: Rabba raised a contradiction: We learned anything that is eaten in an adult ox may be eaten in a young kid, that is not eaten not Say the latter clause The ends of the ribs and the cartilage But these are not eaten in an adult ox,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabba raises a contradiction. We learned in a Mishnah: Anything that is eaten from a large ox - may be eaten from a young goat, but that which is not eaten from a large ox - may not be eaten from a young goat. Let us say the latter clause: the heads of the wings and the spleen. But are these not eaten from a large ox!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: כׇּל הַנֶּאֱכָל בְּשׁוֹר הַגָּדוֹל — יֵאָכֵל בִּגְדִי הָרַךְ, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל — לֹא. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף רָאשֵׁי כְנָפַיִם וְהַסְּחוּסִים.
human_translation: Rather, it is tanna’im , and this is what it is teaching: Anything eaten in an adult ox may be eaten in a young kid, and that is not eaten not And some say even the ends of the ribs and the cartilage
llm_translation: Rather, it is a teaching, and thus it was taught: Whoever partakes of the flesh of the large ox may partake of the tender kid, but one who does not partake of the former may not partake of the latter. And some say: Also the heads of the wings and the diaphragm.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: ״מָה הֵן״ קָתָנֵי, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: כׇּל הַנֶּאֱכָל בְּשׁוֹר הַגָּדוֹל בְּשִׁלְקָא — יֵאָכֵל בִּגְדִי הָרַךְ בְּצָלִי. וּמָה הֵן: רָאשֵׁי כְנָפַיִם וְהַסְּחוּסִים.
human_translation: Rava said: teaches What are they, and this is what it is teaching: Anything that is eaten in an adult ox through cooking may be eaten in a young kid through roasting, And what are these the ends of the ribs and the cartilage.
llm_translation: Rava said: "What are they" it teaches, and thus it teaches: Anyone who eats from the large ox's tail in a stew - may eat the tender kid in a roast. And what are they: the heads of the wings and the diaphragm.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: כׇּל הַנֶּאֱכָל בְּשׁוֹר הַגָּדוֹל בְּשִׁלְקָא — יֵאָכֵל בִּגְדִי הָרַךְ בְּצָלִי, וּמָה הֵן: רָאשֵׁי כְנָפַיִם וְהַסְּחוּסִים, וְגִידִין הָרַכִּין נִידּוֹנִין כְּבָשָׂר.
human_translation: It was taught in accordance with Rava: Anything that is eaten in an adult ox through cooking may be eaten in a young kid through roasting; and what are these the ends of the ribs and the cartilage; and the soft sinews are judged as meat.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rava: Anyone who partakes of the flesh of a large ox in a stew - may eat the tender meat roasted, and what are they: the heads of the wings and the joints, and the soft sinews are judged as meat.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: גִּידִין שֶׁסּוֹפָן לְהַקְשׁוֹת, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: נִמְנִין עֲלֵיהֶן בַּפֶּסַח, רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֵין נִמְנִין עֲלֵיהֶן בַּפֶּסַח. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר נִמְנִין עֲלֵיהֶן — בָּתַר הַשְׁתָּא אָזְלִינַן. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר אֵין נִמְנִין עֲלֵיהֶן — בָּתַר בַּסּוֹף אָזְלִינַן.
human_translation: It was stated sinews that will eventually harden Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One may register for them in the Paschal lamb. Reish Lakish said: One may not register for them in the Paschal lamb. Rabbi Yoḥanan said one may register for them we follow the current Reish Lakish said one may not register for them we follow the eventual
llm_translation: It was stated: Sinews that are destined to contract, Rabbi Yohanan said: We count them for the Paschal offering. Reish Lakish said: We do not count them for the Paschal offering. Rabbi Yohanan said: We count them - afterwards we go. Reish Lakish said: We do not count them - afterwards at the end we go.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַנֶּאֱכָל בְּשׁוֹר הַגָּדוֹל — יֵאָכֵל בִּגְדִי הָרַךְ, וּמָה הֵן רָאשֵׁי כְנָפַיִם וְהַסְּחוּסִים. הָנֵי אִין, אֲבָל גִּידִין שֶׁסּוֹפָן לְהַקְשׁוֹת — לָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנָא הָנֵי וְהוּא הַדִּין לְהָנָךְ. הָנֵי מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּהָא מִתְאַכְלִי בְּשׁוֹר הַגָּדוֹל בְּשִׁלְקָא, הָנָךְ נָמֵי מִתְאַכְלִי בְּשׁוֹר הַגָּדוֹל בְּשִׁלְקָא.
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan: anything eaten in an adult ox may be eaten in a young kid, and what are these the ends of the ribs and the cartilage. these yes, but sinews that will eventually harden, no, said to him: It taught these, and the same is true for those, What is the reason these, because they are eaten in an adult ox through cooking. These, too, are eaten in an adult ox through cooking.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: Anyone who eats from the large ox - may eat the soft garments, and what are they? The heads of the wings and the thighs. These are no, but sinews that are destined to become tough - no! He said to him: A Tanna taught these and the same applies to you. What is the reason for this? Because one may eat from the large ox in its softness, similarly, you may eat from the large ox in its softness.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי אָבִין: כִּי אָזְלַתְּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, רְמִי לֵיהּ: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן גִּידִין שֶׁסּוֹפָן לְהַקְשׁוֹת נִמְנִין עֲלֵיהֶן בַּפֶּסַח, אַלְמָא: בָּתַר הַשְׁתָּא אָזְלִינַן? וְהָא בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עוֹר הָרֹאשׁ שֶׁל עֵגֶל הָרַךְ, מַהוּ שֶׁיְּטַמֵּא? וְאָמַר לוֹ: אֵין מְטַמֵּא. אַלְמָא: בָּתַר בַּסּוֹף אָזְלִינַן!
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Avin: When you go before Rabbi Abbahu, raise contradiction to him: Did Rabbi Yoḥanan say: sinews that will eventually harden, may register for them in the Paschal lamb, apparently we go the current But Reish Lakish asked Rabbi Yoḥanan: the hide of the head of a young calf, what is becoming ritually impure And he said to him: It does not become ritually impure. Apparently, we go the eventual
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yirmeya to Rabbi Avin: When you went before Rabbi Avahu, he raised to him: Who said Rabbi Yochanan tendons that are destined to become tough are counted upon them in the Passover, implying: afterwards we go? And Reish Lakish asked him from Rabbi Yochanan: The skin of a soft calf's head, what does it become impure? And he said to him: It does not become impure. Implying: afterwards we go at the end!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּרְמָא לָךְ הָא — לָא חַשׁ לְקִמְחֵיהּ. הָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְגַבֵּי דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַל תַּקְנִיטֵנִי, שֶׁבִּלְשׁוֹן יָחִיד אֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: said to him: asked you this was not concerned for his flour, Rabbi Yoḥanan retracted Reish Lakish, and said to him, Do not trouble me as I teach it in the singular.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Your words are like a pile of barley — they do not penetrate." Rabbi Yohanan then returned to Resh Lakish, and said to him: "Do not provoke me, for I am explaining it in the language of a single individual."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׁוֹבֵר אֶת הָעֶצֶם בַּפֶּסַח הַטָּהוֹר — הֲרֵי זֶה לוֹקֶה אַרְבָּעִים. אֲבָל הַמּוֹתִיר בַּטָּהוֹר וְהַשּׁוֹבֵר בְּטָמֵא — אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים.
human_translation: One who breaks the bone of a Paschal lamb that is ritually pure receives forty lashes But one who leaves over of a ritually pure and one who breaks of a ritually impure do not receive forty lashes.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who breaks a bone in the Paschal lamb while it is still pure - he is liable for forty lashes. But one who permits it in a pure lamb, and one who breaks a bone in an impure lamb - he is not liable for the forty lashes.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא מוֹתִיר בַּטָּהוֹר — דְּתַנְיָא: ״לֹא תוֹתִירוּ מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר וְהַנֹּתָר מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר וְגוֹ׳״, בָּא הַכָּתוּב לִיתֵּן עֲשֵׂה אַחַר לֹא תַּעֲשֶׂה לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין לוֹקֶה — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Granted, one who leaves over of a ritually pure as it was taught “And you shall not leave any of it until morning; and that which remains of it until morning The verse comes to provide a positive after the prohibition to say that one is not flogged the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar bishlama motir batahor - detanya: 'Lo totiru mimenu ad boqer vehannotar mimenu ad boqer vego,' ba haktuv litet asseh achar lo ta'aseh lomar she'ein loke - divrei Rabbi Yehuda." English translation: "It is fully permissible in the case of purity - as it was taught: 'Do not leave any of it until morning, and what remains of it until morning, etc.' The Scripture comes to give a positive commandment after a negative one, to say that he is not liable - these are the words of Rabbi Yehuda."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִן הַשֵּׁם הוּא זֶה, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְאֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו. אֶלָּא שׁוֹבֵר בַּטָּמֵא מְנָלַן? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעֶצֶם לֹא תִשְׁבְּרוּ בוֹ״, ״בּוֹ״ בְּכָשֵׁר וְלֹא בְּפָסוּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov says: This is not for reason. Rather, because it is a prohibition that does not involve an action. And one is not flogged for . But one who breaks of a ritually impure from where do we as the verse states: and you shall not break a bone in it” “in it,” in a valid and not in a disqualified
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov says: Not from the name is this, rather because it is not that there is no action in it, and one does not receive lashes for it. But how do we know that one breaks the impure vessel? As the verse says: "And a bone of it shall not be broken" - "of it" in a valid vessel and not in an invalid vessel.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְעֶצֶם לֹא תִשְׁבְּרוּ בוֹ״, ״בּוֹ״ — בְּכָשֵׁר וְלֹא בְּפָסוּל. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״בְּבַיִת אֶחָד יֵאָכֵל ... וְעֶצֶם לֹא תִשְׁבְּרוּ בּוֹ״. כׇּל הָרָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה — יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת עֶצֶם, וְשֶׁאֵין רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת עֶצֶם.
human_translation: The Sages taught “And you shall not break a bone in it”; in it, in a valid and not in a disqualified Rabbi says “In one house shall it be eaten,” “And you shall not break a bone in it,” any fit for eating is subject to breaking a bone, and that is not fit for eating is not subject to breaking a bone
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And a bone you shall not break in it," "in it" - in a valid animal and not in a disqualified animal. Rabbi says: "In one house it shall be eaten ... and a bone you shall not break in it." Anything fit for consumption - it has the potential for bone breakage, and anything not fit for consumption - it does not have the potential for bone breakage.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: פֶּסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כָּשֵׁר —
human_translation: What is between them? Rabbi Yirmeya said: The practical difference between them is a Paschal lamb that is brought in ritual impurity. to the one who says a valid
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rabbi Yirmeya said: The Passover sacrifice that comes with impurity is the difference between them. According to the one who says it is valid —

hebrew_text: הַאי פָּסוּל. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה — הַאי נָמֵי רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה הוּא.
human_translation: this one is disqualified, according to the one who says fit for eating, this is also fit for eating,
llm_translation: This is disqualified. According to the one who says it is fit for eating, this is indeed fit for eating.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם, דְּרַבִּי לְאַקּוֹלֵי קָא אָתֵי, וְהַאי הָא פָּסוּל הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: In a case like this, everyone agrees that it is not subject to of breaking a bone. because Rabbi came to be lenient, and this is disqualified
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "For this type of material - which is a mixture of the world, it does not have any concern of bone breakage, for Rabbi Lakuli comes to make it light, and this material is disqualified."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר וְנִפְסַל אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כָּשֵׁר — הָא כָּשֵׁר הוּא. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה — הָא הַשְׁתָּא לָאו רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, the practical difference between them is had a time when it was valid and became disqualified. According to the one who says a valid this one is valid According to the one who says fit for eating, it is not fit for eating now,
llm_translation: Rather, if it had a moment of validity and became invalidated, there is a distinction between them. According to the one who says it is valid - it is indeed valid. According to the one who says it is fit for consumption - now it is not fit for consumption.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כָּל כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם, מַאי טַעְמָא? הַשְׁתָּא מִיהַת הָא פָּסוּל הוּא. אֶלָּא, שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כָּשֵׁר — הָא כָּשֵׁר הוּא, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה — הַשְׁתָּא לָאו בַּר אֲכִילָה הוּא,
human_translation: Abaye said: In any case like this, everyone agrees that it is not subject to breaking a bone. What is the reason? Now, at least, it is disqualified. Rather, breaking a bone while it is still day is the practical difference between them. According to the one who says valid, this one is valid According to the one who says fit for eating, now it is not fit for eating
llm_translation: Abaye said: The entire world, all of it, because this type does not have in it any concern for bone breakage. What is the reason? Now, from here, it is disqualified. Rather, bone breakage is present from the outset. According to the one who says it is valid — now, it is valid. According to the one who says it is fit for consumption — now, it is not fit for consumption.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: נִמְנִין עַל מוֹחַ שֶׁבָּרֹאשׁ וְאֵין נִמְנִין עַל מוֹחַ שֶׁבַּקּוּלִית. עַל מוֹחַ שֶׁבָּרֹאשׁ מַאי טַעְמָא — הוֹאִיל וְיָכוֹל לְגוֹרְרוֹ וּלְהוֹצִיאוֹ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי — קוּלִית נָמֵי, נִתְבְּרֵיהּ מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, וְנַפְּקוּהּ לְמוֹחַ דִּידֵיהּ, וְנִמְנוֹ עֲלֵיהּ!
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rabbi says: One may register for the marrow of the head, and one may not register for the marrow of the thigh bone. What is the reason the marrow of the head? since one can extract it and remove it And if it should enter your mind that breaking a bone while it is still day seems well, we may break the thigh bone as well and remove its marrow, and register for it.
llm_translation: The question was raised: Rabbi says, we count for the brain in the head, but we do not count for the brain in the skull. What is the reason for counting for the brain in the head? Because it is able to drag and extract. And if you think that the breaking of a bone from the day it was formed is considered as if it were already complete - it is proper to count for the skull, it was formed from the day it was formed, and it came out to its own brain, and they counted for it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ אַבָּיֵי: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה נָמֵי: נַיְיתֵי גּוּמַרְתָּא וְנַיחֵות עֲלֵיהּ וְנִקְלֵהּ, וְנַפְּקֵהּ לְמוֹחַ דִּידֵיהּ, וְנִימְּנֵי עֲלֵיהּ. דְּהָא תַּנְיָא: אֲבָל הַשּׂוֹרֵף בַּעֲצָמוֹת וְהַמְחַתֵּךְ בְּגִידִין — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם.
human_translation: Abaye could have said to you: And according to your reasoning, after nightfall also We should bring a coal, and place it on and burn it, and remove its marrow, and register for it, for it was taught But one who burns bones and one who cuts sinews do not breaking a bone.
llm_translation: He said to you, Abaye: And according to your reasoning, from when it becomes dark, we bring a coal and place it on it and it becomes light, and we take it out to its place, and we count on it. For it was taught: But one who burns with its bones and one who cuts with its sinews - there is no issue of breaking the bone.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר — אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם פֶּקַע, רָבָא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם הֶפְסֵד קָדָשִׁים, דְּקָא מַפְסֵיד לֵיהּ בְּיָדַיִם — דִּילְמָא אָכֵיל נוּרָא מִמּוֹחַ דִּידֵיהּ. מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם נָמֵי, גְּזֵירָה מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם אַטּוּ מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה.
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say Abaye said: because burst Rava said: due to ruining sacrificial food, as one ruins it actively it is possible that the fire will consume some of its marrow. while it is still day is also decree. due to after dark.
llm_translation: Rather, what do you have to say? Abbaye said: Due to negligence. Rava said: Due to the loss of consecrated items, as he is causing a loss with his hands — lest he eat a coal from his hand. During the day, it is a decree; after the day has passed, it is a prohibition from when it gets dark.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כָּל כִּי הַאי גַוְנָא — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם. מַאי טַעְמָא? לְאוּרְתָּא מִיחֲזֵי לַאֲכִילָה. אֶלָּא, בְּאֵבֶר שֶׁיָּצָא מִקְצָתוֹ קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מַאן דְּאָמַר כָּשֵׁר — הָא כָּשֵׁר הוּא, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה — הַאי לָאו בַּר אֲכִילָה הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: any case like this, everyone agrees it is subject to breaking a bone. What is the reason? at night it will be fit for eating. Rather, with regard to a portion of a limb has gone out they disagree. the one who said valid, this one is valid, And the one who said fit for eating, this one is not fit for eating,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: All that this bone — all the world has in it due to bone breakage. What is the reason? It is not fit for consumption. Rather, in a limb that some of it protrudes, it is considered split. Whoever says it is kosher — it is indeed kosher, and whoever says it is fit for consumption — this is not a limb for consumption.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: אֵבֶר שֶׁיָּצָא מִקְצָתוֹ וּשְׁבָרוֹ — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם.
human_translation: As it was taught Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: a portion of a limb has gone out and one broke it, It is not subject to breaking a bone. This is
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, says: A limb that has partially emerged and then broke - it does not have the status of a bone break.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי אָמַר: כָּל כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם, דְּהַאי אֵבֶר הָא פָּסוּל הוּא. אֶלָּא, שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם בְּנָא אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר כָּשֵׁר — הָא כָּשֵׁר הוּא, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה — הַשְׁתָּא אֵינוֹ רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: any case like this, everyone agrees that it is not subject to breaking a bone, as this limb is disqualified Rather, breaking a bone when raw is the practical difference between them. the one who said valid, this one is valid, And the one who said fit for eating, now it is not fit for eating.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: All that this type of vessel, which is found throughout the world, does not have any susceptibility to impurity due to bone breakage, for this limb is disqualified. Rather, there is susceptibility to bone breakage between them. Whoever says it is fit - it is fit, and whoever says it is suitable for consumption - now it is not suitable for consumption.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: כָּל כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּהָא חֲזֵי לַאֲכִילָה, דְּמַטְוֵי לֵיהּ וְאָכֵיל לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא, שְׁבִירַת הָאַלְיָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כָּשֵׁר — הָא כָּשֵׁר הוּא, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה — הַאי אֵינוֹ רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה, דְּאַלְיָה לְגָבוֹהַּ סָלְקָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Any case like this is subject to breaking a bone. What is the reason? because it is fit for eating, roast it and eat it. Rather, breaking the tail is the practical difference between them. According to the one who says valid, this one is valid According to the one who says fit for eating, this is not fit for eating, as the tail to God,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: All that has this quality has in it due to breaking of the bone, what is the reason that it is fit for eating, for it is cooked and eaten. Rather, there is a difference between breaking the rib. According to the one who says it is fit - it is fit, according to the one who says it is suitable for eating - this is not suitable for eating, for the rib has risen high.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כָּל כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא וַדַּאי אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם, דְּהָא וַדַּאי אֵינוֹ רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה כְּלָל. אֶלָּא, אֵבֶר שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו כַּזַּיִת בָּשָׂר אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כָּשֵׁר — הָא כָּשֵׁר הוּא, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה — בָּעֵינַן שִׁיעוּר אֲכִילָה, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: A case like this is certainly not subject to breaking a bone, as is certainly not fit for eating at all. Rather, a limb upon which there is not an olive-bulk of meat is the practical difference between them. According to the one who says valid, this is valid, According to the one who says fit for eating, we require the measure of eating, and there is not
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Any item that certainly does not have the potential for bone breakage, for certainly it is not fit for consumption at all. Rather, an item that does not have the size of an olive of meat is the distinction between them. According to the one who says it is kosher - it is indeed kosher, according to the one who says it is fit for consumption - we require the measure of consumption, and there is no disagreement.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: כׇּל כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא לֵית בֵּיהּ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם, דְּבָעֵינַן שִׁיעוּר אֲכִילָה. אֶלָּא, אֵבֶר שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר בְּמָקוֹם זֶה וְיֵשׁ עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר בִּמְקוֹם אַחֵר אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כָּשֵׁר — הָא כָּשֵׁר הוּא. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה — בָּעֵינַן שִׁיעוּר אֲכִילָה בִּמְקוֹם שְׁבִירָה, וְהָא לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Ravina said: Any case like this is not subject to breaking a bone, as we require the measure eating. Rather, a limb upon which there is not an olive-bulk of meat in this place and there is an olive-bulk of meat in another place is the practical difference between them. According to the one who says valid, this one is valid, According to the one who says fit for eating, we require the measure eating in the place of the break, and there is not
llm_translation: Ravina said: Any limb that does not have in it the possibility of breaking a bone, we require a measurement of eating. Rather, a limb that does not have the size of an olive of meat in this place, but has the size of an olive of meat in another place, there is a distinction between them. According to the one who says it is valid - it is valid. According to the one who says it is fit for eating - we require a measurement of eating in a place of breaking, and in this case it is not present.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּאַרְבְּעָה מִינַּיְיהוּ. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״בְּבַיִת אֶחָד יֵאָכֵל ... וְעֶצֶם לֹא תִשְׁבְּרוּ בּוֹ״, עַל הַכָּשֵׁר הוּא חַיָּיב, וְאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַל הַפָּסוּל.
human_translation: it was taught in accordance with four of As it was taught Rabbi says: “In one house shall it be eaten…and you shall not break a bone in it” one is liable for a valid and one is not liable for disqualified
llm_translation: It was taught: in four ways. As it was taught, Rabbi says: "In one house they shall eat ... and you shall not break a bone in it," he is liable for the kosher and not liable for the non-kosher.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר וְנִפְסַל בִּשְׁעַת אֲכִילָה — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת עֶצֶם.
human_translation: it had a time in which it was valid and it became disqualified at the time of eating, it is not subject to breaking a bone.
llm_translation: If he had a moment of fitness and became disqualified at the time of eating - it does not have in it any aspect of bone breakage.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בּוֹ שִׁיעוּר אֲכִילָה — יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת עֶצֶם, אֵין בּוֹ שִׁיעוּר אֲכִילָה — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת עֶצֶם.
human_translation: it has the measure eating, it is subject to breaking a bone; if it does not have the measure eating, it is not subject to breaking a bone.
llm_translation: There is in it a measure of eating - there is in it due to breaking of bone, there is no measure of eating - there is no due to breaking of bone.

hebrew_text: הָרָאוּי לַמִּזְבֵּחַ — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם.
human_translation: That which is fit for the altar, is not subject to breaking a bone.
llm_translation: Fit for the altar - does not have in it any breaking of the bone.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעַת אֲכִילָה — יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת עֶצֶם, שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת אֲכִילָה — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת עֶצֶם.
human_translation: At the time of eating, it is subject to breaking a bone; when it is not the time for eating, it is not subject to breaking a bone.
llm_translation: At the time of eating - there is in it the food the concern of bone breakage, not at the time of eating - there is not in it the food the concern of bone breakage.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: אֵבֶר שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר בִּמְקוֹם זֶה וְיֵשׁ עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר בִּמְקוֹם אַחֵר, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת עֶצֶם.
human_translation: It was stated a limb upon which there is not an olive-bulk of meat in this place and there is an olive-bulk of meat in a different place, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is subject to breaking a bone. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: It is not subject to breaking a bone.
llm_translation: It was stated: A limb that does not have the size of an olive of flesh in this place, and has the size of an olive of flesh in another place, Rabbi Yochanan said: It has the status of a broken bone. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: It does not have the status of a broken bone.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: ״וְעֶצֶם לֹא תִשְׁבְּרוּ בּוֹ״ — אֶחָד עֶצֶם שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר, וְאֶחָד עֶצֶם שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר. מַאי אֵין עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר? אִילֵּימָא דְּאֵין עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר כְּלָל — אַמַּאי יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם?! אֶלָּא לָאו, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֶחָד עֶצֶם שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר בְּמָקוֹם זֶה, וְאֶחָד שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר בְּמָקוֹם זֶה וְיֵשׁ עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר (— קַשְׁיָא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ)!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish “And you shall not break a bone in it,” both a bone upon which there is an olive-bulk of meat and a bone upon which there is not an olive-bulk of meat. What Upon which there is not an olive-bulk of meat? If we say that it does not have an olive-bulk of meat on it at all, Why, is it subject to breaking a bone? Rather, is it not this is what it is saying: both a bone upon which there is an olive-bulk of meat in this place, and upon which there is not an olive-bulk of meat in this place and there is an olive-bulk of meat in a different place? a difficulty to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: "And a bone you shall not break in it" — one bone that has on it the size of an olive of flesh, and one bone that does not have on it the size of an olive of flesh. What does it mean that it does not have on it the size of an olive of flesh? If you say it does not have on it the size of an olive of flesh at all — why then is it prohibited to break the bone?! Rather, this is what it means: one bone that has on it the size of an olive of flesh in this place, and one bone that does not have on it the size of an olive of flesh in this place, but has the size of an olive of flesh in another place. (This is difficult for Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish)!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: He said to him:
llm_translation: He said to him:

hebrew_text: לָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֶחָד עֶצֶם שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר מִבַּחוּץ, וְאֶחָד עֶצֶם שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו כַּזַּיִת בָּשָׂר מִבַּחוּץ, וְיֵשׁ עָלָיו כַּזַּיִת בָּשָׂר מִבִּפְנִים בִּמְקוֹם שְׁבִירָה.
human_translation: No, this is what it is saying: both a bone upon which there is an olive-bulk of meat on the outside and a bone upon which there is not an olive-bulk of meat on the outside, there is an olive-bulk of meat, on inside at the place of the break.
llm_translation: Not so, thus he said: One bone that has on it like an olive of flesh from the outside, and one bone that does not have like an olive of flesh from the outside, and has on it like an olive of flesh from the inside in the place of breakage.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וְעֶצֶם לֹא תִשְׁבְּרוּ בּוֹ״ — אֶחָד עֶצֶם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מוֹחַ, וְאֶחָד עֶצֶם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מוֹחַ. וּמָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְאָכְלוּ אֶת הַבָּשָׂר בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״ — בְּבָשָׂר שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי הָעֶצֶם.
human_translation: And was taught “And you shall not break a bone in it” both a bone in which there is marrow and a bone in which there is no marrow. How do I establish “And they shall eat the meat on that night” with meat that is on the bone.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: 'And you shall not break a bone in it' — one bone that has marrow, and one bone that does not have marrow. And how do I fulfill 'And they shall eat the flesh in that night' — with flesh that is on the bone." English translation:

hebrew_text: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּבָשָׂר שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ הָעֶצֶם, וּמָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְעֶצֶם לֹא תִשְׁבְּרוּ בוֹ״ — בְּעֶצֶם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מוֹחַ, אֲבָל בְּעֶצֶם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מוֹחַ — שׁוֹבֵר וְאוֹכֵל. וְאַל תִּתְמַהּ, שֶׁהֲרֵי יָבֹא עֲשֵׂה וְיִדְחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Or it only to the meat that is inside the bone. And how do I establish And you shall not break a bone in it? to a bone that does not have marrow. However, a bone that does have marrow, one may break and eat And do not be surprised as the positive comes and overrides the prohibition
llm_translation: Or is it only in the flesh within the bone, and how do I fulfill "And you shall not break a bone in it" - in a bone that does not have marrow, but in a bone that has marrow - one may break and eat. And do not wonder, for a positive commandment may come and override a negative commandment.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְעֶצֶם לֹא יִשְׁבְּרוּ בוֹ״ בְּפֶסַח שֵׁנִי, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״כְּכׇל חֻקַּת הַפֶּסַח יַעֲשׂוּ אֹתוֹ״ — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר אֶחָד עֶצֶם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מוֹחַ וְאֶחָד עֶצֶם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מוֹחַ.
human_translation: When it says: nor break a bone in it” with regard to the second Pesaḥ , which there is no need for the verse to state as it is already stated “according to all the statute of the Paschal lamb they shall keep it,” you must say both a bone in which there is marrow and a bone in which there is no marrow.
llm_translation: When he says, "And a bone of it shall not be broken" in the second Passover, there is no need to say, for it has already been stated, "According to all the statutes of the Passover, they shall keep it" — one bone that has marrow and one bone that does not have marrow.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵבֶר שֶׁיָּצָא מִקְצָתוֹ, חוֹתֵךְ עַד מָקוֹם שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לָעֶצֶם וְקוֹלֵף עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לַפֶּרֶק, וְחוֹתֵךְ.
human_translation: raises an objection a portion of a limb has gone out one cut until one reaches the bone, and peel until one reaches the joint, and cut
llm_translation: Challenger: A limb that exited from its socket, one cuts until the point that reaches the bone, and peels until it reaches the joint, and cuts.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אֵבֶר שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר בְּמָקוֹם זֶה וְיֵשׁ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם, לְמָה לִי דְּקוֹלֵף עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לַפֶּרֶק וְחוֹתֵךְ? נִקְלוֹף בֵּיהּ פּוּרְתָּא וְנִתְבְּרֵיהּ!
human_translation: And if you say that a limb upon which there is not an olive-bulk of meat in this place but there is in a different place is not subject to breaking a bone, why do I need peel until he reaches the joint and cut Let him peel a little bit and break
llm_translation: And if you say a limb that does not have the size of an olive of flesh in this place, and there is in another place, it does not have the status of bone breaking, why do I need to strike until it reaches the joint and cut it? Its pit has been removed and it has been broken!

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם פֶּקַע. רָבִינָא אָמַר: בְּקוּלִית.
human_translation: Abaye said: due to crack, Ravina said: a thigh bone,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: because of peka. Ravina said: in the voice of a woman.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַפִּיגּוּל וְהַנּוֹתָר (וְהַטָּמֵא) מְטַמְּאִין אֶת הַיָּדַיִם. רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא. חַד אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי חֲשֵׁדֵי כְהוּנָּה. וְחַד אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי עֲצֵלֵי כְהוּנָּה.
human_translation: We learned there, Piggul and leftover render hands impure Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda One said: due to priests, suspected And one said: due to lazy priests.
llm_translation: We learned there: Pigul and Notar (and Tamei) render the hands impure. Rav Huna and Rav Hisda. One said: Because of suspicions of priesthood. And one said: Because of laziness of priesthood.

hebrew_text: מָר מַתְנֵי אַפִּיגּוּל, וּמַר מַתְנֵי אַנּוֹתָר. מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי אַפִּיגּוּל — מִשּׁוּם חֲשֵׁדֵי כְהוּנָּה. וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי אַנּוֹתָר — מִשּׁוּם עֲצֵלֵי כְהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Sage teaches with regard to piggul , and Sage teaches with regard to leftover The one who teaches with regard to piggul due to priests suspected And the one who teaches with regard to leftover due to lazy priests
llm_translation: Master Matnei Apigul, and Master Matnei Anotar. Whoever says Matnei Apigul - because of suspicions of priesthood. And whoever says Matnei Anotar - because of laziness in the priesthood.

hebrew_text: מָר מַתְנֵי כְּזַיִת, וּמַר מַתְנֵי כְּבֵיצָה. מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי כְּזַיִת — כְּאִיסּוּרוֹ. וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי כְּבֵיצָה — כְּטוּמְאָתוֹ.
human_translation: Sage teaches an olive-bulk, and Sage teaches an egg-bulk. the one who teaches an olive-bulk like its prohibition; And the one who teaches an egg-bulk like its ritual impurity;
llm_translation: Master says: "He sets forth like an olive," and Master says: "He sets forth like an egg." Whoever says "like an olive" - as his prohibition. And whoever says "like an egg" - as his impurity.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: יוֹצֵא גְּזַרוּ רַבָּנַן טוּמְאָה אוֹ לָא? מִי אָמְרִינַן: נוֹתָר דִּגְזַרוּ טוּמְאָה דְּאָתֵי לְאִיעֲצוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ, אֲבָל יוֹצֵא, אַפּוֹקֵי בְּיָדַיִם לָא מַפְּקִי לֵיהּ בְּיָדַיִם, לָא גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן טוּמְאָה, אוֹ דִילְמָא לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before the that has gone out the Sages decree ritual impurity or not? Do we say that leftover as would come to be lazy about it but gone out actively take it out the Sages did not decree that it Or perhaps it is no different,
llm_translation: He asked them: Do the Rabbis decree impurity for that which comes out of a decree of impurity or not? Do we say: That which remains of the decree of impurity, since it can be handled, is susceptible to impurity, but that which comes out, if it can be removed by hand, is not susceptible to impurity, and the Rabbis did not decree impurity upon it, or perhaps it is not different.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֵבֶר שֶׁיָּצָא מִקְצָתוֹ חוֹתֵךְ עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לָעֶצֶם, וְקוֹלֵף עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לַפֶּרֶק, וְחוֹתֵךְ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן טוּמְאָה, כִּי חָתֵיךְ לֵיהּ מַאי הָוֵי? הָא קָמְטַמֵּא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Come hear a portion of a limb has gone out one must cut until one reaches the bone, and peel until one reaches the joint, and cut And if you say the Sages decreed ritual impurity when one cuts it, what has renders impure
llm_translation: Come and hear: A limb that has emerged from its socket, one cuts until reaching the bone, and peels until reaching the joint, and cuts. And if you say that the Sages decreed it impure, what will be the case if one cuts it? It will become impure!

hebrew_text: טוּמְאַת סְתָרִים הִיא, וְטוּמְאַת סְתָרִים לָא מְטַמְּיָא.
human_translation: It is ritual impurity a concealed ritual impurity a concealed does not render impure.
llm_translation: The impurity of hidden things it is, and the impurity of hidden things not is defiled.

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבִינָא דְּאָמַר: חִיבּוּרֵי אוֹכָלִין — לָאו חִיבּוּר הוּא, וּכְמָאן דְּמִפָּרְתִי דָּמֵי, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? הָא קָנָגַע בַּהֲדָדֵי וְקָא מְטַמֵּא! אֶלָּא: לְמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי כְּזַיִת — דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ כְּזַיִת. וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי כְּבֵיצָה — דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ כְּבֵיצָה.
human_translation: And according to Ravina, who said connections of food are not connections and are comparable to separate, what is there to say? They touch each other, and imparts ritual impurity Rather, According to the one who teaches an olive-bulk it does not have an olive-bulk the one who teaches an egg-bulk it does not have an egg-bulk
llm_translation: To Ravina who said: "The joining of foods - it is not considered a joining, and according to whom do we derive the principle that the value is diminished, what can be said? This is like a case where it touched the Hadadei and it renders impure! Rather, according to the one who teaches 'like an olive' - that it does not contain an olive. And the one who teaches 'like an egg' - that it does not contain an egg."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמּוֹצִיא בְּשַׂר פֶּסַח מֵחֲבוּרָה לַחֲבוּרָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, טָהוֹר. מַאי לָאו — טָהוֹר וְאָסוּר, דְּיוֹצֵא מֵחֲבוּרָה לַחֲבוּרָה כַּיּוֹצֵא חוּץ לִמְחִיצָתוֹ דָּמֵי, וּמִפְּסִיל, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי קָתָנֵי טָהוֹר, אַלְמָא לָא גְּזַרוּ רַבָּנַן טוּמְאָה!
human_translation: Come hear one removes the meat of a Paschal lamb from group to group, although he a prohibition, pure. What, is it not pure, and prohibited goes out from group to group is comparable to goes out of its boundary, and it is disqualified? And even so, it is teaching pure. Apparently, the Sages did not decree ritual impurity
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who brings out the meat of the Passover offering from one group to another group, even though it is a violation of a negative commandment, it is pure. What is the reason? — Not pure and forbidden, because it is considered as if it is being taken out from within its boundary to another boundary, similar to taking something out beyond its partition, and it renders it invalid. And even so, the Mishnah teaches that it is pure, indicating that the Rabbis did not decree impurity!

hebrew_text: לָא — טָהוֹר וּמוּתָּר, דְּיוֹצֵא מֵחֲבוּרָה לַחֲבוּרָה לָאו כַּיּוֹצֵא חוּץ לִמְחִיצָתוֹ דָּמֵי, וְלָא מִפְּסִיל.
human_translation: No, pure and permitted goes from group to group is not comparable to goes out of its boundary, and it is not disqualified.
llm_translation: Not — pure and permitted, that which exits from one domain to another domain is not like that which exits outside of its partition, and does not disqualify.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא תָנֵי סֵיפָא: הָאוֹכְלוֹ הֲרֵי זֶה בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה! בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כְּבֵיצָה — דְּאִית בֵּיהּ כְּזַיִת וְלֵית בֵּיהּ כְּבֵיצָה, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כְּזַיִת, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: But didn’t the latter clause teach one who eats is in a prohibition? Granted, according to the one who said an egg-bulk, there is an olive-bulk, and there is not an egg-bulk, But according to the one who says an olive-bulk, what is there to say?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And here it teaches in the latter part: If he ate it, this is a violation without an action! Granted according to the one who says like an egg — for it has the size of an olive and not the size of an egg. But according to the one who says like an olive, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בְּיוֹצֵא בַּפֶּסַח לָא מִיבַּעְיָא לַן דְּלָא גְּזַרוּ רַבָּנַן טוּמְאָה, מַאי טַעְמָא — בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה זְרִיזִין הֵן, וּמִזְהָר זְהִירִי בֵּיהּ. אֶלָּא, כִּי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לַן בְּיוֹצֵא בְּקָדָשִׁים, מַאי, תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rather, With regard to goes out from the Paschal lamb, not necessary for us the Sages did not decree ritual impurity What is the reason the members of the group are zealous and are careful Rather, when was asked, with regard to sacrificial that has gone out What Let it stand
llm_translation: Rather: regarding one who goes out on Passover, it is not necessary for us that the Rabbis did not decree impurity. What is the reason? The members of the group are diligent, and they are cautious with it. Rather, when it is necessary for us regarding one who goes out with consecrated items, what is the resolution.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹצִיא בְּשַׂר פֶּסַח
human_translation: And one who carries out meat Paschal lamb
llm_translation: And he brings out the meat of the Passover.

hebrew_text: מֵחֲבוּרָה לַחֲבוּרָה מִנַּיִן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״לֹא תוֹצִיא מִן הַבַּיִת מִן הַבָּשָׂר חוּצָה״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא מִבַּיִת לְבַיִת, מֵחֲבוּרָה לַחֲבוּרָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״חוּצָה״ — חוּץ לַאֲכִילָתוֹ.
human_translation: from group to group, from where As it was taught you shall not carry out any of the meat from the house to the outside” I have only from house to house; from where from group to group The verse states: To the outside, outside of it may be eaten.
llm_translation: From one group to another group, how do we know? For it was taught: "Do not take out from the house any flesh outside." I only have from house to house, from one group to another group, how do we know? The Talmud teaches: "Outside" - outside for its consumption.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הַמּוֹצִיא בְּשַׂר פֶּסַח מֵחֲבוּרָה לַחֲבוּרָה, אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיַּנִּיחַ. הוֹצָאָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ כְּשַׁבָּת: מָה שַׁבָּת — עַד דְּעָבֵד עֲקִירָה וְהַנָּחָה, אַף הָכָא נָמֵי — עַד דְּעָבֵד עֲקִירָה וְהַנָּחָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: One who carries out the meat of the Paschal lamb from group to group is not liable until he places carrying out is written about it, pertaining to Shabbat. just as Shabbat one is not liable until he performs lifting and placing so too, here also until he performs lifting and placing
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: One who takes out Pesach meat from one group to another group is not liable until he places it down. The writing of taking out is written in it like Shabbat: Just as Shabbat - until he performs uprooting and placing, so too here - until he performs uprooting and placing.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: הָיוּ סוֹבְלִים אוֹתָן בְּמוֹטוֹת, הָרִאשׁוֹנִים יָצְאוּ חוּץ לְחוֹמַת הָעֲזָרָה וְהָאַחֲרוֹנִים לֹא יָצְאוּ, הָרִאשׁוֹנִים מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים וְהָאַחֲרוֹנִים אֵין מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים. וְהָא לָא נָח?
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Mammal raised an objection were carrying them on poles, those in front went outside the wall and those in the rear had not gone out, the ones in front their garments ritually impure, and the ones in the rear do not their garments ritually impure But has not been placed
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rabbi Abba bar Memel asked: If they were carrying them on their shoulders, the first ones went out beyond the wall of the Azarah, and the latter ones did not go out; the first ones would render garments impure, and the latter ones would not render garments impure. Is this not satisfactory?

hebrew_text: הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְפָרֵק לַהּ, בְּנִגְרָרִין.
human_translation: He raised the objection and he resolved it: dragging
llm_translation: He is questioning her and he is answering her, in whispers.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵבֶר שֶׁיָּצָא מִקְצָתוֹ, חוֹתֵךְ עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לָעֶצֶם, וְקוֹלֵף עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לַפֶּרֶק, וְחוֹתֵךְ. וּבַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין — קוֹצֵץ בְּקוֹפִיץ, שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם.
human_translation: a portion of a limb has gone out one must cut until one reaches the bone and peel until one reaches the joint, and cut And with regard to offerings, one may chop with a hatchet, as it is not subject to breaking a bone.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A limb that has emerged partially, one cuts until reaching the bone, and peels until reaching the joint, and then cuts. And in the Temple courtyard, one may cut with a knife, as it does not involve breaking a bone.

hebrew_text: מִן הָאֲגַף וְלִפְנִים — כְּלִפְנִים, מִן הָאֲגַף וּלְחוּץ — כְּלַחוּץ. הַחַלּוֹנוֹת וְעוֹבִי הַחוֹמָה — כְּלִפְנִים.
human_translation: from the doorway inward is as though inside, from the doorway outward is as though outside. And the windows and the thickness of the wall are as though inside,
llm_translation: From the side and inside - like inside, from the side and outside - like outside. The windows and the thickness of the wall - like inside.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: וְכֵן לִתְפִלָּה. וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אֲפִילּוּ מְחִיצָה שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל אֵינָהּ מַפְסֶקֶת בֵּין יִשְׂרָאֵל לַאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: And similar with regard to prayer, disagrees with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Even a barrier of iron does not separate between the Jewish people and their Father in Heaven.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said, Rav Yehudah said, Rav said: And similarly for prayer. And there is a dispute of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. For Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Even an iron partition does not separate between Israel and their Father in Heaven.

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ: מִן הָאֲגַף וְלִפְנִים — כְּלִפְנִים, הָא אֲגַף עַצְמוֹ — כְּלַחוּץ. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: מִן הָאֲגַף וּלְחוּץ — כְּלַחוּץ. הָא אֲגַף עַצְמוֹ — כְּלִפְנִים!
human_translation: This matter itself is difficult; you said from the doorway inward is considered as though inside, which doorway itself is like the outside. say the latter clause from the doorway outward is considered as though outside, which doorway itself is considered as though inside.
llm_translation: The body itself is difficult, you say: from the side and inside - like inside, the side itself - like outside. Say the end: from the side and outside - like outside. The side itself - like inside!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בְּשַׁעֲרֵי עֲזָרָה, כָּאן — בְּשַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: It is not difficult, Here, to the gates of the courtyard, There, the gates of Jerusalem,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here - at the gates of the Temple Mount, here - at the gates of Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נִתְקַדְּשׁוּ שַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּצוֹרָעִין מְגִינִּין תַּחְתֵּיהֶן, בַּחַמָּה מִפְּנֵי הַחַמָּה, וּבַגְּשָׁמִים מִפְּנֵי הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: As Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said: For what gates of Jerusalem not sanctified? Because lepers protect themselves under them; in the sun from the sun and in the rain from the rain.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said: Why were the gates of Jerusalem not sanctified? Because lepers would lodge beneath them, from the sun because of the sun, and from the rain because of the rain.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נִתְקַדְּשָׁה שַׁעַר נִקָּנוֹר? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּצוֹרָעִין עוֹמְדִין שָׁם וּמַכְנִיסִין בְּהוֹנוֹת יָדָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said: For what Gate of Nicanor not sanctified because lepers stand there and insert their thumbs
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak said: Why was the Nikanor Gate not sanctified? Because lepers would stand there and insert their hands with their impurities.

hebrew_text: הַחַלּוֹנוֹת וָעוֹבִי הַחוֹמָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: גַּגִּין וַעֲלִיּוֹת לֹא נִתְקַדְּשׁוּ. אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חִיָּיא ״כְּזֵיתָא פִּסְחָא, וְהַלֵּילָא פָּקַע אִיגָּרָא״.
human_translation: the windows and the thickness of the wall Rav said: Roofs and upper stories were not sanctified. Is that so? Didn’t Rav say in the name of Rabbi Ḥiyya: The Paschal lamb is an olive-bulk, And the hallel breaks the roof;
llm_translation: The windows and the projections of the wall, etc. Rav said: Roofs and upper chambers were not sanctified. Is it not so?! But didn't Rav say in the name of Rabbi Chiya, "Like an olive's size of Passover offering, and the night breaks the roof beam"?

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, דְּאָכְלִי בְּאִיגָּרָא וְאָמְרִי בְּאִיגָּרָא! לָא: דְּאָכְלִי בְּאַרְעָא וְאָמְרִי בְּאִיגָּרָא.
human_translation: What, is it not that they eat on the roof and say on the roof, No, that they eat on the ground and say on the roof.
llm_translation: What is the reason that they ate in the upper chamber and recited the blessing in the upper chamber? Because they ate in the courtyard and recited the blessing in the upper chamber.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָתְנַן: אֵין מַפְטִירִין אַחַר הַפֶּסַח אֲפִיקוֹמָן, וְאָמַר רַב: שֶׁלֹּא יֵעָקְרוּ מֵחֲבוּרָה לַחֲבוּרָה. לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בִּשְׁעַת אֲכִילָה, כָּאן — שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת אֲכִילָה.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t we learn We do not conclude after the Paschal lamb with afikoman , and Rav said they may not uproot from group to group. It is not difficult. Here, during the time of eating. There, not during the time of eating.
llm_translation: I am not? And we learned in a Mishnah: One may not leave the group after the Passover meal, and Rav said: So that they should not be uprooted from one group to another. There is no difficulty: here — at the time of eating, here — not at the time of eating.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: עֲלִיַּית בֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים חֲמוּרָה מִבֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים. שֶׁבֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים — כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל נִכְנָס לוֹ פַּעַם אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה, וַעֲלִיַּית בֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים — אֵין נִכְנָסִין לָהּ אֶלָּא פַּעַם אַחַת בְּשָׁבוּעַ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: פַּעֲמַיִם בְּשָׁבוּעַ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: פַּעַם אַחַת בְּיוֹבֵל, לֵידַע מָה הִיא צְרִיכָה.
human_translation: Come hear Abba Shaul says: The upper story of the chamber of the Holy of Holies is more stringent than the chamber of the Holy of Holies the chamber of the Holy of Holies, the High Priest would enter it once a year the upper story of the chamber of the Holy of Holies is not entered except once in seven years; and some say twice in seven years, and some say one time in a Jubilee, to see what it needs
llm_translation: Come and hear: Abba Shaul says: The ascent to the Beit Kodesh of the Holy of Holies is more stringent than the Beit Kodesh of the Holy of Holies. For in the Beit Kodesh of the Holy of Holies, the High Priest enters it once a year, but the ascent to the Beit Kodesh of the Holy of Holies, they only enter it once a week, and some say: twice a week, and some say: once in the Jubilee year, to know what it requires.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מֵהֵיכָל נֵיקוּם וְנִיתֵּיב אִינִישׁ? שָׁאנֵי הֵיכָל, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּתֵּן דָּוִד לִשְׁלֹמֹה בְנוֹ אֶת תַּבְנִית הָאוּלָם וְאֶת בָּתָּיו וְאֶת גַּנְזַכָּיו וַעֲלִיֹּתָיו וַחֲדָרָיו הַפְּנִימִים וּבֵית הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״, וּכְתִיב: ״הַכֹּל בִּכְתָב מִיַּד ה׳ עָלַי הִשְׂכִּיל״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Can a person get up and ask Sanctuary? The Sanctuary is different, as it is written: “Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the Entrance Hall of the Temple, and of its houses, and of its treasuries, and of its upper rooms, and of its inner chambers, and of the place of the ark cover” and it is written “All this is put in writing by the hand of the Lord, Who has instructed me”
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where does one learn and establish? It is different with the Heichal, as it is written: "And David gave to Solomon his son the plan of the porch, and of its houses, and of its treasuries, and of its upper rooms, and of its inner chambers, and of the house of the mercy seat" (1 Chronicles 28:11), and it is written: "All this in writing from the hand of the Lord made me understand upon all the works of this pattern" (1 Chronicles 28:19).

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַלְּשָׁכוֹת הַבְּנוּיוֹת בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ וּפְתוּחוֹת לַחוֹל — תּוֹכָן חוֹל, וְגַגּוֹתֵיהֶן קוֹדֶשׁ! תַּרְגְּמָא רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּשֶׁגַּגּוֹתֵיהֶן שָׁוִין לְקַרְקַע עֲזָרָה.
human_translation: Come hear the chambers that were built in the sanctified and open to the unsanctified their interiors are unsanctified and their roofs are sanctified. Rav Ḥisda interpreted it their roofs were level with the ground of the courtyard.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Chambers constructed within the sanctuary and open to the secular area — their interior is secular, but their roofs are sanctified! Rabbi Ḥisdah translated: With their roofs sloping towards the ground, they are considered as part of the ground.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: בְּנוּיוֹת בַּחוֹל וּפְתוּחוֹת לַקּוֹדֶשׁ — תּוֹכֶן קוֹדֶשׁ וְגַגּוֹתֵיהֶן חוֹל. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בְּשֶׁגַּגּוֹתֵיהֶן שָׁוִין לְקַרְקַע עֲזָרָה, הָוְיָא לַהּ מְחִילּוֹת, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְחִילּוֹת לֹא נִתְקַדְּשׁוּ! כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — בִּפְתוּחוֹת לְהַר הַבַּיִת. כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא — בִּפְתוּחוֹת לָעֲזָרָה.
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause built in the unsanctified and open to the sanctified their interiors are sanctified and their roofs are unsanctified. And if it should enter your mind whose roofs were level with the ground of the courtyard, would be tunnels, and Rabbi Yoḥanan said the tunnels were not sanctified. When Rabbi Yoḥanan said to open to the Temple Mount; when that baraita , was taught, to open to the courtyard
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, say the conclusion: Built in the secular and open to the sacred - their interior is sacred and their roofs are secular. And if it enters your mind that their roofs are suitable for the ground of the courtyard, it should be for them as partitions. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Partitions were not sanctified! For Rabbi Yochanan said - in the openings to the Temple Mount. As it was taught - in the openings to the courtyard.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מְחִילּוֹת מִתַּחַת הַהֵיכָל חוֹל! כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא — שֶׁפְּתוּחוֹת לַחוֹל.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: The tunnels under the Sanctuary are unsanctified? When that baraita was taught, that open to the unsanctified
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: The tunnels beneath the Temple are mundane! For it was taught in that Baraita — that their openings are to the mundane." English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: וְגַגּוֹ קוֹדֶשׁ!
human_translation: Come hear the roof was sanctified,
llm_translation: Come and hear: "And his roof is holy!"

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא?! וְהָא קָתָנֵי: גַּגִּין הַלָּלוּ אֵין אוֹכְלִין שָׁם קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים, וְאֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין שָׁם קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים! וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא גַּגּוֹ קֹדֶשׁ! אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא: לְאוֹתָן שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: And can you understand Isn’t it teaching: these roofs one may not eat offerings of the most sacred order and one may not slaughter offerings of lesser sanctity there However, that is difficult. the roof is sanctified. Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said: those two cubits
llm_translation: And it was created?! But doesn't the Mishnah teach: These roofs, one may not eat there holy of holies, and one may not slaughter light holy offerings there! Rather, the difficulty is with the sanctity of the roof! Rav Hama son of Gurya said: For those two cubits.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת הָיָה בְּשׁוּשַׁן הַבִּירָה, אַחַת עַל קֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית וְאַחַת עַל קֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית דְּרוֹמִית. זוֹ שֶׁעַל קֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית הָיְתָה יְתֵירָה עַל שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה חֲצִי אֶצְבַּע, וְזוֹ שֶׁעַל קֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית דְּרוֹמִית הָיְתָה יְתֵירָה עָלֶיהָ חֲצִי אֶצְבַּע, נִמְצֵאת יְתֵירָה עַל שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה אֶצְבַּע.
human_translation: As we learned There were two cubits in Shushan the Capital, one in the northeast corner and one in the southeast corner. The one in the northeast corner was longer than of Moses, half a fingerbreadth, and the one in the southeast corner was longer than that by half a fingerbreadth. Consequently, longer than Moses’ by fingerbreadth.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: There were two cubits in Shushan the capital, one on the northeastern corner and one on the southeastern corner. The one on the northeastern corner exceeded that of Moses by half a finger, and the one on the southeastern corner exceeded it by half a finger, thus it was found to exceed that of Moses by a finger.

hebrew_text: וְלָמָה הָיוּ אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה וְאַחַת קְטַנָּה? שֶׁיִּהְיוּ הָאוּמָּנִין נוֹטְלִין בַּקְּטַנָּה וּמַחְזִירִין בַּגְּדוֹלָה, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יָבוֹאוּ לִידֵי מְעִילָה. וְתַרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי? אַחַת — לְכַסְפָּא וְדַהֲבָא, וְאַחַת — לְבִנְיָנָא.
human_translation: And why one large and one small? so that the artisans would take by the small and return by the large so they would not come to misuse consecrated property. And why do I two One, for silver and gold, and one was for construction.
llm_translation: And why were there one large and one small? So that the craftsmen would take from the small and return to the large, in order not to come to theft. And why do I need two? One - for silver and gold, and one - for building.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַחַלּוֹנוֹת וְעוֹבִי הַחוֹמָה — כְּלִפְנִים. בִּשְׁלָמָא הַחַלּוֹנוֹת, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דְּשָׁוְיָה לְקַרְקַע עֲזָרָה. אֶלָּא עוֹבִי הַחוֹמָה, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: We learned The windows and the thickness of the wall were inside. Granted, you will find it when it is level with the ground of the courtyard. But the thickness of the wall, what circumstances you find
llm_translation: We learned: The windows and the thickness of the wall - inward. Granted, the windows, you can say that they are meant for light to reach the ground of the Azarah. But the thickness of the wall, how can you say that they are meant for?

hebrew_text: מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּבַר שׁוּרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּאֲבֶל חֵל וְחוֹמָה״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שׁוּרָא וּבַר שׁוּרָא.
human_translation: You find it in the low wall as it is written: “He has made the rampart and wall mourn” and Rabbi Aḥa said, and some say Rabbi Ḥanina, a wall and a low wall
llm_translation: She found in Bar Shura, as it is written: "And the wall and the rampart mourned" (Isaiah 24:4). And Rabbi Ahah said, and some say Rabbi Hanina: Shura and Bar Shura.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁתֵּי חֲבוּרוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹכְלִין בְּבַיִת אֶחָד, אֵלּוּ הוֹפְכִין אֶת פְּנֵיהֶם הֵילָךְ וְאוֹכְלִין, וְאֵלּוּ הוֹפְכִין אֶת פְּנֵיהֶם הֵילָךְ וְאוֹכְלִין, וְהַמֵּיחַם בָּאֶמְצַע. כְּשֶׁהַשַּׁמָּשׁ עוֹמֵד לִמְזוֹג, קוֹפֵץ אֶת פִּיו וּמַחֲזִיר אֶת פָּנָיו, עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ אֵצֶל חֲבוּרָתוֹ וְאוֹכֵל. וְהַכַּלָּה הוֹפֶכֶת אֶת פָּנֶיהָ וְאוֹכֶלֶת.
human_translation: Two groups that were eating in one house these turn their faces this way and eat, and these turn their faces that way and eat. And the boiler in the middle, When the attendant gets up to pour he must close his mouth and turn his face until he reaches his group and eats And the bride, turns her face and eats,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Two groups that were eating in one house, these turn their faces this way and eat, and these turn their faces that way and eat, and the one who mixes them is in the middle. When the attendant stands to pour, he covers his mouth and turns his face until he reaches his group and eats. And the bride turns her face and eats.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״עַל הַבָּתִּים אֲשֶׁר יֹאכְלוּ אֹתוֹ בָּהֶם״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַפֶּסַח נֶאֱכָל בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲבוּרוֹת. יָכוֹל יְהֵא הָאוֹכֵל אוֹכֵל בִּשְׁתֵּי מְקוֹמוֹת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּבַיִת אֶחָד יֵאָכֵל״.
human_translation: Who is the mishna? t is Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught “Upon the houses wherein they shall eat it” teaches that Paschal lamb may be eaten in two groups, might who eats may eat in two places; therefore, the Torah states: “In one house shall it be eaten [ ye’akhel ]”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, matnitin mani? Rabbi Yehuda hi. Detanya: "Al habatim asher yokhlu oto bahem," melamed shehapessach ne'ekhal bishetei chavurot. Yakhol yehi ha'okhel okhel bishetei mekomot - talmud lomar: "Bebayit echad ye'akhal." English translation: Gemara, from where is the teaching? It is Rabbi Yehuda's. As it was taught: "On the houses in which they will eat it," teaches that the Passover is eaten in two groups. One might have thought that the one who eats should eat in two places - the teaching informs us: "It shall be eaten in one house."

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: הַשַּׁמָּשׁ שֶׁאָכַל כְּזַיִת בְּצַד הַתַּנּוּר, אִי פִּקֵּחַ הוּא מְמַלֵּא כְּרֵיסוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ, וְאִם רָצוּ בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה לַעֲשׂוֹת עִמּוֹ טוֹבָה — בָּאִין וְיוֹשְׁבִין בְּצִדּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: From here they stated an attendant ate an olive-bulk next to the oven if he is prudent he will fill his stomach with it And if the members of the group wanted to do him a favor they would come and sit at his side. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: From here they said: The sun that ate an olive's bulk at the side of the oven, if it is open it fills its pot from it, and if the members of the group wanted to do a favor with it - they come and sit at its side, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״עַל הַבָּתִּים אֲשֶׁר יֹאכְלוּ אֹתוֹ בָּהֶם״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָאוֹכֵל אוֹכֵל בִּשְׁתֵּי מְקוֹמוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says “Upon the houses wherein they shall eat it” teaches that who eats may eat in two places.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "On the houses that they will eat him in them," teaches that the eater eats in two places.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יְהֵא נֶאֱכָל בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲבוּרוֹת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּבַיִת אֶחָד יֵאָכֵל״.
human_translation: might may be eaten in two groups; therefore, the verse states: “In one house shall it be eaten.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Yachol yehi ne'echal bish'tei chavurot, talmud lomar: 'Bebayit echad ye'achel'." English translation: It might have been eaten in two groups, Scripture states: "It shall be eaten in one house."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמָּסוֹרֶת. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi Yehuda holds that the consonantal text of the Torah is authoritative; And Rabbi Shimon holds that the vocalized text of the Torah is authoritative.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Rabbi Yehuda holds: There is a mother for tradition. And Rabbi Shimon holds: There is a mother for scripture.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ יוֹשְׁבִין וְנִפְרְסָה מְחִיצָה בֵּינֵיהֶם, לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר פֶּסַח נֶאֱכָל בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲבוּרוֹת — אוֹכְלִין, לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר אֵין הַפֶּסַח נֶאֱכָל בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲבוּרוֹת — אֵין אוֹכְלִין.
human_translation: were sitting and a partition was spread between them according to who says a Paschal lamb may be eaten in two groups, they may eat; according to who says a Paschal lamb may not be eaten in two groups, they may not eat
llm_translation: They were sitting and a partition was placed between them, according to the opinion of the one who says the Passover offering may be eaten in two groups - they may eat; according to the opinion of the one who says the Passover offering may not be eaten in two groups - they may not eat.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ יוֹשְׁבִין וְנִסְתַּלְּקָה מְחִיצָה בֵּינֵיהֶן, לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר הָאוֹכֵל אוֹכֵל בִּשְׁנֵי מְקוֹמוֹת — אוֹכְלִין, לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר אֵין הָאוֹכֵל אוֹכֵל בִּשְׁנֵי מְקוֹמוֹת — אֵין אוֹכְלִין.
human_translation: they were sitting and the partition between them was removed, according to who says that one who eats may eat in two places, they may eat; according to who says that one who eats may not eat in two places, they may not eat.
llm_translation: They were sitting and a partition was removed between them, according to the one who says, "One who eats, eats in two places" — they may eat; according to the one who says, "One who eats does not eat in two places" — they may not eat.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב כָּהֲנָא קָא פָּשֵׁיט לֵיהּ מִפְשָׁט. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: וְתִיבְּעֵי לָךְ אִיבַּעְיָא: סִילּוּק מְחִיצָה וַעֲשִׂיַּית מְחִיצָה מִי הָוֵי כִּשְׁנֵי מְקוֹמוֹת, וְכִשְׁתֵּי חֲבוּרוֹת דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana sat and simply, Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: You should raise this dilemma as a question: Does removal of a partition or the construction of a partition comparable to two locations and two groups, or not? Let stand
llm_translation: Sitting, Rav Kahana was spreading it out. Rav Ashe said to Rav Kahana: And you should demand proof. Removal of a partition and making a partition, is it considered like two separate places, and like two separate domains, or not? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: הַכַּלָּה הוֹפֶכֶת אֶת פָּנֶיהָ וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא בּוֹשָׁה.
human_translation: a bride turns her face. What is the reason Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is because she is embarrassed
llm_translation: The bride turns her face and so on. What is the reason? Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: Because she is embarrassed.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מָה שְׁמָךְ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: רַב הוּנָא. אֲמַרוּ: נִיתֵּיב מָר אַפּוּרְיָא! יְתֵיב, יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ כָּסָא, קַבְּלֵיהּ בְּחַד זִימְנָא וְשַׁתְיֵיהּ בִּתְרֵי זִימְנֵי, וְלָא אַהְדַּר אַפֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, happened to come to the house of Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak. They said to him: What is your name? He said to them: Rav Huna, They said: Our master may sit on the bed He sat They gave him a cup he accepted the first time, And he drank it in two and did not turn his face
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Nathan, entered the house of Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak. They said to him: What is your name? He said to them: Rav Huna. They said: Let the master sit down! He sat down, they gave him a seat, served him in one cup and he drank in two cups, and did not return his face.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא קָרֵית לְךָ רַב הוּנָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ בַּעַל הַשֵּׁם אֲנִי. מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי אֲמַרוּ לָךְ נִיתֵּיב אַפּוּרְיָא יְתֵבְתְּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: כׇּל מַה שֶׁיֹּאמַר לְךָ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת עֲשֵׂה (חוּץ מִצֵּא).
human_translation: said to him: What is the reason you call yourself Rav Huna? He said to them: I am that name What is the reason when they told you to sit on the bed, you sat He said to them: anything the master of the house says to you, do, except for leave.
llm_translation: They said to him: What is the reason that Rav Huna called you? He said to them: Because I am the Baal HaShem. What is the reason that when they tell you to sit in the uppermost seat, you sit? He said to them: Whatever the master of the house tells you to do, do it, except for going out.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי יָהֲבִי לָךְ כָּסָא קַבֵּלְתְּ בְּחַד זִימְנָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: מְסָרְבִין לַקָּטָן, וְאֵין מְסָרְבִין לַגָּדוֹל. מַאי טַעְמָא אִשְׁתֵּיתֵיהּ בִּתְרֵי זִימְנֵי? אָמַר לְהוּ: דְּתַנְיָא, הַשּׁוֹתֶה כּוֹסוֹ בְּבַת אַחַת הֲרֵי זֶה גַּרְגְּרָן, שְׁנַיִם — דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ, שְׁלֹשָׁה — מִגַּסֵּי הָרוּחַ. מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אַהְדַּרְתְּ אַפָּךְ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: ״כַּלָּה הוֹפֶכֶת פָּנֶיהָ״ תְּנַן.
human_translation: What is the reason that when they gave you the cup, you accepted it the first time He said to them: One may refuse a lesser person, but one may not refuse a great person; What is the reason you drank it in two He said to them: As it was taught One who drinks his cup at one time is a guzzler; two proper manners; three is haughty, What is the reason you did not turn your face He said to them: We learned in the mishna that a bride turns her face;
llm_translation: What is the reason that when he gives you a cup, you accept it in one time? He said to them: We are particular with the young, but we are not particular with the old. What is the reason that you drink it in two sips? He said to them: As it was taught, one who drinks his cup in one gulp, it is like a throat; two sips - it is the way of etiquette; three - it is from arrogance. What is the reason that you did not turn your face back? He said to them: "As a bride turns her face" we learn.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן לָקוֹנְיָא. יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ כָּסָא, קַבְּלֵיהּ בְּחַד זִימְנָא וְשַׁתְיֵיהּ בְּחַד זִימְנָא. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר הַשּׁוֹתֶה כּוֹסוֹ בְּבַת אַחַת הֲרֵי זֶה גַּרְגְּרָן? אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא אָמְרִי בְּכוֹסְךָ קָטָן וְיֵינְךָ מָתוֹק וּכְרֵיסִי רְחָבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, happened to come to the house of Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi Yosei ben Lakonya. They gave him a cup He accepted it the first time and drank it at one time. They said to him: Does our master not hold one who drinks his cup at one time is a guzzler? He said to them: They did not say with regard to your small cup, and your sweet wine, and my wide stomach.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, entered the house of Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi Yosei ben Lakunya. They gave him a seat, he accepted it once, and drank it once. They said to him: Does the master not hold that one who drinks his cup in one gulp, it is like a throat? He said to them: I did not say that your cup is small and your wine is sweet, and your jug is wide.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה נִכְנָסִין בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וְיוֹצְאִין אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶחָד. אָמַר רַבָּה: וְהוּא דְּעָיֵיל בְּעִידָּנָא דִּרְגִילִי לְמֵיעַל, וְהוּא דִּרְגַשׁ בְּהוּ דַּיָּילָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: Members of a group enter with three, and they may leave even with one, Rabba said: And that is when entered at a time when it is common to enter and it is when the waiter [ dayyala ] knew about them,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Members of a group may enter with three, and may leave even with one. Rabbah said: This is when they are accustomed to ascend, and this is when the wine has taken effect.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: וְנוֹתְנִין שְׂכַר דָּמִים, וְצָרִיךְ הָאַחֲרוֹן לְהוֹסִיף דָּמִים. וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said: And must give money wages and the last must add money And the halakha is not in accordance with the opinion
llm_translation: Ravina said: "And we give reward for blood, and the last one must add blood. And the halakha is not in accordance with his opinion."

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ כֵּיצַד צוֹלִין
llm_translation: We will return to you. How do we roast?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִשָּׁה בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִיא בְּבֵית בַּעְלָהּ, שָׁחַט עָלֶיהָ בַּעְלָהּ וְשָׁחַט עָלֶיהָ אָבִיהָ — תֹּאכַל מִשֶּׁל בַּעְלָהּ. הָלְכָה רֶגֶל רִאשׁוֹן לַעֲשׂוֹת בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ, שָׁחַט עָלֶיהָ אָבִיהָ וְשָׁחַט עָלֶיהָ בַּעְלָהּ — תֹּאכַל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁהִיא רוֹצָה.
human_translation: A woman, when she is in her husband’s house, her husband slaughtered on her behalf and her father slaughtered on her behalf, she eat from her husband’s she went on the first Festival to observe in her father’s house, her husband slaughtered on her behalf and her father slaughtered on her behalf, she eat in place she wishes,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A woman, while she is in her husband's house, if her husband slaughtered an animal for her and her father also slaughtered an animal for her - she may eat from her husband's offering. The halacha is: the first year after marriage, she should perform the mitzvah in her father's house. If her father slaughtered an animal for her and her husband also slaughtered an animal for her - she may eat where she desires.

hebrew_text: יָתוֹם שֶׁשָּׁחֲטוּ עָלָיו אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּסִין — יֹאכַל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁהוּא רוֹצֶה. עֶבֶד שֶׁל שְׁנֵי שׁוּתָּפִין לֹא יֹאכַל מִשֶּׁל שְׁנֵיהֶן. מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין לֹא יֹאכַל מִשֶּׁל רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: an orphan guardians [ apotropsin ] slaughtered on his behalf, eat in place he wishes. A slave by two partners not eat from either of them, One who is half slave and half free man may not eat from his master’s
