llm_translation: Orphan that slaughtered upon him, exempt - he may eat in place that he wants. Slave of two partners, may not eat from either of them. One whose half is slave and half is free man, may not eat from his master.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה? מַאי רוֹצָה — בִּשְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: You learn from it there is retroactive clarification. What she wishes? the time of slaughter.
llm_translation: Gemara: Did you hear that there is choice in it? What does it want - at the time of slaughter.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: אִשָּׁה, רֶגֶל הָרִאשׁוֹן אוֹכֶלֶת מִשֶּׁל אָבִיהָ. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, רוֹצָה — אוֹכֶלֶת מִשֶּׁל אָבִיהָ, רוֹצָה — מִשֶּׁל בַּעְלָהּ.
human_translation: raises a contradiction A woman, the first Festival eats from her father’s From here on, she wishes, she eats from her father’s she wishes, from her husband’s
llm_translation: And they asked: A woman, the first foot eats from her father's table. From here and onwards, if she wants - she eats from her father's table, if she wants - from her husband's table.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן, בִּרְדוּפָה לֵילֵךְ. כָּאן, בְּשֶׁאֵינָהּ רְדוּפָה.
human_translation: not difficult. There, to pursued to go here to does not pursued to go
llm_translation: Not difficult: here, in a case of pursuit to kill. Here, when it is not a case of pursuit.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״אָז הָיִיתִי בְעֵינָיו כְּמוֹצְאֵת שָׁלוֹם״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּכַלָּה שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת שְׁלֵימָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ, וּרְדוּפָה לֵילֵךְ לְהַגִּיד שִׁבְחָהּ בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ. כְּדִכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא נְאֻם ה׳ תִּקְרְאִי אִישִׁי וְלֹא תִקְרְאִי לִי עוֹד בַּעְלִי״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּכַלָּה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ, וְלֹא כְּכַלָּה בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: as it is written: then I was in his eyes as one who finds peace” And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: like a bride who was found perfect. in her father-in-law’s house. And pursued, to go to tell her praise, in her father’s house. As it is written: “And it shall be at that day, says the Lord, that you shall call Me: My Husband, and shall call Me no more: My Master” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: like a bride in her father-in-law’s house, And not like a bride in her father’s house,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written: "Then I was in His eyes like one who finds peace." And Rabbi Yochanan said: Like a bride who is found complete in her father-in-law's house, and is pursued to go and praise her in her father's house. As it is written: "And it shall be on that day, says the Lord, you will call Me 'My husband' and you will no longer call Me 'My master'." Rabbi Yochanan said: Like a bride in her father-in-law's house, and not like a bride in her father's house.

hebrew_text: ״אָחוֹת לָנוּ קְטַנָּה וְשָׁדַיִם אֵין לָהּ״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ עֵילָם, שֶׁזָּכְתָה לִלְמוֹד, וְלֹא זָכְתָה לְלַמֵּד.
human_translation: “We have a little sister, and she has no breasts” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is Eilam, which was privileged to study was not privileged to teach
llm_translation: "‘A sister for us, young and she has no breasts,’ Rabbi Yochanan said: This refers to Elam, who merited to learn but did not merit to teach."

hebrew_text: ״אֲנִי חוֹמָה וְשָׁדַי כַּמִּגְדָּלוֹת״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״אֲנִי חוֹמָה״ — זוֹ תּוֹרָה, ״וְשָׁדַי כַּמִּגְדָּלוֹת״ — אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים. וְרָבָא אָמַר: ״אֲנִי חוֹמָה״ — זוֹ כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל, ״וְשָׁדַי כַּמִּגְדָּלוֹת״ — אֵלּוּ בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: “I am a wall and my breasts are like towers” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: “I am a wall”; this is Torah. “And my breasts are like towers”; these are the Torah scholars, And Rava said: “I am a wall”; this is the Congregation of Israel. “And my breasts are like towers”; these are the synagogues and study halls
llm_translation: "I am a wall, and my breasts are like towers," said Rabbi Yochanan: "I am a wall" - this is the Torah, "and my breasts are like towers" - these are the students of the sages. And Rava said: "I am a wall" - this is the congregation of Israel, "and my breasts are like towers" - these are synagogues and study halls.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר בָּנֵינוּ כִּנְטִעִים מְגֻדָּלִים בִּנְעוּרֵיהֶם בְּנוֹתֵינוּ כְזָוִיֹּת מְחֻטָּבוֹת תַּבְנִית הֵיכָל״,
human_translation: Rav Zutra bar Toviya said Rav said What is that which is written: “We whose sons are as plants grown up in their youth; whose daughters are as corner pillars carved after the fashion of a palace”
llm_translation: Rav Zutra bar Toviyya said in the name of Rav, what is the meaning of what is written: "Our sons are like saplings grown tall in their youth, our daughters like corner pillars carved in the style of a palace."

hebrew_text: ״אֲשֶׁר בָּנֵינוּ כִּנְטִעִים״ — אֵלּוּ בַּחוּרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא טָעֲמוּ טַעַם חֵטְא. ״בְּנוֹתֵינוּ כְזָוִיֹּת״ — אֵלּוּ בְּתוּלוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאוֹגְדוֹת פִּתְחֵיהֶן לְבַעֲלֵיהֶן. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וּמָלְאוּ כַּמִּזְרָק כְּזָוִיֹּת מִזְבֵּחַ״, אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״מְזָוֵינוּ מְלֵאִים מְפִיקִים מִזַּן אֶל זַן״,
human_translation: “We whose sons are as plants” these are the young men of Israel who have not tasted the taste of sin. “Whose daughters are as corner pillars” these are the virgins of Israel, who bind their openings for their husbands. And similarly, It is stated: “And they shall be filled like the basins, like the corners of the altar” If you wish, say from here: “Our corners are full, affording all manner of store”
llm_translation: "‘As our sons are like saplings’ — these are the young men of Israel who have not tasted the taste of sin. ‘Our daughters are like corner pillars’ — these are the virgin daughters of Israel who adorn their entrances for their husbands. And so it says: ‘And they shall be like the sprinkling bowl, like corner pillars of an altar.’ If you wish, say from here: ‘Our corner pillars are full, providing from kind to kind.’"

hebrew_text: ״מְחֻטָּבוֹת תַּבְנִית הֵיכָל״ — אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ מַעֲלֶה עֲלֵיהֶן הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ נִבְנָה הֵיכָל בִּימֵיהֶן.
human_translation: “Carved after the fashion of a palace”; the verse ascribes to both these and those, as though the Sanctuary were built in their days.
llm_translation: "Mechutavot tabnit heichal" - These and these the Scripture considers as if the Temple was built in their days.

hebrew_text: ״דְּבַר ה׳ אֲשֶׁר הָיָה אֶל הוֹשֵׁעַ וְגוֹ׳ בִּימֵי עֻזִּיָּהוּ יוֹתָם אָחָז יְחִזְקִיָּה מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה״. בְּפֶרֶק אֶחָד נִתְנַבְּאוּ אַרְבָּעָה נְבִיאִים, וְגָדוֹל שֶׁבְּכוּלָּן הוֹשֵׁעַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תְּחִלַּת דִּבֶּר ה׳ בְּהוֹשֵׁעַ״. וְכִי בְּהוֹשֵׁעַ דִּבֵּר תְּחִלָּה? וַהֲלֹא מִמֹּשֶׁה עַד הוֹשֵׁעַ כַּמָּה נְבִיאִים! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תְּחִלָּה לְאַרְבָּעָה נְבִיאִים שֶׁנִּתְנַבְּאוּ בְּאוֹתוֹ הַפֶּרֶק, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: הוֹשֵׁעַ, יְשַׁעְיָה, עָמוֹס וּמִיכָה.
human_translation: “The word of the Lord that came unto Hosea, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judea, Four prophets prophesied in one era and the oldest of them was Hosea, as it is stated: “When the Lord spoke at first with Hosea” And with Hosea that spoke first Weren’t there several prophets from Moses until Hosea? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the first of the four prophets who prophesied during that period, and these are they: Hosea, Isaiah, Amos, and Micah.
llm_translation: "The word of the Lord that came to Hosea, etc., in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah." In the first chapter, four prophets prophesied, and the greatest among them was Hosea, as it is stated: "The word of the Lord that came to Hosea." Did the word first come to Hosea? But haven't many prophets spoken from Moses to Hosea? Rabbi Yochanan said: Initially to the four prophets who prophesied in that chapter, and they are: Hosea, Isaiah, Amos, and Micah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהוֹשֵׁעַ: בָּנֶיךָ חָטְאוּ. וְהָיָה לוֹ לוֹמַר: בָּנֶיךָ הֵם, בְּנֵי חֲנוּנֶיךָ הֵם, בְּנֵי אַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב, גַּלְגֵּל רַחֲמֶיךָ עֲלֵיהֶן. לֹא דַּיּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא אָמַר כָּךְ, אֶלָּא אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, כׇּל הָעוֹלָם שֶׁלְּךָ הוּא, הַעֲבִירֵם בְּאוּמָּה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Hosea: Your sons, have sinned. should have said they are Your sons; they are sons of Your beloved ones, sons of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Extend Your mercy over them. Not only did he fail to say that, but he said before Him: Master of the Universe, the entire world is Yours; exchange them for another nation.
llm_translation: He said to him the Holy One, blessed be He, to Hoshea: Your sons have sinned. And it should have been for Him to say: They are Your sons, the sons of Your compassionate ones, the sons of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, roll Your mercies upon them. It was not enough that He did not say so, but He said before Him: Master of the universe, the whole world is Yours, transfer them to another nation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לְזָקֵן זֶה? אוֹמַר לוֹ: לֵךְ וְקַח אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה וְהוֹלֵיד לְךָ בָּנִים זְנוּנִים, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אוֹמַר לוֹ שַׁלְּחָהּ מֵעַל פָּנֶיךָ. אִם הוּא יָכוֹל לִשְׁלוֹחַ — אַף אֲנִי אֲשַׁלַּח אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל הוֹשֵׁעַ לֵךְ קַח לְךָ אֵשֶׁת זְנוּנִים וְיַלְדֵי זְנוּנִים״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיִּקַּח אֶת גֹּמֶר בַּת דִּבְלָיִם״, ״גֹּמֶר״, אָמַר רַב: שֶׁהַכֹּל גּוֹמְרִים בָּהּ. ״בַּת
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: What shall I do to this Elder I will say to him: Go and take a prostitute and bear for yourself children of prostitution. And after that I will say to him: Send her away from before you. If he is able to send I will also send the Jewish people. as it is stated: “The Lord said to Hosea: Go, take for yourself a wife of prostitution and children of prostitution” And it is written: “So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim” “Gomer”; Rav said because everyone would finish [ gomerim ] with her. “The daughter of
llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, said: What shall I do with this elder? He says to him: Go and take this harlot as a wife and have children of harlotry, and afterwards say to her, "Depart from before me." If he is able to send her away, so too I will send away Israel. As it is stated: "And the Lord said to Hosea, Go, take for yourself a wife of harlotry and children of harlotry," and it is written: "So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim," "Gomer," Rav said: because everyone is finished with her. "Daughter"

hebrew_text: דִּבְלָיִם״, דִּבָּה רָעָה בַּת דִּבָּה רָעָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שֶׁמְּתוּקָה בְּפִי הַכֹּל כִּדְבֵלָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: שֶׁהַכֹּל דָּשִׁין בָּהּ כִּדְבֵלָה.
human_translation: Diblaim”; ill repute, daughter of ill repute. And Shmuel said: she was as sweet as a cake of pressed figs, Rabbi Yoḥanan, said that everyone would tread [ dashin ] upon her, like a cake of pressed figs.
llm_translation: "Diblayim," dibah ra'ah bat dibah ra'ah. U'Shmuel amar: shemtukah befi hakol kidibelah. Ve'Rabbi Yochanan amar: shehakol dashin bah kidibelah.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״גּוֹמֶר״, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: שֶׁבִּקְּשׁוּ לְגַמֵּר מָמוֹנָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּיָמֶיהָ, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בָּזְזוּ וְגָמְרוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי אִבְּדָם מֶלֶךְ אֲרָם וַיְשִׂמֵם כֶּעָפָר לָדֻשׁ״.
human_translation: Alternatively, Gomer, Rav Yehuda said: sought to finish the money of the Jewish people in her days. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They plundered and finished as it is stated: “For the king of Aram destroyed them and made them like the dust in threshing”
llm_translation: Another explanation: "Gomer," Rabbi Yehuda said: They sought to finish the wealth of Israel in her days, Rabbi Yochanan said: They plundered and finished, as it is said: "For the king of Aram has destroyed them and made them like the dust to be trampled upon."

hebrew_text: ״וַתַּהַר וַתֵּלֶד לוֹ בֵּן וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֵלָיו קְרָא שְׁמוֹ יִזְרְעֶאל כִּי עוֹד מְעַט וּפָקַדְתִּי אֶת דְּמֵי יִזְרְעֶאל עַל בֵּית יֵהוּא וְהִשְׁבַּתִּי מַמְלְכוּת בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל וַתַּהַר עוֹד וַתֵּלֶד בַּת וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ קְרָא שְׁמָהּ לֹא רֻחָמָה כִּי לֹא אוֹסִיף עוֹד אֲרַחֵם אֶת בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּי נָשֹׂא אֶשָּׂא לָהֶם וַתַּהַר וַתֵּלֶד בֵּן וַיֹּאמֶר (ה׳ אֵלָיו) קְרָא שְׁמוֹ לֹא עַמִּי כִּי אַתֶּם לֹא עַמִּי וְאָנֹכִי לֹא אֶהְיֶה לָכֶם״,
human_translation: “And she conceived, and bore him a son. And the Lord said to him: Call his name Jezreel; for soon I will visit the blood of Jezreel upon the house of Jehu, and will obliterate the kingdom of the house of Israel…And she conceived again, and bore a daughter. And He said to him: Call her name Lo-ruhamah, for I will no more have compassion upon the house of Israel that I should bear them…And she conceived, and bore a son. And He said: Call his name Lo-ammi; for you are not My people, and I will not be yours”
llm_translation: "And she conceived and bore him a son, and Hashem said to him, 'Call his name Yizre'el, for yet a little while, and I will avenge the blood of Yizre'el upon the house of Yehu, and will cause to cease the kingdom of the house of Israel. And she conceived again and bore a daughter, and He said to him, 'Call her name Lo-Ruchamah, for I will no more have compassion upon the house of Israel, that I should in any way pardon them. But I will have compassion upon the house of Yehudah, and will save them by Hashem their God, and will not save them by bow, nor by sword, nor by battle, nor by horses, nor by horsemen.' And she conceived and bore a son, and He said, 'Call his name Lo-Ammi, for you are not My people, and I will not be yours.'"

hebrew_text: לְאַחַר שֶׁנּוֹלְדוּ [לוֹ] שְׁנֵי בָנִים וּבַת אַחַת, אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהוֹשֵׁעַ: לֹא הָיָה לְךָ לִלְמוֹד מִמֹּשֶׁה רַבָּךְ? שֶׁכֵּיוָן שֶׁדִּבַּרְתִּי עִמּוֹ פֵּירַשׁ מִן הָאִשָּׁה, אַף אַתָּה בְּדוֹל עַצְמְךָ מִמֶּנָּה. אָמַר לוֹ: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם יֵשׁ לִי בָּנִים מִמֶּנָּה וְאֵין אֲנִי יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיאָהּ וְלֹא לְגָרְשָׁהּ.
human_translation: After two sons and one daughter had been born to him, the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Hosea: Shouldn’t you have learned from your master Moses, who, once I spoke with him, separated from wife? You too, separate yourself from He said to Him: Master of the Universe, I have sons from her and I am unable to dismiss her or to divorce her.
llm_translation: After he had two sons and one daughter, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Hoshea: Did you not learn from your teacher Moses? For as soon as I spoke with him, he separated from his wife. You too, separate yourself from her. He said to Him: Master of the Universe, I have children from her, and I cannot take her out nor divorce her.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: וּמָה אַתָּה שֶׁאִשְׁתְּךָ זוֹנָה וּבָנֶיךָ [בְּנֵי] זְנוּנִים, וְאֵין אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ אִם שֶׁלְּךָ הֵן אִם שֶׁל אֲחֵרִים הֵן — כָּךְ, יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהֵן בָּנַי, בְּנֵי בְּחוּנַי בְּנֵי אַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב, אֶחָד מֵאַרְבָּעָה קִנְיָנִין שֶׁקָּנִיתִי בְּעוֹלָמִי.
human_translation: the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to him: Just as you, whose wife is a prostitute and your children are children of prostitution, and you do not know if they are yours if they are of other so the Jewish people, who are My sons, the sons of My ordeals, the sons of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. one of the four acquisitions that I acquired in My world.
llm_translation: He said to him, the Holy One, blessed be He: And what about you, that your wife is a harlot and your children are the children of harlots, and you do not know whether they are yours or belong to others — so too, Israel, they are my children, the children of free men, the children of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, one of the four acquisitions that I acquired in my world.

hebrew_text: תּוֹרָה קִנְיָן אֶחָד, דִּכְתִיב: ״ה׳ קָנָנִי רֵאשִׁית דַּרְכּוֹ״. שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ קִנְיָן אֶחָד, דִּכְתִיב: ״קֹנֵה שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ״. בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קִנְיָן אֶחָד, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַר זֶה קָנְתָה יְמִינוֹ״. יִשְׂרָאֵל קִנְיָן אֶחָד דִּכְתִיב: ״עַם זוּ קָנִיתָ״ — וְאַתָּה אָמַרְתָּ הַעֲבִירֵם בְּאוּמָּה אַחֶרֶת!
human_translation: Torah is one acquisition, as it is written: “The Lord acquired me as the beginning of His way” Heaven and earth are one acquisition [ kinyan ], as it is written: Creator [ koneh ] of heaven and earth” The Holy Temple is one acquisition, as it is written: to this mountain, which His right hand had acquired” The Jewish people are one acquisition, as it is written: “The nation that You have acquired” And you, said replace them with another nation?
llm_translation: Torah is one acquisition, as it is written: "The Lord acquired me as the beginning of His way." Heaven and earth is one acquisition, as it is written: "He who acquires the heavens and the earth." The Temple is one acquisition, as it is written: "This mountain, God's right hand acquired." Israel is one acquisition, as it is written: "This people You have acquired." And you say, transfer them to another nation!

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּדַע שֶׁחָטָא, עָמַד לְבַקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל עַצְמוֹ. אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: עַד שֶׁאַתָּה מְבַקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל עַצְמְךָ — בַּקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁגָּזַרְתִּי עֲלֵיהֶם שָׁלֹשׁ גְּזֵירוֹת בַּעֲבוּרֶךָ.
human_translation: Once realized that he had sinned, he got up to request compassion upon him The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to him: Before you request compassion upon yourself, request compassion upon the Jewish people, since I have decreed upon them three decrees on your account,
llm_translation: Once he knew that he had sinned, he stood to seek mercy for himself. The Holy One, blessed be He, said to him: Until you seek mercy for yourself - seek mercy for Israel, for I have decreed three decrees upon them for your sake.

hebrew_text: עָמַד וּבִקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים וּבִטֵּל גְּזֵירָה, וְהִתְחִיל לְבָרְכָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה מִסְפַּר בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּחוֹל הַיָּם וְגוֹ׳ וְהָיָה בִּמְקוֹם אֲשֶׁר יֵאָמֵר לָהֶם לֹא עַמִּי אַתֶּם יֵאָמֵר לָהֶם בְּנֵי אֵל חָי וְנִקְבְּצוּ בְּנֵי יְהוּדָה וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יַחְדָּו וְגוֹ׳ וּזְרַעְתִּיהָ לִּי בָּאָרֶץ וְרִחַמְתִּי אֶת לֹא רֻחָמָה וְאָמַרְתִּי לְלֹא עַמִּי עַמִּי אַתָּה״.
human_translation: stood and requested compassion and nullified decree. and began to bless them, as it is stated: “Yet the number of the children of Israel shall be as the sand of the sea, And it will be that instead of that which was said to them: You are not My people, it shall be said to them: You are the children of the living God. And the children of Judea and the children of Israel shall be gathered together” And I will sow her to Me in the land; and I will have compassion upon her that had not received compassion; and I will say to them that were not My people: You are My people”
llm_translation: He stood and sought mercy and annulled the decree, and began to bless them, as it is said: "And the number of the children of Israel shall be as the sand of the sea, etc." "And it shall be in the place where it was said to them, 'You are not My people,' it shall be said to them, 'Children of the living God.' And the children of Judah and the children of Israel shall be gathered together, etc." "And I will sow her for Myself in the land, and I will have compassion on 'Not My Compassion,' and I will say to 'Not My People,' 'You are My People.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אוֹי לָהּ לָרַבָּנוּת שֶׁמְּקַבֶּרֶת אֶת בְּעָלֶיהָ. שֶׁאֵין לָךְ כׇּל נָבִיא וְנָבִיא שֶׁלֹּא קִיפֵּחַ אַרְבָּעָה מְלָכִים בְּיָמָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֲזוֹן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן אָמוֹץ אֲשֶׁר חָזָה עַל יְהוּדָה וִירוּשָׁלַיִם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Woe to authority, which buries its holders. that you don’t have any prophet who did not outlast four kings in his lifetime, as it is stated “The vision of Isaiah, the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judea and Jerusalem
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Woe to the dominion that buries its masters. For you have no prophet, no prophet who did not rebuke four kings in his days, as it is stated: "The vision of Isaiah son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִפְּנֵי מָה זָכָה יָרׇבְעָם בֶּן יוֹאָשׁ מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְהִמָּנוֹת עִם מַלְכֵי יְהוּדָה? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא קִבֵּל לָשׁוֹן הָרַע עַל עָמוֹס.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Due to what Jeroboam, son of Joash, king of Israel, privileged to be counted with the kings of Judea? due to that he did not accept slander about Amos.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: For what reason did Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel, merit to form an alliance with the kings of Judah? Because he did not accept lashon hara (evil speech) about Amos.

hebrew_text: מְנָלַן דְּאִימְּנִי? דִּכְתִיב: ״דְּבַר ה׳ אֲשֶׁר הָיָה אֶל הוֹשֵׁעַ בֶּן בְּאֵרִי בִּימֵי עֻזִּיָּה יוֹתָם אָחָז יְחִזְקִיָּה מַלְכֵי יְהוּדָה וּבִימֵי יָרׇבְעָם בֶּן יוֹאָשׁ מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: From where do we that he was counted As it is written: “The word of the Lord that came to Hosea, son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judea, and in the days of Jeroboam, the son of Joash, king of Israel”
llm_translation: From where do we derive this? As it is written: "The word of the Lord that came to Hosea son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam son of Joash, king of Israel."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּלֹא קִיבֵּל לָשׁוֹן הָרָע? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁלַח אֲמַצְיָה כֹּהֵן בֵּית אֵל אֶל יָרׇבְעָם מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל לֵאמֹר קָשַׁר עָלֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי כֹה אָמַר עָמוֹס בַּחֶרֶב יָמוּת יָרׇבְעָם וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר: חַס וְשָׁלוֹם אָמַר אוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק כָּךְ, וְאִם אָמַר — מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לוֹ? שְׁכִינָה אָמְרָה לוֹ.
human_translation: And from where do we that he did not accept slander? As it is written: “Then Amaziah the priest of Beth-El sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying: Amos has conspired against you And it is written: “For thus said Amos: Jeroboam shall die by the sword said: Heaven forfend that righteous person, said this, and if he said what shall I do to him The Divine Presence said it to him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we know that he did not accept lashon hara (evil speech)? As it is written: "And Amatzyah, the priest of Bethel, sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, 'A conspiracy is against you, etc.'" And it is written: "For thus says Amos, 'By the sword shall Jeroboam die, etc.'" He said: "May it be well, he said that righteous one thus. And if he said - what shall I do to him? The Divine Presence said to him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת כַּעְסוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא זוֹכֵר אֶת הָרַחֲמִים. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֹא אוֹסִיף עוֹד אֲרַחֵם אֶת בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״כִּי נָשֹׂא אֶשָּׂא לָהֶם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Even at time of anger of the Holy One, Blessed be He, He remembers the compassion, as it is stated: “For I will no more have compassion upon the house of Israel” Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Ḥanina said from here, “That I should bear them,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Even at the moment of the anger of the Holy One, blessed be He, He remembers mercy. As it is stated: "For I will not continue to have mercy on the house of Israel." Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said from here: "For I will lift up and bear their burden."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא הִגְלָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְבֵין הָאוּמּוֹת אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתּוֹסְפוּ עֲלֵיהֶם גֵּרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּזְרַעְתִּיהָ לִי בָּאָרֶץ״. כְּלוּם אָדָם זוֹרֵעַ סְאָה אֶלָּא לְהַכְנִיס כַּמָּה כּוֹרִין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, exiled Israel among the nations only so that converts would join them, as it is stated: “And I will sow her to Me in the land” Does a person sow a se’a than to bring in several kor
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, blessed be He, did not exile Israel among the nations except so that converts would join them, as it is stated: "And I will sow her for Myself in the land." Just as a person sows a se'ah and brings in many korin.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְרִחַמְתִּי אֶת לֹא רֻחָמָה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said from here: “And I will have compassion upon her that had not received compassion;
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said from here: "And I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אַל תַּלְשֵׁן עֶבֶד אֶל אֲדוֹנָיו פֶּן יְקַלֶּלְךָ וְאָשָׁמְתָּ״, וּכְתִיב: ״דּוֹר אָבִיו יְקַלֵּל וְאֶת אִמּוֹ לֹא יְבָרֵךְ״, מִשּׁוּם דְּאָבִיו יְקַלֵּל וְאֶת אִמּוֹ לֹא יְבָרֵךְ — אַל תַּלְשֵׁן?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: What is that which is written: “Slander not a servant to his master, lest he curse you, and you be found guilty” and it is written “There is a generation that curses its father, and does not bless its mother” because they curse their father and do not bless their mother you should not slander
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, what is the meaning of what is written: "Do not despise a servant to his master, lest he curse you, and you be found guilty"? And it is written: "He who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death" (Exodus 21:17). Since his father curses and his mother he does not bless - do not despise?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אֲפִילּוּ דּוֹר שֶׁאָבִיו יְקַלֵּל וְאֶת אִמּוֹ לֹא יְבָרֵךְ — אַל תַּלְשֵׁן עֶבֶד אֶל אֲדוֹנָיו. מְנָלַן — מֵהוֹשֵׁעַ.
human_translation: Rather, even generation that curses its father and does not bless its mother, one should not slander a servant to his master. From where do we From Hosea,
llm_translation: Rather, even a generation whose father curses and his mother he does not bless - do not despise a servant towards his master. From where? - from Hosea.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״צִדְקַת פִּרְזוֹנוֹ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״, צְדָקָה עָשָׂה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁפִּזְּרָן לְבֵין הָאוּמּוֹת. וְהַיְינוּ דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֲנַן מְעַלִּינַן מִינַּיְיכוּ, כְּתִיב בְּכוּ: ״כִּי שֵׁשֶׁת חֳדָשִׁים יָשַׁב שָׁם וְגוֹ׳״, וְאִלּוּ אֲנַן אִיתִינְכוּ גַּבַּן כַּמָּה שְׁנֵי וְלָא קָא עָבְדִינַן לְכוּ מִידֵּי. אָמַר לוֹ: רְצוֹנְךָ יִטָּפֵל לָךְ תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: What is which is written: “The righteous acts of His rulers [ pirzono ] in Israel” The Holy One, Blessed be He, performed a charitable deed toward Israel that He scattered them [ pizran ] among the nations; And this is that which a certain apostate said to Rabbi Ḥanina: We are superior to you It is written of you: “For remained there six months whereas we, you have been with us for several years, are not doing anything to you. He said to him: your consent, let one student deal with your
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said, "What is the meaning of the verse: 'The righteousness of Peirazon is in Israel'? The Holy One, blessed be He, performed righteousness for Israel by scattering them among the nations. This is what that heretic said to Rabbi Chanina: 'We surpass you in merit, as it is written: 'For six months he dwelt there,' and if we had been there for how many years, we would not have needed you immediately.' He said to him: 'Your desire should be that you have one student.'"

hebrew_text: נִטְפַּל לֵיהּ רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא יָדְעִיתוּ הֵיכִי תַּעְבְּדוּ, תְּכַלִּינַן כּוּלְּהוּ — לֵיתַנְהוּ גַּבַּיְיכוּ. מַאי דְּאִיכָּא גַּבַּיְיכוּ, קָרֵי לְכוּ מַלְכוּתָא קְטִיעֲתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּפָּא דְרוֹמָאֵי! בְּהָא נָחֲתִינַן וּבְהָא סָלְקִינַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya dealt with his said to him: because you do not know how to do to destroy all of they are not with you those who are with you you will be called a severed kingdom said to him: Gappa, of the Romans, with this we lie down and with this we rise up,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rabbi Oshaya interjected to him, saying: Because you did not know how to act, you have caused them all to be delayed — bring them to your heels. What is meant by 'bring them to your heels'? — It is like the cutting off of a kingdom. He said to him: The pride of the Romans! With this we descend and with this we ascend."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אֱלֹהִים הֵבִין דַּרְכָּהּ וְהוּא יָדַע אֶת מְקוֹמָהּ״, יוֹדֵעַ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאֵינָן יְכוֹלִין לְקַבֵּל גְּזֵירוֹת שֶׁל רוֹמִיִּים, לְפִיכָךְ הִגְלָה אוֹתָם לְבָבֶל. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא הִגְלָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְבָבֶל אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעֲמוּקָּה כִּשְׁאוֹל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִיַּד שְׁאוֹל אֶפְדֵּם מִמָּוֶת אֶגְאָלֵם״. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקָּרוֹב לְשׁוֹנָם לִלְשׁוֹן תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: What is which is written: “God understands its ways and He knows its place” The Holy One, Blessed be He, knows the Jewish people, who are unable to withstand the decrees of the Romans. Therefore, He exiled them to Babylonia, And Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, exiled Israel to Babylonia only due to it is as deep as the netherworld, which is stated: “I shall ransom them from the power of the netherworld, I shall redeem them from death” Rabbi Ḥanina said: It is due to that their language, is similar to the language of the Torah,
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya: What is the meaning of the verse, "God understood her way, and He knew her place"? The Holy One, blessed be He, knows that the Israelites are unable to accept the decrees of the Romans, therefore He exiled them to Babylon. And Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, blessed be He, did not exile Israel to Babylon except because it is as deep as Sheol, as it is stated: "From the hand of Sheol I will redeem them, from death I will ransom them." Rabbi Chanina said: Because their language is close to the language of the Torah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשִּׁיגְּרָן לְבֵית אִמָּן. מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁכָּעַס עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ, לְהֵיכָן מְשַׁגְּרָהּ — לְבֵית אִמָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is due to that He sent them to their mother’s house, comparable to a man who is angry at his wife; to where does he send her? to her mother’s house.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Because he angered his mother-in-law. A parable for a man who is angry with his wife, where should he send her? To her mother's house.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּרַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי, דְּאָמַר: שְׁלֹשָׁה חָזְרוּ לְמַטָּעָתָן, אֵלּוּ הֵן: יִשְׂרָאֵל, כֶּסֶף מִצְרַיִם, וּכְתַב לוּחוֹת. יִשְׂרָאֵל — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. כֶּסֶף מִצְרַיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בַּשָּׁנָה הַחֲמִישִׁית לַמֶּלֶךְ רְחַבְעָם עָלָה שִׁישַׁק מֶלֶךְ מִצְרַיִם עַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם וְגוֹ׳״. כְּתַב הַלּוּחוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וָאֲשַׁבְּרֵם לְעֵינֵיכֶם״, תָּנָא: לוּחוֹת נִשְׁבְּרוּ וְאוֹתִיּוֹת פּוֹרְחוֹת.
human_translation: And this is Rabbi Alexandri, who said: three returned to their origin, these are they: The Jewish people, the money of Egypt, and the writing Tablets The Jewish people; that which we said, The money of Egypt; as it is written: “And it came to pass in the fifth year of King Rehoboam, that Shishak, king of Egypt, came up against Jerusalem; The writing on the Tablets as it is written: and broke them before your eyes” it was taught The tablets were broken and the letters are flying
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this is what Rabbi Alexandri said: Three things returned to their place of origin, these are: Israel, silver of Egypt, and the tablets. Israel - this is what we said. Silver of Egypt, as it is written: "And it came to pass in the fifth year of King Rehoboam, Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, etc." The tablets, as it is written: "And I broke them before your eyes." It was taught: The tablets were broken and the letters flew off. English translation:

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיֹּאכְלוּ
human_translation: Ulla said in order to eat
llm_translation: Ulai said: "In order that they may eat."

hebrew_text: תְּמָרִים וְיַעַסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה. עוּלָּא אִיקְּלַע לְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא, קָרִיבוּ לֵיהּ טִירְיָנָא דְתַמְרֵי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: כַּמָּה כִּי הָנֵי בְּזוּזָא? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: תְּלָת בְּזוּזָא. אֲמַר: מְלָא צַנָּא דְּדוּבְשָׁא בְּזוּזָא, וּבַבְלָאֵי לָא עָסְקִי בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: dates and engage in Torah Ulla visited Pumbedita, brought him a basket [ tirina ] of dates. He said to them: How many like these for a zuz ? They said to him: three for a zuz . He said: a basketful of honey for zuz , and the Babylonians do not engage in Torah
llm_translation: Dates and engage in Torah study. Ulla happened to come to Pumbedita, they brought him a basket of dates. He said to them: How much are these in Zuz? They said to him: Three in Zuz. He said: Fill a jar of honey with Zuz, and do not engage in Torah study on an empty stomach.

hebrew_text: בְּלֵילְיָא צַעֲרוּהוּ. אָמַר: מְלָא צַנָּא סַמָּא דְמוֹתָא בְּזוּזָא בְּבָבֶל, וּבַבְלָאֵי עָסְקִי בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: That night, afflicted him said: A basketful of lethal poison, for a zuz in Babylonia, and the Babylonians engage in Torah
llm_translation: In the nights, they troubled him. He said: Fill a dish with sand of the sea in Babylon, and Babylonians engaged in Torah.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָלְכוּ עַמִּים רַבִּים וְאָמְרוּ לְכוּ וְנַעֲלֶה אֶל הַר ה׳ אֶל בֵּית אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב וְגוֹ׳״. אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב, וְלֹא אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם וְיִצְחָק?
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: What is which is written: “And many peoples shall go and say: Go and let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the house of the God of Jacob; He the God of Jacob and not the God of Abraham and Isaac?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said, what is the meaning of what is written: "And many peoples shall go and say: 'Come, let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the house of the God of Jacob...'" (Isaiah 2:3). The God of Jacob, and not the God of Abraham and Isaac?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לֹא כְּאַבְרָהָם שֶׁכָּתוּב בּוֹ ״הַר״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר יֵאָמֵר הַיּוֹם בְּהַר ה׳ יֵרָאֶה״, וְלֹא כְּיִצְחָק שֶׁכָּתוּב בּוֹ ״שָׂדֶה״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֵּצֵא יִצְחָק לָשׂוּחַ בַּשָּׂדֶה״, אֶלָּא כְּיַעֲקֹב שֶׁקְּרָאוֹ ״בַּיִת״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אֶת שֵׁם הַמָּקוֹם הַהוּא בֵּית אֵל״.
human_translation: Rather, not as Abraham. It is written of him mount, as it is stated: “As it is said on this day: On the mount where the Lord is seen” And not as Isaac. It is written of him field as it is stated: “And Isaac went out to meditate in the field” Rather, as Jacob, who called it house, as it is stated: “And he called the name of that place Beth-El”
llm_translation: Rather, not like Abraham in whom "mountain" is written, as it says: "What will be said today on the mountain of the Lord, He will be seen," and not like Isaac in whom "field" is written, as it says: "And Isaac went out to meditate in the field," but like Jacob who called it "house," as it says: "And he called the name of that place Bethel."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גָּדוֹל קִבּוּץ גָּלִיּוֹת כַּיּוֹם שֶׁנִּבְרְאוּ בּוֹ שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִקְבְּצוּ בְּנֵי יְהוּדָה וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יַחְדָּו וְשָׂמוּ לָהֶם רֹאשׁ אֶחָד וְעָלוּ מִן הָאָרֶץ כִּי גָדוֹל יוֹם יִזְרְעֶאל״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי עֶרֶב וַיְהִי בֹקֶר יוֹם אֶחָד״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: ingathering of exiles is as great as the day on which heaven and earth were created. as it is stated “And the children of Judea and the children of Israel shall be gathered together, and they shall appoint themselves one head, and shall go up out of the land; for great shall be the day of Jezreel” and it is written “And there was evening and there was morning, one day”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Great is the gathering of the exiles like the day on which the heavens and the earth were created, as it is stated: "And the sons of Judah and the sons of Israel shall be gathered together, and they shall appoint for themselves one head, and they shall go up from the land, for great is the day of Jezreel." And it is written: "And there was evening and there was morning, one day."

hebrew_text: יָתוֹם שֶׁשָּׁחֲטוּ עָלָיו אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּסִין וְכוּ׳. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: ״שֶׂה לַבָּיִת״ — מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: an orphan guardians slaughtered on his behalf, eat in place he wishes. You can learn from it there is retroactive clarification, Rabbi Zeira said: a lamb for a household” in any case,
llm_translation: Orphan that slaughtered upon him, they exempt him and so forth. You heard from it there is choice. Rabbi Zeira said: "A sheep for the house" - from every place.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״שֶׂה לַבָּיִת״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאָדָם מֵבִיא וְשׁוֹחֵט עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים וְעַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַכְּנַעֲנִים, בֵּין מִדַּעְתָּן בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּן. אֲבָל אֵינוֹ שׁוֹחֵט עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים וְעַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הָעִבְרִים וְעַל יַד אִשְׁתּוֹ, אֶלָּא מִדַּעְתָּן.
human_translation: The Sages taught A lamb for a household teaches that a person brings and slaughters on behalf of his minor son and daughter and on behalf of his Canaanite slave and maidservant, whether with their consent or without their consent. However, one may not slaughter on behalf of his adult son or daughter, or on behalf of his Hebrew slave and maidservant, or on behalf of his wife unless their consent.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "A sheep for the household" - teaches that a person brings and slaughters by the hands of his young son and daughter, and by the hands of his Canaanite male and female slaves, whether with their knowledge or without their knowledge. But he does not slaughter by the hands of his adult son and daughter, and by the hands of his Hebrew male and female slaves, and by the hand of his wife, except with their knowledge.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט אָדָם לֹא עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים וְעַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הָעִבְרִים וְעַל יַד אִשְׁתּוֹ, אֶלָּא מִדַּעְתָּן. אֲבָל שׁוֹחֵט הוּא עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים וְעַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַכְּנַעֲנִים, בֵּין מִדַּעְתָּן וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּן, וְכוּלָּן שֶׁשָּׁחֲטוּ וְשָׁחַט רַבָּן עֲלֵיהֶן — יוֹצְאִין בְּשֶׁל רַבָּן, וְאֵין יוֹצְאִין בְּשֶׁל עַצְמָן,
human_translation: It was taught another A person may not slaughter on behalf of his adult son or daughter, or on behalf of his Hebrew slave and maidservant, or on behalf of his wife unless their consent. However, he may slaughter on behalf of his son or daughter who are minors, or on behalf of his Canaanite slave or maidservant, both with their consent or without their consent. And any of them who slaughtered and their master, slaughtered on their behalf, they fulfill with of their master, and they do not fulfill with their own.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The following was also taught: A person should not slaughter, neither by the hands of his adult son or daughter, nor by the hands of his male or female slave, whether they are Hebrews or by the hands of his wife, except with their knowledge. However, if he slaughtered by the hands of his minor son or daughter, or by the hands of his male or female Canaanite slave, whether with their knowledge or without their knowledge, and all of them slaughtered and the Rabbi subsequently slaughtered on them - they fulfill their obligation through the slaughter of the Rabbi, but they do not fulfill their obligation through their own slaughter.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִן הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה לְמַחוֹת.
human_translation: except the wife, who is able to protest
llm_translation: Outside of the woman that is able to erase.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא אִשָּׁה? אָמַר רָבָא: אִשָּׁה וְכׇל דְּדָמֵי לַהּ.
human_translation: What is different a wife; Rava said: a wife and all who are similar to her,
llm_translation: What is the difference with a woman? Rava said: A woman and all that belongs to her.

hebrew_text: הָא גּוּפָא קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ: חוּץ מִן הָאִשָּׁה — שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה לְמַחוֹת. טַעְמָא דְּמַחַי, הָא לָא מַחַי — נָפְקָא בְּשֶׁל בַּעְלָהּ, וְהָא קָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא: ״וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ אֶלָּא מִדַּעְתָּן״, הָא סְתָמָא לָא נָפְקָא!
human_translation: this matter itself is difficult. You said Except for a wife, who is able to protest. the reason is that she protests, she does not protest, she fulfill with her husband’s But doesn’t the first clause teach his wife only with their consent, indeterminate she does not fulfill
llm_translation: The body difficult, said: except from the woman - that she can erase. Reason of living, this not living - comes out from her husband, and this teaches at the beginning: "and not by the hand of his wife, but from their knowledge," this is not explicitly stated!

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֶלָּא מִדַּעְתָּן״ — לָאו דְּאָמְרִי אִין, אֶלָּא בִּסְתָמָא, לְאַפּוֹקֵי הֵיכָא דַּאֲמוּר לָא.
human_translation: What only with their consent? It is not where they said yes, rather, an indeterminate case to exclude where they said no,
llm_translation: "What is 'rather from your knowledge' - not that they say 'no,' but rather in general, to go out to where it is said 'no.'"

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״כּוּלָּם שֶׁשָּׁחֲטוּ וְשָׁחַט רַבָּן עֲלֵיהֶן — יוֹצְאִין בְּשֶׁל רַבָּן״ דְּבִסְתָמָא, וְקָתָנֵי: חוּץ מִן הָאִשָּׁה — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה לְמַחוֹת!
human_translation: But wasn’t Any of them, who slaughtered and their master slaughtered on their behalf, fulfills with of their master, which is indeterminate and teaches: except for the wife, because she is able to protest,
llm_translation: "And this, 'All of them that slaughtered, and Rabban slaughtered on them - they fulfill the obligation through Rabban,' is in the case of a doubt, and it is taught: 'Except for the woman - because she is able to extinguish!'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁשָּׁחֲטוּ אֵין לְךָ מִיחוּי גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה.
human_translation: Rava said: Since they slaughtered you do not have a protest greater than this.
llm_translation: Rava said: Once they slaughtered, you have no greater significance than this.

hebrew_text: עֶבֶד שֶׁל שְׁנֵי שׁוּתָּפִין וְכוּ׳. רָמֵי לֵיהּ רַב עֵינָא סָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: תְּנַן, עֶבֶד שֶׁל שְׁנֵי שׁוּתָּפִין לֹא יֹאכַל מִשֶּׁל שְׁנֵיהֶן. וְהָתַנְיָא: רָצָה — מִזֶּה אוֹכֵל, רָצָה — מִזֶּה אוֹכֵל!
human_translation: A slave by two partners Rav Eina the Elder raised a contradiction before Rav Naḥman. We learned A slave by two partners But wasn’t it taught he wanted he eat from this he wanted he eat from that
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A slave of two partners, etc. Rav Einah Saba raised an objection to Rav Nachman: We learned: A slave of two partners may not eat from the property of both of them. And it was taught: If he wishes - he may eat from this one, if he wishes - he may eat from that one!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֵינָא סָבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: פַּתְיָא אוּכָּמָא, מִינִּי וּמִינָּךְ תִּסְתַּיֵּים שְׁמַעְתְּתָא. מַתְנִיתִין — בִּדְקָפְדִי אַהֲדָדֵי, בָּרַיְיתָא — דְּלָא קָפְדִי אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: said to him: Eina the Elder, and some say black pot [ patya ], From me and from you, halakha will be concluded. The mishna are exacting with each other. The baraita they are not exacting with each other.
llm_translation: He said to him: "An old wine, and they said to him: 'coarse bread and salted fish,' from me and from you will be satisfied, you have heard. Mishnah - in the case of two who are particular with each other, Baraita - when they are not particular with each other."

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין לֹא יֹאכַל מִשֶּׁל רַבּוֹ וְכוּ׳. מִשֶּׁל רַבּוֹ הוּא דְּלֹא יֹאכַל, אֲבָל מִשֶּׁל עַצְמוֹ — יֹאכַל. וְהָא תַּנְיָא: לֹא יֹאכַל לֹא מִשֶּׁלּוֹ וְלֹא מִשֶּׁל רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: One who is half slave and half free man may not eat from his master’s from his master’s he may not eat; however, from his own he may eat. But wasn’t it taught may eat neither from his own nor from his master’s
llm_translation: One whose half is a slave and half is a free man may not eat from his master's food, etc. It is his master's food that he may not eat, but he may eat from his own food. And it was taught: He may not eat neither from his own food nor from his master's food.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — כְּמִשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, כָּאן — כְּמִשְׁנָה אַחֲרוֹנָה. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין — עוֹבֵד אֶת רַבּוֹ יוֹם אֶחָד וְאֶת עַצְמוֹ יוֹם אֶחָד, דִּבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים:
human_translation: not difficult: Here, is in accordance with the original mishna, There, is in accordance with the ultimate mishna, As we learned One who is half slave and half free man serves his master one day and himself one day; the statement of Beit Hillel. Beit Shammai say:
llm_translation: The difficulty is not difficult: here - like the first Mishnah, here - like the last Mishnah. As we learned: One whose half is a slave and half is free - he serves his master one day and himself one day, the words of Beit Hillel. Beit Shammai say:

hebrew_text: תִּקַּנְתֶּם אֶת רַבּוֹ, וְאֶת עַצְמוֹ לֹא תִּקַּנְתֶּם. לִישָּׂא שִׁפְחָה אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל — שֶׁכְּבָר חֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין, לִישָּׂא בַּת חוֹרִין אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל — שֶׁעֲדַיִין חֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד. יִבְטַל, וַהֲלֹא לֹא נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם אֶלָּא לִפְרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תֹהוּ בְרָאָהּ (אֶלָּא) לָשֶׁבֶת יְצָרָהּ״. אֶלָּא, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם כּוֹפִין אֶת רַבּוֹ וְעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין, וְכוֹתֵב שְׁטָר עַל חֲצִי דָמָיו.
human_translation: You have remedied his master, his own you have not remedied. He is not able to marry a maidservant, since half of him is already free, He not able to marry a free woman, since half of him is still a slave, he should be idle but is it not the world was created only for procreation, as it is stated: “He did not create it to be a waste; He formed it to be inhabited” Rather, for the improvement of the world we force his master to make him a free man, and writes a bill half his value
llm_translation: You have established his master, but you have not established himself. If a slave wishes to marry a maidservant, he cannot—because he is already half free. If a free man wishes to marry a maidservant, he cannot—because he is still half a slave. He should abstain, but was not the world created only for procreation, as it is said: "He did not create it a waste, He formed it to be inhabited"? Rather, for the betterment of the world, they compel his master to make him a free man, and he writes a document for half of his value.

hebrew_text: וְחָזְרוּ בֵּית הִילֵּל לְהוֹרוֹת כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel retracted and ruled like Beit Shammai.
llm_translation: And they returned, Beit Hillel, to teach like Beit Shammai.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר לְעַבְדּוֹ צֵא וּשְׁחוֹט עָלַי אֶת הַפֶּסַח, שָׁחַט גְּדִי — יֹאכַל, שָׁחַט טָלֶה — יֹאכַל, שָׁחַט גְּדִי וְטָלֶה — יֹאכַל מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: one who says to his slave: Go and slaughter the Paschal offering on my behalf, slaughtered a kid, may eat he slaughtered a lamb, may eat slaughtered a kid and a lamb, should eat from the first one
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says to his servant, "Go out and slaughter the Paschal lamb for me," and he slaughtered a kid - he may eat it; if he slaughtered a lamb - he may eat it; if he slaughtered both a kid and a lamb - he may eat from the first.

hebrew_text: שָׁכַח מָה אָמַר לוֹ רַבּוֹ, כֵּיצַד יַעֲשֶׂה? יִשְׁחַט טָלֶה וּגְדִי, וְיֹאמַר: אִם גְּדִי אֲמַר לִי רַבִּי — גְּדִי שֶׁלּוֹ וְטָלֶה שֶׁלִּי, וְאִם טָלֶה אֲמַר לִי רַבִּי — הַטָּלֶה שֶׁלּוֹ וּגְדִי שֶׁלִּי.
human_translation: forgot what his master said to him, what should he do? He should slaughter a lamb and a kid and say If my master said to me a kid, the kid is his and the lamb is mine; and if my master said to me a lamb, the lamb is his and the kid is mine.
llm_translation: He forgot what his teacher told him, how should he act? He should slaughter a lamb and a kid, and say: "If my teacher said 'kid' to me - his kid and my lamb, and if he said 'lamb' to me - his lamb and my kid."

hebrew_text: שָׁכַח רַבּוֹ מָה אָמַר לוֹ, שְׁנֵיהֶן יֵצְאוּ לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה, וּפְטוּרִין מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: his master forgot what he said to him, both of them, go out to the place for burning, exempt from observing the second Pesaḥ
llm_translation: The master forgot what he said to him, both of them went out to the house of burning, and they are exempt from performing the second Passover.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא! שָׁחַט גְּדִי — יֹאכַל, אַף עַל גַּב דִּרְגִיל בְּטָלֶה. שָׁחַט טָלֶה — יֹאכַל, אַף עַל גַּב דִּרְגִיל בִּגְדִי.
human_translation: obvious. slaughtered a kid. may eat even though is accustomed to a lamb. slaughtered a lamb, may eat although he is accustomed to a kid
llm_translation: Gemara: It is obvious! If one slaughters a goat - it may be eaten, even though it is accustomed to be nullified. If one slaughters a lamb - it may be eaten, even though it is accustomed to be nullified with a goat.

hebrew_text: שָׁחַט גְּדִי וְטָלֶה — יֹאכַל מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן. וְהָא תַנְיָא: אֵין נִמְנִין עַל שְׁנֵי פְסָחִים כְּאֶחָד!
human_translation: slaughtered a kid and a lamb, should eat from the first one Wasn’t it taught: One may not be registered for two Paschal offerings at once?
llm_translation: He slaughtered a goat and a lamb - he shall eat from the first. But isn't it taught: We do not count for two Passovers as one!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין בְּמֶלֶךְ וּמַלְכָּה.
human_translation: The mishna of a king and queen
llm_translation: Mishnah: Matnitin b'melech u'malka.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין נִמְנִין עַל שְׁנֵי פְסָחִים כְּאֶחָד, וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּמֶלֶךְ וּמַלְכָּה שֶׁאָמְרוּ לְעַבְדֵיהֶם: צְאוּ וְשַׁחֲטוּ עָלֵינוּ אֶת הַפֶּסַח, וְיָצְאוּ וְשָׁחֲטוּ עֲלֵיהֶן שְׁנֵי פְסָחִים. בָּאוּ וְשָׁאֲלוּ אֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ, אָמַר לָהֶם: לְכוּ וְשַׁאֲלוּ אֶת הַמַּלְכָּה. בָּאוּ וְשָׁאֲלוּ מִן הַמַּלְכָּה, אָמְרָה לָהֶם: לְכוּ וְשַׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: And it was taught One may not register for two Paschal offerings at once. And there was an incident involving a king and queen who said to their slaves: Go and slaughter the Paschal offering on our behalf. And they went out and slaughtered two Paschal offerings on their behalf. They came and asked the king He said to them: Go and ask the queen. They came and asked the queen. She said to them: Go and ask Rabban Gamliel
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: One does not count two Paschal lambs as one. And there was an incident with a king and queen who said to their servants: Go and slaughter the Paschal lamb for us, and they went and slaughtered two Paschal lambs for them. They came and asked the king, he said to them: Go and ask the queen. They came and asked the queen, she said to them: Go and ask Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: בָּאוּ וְשָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אָמַר לָהֶם: מַלְכָּה וּמֶלֶךְ דְּדַעְתָּן קַלָּה עֲלֵיהֶן — יֹאכְלוּ מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן. אֲנַן לֹא נֹאכַל לֹא מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא מִן הַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: They came and asked Rabban Gamliel. He said to them: A king and queen, who are easily accepting should eat from the first one we, would not eat from the first or from the second,
llm_translation: They came and asked Rabban Gamliel, he said to them: "A king and queen whose knowledge is light upon them - they may eat from the first. We do not eat neither from the first nor from the second."

hebrew_text: וְשׁוּב פַּעַם אַחַת נִמְצֵאת הַלְטָאָה בְּבֵית הַמִּטְבָּחַיִם וּבִקְּשׁוּ לְטַמֵּא כָּל הַסְּעוּדָה כּוּלָּהּ. בָּאוּ וְשָׁאֲלוּ אֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ, אָמַר לָהֶם: לְכוּ וְשַׁאֲלוּ אֶת הַמַּלְכָּה. בָּאוּ וְשָׁאֲלוּ אֶת הַמַּלְכָּה, אָמְרָה לָהֶם: לְכוּ וְשַׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: And another time lizard was found in the kitchen they wanted to pronounce the entire meal ritually impure. They came and asked the king. He said to them: Go and ask the queen. They came and asked the queen. She said to them: Go and ask Rabban Gamliel
llm_translation: And again, once a lat'ah was found in the slaughterhouse, and they sought to render the entire meal impure. They came and asked the king, he said to them: Go and ask the queen. They came and asked the queen, she said to them: Go and ask Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: בָּאוּ וְשָׁאֲלוּ אוֹתוֹ, אָמַר לָהֶם: בֵּית הַמִּטְבָּחַיִם רוֹתֵחַ אוֹ צוֹנֵן? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: רוֹתֵחַ. אָמַר לָהֶם: לְכוּ וְהָטִילוּ עָלֶיהָ כּוֹס שֶׁל צוֹנֵן. הָלְכוּ וְהֵטִילוּ עָלֶיהָ כּוֹס שֶׁל צוֹנֵן וְרִיחֲשָׁה, וְטִהֵר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל כׇּל הַסְּעוּדָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: They came and asked him, he said to them: Is the kitchen boiling or cold? They said to him: boiling. He said to them: Go and pour a cup of cold upon They went and poured a cup of cold on it and it quivered, Rabban Gamliel pronounced the entire meal to be ritually pure,
llm_translation: They came and asked him, he said to them: Does the slaughterhouse boil or cool? They said to him: It boils. He said to them: Go and place upon it a cup of cold water. They went and placed a cup of cold water upon it, and Rabban Gamliel's entire meal was purified.

hebrew_text: נִמְצָא מֶלֶךְ תָּלוּי בַּמַּלְכָּה, וְנִמְצֵאתָ מַלְכָּה תְּלוּיָה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, נִמְצֵאת כׇּל הַסְּעוּדָה תְּלוּיָה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: It turns out that the king is dependent on the queen, and it turns out that the queen is dependent on Rabban Gamliel. And it turns out that the entire meal is dependent upon Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: A king is found dependent on the queen, and the queen is found dependent on Rabban Gamliel, the entire feast is found dependent on Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: שָׁכַח מַה שֶּׁאָמַר לוֹ רַבּוֹ וְכוּ׳. שֶׁלִּי?! מַה שֶּׁקָּנָה עֶבֶד קָנָה רַבּוֹ!
human_translation: forgot what his master said to him, mine? Whatever a slave acquires, his master acquires
llm_translation: He forgot what his teacher told him, etc. "Mine?!" Whatever a slave acquires, his master acquires!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הוֹלֵךְ אֵצֶל רוֹעֶה הָרָגִיל רַבּוֹ אֶצְלוֹ, דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּתַקַּנְתָּא דְרַבֵּיהּ, וּמַקְנֵי לֵיהּ חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לְרַבּוֹ רְשׁוּת בּוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said goes to a shepherd that his master regularly patronizes, is pleased a solution for his master. grants ownership of one of on condition that his master has no rights to it.
llm_translation: Abaye said: One who goes to visit his teacher who is accustomed to have his teacher visit him, it is pleasing to him in the ordinance of his teacher, and he acquires for him one of his belongings on the condition that his teacher has no authority over it.

hebrew_text: שָׁכַח רַבּוֹ מַה שֶּׁאָמַר לוֹ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁשָּׁכַח אַחַר זְרִיקָה, דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּאִיזְּרִיק דָּם — הֲוָה חֲזֵי לַאֲכִילָה. אֲבָל שָׁכַח לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה, דְּכִי אִיזְּרִיק דָּם לָא הֲוָה חֲזֵי לַאֲכִילָה — חַיָּיבִין לַעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: his master forgot what he said to him, Abaye said: They taught forgot only after sprinkling for at the time the blood was sprinkled, it was fit to be eaten, But had forgotten before the sprinkling, that when the blood was sprinkled was not fit to be eaten, are obligated to observe second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: The master forgot what he told him, etc. Abaye said: They only taught that if one forgets after the sprinkling, for at the time that he sprinkles the blood, it appears fit for consumption. But if he forgets before the sprinkling, for when he sprinkles the blood, it does not appear fit for consumption - they are obligated to perform a second Passover.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַבָּרַיְיתָא: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ עוֹרוֹת פִּסְחֵיהֶן זֶה בָּזֶה, וְנִמְצֵאת יַבֶּלֶת בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן — כּוּלָּן יוֹצְאִין לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה, וּפְטוּרִין מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Some teach this to baraita : Five hides of their Paschal lambs mixed up together, and a wart was found on one of them. all go out to the place for burning. are exempt from observing second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: There is one who teaches in the academy of Abaye: If the skins of their Passover offerings became intermingled with one another, and a yavaleth is found among them, all of them may be taken out to the place of burning, and they are exempt from performing a second Passover.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה, דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּאִיזְּרִיק דָּם מִיהָא הֲוָה חֲזֵי לַאֲכִילָה. אֲבָל נִתְעָרְבוּ לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה — חַיָּיבִין לַעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Abaye said: They taught where were mixed up together only after the sprinkling for at the time the blood was sprinkled, was, at any rate, fit to be eaten, But if they were mixed up together before the sprinkling, they are obligated to observe second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: Abaye said: They only taught the law when they became mixed after the sprinkling, for at the time of the sprinkling, if blood was visible, it would appear fit for consumption. But if they became mixed before the sprinkling, they are obligated to perform a second Passover.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי אַמַּתְנִיתִין, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַבָּרַיְיתָא. מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי אַבָּרַיְיתָא, אֲבָל אַמַּתְנִיתִין לָא. כֵּיוָן דִּכְשֵׁירִין נִינְהוּ, דְּאִי אִידְּכַר הֲוֵי חֲזֵי לַאֲכִילָה, קַמֵּי שְׁמַיָּא גַּלְיָא.
human_translation: The one who teaches referring to the mishna, all the more so to the baraita , the one who teaches to the baraita with regard to the mishna, no, Since are valid for if remembers will be fit to be eaten, It is revealed before Heaven
llm_translation: The one who teaches Amatnitin, all the more so Abaryita. The one who teaches Abaryita, but not Amatnitin. Since they are qualified, for if one is remembered, it is fit for consumption, before the heavens it is revealed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: וּפְטוּרִין מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי. וְהָא אִיכָּא חַד דְּלָא נָפֵיק!
human_translation: The Master said: are exempt from observing second Pesaḥ . But there is one, who did not fulfill
llm_translation: Master said: "And they are exempt from performing the second Pesach." But there is one case where this does not apply!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אִיפְשָׁר. הֵיכִי לֶיעְבֵּיד? לַיְתֵי כׇּל חַד וְחַד פֶּסַח — קָא מַיְיתֵי חוּלִּין לָעֲזָרָה, דְּאַרְבְּעָה מִינַּיְיהוּ עָבְדִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: Because it is not possible what should he do? Let each one bring a Paschal lamb. They would be bringing unconsecrated animals into the courtyard, since four of them, have already performed
llm_translation: Because it is not possible. How can it be done? Let each and every one bring a Paschal lamb - he brings ordinary funds to the Temple, for four types of work are done with them.

hebrew_text: לַיְתֵי כּוּלְּהוּ חַד פֶּסַח — נִמְצָא פֶּסַח נֶאֱכָל שֶׁלֹּא לִמְנוּיָו.
human_translation: Let them all bring one Paschal lamb It would turn out that the Paschal lamb was eaten by those who have not registered for it,
llm_translation: Let all of them come together one Passover - it was found that a Passover may be eaten not in its designated time.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי? נַיְתֵי כׇּל חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ פִּסְחוֹ, וְנַיתְנֵי וְנֵימָא: אִי דִּידִי בַּעַל מוּם — הַאי דְּאַיְיתַי הַשְׁתָּא נִיהְוֵי פֶּסַח, וְאִי דִּידִי תָּם — הַאי דְּאַיְיתַי הַשְׁתָּא נִיהְוֵי שְׁלָמִים!
human_translation: What is this? Let each one bring his Paschal lamb and stipulate and say: If mine was the blemished this that I am bringing now shall be a Paschal lamb, and if mine was unblemished, this that I am bringing now shall be a peace-offering.
llm_translation: This what? Comes every one of them Passover, and it is said: If mine blemished — this that comes now will be Passover, and if mine unblemished — this that comes now will be peace offerings!

hebrew_text: לָא אֶפְשָׁר,
human_translation: It is not possible
llm_translation: Not possible.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא חָזֶה וָשׁוֹק, דְּכֹהֲנִים הוּא דְּאָכְלִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: because there are breast and hind leg, which the priests eat
llm_translation: Because there is a vision and a thigh, it is the priests who eat it.

hebrew_text: וְנַיְתֵי כׇּל חַד וְחַד כֹּהֵן בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: Let each one bring a priest with him
llm_translation: And they placed each and every priest in his division.

hebrew_text: הַאי כֹּהֵן הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דְּעָבֵיד פֶּסַח — דִּילְמָא הַאי פֶּסַח הוּא, וְנִמְצָא פֶּסַח נֶאֱכָל שֶׁלֹּא לִמְנוּיָו. וְאִי דְּלָא עָבֵיד פֶּסַח — דִּילְמָא שְׁלָמִים הוּא, וְלָא עָבֵיד פֶּסַח!
human_translation: What are the circumstances this priest? If he had performed Paschal lamb perhaps this is a Paschal lamb and it will turn out Paschal lamb is eaten by those who did not register for it. And if, had not performed Paschal lamb perhaps is a peace-offering, did not perform Paschal lamb
llm_translation: This priest, how is it considered? If he performed the Passover sacrifice — perhaps this is the Passover sacrifice, and it is found that the Passover was eaten out of its designated time. And if he did not perform the Passover sacrifice — perhaps it is a peace offering, and he did not perform the Passover sacrifice!

hebrew_text: וְנַיְתֵי כֹּל חַמְשָׁה חַד כֹּהֵן דְּלָא עֲבַד פֶּסַח, וְנִימְּנֵי עִילָּוֵיהּ הָנֵי חֲמִשָּׁה פְּסָחִים, דְּמִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ אִיכָּא חַד דְּלָא עָבֵיד פֶּסַח, וְקָא נָפְקִי בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Let all five bring one priest, who has not performed the Paschal lamb. And let register for these five Paschal lambs. Whichever way you look at it, there is one who has not performed Paschal lamb, and fulfill with him.
llm_translation: And it was taught: all five people, if one of them is a Kohen who did not perform the Passover offering, and they were counted for him, these five Passover offerings, for what purpose do you need one who did not perform the Passover offering, and it is derived from it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מְמַעֵיט בַּאֲכִילַת שְׁלָמִים, דְּאִילּוּ פֶּסַח לְיוֹם וְלַיְלָה, וְאִילּוּ שְׁלָמִים לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rather, because it would reduce the eating the peace-offering, for a Paschal lamb for a day and a night, whereas a peace-offering for two days and one night.
llm_translation: Rather, because he is diminishing in the consumption of peace offerings, for even the Passover is for one day and one night, while peace offerings are for two days and one night.

hebrew_text: וְנַיְתֵי מוֹתַר הַפֶּסַח.
human_translation: let them bring a surplus Paschal lamb.
llm_translation: And the leftover meat of the Paschal lamb is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא: אִי דִּידִי בַּעַל מוּם — הַאי דְּאַיְיתַי הַשְׁתָּא נִיהְוֵי פֶּסַח, אִי דִּידִי תָּם הוּא — נִיהְוֵי הַאי דְּאַיְיתַי הַשְׁתָּא שְׁלָמִים, דְּמוֹתַר הַפֶּסַח נֶאֱכָל לְיוֹם וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד.
human_translation: And they should say: If mine was the blemished this that I am bringing now shall be a Paschal lamb; if mine was unblemished, this that I am bringing now shall be a peace-offering a surplus Paschal lamb may be eaten for day and one night,
llm_translation: And it was stated: If it is mine with a blemish - this one that comes now will be for Passover, if it is mine whole - this one that comes now will be for peace offerings, for the Passover may be eaten for one day and one night.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מַפְרִישִׁין תְּחִלָּה לַמּוֹתָרוֹת?! וְנִטְרְחוּ וְנַיְיתֵי מוֹתַר הַפֶּסַח!
human_translation: But can we designate initially surplus Let them trouble themselves and bring a surplus Paschal lamb,
llm_translation: And do we separate first for the permissible ones?! And they were troubled and came the permission of the Passover!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם סְמִיכָה. דְּאִילּוּ פֶּסַח לָא בָּעֵי סְמִיכָה, וְאִילּוּ מוֹתָר בָּעֵי סְמִיכָה.
human_translation: Rather, because placing for a Paschal lamb does not need placing whereas a surplus does need placing
llm_translation: Rather, because of "smichah." For if it did not require "smichah" for the Passover offering, and if it were permitted, it would require "smichah."

hebrew_text: הָא תִּינַח קׇרְבַּן אֲנָשִׁים. קׇרְבַּן נָשִׁים, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well offering of men, offering of women, what is there to say?
llm_translation: This is the text: "Ha tinach korban anashim. Korban nashim, mai ikka lemeimar?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם מַתָּנוֹת. דְּאִילּוּ פֶּסַח — מַתָּנָה אַחַת, וְאִילּוּ שְׁלָמִים — שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: Rather, because presentations For whereas a Paschal lamb one presentation, two that constitute four,
llm_translation: Rather, because of gifts. For if it were Passover — it would be one gift, and if it were peace offerings — two, which are four.

hebrew_text: מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? וְהָא תְּנַן: כׇּל הַנִּיתָּנִין עַל מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן שֶׁנְּתָנָן בְּמַתַּן אַחַת — כִּפֵּר,
human_translation: What difference does make? Didn’t we learn all presented upon the outer altar, presented with one presentation, has atoned,
llm_translation: What is derived from it? But didn't we learn: All the offerings placed on the outer altar that were given in one donation - atoned.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאִילּוּ פֶּסַח בִּשְׁפִיכָה, וְאִילּוּ שְׁלָמִים בִּזְרִיקָה.
human_translation: Rather, because Whereas the Paschal lamb by pouring a peace-offering is by sprinkling
llm_translation: Rather, because if the Passover offering is through pouring, and the peace offerings through sprinkling.

hebrew_text: מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: כׇּל הַנִּיתָּנִין בִּזְרִיקָה שֶׁנְּתָנָן בִּשְׁפִיכָה יָצָא. אֵימַר דְּקָא אָמְרִינַן דְּאִי עֲבַד, לְכַתְּחִלָּה נָמֵי?!
human_translation: What difference does make? Wasn’t it taught all by sprinkling, one applied by pouring, one has fulfilled Say that we say if he did ab initio as well?
llm_translation: What is derived from it? But it was taught: All offerings that were designated for sprinkling, if they were designated for pouring, they are valid. Do we say that if one did so, it is valid from the outset as well?!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר לְבָנָיו: הֲרֵינִי שׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל מִי שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה מִכֶּם רִאשׁוֹן לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִכְנִיס הָרִאשׁוֹן רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ — זָכָה בְּחֶלְקוֹ וּמְזַכֶּה אֶת אֶחָיו עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: one who says to his children: I am slaughtering the Paschal lamb on behalf of whomever of you goes up first to Jerusalem, as soon as the first has entered his head and the majority of his he has acquired his portion and acquires his brothers with him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says to his sons, "I am slaughtering the Passover sacrifice for the one among you who will ascend first to Jerusalem," once the first one has entered with his head and the majority of his body - he has acquired his portion and can acquire for his brothers with him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה!
human_translation: You can learn from there is retroactive clarification.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "G'ma sh'ma minah yesh b'reirah!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, כְּדֵי לְזָרְזָן בְּמִצְוֹת קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: in order to enthuse them, in mitzvot;
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan, "In order to be diligent in mitzvot is what he meant."

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי: וּמְזַכֶּה אֶחָיו עִמּוֹ, אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּאַמְנִינְהוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא — שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּלָא אַמְנִינְהוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא, לְבָתַר דְּשָׁחֵיט מִי קָא מִתְמַנּוּ? וְהָא תְּנַן: נִמְנִין וּמוֹשְׁכִין יְדֵיהֶן מִמֶּנּוּ עַד שֶׁיִּשָּׁחֵט. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is also precise, as it teaches: And he acquires his brothers with him. Granted, if you say that registered them from the beginning, is well But if you say he did not register them from the beginning, after he slaughtered can they be registered? Didn’t we learn be registered and withdraw themselves from until it is slaughtered, learn from this
llm_translation: It is precisely as it was taught: "And one who purifies his brothers with him," if you say that from the outset they believed him — fine, but if you say that they did not believe him from the outset, after he slaughters, who will appoint them? And we learned: They are counted and they extend their hands from him until he slaughters. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מַעֲשֶׂה וְקָדְמוּ בָּנוֹת לְבָנִים, וְנִמְצָא בָּנוֹת זְרִיזוֹת וּבָנִים שְׁפָלִים.
human_translation: That was also taught an incident and the daughters preceded the sons. And it turned out that the daughters were enthusiastic, the sons were lazy.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Namai the Elder said: The daughters preceded the sons, and it was found that the daughters were diligent and the sons were lazy.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לְעוֹלָם נִמְנִין עָלָיו עַד שֶׁיִּהְיֶה בּוֹ כְּזַיִת לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד. נִמְנִין וּמוֹשְׁכִין אֶת יְדֵיהֶן מִמֶּנּוּ עַד שֶׁיִּשָּׁחֵט. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּזָּרֵק אֶת הַדָּם.
human_translation: can always be registered for as long as there will be an olive-bulk for each and every can be registered and withdraw themselves from until it is slaughtered. Rabbi Shimon says: until sprinkles the blood.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One should always count the animal for him until each one has an olive's worth. They should count and draw their hands from it until it is slaughtered. Rabbi Shimon says: Until he sprinkles the blood.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִימְּנִי עָלָיו חֲבוּרָה זוֹ, חוֹזֶרֶת וְנִמְנִין עָלָיו חֲבוּרָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: What teaching us? This comes to teach us that although this group was registered for it, can withdraw and a different group can register for it,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is it teaching us? It is teaching us that even though this group was established with him, another group can come and be established with him.

hebrew_text: נִמְנִין וּמוֹשְׁכִין אֶת יְדֵיהֶן עַד שֶׁיִּשָּׁחֵט וְכוּ׳. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַחֲלוֹקֶת לִימָּשֵׁךְ,
human_translation: be registered and withdraw themselves from until it is slaughtered. Abaye said: The dispute to withdraw
llm_translation: Counting and stretching out their hands until they slaughter, etc. Abaye said: The dispute is regarding stretching out.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: ״מִהְיוֹת מִשֶּׂה״ — מֵחַיּוּתֵיהּ דְּשֶׂה. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: מֵהֲוָיָיתֵיהּ דְּשֶׂה. אֲבָל לִימָּנוֹת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל עַד שֶׁיִּשָּׁחֵט, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״בְּמִכְסַת נְפָשֹׁת״, וַהֲדַר: ״תָּכֹסּוּ״.
human_translation: The Rabbis hold “from being [ miheyot ] from a lamb” during the life [ meiḥayutei ] of the lamb, And Rabbi Shimon holds during the happenings [ meihavayatei ] of the lamb, But to being registered all agree that until it is slaughtered, as the verse states, “According to the number [ bemikhsat ] of the people,” and then “you shall make your count [ takhosu ].”
llm_translation: The sages hold: "From the living of a lamb" — from the living of a lamb. And Rabbi Shimon holds: "From the existence of a lamb." But for the counting — the words of everyone until it is slaughtered, as the verse says: "For the ransom of lives," and then: "You shall count."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: נִמְנִין וּמוֹשְׁכִין אֶת יְדֵיהֶן מִמֶּנּוּ עַד שֶׁיִּשָּׁחֵט, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: נִמְנִין עַד שֶׁיִּשָּׁחֵט, וּמוֹשְׁכִין עַד שֶׁיִּזָּרֵק הַדָּם.
human_translation: That was also taught can be registered and withdraw themselves from until it is slaughtered. Rabbi Shimon says: They can be registered until it is slaughtered and withdraw themselves until sprinkles the blood.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: They count and stretch out their hands from it until it is slaughtered. Rabbi Shimon says: They count until it is slaughtered, and they stretch out until the blood is sprinkled.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְמַנֶּה עִמּוֹ אַחֵר בְּחֶלְקוֹ — רַשָּׁאִין בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה לִיתֵּן לוֹ אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, וְהֵן אוֹכְלִין מִשֶּׁלָּהֶן.
human_translation: registers another with him in his portion members of group are permitted to give him, his And he, eats from his and they, eat from theirs.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who appoints another with him in his portion—members of the group are permitted to give him his share, and he eats from his own, while they eat from theirs.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה שֶׁהָיוּ יָדָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן יָפוֹת, מַהוּ שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ לוֹ: טוֹל חֶלְקְךָ וָצֵא. מִי אָמְרִינַן, מָצֵי אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָא קַבֵּילְתּוּן. אוֹ דִילְמָא, מָצוּ לְמֵימַר לֵיהּ: כִּי קַבֵּלְינַן — לְתַיקּוֹנֵי זְבִיחָה, אַדַּעְתָּא דְּאָכְלַתְּ טְפֵי מִינַּן — לָא קַבֵּלְינָךְ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before members of a group one of them who has fine hands, what is they can say to him: Take your portion and leave; Do we say he can say to them: You accepted me Or perhaps they can say to him: When we accepted you, it was for the preparation of the offering, we did not accept you the understanding that you would eat more than us.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a question: In the case of members of a group where the hands of one of them were beautiful, what should they say to him: Take your portion and leave. Who said that we should say to him: You have received your share? Perhaps, they should say to him: When we said we have received our share, it was for the purpose of the offering, but we did not receive you.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמְמַנֶּה אֲחֵרִים עִמּוֹ עַל חֶלְקוֹ — רַשָּׁאִין [בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה] לִיתֵּן לוֹ אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ, וְהֵן אוֹכְלִין אֶת שֶׁלָּהֶן. מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי לֵיהּ כְּיָדַיִם שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן יָפוֹת. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ יָדָיו יָפוֹת מָצֵי אֲמַר לְהוּ קַבֵּילְתּוּן, נִיהְוֵי הַאי כְּיָדָיו יָפוֹת!
human_translation: Come hear registers other with him in his portion, members of the group are permitted to give him his And he eat from his and they, eat from theirs. What is the reason Is it not because it is comparable to one of them has fine hands, And if it could enter your mind fine hands can say to them: You accepted me this should be as though he had fine hands,
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who appoints others with him on his portion - the members of the group are authorized to give him his portion, and he eats his portion, while they eat their portions. What is the reason? Not because it would be as if one of their hands is beautiful. And if you think his hands are beautiful, he should say to them, "Accept it," so that it will be as if his hands are beautiful!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לָא, דֵּעוֹת שָׁאנֵי, דְּאִי נָמֵי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ כְּחַד מִבְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה הוּא דְּאָכְלִי, מָצֵי אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: דְּלָא נִיחָא לַן אִינָשׁ נוּכְרָא גַּבָּן.
human_translation: They say: No, minds is different. Even if both of them eat equivalent to a single member of the group, can say to him: It is not pleasant for us a strange person among us.
llm_translation: They said: No, their opinions differ, for if indeed both of them were like one of the members of the group who ate, he would have said to him: "It is not pleasing to us, a stranger among us."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַשַּׁמָּשׁ שֶׁאָכַל כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר בְּצַד הַתַּנּוּר, אִם הָיָה פִּקֵּחַ — מְמַלֵּא כְּרֵיסוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ. אִם רָצוּ בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה לַעֲשׂוֹת טוֹבָה עִמּוֹ — בָּאִין וְיוֹשְׁבִין בְּצִדּוֹ וְאוֹכְלִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רָצוּ — אִין, לֹא רָצוּ — לָא. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא לְהוּ: הָא קַבֵּילְתּוּן.
human_translation: Come hear an attendant who ate an olive-bulk of meat next to the oven if he were judicious, he should fill his stomach with it. an olive-bulk, If the members of the group wanted to do him a favor they can come and sit at his side and eat the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. If they wanted yes; if they did not want no. But why Let him say to them: You accepted me
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: hashamash she'akhal kezayit basar betzad hattanur, im haya pikach — memale kriso mimenu. Im ratzu benei chavurah la'asot tovah imo — bain ve'yoshvin betzido ve'okhlin, divrei Rabbi Yehudah. Ratzu — ein, lo ratzu — la. Ve'amai? Neima lehu: ha kabileitun." English translation: "Come and hear: If the attendant who ate an olive-sized portion of meat beside the oven was conscious — he fills his stomach from it. If the members of the group wanted to do a kindness with him — they come and sit beside him and eat, the words of Rabbi Yehudah. If they wanted — yes, if they did not want — no. And why? Say to them: 'Did you accept it?'"

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: כִּי קַבֵּלְינָךְ — אַדַּעְתָּא דְּנַטְרְחָךְ קַמַּן. לְמִטְרַח לַן לְדִידָךְ — לָא קַבֵּלְינָךְ.
human_translation: It is different there, for they say to him: When we accepted you, it was with the understanding that you would exert yourself before us for us to exert ourselves for you, we did not accept you.
llm_translation: The matter is different there, for they say to him: "When I receive you" - the knowledge that I am troubled before you. If I am troubled for your sake - I do not receive you.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה שֶׁהָיָה יָדָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן יָפוֹת, רַשָּׁאִין לוֹמַר: טוֹל חֶלְקְךָ וָצֵא. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ חֲמִשָּׁה וְעָשׂוּ סִיבּוֹלֶת, רַשָּׁאִין לוֹמַר לוֹ: טוֹל חֶלְקְךָ וָצֵא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear Members of a group in which one of had fine hands are permitted to say Take your portion and leave; And not only but even five who made a shared meal of friends [ sibolet ] are permitted to say Take your portion and leave. learn from this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: Members of a partnership, if the hands of one of them are beautiful, they are permitted to say to him, "Take your share and leave." And not only that, but even if they made a rope of five and formed a bond, they are permitted to say to him, "Take your share and leave." Learn from this. English translation:

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְלֹא עוֹד״? לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא פֶּסַח, דְּמָצֵי אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: כִּי קַבֵּלְינָךְ לְתַקּוֹנֵי זְבִיחָה, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ סִיבּוֹלֶת נָמֵי, דְּצַוְותָּא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, רַשָּׁאִין לוֹמַר לוֹ: טוֹל חֶלְקְךָ וָצֵא.
human_translation: What And not only? is speaking There is no need. There is no need to state as they can say to him: When we accepted you, it was for the preparation of the offering, Rather, even a shared friendly meal, which is for companionship only, they are permitted to say to him: Take your portion and leave.
llm_translation: What is "and not yet"? He is not asking. He is not asking about Pesach, for they say to him: "When you were accepted for the repairs of the slaughter, even a thornbush, which is a mere commandment, they are permitted to say to him: Take your portion and leave."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: הָא לָא אִיבַּעְיָא לַן, אֶלָּא הָכִי הוּא דְּאִיבַּעְיָא לַן: בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה רַשָּׁאִין לְחַלֵּק, אוֹ אֵינָן רַשָּׁאִין לְחַלֵּק?
human_translation: There are who say this is not our dilemma. Rather, this is our dilemma: members of a group permitted to divide up or are they not allowed to divide up
