llm_translation: There are those who say: This is not what we need, but rather this is what we need: Are members of a partnership permitted to divide, or are they not permitted to divide?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה שֶׁהָיוּ יָדָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן יָפוֹת — רַשָּׁאִין לוֹמַר לוֹ: טוֹל חֶלְקְךָ וָצֵא. יָדָיו יָפוֹת — אִין, אֵין יָדָיו יָפוֹת — לָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear Members of a group one of them had fine hands are permitted to say to him: Take your portion and leave, his hands are fine, yes, his hands are not fine, no, learn from this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: Members of a partnership whose hands of one of them are beautiful - they are permitted to say to him: Take your share and leave. If his hands are not beautiful - no, if his hands are beautiful - no. Learn from this. English translation:

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עָרִיבוּ רִיפְתָּא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אַדְּאָכֵיל רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ חֲדָא, אָכֵיל רַב פָּפָּא אַרְבַּע. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּלַג לִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קַבֵּילְתּוּן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, mixed bread together By the time Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, ate one Rav Pappa ate four said to him: divide with me He said to him: You accepted
llm_translation: Rav Papa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, combined a dish together. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, ate one portion, while Rav Papa ate four. He said to him: "Divide with me." He said to him: "You have received it."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ כׇּל הָנֵי תְּיוּבָתָא, וְשַׁנִּי כִּדְשַׁנִּינַן. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ כִּי קַבֵּלְינָךְ — לְתַיקּוֹנֵי זְבִיחָה. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ סִיבּוֹלֶת, פְּלַג לֵיהּ.
human_translation: raised all these objections and answered as we answered raised an objection members of a group said to him: There, they say to him: When we accepted you it was for the preparation of the sacrifice, raised an objection a shared meal. divided with him.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: all those deposits, and he answered as we have learned. He raised an objection against him from the sons of the association. He said to him: there, where they say to you "since we have received you" - for the improvement of the slaughter. He raised an objection against him from a basket, he refuted him.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל עָרֵיב בַּהֲדֵי רָבִינָא. אַדְּאָכֵיל רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ חֲדָא, אָכֵיל רָבִינָא תְּמָנְיָא. אֲמַר: מְאָה פָּפֵּי וְלָא חֲדָא רָבִינָא.
human_translation: went and mixed together with Ravina. By the time Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, ate one Ravina ate eight. said one hundred Pappas and not one Ravina,
llm_translation: Went evening with Ravina. Now ate Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua one, ate Ravina eight. Said: one hundred papa and not one Ravina.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְמַנֶּה אֲחֵרִים עִמּוֹ עַל פִּסְחוֹ וְעַל חֲגִיגָתוֹ — מָעוֹת שֶׁבְּיָדוֹ חוּלִּין. וְהַמּוֹכֵר עוֹלָתוֹ וּשְׁלָמָיו — לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְּלוּם, וּמָעוֹת כׇּל שֶׁהֵן יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who registers others with him for his Paschal lamb for his Festival peace-offering the money in his hand is non-sacred. And one who sells his burnt-offering peace-offerings has not done anything; and any money should go for free-will offerings -
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who appoints others with him for his Paschal offering and his festival peace offering— the money in his possession is considered ordinary funds. But one who sells his burnt offering and his peace offerings— he did not fulfill his obligation, and the money, all of it, shall fall as a donation.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּלֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְּלוּם, מָעוֹת אַמַּאי יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה? אָמַר רָבָא: קְנָסָא. וּמַאי ״כׇּל שֶׁהֵן״ — אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא הֲווֹ שָׁווּ אֶלָּא אַרְבְּעָה, וִיהַבוּ לֵיהּ חַמְשָׁה — אֲפִילּוּ בְּהָהִיא יַתִּירָא נָמֵי קַנְסוּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But since he has not done anything, why does the money fall for free-will offerings? Rava said: It is a fine And what is And any although were worth only four and they gave him five even that extra the Sages also fined him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if after he did not do anything and they did not become disqualified, why should the money fall into the category of a donation? Rava said: A penalty. And what is "all of them"? Even though they were not equal but were four, and they gave him five - even in that case, the Rabbis penalized him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: אֶפְשָׁר יָדְעִי חַבְרִין בַּבְלָאֵי טַעְמָא דְּהַאי מִלְּתָא. זֶה הִפְרִישׁ טָלֶה לְפִסְחוֹ, וְזֶה הִפְרִישׁ מָעוֹת לְפִסְחוֹ, הֵיאַךְ הֶקְדֵּשׁ חָל עַל הֶקְדֵּשׁ, דְּקָתָנֵי: מָעוֹת שֶׁבְּיָדוֹ חוּלִּין?
human_translation: Ulla said, and some say it was Rabbi Oshaya: possible our Babylonian friends know the reason of this matter: This designated a lamb for his Paschal lamb, and this designated money with his Paschal lamb, How does sanctity take effect upon sacred, that teaches that the money in his hand is non-sacred,
llm_translation: Ula said, and it was stated by Rabbi Oshaya: Is it possible for one to know the companions in the Babylonian Talmud of this matter. This one designated a lamb for his Passover offering, and this one designated coins for his Passover offering, how can he sanctify the secular upon the sacred, as it is taught: coins that are in his possession are secular?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִי לָאו דְּאוֹקְמֵיהּ רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא לְהַהִיא בִּמְמַנֶּה זוֹנָה עַל פִּסְחוֹ וְרַבִּי הִיא, הֲוָה מוֹקֵמְינָא לָהּ לְהַהִיא בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאָמַר: קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים מָמוֹן בְּעָלִים הוּא,
human_translation: Abaye said: If not that Rabbi Oshaya established that one who registers a prostitute for his Paschal lamb and is Rabbi I would have established that offerings of lesser sanctity and in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, said: Offerings of lesser sanctity are the monetary property of their owners,
llm_translation: Abaye said: If it were not that Rabbi Oshaya established that woman as a prostitute on Passover, and she was Rabbi's wife, we would have established her for that man with light holy items. And according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, who said: Light holy items belong to the owner.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּפֶסַח לָא מְשַׁיַּיר אִינִישׁ, בְּמָעוֹת וַדַּאי מְשַׁיַּיר אִינִישׁ, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא כִּי מַפְרֵישׁ לְהוּ — אַדַּעְתָּא דְּהָכִי מַפְרֵישׁ לְהוּ.
human_translation: But a Paschal lamb a person does not restrict money a person certainly restricts When one initially designates it, he designated it with this intent:
llm_translation: But on Pesach one does not leave over, with money certainly one leaves over, for initially when one separates for them - know that one separates for them.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי הִיא, וּמִשּׁוּם הָכִי מָעוֹת שֶׁבְּיָדוֹ חוּלִּין, דְּבַפֶּסַח לָא מְשַׁיַּיר אִינִישׁ, וּבְמָעוֹת וַדַּאי מְשַׁיַּיר אִינִישׁ.
human_translation: this Rabbi Due to this money in the hand is non-sacred because, with regard to the Paschal lamb a person does not restrict with regard to money a person certainly restricts
llm_translation: And this is the opinion of Rabbi, and therefore, the money in his possession is considered secular, for on Passover one does not leave over anything, but with money, one certainly leaves over something.

hebrew_text: וְהָהִיא דְּקָא מוֹקֵי לַהּ רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא כְּרַבִּי — לָא מוֹקֵמְינָא לֵיהּ אֲנָא כְּרַבִּי, דִּבְפֶסַח לָא מְשַׁיַּיר אִינִישׁ — וּבְמָעוֹת מְשַׁיַּיר אִינִישׁ. דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא כִּי מַפְרֵישׁ לְהוּ — אַדַּעְתָּא דְּהָכִי מַפְרֵישׁ לְהוּ.
human_translation: And that that Rabbi Oshaya established as in accordance Rabbi I would not establish it as in accordance with Rabbi a Paschal lamb, a person does not limit with regard to money, a person limit for when one originally designates it, he designates it with this intent.
llm_translation: And that which Rabbi Oshaya was quoting in the name of Rabbi - we do not establish it for him as I establish it for Rabbi, for regarding Pesach, a person does not leave over, but regarding Ma'ot, a person does leave over. Initially, when he separates for them - know that he separates for them in this way.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לֵיכָּא לְאוֹקֹמֵי כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּהָא תָּנֵי בַּהּ: וְהַמּוֹכֵר עוֹלָתוֹ וּשְׁלָמָיו — לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם.
human_translation: However, this, cannot be established accordance with Rabbi Yosei, for it teaches one who sells his burnt-offering and peace-offerings has not done anything.
llm_translation: And there is a refutation to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, for it was taught in it: "And one who sells his burnt offering and his peace offerings - he has not done and has not fulfilled."

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאוֹקְמֵיהּ רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא לְהָהִיא בִּמְמַנֶּה זוֹנָה עַל פִּסְחוֹ, וְרַבִּי הִיא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דִּסְבִירָא לֵיהּ אֲפִילּוּ בְּפִסְחוֹ מְשַׁיַּיר אִינִישׁ.
human_translation: now that Rabbi Oshaya has established that to one who registers a prostitute for his Paschal lamb, and it is Rabbi learn from it that holds that even with regard to one’s Paschal lamb, a person restricts
llm_translation: And the incident where Rabbi Oshaya established that certain woman as a prostitute on his Passover, and it was indeed Rabbi. Learn from it that he reasoned with her that even on his Passover a person may sing.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא דְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, דִּתְנַן: נָתַן לָהּ מוּקְדָּשִׁין בְּאֶתְנַנָּהּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: What is Rabbi Oshaya we learned one gave consecrated for payment, they are permitted
llm_translation: What is the case of Rabbi Oshaya, as we learned: If he gave her consecrated items in her dowry - these are permitted.

hebrew_text: עוֹפוֹת דְּחוּלִּין — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ אֲסוּרִין. שֶׁהָיָה בַּדִּין: וּמָה אִם מוּקְדָּשִׁים שֶׁהַמּוּם פּוֹסֵל בָּהֶן — אֵין אֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר חָל עֲלֵיהֶן, עוֹפוֹת שֶׁאֵין הַמּוּם פּוֹסֵל בָּהֶן — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁאֵין אֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר חָל עֲלֵיהֶן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְכׇל נֶדֶר״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָעוֹפוֹת.
human_translation: birds non-sacred, they are prohibited as, by right, it should have been What? If consecrated which a blemish disqualifies them payment price does not take effect upon them, birds, which a blemish does not disqualify them is it not right that payment price should not take effect upon them? the verse states: for any vow” to include birds,
llm_translation: Birds of the sky - behold, these are forbidden. For it was taught: And what if consecrated birds have a blemish that disqualifies them - we do not give them as a gift, and their value does not apply to them. Birds that do not have a disqualifying blemish - is it not the case that we do give them as a gift and their value applies to them? The Talmud teaches: "For every vow" - to include birds.

hebrew_text: קַל וָחוֹמֶר לַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין מֵעַתָּה: מָה עוֹפוֹת שֶׁאֵין הַמּוּם פּוֹסֵל בָּהֶן — אֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר חָל עֲלֵיהֶן, מוּקְדָּשִׁין שֶׁהַמּוּם פּוֹסֵל בָּהֶן — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁאֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר חָל עֲלֵיהֶן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְכׇל נֶדֶר״ — פְּרָט לִנְדּוֹר.
human_translation: From now, a fortiori inference consecrated: Just as birds, which a blemish does not disqualify them, payment and price takes effect upon them, consecrated which a blemish does disqualify them, is it not right that payment and price should take effect upon them? the verse states: “For any vow,” except for already been vowed
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A fortiori for the consecrated items from now: Just as birds in which a blemish does not disqualify them — their value and the price is incumbent upon them, consecrated items in which a blemish disqualifies them — is it not logical that their value and the price should be incumbent upon them? The Torah teaches: "For every vow" — excluding a vow.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״נֶדֶר״, הָא לָאו הָכִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מוּקְדָּשִׁים חָל אִיסּוּר אֶתְנַן עֲלֵיהֶן, וְהָא אֵין אָדָם אוֹסֵר דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ!
human_translation: But the reason is that the Torah writes vow; but if not for that I would have said consecrated the prohibition of a payment takes effect upon them. But A person cannot make forbidden something that is not his.
llm_translation: Rather, the reason why the Merciful One wrote "nedarim" is not as you say. I would have thought that consecrated items incur a prohibition upon them, but a person does not forbid something that is not his!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: בִּמְמַנֶּה זוֹנָה עַל פִּסְחוֹ, וְרַבִּי הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: to one who registers a prostitute for his Paschal lamb, and are Rabbi
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaia said: "With a designated prostitute on his Passover, and it is Rabbi."

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי? דְּתַנְיָא: ״אִם יִמְעַט הַבַּיִת מִהְיוֹת מִשֶּׂה״, הַחֲיֵיהוּ מִשֶּׂה. מִכְּדֵי אֲכִילָה, וְלֹא מִכְּדֵי מִקָּח.
human_translation: What is Rabbi As it was taught if the household be too little for a lamb, sustain him [ haḥayeihu ] from the lamb, sufficient means to eat, not sufficient means to purchase
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi? As it was taught: "If the house is too small for a lamb," let him and his neighbor share in the lamb. For the purpose of eating, but not for the purpose of purchase.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אַף מִכְּדֵי מִקָּח, שֶׁאִם אֵין לוֹ — מְמַנֶּה אַחֵר עִמּוֹ עַל פִּסְחוֹ וְעַל חֲגִיגָתוֹ, וּמָעוֹת שֶׁבְּיָדוֹ חוּלִּין, שֶׁעַל מְנָת כֵּן הִקְדִּישׁוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת פִּסְחֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi says: even sufficient means to purchase for if he does not have he may register another with him for his Paschal lamb and for his Festival peace-offering. And the money in his hand is non-sacred, for it is on this condition that the Jewish people consecrate their Paschal lambs.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: Even from the time of acquisition, that if he does not have money, he designates another with him for his Passover offering and his festival peace-offering, and the money in his possession is secular, for on condition that way did the Israelites sanctify their Passover offerings.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַבִּי זֵירָא, חַד אָמַר: בְּעֵצִים לִצְלִיָּיתוֹ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי, דְּכֵיוָן דְּתַקַּנְתָּא דְפֶסַח הוּא — כְּגוּפָא דְפֶסַח דָּמֵי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּמַצָּה וּמָרוֹר.
human_translation: Rabba and Rabbi Zeira One said: wood to roast everyone agrees that since it is for the preparation of the Paschal lamb, it is comparable to the Paschal lamb itself, Where they disagree matza and bitter herbs.
llm_translation: Rabba and Rabbi Zeira, one said: In regards to wood for roasting the Passover offering, everyone agrees, for since it is an enactment of the Passover, it is like the Passover itself. They only disagree regarding the matzah and bitter herbs.

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: הָא אֲכִילָה אַחֲרִיתִי הִיא. וְרַבִּי סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּהֶכְשֵׁירוֹ דְפֶסַח הוּא — כְּגוּפָא דְפֶסַח דָּמֵי.
human_translation: The Rabbis hold that this is a different eating, And Rabbi holds that since it facilitates the Paschal lamb, it is like the Paschal lamb itself
llm_translation: The sages hold: this is a final meal. And Rabbi holds: since it is fit for Pesach, it is like the Pesach offering itself.

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: בְּמַצָּה וּמָרוֹר נָמֵי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״עַל מַצּוֹת וּמְרֹרִים יֹאכְלֻהוּ״, דְּכֵיוָן דְּמַכְשִׁירִין דְפֶסַח נִינְהוּ — כְּפֶסַח דָּמֵי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי לִיקַּח בּוֹ חָלוּק, לִיקַּח בּוֹ טַלִּית. רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: ״מִהְיוֹת מִשֶּׂה״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, הַחֲיֵיהוּ לַשֶּׂה, וְרַבִּי סָבַר: הַחֲיֵה עַצְמְךָ מִשֶּׂה.
human_translation: And one said: Also with regard to matza and bitter herbs everyone agrees, as it is written: “They shall eat it with matza and bitter herbs” for since they are that facilitate the Paschal lamb, they are like the Paschal lamb Where they disagree is to purchase a shirt with it to purchase a cloak with it. The Rabbis hold the Torah stated “ miheyot miseh ,” sustain the lamb [ haḥayeihu leseh ], And Rabbi holds sustain yourself from the lamb [ haḥayei atzmekha miseh ],
llm_translation: One said: In matzah and maror, all agree, for it is written: "They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs," since the items that make it fit for Pesach are like the Pesach itself. When they disagree, one should use it for a garment, one should use it for a cloak. The Rabbis hold: "From the sheep" the Merciful One said, let him redeem it for a sheep, and Rabbi holds: Redeem yourself from the sheep.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר: אִי לָאו דְּאוֹקְמַהּ רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא לְהַהִיא בִּמְמַנֶּה זוֹנָה עַל פִּסְחוֹ וְרַבִּי הִיא, הֲוֵי מוֹקְמִינַן לַהּ בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאָמַר קָדָשִׁים [קַלִּים] מְמוֹן בְּעָלִים הוּא, אֲבָל בְּפֶסַח לָא מְשַׁיַּיר אִינִישׁ —
human_translation: And according to Abaye, who said: If Rabbi Oshaya had not established that to one who registers a prostitute for his Paschal lamb and it is Rabbi I would have established it sacrifices of lesser sanctity and according to Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who said: Sacrifices of lesser sanctity are the property of their owners, but in the Paschal sacrifice one does not leave
llm_translation: To Abbaye who said: If it is not that Rabbi Oshaya established that woman as a prostitute on Passover, and Rabbi is she, we should establish her with light holy items. And according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, who said light holy items belong to the owner, but with Passover, a person does not leave.

hebrew_text: הָא קָתָנֵי בְּהֶדְיָא: ״שֶׁעַל מְנָת כֵּן הִקְדִּישׁוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת פִּסְחֵיהֶן״? אֵימָא: שֶׁעַל מְנָת כֵּן הִקְדִּישׁוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מְעוֹת פִּסְחֵיהֶן.
human_translation: but teaches explicitly that It is on this condition, that the Jewish people consecrate their Paschal lamb? say: For it is on this condition that the Jewish people consecrated money for their Paschal lambs.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a contradiction: "For what reason did the Israelites sanctify their Passover offerings?" Say: "For what reason did the Israelites sanctify the money for their Passover offerings."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ זָב שֶׁרָאָה שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלָיו בַּשְּׁבִיעִי. רָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלָיו בַּשְּׁמִינִי שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: A zav , who saw two sightings One slaughters on his behalf on his seventh he saw three one slaughters on his behalf on his eighth have
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a Zav saw two emissions - they slaughter the offering for him on the seventh day. If he saw three emissions - they slaughter the offering for him on his eighth day.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלֶיהָ בַּשֵּׁנִי שֶׁלָּהּ, רָאֲתָה שְׁנֵי יָמִים — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלֶיהָ בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי.
human_translation: A woman who keeps watch a day for a day one slaughters on her behalf on her second day, she saw two days, one slaughters on her behalf on the third
llm_translation: Guardian of the day corresponding to the day - slaughter upon it on its second day, she saw two days - slaughter upon it on the third day.

hebrew_text: וְהַזָּבָה — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלֶיהָ בַּשְּׁמִינִי.
human_translation: And a zava One slaughters on her behalf on the eighth
llm_translation: And the zavah - we slaughter upon it on the eighth day.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְבוּל יוֹם וּמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים,
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: One slaughters and sprinkles on behalf of one who has immersed himself during the day And lacks atonement
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One may slaughter and sprinkle on a Tevul Yom and one lacking atonement,

hebrew_text: וְאֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ. וְעוּלָּא אָמַר: אַף שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: And one does not slaughter and sprinkle on behalf of one who is ritually impure creeping animal, And Ulla said: One slaughters and sprinkles even for one who is ritually impure a creeping animal.
llm_translation: And one does not slaughter and sprinkle on a ritually impure creature. And Ulla said: Even so, one may slaughter and sprinkle on a ritually impure creature.

hebrew_text: לְרַב, מַאי שְׁנָא טְבוּל יוֹם — דַּחֲזֵי לְאוּרְתָּא? טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ נָמֵי חֲזֵי לְאוּרְתָּא! מְחוּסָּר טְבִילָה.
human_translation: According to Rav, what is different one who has immersed himself during the day that he is fit by night. one who is ritually impure creeping animal? also be fit by night He lacks immersion
llm_translation: To Rav, what is the difference of "immersed during the day" - for it appears like light? One who is impure due to contact with a creeping thing, it appears like light! Requires immersion.

hebrew_text: טְבוּל יוֹם נָמֵי — מְחוּסָּר הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ! שִׁמְשָׁא מִמֵּילָא עָרְבָא.
human_translation: one who immersed himself during the day also lacks the setting of the sun, The sun sets by itself,
llm_translation: "Tevel Yom Namei - Mechusar He'erev Shemesh! Shemsha Mimeila Arva."

hebrew_text: מְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים נָמֵי — הָא מְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה! שֶׁקִּינּוֹ בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: one who lacks an atonement also lacks his atonement His nest, is in his possession,
llm_translation: Lacking atonements near — here lacking purification! For he acquired it in his hand.

hebrew_text: טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ נָמֵי — הֲרֵי מִקְוֶה לְפָנָיו! דִּילְמָא פָּשַׁע. אִי הָכִי, מְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים נָמֵי דִּילְמָא פָּשַׁע! כְּגוֹן דְּמַסְרִינְהוּ לְבֵית דִּין,
human_translation: one ritually impure a creeping animal also the ritual bath is before him perhaps he will be neglectful If so, one who lacks an atonement also perhaps he will be neglectful such as he handed over to the court
llm_translation: Impure that touched a creeping thing — behold, immersion before him! Perhaps he transgressed. If so, lacking atonements behold, perhaps he transgressed! For example, if he handed them over to the court,

hebrew_text: וְכִדְרַב שְׁמַעְיָה, דְּאָמַר: חֲזָקָה אֵין בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים עוֹמְדִין מִשָּׁם עַד שֶׁיִּכְלוּ מָעוֹת שֶׁבַּשּׁוֹפָרוֹת.
human_translation: And in accordance with Rav Shemaya, who said there is a presumption that the court of priests will not stand up from there, until all the money in the collection boxes, is used up.
llm_translation: And like Rav Shemaya, who said: Strong, the court of Kohanim does not stand from there until they finish the coins in the trumpets.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב, מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מִיחְזֵא חֲזֵי וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דִּגְזַרוּ בֵּיהּ, אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַב מְטַמְּאִין אֶחָד מֵהֶן בְּשֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: And according to Rav, by Torah law one ritually impure a creeping animal fit and it is the Sages who decreed that he why did Rav say We contaminate one of them with a creeping animal
llm_translation: And for Rav, from the Torah, he sees visions, and it is the Rabbis who decreed upon it, why did Rav say that one of them becomes impure with a creeping thing.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְרַב מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נָמֵי לָא חֲזֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ כִּי יִהְיֶה טָמֵא לָנֶפֶשׁ״. מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן שֶׁחָל שְׁבִיעִי שֶׁלּוֹ לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, דְּהַיְינוּ טוּמְאַת שֶׁרֶץ, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: נִידְּחֵי!
human_translation: Rather, according to Rav, by Torah law he is also unfit as it is written: “If any man of you or of your posterity shall be ritually impure due to a dead body... Are we not dealing with whose seventh occurred on Passover eve. which is ritual impurity creeping animal, and the Torah states that he shall be deferred,
llm_translation: Rather, for Rav, from the Torah itself it is not seen, as it is written: "A man, a man, when he becomes impure for a soul." Who are we dealing with that became impure on the seventh day to be in the evening of Passover, which is the impurity of a creeping thing, and the Merciful One said: "Rejected ones!"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא מִמַּאי דְּהָכִי?
human_translation: And if you say: From where that this
llm_translation: And if you will say, from what is this?

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק, דְּאָמַר: טְמֵאֵי מֵת מִצְוָה הָיוּ, שֶׁחָל שְׁבִיעִי שֶׁלָּהֶן לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יָכְלוּ לַעֲשֹׂת הַפֶּסַח בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא״, בְּיוֹם הַהוּא הוּא דְּאֵינָן יְכוֹלִין לַעֲשׂוֹת, אֲבָל לְמָחָר יְכוֹלִין לַעֲשׂוֹת, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: נִדְּחוֹ.
human_translation: He holds in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yitzḥak, who said: They were ritually impure from a corpse that had no one to bury it [ met mitzva ], their seventh day occurred on Passover eve, as it is stated: “They could not perform the Paschal lamb on that day” it was on that day that they were unable to perform but the next day they would able to perform it and the Torah said that they should be deferred.
llm_translation: He thought like Rabbi Yitzchak, who said: The impure ones from contact with the dead were a mitzvah, that their seventh day should fall on the eve of Passover, as it is stated: "And they could not perform the Passover sacrifice on that day." On that day, when they were unable to perform, but on the next day they were able to perform, and the Merciful One said: "He is rejected."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: זָב שֶׁרָאָה שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלָיו בַּשְּׁבִיעִי. מַאי לָאו — דְּלָא טָבֵיל, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ!
human_translation: We learned a zav who saw two sightings one slaughters on his behalf on his seventh What, is it not he has not immersed and learn from it that we slaughter and sprinkle on behalf of one who is ritually impure from a creeping animal,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: A man who saw two emissions - they slaughter the offering for him on the seventh day. What is the reason? - Because he did not immerse, and we learn from it: They slaughter and sprinkle on one who is impure with a creeping thing!

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּטָבֵיל. אִי טָבֵיל, מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דִּמְחוּסַּר הֶעֱרֵב הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּשִׁמְשָׁא מִמֵּילָא עָרְבָא.
human_translation: No, who immersed. if he immersed, what is it teaching us? It teaches us this: That even though he lacks the setting of the sun, It teaches us that the sun sets by itself,
llm_translation: Not if he immersed. If he immersed, what is it teaching us? It is teaching us that even though the evening has passed, it is teaching us that the sun is still shining from the west.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: רָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ רְאִיּוֹת — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלָיו בַּשְּׁמִינִי. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא זָב שֶׁרָאָה שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלָיו בַּשְּׁבִיעִי, דְּטָבֵיל — אִיצְטְרִיךְ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable from that the last clause taught: saw three sightings, one slaughters on his behalf on the eighth Granted, if you say a zav who saw two sightings, one slaughters on his behalf on the seventh day, he immersed, necessary
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: it is logical, from the end of the Mishnah: if he saw three sightings - they slaughter for him on the eighth. If you say, it is well, a zav who saw two sightings, they slaughter for him on the seventh, for he must immerse - it is necessary.

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, רָאָה שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת בִּשְׁבִיעִי הוּא דְּלָא מְחוּסַּר מַעֲשֶׂה, אֲבָל רָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ בַּשְּׁמִינִי, דִּמְחוּסַּר מַעֲשֶׂה — מְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה, לָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאַף עַל גַּב דִּמְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה, שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עִילָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: It could enter your mind to say that it is saw two sightings on his seventh for he, does not lack action; but saw three sightings on his eighth who lacks an action lacks atonement no, teach us that although he lacks atonement one slaughters and sprinkles on his behalf.
llm_translation: I ascend your understanding, I say, he saw two sightings on the seventh day that are not lacking action, but he saw three on the eighth day, that are lacking action - lacking atonement, no. It is inferred for us that even though it is lacking atonement, we slaughter and throw its blood.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רָאָה שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת בִּשְׁבִיעִי, דְּלָא טָבֵיל — רָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ בַּשְּׁמִינִי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: But if you say a zav who saw two sightings, on the seventh day, he not immersed, why do I need a zav who saw three sightings, on the eighth day?
llm_translation: Rather, if you say he saw two sightings on the seventh day, since he did not immerse — he saw three on the eighth, why do I need this?

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא יֵשׁ לוֹמַר רָאָה שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת בַּשְּׁבִיעִי, דְּלָא טָבֵיל, דְּטָמֵא מְעַלְּיָא הוּא — שָׁחֲטִינַן וְזָרְקִינַן עִילָּוֵיהּ. רָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ בַּשְּׁמִינִי, דְּטָבֵיל לֵיהּ בַּשְּׁבִיעִי, דִּקְלִישָׁא טוּמְאָה — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּשָׁחֲטִינַן וְזָרְקִינַן עִילָּוֵיהּ!
human_translation: Now, it can be said: saw two sightings on seventh has not immersed, he is completely impure, one slaughters and sprinkles on his behalf, saw three on eighth who has immersed on the seventh impurity weakened is it not all the more so that one slaughter and sprinkle on his behalf?
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a question: If one saw two sightings on the seventh day, that he did not immerse, for he is impure above — we slaughter and sprinkle its blood above. If one saw three sightings on the eighth day, that he should immerse on the seventh day, for the impurity is severe — not to mention that we slaughter and sprinkle its blood above!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: רָאָה שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת בַּשְּׁבִיעִי דְּשָׁחֲטִינַן עִילָּוֵיהּ, דְּטָבֵיל.
human_translation: Rather, must one not conclude from saw two sightings, on the seventh day, he immersed?
llm_translation: Rather, no, learn from it: he saw two appearances on the seventh day that we slaughtered its fat-tail, that it was immersed.

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ דְּלָא טָבֵיל, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא בַּשְּׁבִיעִי הוּא דִּבְיָדוֹ לְתַקֵּן,
human_translation: No, Actually, I can say to you that one did not immerse, and it is necessary it could enter your mind to say it is on the seventh, for it is within his ability to remedy
llm_translation: Not, forever I will say to you that not immersed, and necessary. Presumably your opinion I say on the seventh, he has in his hand to fix,

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בַּשְּׁמִינִי דְּאֵין בְּיָדוֹ לְהַקְרִיב קׇרְבָּן, אֵימָא פָּשְׁעִי בֵּיהּ כֹּהֲנִים, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְרַב שְׁמַעְיָה.
human_translation: But on the eighth when it is not within his ability to sacrifice offering, say the priests will be negligent with him. teaches us in accordance with Rav Shemaya,
llm_translation: But in the eighth day, when he is not able to bring a sacrifice, let us say that the priests are guilty of a transgression, as Rav Shemaya teaches us.

hebrew_text: וְהַזָּבָה שׁוֹחֲטִין וְכוּ׳. תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: ״וְהַזָּבָה שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלֶיהָ בַּשְּׁבִיעִי שֶׁלָּהּ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זָבָה בַּשְּׁבִיעִי שֶׁלָּהּ מִי חַזְיָא? אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ, הָנֵי מִילֵּי טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ — דַּחֲזֵי לְאוּרְתָּא, הָא — עַד לִמְחַר דְּמַתְיָא כַּפָּרָה לָא חַזְיָא! אֵימָא: ״בַּשְּׁמִינִי״.
human_translation: We learned And a zava ; one slaughters The tanna taught before Rav Adda bar Ahava: And a zava , one slaughters on her behalf on her seventh He said to him: Is a zava fit on her seventh day? Even according to the one who says one slaughters and sprinkles on behalf of one who is impure from a creeping animal, this applies only to one who is ritually impure from a creeping animal, who will be fit by the evening, this will not be fit until the following day, when she brings her atonement say: eighth
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And for a woman with an abnormal uterine bleeding, one may slaughter the Passover offering for her, etc." A certain Tanna taught before Rav Adda bar Ahava: "And for a woman with an abnormal uterine bleeding, one may slaughter the Passover offering for her on her seventh day." He said to him: "Do we see a woman with an abnormal uterine bleeding on her seventh day? Even according to the one who says that we slaughter and sprinkle the blood on a ritually impure person who has touched a creeping thing, those matters of ritual impurity — they are visible until the morrow, but this — until the next day, the atonement is not visible!" Say: "On the eighth day."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא כֵּיוָן דִּמְחַסְּרָא כַּפָּרָה — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְרַב שְׁמַעְיָה.
human_translation: obvious lest you say since she lacks atonement teaches us in accordance with Rav Shemaya
llm_translation: It is obvious! What is the reasoning? Since it lacks atonement - no, it is teaching us as Rav Shemaya.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר — ״נִדָּה״ תְּנָא קַמֵּיהּ: ״וְהַנִּדָּה שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלֶיהָ בַּשְּׁבִיעִי״.
human_translation: Ravina said: taught a menstruating woman And a menstruating woman, one slaughters for her on the seventh
llm_translation: Ravina said - "Niddah" a Tanna taught before him: "And the niddah, they slaughter upon it on the seventh."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִדָּה בַּשְּׁבִיעִי מִי חַזְיָא? אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ, דַּחֲזֵי לְאוּרְתָּא, נִדָּה לְאוּרְתָּא דִשְׁבִיעִי הוּא דְּטָבְלָה, עַד שְׁמִינִי דְּעָבְדָה הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ לָא חַזְיָא! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: ״בַּשְּׁמִינִי״.
human_translation: He said to him: Is a menstruating woman fit on the seventh? Even according to the one who says one slaughters and sprinkles on behalf of one who is impure from a creeping animal, he will be fit by the evening. a menstruating woman immerses the night seventh until the eighth when she experiences the setting of the sun, she is not fit Rather, say: eighth
llm_translation: He said to him: "Regarding menstruation on the seventh day, who sees it? Even according to the one who says we slaughter and sprinkle on a ritually impure creeping animal, it is seen by light. Menstruation is seen by the light of the seventh day, which is when she immersed. Until the eighth day when she performed the evening immersion, it is not seen! Rather say: 'On the eighth day.'"

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה זָבָה דִּמְיחַסְּרָא כַּפָּרָה — שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עָלֶיהָ בַּשְּׁמִינִי, נִדָּה דְּלָא מְיחַסְּרָא כַּפָּרָה — צְרִיכָה לְמֵימַר דְּשָׁחֲטִינַן וְזָרְקִינַן עֲלַהּ?!
human_translation: obvious Now, just as a zava who lacks atonement one slaughters and sprinkles on her behalf on the eighth a menstruating woman, who does not lack atonement is it necessary to say that one slaughters and sprinkles on her behalf?
llm_translation: It is obvious! Now, if the issue of impurity is lacking atonement - we slaughter and sprinkle upon it on the eighth day. But in the case of impurity that is not lacking atonement - do we need to say that we slaughter and sprinkle upon it?!

hebrew_text: נִדָּה אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: בַּשְּׁמִינִי אִין, בַּשְּׁבִיעִי לָא, כִּדְתַנְיָא: כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי טְבִילוֹת טְבִילָתָן בַּיּוֹם, נִדָּה וְיוֹלֶדֶת טְבִילָתָן בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: it was necessary for a menstruating woman it teaches us on the eighth yes, on the seventh no, as it was taught all are obligated to immerse, their immersion is in the day, a menstruating woman and a woman after childbirth, immersion is at night.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Niddah itztricha lei, ha ka mashma lan: Ba'shmini ein, ba'shvi'i la, kid'tanya: Kol chayavei tevilot tevilatan bayom, niddah v'yoledet tevilatan balaila." Translation: "Niddah requires it, for it is implied to us: On the eighth day, no, on the seventh day, yes, as it was taught: All those obligated in immersion, their immersion is by day, the immersion of a niddah and a woman who gave birth is at night."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל תְּהֵא טוֹבֶלֶת מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים תִּהְיֶה בְּנִדָּתָהּ״ — תְּהֵא בְּנִדָּתָהּ כׇּל שִׁבְעָה. וְיוֹלֶדֶת אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְנִדָּה.
human_translation: As it was taught I might should immerse while still day, the verse states: she shall be in her impurity seven days” she shall be in her impurity full seven And a woman after childbirth, is compared to a menstruating woman
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Is it possible for a woman to immerse during the day? The Torah teaches: "She shall be in her impurity for seven days" - she shall be in her impurity for the entire seven days. And a woman who gives birth is connected to impurity.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹנֵן,
human_translation: An acute mourner,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Ha'onen,"

hebrew_text: וְהַמְפַקֵּחַ אֶת הַגַּל, וְכֵן מִי שֶׁהִבְטִיחוּהוּ לְהוֹצִיאוֹ מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִים, וְהַחוֹלֶה וְהַזָּקֵן שֶׁהֵן יְכוֹלִין לֶאֱכוֹל כְּזַיִת — שׁוֹחֲטִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: and one clearing a pile and similarly, one whom promised to release from prison and an ill person and an elderly person who are capable of eating an olive-bulk one slaughters on their behalf,
llm_translation: The one who removes the stone, and similarly one who they promised to bring him out from the prison, and the sick and the elderly who are able to eat an olive's worth - we slaughter for them.

hebrew_text: עַל כּוּלָּם אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין עֲלֵיהֶן בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן, שֶׁמָּא יָבִיאוּ אֶת הַפֶּסַח לִידֵי פְסוּל.
human_translation: with regard to all of them, we do not slaughter on their behalf by themselves, perhaps they will cause the Paschal lamb to become disqualified,
llm_translation: Regarding all of them, one does not slaughter on them in their own presence, lest they bring the Paschal lamb to a state of disqualification.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ אִם אֵירַע בָּהֶן פְּסוּל — פְּטוּרִין מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי, חוּץ מִן הַמְפַקֵּחַ בַּגַּל, שֶׁהוּא טָמֵא מִתְּחִלָּתוֹ.
human_translation: Therefore, if a disqualification occurred to them they are exempt from observing the second Pesaḥ . except for one who was clearing a pile because ritually impure from the outset,
llm_translation: Therefore, if an invalidity occurs in them - they are exempt from performing a second Passover sacrifice, except for the one who was opening the wine barrel, as he is impure from the outset.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין דְּגוֹי, אֲבָל בֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל — שׁוֹחֲטִין בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, כֵּיוָן דְּאַבְטְחִינְהוּ, מַפֵּיק לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״שְׁאֵרִית יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יַעֲשׂוּ עַוְלָה וְלֹא יְדַבְּרוּ כָזָב״.
human_translation: Rabba bar Huna said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They taught only a prison belonging to gentiles; but a prison belonging to Jews, one slaughters by himself Since they promised him they will release him, as it is written: “The remnant of Israel will not do iniquity nor speak lies”
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabba bar Huna said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: They only taught this regarding the slaughterhouse of a gentile, but in the slaughterhouse of a Jew - one may slaughter by himself, since he trusts him, he may take it out, as it is written: "The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity nor speak lies."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ בֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין דְּגוֹיִם, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא חוּץ לְחוֹמַת בֵּית פָּאגֵי. אֲבָל לִפְנִים מֵחוֹמַת בֵּית פָּאגֵי — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלָיו בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא — אֶפְשָׁר דְּאַמְטוּ לֵיהּ וְאָכֵיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: that which you said, a prison belonging to gentiles, they said outside the wall of Beit Pagei, But within the wall of Beit Pagei, one slaughters on his behalf by himself What is the reason? it is possible for them to bring him and he will eat it
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: This that you said, "A house of non-Jews," we only said this regarding outside the wall of Beit Pagi. But inside the wall of Beit Pagi, one may slaughter on it by itself. What is the reason? It is possible that they designated it and ate from it.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ אִם אֵירַע וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא גַּל עָגוֹל, אֲבָל גַּל אָרוֹךְ — פָּטוּר מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי, אֵימָא: טָהוֹר הָיָה בִּשְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: Therefore, if occurred Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They taught only a round pile. But a long pile he is exempt from observing the second Pesaḥ , say he was ritually pure at the time of the slaughter.
llm_translation: Therefore, if it should happen, etc. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: They only taught regarding a round lump, but a long lump - he is exempt from performing the second Passover. I might say: He was pure at the time of slaughter.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: מְפַקֵּחַ בַּגַּל — עִתִּים פָּטוּר עִתִּים חַיָּיב. כֵּיצַד? גַּל עָגוֹל וְנִמְצֵאת טוּמְאָה תַּחְתָּיו — חַיָּיב, גַּל אָרוֹךְ וְנִמְצֵאת טוּמְאָה תַּחְתָּיו — פָּטוּר, אֵימָא טָהוֹר הָיָה בִּשְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: That was also taught Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: One who clears a pile of stones is sometimes exempt sometimes obligated. How so? a round pile of stones and ritual impurity was found underneath it, he is obligated a long pile of stones and ritual impurity was found underneath it, he is exempt, say he was pure at the time of the slaughter.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, says: If one uncovers a barrel - sometimes he is exempt, sometimes he is liable. How so? If it is a round barrel and impurity is found beneath it - he is liable; if it is a long barrel and impurity is found beneath it - he is exempt. Perhaps it was pure at the time of slaughter.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הַיָּחִיד — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר. וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲבוּרָה שֶׁל מֵאָה שֶׁאֵינָן יְכוֹלִין לֶאֱכוֹל כְּזַיִת — אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: We do not slaughter the Paschal lamb on behalf of an individual, this is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Yosei permits And even a group of one hundred who are unable to eat an olive-bulk we do not slaughter on their behalf.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not slaughter the Paschal lamb for an individual - these are the words of Rabbi Yehuda, while Rabbi Yosei permits it. And even if a group of one hundred people cannot eat as much as an olive's worth, one may not slaughter for them.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין חֲבוּרַת נָשִׁים וַעֲבָדִים וּקְטַנִּים.
human_translation: And we do not make a group of women, slaves, and minors.
llm_translation: And not do make group of women and slaves and minors.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הַיָּחִיד, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תוּכַל לִזְבֹּחַ אֶת הַפָּסַח בְּאַחַד״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יָחִיד וְיָכוֹל לְאׇכְלוֹ — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלָיו, עֲשָׂרָה וְאֵין יְכוֹלִין לְאׇכְלוֹ — אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: The Sages taught From where that we do not slaughter a Paschal lamb on behalf on an individual? The verse states: “You may not sacrifice the Paschal lamb in any one the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Yosei says: an individual and he is able to eat one slaughters it on his behalf; ten and they are unable to eat we do not slaughter it on their behalf.
llm_translation: The sages taught: From where do we derive that one does not slaughter the Passover offering for an individual? The verse states: "You may not slaughter the Passover offering within any of your gates," the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Yosei says: If an individual is able to eat it - one may slaughter it for him, even if there are ten individuals who are unable to eat it - one may not slaughter it for them.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הַאי ״בְּאַחַד״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִין לַזּוֹבֵחַ אֶת פִּסְחוֹ בְּבָמַת יָחִיד בִּשְׁעַת אִיסּוּר הַבָּמוֹת שֶׁהוּא בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה —
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Yosei do this “in any one,” He needs it for that which Rabbi Shimon expounded, as it was taught Rabbi Shimon says: From where do we know that one who sacrifices his Paschal lamb on an improvised altar, at a time the prohibition of improvised altars he a negative mitzva?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, this "in one" what does he do with it? He requires it according to Rabbi Shimon. As it was taught, Rabbi Shimon says: From where do we derive that one may slaughter his Passover sacrifice on a private altar during the prohibition of altars, which is a negative commandment —

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תוּכַל לִזְבֹּחַ אֶת הַפָּסַח בְּאַחַד שְׁעָרֶיךָ״. יָכוֹל אַף בִּשְׁעַת הֶיתֵּר הַבָּמוֹת כֵּן, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּאַחַד שְׁעָרֶיךָ״ — לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל נִכְנָסִין בְּשַׁעַר אֶחָד.
human_translation: The verse states: “You may not slaughter the Paschal lamb in any one of your gates.” I might even at a time permitted improvised altars is so; the verse states “in any one of your gates,” was said only when all of the Jewish people enter into one gate,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "You may not slaughter the Passover sacrifice in any of your towns." Could this also apply during the time when the altars were permitted? The Talmud teaches: "In any of your towns" - they only said this at a time when all of Israel would enter through one gate.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הַאי מְנָא לֵיהּ? תַּרְתֵּי שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, from where does he this you learn two things from
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, this count to him? Two hear from her.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, מִמַּאי דִּלְהָכִי דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? דִּילְמָא כִּדְקָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הוּא דַּאֲתָא? אָמַר לָךְ: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּהָא כְּתִיב: ״אִישׁ לְפִי אׇכְלוֹ״.
human_translation: And for Rabbi Yosei, from where as Rabbi Shimon said Perhaps it comes Rabbi Yehuda said? said to you: This cannot enter your mind, because it is written “According to every man’s eating
llm_translation: And to Rabbi Yosei, from what does it appear that Rabbi Shimon is saying? Perhaps as Rabbi Yehuda said, he is the one who came? He said to you: Your opinion did not arise, for it is written: "Each according to his eating."

hebrew_text: רָמֵי לֵיהּ רַב עוּקְבָא בַּר חִינָּנָא מִפָּרִישְׁנָא לְרָבָא: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הַיָּחִיד? וּרְמִינְהוּ: אִשָּׁה בָּרִאשׁוֹן — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלֶיהָ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, וּבַשֵּׁנִי עוֹשִׂין אוֹתָהּ טְפֵילָה לַאֲחֵרִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא תֵּימָא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן.
human_translation: Rav Ukva bar Ḥinana from Perishna raised a contradiction to Rava: Did Rabbi Yehuda say: We do not slaughter the Paschal lamb on behalf of an individual? we may raise a contradiction a woman, on the first one slaughters on her behalf, by herself. And on the second we make her ancillary to others, this is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. said to him: Do not say by herself; rather, say by themselves.
llm_translation: Rav Ukva bar Chinana raised an objection to Rava: Who said that Rabbi Yehuda holds that one does not slaughter the Paschal lamb for an individual? And we ask: A woman in the first case - they slaughter it for her separately, and in the second case, they make it a group offering for others, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. He said to him: Do not say "for her separately," rather say: "separately for themselves."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי עָבְדִינַן חֲבוּרָה שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ נָשִׁים? וְהָתְנַן: אֵין עוֹשִׂין חֲבוּרַת נָשִׁים וַעֲבָדִים וּקְטַנִּים, מַאי לָאו — נָשִׁים לְחוֹדַיְיהוּ, וַעֲבָדִים לְחוֹדַיְיהוּ, וּקְטַנִּים לְחוֹדַיְיהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, נָשִׁים וַעֲבָדִים וּקְטַנִּים. נָשִׁים וַעֲבָדִים — מִשּׁוּם תִּפְלוּת, קְטַנִּים וַעֲבָדִים — מִשּׁוּם
human_translation: said to him: Do we make a group that is entirely women? didn’t we learn We do not make a group of women, slaves, and minors. What, is not women by themselves and slaves by themselves and minors by themselves? said to him: No, women and slaves and minors women and slaves, due to frivolity. minors and slaves, due to
llm_translation: He said to him: Who performed a group that its entirety is women? And we learned in a Mishnah: They do not make a group of women, slaves, and minors. What is the reason? Is it not that women by themselves, and slaves by themselves, and minors by themselves? He said to him: No, women and slaves and minors. Women and slaves - because of prayer, minors and slaves - because of

hebrew_text: פְּרִיצוּתָא.
human_translation: promiscuity,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text "פְּרִיצוּתָא" can be translated into English as "Pritzuta."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: אִשָּׁה בָּרִאשׁוֹן — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלֶיהָ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, וּבַשֵּׁנִי עוֹשִׂין אוֹתָהּ טְפֵילָה לַאֲחֵרִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אִשָּׁה בַּשֵּׁנִי — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלֶיהָ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר בָּרִאשׁוֹן. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אִשָּׁה בָּרִאשׁוֹן — עוֹשִׂין אוֹתָהּ טְפֵילָה לַאֲחֵרִים, בַּשֵּׁנִי אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלֶיהָ כָּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: the matter itself, A woman; on the first one slaughters on her behalf by herself. And on the second we make her ancillary to others, this is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: A woman; on the second one slaughters on her behalf by herself. And needless to say on the first Rabbi Shimon says: A woman; on the first we make her ancillary to others, on the second we do not slaughter on her behalf at all.
llm_translation: Body: A woman in the first case - they slaughter upon her in her own presence, and in the second case they make her forbidden to others, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: A woman in the second case - they slaughter upon her in her own presence, and needless to say in the first case. Rabbi Shimon says: A woman in the first case - they make her forbidden to others, in the second case they do not slaughter upon her at all.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: ״בְּמִכְסַת נְפָשֹׁת״, וַאֲפִילּוּ נָשִׁים. וְכִי תֵּימָא, אִי הָכִי אֲפִילּוּ בַּשֵּׁנִי נָמֵי? כְּתִיב: ״חֶטְאוֹ יִשָּׂא הָאִישׁ הַהוּא״. אִישׁ — אִין, אִשָּׁה — לָא.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi Yehuda holds “According to the number of the souls and even women, And if you say if so, even on the second also it is written “That man shall bear his sin” a man, yes, a woman, no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: With what do they disagree? Rabbi Yehuda holds: "With a ransom for lives," even for women. And if you would say, does this apply even to the second tithe? It is written: "That man shall bear his iniquity." Man - yes, woman - no.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, אִי הָכִי אֲפִילּוּ טְפִילָה נָמֵי בַּשֵּׁנִי לָא? אַהֲנִי ״כְּכׇל חֻקַּת הַפֶּסַח״ לִטְפִילָה בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And if you say if so, even ancillary on the second no “According to the entire statute of the Paschal lamb effective a merely ancillary
llm_translation: And if you will say, if so, even the second dipping alone not? This is like "according to all the statutes of the Passover" for dipping in general.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַאי טַעְמָא? דִּכְתִיב בָּרִאשׁוֹן: ״בְּמִכְסַת נְפָשֹׁת״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ אִשָּׁה, וּכְתִיב בְּפֶסַח שֵׁנִי: ״וְנִכְרְתָה הַנֶּפֶשׁ הַהִוא מֵעַמֶּיהָ״, נֶפֶשׁ — וַאֲפִילּוּ נָשִׁים. וְאֶלָּא: ״חֶטְאוֹ יִשָּׂא הָאִישׁ הַהוּא״, לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לְמַעוֹטֵי קָטָן מִכָּרֵת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, what is the reason As it is written first “According to the number of the souls,” even a woman. And it is written the second Pesaḥ : that same soul shall be cut off from among his people” soul even women. But “That man shall bear his sin,” to exclude what to exclude a minor from karet .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, what is the reason? For it is written in the first instance: "For the atonement of souls" — and even a woman, and it is written in the second Passover: "That soul shall be cut off from its people," soul — and even women. But rather: "That man shall bear his iniquity," to exclude what? To exclude a minor from being cut off.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כְּתִיב בָּרִאשׁוֹן ״אִישׁ״, אִישׁ — אִין, אִשָּׁה — לָא. וְכִי תֵּימָא, אִי הָכִי אֲפִילּוּ טְפִילָה נָמֵי לָא? אַהֲנִי לֵיהּ ״בְּמִכְסַת נְפָשֹׁת״ לִטְפִילָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, It is written first “man.” a man, yes, a woman, no. And if you say if so, even ancillary “According to the number of the souls,” effective an ancillary
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon: It is written in the first instance "man," man - no, woman - yes. And if you say, if so, even a minor girl also no? It is necessary for him "for the covering of souls" for immersion.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, אֲפִילּוּ בַּשֵּׁנִי נָמֵי. מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא בַּשֵּׁנִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״חֶטְאוֹ יִשָּׂא הָאִישׁ״, אִישׁ — אִין, אִשָּׁה — לָא. מִמַּאי קָמְמַעֵיט לֵיהּ? אִי מֵחִיּוּב — הַשְׁתָּא בָּרִאשׁוֹן לָא, בַּשֵּׁנִי מִיבַּעְיָא? אֶלָּא לָאו, מִטְּפִילָה.
human_translation: And if you say even on the second the Torah excludes on the second as it is written: “That man shall bear his sin.” a man, yes; a woman, no. From what exclude If from obligation now, on the first no on the second is it necessary Rather, is it not from an ancillary
llm_translation: And if you will say, even in the second half. The Merciful One is more lenient in the second half, as it is written: "His sin he shall bear, the man" - man, yes; woman, no. From where do we derive this? If from the obligation - now in the first instance it is not required, in the second instance it is needed? Rather, it is not so, it is from a superfluous expression.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״אִישׁ״ דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? אִי נֵימָא: ״וְיִקְחוּ לָהֶם אִישׁ שֶׂה לְבֵית אָבוֹת וְגוֹ׳״ — הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, דְּאָמַר: אִישׁ זוֹכֶה, וְאֵין קָטָן זוֹכֶה.
human_translation: And what is “man” that Rabbi Shimon spoke If we say “They shall take to them every man a lamb, according to their fathers’ houses, he needs that for Rabbi Yitzḥak, who said: a man, can acquire a minor cannot acquire
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is the meaning of "man" that Rabbi Shimon is saying? If you say: "And they shall take for themselves a man a sheep for a father's house, etc." — that is what Rabbi Yitzchak requires, for he said: A man acquires, and a minor does not acquire.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא ״מֵאִישׁ לְפִי אׇכְלוֹ״, הָא מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן נָמֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְהַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ דְּשׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הַיָּחִיד.
human_translation: Rather, from “According to every man’s eating Since Rabbi Yosei holds in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, Rabbi Shimon also holds in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, needs that that we may slaughter the Paschal lamb for an individual,
llm_translation: And rather "according to his eating," this is from Rabbi Yosei who holds like Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Shimon, however, holds like Rabbi Yosei. And that one requires that the Paschal lamb be slaughtered for an individual.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: אִם כֵּן נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״לְפִי אׇכְלוֹ״. מַאי ״אִישׁ״ — שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: said to you: If so, the Torah should have written: According to his eating, What “man”? you learn from two
llm_translation: He said to you: If so, it is written, "according to his eating." What is "a man" - you heard from it two.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אִשָּׁה בָּרִאשׁוֹן חוֹבָה וּבַשֵּׁנִי רְשׁוּת, וְדוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. אִי רְשׁוּת, אַמַּאי דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: בַּשֵּׁנִי רְשׁוּת וּבָרִאשׁוֹן חוֹבָה, וְדוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rabbi Elazar said: A woman’s in the first is mandatory, and in the second is optional and overrides Shabbat? If optional why does it override Shabbat? Rather, say: in the second is optional, and in the first is mandatory and overrides Shabbat. In accordance with whose It is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: As to whom does this statement go according to? This one that Rabbi Elazar said: In the first case, a woman is obligated, and in the second case, it is optional, and she overrides the Sabbath. If it is optional, why does she override the Sabbath? Rather say: In the second case, it is optional, and in the first case, she is obligated, and she overrides the Sabbath. As to whom? According to Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין עוֹשִׂין חֲבוּרָה שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ גֵּרִים, שֶׁמָּא יְדַקְדְּקוּ בּוֹ וִיבִיאוּהוּ לִידֵי פְּסוּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: We do not make a group that is entirely of converts, perhaps they will be meticulous and cause it to become disqualified.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov said Rabbi Yochanan: A mixture is not made with its entirety being converts, lest they scrutinize it and render it unfit.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פֶּסַח וּמַצָּה וּמָרוֹר, בָּרִאשׁוֹן — חוֹבָה, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — רְשׁוּת, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בָּאֲנָשִׁים חוֹבָה וּבַנָּשִׁים רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: The Sages taught Paschal lamb and matza and bitter herbs on the first is mandatory. From here on, it is optional. Rabbi Shimon says: For men it is mandatory and for women it is optional.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The Pesach offering, matzah, and bitter herbs on the first night - obligatory; from then on - optional. Rabbi Shimon says: For men, it is obligatory; for women, it is optional.

hebrew_text: אַהֵיָיא קָאֵי? אִילֵּימָא אַפֶּסַח, פֶּסַח כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִי אִיכָּא? וְאֶלָּא אַמַּצָּה וּמָרוֹר, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בָּאֲנָשִׁים חוֹבָה וּבְנָשִׁים רְשׁוּת,
human_translation: To which part refer? If you say to the Paschal lamb, is there a Paschal lamb all seven Rather, to matza and bitter herbs, say the last part Rabbi Shimon says: For men it is mandatory and for women it is optional.
llm_translation: Ahayya is standing? If you say Pesach, is there Pesach every seven days? Rather, it refers to Matzah and Maror. Let us say the latter part: Rabbi Shimon says: With men it is an obligation, and with women it is optional.

hebrew_text: לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת בַּאֲכִילַת מַצָּה דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תֹאכַל עָלָיו חָמֵץ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים תֹּאכַל עָלָיו מַצּוֹת״ — כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּבַל תֹּאכַל חָמֵץ, יֶשְׁנוֹ בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל מַצָּה. וְהָנֵי נָשִׁים, הוֹאִיל וְיֶשְׁנָן בְּבַל תֹּאכַל חָמֵץ, יֶשְׁנָן בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל מַצָּה!
human_translation: Does Rabbi Shimon not that which Rabbi Elazar said, that women are obligated in eating matza by Torah law, as it is stated: “You shall eat no leavened bread with it; seven days shall you eat matzot with it” all who are subject to the prohibition to not eat leavened bread subject arise and eat matza ? And those women, since they are subject to the prohibition to not eat leavened bread, they are subject also to arise and eat matza .
llm_translation: There is no response to Rabbi Shimon regarding what Rabbi Elazar said: Women are obligated in eating matzah during the Torah command, as it is stated: "You shall not eat upon it leaven; seven days you shall eat upon it matzot" — anyone who is obligated in not eating leaven, is obligated in rising to eat matzah. And these women, since they are obligated in not eating leaven, they are obligated in rising to eat matzah!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: פֶּסַח מַצָּה וּמָרוֹר, בָּרִאשׁוֹן — חוֹבָה, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — רְשׁוּת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: פֶּסַח בָּאֲנָשִׁים חוֹבָה, בַּנָּשִׁים רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: Rather, say Paschal lamb, matza , and bitter herbs on the first is mandatory. From here on, it is optional Rabbi Shimon says: Paschal lamb is mandatory for men and optional for women,
llm_translation: Rather say: The Passover offering, matzah, and bitter herbs, on the first night — obligatory, from here on — optional. Rabbi Shimon says: The Passover offering is obligatory for men, optional for women.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אוֹנֵן — טוֹבֵל וְאוֹכֵל אֶת פִּסְחוֹ לָעֶרֶב, אֲבָל לֹא בַּקֳּדָשִׁים. הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ עַל מֵתוֹ,
human_translation: An acute mourner, immerses and eats his Paschal lamb in the evening. But not sacrificial food. one who hears about his dead,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: An onen may immerse in a mikveh and eat his Paschal offering in the evening, but not eat consecrated items. If he hears about the death of his relative,

hebrew_text: וְהַמְלַקֵּט לוֹ עֲצָמוֹת — טוֹבֵל וְאוֹכֵל בַּקֳּדָשִׁים.
human_translation: And one who gathers bones immerse and eat sacrificial food
llm_translation: And the one who gathers his own bones - immerses and eats in the holy things.

hebrew_text: גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר בְּעֶרֶב פֶּסַח, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: טוֹבֵל וְאוֹכֵל אֶת פִּסְחוֹ לָעֶרֶב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: הַפּוֹרֵשׁ מִן הָעׇרְלָה כְּפוֹרֵשׁ מִן הַקֶּבֶר.
human_translation: a convert who converted on Passover eve, Beit Shammai say: He immerses and eats his Paschal lamb in the evening. And Beit Hillel say: One who separates from the foreskin like one who separates from the grave
llm_translation: A convert who converted on the eve of Passover, Beit Shammai say: He immerses and eats his Passover sacrifice in the evening, and Beit Hillel say: One who separates from the foreskin is like one who separates from the grave.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? קָא סָבַר אֲנִינוּת דְּלַיְלָה דְּרַבָּנַן, וְגַבֵּי פֶּסַח לֹא הֶעֱמִידוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶם בִּמְקוֹם כָּרֵת, גַּבֵּי קָדָשִׁים הַעֲמִידוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶם בִּמְקוֹם עֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: What is the reason holds acute mourning at night is a rabbinic And with regard to the Paschal lamb, they did not uphold their statement in a situation of karet , with regard to sacrificial food, they upheld their statement in a situation a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? He holds that the prohibition of eating at night, as decreed by the Rabbis, and regarding Passover they did not establish their words in a place of excision, but regarding sacrifices they did establish their words in a place of positive commandment.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ עַל מֵתוֹ וְכוּ׳. מְלַקֵּט עֲצָמוֹת? הָא בָּעֵי הַזָּאַת שְׁלִישִׁי וּשְׁבִיעִי! אֵימָא: שֶׁלִּיקְּטוּ לוֹ עֲצָמוֹת.
human_translation: One who hears about his dead one who gathers bones? But he needs sprinkling on third and seventh say: for whom they gathered bones,
llm_translation: The one who hears about his deceased and so forth. Is he gathering bones? This requires the third and seventh! Say: They gathered his bones.

hebrew_text: גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּעָרֵל גּוֹי,
human_translation: a convert who converted Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said the dispute is about an uncircumcised gentile
llm_translation: A convert who converted, etc. Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Dispute regarding the foreskin of a non-Jew,

hebrew_text: דְּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִטָּמֵא לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה, וְיֹאמַר: אֶישְׁתָּקַד, מִי לֹא טָבַלְתִּי וְאָכַלְתִּי? עַכְשָׁיו נָמֵי אֶטְבּוֹל וְאוֹכַל. וְלָא יָדַע דְּאֶשְׁתָּקַד — גּוֹי הֲוָה וְלָא מְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה, עַכְשָׁיו — יִשְׂרָאֵל וּמְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Beit Hillel hold there is a rabbinic decree perhaps he will become contaminated in the following year and he will say: Last year, did I not immerse and eat Now also, I will immerse and eat. And he does not know that last year, he was a gentile and he was not susceptible to ritual impurity, now he is a Jew and is susceptible to ritual impurity.
llm_translation: House of Hillel hold: decree lest he become impure for the following year, and he will say: "I have already immersed and eaten, who has not immersed and eaten? Now, too, let me immerse and eat." And he does not know that he has already immersed — he was a non-Jew and did not accept impurity, now — he is a Jew and accepts impurity.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: לָא גָּזְרִינַן. אֲבָל עָרֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל טוֹבֵל וְאוֹכֵל אֶת פִּסְחוֹ לָעֶרֶב, וְלָא גָּזְרִינַן עָרֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל מִשּׁוּם עָרֵל גּוֹי.
human_translation: And Beit Shammai hold that we do not make a decree But an uncircumcised Jew all agree that he may immerse and eat his Paschal lamb in the evening. and we do not decree uncircumcised Jew due to an uncircumcised gentile
llm_translation: House of Shammai holds: we do not decree. But an uncircumcised Israelite — everyone agrees may immerse and eat his Passover in the evening, and we do not decree against an uncircumcised Israelite because of a uncircumcised Gentile.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל עָרֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁטּוֹבֵל וְאוֹכֵל אֶת פִּסְחוֹ לָעֶרֶב, עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל עָרֵל גּוֹי. שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: טוֹבֵל וְאוֹכֵל אֶת פִּסְחוֹ לָעֶרֶב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: הַפּוֹרֵשׁ מִן הָעׇרְלָה כְּפוֹרֵשׁ מִן הַקֶּבֶר.
human_translation: That was also taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree about an uncircumcised Jew may immerse and eat his Paschal lamb in the evening. With regard to what did they disagree? With regard to an uncircumcised gentile Beit Shammai say he may immerse and eat his Paschal lamb in the evening, and Beit Hillel say one who separates from the foreskin is like one who separates from the grave.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in the name of the School of Hillel: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not dispute regarding a circumcised Israelite who immerses and eats his Passover sacrifice in the evening. What did they dispute about? They disputed about a circumcised non-Jew. Beit Shammai say: He may immerse and eat his Passover sacrifice in the evening, and Beit Hillel say: One who separates from the foreskin is like one who separates from the grave.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: עָרֵל הַזָּאָה וְאִיזְמֵל — הֶעֱמִידוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶן בִּמְקוֹם כָּרֵת. אוֹנֵן וּמְצוֹרָע וּבֵית הַפְּרָס — לֹא הֶעֱמִידוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶן בִּמְקוֹם כָּרֵת.
human_translation: Rava said: an uncircumcised sprinkling and scalpel [ izmel ], upheld their statement in a situation of karet . an acute mourner, a leper, and a beit haperas , they did not uphold their statement in a situation of karet .
llm_translation: Rava said: A foreskin and a wart - they established their words in a place of excision. A mourner, a leper, and a house of separation - they did not establish their words in a place of excision.

hebrew_text: עָרֵל — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: an uncircumcised as we have said
llm_translation: Uncircumcised - this that we have said.

hebrew_text: הַזָּאָה — דְּאָמַר מָר: הַזָּאָה שְׁבוּת וְאֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: sprinkling as the Master said Sprinkling rabbinic decree, and it does not override Shabbat
llm_translation: The zaa - as Mar said: the zaa is a sitting and does not push aside the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אִיזְמֵל — דְּתַנְיָא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין מְבִיאִין אוֹתוֹ דֶּרֶךְ רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, כָּךְ אֵין מְבִיאִין אוֹתוֹ דֶּרֶךְ גַּגּוֹת וְדֶרֶךְ חֲצֵרוֹת וְדֶרֶךְ קַרְפֵּיפוֹת.
human_translation: scalpel as it was taught just as we may not bring it through a public domain so we may not bring it through roofs, through courtyards, and through enclosures,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Izmel - detanya: k'shem she'ein mevi'in oto derech reshut harabim, kach ein mevi'in oto derech gagot v'derech chatzerot v'derech karpifot." English translation: "Izmel - as it was taught: Just as one does not bring it through a public domain, so too one does not bring it through rooftops, courtyards, and karpifot."

hebrew_text: אוֹנֵן — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: acute mourner is that which we said
llm_translation: Mourner — this that we have said.

hebrew_text: מְצוֹרָע — מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: מְצוֹרָע שֶׁחָל שְׁמִינִי שֶׁלּוֹ בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, וְרָאָה קֶרִי בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם — טוֹבֵל וְאוֹכֵל.
human_translation: leper, what is it? as it was taught A leper eighth day occurs on Passover eve, and he saw an occurrence on that day, he may immerse and eat
llm_translation: Afflicted person — what is it? As it was taught: An afflicted person who experiences his eighth day on the eve of Passover, and sees a seminal emission on that day — he immerses and eats.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁטְּבוּל יוֹם אֵינוֹ נִכְנָס, זֶה נִכְנָס. מוּטָב יָבֹא עֲשֵׂה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ כָּרֵת, וְיִדְחֶה עֲשֵׂה שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ כָּרֵת.
human_translation: The Sages said: Although one who has immersed on that day may not enter this one may enter. it is better for a positive mitzva that has karet , to come and override a positive mitzva that does not have karet ,
llm_translation: The sages said: Even though one who is a Tevul Yom does not enter, this one enters. It is better for him to perform a positive commandment that carries with it the penalty of excision, and to push aside a positive commandment that does not carry with it the penalty of excision.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה אֲפִילּוּ עֲשֵׂה אֵין בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעֲמֹד יְהוֹשָׁפָט בִּקְהַל יְהוּדָה וִירוּשָׁלִַים בְּבֵית ה׳ לִפְנֵי הֶחָצֵר הַחֲדָשָׁה״, מַאי חָצֵר הַחֲדָשָׁה? שֶׁחִדְּשׁוּ בּוֹ דָּבָר, וְאָמְרוּ: טְבוּל יוֹם לֹא יִכָּנֵס בְּמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: By Torah law, there is not even a positive mitzva as it is stated: “And Jehoshaphat stood in the congregation of Judea and Jerusalem, in the House of the Lord, before the new courtyard” What the new courtyard? that they innovated something in it, and they said: One who has immersed on that day may not enter the Levite camp,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: A matter of Torah, even if it has not been done, as it is stated: "And Jehoshaphat stood in the congregation of Judah and Jerusalem in the house of the Lord, before the new court." What is the new court? That they renewed a matter in it, and they said: One who is a tevul yom may not enter the camp of Levi.

hebrew_text: בֵּית הַפְּרָס, דִּתְנַן: וְשָׁוִין בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל
human_translation: beit haperas , as it was taught And Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree
llm_translation: The House of Persia, as we learned: And the House of Shammai and the House of Hillel are equal.

hebrew_text: שֶׁבּוֹדְקִין לְעוֹשֵׂי פֶסַח, וְאֵין בּוֹדְקִין לְאוֹכְלֵי תְרוּמָה.
human_translation: that we examine for those offering the Paschal lamb we do not examine for those eating teruma
llm_translation: They inspect for those who make Passover, but they do not inspect for those who eat terumah.

hebrew_text: מַאי בּוֹדְקִין (לְעוֹשֵׂי פֶּסַח)? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְנַפֵּחַ בֵּית הַפְּרָס וְהוֹלֵךְ. רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר אַבָּיֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: בֵּית הַפְּרָס שֶׁנִּידַּשׁ טָהוֹר.
human_translation: What is we examine for those offering the Paschal lamb? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One must blow the beit haperas as he walks Rav Yehuda bar Abaye in the name of Rav Yehuda said: A beit haperas that has been trodden ritually pure,
llm_translation: What is the inspection (for those preparing the Passover offering)? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One checks the Beit HaPars and proceeds. Rav Yehudah bar Abaye in the name of Rav Yehudah said: The Beit HaPars that was newly whitewashed is pure.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הָאִשָּׁה
llm_translation: We will return to you, woman.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָיָה טָמֵא אוֹ בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה וְלֹא עָשָׂה אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן — יַעֲשֶׂה אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי. שָׁגַג אוֹ נֶאֱנַס וְלֹא עָשָׂה אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן — יַעֲשֶׂה אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי. אִם כֵּן, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר טָמֵא אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה? שֶׁאֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין מֵהִכָּרֵת, וְאֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין בְּהִכָּרֵת.
human_translation: One who was impure or on a distant journey and did not observe first should observe the second unwittingly or prevented beyond his control and did not observe the first he should observe the second If so, why is it stated impure or on a distant journey? that these are exempt from karet but those are liable to karet ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who was impure or on a distant road and did not perform the first offering - should perform the second. If he erred or was compelled and did not perform the first - he should perform the second. If so, why is it stated impure or on a distant road? To teach that these are exempt from karet, while these are liable to karet.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר: הָיָה בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה וּשְׁחָטוֹ וְזָרְקוּ עָלָיו, רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: הוּרְצָה. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: לֹא הוּרְצָה. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: הוּרְצָה, מֵיחָס הוּא דְּחַס רַחֲמָנָא עָלָיו. וְאִי עָבֵיד — תָּבֹא עָלָיו בְּרָכָה. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: לֹא הוּרְצָה, מִידְחֵא דַּחְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא כְּטָמֵא.
human_translation: It was stated one was on a distant journey and slaughtered and sprinkled on his Rav Naḥman said: was accepted, Rav Sheshet said: was not accepted, Rav Naḥman said: was accepted the Torah has mercy on if he did blessing come upon him. And Rav Sheshet said: is not accepted the Torah deferred his as one who is ritually impure.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was on a distant road, and they slaughtered it and threw its blood upon him. Rav Nachman said: It was accepted. Rav Sheshet said: It was not accepted. Rav Nachman said: It was accepted, for the Merciful One had mercy on him. And if he does it, a blessing shall come upon him. And Rav Sheshet said: It was not accepted, for the Merciful One detests him like the impure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהָיָה טָמֵא אוֹ בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה וְלֹא עָשָׂה אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן — יַעֲשֶׂה אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי. מִכְּלָל דְּאִי בָּעֵי — עָבֵד.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: From where do I say As we learned One who was ritually impure or on a distant journey and did not observe first should observe the second by inference that had he wished, he observed
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: From where do I say this to her, as we learned: One who was impure or on a distant road and did not perform the first Passover sacrifice — should perform the second. By implication, if he desires — he may do so.

hebrew_text: וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר לָךְ: אִי הָכִי, סֵיפָא דְּקָתָנֵי: שָׁגַג אוֹ נֶאֱנַס וְלֹא עָשָׂה אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן — יַעֲשֶׂה אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי. מִדְּקָתָנֵי ״וְלֹא עָשָׂה״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִי בָּעֵי — עָבֵד. הֲרֵי שָׁגַג, וַהֲרֵי נֶאֱנַס!
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet said If so, the latter clause which teaches: unwittingly or prevented beyond his control and did not observe the first he should observe the second from that it is taught: And did not observe, by inference that had he wished, he observed as he unwittingly or prevented beyond his control
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said to you: If so, the latter part of the Mishnah teaches: If one erred or was compelled and did not perform the first offering, he should perform the second offering. From the fact that it teaches "and did not perform," it implies that if he wants to, he may perform the offering. Here is an error, and here is compulsion!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מֵזִיד קָתָנֵי בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ. הָכָא נָמֵי: אוֹנֵן קָתָנֵי בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, is teaching intentionally with Here, too, is teaching an acute mourner, with the
llm_translation: Rather, it teaches intentionally in their presence. Here it is stated: Onen teaches in their presence.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין מֵהִכָּרֵת וְאֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין בְּהִכָּרֵת. אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַשּׁוֹגֵג וְנֶאֱנָס, שׁוֹגֵג וְנֶאֱנָס בְּנֵי כָרֵת נִינְהוּ?! אֶלָּא לָאו — אַמֵּזִיד וְאוֹנֵן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The mishna is also precisely as it teaches: These are exempt from karet , but those are liable to karet . To which If we say to one who unwittingly and one who prevented beyond his control, are one who unwittingly and one prevented beyond his control subject to karet ? Rather, is it not intentionally and to an acute mourner,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah is precise, as it teaches: These are exempt from karet, and these are liable to karet. Is it possible? If you say it is unintentional and coerced, are those who are unintentional and coerced considered as if they are liable to karet?! Rather, no — intentional and defiant.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר לָךְ: לְעוֹלָם אַמֵּזִיד לְחוֹדֵיהּ. וּבְדִין הוּא דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִיתְנֵא ״חַיָּיב״, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי ״חַיָּיבִין״ — אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״פְּטוּרִין״, תְּנָא סֵיפָא ״חַיָּיבִין״.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said to you Actually, only to intentionally and by right it taught He is liable, And that it teaches are liable, since the first clause teaches are exempt, the latter clause teaches are liable,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said to you: Always intentionally to his advantage. And in a case where it is required to teach "liable," and this that it teaches "liable" - it is because a Tanna taught in the beginning "exempt," the latter Tanna taught "liable."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר ״טָמֵא״, וְנֶאֱמַר ״בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה״,
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I say As it was taught Rabbi Akiva says: It is stated that ritually impure and it is stated distant journey
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I say this to her? As it was taught, Rabbi Akiva says: It is stated "unclean," and it is stated "on a distant road."

hebrew_text: מָה טָמֵא, שֶׁסִּפֵּק בְּיָדוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת וְאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה. אַף דֶּרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה נָמֵי, שֶׁסִּפֵּק בְּיָדוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת וְאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה!
human_translation: just as ritually impure one who has the means to observe does not do so too, distant journey also who has the means to observe does not do
llm_translation: What is impure, that he has the ability in his hand to do but does not do. Also a distant path, that he has the ability in his hand to do but does not do!

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר לָךְ: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּקָסָבַר: אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ. וַאֲנָא סְבִירָא לִי כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר: שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said to you: Rabbi Akiva to his reasoning, as he holds that one not slaughter and sprinkle on one who is ritually impure a creeping animal, But I hold in accordance with the one who said: slaughter and sprinkle on one who is ritually impure creeping animal,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said to you: Rabbi Akiva according to his reasoning, for he holds: One does not slaughter and sprinkle on a ritually impure creeping thing. And I hold like the one who says: One slaughters and sprinkles on a ritually impure creeping thing.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, אֵלּוּ שֶׁעוֹשִׂין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי: הַזָּבִין וְהַזָּבוֹת, הַמְצוֹרָעִין וְהַמְצוֹרָעוֹת, [וְנִדּוֹת] וּבוֹעֲלֵי נִדּוֹת וְהַיּוֹלְדוֹת, הַשּׁוֹגְגִין וְהָאֲנוּסִין וְהַמְּזִידִין, וְטָמֵא וְשֶׁהָיָה בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה.
