human_translation: The Sages taught these who observe the second Zavim and zavot ; lepers and lepers; and menstruating women and those who had sexual relations with menstruating women; and women after childbirth; those who unwittingly, and those who prevented beyond their control, and those who intentionally and one who was ritually impure; and one who was on a distant journey.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: These are the ones who must bring a second offering: men with a discharge, women with a discharge, lepers, leprous women, menstruating women, men who have intercourse with menstruating women, women who have given birth, those who have unintentionally sinned, those who have been coerced to sin, and those who have intentionally sinned, and one who is impure and was on a distant road.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״טָמֵא״? לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר?! דְּאִי בָּעֵי לְמִיעְבַּד בָּרִאשׁוֹן לָא שָׁבְקִינַן לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא: אִם כֵּן, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה״ — לְפוֹטְרוֹ מִן הִכָּרֵת. וּכְמַאן דְּאָמַר הוּרְצָה.
human_translation: If so, why ritually impure stated Why is it stated? that if wishes to perform on the first we do not allow him Rather, Why one on a distant journey stated to exempt him from karet And the one who said it was accepted,
llm_translation: If so, why is it stated "impure"? Why is it stated?! For if it was necessary to be stringent in the first case, we should not have left it! Rather, if so, why is it stated "on a distant road" — to exempt him from excision. And as it says, "He desired."

hebrew_text: אִשָּׁה בַּשֵּׁנִי מִי מִיחַיְּיבָא? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: יָכוֹל לֹא יְהוּ עוֹשִׂין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי אֶלָּא טְמֵא נֶפֶשׁ וְשֶׁהָיָה בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה. זָבִין וּמְצוֹרָעִין וּבוֹעֲלֵי נִדּוֹת מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״.
human_translation: Is a woman obligated the second Wasn’t taught might only one impure a corpse or one who was on a distant journey observe the second zavim , lepers, and those who had sexual relations with menstruating women, from where The verse states: any man [ ish ish ]
llm_translation: A woman on the second, who is liable? And it was taught: Can it not be inferred that the second is only liable for impurity of the soul and when she was on a distant journey. Menstruants, lepers, and those who have intercourse with menstruants, from where? The Scripture teaches: "Each man."

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הָא — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: not difficult: This Rabbi Yosei that Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - Rabbi Yosei, this - Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חַיָּיב כָּרֵת עַל הָרִאשׁוֹן, וְחַיָּיב כָּרֵת עַל הַשֵּׁנִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיב כָּרֵת עַל הָרִאשׁוֹן, וּפָטוּר עַל הַשֵּׁנִי. רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא אוֹמֵר: אַף [עַל] הָרִאשׁוֹן אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב כָּרֵת אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן לֹא עָשָׂה אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: The Sages taught is liable to karet for the first is liable to karet the second the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Natan says: One is liable to karet for the first and one is exempt for the second Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya says: Even for the first one is liable to karet only if he fails to observe the second
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One is liable to karet for the first offense, and one is liable to karet for the second, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Nathan says: One is liable to karet for the first, and exempt for the second. Rabbi Hananiah ben Akavya says: Even for the first, one is not liable to karet unless he did not do the second.

hebrew_text: וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ. דְּתַנְיָא: גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר בֵּין שְׁנֵי פְסָחִים, וְכֵן קָטָן שֶׁהִגְדִּיל בֵּין שְׁנֵי פְסָחִים — חַיָּיב לַעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁזָּקוּק לָרִאשׁוֹן — זָקוּק לַשֵּׁנִי, כֹּל שֶׁאֵין זָקוּק לָרִאשׁוֹן — אֵין זָקוּק לַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: follow their reasoning As it was taught A convert who converted between the two Paschal lambs and similarly, a minor who grew up between the two Paschal lambs, is obligated to observe the second Pesaḥ ; the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Natan says: Whoever needs the first needs the second; whoever does not need the first does not need the second
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons. As it was taught: A convert who converted between two Passovers, and similarly a minor who reached maturity between two Passovers - is obligated to observe a second Passover, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Nathan says: Anyone who was connected to the first Passover is connected to the second; anyone who was not connected to the first is not connected to the second.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי סָבַר: שֵׁנִי רֶגֶל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi holds the second is its own Festival,
llm_translation: With what does he disagree? Rabbi holds: Two legs by themselves it is.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נָתָן סָבַר: שֵׁנִי תַּשְׁלוּמִין דְּרִאשׁוֹן הוּא. תַּקּוֹנֵי לָרִאשׁוֹן, לָא מְתַקֵּין לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Natan holds the second is a redress for the first it does not repair the the first
llm_translation: Rabbi Natan holds: the second payment of the first one it is. The enactments of the first one, they do not enact for it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא סָבַר: שֵׁנִי תַּקַּנְתָּא דְרִאשׁוֹן הוּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya held: The second repairs the first
llm_translation: Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya holds: The second enactment of the first one it is.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁלׇשְׁתָּן מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״וְהָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר הוּא טָהוֹר וּבְדֶרֶךְ לֹא הָיָה״. רַבִּי סָבַר: ״וְחָדַל לַעֲשׂוֹת הַפֶּסַח וְנִכְרְתָה״, דְּלָא עֲבַד בָּרִאשׁוֹן, אִי נָמֵי: ״קׇרְבַּן ה׳ לֹא הִקְרִיב בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״, בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: And three of them expounded the same verse “But the man who is ritually pure, and is not on a journey, Rabbi holds “And refrains from offering the Paschal lamb, shall be cut off,” that he did not participate the first If he also “did not bring the offering of the Lord in its appointed season,” the second
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And three scholars interpreted one verse: "And the man who is pure and did not happen to be on the road." Rabbi holds: "And he ceased to perform the Passover and shall be cut off," for he did not perform it in the first month, or perhaps it means: "The offering of the Lord he did not bring at its appointed time," in the second month. English translation:

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי (דְּהָא) ״חֶטְאוֹ יִשָּׂא״ כָּרֵת הוּא?
human_translation: And from where that this Shall bear his sin, karet
llm_translation: And from where (that) "his sin he shall bear" is it a cutting off?

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר: מְגַדֵּף הַיְינוּ מְבָרֵךְ הַשֵּׁם, וּכְתִיב בִּמְבָרֵךְ אֶת הַשֵּׁם ״וְנָשָׂא חֶטְאוֹ״.
human_translation: He holds blasphemer this is one who blesses the name And it is written with regard to one who blesses the name shall bear his sin”
llm_translation: He holds: One who curses blesses the Name, and it is written in blessing the Name "and he shall bear his sin."

hebrew_text: וְגָמַר הַאי ״חֶטְאוֹ״ דְּהָכָא, מֵ״חֶטְאוֹ״ דְּהָתָם: מָה לְהַלָּן כָּרֵת, אַף כָּאן נָמֵי כָּרֵת.
human_translation: And learned this his sin,” here, from his sin” there, Just as later, karet , so too here, karet .
llm_translation: And he concluded this "sin" here, from the "sin" there: just as there it is excision, so too here it is excision.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי נָתָן סָבַר: ״וְחָדַל לַעֲשׂוֹת הַפֶּסַח וְנִכְרְתָה״, דְּהַאי ״כִּי״ — לְשׁוֹן דְּהָא הוּא, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: דְּהָא ״קׇרְבַּן ה׳ לֹא הִקְרִיב בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״ בָּרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Natan holds “And refrains from offering the Paschal lamb, shall be cut off this ki meaning of: Because. And this is the Torah is saying: “Because he did not bring the offering of the Lord in its appointed season,” the first
llm_translation: Rabbi Nathan holds: "And he ceased to perform the Passover and shall be cut off," for this "ki" - the language of this is, and thus the Merciful One says: for this "the offering of the Lord he did not bring in its appointed time" in the first.

hebrew_text: הַאי ״חֶטְאוֹ יִשָּׂא״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? קָסָבַר: מְגַדֵּף לָאו הַיְינוּ מְבָרֵךְ אֶת הַשֵּׁם, וְגָמַר הַאי ״חֶטְאוֹ״ דְּהָתָם מֵהַאי ״חֶטְאוֹ״ דְּהָכָא. מָה הָכָא כָּרֵת — אַף הָתָם כָּרֵת.
human_translation: that He shall bear his sin, what does do with it? holds the blasphemer is not blesses the name He learned that “his sin,” there, from this “his sin” here, Just as here, karet , so too there, karet .
llm_translation: This "his sin he shall bear," what does it do for him? He holds: One who blasphemes is not the same as one who blesses the Name, and he completes this "his sin" from there, from this "his sin" from here. Just as here it is excision - so too there it is excision.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא סָבַר: ״וְחָדַל לַעֲשׂוֹת הַפֶּסַח וְנִכְרְתָה״, אִי ״קׇרְבַּן ה׳ לֹא הִקְרִיב בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״ — בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya holds “And refrained from participating the Paschal lamb, shall be cut off if he did not bring the offering of the Lord in its appointed season,” on the second
llm_translation: Rabbi Hananiah ben Akavya holds: "And if he ceases to perform the Passover, he shall be cut off," whether "he did not bring the offering of the Lord in its appointed time" - on the second day.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי ״חֶטְאוֹ יִשָּׂא״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? כְּדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: And that “He shall bear his sin,” what does do with it? as we said
llm_translation: And this "his sin he shall bear," what does it do for him? As we said.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ: הֵזִיד בָּזֶה וּבָזֶה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל חַיָּיב, שָׁגַג בָּזֶה וּבָזֶה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Therefore, intentionally on both all agree liable unwittingly on both all agree exempt
llm_translation: Therefore: intentional in this and this - the words of everyone are liable, unintentional in this and this - the words of everyone are exempt.

hebrew_text: הֵזִיד בָּרִאשׁוֹן וְשָׁגַג בַּשֵּׁנִי, לְרַבִּי וּלְרַבִּי נָתָן — מִחַיְּיבִי, לְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: intentionally on the first and unwittingly on the second, to Rabbi and Rabbi Natan he liable to Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya exempt,
llm_translation: Intentional in the first and unintentional in the second, according to Rabbi and according to Rabbi Nathan - liable; according to Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya - exempt.

hebrew_text: שָׁגַג בָּרִאשׁוֹן וְהֵזִיד בַּשֵּׁנִי, לְרַבִּי — חַיָּיב. לְרַבִּי נָתָן וּלְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: unwittingly on the first and intentionally on the second to Rabbi he is liable, to Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya, exempt
llm_translation: Mistaken in the first and intentional in the second, according to Rabbi - liable. According to Rabbi Natan and according to Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya - exempt.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵיזוֹ הִיא דֶּרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה? מִן הַמּוֹדִיעִים וְלַחוּץ, וּכְמִדָּתָהּ לְכׇל רוּחַ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מֵאִיסְקוּפַּת הָעֲזָרָה וְלַחוּץ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לְפִיכָךְ נָקוּד עַל ה׳, לוֹמַר: לָא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרָחוֹק וַדַּאי, אֶלָּא מֵאִיסְקוּפַּת הָעֲזָרָה וְלַחוּץ.
human_translation: What is the a distant journey from the Modi’im and beyond, and distance in every direction; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Eliezer says: From the threshold of the courtyard and beyond Rabbi Yosei said to him: Therefore, dotted over the heh to say it is not because he is really distant; rather, from the threshold of the courtyard and beyond.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: What is considered a distant path? From the Modiim and outward, and according to its measure for every spirit, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Eliezer says: From the Azarah balcony and outward. Rabbi Yose said to him: Therefore it is punctuated on the letter Hei, to say: Not because it is truly distant, but rather from the Azarah balcony and outward.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר עוּלָּא: מִן הַמּוֹדִיעִים לִירוּשָׁלַיִם חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר מִילִין הָוְיָא. סָבַר לַהּ כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כַּמָּה מַהֲלַךְ אָדָם בַּיּוֹם — עֲשָׂרָה פַּרְסָאוֹת: מֵעֲלוֹת הַשַּׁחַר וְעַד הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה חֲמֵשֶׁת מִילִין, מִשְּׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה וְעַד צֵאת הַכּוֹכָבִים חֲמֵשֶׁת מִילִין. פָּשׁוּ לֵהּ תְּלָתִין: חֲמֵיסַר מִצַּפְרָא לְפַלְגָא דְיוֹמָא, וַחֲמֵיסַר מִפַּלְגָא דְיוֹמָא לְאוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: Ulla said: from the Modi’im to Jerusalem is fifteen mil . He held like this that Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: How can an person walk on an day? ten parasangs [ parsaot ], From dawn until sunrise five mil , from sunset until the emergence of the stars five mil . thirty remaining Fifteen from the morning until midday, and fifteen from midday until evening.
llm_translation: Gemara said Ula: From the informers to Jerusalem fifteen mil was. Thought to him as this that said Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan: How much does a person walk in a day - ten parasangs: from the rising of the dawn until the sun rises five mil, from the setting of the sun until the emergence of the stars five mil. They explained to him thirty: fifteen from the morning to midday, and fifteen from midday to evening.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: אֵי זֶה הוּא דֶּרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה? כֹּל שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לִיכָּנֵס בִּשְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: Ulla to his reasoning as Ulla said: What is a distant journey? any one is unable to enter by the time of the slaughter
llm_translation: Ula according to his reasoning, for Ula said: Who is considered one who is far away? Anyone who cannot enter at the time of slaughter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מֵעֲלוֹת הַשַּׁחַר עַד הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה חֲמֵשֶׁת מִילִין, מְנָא לַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וּכְמוֹ הַשַּׁחַר עָלָה וַיָּאִיצוּ הַמַּלְאָכִים וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ יָצָא עַל הָאָרֶץ וְלוֹט בָּא צוֹעֲרָה״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי הָהוּא אַתְרָא וְהָוְיָא חֲמִשָּׁה מִילִין.
human_translation: The Master said from dawn until sunrise five mil . From where do we As it is written: “And when the morning arose, the angels hastened Lot, and it is written: “The sun was risen upon the earth when Lot came to Zoar” and Rabbi Ḥanina said: I myself saw that place, and it is five mil .
llm_translation: Master said: From the rising of the dawn until the sun's zenith is five mil, how do we know? As it is written: "And as the dawn arose, the angels urged Lot, etc.," and it is written: "The sun had risen upon the earth when Lot entered Zoar." And Rabbi Chanina said: In my opinion, that place appears to me to be five mil.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר עוּלָּא: אֵיזֶה הוּא דֶּרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה? כֹּל שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לִיכָּנֵס בִּשְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה. וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לִיכָּנֵס בִּשְׁעַת אֲכִילָה.
human_translation: the matter itself. Ulla said: What is a distant journey; any one is unable to enter by the time of the slaughter And Rav Yehuda said: Any one is unable to enter during the time of the eating,
llm_translation: The body, Ula said: What is considered a distant path? Anything that cannot enter at the time of slaughter. And Rav Yehudah said: Anything that cannot enter at the time of eating.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה לְעוּלָּא: לְדִידָךְ קַשְׁיָא וּלְרַב יְהוּדָה קַשְׁיָא. לְדִידָךְ קַשְׁיָא, דְּאָמְרַתְּ: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לִיכָּנֵס בִּשְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה, וְהָא טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ — דְּאֵין יָכוֹל לִיכָּנֵס בִּשְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה, וְקָאָמְרַתְּ: שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: Rabba said to Ulla: to your difficult, and to Rav Yehuda’s difficult. to your difficult, as you said any one is unable to enter by the time of the slaughter Yet one who is ritually impure creeping animal, who is unable to enter at the time of the slaughter you said: One slaughter and sprinkle on one who is ritually impure creeping animal,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabba said to Ulai: According to your opinion it is difficult, and according to Rav Yehuda's opinion it is difficult. According to your opinion it is difficult, for you say: Anyone who cannot enter at the time of slaughter, and a ritually impure creature - for it cannot enter at the time of slaughter, and you are saying: We slaughter and throw upon a ritually impure creature.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב יְהוּדָה קַשְׁיָא, דְּאָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לִיכָּנֵס בִּשְׁעַת אֲכִילָה, וְהָא טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ — דְּיָכוֹל לִיכָּנֵס בִּשְׁעַת אֲכִילָה, וְקָאָמַר: אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עַל טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ!
human_translation: And to Rav Yehuda’s difficult, as he said any one is unable to enter during the time of the eating yet one who is ritually impure creeping animal, who enter at the time of the eating, he said One not slaughter and sprinkle on one who is ritually impure creeping animal,
llm_translation: And for Rav Yehudah it is difficult, for he said: Anyone who cannot enter at the time of eating, and this impure creature — who can enter at the time of eating, and he said: We do not slaughter and sprinkle on an impure creature!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא לְדִידִי קַשְׁיָא וְלָא לְרַב יְהוּדָה קַשְׁיָא. לְדִידִי לָא קַשְׁיָא: דֶּרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה לַטָּהוֹר, וְאֵין דֶּרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה לַטָּמֵא.
human_translation: said to him: According to my not difficult, and according to Rav Yehuda’s not difficult. According to my not difficult a distant journey to one who is ritually pure, and the distant journey not to one who is ritually impure.
llm_translation: He said to him: Not for me is the difficulty, and not for Rav Yehuda is the difficulty. For me, it is not difficult: the way is far for the pure, and there is no far way for the impure.

hebrew_text: לְרַב יְהוּדָה לָא קַשְׁיָא: טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ רַחֲמָנָא דַּחְיֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ כִּי יִהְיֶה טָמֵא לָנֶפֶשׁ״, מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן שֶׁחָל שְׁבִיעִי שֶׁלּוֹ לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא — לִידְּחֵי.
human_translation: According to Rav Yehuda’s not difficult, the Torah deferred one who is ritually impure creeping animal as it is written: “If any man of you or of your generations shall be ritually impure due to a dead body” Are we not dealing his seventh occurs on Passover eve, And nonetheless the Torah stated his shall be deferred.
llm_translation: To Rav Yehudah it is not difficult: "Impure is the creeping thing," the Merciful One has pushed it away, as it is written: "Any man who becomes impure for a soul." Who are we not dealing with that he defiled his seventh day to be on the eve of Passover, and even so the Merciful One said - to push away.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה עוֹמֵד חוּץ לַמּוֹדִיעִים, וְיָכוֹל לִיכָּנֵס בְּסוּסִים וּבִפְרָדִים, יָכוֹל יְהֵא חַיָּיב — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבְדֶרֶךְ לֹא הָיָה״, וְהַלָּה הָיָה בַּדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one was standing outside the of Modi’im and was able to enter on horses or mules might he would be liable therefore, the verse states: “And is not on a journey” This was on a journey
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If one was standing outside the designated area for informing the congregation, and he could enter with horses and mules, he may still be liable — this is derived from the verse "And he was not on the road," and he was on the road.

hebrew_text: הָיָה עוֹמֵד לִפְנִים מִן הַמּוֹדִיעִים, וְאֵין יָכוֹל לִיכָּנֵס מִפְּנֵי גְּמַלִּים וּקְרוֹנוֹת הַמְעַכְּבוֹת אוֹתוֹ, יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבְדֶרֶךְ לֹא הָיָה״, וַהֲרֵי לֹא הָיָה בַּדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: one was standing closer than Modi’im was not able to enter due to the camels and carriages that are delaying him, might he would not be liable therefore, the verse states: “And was not on a journey,” and was not on a journey
llm_translation: He was standing in front of the informers, and he could not enter because of camels and obstructing horns, he can say, "Let him not be liable" - the Talmud teaches: "And he was not on the road," and indeed he was not on the road.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שִׁיתָּא אַלְפֵי פַּרְסֵי הָוֵי עָלְמָא, וְסוּמְכָא דִרְקִיעָא אַלְפָּא פַּרְסֵי. חֲדָא גְּמָרָא, וַחֲדָא סְבָרָא.
human_translation: Rava said: The world is six thousand parasangs, and the thickness of the firmament is one thousand parasangs. One is a tradition, and one is reasoning.
llm_translation: Rava said: Six thousand Parsa should be the world, and the support of the firmament is one thousand Parsa. One is a tradition, and one is a logical deduction.

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כַּמָּה מַהֲלַךְ אָדָם בֵּינוֹנִי בַּיּוֹם — עֶשֶׂר פַּרְסָאוֹת: מֵעֲלוֹת הַשַּׁחַר וְעַד הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה חֲמִשָּׁה מִילִין, מִשְּׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה עַד צֵאת הַכּוֹכָבִים חֲמִשָּׁה מִילִין, נִמְצָא עוֹבְיוֹ שֶׁל רָקִיעַ אֶחָד מִשִּׁשָּׁה בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: holds like that which Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: How far can an average person walk in a day? ten parasangs, From dawn until sunrise five mil ; from sunset until the emergence of the stars five mil . it is found the thickness of the firmament is one-sixth the day.
llm_translation: He thought to her, as that which Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: How much does an average person walk in a day? Ten parasangs: from dawn until sunrise, five mil; from sunset until the appearance of the stars, five mil; thus, the thickness of the firmament is one-sixth of a mil in a day.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עוֹבְיוֹ שֶׁל רָקִיעַ אֶחָד מֵעֲשָׂרָה בַּיּוֹם. תֵּדַע, כַּמָּה מַהֲלַךְ אָדָם בֵּינוֹנִי בַּיּוֹם — עֶשֶׂר פַּרְסָאוֹת, וּמֵעֲלוֹת הַשַּׁחַר עַד הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה אַרְבַּעַת מִילִין, מִשְּׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה וְעַד צֵאת הַכּוֹכָבִים אַרְבַּעַת מִילִין, נִמְצֵאת עוֹבְיוֹ שֶׁל רָקִיעַ אֶחָד מֵעֲשָׂרָה בַּיּוֹם. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרָבָא, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְעוּלָּא. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yehuda says: The thickness of the firmament is one-tenth the day. Know how far can an average person walk in a day ten parasangs, and from dawn until sunrise four mil , it is found that the thickness of the firmament is one-tenth the day. a refutation of Rava. a refutation of Ulla, It is a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: The question was raised: Rabbi Yehuda says: The thickness of the firmament is one-tenth of the day. You should know, how far does a person walk in an average day - ten parasangs, and from the break of dawn until sunrise is four mil, from the setting of the sun until the appearance of the stars is four mil, thus the thickness of the firmament is one-tenth of the day. The dispute of Rava, the dispute of Ulla. The dispute.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? אָמַר לָךְ: אֲנָא בִּימָמָא הוּא דַּאֲמַרִי, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דְּקָא טָעוּ, דְּקָא חָשְׁבִן דְּקַדְמָא וַחֲשׁוֹכָא.
human_translation: Let us say will be a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan, said to you: I am speaking in an day, And it was the Sages erred because they calculated earlier
llm_translation: Let it be the preference of Rabbi Yochanan? He said to you: I in the day he said, and the Rabbis in the night they erred, thinking that darkness comes before light.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא? לָא, ״וַיָּאִיצוּ״ שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Let us say it is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Ḥanina, No, hastened is different;
llm_translation: Let it be the preference of Rabbi Chanina? No, "and they urged" is different.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִצְרַיִם הָיָה אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת פַּרְסָה עַל אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת פַּרְסָה, וּמִצְרַיִם אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים בְּכוּשׁ, וְכוּשׁ אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים בָּעוֹלָם, וְעוֹלָם אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים בַּגָּן, וְגַן אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים בְּעֵדֶן, וְעֵדֶן אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים בְּגֵיהִנָּם, נִמְצָא כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ כְּכִיסּוּי קְדֵירָה לְגֵיהִנָּם. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Come hear Egypt was four hundred parasangs by four hundred parasangs, and Egypt is one-sixtieth of Cush, and Cush is one-sixtieth of the world, and the world is one-sixtieth of the Garden and the Garden is one-sixtieth of Eden, and Eden is one sixtieth of Gehenna. it is found that the entire world is like a pot cover, to Gehenna. conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Egypt was four hundred parsa by four hundred parsa, and Egypt is one of sixty in Cush, and Cush is one of sixty in the world, and the world is one of sixty in the Garden, and the Garden is one of sixty in Eden, and Eden is one of sixty in Gehenna, thus the entire world is like a covering of a pot for Gehenna. This is a logical inference.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַיִּשּׁוּב כּוּלּוֹ תַּחַת כּוֹכָב אֶחָד יוֹשֵׁב. תֵּדַע, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָדָם נוֹתֵן עֵינוֹ בְּכוֹכָב אֶחָד, הוֹלֵךְ לַמִּזְרָח — עוֹמֵד כְּנֶגְדּוֹ, לְאַרְבַּע רוּחוֹת הָעוֹלָם — עוֹמֵד כְּנֶגְדּוֹ, מִכְּלָל דְּכׇל הַיִּשּׁוּב כּוּלּוֹ תַּחַת כּוֹכָב אֶחָד יוֹשֵׁב. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Come hear the school of Eliyahu taught Rabbi Natan says: The entire settlement, sits under one star. Know a person focuses his eye on one star, travel east remains opposite him in the four directions of the world remains opposite him. By inference, the entire settlement rests under one star; a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught in the school of Elijah, Rabbi Nathan says: All the Yishuv entirely beneath one star resides. You should know, for when a person sets his eyes on one star, he stands opposite it, for the four winds of the world - he stands opposite it, from which it is inferred that all the Yishuv entirely beneath one star resides. This is a logical deduction.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: עֲגָלָה בַּצָּפוֹן, וְעַקְרָב בַּדָּרוֹם, וְכׇל הַיִּשּׁוּב כּוּלּוֹ אֵינוֹ יוֹשֵׁב אֶלָּא בֵּין עֲגָלָה לְעַקְרָב. וְכׇל הַיִּשּׁוּב כּוּלּוֹ אֵינוֹ הֹוֶה אֶלָּא שָׁעָה אַחַת בַּיּוֹם, שֶׁאֵין חַמָּה נִכְנֶסֶת לַיִּשּׁוּב אֶלָּא שָׁעָה אַחַת בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: Come hear Ursa Major is in the north and Scorpio is in the south, and the entire settlement sits between Ursa Major and Scorpio, the entire settlement only one hour in a day, as the sun enters the settlement only one hour a day
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: A scorpion in the north, and a spider in the south, and all the rest of the vermin do not settle except between a scorpion and a spider. And all the rest of the vermin do not exist except for one hour in the day, for the sun only enters the rest of the vermin for one hour in the day.

hebrew_text: תֵּדַע, שֶׁבְּחָמֵשׁ חַמָּה בַּמִּזְרָח, וּבְשֶׁבַע חַמָּה בַּמַּעֲרָב, חֲצִי שֵׁשׁ וַחֲצִי שֶׁבַע חַמָּה עוֹמֶדֶת בְּרֹאשׁ כׇּל אָדָם. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Know at five the sun is in the east, and at seven the sun is in the west. half of sixth and half of seventh the sun is positioned on top of everyone, a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: You should know, that at five hours in the east, and at seven hours in the west, half of six and half of seven hours stands at the head of every person. Teyuvta.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי: מָה תְּשׁוּבָה הֱשִׁיבַתּוּ בַּת קוֹל לְאוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר ״אֶעֱלֶה עַל בָּמֳתֵי עָב אֶדַּמֶּה לְעֶלְיוֹן״, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לוֹ: רָשָׁע בֶּן רָשָׁע,
human_translation: Come hear as Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai said: What response did the Divine Voice answer to that wicked man, when he said: “I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the Most High” A Divine Voice emerged and said to him: Wicked man, son of a wicked man,
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai said: What response did the Bat Kol give to that wicked one at the moment he said, "I will ascend to the heights of the clouds; I will be like the Most High"? The Bat Kol emerged and said to him: "Wicked one, son of a wicked one."

hebrew_text: בֶּן בְּנוֹ שֶׁל נִמְרוֹד הָרָשָׁע, שֶׁהִמְרִיד אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ עָלַי בְּמַלְכוּתוֹ. כַּמָּה שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם? שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה, וְאִם בִּגְבוּרוֹת — שְׁמוֹנִים שָׁנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְמֵי שְׁנוֹתֵינוּ בָהֶם שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה וְאִם בִּגְבוּרוֹת שְׁמוֹנִים שָׁנָה״,
human_translation: disciple of Nimrod the wicked, who caused the entire world to rebel against Me during his reign how many are the years of a person Seventy years, and if with strength, eighty years, as it is stated: “The days of our years are seventy years and with strength eighty years”
llm_translation: Son of Nimrod the wicked, who rebelled against the entire world upon me in his kingdom. How many are the years of a person? Seventy years, and if with strength — eighty years, as it is stated: "The days of our years among them are seventy years, and if with strength, eighty years."

hebrew_text: מִן הָאָרֶץ עַד לָרָקִיעַ מַהֲלַךְ חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה, וְעוֹבְיוֹ שֶׁל רָקִיעַ מַהֲלַךְ חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה, וּבֵין (כׇּל) רָקִיעַ לְרָקִיעַ מַהֲלַךְ חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה, וְכֵן בֵּין כׇּל רָקִיעַ וְרָקִיעַ, ״אַךְ אֶל שְׁאוֹל תּוּרָד אֶל יַרְכְּתֵי בוֹר״. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: from the earth to the firmament is a walking of five hundred years, and the thickness of the firmament is a walking of five hundred years, and between each firmament is walking of five hundred years, and so too between each and every firmament. “Yet you shall be brought down to the netherworld, to the uttermost parts of the pit” a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: From the earth to the firmament is a distance of five hundred years, and the thickness of the firmament is a distance of five hundred years, and between each firmament to firmament is a distance of five hundred years, and likewise between each firmament and firmament, "Yet you will be brought down to Sheol, to the depths of the pit." Conclusion.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹמְרִים: גַּלְגַּל קָבוּעַ, וּמַזָּלוֹת חוֹזְרִין. וְחַכְמֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם אוֹמְרִים: גַּלְגַּל חוֹזֵר, וּמַזָּלוֹת קְבוּעִין. אָמַר רַבִּי: תְּשׁוּבָה לְדִבְרֵיהֶם — מֵעוֹלָם לֹא מָצִינוּ עֲגָלָה בַּדָּרוֹם וְעַקְרָב בַּצָּפוֹן.
human_translation: the Sages taught: The Jewish Sages say the celestial sphere is stationary, and the constellations revolve and the sages of the nations of the world say the celestial sphere revolves, and the constellations are stationary Rabbi said: A refutation of their words we have never found Ursa Major in the South or Scorpio in the North.
llm_translation: The sages of Israel taught: The wheel is fixed, and the constellations return. And the sages of the nations of the world say: The wheel returns, and the constellations are fixed. Rabbi said: Return to their words - we have never found a calf in the south and a scorpion in the north.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: וְדִילְמָא כְּבוּצִינָא דְרִיחְיָא. אִי נָמֵי כְּצִינּוֹרָא דְּדַשָּׁא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov strongly objects to this And perhaps like the steel of a mill, Alternatively, like the pivot of a door,
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Acha bar Yaakov: Perhaps like a bundle of reeds. Or like a hyssop branch.

hebrew_text: חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹמְרִים: בַּיּוֹם חַמָּה מְהַלֶּכֶת לְמַטָּה מִן הָרָקִיעַ, וּבַלַּיְלָה לְמַעְלָה מִן הָרָקִיעַ. וְחַכְמֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם אוֹמְרִים: בַּיּוֹם חַמָּה מְהַלֶּכֶת לְמַטָּה מִן הָרָקִיעַ, וּבַלַּיְלָה לְמַטָּה מִן הַקַּרְקַע. אָמַר רַבִּי: וְנִרְאִין דִּבְרֵיהֶן מִדְּבָרֵינוּ, שֶׁבַּיּוֹם מַעֲיָנוֹת צוֹנְנִין, וּבַלַּיְלָה רוֹתְחִין.
human_translation: The Jewish Sages say during the day the sun travels beneath the firmament and at night above the firmament. And the sages of the nations of the world say during the day the sun travels beneath the firmament, and at night beneath the earth Rabbi said: And the statement appears than our statement. that during the day, springs are cold, and during the night they are hot
llm_translation: The sages of Israel say: During the day, the sun travels beneath the firmament, and at night it travels above the firmament. And the sages of the nations of the world say: During the day, the sun travels beneath the firmament, and at night it travels beneath the earth. Rabbi said: And their words appear to us as our words, for during the day the springs cool down, and at night they heat up.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, חַמָּה מְהַלֶּכֶת בְּגוֹבַהּ שֶׁל רָקִיעַ, לְפִיכָךְ כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ רוֹתֵחַ וּמַעֲיָנוֹת צוֹנְנִין. בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, חַמָּה מְהַלֶּכֶת בְּשִׁיפּוּלֵי רָקִיעַ, לְפִיכָךְ כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ צוֹנֵן וּמַעֲיָנוֹת רוֹתְחִין.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Natan says: During the summer the sun travels high in the sky, therefore the entire world is hot, and springs are cold. during the winter the sun travels low in the sky, Therefore, the entire world is cold, springs are hot
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nathan says: In the days of the sun, the sun travels in the height of the firmament, therefore the whole world is boiling and springs are cold. In the days of rain, the sun travels in the depths of the firmament, therefore the whole world is cold and springs are boiling.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּאַרְבָּעָה שְׁבִילִין חַמָּה מְהַלֶּכֶת. נִיסָן אִיָּיר וְסִיוָן — מְהַלֶּכֶת בֶּהָרִים, כְּדֵי לְפַשֵּׁר אֶת הַשְּׁלָגִין. תַּמּוּז אָב וֶאֱלוּל — מְהַלֶּכֶת בַּיִּשּׁוּב, כְּדֵי לְבַשֵּׁל אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת. תִּשְׁרֵי מְרַחְשְׁוָן וְכִסְלֵיו — מְהַלֶּכֶת בַּיַּמִּים, כְּדֵי לְיַבֵּשׁ אֶת הַנְּהָרוֹת. טֵבֵת שְׁבָט וַאֲדָר — מְהַלֶּכֶת בַּמִּדְבָּר, שֶׁלֹּא לְיַבֵּשׁ אֶת הַזְּרָעִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: The sun travels in four paths Nisan, Iyyar, and Sivan, travels over the mountains in order to melt the snows Tammuz, Av, and Elul, it travels over the the settlement in order to ripen the produce. Tishrei, Marḥeshvan, and Kislev, it travels over the seas in order to dry the rivers, Tevet, Shevat, and Adar, it travels over the desert in order to not dry the seeds
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: In four paths the sun travels. Nisan, Iyyar, and Sivan — it travels in the mountains, in order to melt the snow. Tammuz, Av, and Elul — it travels in the valleys, in order to ripen the fruits. Tishrei, Marcheshvan, and Kislev — it travels in the seas, in order to dry up the rivers. Tevet, Shevat, and Adar — it travels in the desert, so as not to dry up the seeds.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר מֵאִסְקוּפַּת כּוּ׳. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמָצֵי עָיֵיל, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ קוּם עֱיֵיל?! וְהָתַנְיָא: יְהוּדִי עָרֵל שֶׁלֹּא מָל — עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: from the threshold And even though he is able to enter we do not say to him: Get up and enter; But wasn’t it taught An uncircumcised Jew who did not circumcise will be punished with karet the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says from Iskufa and even though it is found to be difficult, and we do not say to him "Get up and go"?! And it was taught: A Jewish uncircumcised person - the punishment is karet, the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דֶּרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה לַטָּהוֹר, וְאֵין דֶּרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה לַטָּמֵא.
human_translation: Abaye said: distant journey for one who is ritually pure, and there is no distant journey for one who is ritually impure
llm_translation: Abbaye said: The way of purity is far, and there is no way that is far for impurity.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר רִיחוּק מָקוֹם בַּפֶּסַח, וְנֶאֱמַר רִיחוּק מָקוֹם בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר. מָה לְהַלָּן חוּץ לַאֲכִילָתוֹ, אַף כָּאן חוּץ לַאֲכִילָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: It is tanna’im as it was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: a distant journey is stated with regard to the Paschal lamb, and a distant journey is stated with regard to tithe, Just as later outside where it be eaten, so too here, outside it be eaten,
llm_translation: Rava said, it is a teaching. As it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: It is said "its place is distant" regarding the Passover offering, and it is said "its place is distant" regarding tithes. Just as there, it is outside of its consumption, so too here, it is outside of its consumption.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: חוּץ לַעֲשִׂיָּיתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda says, citing Rabbi Eliezer: outside where be performed,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: "Except for its making."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר רַב יוֹסֵף: בִּטְמֵאִים הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב הָעוֹמְדִין בָּעֲזָרָה. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Rav Yosef said: ritually impure, follow the majority of those standing in the courtyard, In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda said, citing Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: As to where it goes, this is what Rabbi Yitzchak bar Rav Yosef said: "With regard to those who are impure, one follows the majority of those standing in the Temple courtyard." As to where - like Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda who said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לְפִיכָךְ וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: ״דֶּרֶךְ״, שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי מַהֲלַךְ שְׁנַיִם אוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים, כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וּבְדֶרֶךְ לֹא הָיָה״, מַגִּיד שֶׁמֵּאִסְקוּפַּת הָעֲזָרָה וְלַחוּץ קָרוּי דֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said to him: Therefore, It was taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: journey,” One conclude a two- or three-day walk. when it says and is not on a journey” it teaches that from the threshold of the courtyard and beyond is called a journey,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yosei: Therefore and so forth. It was taught: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: "On the way," I understand walking two or three days, when he says "and he was not on the way," it indicates that he detoured from the main road to the side road.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָה בֵּין פֶּסַח הָרִאשׁוֹן לַשֵּׁנִי? הָרִאשׁוֹן אָסוּר בְּ״בַל יֵרָאֶה״ וּ״בַל יִמָּצֵא״, וְהַשֵּׁנִי — חָמֵץ וּמַצָּה עִמּוֹ בַּבַּיִת. הָרִאשׁוֹן טָעוּן הַלֵּל בַּאֲכִילָתוֹ, וְהַשֵּׁנִי אֵינוֹ טָעוּן הַלֵּל בַּאֲכִילָתוֹ. זֶה וָזֶה טָעוּן הַלֵּל בַּעֲשִׂיָּיתָן, וְנֶאֱכָלִין צָלִי עַל מַצָּה וּמְרוֹרִים, וְדוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: What is between  the first Pesaḥ the second  the first it is prohibited It shall not be seen, and: It shall not be found. And the second leavened bread and matza with him in the house. the first requires hallel as it is eaten and the second does not require hallel as it is eaten. both require hallel as they are prepared, and they are eaten roasted with matza and bitter herbs, and they override Shabbat
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: What is the difference between the first Passover and the second? The first prohibits "it shall not be seen" and "it shall not be found," and the second - leaven and matzah are together in the house. The first requires Hillel in its consumption, and the second does not require Hillel in its consumption. Both require Hillel in their preparation, and they are eaten roasted with matzah and bitter herbs, and override the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כְּכׇל חוּקַּת הַפֶּסַח יַעֲשׂוּ אוֹתוֹ״ — בְּמִצְוָה שֶׁבְּגוּפוֹ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught according to all the entire statute of the Paschal lamb they shall offer it” the verse is speaking of a mitzva applicable to body
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "As all the statute of the Passover, so shall they do it" - in a commandment that the Scripture itself speaks about.

hebrew_text: מִצְוָה שֶׁעַל גּוּפוֹ, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל מַצּוֹת וּמְרוֹרִים יֹאכְלוּהוּ״. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ מִצְוֹת שֶׁלֹּא עַל גּוּפוֹ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעֶצֶם לֹא יִשְׁבְּרוּ בוֹ״, מָה שְׁבִירַת הָעֶצֶם מְיוּחָד מִצְוָה שֶׁבְּגוּפוֹ — אַף כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁבְּגוּפוֹ.
human_translation: a mitzva related to body from where The verse states: “They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs” might even mitzvot not related to body Therefore, the Torah states: “And they shall not break a bone in it” just as breaking a bone is notable a mitzva applicable to itself, so too, any mitzva applicable to itself
llm_translation: Mitzvah that is upon his body, from where? Scripture teaches: "They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs." Could it be even mitzvot that are not upon his body? Scripture teaches: "And a bone of it shall not be broken." Just as the breaking of the bone is a unique mitzvah that is on his body, so too every mitzvah that is on his body.

hebrew_text: אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״יַעֲשׂוּ אוֹתוֹ״, בְּמִצְוֹת שֶׁבְּגוּפוֹ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: Isi ben Yehuda says: “They shall perform it,” the verse is speaking of mitzvot applicable to body itself.
llm_translation: Isi son of Judah says: "They shall do it," in commandments that the Scripture speaks of in his body.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָכוֹל אַף מִצְוָה שֶׁלֹּא עַל גּוּפוֹ. הָא אָמְרַתְּ בְּמִצְוָה שֶׁבְּגוּפוֹ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר?
human_translation: The Master said: might even a mitzva not related to body But you said the verse is speaking of a mitzva applicable to body
llm_translation: Master said: Can also commandment not on its body. Behold you said in commandment that in its body the scripture speaks?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ ״עַל מַצּוֹת וּמְרוֹרִים יֹאכְלוּהוּ״, אַלְמָא ״יַעֲשׂוּ אוֹתוֹ״ לָאו דַּוְקָא הוּא. אֵימָא הָוֵה לֵיהּ כִּפְרָט וּכְלָל, וְנַעֲשָׂה כְּלָל מוֹסִיף עַל הַפְּרָט, וַאֲפִילּוּ כֹּל מִילֵּי נָמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: this is is saying: Now that you said they shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs, apparently “They shall perform it,” is not specific say is a detail and a generalization, the generalization adds to the detail and even everything, teaches us
llm_translation: So it is stated: This year, when you say "They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs," it implies "they shall make it," not specifically. Say it should have been for him as a detail and a general principle, and the general principle adds to the detail, and even all similar matters, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה, הַאי ״עֶצֶם״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְאֶחָד עֶצֶם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מוֹחַ, וְאֶחָד עֶצֶם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מוֹחַ.
human_translation: What does Isi ben Yehuda do with the bone He needs it both to a bone that has marrow and to a bone that does not have marrow.
llm_translation: Issi ben Yehuda, this "bone," what does he do with it? He requires it for one bone that has a brain, and one bone that does not have a brain.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״יַעֲשׂוּ אֹתוֹ״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ שֶׁאֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הַיָּחִיד, דְּכַמָּה דְּאֶפְשָׁר לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי מַהְדְּרִינַן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what do they do with this They need it that one does not slaughter the Paschal on individual. that as much as it is possible to search we search
llm_translation: The sages, this "they shall make it," what do they do with it? They require it to teach that one does not slaughter the Passover sacrifice for an individual, as much as it is possible to gather together groups.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כְּכׇל חוּקַּת הַפֶּסַח יַעֲשׂוּ אוֹתוֹ״. יָכוֹל כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהָרִאשׁוֹן אָסוּר בְּ״בַל יֵרָאֶה״ וּ״בַל יִמָּצֵא״ כָּךְ שֵׁנִי אָסוּר בְּ״בַל יֵרָאֶה״ וּ״בַל יִמָּצֵא״ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל מַצּוֹת וּמְרוֹרִים יֹאכְלוּהוּ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught “According to the entire statute of the Paschal lamb they shall offer it” One might that just as the first is prohibited It shall not be seen, and: It shall not be found, so too, the second it is prohibited It shall not be seen, and: It shall not be found. Therefore, the Torah states: “They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "They shall make it according to all the statutes of the Passover." One might have thought that just as the first Passover offering is prohibited from being seen and found after its time, so too the second Passover offering is prohibited from being seen and found — the Torah teaches: "They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה, מִצְוַת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יַשְׁאִירוּ מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר״.
human_translation: And I have only positive mitzvot from where negative mitzvot? The verse states: “They shall leave none of it to the morning,
llm_translation: "And I have only a positive commandment, how do I know the source for a negative commandment? The Torah teaches: 'They shall not leave any of it until morning.'"

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא מִצְוַת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁנִּיתָּק לַעֲשֵׂה. מִצְוַת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה גָּמוּר מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעֶצֶם לֹא יִשְׁבְּרוּ בוֹ״. מָה הַפְּרָט — מְפוֹרָשׁ: מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה, וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁנִּיתָּק לַעֲשֵׂה, וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה גָּמוּר — אַף כׇּל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה, וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁנִּיתָּק לַעֲשֵׂה, וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה גָּמוּר.
human_translation: And I have only a negative mitzva can be rectified by a positive from where a full-fledged negative mitzva? The verse states: “They shall not break a bone in it.” just as the detail, is explicit a positive mitzva, a prohibition can be rectified by a positive mitzva, and a full-fledged negative mitzva; so too, every positive mitzva, prohibition can be rectified by a positive mitzva, and full-fledged negative mitzva
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And I have only a negative commandment that is detached from a positive commandment. How do we know that a complete negative commandment is derived from? The Talmud teaches: 'And none of his bones shall be broken.' What is the detail - explicit: a positive commandment, and a negative commandment that is detached from a positive commandment, and a complete negative commandment - so too, every positive commandment, and a negative commandment that is detached from a positive commandment, and a complete negative commandment."

hebrew_text: בִּכְלָלֵיהּ דְּ״מַצּוֹת וּמְרוֹרִים״, מַאי קָא מְרַבֵּי? צְלִי אֵשׁ. בִּפְרָטֵיהּ מַאי מְמַעֵיט לֵיהּ? הַשְׁבָּתַת שְׂאוֹר. אֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא! מִצְוָה דְגוּפֵיהּ עֲדִיף.
human_translation: what is included through the generalization of unleavened bread and bitter herbs? roasting in fire what does it exclude through its detail? removal of leaven I reverse it A mitzva relating to itself is preferable,
llm_translation: In its entirety of "matzot and maror," what does it increase? Roasting with fire. In its specifics, what does it decrease? Removing leaven on Shabbat. Turn it around! A commandment in and of itself is superior.

hebrew_text: בִּכְלָלֵיהּ דְּ״לֹא יַשְׁאִירוּ מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר״ מַאי קָא מְרַבֵּה לֵיהּ? ״לֹא תוֹצִיא מִמֶּנּוּ״ (דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ. דְּהַאי מִיפְּסַל בְּנוֹתָר, וְהַאי מִיפְּסַל בְּיוֹצֵא).
human_translation: What is included through the generalization of: They shall leave none of it to the morning? You shall not remove any of its which is similar to it, as this it is disqualified as leftovers, and this it is disqualified as has left
llm_translation: In its entirety, "do not leave any of it until morning." What is it teaching us? "Do not take any of it out" (for its blood will be disqualified if left over, and its flesh will be disqualified if taken out).

hebrew_text: בִּפְרָטֵיהּ מַאי קָא מְמַעֵט לֵיהּ? ״לֹא יֵרָאֶה וְלֹא יִמָּצֵא״ (דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ, דְּהַאי אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה דְּהָוֵה לָאו שֶׁנִּיתָּק לַעֲשֵׂה. וְהַאי אֵינוֹ לוֹקָה דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ לָאו שֶׁנִּיתָּק לַעֲשֵׂה). אֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא! מִצְוָה דְגוּפֵיהּ עֲדִיף.
human_translation: What does it exclude through its detail? It shall not be seen, and: It shall not be found, which are similar to it, as this is not flogged because it is a prohibition can be rectified by a positive mitzva and this is not flogged because it is a prohibition can be rectified by a positive mitzva I reverse it a mitzva related to itself is preferable
llm_translation: In its particulars, what is it diminishing for him? "He shall not be seen and he shall not be found" (for his blood, for this is not a case of a penalty that is detached from an action. And this is not a case of a penalty that is detached from an action). On the contrary! A mitzvah that is intrinsically superior.

hebrew_text: בִּכְלָלֵיהּ דְּ״עֶצֶם לֹא יִשְׁבְּרוּ בוֹ״
human_translation: Through the generalization: They shall not break a bone in it,
llm_translation: In its entirety, "Etzem" shall not be broken within it.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מְרַבֵּה? ״אַל תֹּאכְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ נָא״. בִּפְרָטֵיהּ מַאי קָא מְמַעֲטִי? ״לֹא תִשְׁחַט עַל חָמֵץ דַּם זִבְחִי״. אֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא! מִצְוָה דְגוּפֵיהּ עֲדִיף.
human_translation: what is it including, “Do not eat from it raw” What does it exclude through its detail? “You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with leavened bread” I reverse it a mitzva related to itself is preferable
llm_translation: What is he increasing? "Do not eat from it raw." What is he decreasing specifically? "Do not slaughter upon leaven the blood of my sacrifice." Turn it around! A mitzvah that is intrinsically preferable.

hebrew_text: הָרִאשׁוֹן טָעוּן הַלֵּל בַּאֲכִילָתוֹ וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: אָמַר קְרָא ״הַשִּׁיר יִהְיֶה לָכֶם כְּלֵיל הִתְקַדֶּשׁ חָג״. לַיְלָה הַמְקוּדָּשׁ לֶחָג — טָעוּן הַלֵּל, לַיְלָה שֶׁאֵין מְקוּדָּשׁ לֶחָג — אֵין טָעוּן הַלֵּל.
human_translation: the first requires hallel as it is eaten, From where are these matters Rabbi Yoḥanan said, citing Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak, the verse states: “You shall have a song as in the night when a Festival is sanctified” a night sanctified as a Festival, requires hallel ; a night which is not sanctified as a Festival, does not require hallel .
llm_translation: The first requires Hillel in his eating, etc. Whence these words? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: The verse says, "The song shall be for you as in the night when a festival is sanctified." On a night that is sanctified for the festival - Hillel is required; on a night that is not sanctified for the festival - Hillel is not required.

hebrew_text: זֶה וָזֶה טְעוּנִין הַלֵּל בַּעֲשִׂיָּיתָן כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לַיְלָה קָא מְמַעֵט, יוֹם לָא קָא מְמַעֵט. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אֶפְשָׁר יִשְׂרָאֵל שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת פִּסְחֵיהֶן וְנוֹטְלִין אֶת לוּלְבֵיהֶן, וְאֵין אוֹמְרִים הַלֵּל?!
human_translation: both require hallel as they are prepared. What is the reason If you wish, say excludes night, it does not exclude day; And if you wish, say Is it possible the Jewish people slaughtering their Paschal lambs taking their lulavim and not reciting hallel ?
llm_translation: This and this are necessary according to Hillel in their making. What is the reason? If you wish, say: At night it diminishes, but during the day it does not diminish. And if you wish, say: Perhaps the Israelites slaughter their Passover sacrifices and take their lulavs, and they do not say Hillel?!

hebrew_text: וְנֶאֱכָלִין צָלִי וְכוּ׳. שַׁבָּת אִין, טוּמְאָה לָא. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא: דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, וְאֵין דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: are eaten roasted Shabbat, yes, ritual impurity, no, the mishna is not in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught overrides Shabbat and does not override ritual impurity. Rabbi Yehuda says: It overrides even ritual impurity.
llm_translation: "And they may be eaten roasted, etc." On Shabbat, no, but regarding impurity, yes. The Mishnah that does not follow Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: One may override the Sabbath, but one may not override impurity. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may even override impurity.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא: מִפְּנֵי טוּמְאָה דְּחִיתִיו יַחְזוֹר וְיֵעָשֶׂה בְּטוּמְאָה?! וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הַתּוֹרָה חָזְרָה עָלָיו לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ בְּטׇהֳרָה, לֹא זָכָה — יֵעָשֶׂה בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: What is the reason the first tanna ? was deferred due to ritual impurity, shall he return and perform in ritual impurity? And Rabbi Yehuda The Torah sought to perform in ritual purity; he did not merit let him perform in ritual impurity.
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna taught: "Because of the impurity, I have removed him, let him return and perform in impurity?!" And Rabbi Yehuda said: The Torah returned upon him to do it in purity, if he did not merit — let him do it in impurity.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פֶּסַח רִאשׁוֹן דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. פֶּסַח רִאשׁוֹן דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה, פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה. פֶּסַח רִאשׁוֹן טָעוּן לִינָה, פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי טָעוּן לִינָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught The first Pesaḥ overrides Shabbat, second Pesaḥ overrides Shabbat. first Pesaḥ overrides ritual impurity, the second Pesaḥ overrides ritual impurity. The first Pesaḥ requires remaining the second Pesaḥ requires remaining
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The first Pesach overrides the Shabbat, the second Pesach overrides the Shabbat. The first Pesach overrides impurity, the second Pesach overrides impurity. The first Pesach requires eating in it, the second Pesach requires eating in it.

hebrew_text: דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה, כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: overrides ritual impurity, in accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Pushes away the impurity, like whom? Like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה טָעוּן לִינָה? וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִין לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי שֶׁאֵין טָעוּן לִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּפָנִיתָ בַבֹּקֶר וְהָלַכְתָּ לְאֹהָלֶיךָ״, וּכְתִיב: ״שֵׁשֶׁת יָמִים תֹּאכַל מַצּוֹת״, הַנֶּאֱכָל לְשִׁשָּׁה טָעוּן לִינָה, שֶׁאֵין נֶאֱכָל לְשִׁשָּׁה — אֵין טָעוּן לִינָה!
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Yehuda, does require remaining Wasn’t taught Rabbi Yehuda says: From where the second Pesaḥ does not require remaining As it is stated and you shall turn in the morning and go to your tents” and it is written “Six days you shall eat matzot ; to eat for six requires remaining to eat for six does not require remaining
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yehuda, is sleep necessary? But it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: From where do we derive that for the second Passover offering, sleep is not necessary? As it is stated: "And you shall turn in the morning and go to your tents." And it is written: "For six days you shall eat unleavened bread." One who eats within six days requires sleep, one who does not eat within six days does not require sleep!

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי תַנָּאֵי וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: two tanna’im in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Two Tannaim and the following of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפֶּסַח שֶׁבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה, לֹא יֹאכְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ זָבִין וְזָבוֹת נִדּוֹת וְיוֹלְדוֹת. וְאִם אָכְלוּ — פְּטוּרִין מִכָּרֵת.
human_translation: the Paschal lamb is sacrificed in ritual impurity zavim , and zavot , menstruating women, and women after childbirth may not eat it, if they ate they are exempt from karet .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The Paschal lamb that was brought in a state of impurity, those who are menstruating, those with abnormal genital discharges, and women who have recently given birth should not eat from it. And if they did eat from it, they are exempt from the penalty of karet.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר פּוֹטֵר אַף עַל בִּיאַת מִקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer exempts even for entering the Temple
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer exempts even for the entry into the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: זָבִין וְזָבוֹת נִדּוֹת וְיוֹלְדוֹת שֶׁאָכְלוּ בְּפֶסַח שֶׁבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה, יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כׇּל טָהוֹר יֹאכַל בָּשָׂר. וְהַנֶּפֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר תֹּאכַל בָּשָׂר מִזֶּבַח הַשְּׁלָמִים אֲשֶׁר לַה׳ וְטוּמְאָתוֹ עָלָיו וְנִכְרְתָה״.
human_translation: The Sages taught zavim , and zavot , menstruating women, and women after childbirth who ate of the Paschal lamb that was sacrificed in ritual impurity, might liable therefore, the verse states: and the meat, every one that is ritually pure may eat the meat. But the soul that eats of the meat of the sacrifice of peace-offerings, that belong to the Lord, having his impurity upon him, shall be cut off [ venikhreta ]
llm_translation: The sages taught: Menstruating women, those with abnormal genital discharges, and women who have given birth, who ate from the Passover offering while impure, one might have thought they are liable — the Torah teaches: "Any pure person may eat meat. But the person who eats the meat of the peace offering sacrifice to the Lord while impure, that soul shall be cut off."

hebrew_text: נֶאֱכַל לִטְהוֹרִים — חַיָּיבִים עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם טָמֵא, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל לִטְהוֹרִין — אֵין טְמֵאִין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם טָמֵא.
human_translation: is eaten by ritually pure, liable for it due to ritually impure, but if it is not eaten by ritually pure, those who are ritually impure are not liable for it due to impure.
llm_translation: Eaten by the pure - obligated upon it from impurity, and that which is not eaten by the pure - impure are not obligated upon it from impurity.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל דָּחֲקוּ זָבִין וְנִכְנְסוּ לָעֲזָרָה בְּפֶסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה, יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וִישַׁלְּחוּ מִן הַמַּחֲנֶה כׇּל צָרוּעַ וְכׇל זָב וְכֹל טָמֵא לָנָפֶשׁ״, בִּזְמַן שֶׁטְּמֵאֵי מֵתִים מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין — זָבִין וּמְצוֹרָעִין מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין, אֵין טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין — אֵין זָבִין וּמְצוֹרָעִין מִשְׁתַּלְּחִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: might zavim pushed and entered the courtyard, the Paschal lamb that is brought in ritual impurity, might they would be liable the verse states: “That they send out from the camp any leper and any zav and anyone defiled by the dead” at a time when those who are impure a corpse are sent out zavim and lepers are sent out; those who are impure a corpse are not sent out zavim and lepers are not sent out.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Could it be that if those with a discharge were pressed for space and entered the Temple courtyard on Passover while impure, they would be liable? The verse teaches: "And they shall send out of the camp every leper, and every one having a discharge, and whoever is unclean by a corpse." When those who are impure due to contact with the dead are sent out, those with a discharge and lepers are sent out; when those impure due to contact with the dead are not sent out, those with a discharge and lepers are not sent out.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: דָּחֲקוּ טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים וְנִכְנְסוּ לַהֵיכָל בְּפֶסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה, מַהוּ? מִדְּאִישְׁתְּרַי טוּמְאַת עֲזָרָה אִישְׁתְּרַי נָמֵי טוּמְאַת הֵיכָל, אוֹ דִילְמָא מַאי דְּאִישְׁתְּרַי — אִישְׁתְּרַי, מַאי דְּלָא אִישְׁתְּרַי — לָא אִישְׁתְּרַי!
human_translation: Rav Yosef asked If those who are impure a corpse pushed and entered the Sanctuary, Paschal lamb is brought in ritual impurity, what is since ritual impurity was permitted in the courtyard ritual impurity in the Sanctuary was also permitted; or perhaps what was permitted was permitted what was not permitted was not permitted,
llm_translation: The question of Rav Yosef: If the impure ones from the dead were pressed and entered the sanctuary on Passover that came with impurity, what is the ruling? Since the impurity of the Azarah is permitted, is the impurity of the Heichal also permitted, or perhaps what is permitted is permitted, what is not permitted is not permitted!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וִישַׁלְּחוּ מִן הַמַּחֲנֶה״, אֲפִילּוּ מִקְצָת מַחֲנֶה.
human_translation: Rava said the verse states: “They send out from the camp” even a part of the camp.
llm_translation: Rava said, the verse says: "And they shall send away from the camp," even a part of the camp.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וִישַׁלְּחוּ מִן הַמַּחֲנֶה ... אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה תְּשַׁלְּחוּם״, כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּקָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה תְּשַׁלְּחוּם״ — קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וִישַׁלְּחוּ מִן הַמַּחֲנֶה״.
human_translation: Some say Rava said The verse states: “That they send out from the camp dead…outside the camp you shall send them” anywhere that we apply “Outside the camp you shall send them,” we apply “They must send out from the camp,”
llm_translation: There are some who say: Rava said, the verse says: "And they shall send out of the camp... you shall send them outside the camp," wherever it says "you shall send them outside the camp" - it also says "And they shall send out of the camp."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: דָּחֲקוּ טְמֵאֵי מֵתִים וְאָכְלוּ אֵימוּרֵי פֶּסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה,
human_translation: Rav Yosef asked If people who are impure a corpse pushed and ate portions a Paschal lamb offered in ritual impurity,
llm_translation: The question of Rav Yosef: The impure individuals were distressed and they consumed the offerings of the Passover that came in a state of impurity.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ? מִדְּאִישְׁתְּרַי טוּמְאַת בָּשָׂר — אִישְׁתְּרַי נָמֵי טוּמְאַת אֵימוּרִין, אוֹ דִילְמָא: מַאי דְּאִישְׁתְּרַי — אִישְׁתְּרַי, מַאי דְּלָא אִישְׁתְּרַי — לָא אִישְׁתְּרַי.
human_translation: what is since ritual impurity of the meat was permitted, ritual impurity of the portions was also permitted; or perhaps what was permitted was permitted, what was not permitted was not permitted?
llm_translation: What is it? From the fact that the impurity of meat is permitted - it is permitted for the impurity of sacrificial portions, or perhaps: what is it that is permitted - it is permitted, what is it that is not permitted - it is not permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִכְּדֵי טוּמְאַת אֵימוּרִין מֵהֵיכָא אִיתְרַבַּי — מִטּוּמְאַת בָּשָׂר, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר לַה׳״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָאֵימוּרִין.
human_translation: Rava said: After all, from where portions ritual impurity included? from meat ritual impurity, as it is written: that pertain to the Lord, to include the portions
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do we derive the impurity of sacrificial portions? From the impurity of flesh, as it is written: "Which belong to the Lord," to include the sacrificial portions.

hebrew_text: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ לְטוּמְאַת בָּשָׂר, אִיתֵיהּ לְטוּמְאַת אֵימוּרִין. כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיתֵיהּ לְטוּמְאַת בָּשָׂר, לֵיתֵיהּ לְטוּמְאַת אֵימוּרִין.
human_translation: Anywhere that there is for meat ritual impurity, there is portions ritual impurity; anywhere that there is no meat ritual impurity, there is no portions ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Every place where there is susceptibility to impurity of the body, there is susceptibility to impurity of verbal statements. Every place where there is no susceptibility to impurity of the body, there is no susceptibility to impurity of verbal statements.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא: אֵימוּרֵי פֶּסַח מִצְרַיִם הֵיכָא אַקְטְרִינְהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּמַאן לֵימָא לַן דְּלָא שְׁוִיסְקֵי עֲבוּד?
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira asked: the portions of the Paschal lamb Egypt where did they burn them? Abaye said to him: Who will tell us that they did not make them roasted
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Zeira: The sayings of the Passover offering in Egypt, where should we arrange them? Abaye said to him: And who will say to us that we should not juxtapose the service?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, הָא תְּנָא רַב יוֹסֵף: שְׁלֹשָׁה מִזְבְּחוֹת הָיוּ שָׁם: עַל הַמַּשְׁקוֹף, וְעַל שְׁתֵּי הַמְּזוּזוֹת. וְתוּ מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא לָא הֲוָה.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rav Yosef taught there were three altars there upon the lintel and upon the two doorposts; and there was nothing else.
llm_translation: And furthermore, this is what the Tanna Rabbi Yosef taught: There were three altars there: on the roof, and on the two doorposts. And it was not from another source.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָה בֵּין פֶּסַח מִצְרַיִם לְפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת? פֶּסַח מִצְרַיִם מִקָּחוֹ מִבֶּעָשׂוֹר, וְטָעוּן הַזָּאָה בַּאֲגוּדַּת אֵזוֹב, וְעַל הַמַּשְׁקוֹף וְעַל שְׁתֵּי הַמְּזוּזוֹת, וְנֶאֱכָל בְּחִפָּזוֹן, בַּלַּיְלָה אֶחָד. וּפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת נוֹהֵג כׇּל שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: What between the Paschal lamb Egypt and the Paschal lamb generations? The Paschal lamb Egypt taken from the tenth and required sprinkle with a bundle of hyssop, and upon the lintel and the two doorposts, and it was eaten with haste; on one night, the Paschal lamb generations is observed for seven
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: What is the difference between the Passover of Egypt and the Passover of subsequent generations? The Passover of Egypt, its purchase is from the tenth day of the month of Nissan, and it requires the sprinkling of the blood with a bundle of hyssop, on the lintel and on the two doorposts, and it is eaten hurriedly, in one night. And the Passover of subsequent generations is observed for a full seven days.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא לַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״דַּבְּרוּ אֶל כׇּל עֲדַת יִשְׂרָאֵל לֵאמֹר בֶּעָשׂוֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה וְיִקְחוּ״. זֶה מִקָּחוֹ מִבֶּעָשׂוֹר, וְאֵין פֶּסַח דּוֹרוֹת מִקָּחוֹ מִבֶּעָשׂוֹר.
human_translation: From where do we As it is written: “Speak to all the congregation of Israel, saying: On the tenth day of this month they shall take this taken from the tenth and the Paschal lamb of generations is not taken from the tenth
llm_translation: Gemara: What does he teach us? As it is written: "Speak to the entire congregation of Israel, saying, 'On the tenth of this month, they shall take.'" This teaches that the purchase of the Paschal lamb is from the tenth day of the month, and the Paschal lamb of future generations is not purchased from the tenth day of the month.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״וְהָיָה לָכֶם לְמִשְׁמֶרֶת עַד אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹם לַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה״, הָכִי נָמֵי — זֶה טָעוּן בִּיקּוּר אַרְבָּעָה יָמִים קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה, וְאֵין אַחֵר טָעוּן בִּיקּוּר?
human_translation: However, if so, “And you shall keep it until the fourteenth day of this month” so too this requires examination four days prior to slaughter, and no other requires examination four days prior to slaughter.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from now on: "And it shall be for you a watch until the fourteenth day of this month," so it is said - this requires examination for four days before slaughter, and does anything else require examination?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, בֶּן בַּג בַּג אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִין לְתָמִיד שֶׁטָּעוּן בִּיקּוּר אַרְבָּעָה יָמִים קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תִּשְׁמְרוּ לְהַקְרִיב לִי בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהָיָה לָכֶם לְמִשְׁמֶרֶת עַד אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר״, מָה לְהַלָּן טָעוּן בִּיקּוּר אַרְבָּעָה יָמִים קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה, אַף כָּאן טָעוּן בִּיקּוּר אַרְבָּעָה יָמִים קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה!
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught ben Bag Bag says: From where the daily offering requires examination four days prior to slaughter? It is stated you shall safeguard it to sacrifice to Me in its due season” and it states there, “And it shall be for you as a safeguard until the fourteenth day of this month” Just as there, requires examination four days prior to slaughter, so too here, requires examination four days prior to slaughter.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught, Ben Bag Bag says: From where do we derive that the daily offering, which requires inspection for four days before slaughter, as it is stated: "You shall keep it to offer it at its appointed time," and elsewhere it says: "And it shall be for you to keep until the fourteenth day." Just as there it requires inspection for four days before slaughter, so too here it requires inspection for four days before slaughter!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״תִּשְׁמְרוּ״.
human_translation: It is different there, as it is written: “You shall safeguard it.”
llm_translation: The matter there is different, as it is written: "You shall guard."

hebrew_text: וּפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״וְעָבַדְתָּ אֶת הָעֲבוֹדָה הַזֹּאת בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה״, שֶׁיְּהוּ כׇּל עֲבוֹדוֹת חֹדֶשׁ זֶה — כָּזֶה.
human_translation: Similarly, the Paschal lamb generations as it is written: that you shall perform this service in this month” that all the services of this month shall be like this,
llm_translation: "And Pesach of generations to come, it is written: 'And you shall serve this service in this month,' that all the services of this month should be like this."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָהוּא ״הַזֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי דִּכְווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, that “this to exclude the second Pesaḥ , which is similar to it,
llm_translation: Rather, that "this" - to exclude the second Pesach of its lashes.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאָכְלוּ אֶת הַבָּשָׂר בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּזֶה נֶאֱכָל בַּלַּיְלָה, וְאֵין אַחֵר נֶאֱכָל בַּלַּיְלָה?! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָבַדְתָּ אֶת הָעֲבוֹדָה״.
human_translation: However, if so, which is written: “And they shall eat the meat on that night” so too, this was eaten at night and no other be eaten at night? the verse states: “You shall perform service
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, now that it is written: "And they shall eat the flesh in this night," is it so that this is eaten in the night, and nothing else is eaten in the night?! The verse says: "And you shall serve the service."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא ״הַזֶּה״ לְמָה לִי? לְכִדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rather, why do I “this” for Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya and Rabbi Akiva
llm_translation: Rather, "this" - why do I need it? According to Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah and Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכׇל עָרֵל לֹא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּ״בוֹ״ אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל, אֲבָל אוֹכֵל בְּפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת?! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָבַדְתָּ״.
human_translation: The However, if so, which is written “And no uncircumcised person shall eat from it” so too, that “from it,” he not eat, but he eat from the Paschal lamb generations? the verse states: “You shall perform,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, now that it is written: "And any uncircumcised male shall not eat of it," is it so that one who is uncircumcised does not eat, but he eats in the Passover of future generations?! The verse says: "And you shall observe."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, ״בּוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? דְּ״בוֹ״ אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל, אֲבָל הוּא אוֹכֵל בְּמַצָּה וּמָרוֹר.
human_translation: But why do I “from it” from it, he may not eat, but he eats from the matza and bitter herbs.
llm_translation: Rather, "in it" - why do I need it? Because "in it" does not eat, but he eats matzah and maror.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״(וְכׇל) בֶּן נֵכָר לֹא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּ״בוֹ״ אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל, אֲבָל אוֹכֵל הוּא פֶּסַח לְדוֹרוֹת?! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָבַדְתָּ״.
human_translation: However, if so, “No stranger shall eat from it” so too, from it, that he not eat, but he eat the Paschal lamb generations? the verse states: “You shall perform,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from now on: "(And) any foreigner shall not eat of it," so it is true that "of it" he does not eat, but can he eat the Passover for generations?! The verse says: "And you shall serve."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, ״בּוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? ״בּוֹ״ מְשׁוּמָּדוּת פּוֹסֶלֶת, וְאֵין מְשׁוּמָּדוּת פּוֹסֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: But why do I “From it”? from it, apostasy disqualifies, but apostasy does not disqualify teruma .
llm_translation: Rather, "in it" why do I need? "In it" due to a disqualifying factor, and a disqualifying factor does not disqualify in terumah.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״עָרֵל״, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״בֶּן נֵכָר״. דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״עָרֵל״, מִשּׁוּם דִּמְאִיס, אֲבָל בֶּן נֵכָר לָא מְאִיס — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן ״בֶּן נֵכָר״, מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין לִבּוֹ לַשָּׁמַיִם, אֲבָל עָרֵל דְּלִבּוֹ לַשָּׁמַיִם — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And it is necessary to write an uncircumcised person, and it is necessary to write a stranger, as, if the Torah had written an uncircumcised person, because is repulsive, but a stranger is not repulsive, say it is necessary And if it would have taught us a stranger, because his heart is not toward Heaven but an uncircumcised person, whose heart is toward Heaven, say no it is necessary
llm_translation: And it is necessary to write "uncircumcised," and it is necessary to write "son of a foreigner." For if the Merciful One wrote "uncircumcised," because he despises, but a son of a foreigner does not despise — say no, it is necessary. And if we were to hear "son of a foreigner," because his heart is not towards heaven, but an uncircumcised one whose heart is towards heaven — say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר לֹא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּ״בוֹ״ הוּא אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל, אֲבָל אוֹכֵל הוּא בְּפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת?! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָבַדְתָּ״. אֶלָּא ״בּוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? ״בּוֹ״ מְשׁוּמָּדוּת פּוֹסֶלֶת, וְאֵין מְשׁוּמָּדוּת פּוֹסֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: However, if so, “A sojourner and a hired servant shall not eat from it” so too, from it, he not eat, but he eat from the Paschal lamb generations? the verse states: “And you shall perform,” But why do I “from it”? from it, apostasy disqualifies but apostasy does not disqualify teruma .
llm_translation: Rather, from now on: "A resident or a hired worker shall not eat of it," thus it is stated: "of it" - he may not eat, but may he eat in the Passover of future generations?! The verse says: "And you shall serve." Rather, why do I need "of it"? "Of it" is due to its specification, and a specification does not disqualify in the case of terumah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״וּמַלְתָּה אֹתוֹ אָז יֹאכַל בּוֹ״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּ״בוֹ״ אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל, אֲבָל אוֹכֵל בְּפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת?! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָבַדְתָּ״. אֶלָּא ״בּוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? ״בּוֹ״ מִילַת זְכָרָיו וַעֲבָדָיו מְעַכֶּבֶת, וְאֵין מִילַת זְכָרָיו וַעֲבָדָיו מְעַכֶּבֶת בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: However, if so, “When you have circumcised him, then shall he eat from it” so too, that from it, he not eat but he eat from the Paschal lamb generations? the verse states: “You shall perform,” But why do I “from it”? from it, the circumcision of one’s male and slaves prevents but the circumcision of one’s male and slaves does not prevent from teruma
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from now on: "And circumcise him, then he may eat of it," thus it is stated, "of it" - he does not eat, but he eats in the Passover of future generations?! The verse says: "And you shall serve." Rather, why do I need "of it"? "Of it" - the word of his male organ and his slaves delays, but the word of his male organ and his slaves does not delay in regards to terumah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעֶצֶם לֹא יִשְׁבְּרוּ בּוֹ״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּ״בוֹ״ אֵינוֹ שׁוֹבֵר, אֲבָל שׁוֹבֵר בְּפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת?! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָבַדְתָּ״. אֶלָּא ״בּוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? ״בּוֹ״ בְּכָשֵׁר, וְלֹא בְּפָסוּל.
human_translation: However, if so, which is written: “And they shall not break a bone in it” so too, of it, but one break of a Paschal lamb generations? the verse states: You shall perform, But why do I “in it”? in it, a fit Paschal lamb, no of an unfit
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, from now on, as it is written: "And a bone of it shall not be broken," is it not so that the letter "בּ" is not broken, but it is broken in the Passover of generations?! The verse says: "And you shall serve." Rather, why do I need the "בּ"? The "בּ" is for valid, and not for invalid.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה דִּכְתִיב: ״אַל תֹּאכְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ נָא״, ״מִמֶּנּוּ״ אִי אַתָּה אוֹכֵל, אֲבָל אַתָּה אוֹכֵל נָא בְּפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת?! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָבַדְתָּ״. אֶלָּא ״מִמֶּנּוּ״ לְמָה לִי? לְכִדְרַבָּה אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק.
human_translation: However, if so, which is written: “Do not eat of it raw, of it, that you not eat but you eat raw from the Paschal lamb of generations? the verse states: “You shall perform,” But why do I “in it”? for that which Rabba said Rabbi Yitzḥak said,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, now that it is written: "Do not eat from it raw," "from it" - you may not eat, but may you eat it raw in the Passover of generations?! The verse says: "And you shall serve." Rather, why do I need "from it"? As Rabbi Yitzchak said according to Rabbi Abba.

hebrew_text: וְנֶאֱכָל בְּחִפָּזוֹן וְכוּ׳. מְנָא לַן? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַאֲכַלְתֶּם אוֹתוֹ בְּחִפָּזוֹן״. ״אוֹתוֹ״ נֶאֱכָל בְּחִפָּזוֹן, וְאֵין אַחֵר נֶאֱכָל בְּחִפָּזוֹן.
human_translation: was eaten with haste From where do we as the verse states: “You shall eat it in haste; “it” is eaten with haste, and no other is eaten with haste.
llm_translation: "And it shall be eaten in haste, etc." How do we know? As the verse states: "And you shall eat it in haste." "It" is eaten in haste, and nothing else is eaten in haste.

hebrew_text: וּפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת נוֹהֵג כׇּל שִׁבְעָה וְכוּ׳. אַמַּאי קָאֵי? אִי לֵימָא אַפֶּסַח, פֶּסַח כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִי אִיכָּא!
human_translation: the Paschal lamb of generations applies all seven On what does this stand? If we say to the Paschal lamb is there a Paschal lamb all seven
llm_translation: "And the Passover of generations is observed every seven and so forth. What is the reason? If you say because of the Passover, is there a Passover every seven?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַחָמֵץ. מִכְּלָל דְּפֶסַח מִצְרַיִם לַיְלָה אֶחָד וְתוּ לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לְפֶסַח מִצְרַיִם שֶׁאֵין חִימּוּצוֹ נוֹהֵג אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יֵאָכֵל חָמֵץ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״הַיּוֹם אַתֶּם יוֹצְאִים״.
human_translation: Rather, to leavened bread, by inference that the Passover of Egypt, one night and not more? But wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: From where the Passover of Egypt that its leavened bread applied for only one day? The verse states: “No leavened bread shall be eaten” and juxtaposed to it “This day you go forth”
llm_translation: Rather, "achametz." From the inference that the Paschal lamb of Egypt is eaten only one night, is it not so? And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: From where do we derive regarding the Paschal lamb of Egypt that its prohibition of chametz is observed only for one day? It is derived from the verse that states: "No leaven shall be eaten," and it is juxtaposed with the verse: "Today you are leaving."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: לַיְלָה אֶחָד, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת. וְחִימּוּצוֹ כׇּל הַיּוֹם, וּפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת נוֹהֵג כׇּל שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: Rather, this is it said one night, and the same is true of the Paschal lamb of generations; and its leavened bread the entire day, and Passover generations it applies to all seven
llm_translation: Thus he said: one night, and it is the same for the Passover of generations. And its leaven is all day, and the Passover of generations is observed for seven days.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁתְּמוּרַת פֶּסַח קְרֵיבָה, וּתְמוּרַת פֶּסַח אֵינָהּ קְרֵיבָה, וְאֵין לִי לְפָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that the substitute of a Paschal lamb is sacrificed the substitute of a Paschal lamb is not sacrificed and I cannot explain
