llm_translation: Mishnah: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that the exchange of a Paschal lamb is brought, but the exchange of a Paschal lamb is not brought, and I have no explanation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֲנִי אֲפָרֵשׁ: הַפֶּסַח שֶׁנִּמְצָא קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטַת הַפֶּסַח — יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב, וְיִמָּכֵר, וְיָבִיא בְּדָמָיו שְׁלָמִים. וְכֵן תְּמוּרָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: I will explain: Paschal lamb and is found before the slaughter of the Paschal lamb, graze until it becomes unfit [ yista’ev ] sold and bring a peace-offering with its proceeds. And so too, its substitute:
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said, I will explain: the Pesach offering that was found before the slaughtering of the Pesach offering - it shall graze until it develops a blemish, and then it shall be sold, and its value shall be brought as a peace offering. And so too is its exchange.

hebrew_text: אַחַר שְׁחִיטַת הַפֶּסַח — קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים. וְכֵן תְּמוּרָתוֹ.
human_translation: after slaughter of the Paschal lamb, it is sacrificed as a peace-offering, and so too, its substitute
llm_translation: After the slaughtering of the Paschal lamb - the peace offerings. And so too its exchange.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְלֵימָא: פֶּסַח קָרֵב וּפֶסַח אֵינוֹ קָרֵב. הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִיכָּא תְּמוּרַת הַפֶּסַח דְּלָא קָרְבָה.
human_translation: let say The Paschal lamb is sacrificed and the Paschal lamb is not sacrificed. This teach us that there is a substitute Paschal lamb that is not sacrificed.
llm_translation: Gemara: And let us say: The Paschal lamb is brought near, and the Paschal lamb is not brought near. This implies to us that there is an alternative to the Paschal lamb that is not brought near.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַבָּה אָמַר: קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה וּלְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה שָׁנִינוּ. רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר: קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת וּלְאַחַר חֲצוֹת שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: It was stated Rabba said: We learned before slaughter or after slaughter Rabbi Zeira said: We learned before midday or after midday.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabah said: Before slaughter and after slaughter we have learned. Rabbi Zeira said: Before midnight and after midnight we have learned.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי זֵירָא, הָא קָתָנֵי קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטַת הַפֶּסַח? אֵימָא: קוֹדֶם זְמַן שְׁחִיטַת הַפֶּסַח.
human_translation: And to Rabbi Zeira, isn’t teaching before the slaughter of the Paschal lamb? Say before the time slaughter of the Paschal lamb,
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Zeira, this was taught: Before the slaughtering of the Paschal lamb? Say: Before the time of the slaughtering of the Paschal lamb.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי. הַפֶּסַח שֶׁנִּמְצָא קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה — יִרְעֶה, לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה — יִקְרַב. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת — יִרְעֶה, לְאַחַר חֲצוֹת — יִקְרַב.
human_translation: is like tanna’im The Paschal lamb that is found before the slaughter shall be left to graze after the slaughter, it is to be sacrificed Rabbi Eliezer says before midday it shall be left to graze, after midday it is to be sacrificed
llm_translation: The Tannaim. The Paschal lamb that was found before slaughter - it shall graze, after slaughter - it shall be brought near. Rabbi Eliezer says: Before midnight - it shall graze, after midnight - it shall be brought near.

hebrew_text: אַחַר שְׁחִיטַת הַפֶּסַח יָבִיא שְׁלָמִים וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּמְצָא אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה וְהֵמִיר בּוֹ אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה. אֲבָל נִמְצָא קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה וְהֵמִיר בּוֹ אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה — תְּמוּרָתוֹ מִכֹּחַ קְדוּשָּׁה דְּחוּיָה קָא אָתָא, וְלָא קָרְבָה.
human_translation: after the slaughter of the Paschal lamb, one bring peace-offering, Rava said: They taught only when was found after the slaughter and one performed the substitution after the slaughter, But was found before the slaughter, one performed the substitution after the slaughter its substitute comes on the strength of deferred sanctity, and may not be sacrificed.
llm_translation: After the slaughter of the Paschal lamb, one should bring peace offerings, etc. Rava said: They only taught that if it was found after slaughter and he exchanged it after slaughter. But if it was found before slaughter and he exchanged it after slaughter - its exchange is ineffective due to the sanctity being rejected, and it is not brought near.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: ״אִם כֶּשֶׂב״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אִם כֶּשֶׂב״? לְרַבּוֹת תְּמוּרַת הַפֶּסַח אַחַר הַפֶּסַח שֶׁקְּרֵבָה שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to “If a lamb what the verse states: “If a lamb”? to include the substitute of a Paschal lamb after Paschal lamb that it is offered as a peace-offering.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: "If 'like a lamb'," what is the Talmud to say 'if like a lamb'? To include the exchange of the Paschal offering after the Paschal offering that is brought as a peace offering.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא שֶׁנִּמְצָא אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה וְהֵמִיר בּוֹ אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה — פְּשִׁיטָא! לְמָה לִי קְרָא? אֶלָּא לָאו, שֶׁנִּמְצָא קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה וְהֵמִיר בּוֹ אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say was found after the slaughter and one performed the substitution after the slaughter, it is obvious, why do I a verse Rather, is it not was found before the slaughter and one performed the substitution after the slaughter
llm_translation: How are the cases similar? If you say that it was found after slaughter and he exchanged it after slaughter - it is obvious! Why do I need a verse? Rather, no, that it was found before slaughter and he exchanged it after slaughter!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם שֶׁנִּמְצָא אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה וְהֵמִיר בּוֹ אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה, וּקְרָא אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: No; actually was found after the slaughter and one performed the substitution after the slaughter. the verse is a mere support.
llm_translation: Not, forever, that found after slaughter and exchanged in it after slaughter, and he read a support in the world.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא קְרָא לְמַאי אֲתָא? כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״כֶּשֶׂב״ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַפֶּסַח לְאַלְיָה.
human_translation: But for what verse come? As it was taught “lamb” to include the Paschal lamb the fat tail
llm_translation: Instead, what does the verse come to include? As it was taught: "A lamb" comes to include the Passover sacrifice for an invalid.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אִם כֶּשֶׂב״, לְרַבּוֹת פֶּסַח שֶׁעָבְרָה שְׁנָתוֹ, וּשְׁלָמִים הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת פֶּסַח לְכׇל מִצְוַת שְׁלָמִים, שֶׁטָּעוּן סְמִיכָה וּנְסָכִים וּתְנוּפַת חָזֶה וָשׁוֹק.
human_translation: When it says: “If a lamb,” to include a Paschal lamb whose year has passed peace-offerings that come due to a Paschal lamb, in all the mitzvot of peace-offerings. they require leaning and libations and the waving of the breast and thigh.
llm_translation: When he says "if a sheep," to include the Passover offering of one whose year has passed, and peace offerings that come because of the Passover for all the mitzvot of peace offerings, which require leaning, libations, waving of the breast and the thigh.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְאִם עֵז״ — הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן, לִימֵּד עַל הָעֵז שֶׁאֵין טְעוּנָה אַלְיָה.
human_translation: And when it says: “And if she-goat” it interrupted the matter and taught that the she-goat does not require fat tail
llm_translation: And when he says, "and if it is a goat" — he interrupted the matter, teaching about the goat that does not require a yoke.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַרֵישָׁא: הַפֶּסַח שֶׁנִּמְצָא קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטַת הַפֶּסַח — יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב, וְיִמָּכֵר, וְיָבִיא בְּדָמָיו שְׁלָמִים. וְכֵן תְּמוּרָתוֹ.
human_translation: some teach this with regard to the first clause a Paschal lamb which is found before the slaughter of the Paschal lamb left to graze until it becomes unfit, and it is sold, and one bring a peace-offering with its proceeds; and likewise, its substitute.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches the following as the first statement: If the Paschal lamb was found before the slaughtering of the Paschal lamb - it shall graze until it becomes blemished, and then it shall be sold, and its value shall be brought as peace offerings. And so too is the exchange for it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּמְצָא קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה וְהֵמִיר בּוֹ קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה, אֲבָל נִמְצָא קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה וְהֵמִיר בּוֹ אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה — תְּמוּרָתוֹ קְרֵיבָה שְׁלָמִים. מַאי טַעְמָא — כִּי קָבְעָה שְׁחִיטָה מִידֵּי דַּחֲזֵי לֵיהּ. מִידֵּי דְּלָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ — לָא קָבְעָה.
human_translation: Rava said: They taught only where was found before the slaughter and one performed the substitution before the slaughter; but was found before the slaughter and one performed the substitution after the slaughter its substitute is offered as a peace-offering. What is the reason The slaughter establishes something which is fit for it; something that was not fit for it, does not establish
llm_translation: Rava said: They only taught the ruling when it was found before slaughter and he exchanged it before slaughter, but if it was found before slaughter and he exchanged it after slaughter - its exchange is considered a peace offering. What is the reason? - Because once slaughter is established, he looks at it. If he does not look at it - it is not established.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: ״אִם כֶּשֶׂב״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְרַבּוֹת תְּמוּרַת הַפֶּסַח אַחַר הַפֶּסַח שֶׁקְּרֵיבָה שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to What the verse states: “If a lamb”? to include the substitute of a Paschal lamb after Passover, which is offered as a peace-offering.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him, Abaye: "If it is a lamb," what is the teaching to say? To include the exchange of the Passover offering after the Passover offering that one brought peace offerings.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אַף לִפְנֵי הַפֶּסַח כֵּן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הוּא״ — הוּא קָרֵב, וְאֵין תְּמוּרַת הַפֶּסַח קְרֵיבָה.
human_translation: might even before Paschal lamb same the verse states: “It,” it, is sacrificed, and the substitute of a Paschal lamb is not sacrificed.
llm_translation: He is close, and the exchange of the Paschal lamb is not close.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא שֶׁנִּמְצָא קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה וְהֵמִיר בּוֹ קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה — פְּשִׁיטָא! לְמָה לִי קְרָא? אֶלָּא לָאו, שֶׁנִּמְצָא קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה וְהֵמִיר בּוֹ אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה! תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרָבָא, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say is found before the slaughter and one performed the substitution before the slaughter obvious; why do I a verse Rather, is it not was found before the slaughter and one performed the substitution after the slaughter the refutation of Rava is a conclusive refutation,
llm_translation: "How are the laws of blood similar? If you say that it was found before slaughter and he designated it before slaughter - it is obvious! Why do I need a verse? Rather, it is not that it was found before slaughter and he designated it after slaughter! A refutation of Rava, a refutation."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֹּל שֶׁבַּחַטָּאת מֵתָה — בַּפֶּסַח קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים, וְכֹל שֶׁבַּחַטָּאת רוֹעֶה — בַּפֶּסַח נָמֵי רוֹעֶה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵין הַפֶּסַח קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּמְצָא אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה, אֲבָל קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה — לֹא.
human_translation: Shmuel stated any that a sin-offering die, a Paschal lamb it is sacrificed as a peace-offering. And any that a sin-offering is left to graze a Paschal lamb it is also left to graze. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A Paschal lamb is sacrificed as a peace-offering only when was found after the slaughter but before the slaughter, no
llm_translation: Shmuel said: All that die in a sin-offering, the Passover offering is brought as peace-offerings, and all that die in a sin-offering of a shepherd, the Passover offering is indeed of a shepherd. And Rabbi Yochanan said: The Passover offering is brought as peace-offerings only if it is found after slaughter, but if before slaughter - no.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: וּכְלָלָא הוּא? וַהֲרֵי חַטָּאת שֶׁעָבְרָה שְׁנָתָהּ, דְּלִרְעִיָּה אָזְלָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: חַטָּאת שֶׁעָבְרָה שְׁנָתָהּ — רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא עוֹמֶדֶת בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, וְרוֹעֶה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef strongly objects to Is that an principle Isn’t a sin-offering whose year has passed which goes to graze As Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: A sin-offering whose year has passed, it is viewed as though it were standing in a cemetery it grazes
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to her: And is it a general principle? But behold, a sin offering whose year has passed, goes to waste, as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: A sin offering whose year has passed - we view it as if it is standing in the cemetery and grazing.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ בְּפֶסַח כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים, דְּתַנְיָא: ״כֶּשֶׂב״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַפֶּסַח לְאַלְיָה, כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִם כֶּשֶׂב״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַפֶּסַח שֶׁעָבְרָה שְׁנָתוֹ וּשְׁלָמִים הַבָּאִין מֵחֲמַת פֶּסַח לְכׇל מִצְוַת שְׁלָמִים, שֶׁטְּעוּנִים סְמִיכָה וּנְסָכִים וּתְנוּפַת חָזֶה וָשׁוֹק. כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִם עֵז״ — הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן, לִימֵּד עַל הָעֵז שֶׁאֵין טָעוּן אַלְיָה.
human_translation: However, a Paschal lamb in a case like this is sacrificed as a peace-offering, as it was taught “lamb” to include the Paschal lamb the fat tail When it says: “If a lamb,” to include a Paschal lamb whose year has passed and peace-offerings that come due to a Paschal lamb. in all the laws of peace-offerings that they require leaning and libations and the waving of the breast and thigh. When it says “And if she-goat” it interrupted the matter in order to teach that the she-goat does not require fat tail
llm_translation: And if in Pesach, for this reason close to peace offerings, as it was taught: "As a sheep," to include the Pesach of an upper grade, when one says, "If as a sheep," to include the Pesach that its year has passed and peace offerings that come due to Pesach for all the commandments of peace offerings, which require leaning, libations, waving of the breast, and the thigh. When one says, "If as a goat" — the matter is interrupted, teaching about the goat that does not require an upper grade.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, בַּאֲבוּדִין. בִּדְחוּיִין לָא אָמַר.
human_translation: He said to him: When Shmuel stated with regard to that were lost; he did not state with regard to that were deferred
llm_translation: He said to him: When Samuel said, in the case of lost items. In the case of rejected items, he did not say.

hebrew_text: וְאָבוּד מִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? וַהֲרֵי אֲבוּדָה בִּשְׁעַת הַפְרָשָׁה, לְרַבָּנַן, דְּלִרְעִיָּה אָזְלָא. דִּתְנַן: הִפְרִישׁ חַטָּאתוֹ וְאָבְדָה, וְהִפְרִישׁ אַחֶרֶת תַּחְתֶּיהָ וְנִמְצֵאת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, וַהֲרֵי שְׁתֵּיהֶן עוֹמְדוֹת — אַחַת מֵהֶן תִּקְרַב וּשְׁנִיָּה תָּמוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין חַטָּאת מֵתָה אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּתְכַּפְּרוּ בְּעָלִים. הָא קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּתְכַּפְּרוּ בְּעָלִים — רוֹעָה.
human_translation: lost do you find But that was lost at the time of the separation According to the Rabbis, goes for grazing, as we learned If one separated his sin-offering and it was lost, and he separated another in its place and the first was found, and therefore both are available, one of them, is sacrificed, and the second shall die; the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: A sin-offering is die only when it is found after the owners gained atonement Therefore, before the owners gained atonement, it grazes.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who will remember the lost item for her? But behold, the lost item was during the time of separation, according to the Rabbis, for it went to the public domain. As we learned: If one separated his sin-offering and it got lost, and he separated another one in its place and then the first one was found, and now both are standing - one of them should be brought close and the other should die, the words of Rabbi. And the Sages say: A sin-offering only dies if it is found after the owners have been atoned for. If it was found before the owners were atoned for - it grazes.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ בְּפֶסַח, הֵיכָא דְּאָבַד וְנִמְצָא אַחַר חֲצוֹת קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה — קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים. שְׁמוּאֵל כְּרַבִּי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר אֲבוּדָה לְמִיתָה אָזְלָא.
human_translation: And yet with regard to the Paschal lamb, where it is found after midday before the slaughter, it is sacrificed as a peace-offering. Shmuel holds in accordance with Rabbi who said a lost goes to death.
llm_translation: And if it was in the case of Pesach, where the animal was lost and found after midnight before slaughter - it is brought as a Korban Shelamim. Shmuel agrees with Rabbi Sevira, for he said, "An item lost for death goes to be used for death."

hebrew_text: וְהָא כֹּל אֲבוּדָה לְרַבִּי מֵתָה, וְאִילּוּ בְּפֶסַח הֵיכָא דְּאָבַד קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת וְנִמְצָא קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת — רוֹעֶה! קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת לָאו אָבוּד הוּא, כִּדְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: אֲבֵידַת לַיְלָה לָאו שְׁמָהּ אֲבֵידָה.
human_translation: But every lost die to Rabbi whereas with regard to the Paschal lamb, when it was lost before midday and found before midday it grazes. before midday is not lost, in accordance with Rava, as Rava said: lost at night is not called lost,
llm_translation: And this, all lost property according to Rabbi is considered as dead. But if it was lost on Passover, where if it was lost before midnight and found before midnight — he may graze! If it was lost before midnight, it is not considered lost, as Rava said: nighttime lost property is not called lost property.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, רוֹעָה לְרַבִּי הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: But according to Rabbi what circumstances graze be found?
llm_translation: Rather, how does Rabbi find fault with her?

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הִפְרִישׁ שְׁתֵּי חַטָּאוֹת לְאַחְרָיוּת — מִתְכַּפֵּר בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן, וּשְׁנִיָּה תִּרְעֶה.
human_translation: in accordance Rabbi Oshaya, as Rabbi Oshaya said: separated two sin-offerings as a guarantee, he gains atonement with one of them and the second is left to graze.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Oshaya said: Rabbi Oshaya said: If one designates two sin-offerings for afterthought, he is atoned for with one of them, and the other shall graze.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִילּוּ בְּפֶסַח כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים! אֶלָּא שְׁמוּאֵל כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת מֵתוֹת.
human_translation: But with regard to a Paschal lamb, in a case like this sacrificed as a peace-offering. Rather, Shmuel held in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who said there are five sin-offerings that die,
llm_translation: And this, if it were done on Passover, for this act is close to offering peace offerings! Rather, Shmuel holds like Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, for he said: "Five sin offerings result in death."

hebrew_text: וְהָא רוֹעָה לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לֵית לֵיהּ כְּלָל! שְׁמוּאֵל נָמֵי חֲדָא קָאָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁבַּחַטָּאת מֵתָה — בְּפֶסַח קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: But Rabbi Shimon does not at all graze, Shmuel also said one any that a sin-offering die, a Paschal lamb it is sacrificed as a peace-offering.
llm_translation: And this, the shepherd of Rabbi Shimon, does not have a general principle! Shmuel also said: Any sin offering that dies - bring peace offerings on Passover.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: אֵין הַפֶּסַח קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּמְצָא אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה, אֲבָל קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה — לָא. אַלְמָא: שְׁחִיטָה קָבַע. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: חֲצוֹת קָבַע.
human_translation: And what does he teach us to exclude of Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said that a Paschal lamb is sacrificed as a peace-offering only when it is found after slaughter, but before the slaughter, no, Apparently, the slaughter determines teaches us midday determines
llm_translation: And what does it teach us? To go out from the teaching of Rabbi Yochanan, who said: The Paschal lamb is not brought as a peace offering unless it is found after slaughter, but before slaughter - no. This implies: Slaughter establishes. It teaches us: Midnight establishes.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: וְאִילּוּ בְּפֶסַח הֵיכָא דְּאָבַד וְנִמְצָא אַחַר חֲצוֹת, קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה יִקְרַב שְׁלָמִים! שְׁמוּאֵל כְּרַבָּה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: שְׁחִיטָה קָבַע.
human_translation: another version with regard to a Paschal lamb, where it is lost and found after midday before the slaughter it is offered as a peace-offering, Shmuel holds in accordance with Rabba, who said the slaughter determines
llm_translation: Another teaching: And in the case of the Passover offering, where if it was lost and found after midnight, one should bring peace offerings before the slaughter! Shmuel holds according to Rabbah, for he said: Slaughter establishes.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן עֲלַהּ: אֵין הַפֶּסַח קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּמְצָא אַחַר שְׁחִיטָה, אֲבָל קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה — לָא. אַלְמָא: שְׁחִיטָה קָבַע. מִכְּלָל דִּשְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר: חֲצוֹת קָבַע.
human_translation: But from the fact Rabbi Yoḥanan said about a Paschal lamb is sacrificed as a peace-offering only when it was found after the slaughter but if it was found before the slaughter, no, apparently the slaughter determines by inference that Shmuel holds midday determines
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: The Paschal lamb is not valid for offering as a peace offering unless it is found after slaughter, but not before slaughter? This implies that slaughter is the determining factor. By inference, Shmuel holds that midnight is the determining factor.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: שְׁמוּאֵל כְּרַבִּי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: אֲבוּדָה לְמִיתָה אָזְלָא. וְהָא כֹּל אֲבוּדִין לְרַבִּי מֵתִין, וְאִילּוּ בְּפֶסַח, הֵיכָא דְּאָבַד קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת וְנִמְצָא קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת — רוֹעֶה! קָסָבַר: קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת לָאו אָבוּד הוּא, וְקָסָבַר חֲצוֹת קָבַע.
human_translation: Rather, Shmuel holds in accordance with Rabbi who said a lost goes to its death. But according to Rabbi all lost die, whereas with regard to the Paschal lamb, where it is lost before midday and found before midday it is left to graze He held before midday is not lost and he held that midday determines
llm_translation: Rather: Samuel like Rabbi Sevira holds, for he said: Lost property leads to death. But all lost items according to Rabbi result in death, except for on Passover, where if it was lost before midnight and found before midnight - one may graze! He holds: Before midnight is not considered lost, and he holds that midnight is fixed.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְפִסְחוֹ, אוֹ זָכָר בֶּן שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים — יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב, וְיִמָּכֵר, וְיִפְּלוּ דָּמָיו לִנְדָבָה לִשְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: one who separates a female for his Paschal lamb or a male that is in its second year is left to graze until it becomes unfit, and it is sold and its money is used for free-will offerings peace-offerings.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who designates a female animal for his Passover offering, or a male animal that is two years old - it shall graze until it develops a blemish, then it shall be sold, and its value shall be designated as a donation for voluntary offerings.

hebrew_text: הַמַּפְרִישׁ פִּסְחוֹ וּמֵת, לֹא יְבִיאֶנּוּ בְּנוֹ אַחֲרָיו לְשֵׁם פֶּסַח אֶלָּא לְשֵׁם שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: one who separates his Paschal lamb and dies, his son not bring it after him for the purpose of a Paschal lamb Rather, for the purpose of a peace-offering.
llm_translation: The one who separates his Passover offering and dies, his son should not bring it after him in the name of Passover, rather in the name of peace offerings.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים נִדְחִין.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Conclude three from this Conclude from it that living things can be deferred;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua: hear from it three. Hear from it: living creatures are disqualified.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: דָּחוּי מֵעִיקָּרָא הָוֵי דָּחוּי. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: יֵשׁ דִּחוּי בְּדָמִים.
human_translation: And conclude from this that deferral at the outset, is a deferral; And conclude from this that there is deferral with regard to the money
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And hear from it: rejected from the outset is considered rejected. And hear from it: there is rejection in blood."

hebrew_text: הַמַּפְרִישׁ פִּסְחוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמַּפְרִישׁ אֶת פִּסְחוֹ וּמֵת, אִם בְּנוֹ מְמוּנֶּה עִמּוֹ יְבִיאֶנּוּ לְשׁוּם פֶּסַח, אֵין בְּנוֹ מְמוּנֶּה עִמּוֹ — יְבִיאֶנּוּ לְשׁוּם שְׁלָמִים לְשִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר. לְשִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר אִין, לַחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר — לָא. קָא סָבַר: נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת אֵין קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: one who separates his Paschal lamb the Sages taught one who separates his Paschal lamb and dies, if is registered with him his son brings it for the purpose of a Paschal lamb, his son is not registered with him, his son bring it for the purpose of a peace-offering on the sixteenth on the sixteenth, yes, on the fifteenth, no, holds that vows and free-will offerings are not offered on a Festival;
llm_translation: The one who separates his Passover offering, etc. The Rabbis taught: One who separates his Passover offering and dies, if his son who is financially capable is with him, he should bring it as a Passover offering in his name. If his son who is financially capable is not with him, he should bring it as a peace offering on the sixteenth of Nisan. If there is no sixteenth of Nisan, on the fifteenth of Nisan — no. He holds: Vows and freewill offerings are not brought on a festival day.

hebrew_text: דְּמִית הָאָב אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא דְּמִית קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת, בְּנוֹ מְמוּנֶּה עִמּוֹ יְבִיאֶנּוּ לְשׁוּם פֶּסַח? הָא חָלָה אֲנִינוּת עִילָּוֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא!
human_translation: When did the father die? If we say died before midday his son is registered with him, bring it for the purpose of a Paschal lamb? Acute mourning applies to from the outset, before
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "When did the father die? Perhaps he died before midnight, and his son, who is appointed with him, brought him for the sake of the Passover? No, the illness was the cause of his death from the outset!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּמִית אַחַר חֲצוֹת. אֵין בְּנוֹ מְמוּנֶּה עִמּוֹ — יְבִיאֶנּוּ לְשׁוּם שְׁלָמִים? הָא קְבַעְתֵּיהּ חֲצוֹת!
human_translation: Rather, he died after midday? his son is not registered with him, bring it for the purpose of a peace-offering; but midday established it
llm_translation: Rather, he died after midnight. If his son is not with him - should he bring him for the purpose of peace offerings? But he established it for midnight!

hebrew_text: אָמַר (רָבָא): לְעוֹלָם דְּמִית קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת, וּמַאי יְבִיאֶנּוּ לְשׁוּם פֶּסַח — לְשׁוּם פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Rava said: Actually, that died before midday, and what bring for the purpose of a Paschal lamb? for the purpose of second Pesaḥ ,
llm_translation: Rava said: Always one should die before midnight, and what will bring him to the Paschal offering? — For the sake of the second Paschal offering.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר, לִצְדָדִין קָתָנֵי: מֵת אַחַר חֲצוֹת — בְּנוֹ מְמוּנֶּה עִמּוֹ יְבִיאֶנּוּ לְשׁוּם פֶּסַח. מֵת קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת — אֵין בְּנוֹ מְמוּנֶּה עִמּוֹ יְבִיאֶנּוּ לְשׁוּם שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: Abaye said: It teaches it disjunctively, died after midday his son was registered with him, bring for the purpose of a Paschal lamb, died before midday his son was not registered with him, bring it for the purpose of a peace-offering
llm_translation: Abaye said, the scholars of Sidon say: If one dies after midnight, his son who is financially capable should bring him for the Pesach offering. If one dies before midnight, his son who is financially capable should not bring him for the peace offering.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם דְּמִית לְאַחַר חֲצוֹת, וּכְגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה אָבִיו גּוֹסֵס בַּחֲצוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Sherevya said: Actually, died after midday, for example, his father was death at midday.
llm_translation: Rav She'revya said: Always one should resemble after midnight, and for example, his father was threshing at midnight.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם דְּמִית לְאַחַר חֲצוֹת, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים נִדְחִין.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, died after midday, and it is Rabbi Shimon, as he said living animals are not deferred.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Always one should resemble after midnight, and Rabbi Shimon is it, who said: living creatures are not rejected.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִפְרִישׁוֹ אַחַר חֲצוֹת וּמֵתוּ בְּעָלִים אַחַר חֲצוֹת, וְקָא סָבַר חֲצוֹת קָבַע.
human_translation: Ravina said where one separated after midday and the owners died after midday; and holds that midday determines
llm_translation: Ravina said: For example, if he separated it after midnight and the owners died after midnight, and he holds that midnight is fixed.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפֶּסַח שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב בִּזְבָחִים — כּוּלָּן יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ, וְיִמָּכְרוּ, וְיָבִיא בִּדְמֵי הַיָּפֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן מִמִּין זֶה וּבִדְמֵי הַיָּפֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן מִמִּין זֶה, [וְיַפְסִיד] הַמּוֹתָר מִבֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: a Paschal lamb that was intermingled with offerings, all of them graze until they become unfit; and they are sold, and with the proceeds of the choicest of them he bring this type and with the proceeds of the choicest of them this type And he loses the difference from his own
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the Paschal lamb became mixed with other sacrifices - all of them shall graze until they develop a blemish, and then they shall be sold. The owner shall bring the value of the best among them from this kind and the value of the best among them from that kind, and the surplus shall be used for the maintenance of the Temple.

hebrew_text: נִתְעָרֵב בִּבְכוֹרוֹת, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אִם חֲבוּרַת כֹּהֲנִים — יֹאכֵלוּ.
human_translation: was intermingled with firstborn Rabbi Shimon says: If groups of priests, they may eat
llm_translation: Mingled in firstborns, Rabbi Shimon says: If a group of priests - they shall eat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָא קָא מַיְיתֵי קָדָשִׁים לְבֵית הַפְּסוּל?
human_translation: They will cause offerings to be considered disqualified
llm_translation: Gemara: And this, isn't it bringing sanctified items into a disqualified house?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: מְבִיאִין קָדָשִׁים לְבֵית הַפְּסוּל. דִּתְנַן: אָשָׁם שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב בִּשְׁלָמִים — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יִשָּׁחֲטוּ בַּצָּפוֹן, וְיֵאָכְלוּ כַּחוֹמֶר שֶׁבָּהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon to his reasoning, as he said it is permitted to cause offerings to be considered disqualified, as we learned a guilt-offering became intermingled with a peace-offering, Rabbi Shimon says: One should slaughter in the northern And they should be eaten as the stricter of them
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon according to his reasoning, as he said: "Bringing sacrifices to the Temple by one who is disqualified." For it was taught: "A guilt-offering that became mixed with peace-offerings - Rabbi Shimon says: They should be slaughtered in the north, and eaten like the more stringent of the two."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין מְבִיאִין קָדָשִׁים לְבֵית הַפְּסוּל.
human_translation: said to him: One may not cause offerings to be considered disqualified,
llm_translation: They said to him: "One does not bring holy offerings to a disqualified house."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הֵיכִי עָבְדִינַן? אָמַר רָבָא: נַמְתִּין לוֹ עַד שֶׁיּוּמְמוּ, וְיָבִיא בְּהֵמָה שְׁמֵינָה, וְלֵימָא: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ לְפֶסַח — תְּחוּל עֲלֵיהּ דְּהַאי, וְאָכֵיל לְהוּ בְּתוֹרַת בְּכוֹר בַּעַל מוּם.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what we do Rava said: We wait for until are blemished, and  he will bring a fat, animal and say: Anywhere that the Paschal lamb is, its should apply to this he eats them the laws of a blemished firstborn
llm_translation: The sages, how do we act? Rava said: We wait for him until they become blemished, and he brings an animal that is eight days old, and let him say: wherever he is for the Passover - let him rely on this one, and he may eat it according to the law of a firstborn animal with a blemish.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חֲבוּרָה שֶׁאָבַד פִּסְחָהּ וְאָמְרוּ לְאֶחָד ״צֵא וּבַקֵּשׁ וּשְׁחוֹט עָלֵינוּ״, וְהָלַךְ וּמָצָא וְשָׁחַט, וְהֵם לָקְחוּ וְשָׁחֲטוּ, אִם שֶׁלּוֹ נִשְׁחַט רִאשׁוֹן — הוּא אוֹכֵל מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, וְהֵם אוֹכְלִין עִמּוֹ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ. וְאִם שֶׁלָּהֶן נִשְׁחַט רִאשׁוֹן — הֵם אוֹכְלִין מִשֶּׁלָּהֶן, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל מִשֶּׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: a group whose Paschal lamb was lost, and they said to one Go and search and slaughter on and he went and found and slaughtered they took and slaughtered If his was slaughtered first, he eats from his and they eat with him from his And if theirs was slaughtered first, they eat from theirs and he eats from his
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If a group lost their Paschal lamb, and they said to one of them, "Go out and search for it and slaughter it for us," and he went and found it and slaughtered it, and they took it and slaughtered it, if his was slaughtered first - he eats from his, and they eat with him from his. But if theirs was slaughtered first - they eat from theirs, and he eats from his.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אֵינוֹ יָדוּעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן נִשְׁחַט רִאשׁוֹן, אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁחֲטוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּאֶחָד — הוּא אוֹכֵל מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, וְהֵם אֵינָם אוֹכְלִין עִמּוֹ, וְשֶׁלָּהֶן יֵצֵא לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה. וּפְטוּרִין מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: And if it is not known which of was slaughtered first, or both slaughtered together, he eats from his and they do not eat with him and theirs must be taken out to the place burning. they are exempt from performing second Pesaḥ ,
llm_translation: And if it is not known which of them was slaughtered first, or if they were both slaughtered simultaneously — he eats from his own, and they do not eat with him, and their portion goes out to the burning place. And they are exempt from performing the second Passover.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: ״אִם אֵחַרְתִּי — צְאוּ וְשַׁחֲטוּ עָלַי״. הָלַךְ וּמָצָא וְשָׁחַט, וְהֵן לָקְחוּ וְשָׁחֲטוּ. אִם שֶׁלָּהֶן נִשְׁחַט רִאשׁוֹן — הֵן אוֹכְלִין מִשֶּׁלָּהֶן, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל עִמָּהֶן. וְאִם שֶׁלּוֹ נִשְׁחַט רִאשׁוֹן — הוּא אוֹכֵל מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, וְהֵן אוֹכְלִין מִשֶּׁלָּהֶם.
human_translation: said to If I am late, go and slaughter He went and found and slaughtered and they took and slaughtered if theirs was slaughtered first, they eat from theirs and he eats with them, And if his was slaughtered first, he eats from his and they eat from theirs,
llm_translation: He said to them: "If I am the last one, go out and slaughter upon me." He went and found, and slaughtered, and they took and slaughtered. If the first one belonged to them - they eat from theirs, and he eats with them. And if the first one belonged to him - he eats from his, and they eat from theirs.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אֵינוֹ יָדוּעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן נִשְׁחַט רִאשׁוֹן, אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁחֲטוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּאֶחָד — הֵן אוֹכְלִין מִשֶּׁלָּהֶן, וְהוּא אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל עִמָּהֶן. וְשֶׁלּוֹ יֵצֵא לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה, וּפָטוּר מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: And if it is not known which of was slaughtered first, or both slaughtered together, they eat from theirs and he does not eat with them his must be taken out to the place burning; and he is exempt from performing the second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: And if it is not known which of them was slaughtered first, or if they were both slaughtered together - they may eat from their own, and he does not eat with them. And his portion goes out to the burning place, and he is exempt from making a second Passover.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ — אוֹכְלִין כּוּלָּן מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן. וְאִם אֵין יָדוּעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן נִשְׁחַט רִאשׁוֹן — שְׁנֵיהֶן יוֹצְאִין לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: he said to them and they said to him all of them eat from the first And if it is not known which of them was slaughtered first, both of them must be taken out to the place burning,
llm_translation: He said to them, and they said to him - they all eat from the first. And if it is not known which of them was slaughtered first - both of them go out to the burning place.

hebrew_text: לֹא אָמַר לָהֶן וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לוֹ — אֵין אַחֲרָאִין זֶה לָזֶה.
human_translation: he did not say to them and they did not say to him, they are not responsible for each other,
llm_translation: He did not say to them, and they did not say to him - others do not follow one another.

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי חֲבוּרוֹת שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ פִּסְחֵיהֶן, אֵלּוּ מוֹשְׁכִין לָהֶן אֶחָד וְאֵלּוּ מוֹשְׁכִין לָהֶן אֶחָד. אֶחָד מֵאֵלּוּ בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל אֵלּוּ, וְאֶחָד מֵאֵלּוּ בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל אֵלּוּ, וְכָךְ הֵם אוֹמְרִים: אִם שֶׁלָּנוּ הוּא הַפֶּסַח הַזֶּה — יָדֶיךָ מְשׁוּכוֹת מִשֶּׁלְּךָ וְנִמְנֵיתָ עַל שֶׁלָּנוּ. וְאִם שֶׁלְּךָ הוּא הַפֶּסַח הַזֶּה — יָדֵינוּ מְשׁוּכוֹת מִשֶּׁלָּנוּ וְנִמְנֵינוּ עַל שֶׁלָּךְ.
human_translation: Two groups whose Paschal lambs have become intermingled These draw one for themselves, and those draw one for themselves. One of these, comes to those, and one of those comes to these And this is what says If this Paschal lamb is ours, you are withdrawn from yours, and you are registered for our And if this Paschal lamb is yours, we are withdrawn from ours and we are registered for your
llm_translation: Two groups that mixed their Passover offerings, these draw for one group and these draw for one group. One from these comes to those, and one from those comes to these, and thus they say: If this Passover offering is ours - your hands are drawn from yours and counted for ours. And if this Passover offering is yours - our hands are drawn from ours and counted for yours.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן חָמֵשׁ חֲבוּרוֹת שֶׁל חֲמִשָּׁה חֲמִשָּׁה וְשֶׁל עֲשָׂרָה עֲשָׂרָה — מוֹשְׁכִין לָהֶן אֶחָד מִכׇּל חֲבוּרָה וַחֲבוּרָה וְכֵן הֵם אוֹמְרִים.
human_translation: And similarly, five groups of five each of ten each, they draw one from each and every group, and they say this
llm_translation: And so too, five groups of five and groups of ten, they draw one from each group, and so they say.

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ פִּסְחֵיהֶן — זֶה מוֹשֵׁךְ לוֹ אֶחָד וְזֶה מוֹשֵׁךְ לוֹ אֶחָד, זֶה מְמַנֶּה עִמּוֹ אֶחָד מִן הַשּׁוּק וְזֶה מְמַנֶּה עִמּוֹ אֶחָד מִן הַשּׁוּק,
human_translation: two whose Paschal lambs became intermingled This draws one for himself and that draws one for himself; this registers someone from the marketplace with him and that registers someone from the marketplace with him
llm_translation: Two who mixed their Passover offerings - this one pulls one and this one pulls one, this one appoints with him one from the market and this one appoints with him one from the market.

hebrew_text: זֶה בָּא אֵצֶל זֶה, וְזֶה בָּא אֵצֶל זֶה, וְכָךְ הֵם אוֹמְרִים: אִם שֶׁלִּי הוּא פֶּסַח זֶה — יָדֶיךָ מְשׁוּכוֹת מִשֶּׁלְּךָ וְנִמְנֵיתָ עַל שֶׁלִּי, וְאִם שֶׁלְּךָ הוּא פֶּסַח זֶה — יָדַי מְשׁוּכוֹת מִשֶּׁלִּי וְנִמְנֵיתִי עַל שֶׁלָּךְ.
human_translation: this one comes to that and that one comes to this and this is what they say: If this Paschal lamb is mine, you are withdrawn from yours and you are registered for mine, and if this is your Paschal lamb, I am withdrawn from mine and I am registered for yours,
llm_translation: This one comes to that one, and that one comes to this one, and thus they say: If this Passover sacrifice is mine - your hands are withdrawn from yours and counted on mine, and if this Passover sacrifice is yours - my hands are withdrawn from mine and counted on yours.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָמַר לָהֶן וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ — אוֹכֵל מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן. לֹא אָמַר לָהֶן וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לוֹ — אֵינָן אַחֲרָאִין זֶה לָזֶה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: he, said to and they said to him eat from the first he did not say to them and they did not say to him, they are not responsible for each other,
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: If he said to them, and they said to him - "Eat from the first one," and he did not say to them and they did not say to him - "They are not responsible for each other."

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: יָפָה שְׁתִיקָה לַחֲכָמִים, קַל וָחוֹמֶר לַטִּפְּשִׁים. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱוִיל מַחֲרִישׁ חָכָם יֵחָשֵׁב״.
human_translation: From here the Sages stated: Silence is fitting for the wise, a fortiori for fools. as it is stated: a fool, when he holds his peace, is considered wise;
llm_translation: From here the sages said: Silence is praiseworthy for the wise, how much more so for fools. As it is said: "A fool remains silent and is considered wise."

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ פִּסְחֵיהֶם וְכוּ׳. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאִם יִמְעַט הַבַּיִת מִהְיוֹת מִשֶּׂה״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמִּתְמַעֲטִין וְהוֹלְכִין, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּהֵא אֶחָד מִבְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה קַיָּים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַנִּיחוּ אֶת הַפֶּסַח כְּמוֹת שֶׁהוּא!
human_translation: two whose Paschal lambs were intermingled Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught “And if the household be too little for a lamb” teaches that may keep decreasing, provided one of the members of the group remains; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: provided they do not leave the Paschal lamb on its own,
llm_translation: Two that their Passovers became mixed and so on. Let us say the Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Yehudah. As it was taught: "And if the household is too small for a lamb," teaches that they should decrease and go, but only if one of the members of the group remains, the words of Rabbi Yehudah. Rabbi Yosei says: And they should not leave the Passover lamb over like it is!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הַיָּחִיד, מֵעִיקָּרָא לְאַמְנוֹיֵי אַחֲרִינָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ קָאֵי, וּכְאֶחָד מִבְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even you say that Rabbi Yehuda, since Rabbi Yehuda said one may not slaughter the Paschal lamb for an individual, from the beginning it stood to another registered with is like one of the members of the group.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you were to say Rabbi Yehuda, since Rabbi Yehuda said we do not slaughter the Passover sacrifice for an individual, initially he stands for subsequent appointments, and is considered like one of the members of the group.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְיקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: וְכֵן חָמֵשׁ חֲבוּרוֹת שֶׁל חֲמִשָּׁה חֲמִשָּׁה. שֶׁל חֲמִשָּׁה — אִין, אֲבָל שֶׁל חֲמִשָּׁה וְאַרְבָּעָה — לָא, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא פָּיֵישׁ חַד מִבְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה גַּבֵּיהּ? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The mishna is also precisely as it teaches: And similarly, five groups of five each. five, yes, but of five and four, no Is it not because none of the original members of the group would remain with it learn from it
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah is precise, as it teaches: "And likewise five groups of five each." Regarding a group of five — no, but a group of five and four — yes, is it not because one member of the group is not included in the group? This is the conclusion.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ מִי שֶׁהָיָה טָמֵא וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי
llm_translation: We will see you, one who was impure and went up to offer the second Passover.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עֶרֶב פְּסָחִים סָמוּךְ לַמִּנְחָה לֹא יֹאכַל אָדָם עַד שֶׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ. אֲפִילּוּ עָנִי שֶׁבְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יֹאכַל עַד שֶׁיָּסֵב, וְלֹא יִפְחֲתוּ לוֹ מֵאַרְבַּע כּוֹסוֹת שֶׁל יַיִן וַאֲפִילּוּ מִן הַתַּמְחוּי.
human_translation: the eve of Passover, adjacent to minḥa a person not eat until dark, Even the poorest of Jews not eat until he reclines And not give less than four cups of wine And even from the charity plate.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: On the eve of Passover, close to the time of the afternoon offering, a person should not eat until it gets dark. Even a poor person in Israel should not eat until they recline, and they should not have less than four cups of wine, and even from the poorest quality.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי אִירְיָא עַרְבֵי פְסָחִים? אֲפִילּוּ עַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים נָמֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יֹאכַל אָדָם בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּכָּנֵס לַשַּׁבָּת כְּשֶׁהוּא תַּאֲוָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אוֹכֵל וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד שֶׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ.
human_translation: Why discuss particularly eves of Passover? Even eves of Shabbat and Festivals it is also as it was taught A person not eat on the eves of Shabbat and Festivals from minḥa onward, so that he will enter Shabbat when he a desire the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: One continue eating until dark.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is meant by "Erev Pesach"? Even the eves of Shabbatot and festivals as well. As it was taught: A person should not eat from the Mincha offering and onwards on the eves of Shabbatot and festivals, in order to enter Shabbat with an appetite, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: One may eat and continue until it gets dark.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לָא צְרִיכָא אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: אוֹכֵל וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד שֶׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ — הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים, אֲבָל בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, מִשּׁוּם חִיּוּבָא דְמַצָּה מוֹדֶה.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: was necessary only according to Rabbi Yosei, who said one continue eating until dark. this applies on the eves of Shabbat and Festivals. But on the eve of Passover, due to the obligation to matza , concedes
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: It is necessary only according to Rabbi Yosei, who said: One may eat and walk until it gets dark - those matters on Erev Shabbatot and holidays, but on Erev Pesach, due to the obligation of matzah, he concedes.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָתָם בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה הוּא דַּאֲסִיר, סָמוּךְ לַמִּנְחָה שְׁרֵי. אֲבָל בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, אֲפִילּוּ סָמוּךְ לַמִּנְחָה נָמֵי אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Even you say Rabbi Yehuda, There, on the eves of Shabbat and Festivals, from minḥa onward that it is prohibited adjacent to minḥa it is permitted. However, on the eve of Passover, even adjacent to minḥa it is also prohibited
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even if you say it is according to Rabbi Yehuda, there, on Erev Shabbatot and Yomim Tovim from the Minchah offering and onwards, it is prohibited, close to the Minchah offering it is permitted. But on Erev Pesach, even if it is close to the Minchah offering, it is still forbidden.

hebrew_text: וּבָעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת סָמוּךְ לַמִּנְחָה שְׁרֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: לֹא יֹאכַל אָדָם בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים מִתֵּשַׁע שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַעְלָה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּכָּנֵס לַשַּׁבָּת כְּשֶׁהוּא תַּאֲוָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אוֹכֵל וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד שֶׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ.
human_translation: And on the eve of Shabbat adjacent to minḥa permitted But wasn’t taught A person not eat on the eve of Shabbat and Festivals from nine hours onward, so that he will enter Shabbat when he is desire the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: One continue eating until dark.
llm_translation: In the evening close to Minchah on Shabbat, is it permissible? And it was taught: A person should not eat on Friday evening from nine hours and onwards, in order to enter Shabbat with an appetite, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: One may eat and walk until it gets dark.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: מַאן לֵימָא לַן דִּמְתָרַצְתָּא הִיא?
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: Who will say to us that is accurate?
llm_translation: Mar Zutra said: Who will say to us that you have been appeased?

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא מְשַׁבַּשְׁתָּא הִיא.
human_translation: Perhaps is corrupted,
llm_translation: Perhaps it is a mixture.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָרִימָר, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יֵימַר: אֲנָא אִיקְּלַעִי לְפִירְקֵיהּ דְּרַב פִּנְחָס בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַמֵּי, וְקָם תַּנָּא וְתָנֵי קַמֵּיהּ וְקַיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ. אִי הָכִי קַשְׁיָא! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְרַב הוּנָא.
human_translation: Mareimar said to him, and some say Rav Yeimar: I happened to the lecture of Rav Pineḥas, son of Rav Ami, and tanna stood up and taught before him, and he accepted it. If so, difficult. Rather, it is clear in accordance with Rav Huna.
llm_translation: He said to him, Marimar, and it was said, Rav Yeimar: I happened to enter the study hall of Rav Pinchas, son of Rav Ammi, and a Tanna came and taught before him, and he accepted it from him. If so, it is difficult! Rather, it is like the case of Rav Huna.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב הוּנָא מִי נִיחָא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאִיתֵּימָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And according to Rav Huna, does it work out well? But didn’t Rabbi Yirmeya say Rabbi Yoḥanan said, and some say Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Ḥanina said: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda to the eve of Passover, and the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei to the eve of Shabbat?
llm_translation: And for Rav Huna, is it appropriate? And Rabbi Yirmiyah said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, and some say Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina: The halacha follows Rabbi Yehuda on Erev Pesach, and the halacha follows Rabbi Yosei on Erev Shabbat.

hebrew_text: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיג רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ!
human_translation: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda to the eve of Passover, by inference that Rabbi Yosei disagrees with regard to both
llm_translation: Halakha like Rabbi Yehudah on Erev Pesach, from the principle that Rabbi Yosei disagrees with both of them!

hebrew_text: לָא: הֲלָכָה, מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיגִי בְּהַפְסָקָה.
human_translation: No; halakha by inference that they disagree with regard to interruption.
llm_translation: Not: Halakha, miklal dipligi b'hapsakha.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: מַפְסִיקִין לְשַׁבָּתוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַפְסִיקִין.
human_translation: As it was taught they interrupt for Shabbatot , the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: not interrupt
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One may interrupt for Shabbat, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: One may not interrupt.

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל [וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה] וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי שֶׁהָיוּ מְסוּבִּין בְּעַכּוֹ וְקִדֵּשׁ עֲלֵיהֶם הַיּוֹם, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: בְּרַבִּי, רְצוֹנְךָ נַפְסִיק וְנֵיחוּשׁ לְדִבְרֵי יְהוּדָה חֲבֵירֵנוּ?
human_translation: And an incident involving Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Yosei, who were reclining in Akko and the day was sanctified, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to Rabbi Yosei: Berabbi , your will that we interrupt and be concerned for the statements of our colleague Yehuda,
llm_translation: And it happened with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei who were reclining in Akko, and they sanctified the day. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to Rabbi Yosei: Rabbi, is your desire to cease and be concerned with the words of Yehuda our colleague?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: בְּכׇל יוֹם וְיוֹם אַתָּה מְחַבֵּב דְּבָרַיי לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְעַכְשָׁיו אַתָּה מְחַבֵּב דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּפָנַי? ״הֲגַם לִכְבּוֹשׁ אֶת הַמַּלְכָּה עִמִּי בַּבָּיִת״.
human_translation: He said to him: Each and every day you cherish my statements before Rabbi Yehuda, and now you cherish the statement of Rabbi Yehuda before me? “Will he even force the queen before me in the house?”
llm_translation: He said to him: "Every day you used to cherish my words before Rabbi Yehuda, and now you cherish the words of Rabbi Yehuda in my presence? 'Should you also oppress the queen with me in the house?'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן לֹא נַפְסִיק, שֶׁמָּא יִרְאוּ הַתַּלְמִידִים וְיִקְבְּעוּ הֲלָכָה לְדוֹרוֹת. אָמְרוּ: לֹא זָזוּ מִשָּׁם עַד שֶׁקָּבְעוּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: said to him: If so, we will not interrupt, perhaps the students will see and will establish the halakha for generations said: They did not move from there until they established the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: He said to him: If so, we will not interrupt, lest the disciples see and establish the halakha for generations. They said: They did not move from there until they established the halakha like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין הֲלָכָה לֹא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְלֹא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אֶלָּא פּוֹרֵס מַפָּה וּמְקַדֵּשׁ. אִינִי?! וְהָא אָמַר רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר אַבְדִּימִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמַּפְסִיקִין לְקִידּוּשׁ
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, nor in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, Rather, spread a cloth and recite kiddush , Is that so? But didn’t Rav Taḥalifa bar Avdimi say Shmuel said: Just as one interrupts for kiddush ,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is neither like Rabbi Yehudah nor like Rabbi Yosei, but one spreads a cloth and sanctifies. Is it not so? But Rav Tachlifa son of Avdimi said in the name of Shmuel: Just as we interrupt for Kiddush.

hebrew_text: כָּךְ מַפְסִיקִין לַהַבְדָּלָה. מַאי מַפְסִיקִין — לָאו לַעֲקִירַת שׁוּלְחַן? לָא, לְמַפָּה.
human_translation: so one interrupts for havdala ? What One interrupts? not to removing the table? No, to a cloth,
llm_translation: Thus they interrupt for the Havdalah. What is meant by "they interrupt"? Not for clearing the table? No, for the tablecloth.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא, אַיְיתוֹ תַּכָּא קַמֵּיהּ, פְּרַס מַפָּה וְקַידֵּשׁ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: (וְשָׁוִין) שֶׁאֵין מְבִיאִין אֶת הַשּׁוּלְחָן אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן קִידֵּשׁ, וְאִם הֵבִיא — פּוֹרֵס מַפָּה וּמְקַדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna happened to the house of the Exilarch. and brought a table before him he spread a cloth and recited kiddush . That was also taught And agree that one bring the table only if he has recited kiddush ; and if one brought spread a cloth and recite kiddush .
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna happened to come to the house of the head of the exile, they brought a table before him, he spread a cloth and sanctified. It was also taught likewise: (And they are equal) that one does not bring the table except if he sanctified, and if he brought it - he spreads a cloth and sanctifies.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: שָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין מַתְחִילִין, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: שָׁוִין שֶׁמַּתְחִילִין. בִּשְׁלָמָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא שָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין מַתְחִילִין — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח,
human_translation: It was taught in one agree that one not begin And it was taught in the other they agree that one begin Granted, that which was taught agree that one not begin you will find with regard to the eve of Passover,
llm_translation: One taught: They are equal in that they do not initiate, and another teaching: They are equal in that they do initiate. Granted, the one teaching that they are equal in not initiating — it is found in the evening of Passover.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא שָׁוִין שֶׁמַּתְחִילִין — אֵימַת? אִי נֵימָא בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — הָא מִיפְלָג פְּלִיגִי! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — קוֹדֶם תִּשְׁעָה, כָּאן — לְאַחַר תִּשְׁעָה.
human_translation: However, which taught agree that one begin, when If we say the eve of Shabbat, disagree not difficult: Here, before nine hours there, after nine hours.
llm_translation: Rather, this that was taught: "They are equal when they begin" - when? If you say on Friday evening - here they argue! It is not difficult: here - before nine, here - after nine.

hebrew_text: אוֹתָם בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁקִּידְּשׁוּ בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, אָמַר רַב: יְדֵי יַיִן לֹא יָצְאוּ, יְדֵי קִידּוּשׁ יָצְאוּ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר:
human_translation: those people who recited kiddush in the synagogue, Rav said: They have not fulfilled over wine. they have fulfilled of kiddush . And Shmuel said:
llm_translation: Those people who sanctified in the synagogue, Rav said: the hands of wine did not fulfill their obligation, the hands of sanctification fulfilled their obligation. And Shmuel said:

hebrew_text: אַף יְדֵי קִידּוּשׁ לֹא יָצְאוּ. אֶלָּא לְרַב, לְמָה לֵיהּ לְקַדּוֹשֵׁי בְּבֵיתֵיהּ? כְּדֵי לְהוֹצִיא בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ.
human_translation: Even of kiddush they have not fulfilled, But according to Rav, why to recite kiddush at home to fulfill his children and the members of his household,
llm_translation: The hands of Kiddush have not fulfilled their obligation. Rather, according to Rav, why does he need to sanctify in his home? In order to bring out his sons and the members of his household.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל, לְמָה לִי לְקַדּוֹשֵׁי בְּבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא? לְאַפּוֹקֵי אוֹרְחִים יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן, דְּאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ וְגָנוּ בְּבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא.
human_translation: But Shmuel, why do I to recite kiddush in the synagogue to fulfill the obligations of the guests who eat and drink and sleep in the synagogue.
llm_translation: And Samuel, why do I need the holy ones in the synagogue? To escort the hands of their obligation, for they ate, drank, and stole in the synagogue.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא שְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין קִידּוּשׁ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם סְעוּדָה. סְבוּר מִינַּהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי מִבַּיִת לְבַיִת, אֲבָל מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם בְּחַד בֵּיתָא — לָא.
human_translation: And Shmuel follows his reasoning, as Shmuel said: There is no kiddush except in the place of meal. understood from this applies from house to house But from place to place in one house, no,
llm_translation: And it was established according to Shmuel's reasoning, for Shmuel said: "Sanctification is only in a place of a meal." He thought: Those words are from house to house, but from place to place within one house - no.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב עָנָן בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא: זִימְנִין סַגִּיאִין הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְנָחֵית מֵאִיגָּרָא לְאַרְעָא וַהֲדַר מְקַדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Anan bar Taḥalifa said to Many times I stood before Shmuel, and he descended from the roof to the ground and recited kiddush again.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Anan bar Tachlifa: Sometimes great storms were standing before Samuel, and he descended from the roof to the ground and then sanctified.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַב הוּנָא סָבַר אֵין קִידּוּשׁ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם סְעוּדָה. דְּרַב הוּנָא קַדֵּישׁ, וְאִיתְעֲקַרָא לֵיהּ שְׁרָגָא, וְעַיַּילִי לֵיהּ לְמָנֵיהּ לְבֵי גְנָנֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה שְׁרָגָא וְקַדֵּישׁ וּטְעֵים מִידֵּי, אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: אֵין קִידּוּשׁ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם סְעוּדָה.
human_translation: And Rav Huna also maintains there is no kiddush except in the place of meal. that Rav Huna recited kiddush and his lamp was extinguished. And he brought his belongings to the wedding home of his son Rabba, where there was a lamp, and he recited kiddush and tasted some Apparently, maintains there is no kiddush except in the place of meal.
llm_translation: And even Rav Huna holds that sanctification is only in the place of a meal. For Rav Huna sanctified, and a demon came and uprooted his pitcher, and they brought him to the children's house of Rabba, the son of his daughter, who was a demon and sanctified and tasted from his hand. This proves that he holds: sanctification is only in the place of a meal.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבָּה סָבַר אֵין קִידּוּשׁ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם סְעוּדָה. דַּאֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי הֲוֵינָא בֵּי מָר, כִּי הֲוָה מְקַדֵּשׁ אֲמַר לַן: טְעִימוּ מִידֵּי, דִּילְמָא אַדְּאָזְלִיתוּ לְאוּשְׁפִּיזָא מִתְעַקְרָא לְכוּ שְׁרָגָא וְלָא מְקַדֵּשׁ לְכוּ בְּבֵית אֲכִילָה, וּבְקִידּוּשָׁא דְהָכָא לָא נָפְקִיתוּ, דְּאֵין קִידּוּשׁ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם סְעוּדָה.
human_translation: And Rabba also maintains there is no kiddush except in the place of meal, as Abaye said: When I was in the house of my Master, when he would recite kiddush say to us: Taste some lest by the time you get to your lodging your lamp be extinguished, and you will not recite kiddush in the place eat. And with the kiddush here you do not fulfill as there is no kiddush except in the place of meal.
llm_translation: And even Rabba holds that sanctification is only in the place of a meal. For Abaye said: When I was in the house of the Master, when he would sanctify for us, he would say: Taste from this, lest you go to the bathhouse, become sweaty, and not sanctify in the dining hall, and with the sanctification of here you will not fulfill, for sanctification is only in the place of a meal.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כֹּל מִילֵּי דְּמָר הֲוָה עָבֵיד כְּרַב, לְבַר מֵהָנֵי תְּלָת דְּעָבֵיד כִּשְׁמוּאֵל: מַתִּירִין מִבֶּגֶד לְבֶגֶד. וּמַדְלִיקִין מִנֵּר לְנֵר.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Abaye say: all the of my Master, he would act in accordance with Rav, except for these three he acted in accordance with Shmuel: one untie from garment to garment, one light from lamp to lamp,
llm_translation: I?! And Abaye said: All matters that Mar used to do like Rav, except for three things that he did like Shmuel: Permitting transferring from one garment to another. And lighting from one lamp to another.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בִּגְרִירָה. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: גּוֹרֵר אָדָם מִטָּה כִּסֵּא וְסַפְסָל בַּשַּׁבָּת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִתְכַּוֵּין לַעֲשׂוֹת חָרִיץ.
human_translation: the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon in dragging. As it was taught Rabbi Shimon says: A person drag a bed, chair, or stool on Shabbat provided that he does not intend to dig a furrow
llm_translation: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon in regards to dragging. As it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: One may drag a bed, chair, or bench on Shabbat, as long as he does not intend to make a furrow.

hebrew_text: כְּחוּמְרֵי דְרַב הֲוָה עָבֵיד, כְּקוּלֵּי דְרַב לָא הֲוָה עֲבִיד.
human_translation: He would act in accordance with Rav’s stringencies, he would not act in accordance with Rav’s leniencies.
llm_translation: Like the strictness of Rav was, like the leniency of Rav was not.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף יְדֵי יַיִן נָמֵי יָצְאוּ. וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין בַּר אַבָּיֵי אָמַר רַבִּי פְּדָת אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֶחָד שִׁינּוּי יַיִן,
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: they fulfill even over wine And Rabbi Yoḥanan follows his reasoning, as Rabbi Ḥanin bar Abaye said Rabbi Pedat said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Both a change of wine
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even the hands of wine are considered pouring. And Rabbi Yochanan was certain of his reasoning, as Rabbi Chanin bar Abaye said in the name of Rabbi Pedat who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One is considered a change of wine.

hebrew_text: וְאֶחָד שִׁינּוּי מָקוֹם — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ. מֵיתִיבִי: שִׁינּוּי מָקוֹם צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ, שִׁינּוּי יַיִן אֵין צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: and a change of place, need not recite blessing. raises an objection a change of place must recite blessing; a change of wine need not recite blessing. The refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: And one change of place — not necessary to bless. It was asked: Change of place requires a blessing, change of wine does not require a blessing, the refutation of Rabbi Yochanan is a refutation.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, וְיָתֵיב רַב חִסְדָּא וְקָאָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ שִׁינּוּי מָקוֹם צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ, לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מִבַּיִת לְבַיִת, אֲבָל מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם — לָא.
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin sat before Rav Ḥisda, and Rav Ḥisda sat and said in the name of Rav Huna: That you said, a change of place must recite blessing, they only taught from house to house; however, from place to place no,
llm_translation: Sat Rav Idi bar Avin before Rav Ḥisdah, and sat Rav Ḥisdah and said in the name of Rav Huna: That which you said, a change of location requires a blessing, they only taught this regarding from house to house, but from place to place — no.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: הָכִי תְּנֵינָא לֵיהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא דְּבֵי רַב הֵינַק, וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא דְּבֵי בַּר הֵינַק כְּווֹתָיךְ. וְאֶלָּא רַב הוּנָא מַתְנִיתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? רַב הוּנָא מַתְנִיתָא לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said to him: This we learned in the baraita of the school of Rav Hinak, and say in the baraita of the school of bar Hinak, in accordance with your But Rav Huna teach us a baraita ? Rav Huna he had not heard the baraita .
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Idi bar Avin: Thus we have learned in the Mishnah of the school of Rav Henak, and some say in the Mishnah of the school of Bar Henak like your words. But does Rav Huna teach us in the Mishnah? Rav Huna's Mishnah does not agree with him.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, יָתֵיב רַב חִסְדָּא וְקָאָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ שִׁינּוּי מָקוֹם צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בִּדְבָרִים שֶׁאֵין טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְאַחֲרֵיהֶן בִּמְקוֹמָן,
human_translation: And furthermore, Rav Ḥisda sat and said in his own name, That you said, a change of place must recite blessing, we only said with regard to items that do not require a blessing after them in their place,
llm_translation: And so, Rav Ḥisdah was sitting and saying in his own name: That which you said, "A change of location requires a blessing," we only said that regarding matters that do not require a blessing after them in their place.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל דְּבָרִים הַטְּעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְאַחֲרֵיהֶן בִּמְקוֹמָן — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ. מַאי טַעְמָא, לְקִיבְעָא קַמָּא הָדַר. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: However, items that require a blessing after them, in their place, need not recite blessing. What is the reason He returns to the originally established And Rav Sheshet said: Both this and that must recite blessing.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But things that require a blessing after them in their place - no need to bless. What is the reason? Because the original establishment is still in effect. And Rav Sheshet said: One this and one that require a blessing. English translation:

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה שֶׁהָיוּ מְסוּבִּין לִשְׁתּוֹת, וְעָקְרוּ רַגְלֵיהֶן לָצֵאת לִקְרַאת חָתָן אוֹ לִקְרַאת כַּלָּה, כְּשֶׁהֵן יוֹצְאִין — אֵין טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְמַפְרֵעַ, כְּשֶׁהֵן חוֹזְרִין — אֵין טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: raises an objection members of a group who were reclining to drink, and they uprooted themselves from their place to go greet a groom or greet a bride, when they exit, do not require a blessing afterward, when they return do not require an introductory blessing.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Challenger: The members of a group who were gathered to drink, and they lifted their feet to go out to meet the groom or to meet the bride, when they are leaving - they do not require a blessing upon departure, but when they return - they do not require a blessing upon the outset.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים שֶׁהִנִּיחוּ שָׁם זָקֵן אוֹ חוֹלֶה, אֲבָל לֹא הִנִּיחוּ שָׁם לֹא זָקֵן וְלֹא חוֹלֶה, כְּשֶׁהֵן יוֹצְאִין — טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְמַפְרֵעַ, כְּשֶׁהֵן חוֹזְרִין — טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: In what is this statement said? When they left there an elderly or a sick However, they did not leave there an elderly or sick when they exit, require a blessing; when they return, require an introductory blessing.
llm_translation: In what matters are these words spoken, that if an elder or sick person left there, but if neither an elder nor a sick person left there, when they go out - they are required to recite a blessing upon departure, and when they return - they are required to recite a blessing upon entering anew.

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָתָנֵי עָקְרוּ רַגְלֵיהֶן, מִכְּלָל דְּבִדְבָרִים הַטְּעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְאַחֲרֵיהֶן בִּמְקוֹמָן עָסְקִינַן, וְטַעְמָא דְּהִנִּיחוּ שָׁם זָקֵן אוֹ חוֹלֶה הוּא דִּכְשֶׁהֵן יוֹצְאִין אֵין טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְמַפְרֵעַ וּכְשֶׁהֵן חוֹזְרִין אֵין טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה,
human_translation: From that it is taught Uprooted themselves, by inference that we are dealing with items that require a blessing after them in their place. And the reason is that they left there an elderly or sick That is when they exit, do not require a blessing afterward, and when they return, do not require an introductory blessing.
llm_translation: From when they uprooted their feet, from the general principle of things that require a blessing afterwards in their place we are dealing, and the reason is that they left there an elder or a sick person, for when they leave, they do not require a blessing for separation, and when they return, they do not require a blessing for the beginning.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא הִנִּיחוּ שָׁם זָקֵן אוֹ חוֹלֶה, כְּשֶׁהֵן יוֹצְאִין — טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְמַפְרֵעַ, וּכְשֶׁהֵן חוֹזְרִין — טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה, קַשְׁיָא לְרַב חִסְדָּא!
human_translation: However, if they did not leave there an elderly or sick when they exit, require a blessing afterward, and when they return, require an introductory blessing difficult according to Rav Ḥisda,
llm_translation: But they did not leave there an elder or a sick person, when they go out - they are obligated in a blessing for departure, and when they return - they are obligated in a blessing for beginning. This is difficult for Rav Ḥisdah!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said:
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said:

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא עֲקִירוֹת,
human_translation: Who is the tanna uprooting
llm_translation: Who taught the laws of uprooting,

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא: חֲבֵרִים שֶׁהָיוּ מְסוּבִּין, וְעָקְרוּ רַגְלֵיהֶם לֵילֵךְ לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת אוֹ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, כְּשֶׁהֵן יוֹצְאִין — אֵין טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְמַפְרֵעַ, וּכְשֶׁהֵן חוֹזְרִין — אֵין טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִנִּיחוּ שָׁם מִקְצָת חֲבֵרִים, אֲבָל לֹא הִנִּיחוּ שָׁם מִקְצָת חֲבֵרִים, כְּשֶׁהֵן יוֹצְאִין — טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְמַפְרֵעַ, וּכְשֶׁהֵן חוֹזְרִין — טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught friends who were reclining and uprooted themselves to go to the synagogue or to the study hall, when they exit, do not require a blessing afterward, and when they return, these foods do not require an introductory blessing Rabbi Yehuda said: In what is this statement said? When they left some of friends there, However, if they did not leave some of the friends there, when they exit, require a blessing afterward, and when they return, require an introductory blessing.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: Companions who were walking together and they uprooted their feet to go to the synagogue or the study hall, when they are leaving - they do not require a blessing for parting, and when they are returning - they do not require a blessing for the beginning. Rabbi Yehuda said: In what case are these words said? When they left there some of the companions, but if they did not leave some of the companions there, when they are leaving - they require a blessing for parting, and when they are returning - they require a blessing for the beginning.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דְּבִדְבָרִים הַטְּעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְאַחֲרֵיהֶן בִּמְקוֹמָן, דִּכְשֶׁהֵן יוֹצְאִין — אֵין טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְמַפְרֵעַ, וּכְשֶׁהֵן חוֹזְרִין — אֵין טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה. אֲבָל דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְאַחֲרֵיהֶן בִּמְקוֹמָן, אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן, כְּשֶׁהֵן יוֹצְאִין — טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְמַפְרֵעַ, וּכְשֶׁהֵן חוֹזְרִין — טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְכַתְּחִילָּה,
human_translation: The reason that items that require a blessing after them in their place, that when exit, do not require a blessing afterward, and when they return, do not require an introductory blessing. However, items that do not require a blessing in their place, even according to the Rabbis, when exit, require a blessing afterward, and when they return require an introductory blessing.
llm_translation: Rather, the reason regarding matters that require a blessing after them in their place, when they are leaving - no blessing is required for the conclusion, and when they are returning - no blessing is required for the beginning. But regarding matters that do not require a blessing after them in their place, even according to the Rabbis, when they are leaving - a blessing is required for the conclusion, and when they are returning - a blessing is required for the beginning.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן! וְלָאו מִי אוֹתְבִינֵּיהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא! נֵימָא מֵהָא נָמֵי תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא!
human_translation: Shall we say that this is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan, But didn’t we refute once? let us say that this is also a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: Let it be the preference of Rabbi Yochanan! And not that we understand it once! Let it be from there, let it be the preference!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְאַחֲרֵיהֶם בִּמְקוֹמָן נָמֵי אֵין צְרִיכִין לְבָרֵךְ, וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״עָקְרוּ רַגְלֵיהֶן״, לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה,
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you: The same is true that even items that do not require a blessing afterward in their place, are also not required to recite blessing. And that which teaches: They uprooted themselves, to convey the far-reaching of Rabbi Yehuda’s
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Yochanan: The same applies that even things that do not require a blessing after them in their place, do not need to be blessed, and that which is taught "they uprooted their feet," to inform you the power of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: דַּאֲפִילּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁטְּעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְאַחֲרֵיהֶן בִּמְקוֹמָן, טַעְמָא דְּהִנִּיחוּ מִקְצָת חֲבֵרִים, אֲבָל לֹא הִנִּיחוּ מִקְצָת חֲבֵרִים, כְּשֶׁהֵן יוֹצְאִין — טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְמַפְרֵעַ, וּכְשֶׁהֵן חוֹזְרִין — טְעוּנִין בְּרָכָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: even items that require a blessing after them in their place, the reason that they left some of friends However, if they did not leave some of friends, when they exit, require a blessing afterward, and when they return, require an introductory blessing.
llm_translation: Even though matters that require a blessing after them in their place, the reason being that they left some companions, but if they did not leave some companions, when they depart - they require a blessing for separation, and when they return - they require a blessing for the beginning.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא: חֲבֵרִים שֶׁהָיוּ מְסוּבִּין לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן, וְעָקְרוּ רַגְלֵיהֶן וְחָזְרוּ — אֵין צְרִיכִין לְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rav Ḥisda: friends who were reclining to drink wine and uprooted themselves and returned need not recite blessing.
llm_translation: It was taught in the presence of Rav Ḥisda: Companions who were sitting to drink wine, and they lifted their feet and then sat down again - they do not need to recite a blessing.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה שֶׁהָיוּ מְסוּבִּין וְקִדֵּשׁ עֲלֵיהֶן הַיּוֹם — מְבִיאִין לוֹ כּוֹס שֶׁל יַיִן וְאוֹמֵר עָלָיו קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם, וְשֵׁנִי אוֹמֵר עָלָיו בִּרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אוֹכֵל וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד שֶׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: members of a group who were reclining and the day was sanctified, they bring a cup of wine and he recites over it the sanctification of the day, and a second over which he recites Grace after Meals; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: One continue eating until dark.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Members of a fellowship who were reclining and sanctified the day upon them - they bring him a cup of wine and he says over it the sanctity of the day, and another says over it the grace after meals, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: One may eat and walk until it gets dark.

hebrew_text: גָּמְרוּ, כּוֹס רִאשׁוֹן מְבָרֵךְ עָלָיו בִּרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן וְהַשֵּׁנִי אוֹמֵר עָלָיו קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם. אַמַּאי? וְנֵימְרִינְהוּ לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ אַחֲדָא כָּסָא!
human_translation: finished over the first cup one recites the Grace after Meals, and over the second recites the sanctification of the day. Why And let them say both of them, over one cup.
llm_translation: They concluded: The first cup, one recites Grace after Meals over it, and the second one says over it the sanctity of the day. Why? And they said to both of them: One cup!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אֵין אוֹמְרִים שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת עַל כּוֹס אֶחָד. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין מִצְוֹת חֲבִילוֹת חֲבִילוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rav Sheshet said: One does not recite two sanctifications, over one cup. What is the reason Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Because one does not perform mitzvot in bundles.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Sheshet: One does not say two blessings over one cup. What is the reason? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Because they do not perform mitzvot in bundles.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: הַנִּכְנָס לְבֵיתוֹ בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן וְעַל הַמָּאוֹר וְעַל הַבְּשָׂמִים, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אוֹמֵר הַבְדָּלָה עַל הַכּוֹס. וְאִם אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא כּוֹס אֶחָד — מַנִּיחוֹ לְאַחַר הַמָּזוֹן וּמְשַׁלְשְׁלָן כּוּלָּן לְאַחֲרָיו. אֵין לוֹ שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: And not But wasn’t taught One who enters his home at the conclusion of Shabbat recites the blessing over the wine, and over the light, and over the spices, and thereafter he recites havdala over the cup And if he has only one cup he leaves it for after food, and arranges all of the thereafter. does not have is different.
llm_translation: And not? But it was taught: One who enters his home on Motzaei Shabbat blesses on the wine, and on the light, and on the spices, and afterwards says the blessing of havdalah over the cup. And if he only has one cup, he places it after the meal and includes all of them in it. There is no difference.

hebrew_text: וְהָא יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת, דְּאִית לֵיהּ, וְאָמַר רַב יַקְנֶ״ה!
human_translation: But a Festival that occurs after Shabbat, one has And Rav said yod , kuf , nun , heh :
llm_translation: And this, the good day that falls after the Sabbath, for it has, and Rav said, may his memory be blessed!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: מִדְּלָא אָמַר זְמַן, מִכְּלָל דְּבִשְׁבִיעִי שֶׁל פֶּסַח עָסְקִינַן, דְּכׇל מַאי דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ אָכֵיל לֵיהּ, וְלֵית לֵיהּ.
