human_translation: They say From did not say time, by inference that we are dealing with the seventh of Passover, whatever had, he consumed and he does not have
llm_translation: They said: Since he did not mention a specific time, we are dealing with the general topic of the seventh day of Passover, for anything that was fit for him to eat, he ate, and there is no issue.

hebrew_text: וְהָא יוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן דְּאִית לֵיהּ, וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: יַקְזְנָ״ה, וְרָבָא אָמַר: יַקְנְהָ״ז.
human_translation: But the first Festival when one has and Abaye said yod , kuf , zayin , nun , heh : And Rava said yod , kuf , nun , heh , zayin :
llm_translation: The day good first that it has, and said Abbaye: Yakhzna, and Rava said: Yakneha.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הַבְדָּלָה וְקִידּוּשׁ חֲדָא מִילְּתָא הִיא, בִּרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן וְקִידּוּשׁ תְּרֵי מִילֵּי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, Havdala and kiddush are one matter, Grace after Meals and kiddush are two matters.
llm_translation: Rather: separation and sanctification are one matter, the blessing of the meal and sanctification are two separate matters.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת, רַב אָמַר: יַקְנֶ״ה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: יִנְהַ״ק.
human_translation: the itself. a Festival that occurs after Shabbat, Rav said yod , kuf , nun , heh : and Shmuel said yod , nun , heh , kuf :
llm_translation: Body. A good day that happens to be after the Sabbath, Rav said: "Yaknehaz." And Shmuel said: "Yinhaq."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה אָמַר: יַהְנֵ״ק. וְלֵוִי אָמַר: קְנִיָּ״ה. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: קִינָ״ה. מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבְנָא אָמַר: נְקִיָּ״ה. מָרְתָא אָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: נִיהָ״ק.
human_translation: And Rabba said yod , heh , nun , kuf : And Levi said kuf , nun , yod , heh : And the Rabbis say kuf , yod , nun , heh : Mar, son of Rabbana, said nun , kuf , yod , heh : Marta said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua nun , yod , heh , kuf :
llm_translation: Rabba said: YAHNEK. Levi said: KENIYAH. The Rabbis said: KINAH. Mar, son of Ravina, said: NEKIYAH. Marta said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: NIHAK.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל לְרַבִּי: יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, סֵדֶר הַבְדָּלוֹת הֵיאַךְ. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: כָּךְ אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם אָבִיו שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה: נְהִי״ק.
human_translation: the father of Shmuel, sent to Rabbi Teach us, our Rabbi. How the order of havdala sent him This Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said, who said in the name of his father, who said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: nun , heh , yod , kuf :
llm_translation: Send to him father of Samuel to Rabbi: Teach us, our teacher, the order of Havdalah, how. Send to him: Thus said Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yosei who said in the name of his father who said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah: "Nehiq."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מָשָׁל דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה לְמֶלֶךְ שֶׁיּוֹצֵא וְאִפַּרְכוֹס נִכְנָס, מְלַוִּוין אֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ וְאַחַר כָּךְ יוֹצְאִים לִקְרַאת אִפַּרְכוֹס.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said parable of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: to a king who is exiting and a governor is entering. escort the king and afterward they go out to greet the governor.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: A parable of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananya to a king who goes out and Ipharchoz enters, they escort the king and afterwards go out to meet Ipharchoz.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: יַקְזְנָ״ה, וְרָבָא אָמַר: יַקְנְהָ״ז, וְהִילְכְתָא כְּרָבָא.
human_translation: What was reached about Abaye said yod , kuf , zayin , nun , heh : And Rava said yod , kuf , nun , heh , zayin : And halakha in accordance with Rava.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "עֲלַהּ"? Abbaye said: "יקזנה," and Rava said: "יקנה״ז," and the law follows Rava.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רָבָא, אַיְיתוֹ לְקַמַּיְיהוּ מָאוֹר וּבְשָׂמִים. בָּרֵיךְ רָבָא אַבְּשָׂמִים בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר אַמָּאוֹר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָא בֵּין בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵין בֵּית הִילֵּל — מָאוֹר בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר אַבְּשָׂמִים.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda happened to the house of Rava. they brought before them a light and spices. Rava recited the blessing over the spices first and then over the light. said to him: But both Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel, light is first, and then over the spices.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Yehuda entered the house of Rava, they brought before them light and spices. Rava first brought spices and then brought the light. He said to him: This is like the difference between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel - first spices and then light.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי הִיא? דִּתְנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נֵר וּמָזוֹן, בְּשָׂמִים וְהַבְדָּלָה. וּבֵית הִילֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נֵר וּבְשָׂמִים, וּמָזוֹן וְהַבְדָּלָה.
human_translation: And what is this; As we learned Beit Shammai say candle, and Meals, spices, and havdala . And Beit Hillel say: candle and spices, and Meals, and havdala .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is it? As we learned, Beit Shammai say: candle and food, spices and havdalah. And Beit Hillel say: candle and spices, and food and havdalah.

hebrew_text: עָנֵי רָבָא בָּתְרֵיהּ וְאָמַר: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִילֵּל עַל הַמָּזוֹן שֶׁהוּא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְעַל הַבְדָּלָה שֶׁהִיא בַּסּוֹף,
human_translation: Rava answered after him and said: This the statement of Rabbi Meir. However, Rabbi Yehuda says: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree over Meals, as it is first, nor over the blessing over the spices , as it is last.
llm_translation: The poor of Rava came to him and said: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, but Rabbi Yehuda says: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding the meal which is at the beginning and the separation which is at the end.

hebrew_text: עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ? עַל הַמָּאוֹר וְעַל הַבְּשָׂמִים. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מָאוֹר וְאַחַר כָּךְ בְּשָׂמִים, וּבֵית הִילֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בְּשָׂמִים וְאַחַר כָּךְ מָאוֹר. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: נָהֲגוּ הָעָם כְּבֵית הִילֵּל וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: With regard to what did they disagree? over light and over the spices. Beit Shammai say: Light and spices thereafter; and Beit Hillel say: Spices and light thereafter. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The people were accustomed in accordance with Beit Hillel, according to Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: On what did they argue? On the lighting and on the spices. Beit Shammai says: lighting and afterwards spices, and Beit Hillel says: spices and afterwards lighting. And Rabbi Yochanan said: The people have adopted the practice of Beit Hillel, and the halacha is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַב יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַבָּא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רָבָא, חַזְיֵהּ דְּבָרֵיךְ ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הַגֶּפֶן״ אַכָּסָא קַמָּא, וַהֲדַר בָּרֵיךְ אַכָּסָא דְבִרְכְּתָא, וְאִישְׁתִּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְמָה לָךְ כּוּלֵּי הַאי? הָא בָּרֵיךְ לַן מָר חֲדָא זִימְנָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא הָכִי עָבְדִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Ya’akov bar Abba happened to Rava’s house He saw that recited Who creates the fruit of the vine, over the first cup and then he recited blessing upon the cup of blessing and drank He said to him: Why do you all this, The Master has recited a blessing for us once said to him: When we were in the house of the Exilarch, this was our practice.
llm_translation: Rav Ya'akov bar Abba entered the house of Rava, he saw that your words "Who creates the fruit of the vine" - a cup was standing, he then blessed a cup of wine, and drank. He said to him: Why do you drink so much of this? Bless us with one cup once! He said to him: Because we are in the head of the exile, this is what we do.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תִּינַח בֵּי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא דְּהָכִי עָבֵיד, דְּסָפֵק מַיְיתֵי לַן סָפֵק לָא מַיְיתֵי לַן. הָכָא, הָא מַנַּח כָּסָא קַמַּן וְדַעְתַּן עִילָּוֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא עֲבַדִי כְּתַלְמִידֵי דְרַב, דְּרַב בְּרוֹנָא וְרַב חֲנַנְאֵל תַּלְמִידֵי דְרַב הֲווֹ יָתְבִי בִּסְעוֹדְתָּא
human_translation: He said to him: well to act this way the house of the Exilarch, as there is uncertainty he will bring us or whether he will not bring us Here, the cup is resting before us and our attention is on it, He said to him: I acted in accordance with the students of Rav, as Rav Beruna and Rav Ḥananel, the students of Rav, were sitting at a meal,
llm_translation: He said to him: Let the household of the head of the exile do as such, for if doubt comes to us, doubt does not come to us. Here, is this one placing his chair before us and their opinion above? He said to him: I serve like the disciples of Rav, for Rav Barona and Rav Hananel were disciples of Rav and they used to sit at the meal.

hebrew_text: קָאֵי עֲלַיְיהוּ רַב יֵיבָא סָבָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הַב לַן וְנִיבָרֵיךְ. לְסוֹף אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הַב לַן וְנִישְׁתֵּי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרִיתוּ הַב לַן וְנִיבָרֵיךְ, אִיתַּסְרָא לְכוּ לְמִישְׁתֵּי. מַאי טַעְמָא, דְּאַסְחִיתוּ דַּעְתַּיְיכוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yeiva the Elder stood over them They said to him: Give us and we will recite the blessings Ultimately, they said to him: Give us and we will drink He said to them Rav said as follows: Since you said: Give us and we will recite the blessings it is prohibited for you to drink What is the reason that you have diverted your attention
llm_translation: Standing over them, Rav Yeiva the Elder. They said to him: "Bring us and we will explain." In the end, they said to him: "Bring us and we will drink." He said to them: "So said Rav, once you said 'Bring us and we will explain,' it is necessary for you to drink. What is the reason? Because you have made my mind anxious."

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר וּמָר זוּטְרָא וְרַב אָשֵׁי הֲווֹ יָתְבִי בִּסְעוּדָה, וְקָאֵי עֲלַיְיהוּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא. אַמֵּימָר בָּרֵיךְ עַל כׇּל כָּסָא וְכָסָא, וּמָר זוּטְרָא בָּרֵיךְ אַכָּסָא קַמָּא וְאַכָּסָא בָּתְרָא, רַב אָשֵׁי בָּרֵיךְ אַכָּסָא קַמָּא, וְתוּ לָא בָּרֵיךְ.
human_translation: Ameimar, Mar Zutra, and Rav Ashi were sitting at a meal, and Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, stood over them Ameimar recited a blessing over each and every cup And Mar Zutra recited a blessing over the first cup and over the last cup Rav Ashi recited a blessing over the first cup and not recite any further blessings
llm_translation: Ammemar and Mar Zutra and Rav Ashe were sitting at a meal, and Rav Acha, son of Rava, was standing over them. Ammemar blessed on each cup and cup, and Mar Zutra blessed on the first cup and the last cup, Rav Ashe blessed on the first cup, and then did not bless.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב אַחָא בַּר רָבָא: אֲנַן כְּמַאן נַעֲבֵיד? אַמֵּימָר אָמַר: נִמְלָךְ אֲנָא. מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר: אֲנָא דַּעֲבַדִי כְּתַלְמִידֵי דְרַב.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Rava said to them: In accordance with whose we act Ameimar said: I changed my mind. Mar Zutra said: I acted in accordance with the students of Rav.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Acha bar Rava: "Who are we like?" Amemar said: "I am like a king." Mar Zutra said: "I am like a servant who serves the disciples of Rav."

hebrew_text: וְרַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לֵית הִילְכְתָא כְּתַלְמִידֵי דְרַב, דְּהָא יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת, וְאָמַר רַב: יַקְנֶ״ה.
human_translation: And Rav Ashi said: halakha not in accordance with the students of Rav. as a Festival that occurs after Shabbat, Rav said yod , kuf , nun , heh :
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: The halakha does not follow the students of Rav, for there is a festival that falls after Shabbat, and Rav said: "Yaknehaz."

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, הָתָם — עָקַר דַּעְתֵּיהּ מִמִּשְׁתְּיָא, הָכָא — לָא עָקַר דַּעְתֵּיהּ מִמִּשְׁתְּיָא.
human_translation: And that is not so. There, uprooted his mind from drinking. Here, he has not uprooted his mind from drinking.
llm_translation: "And not this, there — uprooted his mind from there, here — not uprooted his mind from there."

hebrew_text: כִּי מְטָא לְאַבְדּוֹלֵי, קָם שַׁמָּעֵיהּ וְאַדְלֵיק אֲבוּקָה מִשְּׁרָגָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְמָה לָךְ כּוּלֵּי הַאי, הָא מַנְחָא שְׁרָגָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁמָּעָא מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָא עָבֵיד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ דְּמָר, לָא הֲוָה עָבֵיד! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לֵיהּ מָר אֲבוּקָה לְהַבְדָּלָה מִצְוָה מִן הַמּוּבְחָר.
human_translation: When came to recite havdala , attendant got up and lit a torch from a candle. said to him: Why do you all this? The candle was present, said to him: The attendant did on his own said to him: If he had not heard it from the Master he would not have done it said to him: Does the Master not maintain a torch for havdala is the optimal manner to fulfill the mitzva?
llm_translation: When he came to the idol worshippers, he heard and lit a torch from the lamp. He said to him: Why do you need this lamp, when this lamp is already lit! He said to him: Listen, because he is doing it for his own benefit. He said to him: If he did not hear from his master, he would not have done it! He said to him: The master did not think that lighting a torch is a commandment from the chosen one.

hebrew_text: פָּתַח וְאָמַר: ״הַמַּבְדִּיל בֵּין קוֹדֶשׁ לְחוֹל בֵּין אוֹר לְחֹשֶׁךְ בֵּין יִשְׂרָאֵל לָעַמִּים בֵּין יוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי לְשֵׁשֶׁת יְמֵי הַמַּעֲשֶׂה״ אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְמָה לָךְ כּוּלֵּי הַאי? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: ״הַמַּבְדִּיל בֵּין קוֹדֶשׁ לְחוֹל״ זוֹ הִיא הַבְדָּלָתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא?
human_translation: began and said: Who distinguishes between sacred and profane, between light and darkness, between Israel and the nations, between the seventh day and the six days of work. said to him: Why do you all this? Didn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav said Who distinguishes between sacred and profane, this is the havdala of Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi?
llm_translation: He began and said: "Whoever distinguishes between holy and mundane, between light and darkness, between Israel and the nations, between the seventh day and the six days of work," he said to him: "Why do you need all this?" And didn't Rav Yehudah say in the name of Rav: "Whoever distinguishes between holy and mundane," this is the distinction of Rabbi Yehudah the Prince?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא כְּהָא סְבִירָא לִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הַפּוֹחֵת לֹא יִפְחוֹת מִשָּׁלֹשׁ, וְהַמּוֹסִיף לֹא יוֹסִיף עַל שֶׁבַע. אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: He said to him: I maintain in accordance with this that Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya said: One who decreases not decrease less than three, and one who increases not increase more than seven. said to him:
llm_translation: He said to him: I think like this, for Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: One who subtracts should not subtract less than three, and one who adds should not add more than seven. He said to him:

hebrew_text: וְהָא מָר לָא תְּלָתָא אָמַר וְלָא שְׁבַע אָמַר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיבְרָא ״בֵּין יוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי לְשֵׁשֶׁת יְמֵי הַמַּעֲשֶׂה״, מֵעֵין חֲתִימָה הִיא, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמַּבְדִּיל צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר מֵעֵין חֲתִימָה סָמוּךְ לַחֲתִימָתוֹ. וּפוּמְבְּדִיתָאֵי אָמְרִי מֵעֵין פְּתִיחָתָן סָמוּךְ לַחֲתִימָתָן.
human_translation: But the Master did not say three nor did he say seven, He said to him: In truth, between the seventh day and the six days of work similar to the conclusion and Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One who recites havdala must say similar to the conclusion near the conclusion And the of Pumbedita say similar to the beginnings near their conclusions.
llm_translation: The master did not say three, nor did he say seven! He said to him: It is like a בֵּין יוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי לְשֵׁשֶׁת יְמֵי הַמַּעֲשֶׂה, it is similar to a seal. And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who separates must say "similar to a seal" close to his sealing. And the mouth of the wellsprings say, "similar to their opening" close to their sealing.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת, דְּחָתְמִינַן ״בֵּין קוֹדֶשׁ לְקוֹדֶשׁ״,
human_translation: What is between them? The between them is a Festival that occurs after Shabbat, as one concludes between sacred and sacred.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them on a festival that falls after the Sabbath, as we establish "between holy to holy."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר מֵעֵין פְּתִיחָתָן סָמוּךְ לַחֲתִימָתָן, לָא בָּעֵי לְמֵימַר ״בֵּין קְדוּשַּׁת שַׁבָּת לִקְדוּשַּׁת יוֹם טוֹב הִבְדַּלְתָּ״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מֵעֵין חֲתִימָתָן סָמוּךְ לַחֲתִימָתָן, בָּעֵי לְמֵימַר ״בֵּין קְדוּשַּׁת שַׁבָּת לִקְדוּשַּׁת יוֹם טוֹב הִבְדַּלְתָּ״.
human_translation: The one who said similar to beginnings near their conclusions not required to say: Between the sanctity of Shabbat and the sanctity of the Festival You have distinguished, And the one who said similar to conclusions near their conclusions, required to say: Between the sanctity of Shabbat and the sanctity of the Festival You have distinguished.
llm_translation: One who says that the opening is adjacent to the closing, does not need to say "You have distinguished between the sanctity of Shabbat and the sanctity of Yom Tov." And one who says that the closing is adjacent to the opening, needs to say "You have distinguished between the sanctity of Shabbat and the sanctity of Yom Tov."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הַפּוֹחֵת — לֹא יִפְחוֹת מִשָּׁלֹשׁ, וְהַמּוֹסִיף — לֹא יוֹסִיף עַל שֶׁבַע.
human_translation: itself. Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya said: One who decreases not decrease than three, and one who increases not increase more than seven.
llm_translation: The body. Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya: The one who diminishes - should not diminish from three, and the one who adds - should not add beyond seven.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אוֹמֵר הַבְדָּלוֹת בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וּבְמוֹצָאֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים וּבְמוֹצָאֵי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וּבְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת לְיוֹם טוֹב וּבְמוֹצָאֵי יוֹם טוֹב לְחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, אֲבָל לֹא בְּמוֹצָאֵי יוֹם טוֹב לְשַׁבָּת. הָרָגִיל — אוֹמֵר הַרְבֵּה, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ רָגִיל — אוֹמֵר אַחַת.
human_translation: raises an objection One says distinctions at the conclusion of Shabbat, and at the conclusion of Festivals, and at the conclusion of Yom Kippur, and at the conclusion of Shabbat into a Festival, and at the conclusion of a Festival into the intermediate days However, not at the conclusion of a Festival into Shabbat, One who is accustomed recite many and one who is not accustomed recites one
llm_translation: Challenger: Says separations on the eve of Sabbaths and on the eve of festivals and on the eve of Yom Kippur, and on the eve of a Sabbath that falls on a festival, and on the eve of a festival that falls on a weekday of a festival, but not on the eve of a festival that falls on a Sabbath. One who is accustomed says many, and one who is not accustomed says one.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּנָן שֶׁל קְדוֹשִׁים אוֹמֵר אַחַת, וְנָהֲגוּ הָעָם לוֹמַר שָׁלֹשׁ. מַאן נִיהוּ ״בְּנָן שֶׁל קְדוֹשִׁים״? רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בַּר סִימַאי. וְאַמַּאי קָרוּ לֵיהּ ״בְּנָן שֶׁל קְדוֹשִׁים״? דְּלָא אִיסְתַּכַּל בְּצוּרְתָּא דְזוּזָא. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אִידִי: חֲנַנְיָא אָחִי אוֹמֵר אַחַת. וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: It is tanna’im , as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The son of sacred ones recites one the people were accustomed to recite three Who is the son of sacred ones? Rabbi Menaḥem bar Simai. And why did they call him the son of sacred ones? he would not look at the forms on coins, Rav Shmuel bar Idi sent My brother Ḥananya says one And the halakha is not in accordance with
llm_translation: It was taught: as Rabbi Yochanan said: A builder of the Temple says one, and the people have accustomed to say three. Who is "a builder of the Temple"? Rabbi Menachem bar Simai. And why is he called "a builder of the Temple"? Because he did not look at the shape of the doorpost. Rav Shmuel bar Idi sent to him: Chananya the brother says one. And the law is not like him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הַמַּבְדִּיל צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר מֵעֵין הַבְדָּלוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה. מֵיתִיבִי: סֵדֶר הַבְדָּלוֹת הֵיאַךְ? אוֹמֵר: ״הַמַּבְדִּיל בֵּין קוֹדֶשׁ לְחוֹל, בֵּין אוֹר לְחוֹשֶׁךְ, בֵּין יִשְׂרָאֵל לָעַמִּים, וּבֵין יוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי לְשֵׁשֶׁת יְמֵי הַמַּעֲשֶׂה, בֵּין טָמֵא לְטָהוֹר, בֵּין הַיָּם לֶחָרָבָה, בֵּין מַיִם הָעֶלְיוֹנִים לְמַיִם הַתַּחְתּוֹנִים, בֵּין כֹּהֲנִים לִלְוִיִּם וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who recites havdala must say similar to the distinctions stated in the Torah. raises an objection How the order of the distinctions One recites: Who distinguishes between sacred and profane: Between light and darkness; between Israel and the nations; and between the seventh day and the six days of work; between the ritually impure and the ritually pure; between the sea and the dry land; between the upper waters and the lower waters between priests, Levites, and Israelites.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who makes a distinction must say it in a manner similar to the distinctions mentioned in the Torah. The question was raised: What is the order of distinctions? One says: "Who distinguishes between holy and mundane, between light and darkness, between Israel and the nations, and between the seventh day and the six days of creation, between impure and pure, between the sea and dry land, between upper waters and lower waters, between priests, Levites, and Israelites."

hebrew_text: וְחוֹתֵם בְּ״סֵדֶר בְּרֵאשִׁית״. וַאֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּ״יוֹצֵר בְּרֵאשִׁית״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חוֹתֵם ״מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְאִם אִיתָא, הָא ״בֵּין הַיָּם לֶחָרָבָה״ לָא כְּתִיבָא בֵּיהּ ״הַבְדָּלָה״! סְמִי מִכָּאן ״בֵּין הַיָּם לֶחָרָבָה״.
human_translation: And one concludes with the order of Creation: And others say with: Who fashions Creation. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says one concludes with Who sanctifies Israel. And if is so, between the sea and the dry land distinction is not written with regard to Remove from here between the sea and the dry land.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And seals with "In the beginning." And others say: with "He who forms in the beginning." Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: seals "Who sanctifies Israel." And if it comes, this "Between the sea and the wilderness" does not have in it "distinction"! Learn from here "Between the sea and the wilderness."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי ״בֵּין יוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי לְשֵׁשֶׁת יְמֵי הַמַּעֲשֶׂה״ נָמֵי? מֵעֵין חֲתִימָה הוּא, בְּצַר חֲדָא וְלֵיכָּא שֶׁבַע!
human_translation: If so, between the seventh day and the six days of work also is similar to the conclusion. lacks one and there are not seven
llm_translation: So is it not "between the seventh day and the six days of work" indeed? It is like a signature, in one narrow place and not in seven!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי, כֹּהֲנִים לְוִיִּם וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים תְּרֵי מִילֵּי נִינְהוּ. בֵּין לְוִיִּם לְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״בָּעֵת הַהִיא הִבְדִּיל ה׳ אֶת שֵׁבֶט הַלֵּוִי״. בֵּין הַכֹּהֲנִים לַלְוִיִּם, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּנֵי עַמְרָם אַהֲרֹן וּמֹשֶׁה וַיִּבָּדֵל אַהֲרֹן לְהַקְדִּישׁוֹ קֹדֶשׁ קָדָשִׁים״.
human_translation: They say priests, Levites, and Israelites is two matters, between Levites and Israelites, as it is written: “At that time the Lord separated the tribe of Levi between the priests and the Levites, as it is written: “The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses; and Aaron was separated, that he should be sanctified as most holy,
llm_translation: The priests, Levites, and Israelites are three distinct categories. Between the Levites and the Israelites, as it is written: "At that time, the Lord set apart the tribe of Levi." Between the priests and the Levites, as it is written: "The sons of Amram were Aaron and Moses. And Aaron was set apart to sanctify him as most holy."

hebrew_text: מִחְתָּם מַאי חָתֵים? רַב אָמַר: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: ״הַמַּבְדִּיל בֵּין קוֹדֶשׁ לְחוֹל״. לָיֵיט עֲלַהּ אַבָּיֵי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יוֹסֵף אַהָא דְּרַב.
human_translation: What to conclude Rav said Who sanctifies Israel. And Shmuel said Who distinguishes between sacred and profane. Abaye, and some say Rav Yosef, cursed it, that of Rav.
llm_translation: Seal, what is the seal? Rav said: "Sanctifying Israel," and Shmuel said: "Distinguishing between holy and mundane." Abaye raised an objection and Rav Yosef answered in the name of Rav.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָא: כׇּל הַחוֹתֵם ״מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהַמַּבְדִּיל בֵּין קוֹדֶשׁ לְחוֹל״ מַאֲרִיכִין לוֹ יָמָיו וּשְׁנוֹתָיו.
human_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: Anyone who concludes Who sanctifies Israel and distinguishes between sacred and profane, lengthen his days and years.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah: Anyone who seals "Mekadesh Yisrael" and distinguishes between holy and mundane, his days and years are prolonged for him.

hebrew_text: וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: And halakha not in accordance with
llm_translation: And there is no halakha like his opinion.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אִיקְּלַע לְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ: זִיל אַמְטִי לֵיהּ כַּלְכַּלָּה דְפֵירֵי, וַחֲזִי הֵיכִי אַבְדֵּיל. לָא אֲזַל, שַׁדַּר לֵיהּ לְאַבָּיֵי. כִּי אֲתָא אַבָּיֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵיכִי אָמַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״בָּרוּךְ הַמַּבְדִּיל בֵּין קוֹדֶשׁ לְחוֹל״ אָמַר, וְתוּ לָא.
human_translation: Ulla happened to Pumbedita. Rav Yehuda said to his son, Rav Yitzḥak: Go bring him a basket of fruit and observe how he recites havdala . did not go. he sent to him Abaye, When Abaye came said to him: How did recite said to him said: Blessed is He Who distinguishes between sacred and profane, but not further.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ula ikla le'pumbedita, amar lei Rav Yehuda le'Rav Yitzchak brei'ah: Zil amti lei kal'kalla d'feirei, v'chazi heichi avdeil. La azal, shadar lei le'Abaye. Ki ata Abaye, amar lei: Heichi amar? Amar lei: "Baruch hamavdil bein kodesh le'chol" amar, v'tu la. English translation: Ula entered the marketplace, Rav Yehuda said to Rav Yitzchak his son: Go bring him a basket of fruits, and see how he distinguishes. He did not go, he sent it to Abaye. When Abaye came, he said to him: How did he say? He said to him: "Blessed is He who distinguishes between holy and mundane" he said, and that's it.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דַּאֲבוּהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵיכִי אָמַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא לָא אֲזַלִי, אֲנָא שַׁדְּרִיתֵיהּ לְאַבָּיֵי, וַאֲמַר לִי ״הַמַּבְדִּיל בֵּין קוֹדֶשׁ לְחוֹל״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבְרְבָנוּתֵיהּ דְּמָר, וּסְרָרוּתֵיהּ דְּמָר, גְּרַמָא לֵיהּ לְמָר דְּלָא תֵּימָא שְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ מִפּוּמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: came before his father, said to him: How did recite He said to him: I did not go. I sent Abaye, who said to me Who distinguishes between sacred and profane. said to him: The Master’s haughtiness and the Master’s pride caused the Master that halakha will not be said in his name.
llm_translation: He came before his father, he said to him: How did he say? He said to him: I did not go, I sent it to Abbaye, and he said to me, "Who distinguishes between holy and profane." He said to him: The greatness of Mar, and the stubbornness of Mar, caused him not to hear from his mouth.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כׇּל הַבְּרָכוֹת כּוּלָּן פּוֹתֵחַ בְּבָרוּךְ וְחוֹתֵם בָּהֶן בְּבָרוּךְ, חוּץ מִבִּרְכַּת מִצְוֹת וּבִרְכַּת הַפֵּירוֹת וּבְרָכָה הַסְּמוּכָה לַחֲבֶירְתָּהּ וּבְרָכָה אַחֲרוֹנָה שֶׁבִּקְרִיַּת שְׁמַע,
human_translation: raises an objection all blessings, begins with: Blessed, and concludes them with: Blessed, except for blessings over mitzvot, blessings over fruit, a blessing that is juxtaposed to another and the final blessing after Shema .
llm_translation: Challenger: All the blessings, all of them, begin with "Baruch" and conclude with "Baruch," except for the blessing of the commandments, and the blessing of fruits, and a blessing adjacent to its companion, and the final blessing of the Shema recitation.

hebrew_text: שֶׁיֵּשׁ מֵהֶן פּוֹתֵחַ (בָּהֶן) בְּבָרוּךְ וְאֵין חוֹתֵם בְּבָרוּךְ, וְיֵשׁ מֵהֶן שֶׁחוֹתֵם בְּבָרוּךְ וְאֵין פּוֹתֵחַ בְּבָרוּךְ. וְ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״ פּוֹתֵחַ בְּבָרוּךְ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹתֵם בְּבָרוּךְ.
human_translation: as some of them begin with: Blessed, and do not conclude with: Blessed, and some of them conclude with: Blessed, and do not begin with: Blessed, And He Who is good and does good, begins with: Blessed, and does not conclude with: Blessed.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "That some of them open with 'Baruch' and do not conclude with 'Baruch,' and some of them conclude with 'Baruch' and do not open with 'Baruch.' And 'He who is good and does good' opens with 'Baruch' and does not conclude with 'Baruch.'"

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא לְעוּלָּא! אָמַר לָךְ עוּלָּא: הָא נָמֵי כְּבִרְכַּת הַמִּצְוֹת דָּמְיָא, בִּרְכַּת הַמִּצְוֹת מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּהוֹדָאָה הִיא — הָא נָמֵי הוֹדָאָה הִיא.
human_translation: difficult for Ulla, Ulla said to you: This is also considered like a blessing over mitzvot, What is the reason blessings over mitzvot because is praise, This also is praise.
llm_translation: A difficulty to Ulai! Ulai said to you: Behold, like the blessing of the commandments is blood, what is the reason for the blessing of the commandments? Because it is acknowledgment — behold, acknowledgment it is.

hebrew_text: רַב חֲנַנְיָא בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָא וְתַלְמִידֵי דְּרַב הֲווֹ יָתְבִי בִּסְעוֹדְתָּא, וְקָאֵי עֲלַיְיהוּ רַב הַמְנוּנָא סָבָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זִיל חֲזִי אִי מִקְּדִישׁ יוֹמָא נַפְסִיק וְנִיקְבְּעֵיהּ לְשַׁבְּתָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא צְרִיכִיתוּ — שַׁבְּתָא קָבְעָה נַפְשַׁהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥananya bar Shelemya and students of Rav were sitting at a meal and Rav Hamnuna the Elder was standing over them They said to him: Go see if day has become sanctified we will interrupt and establish its for Shabbat. said to them: You do not need to Shabbat establishes itself.
llm_translation: Rav Chananya bar Shelamya and the students of Rav were sitting at a meal, and Rav Hamnuna the Elder was standing over them. They said to him: Go and see if he sanctifies the day, it will be interrupted and established for Shabbat. He said to them: You did not need to - Shabbat has already established itself.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַשַּׁבָּת קוֹבַעַת לְמַעֲשֵׂר, כָּךְ שַׁבָּת קוֹבַעַת לְקִידּוּשׁ.
human_translation: As Rav said: Just as Shabbat establishes to tithes, so Shabbat establishes to kiddush .
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "דְּאָמַר רַב: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַשַּׁבָּת קוֹבַעַת לְמַעֲשֵׂר, כָּךְ שַׁבָּת קוֹבַעַת לְקִידּוּשׁ." English translation: "Rav said: Just as Shabbat establishes the obligation of tithing, so too Shabbat establishes the obligation of sanctification."

hebrew_text: סְבוּר מִינַּהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּקָבְעָה לְקִידּוּשׁ כָּךְ קָבְעָה לְהַבְדָּלָה, אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב עַמְרָם, הָכִי אָמַר רַב: לְקִידּוּשׁ קוֹבַעַת, וְלֹא לְהַבְדָּלָה קוֹבַעַת.
human_translation: They understood from it just as establishes to kiddush , so establishes to havdala . Rav Amram said to them: This is Rav said: establishes to kiddush , but does not establish to havdala .
llm_translation: He thought that just as she established for sanctification, so she established for separation. Rav Amram said to them: Thus said Rav: She establishes for sanctification, and not for separation she establishes.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי לְעִנְיַן מִיפְסָק דְּלָא מַפְסְקִינַן, אֲבָל אַתְחוֹלֵי לָא מַתְחֲלִינַן. וּמִיפְסָק נָמֵי לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בַּאֲכִילָה, אֲבָל בִּשְׁתִיָּה — לָא.
human_translation: And this applies with regard to the matter of interrupting that one does not to interrupt However, one not begin And interrupting also, we only said that eating; but with regard to drinking, no,
llm_translation: And these matters regarding the issue of interruption, we do not interrupt, but postponements we do not postpone. And regarding interruption, we only said in eating, but in drinking - no.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁתִיָּה נָמֵי לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּחַמְרָא וְשִׁיכְרָא, אֲבָל מַיָּא — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: And drinking also, we only said with regard to wine and beer, but water, we have no with it.
llm_translation: And Shetiya, we did not say except with wine and beer, but water - we do not have in it.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַב הוּנָא. דְּרַב הוּנָא חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּשְׁתָה מַיָּא קוֹדֶם הַבְדָּלָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא מִיסְתְּפֵי מָר מֵאַסְכָּרָה? דְּתָנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כׇּל הַטּוֹעֵם כְּלוּם קוֹדֶם שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל — מִיתָתוֹ בְּאַסְכָּרָה. רַבָּנַן דְּבֵי רַב אָשֵׁי לָא קָפְדִי אַמַּיָּא.
human_translation: disagrees with of Rav Huna. As Rav Huna saw a certain man drinking water before he recited havdala He said to him: Is the Master not afraid of askara ? As it was taught in the name of Rabbi Akiva whoever tastes anything before he recites havdala , his death will through askara . the Sages of the school of Rav Ashi were not particular with regard to water.
llm_translation: Disagreement of Rav Huna. Rav Huna saw that certain man who drank water before havdalah. He said to him: Does the Master not care about the prohibition of drinking before havdalah? For it was taught in the name of Rabbi Akiva: Anyone who tastes anything before making havdalah – his death is by ascaris. The sages of the house of Rav Ashi did not pay attention to this matter.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבִינָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִי שֶׁלֹּא קִידֵּשׁ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת מַהוּ שֶׁיְּקַדֵּשׁ וְהוֹלֵךְ כָּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדְּאָמְרִי בְּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הִבְדִּיל בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת — מַבְדִּיל וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַשַּׁבָּת כּוּלּוֹ, הָכָא נָמֵי: מִי שֶׁלֹּא קִידֵּשׁ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מְקַדֵּשׁ וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Ravina raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak: one who did not recite kiddush on Shabbat eve, what is to recite kiddush any time the entire day? said to him: From the sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya say one who did not recite havdala at the conclusion of Shabbat recite havdala any time the entire week, here too, one who did not recite kiddush on Shabbat eve recite kiddush at any time the entire day.
llm_translation: Requested text translation: Ravina asked Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: One who did not sanctify the Sabbath on Friday evening, what should he do? Should he sanctify and continue the entire day? He said to him: As the sons of Rabbi Chiya said: One who did not separate Havdalah at the conclusion of the Sabbath - separates and continues the entire Sabbath. Here too: One who did not sanctify on Friday evening - sanctifies and continues the entire day.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: לֵילֵי שַׁבָּת וְלֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב יֵשׁ בָּהֶן קְדוּשָּׁה עַל הַכּוֹס וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶן הַזְכָּרָה בְּבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן. שַׁבָּת וְיוֹם טוֹב — אֵין בָּהֶם קְדוּשָּׁה עַל הַכּוֹס, וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶן הַזְכָּרָה בְּבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן.
human_translation: raised an objection to the nights of Shabbat and the nights of a Festival there is kiddush over a cup. And there is mention in Grace after Meals, Shabbat and Festivals, there is no kiddush over a cup, but there is mention in Grace after Meals.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: On the nights of Shabbat and the nights of Yom Tov, there is sanctity in them upon the cup, and there is remembrance in them in the blessing of the meal. Shabbat and Yom Tov - there is no sanctity upon the cup, and there is remembrance in them in the blessing of the meal.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מִי שֶׁלֹּא קִידֵּשׁ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת מְקַדֵּשׁ וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, שַׁבָּת וְיוֹם טוֹב נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לְהוּ דְּיֵשׁ בָּהֶן קְדוּשָּׁה עַל הַכּוֹס, דְּאִי לָא קַדֵּישׁ מֵאוּרְתָּא מְקַדֵּשׁ לִמְחַר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״דְּאִי״ לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: And if it could enter your mind one who did not recite kiddush on Shabbat eve recite kiddush any time the entire day, Shabbat and a Festival too, can be found that there is kiddush over a cup, for if one did not recite kiddush at night recite kiddush the following day. said to him: does not teach what if.
llm_translation: And if it comes to your mind that one who did not sanctify the wine on Friday evening may sanctify it and go the entire day, all of it, on Shabbat and Yom Tov, the Mishnah also forgets that there is sanctity in them upon the cup, for if he does not sanctify from the outset, he sanctifies for the next day! He said to him: "If" is not taught.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: כְּבוֹד יוֹם וּכְבוֹד לַיְלָה כְּבוֹד יוֹם קוֹדֵם. וְאִם אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא כּוֹס אֶחָד — אוֹמֵר עָלָיו
human_translation: raised an objection to the honor of the day and the honor of the night, the honor of the day takes precedence. And if one has only one cup, recite over it
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: The honor of day and the honor of night, the honor of day precedes. And if he has only one cup, he says over it:

hebrew_text: קִידּוּשׁ הַיּוֹם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקִּידּוּשׁ הַיּוֹם קוֹדֵם לִכְבוֹד יוֹם (וּכְבוֹד לַיְלָה). וְאִם אִיתָא — לִישְׁבְּקֵיהּ עַד לִמְחַר, וְלֶיעְבֵּיד בֵּיהּ תַּרְתֵּי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲבִיבָה מִצְוָה בִּשְׁעָתָהּ.
human_translation: the sanctification of the day, because the sanctification of the day takes precedence over the honor of the day and the honor of the night. And if it is so, let him leave over until the following day and use it for two said to him: A mitzva is beloved in its time.
llm_translation: The sanctification of the day, because the sanctification of the day precedes the honor of the day (and the honor of the night). And if it comes — let him wait until tomorrow, and he will fulfill two! He said to him: A mitzvah is beloved in its time.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמְרִינַן חֲבִיבָה מִצְוָה בִּשְׁעָתָהּ? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: הַנִּכְנָס לְבֵיתוֹ בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן וְעַל הַמָּאוֹר וְעַל הַבְּשָׂמִים, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אוֹמֵר הַבְדָּלָה עַל הַכּוֹס. וְאִם אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא כּוֹס אֶחָד — מַנִּיחוֹ עַד לְאַחַר הַמָּזוֹן וּמְשַׁלְשְׁלָן כּוּלָּן לְאַחֲרָיו, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן חֲבִיבָה מִצְוָה בִּשְׁעָתָהּ!
human_translation: And do we say a mitzva is beloved in its time? But wasn’t taught One who enters his home at the conclusion of Shabbat recites the blessing over the wine, and over the light, and over the spices, and recites havdala thereafter over the cup And if he has only one cup he leaves it for after food, and arranges all of the thereafter. we do not say a mitzva is beloved in its time,
llm_translation: And who said that a mitzvah is beloved at its time? But it was taught: One who enters his home on Saturday night blesses on the wine, and on the light, and on the spices, and afterwards says the blessing of havdalah over the cup. And if he only has one cup, he leaves it until after the meal and includes all of them in it, and we do not say a mitzvah is beloved at its time!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא לָא חַכִּימָאָה אֲנָא, וְלָא חוֹזָאָה אֲנָא, וְלָא יְחִידָאָה אֲנָא, אֶלָּא גַּמְרָנָא וְסַדְרָנָא אֲנָא, וְכֵן מוֹרִין בְּבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא כְּווֹתִי. שָׁאנֵי לַן בֵּין עַיּוֹלֵי יוֹמָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי יוֹמָא: עַיּוֹלֵי יוֹמָא — כׇּל כַּמָּה דְּמַקְדְּמִינַן לֵיהּ עֲדִיף, וּמְחַבְּבִינַן לֵיהּ. אַפּוֹקֵי יוֹמָא — מְאַחֲרִינַן לֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לֶיהֱוֵי עֲלַן כְּטוּנָא.
human_translation: He said to him: I am neither a scholar, nor a speculator, nor individual; rather, I teach and arrange and instruct in the study hall in accordance with my there is a difference for us between the arrival of the day and the departure of the day. the arrival of the day, the sooner we the better, and we beloved it is the conclusion of the day, we delay it so that to be like a burden to us.
llm_translation: He said to him: I am not a sage, nor a seer, nor an individual, but I am a learner and an organizer, and so we teach in the study hall like me. We differ between the young of the day and the old of the day: the young of the day - whatever we prioritize for it is preferable, and we show it respect. The old of the day - we delay for it, so that it will not be like a burden upon us.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִיהָא מַתְנִיתָא תַּמְנֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַמַּבְדִּיל בִּתְפִלָּה — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס.
human_translation: learn from this baraita eight Learn from it one who recites havdala in the prayer must recite havdala over a cup.
llm_translation: Listen from it from the following Mishnah: Listen from it: One who separates in prayer - he must separate on the cup.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בְּרָכָה טְעוּנָה כּוֹס. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה צָרִיךְ שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: And learn from it blessing requires a cup And learn from it a cup of blessing requires measure,
llm_translation: And hear from it: a blessing required a cup. And hear from it: a cup of blessing requires a specific measurement.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַמְבָרֵךְ צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּטְעוֹם. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: טְעָמוֹ — פְּגָמוֹ. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: טָעַם מַבְדִּיל.
human_translation: And learn from it one who recites a blessing must taste And learn from it he has tasted disqualified it And learn from it tasted recites havdala .
llm_translation: And hear from it: one who blesses needs to taste it. And hear from it: its taste - its flaw. And hear from it: taste distinguishes.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אוֹמֵר שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת עַל כּוֹס אֶחָד. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And learn from it recite two sanctifications over one cup, And learn from it this is Beit Shammai, in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: And hear from it: he says two sanctifications over one cup. And hear from it: it is the opinion of Beit Shammai, and according to the view of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: טְעָמוֹ פְּגָמוֹ וְכוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה צָרִיךְ שִׁיעוּר — חֲדָא מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: tasted disqualified it and a cup of blessing requires measure, are one matter
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Its taste is its flaw, and a cup of blessing requires a measure - this is one matter.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: מַאי טַעְמָא טְעָמוֹ פְּגָמוֹ? מִשּׁוּם דְּכוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה צָרִיךְ שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: And this is is saying: What is the reason tasted disqualified it because a cup of blessing requires measure.
llm_translation: And thus he said: What is the reason that the taste of its blemish is its taste? Because the cup of blessing requires a specific measure.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי קָפֵיד אַחַצְבָּא פְּגִימָא. רַב אִידִי בַּר שִׁישָׁא קָפֵיד אַכָּסָא פְּגִימָא. מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי קָפֵיד אֲפִילּוּ אַחָבִיתָא פְּגִימְתָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi was particular with regard to a blemished pitcher, Rav Idi bar Sheisha was particular with regard to a blemished cup. Mar bar Rav Ashi was particular even with regard to a blemished barrel
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi was meticulous with a half-broken jug. Rav Idi bar Shisha was meticulous with a damaged flask. Mar bar Rav Ashi was meticulous even with a cracked barrel.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״זָכוֹר אֶת יוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת לְקַדְּשׁוֹ״ — זוֹכְרֵהוּ עַל הַיַּיִן. אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּיוֹם, בַּלַּיְלָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זָכוֹר אֶת יוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת לְקַדְּשׁוֹ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught “Remember the day of Shabbat to sanctify it” Remember it over wine, I have only during the day, From where at night? The verse states: “Remember the day of Shabbat to sanctify it,”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Remember the Sabbath day, to sanctify it" - this is to remember it over wine. I only know during the day, from where do I know at night? The Torah teaches: "Remember the Sabbath day, to sanctify it."

hebrew_text: ״בַּלַּיְלָה מִנַּיִן״?! אַדְּרַבָּה, עִיקַּר קִדּוּשָׁא בַּלַּיְלָה הוּא קָדֵישׁ, דְּכִי קָדֵישׁ — תְּחִלַּת יוֹמָא בָּעֵי לְקַידּוֹשֵׁי! וְתוּ: ״בַּלַּיְלָה מִנַּיִן תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: זָכוֹר אֶת יוֹם״, תַּנָּא מְיהַדַּר אַלַּיְלָה וְקָא נָסֵיב לֵיהּ קְרָא דִּימָמָא?!
human_translation: From where at night? On the contrary, the essential kiddush is to sanctify at night, as must sanctify the beginning of the day, And furthermore, From where at night? The verse states: “Remember the day of Shabbat.” The tanna is seeking at night, and cites a verse to the day.
llm_translation: "At night, from where do we know?!" Rather, the primary sanctity is at night, for when it is sanctified - the beginning of the day requires sanctification! And furthermore: "At night, from where do we know that the Torah says: Remember the day," a Tanna retracted at night and brought forth a verse from the day?!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״זָכוֹר אֶת יוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת לְקַדְּשׁוֹ״ — זוֹכְרֵהוּ עַל הַיַּיִן בִּכְנִיסָתוֹ, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בַּלַּיְלָה, בַּיּוֹם מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זָכוֹר אֶת יוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת״.
human_translation: this is is saying: “Remember the day of Shabbat to sanctify it” remember it over wine when it begins. I have only at night; from where during the day? The verse states: “Remember the day of Shabbat.”
llm_translation: So it is stated: "Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy" - one should remember it over wine at its entrance, I have only at night, from where during the day? The Scripture teaches: "Remember the Sabbath day."

hebrew_text: בְּיוֹם מַאי מְבָרֵךְ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הַגֶּפֶן״. רַב אָשֵׁי אִיקְּלַע לְמָחוֹזָא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לִיקַדֵּישׁ לַן מָר קִידּוּשָׁא רַבָּה (הַבוּ לֵיהּ).
human_translation: During the day, what blessing does one recite? Rav Yehuda said: Who creates the fruit of the vine. Rav Ashi happened to Meḥoza. said to him the Master recite for us the great kiddush ? brought him
llm_translation: On what day does one recite the blessing? Rav Yehudah said: "Who creates the fruit of the vine." Rav Ashe happened to come to Mahoza, and they said to him: "Let our master sanctify us with the great sanctification (bring it to us)."

hebrew_text: סְבַר: מַאי נִיהוּ ״קִידּוּשָׁא רַבָּה״? אָמַר, מִכְּדֵי כׇּל הַבְּרָכוֹת כּוּלָּן ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הַגֶּפֶן״ אָמְרִי בְּרֵישָׁא, אֲמַר ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הַגֶּפֶן״ וְאַגֵּיד בֵּיהּ. חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא סָבָא דְּגָחֵין וְשָׁתֵי, קָרֵי אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ ״הֶחָכָם עֵינָיו בְּרֹאשׁוֹ״.
human_translation: He thought: What is this great kiddush He said Since all the blessings one first recites Who creates the fruit of the vine, He recited: Who creates the fruit of the vine, and lengthened it He saw a particular elder bending over his cup and drinking, He read about himself: “The wise man, his eyes are in his head”
llm_translation: He thinks: What is "Kiddusha Rabba"? He said, since all the blessings, all of them, "Who creates the fruit of the vine," they said at the beginning, he said "Who creates the fruit of the vine" and recited it. He saw that elder who would eat and drink, he called himself "The wise man's eyes are in his head."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי בְּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הִבְדִּיל בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת — מַבְדִּיל וְהוֹלֵךְ בְּכׇל הַשַּׁבָּת כּוּלּוֹ. וְעַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: עַד רְבִיעִי בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: the sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya say: One who did not recite havdala at the conclusion of Shabbat recite havdala anytime the entire week. And until how many Rabbi Zeira said: Until the fourth of the week,
llm_translation: The sons of Rabbi Chiya said: One who did not separate at the conclusion of Shabbat - separates and walks throughout the entire Shabbat. And until when? Rabbi Zeira said: Until the fourth hour on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּיָתֵיב רַבִּי זֵירָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אַסִּי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב אַסִּי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: לְעִנְיַן גִּיטִּין, חֲדָא בְּשַׁבְּתָא תְּרֵי וּתְלָתָא — בָּתַר שַׁבְּתָא. אַרְבַּע וְחַמְשָׁא וּמַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא — קַמֵּי שַׁבְּתָא.
human_translation: like that Rabbi Zeira sat before Rav Asi, and some say it Rav Asi before Rabbi Yoḥanan. And he sat and said: With regard to bills of divorce, first the week second and third After Shabbat. fourth fifth and eve of the day Before Shabbat.
llm_translation: When Rabbi Zeira was sitting before Rabbi Assi, and some say before Rabbi Yochanan, he sat and said: Regarding matters of divorce, one may send a document on Shabbat, two or three days after Shabbat. Four, five, and beyond the day of Shabbat - before Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי: אֲבָל לֹא עַל הָאוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said: However, not over fire.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi: But not on the light.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב בְּרוֹנָא אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: Rav Beruna said Rav said:
llm_translation: Rav Barona said in the name of Rav:

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹטֵל יָדָיו לֹא יְקַדֵּשׁ. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָא: אַכַּתִּי לָא נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַב שְׁכַחְנִינְהוּ לִשְׁמַעְתְּתֵיהּ. זִמְנִין סַגִּיאִין הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב, זִימְנִין דַּחֲבִיבָא עֲלֵיהּ רִיפְתָּא — מְקַדֵּשׁ אַרִיפְתָּא. זִימְנִין דַּחֲבִיבָא לֵיהּ חַמְרָא — מְקַדֵּשׁ אַחַמְרָא.
human_translation: One who washes his hands not recite kiddush Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta said to them: Not yet Rav died, we have forgotten his rulings. Many times I stood before Rav sometimes he preferred bread, he would recite kiddush over bread. At times he preferred wine would recite kiddush over wine.
llm_translation: One who washes his hands should not sanctify. Rav Yitzchak son of Shmuel son of Marta said to them: "Indeed, the soul of Rav was not at ease, for he forgot to hear them. Sometimes when a dish was very precious before Rav, if it was a dish of bread — he would sanctify the bread. If it was a dish of wine — he would sanctify the wine."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: טָעַם אֵינוֹ מְקַדֵּשׁ. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב חָנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא מֵרַב הוּנָא: טָעַם מַהוּ שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, אֲנִי אוֹמֵר: טָעַם — מַבְדִּיל, וְרַב אַסִּי אָמַר: טָעַם — אֵינוֹ מַבְדִּיל.
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rav said: tasted not recite kiddush Rav Ḥana bar Ḥinnana raised a dilemma before Rav Huna: tasted what is to he recite havdala ? He said to him: I say tasted recite havdala . And Rav Asi said: tasted not recite havdala .
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Taste does not sanctify. Rav Hana bar Chinena asked Rav Huna: What about distinguishing taste? He said to him, I say: Taste distinguishes, and Rav Assi said: Taste does not distinguish.

hebrew_text: רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב אַסִּי, אִישְׁתְּלִי וְטָעִים מִידֵּי, הַבוּ לֵיהּ כָּסָא וְאַבְדֵּיל. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ: וְהָא מָר לָא עָבֵיד הָכִי! אֲמַר לַהּ: שִׁבְקֵיהּ, כְּרַבֵּיהּ סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba happened to the house of Rav Asi. He forgot and tasted some They gave him a cup and he recited havdala . wife said to But Master does not act this way. He said to her: Leave He maintains in accordance with his rabbi.
llm_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba entered the house of Rav Assi, he sat and tasted from his hand, they brought him a chair and a spice box. His wife said to him: "Doesn't the master usually not do this?" He said to her: "Leave him, for it is pleasant for him like his master."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: טָעַם — אֵינוֹ מְקַדֵּשׁ, טָעַם — אֵינוֹ מַבְדִּיל. וְרַבָּה אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: טָעַם — מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְטָעַם — מַבְדִּיל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said Shmuel said: tasted not recite kiddush , one who has tasted not recite havdala . And Rabba said Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: tasted recite kiddush , and one who has tasted recite havdala .
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said in the name of Shmuel: "Taste does not sanctify, taste does not separate." And Rabbah said Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: "Taste sanctifies, and taste separates."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הִילְכְתָא, טָעַם — מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְטָעַם — מַבְדִּיל, וּמִי שֶׁלֹּא קִידֵּשׁ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מְקַדֵּשׁ וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ עַד מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת. מִי שֶׁלֹּא הִבְדִּיל בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת — מַבְדִּיל וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַשַּׁבָּת כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: halakha tasted recite kiddush ; and tasted recite havdala ; and one who did not recite kiddush on Shabbat eve, recite kiddush any time the entire day until the conclusion of Shabbat. one who did not recite havdala at the conclusion of Shabbat recite havdala any time the entire week,
llm_translation: Rava said: The halakha is, one who tasted wine — sanctifies, and one who tasted wine — differentiates, and one who did not sanctify on Friday evening — sanctifies and continues the entire day until the conclusion of the Sabbath. One who did not differentiate at the conclusion of the Sabbath — differentiates and continues the entire Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר פָּתַח לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא דְּרָבָא בְּהַאי לִישָּׁנָא, אָמַר רָבָא: הִילְכְתָא, טָעַם — מְקַדֵּשׁ, טָעַם — מַבְדִּיל, מִי שֶׁלֹּא קִידֵּשׁ בָּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מְקַדֵּשׁ וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, מִי שֶׁלֹּא הִבְדִּיל בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת — מַבְדִּיל וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Ameimar began this teaching of Rava in this formulation: Rava said: halakha tasted recite kiddush ; tasted recite havdala ; one who did not recite kiddush on Shabbat eve, recite kiddush any time the entire day. One who did not recite havdala at the conclusion of Shabbat recite havdala any time the entire day
llm_translation: Ammemar began for her to say the teaching of Rava in this matter, he said: The halakha is, the reason - sanctifies, the reason - distinguishes. One who did not sanctify on Friday evening - sanctifies and continues the entire day, one who did not distinguish at the conclusion of Shabbat - distinguishes and continues the entire day.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ מָר יָנוֹקָא וּמָר קַשִּׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: זִימְנָא חֲדָא אִיקְּלַע אַמֵּימָר לְאַתְרִין, וְלָא הֲוָה לַן חַמְרָא. אַיְיתִינָא לֵיהּ שִׁיכְרָא, וְלָא אַבְדֵּיל וּבָת טְווֹת. לִמְחַר, טְרַחְנָא וְאַיְיתִינָא לֵיהּ חַמְרָא, וְאַבְדֵּיל וּטְעֵים מִידֵּי. לְשָׁנָה תּוּ אִיקְּלַע לְאַתְרִין, לָא הֲוָה לַן חַמְרָא, אַיְיתִינָא שִׁיכְרָא, אָמַר: אִי הָכִי, חֲמַר מְדִינָה הוּא, אַבְדֵּיל וּטְעֵים מִידֵּי.
human_translation: the Mar Yanuka, and Mar Kashisha, sons of Rav Ḥisda, said to Rav Ashi: Once Ameimar happened to our place and we did not have wine We brought him beer and he did not recite havdala , and he passed the night fasting, The next day we exerted ourselves and brought him wine, and he recited havdala and tasted some The next year he again happened to our place. we did not have wine we brought beer. He said: If so, is the wine of the province. He recited havdala and tasted some
llm_translation: They said to him, Master Yanuka and Master Kashisha, sons of Rav Hisda, to Rav Ashi: "One time, Amemar arrived at a certain place, and we did not have wine. I brought him beer, but he did not separate and taste it. The next day, I made an effort and brought him wine, and he separated and tasted it immediately. The following year, he arrived at the same place, and we did not have wine. I brought him beer, and he said: 'If so, it is wine of the region,' and he separated and tasted it."

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַמַּבְדִּיל בִּתְפִלָּה, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל עַל הַכּוֹס. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אָסוּר לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיֹּאכַל קוֹדֶם שֶׁיַּבְדִּיל. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הִבְדִּיל בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, מַבְדִּיל וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַשַּׁבָּת כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: learn from three Learn from it one who recites havdala in the prayer must recite havdala over a cup, And learn from it it is prohibited for a person to eat before he recites havdala . And learn from it one who did not recite havdala at the conclusion of Shabbat recite havdala anytime the entire week,
llm_translation: Listen, derive three. Listen, derive: one who separates in prayer, must separate over the cup. And listen, derive: it is forbidden for a person to eat before he separates. And listen, derive: one who did not separate at the conclusion of Shabbat, separates and continues the entire Shabbat.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב הוּנָא מֵרַב חִסְדָּא: מַהוּ לְקַדּוֹשֵׁי אַשִּׁיכְרָא? אָמַר: הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה פִּירְזוּמָא וּתְאֵינֵי וְאַסְנֵי דִּבְעַאי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב, וְרַב מֵרַבִּי חִיָּיא, וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא מֵרַבִּי, וְלָא פְּשַׁט לֵיהּ — שִׁיכְרָא מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Rav Huna raised a dilemma before Rav Ḥisda: What is to recite kiddush over date beer? He said: Now, if barley beer, fig beer, and berries, I raised a dilemma before Rav and Rav before Rabbi Ḥiyya, and Rabbi Ḥiyya of Rabbi and he did not resolve it for him, is it necessary to say that date beer,
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Huna from Rav Ḥisda: What about for the holy ones of Ashikra? He said: Now, what about the winepresses and fig trees and thorns that Rav inquired about, and Rav from Rabbi Ḥiyya, and Rabbi Ḥiyya from Rabbi, and it did not resolve for him — does Ashikra require it?!

hebrew_text: סְבוּר מִינָּה קַדּוֹשֵׁי הוּא דְּלָא מְקַדְּשִׁינַן עִילָּוֵיהּ, אֲבָל אַבְדּוֹלֵי מַבְדְּלִינַן. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב חִסְדָּא: הָכִי אָמַר רַב: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין עָלָיו, כָּךְ אֵין מַבְדִּילִין עָלָיו. אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר אֲבִימִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין עָלָיו, כָּךְ אֵין מַבְדִּילִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: understood from it it is kiddush that one not recite over it, but one recite havdala Rav Ḥisda said to them Rav said as follows: Just as one not recite kiddush over so one not recite havdala over it. It was also stated Rav Taḥalifa bar Avimi said Shmuel said: Just as one not recite kiddush over so one not recite havdala over it.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "It is thought that the holy items are not sanctified for its sake, but the idolatrous items are separated. Rav Ḥisdah said to them: So said Rav: Just as we do not sanctify upon it, so too we do not separate upon it. It was also stated: Rav Taḥalifa, son of Avimi, said in the name of Shmuel: Just as we do not sanctify upon it, so too we do not separate upon it."

hebrew_text: לֵוִי שַׁדַּר לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁיכְרָא בַּר תְּלֵיסַר מְגָנֵי, טַעְמֵיהּ — הֲוָה בְּסִים טוּבָא, אֲמַר: כְּגוֹן זֶה רָאוּי לְקַדֵּשׁ עָלָיו וְלוֹמַר עָלָיו כׇּל שִׁירוֹת וְתוּשְׁבָּחוֹת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם. בְּלֵילְיָא צַעֲרֵיהּ. אָמַר: מְיַסְּרָן וּמְפַיֵּיס.
human_translation: Levi sent Rabbi a beer of thirteen soakings, tasted it it was especially pleasant. He said: like this is fit to recite kiddush over and to say upon it all the songs and praises in the world, At night, it caused him pain. He said: It pains and soothes
llm_translation: Levi sent to Rabbi Shikra son of Telyasar Meganei, his taste was good, he said: such as this is fitting to sanctify upon it and to recite upon it all songs and praises in the world. In the evenings his troubles. He said: Rebuke them and appease them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֶדּוֹר בָּרַבִּים דְּלָא אִישְׁתֵּי שִׁיכְרָא. אָמַר רָבָא: אִישְׁתֵּי מֵי זוּרְיוֹן וְלָא אִישְׁתֵּי שִׁיכְרָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: I will take a vow in public, that I will not drink beer Rava said: I would drink water soaking and I will not drink beer.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: A generation that does not drink beer. Rava said: They drink wine of Zorayon and not beer.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: תֶּיהְוֵי שַׁקְיוּתֵיהּ שִׁיכְרָא מַאן דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ אַשִּׁיכְרָא. רַב, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא דְּקַדֵּישׁ אַשִּׁיכְרָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁרֵי אַבָּא לְמִיקְנֵי אִיסְתֵּירֵי מִשִּׁיכְרָא.
human_translation: And Rava said: One who recites kiddush over beer, his drink should be beer. Rav found Rav Huna reciting kiddush over beer. He said to him: Abba, has started to acquire coins with beer.
llm_translation: And Rava said: Let his indulgence be with beer, whoever sanctifies beer. Rav found Rav Huna who sanctified beer, he said to him: It is permitted, my father, to acquire indulgences from beer.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶלָּא עַל הַיַּיִן, וְאֵין מְבָרְכִין אֶלָּא עַל הַיַּיִן. אַטּוּ אַשִּׁיכְרָא וְאַמַּיָּא מִי לָא מְבָרְכִין עֲלַיְהוּ שֶׁהַכֹּל נִהְיֶה בִּדְבָרוֹ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין אוֹמְרִים ״הָבֵא כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה לְבָרֵךְ״ אֶלָּא עַל הַיַּיִן. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין עַל הַשֵּׁכָר. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אָמְרוּ: מְקַדְּשִׁין.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One recite kiddush only over wine, and one recite blessings only over wine. Is that to say that one does not say the blessing: By Whose word all things [ shehakol ] came to be, over beer and water? Abaye said: This is is saying: One only says: Bring a cup of blessing to recite the blessing over wine. The Rabbis taught One not recite kiddush over beer. In the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, they said one recite kiddush
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One sanctifies only over wine, and one blesses only over wine. Why do we not bless over beer and mead, since everything comes about through His word? Abaye said: This is what he meant to say: One does not say, "Bring a cup of blessing to bless," except over wine. The Rabbis taught: One does not sanctify over beer. In the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, they said: One sanctifies.

hebrew_text: מַטְעֶימֶת יַיִן כׇּל שֶׁהוּא. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מְלֹא לוּגְמָא. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב, וְכֵן תָּנֵי רַב גִּידֵּל דְּמִן נָרֶשׁ: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ וְטָעַם מְלֹא לוּגְמָא — יָצָא, וְאִם לָאו — לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: by tasting any amount of wine. Rabbi Yosei, son of Yehuda, says a cheekful. Rav Huna said Rav said, and Rav Giddel from Neresh likewise teaches: One who recites kiddush and tastes a cheekful has fulfilled and if not, has not fulfilled
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mat'emeit yayin kol shehu. Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda omer: Melo lugma. Amar Rav Huna amar Rav, v'chen tanei Rav Giddel d'min Nares: Ham'kadesh v'ta'am melo lugma - yatza, v'im lav - lo yatza." English translation: "One who dilutes wine in any amount. Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: Fill it with a log of water. Rav Huna said in the name of Rav, and similarly taught Rav Giddel from Nares: If one sanctifies and tastes a log of water - he has fulfilled his obligation, but if not - he has not fulfilled his obligation."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֲנָא תְּנֵינָא לַהּ לָא גִּידּוֹל בַּר מְנַשְּׁיָא וְלָא גִּידּוֹל בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אֶלָּא גִּידּוֹל סְתָמָא. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִירְמָא דִּידֵיהּ אַדִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: I teach this not Giddul bar Menashya, nor Giddul bar Minyumei, but rather plain Giddul, What is practical difference To raise a contradiction his his
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: I, we have taught her, not from the great son of men, and not from the great son of the sea, but from the great unknown. What is the reason for this? To show that His knowledge is not like our knowledge.

hebrew_text: סָמוּךְ לַמִּנְחָה. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: סָמוּךְ לְמִנְחָה גְּדוֹלָה תְּנַן, אוֹ דִילְמָא סָמוּךְ לְמִנְחָה קְטַנָּה תְּנַן?
human_translation: adjacent to minḥa time A dilemma was raised before we learn adjacent to greater minḥa [ minḥa gedola ], or perhaps we learned adjacent to lesser minḥa [ minḥa ketana ],
llm_translation: Adjacent to the meal-offering. It was asked: Adjacent to a large meal-offering we learned, or perhaps adjacent to a small meal-offering we learned?

hebrew_text: סָמוּךְ לְמִנְחָה גְּדוֹלָה תְּנַן — וּמִשּׁוּם פֶּסַח, דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְמִימְּשַׁךְ,
human_translation: we learn adjacent to the greater minḥa , because of the Paschal lamb, lest one come to be drawn after
llm_translation: Adjacent to the large Mincha offering we learned - and because of Pesach, perhaps one will come to mix it up.

hebrew_text: וְאָתֵי לְאִימְּנוֹעֵי מִלְּמִיעְבַּד פִּסְחָא. אוֹ דִילְמָא, סָמוּךְ לְמִנְחָה קְטַנָּה תְּנַן — וּמִשּׁוּם מַצָּה, דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְמֵיכְלַהּ לְמַצָּה אֲכִילָה גַּסָּה.
human_translation: and he will end up refraining from performing the Paschal lamb? Or perhaps we learned adjacent to the lesser minḥa , and due to matza . perhaps he will come to eat the matza excessive eating,
llm_translation: And it comes to teach about the faithless ones who would eat the Paschal lamb. Or perhaps, close to the offering of the small meal-offering we learned — and because of the matzah, lest one come to eat it as a thick matzah meal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: אֲפִילּוּ אַגְרִיפַּס הַמֶּלֶךְ שֶׁהוּא רָגִיל לֶאֱכוֹל בְּתֵשַׁע שָׁעוֹת — אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם לֹא יֹאכַל עַד שֶׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא סָמוּךְ לְמִנְחָה קְטַנָּה תְּנַן, הַיְינוּ רְבוּתֵיהּ דְּאַגְרִיפַּס.
human_translation: Ravina said: Come hear Even King Agrippa, who regularly eats at nine hours, on that day he not eat until dark. Granted, if you say we learned adjacent to the lesser minḥa , this is the greatness of Agrippa,
llm_translation: Ravina said, come and hear: Even Agrippas the king, who is accustomed to eat at the ninth hour - on that day he will not eat until it gets dark. If you say that we learned near the afternoon offering, that is his usual practice of Agrippas.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ סָמוּךְ לְמִנְחָה גְּדוֹלָה תְּנַן, מַאי רְבוּתֵיהּ דְּאַגְרִיפַּס? חָל אִיסּוּר עֲלֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא! אֶלָּא סָמוּךְ לְמִנְחָה קְטַנָּה תְּנַן.
human_translation: However, if you say we learned adjacent to the greater minḥa , what is the greatness of Agrippa? prohibition taken effect at the outset, Rather, we learned adjacent to the lesser minḥa ,
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that it is taught: "Adjacent to a large Minchah offering," what is the excess of Agrippas? The prohibition was upon it from the outset! Rather, it is taught: "Adjacent to a small Minchah offering."

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף מַאי רְבוּתֵיהּ דְּאַגְרִיפַּס, הָא מָטְיָא לֵיהּ זְמַן אִיסּוּרָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא תֵּשַׁע שָׁעוֹת לְאַגְרִיפַּס כְּאַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת דִּידַן דָּמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Ultimately, what is the greatness of Agrippa? The time of the prohibition had arrived. Lest you say nine hours for Agrippa is considered like four hours for us, teaches us
llm_translation: At the end, what is the advantage of Agrippas? This time of prohibition comes to him! Lest you say, "Nine hours for Agrippas are like our four hours," it teaches us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי (יוֹסֵי): אֲבָל מְטַבֵּיל הוּא בְּמִינֵי תַּרְגִּימָא. רַבִּי יִצְחָק מְטַבֵּיל בְּיַרְקֵי. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַשַּׁמָּשׁ מְטַבֵּיל בִּבְנֵי מֵעַיִין וְנוֹתְנָן לִפְנֵי הָאוֹרְחִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: however, one dip types of refreshments, Rabbi Yitzḥak dip vegetables. That was also taught the waiter dip in the intestines and place them before the guests
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: But he immerses in types of Targima. Rabbi Yitzchak immerses in vegetables. It was also taught likewise: The attendant immerses in the waters of the spring and places them before the guests.

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִירוּ לָכֶם נִיר וְאַל תִּזְרְעוּ אֶל קוֹצִים״.
human_translation: And although there is no proof for matter, is an allusion to matter, it is stated: “Break up for yourselves a fallow ground, and do not sow among thorns”
llm_translation: "And even though there is no proof for the matter, a remembrance for the matter, as it is stated: 'Sow for yourselves seed and do not sow among thorns.'"

hebrew_text: רָבָא הֲוָה שָׁתֵי חַמְרָא כּוּלֵּי מַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְפִיסְחָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנִיגְרְרֵיהּ לְלִיבֵּיהּ דְּנֵיכוֹל מַצָּה טְפֵי לְאוּרְתָּא. אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ דְּחַמְרָא מִיגְרָר גָּרֵיר, דִּתְנַן:
human_translation: Rava would drink wine the entire day of Passover eve, so whet his appetite to eat more matza at night. Rava said: From where do I say it, that wine whets As we learned
llm_translation: Rava was drinking wine all the days of Passover, so that it would drag along the matzah in his intestines to the light. Rava said: From where do I know that wine drags along? As we learned:

hebrew_text: בֵּין הַכּוֹסוֹת הַלָּלוּ אִם רָצָה לִשְׁתּוֹת — יִשְׁתֶּה, בֵּין שְׁלִישִׁי לִרְבִיעִי — לֹא יִשְׁתֶּה. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִסְעָד סָעֵיד, אַמַּאי יִשְׁתֶּה? הָא קָא אָכֵיל לְמַצָּה אֲכִילָה גַּסָּה. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מִגְרָר גָּרֵיר.
human_translation: between these cups if one wants to drink he drink. between the third and fourth one not drink. And if you say that satisfies why one drink He will eat matza an excessive eating. Rather, learn from that whets
llm_translation: Among these cups, if he wants to drink - he may drink, between the third and fourth - he may not drink. And if you say, "He is satiated," why should he drink? He is eating a heavy meal of matzah. Rather, learn from it: he is stirring.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת הֲוָה יָתֵיב בְּתַעֲנִיתָא כׇּל מַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְפִסְחָא. נֵימָא קָא סָבַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: סָמוּךְ לְמִנְחָה גְּדוֹלָה תְּנַן — וּמִשּׁוּם פִּסְחָא הוּא, דִּילְמָא מִימְּשַׁךְ וְאָתֵי לְאִימְּנוֹעֵי מִלְּמֶעְבַּד פִּיסְחָא הוּא,
human_translation: Rav Sheshet would fast the entire eve of Passover. Shall we say Rav Sheshet maintains we learned adjacent to the greater minḥa , and is due to the Paschal lamb, lest one be drawn and come to refrain from performing the Paschal lamb.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet was sitting in a fast on the eve of Passover. It was said that Rav Sheshet thought: We learn near the Minchah Gedolah - and because of Passover it is, perhaps he will delay and come to be distracted from performing the Passover.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר לַהּ כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַכְשִׁיר הָיָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא בְּפֶסַח שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ שַׁחֲרִית בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר לִשְׁמוֹ, וּמִצַּפְרָא זְמַן פִּסְחָא הוּא, דְּכוּלֵּי יוֹמָא חֲזֵי לְפִסְחָא,
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet maintains in accordance with that that Rabbi Oshaya said Rabbi Elazar said: Ben Beteira would deem valid a Paschal lamb that was slaughtered in the morning on the fourteenth for its own purpose, from the morning it is time a Paschal lamb as the whole day is fit for the Paschal lamb.
llm_translation: And he reasoned with her, for this that Rabbi Oshaya said, Rabbi Elazar said: Ben Beteira was fit for the Passover when he slaughtered it in the morning of the fourteenth of its name, and it was the time of the Passover offering, for the entire day is fit for the Passover.

hebrew_text: דְּסָבַר ״בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם״ — בֵּין עֶרֶב דְּאֶתְמוֹל לְעֶרֶב דְּהָאִידָּנָא.
human_translation: As maintained “ bein ha’arbayim ” between the evening of yesterday and the current evening
llm_translation: He holds "between the evenings" — between the evening of yesterday and the evening of today.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לָא, שָׁאנֵי רַב שֵׁשֶׁת דְּאִיסְתְּנִיס הֲוָה, דְּאִי טָעֵים בְּצַפְרָא מִידֵּי, לְאוּרְתָּא לָא הֲוָה מַהְנֵי לֵיהּ מֵיכְלָא.
human_translation: They say No, Rav Sheshet was different, as he was delicate [ istenis ], for if he would taste some in the morning, food at night would not be effective for him.
llm_translation: They said: No, it is different with Rav Sheshet who was blind, for if one tastes from a bird, he cannot discern whether it is from the pot.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ עָנִי שֶׁבְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יֹאכַל עַד שֶׁיָּסֵב. אִיתְּמַר: מַצָּה צָרִיךְ הֲסִיבָּה, מָרוֹר אֵין צָרִיךְ הֲסִיבָּה. יַיִן, אִיתְּמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: צָרִיךְ הֲסִיבָּה. וְאִיתְּמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: אֵין צָרִיךְ הֲסִיבָּה.
human_translation: even the poorest of Jews not eat until he reclines. It was stated matza requires reclining, bitter herbs do not require reclining. wine, it was stated in the name of Rav Naḥman requires reclining, and it was stated in the name of Rav Naḥman does not require reclining.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even a poor person among the Israelites may not eat until he is satiated. It was stated: Matzah requires being satiated, Maror does not require being satiated. Wine, it was stated in the name of Rav Nachman: requires being satiated. And it was stated in the name of Rav Nachman: does not require being satiated.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא בְּתַרְתֵּי כָּסֵי קַמָּאֵי, הָא בְּתַרְתֵּי כָּסֵי בָּתְרָאֵי. אָמְרִי לַהּ לְהַאי גִּיסָא וְאָמְרִי לַהּ לְהַאי גִּיסָא. אָמְרִי לַהּ לְהַאי גִּיסָא: תְּרֵי כָּסֵי קַמָּאֵי — בָּעוּ הֲסִיבָּה, דְּהַשְׁתָּא הוּא דְּקָא מַתְחֲלָא לַהּ חֵירוּת. תְּרֵי כָּסֵי בָּתְרָאֵי — לָא בָּעוּ הֲסִיבָּה, מַאי דַּהֲוָה הֲוָה.
human_translation: And do not disagree This to the first two cups, and that to the last two cups. Some say in this manner and some say it in that manner. Some say it in this manner, the first two cups require reclining, as it is now that freedom begins. last two cups do not require reclining, what was was.
llm_translation: They did not argue: this one with two cups in front of him, this one with two cups behind him. They said to him regarding this case, and they said to him regarding that case. They said to him regarding this case: two cups in front of him - they needed the reason, for now he is beginning to feel freedom. Two cups behind him - they did not need the reason, whatever will be, will be.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִי לַהּ לְהַאי גִּיסָא: אַדְּרַבָּה, תְּרֵי כָּסֵי בָּתְרָאֵי — בָּעוּ הֲסִיבָּה, הָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא דְּקָא הָוְיָא חֵירוּת. תְּרֵי כָּסֵי קַמָּאֵי — לָא בָּעוּ הֲסִיבָּה, דְּאַכַּתִּי ״עֲבָדִים הָיִינוּ״ קָאָמַר. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאִיתְּמַר הָכִי וְאִיתְּמַר הָכִי, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בָּעוּ הֲסִיבָּה.
human_translation: And some say it in that manner on the contrary, last two cups require reclining, at that time that there is freedom. first two cups do not require reclining, as one still says: We were slaves. Now that it was stated so, and it was stated so, these and those require reclining.
llm_translation: And they said to her in this case: Adrabah, two cups afterwards - they came to argue, that hour that was freedom. Two cups before - they did not come to argue, for it is written "we were slaves." Now that it was said this way and it was said that way, both of them came to argue.

hebrew_text: פְּרַקְדָּן לָא שְׁמֵיהּ הֲסִיבָּה. הֲסִיבַּת יָמִין לָא שְׁמַהּ הֲסִיבָּה. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁמָּא יַקְדִּים קָנֶה לְוֶושֶׁט, וְיָבֹא לִידֵי סַכָּנָה.
human_translation: Lying on one’s back is not called reclining. Reclining to the right is not called reclining, And not only that, but perhaps the windpipe will precede the esophagus. and one will come into danger
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Pergdan is not its name, Hasibah. Hasibat Yamin is not its name, Hasimah. Moreover, lest one precede a reed to a staff, and come to danger."

hebrew_text: אִשָּׁה אֵצֶל בַּעְלָהּ לָא בָּעֲיָא הֲסִיבָּה, וְאִם אִשָּׁה חֲשׁוּבָה הִיא — צְרִיכָה הֲסִיבָּה. בֵּן אֵצֶל אָבִיו בָּעֵי הֲסִיבָּה. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: תַּלְמִיד אֵצֶל רַבּוֹ מַאי?
human_translation: A woman with her husband is not required to recline, but if she is an important woman, she is required to recline. A son with his father is required to recline. A dilemma was raised before What is a student with his teacher?
llm_translation: A woman with her husband does not require permission, but if she is a respected woman, she requires permission. A son with his father requires permission. They asked: What about a student with his teacher?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, (אֲמַר) אַבָּיֵי: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי מָר זְגֵינַן אַבִּירְכֵי דַהֲדָדֵי, כִּי אָתֵינַן לְבֵי רַב יוֹסֵף, אָמַר לַן: לָא צְרִיכִתוּ, מוֹרָא רַבָּךְ כְּמוֹרָא שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Come hear Abaye said: When we were in the house of Master, we reclined on each other’s knees, When we came to the house of Rav Yosef, said to us: You need not the fear of your teacher is like the fear of Heaven.
llm_translation: Come and hear, (said) Abbaye: When we were in the house of Mar Zegina, the sons of Hadadei, when we came to the house of Rav Yosef, he said to us: You are not needed, the fear of your master should be like the fear of Heaven.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: עִם הַכֹּל אָדָם מֵיסֵב, וַאֲפִילּוּ תַּלְמִיד אֵצֶל רַבּוֹ! כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא — בִּשְׁוַלְיָא דְנַגָּרֵי.
human_translation: raises an objection: A person must recline of anyone, and even a student with his teacher When that was taught, with regard to a craftsman’s apprentice,
llm_translation: Challenger: With everyone a person may recline, even a student with his teacher! For it was taught in that Baraita - in the bathhouse of the blacksmiths.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שַׁמָּשׁ מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הַשַּׁמָּשׁ שֶׁאָכַל כְּזַיִת מַצָּה כְּשֶׁהוּא מֵיסֵב — יָצָא. מֵיסֵב — אִין, לֹא מֵיסֵב — לָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בָּעֵי הֲסִיבָּה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is a waiter? Come hear as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A waiter who ate an olive-bulk of matza while reclining has fulfilled reclining, yes, not reclining, no, Learn from requires reclining. learn from it
llm_translation: He asked them: What about a servant? Come and hear, for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: If the servant ate an olive's worth of matzah while he is reclining - he has fulfilled his obligation. If he is not reclining - he has not fulfilled his obligation. Learn from this: it requires leaning. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת בְּאַרְבָּעָה כּוֹסוֹת הַלָּלוּ,
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Women are obligated in these four cups
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Women obligated in four cups these,

hebrew_text: שֶׁאַף הֵן הָיוּ בְּאוֹתוֹ הַנֵּס.
human_translation: As they too were in that miracle
llm_translation: "They too were in that miracle."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אַרְבָּעָה כּוֹסוֹת הַלָּלוּ צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּהֶן כְּדֵי מְזִיגַת כּוֹס יָפֶה. שְׁתָאָן חַי — יָצָא. שְׁתָאָן בְּבַת אַחַת — יָצָא. הִשְׁקָה מֵהֶן לְבָנָיו וְלִבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ — יָצָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: These four cups must contain for diluting a significant cup. one drank them undiluted, fulfilled one drank them all at once, fulfilled one gave his sons or the members of his household to drink from them, fulfilled
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: These four cups, one must have in them enough for a beautiful cup to be poured. If he drank the first two — he has fulfilled his obligation. If he drank them in one shot — he has fulfilled his obligation. If he gave from them to his sons and the members of his household to drink — he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: שְׁתָאָן חַי יָצָא, אָמַר רָבָא: יְדֵי יַיִן — יָצָא, יְדֵי חֵירוּת — לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: one drank them undiluted fulfilled Rava said: fulfilled wine, not fulfilled freedom,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Shetaan Chai yatza, amar Rava: Yedei yayin - yatza, yedei cheirut - lo yatza." Translation: "If a living demon departs, Rava said: By the hands of wine - it departs, by the hands of freedom - it does not depart."

hebrew_text: שְׁתָאָן בְּבַת אַחַת, רַב אָמַר: יְדֵי יַיִן — יָצָא, יְדֵי אַרְבָּעָה כּוֹסוֹת — לֹא יָצָא. הִשְׁקָה מֵהֶן לְבָנָיו וְלִבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ — יָצָא, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: וְהוּא דְּאִשְׁתִּי רוּבָּא דְכָסָא.
