human_translation: one drank all at once, Rav said fulfilled wine not fulfilled four cups, one gave his sons or the members of his household to drink from them, fulfilled Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: And this is if he drank the majority of the cup.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If one drank in one house, Rav said: the hands of wine - he fulfilled his obligation, the hands of four cups - he did not fulfill his obligation. If he gave them to his sons and the members of his household to drink - he fulfilled his obligation, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: and he who drinks the majority of a cup.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אַרְבָּעָה כּוֹסוֹת הַלָּלוּ צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּהֶן כְּדֵי רְבִיעִית, אֶחָד חַי וְאֶחָד מָזוּג, אֶחָד חָדָשׁ וְאֶחָד יָשָׁן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא בּוֹ טַעַם וּמַרְאֵה יַיִן. קָתָנֵי מִיהַת כְּדֵי רְבִיעִית, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ כּוֹס יָפֶה!
human_translation: raises an objection These four cups must contain quarter whether is undiluted or diluted, whether new or aged. Rabbi Yehuda says: It must have the taste and appearance of wine. In any event, is teaching of quarter- and you said a significant cup.
llm_translation: Challenger: Four cups these require that there be in them a quarter, one live and one mixed, one new and one old. Rabbi Yehuda says: It requires that there be in it taste and appearance of wine. The Tanna taught: a quarter, and you say a beautiful cup!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא, מַאי ״כְּדֵי מְזִיגַת כּוֹס יָפֶה״ דְּקָאָמַר — לְכׇל חַד וְחַד, דְּהָוֵי לְהוּ כּוּלְּהוּ רְבִיעִית.
human_translation: They say this and that are one measure. What Enough for diluting a significant cup, which said? for each and every one This quarter for all of them
llm_translation: They said: Both this and that are one measure, what is "like the pouring of a beautiful cup" that it is saying - for each and every one, that it should be a quarter for all of them.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא בּוֹ טַעַם וּמַרְאֶה. אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״אַל תֵּרֶא יַיִן כִּי יִתְאַדָּם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says must have taste and appearance Rava said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? As it is written: “Look not upon wine when it is red”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: It is necessary that it have taste and appearance. Rava said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's statement? As it is written: "Do not look at wine when it is red."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַכֹּל חַיָּיבִין בְּאַרְבָּעָה כּוֹסוֹת הַלָּלוּ, אֶחָד אֲנָשִׁים, וְאֶחָד נָשִׁים, וְאֶחָד תִּינוֹקוֹת. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וְכִי מָה תּוֹעֶלֶת יֵשׁ לְתִינוֹקוֹת בְּיַיִן? אֶלָּא מְחַלְּקִין לָהֶן
human_translation: The Sages taught All are obligated in these four cups, including men, women, and children. Rabbi Yehuda said: What benefit do children receive from wine? Rather, one distributes to them
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Everyone is obligated in these four cups of wine, one for men, one for women, and one for children. Rabbi Yehuda said: What benefit do children have from wine? Rather, we give them a portion.

hebrew_text: קְלָיוֹת וֶאֱגוֹזִין בְּעֶרֶב פֶּסַח כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁנוּ, וְיִשְׁאֲלוּ. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שֶׁהָיָה מְחַלֵּק קְלָיוֹת וֶאֱגוֹזִין לְתִינוֹקוֹת בְּעֶרֶב פֶּסַח כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁנוּ, וְיִשְׁאֲלוּ. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: חוֹטְפִין מַצּוֹת בְּלֵילֵי פְּסָחִים בִּשְׁבִיל תִּינוֹקוֹת שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁנוּ.
human_translation: roasted grains and nuts on Passover eve, so that they will not sleep and they will ask They said about Rabbi Akiva that he would distribute roasted grains and nuts to children on Passover eve, so that they would not sleep and they would ask. It was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: One grabs the matzot on the nights of Passover. on account of the children, so they will not sleep
llm_translation: Almonds and nuts on the eve of Passover in order that they not fall asleep, and they should ask. They said about Rabbi Akiva that he would distribute almonds and nuts to children on the eve of Passover in order that they not fall asleep, and they should ask. It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: We snatch the matzot on the nights of Passover for the sake of children so that they not fall asleep.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִיָּמָיו לֹא אָמַר הִגִּיעַ עֵת לַעֲמוֹד בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, חוּץ מֵעַרְבֵי פְסָחִים וְעֶרֶב יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. בְּעֶרֶב פֶּסַח — בִּשְׁבִיל תִּינוֹקוֹת, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁנוּ. וְעֶרֶב יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּאֲכִילוּ אֶת בְּנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: It was taught They said about Rabbi Akiva in his days he never said time had come to arise in the study hall. except for the eves of Passover and the eve of Yom Kippur, On the eve of Passover, on account of children, so that they would not sleep And the eve of Yom Kippur, so that would feed their children.
llm_translation: It was taught: They said about Rabbi Akiva: From his days he did not say, "It is time to stand in the study hall," except on the eve of Passover and on the eve of Yom Kippur. On the eve of Passover - for the sake of the children, so that they do not fall asleep. And on the eve of Yom Kippur - so that they may feed their children.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְשַׂמֵּחַ בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ בָּרֶגֶל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׂמַחְתָּ בְּחַגֶּךָ״. בַּמֶּה מְשַׂמְּחָם — בְּיַיִן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A man is obligated to gladden his children and the members of his household on a Festival, as it is stated: “And you shall rejoice on your Festival, With what one make them rejoice? With wine.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A person is obligated to rejoice with his children and the members of his household on a festival, as it is stated: "And you shall rejoice on your festival." With what does one make them rejoice? With wine.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲנָשִׁים בָּרָאוּי לָהֶם, וְנָשִׁים בָּרָאוּי לָהֶן. אֲנָשִׁים בָּרָאוּי לָהֶם — בְּיַיִן. וְנָשִׁים בְּמַאי? תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּבָבֶל — בְּבִגְדֵי צִבְעוֹנִין, בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — בְּבִגְדֵי פִּשְׁתָּן מְגוֹהָצִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: men with what is fit for them and women with what is fit for them. Men with what is fit for them, with wine. And women, with what Rav Yosef teaches: in Babylonia with colored clothes in Eretz Yisrael with pressed linen clothes
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Men were created for themselves, and women were created for themselves. Men were created for themselves - with wine. And women with what? Rav Yosef taught: In Babylonia - with colored garments, in the Land of Israel - with fine linen garments.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים אֵין שִׂמְחָה אֶלָּא בְּבָשָׂר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְזָבַחְתָּ שְׁלָמִים וְאָכַלְתָּ שָּׁם וְשָׂמַחְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״, וְעַכְשָׁיו שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, אֵין שִׂמְחָה אֶלָּא בְּיַיִן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיַיִן יְשַׂמַּח לְבַב אֱנוֹשׁ״.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: When the Temple is standing, rejoicing is only through meat, as it is stated: “And you shall sacrifice peace-offerings and you shall eat there and you shall rejoice before the Lord your God” And now that the Temple is not standing rejoicing only by wine, as it is stated: “And wine that gladdens the heart of man”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: When the Temple is standing, there is no joy except with meat, as it is stated: "And you shall sacrifice peace offerings and eat there, and you shall rejoice before the Lord your God." But now that the Temple is not standing, there is no joy except with wine, as it is stated: "And wine gladdens the heart of man."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: קִסְתָּא דְמוּרְיְסָא דַּהֲוָה בְּצִיפּוֹרִי הִיא הֲוָת כְּמִין לוּגָּא דְּמַקְדְּשָׁא, וּבָהּ מְשַׁעֲרִין רְבִיעִית שֶׁל פֶּסַח. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תְּמָנְיָיתָא קַדְמָיְיתָא דַּהֲוָה בִּטְבֶרְיָא הֲוָת יַתִּירָה עַל דָּא רִיבְעָא, וּבָהּ מְשַׁעֲרִין רְבִיעִית שֶׁל פֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: The vessel brine [ moraysa ] that was in Tzippori was the same as the log in the Temple, and with it measure the quarter of Passover. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The old eighth that was in Tiberias was greater than this by quarter and with it we measure quarter of Passover.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: The chest of Muraysa that was in Tzipori was like a type of a luga of the Sanctuary, and in it they would measure the fourth of a log for the Pesach offering. Rabbi Yochanan said: The eighteenth chest that was in Tiverya was greater than that by a quarter, and in it they would measure the fourth of a log for the Pesach offering.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רְבִיעִית שֶׁל תּוֹרָה אֶצְבָּעַיִם עַל אֶצְבָּעַיִם בְּרוּם אֶצְבָּעַיִם וַחֲצִי אֶצְבַּע וְחוֹמֶשׁ אֶצְבַּע. כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם אֶת כָּל בְּשָׂרוֹ״ — שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא דָּבָר חוֹצֵץ בֵּין בְּשָׂרוֹ לַמַּיִם. ״בַּמַּיִם״ — בְּמֵי מִקְוֶה. ״אֶת כׇּל בְּשָׂרוֹ״ — מַיִם שֶׁכׇּל גּוּפוֹ עוֹלֶה בָּהֶן, וְכַמָּה הֵן?
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The quarter of the Torah is two fingerbreadths by two fingerbreadths by the height of two fingerbreadths and one half fingerbreadth and one-fifth of a fingerbreadth. as it was taught “And he shall bathe all his flesh in the water” that there should be nothing interposing between one’s flesh the water. “in the water” in the water of a ritual bath. “all his flesh” water that his whole body can enter And how much is that?
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The fourth of the Torah, two fingers on two fingers, in the height of two fingers, and half a finger, and a fifth of a finger. As it was taught: "And he shall wash his flesh with water" — that nothing should separate between his flesh and the water. "With water" — with the waters of a mikveh. "His flesh" — water that his entire body can be immersed in, and how much is that?

hebrew_text: אַמָּה עַל אַמָּה בְּרוּם שָׁלֹשׁ אַמּוֹת, וְשִׁיעֲרוּ חֲכָמִים שִׁיעוּר מֵי מִקְוֶה אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה.
human_translation: A cubit, by a cubit, by a height of three cubits. And the Sages measured measure the water for a ritual bath forty se’a .
llm_translation: Cubit upon cubit in height three cubits, and the Sages estimated the measure of the water of a mikveh to be forty se'ah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אָמַר לִי רָבִין בַּר חִינָּנָא, שׁוּלְחָן שֶׁל מִקְדָּשׁ — שֶׁל פְּרָקִים הֲוָה, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ הַדּוֹקֵי הֲוָה מִיהַדַּק, אַמְּתָא בְּאַמְּתָא הֵיכִי מַטְבְּלֵיהּ?!
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Ravin bar Ḥinnana said to me: The table of the Temple, was parts. For if it should enter your mind was firmly connected how could immerse a cubit in a cubit?
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Ravin bar Chinana told me, the table of the Temple - was of planks, for if it enters your mind to say it was of solid wood, how could they immerse it cubit by cubit?!

hebrew_text: מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּילְמָא בְּיָם שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלֹמֹה הֲוָה מַטְבֵּיל לֵיהּ. דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: יָם שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלֹמֹה מַחֲזִיק מֵאָה וַחֲמִשִּׁים מִקְוֵה טׇהֳרָה.
human_translation: What is the difficulty? Perhaps would immerse it in the sea that Solomon built, As Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: The sea that Solomon built contained one hundred and fifty ritual purification baths.
llm_translation: What is the question? Perhaps in the sea that Solomon made, he would immerse in it. For Rabbi Chiya taught: The sea that Solomon made holds one hundred and fifty mikvehs of purity.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יִפְחֲתוּ לוֹ מֵאַרְבָּעָה. הֵיכִי מְתַקְּנִי רַבָּנַן מִידֵּי דְּאָתֵי בֵּהּ לִידֵי סַכָּנָה, וְהָתַנְיָא: לֹא יֹאכַל אָדָם תְּרֵי, וְלֹא יִשְׁתֶּה תְּרֵי, וְלֹא יְקַנַּח תְּרֵי, וְלֹא יַעֲשֶׂה צְרָכָיו תְּרֵי?
human_translation: not him less than four How could the Sages establish a matter through which one will come to danger? But wasn’t it taught A person not eat pairs, and he not drink pairs and he not wipe himself with pairs; and he not attend to his needs in pairs.
llm_translation: And they shall not appoint for him less than four. How do the Rabbis rectify it when it comes to a situation of danger? And it was taught: A person should not eat two, and should not drink two, and should not relieve himself two, and should not perform his needs two?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לֵיל שִׁמּוּרִים״ — לַיִל הַמְשׁוּמָּר וּבָא מִן הַמַּזִּיקִין.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said the verse said: “It was a night of watching is a night that remains guarded from harmful spirits
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, the verse says: "Leil Shimmurim" - a guarded night, and comes from the damaging forces.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה מִצְטָרֵף לְטוֹבָה, וְאֵינוֹ מִצְטָרֵף לְרָעָה. רָבִינָא אָמַר: אַרְבָּעָה כָּסֵי תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן דֶּרֶךְ חֵירוּת, כׇּל חַד וְחַד
human_translation: Rava said The cup of blessing it combines for the good, and it does not combine for the bad. Ravina said: The Sages instituted four cups, in a manner freedom. each and every one
llm_translation: Rava said: A cup of blessing combines with goodness, and does not combine with evil. Ravina said: The Sages established four cups in a manner of freedom, each one individually.

hebrew_text: מִצְוָה בְּאַפֵּי נַפְשַׁהּ הוּא.
human_translation: is a distinct mitzva
llm_translation: Commandment in the nose of herself he is.

hebrew_text: ״לֹא יַעֲשֶׂה צְרָכָיו תְּרֵי״, אַמַּאי? נִמְלָךְ הוּא! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: לֹא יֹאכַל תְּרֵי וְיִשְׁתֶּה תְּרֵי, וְלֹא יַעֲשֶׂה צְרָכָיו אֲפִילּוּ פַּעַם אַחַת — דִּילְמָא חָלֵישׁ וּמִיתְּרַע.
human_translation: one not attend to his needs in pairs. Why he has changed his mind? Abaye said: This is is saying, One not eat in pairs nor drink in pairs, and he not attend to his needs even once, lest he is weakened and will be harmed
llm_translation: "He shall not do his needs twice," why? Perhaps he is sick! Abaye said, this is what he meant: He shall not eat twice and drink twice, and he shall not do his needs even once - lest he become weak and suffer harm."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שׁוֹתֶה כִּפְלַיִם — דָּמוֹ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁלֹּא רָאָה פְּנֵי הַשּׁוּק, אֲבָל רָאָה פְּנֵי הַשּׁוּק — הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חֲזֵינָא לֵיהּ לְרַב חֲנַנְיָא בַּר בִּיבִי, דְּאַכֹּל כָּסָא הֲוָה נָפֵיק וְחָזֵי אַפֵּי שׁוּקָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught drinks in pairs his blood is upon his head, Rav Yehuda said: When When one did not view the marketplace However, if he saw the marketplace he has permission Rav Ashi said: I saw Rav Ḥananya bar Beivai Upon each cup, he would leave and view the marketplace.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One who drinks two cups - his blood is on his head. Rav Yehudah said: When? When he has not seen the face of the marketplace, but if he has seen the face of the marketplace - the responsibility is in his hands. Rav Ashe said: I saw Rav Chananya bar Bevai eating a cup, and he would look at the corners of the marketplace.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא לָצֵאת לַדֶּרֶךְ, אֲבָל בְּבֵיתוֹ — לָא. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: וּלְיָשֵׁן — כְּלָצֵאת לַדֶּרֶךְ דָּמֵי. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וְלָצֵאת לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא — כְּלָצֵאת לַדֶּרֶךְ דָּמֵי. וּבְבֵיתוֹ לָא? וְהָא רָבָא מָנֵי כְּשׁוּרֵי.
human_translation: And we said only to set out on the road but in his home no Rabbi Zeira said: And to sleep is comparable to setting out on the road. Rav Pappa said: And going to the bathroom is comparable to setting out on the road. And in his home, no But Rava would count the beams
llm_translation: We did not say except for going out on the road, but in his house - no. Rabbi Zeira said: And to sleep - it is like going out on the road. Rav Papa said: And to go to the bathroom - it is like going out on the road. But in his house? But Rava supports the opinion of the Persians.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי, כִּי שָׁתֵי חַד כָּסָא, מְנַקֵּיט לֵיהּ אִימֵּיהּ תְּרֵי כָסֵי בִּתְרֵי יְדֵיהּ. וְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, כִּי הֲוָה שָׁתֵי תְּרֵי כָסֵי, מְנַקֵּיט לֵיהּ שַׁמָּעֵיהּ חַד כָּסָא, חַד כָּסָא — מְנַקֵּיט לֵיהּ תְּרֵי כָסֵי בִּתְרֵי יְדֵיהּ! אָדָם חָשׁוּב שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: And Abaye, when he would drink one cup, his mother would place two cups in his two hands And when Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak would drink two cups, his attendant would place one cup in his hand, one cup, place two cups in his two hands. An important person is different.
llm_translation: And Abbaye, when he would drink a cup of wine, would hold it with two hands. And Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak, when he would drink two cups of wine, would hold one cup in one hand, one cup in one hand — he would hold two cups with two hands! A distinguished person is different.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: עֲשָׂרָה כּוֹסוֹת אֵין בָּהֶם מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. עוּלָּא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: עֲשָׂרָה כּוֹסוֹת תִּיקְּנוּ חֲכָמִים בְּבֵית הָאֵבֶל, וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ עֲשָׂרָה כּוֹסוֹת יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת, הֵיכִי קָיְימִי רַבָּנַן וְתַקִּנוּ מִילְּתָא דְּאָתֵי לִידֵי סַכָּנָה?! אֲבָל תְּמָנְיָא יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת.
human_translation: Ulla said: Ten cups contain no element of pairs. Ulla in accordance with his reasoning as Ulla said, and some say it was taught in a baraita : The Sages instituted ten cups in the house of a mourner And if it could enter your mind ten cups do contain the element of pairs, how could the Sages arise and institute something that bring a person to danger? However, eight cups do contain the element of pairs.
llm_translation: Ula said: Ten cups do not have pairs. Ula according to his reasoning, for Ula said, and it was taught in a baraita: The Sages instituted ten cups in the house of mourning, and if according to your opinion there are pairs in ten cups, how can the Rabbis establish a matter that could lead to danger?! But in the case of eight, there are pairs.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: ״שָׁלוֹם״, לְטוֹבָה — מִצְטָרֵף, לְרָעָה — לֹא מִצְטָרֵף. אֲבָל שִׁיתָּא יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna both say shalom , combines for the good does not combine for the bad. However, six cups do contain the element of pairs.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna both said: "Peace," for good - combines, for evil - does not combine. But there is in them a certain aspect of pairs.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: ״וִיחֻנֶּךָּ״, לְטוֹבָה — מִצְטָרֵף. לְרָעָה — לֹא מִצְטָרֵף. אֲבָל אַרְבָּעָה יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say viḥuneka combines for the good does not combine for the bad. However, four cups do contain the element of pairs.
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: "And He will bless you," for good - it is combined. For evil - it is not combined. But there are four in them because of pairs.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: ״וְיִשְׁמְרֶךָ״, לְטוֹבָה — מִצְטָרֵף, לְרָעָה — לֹא מִצְטָרֵף.
human_translation: Abaye and Rava both say veyishmerekha , It combines for the good does not combine for the bad.
llm_translation: Abaye and Rava both said: "And He will guard you," for good - combines, for evil - does not combine.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּרָבָא אַפְּקִינְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן בְּאַרְבָּעָה כּוֹסוֹת, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיתַּזַּק רָבָא בַּר לֵיוַאי, לָא חַשׁ לַהּ לְמִילְּתָא, דְּאָמַר: הָהוּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאוֹתְבַן בְּפִירְקָא הֲוָה.
human_translation: And Rava follows his reasoning as Rava the Sages to leave four cups Although Rava bar Livai was injured was not concerned the matter as he said: That because challenged me during the lecture.
llm_translation: And Rava went according to his reasoning, for Rava brought it before the Rabbis with four cups, even though Rava bar Levai was present, he did not pay attention to the matter, as he said: "That one was occupied with a matter in the marketplace."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, אָמַר לִי יוֹסֵף שֵׁידָא: אַשְׁמְדַאי מַלְכָּא דְשֵׁידֵי — מְמוּנֶּה הוּא אַכּוּלְּהוּ זוּגֵי, וּמַלְכָּא לָא אִיקְּרִי מַזִּיק. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי לַהּ לְהַאי גִּיסָא: אַדְּרַבָּה, מַלְכָּא [רַתְחָנָא הוּא], מַאי דְּבָעֵי עָבֵיד, שֶׁהַמֶּלֶךְ פּוֹרֵץ גָּדֵר לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ דֶּרֶךְ וְאֵין מוֹחִין בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Yosef the Demon said to me: Ashmedai, the king of the demons, is appointed over all pairs, and a king is not called a harmful spirit. Some say in this manner: On the contrary, he is an angry king does what he wants, that a king breach the fence in order to form a path for himself, and none protest his
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, Yosef Sheida told me: Ashmedai, the king of the demons, is appointed to eat in pairs, and the king does not call him a harmful creature. Some say to him in this matter: Adrabba, the king is a fierce one, what does he want to do, that the king breaks down barriers to make a path for him and there is no one to stop him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, אָמַר לִי יוֹסֵף שֵׁידָא: בִּתְרֵי קָטְלִינַן, בְּאַרְבְּעָה לָא קָטְלִינַן, בְּאַרְבְּעָה מַזְּקִינַן. בִּתְרֵי, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד. בְּאַרְבְּעָה, בְּמֵזִיד — אִין, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — לָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Yosef the Demon said to me: two we kill four, we do not kill four, we harm With two, whether unwittingly or intentionally, With four, intentionally, yes, unwittingly, no,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, Yosef Sheida told me: With two witnesses we execute, with four we do not execute; with four we establish someone as elderly. With two, whether unintentional or intentional. With four, intentional — no, unintentional — yes.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִישְׁתְּלִי וְאִיקְּרִי וּנְפַק, מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? לִינְקוֹט זַקְפָּא דִידֵיהּ דְּיַמִּינֵיהּ בִּידָא דִשְׂמָאלֵיהּ וְזַקְפָּא דִשְׂמָאלֵיהּ בִּידָא דְיַמִּינֵיהּ, וְנֵימָא הָכִי: ״אַתּוּן וַאֲנָא — הָא תְּלָתָא״. וְאִי שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: ״אַתּוּן וַאֲנָא — הָא אַרְבְּעָה״, נֵימָא לֵיהּ: ״אַתּוּן וַאֲנָא — הָא חַמְשָׁה״. וְאִי שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: ״אַתּוּן וַאֲנָא — הָא שִׁיתָּא״, נֵימָא לֵיהּ: ״אַתּוּן וַאֲנָא — הָא שִׁבְעָה״. הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא עַד מְאָה וְחַד, וּפְקַע שֵׁידָא.
human_translation: And if one forgets and it happens that he goes outside what is his solution? take his right thumb in his left hand, and his left thumb in his right hand, and say as follows: You, and I are three, And if he hears that says: You and I are four, say to it: You and I are five. And if he hears it say: You and I are six, say to it: You and I are seven. there was an incident until a hundred and one, and the demon burst
llm_translation: If one untwists and reads and goes out, what is its benefit? To take the right foot of his right hand and the left foot of his left hand, and the left foot of his left hand in his right hand, and it should be said thus: "You and I - here are three." And if he hears that he said: "You and I - here are four," it should be said to him: "You and I - here are five." And if he hears that he said: "You and I - here are six," it should be said to him: "You and I - here are seven." The matter was until one hundred and one, and the demon departed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: אֲמַרָה לִי רֵישָׁתִינְהִי דְּנָשִׁים כַּשְׁפָנִיּוֹת: הַאי מַאן דְּפָגַע בְּהוּ בְּנָשִׁים כַּשְׁפָנִיּוֹת, נֵימָא הָכִי: ״חָרֵי חַמִּימֵי בְּדִיקּוּלָא בַּזְיָיא לְפוּמַּיְיכוּ נְשֵׁי דְּחָרָשַׁיָּיא, קָרַח קָרְחַיְיכִי, פָּרַח פָּרְחַיְיכִי,
human_translation: Ameimar said: The chief of witches said to me: One who encounters witches say this Hot feces in torn date baskets in your mouth, witches; may your hairs fall out your crumbs, should scatter
llm_translation: אָמַר - said אַמֵּימָר - Amemar (name of Talmudic sage) אֲמַרָה - said to me לִי - to me רֵישָׁתִינְהִי - head of the women דְּנָשִׁים - women כַּשְׁפָנִיּוֹת - like snakes הַאי - this מַאן - who דְּפָגַע - encounters בְּהוּ - in them בְּנָשִׁים - women כַּשְׁפָנִיּוֹת - like snakes נֵימָא - let him say הָכִי - thus ״חָרֵי - hot coals חַמִּימֵי - of the blacksmith בְּדִיקּוּלָא - in a furnace בַזְיָיא - to the mouth לְפוּמַּיְיכוּ - of your mouth נְשֵׁי - women דְּחָרָשַׁיָּיא - of the weavers קָרַח - bald קָרְחַיְיכִי - your baldness פָּרַח - bloom פָּרְחַיְיכִי - your bloom

hebrew_text: אִיבַּדּוּר תַּבְלוּנַיְיכִי, פָּרְחָא זִיקָא לְמוֹרִיקָא חַדְתָּא דְּנָקְטִיתוּ נָשִׁים כַּשְׁפָנִיּוֹת, אַדְּחַנַּנִּי וְחַנַּנְכִי לָא אֲתֵיתִי לְגוֹ, הַשְׁתָּא דַּאֲתֵיתִי לְגוֹ — קַרְחַנְנִי וַחֲנַנְכִי״.
human_translation: your spices, should scatter; the wind should carry away the fresh saffron that you witches hold As long as I was shown favor and you showed me favor, I did not come here. Now that I have come here, your favor toward me has cooled and you should find favor.
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "They adorned themselves, the daughters of nobles, with a new type of jewelry that the women of the East had brought. Adchanani and Channankhi did not come to me. Now that they have come to me - they have adorned me."

hebrew_text: בְּמַעְרְבָא לָא קָפְדִי אַזּוּגֵי. רַב דִּימִי מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא קָפֵיד אֲפִילּוּ אַרוּשְׁמָא דְחָבִיתָא. הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא וּפְקַע חָבִיתָא. כְּלָלָא דְמִילְּתָא, כׇּל דְּקָפֵיד — קָפְדִי בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וּדְלָא קָפֵיד — לָא קָפְדִי בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וּמִיהוּ לְמֵיחַשׁ מִיבְּעֵי.
human_translation: in the West, they were not particular with regard to pairs. Rav Dimi from Neharde’a was particular even with regard to the signs on a barrel; There was an incident and the barrel burst. The rule of the matter all who are particular are particular with him; and one is not particular, they are not particular with him. However, one is required to be concerned
llm_translation: In the west, they do not care about the pairing. Rav Dimi from Nehardea is particular even about the strap of a barrel. There was an incident where a barrel broke. In general, regarding matters, whoever is particular - is particular in his own case, and whoever is not particular - is not particular in his own case, but one should be concerned about what is required.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: שְׁתֵּי בֵיצִים, וּשְׁתֵּי אֱגוֹזִין, שְׁתֵּי קִישּׁוּאִין, וְדָבָר אַחֵר — הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי. וּמִסְתַּפְּקָא לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן מַאי נִיהוּ דָּבָר אַחֵר, וּגְזוּר רַבָּנַן בְּכוּלְּהוּ זוּגֵי מִשּׁוּם דָּבָר אַחֵר.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: two eggs, two nuts, two cucumbers, and another matter, a halakha to Moses from Sinai But the Sages are uncertain what the other matter is, and the Sages decreed that all pairs due to other matter.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: Two eggs, and two nuts, two gourds, and another matter - a halakha from Moses at Sinai. The Rabbis were in doubt about what the other matter was, and the Rabbis decreed in all of them pairs because of the other matter.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דַּאֲמַרַן עֲשָׂרָה, תְּמָנְיָא, שִׁיתָּא, אַרְבְּעָה אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגֵי, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן מַזִּיקִין. אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן כְּשָׁפִים — אֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא נָמֵי חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: And that which we said ten, eight, six, four do not with pairs, we said only with regard to harmful spirits. However, with regard to witchcraft, we are concerned even with regard to a greater
llm_translation: And this that we said ten, eight, six, four, they do not have the status of pairs, we only said this in regards to damages. But in regards to witchcraft, even two we are concerned.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּגָרְשַׁהּ לִדְבֵיתְהוּ. (אֲזִיל) אִינַּסְבָה לְחַנְוָאָה. כׇּל יוֹמָא הֲוָה אָזֵיל וְשָׁתֵי חַמְרָא. הֲוָה קָא עָבְדָא לֵיהּ כְּשָׁפִים וְלָא קָא מַהְנְיָא לַהּ בֵּיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דַּהֲוָה מִזְדְּהַר בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּזוּגָא.
human_translation: like that a certain man who divorced his wife. She went and married a shopkeeper Every day, would go and drink wine would perform witchcraft upon him, and it would not be effective for her him because he was careful with regard to pairs.
llm_translation: The case of that man who divorced his wife. (He went) and married a wine-seller. Every day he would go and drink wine. He would perform sorcery for her, but it did not benefit her, because he was cautious with himself in the mixture.

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד אִשְׁתִּי טוּבָא, וְלָא הֲוָה יָדַע כַּמָּה שָׁתֵי. עַד שִׁיתְּסַר הֲוָה צְיִיל וְאִיזְדְּהַר בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ לָא הֲוָה צְיִיל וְלָא אִיזְדְּהַר בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ, אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ בְּזוּגָא. כִּי הֲוָה אָזֵיל, גָּס בֵּיהּ הָהוּא טַיָּיעָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּבְרָא קְטִילָא הוּא דְּאָזֵיל הָכָא. אָזֵיל חַבְּקֵיהּ לְדִיקְלָא, צְוַוח דִּיקְלָא וּפְקַע הוּא.
human_translation: One day he drank a lot, and he did not know how much he drank. Until sixteen he was lucid and was careful with regard to himself, From here onward he was not lucid and was not careful to himself, and she caused him to leave a pair, As he walked, a certain Arab met him and, said to him: It is a dead man who walks here. He went and hugged a palm tree the palm tree dried out and he burst.
llm_translation: One day his wife was good, and he did not know how much she drank. Until she became drunk, she was modest and careful with herself. From then on, she was neither modest nor careful with herself, she would expose herself in public. When he would go out, that prosecutor would come, he said to him: "It is a dangerous man who goes out here." He went and embraced a palm tree, the palm tree screamed and he fell.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עַוִּירָא: קְעָרוֹת וְכִכָּרוֹת אֵין בָּהֶם מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. כְּלָלָא דְּמִילְּתָא: כׇּל שֶׁגְּמָרוֹ בִּידֵי אָדָם — אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. גְּמָרוֹ בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם — בְּמִילֵּי מִינֵי דְמֵיכַל חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: Rav Avira said: Plates and loaves do not contain the element of pairs. The rule of the matter anything was completed by people, they do not contain the element of pairs. was completed by Heaven, with regard to types of food, we are concerned.
llm_translation: Rav Avira said: Bowls and loaves do not have the status of pairs. General principle: Anything completed by the hands of man - does not have the status of pairs. Completed by the hands of Heaven - we are concerned about various types of blood.

hebrew_text: חֲנוּת — אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. נִמְלָךְ — אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. אוֹרֵחַ — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. אִשָּׁה — אֵין בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. וְאִי אִשָּׁה חֲשׁוּבָה, חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: a store does not contain the element of pairs. changed one’s mind does not contain the element of pairs, a guest does not contain the element of pairs, a woman does not contain the element of pairs, But if an important woman, we are concerned.
llm_translation: Merchant - there is no obligation of pairs in it. Tax collector - there is no obligation of pairs in it. Traveler - there is no obligation of pairs in him. Woman - there is no obligation of pairs in her. And if she is a considered woman, we are concerned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אִיסְפָּרָגוֹס — מִצְטָרֵף לְטוֹבָה, וְאֵין מִצְטָרֵף לְרָעָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Isparegus , combines for the good, and does not combine for the bad,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥinnana, son of Rabbi Yehoshua, said: Isparagos - joins with good, and does not join with evil.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: זוּגֵי — לְחוּמְרָא. וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: זוּגֵי — לְקוּלָּא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תְּרֵי דְחַמְרָא וְחַד דְּשִׁיכְרָא — לָא מִצְטָרֵף, תְּרֵי דְשִׁיכְרָא וְחַד דְּחַמְרָא — מִצְטָרֵף.
human_translation: Ravina said in the name of Rava: pairs, stringent And say pairs lenient Rav Yosef said: Two of wine and one of beer do not combine; two of beer and one of wine do combine.
llm_translation: Ravina said in the name of Rava: "Zugei - for stringency." And some say: "Zugei - for leniency." Rav Yosef said: "Two cups of wine and one of beer - do not combine; two cups of beer and one of wine - do combine."

hebrew_text: וְסִימָנָיךְ, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל הַמְחוּבָּר לוֹ מִן הֶחָמוּר מִמֶּנּוּ — טָמֵא, מִן הַקַּל מִמֶּנּוּ — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: And your mnemonic This is the rule: anything attached to is more stringent than is ritually impure; is more lenient than it, is ritually pure.
llm_translation: And your sign, this is the principle: anyone connected to him from the more severe - impure, from the lighter - pure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: תְּרֵי קַמֵּי תַּכָּא וְחַד אַתַּכָּא — מִצְטָרְפִי. חַד מִקַּמֵּי תַּכָּא וּתְרֵי אַתַּכָּא — לֹא מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rav said: two before the table and one over the table they combine, one before the table and two over the table they do not combine;
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Rav: Two vessels in front of one vessel and one vessel in front of two vessels - they combine. One vessel in front of two vessels and two vessels in front of one vessel - they do not combine.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: אַטּוּ אֲנַן לְתַקּוֹנֵי תַּכָּא קָא בָּעֵינַן? לְתַקּוֹנֵי גַּבְרָא בָּעֵינַן, וְגַבְרָא קָא מִיתְּקַן וְקָאֵי.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiya strongly objects to this Is that to say that we need to resolve the table? We need to resolve the person, and the person is resolved.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Mesharshaya objects to her: Do we need to fix the container? We need to fix the contents, and when the contents are fixed, the container is also fixed and stands.

hebrew_text: (אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא): דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא תְּרֵי אַתַּכָּא וְחַד לְבָתַר תַּכָּא — לָא מִצְטָרְפִי. כִּי הַהִיא מַעֲשֶׂה דְּרַבָּה בַּר נַחְמָנִי.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Mesharshiya said: Everyone agrees two over the table and one after the table they do not combine. like that incident Rabba bar Naḥmani,
llm_translation: (Instead, Rav Mesharshya said): In all the world, two pitchers and one spout - they do not combine. This is like the incident with Rabbah bar Nachmani.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל הַמָּזוּג — מִצְטָרֵף,
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Any diluted combines
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Anyone who is mixed - joins together.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִן הַמַּיִם. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מַיִם. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא חַמִּימֵי לְגוֹ קָרִירֵי, וְקָרִירֵי לְגוֹ חַמִּימֵי. אֲבָל חַמִּימֵי לְגוֹ חַמִּימֵי, וְקָרִירֵי לְגוֹ קָרִירֵי — לָא.
human_translation: except for water. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even water Rav Pappa said: We said this statement only hot into cold and cold into hot water. However, hot into hot or cold into cold no,
llm_translation: Outside of the water. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even water. Rav Papa said: We did not say this, rather warm to cold and cold to warm. But warm to warm and cold to cold - no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים הָעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָן דָּמוֹ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ וּמִתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ. אֵלּוּ הֵן: הַנִּפְנֶה בֵּין דֶּקֶל לְכוֹתֶל, וְהָעוֹבֵר בֵּין שְׁנֵי דְקָלִים, וְהַשּׁוֹתֶה מַיִם שְׁאוּלִין, וְהָעוֹבֵר עַל מַיִם שְׁפוּכִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁפָכַתּוּ אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: four matters. The one who performs them, his blood is upon his head, and liable for his own life, One who relieves himself between a palm tree and a wall, one who passes between two palm trees, one who drinks borrowed water, and one who passes over spilled water, even if his wife poured it out in front of him.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Four things one who does them, his blood is upon his own head. These are they: One who passes between a palm tree and a wall, and one who passes between two palm trees, and one who drinks Saulin water, and one who passes over spilled water, even if his wife spilled it before him.

hebrew_text: הַנִּפְנֶה בֵּין דֶּקֶל לְכוֹתֶל — לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, אֲבָל אִית לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וְכִי לֵית לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵיכָּא דִּירְכָּא אַחֲרִינָא, אֲבָל אִיכָּא דִּירְכָּא אַחֲרִינָא — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: one who relieves himself between a palm tree and a wall, we said only when there are not four cubits However, there are four cubits, we have no with it. And when there are not four cubits, we said only when have no other route However, have another route, we have no with it.
llm_translation: The one who turns between a palm tree and a wall - we only said this when there are not four cubits, but if there are four cubits - we do not have a concern. And if there are not four cubits, we only said this when there is not another courtyard, but if there is another courtyard - we do not have a concern.

hebrew_text: וְהָעוֹבֵר בֵּין שְׁנֵי דְקָלִים — לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא פַּסְקִינְהוּ רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, אֲבָל פַּסְקִינְהוּ רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — לֵית לַן בַּהּ. הַשּׁוֹתֶה מַיִם שְׁאוּלִין — לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּשַׁיְילִינְהוּ קָטָן, אֲבָל גָּדוֹל — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: And one who passes between two palm trees, we said only if a public domain does not cross between them. However, a public domain crosses between them, we have no with it, And one who drinks borrowed water, we said only if a minor borrowed it. However, an adult we have no with it.
llm_translation: One who passes between two palm trees - we only said this when he did not separate them in a public domain, but if he separated them in a public domain - we have no concern. One who drinks water in sips - we only said this when he drinks in small sips, but if he drinks in large gulps - we have no concern.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ שַׁיְילִינְהוּ קָטָן נָמֵי — לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בַּשָּׂדֶה, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי, אֲבָל בָּעִיר, דִּשְׁכִיחִי — לֵית לַן בָּהּ. וַאֲפִילּוּ בַּשָּׂדֶה נָמֵי — לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא מַיָּא, אֲבָל חַמְרָא וְשִׁיכְרָא — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: And even a minor borrowed it, we said only in a field, where is not found. However, in a city, where can be found, we have no with it. And even in a field, we said only water; however, wine and beer, we have no with it.
llm_translation: And even if they would ask him when he is a minor - we only said this regarding the field, where it is not common, but in the city, where it is common - we do not have a concern with it. And even in the field, we only said this regarding water, but wine and beer - we do not have a concern with them.

hebrew_text: וְהָעוֹבֵר עַל מַיִם שְׁפוּכִין — לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא אַפְסְקִינְהוּ בְּעַפְרָא וְלָא תַּף בְּהוּ רוּקָּא, אֲבָל אַפְסְקִינְהוּ אוֹ תַּף בְּהוּ רוּקָּא — לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא עֲבַר עֲלַיְיהוּ שִׁימְשָׁא וְלָא עֲבַר עֲלַיְיהוּ שִׁיתִּין נִיגְרֵי, אֲבָל עֲבַר עֲלַיְיהוּ שִׁימְשָׁא וַעֲבַר עֲלַיְיהוּ שִׁיתִּין נִיגְרֵי — לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא רְכִיב חֲמָרָא וְלָא סָיֵים מְסָנֵי, אֲבָל רְכִיב חֲמָרָא וְסָיֵים מְסָנֵי — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: And one who passes over spilled water, we said only if no one sprinkled dirt over it and no one spat in it. However, if sprinkled dirt over it or spat in it, we have no with it. And we said only if the sun did not pass over it, and sixty steps have not passed over it. However, the sun passed over it and sixty steps passed over it, we have no with it. And we said only if he was not riding a donkey and not wearing shoes; however, if he was riding a donkey and wearing shoes, we have no with it.
llm_translation: The one who passes over flowing water - we only said that if he did not break it with dust and did not spit in it, but if he broke it or spat in it - we have no concern. And we only said that if he did not pass over it with shoes and did not pass over it with two wooden planks, but if he passed over it with shoes and passed over it with two wooden planks - we have no concern. And we only said that if he did not ride on a donkey and did not finish a meal, but if he rode on a donkey and finished a meal - we have no concern.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא לְמֵיחַשׁ לִכְשָׁפִים, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵיחַשׁ לִכְשָׁפִים, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא כׇּל הָנֵי — חָיְישִׁינַן. (וְהָהוּא) גַּבְרָא דִּרְכִיב חֲמָרָא וְסָיֵים מְסָנֵי, וּגְמוּד מְסָאנֵיהּ וּצְווֹ כַּרְעֵיהּ.
human_translation: And this where there is no concern for witchcraft, However, where there is concern for witchcraft, even if all of these are we are concerned. And a certain man who was riding a donkey and wearing shoes. and his shoes shrank and his feet shriveled up.
llm_translation: And these are the matters: where there is no concern for sorcery, but where there is concern for sorcery, even though all these - we are cautious. (And that) man who rode a donkey and finished Mishnah, and wrapped himself and tied his legs.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה אֵין מְמַצְּעִין וְלֹא מִתְמַצְּעִין. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: הַכֶּלֶב וְהַדֶּקֶל וְהָאִשָּׁה. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַחֲזִיר, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַנָּחָשׁ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Three not pass between not walk between A dog, a palm tree, and a woman. And some say: Also a pig. And some say: Also a snake.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three do not interpose and are not interposed. And they are: the dog, the palm tree, and the woman. And some say: also the pig, and some say: also the snake.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מְמַצְּעִין מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: נִפְתַּח בְּ״אֵל״ וְנַפְסֵיק בְּ״אֵל״.
human_translation: And if they pass between them, what is the remedy Rav Pappa said: He begin with God and conclude with God.
llm_translation: And if they are in the middle, what is the remedy? Rav Papa said: It begins with "El" and ends with "El."

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, נִפְתַּח בְּ״לֹא״ וְנַפְסֵיק בְּ״לֹא״.
human_translation: Alternatively, he open lo , and conclude lo :
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "אִי נָמֵי, נִפְתַּח בְּ״לֹא״ וְנַפְסֵיק בְּ״לֹא״." English translation: "If so, it begins with 'lo' and ends with 'lo'."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי בֵּי תְרֵי דְּמַצַּעָא לְהוּ אִשָּׁה נִדָּה, אִם תְּחִלַּת נִדָּתָהּ הִיא — הוֹרֶגֶת אֶחָד מֵהֶן, אִם סוֹף נִדָּתָהּ הִיא — מְרִיבָה עוֹשָׂה בֵּינֵיהֶן. מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? נִפְתַּח בְּ״אֵל״ וְנַפְסֵיק בְּ״אֵל״.
human_translation: these two between whom a menstruating woman passes, if she is at the beginning of her menstruation she kills one of them, If she is the end of her menstruation causes a fight between them. What is his remedy? He open with God and he conclude with God,
llm_translation: These are the words of the House of Shammai: If a menstruating woman is found between two men, if she is at the beginning of her menstrual cycle, she causes one of them to die; if she is at the end of her menstrual cycle, she causes strife between them. What is the reason for this? It is opened with "El" and concluded with "El."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי תְּרֵי נְשֵׁי דְּיָתְבָן בְּפָרָשַׁת דְּרָכִים, חֲדָא בְּהַאי גִּיסָא דִּשְׁבִילָא, וַחֲדָא בְּאִידַּךְ גִּיסָא, וּמְכַוְּונָן אַפַּיְיהוּ לַהֲדָדֵי — וַדַּאי בִּכְשָׁפִים עֲסִיקָן. מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? אִי אִיכָּא דִּירְכָּא אַחֲרִינָא — לֵיזִיל בַּהּ. וְאִי לֵיכָּא דִּירְכָּא אַחֲרִינָא, אִי אִיכָּא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ — נִינְקְטוֹ לִידַיְיהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי וְנִיחַלְּפוּ. וְאִי לֵיכָּא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא, נֵימָא הָכִי: ״אָגְרַת אָזְלַת אָסְיָא בְּלוּסְיָא, מִתְקַטְלָא בְּחֵיק קָבָל״.
human_translation: These two women, who are sitting at a crossroads, one on this side of the road and the other on the other side, and they are facing each other, they are certainly engaging in witchcraft. What is remedy If there is another route, he go by it. And if there is no other route, if there is another person with him, they hold hands and switch And if there is no other person with him, he say as follows: Iggeret, Azlat, Asiya, Belusiya are killed by arrows.
llm_translation: These are two women who were sitting in the marketplace of Darakim, one with a certain type of needle from Shevila, and the other with a different type of needle. And they would exchange their needles with each other - surely they were engaged in witchcraft. What is the remedy for this? If there is another alleyway nearby - let them go there. And if there is no other alleyway nearby, if there is another person behind them - they should be taken into their hands together and exchanged. And if there is no other person behind them, it should be said thus: "A letter has gone to Asya in Lusya, it is killed in the lap of Kaval."

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאן דְּפָגַע בְּאִיתְּתָא בְּעִידָּנָא דְּסָלְקָא מִטְּבִילַת מִצְוָה, אִי אִיהוּ קָדֵים וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ — אָחֲדָא לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ רוּחַ זְנוּנִים. אִי אִיהִי קָדְמָה וּמְשַׁמְּשָׁה — אָחֲדָא לַהּ לְדִידַהּ רוּחַ זְנוּנִים. מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? לֵימָא הָכִי: ״שׁוֹפֵךְ בּוּז עַל נְדִיבִים וַיַּתְעֵם בְּתוֹהוּ לֹא דָרֶךְ״.
human_translation: One who meets a woman when she is ascending from the ritual immersion of a mitzva, if he has intercourse first, a spirit of immorality overtakes him; if she has intercourse first, a spirit of immorality overtakes her. What is his remedy? He say this: “He pours contempt upon princes, and causes them to wander in the waste, where there is no way”
llm_translation: The one who encounters a woman at the time of her emergence from the ritual immersion of a mitzvah, if he precedes and engages — one spirit of promiscuity for him. If she precedes and engages — one spirit of promiscuity for her. What is the remedy? Let us say thus: "He pours contempt upon princes and causes them to wander in a pathless waste."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״גַּם כִּי אֵלֵךְ בְּגֵיא צַלְמָוֶת לֹא אִירָא רָע כִּי אַתָּה עִמָּדִי״ — זֶה הַיָּשֵׁן בְּצֵל דֶּקֶל יְחִידִי, וּבְצֵל לְבָנָה. וּבְצֵל דֶּקֶל יְחִידִי — לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא נָפֵיל טוּלָּא דְחַבְרֵיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ, אֲבָל נָפֵל טוּלָּא דְחַבְרֵיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak said: What is written: “Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for You are with me” This is who sleeps in the shadow of a single palm tree, and in the shadow of the moon. And with regard to in the shadow of a single palm tree, we said only if the shadow of another does not fall upon him. However, the shadow of another falls upon him, we have no with it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said, what is the meaning of what is written: "Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for You are with me" — this refers to one who sleeps in the shade of a palm tree alone, and in the shade of the moon. And in the shade of a palm tree alone — we only said this when the palm branch of his companion did not fall above him, but if the palm branch of his companion fell above him — we have no remedy for it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: הַיָּשֵׁן בְּצֵל דֶּקֶל יְחִידִי בֶּחָצֵר, וְהַיָּשֵׁן בְּצֵל לְבָנָה — דָּמוֹ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ, הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי לֵימָא דְּלָא נָפֵל טוּלָּא דְּחַבְרֵיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ, אֲפִילּוּ בַּשָּׂדֶה נָמֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בְּחָצֵר אַף עַל גַּב דְּנָפֵיל טוּלָּא דְּחַבְרֵיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: But that was taught who sleeps in the shadow of a single palm tree in a courtyard and one who sleeps in the shadow of the moon, his blood is upon his head. What are the circumstances? If we say that the shadow of another does not fall on him, also in a field. Rather, one not conclude from courtyard, even if the shadow of another fell on him, learn from it
llm_translation: Rather, this that was taught: One who sleeps in the shade of a palm tree alone in a courtyard, and one who sleeps in the shade of a white fig tree — his blood is upon his head, how so? If you say it is because the dew of his companions did not fall upon him, even in the field it is the same! Rather, this is not the reason: In a courtyard, even though the dew of his companions did not fall upon him, it is the same. This is the conclusion.

hebrew_text: וּבְצִילָּהּ שֶׁל לְבָנָה — לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּמַעְרְבָה, אֲבָל בְּמַדִּינְחֲתָא — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: And to the shadow of the moon, we said only in the west. However, in the east, we have no with it.
llm_translation: In its shadow of the moon - we only said in the west, but in the east - we do not have in it.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאן דְּמִפְּנֵי אַגִּירְדָּא דְּדִיקְלָא — אָחֲדָא לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ רוּחַ פַּלְגָא. וְהַאי מַאן דְּמַצְלֵי רֵישֵׁיהּ אַגִּירְדָּא דְּדִיקְלָא — אָחֲדָא לֵיהּ רוּחַ צְרָדָא. הַאי מַאן דְּפָסְעִי אַדִּיקְלָא, אִי מִיקְּטַל — קְטִיל, אִי אִיעֲקַר — מִיעֲקַר וּמָיֵית. הָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּלָא מַנַּח כַּרְעֵיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ, אֲבָל מַנַּח כַּרְעֵיהּ — עִילָּוֵיהּ לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: One who relieves himself on the stump of a palm tree will be seized by a spirit of sickness, and one who places his head on the stump of a palm tree will be seized by a spirit of a headache is cut down, he will be killed. If is uprooted, he will be uprooted and will die. This applies he does not place his legs upon it; however, he places his legs upon it, we have no with it.
llm_translation: The one who covers the top of a palm tree due to the cold wind - one side of it has a gentle breeze. And the one who uncovers the top of a palm tree due to the hot wind - one side of it has a scorching wind. The one who cuts down a palm tree, if it dies - it is cut down, if it remains alive - it remains alive and thrives. These are matters that do not leave its roots, but if it leaves its roots - we have nothing in it.

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה טוּלֵּי הָוֵי: טוּלָּא דְּדִיקְלָא יְחִידָא, טוּלָּא דְכִנָּדָא, טוּלָּא דְפִרְחָא, טוּלָּא דְזַרְדְּתָא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אַף טוּלָּא דְאַרְבָּא, וְטוּלָּא דַעֲרַבְתָּא. כְּלָלָא דְּמִילְּתָא: כֹּל דִּנְפִישׁ עַנְפֵיהּ — קְשֵׁי טוּלֵּיהּ,
human_translation: are five shadows: The shadow of a single palm tree, the shadow of kanda , the shadow of a caper-bush, and the shadow of sorb Some say: Also the shadow of a ship and the shadow of a willow. The rule of the matter Whatever has many branches, its shadow is dangerous.
llm_translation: Five palm branches: a single palm branch, a branch of a palm tree, a branch of a flower, a branch of a cedar. Some say: also a branch of a willow, and a branch of a myrtle. The general principle: all whose branches are thick - its branches are hard.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל דִּקְשֵׁי סִילְוֵיהּ — קְשֵׁי טוּלֵּיהּ, לְבַר מִכְּרוּ מְשָׁא, אַף עַל גַּב דִּקְשֵׁי סִילְוֵיהּ — לָא קְשֵׁי טוּלֵּיהּ, דַּאֲמַרָה לֵהּ שֵׁידָא לִבְרַהּ: פִּירְחִי נַפְשָׁיךְ מִכְּרוּ מְשָׁא, דְּאִיהוּ הוּא דְּקָטֵיל לַאֲבוּךְ, וְקָטֵיל לְדִידֵיהּ. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חֲזֵינָא לְרַב כָּהֲנָא דְּפָרֵישׁ מִכּוּלְּהוּ טוּלֵּי.
human_translation: And any tree whose wood is hard, its shadow is dangerous, except for kero masa . Although its wood is hard, its shadow is not dangerous, as the demon said to her son: Leave the kero masa alone, as it that that killed your father. And killed Rav Ashi said: I saw that Rav Kahana avoided all of shadows.
llm_translation: "And all who are stubborn in his ways - stubborn in his removal, to the son of his acquaintance a burden, even though he is stubborn in his ways - he is not stubborn in his removal, for she said to him: 'Save your soul from a burden, for he is the one who killed your father, and he will kill me.' Rav Ashe said: I saw Rav Kahana who separated himself from all removals."

hebrew_text: בֵּי פִרְחֵי — רוּחֵי. דְּבֵי זַרְדְּתָא — שֵׁידָא. דְּבֵי אִיגָּרֵי — רִישְׁפֵּי. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לִקְמִיעָא.
human_translation: near the caper-bush ruḥei . near the sorb trees shida . on roofs rishfei . What is practical difference for an amulet
llm_translation: The House of Perachim - the spirits. The House of Zardeta - the demons. The House of Igarei - the heads of fire. What is derived from it? For the sake of the vineyard.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי פִרְחֵי — בְּרִיָּה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ עֵינַיִם. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ — לְגַזּוֹזֵי לַהּ. זִימְנָא חֲדָא הֲוָה אָזֵיל צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן לְאִפְּנוֹיֵי לְבֵי פִרְחֵי, שְׁמַע דְּקָא אָתָא עִילָּוֵיהּ, וְגַזִּי לַהּ. כִּי אָזְלָא, חַבְּקַיהּ לְדִיקְלָא — צְוַוח דִּיקְלָא וּפְקַעָה הִיא.
human_translation: near the caper-bush a creature with no eyes. What is difference to fleeing it. Once a Torah scholar went to relieve himself near a caper-bush. He heard coming and fled from it. When went, it grabbed a palm tree The palm tree dried out and burst.
llm_translation: Houses of Perkhei - a creature that has no eyes. For what purpose does it come out? To gather food for it. One time, it happened that a student went from the study hall to the Houses of Perkhei to visit them. He heard that it was coming up, so he gathered it. When he went, he embraced a palm tree - the palm tree cried out, and it was split.

hebrew_text: פִּרְחָא דְּבֵי זַרְדְּתָא — שֵׁידֵי. הָא זַרְדְּתָא דִּסְמִיכָה לְמָתָא — לָא פָּחֲתָא מִשִּׁיתִּין שֵׁידֵי. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִיכְתַּב לַהּ קְמִיעָא.
human_translation: near the sorb tree sheidei . This sorb that is close to the city no less than sixty demons. What is practical difference for writing an amulet
llm_translation: The flower of the house of Zardeta - almonds. This Zardeta of proximity to a corpse - does not diminish from the sixth degree of impurity almonds. What is derived from it? To write for it a title deed.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא בַּר קַשָּׁא דְּמָתָא דְּאָזֵיל וְקָאֵי גַּבֵּי זַרְדְּתָא, דַּהֲוָה סְמִיךְ לְמָתָא, עַלּוּ בֵּיהּ שִׁיתִּין שֵׁידֵי וְאִיסְתַּכַּן. אֲתָא לְהָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן דְּלָא יְדַע דְּזַרְדְּתָא דְּשִׁיתִּין שֵׁידֵי הִיא, כְּתַב לַהּ קְמִיעַ לַחֲדָא שֵׁידָא. שְׁמַע דְּתָלוּ חִינְגָּא בְּגַוֵּויהּ, וְקָא מְשָׁרוּ הָכִי: סוּדָרֵיהּ דְּמָר כִּי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן, בָּדֵיקְנָא בֵּיהּ בְּמָר דְּלָא יָדַע ״בָּרוּךְ״. אֲתָא הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן דִּידַע דְּזַרְדְּתָא שִׁיתִּין שֵׁידֵי הֲוָה, כְּתַב לַהּ קְמִיעָא דְּשִׁיתִּין שֵׁידֵי, שְׁמַע דְּקָא אָמְרוּ: פַּנּוּ מָנַיְיכוּ מֵהָכָא.
human_translation: A certain ruler of a city walked and stood by a sorb that was near a city. Sixty sheidei came upon him and he was in danger. One of the Sages who did not know that it was a sorb tree of sixty sheidei came and wrote him an amulet for one shida heard that there was a celebration inside and were singing: The scarf of Master is like that of a Torah scholar, we checked the Master and he does not know barukh , one of the Sages, who knew that it was a sorb tree of sixty sheidei , came and wrote an amulet sixty demons. He heard them saying: Clear your items away from here.
llm_translation: That son of a difficult one from the town of Azil went and stood over a bridge, which was close to a town. Six merchants came and settled there. A certain Rabbi who did not know that the bridge where the six merchants settled was, wrote for them a document for one share. He heard that they were celebrating a feast in their town, and he sent to them thus: The arrangement of the Master is like the rock of the Rabbis, examine it with the Master so that he does not know "Baruch." Another Rabbi who knew that the bridge where the six merchants settled was, wrote for them a document for six shares. He heard that they said: Turn your faces away from here.

hebrew_text: קֶטֶב מְרִירִי — תְּרֵי קִטְבֵי הָווּ. חַד מִקַּמֵּי טִיהֲרָא, וְחַד מִבָּתַר טִיהֲרָא. דְּמִקַּמֵּי טִיהֲרָא — ״קֶטֶב מְרִירִי״ שְׁמוֹ, וּמִיחֲזֵי בֵּי כַדָּא דְּכַמְכָּא וְהָדַר בֵּיהּ בַּחְשָׁא. דְּבָתַר טִיהֲרָא — ״קֶטֶב יָשׁוּד צׇהֳרָיִם״ שְׁמוֹ, וּמִיחֲזֵי בֵּי קַרְנָא דְּעִיזָּא, וְהָדַר בֵּיהּ כְּנָפְיָא.
human_translation: ketev meriri , There are two of ketev one before noon and one in the afternoon. that before noon is called ketev meriri , and it appears in a jug of kutaḥ , revolves around inside it. in the afternoon is called ketev yashud tzaharayim and it appears inside the horn of a goat and revolves around inside it like a sifter.
llm_translation: "Ketev Meriri - trei kitvei havu. Chad mikamei tihera, ve'chad mibatara tihera. De'mikamei tihera - 'Ketev Meriri' shmo, u'michazei bei khada de'kamkha ve'hadar bei bachsha. De'batara tihera - 'Ketev Yashud Tzoharayim' shmo, u'michazei bei karna de'izza, ve'hadar bei kenafya."

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל וְאָזֵיל, וְאָזֵיל רַב פָּפָּא מִיַּמִּינֵיהּ וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מִשְּׂמָאלֵיהּ. חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא קֶטֶב מְרִירִי דְּקָא אָתֵי לְאַפֵּיהּ דִּשְׂמָאלֵיהּ. אַהְדְּרֵא לְרַב פָּפָּא לִשְׂמָאלֵיהּ, וּלְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְיַמִּינֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אֲנָא מַאי שְׁנָא דְּלָא חָשֵׁשׁ לִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְּ שַׁעְתָּא קָיְימָא לָךְ.
human_translation: Abaye was coming and walking And Rav Pappa was walking on his right and Rav Huna, son Rav Yehoshua, on his left. saw a certain ketev meriri coming on his left side and he switched Rav Pappa to his left and Rav Huna, son Rav Yehoshua, to his right. Rav Pappa said I, what is different that you were not concerned about me? said to him: The time is in your favor.
llm_translation: Abbaye was walking and going, and Rav Papa was going from his right side and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, was going from his left side. He saw a certain bitter gourd coming towards the nose of Rav Papa from his left side. Rav Papa turned to his left, and to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, to his right. Rav Papa said to him: What difference does it make to me? He said to him: You are standing in the way.

hebrew_text: מֵחַד בְּתַמּוּז עַד שִׁיתְּסַר בֵּיהּ — וַדַּאי שְׁכִיחִי. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — סָפֵק שְׁכִיחִי, סָפֵק לָא שְׁכִיחִי. וּמִשְׁתַּכְחִי בְּטוּלֵּי דְּחַצְבָּא דְּלָא חֲצַב גַּרְמִידָא, וּבְטוּלֵּי דְּצַפְרָא וּפַנְיָא דְּלָא הָוֵי גַּרְמִידָא, וְעִיקָּר בְּטוּלֵּי דְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא.
human_translation: From the first of Tammuz to the sixteenth of certainly found. From here onward uncertain whether they are found or whether they are not found. And they can be found in the shadow of a sea squill that has not grown a cubit, and in the shadow morning and evening when is less than a cubit. And they are mostly in the shadow of a privy.
llm_translation: From the first of Tamuz until the sixteenth of it - certainly common. From here and onwards - it is a doubtful matter whether it is common or not common. And when it is found in the stubble of a cucumber that did not produce a gourd, and in the stubble of a turnip and a radish that did not produce a gourd, the main issue is in the stubble of the beet.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָנֵי תְּלָת מִילֵּי יָהֵיב אַרְבּוֹנָא לִנְהוֹרָא: מַן דְּסָרֵיק רֵישֵׁיהּ יַבִּשׁ, וּמַן דְּשָׁתֵי טִיף טִיף, וּמַן דְּסָיֵים מְסָנֵי אַדְּמִייתִנְיָה כַּרְעָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: These three matters cause blindness to the light One who combs his hair dry, one who drinks dripping and one who puts on shoes when his feet are wet
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Those three things, he gave a pledge to Nehorai: One who is careful with his head will become bald, and one who drinks drop by drop, and one who finishes his cup will see the bottom of the cup.

hebrew_text: תְּלַאי בְּבֵיתָא קְשֵׁי לְעַנְיוּתָא. כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: תְּלָא סִילְתָּא — תְּלָא מְזוֹנֵיהּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא רִיפְתָּא, אֲבָל בִּישְׂרָא וְכַוְורֵי — לֵית לַן בַּהּ, אוֹרְחֵיהּ הִיא. פָּארֵי בְּבֵיתָא — קְשֵׁי לְעַנְיוּתָא. נִשְׁוָרָא בְּבֵיתָא — קְשֵׁי לְעַנְיוּתָא. בְּלֵילֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וּבְלֵילֵי רְבִיעִית — שָׁרוּ מַזִּיקִין עִילָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: hanging in one’s house, causes poverty. as people say He who hangs the basket hangs his sustenance, And we said this only bread; however, meat and fish, we have no with it. it is the common practice Bran [ parei ] in the house causes poverty. crumbs in the house cause poverty. Shabbat nights, or on Tuesday nights, harmful spirits rest on them.
llm_translation: The burden in the house is difficult for the poor. As people say: "The burden of the basket - the burden of its sustenance." And we only said this regarding a basket, but regarding a purse and a wallet - we do not have any concern, it is its owner's responsibility. Bulls in the house - difficult for the poor. A cow in the house - difficult for the poor. On the nights of Sabbaths and on the nights of the fourth year - demons roam about in it.

hebrew_text: אִיסָּרָא דִמְזוֹנֵי ״נְקִיד״ שְׁמֵיהּ. אִיסָּרָא דְעַנְיוּתָא ״נָבָל״ שְׁמֵיהּ. צָעָא אַפּוּמָּא דְחַצְבָּא — קְשֵׁי לְעַנְיוּתָא. מַאן דְּשָׁתֵי מַיָּא בְּצָעֵי — קְשֵׁי לִבְרוּקְתִּי. דְּאָכֵיל תַּחְלֵי וְלָא מָשֵׁי יְדֵיהּ — מְפַחֵיד תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין.
human_translation: The administering angel food is called Nakid, The administering angel poverty is called Naval. A plate on a jug causes poverty. One who drinks water from a plate causes pain. who eats cress without washing his hands will be afraid for thirty days.
llm_translation: The prohibition of "Nekid" is its name. The prohibition of "Naval" is its name. He drank the vinegar of a barrel - difficult for the stomach. One who drinks water in the morning - difficult for the kidneys. If one eats before washing his hands - he is frightened for thirty days.

hebrew_text: דִּמְסוֹכַר וְלָא מָשֵׁי יְדֵיהּ — מְפַחֵיד שִׁבְעָה יוֹמֵי. דְּשָׁקֵיל מַזְיֵיהּ וְלָא מָשֵׁי יְדֵיהּ — מְפַחֵיד תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי. דְּשָׁקֵיל טוּפְרֵיהּ וְלָא מָשֵׁי יְדֵיהּ — מְפַחֵיד חַד יוֹמָא, וְלָא יָדַע מַאי קָא מְפַחֵיד. יְדָא אַאוּסְיָא — דַּרְגָּא לְפַחְדָּא. יְדָא אַפּוּתָא — דַּרְגָּא לְשִׁינְתָּא.
human_translation: who lets blood and does not wash his hands will be afraid for seven days. who cuts his hair and does not wash his hands will be afraid for three days. who cuts his nails and does not wash his hands will be afraid for one day, and he will not know what is frightening hand on nostrils a way to afraid. hand on his forehead is a way asleep.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If he takes a knife and does not put it down — he is afraid for seven days. If he takes a needle and does not put it down — he is afraid for three days. If he takes a shovel and does not put it down — he is afraid for one day, and he does not know what he is afraid of. The hand of a bear — a level of fear. The hand of a snake — a level of hatred."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: אוֹכָלִין וּמַשְׁקִין תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה, אֲפִילּוּ מְחוּפִּין בִּכְלִי בַּרְזֶל — רוּחַ רָעָה שׁוֹרָה עֲלֵיהֶן. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לֹא יִשְׁתֶּה אָדָם מַיִם לֹא בְּלֵילֵי רְבִיעִיּוֹת וְלֹא בְּלֵילֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת, וְאִם שָׁתָה — דָּמוֹ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ מִפְּנֵי סַכָּנָה. מַאי סַכָּנָה? רוּחַ רָעָה.
human_translation: taught: food and drink under bed, even if they are covered with iron vessels, an evil spirit rests upon them. The Sages taught: A person not drink water on Tuesday nights or on Shabbat nights, And if he drinks his blood is upon his head, due to danger. What is danger? evil spirit
llm_translation: Mishna: Eating and drinking under the bed, even if they are covered with an iron vessel - a harmful spirit rests upon them. The Sages taught: A person should not drink water on the nights of the fourth day or on the nights of Sabbaths, and if he drank - his blood is on his head due to danger. What is the danger? A harmful spirit.

hebrew_text: וְאִם צָחֵי מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? (נֵימָא) שִׁבְעָה קוֹלוֹת שֶׁאָמַר דָּוִד עַל הַמַּיִם, וַהֲדַר נִישְׁתֵּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קוֹל ה׳ עַל הַמָּיִם אֵל הַכָּבוֹד הִרְעִים ה׳ עַל מַיִם רַבִּים קוֹל ה׳ בַּכֹּחַ קוֹל ה׳ בֶּהָדָר קוֹל ה׳ שׁוֹבֵר אֲרָזִים וַיְשַׁבֵּר ה׳ אֶת אַרְזֵי הַלְּבָנוֹן קוֹל ה׳ חוֹצֵב לַהֲבוֹת אֵשׁ קוֹל ה׳ יָחִיל מִדְבָּר יָחִיל ה׳ מִדְבַּר קָדֵשׁ קוֹל ה׳ יְחוֹלֵל אַיָּלוֹת וַיֶּחֱשׂוֹף יְעָרוֹת וּבְהֵיכָלוֹ כּוּלּוֹ אוֹמֵר כָּבוֹד״.
human_translation: And if he is thirsty, what is his remedy? He say seven voices that David said over the water, and afterward he drink. As it is stated: “The voice of the Lord is upon the waters; God of glory thunders, even the Lord upon many waters. The voice of the Lord is powerful; the voice of the Lord is full of majesty. The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars; the Lord breaks in pieces the cedars of Lebanon. The voice of the Lord hews out flames of fire. The voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness; the Lord shakes the wilderness of Kadesh. The voice of the Lord makes the hinds to calve, and strips the forests bare; and in His temple all say: Glory”
llm_translation: And if he is pure, what is its remedy? (It was stated) seven voices that David said upon the waters, and then he was silent, as it is said: "The voice of the Lord is upon the waters; the God of glory thunders; the Lord is upon many waters. The voice of the Lord is powerful; the voice of the Lord is full of majesty. The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars; yes, the Lord breaks the cedars of Lebanon. The voice of the Lord hews out flames of fire. The voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness; the Lord shakes the wilderness of Kadesh. The voice of the Lord makes the hinds to calve, and strips the forests bare; and in His temple all say, 'Glory!'"

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא, (נֵימָא) הָכִי: ״לוּל שָׁפָן אֲנִיגְרוֹן אֲנִירָדְפִין בֵּין כּוֹכְבֵי יָתֵיבְנָא, בֵּין בְּלִיעִי שַׁמִּינֵי אָזֵילְנָא״. וְאִי לָא, אִי אִיכָּא אִינִישׁ בַּהֲדֵיהּ — נַיתְעֲרֵיהּ וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: ״פְּלָנְיָא בַּר פְּלָנִתָא צָחֵינָא מַיָּא״, וַהֲדַר נִישְׁתֵּי. וְאִי לָא — מְקַרְקֵשׁ נִכְתְּמָא אַחַצְבָּא וַהֲדַר נִישְׁתֵּי. וְאִי לָא — נִישְׁדֵּי בַּהּ מִידֵּי, וַהֲדַר נִישְׁתֵּי.
human_translation: And if not he say as follows: Lul, Shafan, Anigron, Anirdafin, I sit between the stars, I walk between thin fat And if not if there is person with him, he wake him and say to him: So-and-so, son of so-and-so, I thirst for water; and then drink. And if no knock the cover on the cup and then drink. And if not he throw some in it and then drink.
llm_translation: "If not, (say) thus: 'If a fox is being pursued between the stars, we will sit; if between the tails of the Pleiades, we will go.' And if not, if there is someone with him - he should shake himself and say to him: 'So-and-so son of so-and-so, we need water,' and then he should depart. And if not - he should scratch with his finger, and then depart."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לֹא יִשְׁתֶּה אָדָם מַיִם לֹא מִן הַנְּהָרוֹת וְלֹא מִן הָאֲגַמִּים בַּלַּיְלָה, וְאִם שָׁתָה — דָּמוֹ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ, מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה. מַאי סַכָּנָה? סַכָּנַת שַׁבְרִירֵי. וְאִי צַחֵי מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? אִי אִיכָּא אִינִישׁ בַּהֲדֵיהּ — לֵימָא לֵיהּ: ״פְּלָנְיָא בַּר פְּלָנִתָא, צָחֵינָא מַיָּא״. וְאִי לָא, (נֵימָא) אִיהוּ לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ: ״פְּלָנְיָא, אֲמַרָה לִי אִימִּי אִיזְדְּהַר מִשַּׁבְרִירֵי שַׁבְרִירֵי בְּרִירֵי רִירֵי יְרֵי רֵי — צָחֵינָא מַיָּא בְּכָסֵי חִיוָּרֵי״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A person not drink water from rivers or from ponds at night. And if he drank, his blood is upon his head due to the danger. What is danger? The danger of blindness. And if he is thirsty, what is his remedy? If there is person with him, he say to him: So-and-so, son of so-and-so, I thirst for water. And if no he say to himself: So-and-so, my mother said to me beware of shavrirei , Shavrirei berirei rirei yiri ri ; I thirst for water in white cups.
llm_translation: The sages taught: A person should not drink water, neither from rivers nor from ponds, at night. And if he drank — his blood is upon his head, because of the danger. What is the danger? The danger of demons. And if he is clever, what is his remedy? If there is someone with him, he should say to him: "So-and-so, son of so-and-so, bring me water." And if not, let him say to himself: "So-and-so, my mother told me to beware of the demons of demons, the demons of demons of demons, the demons of demons of demons — bring me water in a vessel of glass."

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ מִן הַתַּמְחוּי וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: And even from the charity plate. obvious
llm_translation: "And even from the tamchuy and so on. Obviously!"

hebrew_text: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: עֲשֵׂה שַׁבַּתְּךָ חוֹל וְאַל תִּצְטָרֵךְ לַבְּרִיּוֹת — הָכָא מִשּׁוּם פַּרְסוֹמֵי נִיסָּא (מוֹדֵי).
human_translation: is necessary only even according to Rabbi Akiva, who said: Make your Shabbat weekday and do not be beholden to beings. Here, concedes due to to publicize the miracle.
llm_translation: Not needed except even for Rabbi Akiva, as he said: Make your Shabbat like a weekday and do not rely on people - here because of publicizing the miracle (they admit).

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: עֲשֵׂה שַׁבַּתְּךָ חוֹל וְאַל תִּצְטָרֵךְ לַבְּרִיּוֹת, אֲבָל עוֹשֶׂה הוּא דָּבָר מוּעָט בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ. מַאי נִינְהוּ? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כָּסָא דְהַרְסָנָא. כְּדִתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן תֵּימָא אוֹמֵר: הֱוֵי עַז כַּנָּמֵר וְקַל כַּנֶּשֶׁר, רָץ כַּצְּבִי וְגִבּוֹר כָּאֲרִי לַעֲשׂוֹת רְצוֹן אָבִיךָ שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: the school of Eliyahu taught although Rabbi Akiva said: Make your Shabbat a weekday and do not be beholden to beings; however, one perform some small in his house What this Rav Pappa said: small, fried fish. As we learned Rabbi Yehuda ben Teima says: Be bold like a leopard, light like an eagle, run like a deer, and strong like a lion to perform the will of your Father in Heaven.
llm_translation: The Tanna of the school of Elijah taught: Even though Rabbi Akiva said, "Make your Sabbath like a weekday and do not rely on others," one should still do a small matter within his home. What are they? Rav Papa said: The chair of the craftsman. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda ben Tema says: Be bold as a leopard, light as an eagle, swift as a deer, and strong as a lion to do the will of your Father in Heaven.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, שִׁבְעָה דְּבָרִים צִוָּה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֶת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּנוֹ: בְּנִי, אַל תֵּשֵׁב בְּגוֹבְהָהּ שֶׁל עִיר וְתִשְׁנֶה, וְאַל תָּדוּר בְּעִיר שֶׁרָאשֶׁיהָ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Rabbi Akiva commanded Rabbi Yehoshua, his son, seven matters: My son, do not sit at the high point of a city, and study And do not live in a city whose leaders are Torah scholars,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Rabbi Akiva commanded Rabbi Yehoshua his son with seven matters: My son, do not dwell in the height of the city and become forgetful, and do not reside in a city whose leaders are scholars.

hebrew_text: וְאַל תִּכָּנֵס לְבֵיתְךָ פִּתְאוֹם, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן לְבֵית חֲבֵירְךָ. וְאַל תִּמְנַע מִנְעָלִים מֵרַגְלֶיךָ. הַשְׁכֵּם וֶאֱכוֹל, בַּקַּיִץ מִפְּנֵי הַחַמָּה, וּבַחוֹרֶף מִפְּנֵי הַצִּינָּה. וַעֲשֵׂה שַׁבַּתְּךָ חוֹל וְאַל תִּצְטָרֵךְ לַבְּרִיּוֹת. וֶהֱוֵי מִשְׁתַּדֵּל עִם אָדָם שֶׁהַשָּׁעָה מְשַׂחֶקֶת לוֹ.
human_translation: And do not enter your house suddenly, all the more so the house of another, And do not withhold shoes from your feet, Wake up and eat, in the summer due to the heat, and in the winter due to the cold. And make your Shabbat a weekday and do not be beholden to beings. And exert yourself with a person upon whom the hour smiles,
llm_translation: Do not enter your house suddenly, all the more so your friend's house. And do not withhold shoes from your feet. Rise early and eat, in the summer because of the heat, and in the winter because of the cold. Make your Sabbath like a weekday, and do not rely on others. And be diligent with a person for whom the hour is favorable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא לְמִיזְבַּן מִינֵּיהּ וְלָא לְזַבּוֹנֵי לֵיהּ, אֶלָּא לְמֶעְבַּד שׁוּתָּפוּת בַּהֲדֵיהּ. וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״מַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו בֵּרַכְתָּ״ — כׇּל הַנּוֹטֵל פְּרוּטָה מֵאִיּוֹב מִתְבָּרֵךְ, אֲפִילּוּ לְמִיזְבַּן מִינֵּיהּ וּלְזַבּוֹנֵי לֵיהּ שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Do not buy from him and do not sell to him. Rather, form a partnership with him. And now that Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: What which is written: “You have blessed the work of his hands” anyone who took a peruta from Job would be blessed, even if to buy from him or to sell to him it is well,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Not to buy from him and not to sell to him, but to engage in partnership with him. And now that Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: What is the meaning of the verse "You have blessed the work of his hands"? — Anyone who benefits even a small coin from Job is blessed, even to buy from him and to sell to him is praiseworthy.

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים צִוָּה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֶת רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי כְּשֶׁהָיָה חָבוּשׁ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, לַמְּדֵנִי תּוֹרָה, אָמַר: אֵינִי מְלַמְּדֶךָ. אָמַר לוֹ: אִם אֵין אַתָּה מְלַמְּדֵנִי אֲנִי אוֹמֵר לְיוֹחַי אַבָּא וּמוֹסֶרְךָ לַמַּלְכוּת. אָמַר לוֹ: בְּנִי, יוֹתֵר מִמַּה שֶּׁהָעֵגֶל רוֹצֶה לִינַק פָּרָה רוֹצֶה לְהָנִיק. אָמַר לוֹ: וּמִי בְּסַכָּנָה? וַהֲלֹא עֵגֶל בְּסַכָּנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva commanded Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai five matters when was imprisoned. said to him: Rabbi, teach me Torah. said I will not teach you, said to him If you will not teach me, I will tell Yoḥai father, and he will turn you over to the government. said: My son, more than the calf wishes to suck, the cow wants to suckle, said to him: And who is in danger? Isn’t the calf in danger,
llm_translation: Five things did Rabbi Akiva command Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai when he was imprisoned in the jail. He said to him: "My teacher, teach me Torah." He replied: "I cannot teach you." He said to him: "If you do not teach me, I will go and inform on you to the authorities." He said to him: "My son, more than the calf desires to suck, the cow desires to suckle." He said to him: "But who is in danger?" Is not the calf in danger?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: אִם בִּקַּשְׁתָּ לֵיחָנֵק — הִיתָּלֵה בְּאִילָן גָּדוֹל. וּכְשֶׁאַתָּה מְלַמֵּד אֶת בִּנְךָ — לַמְּדֵהוּ בְּסֵפֶר מוּגָּהּ. מַאי הִיא? אָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: בְּחַדְתָּא, שַׁבֶּשְׁתָּא כֵּיוָן דְּעָל — עָל.
human_translation: said to him: if you wish to strangle yourself, hang yourself on a tall tree. And when you teach your son, teach him from a corrected text. What is that Rava said, and some say Rav Mesharshiya to a new once a mistake enters entered
llm_translation: He said to him: If you sought to be choked — hang yourself on a large tree. And when you teach your son — teach him in a clear book. What is it? Rava said, and some say Rav Mesharshya: In a new place, when you sit down, since you came — speak.

hebrew_text: לֹא תְּבַשֵּׁל בִּקְדֵירָה שֶׁבִּישֵּׁל בָּהּ חֲבֵירֶךָ. מַאי נִיהוּ — גְּרוּשָׁה בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ, דְּאָמַר מָר גָּרוּשׁ שֶׁנָּשָׂא גְּרוּשָׁהּ — אַרְבַּע דֵּעוֹת בַּמִּטָּה. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַלְמָנָה, לְפִי
human_translation: Do not cook in a pot in which your colleague cooked What is this a divorced woman in the lifetime of her husband. As the Master said: a divorced man marries a divorced woman, there are four minds in the bed And if you wish, say even with regard to a widow, as
llm_translation: Do not cook in a pot that your friend has cooked in. What is the reason? — Because it is like a divorced woman in the presence of her husband, as Mar said: A divorced woman who remarries has four opinions in the bed. And if you wish, I can say: Even with a widow, according to

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵין כׇּל אֶצְבָּעוֹת שָׁווֹת.
human_translation: not all fingers are equal.
llm_translation: That all fingers are not equal.

hebrew_text: מִצְוָה וְגוּף גָּדוֹל — אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת וְלֹא שָׂכָר. מִצְוָה וְגוּף טָהוֹר — נוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה וְלוֹ בָּנִים.
human_translation: a mitzva and a great body eat fruits without payment. a mitzva and pure body marries a woman, and he will have children.
llm_translation: Commandment and body great — eats fruits and not hire. Commandment and body pure — marries a woman and has children.

hebrew_text: אַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים צִוָּה רַבֵּינוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ אֶת בָּנָיו: אַל תָּדוּר בְּשַׁכְנְצִיב מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיצָנֵי הָווּ, וּמָשְׁכוּ לָךְ בְּלֵיצָנוּתָא.
human_translation: Our holy rabbi, commanded his sons four matters: Do not live in Shekhantziv because they are mockers. And they will draw you in to their mockery
llm_translation: Four things Rabbi Yehudah HaKadosh commanded his sons: Do not dwell in the city of Shachneziv because they are mockers, and distance yourself from mockery.

hebrew_text: וְאַל תֵּשֵׁב עַל מִטַּת אֲרַמִּית. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: דְּלָא תִּיגְנֵי בְּלָא קְרִיַּת שְׁמַע. וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: דְּלָא תִּינְסַב גִּיּוֹרְתָּא.
human_translation: Do not sit on the bed of an Aramean woman. Some say that you not go to sleep without reciting Shema , And some say that you not marry a convert,
llm_translation: "Do not sit on a bed of an Aramean woman." Some say: so as not to emit semen without intention. And some say: so as not to marry a convert woman."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: אֲרַמָּאִית מַמָּשׁ, וּמִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה דְרַב פָּפָּא.
human_translation: And some say actual an Aramean woman, and due to incident involving Rav Pappa.
llm_translation: And there are those who say: Aramaic indeed, and because of the incident of Rav Papa.

hebrew_text: וְאֶל תַּבְרִיחַ עַצְמְךָ מִן הַמֶּכֶס, דִּילְמָא מַשְׁכְּחוּ לָךְ וְשָׁקְלִי מִנָּךְ כׇּל דְּאִית לָךְ. וְאַל תַּעֲמוֹד בִּפְנֵי הַשּׁוֹר בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעוֹלֶה מִן הָאֲגַם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַשָּׂטָן מְרַקֵּד בֵּין קַרְנָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּשׁוֹר שָׁחוֹר, וּבְיוֹמֵי נִיסָן.
human_translation: And do not avoid paying taxes, lest they find you and confiscate everything you own. And do not stand before an ox when it emerges from the marsh because Satan dances between its horns, Rabbi Shmuel said: to a black ox, and during the days of Nisan,
llm_translation: "And do not hide yourself from the tax, lest you forget and they take from you all that you have. And do not stand in front of the ox at the time it emerges from the swamp, because the Satan dances between its horns." Rabbi Shmuel said: "A black ox, and in the days of Nissan."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מַרְחִיקִין מִשּׁוֹר תָּם — חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה, מִשּׁוֹר מוּעָד — כִּמְלֹא עֵינָיו.
human_translation: Rav Oshaya teaches One distances himself fifty cubits from an innocuous ox [ shor tam ], From a forewarned ox [ shor muad ], eyeshot.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita by Rav Oshaya: We distance a Tam ox - fifty cubits, a Mu'ad ox - as far as its eyes can see.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר: רֵישׁ תּוֹרָא בְּדִיקּוּלָא — סַק לְאִיגָּרָא וּשְׁדִי דַּרְגָּא מִתּוּתָךְ. אָמַר רַב: נִיזְהָא דְתוֹרָא — ״הֵן הֵן״. נִיזְהָא דְאַרְיָה — ״זֶה זֶה״. נִיזְהָא דְגַמְלָא — ״דָּא דָּא״. נִיזְהָא דְאַרְבָּא — ״הֵילֵנִי הַיָּיא הִילָא וְהִילּוּק הוּלְיָא״.
human_translation: taught citing the name Rabbi Meir, the head of the ox basket, go up to the roof and kick the ladder out from underneath you Rav said: The cry to an ox hen hen . The cry to a lion zeh zeh . The cry to a camel da da . The cry to a ship heleni , hayya , hela , vehilook , hulya .
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: The beginning of Torah is scrutiny — look into it and investigate it thoroughly. Rav said: The crown of Torah — "Yes, yes." The crown of a lion — "This, this." The crown of a camel — "This and that." The crown of a wild ox — "Exalt me, let me exalt and be exalted."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: עוֹר, דָּג, וְכוֹס, חַמִּין, וּבֵיצִים, וְכִנִּים לְבָנִים — כּוּלָּן קָשִׁין לְדָבָר אַחֵר. עוֹר — מַאן דְּגָנֵי אַמַּשְׁכָּא דְצַלָּא. דָּג — שִׁיבּוּטָא בְּיוֹמֵי נִיסָן. כּוֹס — שִׁיּוּרֵי כָּסָא דְהַרְסָנָא. חַמִּין — חַמִּימֵי דְחַמִּימֵי מְשַׁדְּרוּ עִילָּוֵיהּ. בֵּיצִים — מַאן דִּמְדָרֵךְ אַקְּלִיפִּים. כִּינִּים לְבָנִים — מַאן דִּמְחַוַּור לְבוּשֵׁיהּ וְלָא נָטֵיר לֵיהּ תְּמָנְיָא יוֹמֵי וַהֲדַר לָבֵישׁ לֵהּ — בָּרְיָין הָנָךְ כִּינִּים, וְקַשְׁיָן לְדָבָר אַחֵר.
