human_translation: Abaye said: Hide, fish, and a cup, hot water, and eggs, and white lice all cause other matter, Hide one who sleeps on a tanner’s hide Fish shibuta in the days of Nisan. cup the leftovers of small fried fish. Hot water very hot water that pours on himself. Eggs one who steps on eggshells. White lice one who washes his garment but does not keep it for eight days before wearing it again, creates these lice. And cause other matter,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Skin, fish, cup, hot water, eggs, and white lice - all of them are difficult for another matter. Skin - one who removes the hair of a hide. Fish - the spawning of fish in the days of Nissan. Cup - the scraping of the cup of a potter. Hot water - the hot waters of hot springs that heat it. Eggs - one who peels eggshells. White lice - one who checks his clothing and does not leave it for eight days, and then he wears it - these are white lice, and they are difficult for another matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בֵּיתָא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ שׁוּנָּרָא לָא נֵיעוּל בַּהּ אִינִישׁ בְּלָא מְסָנֵי. מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּשׁוּנָּרָא קָטֵיל לְחִיוְיָא וְאָכֵיל לֵיהּ, וְאִית בֵּיהּ בְּחִיוְיָא גַּרְמֵי קַטִּינֵי, וְאִי יָתֵיב לֵהּ גַּרְמָא דְחִיוְיָא אַכַּרְעֵיהּ — לָא נָפֵיק וְאִסְתַּכַּן לֵיהּ. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: בֵּיתָא דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ שׁוּנָּרָא — לָא נֵיעוּל בֵּיהּ אִינִישׁ בְּהַכְרָא, מַאי טַעְמָא — דִילְמָא מִיכְּרִיךְ בֵּיהּ חִוְיָא וְלָא יָדַע וּמִסְתַּכַּן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: a house in which there is a cat, a person not enter there barefoot. What is the reason? Because the cat kill a snake and eat it, and the snake has small bones, and if bone gets into one’s foot it cannot be removed, and he will be in danger. Some say a house in which there is no cat, a person not enter there in the dark. What is the reason? perhaps a snake will wrap itself around him without knowing and he will be in danger.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: A house that has a cat should not be rented out to someone without a weapon. What is the reason? Because the cat kills mice and eats them, and in the house there are small mice. If the person sits with the cat's prey under his feet, he will not be able to leave and settle there. Some say: A house that does not have a cat should not be rented out to someone with a weapon. What is the reason? Perhaps he will see a mouse in the house, not know it, and get startled.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים צִוָּה רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֶת רַבִּי: (מק״ש סִימָן) אַל תַּעַשׂ מוּם בְּעַצְמְךָ. מַאי הִיא? לָא תֶּיהְוֵי לָךְ דִּינָא בַּהֲדֵי תְּלָתָא, דְּחַד הָוֵי בַּעַל דִּינָךְ וּתְרֵי סָהֲדֵי. וְאַל תַּעֲמוֹד עַל הַמִּקָּח בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאֵין לְךָ דָּמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, commanded Rabbi three matters. mem , kuf , shin a mnemonic Do not inflict a blemish upon yourself. What Do not have a court case against three as one will be your opponent and two witnesses And do not stand over a purchase when you do not have money
llm_translation: Three things Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, commanded Rabbi: (Makkot Chapter) Do not cause a blemish in yourself. What is it? Do not make yourself a judge in front of three, for one should be your judge and two witnesses. And do not stand on the transaction when you do not have money.

hebrew_text: אִשְׁתְּךָ טָבְלָה — אַל תִּזָּקֵק לָהּ לַיְלָה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה. אָמַר רַב: וּבְנִדָּה דְאוֹרָיְיתָא, הוֹאִיל וְהוּחְזַק מַעְיָן פָּתוּחַ, דִּילְמָא מָשְׁכָה זִיבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, commanded Rabbi your wife has immersed, do not engage with her on the first night. Rav said: And to a menstruating woman by Torah Since a presumption the flow is open, perhaps zava will continue
llm_translation: Your wife immersed - do not have relations with her on the first night. Rav said: And regarding a woman in a state of niddah according to biblical law, since the opening of the spring has been established, perhaps there will be a flow of menstrual blood.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים צִוָּה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֶת רַבִּי: אַל תֵּצֵא יְחִידִי בַּלַּיְלָה, וְאַל תַּעֲמוֹד בִּפְנֵי הַנֵּר עָרוֹם, וְאַל תִּכָּנֵס לְמֶרְחָץ חָדָשׁ, שֶׁמָּא תִּפָּחֵת. עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: עַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. וְאַל תַּעֲמוֹד בִּפְנֵי הַנֵּר עָרוֹם, דְּתַנְיָא: הָעוֹמֵד בִּפְנֵי הַנֵּר עָרוֹם — הָוֵי נִכְפֶּה. וְהַמְשַׁמֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ לְאוֹר הַנֵּר — הָוַיִין לוֹ בָּנִים נִכְפִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, commanded Rabbi three matters: Do not go out alone at night; do not stand naked before a candle; and do not enter a new bathhouse, lest it collapse Until when Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Until twelve months And do not stand naked before a candle, as it was taught One who stands naked before a candle will become epileptic, and one who engages in intimacy by candlelight will have epileptic children.
llm_translation: Three things Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, commanded Rabbi: Do not go out alone at night, and do not stand in front of a naked flame, and do not enter a new bathhouse, lest you become weakened. Until when? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Until twelve months. And do not stand in front of a naked flame, as it was taught: One who stands in front of a naked flame - will be afflicted. And one who uses his bed for the light of the flame - his children will be afflicted.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְשַׁמֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ עַל מִטָּה שֶׁתִּינוֹק יָשֵׁן עָלֶיהָ — אוֹתוֹ תִּינוֹק נִכְפֶּה. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא הָוֵי בַּר שַׁתָּא, אֲבָל הָוֵי בַּר שַׁתָּא — לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּגָנֵי לַהֲדֵי כַּרְעֵיהּ, אֲבָל גָּנֵי לַהֲדֵי רֵישֵׁיהּ — לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא מַנַּח יְדֵיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ, אֲבָל מַנַּח יְדֵיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: the Sages taught: One who engages in intimacy in a bed upon which a baby is sleeping, that child becomes epileptic. And we said only if is not one year old; however, is one year old we have no with it, And we said this only that is sleeping near feet; but is sleeping near his head we have no with it. And we said this only if he does not place his hand on but he places his hands on we have no with it.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who places his bed upon a bed that a child is sleeping on - that child will be harmed. And we only said this when he is not a bar shata, but if he is a bar shata - we are not concerned. And we only said this when he covers his legs, but if he covers his head - we are not concerned. And we only said this when he does not place his hands above his pillow, but if he places his hands above his pillow - we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: אֵל תֵּצֵא יְחִידִי בַּלַּיְלָה, דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יֵצֵא יְחִידִי בַּלַּיְלָה, לֹא בְּלֵילֵי רְבִיעִיּוֹת וְלֹא בְּלֵילֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָגְרַת בַּת מָחֲלַת, הִיא וּשְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה רִבּוֹא שֶׁל מַלְאֲכֵי חַבָּלָה יוֹצְאִין, וְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד יֵשׁ לוֹ רְשׁוּת לְחַבֵּל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Do not go out alone at night, as it was taught not go out alone at night, neither on Tuesday nights nor on Shabbat nights, because Agrat, daughter of Maḥalat, she and 180,000 angels of destruction go out And each and every one has permission to destroy by itself,
llm_translation: Do not go out alone at night, as it was taught: One should not go out alone at night, neither on the nights of the fourth watch nor on the nights of Sabbaths, because the destroying angel is abroad, and eighteen myriads of destructive angels go forth, and each and every one has permission to destroy by itself.

hebrew_text: מֵעִיקָּרָא הֲווֹ שְׁכִיחִי כּוּלֵּי יוֹמָא. זִמְנָא חֲדָא פְּגַעָה בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דְּמַכְרְזִן עֲלָךְ בְּרָקִיעַ: ״הִזָּהֲרוּ בַּחֲנִינָא וּבְתוֹרָתוֹ״ — סַכַּנְתָּיךְ. אֲמַר לַהּ: אִי חֲשִׁיבְנָא בְּרָקִיעַ, גּוֹזֵר אֲנִי עָלַיִךְ שֶׁלֹּא תַּעֲבוֹרִי בַּיִּישּׁוּב לְעוֹלָם. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: בְּמָטוּתָא מִינָּךְ, שְׁבֹק לִי רַוְוחָא פּוּרְתָּא. שְׁבַק לַהּ לֵילֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וְלֵילֵי רְבִיעִיּוֹת.
human_translation: Initially, were present every day. Once met Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa said to him: Had they not announced about you in the Heavens: Be careful of Ḥanina and his Torah, I would have placed you in danger. He said to her: If I am important in Heaven, I decree upon you that you never travel through inhabited places. She said to him: I beg you, leave me a little space. He left for her Shabbat nights and Tuesday nights.
llm_translation: From the outset, they were frequent every day. One time, a woman encountered Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa, and she said to him: "If not for the fact that they announce concerning you in the heavens: 'Beware of Chanina and his Torah,' I would have endangered you." He said to her: "If I am considered in the heavens, I decree upon you that you shall not pass through the alleyway forever." She said to him: "Your mat is from you, leave me a small space." He left for her the nights of Sabbaths and the nights of Wednesdays.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: חֲדָא זִמְנָא פְּגַעָה בֵּיהּ בְּאַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דְּמַכְרְזִי עֲלָךְ בְּרָקִיעַ: ״הִזָּהֲרוּ בְּנַחְמָנִי וּבְתוֹרָתוֹ״ — הֲוָה סַכַּנְתָּיךְ. אֲמַר לַהּ: אִי חֲשִׁיבְנָא בְּרָקִיעַ, גּוֹזְרַנִי עֲלַיְיכִי שֶׁלֹּא תַּעֲבוּרִי בַּיִּישּׁוּב לְעוֹלָם. הָא קָא חָזֵינַן דְּעָבְרָה?! אָמְרִי: הָנֵי
human_translation: And furthermore, once met Abaye said to him: Had they not announced about you in the Heavens: Be careful of Naḥmani, and his Torah, I would have placed you in danger. He said to her: If I am important in Heaven, I decree upon you that you never pass through inhabited places. But we see that, pass through say These
llm_translation: And further: One time a certain woman encountered Abaye, she said to him: If it is not that the verse "Be careful with Nachmani and his Torah" was said about you, you would have been in danger. He said to her: If I were considered in the heavens, they would decree upon you that you never return to your homeland. But do we see that she did return?! They said: Those words were

hebrew_text: גָּזְיָיתָא נִינְהוּ, דְּשָׁמְטִי סוּסַיָּא וְאָתוּ דָּבְרִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: are on the paths [ gazyata ] as horses flee and come to lead them
llm_translation: Gaziyata are they, for I have released the horses and they have come to me with words.

hebrew_text: (וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ) רַב לְרַב אַסִּי: לָא תְּדוּר בְּמָתָא דְּלָא צָנֵיף בַּהּ סוּסְיָא וְלָא נָבַח בַּהּ כַּלְבָּא. וְאַל תָּדוּר בְּעִיר דְּרֵישׁ מָתָא אָסְיָא, וְלָא תִּנְסֵיב תַּרְתֵּי. אִי נָסְבַתְּ תַּרְתֵּי — נְסֵיב תְּלָת.
human_translation: And said to Rav Asi: Do not live in a city where horses do not neigh and where dogs do not bark, And do not live in a city where the mayor is a doctor, And do not marry two if you marry two, marry a third
llm_translation: (And he said to him) Rav to Rav Assi: Do not reside in a town where there is no market for horses, and do not marry a woman who does not comb her hair like a dog. And do not reside in a city where there is no physician, and do not marry two wives. If you have married two wives - marry a third.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: הֲפוֹךְ בִּנְבֵילְתָּא וְלָא תֵּיפוֹךְ בְּמִילֵּי. פְּשׁוֹט נְבֵילְתָּא בְּשׁוּקָא וּשְׁקֵיל אַגְרָא, וְלָא תֵּימָא ״כָּהֲנָא אֲנָא, וְגַבְרָא רַבָּא אֲנָא, וְסַנְיָא בִּי מִלְּתָא״. סָלְקַתְּ לְאִיגָּרָא — שֵׁירוּתָךְ בַּהֲדָךְ. מְאָה קָרֵי בְּמָתָא בְּזוּזָא — תּוּתֵי כַּנְפָיךְ נִיהְווֹ.
human_translation: Rav said to Rav Kahana: to turn over a carcass than to turn over his word, Skin a carcass in the market and take payment, but do not say: I am a priest, or: I am a great man, and this matter disgusts me. you ascend to the roof, your food with you. one hundred pumpkins in the city a zuz , place the corners
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav to Rav Kahana: Turn the carcass over and do not turn over the words. Spread the carcass in the marketplace and take a wage, and do not say, "I am a priest, and I am a great man, and I am too delicate for this matter." When you ascend to the roof, let your song be in your lap. One hundred read in the city in a mezuzah - the tassels of your wings have become beautiful.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְחִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ: לָא תִּשְׁתֵּי סַמָּא, וְלָא תְּשַׁוַּור נִיגְרָא, וְלָא תִּעְקַר כַּכָּא, וְלָא תְּקַנֵּא בְּחִיוְיָא, וְלָא תְּקַנֵּא בְּאַרְמָאָה.
human_translation: Rav said to Ḥiyya, his son: Do not drinking medications, And do not leap over a ditch, And do not pull out a tooth, And do not provoke a snake And do not provoke a gentile,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav to Ḥiyya his son: Do not drink samma, and do not soak nigra, and do not uproot kaka, and do not be jealous of living creatures, and do not be jealous of Aramaic.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה אֵין מִתְקַנְּאִין בָּהֶן, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: גּוֹי קָטָן, וְנָחָשׁ קָטָן, וְתַלְמִיד קָטָן. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּמַלְכוּתַיְיהוּ אֲחוֹרֵי אוּדְנַיְיהוּ קָאֵי.
human_translation: the Sages taught: three one not provoke: A small gentile, and a small snake, and a small scholar. What is the reason? Because their authority stands behind their ears.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three do not provoke jealousy, and they are: a minor non-Jew, a minor snake, and a minor student. What is the reason? Because their kingdom is behind them, and their lord is behind them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְאַיְבוּ בְּרֵיהּ: טְרַחִי בָּךְ בִּשְׁמַעְתָּא וְלָא מִסְתַּיַּיע מִילְּתָא. תָּא אַגְמְרָךְ מִילֵּי דְעָלְמָא. אַדְּחָלָא אַכַּרְעָיךָ — זְבִינָךְ זַבֵּין. כֹּל מִילֵּי זַבֵּין וְתִחָרַט — בַּר מֵחַמְרָא, דְּזַבֵּין וְלָא תִּחָרַט.
human_translation: Rav said to Ayvu, his son: I struggled you halakha but did not succeed, Come I will teach you mundane matters: Sell your merchandise while the dust on your feet. anything you sell regret except for wine, which you sell without regret.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav to Aivu his son: You have exerted yourself in learning, yet the matter did not succeed. Come, I will teach you worldly matters. If your ear is hard — sell your merchandise. All merchandise that is sold and does not regret — is from the wine, for it is sold and does not regret.

hebrew_text: שְׁרֵי כִּיסָיךְ, פְּתַח שַׂקָּיךָ. קַבָּא מֵאַרְעָא, וְלָא כּוֹרָא מֵאִיגָּרָא.
human_translation: Open your purse open your sack a kav from the ground than a kor from the roof.
llm_translation: The contents of your purse, open your sack. A measure from the land, but not a measure from the winepress.

hebrew_text: תַּמְרֵי בַּחֲלוּזָךְ — לְבֵית סוּדָנָא רְהוֹט. וְעַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רָבָא: עַד תְּלָת סְאָה. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אִי לָא דִּרְמַאי שִׁכְרָא לָא אִיעַתַּרִי. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אִי לָא דִּרְמַאי שִׁכְרָא לָא אִיעַתַּרִי: מַאי ״סוּדָנָא״? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: סוֹד נָאֶה, וּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים.
human_translation: dates in your storeroom, run to the brewery And how many Rava said: Up to three se’a . Rav Pappa said: If I were not a beer manufacturer I would not have become wealthy. Some say Rav Ḥisda who said: If I were not a beer manufacturer I would not have become wealthy. What is sudana , Rav Ḥisda said: A pleasant secret [ sod na’e ] and acts of loving kindness,
llm_translation: Date palms in your courtyard - to the house of Sudana is hot. And until when? Rava said: Up to three se'ah. Rav Papa said: If not for the heat of beer, I would not be able to endure. Some say, Rav Ḥisda said: If not for the heat of beer, I would not be able to endure. What is "Sudana"? Rav Ḥisda said: A beautiful secret, and acts of loving-kindness.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כׇּל אַגַּב — גְּבִיָּא בָּעֵי. כֹּל אַשְׁרַאי — סָפֵק אָתֵי סָפֵק לָא אָתֵי. וּדְאָתֵי — מָעוֹת רָעוֹת נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Anything by means requires collection, Any sale on credit is uncertain whether or not will come And if it come the money is bad.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "All Agav - Gebiya Ba'ei. All Ashrai - Safeik Atai Safeik La Atai. Udatai - Ma'ot Ra'ot Ninhu."

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם אַנְשֵׁי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם: כְּשֶׁאַתָּה יוֹצֵא לַמִּלְחָמָה — אַל תֵּצֵא בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, אֶלָּא תֵּצֵא בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה, כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה. וַעֲשֵׂה שַׁבַּתְּךָ חוֹל, וְאַל תִּצְטָרֵךְ לַבְּרִיּוֹת. וֶהֱוֵי מִשְׁתַּדֵּל עִם מִי שֶׁהַשָּׁעָה מְשַׂחֶקֶת לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said three matters, citing the people of Jerusalem: When you go to war do not go out first, but go out last. so that you will enter first. And make your Shabbat weekday and do not be beholden to beings. And exert yourself with one upon whom the hour smiles.
llm_translation: Three things Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of the people of Jerusalem: When you go out to battle, do not go out first, but go out last, so that you may enter first. Make your Sabbath like a weekday, and do not depend on others. And be diligent with someone for whom the hour is favorable.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִשּׁוּם אַנְשֵׁי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם: אַל תַּרְבֶּה בִּגְנוּת, מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה. בִּתְּךָ בָּגְרָה — שַׁחְרֵר עַבְדְּךָ וְתֵן לָהּ. וֶהֱוֵי זָהִיר בְּאִשְׁתְּךָ מֵחֲתָנָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן. מַאי טַעְמָא? רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם עֶרְוָה, רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם מָמוֹן. הָא וְהָא אִיתַנְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said three matters, citing the people of Jerusalem: Do not indulge in a shameful act because of the incident that occurred your daughter has grown up, free your slave and give to her And be careful with your wife with regard to her first son-in-law, What is the reason Rav Ḥisda said: Due to licentiousness. Rav Kahana said: Due to money either of these happen,
llm_translation: Three things Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said in the name of the people of Jerusalem: Do not increase in derogatory remarks, because of an incident that occurred. If your daughter reaches puberty - free your maidservant and give her to her. And be cautious with your wife from her first husband. What is the reason? Rav Chisda said: Because of immodesty, Rav Kahana said: Because of money. This one and that one have been established.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁלֹשָׁה מִנּוֹחֲלֵי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. אֵלּוּ הֵן: הַדָּר בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְהַמְגַדֵּל בָּנָיו לְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה, וְהַמַּבְדִּיל עַל הַיַּיִן בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת. מַאי הִיא? דִּמְשַׁיַּיר מִקִּידּוּשָׁא לְאַבְדָּלְתָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Three among those who inherit the World-to-Come: One who lives in Eretz Yisrael; one who raises his sons to in Torah study; and one who recites havdala over wine at the conclusion of Shabbat. What is that who leaves some of for havdala .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Three inheritances of the World to Come. These are: one who resides in the Land of Israel, one who raises his children to engage in Torah study, and one who distinguishes himself over wine at the conclusion of Shabbat. What is it? That he transitions from sanctification to havdalah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, שְׁלֹשָׁה מַכְרִיז עֲלֵיהֶן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּכׇל יוֹם: עַל רַוּוֹק הַדָּר בִּכְרַךְ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹטֵא, וְעַל עָנִי הַמַּחֲזִיר אֲבֵידָה לִבְעָלֶיהָ, וְעַל עָשִׁיר הַמְעַשֵּׂר פֵּירוֹתָיו בְּצִינְעָה. רַב סָפְרָא רַוּוֹק הַדָּר בִּכְרַךְ הֲוָה,
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, proclaims about three of people every day, About a bachelor who lives in a city and does not sin about a poor person who returns a lost object to its owners and about a wealthy person who tithes his produce in private, Rav Safra was a bachelor living in a city.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, three things the Holy One, blessed be He, proclaims daily: concerning a bachelor who lives in a city and does not sin, concerning a poor person who returns a lost object to its owner, and concerning a wealthy person who tithes his fruits in secret. Rav Safra was a bachelor who lived in a city.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא וְרַב סָפְרָא, צָהֲבוּ פָּנָיו דְּרַב סָפְרָא. אָמַר לוֹ רָבָא: לָאו כְּגוֹן מָר, אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן רַב חֲנִינָא וְרַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא דַּהֲווֹ אוּשְׁכָּפֵי בְּאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וַהֲווֹ יָתְבִי בְּשׁוּקָא דְזוֹנוֹת, וְעָבְדִי לְהוּ מְסָאנֵי לְזוֹנוֹת, וְעָיְילִי לְהוּ. אִינְהוּ מִסְתַּכְּלִי בְּהוּ, וְאִינְהוּ לָא מַדְלָן עֵינַיְיהוּ לְאִיסְתַּכּוֹלֵי בְּהוּ. וּמוֹמָתַיְיהוּ הָכִי: בְּחַיֵּיהֶן רַבָּנַן קַדִּישֵׁי דִּבְאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: the tanna taught before Rava and Rav Safra, Rav Safra’s face lit up Rava said to him: like the Master. Rather, Rav Ḥanina and Rav Oshaya, who were cobblers in Eretz Yisrael, and they would sit in the marketplace of prostitutes and fashion shoes for prostitutes. And would enter look at them. did not raise their eyes to look at swore, as follows: By the lives of the holy Sages of Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rava and Rav Safra, the face of Rav Safra turned pale. Rava said to him: Not like our master, but like Rab Chanina and Rav Oshaya who were accustomed to frequent the Land of Israel, and they would sit in the marketplaces of prostitutes, and would give them money for their services, and they would then leave. They would not look at them, and they would not even raise their eyes to glance at them. And their deaths were as follows: In their lifetimes, they were considered holy rabbis in the Land of Israel.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אוֹהֲבָן: מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ כּוֹעֵס, וּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִשְׁתַּכֵּר, וּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַעֲמִיד עַל מִדּוֹתָיו. שְׁלֹשָׁה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שׂוֹנְאָן: הַמְדַבֵּר אֶחָד בַּפֶּה וְאֶחָד בַּלֵּב, וְהַיּוֹדֵעַ עֵדוּת בַּחֲבֵירוֹ וְאֵינוֹ מֵעִיד לוֹ, וְהָרוֹאֶה דְּבַר עֶרְוָה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ וּמֵעִיד בּוֹ יְחִידִי.
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, loves three One who does not get angry; one who does not get drunk; and one who is forgiving. The Holy One, Blessed be He, hates three One who says one with his mouth and another in his heart, one who knows testimony about another and does not testify on his behalf; and one who observes a licentious matter by another and testifies against him alone.
llm_translation: Three the Holy One, blessed be He, loves: one who does not get angry, and one who does not get drunk, and one who does not insist on his own honor. Three the Holy One, blessed be He, hates: one who speaks one thing with his mouth and another thing in his heart, and one who knows testimony about his fellow and does not testify, and one who sees a matter of indecency in his fellow and testifies about it alone.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּטוֹבִיָּה חָטָא, וַאֲתָא זִיגּוּד לְחוּדֵיהּ וְאַסְהֵיד בֵּיהּ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא. נַגְּדֵיהּ לְזִיגּוּד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טוֹבִיָּה חֲטָא וְזִיגּוּד מִינַּגַּד?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יָקוּם עֵד אֶחָד בְּאִישׁ״, וְאַתְּ לְחוֹדָךְ אַסְהֵדְתְּ בֵּיהּ, שֵׁם רַע בְּעָלְמָא קָא מַפְּקַתְּ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: like where Tuveya sinned and Zigud came alone to testify about him before Rav Pappa. Zigud be lashed. said to him: Tuveya sinned and Zigud is lashed, He said to him: Yes, as it is written: “One witness shall not rise up against a man” and you testified against him alone. You have merely given him a bad reputation.
llm_translation: The case of Toviya who sinned, and a contradiction came to challenge him, and he was embarrassed before Rav Papa. The contradiction stood against him. He said to him: Toviya sinned and a contradiction stood against him?! He said to him: No, as it is written: "A single witness shall not rise up against a man," and you alone testified against him, causing a bad name in the world.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק אָמַר רַב: מוּתָּר לִשְׂנֹאתוֹ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי תִרְאֶה חֲמוֹר שֹׂנַאֲךָ רוֹבֵץ תַּחַת מַשָּׂאוֹ״. מַאי ״שׂוֹנֵא״? אִילֵּימָא שׂוֹנֵא גּוֹי, וְהָא תַּנְיָא: שׂוֹנֵא שֶׁאָמְרוּ — שׂוֹנֵא יִשְׂרָאֵל וְלֹא שׂוֹנֵא גּוֹי.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said Rav said: he is permitted to hate him, as it is stated: “If you see the donkey of he who hates you lying under its load” What who hates you If you say a gentile who hates but wasn’t taught He who hates, of spoke, is a Jew who hates not a gentile who hates
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak said in the name of Rav: It is permitted to hate him. As it is stated: "If you see the donkey of your enemy lying under its burden" (Exodus 23:5). What is meant by "enemy"? If you wish, say it refers to a non-Jew, but isn't it taught: "Your enemy" means one who hates Israel and not one who hates a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא, שׂוֹנֵא יִשְׂרָאֵל. וּמִי שְׁרֵיא לְמִסְנְיֵהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״לֹא תִשְׂנָא אֶת אָחִיךָ בִּלְבָבֶךָ״. אֶלָּא דְּאִיכָּא סָהֲדִי דְּעָבֵיד אִיסּוּרָא — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא נָמֵי מִיסְנֵי סָנֵי לֵיהּ, מַאי שְׁנָא הַאי? אֶלָּא לָאו כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא, דַּחֲזָיא בֵּיהּ אִיהוּ דְּבַר עֶרְוָה.
human_translation: Rather, obvious a Jew who hates But is one permitted to hate But isn’t it written: “You shall not hate your brother in your heart” Rather, where there are witnesses that he performed a sin. everyone also hate him. What is different Rather, is it not to a case like this, when he saw him a licentious matter?
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious, one who hates Israel. And who is the one who permits hating him? And it is written: "You shall not hate your brother in your heart." Rather, if there is a witness who testifies that he committed a transgression - everyone in the world hates him, what is the difference with this one? Rather, is it not because this person, who saw in him a matter of indecency.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: מִצְוָה לִשְׂנֹאתוֹ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יִרְאַת ה׳ (שׂוֹנְאֵי) רָע״. אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מַהוּ לְמֵימְרָא לֵיהּ לְרַבֵּיהּ לְמִשְׂנְיֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי יָדַע דִּמְהֵימַן לְרַבֵּיהּ כְּבֵי תְרֵי — לֵימָא לֵיהּ, וְאִי לָא — לָא לֵימָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: a mitzva to hate him, as it is stated: “The fear of God is to hate evil” Rav Aḥa, son Rava, said to Rav Ashi: What is to tell his teacher he will hate him? said to him: If knows trusted by his teacher as two he tell him, and if not not tell him.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It is a commandment to hate him, as it is stated: "The fear of the Lord (is to hate) evil." Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: What should one say to his teacher to repeat his teachings? He said to him: If he knows that his teacher is like two houses, he should say it to him, and if not, he should not say it to him.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, שְׁלֹשָׁה חַיֵּיהֶן אֵינָם חַיִּים: הָרַחְמָנִין, וְהָרַתְחָנִין, וַאֲנִינֵי הַדַּעַת. וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כּוּלְּהוּ אִיתַנְהוּ בִּי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: three whose lives are not lives, The compassionate, the hot tempered, and the delicate. Rav Yosef said: All of these are in me.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Three of their lives are not considered lives: the merciful, the hot-tempered, and flatterers. And Rav Yosef said: All of them are found in me.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה שׂוֹנְאִין זֶה אֶת זֶה, אֵלּוּ הֵן: הַכְּלָבִים, וְהַתַּרְנְגוֹלִין, וְהַחַבָּרִין. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַזּוֹנוֹת. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁבְּבָבֶל.
human_translation: the Sages taught: three hate other Dogs, roosters, and the Persian priests. And some say: Also prostitutes. And some say: Also Torah scholars in Babylonia.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three hate each other, these are they: dogs, roosters, and companions. And some say: also prostitutes. And some say: also Babylonian Torah scholars.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה אוֹהֲבִין זֶה אֶת זֶה, אֵלּוּ הֵן: הַגֵּרִים, וַעֲבָדִים, וְעוֹרְבִין.
human_translation: the Sages taught: three love one another: Converts, slaves, and ravens.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Three love one another, these are they: converts, slaves, and ravens.

hebrew_text: אַרְבָּעָה אֵין הַדַּעַת סוֹבַלְתָּן, אֵלּוּ הֵן: דַּל גֵּאֶה, וְעָשִׁיר מְכַחֵשׁ, וְזָקֵן מְנָאֵף, וּפַרְנָס מִתְגָּאֶה עַל הַצִּיבּוּר בְּחִנָּם. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַמְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה וּמַחְזִירָהּ.
human_translation: Four cannot be endured An arrogant pauper; a wealthy person who denies a lecherous old man; and a leader who lords over the community for no cause. And some say: Also one who divorces his wife once and twice and takes her back
llm_translation: Four, the mind cannot tolerate them, these are: a poor person who is arrogant, a wealthy person who denies, an elderly person who commits adultery, and a community leader who boasts to the public for free. And some say: even one who divorces his wife once, twice, and takes her back.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא? זִימְנָא דִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה. אִי נָמֵי: יֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים הֵימֶנָּה וְלָא מָצֵי מְגָרֵשׁ לַהּ.
human_translation: And the first tanna Sometimes her marriage contract, is large, Alternatively, he has children with her and cannot divorce her,
llm_translation: And did the first Tanna teach? The time when her writing is more numerous. If so: he has children from her and cannot divorce her.

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים צִוָּה כְּנַעַן אֶת בָּנָיו: אֶהֱבוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה, וְאֶהֱבוּ אֶת הַגָּזֵל, וְאֶהֱבוּ אֶת הַזִּמָּה, וְשִׂנְאוּ אֶת אֲדוֹנֵיכֶם, וְאַל תְּדַבְּרוּ אֱמֶת.
human_translation: Canaan commanded his sons five matters Love one another, love robbery, love promiscuity, hate your masters, and do not speak the truth.
llm_translation: Five things did Canaan command his sons: Love one another, love theft, love immorality, hate your masters, and do not speak the truth.

hebrew_text: שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים נֶאֱמָרִים בַּסּוּס: אוֹהֵב אֶת הַזְּנוּת, וְאוֹהֵב אֶת הַמִּלְחָמָה, וְרוּחוֹ גַּסָּה, וּמוֹאֵס אֶת הַשֵּׁינָה, וְאוֹכֵל הַרְבֵּה וּמוֹצִיא קִמְעָה. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף מְבַקֵּשׁ לַהֲרוֹג בְּעָלָיו בַּמִּלְחָמָה.
human_translation: Six matters are said with regard to a horse: loves promiscuity, loves war, its demeanor is arrogant, it despises sleep, it eats much, and it excretes little. And some say: also attempts to kill its master in war.
llm_translation: Six things are said about the horse: it loves promiscuity, it loves battle, its spirit is haughty, it despises sleep, it eats much and excretes little. And some say: it even seeks to kill its rider in battle.

hebrew_text: שִׁבְעָה מְנוּדִּין לַשָּׁמַיִם, אֵלּוּ הֵן: (יְהוּדִי) [מִי] שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אִשָּׁה, וְשֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אִשָּׁה וְאֵין לוֹ בָּנִים, וּמִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים וְאֵין מְגַדְּלָן לְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה, וּמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ תְּפִילִּין בְּרֹאשׁוֹ וּתְפִילִּין בִּזְרוֹעוֹ וְצִיצִית בְּבִגְדוֹ וּמְזוּזָה בְּפִתְחוֹ, וְהַמּוֹנֵעַ מִנְעָלִים מֵרַגְלָיו. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף מִי שֶׁאֵין מֵיסֵב בַּחֲבוּרָה שֶׁל מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Seven ostracized by Heaven, A Jew who does not have a wife; and one who has a wife but has no sons; and one who has sons whom he does not raise to Torah study; and one who does not have phylacteries on his head, and phylacteries on his arm, and ritual fringes on his garment, and a mezuza in his doorway; and one who withholds shoes from his feet. And some say: Also one who does not sit with a group of a mitzva.
llm_translation: Seven are liable to the heavens, these are they: One who does not have a wife, and one who has a wife but does not have children, and one who has children but does not raise them to study Torah, and one who does not have phylacteries on his head and phylacteries on his arm and fringes on his garment and a mezuzah on his doorpost, and one who withholds shoes from his feet. And some say: Also one who does not sit in the company of a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָא אָמַר רַב מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אִישׁ הוּצָל: מִנַּיִין שֶׁאֵין שׁוֹאֲלִין בַּכַּלְדִּיִּים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תָּמִים תִּהְיֶה עִם ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Shmuel bar Marta said Rabbi Yosei of Hutzal: From where that one not consult astrologers? As it is stated: “You shall be wholehearted with the Lord your God”
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said, Rabbi Shemu'el bar Marta said, Rav said in the name of Rabbi Yosei Ish Hutzael: From where do we know that we do not inquire of the necromancers? As it is stated: "You shall be wholehearted with the Lord your God."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִין הַיּוֹדֵעַ בַּחֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁהוּא גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ אֲפִילּוּ בְּדָבָר אֶחָד, שֶׁחַיָּיב לִנְהוֹג בּוֹ כָּבוֹד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל קֳבֵל דִּי רוּחַ יַתִּירָא בֵּיהּ [וּמַלְכָּא עֲשִׁית לַהֲקָמוּתֵיהּ עַל כׇּל מַלְכוּתָא]״.
human_translation: And from where one who knows about another that he is greater than him, even in one matter, that he must treat him with respect? As it is stated: “Because a surpassing spirit was in him, the king thought to set him over the whole realm”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that one who knows his fellow is greater than him, even in one matter, is obligated to treat him with honor, as it is stated: "All that the king commands should be feared and the king is great above all kings" (Esther 10:3). English translation:

hebrew_text: וְהַיּוֹשֶׁבֶת עַל דָּם טָהוֹר — אֲסוּרָה לְשַׁמֵּשׁ. עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַב: עוֹנָה.
human_translation: And observing pure blood, is prohibited to engage in intimacy Until when Rav said: a set interval of time
llm_translation: The one sitting on pure blood - forbidden to sunbathe. Until when? Rav said: A period of mourning.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא, הוּא יוֹסֵף אִישׁ הוּצָל, הוּא יוֹסֵף הַבַּבְלִי, הוּא אִיסִי בֶּן גּוּר אַרְיֵה, הוּא אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה, הוּא אִיסִי בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, הוּא אִיסִי בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל. וּמָה שְׁמוֹ? — אִיסִי בֶּן עֲקַבְיָה שְׁמוֹ. הוּא רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן טַבְלָא, הוּא רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן חַקְלָא, הוּא רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אִלְעָא, הוּא
human_translation: taught: Yosef of Hutzal is Yosef the Babylonian. he is Isi ben Gur Arye, he is Isi ben Yehuda, he is Isi ben Gamliel, he is Isi ben Mahalalel. And what is his name? His name Isi ben Akavya. Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Tavla is Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Ḥakla, is Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Ela.
llm_translation: We learned: he is Yosef Ish Hutzal, he is Yosef the Babylonian, he is Isi ben Gur Aryeh, he is Isi ben Yehuda, he is Isi ben Gamliel, he is Isi ben Mahalalel. And what is his name? — Isi ben Akavya is his name. He is Rabbi Yitzchak ben Tabla, he is Rabbi Yitzchak ben Chakla, he is Rabbi Yitzchak ben Il'a, he is...

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אַחָא דִּשְׁמַעְתָּא, הוּא רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן פִּנְחָס דְּאַגָּדְתָּא. וְסִימָנָיךְ (שִׁמְעוּ נָא אַחַיי וְרֵעַיי).
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzhak ben Aḥa of halakha is Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Pineḥas of aggada . And your mnemonic Listen my brothers and friends [ shimu na aḥai vere’ai ].
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak ben Acha said, he is Rabbi Yitzchak ben Pinchas of the Aggadeta. And your mnemonic is, "Listen now, my brothers and friends."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי אִילְעַי: אֱכוֹל בָּצָל וְשֵׁב בַּצֵּל, וְלָא תֵּיכוּל אֲווֹזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין וִיהֵא לִבְּךָ רוֹדֵף עָלֶיךָ. פְּחוֹת מִמֵּיכְלָךְ וּמִמִּשְׁתְּיָךְ, וְתוֹסֵיף עַל דֵּירְתָךְ.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said, citing Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Elai: Eat an onion [ batzal ] and sit in the shade [ batzel ], but do not eat geese and chickens, as your heart will pursue you, less to your food and your drink and more on your house,
llm_translation: Rava bar Bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan in the name of Rabbi Yehuda son of Rabbi Ilai: Eat in the shade and sit in the shade, and do not eat garlic or onions, so that your heart may not be troubled. Eat less from your dish and from your cup, and you will add to your dwelling.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא עוּלָּא, אָמַר: מַתְלָא מָתְלִין בְּמַעְרְבָא דְּאָכֵיל אַלְיְתָא — טָשֵׁי בְּעִלִּיתָא. דְּאָכֵיל קָקוּלִי — אַקִּיקְלֵי דְמָתָא שָׁכֵיב.
human_translation: When Ulla came he said they say proverb in the west, One who eats a fat tail [ alita ] must hide in the attic [ aliyata ] One who eats vegetables [ kakulei ] can lie down in the city’s garbage [ kiklei ]
llm_translation: When Ulla came, he said: "When one eats a fatty tail in the west, it causes a headache. If one eats roasted liver, it causes a deep sleep."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָזְגוּ לוֹ כּוֹס רִאשׁוֹן. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיּוֹם, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: poured the first cup Beit Shammai say: One recites the blessing over the day, and thereafter he recites the blessing over the wine: And Beit Hillel say: One recites the blessing over the wine and thereafter recites the blessing over the day.
llm_translation: They taught: They pour for him the first cup. Beit Shammai say: One blesses on the day, and afterwards blesses on the wine. And Beit Hillel say: One blesses on the wine, and afterwards blesses on the day.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: דְּבָרִים שֶׁבֵּין בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בַּסְּעוּדָה. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיּוֹם, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַיּוֹם גּוֹרֵם לַיַּיִן שֶׁיָּבֹא, וּכְבָר קִידֵּשׁ הַיּוֹם וַעֲדַיִין יַיִן לֹא בָּא.
human_translation: The Sages taught matters between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel with regard to a meal. Beit Shammai say: one recites a blessing over the day and thereafter recites a blessing over the wine, because the day causes the wine to come The day has been sanctified and the wine has not yet come.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Matters between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel regarding the meal. Beit Shammai say: One blesses over the day, and afterwards blesses over the wine — because the day causes the wine to come, and the day has already been sanctified, yet the wine has not yet come.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיַּיִן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַיּוֹם — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַיַּיִן גּוֹרֵם לְקִידּוּשׁ שֶׁתֵּאָמֵר. דָּבָר אַחֵר: בִּרְכַּת הַיַּיִן תְּדִירָה וּבִרְכַּת הַיּוֹם אֵינָהּ תְּדִירָה. תָּדִיר וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ תָּדִיר — תָּדִיר קוֹדֵם. וְהִילְכְתָא כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: One recites the blessing over the wine and thereafter recites a blessing over the day, because the wine causes kiddush to be recited. Alternatively, the blessing over wine is frequently and the blessing over the day is not frequently, a frequent and an infrequent the frequent takes precedence And halakha in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: The House of Hillel says: One blesses over the wine, and afterwards blesses over the day - because the wine causes the sanctification to be said. Another explanation: The blessing over the wine is frequent, and the blessing over the day is not frequent. When something frequent and something not frequent occur together, the frequent one takes precedence. And the halakha is in accordance with the words of the House of Hillel.

hebrew_text: מַאי דָּבָר אַחֵר? וְכִי תֵּימָא הָתָם תַּרְתֵּי וְהָכָא חֲדָא — הָכָא נָמֵי תַּרְתֵּי נִינְהוּ: תָּדִיר וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ תָּדִיר — תָּדִיר קוֹדֵם.
human_translation: What is alternatively? And if you say there two and here one; they are two a frequent and an infrequent the frequent takes precedence
llm_translation: What is the other matter? And if you say there are two there and here one - here they are considered as two: Frequent and infrequent - frequent takes precedence.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל: פְּשִׁיטָא, דְּהָא נְפַיק בַּת קוֹל! אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: קוֹדֶם בַּת קוֹל,
human_translation: And halakha in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel. obvious as a Divine Voice emerged If you wish, say before the Divine Voice
llm_translation: The halakha follows the words of Beit Hillel. It is obvious, for a heavenly voice came out! If you will say: "Before the heavenly voice,"

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְאַחַר בַּת קוֹל, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין בְּבַת קוֹל.
human_translation: if you wish, say after the Divine Voice Rabbi Yehoshua, who said one disregards a Divine Voice
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "After the bat kol," and Rabbi Yehoshua it is, for he said: "We do not pay attention to a bat kol."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הֵבִיאוּ לְפָנָיו, מְטַבֵּל בַּחֲזֶרֶת עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְפַרְפֶּרֶת הַפַּת. הֵבִיאוּ לְפָנָיו מַצָּה וַחֲזֶרֶת וַחֲרוֹסֶת וּשְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין חֲרוֹסֶת מִצְוָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר (בֶּן) צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: מִצְוָה. וּבְמִקְדָּשׁ הָיוּ מְבִיאִין לְפָנָיו גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל פֶּסַח.
human_translation: brought before He dips the ḥazeret before he reaches the the bread, They brought before him matza and and ḥaroset , and two cooked dishes although ḥaroset is not a mitzva Rabbi Eliezer ben Tzadok says: a mitzva And in the Temple they brought before him the body of the Paschal lamb.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: They brought before him, he dips in lettuce until he reaches the end of the piece. They brought before him matzah, lettuce, charoset, and two cooked dishes, even though charoset is not a mitzvah. Rabbi Eliezer (ben) Zadok says: It is a mitzvah. And in the Temple, they would bring before him the body of the Paschal lamb.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת מִצְוֹת צְרִיכוֹת כַּוּוֹנָה. כֵּיוָן דְּלָא בְּעִידָּן חִיּוּבָא דְּמָרוֹר הוּא דְּאָכֵיל לֵיהּ, בְּ״בוֹרֵא פְּרִי הָאֲדָמָה״ הוּא דְּאָכֵיל לֵיהּ. וְדִילְמָא לָא אִיכַּוַּון לְמָרוֹר, הִלְכָּךְ בָּעֵי לְמֶהְדַּר לְאַטְבּוֹלֵי לְשֵׁם מָרוֹר. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מִצְוָה לָא בָּעֲיָא כַּוּוֹנָה, לְמָה לָךְ תְּרֵי טִיבּוּלֵי? וְהָא טַבֵּיל לֵיהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא!
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: That is to say mitzvot require intent. since one does not eat at the time of his obligation to bitter herbs, Who creates fruit of the ground. And perhaps he did not intend bitter herbs, therefore needs to dip it again for the purpose of bitter herbs. For if it could enter your mind mitzvot do not require intent, why do you two dippings? But he dipped once.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Reish Lakish: This means commandments require intention. Since it is not at the time of the obligation of eating bitter herbs that one eats it, it is at "Who creates the fruit of the earth" that one eats it. And perhaps it is not suitable for bitter herbs, therefore one needs to enhance it by soaking it in vinegar for the sake of bitterness. For if you think that a commandment does not require intention, why do you need two immersions? Rather, immerse it once!

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא: לְעוֹלָם מִצְוֹת אֵין צְרִיכוֹת כַּוּוֹנָה, וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ תְּרֵי טִיבּוּלֵי לְמָה לִי? כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֶיהְוֵי הֶיכֵּירָא לְתִינוֹקוֹת.
human_translation: From where Perhaps actually mitzvot do not require intent. And that which you said, why do I two dippings, so that there be a conspicuous for the children,
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps: Always commandments not require intention, and you say two immersion why to me? So that it should be recognizable to children.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵימָא: אִם כֵּן לַישְׁמְעִינַן שְׁאָר יְרָקוֹת? אִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן שְׁאָר יְרָקוֹת, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא שְׁאָר יְרָקוֹת הוּא דְּבָעֵינַן תְּרֵי טִיבּוּלֵי, אֲבָל חֲזֶרֶת לְחוֹדֵהּ לָא בָּעֵי תְּרֵי טִיבּוּלֵי, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ חֲזֶרֶת בָּעֵינַן תְּרֵי טִיבּוּלֵי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֶיהְוֵי בֵּיהּ הֶיכֵּירָא לְתִינוֹקוֹת.
human_translation: And if you say: so, let teach us other vegetables taught us other vegetables, I would have said where there are other vegetables that one requires two dippings, however, only ḥazeret , he does not require two dippings, teaches us even ḥazeret he requires two dippings, so that there be a conspicuous for the children.
llm_translation: And if you will say: If so, should we also include other vegetables? If we include other vegetables, I would say: Where there are other vegetables, we require two immersions, but lettuce, we do not require two immersions. It teaches us that even if lettuce, we require two immersions, so that it should be recognizable to children.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד תַּנְיָא: אֲכָלָן דְּמַאי — יָצָא. אֲכָלָן בְּלֹא מִתְכַּוֵּין — יָצָא. אֲכָלָן לַחֲצָאִין — יָצָא.
human_translation: And furthermore, it was taught one ate doubtfully tithed produce, he has fulfilled he ate them without intent he has fulfilled If he ate them in halves, he has fulfilled
llm_translation: And furthermore it was taught: Those who ate produce of what is subject to the question of ma'aser — have fulfilled their obligation. Those who ate without separating terumah and ma'aser — have fulfilled their obligation. Those who ate produce in halves — have fulfilled their obligation.

hebrew_text: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁהֶא בֵּין אֲכִילָה לַחֲבֶירְתָּהּ יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס!
human_translation: And provided that he does not pause between eating the other more than the time it takes to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: And only not should sit between eating to her friend more than the amount of eating half a loaf!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁטִּיבֵּל בַּחֲזֶרֶת — מִצְוָה לְהָבִיא לְפָנָיו חֲזֶרֶת וַחֲרוֹסֶת וּשְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין.
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it was taught Rabbi Yosei says: Although one dipped the ḥazeret a mitzva to bring before him ḥazeret and ḥaroset , and two cooked dishes.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei says: Even though one has a dish of vegetables before him, it is a mitzvah to bring before him vegetables, lettuce, and two cooked dishes.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִצְוֹת אֵין צְרִיכוֹת כַּוּוֹנָה, וְהַאי דְּבָעֵינַן תְּרֵי טִיבּוּלֵי כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתִיהְוֵי הֶיכֵּירָא לְתִינוֹקוֹת. אִם כֵּן, מַאי ״מִצְוָה״?!
human_translation: And still from where Perhaps Rabbi Yosei maintains mitzvot do not require intent, and that we require two dippings is so that there be a conspicuous for the children. If so, what mitzva?
llm_translation: And what is the reason? Perhaps Rabbi Yosei holds that mitzvot do not require intention, and this case where we need two immersions, how will it be recognizable to infants? If so, what is "mitzvah"?!

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: סִילְקָא וְאָרוֹזָא. רָבָא הֲוָה מְיהַדַּר אַסִּילְקָא וְאָרוֹזָא הוֹאִיל וְנָפֵיק מִפּוּמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא.
human_translation: What two cooked foods Rav Huna said: Beets and rice. Rava would seek beets and rice since came from Rav Huna’s mouth.
llm_translation: What is "two dishes"? Rav Huna said: Silka and Aruza. Rava used to honor Silka and Aruza because they came from the mouth of Rav Huna.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, לֵית דְּחָיֵישׁ לְהָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אוֹמֵר: אוֹרֶז מִין דָּגָן הוּא וְחַיָּיבִין עַל חִימּוּצוֹ כָּרֵת, וְאָדָם יוֹצֵא בּוֹ יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בַּפֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Learn from of Rav Huna, no who is concerned about that of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri. As it was taught in Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: Rice is a type of grain and one is liable karet for its leavened and one fulfills his obligation with it on Passover,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Learn a lesson from the ruling of Rav Huna, that one should not be concerned about the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri. As it was taught: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says: Rice is a type of grain, and one is liable for its leavening with karet, and a person fulfills his obligation with it on Passover.

hebrew_text: חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ דָּג וּבֵיצָה שֶׁעָלָיו. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: צָרִיךְ שְׁנֵי מִינֵי בָשָׂר, אֶחָד זֵכֶר לַפֶּסַח, וְאֶחָד זֵכֶר לַחֲגִיגָה. רָבִינָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ גַּרְמָא וּבִישּׁוּלָא.
human_translation: Ḥizkiya said: even fish and egg that on it. Rav Yosef said: requires two types of meat one in remembrance of the Paschal lamb and one in remembrance of the Festival Ravina said: even the bone gravy
llm_translation: Hezekiah said: Even a fish and an egg upon it. Rav Yosef said: Two types of meat are required, one in remembrance of the Passover, and one in remembrance of the festival offering. Ravina said: Even a bone and a cooked dish.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא שְׁאָר יְרָקוֹת, מְבָרֵךְ אַשְּׁאָר יְרָקוֹת ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הָאֲדָמָה״ וְאָכֵיל, וַהֲדַר מְבָרֵךְ ״עַל אֲכִילַת מָרוֹר״ וְאָכֵיל.
human_translation: obvious where there are other vegetables one recites over other vegetables the blessing: Who creates fruit of the ground, and eats, And then, he recites the blessing: eating bitter herbs, and eats
llm_translation: The Gemara: It is obvious, where there are other vegetables, one recites the blessing "borei peri ha'adama" over the other vegetables and eats, then afterwards recites the blessing "al achilat maror" and eats.

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא אֶלָּא חַסָּא, מַאי? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מְבָרֵךְ מֵעִיקָּרָא אַמָּרוֹר ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הָאֲדָמָה״ וְאָכֵיל, וּלְבַסּוֹף מְבָרֵךְ עֲלֵיהּ ״עַל אֲכִילַת מָרוֹר״ וְאָכֵיל.
human_translation: what is where there is only lettuce Rav Huna said: One initially recites the blessing: Who creates fruit of the ground, over the bitter herbs, and eats And ultimately, one recites the blessing: eating bitter herbs, over and eats
llm_translation: Here where there is only lettuce, what? Said Rav Huna: One blesses initially "Who creates the fruit of the ground" and eats, and ultimately blesses over it "for the eating of bitter herbs" and eats.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: לְאַחַר שֶׁמִּילֵּא כְּרֵיסוֹ הֵימֶנּוּ חוֹזֵר וּמְבָרֵךְ עֲלֵיהּ? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מֵעִיקָּרָא מְבָרֵךְ עֲלֵיהּ ״בּוֹרֵא פְּרִי הָאֲדָמָה״ וְ״עַל אֲכִילַת מָרוֹר״ וְאָכֵיל, וּלְבַסּוֹף אָכֵיל אֲכִילַת חַסָּא בְּלֹא בְּרָכָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda strongly objects to this after one fills his belly with he then recites blessing over it? Rather, Rav Ḥisda said: Initially one recites blessings over Who creates fruit of the ground, and: eating bitter herbs, and he eats and later he eats lettuce without a blessing.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Ḥisdah objects to her: After he has filled his stomach like a sieve, he returns and recites a blessing over it? Rather, Rav Ḥisdah said: Initially, he recites a blessing over it with "Who creates the fruit of the earth" and "over the eating of bitter herbs," and he eats. And in the end, he eats the meal of the Paschal lamb without a blessing.

hebrew_text: בְּסוּרְיָא עָבְדִי כְּרַב הוּנָא, וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עָבֵיד כְּרַב חִסְדָּא. וְהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא. רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מְהַדַּר אַשְּׁאָר יְרָקוֹת לְאַפּוֹקֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ מִפְּלוּגְתָּא.
human_translation: In Syria, they act in accordance with Rav Huna. And Rav Sheshet, son Rav Yehoshua, acted in accordance with Rav Ḥisda. And the halakha is in accordance with Rav Ḥisda. Rav Aḥa, son Rava, would seek other vegetables to preclude himself from the dispute.
llm_translation: In Suria, the servants of Rav Huna, and Rav Sheshet son of Rav Yehoshua, acted in accordance with the rulings of Rav Chisda. And the halakha follows the opinion of Rav Chisda. Rav Acha, son of Rava, would set aside vegetables to refresh himself from the dispute.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: אָמַר לִי רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן, הָכִי אָמַר הִלֵּל מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּגְמָרָא: לָא נִיכְרוֹךְ אִינִישׁ מַצָּה וּמָרוֹר בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי וְנֵיכוֹל, מִשּׁוּם דִּסְבִירָא לַן מַצָּה בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמָרוֹר דְּרַבָּנַן, וְאָתֵי מָרוֹר דְּרַבָּנַן וּמְבַטֵּיל לֵיהּ לְמַצָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Ravina said: Rav Mesharshiya, son Rav Natan, said to me Hillel said as follows, citing tradition: A person not wrap matza and bitter herbs together and eat because today, matza by Torah and bitter herbs by rabbinic And bitter herbs, by rabbinic come and nullify matza , by Torah
llm_translation: Ravina said: Rav Mesharshaya, son of Rav Natan, told me the following in the name of Hillel from the tradition: A person should not wrap matzah and maror together and eat them, because we hold that matzah is from the Torah, and maror is from the Rabbis. And the maror from the Rabbis comes and nullifies the matzah from the Torah.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: מִצְוֹת אֵין מְבַטְּלוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ, הָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא אוֹ דְּרַבָּנַן בִּדְרַבָּנַן, אֲבָל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא וּדְרַבָּנַן — אָתֵי דְּרַבָּנַן וּמְבַטֵּיל לֵיהּ לִדְאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: And even according to the one who says mitzvot do not nullify each other, that by Torah with by Torah by rabbinic with by rabbinic However, by Torah with by rabbinic by rabbinic comes and nullifies by Torah
llm_translation: And even according to the one who says: Mitzvot do not annul one another, these matters of Torah law with Torah law or Rabbinic law with Rabbinic law, but Torah law and Rabbinic law - Rabbinic law comes and annuls it to Torah law.

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ מִצְוֹת אֵין מְבַטְּלוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ? הִלֵּל הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל הִלֵּל שֶׁהָיָה כּוֹרְכָן בְּבַת אַחַת וְאוֹכְלָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל מַצּוֹת וּמְרוֹרִים יֹאכְלוּהוּ״.
human_translation: Who is the tanna that you heard mitzvot do not nullify each other? It is Hillel, as it was taught They said about Hillel that he would wrap together and eat them, as it is stated: “They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs”
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that holds that mitzvot do not nullify each other? Hillel. As it was taught: They said about Hillel that he used to wrap them together and eat them, as it is stated: "They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חוֹלְקִין עָלָיו חֲבֵירָיו עַל הִלֵּל. דְּתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל יְהֵא כּוֹרְכָן בְּבַת אַחַת וְאוֹכְלָן כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהִלֵּל אוֹכְלָן, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל מַצּוֹת וּמְרוֹרִים יֹאכְלוּהוּ״, אֲפִילּוּ זֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְזֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: אִי הָכִי, מַאי אֲפִילּוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: colleagues disagree with him, as it was taught might one wrap together and eat them in the manner that Hillel eats them; the verse states: “They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs,” even this, by itself, and that, by themselves. Rav Ashi strongly objects to this If so, what even
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: His colleagues argue with him regarding Hillel. As it was taught: Is it possible that one should wrap them together and eat them in the manner that Hillel eats them? The verse teaches: "They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs." Even if this one is by itself and that one is by itself. Rav Ashe challenges him: If so, what then?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, הַאי תַּנָּא הָכִי קָתָנֵי: יָכוֹל לֹא יָצָא בְּהוּ יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן כּוֹרְכָן בְּבַת אַחַת וְאוֹכְלָן כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהִלֵּל אוֹכְלָן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל מַצּוֹת וּמְרוֹרִים יֹאכְלוּהוּ״ — אֲפִילּוּ זֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְזֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: This is what this tanna is teaching: might one fulfills his obligation with them only if he wraps together and eats them in the manner that Hillel eats them. the verse states: “They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs,” even by itself and by themselves.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said, this Mishnah teaches thus: One may not fulfill his obligation unless he wraps them together in one matzah and eats them as Hillel would eat them. The Talmud teaches: "They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs" - even this one by itself and that one by itself.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָא אִיתְּמַר הִלְכְתָא לָא כְּהִלֵּל וְלָא כְּרַבָּנַן, מְבָרֵךְ ״עַל אֲכִילַת מַצָּה״ וְאָכֵיל, וַהֲדַר מְבָרֵךְ ״עַל אֲכִילַת מָרוֹר״ וְאָכֵיל, וַהֲדַר אָכֵיל מַצָּה וְחַסָּא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי בְּלֹא בְּרָכָה זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ, כְּהִלֵּל.
human_translation: Now that the halakha was stated neither in accordance with Hillel nor in accordance with the Rabbis, recites the blessing: eating matza , and eats And then he recites the blessing: over eating bitter herbs, and eats And then he eats matza and lettuce together without a blessing in remembrance of the Temple, in the manner of Hillel
llm_translation: The case where it was not stated, the halakha is not like Hillel and not like Rabbanan, one blesses "al achilat matzah" and eats, then afterwards blesses "al achilat maror" and eats, then eats matzah and charoset together without a blessing, in remembrance of the Temple, like Hillel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: כׇּל שֶׁטִּיבּוּלוֹ בְּמַשְׁקֶה — צָרִיךְ נְטִילַת יָדַיִם. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, הַאי חַסָּא
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said Rav Oshaya said: Anything that is dipped in a liquid requires washing of hands. Rav Pappa said: Learn from that this lettuce
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rav Oshaya: Anyone whose fingers are wet with liquid - requires washing of the hands. Rav Papa said: Learn from this, this is the ruling.

hebrew_text: צְרִיךְ לְשַׁקּוֹעֵיהּ בַּחֲרוֹסֶת, מִשּׁוּם קָפָא. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לָא צְרִיךְ לְשַׁקּוֹעֵיהּ — נְטִילַת יָדַיִם לְמָה לִי? הָא לָא נָגַע! וְדִילְמָא לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: לָא צְרִיךְ לְשַׁקּוֹעֵיהּ, וְקָפָא מֵרֵיחָא מָיֵית. אֶלָּא לְמָה לִי נְטִילַת יָדַיִם — דִּילְמָא מְשַׁקְּעוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: must submerge it in the ḥaroset , due to poison For if it could enter your mind need not submerge why do I wash hands He did not touch Actually, I will say to you: need not submerge and poison dies. from the smell But why do I washing of hands Perhaps one will submerge
llm_translation: One must rinse it in earthenware due to the vinegar. For if it enters your mind that it is not necessary to rinse it - "Why do I need to wash my hands? It did not touch!" But perhaps I will say to you: It is not necessary to rinse it, and the vinegar neutralizes the smell. So why do I need to wash my hands - perhaps they have soaked in it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא נִישַׁהֵי אִינִישׁ מָרוֹר בַּחֲרוֹסֶת, דִּילְמָא אַגַּב חַלְיֵיהּ דְּתַבְלִין מְבַטֵּיל לֵיהּ לִמְרוֹרֵיהּ, וּבָעֵינַן טַעַם מָרוֹר, וְלֵיכָּא. אַדְבְּרֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַבָּנָא עוּקְבָא, וּדְרַשׁ: נָטַל יָדָיו בְּטִיבּוּל רִאשׁוֹן — נוֹטֵל יָדָיו בְּטִיבּוּל שְׁנֵי.
human_translation: And Rav Pappa said: A person not leave bitter herbs in the ḥaroset lest the sweetness nullify its bitterness. And require a taste, and not Rav Ḥisda authorized Rabbana Ukva and he taught: washed his hands for the first dipping, wash his hands for the second dipping.
llm_translation: And Rav Papa said: A person should not soak the maror in the charoset, lest the spices nullify its bitterness due to his illness, and we require the taste of bitterness, and it is not there. Rav Chisda spoke to Rabbana Ukva, and expounded: If he immersed his hands in the first washing - he should immerse his hands in the second washing.

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: הָא בְּעָלְמָא אִיתְּמַר. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ הָכָא אִיתְּמַר, לְמָה לִי נְטִילַת יָדַיִם תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי? הָא מְשָׁא לֵיהּ יְדֵיהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא!
human_translation: The Sages said before Rav Pappa was stated generally, For if it could enter your mind was stated here, why do I washing of hands twice? has washed his hands once.
llm_translation: The sages said before Rav Papa: This is a matter of the world. For if your intention is stated here, why do I need to wash my hands twice? He should wash his hands once!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב פָּפָּא: אַדְּרַבָּה, הָכָא אִיתְּמַר. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בְּעָלְמָא אִיתְּמַר, לְמָה לִי תְּרֵי טִיבּוּלֵי?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to them: On the contrary, was stated here, For if it could enter your mind was stated in general, why do I two dippings?
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Papa: "Adrabah, here it was stated. For if your mind is set on the world, why do I need two seasonings?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי, הָכָא אִיתְּמַר? נְטִילַת יָדַיִם תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי לְמָה לִי? הָא מְשָׁא לֵיהּ יְדֵיהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא! אָמְרִי: כֵּיוָן דְּבָעֵי לְמֵימַר אַגָּדְתָּא וְהַלֵּילָא, דִּילְמָא אַסּוֹחֵי אַסְּחֵיהּ לְדַעְתֵּיהּ וּנְגַע.
human_translation: Rather, what was stated here, why do I two washings of hands? He has washed his hands once. They say Since he needs to recite Haggadah and hallel perhaps he will divert his thoughts and will touch
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason it is stated here? Washing hands two times, why do I need? This one washes his hands one time! They said: Since he wants to say Aggadta and Halilah, perhaps he will touch his private parts and touch.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בָּלַע מַצָּה — יָצָא, בָּלַע מָרוֹר — לֹא יָצָא. בָּלַע מַצָּה וּמָרוֹר, יְדֵי מַצָּה — יָצָא, יְדֵי מָרוֹר — לֹא יָצָא. כְּרָכָן בְּסִיב וּבְלָעָן — אַף יְדֵי מַצָּה נָמֵי לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: Rava said: one swallowed matza he has fulfilled one swallowed bitter herbs he has not fulfilled one swallowed matza and bitter herbs he has fulfilled of matza , he has not fulfilled of bitter herbs. wrapped in net, and swallowed them, he has not fulfilled even of eating matza .
llm_translation: Rava said: One who swallows matzah - has fulfilled the obligation, one who swallows maror - has not fulfilled the obligation. One who swallows matzah and maror, the hands of matzah - has fulfilled the obligation, the hands of maror - has not fulfilled the obligation. If one wraps them together and swallows them - even the hands of matzah also have not fulfilled the obligation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: מַצָּה לִפְנֵי כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, מָרוֹר לִפְנֵי כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, וַחֲרוֹסֶת לִפְנֵי כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד. וְאֵין עוֹקְרִין אֶת הַשֻּׁלְחָן אֶלָּא לִפְנֵי מִי שֶׁאוֹמֵר הַגָּדָה.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: Matza before each and every bitter herbs before each and every and ḥaroset before each and every And one remove the table only from before the one reciting Haggadah.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashe said: Matzah before each and every one, maror before each and every one, and charoset before each and every one. And we do not remove the table except before the one who says the Haggadah.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא אוֹמֵר: כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי לִפְנֵי מִי שֶׁאוֹמֵר הַגָּדָה. וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרַב הוּנָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: All also before the one who recites Haggadah. And the halakha is in accordance with Rav Huna.
llm_translation: Rav Huna says: All of them are considered as if said before the One who says the Hagadah. And the halakha is according to Rav Huna.

hebrew_text: לָמָּה עוֹקְרִין אֶת הַשּׁוּלְחָן? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּכִּירוּ תִּינוֹקוֹת וְיִשְׁאֲלוּ. אַבָּיֵי הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה, חֲזָא דְּקָא מַדְלִי תַּכָּא מִקַּמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: עֲדַיִין לָא קָא אָכְלִינַן, אָתוּ קָא מְעַקְּרִי תַּכָּא מִיקַּמַּן?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה: פְּטַרְתַּן מִלּוֹמַר ״מָה נִּשְׁתַּנָּה״.
human_translation: Why does one remove the table? The school of Rabbi Yannai say: So that the children will notice and they will ask: Abaye was sitting before Rabba He saw that they were removing the table from before him, and he said to We have not yet eaten, and you are taking the table away from us? Rabba said to him: You have exempted us from reciting Why is different [ ma nishtana ],
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why do they uproot the table? The house of Rabbi Yannai said: So that children will recognize and ask. Abbaye was sitting before Rabba, he saw that he was removing a dish from before him, he said to them: We have not yet eaten, why are you uprooting the dish from before us?! Rabba said to him: You exempted us from saying "What has changed."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: ״לֶחֶם עוֹנִי״ כְּתִיב — לֶחֶם שֶׁעוֹנִין עָלָיו דְּבָרִים. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״לֶחֶם עוֹנִי״ — לֶחֶם שֶׁעוֹנִין עָלָיו דְּבָרִים הַרְבֵּה. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״לֶחֶם עוֹנִי״ — ״עֹנִי״ כְּתִיב, מָה עָנִי שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ בִּפְרוּסָה,
human_translation: Shmuel said “The bread of affliction [ leḥem oni ]” bread over which one answers [ onim ] matters, That was also taught Leḥem oni bread over which one answers many matters. Alternatively, “ leḥem oni ” is written Just as the manner of a poor to a piece
llm_translation: Samuel said: "Poor man's bread" is written - bread that people speak words about it. It was also taught similarly: "Poor man's bread" - bread that people speak many words about it. Another explanation: "Poor man's bread" - "poor" is written, just as a poor person whose way is in the marketplace,

hebrew_text: אַף כָּאן בִּפְרוּסָה. דָּבָר אַחֵר: מָה דַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל עָנִי הוּא מַסִּיק וְאִשְׁתּוֹ אוֹפָה, אַף כָּאן נָמֵי — הוּא מַסִּיק וְאִשְׁתּוֹ אוֹפָה.
human_translation: so too, here a piece Alternatively: Just as the manner of a poor person he heats and his wife bakes so too here; he heats the oven and his wife bakes
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "Also here in P'rusah. Another explanation: What is the way of a poor person? He gathers and his wife bakes, so too here - he gathers and his wife bakes."

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין חֲרוֹסֶת מִצְוָה. וְאִי לָא מִצְוָה, מִשּׁוּם מַאי מַיְיתֵי לַהּ? אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מִשּׁוּם קָפָא. אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: קָפָא דְחַסָּא — חָמָא. קָפָא דְּחָמָא — כַּרָּתֵי. [קָפָא דְכַרָּתֵי — חַמִּימֵי.] קָפָא דְּכוּלְּהוּ — חַמִּימֵי. אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי, נֵימָא הָכִי: ״קָפָא קָפָא, דְּכִירְנָא לָךְ וּלְשַׁב בְּנָתָיךְ וּלְתַמְנֵי כַּלָּתָךְ״.
human_translation: although ḥaroset is not a mitzva. And if is not a mitzva, for what bring it Rabbi Ami said: due to poison Rav Asi said: poison in lettuce a radish. for the poison in a radish leeks. the poison in leeks hot for the poison in all hot In the meantime, let him say Poison, poison, I remember you, and your seven daughters, and your eight daughters-in-law.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even though there is no obligation of charoset, and if not an obligation, for what purpose is it brought? Rabbi Ammi said: For the sake of the apple. Rav Assi said: The apple of desire is heat. The apple of heat is like a beam. The apple of like a beam is hot water. The apple of all of them is like hot water. Nevertheless, it is said thus: "Apple, apple, we have prepared for you and for your daughters-in-law and for your daughters-in-law's daughters."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר מִצְוָה וְכוּ׳. מַאי מִצְוָה? רַבִּי לֵוִי אוֹמֵר: זֵכֶר לַתַּפּוּחַ. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: זֵכֶר לַטִּיט. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִלְכָּךְ צְרִיךְ לְקַהוֹיֵיהּ וּצְרִיךְ לְסַמּוֹכֵיהּ. לְקַהוֹיֵיהּ — זֵכֶר לַתַּפּוּחַ, וּצְרִיךְ לְסַמּוֹכֵיהּ — זֵכֶר לַטִּיט.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says a mitzva. What mitzva? Rabbi Levi says: in remembrance of the apple, And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: in remembrance of the mortar Abaye said: Therefore, must tart and must thick. tart in remembrance of the apple, and must thick in remembrance of the mortar.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: "Mitzvah, etc." What is the mitzvah? Rabbi Levi says: "A memorial for the apple." And Rabbi Yochanan says: "A memorial for the clay." Abaye said: Therefore, one must establish it and support it. To establish it - a memorial for the apple, and to support it - a memorial for the clay.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תַּבְלִין זֵכֶר לַתֶּבֶן, חֲרוֹסֶת זֵכֶר לַטִּיט. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק, כָּךְ הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים תַּגָּרֵי חָרָךְ שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם: בּוֹאוּ וּטְלוּ לָכֶם תַּבְלִין לְמִצְוָה.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan: spices in remembrance of the hay ḥaroset is in remembrance of the mortar. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: the small shopkeepers in Jerusalem would say as follows: Come and take spices for yourselves for mitzva.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan: Spice is reminiscent of straw, clay is reminiscent of mud. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said, "This is what they used to say in the spice markets of Jerusalem: 'Come and take spices for the commandment.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָזְגוּ לוֹ כּוֹס שֵׁנִי וְכָאן הַבֵּן שׁוֹאֵל אָבִיו. וְאִם אֵין דַּעַת בַּבֵּן אָבִיו מְלַמְּדוֹ.
human_translation: poured the second cup for and here the son asks his father And if the son does not have the intelligence his father teaches him
llm_translation: They taught: They pour for him a second cup, and here the son asks his father. And if the son does not have knowledge, his father teaches him.

hebrew_text: מָה נִשְׁתַּנָּה הַלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה מִכׇּל הַלֵּילוֹת. שֶׁבְּכָל הַלֵּילוֹת אָנוּ אוֹכְלִין חָמֵץ וּמַצָּה, הַלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה — כּוּלּוֹ מַצָּה. שֶׁבְּכָל הַלֵּילוֹת אָנוּ אוֹכְלִין שְׁאָר יְרָקוֹת, הַלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה — מָרוֹר. שֶׁבְּכָל הַלֵּילוֹת אָנוּ אוֹכְלִין בָּשָׂר צָלִי שָׁלוּק וּמְבוּשָּׁל, הַלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה — כּוּלּוֹ צָלִי. שֶׁבְּכָל הַלֵּילוֹת אָנוּ מַטְבִּילִין פַּעַם אֶחָת, הַלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה — שְׁתֵּי פְעָמִים.
human_translation: Why is this night different from all other nights? As on all other nights we eat leavened bread and matza on this night all matza . As on all other nights we eat other vegetables; on this night bitter herbs. As on all other nights we eat roasted, stewed, cooked meat, on this night all roasted As on all other nights we dip once; on this night twice.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What is different about this night from all other nights? For on all other nights we eat chametz and matzah, but on this night, only matzah. On all other nights we eat any kind of herbs, but on this night, bitter herbs. On all other nights we eat roasted, stewed, or boiled meat, but on this night, only roasted. On all other nights we dip once, but on this night, twice." English translation:

hebrew_text: וּלְפִי דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בֵּן אָבִיו מְלַמְּדוֹ. מַתְחִיל בִּגְנוּת וּמְסַיֵּים בְּשֶׁבַח. וְדוֹרֵשׁ מֵ״אֲרַמִּי אוֹבֵד אָבִי״, עַד שֶׁיִּגְמוֹר כׇּל הַפָּרָשָׁה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: And according to the intelligence of son, his father teaches him He begins with disgrace and concludes with glory. And he expounds from “An Aramean tried to destroy my father” until he concludes the entire section.
llm_translation: According to the opinion of his father, he teaches him. He begins with rebuke and ends with praise. And he expounds from "My father was a wandering Aramean" until the entire portion is completed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חָכָם בְּנוֹ — שׁוֹאֲלוֹ. וְאִם אֵינוֹ חָכָם — אִשְׁתּוֹ שׁוֹאַלְתּוֹ, וְאִם לָאו — הוּא שׁוֹאֵל לְעַצְמוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁיּוֹדְעִין בְּהִלְכוֹת הַפֶּסַח — שׁוֹאֲלִין זֶה לָזֶה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: his son is wise asks him. And if he is not wise, his wife asks him. And if not he asks himself. And even two Torah scholars who know the halakhot of Passover ask each other.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A wise person, his son asks him. And if he is not wise, his wife asks him. And if not, he asks himself. And even two Torah scholars who are knowledgeable in the laws of Passover, they ask each other.

hebrew_text: מָה נִשְׁתַּנָּה הַלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה מִכׇּל הַלֵּילוֹת, שֶׁבְּכָל הַלֵּילוֹת אָנוּ מַטְבִּילִין פַּעַם אֶחָת, הַלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה — שְׁתֵּי פְעָמִים. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: אַטּוּ כׇּל יוֹמָא לָא סַגִּיא דְּלָא מְטַבְּלָא חֲדָא זִימְנָא? אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: שֶׁבְּכָל הַלֵּילוֹת אֵין אָנוּ חַיָּיבִין לְטַבֵּל אֲפִילּוּ פַּעַם אֶחָת, הַלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה — שְׁתֵּי פְעָמִים.
human_translation: Why is this night different from all other nights? As on all other nights we dip once; on this night twice. Rava strongly objects to this Is that to say every day there is no alternative dip once? Rather, Rava said this is what is teaching: As on all other nights we are not obligated to dip even once; on this night twice.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What is different about this night from all other nights, that on all other nights we dip once, but on this night we dip twice." Rava objects: "Is it not sufficient every day that we do not dip even once? Rather, Rava said, this is what it means: On all other nights we are not obligated to dip even once, but on this night we dip twice."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב סָפְרָא: חִיּוּבָא לְדַרְדְּקֵי?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֵין אָנוּ מַטְבִּילִין אֲפִילּוּ פַּעַם אֶחָת, הַלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה — שְׁתֵּי פְעָמִים.
human_translation: Rav Safra strongly objects to this obligatory for the children? Rather, Rav Safra said this is what is teaching: We do not dip even once; on this night twice.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Safra objected to her: An obligation for fine flour?! Rather, Rav Safra said, thus it was taught: We do not immerse even once, this night - two times.

hebrew_text: מַתְחִיל בִּגְנוּת וּמְסַיֵּים בְּשֶׁבַח. מַאי בִּגְנוּת? רַב אָמַר: ״מִתְּחִלָּה עוֹבְדֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הָיוּ אֲבוֹתֵינוּ״. [וּשְׁמוּאֵל] אָמַר: ״עֲבָדִים הָיִינוּ״.
human_translation: begins with disgrace and concludes with glory. What With disgrace? Rav said At first our forefathers were idol worshippers, And Shmuel said: We were slaves.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: One begins with disgrace and concludes with praise. What is meant by "disgrace"? Rav said: "At first, our ancestors were idolaters." And Shmuel said: "We were slaves." English translation:

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְדָרוּ עַבְדֵּיהּ: עַבְדָּא דְּמַפֵּיק לֵיהּ מָרֵיהּ לְחֵירוּת, וְיָהֵיב לֵיהּ כַּסְפָּא וְדַהֲבָא, מַאי בָּעֵי לְמֵימַר לֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בָּעֵי לְאוֹדוֹיֵי וּלְשַׁבּוֹחֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּטַרְתַּן מִלּוֹמַר ״מָה נִשְׁתַּנָּה״. פָּתַח וְאָמַר ״עֲבָדִים הָיִינוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to his servant, Daru: a slave who is freed by his master, who gives him gold and silver, what the slave say to him? said to him: He must thank and praise He said to him: you have exempted us from reciting Why is this different, began to recite: We were slaves.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman said to Daru his servant: The servant who brings his master to freedom, and his master gives him silver and gold, what should he say to him? He said to him: He should say words of thanks and praise. He said to him: You have exempted me from saying "How different." He began and said, "We were slaves."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָיָה אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁלֹּא אָמַר
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel would say: Anyone who did not say
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabban Gamliel would say: "Anyone who does not say"

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים אֵלּוּ בַּפֶּסַח לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: פֶּסַח, מַצָּה, וּמָרוֹר. פֶּסַח — עַל שׁוּם שֶׁפָּסַח הַמָּקוֹם עַל בָּתֵּי אֲבוֹתֵינוּ בְּמִצְרַיִם, [שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַאֲמַרְתֶּם זֶבַח פֶּסַח הוּא לַה׳ אֲשֶׁר פָּסַח וְגוֹ׳״].
human_translation: these three matters on Passover has not fulfilled his obligation: Paschal lamb, matza , and bitter herbs. Paschal lamb because the Omnipresent passed over [ pasaḥ ] the houses of our forefathers in Egypt, as it is stated: “That you shall say: It is the sacrifice of the Lord’s Paschal offering for He passed over
llm_translation: Three things these in Passover not fulfilled his obligation, and these they are: Passover, matzah, and bitter herbs. Passover — on account of that He passed over the houses of our ancestors in Egypt, as it is said: "And you shall say, 'It is a Passover sacrifice to the Lord, who passed over...'" (Exodus 12:27).

hebrew_text: מַצָּה — עַל שׁוּם שֶׁנִּגְאֲלוּ אֲבוֹתֵינוּ מִמִּצְרַיִם, [שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאפוּ אֶת הַבָּצֵק אֲשֶׁר הוֹצִיאוּ מִמִּצְרַיִם וְגוֹ׳״]. מָרוֹר — עַל שׁוּם שֶׁמֵּרְרוּ הַמִּצְרִיִּים אֶת חַיֵּי אֲבוֹתֵינוּ בְּמִצְרַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: [״וַיְמָרְרוּ אֶת חַיֵּיהֶם וְגוֹ׳״].
human_translation: matza because our forefathers were redeemed from Egypt, as it is stated: “And they baked the dough that they took out of Egypt bitter herbs because the Egyptians embittered our forefathers’ lives in Egypt, as it is stated: “And they embittered their lives
llm_translation: Matzah - on account of that our fathers were redeemed from Egypt, as it is said: "And they baked the dough which they brought out of Egypt, etc.". Maror - on account of that the Egyptians embittered the lives of our fathers in Egypt, as it is said: "And they embittered their lives, etc.".

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל דּוֹר וָדוֹר חַיָּיב אָדָם לִרְאוֹת אֶת עַצְמוֹ כְּאִילּוּ הוּא יָצָא מִמִּצְרַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִגַּדְתָּ לְבִנְךָ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא לֵאמֹר בַּעֲבוּר זֶה עָשָׂה ה׳ לִי בְּצֵאתִי מִמִּצְרָיִם״.
human_translation: In each and every generation a person must view himself as though he left Egypt, as it is stated: “And you shall tell your son on that day, saying: It is because of this which the Lord did for me when I came forth out of Egypt”
llm_translation: In every generation, a person is obligated to see themselves as if they personally left Egypt, as it is stated: "And you shall tell your child on that day, saying, 'It is because of this that the Lord did for me when I went out from Egypt.'"

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ אֲנַחְנוּ חַיָּיבִים לְהוֹדוֹת, לְהַלֵּל, לְשַׁבֵּחַ, לְפָאֵר, לְרוֹמֵם, לְהַדֵּר, לְבָרֵךְ, לְעַלֵּה וּלְקַלֵּס לְמִי שֶׁעָשָׂה לַאֲבוֹתֵינוּ וְלָנוּ אֶת כׇּל הַנִּסִּים הָאֵלּוּ. הוֹצִיאָנוּ מֵעַבְדוּת לְחֵרוּת, מִיָּגוֹן לְשִׂמְחָה, וּמֵאֵבֶל לְיוֹם טוֹב, וּמֵאֲפֵלָה לְאוֹר גָּדוֹל, וּמִשִּׁעְבּוּד לִגְאוּלָּה. וְנֹאמַר לְפָנָיו הַלְלוּיָהּ.
human_translation: Therefore we are obligated to thank, praise, glorify, extol, exalt, honor, bless, revere, and laud [ lekales ] the One who performed for our forefathers and for us all these miracles: He took us out from slavery to freedom, from sorrow to joy, from mourning to a Festival, from darkness to a great light, and from enslavement to redemption. And we will say before Him: Halleluya .
llm_translation: Therefore, we are obligated to thank, to praise, to glorify, to exalt, to honor, to extol, to bless, to elevate and to laud Him who performed all these miracles for our ancestors and for us. He brought us out from slavery to freedom, from sorrow to joy, from mourning to a festive day, from darkness to great light, and from servitude to redemption. And we shall say before Him, "Hallelujah."

hebrew_text: עַד הֵיכָן הוּא אוֹמֵר? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: עַד ״אֵם הַבָּנִים שְׂמֵחָה״. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עַד ״חַלָּמִישׁ לְמַעְיְנוֹ מָיִם״. וְחוֹתֵם בִּגְאוּלָּה. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲשֶׁר גְּאָלָנוּ וְגָאַל אֶת אֲבוֹתֵינוּ מִמִּצְרַיִם, וְלֹא הָיָה חוֹתֵם.
human_translation: Until where does one recite Beit Shammai say: Until a joyful mother of children, And Beit Hillel say: Until the flint into a fountain of waters” And one concludes with redemption. Rabbi Tarfon says Who redeemed us and redeemed our forefathers from Egypt, would not conclude
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Until where does he say? Beit Shammai says: Until "a mother of children is joyful." And Beit Hillel says: Until "a dreamer of dreams brings forth water." And he concludes with redemption. Rabbi Tarfon says: Who has redeemed us and redeemed our ancestors from Egypt, and did not conclude.
