hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״כֵּן ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵינוּ יַגִּיעֵנוּ לְמוֹעֲדִים וְלִרְגָלִים אֲחֵרִים הַבָּאִים לִקְרָאתֵנוּ לְשָׁלוֹם, שְׂמֵחִים בְּבִנְיַן עִירֶךָ, וְשָׂשִׂים בַּעֲבוֹדָתֶךְ. וְנֹאכַל שָׁם (מִן הַפְּסָחִים וּמִן הַזְּבָחִים) כּוּ׳״, עַד ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ גָּאַל יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says So too, the Lord our God and the God of our forefathers will bring us to future holidays and Festivals in peace, happy over the building of Your city and joyous in Your service. And there we will eat from the Paschal lamb and other offerings, etc., until: Blessed are You, Lord, Who redeemed Israel.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "So may the Lord our God and the God of our fathers bring us to the appointed times and to other festivals that come to meet us in peace, rejoicing in the building of Your city, and happy in Your service. And we shall eat there (from the Paschal offerings and from the sacrifices) until 'Blessed are You, Lord, Redeemer of Israel.'"

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״וְאוֹתָנוּ הוֹצִיא מִשָּׁם״. אָמַר רָבָא: מַצָּה — צָרִיךְ לְהַגְבִּיהַּ, וּמָרוֹר — צָרִיךְ לְהַגְבִּיהַּ. בָּשָׂר — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהַגְבִּיהַּ. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּרְאֶה כְּאוֹכֵל קָדָשִׁים בַּחוּץ.
human_translation: Rava said: must say: And He took us out from there. Rava said: matza he must lift bitter herbs, one must raise one need not raise meat. And not only that, but it appears as though he is eating sacrificial meat outside
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rava: needs that he will say "and us he brought out from there." Said Rava: matzah — needs to elevate it, and maror — needs to elevate it. Meat — not needs to elevate it. And not only that, but appears as one who eats holy things outside.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: סוֹמֵא פָּטוּר מִלּוֹמַר הַגָּדָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״בַּעֲבוּר זֶה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״בְּנֵנוּ זֶה״. מַה לְּהַלָּן — פְּרָט לְסוֹמֵא, אַף כָּאן — פְּרָט לְסוֹמִין.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: A blind is exempt from reciting Haggadah. it is written here, it is because of this and it was written there, “This son of ours Just as there, excludes a blind so too here, excludes blind
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: A blind person is exempt from reciting the Haggadah. It is written here, "for this," and it is written there, "for his son." Just as there, it excludes the blind person, so too here, it excludes the blind people.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר מָרִימָר, שְׁאֵלְתִּינְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּבֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאן דְּאָמַר אַגָּדְתָּא בֵּי רַב יוֹסֵף? אֲמַרוּ: רַב יוֹסֵף. מַאן דְּאָמַר אַגָּדְתָּא בֵּי רַב שֵׁשֶׁת? אָמְרוּ: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת. קָסָבְרִי רַבָּנַן, מַצָּה בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה — דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Mareimar say: I asked the Sages from the school of Rav Yosef, Who recited Haggadah in the house of Rav Yosef? They said Rav Yosef Who recited Haggadah in the house of Rav Sheshet, They said Rav Sheshet These Sages, maintain nowadays matza by rabbinic
llm_translation: I? And it was said by Marimar, I asked the Rabbis of the house of Rav Yosef: Who said the Aggadta of the house of Rav Yosef? They said: Rav Yosef. Who said the Aggadta of the house of Rav Sheshet? They said: Rav Sheshet. The Rabbis hold, Matzah nowadays — of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב סָבַר מַצָּה בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא? וְהָא רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב הוּא דְּאָמַר: מַצָּה בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה דְּרַבָּנַן! קָסָבַר: כֹּל דְּתַקּוּן רַבָּנַן — כְּעֵין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא תַּיקּוּן.
human_translation: by inference Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov maintains matza nowadays by Torah But isn’t Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov the one who said matza nowadays by rabbinic maintains everything the Sages instituted they instituted similar by Torah
llm_translation: From the premise of Rav Acha bar Yaakov, does he hold that matzah nowadays is from the Torah? But Rav Acha bar Yaakov himself said: Matzah nowadays is from the Rabbis! He holds: Anything the Rabbis instituted is like a Torah decree.

hebrew_text: לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת וּלְרַב יוֹסֵף נָמֵי, הָא וַדַּאי כׇּל דְּתַקּוּן רַבָּנַן — כְּעֵין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא תַּיקּוּן?
human_translation: According to Rav Sheshet and Rav Yosef too, certainly everything the Sages instituted they instituted similar by Torah
llm_translation: To Rav Sheshet and to Rav Yosef Nami, this and certainly all that the sages have established — is it a correction like a correction of the Torah?

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם, מִדַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמִיכְתַּב ״בְּנֵנוּ הוּא״, וּכְתִיב ״בְּנֵנוּ זֶה״ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: פְּרָט לְסוֹמִין הוּא דַּאֲתָא. אֲבָל הָכָא, אִי לָאו ״בַּעֲבוּר זֶה״, מַאי לִכְתּוֹב? אֶלָּא בַּעֲבוּר מַצָּה וּמָרוֹר הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: How can be compared? Granted, there, as could have written: He is our son, and it is written: “This son of ours,” learn from it which comes to exclude blind However, here, not “because of this,” what written Rather, comes because of the matza and bitter herbs.
llm_translation: So now?! Granted there, since it is written "benehu," and it is written "benehu zeh" - learn from it: it comes to exclude a blind person. But here, if not for "ba'avur zeh," what would be written? Rather, it comes for the sake of matzah and maror.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ אֲנַחְנוּ חַיָּיבִים.
human_translation: Therefore we are obligated
llm_translation: Therefore, we are obligated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ וְ״כֵסְיָהּ״ וִ״ידִידְיָה״ — אַחַת הֵן. רַב אָמַר: ״כֵּסְיָהּ״ וּ״מֶרְחַבְיָהּ״ — אַחַת הֵן. רַבָּה אָמַר: ״מֶרְחַבְיָהּ״ בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: halleluya kesya Yedidya are a single Rav said kesya and merḥavya are single Rabba said: Only merḥavya
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: "Hallelujah," "Kesiyah," and "Yididyah" - they are one. Rav said: "Kesiyah" and "Merḥavyah" - they are one. Rabbah said: "Merḥavyah" alone.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״מֶרְחָב יָהּ״ לְרַב חִסְדָּא, מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Rav Ḥisda, what is merḥavya ? Let it stand
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: "The expanse of God" to Rav Ḥisdah, what? It shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״יְדִידְיָהּ״ לְרַב, מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב: ״יְדִידְיָהּ״ נֶחְלָק לִשְׁנַיִם, לְפִיכָךְ: יְדִיד חוֹל, יָהּ קוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: dilemma was raised before Rav, what is Yedidya? Come hear, as Rav said Yedidya is divided into two Therefore, yedid a mundane ya a sacred
llm_translation: He asked them: "Yedidyah" to Rav, what? Come and hear, for Rav said: "Yedidyah" is divided into two, therefore: beloved in mundane matters, Yah in matters of holiness.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ לְרַב, מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב: חֲזֵינָא תִּילֵּי דְּבֵי חַבִּיבָא דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ ״הַלְלוּ״ בְּחַד גִּיסָא, וְ״יָהּ״ בְּחַד גִּיסָא.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before According to Rav, what is halleluya ? Come hear, as Rav said: I saw a book of Psalms in the study hall of my uncle, in hallelu is written on one side, and ya on one side,
llm_translation: He asked them: "Hallelujah" to Rav, what? Come and hear, for Rav said: I saw the chambers of the house of Habbiba where it is written with them "Hallelu" in one group, and "Yah" in one group.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַאי ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״? הַלְּלוּהוּ בְּהִלּוּלִים הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: disputes of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is halleluya ? praise Him [ halleluhu ] with many praises [ hillulim ].
llm_translation: Dispute of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is "Hallelujah"? Praise Him with great praises.

hebrew_text: ופְלִיגָא דִּידֵיהּ אַדִּידֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: בַּעֲשָׂרָה מַאֲמָרוֹת שֶׁל שֶׁבַח נֶאֱמַר סֵפֶר תְּהִלִּים: בְּ״נִיצּוּחַ״, בְּ״נִגּוּן״, בְּ״מַשְׂכִּיל״, בְּ״מִזְמוֹר״, בְּ״שִׁיר״, בְּ״אַשְׁרֵי״, בִּ״תְהִלָּה״, בִּ״תְפִלָּה״, בְּ״הוֹדָאָה״, בְּ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״. גָּדוֹל מִכּוּלָּן ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״, שֶׁכּוֹלֵל שֵׁם וָשֶׁבַח בְּבַת אַחַת.
human_translation: of disagrees with himself as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The book of Psalms is said by ten expressions of praise: By nitzuaḥ , niggun , maskil , mizmor , shir , ashrei , tehilla , tefilla , hoda’a , halleluya . The greatest of them all halleluya , as it includes name and praise at one time.
llm_translation: Dispute of his and his, for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: In the ten expressions of praise mentioned in the Book of Psalms: in "Nitzuach," in "Nigun," in "Maskil," in "Mizmor," in "Shir," in "Ashrei," in "Tehillah," in "Tefillah," in "Hoda'ah," in "Halleluyah." Greater than all of them is "Halleluyah," for it includes both name and praise in one expression.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שִׁיר שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, מֹשֶׁה וְיִשְׂרָאֵל אֲמָרוּהוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ מִן הַיָּם. וְהַלֵּל זֶה מִי אֲמָרוֹ? נְבִיאִים שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶן תִּקְּנוּ לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיְּהוּ אוֹמְרִין אוֹתוֹ עַל כׇּל פֶּרֶק וּפֶרֶק, וְעַל כׇּל צָרָה וְצָרָה שֶׁלֹּא תָּבֹא עֲלֵיהֶן. וְלִכְשֶׁנִּגְאָלִין, אוֹמְרִים אוֹתוֹ עַל גְּאוּלָּתָן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The song in the Torah, Moses and the Jewish people recited it when they ascended from the sea. And who said this hallel Prophets among them established for the Jewish people, that they recite it on every occasion; and for every trouble, may it not come upon them, When they are redeemed, they recite it over their redemption,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The song in the Torah, Moses and Israel said it when they ascended from the sea. And who said this praise? The prophets among them established for Israel to say it at every chapter and every distress so that it should not come upon them. And when they were redeemed, they say it upon their redemption.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל תּוּשְׁבָּחוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּסֵפֶר תְּהִלִּים כֻּלָּן דָּוִד אֲמָרָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּלּוּ תְפִלּוֹת דָּוִד בֶּן יִשָׁי״ — אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״כׇּלּוּ״, אֶלָּא ״כׇּל אֵלּוּ״.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Meir would say: All the praises stated in the book of Psalms were recited by David, as it is stated: “The prayers of David, son of Yishai, are ended [ kalu ]” Do not read kalu ; rather, kol elu , all of these,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say, "All praises mentioned in the Book of Psalms were all said by David, as it is stated: 'All the prayers of David son of Jesse' - do not read it as 'all of them,' rather 'all of these.'"

hebrew_text: הַלֵּל זֶה מִי אֲמָרוֹ? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר, אֶלְעָזָר בְּנִי אוֹמֵר: מֹשֶׁה וְיִשְׂרָאֵל אֲמָרוּהוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ מִן הַיָּם. וַחֲלוּקִין עָלָיו חֲבֵירָיו לוֹמַר שֶׁדָּוִד אֲמָרוֹ. וְנִרְאִין דְּבָרָיו מִדִּבְרֵיהֶן. אֶפְשָׁר יִשְׂרָאֵל שָׁחֲטוּ אֶת פִּסְחֵיהֶן וְנָטְלוּ לוּלְבֵיהֶן וְלֹא אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה?!
human_translation: who recited this hallel ? Rabbi Yosei says: My son Elazar says Moses and the Jewish people recited it when they ascended from the sea. And his colleagues dispute him, saying that it was recited by David. And the statement of appears than their statement. possible that the Jewish people slaughtered their Paschal lambs and took their lulavim without reciting a song?
llm_translation: Hillel, who said this? Rabbi Yosei says, Elazar beni says: Moses and Israel said it when they ascended from the sea. And his colleagues disputed with him, saying that David said it. And his words appear more correct. Is it possible that Israel slaughtered their Passover sacrifices, took their lulavs, and did not sing praise?!

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: פִּסְלוֹ שֶׁל מִיכָה עוֹמֵד בִּבְכִי, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹמְרִים אֶת הַהַלֵּל?
human_translation: Alternatively, Micah’s idol stood in tears, and the Jewish people reciting hallel
llm_translation: Another matter: The idol of Micah stands in weeping, and the Israelites say, "Shall we praise?"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל שִׁירוֹת וְתוּשְׁבָּחוֹת שֶׁאָמַר דָּוִד בְּסֵפֶר תְּהִלִּים, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כְּנֶגֶד עַצְמוֹ אֲמָרָן. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כְּנֶגֶד צִיבּוּר אֲמָרָן. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ מֵהֶן כְּנֶגֶד צִיבּוּר וְיֵשׁ מֵהֶן כְּנֶגֶד עַצְמוֹ. הָאֲמוּרוֹת בִּלְשׁוֹן יָחִיד — כְּנֶגֶד עַצְמוֹ, הָאֲמוּרוֹת בִּלְשׁוֹן רַבִּים — כְּנֶגֶד צִיבּוּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught all the songs and praise that David recited in the book of Psalms, Rabbi Eliezer says: said them about himself. Rabbi Yehoshua says: He said them about the community. And the Rabbis say: There are among these about the community, and there are among these about himself. that are stated in the singular about himself, those stated in the plural about the community.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: All the songs and praises that David said in the Book of Psalms, Rabbi Eliezer says: he said them for himself. Rabbi Yehoshua says: he said them for the community. And the Sages say: some of them are for himself and some are for the community. Those said in singular language - for himself, those said in plural language - for the community.

hebrew_text: ״נִיצּוּחַ״ וְ״נִיגּוּן״ — לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא. ״מַשְׂכִּיל״ — עַל יְדֵי תּוּרְגְּמָן. ״לְדָוִד מִזְמוֹר״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁשָּׁרְתָה עָלָיו שְׁכִינָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָמַר שִׁירָה. ״מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאָמַר שִׁירָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ שָׁרְתָה עָלָיו שְׁכִינָה.
human_translation: nitzuaḥ or niggun , in the future. maskil by a disseminator, Of David a psalm, teaches that the Divine Presence rested upon him and afterward he recited song. A psalm of David, teaches that he recited song, and afterward the Divine Presence rested upon him.
llm_translation: "Victory" and "melody" — in the future. "Maskil" — through an interpreter. "A Psalm of David" — teaches that the Divine Presence served upon him, and only afterwards did he sing. "A Psalm of David" — teaches that he sang first, and only afterwards did the Divine Presence serve upon him.

hebrew_text: לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁאֵין הַשְּׁכִינָה שׁוֹרָה, לֹא מִתּוֹךְ עַצְלוּת וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ עַצְבוּת וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ שְׂחוֹק וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ קַלּוּת רֹאשׁ וְלֹא מִתּוֹךְ דְּבָרִים בְּטֵלִים, אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ דְּבַר שִׂמְחָה שֶׁל מִצְוָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעַתָּה קְחוּ לִי מְנַגֵּן וְהָיָה כְּנַגֵּן הַמְנַגֵּן וַתְּהִי עָלָיו יַד ה׳״.
human_translation: to teach you that the Divine Presence rests neither from laziness, from sadness, nor from laughter, nor from frivolity, nor from idle chatter, but rather from the joy of a mitzva. As it is stated “But now bring me a minstrel; and it came to pass when the minstrel played, that the hand of the Lord came upon him”
llm_translation: To teach you that the Divine Presence does not dwell due to laziness, nor due to sadness, nor due to frivolity, nor due to light-headedness, nor due to idle matters, but rather due to the joy of a commandment. As it is stated: "Now bring me a musician." And when the musician played, the hand of the Lord came upon him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: וְכֵן לִדְבַר הֲלָכָה. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וְכֵן לַחֲלוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: And, so a matter of halakha . Rav Naḥman said: And, so to a good dream.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: And so too regarding a matter of halakha. Rav Nachman said: And so too for a good dream.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הַיּוֹשֵׁב לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹ וְאֵין שִׂפְתוֹתָיו נוֹטְפוֹת מַר — תִּכָּוֶינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׂפְתוֹתָיו שׁוֹשַׁנִּים נוֹטְפוֹת מוֹר עוֹבֵר״. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״שׁוֹשַׁנִּים״, אֶלָּא ״שֶׁשּׁוֹנִים״. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״מוֹר עוֹבֵר״, אֶלָּא ״מַר עוֹבֵר״.
human_translation: Is that so, Didn’t Rav Giddel say Rav said: Any Torah scholar who sits before his teacher and his lips are not dripping with bitterness shall be burned, as it is stated: “His lips are as lilies [ shoshanim ] dripping with flowing myrrh [ notefot mor over ]” Do not read it shoshanim , lilies; rather, sheshonim , who are studying. do not read it mor over , flowing myrrh; rather, mar over , flowing bitterness.
llm_translation: I?! And didn't Rav Giddel say in the name of Rav: Every Torah scholar who sits before his teacher, and his lips are not dripping bitterness — let him intend, as it is stated: "His lips are lilies dripping with myrrh." Do not read "lilies," rather "roses." Do not read "myrrh," rather "bitterness."

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּרַבָּה, הָא — בְּתַלְמִידָא.
human_translation: not difficult; this to a rabbi, and that to a student,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this — in Rabah, this — in Talmida.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא בְּרַבָּה, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — מִקַּמֵּי דְּפָתַח, וְהָא — לְבָתַר דְּפָתַח. כִּי הָא דְּרַבָּה, מִקַּמֵּי דְּפָתַח לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן, אָמַר מִילְּתָא דִּבְדִיחוּתָא וּבָדְחוּ רַבָּנַן, וּלְבַסּוֹף יָתֵיב בְּאֵימְתָא, וּפָתַח בִּשְׁמַעְתָּא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that to a rabbi, and not difficult. This before begins that after began like that of Rabba’s. Before he began to the Sages, he would say some humorous and the Sages would be cheered. Ultimately, he sat in trepidation and began the halakha .
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this in Rabah, and it is not difficult: This — before he began, and this — after he began. For this of Rabah, before he began to teach the Rabbis, he would say a matter of jest and the Rabbis would laugh, and in the end he would sit in awe and begin with a matter of learning.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַלֵּל זֶה מִי אֲמָרוֹ? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מֹשֶׁה וְיִשְׂרָאֵל אֲמָרוּהוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָמְדוּ עַל הַיָּם. הֵם אָמְרוּ: ״לֹא לָנוּ ה׳ לֹא לָנוּ״, מְשִׁיבָה רוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ וְאָמְרָה לָהֶן: ״לְמַעֲנִי לְמַעֲנִי אֶעֱשֶׂה״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְיִשְׂרָאֵל אֲמָרוּהוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָמְדוּ עֲלֵיהֶן מַלְכֵי כְנַעַן. הֵם אָמְרוּ: ״לֹא לָנוּ״, וּמְשִׁיבָה וְכוּ׳:
human_translation: The Sages taught: This hallel , who recited it? Rabbi Eliezer says: Moses and the Jewish people recited it when they stood by the sea. They said: “Not to us, God, not to us, The Divine Spirit responded and said to them: “For My own sake, for My own sake, will I do it” Rabbi Yehuda says: Joshua and the Jewish people recited it when the kings of Canaan stood against them They said: Not to us, and responded:
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Who said this? Rabbi Eliezer says: Moses and Israel said it when they stood by the sea. They said: "Not for us, not for us, the Lord." The Holy Spirit responded and said to them: "For My sake, for My sake, I will act." Rabbi Yehuda says: Joshua and Israel said it when the kings of Canaan stood against them. They said: "Not for us," and the response was, etc.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַמּוֹדָעִי אוֹמֵר: דְּבוֹרָה וּבָרָק אֲמָרוּהוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָמַד עֲלֵיהֶם סִיסְרָא. הֵם אָמְרוּ: ״לֹא לָנוּ״, וְרוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ מְשִׁיבָה וְאוֹמֶרֶת לָהֶם: ״לְמַעֲנִי לְמַעֲנִי אֶעֱשֶׂה״. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: חִזְקִיָּה וְסִייעָתוֹ אֲמָרוּהוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָמַד עֲלֵיהֶם סַנְחֵרִיב. הֵם אָמְרוּ: ״לֹא לָנוּ״, וּמְשִׁיבָה וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה אֲמָרוּהוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָמַד עֲלֵיהֶם נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הָרָשָׁע. הֵם אָמְרוּ: ״לֹא לָנוּ״, וּמְשִׁיבָה וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: מָרְדְּכַי וְאֶסְתֵּר אֲמָרוּהוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָמַד עֲלֵיהֶם הָמָן הָרָשָׁע. הֵם אָמְרוּ: ״לֹא לָנוּ״, וּמְשִׁיבָה וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar HaModa’i says: Deborah and Barak recited it when Sisera stood against them They said: Not to us, and the Divine Spirit responded and said to them: For My own sake, for My own sake, will I do it. Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: Hezekiah and his company recited it when Sennacherib stood against them They said: Not to us and responded: Rabbi Akiva says: Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah recited it when the wicked Nebuchadnezzar stood against them They said: Not to us, and responded: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: Mordecai and Esther recited it when the wicked Haman stood against them. They said: Not to us, and responded:
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar HaModa'i says: Deborah and Barak said it when Sisera stood against them. They said, "Not for us," and the Holy Spirit responds and says to them, "For my sake, for my sake, I will act." Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: Hezekiah and his entourage said it when Sennacherib stood against them. They said, "Not for us," and the response continues, etc. Rabbi Akiva says: Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah said it when Nebuchadnezzar the wicked stood against them. They said, "Not for us," and the response continues, etc. Rabbi Yosei HaGalili says: Mordecai and Esther said it when Haman the wicked stood against them. They said, "Not for us," and the response continues, etc.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: נְבִיאִים שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶן תִּיקְּנוּ לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיְּהוּ אוֹמְרִים אוֹתוֹ עַל כׇּל פֶּרֶק וּפֶרֶק וְעַל כׇּל צָרָה וְצָרָה שֶׁלֹּא תָּבֹא עֲלֵיהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל. וְלִכְשֶׁנִּגְאָלִין, אוֹמְרִים אוֹתוֹ עַל גְּאוּלָּתָן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say the Prophets among them instituted that the Jewish people recite it on every occasion, and for every trouble, may it not come upon the Jewish people. When they are redeemed, they recite it over their redemption.
llm_translation: The Sages say: The prophets among them established for the people of Israel that they should say it over every chapter and every distress, so that it should not come upon the people of Israel. And when they are redeemed, they should say it over their redemption.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ — סוֹף פִּירְקָא. רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ — רֵישׁ פִּירְקָא. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: חֲזֵינָא לְהוּ לְתִילֵּי דְּבֵי רַב חָנִין בַּר רַב דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ בְּאֶמְצַע פִּירְקָא. אַלְמָא מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: halleluya the end of a chapter. Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Halleluya the start of chapter, Rav Ḥisda said: I saw a book of Psalms in the study hall of Rav Ḥanin bar Rav, in which it is written halleluya in the middle of the chapter, Apparently, was uncertain
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: "Hallelujah" — the end of the chapter. Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: "Hallelujah" — the beginning of the chapter. Rav Ḥisda said: I saw them hanging up in the house of Rav Ḥanin bar Rav, as it is written in them "Hallelujah" in the middle of the chapter. Apparently, he is in doubt about it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר רָבָא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בִּ״תְהִלַּת ה׳ יְדַבֶּר פִּי וִיבָרֵךְ כׇּל בָּשָׂר שֵׁם קׇדְשׁוֹ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד (הַלְלוּיָהּ)״, ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ דְּבָתְרֵיהּ — רֵישׁ פִּירְקָא. ״רָשָׁע יִרְאֶה וְכָעָס שִׁנָּיו יַחֲרֹק וְנָמָס תַּאֲוַת רְשָׁעִים תֹּאבֵד״, ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ דְּבָתְרֵיהּ — רֵישׁ פִּירְקָא. וְ״שֶׁעוֹמְדִים בְּבֵית ה׳״, ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ דְּבָתְרֵיהּ — רֵישׁ פִּירְקָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanin bar Rava said: Everyone concedes “My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord; and let all flesh bless His holy name forever and ever” halleluya that follows, the start of chapter, “The wicked shall see and be vexed; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away; the desire of the wicked shall perish” halleluya that follows it, the start of chapter. And “You who stand in the house of the Lord” halleluya that follows it, the start of chapter.
llm_translation: Rav Hanin bar Rava said: Everyone agrees with the "Praise the Lord" (Psalm 150:6), let my mouth speak and let all flesh bless His holy name forever and ever (Hallelujah), "Hallelujah" at the end of it is the beginning of the chapter. "The wicked shall see and be angry, they shall gnash their teeth and melt away; the desire of the wicked shall perish" (Psalm 112:10), "Hallelujah" at the end of it is the beginning of the chapter. And "those who stand in the house of the Lord," "Hallelujah" at the end of it is the beginning of the chapter.

hebrew_text: קָרָאֵי מוֹסִיפִין אַף אֶת אֵלּוּ: ״מִנַּחַל בַּדֶּרֶךְ יִשְׁתֶּה עַל כֵּן יָרִים רֹאשׁ״, ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ דְּבָתְרֵיהּ — רֵישׁ פִּירְקָא. ״רֵאשִׁית חׇכְמָה יִרְאַת ה׳ שֵׂכֶל טוֹב לְכׇל עוֹשֵׂיהֶם״, ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ דְּבָתְרֵיהּ — רֵישׁ פִּירְקָא.
human_translation: verses add these too: “He will drink of the brook in the way; therefore will he lift up the head” halleluya that follows it, is the start of chapter. “The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom; a good understanding have all they who practice them; the halleluya that follows it, the start of chapter.
llm_translation: The readers are Talmud scholars and do not require any Notes.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: עַד הֵיכָן הוּא אוֹמֵר? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: עַד ״אֵם הַבָּנִים שְׂמֵחָה״, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עַד ״חַלָּמִישׁ לְמַעְיְנוֹ מָיִם״. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ, עַד הֵיכָן הוּא אוֹמֵר? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: עַד ״בְּצֵאת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִמִּצְרָיִם״. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עַד ״לֹא לָנוּ ה׳ לֹא לָנוּ״.
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im , Until where does one recite Beit Shammai say: Until “A joyful mother of children, And Beit Hillel say: Until “The flint into a fountain of waters” And it was taught another Until where does one recite Beit Shammai say: Until “When Israel came forth out of Egypt” And Beit Hillel say: Until “Not to us, God, not to us”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima k'tanna'i: ad heichan hu omer? Beit Shammai omerim: ad 'em habanim semechah', u'beit Hillel omerim: ad 'chalamesh lema'ayano mayim'. Ve'tanya idach, ad heichan hu omer? Beit Shammai omerim: ad 'betzet Yisrael mimitzrayim'. U'beit Hillel omerim: ad 'lo lanu Hashem lo lanu'." English translation: "It was stated in a Baraita: Until where does he say? Beit Shammai says: Until 'a mother of children is joyful', and Beit Hillel says: Until 'a dreamer of wells of water'. And it was taught in another Baraita, until where does he say? Beit Shammai says: Until 'when Israel went out of Egypt'. And Beit Hillel says: Until 'not to us, O Lord, not to us'."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עַד ״אֵם הַבָּנִים שְׂמֵחָה״, סָבַר ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ — רֵישׁ פִּירְקָא, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר עַד ״בְּצֵאת יִשְׂרָאֵל״, סָבַר ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ — סוֹף פִּירְקָא.
human_translation: What, is it not that the disagree the following According to the one who says until “A joyful mother of children,” maintains halleluya the start of a chapter. And the one who said until “When Israel came forth” maintains halleluya the end of the chapter.
llm_translation: What is the reason that they disagree? According to the one who says until "If the children are happy," he holds "Hallelujah" at the beginning of the chapter, and according to the one who says until "When Israel went out," he holds "Hallelujah" at the end of the chapter.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סָבְרִי: ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ — סוֹף פִּירְקָא. מַאן דְּאָמַר עַד ״בְּצֵאת יִשְׂרָאֵל״ שַׁפִּיר, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר עַד ״אֵם הַבָּנִים שְׂמֵחָה״, עַד — וְעַד בַּכְּלָל.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda explains in accordance with his reasoning, that everyone maintains halleluya the end of a chapter. the one who said until “When Israel came forth” well, And the one who said until “A joyful mother of children” until and including,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda interprets according to his reasoning, as everyone in the world thinks: "Hallelujah" — the conclusion of the chapter. Whoever said until "when Israel went out," is good, and whoever said until "the mother of children rejoices," until — and including.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא עַד ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״! וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּלָא יָדְעִינַן הֵי ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ — וְנֵימָא ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ שֶׁל ״אֵם הַבָּנִים שְׂמֵחָה״? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: let say: Until halleluya . And if you say that we not know which halleluya let say: halleluya of “A joyful mother of children.” difficult
llm_translation: And it was said until "Hallelujah"! And if you say that we do not know what "Hallelujah" is - and it was said, "Hallelujah" of "A mother of children is joyous"? This is difficult.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ — רֵישׁ פִּירְקָא, מַאן דְּאָמַר עַד ״אֵם הַבָּנִים שְׂמֵחָה״ — שַׁפִּיר, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר עַד ״בְּצֵאת יִשְׂרָאֵל״, סָבַר: עַד — וְלֹא עַד בַּכְּלָל.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna explains in accordance with his reasoning, that everyone agrees halleluya the start of a chapter. The one who said until “A joyful mother of children” well, and the one who said until “When Israel came forth” maintains until and not including,
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Rav Huna interprets his reasoning: Regarding all the world "Hallelujah" - the beginning of the chapter, one who says until "A joyful mother of children" - it is beautiful, and one who says until "When Israel went forth" thinks: until - but not including at all.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא: עַד ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״, וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּלָא יָדְעִינַן הֵי ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ — וְנֵימָא עַד ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ שֶׁ״בְּצֵאת יִשְׂרָאֵל״? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: let say: Until halleluya . And if you say that we not know which halleluya let say: halleluya of “When Israel came forth.” difficult
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was said: Until "Hallelujah." And if you say that we do not know what "Hallelujah" is - and it was said: Until "Hallelujah" in "the departure of Israel"? This is difficult.

hebrew_text: וְחוֹתֵם בִּגְאוּלָּה. אָמַר רָבָא: קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע וְהַלֵּל — ״גָּאַל יִשְׂרָאֵל״. דִּצְלוֹתָא — ״גּוֹאֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל״. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּרַחֲמֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And one concludes with to redemption. Rava said: the recitation of Shema and hallel Who redeemed Israel, prayer Who redeems Israel, What is the reason is a
llm_translation: "And he shall seal it with redemption." Rava said: The recitation of the Shema and Hallel - "He redeemed Israel." In the language of Tzalota - "The Redeemer of Israel." What is the reason? Because they are expressions of mercy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: דְּקִידּוּשָׁא — ״אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ״. דִּצְלוֹתָא — ״קַדְּשֵׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתֶיךָ״. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּרַחֲמֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: of kiddush Who sanctified us with His mitzvot and commanded us, prayer Sanctify us with Your mitzvot, What is the reason is a
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Regarding Kiddush - "Who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us." Regarding Havdalah - "Sanctify us with Your commandments." What is the reason? Because they are expressions of mercy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: וְצָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּזְכִּיר יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם בְּקִידּוּשׁ הַיּוֹם. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״לְמַעַן תִּזְכּוֹר אֶת יוֹם״. וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״זָכוֹר אֶת יוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת לְקַדְּשׁוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: And one must mention the exodus from Egypt in the kiddush here, it is written: “That you may remember the day and it is written there, “Remember the Shabbat day to sanctify it”
llm_translation: Said Rav Acha bar Yaakov: And it is necessary to mention the exodus from Egypt in the sanctification of the day. It is written here: "In order that you shall remember the day." And it is written there: "Remember the Sabbath day to sanctify it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא: דִּצְלוֹתָא — ״מַצְמִיחַ קֶרֶן יְשׁוּעָה״, דְּאַפְטָרְתָּא — ״מָגֵן דָּוִד״.
human_translation: Rabba bar Sheila said: prayer He Who causes the horn of salvation to flourish, after the haftara , Shield of David.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Sheilah said: Regarding a shadow - "He brings salvation," and regarding a moth - "the shield of David."

hebrew_text: ״וְעָשִׂיתִי לְךָ שֵׁם גָּדוֹל כְּשֵׁם הַגְּדוֹלִים״, תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: זֶהוּ שֶׁאוֹמְרִים ״מָגֵן דָּוִד״.
human_translation: “And I will make you a great name, like the names of the great ones Rav Yosef teaches: This is say: Shield of David,
llm_translation: "And I will make for you a great name like the name of the great ones," Rav Yosef taught: This is referring to when they say, "Shield of David."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: ״וְאֶעֶשְׂךָ לְגוֹי גָּדוֹל״, זֶהוּ שֶׁאוֹמְרִים ״אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם״. ״וַאֲבָרֶכְךָ״, זֶהוּ שֶׁאוֹמְרִים ״אֱלֹהֵי יִצְחָק״. ״וַאֲגַדְּלָה שְׁמֶךָ״, זֶהוּ שֶׁאוֹמְרִים ״אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said “And I will make of you a great nation”; this is as say: God of Abraham. “And I will bless you”; this is they say: God of Isaac, “And I will make your name great”; this is when they say: God of Jacob.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: "And I will make you a great nation," this is referring to those who say "God of Abraham." "And I will bless you," this is referring to those who say "God of Isaac." "And I will make your name great," this is referring to those who say "God of Jacob."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יְהוּ חוֹתְמִין בְּכוּלָּן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וֶהְיֵה בְּרָכָה״. בְּךָ חוֹתְמִין, וְאֵין חוֹתְמִין בְּכוּלָּן.
human_translation: might conclude with all the verse states: “And you will be a blessing” with you, they conclude and they not conclude with all
llm_translation: Can Yehu sign all of them? Scripture says: "And be a blessing." In you they can sign, but they cannot sign in all of them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַשְׁכַּחְתִּינָא לְסָבֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא דְּיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: בְּשַׁבְּתָא — בֵּין בִּצְלוֹתָא בֵּין בְּקִידּוּשָׁא: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ הַשַּׁבָּת״. בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא — בֵּין בִּצְלוֹתָא וּבֵין בְּקִידּוּשָׁא: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהַזְּמַנִּים״. וְאָמֵינָא לְהוּ אֲנָא: אַדְּרַבָּה, דִּצְלוֹתָא — בֵּין בְּשַׁבְּתָא בֵּין בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל״, בְּקִידּוּשָׁא דְשַׁבְּתָא: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ הַשַּׁבָּת״, בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהַזְּמַנִּים״.
human_translation: Rava said: I found the Elders of Pumbedita sitting and saying: On Shabbat, both in prayer and in kiddush , Who sanctifies Shabbat. On a Festival, both in prayer and in kiddush Who sanctifies Israel and the seasons. And I said to them: On the contrary, prayer, both on Shabbat and on a Festival, Who sanctifies Israel. in the kiddush of Shabbat Who sanctifies Shabbat, of a Festival Who sanctifies Israel and the seasons.
llm_translation: Rava said: I found the elders of Pumbedita sitting and saying: On Shabbat, whether in the twilight or in the sanctification: "Sanctifying the Sabbath." On a festival day, whether in the twilight or in the sanctification: "Sanctifying Israel and the appointed times." And I said to them: I hold with Rabba, that in the twilight - whether on Shabbat or on a festival day: "Sanctifying Israel," in the sanctification of Shabbat: "Sanctifying the Sabbath," on a festival day: "Sanctifying Israel and the appointed times."

hebrew_text: וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא טַעְמָא דִידִי וְטַעְמָא דִידְכוּ. טַעְמָא דִידְכוּ: שַׁבָּת, דִּקְבִיעָא וְקַיְימָא — בֵּין בִּצְלוֹתָא וּבֵין בְּקִידּוּשָׁא: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ הַשַּׁבָּת״. יוֹמָא טָבָא, דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא דְּקָבְעִי לֵיהּ — דְּקָמְעַבְּרִי יַרְחֵי וְקָבְעִי לְשָׁנֵי: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהַזְּמַנִּים״.
human_translation: And I say my reason and your reason. Your reason Shabbat is established and permanent, both in prayers and in kiddush Who sanctifies Shabbat. Festival, as it is Israel who establishes it, as add months and establish years Who sanctifies Israel and the seasons.
llm_translation: I say: My reason and your reason. Your reason: Shabbat, which is fixed and established - whether in its twilight or in its sanctification: "Sanctifying the Sabbath." A good day, for Israel is the one who established it - for it passes through months and is established for years: "Sanctifying Israel and the appointed times."

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דִידִי: צְלוֹתָא, דִּבְרַבִּים אִיתָא: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל״. קִידּוּשׁ, דִּבְיָחִיד אִיתָא, בְּשַׁבָּת: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ הַשַּׁבָּת״, בְּיוֹם טוֹב: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהַזְּמַנִּים״.
human_translation: My reason is prayer, which is in public, Who sanctifies Israel, kiddush , which is alone on Shabbat, Who sanctifies Shabbat, On a Festival Who sanctifies Israel and the seasons.
llm_translation: Reasoning of mine: roasting, as it is stated in the multitude: "Sanctifying Israel." Sanctification, as it is stated in the individual, on Shabbat: "Sanctifying the Sabbath," on a festival: "Sanctifying Israel and the appointed times."

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, צְלוֹתָא בְּיָחִיד מִי לֵיתֵיהּ? וְקִידּוּשָׁא בְּרַבִּים מִי לֵיתֵיהּ? וְרָבָא סָבַר: זִיל בָּתַר עִיקָּר.
human_translation: And that is not so. Is there not prayer by alone; and is there not in public? But Rava maintains: Follow the main
llm_translation: "And not this, roasting in private who does it? And sanctifying in public who does it? And Rava holds: Go after the main thing."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא בַּר רַב נְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר כְּסָבֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא, וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. אַלְמָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ רָבָא. רַב נָתָן אֲבוּהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן נְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, אֲמַר כְּסָבֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא, וְשַׁבְּחֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא.
human_translation: Ulla bar Rav descended before Rava. He said in accordance with of the Elders of Pumbedita, and did not say anything to him. Apparently, Rava retracted Rav Natan, father of Rav Huna, son Rav Natan, descended before Rav Pappa recited in accordance with of the Elders of Pumbedita, Rav Pappa praised him
llm_translation: Ula son of Rav Nachit stood before Rava, he said like the elders of Pumbedita, and he did not say anything to him. Apparently, Rava was pleased with him. Rav Natan, the father of Rav Huna son of Rav Natan, stood before Rav Papa, he said like the elders of Pumbedita, and Rav Papa praised him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: אֲנָא אִיקְּלַעִי לְסוּרָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּמָרִימָר, וּנְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ שְׁלוּחָא דְצִיבּוּרָא וַאֲמַר כְּסָבֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא, וַהֲווֹ מְשַׁתְּקִי לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: שִׁבְקוּהוּ הִילְכְתָא כְּסָבֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא, וְלָא הֲווֹ מְשַׁתְּקוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said: I happened to Sura before Mareimar, and the prayer leader descended before him and recited in accordance with of the Elders of Pumbedita, and everyone silence him, said to them: Leave him, the halakha is in accordance with of the Elders of Pumbedita. And no silence
llm_translation: Ravina said: I happened to come to Sura, before Marimar, and I sat before the congregation's emissary and said, "Like the elders of Pumbedita." And all the people were silent. He said to them: Leave him, he has gone to the elders of Pumbedita, and they did not silence him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָזְגוּ לוֹ כּוֹס שְׁלִישִׁי מְבָרֵךְ עַל מְזוֹנוֹ. רְבִיעִי גּוֹמֵר עָלָיו אֶת הַלֵּל, וְאוֹמֵר עָלָיו בִּרְכַּת הַשִּׁיר. בֵּין הַכּוֹסוֹת הַלָּלוּ, אִם רוֹצֶה לִשְׁתּוֹת — יִשְׁתֶּה, בֵּין שְׁלִישִׁי לִרְבִיעִי — לֹא יִשְׁתֶּה.
human_translation: They poured for the third cup and he recites the blessing over his food, fourth He completes hallel over it, And he recites the blessing of the song over between these cups, if one wishes to drink he drink; between the third and the fourth not drink.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If they poured for him a third cup, he recites grace after meals. If they poured for him a fourth cup, he concludes with the Hallel and recites the blessing of the song over it. Among these cups, if he wishes to drink, he may drink; between the third and the fourth cup, he should not drink.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חָנָן לְרָבָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בִּרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן טְעוּנָה כּוֹס. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַרְבַּע כָּסֵי תִּיקְּנוּ רַבָּנַן דֶּרֶךְ חֵירוּת, כֹּל חַד וְחַד נַעֲבֵיד בֵּיהּ מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Ran Ḥanan said to Rava: learn from it requires a cup said to him: the Sages instituted four cups in the manner of freedom, each and every one we will perform a mitzva,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Rav Hanan said to Rava: Hear from it, the blessing of the meal requires a cup. He said to him: The Rabbis instituted four cups as a way of freedom, each one is used for a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: רְבִיעִי גּוֹמֵר עָלָיו אֶת הַהַלֵּל וְאוֹמֵר עָלָיו בִּרְכַּת הַשִּׁיר.
human_translation: fourth he completes hallel over it, and he recites the blessing of the song over
llm_translation: Fourth person completes upon him the Hallel and says upon him the blessing of the song.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״בִּרְכַּת הַשִּׁיר״? רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: ״יְהַלְלוּךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ״. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״נִשְׁמַת כָּל חַי״. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רְבִיעִי גּוֹמֵר עָלָיו אֶת הַהַלֵּל, וְאוֹמֵר הַלֵּל הַגָּדוֹל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: ״ה׳ רוֹעִי לֹא אֶחְסָר״.
human_translation: What is the blessing of the song Rav Yehuda said: They shall praise You, Lord, our God. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said The breath of all living, The Sages taught fourth one completes hallel over it and recites the great hallel ; the statement of Rabbi Tarfon. And some say “The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want”
llm_translation: What is "Birkat HaShir"? Rav Yehudah said: "Let them praise You, Hashem our God." And Rabbi Yochanan said: "The soul of every living being." The Rabbis taught: On the fourth cup, one concludes with reciting Hallel and says the Great Hallel, the words of Rabbi Tarfon. And some say: "Hashem is my shepherd, I shall not want."

hebrew_text: מֵהֵיכָן הַלֵּל הַגָּדוֹל? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מֵ״הוֹדוּ״ עַד ״נַהֲרוֹת בָּבֶל״. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: מִ״שִּׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת״ עַד ״נַהֲרוֹת בָּבֶל״. רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: מִ״כִּי יַעֲקֹב בָּחַר לוֹ יָהּ״ עַד ״נַהֲרוֹת בָּבֶל״.
human_translation: From where great hallel Rabbi Yehuda says: From “Give thanks” until “The rivers of Babylon” And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From “A song of ascents” until “The rivers of Babylon.” Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: From “For the Lord has chosen Jacob for Himself” until “The rivers of Babylon.”
llm_translation: From where was Hillel the Elder? Rabbi Yehudah says: from "Hodu" until "the rivers of Babylon." And Rabbi Yochanan says: from "Shir HaMaalot" until "the rivers of Babylon." Rav Acha bar Yaakov says: from "Ki Yaakov bachar lo Yah" until "the rivers of Babylon."

hebrew_text: וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ הַלֵּל הַגָּדוֹל? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יוֹשֵׁב בְּרוּמוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם וּמְחַלֵּק מְזוֹנוֹת לְכׇל בְּרִיָּה.
human_translation: And why is called the great hallel ? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Because the Holy One, Blessed be He, sits in the heights of the universe and dispenses food to every creature.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And why was his name called Hillel the Elder? Rabbi Yochanan said: Because the Holy One, blessed be He, sits in His lofty abode of the world and provides sustenance for all creatures."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הָנֵי עֶשְׂרִים וְשִׁשָּׁה ״הוֹדוּ״, כְּנֶגֶד מִי — כְּנֶגֶד עֶשְׂרִים וְשִׁשָּׁה דּוֹרוֹת שֶׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּעוֹלָמוֹ וְלֹא נָתַן לָהֶם תּוֹרָה, וְזָן אוֹתָם בְּחַסְדּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: These twenty-six hodu , to what correspond? correspond to the twenty-six generations that the Holy One, Blessed be He, created in His world, and did not give the Torah. And sustained them through His mercy,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: These twenty-six "Hodu," against whom - against the twenty-six generations that the Holy One, blessed be He, created in His world and did not give them the Torah, but sustained them with His kindness.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״הוֹדוּ לַה׳ כִּי טוֹב״? הוֹדוּ לַה׳ שֶׁגּוֹבֶה חוֹבָתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם בְּטוֹבָתוֹ: עָשִׁיר בְּשׁוֹרוֹ, וְאֶת עָנִי בְּשֵׂיוֹ, יָתוֹם בְּבֵיצָתוֹ, אַלְמָנָה בְּתַרְנְגוֹלְתָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: What is which is written: “Give thanks to the Lord for He is good” give thanks to the Lord who exacts one’s debt, in goodness of a wealthy his ox, and a poor his sheep. orphan by his egg, widow by her chicken.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: What is the meaning of what is written, "Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good"? Give thanks to the Lord when a person's obligation is elevated with his goodness: the rich with his ox, and the poor with his gift, the orphan with his egg, the widow with her hen.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קָשִׁין מְזוֹנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם כִּפְלַיִים כַּיּוֹלֵדָה, דְּאִילּוּ בְּיוֹלֵדָה כְּתִיב: ״בְּעֶצֶב״, וּבִמְזוֹנוֹת כְּתִיב ״בְּעִצָּבוֹן״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a person’s food is twice as difficult as a woman in childbirth. While, with regard to a woman in childbirth, it is written: “In pain [ be’etzev ] with regard to food, it is written: “In toil [ be’itzavon ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The sustenance of a person is as difficult as the splitting of the Red Sea, for if it were written regarding childbirth "in pain," and regarding sustenance it is written "in sorrow."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קָשִׁין מְזוֹנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם יוֹתֵר מִן הַגְּאוּלָּה, דְּאִילּוּ בִּגְאוּלָּה כְּתִיב: ״הַמַּלְאָךְ הַגּוֹאֵל אוֹתִי מִכׇּל רָע״, מַלְאָךְ בְּעָלְמָא, וְאִילּוּ בִּמְזוֹנוֹת כְּתִיב: ״הָאֱלֹהִים הָרוֹעֶה אֹתִי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a person’s food is more difficult than the redemption. While, with regard to the redemption, it is written: “The angel who has redeemed me from all evil” a mere angel whereas, with regard to sustenance, it is written: “The God who has been my shepherd
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: The sustenance of a person is more difficult than redemption, for regarding redemption it is written: "The angel who redeems me from all evil," an angel in the world, but regarding sustenance it is written: "God who feeds me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לָאָדָם ״וְקוֹץ וְדַרְדַּר תַּצְמִיחַ לָךְ״ זָלְגוּ עֵינָיו דְּמָעוֹת, אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אֲנִי וַחֲמוֹרִי נֹאכַל בְּאֵבוּס אֶחָד? כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ: ״בְּזֵעַת אַפֶּךָ תֹּאכַל לֶחֶם״, נִתְקָרְרָה דַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: When the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Adam: “Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to you, his eyes streamed with tears. said before Him: Master of the Universe, my donkey and I eat from one trough? After said to him: “In the sweat of your face shall you eat bread” his mind was settled,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: At the moment when the Holy One, blessed be He, said to man, "Thorns and thistles shall sprout for you," his eyes welled with tears. He said before Him: Master of the Universe, I and my donkey shall eat from one bundle? Once He said to him, "By the sweat of your brow shall you eat bread," his mind was put at ease.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: אַשְׁרֵינוּ אִם עָמַדְנוּ בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, וַעֲדַיִין לָא פָּלְטִינַן מִינַּהּ, דְּקָא אָכְלִינַן עִיסְבֵי דְּדַבְרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: We fortunate had we remained under the first And we still have not escaped from as we eat the grass of the field,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: "Fortunate are we if we stood at the beginning, and still have not been exempt from it, for we are eating the leftovers of the Creator."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁיזְבִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: קָשִׁין מְזוֹנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם כִּקְרִיעַת יַם סוּף, דִּכְתִיב: ״נוֹתֵן לֶחֶם לְכׇל בָּשָׂר״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״לְגוֹזֵר יַם סוּף לִגְזָרִים״.
human_translation: Rav Sheizvi said, citing Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya: a person’s food is as difficult as the splitting of the Red Sea, as it is written: “He gives food to all flesh, and juxtaposed to it is “To Him who divided the Red Sea in sunder,
llm_translation: Rav Sheizbi said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah: The sustenance of a person is as difficult as the splitting of the Red Sea, as it is written: "He gives bread to all flesh," and it is juxtaposed with: "He split the Red Sea into parts."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: קָשִׁין נְקָבָיו שֶׁל אָדָם כְּיוֹם הַמִּיתָה וְכִקְרִיעַת יַם סוּף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִהַר צוֹעֶה לְהִפָּתֵחַ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״רוֹגַע הַיָּם וַיֶּהֱמוּ גַּלָּיו״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said: A person’s orifices, are as difficult as the day of death and the splitting of the Red Sea, as it is stated: “He who is bent down shall speedily be loosed; And afterward it is written: “Who stirs up the sea, that its waves roar”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said: The openings of a person are as difficult as the day of death and as the splitting of the Red Sea, as it is stated: "He hastened to open," and it is written afterwards: "The sea was calm and its waves roared."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: כׇּל הַמְבַזֶּה אֶת הַמּוֹעֲדוֹת כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱלֹהֵי מַסֵּכָה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה לָּךְ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״אֶת חַג הַמַּצּוֹת תִּשְׁמוֹר״.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet said, citing Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya: Anyone who disparages the Festivals, it is as though he engages in idol worship. as it is stated: “You shall make yourself no molten gods” and afterward it is written: “The Festival of matzot you shall keep”
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah: Anyone who disgraces the festivals is as if he worships idols, as it is stated: "You shall not make for yourself a molten god," and it is written thereafter: "You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: כׇּל הַמְסַפֵּר לָשׁוֹן הָרָע, וְכׇל הַמְקַבֵּל לָשׁוֹן הָרָע, וְכׇל הַמֵּעִיד עֵדוּת שֶׁקֶר בַּחֲבֵירוֹ — רָאוּי לְהַשְׁלִיכוֹ לִכְלָבִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לַכֶּלֶב תַּשְׁלִיכוּן אוֹתוֹ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״לֹא תִשָּׂא שֵׁמַע שָׁוְא״, וּקְרִי בֵּיהּ: ״לֹא תַּשִּׂיא״.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet said, citing Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya: Anyone who speaks slander, and anyone who accepts slander and anyone who testifies falsely about another, it is fitting to throw him to the dogs, as it is stated: you shall cast it to the dogs” and afterward it is written: “You shall not utter [ tisa ] a false report; read into Do not cause to be accepted [ tasi ],
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah: Anyone who relates slanderous speech, and anyone who accepts slanderous speech, and anyone who testifies falsely against his fellow - it is fitting to cast him to the dogs, as it is said: "You shall cast it to the dog," and it is written thereafter: "You shall not carry false report," and it is read as: "You shall not bear."

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּאִיכָּא הַלֵּל הַגָּדוֹל, אֲנַן מַאי טַעְמָא אָמְרִינַן הַאי? מִשּׁוּם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה דְבָרִים הַלָּלוּ: יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם, קְרִיעַת יַם סוּף, וּמַתַּן תּוֹרָה, וּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים, וְחֶבְלוֹ שֶׁל מָשִׁיחַ.
human_translation: And since there is great hallel , what is the reason one recites this because contains these five matters: exodus from Egypt, the splitting of the Red Sea, the giving of the Torah, the resurrection of the dead, and the pangs of the Messiah.
llm_translation: And when there is Hillel the Great, what is the reason that we say this? Because it contains these five things: the exodus from Egypt, the splitting of the Red Sea, the giving of the Torah, the resurrection of the dead, and the birth pangs of the Messiah.

hebrew_text: יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּצֵאת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִמִּצְרַיִם״. וּקְרִיעַת יַם סוּף, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַיָּם רָאָה וַיָּנוֹס״. מַתַּן תּוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״הֶהָרִים רָקְדוּ כְאֵילִים״. תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶתְהַלֵּךְ לִפְנֵי ה׳״.
human_translation: The exodus from Egypt, as it is written: “When Israel came forth out of Egypt, And the splitting of the Red Sea, as it is written: “The sea saw it and fled; The giving of the Torah, as it is written: “The mountains skipped like rams” The resurrection of the dead, as it is written: “I will walk before the Lord
llm_translation: The exodus from Egypt, as it is written: "When Israel went out from Egypt." And the splitting of the Red Sea, as it is written: "The sea saw and fled." The giving of the Torah, as it is written: "The mountains skipped like rams." The resurrection of the dead, as it is written: "I walk before the Lord."

hebrew_text: חֶבְלוֹ שֶׁל מָשִׁיחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא לָנוּ ה׳ לֹא לָנוּ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״לֹא לָנוּ ה׳ לֹא לָנוּ״ — זוֹ שִׁעְבּוּד מַלְכִיּוֹת. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״לֹא לָנוּ ה׳ לֹא לָנוּ״ — זוֹ מִלְחֶמֶת גּוֹג וּמָגוֹג.
human_translation: The pangs of the Messiah, as it is written: “Not to us, God, not to us, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: “Not to us, God, not to us” the enslavement of the kingdoms Some say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: “Not to us, God, not to us” the war of Gog and Magog,
llm_translation: The cord of the Messiah, as it is written: "Not to us, O Lord, not to us," and Rabbi Yochanan said: "Not to us, O Lord, not to us" - this refers to the servitude of kingdoms. Some say, Rabbi Yochanan said: "Not to us, O Lord, not to us" - this refers to the war of Gog and Magog.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מִילּוּט נְפָשׁוֹת שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מִגֵּיהִנָּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָנָּה ה׳ מַלְּטָה נַפְשִׁי״. חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ יְרִידָתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים לְכִבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וַעֲלִיָּיתָן מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: because it contains the deliverance of the souls of the righteous from Gehenna, as it is stated: “I beseech you, Lord, deliver my soul” Ḥizkiya said: because it contains the descent of the righteous into the fiery furnace and their ascent from it.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Because it has in it the intercession of the souls of the righteous from Gehinnom, as it is said: "O Lord, deliver my soul." Hezekiah said: Because it has in it the descent of the righteous to subdue the fire, and their ascent from it.

hebrew_text: יְרִידָתָן, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא לָנוּ ה׳ לֹא לָנוּ״ אָמַר חֲנַנְיָה, ״כִּי לְשִׁמְךָ תֵּן כָּבוֹד״ אָמַר מִישָׁאֵל, ״עַל חַסְדְּךָ וְעַל אֲמִתֶּךָ״ אָמַר עֲזַרְיָה, ״לָמָּה יֹאמְרוּ הַגּוֹיִם״ אָמְרוּ כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: Their descent as it is written: “Not to us, God, not to us,” recited. Mishael recited: “But to Your name give glory.” Azariah recited: “For Your mercy and for Your truth’s sake.” They all recited “Why should the nations say:
llm_translation: The descent of Yeridatan, as it is written: "Not for us, O Lord, not for us," said Hananiah, "but for Your name give glory," said Mishael, "for Your kindness and truth," said Azariah, "why should the nations say," they all said.

hebrew_text: עֲלִיָּיתָן מִכִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַלְלוּ אֶת ה׳ כׇּל גּוֹיִם״ אָמַר חֲנַנְיָה, ״שַׁבְּחוּהוּ כָּל הָאוּמִּים״ אָמַר מִישָׁאֵל, ״כִּי גָבַר עָלֵינוּ חַסְדּוֹ״ אָמַר עֲזַרְיָה, ״וֶאֱמֶת ה׳ לְעוֹלָם הַלְלוּיָהּ״ אָמְרוּ כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: the ascent from the fiery furnace, as it is written: Hananiah recited: “Praise the Lord, all you nations,” Mishael recited: “Laud Him all you peoples.” Azariah recited: “For His mercy is great toward us.” They all recited “And the truth of the Lord endures forever, halleluya .”
llm_translation: The ascent from the fiery furnace, as it is written: "Praise the Lord, all nations." Hananiah said, "Praise Him, all peoples." Mishael said, "For His mercy is great upon us." Azariah said, "And the truth of the Lord endures forever, hallelujah." They all said.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: ״וֶאֱמֶת ה׳ לְעוֹלָם״ גַּבְרִיאֵל אֲמָרוֹ. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהִפִּיל נִמְרוֹד הָרָשָׁע אֶת אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ אָמַר גַּבְרִיאֵל לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אֵרֵד וַאֲצַנֵּן וְאַצִּיל אֶת הַצַּדִּיק מִכִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ. אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אֲנִי יָחִיד בְּעוֹלָמִי וְהוּא יָחִיד בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, נָאֶה לַיָּחִיד לְהַצִּיל אֶת הַיָּחִיד. וּלְפִי שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֵינוֹ מְקַפֵּחַ שְׂכַר כׇּל בְּרִיָּה, אָמַר: תִּזְכֶּה וְתַצִּיל שְׁלֹשָׁה מִבְּנֵי בָנָיו.
human_translation: And some say Gabriel recited: “And the truth of the Lord endures forever.” When the evil Nimrod threw our father, Abraham, into the fiery furnace, Gabriel said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, I will descend and cool and I will save the righteous from the fiery furnace. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to him: I am unique in my world and is unique in his world. It is fitting for the unique to save the unique. And as the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not withhold reward from any creature said You will merit the rescue of three of his descendants
llm_translation: "And some say: 'The truth of the Lord is forever,' Gabriel said. At the moment when the wicked Nimrod cast our father Abraham into the fiery furnace, Gabriel said before the Holy One, blessed be He: 'Master of the Universe, I will descend and cool and save the righteous one from the fiery furnace.' The Holy One, blessed be He, said to him: 'I am unique in My world, and he is unique in his world, it is fitting for the unique one to save the unique one.' And since the Holy One, blessed be He, does not withhold the reward of any creature, He said: 'You will merit and save three of his descendants.'"

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַשִּׁלוֹנִי: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהִפִּיל נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הָרָשָׁע חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, עָמַד יוֹרֶקְמוֹ שַׂר הַבָּרָד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אֵרֵד וַאֲצַנֵּן אֶת הַכִּבְשָׁן וְאַצִּיל לַצַּדִּיקִים הַלָּלוּ מִכִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ. אָמַר לוֹ גַּבְרִיאֵל: אֵין גְּבוּרָתוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּכָךְ שֶׁאַתָּה שַׂר בָּרָד, וְהַכֹּל יוֹדְעִין שֶׁהַמַּיִם מְכַבִּין אֶת הָאֵשׁ. אֶלָּא, אֲנִי שַׂר שֶׁל אֵשׁ אֵרֵד וַאֲקָרֵר מִבִּפְנִים,
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon HaShiloni taught: When the evil threw Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah into the fiery furnace, Yurkamo, the ministering angel of hail, stood before the Holy One, Blessed be He, said before Him: Master of the Universe, I will go down and cool furnace, and I will save these righteous ones from the fiery furnace. Gabriel said to him: The strength of the Holy One, Blessed be He, will not be in this you are the minister of hail, and everyone knows that water extinguishes fire. Rather, I, the ministering angel of fire, will descend, and I will cool from within,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon HaShiloni expounded: When the wicked Nebuchadnezzar cast Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah into the fiery furnace, Yorekmo, the prince of hail, stood before the Holy One, blessed be He, and said before Him: "Master of the Universe, I will descend and cool the furnace and save these righteous ones from the fiery furnace." Gabriel said to him: "The strength of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not in this, that you are a prince of hail, and all know that water extinguishes fire. Rather, I, as the prince of fire, will descend and heat it from within."

hebrew_text: וְאַקְדִּיחַ מִבַּחוּץ, וְאֶעֱשֶׂה נֵס בְּתוֹךְ נֵס. אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רֵד! בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה פָּתַח גַּבְרִיאֵל וְאָמַר: ״וֶאֱמֶת ה׳ לְעוֹלָם״.
human_translation: and I will burn from the outside, and I will perform a miracle within a miracle. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to him: Descend. At that time Gabriel began and recited: “And the truth of the Lord endures forever”
llm_translation: "And I will smoke from outside, and I will perform a miracle within a miracle." The Holy One, blessed be He, said to him: "Descend!" At that moment, the angel Gabriel appeared and said: "The truth of the Lord is eternal."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: ״וֶאֱמֶת ה׳ לְעוֹלָם״ — דָּגִים שֶׁבַּיָּם אֲמָרוּהוּ, כִּדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁבְּאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר מִקְּטַנֵּי אֲמָנָה הָיוּ, וְכִדְדָרֵשׁ רַבָּה בַּר מָרִי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וַיַּמְרוּ עַל יָם בְּיַם סוּף״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִמְרוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה וְאָמְרוּ: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאָנוּ עוֹלִין מִצַּד אֶחָד, כָּךְ מִצְרִיִּים עוֹלִים מִצַּד אַחֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Natan says: “And the truth of the Lord endures forever” recited by the fish in the sea, in accordance with Rav Huna. Rav Huna said: The Jewish people of that generation, were of little faith. And is as Rabba bar Mari taught: What is which is written: “But they were rebellious at the sea, even at the Red Sea” teaches that the Jews rebelled at that time, and said: just as we ascending from one side, so too the Egyptians ascending from other side,
llm_translation: Rabbi Nathan says: "The truth of the Lord is forever" - the fish of the sea said it, as Rav Huna said: Israel in that generation were of little faith, and as Rabba bar Mari expounded: What is the meaning of "And they embittered upon the sea, at the Sea of Reeds"? - it teaches that the Israelites embittered at that moment and said: Just as we ascend from one side, so too the Egyptians ascend from the other side.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְשַׂר שֶׁל יָם: פְּלוֹט אוֹתָן לַיַּבָּשָׁה! אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, כְּלוּם יֵשׁ עֶבֶד שֶׁנּוֹתֵן לוֹ רַבּוֹ מַתָּנָה וְחוֹזֵר וְנוֹטֵל מִמֶּנּוּ? אָמַר לוֹ: אֶתֵּן לָךְ אֶחָד וּמֶחֱצָה שֶׁבָּהֶן.
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the ministering angel of the sea: Spew out onto dry land. said before Him: Master of the Universe, is there a servant whose master gives him a gift and then takes it from him? He said to him: I will give you one and a half their
llm_translation: He said to him the Holy One, blessed be He, to the minister of the sea: Float them onto dry land! He said before Him: Master of the universe, is there any slave to whom his master gives a gift and then takes it back from him? He said to him: I will give you one and a half of them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, יֵשׁ עֶבֶד שֶׁתּוֹבֵעַ אֶת רַבּוֹ? אָמַר לוֹ: נַחַל קִישׁוֹן יְהֵא לִי עָרֵב. מִיָּד פָּלַט אוֹתָן לַיַּבָּשָׁה וּבָאוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְרָאוּ אוֹתָן. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּרְא יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת מִצְרַיִם מֵת עַל שְׂפַת הַיָּם״.
human_translation: He said to him: Master of the Universe, can a servant issue a claim against his master He said to him: The Kishon River will be a guarantor for Me. Immediately, spewed them out onto the land, and the Jewish people came and saw they As it is stated: “And Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the seashore”
llm_translation: He said to him: Master of the Universe, is there a slave who can demand payment from his master? He said to him: Let the Kishon River be my guarantor. Immediately, He caused them to be washed up on dry land, and the Israelites saw them, as it is stated: "And Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the seashore."

hebrew_text: מַאי אֶחָד וּמֶחֱצָה שֶׁבָּהֶן? דְּאִילּוּ בְּפַרְעֹה כְּתִיב: ״שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת רֶכֶב בָּחוּר״, וְאִילּוּ בְּסִיסְרָא כְּתִיב: ״תְּשַׁע מֵאוֹת רֶכֶב בַּרְזֶל״.
human_translation: What is one and a half their While, with regard to Pharaoh, it is written: “Six hundred chosen chariots” whereas, with regard to Sisera, it is written: “Nine hundred iron chariots”
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "one and a half" in both of them? For if it is written regarding Pharaoh, "six hundred chosen chariots," and if it is written regarding Sisera, "nine hundred chariots of iron."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא סִיסְרָא [אֲתָא עֲלַיְיהוּ בְּדִקְרֵי דְפַרְזְלָא, הוֹצִיא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עֲלֵיהֶם כּוֹכָבִים מִמְּסִילּוֹתָם, דִּכְתִיב:] ״מִן שָׁמַיִם נִלְחָמוּ הַכּוֹכָבִים״. כֵּיוָן דִּנְחִיתוּ כּוֹכְבֵי שָׁמַיִם עֲלַיְיהוּ, אַקְדִּירוּ הָנֵי דִּקְרֵי דְפַרְזְלָא. נְחִיתוּ לְאַקְרוֹרֵי לְמִיסְחֵי נַפְשַׁיְיהוּ בְּנַחַל קִישׁוֹן,
human_translation: When Sisera came he came upon them with iron spears, the Holy One, Blessed be He, removed the stars from their orbits against as it is written: “They fought from heaven, the stars Since the stars fell on them, these iron spears heated up they went to cool them and wash themselves in the Kishon River.
llm_translation: When Sisera arrived and came upon them with the iron chariots, the Holy One, blessed be He, cast stars at them from their paths, as it is written: "From heaven the stars fought." Once the stars of heaven descended upon them, they heated up those iron chariots. They descended to the brooks to refresh themselves in the brook Kishon.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְנַחַל קִישׁוֹן: לֵךְ וְהַשְׁלֵם עֵרְבוֹנְךָ. מִיָּד גְּרָפָם נַחַל קִישׁוֹן וְהִשְׁלִיכָן לַיָּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נַחַל קִישׁוֹן גְּרָפָם נַחַל קְדוּמִים״, מַאי ״נַחַל קְדוּמִים״? נַחַל שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה עָרֵב מִקֶּדֶם. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה פָּתְחוּ דָּגִים שֶׁל יָם וְאָמְרוּ: ״וֶאֱמֶת ה׳ לְעוֹלָם״.
human_translation: the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the Kishon River: Go and pay your guarantee Immediately, the Kishon River swept them away and cast them into the sea, as it is stated: “The Kishon River swept them away, that ancient river” What is “ancient river”? the river that was appointed a guarantor from ancient At that time, the fish of the sea began and recited: “And the truth of the Lord endures forever,”
llm_translation: He said to him the Holy One, blessed be He, to Nahal Kishon: Go and complete your pledge. Immediately He grasped Nahal Kishon and threw them into the sea, as it is stated: "Nahal Kishon, Nahal Kedumim." What is "Nahal Kedumim"? A river that was made as a pledge from the east. At that moment, the fish of the sea opened their mouths and said: "The truth of the Lord is eternal."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״מוֹשִׁיבִי עֲקֶרֶת הַבַּיִת״ — אָמְרָה כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, שָׂמוּנִי בָּנֶיךָ כְּחוּלְדָּה זוֹ הַדָּרָה בְּעִיקָּרֵי בָתִּים.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: What is which is written: “Who makes the barren woman dwell in her house The Congregation of Israel, said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, Your children treat me like this rat that dwells in the vaults of houses,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, what is the meaning of what is written: "The one who establishes the foundation of the house"? The Assembly of Israel said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, You have placed Your children like this precious jewel in the main rooms of houses.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אָהַבְתִּי כִּי יִשְׁמַע ה׳״ — אָמְרָה כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם אֵימַת אֲנִי אֲהוּבָה לְפָנֶיךָ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁתִּשְׁמַע קוֹל תַּחֲנוּנַי. ״דַּלּוֹתִי וְלִי יְהוֹשִׁיעַ״ — אָמְרָה כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁדַּלָּה אֲנִי בְּמִצְוֹת, לְךָ אֲנִי וְלִי נָאֶה לְהוֹשִׁיעַ.
human_translation: Rava taught: What is which is written: “I love that the Lord should hear The Congregation of Israel said: Master of the Universe, when am I beloved by You, When You hear the voice of my supplications. “I was brought low, and He saved me” The Congregation of Israel said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, although I am lowly in mitzvot, I am Yours, it is fitting I be saved.
llm_translation: Rava expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "I love because the Lord will hear"? — The Congregation of Israel said: Master of the Universe, when am I beloved before You? When You hear the voice of my supplication. "Though I am poor and needy, the Lord will think of me" — The Congregation of Israel said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, even though I am poor in commandments, to You I am fitting and it is proper for You to save me.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: כְּשֶׁחָלָה רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, שָׁלַח לוֹ רַבִּי: אֱמוֹר לָנוּ שְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַרְתָּ לָנוּ מִשּׁוּם אָבִיךָ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: When Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, fell ill, Rabbi sent to him: Tell us two or three matters that you said to us, citing your father.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: When Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, fell ill, Rabbi sent to him: Tell us two or three matters that you said to us in the name of your father.

hebrew_text: שָׁלַח לוֹ: כָּךְ אָמַר אַבָּא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״הַלְלוּ אֶת ה׳ כׇּל גּוֹיִם״, אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ? הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״הַלָּלוּ אֶת ה׳ כׇּל גּוֹיִם״ אַגְּבוּרוֹת וְנִפְלָאוֹת דְּעָבֵיד בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אָנוּ דְּ״גָבַר עָלֵינוּ חַסְדּוֹ״.
human_translation: He sent to him: My father said as follows: What is which is written: “Praise the Lord, all you nations, What are the nations of the world doing this is is saying: “Praise the Lord, all you nations” for the mighty acts and the wonders that performed before All the more so we, as His mercy is great toward us.
llm_translation: He sent to him: thus said Abba, what is the meaning of what is written: "Praise the Lord, all you nations," what do the nations of the world do? This is what he is saying: "Praise the Lord, all you nations," the mighty and wondrous deeds that He does with them, all the more so with us, for "His kindness is great upon us."

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: עֲתִידָה מִצְרַיִם שֶׁתָּבִיא דּוֹרוֹן לַמָּשִׁיחַ. כְּסָבוּר, אֵינוֹ מְקַבֵּל מֵהֶם. אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לַמָּשִׁיחַ: קַבֵּל מֵהֶם! אַכְסַנְיָא עָשׂוּ לְבָנַיי בְּמִצְרַיִם. מִיָּד: ״יֶאֱתָיוּ חַשְׁמַנִּים מִנִּי מִצְרָיִם״.
human_translation: And furthermore, In the future, Egypt will bring a gift to the Messiah will think not to accept from them, The Holy One, Blessed be He, say to the Messiah: Accept from them, they granted lodging to My children in Egypt. Immediately, “Nobles shall come out of Egypt”
llm_translation: And furthermore: Egypt is destined to bring a gift to the Messiah. He thought that he would not accept from them. The Holy One, blessed be He, said to the Messiah: Accept from them! They made an ornament for My children in Egypt. Immediately: "They shall come with silver and gold from Egypt."

hebrew_text: נָשְׂאָה כּוּשׁ קַל וָחוֹמֶר בְּעַצְמָהּ: וּמָה הַלָּלוּ שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּעְבְּדוּ בָּהֶן כָּךְ, אֲנִי שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּעְבַּדְתִּי בָּהֶן לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן. אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: קַבֵּל מֵהֶם. מִיָּד ״כּוּשׁ תָּרִיץ יָדָיו לֵאלֹהִים״.
human_translation: Kush draw an a fortiori with regard to itself: Just as these they enslaved all the more so not me, who did not enslave them, The Holy One, Blessed be He, say to Accept from them. Immediately, “Kush shall hasten to stretch out her hands to God”
llm_translation: She took Kush lightly and seriously in herself: And what about these that were enslaved in them thus, I who was not enslaved in them certainly not. The Holy One, blessed be He, said to him: Accept from them. Immediately, "Kush will stretch out her hands to God."

hebrew_text: נָשְׂאָה מַלְכוּת (רוֹמִי) הָרְשָׁעָה קַל וָחוֹמֶר בְּעַצְמָהּ: וּמָה הַלָּלוּ שֶׁאֵין אֲחֵיהֶן כָּךְ, אָנוּ שֶׁאָנוּ אֲחֵיהֶן — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?! אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְגַבְרִיאֵל: ״גְּעַר חַיַּת קָנֶה״ — גְּעוֹר חַיָּה וּקְנֵה לְךָ עֵדָה.
human_translation: the wicked kingdom of Rome draw an a fortiori with regard to itself: Just as these, who are not their brothers, we, who are their brothers, all the more so not The Holy One, Blessed be He, say to Gabriel: “Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds [ kaneh ], Rebuke the beast and acquire [ keneh ] congregation [ eda ]
llm_translation: The kingdom of (Rome) the wicked is light and heavy in itself: And if these, whose brothers are not like them, we who are their brothers — all the more so?! The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Gabriel: "Rebuke the wild beast" — Rebuke the animal and acquire for yourself a congregation.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״גְּעוֹר חַיַּת קָנֶה״ שֶׁדָּרָה בֵּין הַקָּנִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְכַרְסְמֶנָּה חֲזִיר מִיָּעַר וְזִיז שָׂדַי יִרְעֶנָּה״.
human_translation: Alternatively, “Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds,” that dwells between the reeds, as it is written: “The pig out of the wood ravages it, and that which moves in the field feeds on it”
llm_translation: Another explanation: "A wild animal of the reeds" that dwells among the reeds, as it is written: "The boar from the forest ravages it, and the wild beast of the field grazes upon it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גְּעוֹר בְּחַיָּה שֶׁכׇּל מַעֲשֶׂיהָ נִכְתָּבִין בְּקוּלְמוֹס אֶחָד. ״עֲדַת אַבִּירִים בְּעֶגְלֵי עַמִּים״ — שֶׁשָּׁחֲטוּ אַבִּירִים כַּעֲגָלִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם בְּעָלִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said Rebuke the beast, all of whose actions are written with a single quill. “The multitude of the bulls [ abirim ], with the calves of the peoples”; who slaughtered mighty people [ abirim ] like ownerless calves.
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Rebuke a living animal, for all its actions are written in one scroll. "The assembly of nobles among the nations" - they slaughtered nobles like calves that have no master.

hebrew_text: ״מִתְרַפֵּס בְּרַצֵּי כָסֶף״ — שֶׁפּוֹשְׁטִין יָד לְקַבֵּל מָמוֹן, וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין רְצוֹן בְּעָלִים. ״פִּיזַּר עַמִּים קְרָבוֹת יֶחְפָּצוּן״ — מִי גָּרַם לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיִּתְפַּזְּרוּ לְבֵין אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם? קְרִיבוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ חֲפֵצִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: “Everyone submitting himself with pieces of silver,” that open their hands to receive money but do not perform the will of their masters, “He has scattered the peoples who delight in war”; what caused the Jewish people to be scattered among the nations of the world? The intimacies that they desired with them.
llm_translation: "Mitrapes in silver coins" — that they extend their hand to receive money, and do not fulfill the will of the owners. "Pezer amim keravot yechfatzun" — who caused Israel to be scattered among the nations of the world? Sacrifices that they desired.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד שָׁלַח לוֹ: שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וְשִׁשִּׁים וַחֲמִשָּׁה שְׁוָוקִים בִּכְרַךְ גָּדוֹל שֶׁל רוֹמִי, וְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד (הָיוּ) [יֵשׁ] בּוֹ שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וְשִׁשִּׁים וַחֲמִשָּׁה בִּירָנִיּוֹת, וְכׇל בִּירָנִית וּבִירָנִית (הָיוּ בּוֹ) [יֵשׁ בָּהּ] שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וְשִׁשִּׁים וַחֲמִשָּׁה מַעֲלוֹת, וְכׇל מַעֲלָה וּמַעֲלָה (הָיוּ בּוֹ) [יֵשׁ בָּהּ] כְּדֵי לָזוּן אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: And further sent to 365 markets in the great city of Rome, and each and every one contained 365 towers, and each and every tower contained 365 floors, and each and every floor contained enough to sustain the entire world.
llm_translation: And furthermore he sent to him: three hundred and sixty-five marketplaces in a large Roman city, and each and every one had three hundred and sixty-five balconies, and each balcony had three hundred and sixty-five steps, and each step had enough to sustain the entire world.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) [שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי] לְרַבִּי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ (לְ)רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּר יוֹסֵי [לְרַבִּי]: הָנֵי לְמַן? לָךְ וּלְחַבְרָךְ וּלְחַבְרוּתָךְ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״סַחְרָהּ וְאֶתְנַנָּהּ קוֹדֶשׁ לַה׳ לֹא יֵאָצֵר וְלֹא יֵחָסֵן כִּי לַיּוֹשְׁבִים לִפְנֵי ה׳ יִהְיֶה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said to Rabbi and some say it to Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei: For whom this For you and your colleagues and the colleagues of your colleagues, as it is stated: “Her grain and her hire shall be consecrated to the Lord; it shall not be treasured nor laid up; for her gain shall be for those who dwell before the Lord,
llm_translation: Rabbi (Ishmael) Shimon son of Rabbi said to Rabbi, and some say to him (to) Rabbi Ishmael son of Yosei to Rabbi: Those for whom? For you and for your friend and for your friend's friend, as it is stated: "Her merchandise and her hire shall be holiness to the Lord; it shall not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise shall be for them that dwell before the Lord" etc.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לֹא יֵאָצֵר״? תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״לֹא יֵאָצֵר״ — זֶה בֵּית אוֹצָר, ״וְלֹא יֵחָסֵן״ — זֶה בֵּית גְּנִיזָה. מַאי ״כִּי לַיּוֹשְׁבִים לִפְנֵי ה׳״? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר:
human_translation: What is “It shall not be treasured”? Rav Yosef teaches: “It shall not be treasured,” this a storehouse; “nor laid up,” this a treasury, What is “Who dwell before the Lord?” Rabbi Elazar said:
llm_translation: What is "not to be stored"? Rav Yosef taught: "Not to be stored" - this refers to a treasury, "and not to be hoarded" - this refers to a genizah. What is "for those who sit before the Lord"? Rabbi Elazar said:

hebrew_text: זֶה הַמַּכִּיר מְקוֹם חֲבֵירוֹ בַּיְּשִׁיבָה. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: זֶה הַמְקַבֵּל פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בַּיְּשִׁיבָה.
human_translation: This is one who recognizes his colleague’s place in the yeshiva, Some say Rabbi Elazar said This is who greets his colleague in the yeshiva,
llm_translation: This is the one who recognizes the place of his colleague in the study hall. Some say, Rabbi Elazar said: This is one who greets his colleague in the study hall.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לִמְכַסֶּה עָתִיק״ — זֶה הַמְכַסֶּה דְּבָרִים שֶׁכִּיסָּה עַתִּיק יוֹמִין, וּמַאי נִינְהוּ? סִתְרֵי תוֹרָה. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: זֶה הַמְגַלֶּה דְּבָרִים שֶׁכִּיסָּה עַתִּיק יוֹמִין, מַאי נִינְהוּ? טַעֲמֵי תוֹרָה.
human_translation: What “For stately clothing [ limekhaseh atik ]” This is who conceals [ mekhaseh ] that the Ancient of Days [ atik yomin ], concealed. And what are these? the secrets of the Torah, And some say: This who reveals matters that the Ancient of Days concealed. And what are these? reasons Torah,
llm_translation: "What is 'to cover the ancient'? — This is one who covers matters that were covered in ancient days. And what are they? Hidden teachings of the Torah. And there are those who say: This is one who reveals matters that were covered in ancient days. What are they? Reasons of the Torah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״לַמְנַצֵּחַ מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד״ — זַמְּרוּ לְמִי שֶׁנּוֹצְחִין אוֹתוֹ וְשָׂמֵחַ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said, citing Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei: What is which is written: “ Lamenatzeaḥ a psalm of David” Sing to the One who rejoices when conquered [ shenotzḥin oto ].
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, what is the meaning of what is written: "For the conductor, a psalm of David" - Sing to the One who conducts and rejoice.

hebrew_text: בֹּא וּרְאֵה שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם. בָּשָׂר וָדָם — מְנַצְּחִין אוֹתוֹ וְעָצֵב, אֲבָל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — נוֹצְחִין אוֹתוֹ וְשָׂמֵחַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לְהַשְׁמִידָם לוּלֵי מֹשֶׁה בְחִירוֹ עָמַד בַּפֶּרֶץ לְפָנָיו״.
human_translation: Come and see how the characteristics of the Holy One, Blessed be He, are unlike the characteristics of flesh and blood: When a flesh and blood is conquered, he is sad; however, when the Holy One, Blessed be He, is conquered, He rejoices, as it is stated: “Therefore He said that He would destroy them, had not Moses His chosen stood before Him in the breach,
llm_translation: Come and see that the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the measure of flesh and blood. With flesh and blood, one conquers and becomes sad, but with the Holy One, blessed be He, one conquers and rejoices, as it is stated: "And He said to destroy them, had not Moses His chosen one stood in the breach before Him."
