hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וִידֵי אָדָם מִתַּחַת כַּנְפֵיהֶם״, ״יָדוֹ״ כְּתִיב — זֶה יָדוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁפְּרוּסָה תַּחַת כַּנְפֵי הַחַיּוֹת כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל בַּעֲלֵי תְשׁוּבָה מִיַּד מִדַּת הַדִּין.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said, citing Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, citing Rabbi Yehuda Nesia: What is which is written “And they had the hands of a man under their wings” “his hand” is written This is the hand of the Holy One, Blessed be He, that is spread under the wings of the ḥayyot to accept penitents from the attribute of justice.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yehudah Nasi: What is the meaning of what is written: "And the hands of man are under their wings," "his hand" is written - this is the hand of the Holy One, blessed be He, which is spread out under the wings of the living creatures in order to receive those who repent immediately from the attribute of judgment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם יוֹסֵף לִקְּטוֹ וֶהֱבִיאוֹ לְמִצְרַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְלַקֵּט יוֹסֵף אֶת כׇּל הַכֶּסֶף הַנִּמְצָא״. אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם וְשֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן, בִּשְׁאָר אֲרָצוֹת מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכׇל הָאָרֶץ בָּאוּ מִצְרַיְמָה״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Joseph collected all the silver and gold in the world and brought it to Egypt, as it is stated: “And Joseph collected all the money found I have only that in the land of Egypt and that in the Land of Canaan. From where that in other lands? The verse states “And all the land came to Egypt
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: All the silver and gold in the world Joseph gathered and brought to Egypt, as it is stated: "And Joseph gathered all the money found." I only know that this applies to the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan, from where do we derive that it applies to other lands? The verse teaches us: "And all the land came to Egypt."

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִמִּצְרַיִם הֶעֱלוּהוּ עִמָּהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְנַצְּלוּ אֶת מִצְרָיִם״, רַב אַסִּי אָמַר: עֲשָׂאוּהָ כִּמְצוּדָה זוֹ שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ דָּגָן, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אָמַר: כִּמְצוּלָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ דָּגִים.
human_translation: And when the Jewish people ascended from Egypt they took with them, as it is stated: “They despoiled [ vayenatzlu ] Egypt” Rav Asi said: They made like this trap [ metzuda ] in which there is no grain. Rabbi Shimon said: like the depths [ kimetzula ] in which there are no fish.
llm_translation: When the Israelites ascended from Egypt, they brought it up with them, as it is stated: "And they plundered Egypt" (Exodus 12:36). Rav Assi said: They made it like this trap that does not contain grain. Rabbi Shimon said: Like this trap that does not contain fish.

hebrew_text: וְהָיָה מוּנָּח עַד רְחַבְעָם. בָּא שִׁישַׁק מֶלֶךְ מִצְרַיִם וּנְטָלוֹ מֵרְחַבְעָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי בַּשָּׁנָה הַחֲמִישִׁית לַמֶּלֶךְ רְחַבְעָם עָלָה שִׁישַׁק מֶלֶךְ מִצְרַיִם [עַל יְרוּשָׁלִַים] וַיִּקַּח אֶת אוֹצְרוֹת בֵּית ה׳ וְאֶת אוֹצְרוֹת בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ״. בָּא זֶרַח מֶלֶךְ כּוּשׁ וּנְטָלוֹ מִשִּׁישַׁק.
human_translation: And remained until Rehoboam, Shishak, king of Egypt, came and took it from Rehoboam, as it is stated: “And it came to pass in the fifth year of king Rehoboam, that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem. And he took the treasures of the house of the Lord, and the treasures of the king’s house; Zerah, king of Kush, came and took it from Shishak.
llm_translation: "And it shall be at rest until Rehoboam. Shishak king of Egypt came and took from Rehoboam, as it is stated: 'And it came to pass in the fifth year of King Rehoboam, that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, and took away the treasures of the house of the Lord, and the treasures of the king's house.' Zerah the king of Cush came and took from Shishak."

hebrew_text: בָּא אָסָא וּנְטָלוֹ מִזֶּרַח מֶלֶךְ כּוּשׁ וְשִׁיגְּרוֹ לְהַדְרִימּוֹן בֶּן טַבְרִימּוֹן. בָּאוּ בְּנֵי עַמּוֹן וּנְטָלוּם מֵהַדְרִימּוֹן בֶּן טַבְרִימּוֹן. בָּא יְהוֹשָׁפָט וּנְטָלוֹ מִבְּנֵי עַמּוֹן וְהָיָה מוּנָּח עַד אָחָז.
human_translation: Asa came and took it from Zerah, king of Kush, and sent it to Hadrimmon ben Tabrimmon, The children of Ammon came and took it from Hadrimmon ben Tabrimmon, Jehosaphat came and took it from the children of Ammon and it remained until Ahaz.
llm_translation: Asa came and took from the east the kingdom of Kush, and he sent it to Hadadrimmon son of Tabrimmon. The children of Ammon came and took it from Hadadrimmon son of Tabrimmon. Jehoshaphat came and took it from the children of Ammon, and it remained until Ahaz.

hebrew_text: בָּא סַנְחֵרִיב וּנְטָלוֹ מֵאָחָז. בָּא חִזְקִיָּה וּנְטָלוֹ מִסַּנְחֵרִיב וְהָיָה מוּנָּח עַד צִדְקִיָּה. בָּאוּ כַּשְׂדִּיִּים וּנְטָלוּהוּ מִצִּדְקִיָּה. בָּאוּ פָּרְסִיִּים וּנְטָלוּהוּ מִכַּשְׂדִּיִּים. בָּאוּ יְוָונִים וּנְטָלוּהוּ מִפָּרְסִיִּים. בָּאוּ רוֹמִיִּים וּנְטָלוּהוּ מִיַּד יְוָונִים, וַעֲדַיִין מוּנָּח בְּרוֹמִי.
human_translation: Sennacherib came and took it from Ahaz. Hezekiah came and took it from Sennacherib, and it remained until Zedekiah. The Chaldeans came and took it from Zedekiah. The Persians came and took it from the Chaldeans. The Greeks came and took it from the Persians. The Romans came and took it from the Greeks, and still remains in Rome.
llm_translation: Sancheiriv came and took it from Ahaz. Hezekiah came and took it from Sancheiriv, and it remained until Zedekiah. The Babylonians came and took it from Zedekiah. The Persians came and took it from the Babylonians. The Greeks came and took it from the Persians. The Romans came and took it from the Greeks, and it is still in Roman hands.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא (בַּר) חֲנִינָא: שָׁלֹשׁ מַטְמוֹנִיּוֹת הִטְמִין יוֹסֵף בְּמִצְרַיִם, אַחַת נִתְגַּלָּה לְקֹרַח, וְאַחַת נִתְגַּלָּה לְאַנְטוֹנִינוּס בֶּן אַסְוִירוּס, וְאַחַת גְּנוּזָה לְצַדִּיקִים לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said: Joseph hid three treasures in Egypt. One was revealed to Korah, one was revealed to Antoninos ben Asveiros, and one is hidden for the righteous in the future.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama (bar) Ḥanina said: Three treasures Joseph hid in Egypt, one was revealed to Korah, one was revealed to Antoninus son of Asviros, and one is hidden for the righteous in the future to come.

hebrew_text: ״עוֹשֶׁר שָׁמוּר לִבְעָלָיו לְרָעָתוֹ״, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: זוֹ עׇשְׁרוֹ שֶׁל קֹרַח. (שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:) ״וְאֶת כׇּל הַיְקוּם אֲשֶׁר בְּרַגְלֵיהֶם״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: זֶה מָמוֹנוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם שֶׁמַּעֲמִידוֹ עַל רַגְלָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: מַשּׂאוֹי שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת פְּרָדוֹת לְבָנוֹת הָיוּ מַפְתְּחוֹת בֵּית גְּנָזָיו שֶׁל קֹרַח, וְכוּלְּהוּ אַקְלִידֵי וּקְלִיפֵּי דְגִלְדָּא.
human_translation: “Riches kept by his owner to his hurt” Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: This is the wealth of Korah, As it is stated: and all the sustenance that was at their feet” Rabbi Elazar said: This a person’s money that stands him upon his feet. Rabbi Levi said: The keys to Korah’s treasuries were load of three hundred white mules, and they were all keys [ aklidei ] and locks of leather.
llm_translation: "Wealth kept for its owner to his detriment," Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: This is the wealth of Korah. (As it is said:) "And all that belonged to them on their feet," Rabbi Elazar said: This is a person's wealth that supports him on his feet. Rabbi Levi said: Three hundred keys made of white pearls were the keys to the treasury of Korah, and all of them were made of the shells and husks of the sea snail."

hebrew_text: (דיא״ש אדי״ש כשד״ך מאוד״ך סִימָן). אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: ״אוֹדְךָ כִּי עֲנִיתָנִי״ — אָמַר דָּוִד. ״אֶבֶן מָאֲסוּ הַבּוֹנִים הָיְתָה לְרֹאשׁ פִּנָּה״ — אָמַר יִשַׁי. ״מֵאֵת ה׳ הָיְתָה זֹּאת״ — אָמְרוּ אֶחָיו. ״זֶה הַיּוֹם עָשָׂה ה׳״ — אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: Dalet, yod, alef, shin, alef, dalet, yod, shin, khaf, shin, dalet, khaf, mem, alef, vav, dalet, khaf a mnemonic Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said David recited: “I will give thanks to You, for You have answered me” Yishai recited: “The stone which the builders rejected has become the chief keystone” The brothers of recited: “This is the Lord’s doing; Samuel recited: “This is the day which the Lord has made;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (דיא״ש אדי״ש כשד״ך מאוד״ך סִימָן). אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: ״אוֹדְךָ כִּי עֲנִיתָנִי״ — אָמַר דָּוִד. ״אֶבֶן מָאֲסוּ הַבּוֹנִים הָיְתָה לְרֹאשׁ פִּנָּה״ — אָמַר יִשַׁי. ״מֵאֵת ה׳ הָיְתָה זֹּאת״ — אָמְרוּ אֶחָיו. ״זֶה הַיּוֹם עָשָׂה ה׳״ — אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל. English translation: (דיא״ש אדי״ש כשד״ך מאוד״ך סִימָן). Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: "I will praise You, for You have answered me" — said David. "The stone which the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone" — said Yishai. "This is from the Lord; it is marvelous in our eyes" — said his brothers. "This is the day that the Lord has made" — said Shmuel.

hebrew_text: ״אָנָּא ה׳ הוֹשִׁיעָה נָּא״ — אָמְרוּ אֶחָיו. ״אָנָּא ה׳ הַצְלִיחָה נָּא״ — אָמַר דָּוִד. ״בָּרוּךְ הַבָּא בְּשֵׁם ה׳״ — אָמַר יִשַׁי. ״בֵּרַכְנוּכֶם מִבֵּית ה׳״ — אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל. ״אֵל ה׳ וַיָּאֶר לָנוּ״ — אָמְרוּ כּוּלָּן. ״אִסְרוּ חַג בַּעֲבוֹתִים״ — אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל. ״אֵלִי אַתָּה וְאוֹדֶךָּ״ — אָמַר דָּוִד. ״אֱלֹהַי אֲרוֹמְמֶךָּ״ — אָמְרוּ כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: The brothers of recited: “We beseech You, Lord, save now” David recited: “We beseech You, Lord, make us prosper now” Yishai recited: “Blessed be he who comes in the name of the Lord” Samuel recited: “We bless you out of the house of the Lord” They all recited: “The Lord is God, and has given us light” Samuel recited: “Order the Festival procession with boughs, David recited: “You are my God, and I will give thanks to You” They all recited: “You are my God, I will exalt You”
llm_translation: "Please, Hashem, save now" - his brothers said. "Please, Hashem, grant success now" - said David. "Blessed is he who comes in the name of Hashem" - said Yishai. "Blessed are you from the house of Hashem" - said Shmuel. "Hashem is God, and He has given us light" - they all said. "Bind the festival sacrifice with cords" - said Shmuel. "You are my God, and I will praise You" - said David. "My God, I will exalt You" - they all said.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ
human_translation: We learned there, a place where they were accustomed
llm_translation: We learned there: a place where they were accustomed to.

hebrew_text: לִכְפּוֹל — יִכְפּוֹל, לִפְשׁוֹט — יִפְשׁוֹט, לְבָרֵךְ אַחֲרָיו — יְבָרֵךְ, הַכֹּל כְּמִנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְאַחֲרָיו, אֲבָל לְפָנָיו — [מִצְוָה] לְבָרֵךְ. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת מְבָרֵךְ עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹבֵר לַעֲשִׂיָּיתָן.
human_translation: to double one doubles them simply, simply. to recite a blessing after recite a blessing. Everything is in accordance with the custom. Abaye said: They taught only after however, a mitzva to recite a blessing before As Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: all the mitzvot, one recites a blessing over them prior to their performance.
llm_translation: To fall - he shall fall, to spread out - he shall spread out, to bless after him - he shall bless, everything according to the custom of the land. Abaye said: They only taught regarding after him, but before him - it is a mitzvah to bless. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who recites a blessing over all the mitzvot, he passes over their performance.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״עוֹבֵר״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאַקְדּוֹמֵי הוּא? אָמַר רַבִּי נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּרׇץ אֲחִימַעַץ דֶּרֶךְ הַכִּכָּר וַיַּעֲבוֹר אֶת הַכּוּשִׁי״. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״וְהוּא עָבַר לִפְנֵיהֶם״. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי מֵהָכָא: ״וַיַּעֲבוֹר מַלְכָּם לִפְנֵיהֶם וַה׳ בְּרֹאשָׁם״.
human_translation: From where may it be inferred that over is a formulation before Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said that as it is written: “And Ahimaaz ran by way of the square and he passed [ vaya’avor ] the Kushite” Abaye said from here: “And he passed [ avar ] before them” Some say from here: “And their king shall pass on [ vaya’avor ] before them, and God at their head”
llm_translation: What is the implication that this "transgressor" is in front of them? Rabbi Nachman bar Yitzchak said, as it is written: "Achimaaz ran by way of the plain and passed the Cushite." Abaye said, from here: "And he passed before them." Some say from here: "And their king passed before them, and the Lord at their head."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי כּוֹפֵל בָּהּ דְּבָרִים, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פַּרְטָא מוֹסִיף בָּהּ דְּבָרִים. מַאי מוֹסִיף? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מוֹסִיף לִכְפּוֹל מֵ״אוֹדְךָ״ לְמַטָּה.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi doubles matters in Rabbi Elazar ben Perata added matters to What add? Abaye said: added repetitions, from “I will give thanks to You” and onward.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Kofel in it words, Rabbi Elazar ben Parta adds in it words. What does he add? Abaye said: He adds to double "from your witness" downwards.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב עַוִּירָא, זִימְנִין אָמַר לֵיהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַמֵּי וְזִימְנִין אָמַר לֵיהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַסִּי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּגְדַּל הַיֶּלֶד וַיִּגָּמַל״ — עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לַעֲשׂוֹת סְעוּדָה לַצַּדִּיקִים בְּיוֹם שֶׁיִּגְמֹל חַסְדּוֹ לְזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל יִצְחָק. לְאַחַר שֶׁאוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין נוֹתְנִין לוֹ לְאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה לְבָרֵךְ,
human_translation: Rav Avira taught. Sometimes he said citing Rav Ami, and sometimes he said citing Rav Asi: What is which is written: “And the child grew and was weaned [ vayiggamal ], In the future, the Holy One, Blessed be He, will prepare a feast for the righteous on the day that He extends [ sheyigmol ] His mercy to the descendants of Isaac. After they eat and drink, give Abraham our father a cup of blessing to recite the blessing,
llm_translation: Rav Avira expounded: Sometimes he said to him in the name of Rav Ammi, and sometimes he said to him in the name of Rav Assi: What is the meaning of what is written: "And the child grew and was weaned" - The Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to make a feast for the righteous on the day that He will show kindness to the seed of Isaac. After they eat and drink, they give to Abraham our father a cup of blessing to recite.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר לָהֶן: אֵינִי מְבָרֵךְ, שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. אוֹמֵר לוֹ לְיִצְחָק: טוֹל וּבָרֵךְ. אוֹמֵר לָהֶן: אֵינִי מְבָרֵךְ, שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנִּי עֵשָׂו. אוֹמֵר לוֹ לְיַעֲקֹב: טוֹל וּבָרֵךְ. אוֹמֵר לָהֶם: אֵינִי מְבָרֵךְ, שֶׁנָּשָׂאתִי שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת בְּחַיֵּיהֶן, שֶׁעֲתִידָה תּוֹרָה לְאוֹסְרָן עָלַי.
human_translation: And say to them: I will not recite the blessing, as Ishmael came from me. say to Isaac: Take and recite the blessing. say to them: I will not recite the blessing, as Esau came from me. say to Jacob: Take and recite the blessing. say to them: I will not recite the blessing, as I married two sisters, in their lifetimes, in the future the Torah forbade them to me.
llm_translation: And he says to them: I do not bless, for Ishmael has come out from me. He says to Isaac: Take and bless. He says to them: I do not bless, for Esau has come out from me. He says to Jacob: Take and bless. He says to them: I do not bless, for I have taken two of his sisters in their lifetime, for the Torah is destined to prohibit them to me.

hebrew_text: אוֹמֵר לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה: טוֹל וּבָרֵךְ. אוֹמֵר לָהֶם: אֵינִי מְבָרֵךְ, שֶׁלֹּא זָכִיתִי לִיכָּנֵס לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, לֹא בְּחַיַּי וְלֹא בְּמוֹתִי. אוֹמֵר לוֹ לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ: טוֹל וּבָרֵךְ, אוֹמֵר לָהֶן: אֵינִי מְבָרֵךְ, שֶׁלֹּא זָכִיתִי לְבֵן, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן״, ״נוֹן בְּנוֹ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּנוֹ״.
human_translation: say to Moses: Take and recite the blessing. say to them: I will not recite the blessing, as I did not merit to enter Eretz Yisrael, neither in my life nor in my death. say to Joshua: Take and recite the blessing. say to them: I will not recite the blessing, as I did not merit to a son. that it is written: “Joshua the son of Nun” “Nun his son, Joshua his son”
llm_translation: He says to him to Moses: Take and bless. He says to them: I do not bless, for I did not merit to enter the land of Israel, neither in my lifetime nor in my death. He says to Joshua: Take and bless, he says to them: I do not bless, for I did not merit a son, as it is written: "Joshua son of Nun," "Nun his son Joshua his son."

hebrew_text: אוֹמֵר לוֹ לְדָוִד: טוֹל וּבָרֵךְ. אוֹמֵר לָהֶן: אֲנִי אֲבָרֵךְ, וְלִי נָאֶה לְבָרֵךְ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כּוֹס יְשׁוּעוֹת אֶשָּׂא וּבְשֵׁם ה׳ אֶקְרָא״.
human_translation: say to David: Take and recite the blessing. say to them: I will recite the blessing, and it is fitting for me to recite the blessing, as it is stated: “I will lift up the cup of salvation, and I will call upon the name of the Lord”
llm_translation: He says to him to David: Take and bless. He says to them: I will bless, and it is fitting for me to bless, as it is stated: "I will lift the cup of salvation and call upon the name of the Lord."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מַפְטִירִין אַחַר הַפֶּסַח אֲפִיקוֹמָן.
human_translation: One does not conclude after the Paschal lamb with an afikoman .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: We do not conclude with an after-meal blessing after the Passover offering.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי אֲפִיקוֹמָן? אָמַר רַב: שֶׁלֹּא יֵעָקְרוּ מֵחֲבוּרָה לַחֲבוּרָה.
human_translation: What afikoman ? Rav said: that not leave group to group.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "Apikoman"? Rav said: That they should not be uprooted from one group to another.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: כְּגוֹן אוֹרְדִּילָאֵי לִי וְגוֹזָלַיָּיא לְאַבָּא. וְרַב חֲנִינָא בַּר שֵׁילָא וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן (אָמַר) [אָמְרוּ]: כְּגוֹן תְּמָרִים קְלָיוֹת וֶאֱגוֹזִים. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין מַפְטִירִין אַחַר הַפֶּסַח כְּגוֹן תְּמָרִים קְלָיוֹת וֶאֱגוֹזִים.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: like mushrooms for me, and chicks for Abba, And Rav Ḥanina bar Sheila and Rabbi Yoḥanan such as dates, roasted grains, and nuts, was taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan: One does not conclude after the Paschal lamb such as dates, roasted grains, and nuts.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Samuel said: For example, Ordelai to me and Gozalaiya to Abba. And Rav Hanina bar Sheilah and Rabbi Yohanan (said): For example, dates, young figs, and nuts. It was taught in a baraita in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yohanan: One does not conclude the meal after the Passover offering with, for example, dates, young figs, and nuts.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין מַפְטִירִין אַחַר מַצָּה אֲפִיקוֹמָן. תְּנַן: אֵין מַפְטִירִין אַחַר הַפֶּסַח אֲפִיקוֹמָן. אַחַר הַפֶּסַח הוּא דְּלָא, אֲבָל לְאַחַר מַצָּה — מַפְטִירִין!
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said one does not conclude after matza with an afikoman . We learned one does not conclude after the Paschal lamb with an afikoman . after the Paschal lamb that not however, after matza one conclude
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One does not conclude the meal after the matzah. We learned in a Mishnah: One does not conclude the meal after the Paschal lamb. After the Paschal lamb is different, but after the matzah - one concludes the meal!

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא אַחַר מַצָּה — דְּלָא נְפִישׁ טַעְמַיְיהוּ, אֲבָל לְאַחַר הַפֶּסַח, דִּנְפִישׁ טַעְמֵיהּ וְלָא מָצֵי עַבּוֹרֵיהּ — לֵית לַן בַּהּ, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: after matza , as the taste is slight. However, after the Paschal lamb, which has a strong taste that is not easily removed, we have no with it. teaches us
llm_translation: Not needed is what he is saying: Not needed after matzah — for their taste is not significant, but after the Passover, for its taste is significant and not its crossing over — we do not have it, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הַסּוּפְגָּנִין וְהַדּוּבְשָׁנִין וְהָאִיסְקְרִיטִין, אָדָם מְמַלֵּא כְּרֵיסוֹ מֵהֶן, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל כְּזַיִת מַצָּה בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה. בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה אִין,
human_translation: Let us say supports sponge cakes, cakes fried in oil and honey, and honey cakes, a person fill his stomach with them provided that he eats an olive-bulk matza after after yes,
llm_translation: Nayma assists him: sponges and honey and iskritin, a person fills his stomach with them, but only after eating an olive-sized piece of matzah last. Last, no.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה לָא. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה — דְּקָאָכֵיל לְתֵיאָבוֹן, אֲבָל בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְמֵיכַל אֲכִילָה גַּסָּה — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: before no, before as he eats it with an appetite. However, after perhaps he will come to eat it excessive eating, you say not teaches us
llm_translation: Firstly, no. He is not saying "no" in the first instance. He is not saying "no" in the first instance - because he may be eating for appetite, but in the latter case, perhaps he comes to eat a large meal - I would say no, he is indicating to us.

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא מַתְנֵי הָכִי: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַפְטִירִין אַחַר הַמַּצָּה אֲפִיקוֹמָן. נֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ, אֵין מַפְטִירִין אַחַר הַפֶּסַח אֲפִיקוֹמָן: אַחַר הַפֶּסַח דְּלָא, אֲבָל אַחַר מַצָּה — מַפְטִירִין.
human_translation: This is Mar Zutra taught Rav Yosef said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One conclude after the matza with an afikoman . Let us say supports his One does not conclude after the Paschal lamb with an afikoman . after the Paschal lamb that not however, after matza one conclude
llm_translation: Master Zutra taught thus: Rav Yosef said, Rav Yehudah said Shmuel said: We conclude the meal after the matzah. It was suggested to support him Shmuel, that we do not conclude after the Pesach offering. After the Pesach offering, no; but after the matzah, we conclude.

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא אַחַר מַצָּה — דְּלָא נְפִישׁ טַעְמֵיהּ, אֲבָל לְאַחַר פֶּסַח — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: after matza , as the taste is slight; however, after the Paschal lamb, say not teaches us
llm_translation: Not required is what he is saying. Not required after matzah - for its taste is not strong, but after Pesach - say not, he is implying to us.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַסּוּפְגָּנִין וְהַדּוּבְשָׁנִין וְהָאִיסְקְרִיטִין אָדָם מְמַלֵּא כְּרֵיסוֹ מֵהֶן וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל (אֲכִילַת) כְּזַיִת מַצָּה בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה. בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה אִין, בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה לָא!
human_translation: raises an objection: sponge cakes, cakes fried in oil and honey, and honey cakes, a person fill his stomach with them provided that he eats an olive-bulk matza after after yes, before no,
llm_translation: Challenger: The sponges, the honeycombs, and the iskritin, a person may fill his stomach with them, provided that he eats (the size of) an olive of matzah afterwards. If he eats the matzah afterwards, it is permitted; if he eats it beforehand, it is not permitted!

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה — דְּקָאָכֵיל לְתֵיאָבוֹן, אֲבָל בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה דְּאָתֵי לְמֵיכְלַהּ אֲכִילָה גַּסָּה — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: before as he eats it with an appetite. However, after when he come to eat it an excessive eating, you say not teaches us
llm_translation: He is not asking a question. He is not asking in the beginning - because he is eating for appetite, but in the end when it comes to gluttony eating - say no, he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַצָּה בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמָרוֹר דְּרַבָּנַן. וּמַאי שְׁנָא מָרוֹר, דִּכְתִיב: ״עַל מַצּוֹת וּמְרוֹרִים״, בִּזְמַן דְּאִיכָּא פֶּסַח — יֵשׁ מָרוֹר, וּבִזְמַן דְּלֵיכָּא פֶּסַח — לֵיכָּא מָרוֹר.
human_translation: Rava said: matza nowadays, Torah but bitter herbs by rabbinic And what is bitter herbs different from As it is written, with matzot and bitter herbs” When there is the Paschal lamb, there is bitter herbs; and when there is no the Paschal lamb, there is no bitter herbs.
llm_translation: Rava said: Matzah is biblical in this time, and Maror is rabbinic. And what is the difference with Maror? As it is written: "On matzot and bitter herbs." When there is Pesach - there is Maror, and when there is no Pesach - there is no Maror.

hebrew_text: מַצָּה נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב: ״עַל מַצּוֹת וּמְרוֹרִים״! מַצָּה מִיהְדָּר הָדַר בֵּיהּ קְרָא: ״בָּעֶרֶב תֹּאכְלוּ מַצּוֹת״. וְרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: matza as well, it is written: “With matzot and bitter herbs.” The verse repeats matza , in the evening, you shall eat matzot ” And Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: both this, and that, by rabbinic
llm_translation: Matzah is preferable, as it is written: "With matzot and maror." Matzah is more dignified, as the verse states: "In the evening, you shall eat matzot." And Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Both this and that are the words of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכְתִיב: ״בָּעֶרֶב תֹּאכְלוּ מַצּוֹת״! הָהִיא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְטָמֵא וְשֶׁהָיָה בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה, דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא כֵּיוָן דְּפֶסַח לָא אָכְלִי — מַצָּה וּמָרוֹר נָמֵי לָא נֵיכוֹל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “In the evening, you shall eat matzot ”? needs that ritually impure or who was on a distant road As it could enter your mind to say since do not eat the they also do not eat matza and bitter herbs. teaches us
llm_translation: Rather it is written: "In the evening you shall eat matzot"! That one asks about it to be impure and that he was on a distant road, since your mind is settled, I would say that since he did not eat the Passover offering, he cannot eat matzah and bitter herbs, this is what we infer.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר לָךְ: טָמֵא וְשֶׁהָיָה בְּדֶרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה לָא צְרִיךְ קָרָא, דְּלָא גָּרְעִי מֵעָרֵל וּבֶן נֵכָר. דְּתַנְיָא: ״כׇּל עָרֵל לֹא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״ — ״בּוֹ״ אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל, אֲבָל אוֹכֵל בְּמַצָּה וּמָרוֹר.
human_translation: And Rava, said to you: not require verse a ritually impure person and a person who was on a distant road are no worse than an uncircumcised or an alien, As it was taught “But no uncircumcised man shall eat from it” “From it” not eat from however, he does eat matza and bitter herbs.
llm_translation: Rava said to you: impure and was on a distant road not need verse, for not worse than uncircumcised and son of a foreigner. As it was taught: "Any uncircumcised person shall not eat thereof" — "thereof" he does not eat, but he may eat matzah and bitter herbs.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? כְּתִיב בְּהַאי וּכְתִיב בְּהַאי, וּצְרִיכִי.
human_translation: And the other, was written with regard to this and it was written with regard to that and are necessary.
llm_translation: And the other one? It is written in this one and it is written in that one, and it is necessary.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: ״שֵׁשֶׁת יָמִים תֹּאכַל מַצּוֹת וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי עֲצֶרֶת לַה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״. מָה שְׁבִיעִי רְשׁוּת, אַף שֵׁשֶׁת יָמִים רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rava: “Six days you shall eat matzot , and on the seventh day shall be a solemn assembly to the Lord your God” Just as seventh optional, so too, six days optional.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rava: "Six days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a solemn assembly to the Lord your God." Just as the seventh day is optional, so too are the six days optional.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? הָוֵי דָּבָר שֶׁהָיָה בַּכְּלָל, וְיָצָא מִן הַכְּלָל לְלַמֵּד, לֹא לְלַמֵּד עַל עַצְמוֹ יָצָא, אֶלָּא לְלַמֵּד עַל הַכְּלָל כּוּלּוֹ יָצָא.
human_translation: What is the reason is something that was included in a generalization but was explicitly singled out to teach. it was intended to teach not just about itself but about the entire generalization.
llm_translation: What is the reason? It is a matter that was included, and it went out from the inclusion to teach, not to teach about itself it went out, rather to teach about the entire inclusion it went out.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אַף לַיְלָה הָרִאשׁוֹן רְשׁוּת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל מַצּוֹת וּמְרוֹרִים יֹאכְלוּהוּ״.
human_translation: might even the first night optional; the verse states: “They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs”
llm_translation: One might have thought that even the first night is optional; therefore, the Scripture states: "They shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs."

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בָּעֶרֶב תֹּאכְלוּ מַצּוֹת״, הַכָּתוּב קְבָעוֹ חוֹבָה.
human_translation: I have nothing other when the Temple is standing. From where when the Temple is not standing? The verse states: “In the evening you shall eat matzot .” The verse establishes obligatory,
llm_translation: I have only when the Temple is standing, when the Temple is not standing, from where? Scripture says: "In the evening you shall eat unleavened bread," the Scripture established it as an obligation.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יָשְׁנוּ מִקְצָתָן — יֹאכֵלוּ. כּוּלָּן — לֹא יֹאכֵלוּ.
human_translation: If some of fell asleep, they eat entire they not eat
llm_translation: It was taught: if some of them are asleep — they may eat. If all of them are asleep — they may not eat.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: נִתְנַמְנְמוּ — יֹאכֵלוּ, נִרְדְּמוּ — לֹא יֹאכֵלוּ. הַפֶּסַח אַחַר חֲצוֹת מְטַמֵּא אֶת הַיָּדַיִם. הַפִּגּוּל וְהַנּוֹתָר מְטַמְּאִין אֶת הַיָּדַיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: they dozed they eat they fell asleep they not eat The Paschal lamb after midnight renders one’s hands ritually impure, piggul , and notar render one’s hands ritually impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If they doze off - they may eat, if they fall asleep - they may not eat. The Passover offering after midnight renders the hands impure. A disqualified sacrifice and what is left over render the hands impure.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: נִתְנַמְנְמוּ — יֹאכֵלוּ, נִרְדְּמוּ — לֹא יֹאכֵלוּ. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי נִתְנַמְנֵם? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: נִים וְלָא נִים, תִּיר וְלָא תִּיר. כְּגוֹן דְּקָרֵי לֵיהּ וְעָנֵי, וְלָא יָדַע לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי סְבָרָא, וְכִי מַדְכְּרוּ לֵיהּ — מִדְּכַר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: they dozed they eat they fell asleep they not eat What are the circumstances dozing? Rav Ashi said: asleep but not asleep, awake but not awake, when, if they call him, he answer, but he is unable to provide a reasonable And when they inform him he remembers
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yosei says: If they nod off - they may eat, if they fall asleep - they may not eat. What is the case of nodding off? Rav Ashi said: Dozing and not dozing, drowsy and not drowsy. For example, if he reads and answers, but does not know how to respond to arguments, and when they remind him - he remembers.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה. חֲזָא דְּקָא נַמְנֵם, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵינָם קָא נָאֵים מָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵינוֹמֵי קָא (מְנַמְנֵם) [מְנַמְנַמְנָא], וּתְנַן: נִתְנַמְנְמוּ — יֹאכֵלוּ, נִרְדְּמוּ — לֹא יֹאכֵלוּ.
human_translation: Abaye was sitting before Rabba, he saw that was dozing He said to him: Is the Master sleeping? said to him: I am dozing, and we learned they dozed, they eat they fell asleep they not eat
llm_translation: Abaye was sitting in front of Rabba. He saw that he was dozing off, so he said to him: "Master, your wine is pleasing." He said to him: "My sleep is (pleasing), and we learned: If they doze off - they may eat, if they fall asleep - they may not eat."

hebrew_text: הַפֶּסַח אַחַר חֲצוֹת מְטַמֵּא אֶת הַיָּדַיִם וְכוּ׳. אַלְמָא מֵחֲצוֹת הָוֵה לֵיהּ נוֹתָר. מַאן תַּנָּא?
human_translation: the Paschal lamb after midnight renders one’s hands ritually impure. Apparently, from midnight is notar . Who tanna
llm_translation: The Passover after midnight defiles the hands, etc. This implies that after midnight it remains. Who is the Tanna?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה הוּא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאָכְלוּ אֶת הַבָּשָׂר בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״וְעָבַרְתִּי בְאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: It is Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, as it was taught “And they shall eat of the meat on that night” Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: Here it is stated “on that night,” And below it is stated: “And I will pass through the land of Egypt on that night
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, as it was taught: "And they shall eat the flesh in this night," Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: It is stated here "in this night," and it is stated there "I will pass through the land of Egypt in this night."

hebrew_text: מַה לְהַלָּן — עַד חֲצוֹת, אַף כָּאן — עַד חֲצוֹת.
human_translation: Just as below, until midnight, so too, here, until midnight
llm_translation: What is there — until midnight, so too here — until midnight.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: וַהֲלֹא נֶאֱמַר ״חִפָּזוֹן״ — עַד שְׁעַת חִפָּזוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to But wasn’t it stated: in haste, until the time of haste,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: But isn't it stated "haste" - until the time of haste.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בַּלַּיְלָה״? יָכוֹל יְהֵא נֶאֱכָל כַּקֳּדָשִׁים בַּיּוֹם — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּלַּיְלָה״, בַּלַּיְלָה הוּא נֶאֱכָל, וְאֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל בְּיוֹם.
human_translation: If so, what is the verse states: “On night,” might is eaten during the day, offerings, verse states: “On night,” is eaten at night, and it is not eaten during the day.
llm_translation: If so, what does the Talmud mean by "at night"? One might think it should be eaten like the holy offerings during the day - the Talmud teaches: "at night," it is to be eaten at night, and not eaten during the day.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הַאי ״הַזֶּה״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמַעוֹטֵי לַיְלָה אַחֵר הוּא דַּאֲתָא. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּפֶסַח קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים, וּשְׁלָמִים קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים — מָה שְׁלָמִים נֶאֱכָלִים לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד, אַף פֶּסַח;
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, what does he do with “that”? He needs it to exclude another night. It could enter your mind to say that since the Paschal lamb offerings of lesser sanctity, peace-offerings are offerings of lesser sanctity, just as peace-offerings be eaten for two days and one night, so too, the Paschal lamb.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, this "this" what does it do for it? He requires it to exclude another night that comes. Do you think I would say: Since the Peace Offerings are easily consumed, and the Passover Offering is easily consumed - just as the Peace Offerings are eaten for two days and one night, so too the Passover Offering;

hebrew_text: אוֹקֵים לֵילוֹת בִּמְקוֹם יָמִים, וִיהֵא נֶאֱכָל לִשְׁנֵי לֵילוֹת וְיוֹם אֶחָד, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״הַזֶּה״.
human_translation: I will substitute the nights instead of the days And be eaten for two nights and one day. the Torah wrote “that,”
llm_translation: He establishes nights in place of days, and let it be eaten for two nights and one day, as it is written: "this."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אָמַר לָךְ: מִ״לֹּא תוֹתִירוּ עַד בֹּקֶר״ נָפְקָא הָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, said to you: This derived from “You shall let nothing remain until the morning;
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said to you: "From 'Do not leave over until morning' it is derived." This emerged.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אָמַר לָךְ: אִי לָא כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״הַזֶּה״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מַאי ״בֹּקֶר״ — בֹּקֶר שֵׁנִי. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר לָךְ: כׇּל הֵיכָא דִּכְתַב ״בֹּקֶר״ — בֹּקֶר רִאשׁוֹן הוּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva said to you, If the Torah hadn’t written that I would have said: What is “morning” the second morning And Rabbi Elazar said to you Anywhere that writes “morning,” the first, morning.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to you: If the Merciful One did not write "this," I would say: What is "morning"? - it is the second morning. And Rabbi Eliezer said to you: wherever it is written "morning" - it is the first morning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אָכַל מַצָּה בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה אַחַר חֲצוֹת, לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ. פְּשִׁיטָא! דְּכֵיוָן דְּאִיתַּקַּשׁ לְפֶסַח — כְּפֶסַח דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: Nowadays, ate matza after midnight, Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, he has not fulfilled his obligation. obvious for since the Paschal lamb, considered like the Paschal lamb,
llm_translation: Rava said: One who eats matzah nowadays after midnight, according to Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, he has not fulfilled his obligation. It is obvious! Since it is connected to Pesach - it is like the Pesach offering.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָא אַפְּקֵיהּ קְרָא מֵהֶיקֵּישָׁא. קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דְּכִי אַהְדְּרֵיהּ קְרָא — לְמִילְּתָא קַמַּיְיתָא אַהְדְּרֵיהּ.
human_translation: lest you say the verse has removed from juxtaposition, teaches us that when the verse repeats it restores to its original status,
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? This verse was stated from a different context. We learn that when the verse repeats itself, it is for clarification.

hebrew_text: הַפִּיגּוּל וְהַנּוֹתָר מְטַמֵּא אֶת הַיָּדַיִם וְכוּ׳. רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא, חַד אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם חֲשֵׁדֵי כְהוּנָּה, וְחַד אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם עֲצֵלֵי כְהוּנָּה. חַד אָמַר: כְּזַיִת, וְחַד אָמַר: כְּבֵיצָה.
human_translation: piggul and notar render one’s hands ritually impure. Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda. One said: due to suspected priests, and one said due to lazy priests. One said an olive-bulk and one said an egg-bulk.
llm_translation: The piggul and the notar render the hands impure, etc. Rav Huna and Rav Hisda, one said: due to suspicions of priesthood, and one said: due to laziness of priesthood. One said: like an olive, and one said: like an egg.

hebrew_text: חַד תָּנֵי אַפִּיגּוּל, וְחַד תָּנֵי אַנּוֹתָר.
human_translation: One teaches with regard to piggul , and one teaches with regard to notar .
llm_translation: One teaches "Apigul," and one teaches "Anotar."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּתָנֵי אַפִּיגּוּל — מִשּׁוּם חֲשֵׁדֵי כְהוּנָּה. מַאן דְּתָנֵי אַנּוֹתָר — מִשּׁוּם עֲצֵלֵי כְהוּנָּה.
human_translation: The one who teaches with regard to piggul due to suspected priests. He who teaches with regard to notar is due to lazy priests,
llm_translation: One who teaches Apigul - because of suspicion of priesthood. One who teaches Anotar - because of laziness of priesthood.

hebrew_text: חַד אָמַר כְּזַיִת וְחַד אָמַר כְּבֵיצָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר כְּזַיִת — כְּאִיסּוּרוֹ, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר כְּבֵיצָה — כְּטוּמְאָתוֹ.
human_translation: One said an olive-bulk one said an egg-bulk The one who said an olive-bulk maintains that similar to its prohibition. And the one who said an egg-bulk it is similar to its ritual impurity.
llm_translation: One said like an olive and one said like an egg. Whoever said like an olive - like its prohibition, and whoever said like an egg - like its impurity.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּירַךְ בִּרְכַּת הַפֶּסַח — פָּטַר אֶת שֶׁל זֶבַח. בֵּירַךְ אֶת שֶׁל זֶבַח — לֹא פָּטַר אֶת שֶׁל פֶּסַח, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא זוֹ פּוֹטֶרֶת זוֹ וְלֹא זוֹ פּוֹטֶרֶת זוֹ.
human_translation: one recited the blessing over the Paschal lamb, he has exempted offering. he recited the blessing over the offering, he has not exempted the Paschal lamb. the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: This does not exempt this one, and that does not exempt that one,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who recites the blessing of the Paschal lamb exempts the blessing of the sacrifice. If one recites the blessing of the sacrifice, he does not exempt the blessing of the Paschal lamb, according to the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: Not this one exempts that one, and not that one exempts this one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כְּשֶׁתִּמְצָא לוֹמַר, לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: זְרִיקָה בִּכְלַל שְׁפִיכָה. וְלֹא שְׁפִיכָה בִּכְלַל זְרִיקָה.
human_translation: according to Rabbi Yishmael, sprinkling is included pouring. But pouring is not included in sprinkling.
llm_translation: Gemara: When he finds to say, according to the words of Rabbi Yishmael: Zerikah is included in Shefikah. And Shefikah is not included in Zerikah.

hebrew_text: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: לֹא שְׁפִיכָה בִּכְלַל זְרִיקָה, וְלֹא זְרִיקָה בִּכְלַל שְׁפִיכָה.
human_translation: according to Rabbi Akiva, Pouring is not included in sprinkling, and sprinkling is not included in pouring.
llm_translation: According to the words of Rabbi Akiva: Not pouring included in sprinkling, and not sprinkling included in pouring.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי אִיקְּלַע לְפִדְיוֹן הַבֵּן, בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ: פְּשִׁיטָא עַל פִּדְיוֹן הַבֵּן ״אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ עַל פִּדְיוֹן הַבֵּן״ — אֲבִי הַבֵּן מְבָרֵךְ. ״בָּרוּךְ ... שֶׁהֶחֱיָינוּ וְקִיְּימָנוּ וְהִגִּיעָנוּ לַזְּמַן הַזֶּה״, כֹּהֵן מְבָרֵךְ, אוֹ אֲבִי הַבֵּן מְבָרֵךְ?
human_translation: Rabbi Simlai attended a redemption of the son. raised a dilemma before him obvious over the redemption of son, Who sanctified us with His mitzvot and commanded us over the redemption of the son, recited by the father of the son, Blessed sheheḥeyanu sustained us, and brought us to this time, priest recite or the father of the son recite
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuelai encountered the redemption of a firstborn son, he asked: Is it obvious regarding the redemption of the firstborn, "Who sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us concerning the redemption of the firstborn" — does the father of the son recite it? "Blessed is He... who has granted us life, sustained us, and enabled us to reach this occasion," does the priest recite it, or does the father of the son recite it?

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן מְבָרַךְ — דְּקָמָטֵי הֲנָאָה לִידֵיהּ, אוֹ אֲבִי הַבֵּן מְבָרֵךְ — דְּקָא עָבֵיד מִצְוָה? לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ, אֲתָא שְׁאֵיל בֵּיהּ מִדְרְשָׁא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֲבִי הַבֵּן מְבָרֵךְ שְׁתַּיִם. וְהִלְכְתָא: אֲבִי הַבֵּן מְבָרֵךְ שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: priest recites the blessing, as he benefits Or, the father of the son recites as he performs the mitzva. did not have went to ask in the study hall. said to him the father of the son recites two blessings: And the halakha is the father of the son recites two blessings.
llm_translation: A priest blesses — for he is experiencing pleasure, or a father of the son blesses — for he is performing a mitzvah? It was not in his hands, he came and asked in the study hall. They said to him: A father of the son blesses twice. And the halakha is: A father of the son blesses twice.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ עַרְבֵי פְסָחִים וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת פְּסָחִים
llm_translation: We will return to you, Arvei Pesachim, and we will go up with it to the tractate of Pesachim.
